headlines: Unnao rape survivor's car was on fire, rains saved her: Eyewitness
text: An eyewitness of the Unnao rape survivor's car-truck collision on Saturday said, "If it hadn't been raining that day everyone [in the car] would be dead." People were scared of going close because the front of the car was on fire, the eyewitness added. Passersby reportedly called the police and then pulled out the passengers after the fire subsided.

headlines: 6,216 passengers reported at Srinagar Airport today: AAI
text: The Airport Authority of India (AAI) on Saturday said that as many as 6,216 passengers reported at Srinagar Airport today for travelling out of the Valley. "Out of this, 5,829 passengers travelled by 32 scheduled flights," AAI added. "Remaining 387 passengers were accommodated in four IAF aircraft and flown to Jammu, Pathankot and Hindon," AAI further said.

headlines: Hundreds detained during protest in Moscow: Reports
text: Russian police reportedly detained hundreds of protestors during an unauthorised opposition rally in Moscow on Saturday. According to the reports, the protestors gathered in the Russian capital after authorities disqualified many opposition candidates from contesting the Moscow parliamentary elections scheduled for September. Mobile internet was blocked in many parts of Moscow, reports claimed.

headlines: Thief finds shop's cash drawer empty, leaves note for owner in TN
text: A thief who broke into a shop in Tamil Nadu left a 'feedback note' for the shopkeeper after finding the shop's cash drawer empty. "I broke into your store putting my life at risk. But there's not a penny in your cash drawer," the thief wrote. "So, I decided to do this monkey business (wrecking the store)," the thief added.

headlines: Saini gets hit for 6, takes 2 wickets in his 1st international over
text: Fast bowler Navdeep Saini, who is making his international debut for India in the T20I against West Indies today, was hit for a six by Nicholas Pooran on the second delivery of his first over. The 26-year-old pacer went on to dismiss Pooran on the fourth delivery and bowled out Shimron Hetmyer off the fifth delivery.

headlines: Every time we woke up, it was the worst feeling: Kohli on WC exit
text: Talking about India's 2019 World Cup exit, Team India captain Virat Kohli said that the first few days after they exited the World Cup were quite difficult. "Every time we woke up it was the worst feeling in the morning. Then through the day you do things and sort of get on with your life. We are professionals," he added.

headlines: Fans tease Warner with sandpaper chants, he shows his empty pockets
text: A section of English crowd at the Edgbaston stadium teased Australia opener David Warner with sandpaper chants while he was fielding in the deep during the third day of the first Ashes Test on Saturday. The crowd was heard chanting, "He's got sandpaper in his hand", to which Warner responded by showing his empty pockets.

headlines: Gambhir criticises Bedi, Chetan Chauhan as Saini makes int'l debut
text: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir criticised ex-cricketers and DDCA members Bishan Singh Bedi and Chetan Chauhan after 26-year-old pacer Navdeep Saini made his debut for India and took two wickets in his first over against West Indies. "Their middle stumps are gone...," wrote Gambhir. Bedi and Chauhan had objected to Saini's selection in Delhi's Ranji team, terming him an 'outsider'.

headlines: Indian boxer Neeraj shares pic with guns, says he's ready to fight Amir
text: Indian boxer Neeraj Goyat, who was ruled out of July 12 bout against British-Pakistani boxer Amir Khan after sustaining injuries in an accident, has said that he is now ready to fight Amir. Neeraj shared a picture of himself with guns and bullets on social media, writing, "I am fit now and ready to beat Amir Khan in the ring."

headlines: Thinking of leaving politics, joining it was an accident: Kumaraswamy
text: Karnataka's former Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Saturday said that he came to politics "accidentally and also became the CM of the state "accidentally". He said that he was thinking of going away from politics stating that people keep dragging his family into politics. Kumaraswamy led Congress-JD(S) coalition government collapsed after 14 months after losing trust vote on July 23.

headlines: Elon Musk says will launch The Boring Company in China this month
text: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has said that he will be launching his tunnel-digging startup The Boring Company later this month. Musk is due to speak at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai taking place from August 29 to 31. Musk also replied to a Twitter user asking if the startup would also do underwater tunnels, saying, "Yes."

headlines: July 2019 equalled if not broke record for hottest month ever: UN
text: July 2019 equalled if not surpassed the record for the hottest month in history, the UN's meteorological agency, the World Meteorological Organization said, based on data from the first 29 days of the month. The previous record for the hottest month was set in July 2016. July 2019 was around 1.2°C warmer than the pre-industrial era, according to the data.

headlines: IAF C-17s to airlift Amarnath pilgrims, aircraft can carry 230 people
text: The IAF C-17 aircraft will airlift Amarnath yatra pilgrims out of the valley following Jammu and Kashmir government's request amid terror threat. The C-17 is a transport aircraft with the capacity of carrying 230 passengers in one go. The Jammu and Kashmir government had on Friday issued an advisory for Amarnath pilgrims and tourists to leave the valley immediately.

headlines: Nawaz Sharif made laws to launder money: Pak PM's aide
text: Pakistan's former PM Nawaz Sharif and his family made laws in the 1990s to facilitate money laundering, PM Imran Khan's aide, Shahzad Akbar, said. He added that 1.7 crore Pakistani rupees were transferred to Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz's account through telegraphic transfer. Notably, the Panama Papers had revealed that Sharif's family owned apartments in London through offshore companies.

headlines: Jet Airways extends deadline for initial bids to August 10
text: Jet Airways has extended the deadline for initial bids for the bankrupt airline to August 10 from August 3. The bid submission deadline has been extended at the request of some prospective bidders, it said. Jet's lenders agreed on July 19 to provide interim financing to help it cover legal and other costs as bankruptcy resolution experts seek a buyer.

headlines: Moeen Ali's leave ends up with his bowled dismissal
text: Australia's Nathan Lyon dismissed Moeen Ali for the eighth time since the start of the Ashes 2017-18 after Ali chose to leave the delivery that crashed into his off stump. Ali had earlier said, "He's [Lyon] bowled really well and got me out a few times. But you don't get medals for getting guys out all the time."

headlines: Overseas players refuse to play entire PSL in Pakistan: Report
text: Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) plans to host Pakistan Super League's entire next season in Pakistan might not be possible as reportedly a few overseas cricketers have expressed their reservations about staying in Pakistan owing to security concerns. According to a report, franchises want to hold half-season of next year's PSL in the United Arab Emirates.

headlines: BJP organic entity not an assembled one: PM Modi to party MPs
text: PM Narendra Modi told party MPs on Saturday that the BJP is an "organic" entity and not an "assembled" entity and it has been successful because of its ideology. Modi was speaking at Abhyas Varga, a training programme organised at the Parliament for BJP MPs. The PM urged party MPs to remain active at the grass-roots level.

headlines: Desist from any political adventurism in J&K: CPI(M) to govt
text: The CPI(M) on Saturday said the government should desist from any "political adventurism" in J&K that will have grave consequences for India. "The unprecedented cancellation of Amarnath Yatra...and the instructions to tourists to leave...have heightened tensions and anxieties among the people," CPI(M) added. The party said a serious situation has developed in J&K due to the government's actions.

headlines: First-ever footage of a molecule's rotation captured
text: Scientists at Germany's largest particle accelerator centre DESY have used precisely tuned pulses of laser light to film the ultrafast rotation of a molecule for the first time ever. "The resulting 'molecular movie' tracks one and a half revolutions of carbonyl sulphide (OCS)," researchers revealed. The revolutions took place within 125 trillionths of a second, they added.

headlines: Join duty or face action: Health Ministry to striking doctors
text: The Health Ministry warned doctors at AIIMS and Safdarjung Hospital striking over the NMC Bill of disciplinary action like termination of service if they don't join duty immediately. Following this, both hospitals issued memos and doctors at AIIMS resumed emergency services but non-essential services remained suspended. Meanwhile, doctors at Safdarjung Hospital didn't join duty in any department.

headlines: India records hottest July ever: IMD
text: Data with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) shows that the mean temperature for July was 28.65°C, making it the hottest July ever. "[The high mean temperature] was mainly a result of clouding at night time in the first and second week of July...which trapped the heat of the surface," AK Srivastava, head of IMD Pune's climate research division said.

headlines: Rajasthan woman allegedly not allowed to breastfeed during exam
text: A 23-year-old woman on Friday was denied permission to breastfeed her eight-month-old daughter while appearing for a college exam in Rajasthan's Jaipur, her husband alleged. He further said their hungry daughter cried for three hours but college authorities asked him to leave the premises. However, college authorities said they were following rules as examinees cannot meet outsiders during the exam.

headlines: Sun Pharma shuts 2 Gujarat research units, 85 employees lose jobs
text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma has decided to shut down two of its clinical pharmacology units in Gujarat's Vadodara, leaving around 85 employees jobless. The employees were terminated without any prior intimation and were given three months' worth of salary, as per reports. The company added that the bio-equivalence studies from these centres will be transferred to its other facilities.

headlines: Confirm WhatsApp's data norms compliance in 6 weeks: SC to RBI
text: The Supreme Court has given six weeks to the RBI to confirm and present a report on the compliance of data localisation norms by Facebook-owned WhatsApp. The court has also asked the government to clarify if WhatsApp needs to have a grievance officer in India. Notably, the full-scale roll-out of WhatsApp's payments service is stuck over the data localisation norms.

headlines: High import duties will make Tesla unaffordable in India: CEO Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, responding to a Twitter user about the launch of the automaker's cars in India, said, "I'm told import duties are extremely high (up to 100%), even for electric cars." "This would make our cars unaffordable," he added. Musk had earlier told IIT Madras students that Tesla cars may come to India in 2020.

headlines: 2 militants killed in J&K encounters, 2 Army jawans injured
text: Two militants were killed in separate encounters with security forces in Baramulla and Shopian districts of Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday, the police said. One of the terrorists has been identified as Manzoor Bhat, who was involved in several terror attacks on security establishments. Meanwhile, two Army personnel were injured in the Shopian encounter.

headlines: 1 held over viral video of UP man shooting at b'day cake with friends
text: A man was arrested on Friday after a video of an Uttar Pradesh man shooting at his birthday cake and his friends indulging in celebratory firing went viral on social media. "The video was about a month old," police said, as they added that another accused in the case is absconding. The accused were allegedly using illegal countrymade pistols.

headlines: Garbage spewed by sea at Marine Drive amid high tide in Mumbai
text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) workers cleaned the garbage spewed by the sea at Marine Drive as high tide hit Mumbai on Saturday. This comes as heavy to very heavy rainfall in the next 24 hours has been forecasted in Mumbai. The Mumbai Police has issued an advisory asking residents to take adequate precautions and travel only if necessary.

headlines: UK, Germany warn citizens against travelling to Jammu & Kashmir
text: The UK and Germany have issued a travel advisory for their nationals, discouraging them to travel to Jammu & Kashmir. Urgently discouraging travelling to Jammu & Kashmir following a security alert by the government, their advisories said. Those who are currently in Kashmir are encouraged to leave the state, they added.

headlines: Girl saves brother as rope stuck in lift door drags him up by neck
text: A girl saved her five-year-old brother's life after a rope stuck in a lift door dragged him up by his neck in Turkey. In a video that went viral, the girl can be seen grabbing her brother's legs to ease the pressure on his neck and pushed a button to stop the lift. She then freed him from the noose.

headlines: Miss Venezuela pageant stops publishing contestants' hip, waist sizes
text: The Miss Venezuela beauty pageant has stopped the practice of publishing contestants' waist, hip and bust measurements as part of its contest. The event, running since 1952, always publicly divulged the measurements of its contestants to the audience members. "A woman's beauty isn't 90, 60, 90...It's measured by each one's talent," a spokesperson for Miss Venezuela said.

headlines: Why there was no food or glasses at Karan Johar's party: MLA
text: Shiromani Akali Dal MLA Manjinder Sirsa, after accusing actors at Karan Johar's party to be in "drugged state", has written an open letter to Bollywood asking why there was no food or drink glasses. Sirsa further asked, "Why did you all appear shamelessly out of your senses?" He also accused stars of "breaking nation's trust".

headlines: Russell plays in GT20 Canada after withdrawal from T20Is vs India
text: Andre Russell showed up to play for the Global T20 League's Vancouver Knights against Edmonton Royals in Canada after the Windies board announced that Russell had pulled out of the first two India-Windies T20Is. "[I]f we need to get him ready for the Twenty20 World Cup, we have to do without him for a couple of series," Carlos Brathwaite said.

headlines: Satwik, Chirag 1st Indian duo to enter a BWF Super 500 final
text: Satwik SaiRaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty on Saturday became the first Indian team to enter the summit clash of a BWF Super 500 tournament after registering a win in their Thailand Open semi-final match. The world number 16 pair, that won the Commonwealth Games 2018 silver medal, beat the 19th-ranked Korean team of Ko Sung Hyun and Shin Baek Cheol.

headlines: Mediation attempts made before Mahabharata too: Yogi on Ayodhya case
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said he knew that the mediation attempts to resolve the Ayodhya land dispute would fail to provide a solution. "Mediation attempts were made before Mahabharata too, but their result was unfruitful," he added. After the mediation attempts failed, the Supreme Court decided to hold the hearing of the case on a day-to-day basis.

headlines: 3 held in UP for spreading communal rumours in youth's death case
text: Police on Thursday arrested three persons for spreading communal disharmony by allegedly spreading rumours saying a youth was set on fire for refusing to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli. Police had dismissed the claim saying that the victim gave three different statements. As per reports, the youth had set himself on fire while attempting a magic trick.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor on ventilator contracts pneumonia: Reports
text: The Unnao rape survivor, who is on the ventilator at a Lucknow hospital, has contracted pneumonia, as per reports. She is being administered with blood pressure medicines, a statement from the hospital read. Her lawyer, who was also critically injured in the car-truck collision, is off the ventilator. However, two of her aunts were killed in the accident.

headlines: Mamata Banerjee declares rural West Bengal open-defecation free
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday tweeted that the state's rural area has now become open-defecation free. "Government of India has confirmed our achievement which was our mission towards a cleaner and greener environment and safe living," the CM tweeted. Notably, West Bengal's Nadia was declared India's first open-defecation free district in 2015.

headlines: New wave of terror attacks possible before end of year: UN
text: A United Nations report has warned that a new spate of terror attacks across the world may occur before the end of the year. The UN report was collated from data provided by the intelligence agencies of its member states. The report claims that foreign fighters, up to 30,000, who traveled to ISIS caliphate to fight still pose a threat.

headlines: US says it wants to deploy new missiles in Asia
text: US Defence Secretary Mark Esper has said the US wants to deploy new intermediate-range missiles in Asia soon. "I see the [US] taking corrective measures to develop a capability that we need for both the European and the Indo-Pacific Command theatre," he added. Esper's statement comes after the US formally withdrew from the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty with Russia.

headlines: N Korea publicly executed prisoners for trying to escape: UN report
text: North Korea prisoners who tried to escape or steal were reportedly executed publicly, a United Nations report said. Female detainees were sexually assaulted by prison officials, including during "invasive body searches", UN chief António Guterres said in the report. The UN human rights office interviewed over 330 people who had experienced detention, mostly women, who escaped initially to China.

headlines: NIT Srinagar suspends classes, students evacuated over security reasons
text: After a government advisory on Friday asked Amarnath pilgrims and tourists to leave the valley, students were evacuated from National Institute of Technology, Srinagar. Several students were seen waiting for buses to leave the valley. This comes after the NIT administration issued a notice, stating that the classwork in the institute stands suspended till further orders.

headlines: US rapper A$AP Rocky released from jail in Sweden
text: American rapper A$AP Rocky was released from prison in Sweden and allowed to return to the US while the verdict on his assault case is awaited. The rapper, whose real name is Rakim Mayers, was accused of beating a 19-year-old man in Stockholm last month. US President Donald Trump had urged Swedish PM to work on the rapper's release.

headlines: Neesham tries trolling Kohli after Burns slams ton, gets trolled back
text: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham was trolled on Twitter after he mocked Team India captain Virat Kohli following England opener Rory Burns' maiden Test and Ashes hundred. "Burns now has more runs in his first Ashes innings than Kohli has in his entire Ashes career," Neesham wrote. "That's probably the least funny thing you've ever tweeted," a user tweeted.

headlines: FB starts adding its name to Instagram, may do so on WhatsApp too
text: Facebook has begun adding its name to some screens on its photo-sharing platform Instagram and will reportedly do so on WhatsApp as well. "We want to be clearer about the products and services that are part of Facebook," the social media giant said. The 'Instagram from Facebook' rebranding was first spotted by reverse-engineering specialist Jane Manchun Wong in March.

headlines: Maruti Suzuki cuts 1,181 temporary jobs in 6 months as sales fall
text: India's biggest automaker Maruti Suzuki said it employed 18,845 temporary workers on average in the six months ended June 30, down 6% or 1,181 from the same period last year. Chairman RC Bhargava said the workforce was being reduced to reflect the slowdown in auto sales, adding that this was one reason carmakers liked to have some temporary workers.

headlines: Lyft admits its response to sexual harassment has 'fallen short'
text: US ride-hailing giant Lyft has acknowledged that it has "fallen short" in response to sexual harassment complaints on several instances, The Washington Post revealed. In one instance, Lyft blamed a user for sharing her number with a driver when she complained of unprofessional behaviour. "The fact that you did (share your number) limits the consequences on the driver," Lyft said.

headlines: WeWork may get $6 bn funding if it raises at least $3 bn in IPO
text: WeWork is set to get $6 billion via a $2 billion letter-of-credit and a $4 billion delayed-draw term loan if it raises at least $3 billion in its Initial Public Offering (IPO), Bloomberg reported. The co-working space startup had confidentially filed for IPO in April. American investment bank JPMorgan Chase is reportedly set to lead the IPO.

headlines: Order issued to cancel expelled BJP MLA Sengar's arms licence
text: Unnao District Magistrate Devendra Kumar Pandey has ordered the cancellation of expelled BJP lawmaker Kuldeep Singh Sengar's arms licence. Sengar has been accused of raping a woman in Unnao. He reportedly had a single barrel gun, a revolver and a rifle, all of which have been confiscated.

headlines: Unnao truck owner says he blackened plates as he was behind on EMIs
text: The owner of the truck, which was involved in Unnao rape survivor's accident, has claimed that he blackened the number plates to avoid forcible seizure of the vehicle as he was behind on his EMIs. However, the agents of the Kanpur-based finance company that financed the truck said the company had never threatened the truck owner to seize the vehicle.

headlines: Zero chance: Michelle Obama on running for US President
text: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama has said that there's "zero chance" that she'll run for US President. "There are so many ways to improve this country and build a better world, and I keep doing plenty of them...But sitting behind the desk in the Oval Office will never be one of them. It's just not for me," she added.

headlines: 3 killed as cliff collapses onto beach in California
text: At least three people were killed after a sandstone cliff collapsed onto a beach in California, US, on Friday. Authorities said pieces of the cliff were known to fall off and beachgoers were warned to sit at some distance away. Sniffer dogs were used to search through the debris to ensure that no additional victims were underneath.

headlines: BCCI's CoA stops release of funds to Bihar Cricket Association
text: The Supreme Court-appointed Committee of Administrators (CoA) has stopped all monetary benefits to the Bihar Cricket Association (BCA). The move was taken after the CoA received repeated emails from the two factions in the Bihar Cricket Association. "[I]t is not possible for the Committee of Administrators to prefer the requests/statements seemingly made by one faction over the other," CoA wrote.

headlines: Give security instead of asking pilgrims to run: Cong to J&K govt
text: Congress on Saturday targeted Jammu and Kashmir government for asking tourists and Amarnath pilgrims to curtail their stay amid terror threats. "Government should have provided security...rather than asking them to cut and run," Congress' Manish Tewari said. "J&K facing Pakistan sponsored Militancy since...1947. Worst period (was) 1990...(India never surrendered) to Pakistan like today," he added.

headlines: Don't believe rumours: J&K Guv to leaders amid Amarnath advisory
text: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik on Friday met political leaders, asking them to maintain calm and not believe rumours following the government advisory for Amarnath Yatris to leave amid terror attack reports. Earlier, politicians in the state had expressed concern over the decision on Article 35A which grants Jammu and Kashmir residents rights to government jobs and land.

headlines: 3 men suspected to be Pakistani spies arrested in Haryana
text: Haryana Police on Thursday arrested three persons who are suspected to be Pakistani spies for allegedly leaking secret information to their handlers. Incriminating evidence, including video clippings of military activities, was found on their mobile phones, as per reports. Police also retrieved a Pakistani number from the phones which is suspected to belong to their handler, reports added.

headlines: Woman allegedly chained by in-laws, raped by relatives in Rajasthan
text: A woman with iron chains on her ankles was brought to the District Collectorate's office, who claimed her husband and in-laws had chained her in Rajasthan's Pratapgarh. The woman alleged that her husband would thrash her after consuming alcohol and she had been raped by her in-laws' relatives. The woman said she tried to escape but her in-laws caught her.

headlines: Govt denies asylum to ex-Maldives VP who tried to enter India illegally
text: Indian government turned down the asylum request of former Vice-President of Maldives Ahmed Adeeb and handed him over to the authorities of his country on Saturday. The 37-year-old had tried to enter India without any valid documents on Thursday. Reportedly, Maldives' Supreme Court had imposed a travel ban on Adeeb and he fled from the island nation through a tugboat.

headlines: No cancellation fee on flights to and from Srinagar amid terror threat
text: After Jammu and Kashmir government asked tourists and Amarnath pilgrims to leave the valley amid terror threat, airlines have announced that they won't charge cancellation or rescheduling fee on flights to and from Srinagar. After the Centre's advisory, Air India offered fee waiver till August 15, while carriers like IndiGo, SpiceJet and Vistara is offering the waiver till August 9.

headlines: Once took my daughter to plane's washroom to breastfeed: Neha Dhupia
text: Launching an initiative called 'freedom to feed', actress Neha Dhupia recalled she once had to take her daughter Mehr to a flight's washroom to breastfeed her. "I remember standing up in the plane and telling everyone I'll be using the washroom for about 15 minutes...I remember...hoping (in the washroom) the seat-belt sign doesn't go on," she said in a video.

headlines: Sunny Leone apologises after Delhi man's number shown as her's in film
text: Actress Sunny Leone has apologised to a Delhi man who claimed he's receiving several calls from unknown men after his phone number appeared in film 'Arjun Patiala' as the actress' number. "Sorry I didn't mean for that to happen to you. Must get some really interesting people calling," she said. The man had filed a police complaint after the incident.

headlines: MS Dhoni still India's best finisher and wicketkeeper: MSK Prasad
text: BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad has said that ex-India captain MS Dhoni is still India's best finisher and wicketkeeper. "The others are still work in progress. MS was a big strength to this team in World Cup both as a batsman and keeper, apart from sharing his vast experience with the team and captain while taking on-field decisions," he added.

headlines: It was emotional: Steve Smith's father on his 24th Test ton
text: After Steve Smith slammed his 24th Test hundred during the first innings of first Ashes Test, his father Peter Smith said it was emotional watching him get his hundred. "He'd worked very hard to get to that point. That was one thing he did say to me, it was one of the hardest innings hes had to play," he added.

headlines: MS Dhoni at no. 7 in WC semi wasn't my decision alone: Sanjay Bangar
text: India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said the decision to send MS Dhoni to bat at number seven in 2019 World Cup semi-final wasn't his decision alone. "Ravi Shastri has [also] categorically stated...it was a team decision," he added. "After consultations in changing room, we decided to leave Dhoni, our most experienced player, to do the finisher's job," he stated.

headlines: Ricky Ponting calls for neutral umpire rule change in int'l cricket
text: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that the time has come for international cricket to not have neutral umpires. He added that because of the 'neutral umpire' rule, the best umpires end up missing out on all the big tournaments. He further said that the rule could force umpires into "retirement a bit early as well".

headlines: Truecaller accused of reading users' SMS to check who needs loan
text: A software developer, by the name 'Nemo' on Twitter, has accused Swedish call-blocking app Truecaller of reading users' messages to check if they need a loan. The developer alleged Truecaller uses third-party software kits for an offline credit scoring of its users. This comes after Truecaller acknowledged a bug automatically linked unspecified Indian users to its payments service without consent.

headlines: 10 bn tonnes of Greenland ice sheet melts, turns into river in 24hrs
text: With several European countries experiencing heatwave, over 10 billion tonnes of ice sheet melted across Greenland on Wednesday alone. A video, which is being widely shared on social media, shows the melted ice sheets flowing like a river in the country. This was Greenland's biggest melt day this season with around 60% of the ice sheet melting at the surface.

headlines: North, central India to witness heavy rains for 2-3 days: IMD
text: Widespread and heavy rains are likely in parts of north and central India in the next 2-3 days, the India Meteorological Department said on Saturday. Fairly widespread rainfall is likely in states including Punjab, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh. The IMD has also issued a red colour rain warning for west and central Maharashtra.

headlines: TN hotel names chicken dish after Brahmin community, apologises later
text: A hotel in Tamil Nadu's Madurai named a chicken dish after 'Kumbakonam Iyer' Brahmin community, who raised a strong objection to the name. The hotel authorities apologised for naming the dish 'Kumbakonam Iyer Chicken' after the representatives of the community met them. The hotel also released a statement, confirming that they are "doing away with the name".

headlines: Girl returning home after celebrating 19th b'day gangraped in Mumbai
text: The police on Friday registered a case against unidentified persons for allegedly gangraping a 19-year-old girl on her birthday in Mumbai. She was allegedly raped by four men when she was returning home after celebrating her birthday at her friend's house last month. The girl's family said she didn't inform anyone about the incident for weeks and kept crying.

headlines: Airlines told to be ready to run extra flights from Srinagar: Report
text: Aviation regulator DGCA on Friday advised airlines to remain ready to operate additional flights from the Srinagar airport if the need arises, according to a report. The move comes after the Indian Army said it has confirmed intelligence inputs of terrorists trying to disrupt Amarnath Yatra and the Jammu and Kashmir government asked tourists to leave the Valley immediately.

headlines: I get lot of roles of molested woman or rape victim: Taapsee
text: 'Pink' actress Taapsee Pannu said in an interview that she is offered stories of a molested woman or rape victim. Adding that she doesn't want to repeat herself, Taapsee revealed, "You can't keep doing the same thing." Commenting on her initial Bollywood struggle, she said that she would go out to ask for what she really wanted to do.

headlines: Google halts transcription of private Assistant conversations in EU
text: Google has suspended the transcription of speech data picked up by its Assistant in the European Union for at least the next three months, a German data protection authority said. Google had admitted its contractors can listen to recordings of private conversations of users with its AI-based Assistant. It came after 1,000 private Dutch-language conversation recordings were leaked.

headlines: Will discuss cabinet expansion with central leadership: K'taka CM
text: After the opposition parties reportedly targeted Karnataka government over the delay in the cabinet formation, state's Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday said he would discuss it with the central leadership during his Delhi visit next week. "I'll try to do the cabinet expansion at the earliest," he added. "Routine developmental works...are not facing problems," Yediyurappa further said.

headlines: SoftBank-backed Automation Anywhere acquires Paris' Klevops
text: US-based robotic process automation unicorn Automation Anywhere has acquired Paris-based automation startup Klevops for an undisclosed amount. Automation Anywhere was founded in 2003 by Ankur Kothari, Mihir Shukla, Neeti Mehta and Rushabh Parmani. It had raised $300 million from SoftBank Vision Fund in November 2018, months after it gained its unicorn status in a $250-million funding in July 2018.

headlines: Pakistan opens historic Gurdwara 72 years after Partition
text: Pakistan on Friday opened the doors of the historic Gurdwara Chowa Sahib in Punjab province to Sikh devotees, including from India, 72 years after Partition. This comes ahead of the 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev, the first Sikh guru, in November. The Gurdwara was in a state of neglect since 1947 when Sikhs migrated to India after Partition.

headlines: Jal Jeevan Mission ready for Cabinet approval
text: Blueprint for Jal Jeevan Mission which was announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on July 05 has been approved by Expenditure Finance Committee and only Cabinet approval is pending, officials said. The mission aims to provide piped water to every household by 2024. "The day the scheme is approved, we'll start working," Minister for Jal Shakti Gajendra Shekhawat said.

headlines: I am definitely interested to coach India one day: Sourav Ganguly
text: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has said that he is "definitely" interested in becoming Team India head coach one day. "I'm interested but not at this point of time. Let one more phase go then I'll throw my name into the fray," he added. "Currently, Im associated with too many things," he further said.

headlines: Ex-Australia batsman Martyn trolls England over celebration pic
text: Former Australia batsman Damien Martyn took to Twitter to troll England by sharing a picture of English players celebrating an Australian wicket on the first day of the first Ashes Test on Thursday. "Woke up this morning and saw these pictures...For a minute I thought England had won Ashes...But then realised just taken a wicket," he added.

headlines: Ronaldo is above anyone else, he is the most complete player: Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has said that Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo is above everyone else. "He's the most complete player I have seen and his work ethic is unmatched," Kohli added. He further said that Ronaldo has had a greater career than Barcelona forward Lionel Messi as he has taken on more challenges and succeeded in all of them.

headlines: Plane carrying 'Arise, Sir Ben Stokes' banner flies over Ashes Test
text: Barmy Army, a semi-organised group of English cricket fans, flew a plane carrying 'Arise, Sir Ben Stokes' banner over the Edgbaston stadium on the second day of the first Ashes Test. This comes after UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson had said that Stokes would be considered for a knighthood.

headlines: UP man bets wife in gambling, lets friends gangrape her after losing
text: A man addicted to gambling and alcohol bet his wife after running out of money and allowed two of his friends to gangrape her after losing his stake. A district court ordered the police to register a case of gangrape after the police initially refused to take action on the victim's complaint. The incident happened in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur district.

headlines: If there's threat to Amarnath, why is Gulmarg being emptied? Omar
text: After the J&K government asked Amarnath pilgrims and tourists to leave the state immediately due to terror threat, former J&K CM Omar Abdullah tweeted, "If there's a threat to yatra why is Gulmarg being emptied?" "Friends staying in hotels...are being forced to leave. State...transport corporation buses are being deployed to bus people out from Pahalgam & Gulmarg," he added.

headlines: Kim doesn't want to disappoint me: Trump on N Korea's missile tests
text: Amid North Korea's recent missile tests, US President Donald Trump said that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un "doesn't want to disappoint [him] with a violation of trust". The tests didn't violate the agreement reached between them at the Singapore summit last year, Trump added. "[Kim] will do the right thing because he's far too smart not to", Trump further said.

headlines: Mark Wood out of Ashes due to multiple injuries
text: Pacer Mark Wood has been ruled out of the entire Ashes series due to multiple injuries. "Mark Wood has had left knee surgery to address an injury sustained during the ICC Cricket World Cup. He will continue rehabilitation for this and the left side strain that he sustained in the World Cup final," ECB's statement read.

headlines: Pak pacer Wahab Riaz set to retire from Test cricket: Report
text: Pakistan's 34-year-old pacer Wahab Riaz is reportedly set to retire from Test cricket. Riaz, who last played in the Test format against Australia in October 2018, has played 27 Test matches and picked 83 wickets. Former Pakistani cricketers like Wasim Akram, Ramiz Raja and Shoaib Akhtar had earlier criticised Mohammad Amir for announcing his retirement at the age of 27.

headlines: Azam Khan gets police notice for moving without bodyguards
text: Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan has been sent a notice by police requesting him to stop moving around without the Y category security allotted to him by administration. Khan has recently started to move around without his bodyguards which could prove to be a security issue, an official said on Friday. It's a lapse on his part, the official added.

headlines: Extra forces suggest something big being planned in J&K: Mufti
text: PDP supremo Mehbooba Mufti on Friday said that the statements of BJP leaders and deployment of additional forces by the Centre in Kashmir hints towards something big being planned. She further said, "It can instill doubt in the heart of any resident of Kashmir." "It is a matter of life and death for the residents [of the state]," Mufti added.

headlines: K Chandrashekar Rao controls BJP in Telangana: Cong leader
text: Telangana Congress' Ponnam Prabhakar Goud on Friday claimed that state's CM K Chandrashekar Rao controls BJP's state unit and has its "key in his hand". "If you (BJP) have courage, take your key back and run the party in Telangana," Goud said. Further reacting on leaders from Opposition party joining BJP, he said no Telangana Congress leader would join BJP.

headlines: Women are fragile, shouldn't work at night: Goa BJP MLA
text: Goa BJP MLA Alina Saldanha on Friday said women are feminine and fragile and shouldn't have to work at night. Her remarks come a day after NCP MLA Churchill Alemao said, "Goan women...[and] girls are delicate, but rest are fast." Goa Assembly has tabled The Factories (Goa Amendment) Bill, 2019 which enables women to work in factories during night shift.

headlines: Will change Maharashtras face if voted to power again: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that if BJP is voted to power in the Assembly polls again, it will change the face of the state in the next five years through development. He said this during his 'Maha Janadesh Yatra' in Nagpur. "Through this yatra, I'm seeking people's blessings as well as their mandate," Fadnavis added.

headlines: Delhi Congress activist Ghanendra Bharadwaj joins AAP
text: Congress activist Ghanendra Bharadwaj on Friday joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) along with several other Congress party workers. Last time AAP won 67 seats, but in the next elections the party will win all 70 seats, Bharadwaj said. Bharadwaj, who was reportedly a Congress activist for 25 years, joined AAP in the presence of senior party leader Durgesh Pathak.

headlines: Milky Way seen as warped, twisted in 'most detailed' 3D map yet
text: Astronomers have created the "most detailed" 3D map of the Milky Way galaxy to date, revealing that it is warped and twisted. "Stars 60,000 light-years away from Milky Way's centre are as far as 4,500 [light years] above or below the galactic plane," a Warsaw University astronomer said. The map is based on the distribution of about 2,400 Cepheids stars.

headlines: Floodwater which entered Vadodara is receding: DM
text: Vadodara District Magistrate Shalini Agarwal on Friday said that the floodwater which had entered the city is receding. "Water level in Vishwamitri river is going down since today morning...We have opened bridges for vehicular traffic," she added. "Electricity, water supply is being restored while health and cleanliness campaigns are being taken up," the DM further said.

headlines: We welcome SC order of daily hearing in Ayodhya case: RSS
text: RSS leader Suresh 'Bhaiyyaji' Joshi on Friday said he welcomes Supreme Court's decision to hold a day-to-day hearing on Ayodhya land dispute. "We're hopeful that this long-pending dispute will be resolved within a certain period of time and legal barriers to the construction of the temple will be removed," Joshi added. The SC will start daily hearings from August 6.

headlines: Noida gets its 1st 'Pink Toilet', 10 more to come up soon
text: Noida got its first 'Pink Toilet' dedicated to women with facilities for sanitary napkins and baby care. The toilet, located in the Sector 50 market, was inaugurated on Thursday by the Noida Authority. At least 10 more such toilets are expected to come up within the next two months, Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari said.

headlines: BJP MP's illegal mosques claim false: Delhi Minorities Commission
text: The Delhi Minorities Commission's fact-finding committee on Thursday said BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Verma's claims about illegal mosques and graveyards in Delhi are false. Earlier, Verma submitted a list of 54 allegedly illegal mosques and graveyards built on government land to Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal. "List was prepared in a careless manner," said the committee's Chairman Ovais Sultan Khan.

headlines: Baseless: Chennai hotel on lesbian couple's homophobia charge
text: After a lesbian couple accused a hotel in Chennai of homophobia and throwing them out of its premises, the hotel reportedly issued a statement and called the allegations baseless. "There have been biased, lopsided, defamatory and baseless allegations hurled at our entrepreneurial venture," they said. Earlier, the hotel said the couple was asked to leave after guests complained against them.

headlines: Pak's Hassan Ali confirms getting married to Indian girl on Aug 20
text: Pakistan fast bowler Hassan Ali on Friday confirmed that he is tying the knot with Haryana engineer Samiya Arzoo in Dubai on August 20. "We plan to stay in Gujranwala after marriage," he added. Hassan further said that he had met with Samiya one year ago in Dubai and their friendship had grown since that meeting.

headlines: FTC probing if FB bought Instagram, WhatsApp to cut rivals: Report
text: The US Federal Trade Commission is probing whether Facebook's Instagram and WhatsApp acquisitions were aimed at buying up potential rivals before they could become a threat, The Wall Street Journal reported. The social networking giant has purchased nearly 90 companies since 2003, as per S&P Global. Notably, Facebook was recently fined a record $5 billion by FTC over privacy scandals.

headlines: Apple AirDrop bug exposes users' phone numbers: Researchers
text: Cybersecurity firm Hexway's researchers have discovered a new flaw on Apple's AirDrop feature which broadcasts the phone number active on an iPhone in the form of a cryptographic hash. It is only partially hashed and can easily be converted into a full number, the researchers revealed. "Even if you're not currently using your iPhone, communication still takes place," researchers said.

headlines: Walmart to invest $50 mn in agritech startup Ninjacart: Report
text: American retail giant Walmart has reportedly committed an investment of about $50 million in Bengaluru-based agritech startup Ninjacart. The first tranche, pegged at $10 million, is reportedly expected to close in the next three weeks. Founded in 2015, Ninjacart enables farmers to directly sell to end retailers like grocery stores and restaurants and has raised $150 million till date.

headlines: Swiggy raising up to $750 million led by Naspers: Report
text: Swiggy is in advanced stages of closing a $700-750 million funding round at a valuation of around $4 billion, led by South African conglomerate Naspers, Livemint reported. "A total commitment of $540 million has come so far," Livemint quoted its source. "If existing or new investors don't give the remaining amount, Naspers may put in more," the source added.

headlines: India drops to 7th largest economy in 2018, UK and France overtake
text: India's economy has been pushed to the seventh spot in GDP rankings in 2018 with the UK and France overtaking the country, the latest World Bank data showed. India's GDP was $2.73 trillion while that of UK was $2.83 trillion and France was $2.77 trillion. India had surpassed France and then the UK in 2017 to become the fifth-largest economy.

headlines: Woman survives 6 days in car drinking rainwater in chewing gum box
text: A 45-year-old Belgian woman trapped in her car for six days following an accident, survived by drinking rainwater collected in an empty chewing gum box. Corine Bastide had injured her spine after her car crashed into a ditch. "I also used a wet branch to create the sensation of moisture in my mouth. But I didn't feel hungry," she said.

headlines: India-born doctor Bhasha Mukherjee crowned Miss England 2019
text: India-born doctor Bhasha Mukherjee was crowned Miss England 2019 on Thursday at a ceremony in Newcastle. The 23-year-old moved to England with her parents at the age of nine and settled in Derby. Mukherjee holds two different medical degrees, one in medical sciences and the other in medicine and surgery.

headlines: Designer says plus size brides shouldn't go for deep necks; criticised
text: Designer Falguni Peacock was criticised after she recommended plus size brides to not opt for deep necks for their wedding lehengas. She further suggested "long blouses, more flared lehengas and not fitted because fitted won't really work when you're a little big." "I won't blatantly tell her to lose weight...It's pretty easy to lose a couple of inches," she added.

headlines: Airtel to shut down 3G networks across India by March 2020
text: Bharti Airtel will shut down its entire 3G network across India's 22 telecom circles by March next year while focusing on providing 4G services to subscribers, CEO Gopal Vittal said. The process began last month when the telecom giant shut down 3G network in the Kolkata circle. Airtel will, however, continue to provide 2G services for feature phone users.

headlines: India unlikely to accept China-led trade deal: RSS economic wing
text: India is unlikely to sign China-backed Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership because of opposition from industry and farmers, RSS economic wing Swadeshi Jagran Manch said. "During the wider consultations, none of the sectors appreciated the idea of going ahead with RCEP," it added. The 16-member trade pact will force cuts in tariffs on farm goods, leading to cheaper imports, farmers said.

headlines: Firms moved from China to Thailand, Vietnam but why not India: Naik
text: L&T Chairman AM Naik said that many companies moved out of China to Vietnam and Thailand because of the US-China trade war but not to India. "How many industries have come here? For two years, the US has been talking of moving industries out of China but we were busy with elections, so we did not do anything," he added.

headlines: Plane lands on highway in US, police camera captures incident
text: A single-propeller KR2 aircraft made an emergency landing on a highway in Washington, US, on Thursday after it experienced a fuel system malfunction. The incident was captured by a patrol officer's dashboard camera. The officer then pulled over to make sure that the pilot was fine after landing.

headlines: See myself being involved more in Indian football: Kohli
text: Indian cricket captain and FC Goa co-owner Virat Kohli said, "I see myself being involved more and at a larger scale. Football has huge potential in India." "We have improved drastically... With new talent coming in... [O]ur skipper Sunil Chhetri leading the team with amazing composure and inspiration, I see us qualifying very soon for the World Cup," Kohli added.

headlines: Names, numbers on Test jerseys look ridiculous: Brett Lee
text: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee has said that the names and the numbers on the back of the Test jerseys look ridiculous. The names and numbers on back of the Test jerseys made a debut in the first Ashes Test between England and Australia. Lee further stated that he loves the other changes made by the ICC.

headlines: Jason Mohammed replaces injured Russell in West Indies T20 squad
text: Jason Mohammed has been called up to replace the injured Andre Russell in West Indies' T20I squad for the first two matches of their series against India that starts in Florida, USA. The Windies and India will contest three T20Is against each other, two in Florida and one in Guyana, before facing off in three ODIs and two Test matches.

headlines: He is down, hes frustrated: Broad about Anderson
text: Speaking about his pace bowling partner James Anderson, England's Stuart Broad said, "He is down, hes frustrated... [H]e is distraught he couldnt be out there today. He feels like hes let the bowling group down." Having been cleared to play against Australia in the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston, Anderson bowled four overs before experiencing pain.

headlines: LS passes Bill to remove Cong Prez as Jallianwala Bagh trustee
text: The Jallianwala Bagh National Memorial (Amendment) Bill, 2019, which seeks to remove the Congress President as a trustee of Jallianwala Bagh Trust was passed by the Lok Sabha on Friday. Piloting the Bill, Culture Minister Prahlad Patel asserted that national memorials should be kept away from politics. The bill was passed by a voice vote amid the Congress walkout.

headlines: BJP will form govt on its own in J&K this time: BJP Vice Prez
text: BJP Vice President and Jammu and Kashmir polls in-charge Avinash Rai Khanna on Friday said that the party will form a government on its own in the state whenever elections are held. Khanna further called the BJP-PDP government incomplete, adding that an era of peace, development and prosperity will usher in Jammu and Kashmir under the BJP government.

headlines: 'Gau rakshak' shot dead allegedly by cow smugglers in Haryana
text: A 'Gau Raksha' team member was shot dead allegedly by cow smugglers while he was following their vehicle on Monday in Haryana's Palwal, as per reports. Investigation is underway but there is no evidence of cattle smuggling so far, police said. This comes a month after the Haryana government made its cow protection law stricter by granting police more power.

headlines: Canada to create protected marine area in Arctic: Trudeau
text: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Thursday said that Canada will create a protected marine area in its Arctic region. Trudeau said that the effect of climate change in the region is three times faster than the global average. He also spoke about protecting Canada's sovereignty in its Arctic area in partnership with the indigenous people residing there.

headlines: 800 asylum seekers sent to wait in Mexico by US: Officials
text: Mexican authorities said the US sent about 800 asylum seekers back to Mexico as part of its "remain in Mexico" programme. Under the programme, the migrants who turn themselves over to US authorities and seek asylum would have to wait in Mexico during their immigration proceedings. They are allowed to enter the US only to attend their court hearings.

headlines: J&K govt asks tourists, Amarnath pilgrims to return amid terror threat
text: The Jammu and Kashmir government has issued a security advisory for Amarnath Yatra pilgrims and tourists, asking them to curtail their stay in the valley immediately. This comes after the Army said it has confirmed intelligence inputs of terrorists backed by Pakistan Army trying to disrupt Amarnath yatra. Sniper attacks were planned on Amarnath yatra route, as per the Army.

headlines: Russia declares INF treaty 'dead' as US formally withdraws from it
text: Russia on Friday said that the 1987 Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty is "formally dead" after the US announced its formal withdrawal from the pact. The Cold War-era pact banned both the US and Russia from stationing short and medium-range missiles in Europe. The US had accused Russia of violating the pact by developing a new type of missile.

headlines: Writer reacts to reports of her affair with Dias estranged husband
text: After actress Dia Mirza and author-screenwriter Kanika Dhillon announced their separation from their respective husbands on Thursday, the latter criticised reports for linking her up with Dia's estranged husband Sahil Sangha. She tweeted, "Have NEVER met Diya/ Sahil in my ENTIRE life!" Kanika had earlier clarified that her marriage had ended two years ago.

headlines: Dia Mirza reacts to reports of her estranged husband's affair
text: After reports speculated that Dia Mirza and her husband Sahil Sangha have separated over his affair with author-sceenwriter Kanika Dhillon, the actress took to Twitter to criticise such reports. "As a woman I'll not stand for another woman's name being used so irresponsibly," she wrote. "No third person is the reason for Sahil and I to part ways," Dia added.

headlines: Apple halts programme where contractors allegedly heard sex clips
text: Apple has globally suspended a quality control programme for Siri, days after The Guardian claimed contractors could hear recordings of drug deals, confidential medical details and people having sex. Apple said it's conducting a "thorough review" of the programme. "As part of a future software update, users will have the ability to choose to participate in grading," it added.

headlines: We lost Indira, Rajiv but never compromised on terror: Digvijaya
text: While discussing Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019, Congress' Digvijaya Singh said, "We lost Indira Gandhi, Rajiv Gandhi and Beant Singh. But we never compromised on terrorism." He accused BJP of compromising on terror and mentioned the release of Masood Azhar, who was released by India in 1999 in exchange for fliers aboard hijacked Indian Airlines flight IC-814.

headlines: Delhi HC bars Snapdeal from selling fake Titan, Fastrack products
text: The Delhi High Court, in response to a civil lawsuit filed by Titan, has directed e-commerce platform Snapdeal and its sellers to stop the sale of fake Titan and Fastrack products. This comes days after Snapdeal Founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal were booked over Congress leader Inder Mohan Singh Honey's allegations of receiving fake Woodland products.

headlines: Chandrayaan-2 successfully enters second-last orbit, confirms ISRO
text: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on Friday updated on India's second Moon mission saying that the Chandrayaan-2 spacecraft has successfully entered the fourth of the five planned orbits. "The last Earth-bound manoeuver is planned on August 6, 2019," ISRO added. Launched on July 22, Chandrayaan-2 mission is scheduled to attempt India's first soft Moon landing on September 7.

headlines: SC halts transfer of Unnao rape survivor's car crash case to Delhi
text: The Supreme Court on Friday halted the implementation of its order to transfer the case of Unnao rape survivor's car accident from Uttar Pradesh to Delhi for two weeks on CBI's request. CBI had sought help to get custody of expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and others to question them for the car crash.

headlines: Alleging torture by son, ex-journo donates properties to govt in will
text: Upset over ill-treatment meted out to him by his son and daughter-in-law, former journalist Khetramohan Mishra in Odisha has donated all his properties to the government in his will. "As my son and his wife don't care if I live or die and they've been constantly torturing me...they've no right to take my body after my death," the 75-year-old said.

headlines: Man who cancelled Zomato order told Taslima 'you have grt b**bs'
text: The man, who cancelled a Zomato order over a 'non-Hindu' delivery boy, had in 2013 told author Taslima Nasreen, "Well I will say you have grt b**bs." Nasreen shared the screenshot of the comment he had posted on her picture on Twitter. Did he show his disrespect to me because I am a non-Hindu, Nasreen asked along with the screenshot.

headlines: Convict stabbed to death by rival gang in Haryana jail
text: A convicted drug peddler named Ravinder Singh was stabbed to death and two other convicts were injured when 20 inmates from a rival gang allegedly attacked them at Haryana's Hisar Central Jail on Thursday. Last month, Ravinder and the two other convicts had attacked a member of the rival gang. Police have registered a case under relevant sections of IPC.

headlines: State-run firms set up JV to mine for lithium, cobalt overseas
text: Three state-run companies have agreed to form a joint venture to buy mining assets overseas that have minerals such as lithium and cobalt. The National Aluminium Company will hold a 40% stake in the joint venture, with Hindustan Copper and Mineral Exploration Corporation controlling 30% each. The joint venture will be called Khanij Bidesh India (KABIL).

headlines: J&K Guv to seek Centre's nod to open Kargil War zones for tourism
text: Jammu and Kashmir's State Administrative Council headed by Governor Satya Pal Malik has decided to seek Centre's permission to open Kargil war zones, like Tiger Hill, for the general public as a tourist destination. At present, tourists need permission from the Ministry of Home Affairs to visit such regions. The state is also planning several trekking routes in the region.

headlines: SC's decision in Unnao case stamp on UP govts failure: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said the Supreme Court's ruling in the Unnao rape case is a "stamp" on the prevailing "jungle raj" in Uttar Pradesh. "Grateful to the SC for taking cognisance of the 'jungle raj' being unleashed in UP," she tweeted. This comes after the Supreme Court transferred all Unnao rape-related cases from UP to Delhi.

headlines: Health Minister asks doctors protesting NMC Bill to join work
text: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday met striking doctors protesting against the National Medical Commission (NMC) Bill and appealed to them to resume work. "I...cleared their misunderstandings..and explained...[the NMC bill] is in the interest of doctors and patients," he said. The bill seeks to replace the allegedly corrupt Medical Council of India (MCI) with an NMC.

headlines: Thank you for the blessing: PM as BJP wins Tripura panchayat polls
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday thanked the people of Tripura after the BJP won most of the seats in the three-tier panchayat elections held on July 27. Thanking people for blessing the party, PM Modi tweeted, "Tripura's faith in @BJP4India remains unwavering!" He added, "I would urge @BJP4India Karyakartas from other states to interact with Karyakartas from Tripura."

headlines: Kindly look at your past: Amit Shah to Congress
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday targeted Congress after they accused the Centre of misusing laws. "What happened during emergency?...There was no democracy for 19 months, and you're accusing us of misusing laws? Kindly look at your past," he said during the debate in Rajya Sabha over UAPA Bill, 2019. The Bill was passed by the Rajya Sabha earlier today.

headlines: Juvenile gets 20 yrs in jail for gangrape of minor girl in J'khand
text: A local court has sentenced a juvenile to 20 years in prison in connection with the gangrape of a 13-year-old girl in Simdega district, Jharkhand last year. The 16-year-old convict will be kept in a probation home till he turns 21 years old. Earlier, the court had sentenced another person to 20 years in prison in connection with the case.

headlines: UP man makes wife drink bug repellant, strangles her to death
text: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly forcing his wife to drink mosquito repellant liquid and then strangling her to death in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The accused was infuriated to find his wife chatting with another man on WhatsApp, police said. The case came to light after the victim's father filed a complaint about his daughter missing from her house.

headlines: 5 held for suffocating lawyer to death after failed poisoning attempt
text: Noida police on Thursday arrested a domestic help and 4 others for allegedly suffocating 60-year-old Supreme Court lawyer Kuljeet Kaur to death, after a failed attempt at poisoning her. "They tied Kaur's legs...sealed her mouth with a tape and suffocated her to death," police said. Suspects stole Kuljeet's Hyundai car, jewellery and also damaged the CCTV cameras, according to officials.

headlines: Boy alerts security at metro station, foils mother's suicide bid
text: A minor boy foiled his mother's alleged suicide attempt by alerting security personnel deployed at a metro station in New Delhi on Thursday. The woman had left her two children alone, following which the boy informed the security personnel. The woman, who is believed to be mentally disturbed, was later handed over to the Delhi Police for further interrogation.

headlines: Assam Forest School transformed with Asian Paints' new campaign
text: As part of the 'Donate A Wall' campaign, Asian Paints along with St+Art India Foundation, transformed Assam Forest School, where the foresters and forest guards of the Assam Forest Department are trained about various aspects of forest and wildlife. One of the walls was painted with digital aesthetics and photorealistic imagery of animals to emphasise the importance of wildlife conservation.

headlines: SC to hear Ayodhya land dispute case on a day-to-day basis
text: The Supreme Court has said the Ayodhya land case will be heard on a day-to-day basis beginning August 6 after mediation process in the dispute failed. A three-member mediation panel in the case submitted its report in a sealed cover to Supreme Court on Thursday. The SC said that the contents of the report on mediation proceedings will remain confidential.

headlines: Terrorists backed by Pak Army trying to disrupt Amarnath Yatra: Army
text: In a joint press conference with J&K Police, Indian Army said it has confirmed intelligence inputs of terrorists backed by Pakistan Army trying to disrupt Amarnath Yatra. It also said that they have recovered terror cache along the yatra route and it includes Pakistan Army anti-personnel landmine and an M-24 American sniper rifle with a telescope.

headlines: Deepika collects my favourite shampoo bottles from hotels for me: Friend
text: Deepika Padukone's friend Sneha Ramchander has penned a note for her on her website ahead of Friendship Day. "Do you know someone who will steal, I mean collect, miniature bottles of your favourite shampoo from hotels, when she travels, because she knows you love them? That's my...friend DP," wrote Sneha. She further wrote Deepika's presence feels like a "warm hug".

headlines: Paytm, Alibaba gaming joint venture may raise $25 million
text: Paytm First Games, the gaming joint venture between Alibaba's AGTech and Noida-based fintech startup Paytm, is reportedly looking to raise $25 million. The platform is reportedly in talks with new investors, including SAIF Partners and an unknown Hong Kong-based entity for the fundraising. Launched as Gamepind in 2018, it raised $16 million from Paytm and AGTech in August 2018.

headlines: Policeman carries baby in tub on his head in neck-deep water
text: A video of a Gujarat policeman saving a baby from floods in Vadodara has gone viral. The video, shared by an IPS officer, shows Govind Chavda carrying the 45-day-old infant in a tub over his head through neck-deep water. "Proud of the humanitarian work of this cop...Great courage & dedication," the IPS officer wrote along with the video.

headlines: 'Hum Hindu' founder covers his eyes on seeing Muslim TV anchor
text: Ajay Gautam, founder of 'Hum Hindu', covered his eyes on seeing a Muslim news anchor on live TV. A video of his act was shared by the news channel that had invited him for a debate on the Zomato incident. Gautam's organisation, as written on its website, was founded with "the sole objective of complete Swaraj, absolute Hindu Rashtra".

headlines: Osama bin Laden's son Hamza was very threatening to US: Trump
text: Responding to the reports of the death of Osama bin Laden's son Hamza bin Laden, US President Donald Trump said, "I can't comment about that. But he was very threatening to our country. He was saying very bad things about our country." Hamza was killed in an air strike, the US media had reported citing intelligence officials.

headlines: 6 bomb blasts hit Bangkok as it hosts ASEAN summit
text: At least six small bomb blasts hit Bangkok on Friday as the Thai capital hosted an ASEAN summit. A statement from the office of Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha condemned the blasts, saying, "The situation is being closely monitored and security measures have been tightened. The public is urged not to panic." There was no immediate claim of responsibility.

headlines: Cognizants Debashis becomes Mindtrees 3rd CEO in its 20-yr history
text: IT services firm Mindtree on Friday named Debashis Chatterjee as its new Managing Director and CEO. Chatterjee, who previously led the digital systems and technology practice at Cognizant, will become Mindtree's third CEO in its two-decade existence. He replaces Rostow Ravanan, who quit along with Chairman Krishnakumar Natarajan and Vice Chairman NS Parthasarathy after L&T's hostile takeover.

headlines: Anushka calls for 'severe punishment' in Jamshedpur rape case
text: Actress Anushka Sharma has called for "severe punishment" expressing her anger on Twitter over Jamshedpur rape case where a three-year-old was allegedly kidnapped from a railway station, raped and beheaded. Reacting to the incident, Anushka tweeted, "It is literally making me shake in anger. Absolutely horrifying." The victim was abducted while she was sleeping beside her mother.

headlines: 'Super 30' now tax-free in Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana
text: J&K and Haryana have become seventh and eighth states respectively to declare Hrithik Roshan's 'Super 30' tax-free. Anand Kumar, on whose life the film is based, tweeted, "J&K Governor...passed instruction for making Super 30 tax-free." In another tweet, he thanked the Haryana CM for the same. Earlier, Bihar, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat, Delhi and Maharashtra declared the film tax-free.

headlines: BITSians Day to be celebrated across 100 locations on August 2
text: On the first Friday of August every year, BITSians Day is celebrated by the alumni and students of BITS Pilani at multiple locations across the world. BITSians will reunite for the 7th edition of BITSians Day on August 2, at more than 100 locations across the globe including new global locations like Vietnam, Israel, the Philippines and New Zealand.

headlines: Will quit AAP, may contest 2020 polls independently: Alka Lamba
text: Delhi AAP MLA Alka Lamba claimed that she has decided to quit the party and will soon make an official announcement on whether she will contest the 2020 Assembly elections as an Independent candidate. Lamba added, "I am not called to meetings. I am insulted repeatedly... In the AAP, I do not get basic respect."

headlines: Nothing wrong in what I said: BJP MLA on 'Muslim women' remark
text: A day after claiming that Muslim women dominate red-light areas of Mumbai and Kolkata, Odisha BJP MLA Bishnu Sethi stated, "There is nothing wrong in what I said... There are many reports which point towards this." Sethi, who was speaking in support of Triple Talaq Bill, added, "Even in Pakistan and Bangladesh, they do not have triple talaq."

headlines: Wanted to get back my freedom: Kumar on quitting as K'taka Speaker
text: Days after quitting as the Speaker of Karnataka Assembly, Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar said that he wanted to get back his freedom and so he took the decision to quit. He added, "As Speaker, there are restrictions on you, modesty demands that you should conceal your identity, suppress everything." He further said that he wanted to "liberate" himself.

headlines: Opposition demands ban on EVMs for Maharashtra Assembly polls
text: The Opposition parties in Maharashtra on Friday unanimously demanded a ban on Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) in the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections. Opposition leaders alleged there were discrepancies in EVMs in the Lok Sabha 2019 elections and demanded a return to ballot paper voting. This will be in the interest of bringing in transparency in the people's mandate, they added.

headlines: Alka Lamba an attention seeker: AAP MLA on her quitting claim
text: Delhi AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj called his party colleague Alka Lamba a "chronic attention seeker" after she claimed to have made up her mind to quit AAP. Bharadwaj said, "She's scared of losing her MLA seat. If she had to resign, she should send a resignation letter to party leadership, which she hasn't done. Declaring to media is just theatrics."

headlines: Block committee member arrested with 100 kg meat in UP
text: A block committee member was arrested after 100 kg of meat, suspected to be beef, was found in his vehicle during checking in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar, police said. The police added that four other occupants of the vehicle managed to escape. The accused were going to Meerut to smuggle the meat, Station House Officer (SHO) said.

headlines: Trump again offers to mediate on Kashmir issue
text: US President Donald Trump has again offered to mediate on Kashmir issue, saying the "battle has been going on for a long time". "I spoke with Pakistan about that, and I spoke, frankly, to India about it...if they wanted me to, I would certainly intervene," he added. Earlier, Trump claimed PM Narendra Modi requested him to mediate on Kashmir issue.

headlines: Saudi allows women above 21 to travel abroad without male consent
text: Saudi Arabia has allowed women above the age of 21 to obtain a passport and travel abroad without male consent, according to royal decrees published on Friday. The royal decrees also grant women the right to register child birth, marriage or divorce. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has eased social restrictions as part of the 'Vision 2030' program.

headlines: Asian Paints transforms school at Ahmedabad with new campaign
text: The walls of Todd Zone School, Ahmedabad were transformed as a part of Asian Paints' Donate A Wall campaign, in collaboration with St+Art India Foundation. With the vision to make the walls of the school better reflect the vibrant atmosphere that the school breeds, they were painted to highlight the importance of art in a student's life.

headlines: Told US that discussion on Kashmir will only be with Pak: Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday tweeted, "Have conveyed to American counterpart [Mike Pompeo]...in clear terms that any discussion on Kashmir, if at all warranted, will only be with Pakistan and only bilaterally." This comes after US President Donald Trump again offered to mediate on the Kashmir issue, saying the "battle has been going on for a long time".

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar to feature in Muttiah Muralitharans biopic
text: Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar will be making an appearance in the biopic of former Sri Lanka spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, Sethumadhavan, the head of the production (DAR motion pictures) confirmed. He further said that Muralitharans wife will also feature in the biopic. The biopic is scheduled to be released next year.

headlines: MacKenzie officially world's third-richest woman with $37 billion
text: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Bezos has officially become the world's third-richest woman with a net worth of $37 billion. Jeff Bezos transferred a 4% stake in Amazon to 49-year-old MacKenzie as part of their divorce settlement, making her the company's second-largest individual shareholder. He retains 12% stake worth $110 billion and remains the world's wealthiest person.

headlines: Jeff Bezos sells $1.8 billion worth of Amazon shares in 3 days
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos sold shares worth $1.8 billion in the last three days of July, reducing the value of his stake in the company to about $110 billion. The move was part of a previously adopted trading plan. Bezos has said previously that he would sell stock worth $1 billion each year to fund his rocket company Blue Origin.

headlines: Microsoft hires man named 'Mac Book' to troll Apple laptop in ad
text: Microsoft, in its latest ad for Surface laptop, hired a man named Mackenzie 'Mac' Book to troll rival Apple's laptop. The ad showed Mackenzie being asked questions such as which laptop lasts longer, which one is faster and which one has a better touch screen, to which he responded with the Surface. "Trust me, I'm Mac Book," he said.

headlines: Amazon to fine sellers who ship products in oversized packaging
text: Amazon has asked its sellers to make packaging for larger items more efficient and easier to open, The Wall Street Journal revealed. The e-commerce giant has said it has extended the deadline to comply with the changes from August 1 to September 3. Every package which does not meet the new standards will be subject to a $1.99 surcharge.

headlines: Kejriwal's office receives 2 emails with alleged threats to kill him
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's office has received two emails from an anonymous email ID on July 25 and July 30, allegedly threatening to kill him. The police have registered a case and are trying to identify the culprit. The emails reportedly didn't have any text except "...kill,kill,kill..." written in the subject line.

headlines: Bengaluru to implement 'no helmet, no petrol' rule from August 5
text: Bengaluru Police will enforce a 'no helmet, no petrol' rule for two-wheeler riders from August 5. "We will hold a meeting with the owners of the petrol pumps...There are no provisions of penalising the petrol pump workers but we are seeking social cooperation for a good cause," said KV Jagadish, DCP Traffic East, Bengaluru.

headlines: Cell to deradicalise terror accused to come up at Tihar jail
text: The Intelligence Bureau, Tihar jail authorities and Delhi Police's special cell are working to launch a de-radicalisation programme for prisoners, a government official has revealed. The programme will also focus on ensuring that prisoners booked in terror cases do not succeed in radicalising other prisoners. The idea was first proposed by the Home Ministry two years ago, the official added.

headlines: Trump announces 10% tariff on $300 billion worth of Chinese goods
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a 10% tariff on an additional $300 billion worth of Chinese imports starting September 1. Trump called it a "small tariff", saying, "We...feel that the future between our two countries will be a very bright one!" About $250 billion of imports from China are already subject to a 25% tariff.

headlines: Man suspected of killing Russian Instagrammer over jealousy held
text: Russian police have arrested a 33-year-old man suspected to have killed 24-year-old Instagram model Ekaterina Karaglanova, who was found dead in a suitcase with her throat slit last week. Police said the arrested man, an acquaintance, had grown jealous after learning Karaglanova planned to go on holiday with another man. She was set to celebrate her birthday with her boyfriend.

headlines: North Korea fires ballistic missiles for 3rd time in 8 days
text: North Korea fired ballistic missiles for the third time in eight days on Friday. The launch follows North Korea's warning over a US-South Korea military exercise which is scheduled to take place this month. US President Donald Trump said the missiles were short-range and "very standard" and would not affect his willingness to negotiate with North Korea.

headlines: Archer is coming back from quite a serious injury: Joe Root
text: Talking about England's newly selected Test member Jofra Archer, team's captain Joe Root said, "Jofra's coming back from quite a serious injury. His fitness will be monitored." Talking about Jofra missing the first Ashes Test, Root said the team looked for a combination which can take 20 wickets. "It also gives [Jofra] time to get absolutely fit," the 28-year-old added.

headlines: WhatsApp starts rolling out frequently forwarded label feature
text: WhatsApp has begun rolling out a new feature to let users know if a message has been forwarded multiple times. Highly forwarded messages will be marked with a double arrow icon and users will also receive a notice while forwarding, WhatsApp said. WhatsApp is also reportedly testing a feature for groups which will let users block the frequently forwarded messages.

headlines: Centre to deploy 28,000 more troops in J&K: Reports
text: Days after the Centre deployed 10,000 troops in Jammu and Kashmir, over 28,000 more security personnel are being sent to the valley, as per reports. No reason has been given by the government for the move, an official said. Reportedly, major entry and exit points have been taken over by the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs).

headlines: Biz failures shouldn't be tabooed: FM on Siddhartha's demise
text: Reacting to CCD Founder VG Siddhartha's death, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said business failures in the country shouldn't be tabooed. She said, "On the contrary, we should give an honourable exit or resolution to the problem in letter and spirit of IBC." In a letter purportedly written by him, Siddhartha had alleged harassment by the I-T Department.

headlines: I'll have a chat about sex with daughter when she grows up: Badshah
text: Rapper Badshah has said parents must talk about sex with children and added, "I've a daughter and I can't wait to have this chat with her, of course at an appropriate age." "I want her to know everything. I don't know how. Probably she'll feel awkward 'ke papa ko kya hogaya achanak se'...I've to make it fun," he added.

headlines: Names and numbers on Test jerseys are rubbish: Adam Gilchrist
