text: Reacting to players wearing Test jerseys with names and numbers on them in the first Ashes Test, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist tweeted, "The names and numbers are rubbish." This is the first time that players are wearing numbered jerseys in 142 years of Test cricket history. "Couldnt agree more. Not required at all," a fan reacted to Gilchrist's tweet.

headlines: SL players' bike skids while celebrating ODI series win, video viral
text: A video of Sri Lankan players Shehan Jayasuriya and Kusal Mendis falling off a bike on the ground while celebrating their ODI series win against Bangladesh has gone viral. In the video, the security personnel can be seen rushing to the rescue of the duo. Both the cricketers got on their feet soon without any injury.

headlines: Steve Smith smashes his 24th Test hundred, 9th in Ashes
text: Australia batsman Steve Smith smashed his 24th Test hundred and his ninth in Ashes after reaching the three-figure mark off 184 deliveries in first Ashes 2019 Test. Smith overtook Greg Chappell, Ricky Ponting and Arthur Morris to reach third position on list of most Ashes hundreds by Australians. Notably, Sir Don Bradman has hit most Ashes hundreds for Australia (19).

headlines: Foolish to remove Kohli as captain, he needs better coach: Akhtar
text: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Virat Kohli should remain Team India captain across all formats. "A lot has been invested into Kohli's captaincy. It will be completely foolish to remove Kohli," he added. "All he needs is a better coach and a better selection committee and he will improve," Akhtar further said.

headlines: Kohlis opinion on next India coach needs to be respected: Kapil Dev
text: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev, who is part of the committee that will pick India's new head coach, said that India captain Virat Kohli's opinion "needs to be respected". Kapil added his panel will do its job to the best of its ability. Notably, Kohli had earlier said that he'd love to see Ravi Shastri get another term.

headlines: BCCI receives over 2,000 applications for India head coach job: Report
text: The BCCI has received over 2,000 applications for the post of Team India head coach, as per reports. Former Sri Lanka coach Tom Moody, former New Zealand coach Mike Hesson are among those who have applied for the post. Among the Indian contenders, former all-rounder Robin Singh and former Team India manager Lalchand Rajput have applied for the role.

headlines: Ex-boxing champ gets 18-yr jail for sexually abusing his daughter
text: Former welterweight world boxing champion, Argentina's 48-year-old Carlos Baldomir, has been sentenced to 18 years in jail for repeatedly sexually abusing his daughter. Carlos abused his daughter for two years beginning when she was seven years old. He was arrested in November 2016 and spent almost three years in pre-trial detention.

headlines: Picture of MS Dhoni signing bat on Army duty in Kashmir goes viral
text: A picture of former Team India captain MS Dhoni signing a bat while on Army duty in Kashmir has gone viral. Dhoni joined his Territorial Army unit of the Parachute Regiment (106 Para TA battalion) on July 31. Dhoni, who holds the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Territorial Army, will serve his regiment in Kashmir till August 15.

headlines: Bengaluru airport plans to host weddings and music concerts
text: Bengaluru International Airport Limited (BIAL) is planning to build a concert arena at Kempegowda International Airport to rent out for weddings, music concerts and other entertainment events. "We plan to develop it on a 6.3-acre land parcel at the airport campus," a BIAL spokesperson said. "It's envisaged to have the capacity to accommodate up to 9,000 people," the spokesperson added.

headlines: Hyderabad constable caught on camera pinching woman doctor; suspended
text: A Hyderabad constable named Parmesh was suspended on Thursday for allegedly sexually harassing a protesting woman doctor. Students of the Government Ayurveda Hospital were protesting against the shifting of the hospital on Wednesday, when the police started dispersing them. Parmesh was caught on camera pinching a woman doctor and running his hand over her sides while she was dragged away.

headlines: Why keep changing features of notes, coins? Bombay HC asks RBI
text: The Bombay High Court has asked the Reserve Bank of India the reason behind changing the size and other features of currency notes and coins. The court was hearing a petition by the National Association for the Blind (NAB). The NAB said these changes posed difficulty for visually impaired persons in the identification and distinguishing of currency.

headlines: Man who cancelled Zomato order to give in writing he won't spread hate
text: Madhya Pradesh Police has sought a written undertaking from Zomato customer Amit Shukla that he would not spread religious hatred after he cancelled his order because his delivery person was a Muslim man. After Shukla gives the undertaking, police will watch his activities over the next six months. In case Shukla violates his undertaking, police can take him into custody.

headlines: We only discussed cricket: Jaishankar shares selfie with NZ minister
text: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar shared a selfie with his New Zealand counterpart Marise Payne on Twitter as he met her on the sidelines of an ASEAN event in Thailand on Thursday. "Couldn't resist a selfie at the end of the day. Nice evening with [Marise Payne]. We only discussed cricket," he wrote while sharing the selfie.

headlines: English FA increases minimum ban for racist abuse to 6 games
text: The English Football Association (FA) has increased the minimum ban for anyone found guilty of discriminatory behaviour to six matches from five ahead of 2019-2020 season. "Suspension may also be increased depending on...additional aggravating factors," FA said in a statement. FA also announced that people in technical areas can be issued with yellow and red cards for cautions and dismissals.

headlines: Saina, Srikanth out of Thailand Open after 2nd round defeats
text: Indian shuttlers Kidambi Srikanth and Saina Nehwal crashed out of the Thailand Open following their second round defeats. World number eight Nehwal lost to Japan's world number 18 Sayaka Takahashi 21-16, 11-21, 14-21, while world number 10 Srikanth lost to Thailand's Khosit Phetpradab 21-11, 16-21, 12-21. Meanwhile, Sai Praneeth has reached last-eight after defeating compatriot Subhankar Dey.

headlines: Man swept away by water in flooded Rajasthan street
text: A man was swept away by water in Rajasthan's Ajmer on Thursday as the streets flooded after heavy rainfall. In the video of the incident, the man can be seen flowing away on the street while some people try to rescue him. Earlier today, reportedly three people died after a house collapsed in Ajmer following heavy rainfall.

headlines: India's tiger census employed 44,000 people across 20 states
text: The 2018 tiger census in India reportedly involved over 44,000 members of field staff, working in 20 states, covering 3,81,400 sq km of forests. The exercise analysed 3,17,958 habitat plots and captured 3.5 crore photos in 26,760 locations. "It does not get any bigger than this, anywhere in the world," Dr Anup Kumar Nayak, Member-Secretary, National Tiger Conservation Authority, said.

headlines: Kelly Craft appointed US envoy to UN after Senate's confirmation
text: Kelly Knight Craft has been appointed as the US' ambassador to the United Nations after the Senate voted 56-34 on Wednesday to approve her appointment. She will replace Nikki Haley who stepped down from the position at the end of 2018. Craft had served as an alternate delegate to the UN during former US President George W Bush's rule.

headlines: 19-year-old UK girl jumps off plane after fight with friend, dies
text: A 19-year-old girl from the UK jumped to death from a plane in Madagascar last week after she fought with her friend, authorities said. Alana Cutland jumped from over 3,500 feet from a Cessna-style light aircraft, local media reported. Cutland's friend and the pilot had tried to stop her from jumping but she managed to free herself from their grip.

headlines: Indian cab driver in NY fails to recognise Kher, actor shares video
text: An Indian man working as a cab driver in New York for 30 years failed to recognise actor Anupam Kher throughout his cab ride recently, whose video was shared by Kher on Wednesday. The driver told Kher he couldn't recognise the actor as he looked like a man aged between 20-25 years. "As always no fare was charged," Kher said.

headlines: If you don't do cocaine in Bollywood, you are not cool: Hard Kaur
text: Speaking in light of SAD MLA Manjinder Sirsa's comments that actors including Deepika Padukone and Ranbir Kapoor were in "drugged state" at a party, rapper Hard Kaur said, "Nowadays the industry maxim is if you don't do coke, you aren't cool." "Cocaine, after all, is an expensive drug," she added. "The ones that stay together snort together," Hard Kaur said.

headlines: Pranksters list YouTuber's house as shelter home on Google Maps
text: Internet trolls listed YouTuber 'Ice Poseidon', or Paul Denino's LA house as a shelter home on Google Maps, falsely promising beds, free meals and security to homeless people. Denino revealed that pranksters had made the listing repeatedly, along with dozens of fake reviews. "It got a lot of people's hopes up," a homeless person living near the fake shelter said.

headlines: Maruti Suzuki sales fall 33.5% in July, the most in 7 years
text: The sales of India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki declined the most in nearly seven years, falling 33.5% to 1.09 lakh units in July from 1.64 lakh units a year earlier. Sales of the company's 'mini' segment, comprising Alto and old WagonR, declined almost 70% in July. Its domestic passenger vehicle sales fell 36.7% to 96,478 units.

headlines: 14 K'taka Cong-JD(S) MLAs move SC over disqualification by ex-Speaker
text: Fourteen rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs in Karnataka approached the Supreme Court on Thursday to challenge the former Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar's decision to disqualify them for the current Assembly term. Earlier, two rebel Congress leaders and an independent leader had moved the court over disqualification. Kumar had disqualified 17 rebel MLAs under the anti-defection law after they gave resignations.

headlines: T'gana court orders FIR against Akbaruddin Owaisi for hate speech
text: A Telangana court has asked the state police to register an FIR against AIMIM MLA Akbaruddin Owaisi over an alleged hate speech. In a speech last week, Owaisi referred to his 2013 comment about "removing the police for 15 minutes off the streets", suggesting violence would erupt between Hindus and Muslims. He suggested RSS was still scared of his threat.

headlines: I thought of taking my life when IndiaPlaza ran out of money: Founder
text: IndiaPlaza Founder K Vaitheeswaran has revealed that he thought about taking his life on January 1, 2013, after his e-commerce company ran out of money. "And this is a thought that crosses the minds of many entrepreneurs in India," he said. Vendors were constantly calling and threatening Vaitheeswaran while an ex-employee threatened to sexually assault his wife over unpaid salaries.

headlines: Muslim women dominate red-light areas of Mumbai: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA BC Sethi, while speaking in support of Triple Talaq Bill on Thursday in Odisha Assembly, said, Muslim women dominate the red-light areas of Mumbai and Kolkata." Sethi also cited magazine and newspaper reports to justify his claim. He was replying to Congress MLAs who had criticised the BJP-led Centre for passing the Triple Talaq Bill in the Parliament.

headlines: Government's economic policies destroying farmers: CPI(M)
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Thursday targeted the government and said its economic policies have "destroyed" farmers, small traders and entrepreneurs. "Destroy farmers, destroy small traders, destroy entrepreneurs...that seems to be the sole motive of the government's economic policies since 2014," he tweeted. "Every single indicator tells us of an economy in deep crisis," Yechury added.

headlines: Bajaj Auto sales in July fall for first time in 2 yrs by 5%
text: The sales of world's largest three-wheeler manufacturer Bajaj Auto declined for the first time in two years, falling 5% to 3.82 lakh units in July from four lakh units a year ago. Bajaj Auto's domestic motorcycles and commercial vehicles sales in July fell 13% to 2.05 lakh units. However, the automaker's exports rose 8% to 1.76 lakh units in July.

headlines: Police seize over one kilogram heroin in Punjab
text: The Punjab Police on Wednesday seized over one kilogram of heroin in Ludhiana. As per reports, two persons, identified as Amit Mongia and Eva Das, have been arrested for possessing the same. Police arrested them after they suspected the two of carrying drugs in the car and later on checking, recovered 1.26 kilograms of heroin.

headlines: Germany rejects US request to join naval mission in Strait of Hormuz
text: Germany has rejected the US' request to join a naval mission in the Strait of Hormuz, Foreign Minister Heiko Maas announced. The US-led mission is aimed at protecting shipping routes in the strategic passageway. The mission comes amid heightened tensions between Iran and the West over the seizure of oil tankers.

headlines: Motilal Oswal Co-Founder Agrawal to take up non-executive role
text: Raamdeo Agrawal, the Co-Founder of Motilal Oswal Financial Services (MOFSL), has been appointed as the non-executive Chairman of the firm. Agrawal will take up the non-executive role from October 14 this year, after his current term as the company's Joint Managing Director expires. Agrawal, who is a Chartered Accountant, co-founded the financial services firm in 1987 alongside CMD Motilal Oswal.

headlines: India Post Payments Bank to be converted into small finance bank
text: The Department of Posts will convert India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) into a small finance bank (SFB) to provide small loans to individuals, and small and medium enterprises. It aims to open one crore IPPB accounts in 100 days. The decision comes under the government's plan to align the postal department with PM Narendra Modi's "New India" initiative.

headlines: OnePlus 7 Pro 5G hits fastest download speeds: RootMetrics
text: According to independent network testing firm RootMetrics, OnePlus 7 Pro 5G hit the fastest download speeds among the 5G handsets available in the UK, including Samsung Galaxy S10 5G, LG V50 5G and Oppo Reno 5G. OnePlus 7 Pro 5G has 90Hz Fluid AMOLED display with dual-curved glass design, the flagship Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 and 30W Warp Charging speeds.

headlines: Anu Malik says he was out of work for no reason, Sona criticises
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra has criticised singer-composer Anu Malik for saying that he was out of work "for no rhyme or reason". He had stepped down as the judge of 'Indian Idol' season 10 after sexual harassment allegations were made against him. "These were the reasons," Sona tweeted while quoting statements from people who had accused him of sexual harassment.

headlines: IBM fired 1 lakh people in last few years to look 'cool': Lawsuit
text: IBM fired up to 1,00,000 employees in the last few years to appear "cool" and "trendy" like Google and Amazon, an ex-employee deposed in an age discrimination lawsuit. The lawsuit's plaintiff accused IBM of firing him after 24 years because of his age. A ProPublica investigation found IBM fired 20,000 US employees aged 40 or older in last five years.

headlines: Police notice to man who cancelled Zomato order over 'non-Hindu' rider
text: Madhya Pradesh Police has issued a notice to Amit Shukla, the Jabalpur-based man who cancelled a Zomato order as the rider assigned to deliver his order was 'non-Hindu'. "He'll be warned, if he tweets anything which is against ideals of Constitution, action will be taken; he is on surveillance," police said. "Food has no religion," Zomato had responded to Shukla.

headlines: CCI dismisses case against OYO over market dominance abuse
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has dismissed a case against Gurugram-based OYO's parent firm Oravel Stays over accusations that it abused its market dominance. The complaint was filed by New Delhi-based RKG Hospitalities, which alleged that OYO made one-sided, unfair and discriminatory agreements. CCI agreed with OYO's argument that it's not a dominant player in any relevant market.

headlines: 6 former Jet Airways pilots debarred from exam for cheating
text: Aviation regulator DGCA has debarred six former Jet Airways pilots for a period of six months from appearing in the examination for a permit to fly Airbus A320. The six pilots were caught cheating during the examination. The examination was being conducted by IndiGo on July 22 in the presence of a DGCA invigilator.

headlines: Goan women delicate, decent, rest are fast: NCP MLA Alemao
text: During a discussion on The Factories (Goa Amendment) Bill, 2019, former CM and NCP MLA Churchill Alemao said, "Goan women are delicate, girls are delicate, but rest are fast. It works for them." Alemao added that Goan women are "decent" and urged Deputy CM Chandrakant Kavlekar to rethink the bill, which enables women to work in factories during night shift.

headlines: Maldives ex-VP detained for trying to enter India illegally: Reports
text: Former Maldivian Vice President Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor has been detained in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin for allegedly trying to enter India illegally, according to reports. Adeeb tried to enter by posing as a crew member of a ship, reports added. Adeeb wants to seek political asylum in India, reports quoting police sources said.

headlines: Don't drag me in it: Priyanka to Cong leaders asking her to be chief
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has turned down the suggestion that she should become the party President after Rahul Gandhi announced his resignation from the post. Priyanka said, "Don't drag me into this", after Congress leader RPN Singh asked her to assume the role of the party chief in a meeting attended by Congress General Secretaries and states in-charges.

headlines: 44 injured after faulty machine makes 10 ft wave in China water park
text: As many as 44 people were injured after a faulty wave machine created a 10-foot wave in Shuiyun Water Park in China on July 29. While the water park claimed that around 10 people were injured, the officials maintained that no fewer than 44 people were injured. They added that three people were hospitalised with broken bones and serious abrasions.

headlines: Ex-US Prez Reagan called Africans 'monkeys', recordings reveal
text: Former US President Ronald Reagan had called African delegates to the United Nations "monkeys" in a phone call in 1971, audio recordings revealed. Reagan was California's Governor when he had made the comment in the call to then-US President Richard Nixon. He was purportedly referring to the way the Tanzanian delegation danced after a vote at the United Nations.

headlines: I owe my Hollywood career to SRK: Gulshan Grover
text: Gulshan Grover in an interview revealed that Shah Rukh Khan had pushed him to sign his first Hollywood movie 'The Second Jungle Book' (1997) when they were shooting for 'Yes Boss'. "I was so scared thinking the director (of 'Yes Boss') would sue me," he added. SRK told him, "Tu ja, I will handle the situation here," Grover revealed.

headlines: Shilpa Shetty to make her comeback in films after 13 years
text: Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty on Wednesday announced on Instagram that she has been roped in for Sabbir Khan's 'Nikamma' along with Abhimanyu Dassani and YouTube singer Shirley Setia. 'Nikamma' will mark her comeback to the big screen after 13 years. "I loved my role as it's something that I have never attempted before," said Shilpa.

headlines: Incredible to be part of such history: Roy on Ashes debut
text: England batsman Jason Roy, who made his Ashes debut today, posted a picture of him on Instagram, saying, "Game day! Incredible feeling to be a part of such history. Excited...#691..." In the picture, the 29-year-old's Ashes jersey with his name and number 20 inscribed on it can also be seen. Roy made his Test debut on July 24 against Ireland.

headlines: BJP should answer schoolgirl's question: Priyanka Gandhi
text: After a class 11 schoolgirl from Uttar Pradesh questioned police officials on women's safety citing the Unnao rape case, Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked BJP to give an answer. "If an influential person does something wrong, would our voices be heard?" the girl asked. "This question is in the mind of every woman and girl in UP," Gandhi tweeted.

headlines: CWC meet to take place after Parliament session: Surjewala
text: Congress' Communications in-charge Randeep Singh Surjewala on Thursday said that a meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) will take place after the Parliament session is over. Surjewala also informed that no agenda has been decided yet for the meeting. The CWC will be meeting for the first time after Rahul Gandhi officially resigned as the Congress President.

headlines: 12-15 people thrash man over money dispute in MP: Police
text: Around 12-15 people dragged and beat up a man following some dispute over money in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas, police said. The victim was admitted to a hospital with a fractured leg and a case has been registered against over a dozen people involved in the incident, Superintendent of Police said. Some of the miscreants abused the police too, he added.

headlines: Azam Khans son arrested for allegedly violating Section 144
text: The Uttar Pradesh police on Thursday arrested Samajwadi Party leader Abdullah Azam Khan, son of SP MP Azam Khan, for allegedly violating Section 144 in Rampur. Abdullah and his supporters were protesting after police carried out raids at Mohammad Ali Jauhar University in Rampur, of which Azam Khan is the Chancellor. "People are being framed," Abdullah said before the arrest.

headlines: Police arrest 3 people with leopard skin in Maharashtra
text: Police have arrested three people after a leopard skin was found during a raid in a house in Maharashtra's Gondia, a senior police officer said. He added, "The skin measured 5.11 feet and its price in the international market runs into lakhs of rupees." Later, the police handed over the trio to the forest department for further action, he said.

headlines: Britain to spend extra £2.1 bn for no-deal Brexit planning
text: Finance Minister Sajid Javid on Thursday announced the UK will spend an additional £2.1 billion on no-deal Brexit planning, taking the total to £6.3 billion. According to PM Boris Johnson, Britain is scheduled to leave the EU on October 31, with or without a deal. The money would be used for stockpiling medicines, hiring more border officials and advertisement campaigns.

headlines: Beijing authorities order removal of Muslim symbols: Reuters
text: A Reuters report states authorities in China's Beijing have ordered the removal of 'halal' written in Arabic and Islamic symbols like crescent moon from signs of food outlets. Analysts claim China is attempting to curb down on foreign influences to control religious groups without difficulty. The report claims the move is part of an attempt to Sinicize China's Muslim population.

headlines: 3-yr-old sleeping near mother kidnapped, raped & beheaded in J'khand
text: Three people have been arrested after a three-year-old girl, sleeping with her mother at a railway station, was allegedly kidnapped, gangraped and beheaded in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur last week. Police have recovered her torso and pressed sniffer dogs into service to locate her head. One of the accused, Rinku, is a policeman's son and was convicted previously for kidnapping children.

headlines: Pak offers consular access to Jadhav, India evaluating proposal
text: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said India has received a proposal from Pakistan for consular access to retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav. "We are evaluating the proposal in the light of the International Court of Justice's judgement," Kumar added. ICJ had found Pakistan guilty of violating the Vienna Convention and ordered it to grant Jadhav consular access.

headlines: OnePlus emerges as leader in premium smartphone segment: Report
text: With the OnePlus 7 series, OnePlus emerged as the leader in the premium smartphone segment in India, as per Counterpoint Research's report. OnePlus achieved this after recording its highest-ever shipment share of 43% in the premium segment, pushing the overall shipment growth to 33% during Q2'19. It debuted in the ultra-premium segment with OnePlus 7 Pro and captured 26% share.

headlines: Amazon may foray into automobiles, gets 210 related patents
text: Amazon received at least 210 patents covering transportation-related topics from drones to automated ground vehicles, Reuters reported after analysing over 5,000 US patents granted from December 2016 through May 2019. Amazon reportedly is likely planning a foray into automobiles sector. Notably, it acquired three transportation-related startups, Dispatch, Canvas and Tapzo, in the past two years.

headlines: DeepMind AI can predict kidney illness 2 days before it occurs
text: Google-parent Alphabet's artificial intelligence (AI) lab DeepMind has created a model which it claims can predict Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) up to 48 hours before it happens. The model correctly identified 9 of 10 patients whose condition worsened enough to need dialysis. The machine-learning software was trained using medical records of over 7,00,000 US Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) patients.

headlines: Man who refused Zomato delivery by 'non-Hindu' to get police notice
text: Madhya Pradesh Police has decided to send a notice to a Zomato customer in Jabalpur who had cancelled a food order after refusing delivery by a "non-Hindu" delivery person. Jabalpur Police Superintendent Amit Singh said the man will be asked to explain his conduct. "If...true, it amounts to hurting religious sentiments of people. This is a crime," he added.

headlines: Faasos parent gets $125mn from Goldman Sachs, Go-Jek, others
text: Cloud-kitchen startup Rebel Foods, which operates brands including Faasos and Behrouz Biryani, has raised $125 million at a valuation of $525 million. The funding saw participation from Goldman Sachs, Indonesian delivery service Go-Jek, Coatue Management, among others. Founded in 2011 by Jaydeep Barman and Kallol Banerjee, Rebel Foods has raised nearly $245 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: Highly gratified by cooperation from great friend India on Iran: US
text: The US is "highly gratified by cooperation from a great friend and partner like India" over the sanctions imposed on the import of Iranian oil, the White House said. India has ended the import of Iranian oil in compliance with the US sanctions. "The US continues to be very mindful of India's legitimate energy needs," an official said.

headlines: Got 6,800 letters in July: SC official to CJI on delayed Unnao letter
text: The secretary general of the Supreme Court has told Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi that around 6,800 letter petitions were received in July and this is why the letter by Unnao rape survivor's family didn't reach him on time. The CJI had sought report from the officials over delay in presenting the letter, which was sent weeks before the survivor's accident.

headlines: AIIMS Delhi resident doctors observe strike against NMC Bill
text: AIIMS Delhi's resident doctors observed a one-day strike on Thursday in protest against certain provisions of National Medical Commission Bill, 2019. They threatened to refrain from working in emergency departments and ICUs if it's passed in Rajya Sabha. The Bill seeks to replace Medical Council of India and proposes a common final-year MBBS exam as an entrance test for PG.

headlines: 3 police staff deployed in Unnao rape survivor's security suspended
text: Three police personnel including two women constables, deployed to provide security to Unnao rape survivor, were suspended for negligence in duty four days after she was critically injured in a road accident in Rae Bareli. They were ordered to accompany the survivor whenever she travels but they were not with her when a speeding truck hit her car on Sunday.

headlines: Ayodhya mediation panel submits its report in sealed cover to SC
text: A three-member mediation panel in the Ayodhya land dispute case submitted its report in a sealed cover to Supreme Court on Thursday. The panel comprises former apex court judge Kalifulla, spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar and senior advocate Sriram Panchu. The outcome of the mediation process will be considered by a five-judge Constitution Bench headed by CJI on Friday.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor's kin sent 36 letters to officials before accident
text: The Unnao rape survivor's family wrote 36 letters to top government officials, politicians and police officers in last one year before the survivor's accident, claiming threat to their lives and requesting safety measures, her relative said. This comes after the family's letter to Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi surfaced in media, following which the CJI took up the matter for hearing.

headlines: Man drives on wrong side; slaps & bites Noida policeman when stopped
text: A man from Bulandshahr named Shailesh Kumar Sharma was arrested on Monday for allegedly slapping traffic head constable Kunwarpal Singh and biting two of his fingers in Noida. Singh had stopped Sharma for allegedly driving his motorcycle on the wrong side of the road. "I cried out in pain and called my colleagues to the spot for help," Singh said.

headlines: US sanctions Iran's Foreign Minister amid rising tensions
text: The US has imposed sanctions on Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif amid the escalating tensions between the two nations. "Zarif implements the reckless agenda of Iran's Supreme Leader and is the regime's primary spokesperson around the world. The US is sending a clear message to the Iranian regime that its recent behaviour is completely unacceptable," Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said.

headlines: ED raids Fortis founders Malvinder Singh and Shivinder Singh
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday raided the premises linked to ex-Ranbaxy promoters and Fortis founders Malvinder Singh and Shivinder Singh in connection with a money laundering case, officials said. They are accused of siphoning hundreds of crores from Fortis and Religare. The raids were also related to allegations that the brothers hold undisclosed foreign assets, reports said.

headlines: Sensex falls 463 points after posting worst July in 17 years
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex fell 463 points on Thursday to close at 37,018. The index declined 4.9% last month suffering its worst July in 17 years because of worries over a number of budget proposals and a further slowdown in the economy. Notably, Sensex has fared better in August than July in only five years since 2002, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: Motor Vehicles Bill will cause decline in accidents: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari expressed confidence that the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Bill will cause a decline in accidents. He added that the passing of this bill is a "tribute" to those who lost their lives in accidents. He further said, "We are number one in accidents in the world. Now, we have got the chance to correct this."

headlines: State govt is run by Owaisi, not KCR: Telangana BJP chief
text: Telangana BJP President Dr K Laxman claimed that the state government is being run by AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and not by CM K Chandrashekar Rao. He added, "TRS revolves and runs around AIMIM agenda." Speaking on Owaisi's comment on Triple Talaq Bill, Laxman said that Owaisi should know over 20 Islamic countries have regulated triple talaq in various forms.

headlines: Leaders are joining BJP to bring development: Fadnavis
text: After one Congress MLA and three NCP MLAs joined the BJP, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said, "Leaders who are connected with the people...are joining the BJP to take this development to the people in their respective areas." Fadnavis added, "People have experienced the change that has set in under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi."

headlines: IMD predicts heavy rainfall in Delhi, Punjab, Haryana
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday said that Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, Haryana and Delhi are likely to witness heavy rainfall. It also predicted that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Goa, Konkan and Saurashtra. Meanwhile, parts of Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Assam and Meghalaya are also likely to witness heavy rainfall.

headlines: Months after father's murder, 2 brothers shot dead in Bihar
text: Months after their father was murdered over a land dispute, two brothers were shot dead while sleeping on the terrace of a temple near their house in Bihar. Their family has accused five people, including cousin brothers of the deceased, of committing the crimes. The police said they have arrested one person, although the main accused remain absconding.

headlines: Kathua schoolgirl alleges rape, says police refused to file FIR
text: A 17-year-old schoolgirl in Kathua, Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday said the police refused to file an FIR after she approached them to file a rape case against two of her classmates. The girl accused her classmates of raping her at a resort and circulating the video online. An FIR was filed after her family approached the court.

headlines: Villagers beat 'most wanted' thief to death in Jharkhand
text: A "most wanted" thief was beaten to death by residents of a village in Jharkhand's Dumka, Superintendent of Police said. He added that there were four thieves but three of them managed to flee. The SP further said that an FIR has been registered in the case and four villagers have been taken into custody for questioning.

headlines: Footballer accidentally live streams himself having sex, apologises
text: Cameroonian forward Clinton N'Jie has tendered an apology after accidentally live streaming himself having sex on Snapchat. "I am sorry, I had drunk too much. I celebrated my new contract and wanted to read the news. I pressed the wrong button," he said. The former Tottenham attacker added that he was trying to 'Google' himself.

headlines: BJP expels Unnao rape and murder accused MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar
text: BJP has expelled MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, who is accused of raping a teen in Unnao. Sengar and about 30 of his aides were recently booked for murder and conspiracy by the CBI in connection with the accident of the rape survivor, which also led to the death of two others. The party had suspended the leader last year.

headlines: CM Kejriwal announces free electricity up to 200 units in Delhi
text: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced that electricity would be free for those who consume less than 200 units in Delhi. "They will get a zero electricity bill. It is a historic decision," he said after making the announcement. "Consumers of 201-400 units of electricity will receive approximately 50% subsidy," Kejriwal added.

headlines: Triple Talaq bill becomes a law after President's approval
text: President Ram Nath Kovind has given assent to the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019 passed by the Parliament, making it a law. The law criminalises instant triple talaq and seeks up to three years in jail for guilty. It was passed in the Rajya Sabha, with 99 MPs voting in its favour and 84 against it.

headlines: Vicky to spend time with Indian Army at 14,000ft altitude; shares pic
text: Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to reveal that he'll be spending time with Indian Army jawans. "Elated to be getting an opportunity to spend a few days with our Indian Army posted at 14,000ft altitude at the Indo-China border of Tawang, Arunachal Pradesh," he wrote while sharing a picture. Vicky will play Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in an upcoming biopic.

headlines: YouTube star Grant Thompson killed in paragliding accident aged 38
text: YouTube star Grant Thompson, host of channel 'The King of Random', died in a paragliding accident aged 38. Authorities said Thompson, who had 11 million subscribers on his channel, was reported missing after he didn't return on Monday from a paragliding trip in Utah. A GPS device that he had with him was used to locate his body on Tuesday.

headlines: Can pay tribute to Hemant Karkare but not respect him: RSS leader
text: RSS leader Indresh Kumar has said that one can pay tributes to 26/11 Mumbai terror attack martyr Hemant Karkare, but he "cannot be respected". "Karkare died of terrorist's bullets, so he is a martyr...However, the Congress government misused agencies and tortured a woman (BJP MP Pragya Thakur) under the conspiracy of 'bhagwa aatankwad'," he added.

headlines: I'm hurt: Muslim delivery boy on man cancelling order over religion
text: Speaking about a customer cancelling his Zomato order over a "non-Hindu" delivery boy, delivery executive Faiyaz, who was assigned the customer's order said, "I feel hurt." "It's okay...We're poor, we've to suffer," he added. Narrating the sequence of events, Faiyaz said, "I called [him]...to know the location of his house. But he said he had cancelled the order."

headlines: How will you protect me: Class 11 girl asks police citing Unnao case
text: After Uttar Pradesh Police delivered a lecture in a school on right to protest, a Class 11 girl raised a question on women's safety citing the Unnao rape case. "We know a teen was raped by a BJP leader. Everyone knows it was no accident...If we protest, how will you ensure justice? How will you guarantee my safety," she asked.

headlines: SC transfers all cases linked to Unnao rape out of UP to Delhi
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday transferred all cases linked to the Unnao rape case from Uttar Pradesh to Delhi. The top court has also asked for the status report on the investigation into the car accident of the Unnao rape survivor. It sought CBI officers' and Solicitor General's presence during the next hearing.

headlines: Probe Unnao rape survivor's accident in 7 days: CJI to CBI
text: Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi has directed the CBI to conclude the investigation in Unnao rape survivor's accident case in seven days. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta had sought a month's time for the probe initially. This comes after the Supreme Court told authorities to transfer all cases linked to the rape case to Delhi.

headlines: DGCA suspends 2 SpiceJet pilots for 1 year over unsafe landing
text: Aviation regulator DGCA on Wednesday suspended flying licences of two SpiceJet pilots who were flying an aircraft that overshot the runway at Surat airport on June 30. DGCA found the pilots had continued an unstabilised approach and the plane had landed with high speed, leading to runway excursion. It had landed with 600 metres of runway left, an official said.

headlines: 6 dead due to heavy rain in Vadodara; airport, schools shut
text: At least six people reportedly died in rain-related incidents in Vadodara till late Wednesday night. The airport was closed and several trains were cancelled or rescheduled, while schools and colleges were also shut. Vadodara received 442 mm of rain in 12 hours between 8 am and 8 pm on Wednesday, the highest in Gujarat in the period, said the state.

headlines: Who's interim CCD Chairman Ranganath appointed after Founder's death?
text: Interim Café Coffee Day (CCD) Chairman SV Ranganath, appointed to the post on Wednesday after Founder-Chairman VG Siddhartha's death, is a former IAS officer who has worked with seven Karnataka Chief Ministers. Ranganath was appointed to the CCD board in 2015 and is currently serving as a non-executive independent director to the Coffee Day group.

headlines: Amit Shah to head Group of Ministers to look into mob lynchings
text: A Group of Ministers (GoM) constituted in 2018 to tackle the problem of mob lynchings in India will now be headed by Home Minister Amit Shah, a senior government official has revealed. Members of the GoM include External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad and Social Justice and Empowerment Minister Thaawarchand Gehlot.

headlines: B'luru India's best city for students, Mumbai 2nd best: QS Rankings
text: Bengaluru has been rated as the best city for studying in India followed by Mumbai, Delhi and Chennai, according to QS Best Student Cities 2019 list. London has been ranked the world's best city for studying for the second consecutive year followed by Tokyo, Melbourne, Munich and Berlin. Globally, Bengaluru has been ranked 81st in the list of 120 cities.

headlines: Tax terrorism claimed life of CCD founder: Congress
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala alleged that "tax terrorism" under the BJP government has claimed the life of Cafe Coffee Day (CCD) founder VG Siddhartha. Sharing a report on Siddhartha's death, Surjewala tweeted, "The End for 'Ease of doing business'!" On Wednesday, Siddhartha's body was found on the banks of river Netravati in Mangaluru after he went missing on Monday.

headlines: CarDekho gets $20 million under ongoing $110 million round
text: Online car marketplace CarDekho has received about $20 million as part of its ongoing $110 million Series C funding round, regulatory filings revealed. The round was led by SC GG India Mobility with participation from Hillhouse and Kreatif Media Karya. Founded in 2008 by IIT graduates Amit Jain and Anurag Jain, CarDekho helps users buy new and used cars.

headlines: US-based sales assistant startup Vymo raises $18 million
text: US-based sales assistant startup Vymo has raised $18 million in a Series B funding round led by Emergence Capital. Existing investor Sequoia India also participated in the funding. Founded in 2013 by Venkat Malladi and Yamini Bhat, Vymo app records sales activities and suggests the best action based on practices of the best sales representatives in an organisation.

headlines: Housing for all by 2022: Modi asks officials to remove hurdles
text: During the first 'Pragati' review meeting of his second term, PM Modi on Wednesday asked bureaucrats to remove hurdles to achieve his government's aim of 'Housing for All by 2022'. He reviewed PM Awas Yojana (Urban) which provides affordable houses to the urban poor. Modi also urged the states to put in efforts to conserve water under Jal Shakti Abhiyan.

headlines: 3 detained for abducting and killing relative in Jodhpur
text: A man was allegedly abducted and killed by his relatives, including two maternal-uncles, in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said. The police detained the three accused based on a complaint filed by the man's kin. The victim was rushed to a hospital after he was found in a "grievously injured state" but was declared brought dead by doctors, a police officer said.

headlines: Agra jail launches radio station for rehabilitation of inmates
text: An internal radio station was launched at the Agra jail in Uttar Pradesh for rehabilitation and reformation of its inmates, officials said. The radio station will be operated by prisoners and will be a source of entertainment for them, Superintendent of Police said. He added, "Programmes like special song request, health programmes and spiritual songs will be played."

headlines: Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist arrested in J&K, arms seized
text: A Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist, identified as Showkat Ahmad Tantary, was arrested by the Budgam Police in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. The police seized incriminating materials including arms and ammunition from his possession. His complicity in other terror crimes is being interrogated, the police said.

headlines: Master AI with Deep Learning module designed by IIT-B faculty
text: Working professionals can gain industry-relevant AI skills without quitting their jobs with Great Learning's Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning program, offered with the University of Texas at Austin and Great Lakes Institute of Management. Participants can upskill with Deep Learning modules designed and lectured by leading IIT-Bombay faculty, through online/weekend classroom sessions and build their expertise with 12+ live projects.

headlines: 2 women accuse Chennai hotel of homophobia, throwing them out
text: Two women accused a hotel in Chennai of homophobia and throwing them out of its premises. Rasika Gopalakrishnan and her girlfriend Shivangi Singh said 4-5 men stared at them, making them uncomfortable when they were dancing. They accused the bouncers of harassing them in the washroom. The hotel said they were asked to leave after guests complained against them.

headlines: Osama bin Laden's son Hamza with $1-million bounty killed: Reports
text: The son of al-Qaeda founder Osama bin Laden, Hamza, has died according to US media reports quoting intelligence officials. The reports also claimed that Hamza, who's thought to be 30 years old, had been killed sometime over the past two years in an operation that involved US. The country had announced a $1-million bounty on his head in February 2019.

headlines: I don't really care about my place in the side anymore: Tim Paine
text: Australia captain Tim Paine has said that he has no fears about losing his place as he prepares to lead his team in the first Ashes 2019 Test against England on Thursday. "I've said before, at 34 years of age, if you are looking further ahead than the next Test match you are kidding yourself," he added.

headlines: ICC posts pic of another cricketer while wishing Hall, gets trolled
text: While wishing former South Africa fast bowler Andrew Hall on his 44th birthday, the ICC mistakenly posted picture of Charl Langeveldt. The Bangladesh Cricket Board trolled the ICC by posting a picture of Andrew Hall, writing, "That's our Bowling Coach Charl Langeveldt.. Happy Birthday to Andrew Hall!" The ICC subsequently deleted the post.

headlines: Who are the nominees for The Best FIFA Men's Player 2019?
text: Two-time winner Cristiano Ronaldo and two-time runner-up Lionel Messi have been nominated for 2019 edition of The Best FIFA Men's Player award. Defender Virgil van Dijk, who won the Champions League with Liverpool and was named Premier League Player of the Year, is also among the candidates. FIFA World Cup 2018's best young player Kylian Mbappé has also been included.

headlines: Would be great to send Australia home with nothing: Moeen Ali
text: Talking about Ashes series, England all-rounder Moeen Ali said that it would be great to send Australia home from "nearly six months in the country with nothing to show for it". He added that World Cup semi-final match will be in "Australian players' minds" and England's plan is to "hit them hard again" at Edgbaston in the first Test.

headlines: Former Arunachal Pradesh CM Nabam Tuki appointed state Cong chief
text: The Congress has appointed former Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Nabam Tuki as the party's state President and MLA Lombo Tayeng as the Leader of the Congress Legislature Party in Arunachal Pradesh Assembly. Tuki has replaced Takam Sanjoy as the state party chief, while Tayeng took over from Takam Pario. The Congress said it appreciated the contributions of Sanjoy and Pario.

headlines: Dangerous if all industrialists leave India or commit suicide: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said, "If all industrialists leave the country like this or commit suicide, don't you think it is a dangerous signal for the country?" She said she felt sad because it should not be the future of the industry. Notably, CCD Founder VG Siddhartha was found dead on Wednesday amid tax liability of crores.

headlines: Major Indian farm union cautions govt over China-backed trade deal
text: The Bhartiya Kisan Union, which represents millions of farmers across India, warned the government against joining the 16-member Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP). It said the China-initiated Asia-Pacific trade pact will lead to imports of cheaper products such as dairy. A team of Indian officials will be in Beijing between August 2 and 3 to negotiate the terms of RCEP.

headlines: Aug 1-7 is celebrated as World Breastfeeding Week in over 120 nations
text: The first week of August is celebrated as World Breastfeeding Week in more than 120 countries to encourage breastfeeding and improve the health of babies around the world. It was first celebrated in 1992 by World Alliance for Breastfeeding Action (WABA). The theme for this year's World Breastfeeding Week is - Empower Parents, Enable Breastfeeding: Now and for the future!

headlines: Leading team a pleasant surprise: Hockey captain Harmanpreet
text: Harmanpreet Singh, who will lead Indian Men's hockey team for the Olympic Test event in Japan said it was a pleasant surprise for him when he was told he will be leading the team. "It's an honour and big responsibility," added Harmanpreet, who was part of India's 2016 Junior World Cup winning side. The 23-year-old debuted for India in 2015.

headlines: Kohli can say anything, it doesn't bother us: Gaekwad on new coach
text: Reacting to Team India captain Virat Kohli saying that he will be happy if Ravi Shastri continues as India coach, Cricket Advisory Committee (CAC) member Anshuman Gaekwad said, "The captain can say anything. It doesn't bother us." "It all depends on BCCI...When we chose the women's coach, we did not contact anybody. We did it on our own," he added.

headlines: Bihar youth beaten for allegedly attempting to rape minor girl
text: A youth was beaten up by the public on Wednesday in Bihar's Patna for allegedly trying to rape an eight-year-old girl. The man was later handed over to the police for further action. "A 15-year-old youth inappropriately entered a toilet where a little girl had entered. The public beat him up after getting hold of him," said DSP Suresh Prasad.

headlines: Next parliament session should be paperless: LS Speaker Om Birla
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday said he was keen on making the next Parliament session paperless and the members should prepare themselves for the same. "We're trying, you have to prepare for it in next two-and-a-half months," he told the members of the House. Birla also said that every penny spent on Parliament should be properly used.

headlines: Naxal commander killed in encounter with Telangana police
text: The commander of an armed underground Naxal group was killed in a police encounter in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem district on Wednesday, police said. The deceased was identified as Linganna who, allegedly, ran a Naxal group called 'Dalam'. As per reports, police have also taken five 'Dalam' members into custody.

headlines: Migrants arriving at US border down by 40% since May: Mexico
text: Mexico on Tuesday said the number of migrants arriving at the US border has declined by 40% since May. An official claimed 87,648 migrants would arrive at the border in July as compared to 1,44,278 in May. US President Donald Trump warned of tariffs on Mexican exports to the US unless it curbs the flow of migrants at the border.

headlines: Rampal's girlfriend shares transformation pic 11 days after delivery
text: Actor Arjun Rampal's girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades has shared a picture of her physical transformation 11 days after delivery on Instagram Story. "All I can say is don't stop your regime during pregnancy. Move, eat well and treat yourself," she wrote. "Prenatal yoga really helped keep my pelvic floor strong...Also remember everyone is different...so be patient with your body," Gabriella added.

headlines: Drug addicts belong in jail, won't apologise: MLA on video of actors
text: Shiromani Akali Dal MLA Manjinder S Sirsa, who was asked to tender an apology by Congress leader Milind Deora for saying that actors including Deepika Padukone and Ranbir Kapoor were in a "drugged state" at a party, has said he won't apologise. "Drug addicts belong in jail, not in society," he said. "They're answerable...for their drug-affected stoned look," Sirsa added.

headlines: 3-year-old boy falls from 6th floor of building in China, survives
text: A three-year-old boy survived after falling from the sixth floor of a building in the Chinese city of Chongqing. Police said the toddler was alone at home when he wandered out onto the balcony. Upon seeing the toddler dangling from the railing, residents of the building rushed to the sidewalk below and placed a blanket to save him.

headlines: Photoshoot of Hindu-Muslim same-sex couple from India, Pak goes viral
text: A photoshoot of a Hindu-Muslim same-sex couple Anjali Chakra and Sundas Malik, originally from India and Pakistan respectively, went viral on social media. Photographer Sarowar Ahmed shared the photos of the couple, currently based out of New York, and wrote, "A New York Love Story." The couple also shared their pictures and wished each other on one year of togetherness.

headlines: What will happen if World Test Championship final ends in a draw or tie?
text: If the World Test Championship final ends in a draw or a tie, the two teams will be joint champions. However, the playing conditions for the final allow for a reserve day, which will only be used if net playing time (30 hours of play) is lost during the scheduled five days. The World Test Championship will commence on August 1.

headlines: How will the points system work in World Test Championship?
text: Each of the nine teams will play six series under the World Test Championship, with each series counting for 120 points. A two-match series will mean 60 points for each Test, while a three-match series will give 40 points to each Test. A tie will be 50% of the points available, whilst a draw will be a 3:1 points ratio.

headlines: I walk out for my country not just team: Rohit amid reports of rift
text: Amid rumours of rift in Team India, limited-overs vice-captain Rohit Sharma took to Twitter to share a picture of himself walking out to bat and wrote, "I dont just walk out for my Team. I walk out for my country." Earlier, captain Virat Kohli had rubbished rumours of rift with Rohit saying, "Everything is fine in the team."

headlines: Snapdeal removes 8,000 sellers for selling fake products
text: Snapdeal has revealed it removed 8,000 sellers in last eight months for selling fake products. This comes days after Rajasthan Police registered a cheating case against Snapdeal Founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal over Congress leader Inder Mohan Singh Honey's allegations of receiving fake Woodland products. Snapdeal said its anti-counterfeit program 'Brand Shield' was launched in November 2018.

headlines: UP man gives Triple Talaq to wife on road, fights with her brother
text: A man allegedly gave Triple Talaq to his wife on a road in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad. The incident was followed by a fight between the man and the woman's brother, a video of which has surfaced online. The woman said a police case for a dispute between the couple was already going on when her husband gave her Triple Talaq.

headlines: Test track for Hyperloop cutting Mumbai-Pune travel to 23 min approved
text: Maharashtra has approved a test track to be constructed for the Hyperloop project, which is expected to reduce the travelling time between Mumbai and Pune to 23 minutes. The 11.80-km test track is expected to take three years to complete. The Hyperloop system would cover over 117 km along the Mumbai-Pune expressway and its speed is projected at 496 km/hr.

headlines: Cabinet clears bill for 10% quota to J&K's Economically Weaker Section
text: The Union Cabinet has approved the Jammu & Kashmir Reservation (Second Amendment) Bill, 2019, which provides 10% reservation to the Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) of the state in educational institutes and government jobs. The Parliament had earlier passed the first amendment bill which gives quota to people living near the state's International Border, besides to people living along the LoC.

headlines: US separated 900 migrant kids since June 2018, claims rights group
text: The US government separated more than 900 migrant children from their parents even after it ended of the separation policy in June last year, human rights group American Civil Liberties Union, said. The US had started the separation of migrant families under its 'zero tolerance' policy against those who cross the border illegally.

headlines: Regional leaders creating fear for own interest: Ram Madhav
text: BJP's Ram Madhav on Wednesday targeted National Conference (NC) and PDP over the additional deployment of troops in J&K and said local political leaders are creating an environment of fear for their selfish motives. "Steps being taken...are in accordance with the situation [in J&K]," he added. Centre issued the notice to deploy 10,000 additional troops in J&K on July 25.

headlines: Cabinet approves increasing number of SC judges from 30 to 33
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday said that the Cabinet approved increasing the number of Supreme Court judges from 30 to 33, excluding the Chief Justice of India (CJI). "This is a 10% increase, it is very crucial," Javadekar added. Once the bill is passed in the Parliament, the strength of judges will increase to 34, including the CJI.

headlines: I thank PM Modi: First petitioner in instant Triple Talaq case
text: Shayara Bano, the first petitioner in the instant Triple Talaq case in the Supreme Court, on Wednesday hailed the passage of Triple Talaq Bill in the Parliament. "Those who were opposing the bill and creating obstacles should understand that it's for the good of society and women. I thank RS Prasad ji and Modi ji for their support," Bano said.

headlines: Afghan highway blast kills at least 35, injures 27
text: Afghan officials claimed a bomb blast killed at least 35 bus passengers and injured 27 at a highway on Wednesday. A police spokesperson informed most of the victims in the blast were women and children while blaming the Taliban for the attack. A Taliban official denied their involvement in the blast and claimed they dont plant landmines in that area.

headlines: Prince Harry says won't have more than 2 kids over climate concerns
text: UK's Prince Harry said in an interview that he wanted to have only two children with his wife Meghan, citing concerns about climate change and Earth's future. "I've always thought this place (Earth) is borrowed...And, surely, being...as evolved as we all are supposed to be, we should be able to leave something better behind for the next generation," he added.

headlines: CCD Founder VG Siddhartha cremated at family estate in Karnataka
text: Coffee Day Enterprises Founder VG Siddhartha was cremated at his family coffee estate in Chikkamagaluru district in Karnataka, where thousands attended the last rites ceremony. He is survived by his wife Malavika Hegde and two sons, Ishaan and Amartya. Siddhartha's body was recovered from Netravati river in Mangaluru early this morning, 36 hours after he went missing from a bridge.

headlines: Flight attendant spotted inside plane's overhead bin, pic goes viral
text: A Southwest Airlines flight attendant was spotted inside the overhead compartment of a Philadelphia-bound plane in the US by a passenger. "Southwest employees are known for demonstrating their sense of humour and unique personalities. In this instance, one of our flight attendants attempted to have a...moment of fun with customers during boarding", the airline said.

headlines: Man called and said 'I'll finish your family': Udit on death threats
text: Speaking about receiving death threats recently, singer Udit Narayan said, "[In] April, I got a call from an unknown number...The man said, 'I'll finish your entire family'." He added another person called him and demanded money. A man named Hussain Ali, whom Narayan has known for a few years, is the third person repeatedly bothering him of late, he said.

headlines: Sindhu criticises journalist for misquoting her on CWG shooting row
text: PV Sindhu took to Twitter to criticise a journalist for misquoting her on CWG shooting controversy. "After Bindra and Narang, PV Sindhu now urges Indian Olympic Association not to shun CWG over exclusion of shooting," the article's title read. "I clearly said...we all want to participate in any...event but I'd always support what IOA and government decide," Sindhu wrote.

headlines: Delhi being choked to death, no solution in sight: Gambhir on pollution
text: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter to react to a 28-year-old non-smoker woman being diagnosed with lung cancer at Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi, with doctors suspecting toxic air as the reason. "We're only as blind as we want to be. Open your eyes. We are being choked to death, and there is no solution in sight," he wrote.

headlines: Regulate cab platforms like Ola, Uber over women safety: SC to govt
text: The Supreme Court has asked the central government to regulate ride-hailing platforms including Ola and Uber, particularly to enhance women safety. A three-judge bench headed by Justice SA Bobde said the centre should do it even if it requires an amendment in the law. The government was also asked to constitute One-Stop Crisis Centres to address assault cases against women.

headlines: 526 teeth removed from 7-year-old boy's mouth in Chennai
text: Doctors in Chennai removed 526 teeth from the mouth of a seven-year-old boy. "A 4x3 centimetre tumour was removed from the lower right side of his jaw [and] after that, we came to know that 526 teeth were present there," doctors said. Genetics or environmental reasons such as radiation from mobile towers may have been the cause, doctors added.

headlines: CBI books BJP MLA Sengar for murder in Unnao rape survivor's accident
text: The CBI has booked BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and about 30 of his aides for allegedly conspiring and attempting to murder the Unnao woman, who had accused the politician of raping her, and her lawyer in connection with a road accident case. The woman and her lawyer were critically injured when a truck hit their car on Sunday.

headlines: Mumbai auto driver held for masturbating in front of woman
text: The Kandivali Police arrested a 33-year-old autorickshaw driver on Tuesday for allegedly masturbating while looking at a 20-year-old woman passenger from the rearview mirror. The woman's colleague complained to the police on Twitter and wrote that the woman panicked and screamed at the driver to stop the rickshaw. The police tracked the accused through CCTV footage of the route.

headlines: Pakistan PM Imran Khan orders cut in prices of roti, naan
text: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has ordered to bring down the prices of roti and naan. Prime Minister Khan on Wednesday called a meeting of the Economic Coordination Committee (ECC) of the cabinet which was aimed at reducing the gas tariff and bringing down the price of wheat flour and duties on it, officials said.

headlines: Coffee Day to probe claims in 'letter written by VG Siddhartha'
text: Coffee Day Enterprises has said it will investigate certain claims purportedly made by late Founder VG Siddhartha in a letter. "Each financial transaction is my responsibility. My team, auditors and senior management are totally unaware of all my transactions," the letter read. Coffee Day, however, said it's unclear whether statements made in the letter pertain to the company or Siddhartha.

headlines: Former RBI Deputy Governor Subir Gokarn passes away
text: Noted economist and former Reserve Bank of India Deputy Governor Subir Vithal Gokarn passed away at the age of 60 on Tuesday in Washington DC after a brief period of illness. Gokarn also represented India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Bhutan at the International Monetary Fund Executive Board. He served as the Deputy Governor of the RBI between 2009 and 2013.

headlines: Gave info on deals between Bhatia and IndiGo to authorities: Gangwal
text: IndiGo Founder Rakesh Gangwal on Tuesday said that he has provided information on related party transactions (RPTs) between IndiGo and Co-Founder Rahul Bhatia's InterGlobe Enterprises to the 'relevant authorities'. "I wish people had the conviction to be quoted and not hide behind the veil of so-called unnamed 'sources' to spread a false narrative in the media," Gangwal said.

headlines: Don't let biz failure destroy self-esteem: Mahindra on Siddhartha
text: Reacting to CCD Founder VG Siddhartha's disappearance, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted he didn't know him personally and that he had no knowledge about his financial circumstances. "I only know that entrepreneurs must not allow business failure to destroy their self-esteem. That will bring about the death of entrepreneurship," he said. Siddhartha's body was recovered on Wednesday.

headlines: I love proving people wrong: Hrithik Roshan on 'Super 30'
text: Hrithik Roshan said in an interview that he wasn't expecting "such a unanimous response" after the success of 'Super 30'. On being asked if he felt he would't suit the role because of his looks, Hrithik replied, "I love proving people wrong." Hrithik further added, "If you want me to do something, just say he can't do it."

headlines: Truecaller stops onboarding new users until it fixes payments bug
text: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has said Truecaller has stopped onboarding new users until it fixes its payments bug. The Swedish call-blocking app had acknowledged that a bug in the latest update of the app automatically linked unspecified Indian users to its payments service Truecaller Pay without their consent. Truecaller discontinued its app's affected version.

headlines: Smriti Irani, RS Prasad get front row seats in Lok Sabha
text: Union Ministers Smriti Irani and Ravi Shankar Prasad have been allotted seats in the front row of the Lok Sabha under the new seating arrangement. The two ministers will share the front row with PM Narendra Modi, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Home Minister Amit Shah, among others. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla cleared the new seating arrangements.

headlines: 1 Congress, 3 NCP MLAs join Bharatiya Janata Party
text: Three MLAs from Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and one from Congress joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and state unit President Chandrakant Patil. The NCP MLAs who switched sides are Shivendra Raje Bhosale, Sandeep Naik and Vaibhav Pichad. The only Congress MLA who joined BJP is Kalidas Kolambkar.

headlines: PM betrayed people who voted for hassle-free economy: Congress
text: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi on Wednesday said PM Narendra Modi has betrayed people who voted for an independent and hassle-free economy. "Since his re-election, (PM) has tried majoritarianism, minoritarianism...to divert the attention," he tweeted. This comes after CCD owner VG Siddhartha, whose body was found in a river in Karnataka, alleged harassment from the I-T officials in a letter.

headlines: Class 10 boy kills classmate with scissors in Tamil Nadu
text: A Class 10 boy murdered his classmate with scissors allegedly after a quarrel broke out between them while playing cricket in Tamil Nadu's Kodaikanal, police said. The police added that the victim was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him "brought dead". The police said, the accused admitted to the crime and has been lodged into an observation home.

headlines: 3-year-old kidnapped, raped and beheaded by repeat offender
text: Jamshedpur police on Tuesday arrested the man who kidnapped a 3-year-old from Tatanagar railway station last week and allegedly raped and beheaded her. He abducted her while she was sleeping beside her mother as per the CCTV footage which helped the police catch him. The accused is a repeat offender who was earlier found guilty in two different murder cases.

headlines: Masaba accused of copying collection's packaging from another brand
text: Instagram page Diet Sabya has called out fashion designer Masaba Gupta for allegedly copying the packaging of her latest beauty collection launched in collaboration with a beauty retailer from another brand. "Is the @masabagupta x @mynykaa packaging a little too inspired by @sephora 'Lip Stories'?" read their caption. Commenting on the post, designer Rohit Bal wrote, "Just so sad".

headlines: Apple to launch credit card linked to iPhone in US in August
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook has revealed that the technology giant's iPhone-linked credit card will be available in the US in August. Apple Card, users can sign up for which from an iPhone, can be used either through Apple Pay or a titanium card received via mail. Apple partnered with American investment firm Goldman Sachs for the credit card.

headlines: K'taka Cong MLA appears before SIT in IMA Ponzi scheme case
text: Karnataka Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan on Wednesday appeared before an SIT in connection with the I Monetary Advisory (IMA) Ponzi scheme case. Earlier, it was reported that Zameer had allegedly received funds from IMA founder Mohammed Mansoor Khan. The IMA Group has been accused of siphoning off funds from investors for the personal benefit of the owners.

headlines: SAD MLA clicked with pro-Khalistan leader; he calls it 'forced pic'
text: A photo of Shiromani Akali Dal MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa with pro-Khalistan leader Gopal Singh Chawla has surfaced online. The picture was taken when Sirsa visited Gurdwara Nankana Sahib in Pakistan. Following this, Sirsa tweeted, "This is a forced picture which gunman of...Chawla clicked! I refuse to meet people like him who are anti-India and act as hate peddlers!"

headlines: Hindu Mahasabha writes 101 blood letters to PM over 49 celebs' letter
text: The members of Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha have posted 101 letters written in blood to PM Narendra Modi, urging him to take action against the 49 celebrities who wrote to him on lynchings and hate crimes in the country. "Such traitors should be charged with sedition and all their national awards should be withdrawn," the letter stated.

headlines: Over 20 feared trapped as building's roof collapses in Maharashtra
text: Over 20 people are feared trapped under debris after the roof of a building that houses a branch of Bank of Maharashtra collapsed in Solapur district on Wednesday. Further, ten people have been rescued till now. The incident took place at around 12.30 pm when some employees and customers were inside the building.

headlines: 28-yr-old diagnosed with lung cancer, doctors suspect toxic Delhi air
text: A 28-year-old non-smoker woman has been diagnosed with fourth stage lung cancer, according to doctors at Ganga Ram Hospital. Doctors at the hospital suspect that highly polluted and toxic air of Delhi is the reason behind her disease. Chest surgeon Dr Arvind Kumar said that this is the first case where the individual is in her 20s.

headlines: CRPF, Army personnel rescue J&K man trapped overnight in landslide
text: CRPF and Indian Army personnel on Wednesday rescued a man who was trapped through the night in the debris of a landslide triggered by excessive rainfall on the Jammu-Srinagar highway. The man, Pradeep Kumar, was found with the help of a CRPF sniffer dog named Ajaxi. After being rescued, Kumar was rushed to the hospital.

headlines: ED changes AgustaWestland case witness' status from dead to alive
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday changed the status of a witness in the AgustaWestland case from dead to alive, a day after telling a Delhi court he "must have been killed" as he has been missing for four months. The witness, identified as KK Khosla, might be available to face questioning in a few days, ED stated.

headlines: Chhattisgarh teacher suspended for being drunk in class
text: Jashpur District Collector Nileshkumar Mahadev Kshirsagar on Wednesday suspended a teacher who was allegedly seen in an inebriated state in a classroom in the Turangkhar primary school in Chhattisgarh. A video had surfaced recently that reportedly showed primary school teacher Ajaydan Minj being confronted by locals after he was seen sleeping with his head down in the classroom.

headlines: China claims it has released most Muslims detained in camps
text: China has said that it has released most of the Uighur Muslims who were detained in detention centres in the Xinjiang region. China is believed to have held nearly 10 lakh Uighur Muslims in such camps. China says that Uighur Muslims are being educated in "vocational training centres" to combat violent religious extremism.

headlines: Artists install seesaws on US-Mexico border
text: Two American artists have installed seesaws on a border fence that separates the US and Mexico. "The wall became a literal fulcrum for US-Mexico relations and children and adults were connected in meaningful ways...with the recognition that the actions that take place on one side have a direct consequence on the other," one of the artists said.

headlines: Billionaire Lakshmi Mittal's brother gets bail in Bosnia
text: A Bosnian court has granted bail to Pramod Mittal, the younger brother of billionaire Lakshmi Mittal, and two other executives suspected of involvement with organised crime. It also ordered Mittal to deposit $12 million for alleged damages to a company he has run in Bosnia. The court has banned the three men from any further activities in the company.

headlines: Fisherman found CCD Founder Siddhartha's body 4 km from bridge
text: A local fisherman found Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha's body floating in the Netravati river about 4 kilometres away from the bridge in Mangaluru where he is suspected to have jumped from. "We found the body about half a kilometre from the sea," he said. Siddhartha had asked his driver to wait for him while he went for a walk.

headlines: With the shooters, not thinking of CWG boycott: Sakshi Malik
text: After Indian Olympic Association wrote to Sports Minister urging to boycott 2022 Commonwealth Games, Olympic medallist Sakshi Malik said she is completely with the shooters and hopes shooting is included. "For now I'm not even thinking about that (boycott)...hoping it doesn't happen," she added. "We are a team...so if anyone is excluded it does make a difference," she stated.

headlines: Progcap to get $5 mn from Sequoia India, CIBIL Chairman, others
text: New Delhi-based fintech startup Progcap has secured $5 million in a Series A funding round led by Sequoia India. The round also saw participation from CIBIL Chairman MV Nair, former founder of FreeCharge Sandeep Tandon, among others. Founded by Pallavi Shrivastava and Himanshu Chandra, Progcap provides access to collateral-free working capital to retailers in Tier-II, III, and IV areas.

headlines: Ahmedabad man held for raping 9-yr-old daughter for 3 months
text: An auto-rickshaw driver has been arrested in Ahmedabad for allegedly raping his nine-year-old daughter multiple times in the last three months. He would allegedly sexually abuse his daughter whenever his wife would leave the house for several hours. His wife filed the complaint after she found him abusing their daughter when she woke up from a nap.

headlines: 7 of family die after vehicle hits tree on Pune-Bengaluru Highway
text: Seven members of a Karnataka-based family died on the spot after their vehicle hit a roadside tree on Pune-Bengaluru Highway in Maharashtra, officials said. According to the officials, the accident occurred after the driver lost control of the vehicle and hit the tree. In another accident, one person died and five others were injured in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu.

headlines: Himachal CM Thakur inaugurates Computerised Online Exam Hall
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Wednesday inaugurated a Computerised Online Examination Hall in the state Public Service Commission (PSC), Shimla. "The goal of our government is to make all-round development of the state," Thakur said. The CM also extended wishes to citizens of the state and PSC on the development at the inauguration event.

headlines: Hope govt ensures justice to Unnao rape survivor's family: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav expressed hope that the Uttar Pradesh government will ensure justice to the family of the Unnao rape survivor, who was recently injured in a road accident. He added, "They've been fighting (for justice) right since the first day of the filing of the rape case." Yadav claimed that the family doesn't "trust the administration".

headlines: Headmaster detained for sexually assaulting 7-yr-old in Andhra
text: Police detained a government primary school headmaster after the parents of a seven-year-old girl alleged that he sexually assaulted her in Andhra Pradesh. The parents got to know about the incident after they visited a hospital to get her treated for stomach pain, the police said. Later, she revealed, the headmaster was misbehaving with her for long, the police added.

headlines: BJP MLA Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri elected as Karnataka Speaker
text: BJP MLA Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri has been elected as Karnataka Assembly Speaker. Kageri was the only one to file the nomination papers for the post following Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar's resignation as the Speaker after Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the trust vote. CM BS Yediyurappa was present when Kageri submitted his nomination papers.

headlines: CJI allows CBI to probe sitting HC judge for corruption for 1st time
text: Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi has allowed CBI to file a corruption case against Allahabad High Court judge SN Shukla. A panel of judges had found Justice Shukla guilty of giving favours to a private medical college in 2017. This is the first time that a sitting high court judge will be investigated by the CBI.

headlines: CCD names SV Ranganath as interim Chairman after Founder's death
text: Café Coffee Day today appointed SV Ranganath as its interim Chairman after the death of founder-chairman VG Siddhartha. Nitin Bagmane was named the company's interim Chief Operating Officer on terms to be detailed and approved by the board later. The body of Siddhartha, who went missing on Monday night, was found today on the banks of a river in Mangaluru.

headlines: MLA says Deepika, Ranbir were in "drugged state"; Deora criticises
text: Shiromani Akali Dal MLA Manjinder Sirsa has alleged that actors including Deepika Padukone, Ranbir Kapoor and Shahid Kapoor were in a "drugged state" at a party hosted by Karan Johar. "I raise my voice against #DrugAbuse," he wrote. Criticising him, Congress leader Milind Deora replied, "My wife was...present that evening...Nobody was in a 'drugged state' so stop spreading lies."

headlines: Google researchers discovered 6 critical iOS security flaws
text: Six critical security iOS vulnerabilities, patched in the 12.4 update released earlier this month, were originally discovered by security researchers at Google. The flaws discovered were "interactionless" bugs which can be executed on a remote iOS device without requiring any direct interaction with it. One of the six vulnerabilities, however, has not yet been fully patched.

headlines: Apple posts $53.8 billion Q3 revenue, iPhone sales drop 12%
