text: Apple has posted a $53.8 billion revenue for its third quarter and reported an about 12% drop in revenue from iPhone sales at $26 billion, relative to $29.5 billion in the same quarter last year. "It's a significant improvement to the 17% year-over-year decline in Q2," Apple CEO Tim Cook said. Apple's stock rose 4% after it posted the results.

headlines: Omar, Mufti engage in Twitter spat over Triple Talaq Bill
text: NC leader Omar Abdullah and PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti engaged in a Twitter spat after she claimed she failed "to understand the need to pass the triple talaq bill". Omar tweeted, "You might want to check how your members voted on this bill before tweeting. I understand they abstained". Following this, Mufti responded, "get off your moral high horse".

headlines: eBay invests $160 million in Paytm Mall at $3 billion valuation
text: US-based online marketplace giant eBay has invested $160 million in Paytm's e-commerce unit Paytm Mall at a valuation of nearly $3 billion through its Singapore arm, as per regulatory filings. Paytm Mall has closed about $805 million in total funding across three rounds, including the eBay funding. This marks eBay's third investment in Indian e-commerce space, after Snapdeal and Flipkart.

headlines: Pak violates ceasefire in J&K's Tangdhar, 4 civilians injured
text: Four civilians were injured in a ceasefire violation by Pakistani troops in Jammu and Kashmir's Tangdhar sector on Tuesday, officials said. Pakistani troops also violated ceasefire along the Line of Control in Nowshera sector, following which the Indian Army retaliated effectively. Earlier, a jawan was martyred in Rajouri district following a ceasefire violation by Pakistani troops.

headlines: Didn't get Unnao rape survivor's letter, news showed I didn't act: CJI
text: After reports that the Unnao rape survivor's family had written to Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi weeks before their accident, CJI said, "The letter hasn't been placed before me and newspapers flashed that CJI did not act." In the letter, the family alleged that rape accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's aides threatened them to withdraw the cases.

headlines: Man cancels Zomato order over non-Hindu delivery boy; firm replies
text: Zomato has replied after a customer tweeted that he cancelled his order as Zomato "allocated a non-Hindu rider" for his food. "They said they can't change rider and can't refund on cancellation. I said you can't force me to take a delivery I don't want don't refund just cancel." Zomato responded, "Food doesn't have a religion. It is a religion."

headlines: Banks can drive anyone to despair: Mallya on CCD Founder's death
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya on Wednesday tweeted that he's "indirectly related" to CCD Founder VG Siddhartha, adding, "The Govt Agencies and Banks can drive anyone to despair." "See what they are doing to me despite offer of full repayment. Vicious and unrelenting," he added. In western countries, government and banks help borrowers repay their debts unlike India, he further said.

headlines: Katy Perry found guilty of copying song Dark Horse from rapper
text: After rapper Marcus Gray alias Flame's allegation against American singer Katy Perry of copying 'Dark Horse' from his song 'Joyful Noise', a jury has found her guilty. Court will decide today the damages Katy owes to Flame. "They're trying to own basic building blocks of music, the alphabet of music that should be available to everyone," said Katy's lawyer.

headlines: Triple Talaq Bill part of many attacks on Muslims: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday tweeted that the Triple Talaq Bill should be seen only as one part of many attacks on Muslim identity and citizenship since 2014. "Mob violence, police atrocities and mass incarceration won't bog us down," he wrote. "I hope All India Muslim Personal Law Board will challenge [the Bill's] constitutionality," Owaisi added.

headlines: IAS Rajeev Kumar appointed as new Finance Secretary
text: A 1984-batch IAS officer from Jharkhand cadre, Rajeev Kumar was on Tuesday appointed as the new Finance Secretary. Kumar, who also served as Joint Secretary and then Additional Secretary in Ministry of Finance, succeeded 1983-batch IAS officer Subhash Chandra Garg as the Finance Secretary. Garg was transferred to the Power Ministry as the secretary on July 24.

headlines: Bodies of couple found stuffed in 2 suitcases in Bengal
text: Bodies of a couple were found stuffed in two separate suitcases in a house in West Bengal's Narendrapur, police said. The case came to light after the police were informed about the bloodstains inside the house and a foul smell coming from it. "We're quizzing the eyewitnesses and have also informed the Special Cell about the incident," the police said.

headlines: Working hard with India to help grow economy: Mike Pompeo
text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Tuesday that the US is "working hard" with India in providing opportunities to help grow its economy. "Our Indo-Pacific strategy is well on its way to bearing fruit," added Mike. Earlier today, India's Ambassador to the US Harsh Vardhan Shringla said that trade between India and US has grown to $142 billion.

headlines: Maoist killed in encounter with police in Telangana
text: A Maoist was killed in an encounter with the police in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem district on Wednesday, officials said. The body of the Maoist and a Self-Loading Rifle (SLR) were recovered from the spot, Superintendent of Police said. The encounter broke out when the police team was carrying out combing operations in a forest area, he added.

headlines: 3 Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh cadres arrested in Assam
text: Three Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) trained cadres were arrested in different raids in Assam's Barpeta, police said. The police added that they had been keeping a watch on the JMB activities in view of the upcoming Independence Day. A country-made revolver and four live rounds were seized from a JMB cadre's possession, Superintendent of Police said.

headlines: 3 militants killed near LoC in J&K's Bandipora district
text: The Army on Tuesday foiled an infiltration bid and killed three infiltrating militants near the LoC in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district, officials said. The encounter started when the infiltrators opened fire after being spotted by the Army near the LoC, the officials added. On Tuesday, two militants were killed in an encounter in Anantnag district.

headlines: North Korea fires ballistic missiles for second time in a week
text: North Korea on Wednesday fired two short-range ballistic missiles in the second such launch in a week, South Korea said. The two missiles were launched from the Kalma area near the port of Wonsan. Last week's launch by North Korea was the first such action since US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un met in Vietnam.

headlines: 24-year-old Russian Instagram influencer found dead in suitcase
text: Russia's 24-year-old Instagram influencer Ekaterina Karaglanova was found dead with her throat slit inside a suitcase by her parents at her Moscow apartment on Friday after they failed to contact her for days. Karaglanova had over 85,000 followers and recently graduated as a doctor. Police said CCTV footage showed her ex-boyfriend visited her property in the days around her disappearance.

headlines: Body of missing CCD Founder Siddhartha found from Mangaluru river
text: Cafè Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha's body has been found on the banks of river Netravati in Mangaluru after he went missing on Monday. Siddhartha had asked his car driver to drop him at a bridge across the river. Earlier, a letter by Siddhartha surfaced online, wherein he wrote, "I fought for a long time but today I gave up."

headlines: I did 17 films with David, even his son won't do that: Govinda
text: Actor Govinda, while opening up about his rift with filmmaker David Dhawan, said he has done 17 films with him and added, "I do not think his son [Varun] will ever do 17 films with him, because he is, after all...educated." "I did not even treat my relatives so well as I treated him," Govinda added.

headlines: I was offered role in Devdas, rejected it as I was superstar: Govinda
text: Govinda has claimed he was offered Jackie Shroff's role in the 2002 film 'Devdas' but rejected it as he was a "superstar" at that time. "I asked Sanjay Leela Bhansali why he's offering me a character role. I told him Shah Rukh should talk to me. I can do [it] for friendship but I won't do it otherwise," he added.

headlines: Sri Lanka head coach Hathurusingha given deadline to quit
text: Sri Lanka head coach Chandika Hathurusingha has been given until the start of Sri Lanka's home Test series against New Zealand to quit and make way for a new coach, Sri Lanka sports minister Harin Fernando said. "If Hathurusingha does not leave, we may have to consider legal action or offer him a different job at the board," he added.

headlines: Not required: Akhtar as fan asks if Rohit should become India captain
text: Responding to a fan who asked whether Rohit Sharma should replace Virat Kohli as captain of Team India, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar tweeted, "Not required." He further said during the Twitter question-answer session that one best thing about Rohit is "taking responsibility". Recently, Team India captain Virat Kohli had rubbished rumours of a rift between him and Rohit.

headlines: Congress expels 14 rebel MLAs in Karnataka
text: Congress on Tuesday expelled the 14 rebel Karnataka MLAs, whose resignations led to the fall of Congress-JD(S) coalition government in the state. The action by the party comes days after these MLAs were disqualified from the state legislature by Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar before he tendered his own resignation. The MLAs had also abstained from voting during trust vote.

headlines: Slip of pen: Lawyer after wrong prisoner with same name released
text: A prisoner named Gul Mohammed was released on Tuesday instead of a man with the same name who was granted bail in Bihar. Advocate of the man who was granted bail said, "It was a clerical error, it was not intentional. We can call it slip of pen." A new release order was issued and the man intended was released.

headlines: Residents of 'Pakistan Wali Gali' in UP urge PM to change its name
text: Residents of 'Pakistan Wali Gali' in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida have urged PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath to change the name of their street. The residents claimed that they aren't getting employment and are treated badly by people due to the name. The area got the name after some people from Pakistan settled down there during partition.

headlines: T'gana Deputy Speaker stuffs cash into kid's mouth during festival
text: A video has surfaced online, showing Telangana Deputy Speaker T Padma Rao stuffing cash into a child's mouth during Bonalu festival celebrations in Secunderabad. The boy was playing a percussion instrument for the crowd when the incident took place. Following criticism for his act, Rao said, "I was impressed with the boy's performance...It's not such a big thing."

headlines: Dubai Princess seeks marriage protection order after fleeing UAE
text: Dubai's Princess Haya Bint Al Hussein has applied for a forced marriage protection order and a non-molestation order in a UK court after she fled the UAE following the break-up of her marriage. Princess Haya also applied for the wardship of her children. Meanwhile, Dubai's ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum applied for the return of his children.

headlines: Residential academies need of hour to lift Indian football: Thapa
text: Ex-footballer and chairman of AIFF technical committee Shyam Thapa has said having residential academies across India is the "need of the hour" if the level of football has to be improved in the country. "If...even 15 states agree (to have an academy) then see how many boys we'll have and we can also conduct competitive tournaments for them," he added.

headlines: Australia's David Warner declared fit for the 1st Ashes Test
text: Australian opener David Warner has been declared fit for the upcoming first Ashes Test scheduled to be held at Edgbaston from August 1. Warner, who inside-edged a ball on to his left knee during a practice session, is set to appear in his first Test match since the ball-tampering scandal in Cape Town last year.

headlines: Will be exciting to see Roy in Tests: Ex-England pacer Hoggard
text: Former England pacer Matthew Hoggard said it'll be exciting to see how England batsman Jason Roy will perform in Test cricket. "We all know what he can do in one-day cricket...But hes got the technique to score runs in any format," Hoggard added about Roy, who's part of England's Ashes Squad. Roy made his Test debut against Ireland last week.

headlines: Caster Semenya blocked from competing at world championships
text: Two-time Olympic champion Caster Semenya won't be eligible to compete in 800m at this year's world track and field championships after a Swiss court reversed a June ruling that had allowed Semenya to compete. The ruling had suspended a regulation imposed by IAAF regarding testosterone levels pending her appeal. The 28-year-old has refused to take medication to be in compliance.

headlines: Microsoft acquires data privacy, governance startup BlueTalon
text: Microsoft has acquired California-based data privacy and governance service startup BlueTalon for an undisclosed amount. Backed by investors including Bloomberg Beta, Maverick Ventures, Signia Venture Partners and Stanford's StartX fund, BlueTalon has raised over $27 million to date, as per Crunchbase. BlueTalon works with leading Fortune 100 companies to eliminate data security blind spots.

headlines: Fort in Maharashtra has a 'staircase waterfall'
text: The Visapur Fort in Maharashtra is a hill fort which is an ideal trekking destination during the monsoons and has a 'staircase waterfall' which trekkers follow during the trail. Located at an elevation of 1,084 metres above sea level, it's one of the highest located forts in Maharashtra. It was built during the early 18th century by Peshwa Balaji Vishwanath.

headlines: Everything is fine, dont pay attention to rumours: J&K Guv
text: Reacting to some leaked government orders, Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik said, "None of the orders being shown are valid" and everything is "fine" in the state. There's no need to pay attention to rumours, he added. His comment came amid the CAPF's deployment and a leaked note by a railway security officer on stockpiling rations in J&K.

headlines: SL to offer free visas on arrival to boost tourism after bombings
text: Sri Lanka will offer free visas on arrival to citizens of 48 countries, including India and China in a bid to boost tourism. The government's move comes in the aftermath of the Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka in April. Foreign visitor arrivals in Sri Lanka in May fell by 70.8%, the lowest since the end of the civil war.

headlines: Kohli calmest person, aggression his demeanour only on field: Anushka
text: Actress Anushka Sharma has said her husband, Team India captain Virat Kohli, is one of the calmest persons she has ever met. She added that Kohli is aggressive on the field only because he is "so passionate". "He's not aggressive in real life. That's only his demeanour on the field. He's the most shaant person I know," she further said.

headlines: Man gets 100-150 calls daily after his number shown as Leone's in film
text: A Delhi man named Puneet Agarwal said he's receiving 100-150 calls daily since last Friday from men seeking to speak with actress Sunny Leone after his phone number appeared in 'Arjun Patiala'. In the film, Leone gives her number to actor Diljit Dosanjh, which belongs to Agarwal. Agarwal has filed a police complaint and plans to sue the film's makers.

headlines: Not confirmed, families yet to meet: Hassan on marrying Indian girl
text: Pakistan fast bowler Hassan Ali has issued a clarification regarding reports of him marrying Shamia Arzoo, an engineer belonging to Haryana's Mewat district. The 25-year-old pacer tweeted that his wedding is "not confirmed yet" as their families are "yet to meet and decide upon it". He further said that he will make a public announcement very soon.

headlines: Pagal hai, bowling kaun karega: Afridi as Riaz asks for 2nd run
text: A video of all-rounder Shahid Afridi teasing his batting partner Wahab Riaz during their team Brampton Wolves' last over against Edmonton Royals in Canada GT20 League has gone viral. After managing a single on the last ball, Riaz asks Afridi for a second run to which the latter replies, "Pagal hai...bowling kaun karega? (Are you mad? Who will bowl then?)"

headlines: Video of Romanian spinner bowling with unorthodox action goes viral
text: A video of Pavel Florin, a bodyguard from Romania, bowling with an unorthodox action in European Cricket League has gone viral. Playing for Cluj, the right-arm spinner can be seen bowling with a one-arm action, conceding 13 runs in an over. Reacting to the video, ex-Australia batsman Mark Waugh said, "I reckon that would be very hard to hit."

headlines: No Indian in ICC's Elite Panel of Umpires as S Ravi excluded
text: The lone Indian umpire in ICC's Elite Panel of Umpires, Sundaram Ravi, has been excluded from the panel for the 2019/20 season. Ravi was promoted to the Elite Panel in 2015, becoming the first Indian umpire in the top panel since S Venkataraghavan in 2004. Further, Javagal Srinath is the only Indian in ICC's Elite Panel of Match Referees.

headlines: Cong never got majority after Shah Bano case: Ravi Shankar Prasad
text: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad while discussing Triple Talaq Bill in Rajya Sabha on Tuesday said Congress never got a majority after the Shah Bano case. "You won 400 seats in 1986. There have been nine Lok Sabha elections after that, you didn't get majority in any of them. You were 44 in 2014, and you're 52 today," said Prasad.

headlines: OYO to not buy FreshMenu over disagreement on valuation: Report
text: India's largest private hotel chain OYO is reportedly no longer acquiring Bengaluru-based food delivery startup FreshMenu over disagreements on valuation. "OYO valued FreshMenu at around $30 million...With the liquidation preference, the Founder (Rashmi Daga) wouldn't have gotten anything," a source told TechCircle. Past reports had claimed OYO was in talks to acquire FreshMenu for $50-60 million.

headlines: Centre hands over Unnao rape survivor's road accident probe to CBI
text: The Centre on Tuesday handed over the probe into the road accident in which the Unnao rape survivor was critically injured to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI). Meanwhile, the survivor is on the ventilator and doctors said her blood pressure is not stable. The case was handed over to the CBI to probe "abetment and conspiracies" in the accident.

headlines: Ethiopia plants 35 crore trees in 12 hours
text: Individuals in Ethiopia planted more than 35 crore trees on Monday as part of an effort to combat climate change and deforestation. The planting is part of the 'Green Legacy' initiative that aims to plant 400 crore trees in Ethiopia this rainy season and is being led by Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.

headlines: I didn't sit down for last 15 minutes: 2019 WC final commentator
text: Talking about commentating in the 2019 World Cup final, former New Zealand cricketer Ian Smith revealed that he did not sit down for the last 15 minutes. "I could never have envisaged calling drama like that...Boult standing on the boundary line...the overthrows off Stokes' bat...I've never seen a batsman diving and ball deflect off his bat for four," he added.

headlines: Gayle becomes first to hit a ton in the Global T20 League
text: Chris Gayle on Tuesday became the first cricketer to slam a hundred in Global T20 league in Canada. Gayle hit a 47-ball hundred to help his side Vancouver Knights post 276/3 against Montreal Tigers, the second-highest total by any team in T20 cricket. Gayle remained unbeaten on 122 in 54 deliveries, hitting seven fours and 12 sixes.

headlines: SC refuses urgent hearing on plea challenging Article 370
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to give an urgent hearing to BJP leader Ashwini Kumar Upadhyay's petition challenging the validity of Article 370. Article 370 of the Constitution grants autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir. BJP in its manifesto had said that it will remove Article 370 and Article 35A, which grants special rights to Jammu and Kashmir natives.

headlines: Discontinuing Tipu Jayanti in Karnataka big mistake: Siddaramaiah
text: After Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa-led BJP government decided to discontinue Tipu Jayanti, former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday said it's wrong and a big mistake. "Since he's a historical man who fought...Britishers we had decided to celebrate him," he added. Siddaramaiah alleged that this decision was taken because Tipu Sultan was from "minority community" and "BJP is against minorities".

headlines: Fail to understand need to pass Triple Talaq Bill: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday said she fails to understand the need to pass the Triple Talaq Bill since the Supreme Court had already declared it illegal. "Undue interference seemingly to punish Muslims. Given the current state of the economy, should this really have been a priority?" she tweeted. The Bill passed in Rajya Sabha criminalises instant triple talaq.

headlines: OPDs to remain closed on July 31 as doctors protest NMC Bill
text: OPDs in government hospitals across the country will remain closed on July 31 after the Indian Medical Association (IMA) called for a nation-wide 24-hour withdrawal of non-essential services against the National Medical Commission (NMC) Bill. IMA has also called for demonstrations and hunger strikes in all states. Medical students have been asked to boycott classes in solidarity.

headlines: JeM commander involved in Anantnag attack killed in encounter
text: Two Jaish-e-Mohammad militants, including a commander involved in the Anantnag attack on CRPF personnel, were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said. Five CRPF jawans were martyred and an SHO was injured, who later succumbed to his injuries in the attack in June. Police have termed the militant's killing a big achievement.

headlines: 19-yr-old Shaw suspended for 8 months by BCCI over doping violation
text: Batsman Prithvi Shaw has been handed a backdated suspension of eight months by the BCCI for doping violation. The BCCI said that the 19-year-old batsman inadvertently ingested a prohibited substance, which can be commonly found in cough syrups. The period of Shaw's suspension would begin retrospectively from March 16, 2019 and end at midnight on November 15, 2019.

headlines: Prithvi Shaw responds to his 8-month suspension over doping violation
text: Batsman Prithvi Shaw took to social media to release a statement after being served a backdated suspension of eight months over doping violation. "I accept my fate with all sincerity...This news has really shaken me," he wrote. He added he didn't follow the protocol of being careful in consuming a basic "over-the-counter cough syrup" out of his "eagerness to play".

headlines: Not a good idea: Bhogle on Kohli stating his head coach preference
text: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has suggested that India captain Virat Kohli shouldn't have stated his Team India head coach preference while the selection process is still on. "It isn't a good idea...for key influencers to be stating their preference," he added. "Somebody should've said the selection process is on and so...it wouldn't be right for him to answer it," he stated.

headlines: Brazil police end Neymar rape investigation over lack of evidence
text: The police in Brazil investigating the rape allegations against PSG forward Neymar have closed the case due to a lack of evidence. Neymar had earlier denied the allegations that he raped a Brazilian woman in a Paris hotel in May. The 27-year-old footballer had also shared a video of his chat with the woman who had accused him of rape.

headlines: Google paid people on US streets $5 to improve Pixel 4 face unlock
text: Google has confirmed it offered $5 gift certificates to people on the streets of American cities in exchange for a facial scan to help improve its Pixel 4 smartphone's face unlock feature's accuracy. Google added it did so to tackle facial recognition's history of bias in gender and skin colour. The scans were obtained after people filled out consent forms.

headlines: Rajya Sabha passed Triple Talaq Bill refusing demand for select panel
text: The Rajya Sabha passed the Triple Talaq Bill with 99 'Ayes' and 84 'Noes' on Tuesday, after rejecting the motion to send the bill to a select committee by 100 'No' and 84 'Yes' votes. The Opposition members were against the provision of criminalising instant Triple Talaq. Notably, NDA allies JD(U) and AIADMK walked out of the House during voting.

headlines: Uber fires 400 employees from its marketing team globally
text: Ride-hailing giant Uber has fired 400 employees from its 1,200-member marketing team globally. Many of Uber's teams are "too big, which creates overlapping work, makes for unclear decision owners and can lead to mediocre results," Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said in an internal email to employees. Notably, Uber had reported a year-over-year 116% hike in Q1 loss, at $1 billion.

headlines: Stones pelted on women Kanwariyas near mosque in Bihar's Muzaffarpur
text: Stones were pelted on Kanwariyas, mostly on women and girls, when they were passing near a mosque in Bihar's Muzaffarpur on Monday by "anti-social elements of Muslim community", said Anil Kumar Das, Sub Divisional Officer (West) Muzaffarpur. Police was deployed in the area following the incident, and the district administration held a meeting with people from Hindu and Muslim communities.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor has multiple fractures, bleeding in lungs: Report
text: Unnao rape survivor who met with a road accident in Raebareli on Sunday suffered serious head injuries and multiple leg fractures, a report quoting hospital sources said. The report added that she has bleeding in her lungs and is currently on a ventilator. She and her lawyer were injured, while two of her aunts died in the accident.

headlines: Medieval practice finally in dustbin: PM as Triple Talaq Bill passed
text: After the Rajya Sabha passed the Triple Talaq Bill, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "An archaic and medieval practice has finally been confined to the dustbin of history!" "Parliament [has corrected] a historical wrong done to Muslim women," he added. "This is a victory of gender justice and will further equality in society. India rejoices today!" he further tweeted.

headlines: My shawl vendor kept asking me 'Will we get independence': J&K Guv
text: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Malik has said that his shawl vendor kept asking him for a year if they will get independence. "I told him, 'You are already free and if you consider being free by going to Pakistan then who is stopping you?'" he added. "You won't get freedom by breaking up India," he further said.

headlines: Missile launcher found in man's luggage, he calls it a 'souvenir'
text: A man was held at a US airport after officials found a missile launcher inside his luggage. The man, who said he worked for the military, called the launcher a souvenir from Kuwait. Authorities said that the launcher wasn't a live device and was handed over for disposal, adding that military weapons are not permitted in checked or carry-on bags.

headlines: 1,000 diagnosed with dengue in 24 hrs amid B'desh's worst outbreak
text: Over 1,000 people, the majority of whom are children, were diagnosed with dengue in 24 hours in Bangladesh as the country faces its worst dengue fever outbreak, officials said. More than 50 districts across the country have been affected, but Dhaka has been the worst-hit. Over 13,600 people have been diagnosed with dengue in Bangladesh so far this year.

headlines: Saw a man jump off bridge where CCD Founder was last seen: Fisherman
text: A fisherman has said he saw a man jumping off the bridge where Coffee Day Enterprises Founder VG Siddhartha was last seen on Monday evening. "I don't know who this man was. I was rushing towards him. But he had reached deep waters by then," he said. Siddhartha didn't return after telling his driver he was going for a walk.

headlines: CCD Founder's disappearance fishy, may have been kidnapped: Shivakumar
text: Senior Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that he found the disappearance of Coffee Day Enterprises Founder VG Siddhartha "utterly fishy". "The current suspicion is that he may be in the water but my suspicion is that someone has taken him away," he added. Shivakumar further said he received a call from Siddhartha on July 28 asking if they could meet.

headlines: We know what the reception is going to be: Langer on Bancroft
text: Australia coach Justin Langer spoke about Cameron Bancroft, saying, "It would be a great story if he comes back into the team... We know what the reception (in England) is going to be. There's nothing we can do about it." Bancroft has returned to Australia's squad after serving a suspension alongside Steve Smith and David Warner for committing ball-tampering.

headlines: SL's 81-Test veteran Samaraweera to assist NZ in SL series
text: Former batsman Thilan Samaraweera, who scored 5,462 runs in 81 Tests for Sri Lanka, will be joining New Zealand's coaching staff for the upcoming Test series in the island nation. The 42-year-old has earlier served as the batting coach of Sri Lanka and Bangladesh. "Samaraweera's knowledge of Sri Lankan conditions will be invaluable," said New Zealand's head coach Gary Stead.

headlines: Arunachal Pradesh government seeks opinions on banning PUBG
text: The Arunachal Pradesh government is seeking opinions on whether the online game PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) should be banned in the state. The state's home department wrote to the Commissioner of Law and Justice, Secretary of IT and Communication, among others, seeking their opinions. "It's just seeking opinions...as there was some complaint," said Under Secretary (Home) Habung Lampung.

headlines: Over 50 Cong, NCP MLAs want to join our party: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Girish Mahajan has claimed that over 50 MLAs of Congress and NCP want to join his party ahead of the Assembly elections in Maharashtra later this year. "Many people are excited to join BJP...but we...have some limitations. We can't admit everyone," Mahajan said. Earlier today, three NCP MLAs resigned from their party and will join BJP on Wednesday.

headlines: Startup behind Jio Saarthi launches Assistive UIs for businesses
text: Bengaluru-based startup Jiny has launched Assistive User Interfaces (AUIs) that assist the users in interacting with the system (apps) at every step in vernacular languages. They act similar to the turn by turn navigation of Google Maps but do it for the apps. Last week, Reliance Jio launched Jio Saarthi digital assistant for its subscribers which is powered by Jiny.

headlines: Jawan martyred after Pak violates ceasefire in J&K's Rajouri
text: A jawan was martyred in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Tuesday after Pakistani troops violated ceasefire for the third consecutive day in the state, officials said. Casualties to Pakistani soldiers were inflicted in the retaliatory action by the Indian Army, officials added. The 34-year-old jawan, identified as Naik Krishan Lal, is survived by his wife Shashi Devi.

headlines: Rajya Sabha passes Triple Talaq Bill
text: Rajya Sabha on Tuesday passed The Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019. The Bill criminalises instant triple talaq and seeks up to three years in jail for guilty. "Triple Talaq Bill is not about politics but empowerment of women. This is a matter of gender justice, dignity and equality," Law & Justice Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.

headlines: Delhi govt bans owner of Budweiser and Hoegaarden beer for 3 years
text: Delhi government has banned world's largest brewer AB InBev, which sells beer brands such as Budweiser and Hoegaarden, for three years for allegedly evading local taxes. An investigation found that SABMiller, which AB InBev acquired in 2016, used duplicate barcodes on beer bottles supplied to retailers that year. Denying the allegations, AB InBev said it would appeal against the order.

headlines: Guru Randhawa receives 4 stitches, says won't ever perform in Canada
text: Punjabi singer Guru Randhawa received four stitches above his right eyebrow after being punched by a man after his concert in Vancouver, Canada. Randhawa, who is now back in India, said on Twitter, "I won't ever perform in Canada for the rest of my life." He added that the man was trying to come on the stage again and again.

headlines: 'The Rock' calls UK PM Johnson his 'cousin', deletes tweet later
text: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson called UK PM Boris Johnson his "cousin" in a tweet while praising the new leader. Dwayne said that he liked a part of one of Boris' speeches wherein he had said that "the people are our bosses". However, Dwayne later deleted the tweet and clarified that he and the UK leader are not actually related.

headlines: Truecaller bug links Indian users' bank accounts without their consent
text: Swedish call-blocking app Truecaller on Tuesday said that a bug in the latest update of the app automatically linked unspecified Indian users' bank accounts to its payments service Truecaller Pay without their consent. The bug led the app to send a text message to a bank to verify their account. Truecaller has discontinued the affected version of the app.

headlines: I'll see his legacy as a successful entrepreneur: Bahl on CCD Founder
text: Snapdeal Co-founder Kunal Bahl on Twitter said he'll always see CCD Founder VG Siddhartha's legacy as a very successful entrepreneur. Siddhartha, who went missing in Mangaluru on Monday evening, had said in a letter that he failed as an entrepreneur. "Heartbreaking," Bahl said, adding, "How can someone get pushed so far to the edge...they decide to take a fall themselves."

headlines: Punjab CM awards ASI rank to Kargil hero working as a constable
text: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh has awarded Assistant Sub-Inspector rank to Kargil war hero Satpal Singh, who had been working as a traffic constable since 2010. Satpal was conferred with Vir Chakra for his role in the war. "Feel sorry he didn't get his due earlier. We've decided to come out with policy to prevent such injustice in future," CM tweeted.

headlines: 16-year-old climate activist to sail to UN summit in US from UK
text: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg has said she will sail to the UN Climate Action Summit in New York from the UK in a racing boat. "We must start bending the emissions curve steeply downwards no later than 2020, if we still are to have a chance of staying below 1.5 degrees of global temperature rise," the 16-year-old said.

headlines: I failed as entrepreneur, couldn't create good biz model: VG Siddhartha
text: Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha, who went missing from a river bridge in Mangaluru on Monday evening, said in a letter that he failed as an entrepreneur. "I have failed to create the right profitable business model despite my best efforts," he said. "I am sorry to let down all the people that put their trust in me," Siddhartha added.

headlines: Toll booth footage shows CCD Founder's car before he went missing
text: Footage retrieved from the Bengaluru-Mangaluru toll booth shows Café Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha moving towards the Netravati bridge in a black Toyota Innova vehicle minutes before he went missing. He has been missing since Monday evening after being last seen on Netravati bridge. The NDRF, police and Coast Guard have been deployed to search for the missing businessman.

headlines: World Test Championship will be like World Cup: Michael Clarke
text: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke said the World Test Championship will have the same impact as the ICC ODI World Cup. "[T]he team that wins the World Cup is I think seen as the best team in the world. With Test cricket it will be the same, whoever wins the championship is the best team in the world", Clarke added.

headlines: ICC names two new umpires in elite panel for 2019-20
text: The ICC on Tuesday named Michael Gough of England and Trinidad's Joel Wilson in the ICC Elite Panel of Umpires for the 2019-20 season. They will be replacing Ravi Sundaram and retired umpire Ian Gould. Gough has officiated in nine Tests, 59 ODIs and 14 T20Is, while Wilson has stood in 13 Tests, 63 ODIs and 26 T20Is.

headlines: Huawei, Google cancel smart speaker over US blacklisting: Report
text: Google and Huawei have reportedly cancelled a smart speaker after the US government blacklisted Huawei and added it to the 'Entity List'. The Huawei-branded smart speaker, which would have been powered by Google Assistant, was reportedly under development for at least a year. The technology giants reportedly planned to reveal the speaker at a trade show in Berlin in September.

headlines: Azam Khan's son booked for forging documents for passport
text: An FIR has been registered against SP MP Azam Khan's son SP MLA Abdullah Azam Khan over age discrepancy in documents submitted for his passport. The case was filed by BJP leader Akash Saxena who alleged Abdullah obtained the passport on the basis of false and coded documents. Saxena claimed that different birthdates were mentioned in education certificates and passports.

headlines: Class 10 boy killed by classmate at TN boarding school
text: A class 10 boy was hit with cricket stump and stabbed to death with scissors by his classmate following a physical fight in a boarding school in Tamil Nadu's Kodaikanal, police said. The deceased was rushed to the hospital where he was declared brought dead. A case was registered against the accused juvenile after the school's principal lodged a complaint.

headlines: Don't have power to grant minority status to Hindus: NCM
text: The National Commission for Minorities (NCM) on Monday said that it does not have the jurisdiction to grant minority status to any community, adding that the power rests with the Centre. The Supreme Court had directed the NCM to take a decision following a BJP leader's PIL for declaring Hindus as minority in states where they are not in majority.

headlines: Lookout notice against Azam Khan's aide Alay Hasan in 27 cases
text: The UP police has issued a lookout circular at international airports and land borders for former Rampur circle officer Alay Hasan Khan, who is a close aide of Rampur MP Azam Khan. Hasan is wanted in 27 cases of extortion and land grabbing. The cases have been lodged by residents of a village.

headlines: Sunny Deol helps rescue 45-yr-old woman sold as slave to Pak man
text: Actor-turned-politician Sunny Deol helped in rescuing a 45-year-old woman, who was lured by a travel agent to Kuwait and sold to a Pakistani man as a slave. She was assaulted and kept in confinement. District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) and two NGOs also helped in bringing back the woman to Punjab's Gurdaspur, Sunny's parliamentary constituency.

headlines: Amazon sued over alleged voice tech patent infringement for Alexa
text: Amazon has been sued by voice software technology developer VB Assets on accusations that it infringed on patents when developing software for digital assistant Alexa. At least six of the patents, covering conversational voice interfaces, commerce and ads, were allegedly infringed on. The lawsuit claimed Amazon was shown the patented technology in 2011, three years before it launched Alexa.

headlines: BJP MLA's men threatening us: Unnao rape survivor's kin wrote to CJI
text: Weeks before the car accident, Unnao rape survivor's family had written a letter to CJI Ranjan Gogoi, alleging that relatives and henchmen of rape accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar had threatened them. "People came to my house and threatened us to take back cases, otherwise the whole family will be put in jail in fake cases," it read.

headlines: Drunk bank employee kisses policeman during festival in Hyd; detained
text: A 30-year-old bank employee has been detained after he hugged and kissed an on-duty sub-inspector in a drunk condition during the Bonalu festival procession in Hyderabad on Sunday. A video of the incident showed the policeman slapping the accused after he kissed him. The accused is being sent to judicial remand, a police official said.

headlines: Unnao rape accused MLA suspended last year, to stay suspended: BJP
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP chief Swatantra Dev Singh has said Unnao rape accused MLA Kuldeep Sengar was suspended from the party and will remain suspended, adding that a CBI inquiry in the case is underway. BJP spokesperson Rakesh Tripathi also claimed Sengar was suspended after a disciplinary committee inquiry last year. However, he said no official press release was issued then.

headlines: 3,812 Afghan civilians killed or wounded in first half of 2019: UN
text: At least 3,812 Afghan civilians were killed or wounded in the first half of 2019 in the war against militant groups, including a big increase in the number of casualties caused by government and NATO-led troops, the UN has said. While 52% civilian casualties were caused by anti-government elements including Taliban and Islamic State, pro-government forces were responsible for 37%.

headlines: 'Pink Lady Bandit', who robbed multiple banks in US, arrested
text: A female robber nicknamed the 'Pink Lady Bandit' and suspected of robbing multiple banks along the East Coast, US, has been arrested along with an accomplice. Circe Baez was given the nickname because of the signature pink bag she carried during two of the robberies. The FBI had offered a reward of up to $10,000 for any information about her.

headlines: More Afghan civilians killed by security forces than by Taliban: UN
text: More Afghan civilians were killed by Afghan and international security forces than by the Taliban and other militants in the first half of 2019, the United Nations (UN) said. While 717 civilians were killed by security forces in the period, militants killed over 530 civilians. Most of the civilians were killed in operations targeting the insurgents, the UN added.

headlines: Accused 9/11 mastermind offers to testify against Saudi Arabia
text: Khalid Shaikh Mohammad, the accused al-Qaeda mastermind of the September 11, 2001 attacks, has indicated a willingness to cooperate in a lawsuit filed by victims seeking damages from Saudi Arabia. However, he said he will do this if the US decides not to seek death penalty against him. The Saudi government has long denied involvement in the 2001 attacks.

headlines: Faced lot of harassment from Income Tax Department: CCD's Siddhartha
text: Missing Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha, in a letter dated July 27, said he faced a lot of harassment from Income Tax Department. He said authorities attached his shares twice to block the Mindtree deal and then took possession of his Coffee Day shares despite revised returns being filed. "This was unfair and...led to a serious liquidity crunch," Siddhartha added.

headlines: No demand, no investment, growth doesn't fall from heavens: Bajaj
text: Bajaj Auto Chairman Rahul Bajaj has criticised the government for falling domestic demand and lack of private investment at the company's annual general meeting. "There is no demand and no private investment, so where will growth come from? It doesn't fall from heavens," the 81-year-old said. He added that the auto industry is going through "a very difficult period".

headlines: World Test Championship great for the game: Steve Waugh
text: Reacting to the launch of World Test Championship by ICC, former Australia captain Steve Waugh said he thinks that the championship is great for Test cricket. Adding that Test cricket is the only format where a player can "truly" test his full capacity, he said Test cricket "really needs" the championship. The championship will commence with Ashes on August 1.

headlines: Rahane is a solid player and he will come around: Kohli
text: Backing Indian Test team vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane, captain Virat Kohli said, "I think he will come around because he is that good a player and when he does, we know he can be very consistent." "He is one of the most sorted guys. Really, really composed, reads the game well also, priceless fielder," Kohli added about Rahane.

headlines: Cricket needs the ICC World Test Championship: Jayawardene
text: Former Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardene wrote, "Cricket needs the ICC World Test Championship. Context is essential, to play for points as well as pride." "I'm pretty confident that it will attract a lot of interest. It's important to keep the Test game healthy. We cannot be afraid of evolution to do that," Jayawardene added in his column.

headlines: Unnao rape a blot on society, Shah must respond: Adhir Chowdhury
text: Days after the Unnao rape survivor's road accident, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury termed the rape as "a blot on civilized society" and demanded a response from Home Minister Amit Shah. He added, "What kind of a society are we talking about, where such an incident happened with the victim." On Sunday, the rape survivor was seriously injured in the accident.

headlines: Rename Signature Bridge after Sheila Dikshit: Cong to Kejriwal
text: The Delhi unit of Congress on Monday wrote to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal saying the Signature Bridge is deceased Congress leader Sheila Dikshit's gift to the city and should be renamed after her. Its construction started during Dikshit's tenure, the letter read. Dikshit, who served as the Chief Minister of Delhi three times, passed away on July 20 aged 81.

headlines: BJP giving protection to gangrape accused: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati criticised the BJP government over the Unnao rape survivor's accident and accused the ruling government of protecting "gangrape accused". She added that BJP MP Sakshi Maharaj's meeting with the accused party MLA proves that the accused are "constantly" getting protection from the BJP. Mayawati further said that the Supreme Court should take cognisance of this.

headlines: BJP MLA Vishweshwar Kageri files nomination for Karnataka Speaker
text: Karnataka BJP MLA Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri on Tuesday filed his nomination for the post of the state Assembly Speaker after KR Ramesh Kumar resigned on Monday. The MLA from Sirsi constituency, Kageri, was accompanied by CM BS Yediyurappa and other senior party leaders. "We received only one nomination that was of Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri," an official at the Secretariat said.

headlines: MindTickle gets $40 million led by Norwest Venture Partners
text: San Francisco-based sales enablement solutions startup MindTickle has raised $40 million in its Series C funding round led by Norwest Venture Partners. Existing investors including Accel, Canaan, NewView Capital, and Qualcomm also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2012, MindTickle is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform that focuses on improving sales of clients.

headlines: Indian culture ruined in areas with more Muslims, Christians: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Tuesday said India's culture is being destroyed in the regions with a higher population of Muslims and Christians. He further said that PM Narendra Modi and UP CM Yogi Adityanath are sent by God as avatars. "God has sent [them]...as avatars who will keep India colourful with the idea of Hindutva," the MLA added.

headlines: Banning cryptocurrency in India not a solution, says Nasscom
text: Industry body Nasscom has opposed a government panel's recent proposal to ban cryptocurrencies in India, saying it is "not a solution". Nasscom said the government should instead work towards developing a risk-based framework to regulate cryptocurrencies. "A ban would inhibit new applications and solutions from being deployed and would discourage tech startups," it added.

headlines: Singer Guru Randhawa attacked after his Canada concert: Reports
text: Punjabi singer Guru Randhawa was attacked by an unidentified assailant after his concert in Canada's Vancouver, according to reports. A picture of injured Randhawa, who was reportedly attacked while exiting the venue, has surfaced online. People said the attacker was behaving in a rowdy manner during his performance. Following the attack, the police and an ambulance arrived on the spot.

headlines: European artist accuses 'Judgementall Hai Kya' makers of plagiarism
text: European artist Flóra Borsi has accused the makers of 'Judgementall Hai Kya' of plagiarism. The photographer took to Facebook to share a collage of her original photograph alongside one of the movie's posters featuring Kangana Ranaut. "Any similarities? They didn't ask for any permission nor reached me out. It's a shame for big companies plagiarising freelance artists work," she wrote.

headlines: 4 Opposition MLAs resign from Maharashtra Assembly, to join BJP
text: NCP MLAs Vaibhav Pichad, Sandeep Naik, Shivendrasinh Bhonsle and Congress MLA Kalidas Kolambkar handed their resignations to Assembly Speaker Haribhau Bagade on Tuesday. They will formally join the BJP tomorrow. The development comes after NCP's Mumbai unit chief Sachin Ahir quit the party and joined the Shiv Sena last week.

headlines: Why has BJP not expelled rape accused MLA Kuldeep Sengar: Priyanka
text: Days after the Unnao woman who accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of rape was critically injured in an accident, Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tweeted, "What is the BJP waiting for?" She questioned why Sengar had not been expelled from the party. Sengar has been booked under sections 302 (murder) and 307 (attempt to murder) following the accident.

headlines: SC to decide if those accused of sexual offences can stay unnamed
text: The Supreme Court has agreed to take up a PIL seeking new guidelines to protect identities of persons accused of sexual harassment or assault and issued a notice to the government for its view on the demand. The PIL was filed by Youth Bar Association of India, which claimed allegations can destroy someone's life even if that person is innocent.

headlines: 5-yr-old UP boy hides inside ice cream trolley during game, dies
text: A five-year-old kindergarten student suffocated to death after hiding inside an ice cream trolley while playing hide-and-seek with his friends in Pilibhit, UP on Monday. After he hid, the chamber's lid reportedly got locked from outside and he died of asphyxiation. His body was found when his family started looking for him as he hadn't returned for a long time.

headlines: Flood water enters hostel in MP, 183 students rescued
text: As many as 183 students of the Kanya Shiksha Parisar school in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh were rescued on Monday after flood water entered their hostel building. Following this, Circle Officer Suresh Chandra said, "The hostel superintendent was not present at the hostel." He added that action will be taken against the hostel superintendent.

headlines: Primary school teacher held for repeatedly raping minor daughters
text: A primary school teacher in Maharashtra was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping his two minor daughters repeatedly. The accused, whose wife has been bed-ridden for several years, had started sexually abusing his 17-year-old daughter five years ago and his 14-year-old daughter last year. The incident came to light after they confided in their uncle.

headlines: Trump wants forces reduced in Afghanistan by 2020 US polls: Pompeo
text: US President Donald Trump wants combat forces reduced in Afghanistan by the next US presidential election, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Monday. On Friday, Pompeo and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani agreed in a phone call to "accelerate efforts" to end the war in Afghanistan. Pompeo said he was "optimistic" about negotiations with the Taliban and the Afghan government.

headlines: 16 inmates beheaded in Brazil jail riot that killed 57
text: A clash between two rival gangs at a prison in Brazil has left at least 57 inmates dead with 16 of them beheaded. Prisoners belonging to the Comando Classe A gang set fire to a cell containing inmates from the rival Comando Vermelho gang, government officials said in a statement. Two prison guards were taken hostage, but later released.

headlines: CCD shares drop 20% after Founder VG Siddhartha goes missing
text: Shares of Coffee Day Enterprises Ltd dropped 20% after its Founder VG Siddhartha went missing in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Monday. The company also sent a letter to National Stock Exchange of India Ltd with updates on the missing case. Police have launched a search operation near Netravati river, where the Founder went missing.

headlines: He got down on bridge, said he'd walk: Missing CCD Founder's driver
text: The driver of CCD Founder VG Siddhartha, who went missing in Mangaluru, has told the police that Siddhartha asked him to take the car to a bridge across Netravati river. "He asked me to be at the end of the bridge and said he'd walk," the driver stated. He alerted Siddhartha's family after waiting for him for an hour.

headlines: Proud to be Test vice-captain again: Ben Stokes
text: After being reinstated as England's Test team vice-captain, Ben Stokes said, "I love having that responsibility and it is something that I thoroughly enjoy doing. I take pride in being vice-captain." Stokes was removed from the position in 2017 following a late-night brawl in Bristol. Stokes replaces Jos Buttler as England's Test vice-captain.

headlines: Contact lens prototype that can zoom by blinking twice made
text: California University, San Diego scientists have developed a prototype contact lens that is controlled by the eye's movements, which can zoom in or out by blinking twice. The lenses are made of stretchable polymer films which respond to electric signals generated by the movement of eyes. They are able to change focal length depending on the signals generated.

headlines: Former BSP leader Jasram Gurjar shot dead in Rajasthan
text: Former Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) leader Jasram Gurjar, who was a history-sheeter, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Rajasthan's Alwar district on Monday, police said. Around 6-7 bullets pierced into his body and the criminals will soon be rounded up, a senior police officer said. The police added that around 14-15 cases were registered against Gurjar.

headlines: Don't use Lord Ram's name to create unrest, anger: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that the name of Lord Ram shouldn't be used to create unrest and spread anger. He added, "If someone does so by heart then it's good, but if someone is made to chant Jai Shri Ram slogans unwillingly, it's wrong." Gehlot further said that it's "unfortunate" that the BJP started "owning" Lord Ram.

headlines: Odisha Secretariat will be called as Lok Seva Bhawan: Patnaik
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Monday announced that the state 'Secretariat' or 'Sachivalaya' will be called as 'Lok Seva Bhawan'. Addressing the Assembly, he added, "I'm highly indebted to the people of our state and will continue to work hard to fulfil their aspirations." Patnaik said that in a democracy, people are masters and "we all exist to serve them".

headlines: 16-yr-old girl gangraped in park in Bihar, 2 youths arrested
text: Two youths were arrested for allegedly raping a 16-year-old girl in a park in East Champaran district, Bihar on Sunday night. The girl was on her way to a chemist when the two youths, one of whom was known to her, intercepted her in a car and took her to the park. She later filed a police complaint.

headlines: 2 killed, 1 injured after wall collapses in Thane; 19 rescued
text: Two people were killed and one was injured after a wall of a house collapsed due to a landslide in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday, officials said. The authorities have reportedly rescued 19 people from the area. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rains for the next two days in Mumbai and its adjoining areas.

headlines: Zonal R'ways offices to list staff over 55 to cut underperformers
text: Zonal Railways offices have reportedly been asked to list employees attaining the age of 55 years or completing 30 years of service by the first quarter of 2020 in a bid to remove underperformers. Those with poor performance or disciplinary issues will be offered premature retirement. Records related to employees' mental and physical fitness, attendance and punctuality will be assessed.

headlines: 17 killed as Pakistan military plane crashes into residential area
text: At least 17 people, including 5 crew members and 12 civilians were killed, after a Pakistan military aircraft on a training flight crashed into a residential area in Rawalpindi. A fire which broke out at the crash site injured 12 other people. Rescue teams reached the site of the incident and the fire has been extinguished.

headlines: Café Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha goes missing in Karnataka
text: Café Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha went missing near Netravati River in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Monday. Siddhartha got off from his car near a bridge across the river but didn't return even after an hour, according to reports. His driver then reportedly went to look for him and informed his family after unsuccessful search. Police have launched a search operation.

headlines: Fought for long but today I gave up: Missing CCD Founder in letter
text: A letter written by Café Coffee Day Founder VG Siddhartha, who has gone missing, has surfaced online. Siddhartha wrote he was under pressure from a private equity partner and other lenders. "I am sorry to let down all the people that put their trust in me. I fought for a long time but today I gave up," he further wrote.

headlines: Was doing bridal shoot: Rakhi on rumours of marrying NRI at hotel
text: Actress Rakhi Sawant has denied rumours that she got married to an NRI at a 5-star hotel. "I was doing a bridal shoot... I don't know why people are saying that I am married. I am not married, I am not in a relationship. I am very much single," she said. Rakhi later shared pictures from the shoot.

headlines: Aparna trolls Arnab after video of him shouting at her goes viral
text: Filmmaker Aparna Sen trolled Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami on Twitter after a video of the journalist shouting at her went viral last week. Goswami had shouted at Sen through a reporter's phone put on speaker during a press conference. "Where were you when people were murdered for saying Jai Shri Ram?" Arnab had asked Aparna.

headlines: Former cricketer Pravin Amre applies for Indias batting coach post
text: Ex-India batsman Pravin Amre has applied for the job of India batting coach. Amre played 11 Tests for India, scoring 425 runs with a hundred and three fifties, along with 37 ODIs in which he scored 513 runs with two fifties. The BCCI has asked interested candidates for several coaching positions to send their applications on or before July 30.

headlines: Disrespectful to drag players' personal lives: Virat Kohli to media
text: India captain Virat Kohli, while categorically refuting rumours of a rift with Rohit Sharma, said that people are feeding off lies. He added that media dragging the personal lives of cricketers is disrespectful. "It's bizarre that people are creating this stuff from outside," he further said. Kohli made the comments during the pre-departure press conference ahead of West Indies tour.

headlines: World Test Championship will add context to 5-day cricket: Kohli
text: Following the official launch of World Test Championship (WTC), Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "We are awaiting the ICC World Test Championship with great enthusiasm as it adds context to the longest format of the game." Test cricket is very challenging and coming out on top in the traditional form is always highly satisfying," he added.

headlines: I don't want to watch the game ever again: Taylor on 2019 WC final
text: Talking about the 2019 World Cup final which England won on boundary count, New Zealand batsman Ross Taylor said he doesn't want to watch the game ever again. "There were lots of emotions because the game had so many ebbs and flows...we were on top, then they were on top. For some guys, the result...hasnt sunk in," he added.

headlines: Korean fans to sue agency as Juventus don't play Ronaldo in Seoul
text: Over 2,000 South Korean football fans will sue a sports agency after Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo stayed on the bench when Juventus played a friendly in Seoul last week, as per a law firm. As many as 65,000 fans had attended the match between Juventus and K-League all-star team. "Ronaldo betrayed the audience and belittled us," a fan said.

headlines: Kapil Dev was 1st to hit 4 consecutive sixes in a Test match
text: Kapil Dev smashed four consecutive sixes off England spinner Eddie Hemmings at Lord's on July 30, 1990, becoming the first ever player to hit sixes off four consecutive balls in Tests. India required 24 runs to avoid a follow-on with one wicket remaining, when Dev achieved the feat. No batsman has ever hit more than four consecutive sixes in Tests.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor has very less chance of survival: DCW chief
text: Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal on Monday met Unnao rape survivor at a Lucknow hospital and said she has very less chance of survival. Maliwal said she should be airlifted to Delhi for treatment as she is critical. A truck on Sunday hit the car of Unnao woman, who had accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of raping her.

headlines: IndiGo plane aborts take-off at last min due to glitch in wheels in MP
text: The pilot of a Mumbai-bound IndiGo flight aborted take-off at the last minute at Bhopal airport in Madhya Pradesh due to a technical glitch in the aircraft's wheels, an official said. A passenger said the plane had stopped suddenly with a loud sound, causing panic among people. Meanwhile, IndiGo's station manager said all 155 passengers in the plane were safe.

headlines: Starting World Test C'ship vs India will be tough: Faf du Plessis
text: South Africa captain Faf du Plessis has said starting World Test Championship against India will be tough. "Any team will say...within a calendar year or so on the circuit, the toughest part of touring is probably playing in India," he added. "Everyone is going to have to play in India eventually...so we might as well start there," he stated.

headlines: Delighted that Smith and Warner will be part of Ashes: Broad
text: England pacer Stuart Broad said he was "delighted" that Australian batsmen Steve Smith and David Warner will be featuring in the Ashes. "I think it makes the game a better spectacle with those two there," Broad added about the duo who faced one-year bans for their roles in 2018 ball-tampering scandal. "They've served their time," Broad further said.

headlines: Amir reveals he mistakenly liked 'leave terrorist country' tweet
text: Reacting to a news portal's article about him liking a tweet calling Pakistan a 'terrorist country', Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir had said he had liked the tweet mistakenly. He added that he was trying to like some other tweet but ended up liking it. Amir also blocked the fan who had tweeted that he "should leave the terrorist country".

headlines: Wildlife reserve in Maharashtra glows in the dark during Monsoon
text: The Bhimashankar Wildlife Reserve in Maharashtra glows in the dark during the Monsoon due to bioluminescent fungi. They glow due to luciferase, an oxidative enzyme that emits light when it comes in contact with a light-emitting substance present on the rotting bark of trees. However, the phenomenon depends on the intensity of rains and moisture in the forests.

headlines: There's jungle raj in UP: Akhilesh on Unnao rape survivor's accident
text: After Unnao rape survivor was critically injured in a road accident, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that there's "jungle raj" in the state. He added, "This incident has links with a BJP MLA and there's a BJP government in UP." Yadav said, the criminals are roaming "fearlessly" in the state and "only a CBI probe will solve this mystery".

headlines: Ant-Man and the Wasp actress Evangeline visits India, shares pics
text: Hollywood actress Evangeline Lilly, known for her role in 'Ant-Man and the Wasp', is currently on a trip to Delhi and shared several pictures. She visited some historical spots including Humayun's Tomb and Agrasen ki Baoli. The actress also shared a Boomerang video of herself on Instagram Story and wrote, "#Fluffitup. Night out in Delhi."

headlines: I would need a crystal maze to solve middle-order issue, jokes Kohli
text: On being asked how Team India intends to bring stability in the middle order in ODIs, Team India captain Virat Kohli joked, "I would need a crystal maze to show you how to solve the middle-order issue." "We believe our top-order is the best...[Middle-order] fails to perform in couple of opportunities they get and everyone starts pointing out," he added.

headlines: None of that nonsense is there: Shastri on reports of Kohli-Rohit rift
text: Reacting to the reports of rift between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "I've been a part of dressing room and none of that nonsense is there." "You cannot have the kind of consistency across all formats, if you have rifts or divisions," he added. "No individual is bigger than the game," he further said.

headlines: TikTok's parent company ByteDance to launch a smartphone
text: Short videos app TikTok's parent company, China's ByteDance, confirmed on Monday that it's developing a smartphone. A ByteDance spokeswoman said a smartphone had been part of Smartisan's development plans before the deal it made with ByteDance. Earlier this year, ByteDance acquired a set of patents from Chinese technology company Smartisan and some Smartisan employees joined ByteDance.

headlines: It was the best decision to turn off phone notifications: Sachin Bansal
text: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal on Monday tweeted that he turned off all phone notifications a few days ago. "The best decision that I had made in recent times. I would recommend it," he added. IIT Delhi alumnus Sachin Bansal, who co-founded Flipkart in 2007, left Flipkart after $16 billion Flipkart-Walmart deal in May 2018 and set up BAC Acquisitions.

headlines: Srinivas BV appointed interim President of Indian Youth Congress
text: Congress leader Srinivas BV was appointed as the interim President of the Indian Youth Congress (IYC) on Monday by the Congress President, said an All India Congress Committee communique signed by party General Secretary KC Venugopal. Srinivas was earlier the National Vice President of the IYC. He replaced Keshav Chand Yadav, who was given the charge in May 2018.

headlines: Kerala Youth Cong sprinkles cow dung water where Dalit MLA protested
text: Kerala Youth Congress in Thrissur district allegedly 'purified' a spot by sprinkling cow dung water where Communist Party of India (CPI) MLA Geetha Gopi sat for a protest. Gopi, who belongs to Scheduled Caste community, has filed a police complaint. "Even after a woman from Scheduled Caste became an MLA, these people insult me using my caste," said Geetha Gopi.

headlines: Odisha gets GI tag for its version of Rasgulla after West Bengal
text: Nearly two years after West Bengal got Geographical Indication (GI) tag for its version of Rasgulla, Odisha on Monday received the GI tag for "Odisha Rasagola". The Chennai based GI Registry issued formal certification for "Odisha Rasagola" on its website. The GI tag for Rasgullas to the neighbouring states recognises two distinct varieties of the sweet in taste and texture.

headlines: 2,461 students dropped out of IITs in 2 yrs, nearly half SC, ST, OBC
text: As many as 2,461 students dropped out of various IITs across the country in the last two years, the Ministry of Human Resource Development has said. Out of these students, 1,171 students belonged to the SC, ST and OBC categories, the ministry added. Most of the dropouts occurred in the older IITs and Delhi topped the list with 782 dropouts.

headlines: Rahul, Priyanka criticise UP govt for Unnao rape survivor's accident
text: A day after Unnao rape survivor was critically injured in a road accident, Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh. Priyanka tweeted, "Does it have no moral duty towards its citizens anymore, or was that never on its agenda?" Rahul tweeted, "Don't ask questions if a BJP MLA is accused of raping you."

headlines: Root a class player, doesn't have any weaknesses: Hazlewood
text: Ahead of 2019 Ashes which starts on Thursday, Australia fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has called England Test captain Joe Root a "class player". The 28-year-old said that the world number seven Test batsman Root doesn't have weaknesses to his game. "It's about being straight on the money from ball one against him," added Hazlewood, who has taken 164 Test wickets.

headlines: Red Bull breaks F1 pit stop record for second race in a row
text: Red Bull broke the Formula One pit stop record for the second race in a row after the pit team completed Max Verstappen's pit stop in 1.88 seconds in the German Grand Prix on Sunday. The team had earlier registered a 1.90-second pit stop for Pierre Gasly in the British Grand Prix. Verstappen went on to win the German GP.

headlines: Minaur 3rd person to win tournament without facing breakpoint
text: Following his Atlanta Open title, Australia's 20-year-old Alex de Minaur became only the third person since the tour began keeping stats in 1991 to win a tournament without facing a breakpoint. De Minaur, the youngest winner in the tournament's history, dropped just seven first-serve points throughout the week. De Minaur gained nine places to reach 25th in the ATP Rankings.

headlines: Article 35A and Article 370 should not be removed: Farooq
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that the Centre should not remove Article 35A and Article 370 as they form the state's foundation. "We are Hindustani but [the Articles] are important to us," Farooq said. This comes a day after PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that touching Article 35A will be like playing with explosives.

headlines: Lone BSP MLA in Jharkhand dismissed for anti-party activities
text: The Jharkhand unit of BSP on Monday dismissed its lone MLA Kushwaha Shivpujan Mehta for anti-party activities, indiscipline and neglecting his constituency, a party leader said. Kushwaha had submitted his resignation from the Assembly on July 26 alleging problems of his constituency weren't being solved. His resignation was rejected by the Speaker, who said the decision was taken in haste.

headlines: Congress is not orphaned: KC Venugopal on Tharoor's remark
text: Following Shashi Tharoor's 'lack of clarity' remark, Congress General Secretary KC Venugopal on Monday said there is no orphaned scenario. Venugopal further said Rahul Gandhi had offered to work until his replacement was found and was still involved in the day to day activities of the party. Tharoor had said that lack of clarity at the top was hurting Congress.

headlines: Maharashtra MLA Kalidas Kolambkar quits Congress to join BJP
text: Maharashtra Congress MLA Kalidas Kolambkar on Monday resigned from the party and the post to reportedly join the BJP. Kolambkar was a former Shiv Sena leader and joined the Congress along with former state Chief Minister Narayan Rane. In March, Kolambkar had removed the Congress signboard outside his residence and instead put up the portrait of Chief Minister Devendra Fadanvis.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor's accident pre-planned conspiracy: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday took to Twitter to call the accident of Unnao rape survivor a pre-planned conspiracy and a mockery of rule of law. "How can any civilised society allow such state-sponsored barbarism?" Kejriwal added. The survivor was critically injured in a car-truck collision on Sunday which killed her aunts and critically injured her lawyer.

headlines: 4 infiltrators from Myanmar arrested from UP madrasas
text: Police on Monday arrested seven persons, of which four were infiltrators into the country from Myanmar, from madrasas in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district. The Myanmar nationals were living illegally in India on an invalid visa for years, as per the FIR. Police have recovered Indian citizenship-related documents, Indian and Myanmar currencies, ATM cards and phones from their possession.

headlines: SC notice to Centre on plea to protect identity of rape accused
text: Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Centre on a petition seeking the protection of identities of those accused in rape cases until the completion of the trial. The confidentiality of victims would also be protected more, the plea stated. The petitioner further said criminal laws regarding sexual accusations need preventive measures to save innocents from false allegations.

headlines: 10-day-old baby injured in Pakistan ceasefire violation dies
text: A ten-day-old baby, who was injured in a ceasefire violation by Pakistan in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch, succumbed to his injuries on Monday. The infant, his mother and another civilian were injured after mortar shells fired by Pakistani troops hit their village on Sunday night. The condition of the other two injured persons is stated to be stable, police said.

headlines: Release seized ship to 'come out of the dark': Britain to Iran
text: Britain has told Iran that if it wants to "come out of the dark" it must follow international rules and release a British-flagged oil tanker seized by its forces in the Gulf. "You cannot go about detaining unlawfully foreign vessels," Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab. Iranian commandos seized the oil tanker, Stena Impero, near the Strait of Hormuz on July 19.

headlines: BC Tripathi denied 3rd term as GAIL CMD by the govt: Reports
text: The government has reportedly denied the extension of a third term to Bhuwan Chandra Tripathi as the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of state-run GAIL. Reports said Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan had recommended an extension of Tripathi's term. Tripathi first became GAIL CMD in 2009 aged 49, as the youngest Chairman of a Navratna public-sector undertaking.

headlines: Display of 'trans-fat-free' claim on food items voluntary: FSSAI
text: Food safety regulator FSSAI said food establishments like bakeries can "voluntarily" display "trans-fat-free" logo on food items containing trans-fat-free oils or not having over 0.2 gm industrial trans-fat per 100 gm. Industrial trans-fats are toxic compounds linked to cardiovascular diseases. FSSAI said India has limited trans-fat content in oils to 5% and will further reduce it to 3% by 2021.

headlines: It has been a lighter part emotionally: Deepika on her role in '83
text: Speaking about her role in the upcoming film '83, Deepika Padukone said, "There are extreme highs and lows that Romi also goes through...But the film also explores lighter moments between Romi and Kapil Dev." "So, in that sense, you can say that it has been a lighter part emotionally," she added. Deepika will portray Kapil Dev's wife in the film.

headlines: I can't be solely blamed for a film's poor collection: Sidharth
text: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has said he can't be solely blamed for a film's poor collection and he also can't be the only reason for a film to work. "Unfortunately, it all becomes about the actor, but there's a team behind every film," he added. Sidharth further called acting an "unpredictable profession" where one is "simply guessing and learning".

headlines: Udit Narayan approaches police after 3 death threats in a month
text: Singer Udit Narayan approached the police after receiving three death threats in a month from the same number. Police traced the mobile phone from which the threat calls were made to Bihar. They found the number was registered in the name of a security guard of the building where Narayan lives, who said his phone was stolen three months ago.

headlines: Ashwin criticises fans after #RIPactorVijay trends on Twitter
text: Cricketer Ashwin Ravichandran has criticised fans after fans of Tamil actor Ajith Kumar started trending the hashtag #RIPactorVijay on Twitter on Monday. "Irregular monsoons hitting different cities, droughts in many parts...but the young generation of our lovey state manage to trend this #RIPactorVIJAY," Ashwin tweeted. In response to Ajith's fans, supporters of Vijay started trending #LongLiveVijay by Monday afternoon.

headlines: What is the World Test Championship launched by ICC today?
text: The ICC today officially launched the inaugural World Test Championship, which will see top nine teams compete in 71 Tests across 27 series played over two years. Each team will play three home and three away series, with the top two teams competing in final in UK in June 2021. The championship will commence with the Ashes on August 1.

headlines: Gavaskar criticises BCCI's selection committee, calls them lame duck
text: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has criticised BCCI selection committee for deciding to continue with Virat Kohli as captain without even holding a meeting following World Cup. Calling the committee "lame duck", Gavaskar said the committee doesn't have players of stature and gets bullied by team management. He further questioned whether Kohli is the captain "at his or committee's pleasure".

headlines: Virat Kohli responds to reports of rift with Rohit Sharma
text: On being asked about reports of rift with Rohit Sharma, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "If I don't like a person, you will see that on my face." "I have always praised Rohit whenever I had an opportunity. We have had no issues," he added. "Everything is fine in the team. We all share great camaraderie," he further said.

headlines: LinkedIn bug lets man put official-looking job posting for Google CEO
text: A man named Michel Rijnders was successfully able to post an official-looking job posting for Google CEO on LinkedIn due to a LinkedIn security bug. Usually, creating job postings on the platform needs a premium subscription, but Michel could post the job opening for free. "Thank you Michel for bringing this to our attention. We're resolving the issue," LinkedIn responded.

headlines: Amazon may buy Uber Eats India to foray into food delivery: Report
text: Amazon India is reportedly in talks to acquire the Indian arm of Uber Eats, the food delivery vertical of ride-hailing company Uber, to foray into the food delivery business. The talks are reportedly in the initial stages and can also result in a strategic partnership. Amazon is said to be interested in the food delivery business through its Prime membership.

headlines: We're now 3 steps closer to Moon, ISRO updates on Chandrayaan-2
text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on Monday posted an update on India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2 and tweeted, "We are now 3 steps closer to the moon!!!"
