"Third earthbound orbit-raising maneuver for Chandrayaan-2 spacecraft has been performed today at 1512 hrs (IST) as planned," ISRO added. The Chandrayaan-2 mission was launched by ISRO on July 22.

headlines: Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train to be customised for extreme heat, dust
text: India is working with Japan to make bullet trains which can handle extreme heat and high levels of pollution for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project. "The trains that run in Japan are built to handle the outside temperature of up to 35°C," National High Speed Rail Corporation's Managing Director said. "But in Maharashtra, the temperature can cross 50°C," he added.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi perfect for Cong chief's post: Capt Amarinder Singh
text: Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said that Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will be the perfect choice for the party President post but the decision rests with the Congress Working Committee. "She has the intelligence and instinct to understand...the needs of the nation, and also has the courage to...take the fight to victory," Singh added.

headlines: Inki aadat zarurat se zada bigadi huyi hai: Rama Devi to Azam Khan
text: After SP leader Azam Khan apologised in Lok Sabha over his remark on BJP MP Rama Devi, she said, "Inki aadat zarurat se zada bigadi huyi hai." Devi added she has reached the Lok Sabha after struggles as a voice of the people, Khan has no right to say such things to her, she hasn't come to hear these comments.

headlines: Changes under Paine haven't affected Aus' desire to win: Cummins
text: Speaking ahead of 2019's Ashes, Australian pacer Pat Cummins has said that changes made under Test captain Tim Paine have not affected Australia's desire to win. Cummins, who took a break following Australia's exit from the World Cup 2019, said that the Australian team took time to think about the way they wanted to play the sport following Paine's appointment.

headlines: Rohit Sharma an amazing captain, Zaheer a legend: Rahul Chahar
text: Team India's newly selected leg-spinner Rahul Chahar called his Mumbai Indians' captain Rohit Sharma "an amazing captain", adding that Rohit shows a lot of trust in him. "I've bowled in the 2nd over of an IPL match and also 17th over," the 19-year-old added. Chahar further praised ex-cricketer Zaheer Khan for "teaching him to experiment" and called him "a legend".

headlines: Big player Anderson will be important for Eng in Ashes: McGrath
text: Ex-Australian pacer Glenn McGrath has termed England pacer James Anderson as a 'big player', saying, "[I]f he (Anderson) has a big series for England, Australia will find it tough. If Australia bat well and can get on top of him, that'll make a massive impact." "Jimmy is on his way to 600 Test wickets, which is absolutely incredible," McGrath added.

headlines: PSL season 5 to be held wholly in Pakistan: Report
text: According to reports, the fifth edition of the Pakistan Super League will be held wholly in Pakistan. Since the start of the league in 2016, the PCB has organised majority of the matches in Dubai and Sharjah as several foreign players were reluctant to travel to Pakistan because of security concerns in the nation.

headlines: I'm not a Portuguese citizen: Goa Assembly Deputy Speaker
text: Goa Assembly Deputy Speaker Isidore Fernandes on Monday denied claims of being a Portuguese citizen, claiming it is a political conspiracy to malign him. A purported copy of his birth certificate being registered in Portugal had emerged online. "I haven't applied for Portuguese citizenship...I'm not a fool to be a Portuguese citizen and stand for elections," the BJP MLA said.

headlines: NMC Bill will be one of the biggest reform: Health Minister
text: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday in Lok Sabha said that the National Medical Commission (NMC) Bill will be one of the biggest reforms. The bill seeks to replace the Medical Council of India (MCI) with an NMC and repeal the Indian Medical Council Act 1956. It was alleged that the process by which MCI regulated medical colleges was flawed.

headlines: TMC launches outreach program 'Didi Ke Bolo' with helpline
text: West Bengal Chief Minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee on Monday launched an outreach program 'Didi Ke Bolo' (Tell Didi), through which people can call the helpline number to complain or give suggestions. TMC leaders will travel to over 10,000 villages and urban areas across the state to interact with people as part of the initiative, Banerjee said.

headlines: 2 Great Learning faculty in AIMs Top Data Science Academics list
text: Great Learning is the only institute to have two academicians, Dr Sarkar and Dr. Viswanathan, to be listed in AIM's 10 Most Prominent Data Science Academicians In India : 2019 list. Great Learning's programs have faculty who've taught at Stanford, MIT, UT Austin, IIM-B, ISI, IISc and more, along with industry experts who offer personalised mentorship to produce job-ready professionals.

headlines: Murder case filed against BJP MLA after Unnao rape survivor's accident
text: An FIR has been registered against BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, his brother Manoj Sengar and several others in connection with Unnao rape survivor's accident in Raebareli. Kuldeep has been booked under sections 302 (murder), 307 (attempt to murder) and 506 (criminal intimidation). The rape survivor was critically injured after the accident, while two of her aunts passed away.

headlines: Dog seeking shelter in building during rain beaten; celebs share post
text: Several Bollywood celebrities, including Sonam Kapoor, Anushka Sharma and John Abraham have shared videos and posts after a dog was brutally beaten when found taking shelter near a building in Mumbai during the rains. The dog can be seen struggling to stand up after being assaulted. An FIR has been registered with the Worli Police Station by Bombay Animal Rights.

headlines: All three 2020 iPhone models to support 5G: Apple analyst
text: Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has told investors that all three iPhone models slated for release next year would support 5G technology. Kuo had originally said that only two of the three new iPhones coming in 2020 will support 5G. Kuo added that Apple's acquisition of Intel's smartphone modem chip business has given company more resources for developing 5G-enabled iPhones.

headlines: Truck that hit Unnao rape survivor's car had grease on number plate
text: The number plate of the truck that hit the car in which Unnao rape survivor, her aunts and her lawyer were travelling was scrubbed with black grease. The survivor's uncle alleged the scrubbing of the number plate hints at a conspiracy. However, police said drivers usually blacken their number plates to avoid Road Transport Office tax in cases of overloading.

headlines: Unnao rape victim refused to take security personnel with her: UP DGP
text: The Unnao rape victim, who was critically injured in an accident yesterday, had refused to take the assigned security personnel along with her in the vehicle due to space constraints, Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh said. He asserted there was no lapse in security provided to her. He added that the government had given her 10 security guards.

headlines: Ex-Gujarat CM Anandiben Patel takes oath as Uttar Pradesh Governor
text: Former Gujarat CM Anandiben Patel took oath as Uttar Pradesh Governor on Monday. High Court Chief Justice Govind Mathur administered her the oath at the Raj Bhawan in Lucknow. Patel was serving as Madhya Pradesh Governor when President Ram Nath Kovind transferred her and appointed her as Uttar Pradesh Governor. Outgoing UP Governor Ram Naik also attended her swearing-in ceremony.

headlines: PM to feature in 'Man vs Wild' episode; Bear Grylls shares video
text: PM Narendra Modi will feature in an episode of 'Man vs Wild'. The show's host Bear Grylls shared a video and said, "People across 180 countries will get to see the unknown side of PM Modi as he ventures into Indian wilderness to create awareness about animal conservation & environmental change." "Thanks Bear Grylls for coming here!" PM Modi tweeted.

headlines: Keeping cows 'love jihad', Muslims should only pet goats: BJP leader
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP leader Ranjit Srivastava has said that Muslims should only pet goats and keeping cows at their homes should be considered as 'love jihad'. Srivastava added that Hindus should take back cows from Muslims because "if we consider our girls and sisters going into Muslim homes as love jihad, then this should also be considered as same."

headlines: Dan Coats to step down as US National Intelligence chief
text: US President Donald Trump announced on Sunday that Dan Coats would step down as the Director of National Intelligence on August 15, adding that he would nominate Congressman John Ratcliffe of Texas to replace Coats. "I would like to thank Dan for his great service to our country," Trump said. He added that the acting Director will be named shortly.

headlines: Britain rejects idea of oil tanker swap with Iran
text: Britain has rejected the idea that it could release a seized Iranian tanker in exchange for a British-flagged vessel captured by the Middle East country in the Gulf. "This is not about some kind of barter. This is about international law and rules of the international legal system being upheld and that is what we'll insist on," Britain said.

headlines: It's an amazing opportunity to play for India at 19: Sundar
text: Off-spinner Washington Sundar, who's part of Team India's T20I squad for West Indies tour, has said that it's an amazing opportunity for him to play for India at "such a young age". The 19-year-old added, "I believe that my hard work is going to pay off going ahead." Sundar has played seven T20Is and an ODI for India till now.

headlines: Bernal becomes youngest Tour de France winner in 110 years
text: Egan Bernal became the youngest Tour de France winner in 110 years after completing the last stage of the competition on Sunday. The 22-year-old is also the first-ever Colombian to win the Tour de France title. Overall, Bernal is the third-youngest winner in the history of Tour de France behind Henri Cornet and François Faber.

headlines: I'm glad it's over: Lewis Hamilton after German Grand Prix
text: After hitting the barrier and spinning off the track in the German Grand Prix, Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton said, "It was probably the worst day I've had in the office for a long, long time. [T]o be honest...I'm glad it's over." Hamilton has maintained his 39-point lead in the Drivers Championship ahead of Mercedes teammate Valtteri Bottas.

headlines: No set deadline for automakers for transition to EVs: FM
text: On the topic of automakers' concerns over the 2023 and 2025 phase-out deadline proposed by NITI Aayog for most petrol and diesel-run three and two-wheelers, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said there's no such deadline. "NITI Aayog can generate a lot of discussions...but it's not the government's policy," she said. The government recently cut 12% GST on electric vehicles to 5%.

headlines: Bombay HC commutes rape convicts' death sentence to life
text: Bombay High Court on Monday commuted two rape convicts' death sentence to life imprisonment saying that there had been an unprecedented delay in executing them. They were convicted in 2012 for the rape and murder of a BPO employee in Pune in 2007. Their death warrant was issued for June 24 but stayed after hearing the convicts' petition last month.

headlines: Doctors, students stage protest against NMC Bill in Delhi
text: Doctors and medical students staged protests against National Medical Commission (NMC) Bill 2019 outside Delhi's Nirman Bhawan and AIIMS on Monday. The bill allows setting up an NMC in place of Medical Council of India (MCI). The President-elect of Indian Medical Association said if the Bill is not amended, 3.5 lakh community health providers will be legalised to prescribe drugs.

headlines: Suspected Islamists kill at least 65 in northeast Nigeria
text: At least 65 people died in an attack by suspected Islamists on a group returning from a funeral in Nigeria's northeastern Borno region. There was no immediate claim of responsibility, but the Boko Haram militant group often carries out attacks in the area. President Muhammadu Buhari condemned the attack.

headlines: RIL may sell its own retail brands via neighbourhood stores
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) is reportedly planning to hire distributors to sell its arm Reliance Retail's private-label brands via neighbourhood stores to boost its retail revenue. "RIL plans to hire fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) dealers on trial-basis...to help meet...delivery needs from online channels," reports said. The brands reportedly include Best Farms, Good Life, etc.

headlines: Colours By Kohler India Palette helps you reinvent your bath space
text: Kohler presents drama and delight to your bath space through the colour of the peacock. The Peacock vessel, rendered as a shade of teal, seeks to evoke an ethnic feel to give a vibrant look of the Indian iconic bird. Kohler's India Palette collection showcases shades which are globally trending yet rooted in the quintessential culture and ethos of India.

headlines: Louis Philippe unveils Permapress, wrinkle-free collection for men
text: Louis Philippe, India's leading menswear brand from Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd., unveils its clothing line for the contemporary man, the Permapress Collection. It is a celebration of re-imagined, pioneering designs rooted in functionality, versatility and style. The brand has launched this collection with a comprehensive campaign Stay Uncrushed that emphasizes on resilience and determination of a true leader.

headlines: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa wins trust vote
text: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa won the trust vote in the state Assembly on Monday. The BJP leader was sworn-in as Chief Minister last week after the Congress-JD(S) coalition government failed the floor test held on July 23. The Congress-JD(S) alliance had received 99 votes against the BJP's 105 in the floor test.

headlines: Karnataka Assembly Speaker resigns after BJP wins trust vote
text: Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Monday resigned from the post after the BS Yediyurappa-led BJP government won the trust vote. Earlier, reports said that BJP was planning to bring a no-confidence motion against Kumar, if he does not voluntarily vacate the post. Ramesh had on Sunday said that the current situation pushed him into "sea of depression".

headlines: 2 Delhi students killed, 3 injured in car crash after birthday party
text: Two students aged 18 and 20 were killed and three injured as their car crashed into a divider and uprooted an electric pole in East Delhi on Sunday. They had gone on a drive after a birthday party. "Except the driver, all...four occupants were flung outside. The woman who died landed on the road opposite the accident spot," said police.

headlines: Azam Khan apologises in LS over his remark on BJP MP Rama Devi
text: Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan on Monday apologised in Lok Sabha for his 'I feel like looking into your eyes' remark on BJP MP Rama Devi. Many female Members of Parliament, including Smriti Irani, Nirmala Sitharaman and Mimi Chakraborty had sought action against Khan over his remark. Rama Devi had said Khan has no right to stay in Lok Sabha.

headlines: Jayawardene-Sangakkara's record 624-run stand lasted 10 hours
text: Sri Lanka's Mahela Jayawardene and Kumar Sangakkara broke the record for the highest-ever partnership in Test history with their 624-run stand against South Africa on July 29, 2006. The partnership started when SL were 14/2 and saw Sangakkara scoring 287(457) and Jayawardene hitting a career-best 374(572). The duo batted for 10-plus hours through 157 overs across three days.

headlines: Don't know why I called Kartik overrated, he is brilliant: Badshah
text: Rapper Badshah, who had earlier called Kartik Aaryan an "overrated actor" on 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I don't know why I named him, maybe because we were talking about Kartik during the break." "It just came out but the fact is that he is a brilliant actor with a very good script sense," he added.

headlines: I wasn't as true to myself as I could've been: Cameron Bancroft
text: Australia batsman Cameron Bancroft, who served a nine-month ban after being involved in ball-tampering scandal, has said he wasn't as true to himself as he could've been. "One of the big lessons...I learned last year was about being true to yourself," he added. "I made a mistake...I'll learn from it and move forward and get better," he further said.

headlines: Tesla cars to soon support Netflix, YouTube streaming: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the company's cars will soon be able to stream videos from Netflix and YouTube when the car isn't moving. "When full self-driving is approved by regulators, we will enable video while moving," he added. Tesla has already unveiled games that drivers can play on the displays in their cars.

headlines: Byju's Founder Byju Raveendran India's newest billionaire: Bloomberg
text: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Byju's Founder and CEO Byju Raveendran, a 37-year-old former teacher, is India's newest billionaire, Bloomberg said on Monday. This comes after Byju's valuation hit $5.7 billion after raising $150 million in funding led by Qatar Investment Authority earlier this month, Bloomberg added. Byju Raveendran owns more than 21% of the startup, Bloomberg said quoting sources.

headlines: 6-yr-old dies in MP after friends pump air into him through rectum
text: A six-year-old boy from Indore, Madhya Pradesh died in hospital on Sunday after his friends allegedly pumped air into him by inserting a compressor into his rectum while playing, police said. The boy's father, who works in a factory, said two of his friends brought him home. "His stomach was swollen. I immediately took him to the hospital," he added.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor's accident a murder conspiracy: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has alleged that the truck hitting the Unnao rape survivor's car on Sunday, critically injuring her and her lawyer, could be a conspiracy to kill her. Her two aunts had died in the accident near UP's Raebareli. The woman had accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of raping her in 2017.

headlines: PM Modi features in Israeli PM's election campaign banners
text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud party has displayed election campaign banners featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Netanyahu's party also displayed banners featuring US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin. Israel will be holding snap polls on September 17 as lawmakers voted to dissolve parliament after Netanyahu failed to form a coalition government.

headlines: Forest cover increased by 16,000 sq km from 2014 to 2019: Javadekar
text: Union Minister of Environment, Forest and Climate Change Prakash Javadekar has said that forest cover has increased 8,000 sq km from 2015 to 2017 and between 2014 and 2019 it increased by about 16,000 sq km as seen from satellites. Javadekar added, "Sometimes permission is given to cut trees for development but if one tree is cut, 5-10 are planted."

headlines: Muslim boy claims being set on fire over 'Jai Shri Ram', police deny
text: The family of a 17-year-old boy named Khalid, from Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli, has alleged that he was set on fire by some people on refusing to chant 'Jai Sri Ram'. Chandauli's SP has however said he has given different statements which were found to be false in investigation and added that an eye witness saw him setting himself on fire.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor out of danger after car-truck collision
text: The Unnao woman, who levelled rape accusations against BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar, is out of danger after she was critically injured on Sunday in a car-truck collision. While both her aunts died in the collision, her lawyer remains critical. "We'll conduct a fair and free probe. Primary probe suggests it was purely an accident," UP DGP OP Singh said.

headlines: 20 killed in attack on Afghan vice presidential candidate's office
text: At least 20 people were killed and 50 injured in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Sunday in a suicide bombing and gun battle at vice presidential candidate Amrullah Saleh's office. Saleh, a running mate of Afghan President Ashraf Ghani, was slightly injured in the attack. Afghan forces killed three militants who entered Saleh's office after a suicide bomber blew himself up.

headlines: 3 killed in shooting at US food festival; suspect shot dead
text: At least three people were killed and several others were injured in a shooting at a food festival in US' California on Sunday. The suspect, who police said used a rifle and gained entry to the festival by cutting through a fence to avoid the tight security, has been shot dead. Some witnesses reported a second suspect.

headlines: Bale's move to Chinese club blocked by Real Madrid
text: Spanish club Real Madrid denied Gareth Bale a chance to play for China's Jiangsu Suning club after his move was blocked by the club administration as they decided that the fee was insufficient. Bale had joined Real Madrid from Tottenham in 2013 for a then world-record fee of £85 million and later went on to win four Champions League title.

headlines: We're building our team in India: US-Based Paymentwall's CEO
text: San Francisco-based payments company Paymentwall's Co-founder and CEO Honor Gunday said they are building their team in India to focus back on the market here and the team has been doing really well. Back in 2010, Gunday had helped Indian startups including Ibibo to process payments. Founded in 2010, Paymentwall allows people to make payments through over 150 methods globally.

headlines: Bihar court annuls marriage of man who was forced to wed at gunpoint
text: A court in Patna has provided relief to an engineer employed in Bokaro Steel Plant by annulling his forced marriage. The man revealed he was forced by his acquaintance to marry his sister in December 2017 when he had gone to attend his friend's marriage. He added that he faced a lot of mental pressure in the last two years.

headlines: Swimmer held in South Korea for sexually harassing 18-yr-old in club
text: Hungary's 22-year-old swimmer Tamas Kenderesi has been arrested on charges of sexually harassing an 18-year-old woman at a nightclub in South Korea's Gwangju. The police has said that the swimmer won't be allowed to leave the country for 10 days. The 22-year-old 2016 Olympic bronze medallist had finished last in the final of men's 200m butterfly event on Wednesday.

headlines: Global T20 Canada fixture delayed due to bomb threat
text: The Global T20 Canada league match between Montreal Tigers and Winnipeg Hawks in Brampton on Friday was delayed by 90 minutes due to a bomb threat. A suspicious package was left unattended at the venue after which the police closed the venue for inspection and even deployed bomb-sniffing dogs. The match was later reduced to 12-overs-a-side.

headlines: I would have held back Kohli to no. 4 spot in WC semi: Robin Singh
text: Ex-India all-rounder Robin Singh, who has applied for Team India's head coach job, has said that he would have held back Virat Kohli to the number four batting position. "I would've picked another top-order batsman, Mayank Agarwal, at number 3. MS Dhoni would've been number 5 and he would've got more time. Kohli and Dhoni could've batted together," he added.

headlines: Anil Kumble-led ICC committee to discuss boundary count rule
text: Anil Kumble-led ICC Cricket Committee will discuss the issues concerning 2019 World Cup final, including the boundary count back rule which decided the winner of the tournament. ICC's general manager of cricket Geoff Allardice said whether the rule should be different is something the committee will consider at some point. The committee will meet during the first quarter of 2020.

headlines: K'taka BJP MLAs to stay at Bengaluru hotel before floor test tomorrow
text: Karnataka BJP MLAs will spend the night at a hotel in Bengaluru, where they also had a legislative party meeting earlier today, ahead of the floor test in the Assembly on Monday. Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa has to prove majority in the Assembly, days after the Congress-JD(S) government lost the floor test after getting 99 votes against the BJP's 105.

headlines: Doctor faces probe for allegedly prescribing condom for stomach ache
text: A Jharkhand doctor employed on a contractual basis at the Ghatshila government hospital is facing probe for allegedly prescribing a condom to a woman who complained of stomach pain. The woman was told at a medical shop that the prescribed medicine was a condom. Based on her complaint, a medical team with a psychiatrist is probing the issue.

headlines: Stray cow enters IIT Bombay classroom during lecture, video viral
text: A video of a stray cow entering an IIT Bombay classroom and walking across it went viral. Reacting to it, a Twitter user wrote, "How did she enter without taking JEE?" Another tweet read, "It's lovely to see students standing out of respect for her!" This comes days after a student sustained injuries after being attacked by cattle on campus.

headlines: Unnao rape survivor critically injured after car collides with truck
text: The Unnao woman who accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of raping her was critically injured on Sunday when her car was hit by a truck. The victim's two aunts died in the accident, while her lawyer was also critically injured. The woman was on her way to meet her uncle in Rae Bareli jail.

headlines: 7 Class 3 students hospitalised as teacher beats them over word meaning
text: As many as seven Class 3 students in a government school in Odisha have been hospitalised after their teacher beat them up over their inability to pronounce and give correct meaning of a word. The teacher allegedly started beating the kids with hand and then with a stick. The woman teacher has been absconding since the matter came to light.

headlines: Congress demands probe into truck hitting Unnao rape survivor's car
text: The Congress party has demanded an investigation into a truck hitting Unnao rape survivor's car, killing three people on Sunday and critically injuring the woman and her lawyer. Uttar Pradesh Congress MLA Aradhana Misra said that the accident occurred under "suspicious circumstances". The Unnao woman had accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of raping her in 2017.

headlines: Vijay Mallya moves SC seeking stay on confiscation of properties
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya has moved the Supreme Court seeking a stay on the confiscation of properties owned by him and his relatives. In his plea, Mallya said only those properties related to Kingfisher Airlines facing cases of alleged irregularities should be confiscated. The matter is listed for hearing on July 29 before the apex court.

headlines: Kohli picks Dhoni, Jadeja in kabaddi team of Indian cricketers
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli on being asked to pick a kabaddi team comprising Indian cricketers, chose MS Dhoni and Ravindra Jadeja, asserting that the game needs lots of "strength and athleticism". He further included pacer Umesh Yadav, wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant and opener KL Rahul. He also picked Jasprit Bumrah, saying, "He can really work on a toe-touch."

headlines: Verstappen wins German GP after Hamilton, Bottas crash
text: Red Bull's Dutch driver Max Verstappen won Sunday's German Grand Prix after Lewis Hamilton hit the wall and then his teammate Valtteri Bottas' race ended after a crash on Mercedes' anniversary race. Sebastian Vettel grabbed the second spot after starting the race from the P20 position in the grid. Daniil Kvyat claimed Toro Rosso's second-ever podium by finishing third.

headlines: Manchester United have quality but no experience: Matic
text: Speaking about the current Manchester United squad, midfielder Nemanja Matic said, "Quality and experience bring you the title. In this squad, we have quality and no experience." "We have five or six top players, but they are still young like Marcus Rashford and Anthony Martial. They have shown their quality on the pitch but they are too young," Matic added.

headlines: Langer rates Bancroft high, he'll handle the boos: Ponting
text: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting revealed that team's head coach Justin Langer "talks highly" of Cameron Bancroft and this makes him believe that the 26-year-old batsman would be "fine" handling boos from the English crowd. "I think Justin's a pretty good assessor of people's character," Ponting added. Bancroft faced a nine-month ban for his part in the 2018 ball-tampering scandal.

headlines: Boycott strong word to use: Shooter Heena on 2022 CWG boycott plan
text: After Indian Olympic Association President Narinder Batra wrote to Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju urging him to boycott 2022 Commonwealth Games for excluding shooting, Indian shooter Heena Sidhu said boycott's a strong word to use. "We can't let others suffer for one sport," she added. "But...if we don't stand for shooting now, it could happen to some other sport," she added.

headlines: Ashes too close to call: Ex-Australian captain Steve Waugh
text: Former Australian captain Steve Waugh said that the upcoming Ashes series is too close to call. "Depth in the squad will be important but I honestly think if I was a betting man I wouldn't back either side because I don't know who's going to win... I think it's going to be a fantastic series," Waugh added about Ashes 2019.

headlines: Congress forged signs of its absent MLAs in MP Assembly: BJP
text: BJP on Sunday accused Congress of forging the signatures of eight to 12 of Congress MLAs during voting on a bill in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly alleging they were not present. Earlier, two BJP MLAs voted along with the Congress to amend the bill. Congress MLA Sanjay Yadav responded saying that 50 BJP MLAs were not present in the House.

headlines: Introspect why people are leaving NCP: Fadnavis to Pawar
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said that NCP President Sharad Pawar should introspect why his people are not ready to stay with the party. This comes a day after Pawar accused BJP of poaching Opposition leaders by misusing power and agencies. Earlier this week, NCP leaders Sachin Ahir and Chitra Kishor Wagh resigned from the party.

headlines: Hinduism being defamed in the name of mob lynching: RSS chief
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said there is a conspiracy to defame Hindu religion and culture in the name of mob lynching and cows. "As part of this conspiracy, conversion of religion is being done in some states," Bhagwat added. This comes days after 49 celebrities wrote an open letter to PM Modi over the mob lynching incidents across the country.

headlines: Surprised Opp'n objecting to Parliament using time to enact laws: BJP
text: BJP General Secretary Bhupender Yadav on Sunday said it's surprising that the Opposition is objecting to Parliament utilising more of its time to enact laws. It's difficult to understand if Parliament has performed better, brought more laws and made more required changes, Yadav added. Seventeen Opposition parties had written to Rajya Sabha Chairman claiming bills were passed without any scrutiny.

headlines: President Kovind becomes 1st Indian head of state to visit Benin
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday arrived in Benin on the first leg of his three nations' tour to the West African region, becoming the first Indian head of state to visit the country. Kovind was received at the airport by Benin's Foreign Minister Aurelien Agbenonci. Kovind's talks with Beninese President Patrice Talon will be held on Monday.

headlines: 2 Gujarat policemen suspended over TikTok video with PCR van
text: Two police constables were suspended for sharing a TikTok video with a Police Control Room (PCR) van while on duty in Gujarat's Rajkot, officials said on Sunday. A former traffic warden posed on the van driven by a constable while another constable recorded the video from afar, officials added. The video was reportedly shot a month and a half ago.

headlines: Namaz shouldn't cause inconvenience to others: AIMPLB member
text: All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) member Khalid Rasheed Farangi Mahli on Sunday said, "Namaz is a prayer before Allah. It's not right to offer...prayer by causing inconvenience to anyone." He said that namaz on roads was not a daily affair and seen only on Friday. "Namazis should make...extra effort to reach the mosque in time," Mahli added.

headlines: Iran to restart activities at Arak heavy water nuclear reactor
text: The head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation, Ali Akbar Salehi, has told lawmakers that the country will restart activities at the Arak heavy water nuclear reactor, the ISNA news agency reported. Heavy water can be employed in reactors to produce plutonium, a fuel used in nuclear warheads. Iran stopped complying in May with some commitments in the 2015 nuclear deal.

headlines: I know someone who wrote initials on hotel TV with pin: Gul Panag
text: Actress Gul Panag has tweeted she's "shocked but not surprised" over video of an Indian family stealing hairdryers and hangers from a Bali hotel. "I know someone, (crew) who'd write his initials on the TV. With a safety pin," she tweeted. She also tweeted that a premium Delhi hotel's suite had to be refurbished after a celebrity partied there.

headlines: See a psychiatrist: Javed to Shekhar over 'I am refugee' tweet
text: Lyricist Javed Akhtar has criticised filmmaker Shekhar Kapur after the latter stated in a tweet that he's "still a refugee" and "fears intellectuals" as their embrace is like a "bite of snake". Adding that Shekhar should see a "good psychiatrist", Akhtar said, "If in India you are still a refugee where will you not feel like a refugee, in Pakistan?"

headlines: Chinmayi criticises Bigg Boss Tamil as contestant admits to molesting
text: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada has criticised Bigg Boss Tamil after a contestant said that he used to take buses to grope women. "A Tamil channel aired a man proudly proclaiming [this] to cheers from the audience. And this is a joke," she tweeted. Host Kamal Haasan was also seen laughing but his spokesperson said the actor was being sarcastic.

headlines: It was my dream to play WC, was difficult to not be picked: Iyer
text: Batsman Shreyas Iyer, who has been selected in India's ODI and T20I squads for West Indies tour, has revealed it was difficult for him to not get selected in India's World Cup squad. "It was my dream to play the World Cup for my country," he further said. "I just kept myself positive and always in high spirits," he added.

headlines: BCCI confirms Kohli to hold press conference on Monday, shares details
text: The BCCI has confirmed that Virat Kohli will hold a pre-departure press conference before leaving for West Indies tour. The BCCI stated Kohli will address the press conference at Mumbai's ITC Maratha at 6 PM on Monday. This comes after several reports stated that Kohli had decided against holding the press conference amid rumours of his rift with Rohit Sharma.

headlines: Will go to SC against disqualification: Rebel JD(S) MLA Vishwanath
text: Rebel Janata Dal (Secular) MLA AH Vishwanath, who was disqualified by the Karnataka Speaker on Sunday, said the decision was "against the law", adding he and other disqualified MLAs would approach the Supreme Court for redressal on Monday. Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar disqualified 17 rebel MLAs under the anti-defection law till the end of the current term of the House.

headlines: Jack Ma's 3-min loan platform lends $290bn to 1.6cr small China firms
text: Chinese billionaire and Alibaba Group's Co-founder Jack Ma's four-year-old online private commercial bank 'MYbank' has lent $290 billion to nearly 1.6 crore small companies, Bloomberg reported. The platform allows borrowers to apply for a loan with a few taps on a smartphone and receive cash almost instantly if approved. The entire process takes three minutes and involves zero human bankers.

headlines: Woman dies after falling from upper berth of Mumbai-Bengaluru train
text: A 40-year-old woman died within a couple of hours after she slipped while getting down from the upper berth of an AC coach of Mumbai-Bengaluru Udyan Express on July 22. She fell before the train was about to enter the Krantivira Sangolli Rayanna (Bengaluru City) station. She died on the way to hospital after a primary checkup at a clinic.

headlines: BJP to hold training programme for all its MPs including PM Modi
text: The BJP will organise a two-day training programme for all its MPs, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, on August 3 and 4. The party's parliamentary office asked all BJP MPs to make sure that they attend the 'Abhyas Varga' in Delhi. PM Modi and Shah will reportedly brief the MPs on several relevant issues.

headlines: In grief: Sonia Gandhi writes to late Cong leader Jaipal Reddy's wife
text: UPA Chairperson and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi has written a condolence letter to Lakshmi Reddy, wife of senior leader and former Union Minister S Jaipal Reddy who passed away on Sunday. "A trusted colleague and respected senior leader of our party, his untimely death leaves a void that can never be filled," read the letter with the valediction 'In grief'.

headlines: Meghalaya Speaker & former CM Donkupar Roy passes away at 64
text: Meghalaya Assembly Speaker and former Chief Minister Donkupar Roy passed away at the age of 64 on Sunday. Roy was admitted to a hospital in Haryana's Gurugram since July 18 over a stomach-related complication. Roy's body will be flown back to Meghalaya by Monday for the last rites. Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to express his condolences.

headlines: I can play a big part in 2019 Ashes: Australia pacer Siddle
text: Talking ahead of 2019 Ashes which commences on Thursday, Australia pacer Peter Siddle said, "I think I can play a big part in this series." The 34-year-old, who has taken 214 wickets in 64 Tests, added, "I'm definitely bowling a lot better...in these [English] conditions." Siddle further said that playing with English county side Essex helped him learn a lot.

headlines: Stokes is natural leader: Former English player Ashley Giles
text: Former England cricketer and current ECB head Ashley Giles said on Saturday that Ben Stokes is a natural leader and will support skipper Joe Root in the upcoming Ashes series. Stokes has been appointed as the vice-captain of the English cricket team which will play against Australia in the Ashes beginning next month.

headlines: Carey is going to be Australias next wicket-keeper: Wade
text: Australian cricketer Matthew Wade has said that according to him Alex Carey is going to be the Australian cricket team's next wicket-keeper. Wade, who hasn't played international cricket since October 2017, said, "I see myself as a batter on this [Ashes] tour and if there is an opportunity to bat at five or six, wherever it is, I am comfortable."

headlines: PL's youngest debutant Elliott joins Liverpool
text: Liverpool have completed the signing of 16-year-old winger Harvey Elliott from Fulham. Elliott made his debut in the 3-1 League Cup win over Millwall in September aged 15 before going on to become the Premier League's youngest debutant when he played against the Wolves in May at the age of 16 years and 30 days.

headlines: Inter Milan beat Neymar-less PSG on penalties
text: Italian side Inter Milan defeated Paris Saint-Germain on penalties in a pre-season friendly match between the sides in Macau on Saturday. Inter Milan goalkeeper Samir Handanovic saved Adil Aouchiche's penalty kick before saving Arthur Zagre's in the shootout after a 1-1 draw. Inter's win comes days after their loss to Italian rivals Juventus on penalties in a friendly in China.

headlines: Cong, JD(S) praise Speaker's decision to disqualify 14 rebel MLAs
text: Following Karnataka Assembly Speaker's decision to disqualify the 14 rebel MLAs, Congress leader Siddaramaiah took to Twitter to say, "This...will send strong signals for all the representatives in the country who might fall for [BJP's] trap." The handle of JD(S) tweeted, "This should be a lesson for all greedy & selfish politicians. Acting against the Constitution...comes with a price."

headlines: NIA raids 4 places in J&K's Baramulla in terror funding case
text: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Sunday conducted raids at four places in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla in connection with a terror funding case. The raids were reportedly carried out at the residences of four businessmen engaged in cross-border trade. The NIA officers were accompanied by the state police as well as CRPF troops.

headlines: 13,187 died in Uttarakhand govt hospital in 9 yrs: RTI reply
text: An RTI reply has revealed that 13,187 patients have died in Uttarakhand's Dr Susheela Tiwari Memorial Forest Hospital in the last nine years. "People are afraid to get treatment in this hospital," said RTI activist Hemant Gauniya. A doctor from the hospital said the mortality rate is high as terminally ill patients from other hospitals are referred there.

headlines: Jio overtakes Vodafone Idea as largest Indian telco by users
text: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Jio has overtaken Vodafone Idea to become India's largest telecom operator by subscribers in the June quarter. While Vodafone Idea had 320 million subscribers in the quarter from the previous quarter's 334.1 million, Jio's subscriber base grew to 331.3 million. Jio had in May surpassed Bharti Airtel to become the country's second-largest operator by users.

headlines: Goal to be $5-trillion economy by 2024-25 definitely achievable: CEA
text: India's target to be a $5-trillion economy by 2024-25 is "definitely achievable", said Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) Krishnamurthy Subramanian, adding that there's ambition involved. He said, "If the target's too small then there'll be no motivation to achieve it." The Economic Survey 2018-19, presented by Subramanian, had stated a sustained 8% GDP growth rate is needed for the $5-trillion goal.

headlines: Amused by people's creativity: Anil Kapoor on his FaceApp memes
text: Speaking about the FaceApp memes on him, Anil Kapoor said, "I'm so amused and entertained by people's creativity!" He added, "Just when I think they would've run out of memes to make about me, they surprise me with yet another hilarious take!" "It's quite flattering and humbling honestly. I'm happy that I'm able to entertain...people of all ages," said Anil.

headlines: Pak Army spokesperson posts doctored video of retd IAF Air Marshal
text: Pakistan Army spokesperson Asif Ghafoor shared a doctored video of retired IAF Air Marshal Denzil Keelor on Twitter. Ghafoor claimed that the video was shot in February this year and that it showed Keelor talking about India's failures during Balakot strike. Ghafoor later admitted that the video he shared was doctored, saying, "Admission and expression were too identical to differentiate."

headlines: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella name their newborn son Arik
text: Actor Arjun Rampal took to Instagram to reveal that he and his girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades have named their newborn son Arik. "That gracious thing made of tears, of happiness, gratitude and light. A rainbow appeared into our lives. So blessed we feel, gratitude and abundance of joy. Welcome junior Rampal, into our lives," he wrote while sharing a picture.

headlines: I've a family to answer to: Urvashi on reports calling Hardik her ex
text: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to her Instagram Story to share the screenshot of a video titled 'Urvashi Rautela seeks help of ex-boyfriend', featuring her and all-rounder Hardik Pandya's photos. "I would humbly request respective media channels on @youtube to stop uploading such ridiculous videos as I have a family to answer [to] and it creates problems for me," she wrote.

headlines: Cong, NCP leaders ready to join BJP, few will be included: Fadnavis
text: Responding to NCP chief Sharad Pawar's claim that BJP was poaching leaders from Opposition parties by misusing power and agencies, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said, "Many Congress and NCP leaders are ready to join BJP but a few chosen ones will be inducted." Fadnavis added BJP won't induct those leaders who are being probed by Enforcement Directorate or other agencies.

headlines: Lack of clarity at the top hurting Congress: Shashi Tharoor
text: Shashi Tharoor has said "lack of clarity" over leadership following Rahul Gandhi's resignation is hurting the Congress. He added that the way forward for Congress could be opening up all key posts, including the CWC membership, to fresh elections which would help legitimise the incoming set of leaders. Tharoor further said he hopes Priyanka Gandhi will contest for party presidency.

headlines: Is it sex when a mother kisses her son: Ex-Bihar CM on Azam's remark
text: Former Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi has reacted to Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan's alleged sexist remarks on BJP MP Rama Devi. He questioned, "When...brother and sister meet, they kiss. Does it equal sex? A mother kisses her son and the son kisses his mother. Is that sex?" "Azam Khan's statement is misinterpreted...He should apologise but not resign," he added.

headlines: Baggage container hits parked Vistara plane amid strong winds in Mumbai
text: An empty baggage container of another airline rolled off and hit the starboard side of one of Vistara airline's planes' engine due to strong winds in Mumbai on Saturday. Vistara spokesperson said that no passengers or crew were on the plane when the incident took place. The aircraft will be grounded for some time for repair work, the spokesperson added.

headlines: K'taka Speaker breaks down recalling late Cong leader Jaipal Reddy
text: Karnataka Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Sunday broke down while recalling veteran Congress leader S Jaipal Reddy, who passed away at the age of 77 earlier today. "Jaipal Reddy has been my mentor and was personally very close to me. I considered him as my elder brother...He was an outstanding parliamentarian. It is a sad day for me," said Kumar.

headlines: Rahim 3rd Bangladeshi batsman to cross 6,000 ODI runs
text: Mushfiqur Rahim became the third Bangladeshi batsman behind Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan to cross 6,000 runs in ODI cricket after he went past the landmark figure in the second ODI against Sri Lanka on Sunday. Rahim, who reached the landmark in his 201st innings, was quicker than the likes of Tillakaratne Dilshan, Sanath Jayasuriya, and Steve Waugh.

headlines: Yuvraj hits Pak's Shadab for a flat six in GT20 Canada
text: Former Indian team batsman Yuvraj Singh hit Pakistan spinner Shadab Khan for a flat six in his 21-ball 35 for the Toronto Nationals in the GT20 League in Canada. The Nationals' captain and South Africa's Heinrich Klaasen put together a 56-run stand for the third wicket to help their side chase down the target set by the Edmonton Royals.

headlines: We'll back IOA's decision to snub 2022 CWG: Rifle Association
text: A day after Indian Olympic Association (IOA) proposed a boycott of the 2022 Birmingham Commonwealth Games for dropping shooting from the roster, National Rifle Association (NRAI) said, "We are with IOA." NRAI added, "We are a part of the IOA so whatever action IOA is taking, we have to back them." Shooters are losing a big opportunity, NRAI further stated.

headlines: Launch of Chandrayaan-2 taught me fearlessness, faith: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing his monthly 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme, said that ISRO's Chandrayaan-2 mission taught him "fearlessness and faith". Lauding its successful launch, he added, "Chandrayaan-2 is thoroughly Indian at heart and in spirit." He further said that he "fervently" hopes that the Chandrayaan-2 mission will inspire the youth towards science and innovation.

headlines: Touching Article 35A is like playing with explosives: Mufti
text: PDP supremo Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday warned the Centre against meddling with Article 35A saying it would be equivalent to playing with explosives. "If any hand tries to touch Article 35A, not only that hand, but that entire body will burn to ashes," Mufti said. Earlier, Mufti had criticised Centre's move to deploy 10,000 additional troops in Jammu and Kashmir.

headlines: 100% sure I will prove my majority: Karnataka CM Yediyurappa
text: A day ahead of seeking the trust vote in Karnataka, CM BS Yediyurappa said that he's 100% confident that he'll prove his majority in the Assembly. He added, after that he'll table the Finance Bill (appropriation bill), prepared by previous Congress-JD(S) government, in the Assembly. He said the bill needs to be passed "urgently" to draw funds to pay salaries.

headlines: Naidu pays last tributes to veteran Cong leader Jaipal Reddy
text: Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu visited the residence of veteran Congress leader Jaipal Reddy and paid his last tributes to the former Union Minister who passed away aged 77 on Sunday. Several politicians, including PM Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind, also condoled the death of Reddy. The President said Reddy was a thinking person's politician and an outstanding Parliamentarian.

headlines: Flipkart makes offline foray with a furniture experience centre
text: Flipkart has launched a furniture experience centre in Bengaluru, marking its first foray into the offline business. Spread across 1,800 square feet, it displays the furniture selection offered along with creating awareness around buying and installation, Flipkart said. "Customers like to see and touch the furniture they're buying," said Adarsh Menon, VP of furniture, electronics and private labels at Flipkart.

headlines: Youth beaten to death over alleged affair; 4 arrested
text: Four persons were arrested on Saturday for beating a 17-year-old youth to death over his alleged affair with a tribal girl in Gujarat. The deceased, identified as Faiz, was reportedly beaten up by 10-12 boys with sticks and pipes when he was out with his friends. A search is on to nab the rest of the accused, police said.

headlines: 7 Tamil Nadu fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy
text: The Sri Lankan naval personnel on Sunday arrested seven Tamil Nadu fishermen off Neduntheevu for allegedly fishing in the island nation's territorial waters, officials said. The fishermen, however, claimed that they had crossed the International Maritime Boundary Line due to strong winds and rough seas. The officials added that the Sri Lankan Navy has also seized their boat.

headlines: European naval mission in Gulf would send hostile message: Iran
text: Iran has said that the proposal to form a European coalition to escort tankers through the Persian Gulf would send a hostile message. France, Italy and Denmark reportedly gave initial support for the British plan to ensure safe shipping. The plan was proposed after Iran's seizure of a British-flagged tanker in response to seizure of an Iranian tanker by UK.

headlines: No review on plan to issue overseas sovereign bonds, says FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, in an interview to Economic Times, denied reports that she has been officially asked to reassess the government's plan to raise money via foreign-currency overseas sovereign bonds. "I'm not doing any review," she said. Earlier, reports claimed the PMO asked for the plan to be restudied for risks and Centre may instead issue rupee-denominated offshore bonds.

headlines: NZ rugby team trolls ICC after their match against SA ends in a draw
text: New Zealand's rugby team, All Blacks, trolled ICC after their match against South Africa ended in a 16-16 draw. "No count back on boundaries in Wellington. It's a draw. Thanks for an epic Test," All Blacks tweeted. This comes after New Zealand's cricket team lost 2019 World Cup final against England on boundary count after tied match and Super Over.

headlines: K'taka Assembly Speaker disqualifies 14 Congress-JD(S) rebel MLAs
text: Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Sunday said that he has disqualified 14 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs. This comes a day before Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa faces a trust vote in the Assembly. BJP's Yediyurappa was sworn-in as the CM after the Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the floor test on July 23, receiving 99 votes against the BJP's 105.

headlines: Pak actor says Mahira is 'overaged' and should play mother; criticised
text: Pakistani actor Firdous Jamal has been criticised for his alleged sexist remarks on actress Mahira Khan on a talk show. "She has no skills of being a heroine...Mahira is overaged and actresses of her age usually play the role of mothers," said Firdous. Reacting to this, actress Mawra Hocane tweeted, "Disrespectful remarks in the garb of opinions need to STOP."

headlines: Russi Taylor, voice of Minnie Mouse for 30 years, passes away aged 75
text: Russi Taylor, the voice actress behind the Disney character Minnie Mouse passed away on Friday in California aged 75. "For more than 30 years, Minnie and Russi worked together to entertain millions around the world," Disney chairman and CEO Bob Iger said. She had also voiced Donald Duck's nephews, Huey, Dewey and Louie in the 'Ducktales' animated series.

headlines: One doesn't have to beg for money in Hollywood: Radhika Apte
text: Actress Radhika Apte, while speaking about the difference between working in Bollywood and Hollywood, said, "They (Hollywood) pay you on time. You don't have to beg them for money." She added that people in Hollywood are also very punctual. The actress will be seen in an upcoming Hollywood project titled 'Liberté: A Call to Spy'.

headlines: Kohli to skip WI tour presser amid rumours of rift with Rohit: Reports
text: India captain Virat Kohli has decided against holding a customary press conference before leaving for the tour of West Indies amid the rumours of rift between him and Rohit Sharma, as per reports. Kohli will reportedly attend a promotional event on Monday but won't take any questions from media before boarding the flight with the team later in the day.

headlines: India is a huge part of the future for WhatsApp: Global Head
text: WhatsApp Global Head Will Cathcart said that India is WhatsApp's "most important" market and a "huge part of the future for WhatsApp". "One of the amazing things I've been seeing here in India is just how WhatsApp has become a way of people doing business," he said. He added that he's working with the Indian government to launch WhatsApp Payments.

headlines: My son was never peaceful as Karnataka CM, he cried: Gowda
text: After the HD Kumaraswamy-led government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, JD(S) patriarch Deve Gowda said that his son was "never peaceful" as the CM and had "cried for 15 minutes sitting in JP Bhavan". He added, "I've no issues with the JD(S)-Congress government losing power." Meanwhile, on Monday, CM BS Yediyurappa will hold confidence vote in the state Assembly.

headlines: Tesla cars may come to India in 2020: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told IIT Madras students that Tesla cars may come to India in a year's time. IIT Madras students' 'Avishkar Hyperloop' team, a SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition 2019 finalist, met Musk at SpaceX headquarters in the US earlier this month. "Would love to be there this year. If not, definitely next! India," Musk had tweeted in March.

headlines: Agra judge forces constable to take off uniform in court; transferred
text: The Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate of Agra was transferred on Saturday, a day after forcing a 58-year-old constable to take off his uniform in a packed courtroom. The judge allegedly made the policeman do this as a punishment for not giving a pass to his vehicle. The constable reportedly broke down after the incident and also applied for voluntary retirement.

headlines: N Korea releases detained Russian fishing boat carrying 17
text: North Korea has released a Russian fishing boat held after being accused of violating entry regulations, the Russian embassy in North Korea said on Sunday. There were 17 people including 15 Russians and 2 South Koreans on the boat which was detained on July 17. The detention prompted a Russian warning of freezing talks on fisheries cooperation.

headlines: Trump calls mostly-black US district 'rat infested mess'
text: While tweeting about Democratic lawmaker Elijah Cummings, US President Donald Trump said, "Why is so much money sent to the Elijah Cummings district (Baltimore) when it is considered the worst run and most dangerous." Trump called Baltimore a "disgusting, rat and rodent infested mess". Cummings had criticised the treatment of migrants at the US-Mexico border.

headlines: Will continue to admire you: Bumrah on Malinga
text: Praising his Mumbai Indians teammate and Sri Lankan international pacer Lasith Malinga, Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah wrote, "[T]hank you for everything you've done for cricket. Always admired you and will always continue to do so". Bumrah also praised Malinga's figures of 3/38 in his final ODI match, terming it as a 'Classic Mali spell'.

headlines: Arthur should make way for others to take Pak forward: Qadir
text: Former Pakistani cricketer Abdul Qadir said that the Pakistani team's current coach Mickey Arthur should make way for others to take Pakistan cricket forward. "[Arthur] has damaged it with his clear bias towards some players including Sohail Khan, Kamran Akmal, Umar Akmal, Ahmed Shehzad... [w]ho could have done a lot for the Pakistan team," Qadir added.

headlines: WhatsApp desktop version may soon work without internet on phone
text: WhatsApp is reportedly working on a desktop version to allow users to use it on a computer without having to connect phones to the internet. WhatsApp Web was launched in 2015, which requires phones to be connected to the internet. The platform is also reportedly working to let users login on more than one device with the same account.

headlines: People of J&K prefer development over bombs: PM in Mann Ki Baat
text: Addressing his monthly 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme, PM Narendra Modi said that people of Jammu and Kashmir prefer "development over bombs". Citing a recent Community Mobilisation Programme - 'Back To Village', held in June in the state, he added that J&K people want "good governance". He said, 'Back To Village' saw villagers' enthusiastic participation from sensitive and remote villages.

headlines: Cong gives financial aid to families of those killed in Sonbhadra
text: Congress leaders on Saturday handed over compensation cheques to the families of those killed in a clash over a land dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra. "They must realise that they're not alone, people are with them," Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tweeted. At least ten people were killed in a gunfight over a property dispute at a village in Sonbhadra.

headlines: Mamata has vision, power to implement decisions: Guv KN Tripathi
text: Outgoing West Bengal Governor Keshari Nath Tripathi on Saturday said that CM Mamata Banerjee has got vision and has the power to implement her decisions. Tripathi's comment came after some reports claimed him saying that the appeasement policy followed by Mamata was affecting social harmony in the state. Tripathi further said, "It is a misrepresentation of what I said."

headlines: BJP poaching Opposition leaders by misusing power: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) President Sharad Pawar alleged that the BJP was poaching leaders from Opposition parties by "misusing power" and agencies. He further expressed confidence that the people will give a befitting reply to the BJP in the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly polls. His comment came after NCP leaders Sachin Ahir and Chitra Kishor Wagh resigned from the party.

headlines: Not in our civilisation to disrespect women: Naidu on Azam's remark
text: Expressing concern over Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's remark on BJP MP Rama Devi, Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu said that disrespecting women is not in our civilisation. He added, "This kind of behaviour and comments in Parliament and other legislatures demean our parliamentary democracy and should be avoided." He said members of the House have rightly voiced outrage over the remark.

headlines: 3-year-old girl raped in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur: Police
text: A three-year-old girl was raped by a young man in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, police said. A police official said that the girl had come to visit her maternal village and the accused was visiting a relative in the village. He added that a police force had been deployed in the area because the incident had sparked outrage.

headlines: India will never compromise its data sovereignty: Prasad
text: Addressing an event, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Saturday said that the country will "never compromise its data sovereignty". He added that the government will make efforts to make the country one of the world's largest centre of data analysis. He further said, "Work is in progress on our data protection law, we'll make a robust data protection law."

headlines: Taliban rejects direct talks with Afghan government
text: The Taliban militant group on Sunday said it will not hold direct talks with Afghan government. "Intra-Afghan talks will start only after a foreign force withdrawal is announced," said Suhail Shaheen, a spokesman for the Taliban's political office in Qatar. This comes after a Afghan minister said that talks with the Taliban will be held "in the coming two weeks".

headlines: Mexico to help create 20,000 jobs in Honduras to curb migration
text: Mexico has said it would help Honduras create 20,000 jobs this year as the two countries seek to curb migration to the US. US President Donald Trump had issued economic threats against Mexico and Central America if more is not done to curb migration. Most people caught trying to enter the US illegally come from Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador.

headlines: Veteran Congress leader Jaipal Reddy passes away aged 77
text: Former Union Minister and senior Congress leader Jaipal Reddy passed away on Sunday aged 77 at a private hospital in Hyderabad after suffering from pneumonia. He served as Information and Broadcasting Minister in the IK Gujral government, and was the Urban Development Minister and later served as the Petroleum Minister in Manmohan Singh's government.

headlines: 1st player to hit 6 sixes in 1 over was born with 12 fingers
text: Former Windies' cricketer Garry Sobers, the first professional cricketer to score six sixes in an over, was born with six fingers on each hand. Sobers had played his first colonial game with 11 fingers, after one of the spare fingers was removed before he was nine. The other spare finger was removed with a sharp knife when he was 14.

headlines: 'Golden Baba' attends 26th Kanwar Yatra in UP wearing 16 kg of gold
text: Sudhir Makkar, also known as 'Golden Baba', participated in the 26th Kanwar Yatra this year in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut wearing 16 kilograms of gold ornaments. He reduced four kilograms of gold this year citing his poor health. "Initially I used to wear 2-3 grams of gold ornaments but today I wear kilos of gold ornaments," he said.

headlines: ICC defends umpire Dharmasena's call to award England 6 overthrows
text: The ICC on Saturday defended umpire Kumar Dharmasena for deciding to award six overthrow runs instead of five to England in the last over of 2019 World Cup final. The ICC said that "right process" was followed while making the decision. It added that the playing conditions did not allow the third umpire or match referee to intervene.

headlines: It was his time to pay back to Pakistan: Akhtar on Amir's retirement
text: Following fast bowler Mohammad Amir's retirement from Test cricket at the age of 27, former fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said that Amir's retirement could set a bad precedent. "It was time for Amir to pay back Pakistan. In a time where Pakistan's run in Test matches is so poor, Amir was needed to deliver for his side," he added.

headlines: To survive in cricket, be a match-winner: Malinga tells youngsters
text: Lasith Malinga, who retired from ODIs on Friday, advised youngsters to be match-winners to survive in cricket. "My captains expect me to take wickets. I tried my best all through my career. I hope all the young bowlers do this as well," he added. "I've to move on because we have to build for 2023 World Cup," he further said.

headlines: Got to be kidding: Mark Waugh on Carey's omission from Ashes squad
text: After wicketkeeper Alex Carey failed to make the cut in Australia's Ashes squad, ex-Australia batsman Mark Waugh tweeted, "Got to be kidding." "For me Alex missing the squad is the biggest shock particularly after his batting during the World Cup and being the second-best gloveman," he added. Meanwhile, Shane Warne said, "Very surprised/disappointed that Carey didn't make the Aussie squad."

headlines: Baseless: Kumaraswamy on reports claiming JD(S) would support BJP
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has said that reports claiming that his party JD(S) would extend support to BJP are "baseless". "Lawmakers and party workers should not pay heed to any of these rumours. It is far from the truth," he added. "We will continue our fight for the people and the fight will go on," he further said.

headlines: Used SpaceX Dragon capsule reaches ISS for record 3rd time
text: NASA has revealed Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX's Dragon cargo spacecraft has been successfully installed on the Earth-facing side of the International Space Station's (ISS) Harmony module. This was SpaceX's 18th resupply mission for NASA, where the Dragon spacecraft was reused for a record third time. It had earlier also flown to the ISS in December 2017 and April 2015.

headlines: Chemist who co-invented JUUL launches own e-cigarettes in China
text: Xing Chenyue, the chemist who had co-invented JUUL e-cigarettes and developed nicotine salts e-liquid formulation for JUUL pods, has launched her own e-cigarette product in China. "JUUL's technology is now three years old. I don't think it's made any other innovation on the liquid formulation since they launched," Xing said. She had co-founded the startup Myst Labs in 2017.

headlines: First batch of 4 Apache helicopters arrive in India from US
text: US aerospace company Boeing handed over the first batch of four AH-64E Apache helicopters to the Indian Air Force at the Air Force Station Hindan on Saturday. An additional four Apache helicopters will arrive next week and all eight will be formally inducted into the IAF in September. India had placed an order for 22 AH-64E Apache helicopters in 2015.

headlines: Agarwal made just 6% profit on $4.3 bn Anglo investment: Reuters
text: Mining mogul Anil Agarwal made just 6% profit from his $4.3 billion investment in Anglo American, held since 2017, even though underlying shares rose over 50% since then, according to Reuters estimates. Agarwal's Volcan Investments had borrowed the amount to fund the acquisition. After accounting for interest payments and investment banking fees, Volcan's profit would have been $243-265 million.

headlines: Boxer Ashish wins gold, India bag 8 medals at Thailand Open
text: Asian Championships silver-medallist boxer Ashish Kumar won the first gold medal of his international career at the Thailand Open in Bangkok on Saturday. Ashish won the gold after defeating Korea's Kim Jinjae 5-0 in the 75 kg category. The Indian contingent ended the tournament with one gold, four silver and three bronze.

headlines: J&K political problem, won't be solved by military means: Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Saturday tweeted that problem of Jammu and Kashmir is political and couldn't be solved by military means. This comes after the government deployed 10,000 additional paramilitary troops in the state 'for maintaining law and order'. "Centre's decision...has created fear psychosis amongst people. There is no dearth of security forces in Kashmir," Mufti wrote.

headlines: Mumbai-Goa national highway shut following heavy rains
text: Mumbai-Goa national highway has been shut for traffic since Saturday due to flood in the Jagbudi river in Maharashtra's Ratnagiri following heavy rains, police said. According to an official, the river water gushed on the highway in the morning. Torrential rains since Friday night have triggered a flood-like situation in some parts of Thane, Raigad and Ratnagiri districts.

headlines: Indian family caught stealing hangers, hair dryers from Bali hotel
text: A video of an Indian family being busted by the staff of a hotel in Bali, Indonesia, for stealing items including hangers, hair dryers, containers and lotions, etc from their rooms, has gone viral. The staff opened their bags and confronted the family. The family pleaded the staff not to call the police and offered to pay for those items.

headlines: Apple contractors for Siri hear couples' sex recordings: The Guardian
text: Apple contractors working for Siri regularly hear recordings of drug deals, confidential medical details and couples having sex for quality control, The Guardian reported. "A small portion of Siri requests are analysed to improve Siri and dictation," Apple said. The contractors check whether Siri was activated deliberately or accidentally, whether the response was appropriate, among other things.

headlines: Was in excruciating pain, couldn't do it without painkillers: Archer
text: England pacer Jofra Archer has revealed he was in "excruciating" pain after sustaining a side strain during the second half of the 2019 World Cup. "It was pretty bad. I couldn't do it without painkillers," he added. "I couldn't get a week's rest...because of how close the games were. I only ever needed a week to 10 days," he added.

headlines: Kidnapper stripped me, forced me to drink at knifepoint: Athlete
text: Austrian cycling champion Nathalie Birli, who was hit by a van and kidnapped while out training, survived after complimenting her kidnapper on his orchids. The 27-year-old revealed the kidnapper stripped her and forced her to drink at knifepoint in an old house. She added the attacker beat her with a stick and bound her hands with duct tape before kidnapping.

headlines: Chandigarh gets BCCI affiliation after nearly 40 years
text: Chandigarh on Friday received affiliation from the BCCI after nearly 40 years. Union Territory Cricket Association (UTCA) president Sanjay Tandon said that the association was registered in 1982 and since then various attempts were made to get the affiliation from BCCI. "Today, the dream of a child who wanted to play from Chandigarh has been fulfilled," he further said.

headlines: Facebook Co-founder Hughes lobbying to break it up: Reports
text: Facebook Co-founder Chris Hughes is lobbying with US government officials and regulators in an attempt to break up the social network, as per reports. "[Mark Zuckerberg's] power is unprecedented and un-American," Hughes had said when he first called for a break-up in May. Hughes, who left Facebook in 2007, had said he feels responsible for Facebook's impact on society.

headlines: India asks Iran to free remaining crew on tanker after 9 released
text: India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has urged Iran to free the three remaining crew members on board the seized Panama-flagged tanker after it released nine others on Thursday. Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps had seized the oil tanker earlier this month, claiming it was carrying one million litres of smuggled fuel.

headlines: Plates, furniture used as weapons in mass brawl on cruise ship
text: Plates and furniture were used as weapons in a mass brawl on a British cruise ship after a group took offence at another passenger dressed as a clown, a journalist who was on board said. The group had specifically booked a cruise ship with no fancy dress, a witness told the journalist. Six people were injured in the brawl.

headlines: India's Venezuelan June oil imports highest in 21 months: Reuters
text: India's oil imports from Venezuela surged to about 475,200 barrels per day (bpd) in June, the highest in 21 months, according to Reuters data. Private refiners Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, part-owned by Russia's Rosneft, are the only Indian buyers of Venezuelan oil. These companies had a term deal to buy oil from Venezuela, which predated US sanctions in January.

headlines: Trump says US could tax French wine in retaliation for digital tax
text: US President Donald Trump has threatened to tax French wines in retaliation for France's recent proposal to levy a tax aimed at large US technology companies. "I've always said American wine is better than French wine!" Trump tweeted. France urged the US not to bring trade tariffs into the debate on "fair taxation of digital activities".

headlines: Govt proposes 2 fitness tests in a yr for vehicles older than 15 yrs
text: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has proposed the renewal of fitness certificates every six months for vehicles older than 15 years instead of the current one year. Further, it also proposed exemption of registration fees for buyers of vehicles if a scrapping certificate of a vehicle, belonging to the same category of the vehicle being purchased, is produced.

headlines: Bangladesh fined for slow over-rate in first Sri Lanka ODI
text: Bangladesh have been fined for maintaining a slow over-rate in Colombo after the team took 4 hours and 7 minutes to bowl 50 overs in the first ODI against Sri Lanka. The team was found two overs short of its target after time allowances were taken into consideration. Sri Lanka went on to win the match.

headlines: Bangladesh rope in Langeveldt, Vettori as bowling coaches
text: Bangladesh's cricket board has appointed former South Africa pacer Charl Langeveldt as the team's fast bowling coach while naming former New Zealand captain and spinner Daniel Vettori as the spin bowling coach. While Langeveldt has been given the charge for two years, Vettori will have at least 100 working days till the 2020 ICC World T20 in Australia.

headlines: Honour for women's cricket fraternity: Shantha on CAC role
text: Former India women's captain Shantha Rangaswamy, who has been named in the three-member Cricket Advisory Committee (CAC), said it is an "honour and recognition" not just for her but for entire women's cricket fraternity in India. CAC is responsible for selecting Team India's next head coach. She was also part of the ad-hoc committee that selected India women's head coach.

headlines: Bale set for £1 million-a-week move to Jiangsu Suning: Report
text: According to reports, Real Madrid's Welsh winger Gareth Bale is set to make a move to Chinese club Jiangsu Suning, who are ready to pay him around £20 million per season. Real Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane had said last weekend that he thought it would be "best for everyone" if Bale's departure could be arranged quickly.

headlines: Lewis Hamilton to co-produce Hollywood documentary
text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton has confirmed he is an executive producer of an upcoming Hollywood documentary, 'The Game Changers'. "It's a revolutionary new documentary movie and I can't wait for you guys to see it," tweeted Hamilton. The documentary's executive production team led by Oscar-winner James Cameron also includes Novak Djokovic and Jackie Chan among others.

headlines: BJP targeting to become 20-crore-member party: JP Nadda
text: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Saturday said his party has enrolled over 11 crore members through its membership drive and it is now targeting to become a 20-crore-member organisation. "We are not competing against anyone, we are trying to break our own record," he added. "Even all the other political parties say...they can't match the saffron party," claimed Nadda.

headlines: Victory of horse-trading: Siddaramaiah on BJP's govt in Karnataka
text: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Saturday said BJP government in Karnataka was not "constitutionally or ethically formed" and called it "victory of horse-trading". He added that Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's swearing-in was also unconstitutional as they haven't proved their majority yet. "The strength of the house is 221...They have 105," he further said adding that for majority BJP needs 111 MLAs.

headlines: 18 mn-yr-old remains of world's smallest fossil monkey found
text: America's Duke University and Peru's National University of Piura scientists have uncovered 18-million-year-old remains of the world's smallest fossil monkey ever found. The remains were found on an exposed riverbank along Río Alto Madre de Dios in southeastern Peru. The specimen is important because it helps bridge a 15-million-year gap in the fossil record for New World monkeys, scientists said.

headlines: Saw enemy playing its games sitting on high peaks in Kargil: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi at a Kargil Vijay Diwas event on Saturday said that he saw enemy playing its games sitting on high peaks in Kargil 20 years ago. "Death was staring in the face yet our jawans carrying the tricolour wanted to reach the valley before anyone," he added. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh was also present at the event.

headlines: 9 pregnant women among those rescued from Mahalaxmi Express
text: The National Disaster Response Force's (NDRF) Director General SN Pradhan on Saturday said the rescue operation for Mumbai-Kolhapur Mahalaxmi Express went on for around eight hours. "Women and children were evacuated first, including nine pregnant women, after that elderly people...and finally the male passengers," he added. The train was stuck between Badlapur and Vangani due to waterlogging.

headlines: Govt deploys 10,000 paramilitary troops in Jammu & Kashmir
text: The central government on Friday deployed an additional 10,000 paramilitary troops in Jammu and Kashmir. The Home Ministry sent a directive to the Jammu and Kashmir Chief Secretary stating that the additional forces will strengthen the anti-terrorist operation and help to maintain law and order. The decision comes after NSA Ajit Doval's two-day visit to the state.

headlines: 19-year-old top Jaish bomb maker Munna Lahori killed in Kashmir
text: A top commander of Jaish-e-Mohammed Munna Lahori and his associate were killed in a gunfight with security forces in J&K's Shopian district on Saturday. Lahori hailed from Pakistan and was known for making improvised explosive devices (IED). The 19-year-old is also said to be responsible for vehicle bomb blast attacks on March 30 and June 17 in the valley.

headlines: Varun faints on film set, pulls off 18-hr shift on return: Reports
text: Actor Varun Dhawan fainted on the sets of his upcoming film 'Street Dancer 3D' due to low blood pressure and was advised bed rest for a few days, according to reports. Varun, who was also suffering from cold and fever, reportedly returned to work after a day's rest and pulled off an 18-hour shift to keep the film on schedule.

headlines: What records does Lasith Malinga hold in ODI cricket?
text: Lasith Malinga, who retired from ODIs on Friday, is the third-highest ODI wicket-taker for Sri Lanka (338 wickets).
