The 35-year-old is the only bowler to take three ODI and two World Cup hat-tricks. He has taken the most World Cup wickets (56) among Asian pacers. He also hit the highest score by a number 10 batsman (56) for Sri Lanka.

headlines: Contesting elections was a big mistake: Infosys Co-founder Nilekani
text: During an interview with ET Now, Infosys Co-founder and former UIDAI Chairman Nandan Nilekani said that contesting elections was a big mistake and he has learnt from it. Nilekani, who contested 2014 Lok Sabha polls from Bangalore South for Congress, lost to BJP's Ananth Kumar. Kumar was then re-elected as MP from the constituency for the sixth consecutive time.

headlines: I've stopped doing new startup deals: Infosys Co-founder Nilekani
text: Infosys Co-founder and former UIDAI Chairman Nandan Nilekani has said that he has stopped making new individual investments. "I don't generally invest in areas where I am doing work policy-wise because I don't want any issues," he said. Nilekani has made 13 investments in the Indian startup ecosystem, as per Crunchbase, and had also co-founded VC fund Fundamentum in 2017.

headlines: Officials give contradictory statements: Rajiv Bajaj on EV policy
text: Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj has said there has been a lot of 'flip-flopping' in the last two years as far as government's policy on electric vehicles is concerned. "Sometimes they blow hot, sometimes they blow cold. Sometimes they make very definitive statements. Their own colleagues contradict their statements. And people in the industry are quite confused," he added.

headlines: Record heatwave in Europe could melt Greenland's ice sheet: WMO
text: The record heatwave that swept across much of western Europe is set to move towards Greenland and could cause record melting, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) said. Greenland lost 160 billion tonnes of ice through surface melting in July, the WMO said, citing data from Denmark's Polar Portal. Increasingly intense heatwaves are linked to manmade climate change, the WMO added.

headlines: Stanford builds device that counts individual sound particles
text: Stanford physicists have developed a highly sensitive "quantum microphone" that is capable of measuring individual particles of sound, called phonons. "We expect this device to allow new types of quantum sensors, transducers and storage devices for future quantum machines," researchers said. It could lead to quantum computers that operate by manipulating sound rather than light, they added.

headlines: UP SP gives foot massage to Kanwariya; Shamli Police shares video
text: Shamli Police department in Uttar Pradesh has shared a video of Superintendent of Police Ajay Kumar giving a foot massage to a Kanwariya at a medical camp. "Service along with protection," the department tweeted, adding that the medical camp was inaugurated by Kumar. This comes after CM Yogi Adityanath instructed officials to ensure "safe, successful and clean" Kanwar Yatra.

headlines: London Stock Exchange in talks to buy Refinitiv for $27 billion
text: The London Stock Exchange Group on Friday said it was in discussions to acquire financial data and trading platform provider Refinitiv Holdings for $27 billion, including debt. LSE said it would pay for the transaction entirely with newly issued shares. A Blackstone Group-led consortium bought a 55% stake in Refinitiv last year from professional information company Thomson Reuters.

headlines: I don't follow cricket, B'wood, politics to be productive: Nilekani
text: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani in an interview to ET Now said that he does not follow cricket, Bollywood and politics to be more productive. He went on to call his decision to contest elections "a big mistake". He added he admires Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and called his work at the company "astonishing" as it achieved a trillion-dollar market cap.

headlines: England captain Joe Root calls Lords pitch substandard
text: Following England's win over Ireland in the one-off Test at Lord's, England's Test captain Joe Root criticised the ground's pitch, calling it 'substandard'. England were dismissed for 85 in the first innings as Tim Murtagh scalped five wickets. "We weren't at our best by any stretch. We managed certain periods very well. We were put under pressure," Root added.

headlines: Isner first tennis player to sign deal with cannabis CBD company
text: USA's top-ranked tennis player John Isner has become the first professional tennis player to sign an endorsement deal with a cannabis-based CBD company that manufactures a CBD-infused sports drink. Recently, a Canada-based company partnered with the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) to research CBD use to manage pain and inflammation in MMA athletes.

headlines: Barcelona planning for post-Lionel Messi era: Club president
text: FC Barcelona's president Josep Maria Bartomeu says they are working on a plan for when Lionel Messi finally calls time on his football career. "We have to think about this changing era when Messi will give up playing football but, as president, I hope that he is going to be (having) very large years playing with us still," Bartomeu added.

headlines: Developing tech for next billion online users in India: Google CEO
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has said that the technology giant is developing technology for the next billion users coming online in countries including India, Brazil and Indonesia. Pichai also said Google is working towards making privacy controls more easily accessible. "We continue to challenge the notion that products need more data to be more helpful," he added.

headlines: Have power to face a man like Azam Khan: BJP MP Rama Devi
text: BJP MP Rama Devi on Saturday said that she has the power to face a man like SP leader Azam Khan. This comes after Khan told the BJP MP in Lok Sabha on Thursday that he is "fond" of her and he feels like looking into her eyes. Devi was presiding over a Lok Sabha session when the incident happened.

headlines: UP farmers are getting threats of confiscation daily: Priyanka
text: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday targeted UP government over a report of five farmer suicides in Bundelkhand. "Bundelkhand farmers get confiscation threats daily. What kind of policy and loan waiver schemes is it that farmers are left with no option but to commit suicide?" she tweeted. She also wrote that farmers don't get the right price for their crop.

headlines: 250 CA answer sheets found with unauthorised man in Kolkata
text: Kolkata Police on Wednesday found 250 CA exam answer sheets at the residence of an unauthorised person. The man, who works as an accountant at a CA firm, claimed the copies were given to him by his employer who was the authorised examiner. ICAI, the organisation that conducts the CA exams, said it has initiated proceedings against both persons.

headlines: Bihar floods death toll rises to 127, over 82 lakh affected
text: The death toll in the Bihar floods, which have affected over 82 lakh people, rose to 127 on Friday. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar told the state Assembly that he will write to the Centre to provide assistance. The state government has deployed 900 personnel with 133 boats to conduct rescue operations, who are assisted by 19 NDRF teams.

headlines: Asaram, son get clean chit in Gurukul children death case
text: Self-styled godman Asaram and his son Narayan Sai have been given a clean chit by Justice DK Trivedi Commission in the 2008 death case of two children who studied at Asaram's Gurukul. The clean chit was given to the duo after 12 years. The commission, however, said that the Gurukul management's negligence resulted in the death of the two children.

headlines: All 700 on Mumbai-Kolhapur train stuck due to waterlogging rescued
text: All 700 people on board the Mumbai-Kolhapur Mahalaxmi Express, which was stuck between Badlapur and Vangani due to waterlogging, have been rescued after around 12 hours. Seven Navy teams and two IAF helicopters were deployed along with NDRF to rescue the people. "Necessary arrangements like food, etc made...14 buses, 3 tempos arranged for further movement," Maharashtra Chief Minister's Office tweeted.

headlines: Korean nightclub balcony drops 16 feet as swimmers dance; 2 dead
text: A balcony and a staircase inside a nightclub in South Korea's Gwangju dropped around 16 feet at 2.30 AM (local time) on Saturday as many including athletes participating in world aquatic championships were dancing. Two South Koreans, a 38-year-old and a 27-year-old, were taken to hospital where they succumbed to injuries. Over 15 people including eight international swimmers, suffered injuries.

headlines: Stokes reappointed vice-captain, Archer earns maiden Test call-up
text: England on Saturday named their 14-member squad for the first Ashes Test, which will commence at Edgbaston on Thursday. Ben Stokes has been reappointed as vice-captain, while Barbados-born pacer Jofra Archer, who was England's highest wicket-taker in 2019 World Cup, has been included in Test squad for the first time. Jos Buttler, who was rested for Ireland Test, also returns.

headlines: WhatsApp told to trace messages in India, says Ravi Shankar
text: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has said that he has asked WhatsApp Global Head Will Cathcart to enable traceability of messages in India to prevent unwanted incidents. "A mechanism should be developed by them...request for that will also come from an appropriately high level," Prasad said. He added the platform has assured a "prompt action" over the same.

headlines: WhatsApp crosses 40 crore monthly active users in India
text: Facebook-owned WhatsApp has confirmed it has crossed over 40 crore monthly active users in its biggest market India, a hike of over 100% in the past two years. WhatsApp Global Head Will Cathcart met with NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant and Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad. Cathcart had announced WhatsApp's payment service will be launched in India this year.

headlines: 4-day I-T raid on Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi ends
text: The Income Tax Department on Friday concluded its tax evasion-related search operation on the properties of Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi on its fourth day. Bishnoi's properties in Hisar, Mandi Adampur, Gurugram and Delhi were searched as part of the raid. Bishnoi's wife Renuka, who is a Congress MLA from Hansi, was not present when the tax officials arrived.

headlines: BigBasket shuts down on-demand delivery in NCR, Mumbai: Report
text: Bengaluru-based online grocery delivery startup BigBasket has shut down its on-demand, under-90-minute delivery service in areas including the National Capital Region (NCR), Mumbai, Pune and Lucknow, among others, Entrackr reported. The on-demand feature is also not available for premium BBStar members, the report said. However, the on-demand service is reportedly still operational in Bengaluru.

headlines: 21-yr-old UP girl Vidisha becomes 1st Indian to win Miss Deaf World
text: Vidisha Baliyan, a 21-year-old girl from Uttar Pradesh, has been crowned Miss Deaf World 2019, the first Indian to bag the title. The international beauty pageant was held in Mbombela, South Africa, and Vidisha was chosen among the 11 finalists from 16 participating countries in the final round. She's a former international tennis player who represented India in the Deaflympics.

headlines: US approves $670 million sales to support India's C-17 aircraft
text: The US has approved military sales worth $670 million to support India's C-17 military transport aircraft. India had requested to buy equipment for C-17 follow-on support, to include spares and repair parts, and personnel training, among others. "India needs this...to maintain its operational readiness and ability to provide Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief assistance," the US said.

headlines: Wife rescues husband after he falls 50 ft into volcano on honeymoon
text: Newlyweds Clay Chastain and Acaimie Chastain were honeymooning in the Caribbean and hiked at the top of 3,700ft-high Mount Liamuiga when Clay fell over 50 feet down into a dormant volcano on July 18. Acaimie climbed down the volcano and dragged him out. Clay, who fractured his skull and has a severe concussion, is recovering at a US hospital.

headlines: US economy misses Donald Trump's 3% growth target in 2018
text: US' Gross Domestic Product expanded by 2.9% last year, missing the 3% growth target set by US President Donald Trump. The economy's performance in 2018 was still an acceleration from the 2.4% growth recorded in 2017. Trump has repeatedly insisted that Federal Reserve should cut borrowing costs, saying it would allow the economy to take off "like a rocket ship".

headlines: US judge cuts $2 billion award for couple with cancer to $86 million
text: A California judge reduced a $2-billion jury award to a couple who blamed Bayer's glyphosate-based weed killer Roundup for their cancer to $86.7 million. The German chemicals company, which bought Roundup maker Monsanto last year, faces similar cancer lawsuits by more than 13,400 customers across the US. To date, it has lost three US jury trials in the Roundup litigation.

headlines: Landslides force Tour de France's 20th stage to be cut short
text: Tour de France's organisers announced on Friday that Saturday's 20th stage of the Tour de France will be cut short from 130km to 59km because of landslides. The shortened stage will mean that the riders will skip one major climb, the Cormet de Roselend, a 19.9km ascent. Colombian rider Egan Bernal leads the Tour by 48 seconds from Julian Alaphilippe.

headlines: Maldives restaurant offers an experience of dining under the sea
text: Built 16 feet below the sea level, the Ithaa restaurant in the Maldives offers guests an experience to dine under the sea with 180-degree panoramic views of the sea life. Their menu consists of a blend of Maldivian and International cuisine. The restaurant structure weighs 75 tonnes and was made on dry land in Singapore before being transported by ship.

headlines: Women should get reservation in Parliament: Venkaiah Naidu
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said women should be given seat reservation in the Parliament and then they should be provided with 'funds, functions and functionaries'. "We call 'Mother India', we don't call 'Father India'. That's the importance given to women," he added. Notably, the Women's Reservation Bill is pending in the Lok Sabha for nearly a decade.

headlines: Bihar women's cell seeks Azam's dismissal over 'eyes' remark
text: Bihar State Commission for Women Chairperson Dilmani Mishra on Friday condemned SP MP Azam Khan's remark to BJP MP Rama Devi, adding that she has written to the Speaker to dismiss Khan. "A member of Parliament who can't respect women is not worthy of being in Parliament," Mishra said. Khan had told Devi, "I feel like looking into your eyes."

headlines: NCP leaders perform havan to stop leaders from leaving party
text: NCP leaders and party workers on Friday performed a havan in Maharashtra's Badlapur to prevent leaders from resigning from the party. The havan was organised by NCP leader Kalidas Deshmukh. This comes after the party's Mumbai chief Sachin Ahir resigned and joined Shiv Sena and NCP's Maharashtra women wing chief Chitra Kishor Wagh resigned from the party.

headlines: Govt has betrayed people: Anna Hazare on RTI Act amendment
text: Social activist Anna Hazare on Tuesday said that the government has betrayed the people of this country after passing the amendment to the Right to Information (RTI) Act. The Lok Sabha passed the bill to amend the Act on Monday which proposes to give Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of Chief Information Commissioner and Information Commissioners.

headlines: Stalker stabs woman to death in Delhi; caught by passersby
text: A 21-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by a stalker who was caught and thrashed by passersby in a crowded market in Delhi on Friday, police said. The official said that the victim was rushed to the hospital where she was declared brought dead. The accused, a resident of the victim's neighbourhood, is currently in police custody, police added.

headlines: 115 feared dead in worst Mediterranean shipwreck of the year
text: About 115 people are missing and feared to have drowned and another 134 were rescued by Libyan coast guards and local fishermen after a wooden boat carrying migrants capsized off Libya. UNHCR head Filippo Grandi said it was the worst Mediterranean tragedy of this year. Those on board were mainly from Eritrea and other sub-Saharan Africa and Arab countries.

headlines: UK PM Johnson's approach to Brexit 'very unhelpful': Ireland
text: Ireland deputy PM Simon Coveney has said Boris Johnson's approach to Brexit is "very unhelpful" and warned that the new UK PM was not going to get a deal with such an approach. Johnson had on Thursday said the Irish border backstop would have to be struck out of the Brexit agreement if there was to be an orderly exit.

headlines: Guatemala agrees to new migration measures to avoid US sanctions
text: In a move aimed at avoiding US sanctions, Guatemala has agreed to implement new measures aimed at reducing US asylum claims from migrants fleeing Honduras and El Salvador. Nearly 200,000 people travelling in families from El Salvador and Honduras have been apprehended at the US border since October, with most passing through Guatemala and Mexico along the way.

headlines: I do not blame Turkey for buying Russian defence system: Trump
text: After removing Turkey from the F-35 fighter jet programme, US President Donald Trump said he does not blame the Middle East country for buying Russian S-400 missile defence system "because there are a lot of circumstances". "We're looking at whole Turkey situation," he added. Earlier, Turkey said it would look for other options if the US doesn't sell F-35 jets.

headlines: Newlywed dies while trying to reach 'Into the Wild' bus in Alaska
text: A newlywed woman from Belarus died after being swept away in a river while she was trying to hike to an abandoned bus at the edge of Denali National Park in Alaska. The bus was made famous by the book and film 'Into the Wild'. The book and movie are based on the death of a hiker inside the bus.

headlines: Mumbai-Kolhapur train carrying 2,000 people stuck due to waterlogging
text: Mumbai-Kolhapur Mahalaxmi Express reportedly carrying around 2,000 passengers has been stuck between Badlapur and Vangani due to waterlogging. Railway Protection Force (RPF) has reached the site, while National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) will be reaching shortly. The RPF is distributing biscuits and water to the stranded passengers. "Please don't get down from train," Central Railway tweeted.

headlines: Tell Amitabh Bachchan not to do 'Jumma Chumma': Amar Singh to Jaya
text: Taking a dig at actress-turned-politician Jaya Bachchan for her speech on women issues in the Parliament, politician Amar Singh in a video message said, "Why don't you tell your husband (Amitabh Bachchan) to not do 'Jumma Chumma'?" "Why don't you tell your daughter-in-law (Aishwarya Rai) to not perform the scenes like she did in 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil'," he added.

headlines: Can I perform 'Hare Krishna...' song: Asha after celebs' letters to PM
text: Singer Asha Bhosle on Friday tweeted, "Dum Maro Dum...Bolo Subh Shyam Hare Krishna Hare Ram..can I perform this evergreen song or not?" This comes after 49 celebrities wrote an open letter to PM Narendra Modi seeking stronger law against lynching, adding, "Jai Shri Ram has become a...'war-cry'." The letter was then opposed by 62 celebrities for its "selective outrage".

headlines: Shami's US visa rejected on domestic violence charge, BCCI intervenes
text: Pacer Mohammad Shami's US visa was initially rejected due to his existing police record on charges of domestic violence and adultery. The 28-year-old got the clearance after BCCI CEO Rahul Johri wrote to US Embassy, stating Shami's achievements and furnishing full police report about his marital discord. Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan had filed FIR against the bowler last year.

headlines: Trump says will reject tariff relief on China-made Mac Pro parts
text: US President Donald Trump took to Twitter to announce his administration will deny tariff reliefs to Apple for its Mac Pro parts manufactured in China. "Make them in the USA, no tariffs," Trump wrote. Apple had asked the US Trade Representative's Office to waive 25% tariffs on 15 parts, including ones for Mac Pro desktop computer, on July 18.

headlines: Act against govt staff with more than 1 spouse: HC to TN govt body
text: The Madras High Court on Friday directed the Secretary to Personnel and Administrative Reforms Department of the State to initiate disciplinary action against public servants who have more than one spouse. The court gave the direction while rejecting a petition filed by the second wife of a deceased police personnel seeking pension benefits equivalent to the first wife.

headlines: Aligarh admin bans recitation of Hanuman Chalisa, Namaz on roads
text: Aligarh district administration has banned all religious activities, including recitation of Hanuman Chalisa and offering Namaz, on roads. The decision was taken after some groups started organising aarti and Hanuman Chalisa recitations on roads to protest against Muslims offering Namaz on streets. "Performing religious activities on the roads can disturb the law and order," District Magistrate CB Singh said.

headlines: CRPF jawan, who survived 8 bullets, rejoins duty in Srinagar
text: CRPF jawan Khursheed Ahmad, who was shot eight times in a terrorist attack in 2016, has rejoined duty in J&K's Srinagar. Ahmad was in ICU for two months after the attack, in which eight jawans were martyred and 22 others were injured. "For my colleagues, I now handle paperwork related to passes, transfers and other office work," he said.

headlines: 8 killed, 60 injured after earthquakes hit Philippines
text: At least eight people were killed and 60 others were injured after two earthquakes struck a province in the Philippines on Saturday. The earthquakes, magnitudes 5.4 and 5.9, hit the province of Batanes, an archipelago in the north of the country. The military has deployed an aircraft to send supplies and rescue those injured.

headlines: Will never forget the sacrifices: Kohli on Kargil Vijay Diwas
text: Indian cricket captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to pay tribute to the Indian soldiers on the Kargil Vijay Diwas, writing, "We will never forget all the sacrifices you made for us. Respect, Love, Salute. #JaiHind #KargilVijayDiwas." "All Gave Some, Some Gave All. Fallen But Never Forgotten.#KargilVijayDivas #20YearsOfKargilVijay," tweeted Indian boxer Vijender Singh.

headlines: Real end US tour with 3-7 thrashing at the hands of Atletico
text: Real Madrid finished their US tour with a 3-7 thrashing at the hands of their city rivals Atletico Madrid in New Jersey on Friday. Diego Costa struck in the first minute against Real, who were then three down before the 20-minute mark, and five down by the interval. Real Madrid have conceded 12 goals in three games in the US.

headlines: NCP's Maharashtra women wing President resigns
text: Ahead of the Maharashtra State Assembly polls, NCP's state women wing President Chitra Kishor Wagh resigned from the party's primary membership on Friday. "I am indeed grateful...for...all the opportunities to serve and be the voice of women of Maharashtra," her resignation read. This comes a day after NCP's Mumbai chief Sachin Ahir resigned from the party and joined Shiv Sena.

headlines: 17 Opp'n MPs write to RS chairman on hurried passage of bills
text: MPs from 17 Opposition parties on Friday wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu claiming bills were passed in Parliament hurriedly without any scrutiny. The letter read, the 17th Lok Sabha passed 14 bills in its first session but none were referred to a Parliamentary Committee. This is a departure from the established practice of enacting laws, it added.

headlines: Edtech startup Brainly raises $30 million led by Naspers
text: Poland-based edtech startup Brainly has raised $30 million in a funding round led by South African conglomerate Naspers, with participation from Runa Capital and Manta Ray. The startup said it will use the funds to further expand its user base in India. Founded in 2009, Brainly had raised around $29 million in its Series B round, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: 2 militants killed in encounter in J&K's Shopian
text: Two militants were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Saturday morning. Police said they received a tip-off following which a joint search operation along with the Army, SOG and CRPF personnel was launched in the area. The bodies of the militants have been recovered along with weapons, said an official.

headlines: 2 interns suspended for making TikTok videos in Hyd hospital
text: Two interns were suspended after their TikTok videos shot inside a Hyderabad government hospital's physiotherapy department went viral. The interns were reportedly trainee technicians and recorded the videos when there were no patients. The physiotherapy in charge will be served a notice and the interns have been sent back with a letter to their college department head, the hospital said.

headlines: 24 UP jails to get Delhi's Tihar jail-like security
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to upgrade security in at least 24 jails along the lines of Delhi's high-security Tihar jail amid reports of security lapses. The upgradation will be implemented in three phases, including deploying 1,300 more personnel, rotating personnel so no staff is at the same spot for over 45 days and frisking visitors, inmates and staff.

headlines: Pakistan can ask for our help against terror: Rajnath Singh
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that if Pakistan is sincere about controlling terror but is unable to do it, they can ask for India's cooperation. They have made no sincere effort against terrorists like Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed, Singh added. Singh further said that if talks are to take place, they will be about Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

headlines: upGrad offers India's 1st fully online Master's program in ML & AI
text: upGrad, with Liverpool John Moores University, helps learners transition to ML & AI with its Master's program. The first-ever fully online Master's program provides learners full access to the digital library at LJMU and network with faculty and postdoctoral fellows, at 1/10th the cost of the on-campus program. 800+ learners have transitioned, through upGrad's 360 degree career support.

headlines: US SC allows Trump to use $2.5bn in defence funds for border wall
text: The US Supreme Court on Friday allowed President Donald Trump's administration to redirect $2.5 billion in money approved by Congress for the Pentagon to help build his promised wall along the US-Mexico border. The Supreme Court voted 5-4 to allow the funds to be used. "Big win for border security and the rule of law!" Trump tweeted after the verdict.

headlines: CoA to not review India's 2019 WC performance, says no time for it
text: Committee of Administrators (CoA) chief Vinod Rai on Friday said the committee won't review Team India's 2019 World Cup performance. "Where is the time to have a review meeting?" asked Rai referring to Team India's departure on July 29 for the West Indies tour. He added that "the usual feedback" from the support staff and manager's report is still awaited.

headlines: 27-yr-old spinner gets hit by teammate's shot, suffers skull fracture
text: Yorkshire's 27-year-old leg-spinner Josh Poysden has been ruled out for the remainder of the county season after sustaining a fractured skull during a training session. Poysden was hit on the head by a stray shot from one of his teammates. A CT scan revealed that the spinner also had internal bleeding which hadn't gone to his brain.

headlines: Malinga top match winner, never failed to deliver: Rohit Sharma
text: Following Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga's retirement from ODIs, Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma tweeted, "If I had to pick one match winner among many others for Mumbai Indians in the last decade, this man will be on the top for sure". "As a captain he give me breather during [a] tense situation and never failed to deliver," he added.

headlines: Malinga takes wicket on last ball of his ODI career as SL beat B'desh
text: Pacer Lasith Malinga took wicket on the last ball of his ODI career and registered figures of 9.4-2-38-3 as Sri Lanka defeated Bangladesh by 91 runs in the first ODI on Friday. The 35-year-old played 226 matches in his 15-year-long ODI career, taking 338 wickets. Sri Lanka had put up a total of 314/8, while Bangladesh were dismissed for 223/10.

headlines: There's shortage of judges, water too: SC on filling doctor vacancies
text: Dismissing petitions seeking directive to fill up doctor vacancies in Bihar, the Supreme Court said, "There are vacancies for judges, doctors, ministers, Rajya Sabha members, even water and sunlight everywhere but we can't fill them all up." "We're already trying to fill up vacancies of judges and we only know how much success we have had," it added.

headlines: Sunanda slapped Tharoor on plane over alleged affair with journo: Book
text: Sunanda Pushkar, the late wife of Shashi Tharoor, had slapped him on a plane during a fight over his alleged affair with Pakistani journalist Mehr Tarar, a biography on Pushkar claimed. Pushkar had found that Tharoor had saved Tarar's number under the name 'Harish' and also found some messages exchanged between the two, the biography written by Pushkar's friend revealed.

headlines: Army launches mission to find bodies of missing crew of 1968 air crash
text: The Indian Army flagged off a search expedition team on Friday from Himachal Pradesh's Sumdo in an attempt to recover the bodies and wreckage of IAF An-12 aircraft that crashed in Lahaul valley in 1968. The aircraft, carrying around 102 people on board, had gone missing over Rohtang Pass. Only five bodies have been found till date.

headlines: 42-yr-old man charred to death after moving car catches fire in Delhi
text: A 42-year-old man was charred to death after his Mahindra XUV 500 car caught fire near Madhuban Chowk in West Delhi's Pitampura. The man was on his way to the Indira Gandhi International Airport when the incident happened. Two fire tenders were rushed but the vehicle was completely burnt and a fully charred body was pulled out of it.

headlines: Lab technician, his family found hanging inside IIT Delhi campus
text: A lab technician, his wife and his mother, who lived inside the premises of Indian Institute of Technology in Delhi, were found hanging from the ceiling fans in three rooms of their flat. While the police suspect it to be a suicide case, no suicide note has been recovered from the site. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

headlines: Government to privatise 25 more airports: AAI Chairman
text: The Airports Authority of India is in the process of identifying 20-25 airports with a traffic of 1-1.5 million passengers a year for private development, Chairman Guruprasad Mohapatra said. "This is part of the 100-day agenda of the government. We will complete the tendering in 100 days," he said. The government is already in the process of privatising six airports.

headlines: Billionaire Agarwal sells Anglo American stake, may make $500 mn
text: Metals tycoon Anil Agarwal, the biggest shareholder in London-based mining giant Anglo American, on Thursday said he is selling the nearly 20% stake he has held since 2017. Bloomberg reported that Agarwal could make $500 million before costs from the investment. The self-made billionaire, who controls Vedanta, said the targeted returns had been achieved "even sooner than expected".

headlines: Raymond's Vijaypat warned Sunanda against marrying Tharoor: Book
text: A book on Sunanda Pushkar's life stated that ex-Raymond chief Vijaypat Singhania cautioned her against marrying Shashi Tharoor. "Singhania met him (Tharoor) for the first time just before the wedding and it took him only a few minutes to size up the minister and tell Sunanda, 'Don't marry him, Sue. You will never be happy with him'," the book read.

headlines: Mary Kom, Amit to feature in inaugural Indian Boxing League
text: Six-time world champion Mary Kom and Asian Championships gold medallist Amit Panghal are among those who will feature in inaugural Indian Boxing League. "There will be a total of 90 bouts of three rounds each, spread over 18 days across three venues," Boxing Federation of India said. The league will be held from October 20 to November 9.

headlines: Aiming for a singles medal in 2024 Games: Manika Batra
text: India's Commonwealth Games gold medallist paddler Manika Batra has said she does not want to put pressure on herself for the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Games. "All paddlers are working hard for Tokyo Olympics...if we play our best and are lucky...we'll win a medal," she added. The 24-year-old further said she is targeting for a singles medal at the 2024 Olympics.

headlines: BJP will provide stable government in Karnataka: JP Nadda
text: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Friday said Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka fell due to internal reasons and asserted that his party would now provide a stable government there. "BJP is synonymous with stability. Wherever we go, we bring stability," he added. Nadda also rubbished the opposition's claim that BJP engineered the collapse of the coalition government.

headlines: Karnataka CM Yediyurappa to face floor test on July 29
text: After swearing-in as Karnataka CM, BS Yediyurappa on Friday said he would conduct the floor test in the state assembly on July 29. "The Karnataka assembly session will be called on July 29...for moving confidence motion and for the passage of the finance bill," he added. Yediyurappa further said the legislative council would begin its proceedings on July 30.

headlines: Have vacated official bungalow before deadline: Scindia
text: Congress' Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday said he vacated his official bungalow in Lutyens' Delhi before the deadline and news claiming him requesting to retain the bungalow is false. "I have always been a law-abiding citizen and these attempts to project a false narrative are extremely regrettable," he tweeted. "(I) never had any desire for any unauthorized retention," Scindia further wrote.

headlines: Will not pursue vindictive politics: K'taka CM Yediyurappa
text: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa on Friday asserted that he will not pursue vindictive politics and would follow 'forgive and forget' policy. "I want to assure the opposition parties that I won't practice vindictive politics. I'll follow forgive and forget policy. Let good thoughts flow from all sides," he said. Earlier today, Yediyurappa sworn-in as the CM of the state.

headlines: SpaceX launches 18th ISS resupply mission, recovers booster
text: Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX has successfully launched its 18th mission for NASA to deliver experiment, research and supply materials to the International Space Station (ISS). The mission was launched using twice-flown Dragon capsule and marked SpaceX's 44th successful recovery of a Falcon 9 rocket booster. SpaceX had used the booster two months ago for the last ISS resupply mission.

headlines: ARIES Nainital scientists discover 28 new stars in Milky Way
text: Scientists at Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observational Sciences (ARIES) in Uttarakhand's Nainital district have discovered 28 new variable stars in Milky Way galaxy. The team performed photometric observations of globular cluster 'NGC 4147' using Devasthal Optical Telescope (DOT), former ARIES director Anil Pandey said. Variable stars have been found for the first time in NGC 4147, he added.

headlines: Congress leaders in MP mistaken for child lifters, beaten
text: Locals of Madhya Pradesh's Betul thrashed three persons including two Congress leaders on suspicion of being child lifters, ASP Ramsnehi Mishra said. The incident occurred when the three were returning from a village on Thursday night. Mishra added that there were rumours of kidnappers being active in the area which had led locals to be suspicious of any outsiders.

headlines: Brexit will make UK 'the greatest place on earth': UK PM
text: UK PM Boris Johnson on Thursday promised to withdraw his country from the European Union by October 31. "Our mission is to deliver Brexit...for the purpose of uniting and re-energising our great United Kingdom and making this country the greatest place on earth," Johnson said in his first speech as Prime Minister.

headlines: BS Yediyurappa takes oath as Karnataka Chief Minister for 4th time
text: Karnataka BJP President BS Yediyurappa took oath as the Chief Minister of Karnataka for the fourth time on Friday. This comes after the HD Kumaraswamy-led Congress-JD(S) coalition government collapsed after losing the confidence motion by six votes on Tuesday. Yediyurappa will have to prove BJP's majority in the Karnataka Assembly by July 31.

headlines: Anurag Kashyap receives death threat on Twitter, alerts Mumbai Police
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, who along with 48 celebrities recently wrote an open letter to PM Narendra Modi over rising cases of mob lynching, took to Twitter to alert Mumbai Police about a death threat made to him. In the now-deleted tweet, the user had said that he recently cleaned his rifle and was waiting to see the director in person.

headlines: What happens to a woman's identity if she's not f**kable: Gwyneth
text: Speaking about ageing, 'Avengers' actress Gwyneth Paltrow said, "What does it mean to get wrinkles? What happens to your identity as a woman if you're not f**kable and beautiful?" The 46-year-old said this while talking about people considering her a "beautiful woman" and added she has always "felt funny" about her looks. "It's...rare to think...youre a beautiful person," said Gwyneth.

headlines: 2-yr-old swept away on airport conveyor belt, injures right hand
text: A two-year-old boy injured his right hand after he climbed onto a baggage conveyor belt at an airport in Atlanta, US. The boy rode on the conveyer belt through restricted areas of the airport until officials saw him and stopped the belt. He climbed onto the belt when his mother put him down to print her boarding pass.

headlines: Australia name 17-man Ashes squad; Warner, Smith, Bancroft included
text: Australia on Friday named their 17-member squad for the upcoming Ashes in England. David Warner, Steve Smith and Cameron Bancroft, who served lengthy bans over their involvement in ball-tampering scandal in South Africa last year, have been included. The squad, led by wicketkeeper Tim Paine, also includes uncapped pacer Michael Neser. The first Ashes Test will begin on August 1.

headlines: England dismiss Ireland for 5th lowest total to win Test at Lord's
text: England defeated Ireland by 143 runs in the one-off Test at Lord's after dismissing them for the fifth-lowest Test total (38). Ireland were dismissed in 94 deliveries, the shortest Test innings in last 83 years. England also became the first team in 111 years to win a Test despite getting all out for 85 runs or fewer in first innings.

headlines: Who will select Team India's next head coach?
text: A three-member Cricket Advisory Committee led by 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev will pick Team India's next head coach, the Committee of Administrators said on Friday. The panel includes former women's cricket team captain Shantha Rangaswamy and former men's coach Anshuman Gaekwad. The interviews of the candidates are expected to take place mid-August.

headlines: Google-parent posts $9bn Q2 profit, to buy back stock worth $25bn
text: Google's parent firm Alphabet has posted a revenue of nearly $39 billion, representing a year-over-year rise of about 19%, with a profit of over $9 billion for the June quarter. It also announced a share repurchase of around $25-billion worth of stocks. Following the announcement, the technology giant's stock went up nearly 9% at the end of trading on Thursday.

headlines: CRED raises $4 million from Sequoia Capital India
text: FreeCharge Co-founder Kunal Shah's credit card bill payment startup CRED has raised $4 million from Sequoia Capital India, as per regulatory filings. The Bengaluru-based startup is reportedly planning to raise $120 million at a valuation of $400 million. CRED is reportedly in talks with US-based General Catalyst, China's Hillhouse Capital and existing investors for the fundraising.

headlines: Tesla loses $7 billion in m-cap after posting $408 million Q2 loss
text: Tesla lost around $7 billion in market value on Thursday after it posted a June-quarter loss of about $408 million on Wednesday. Tesla had also announced its Co-founder JB Straubel was stepping down from the role of the electric carmaker's Chief Technology Officer after nearly 16 years. Tesla shares closed at 13.6%, its biggest stock decline in about 10 months.

headlines: China says gave India data on floods; MEA calls it standard practice
text: China's Ambassador to India, Sun Weidong, said that China had provided satellite data to India to assist in flood relief efforts on ISRO's request. Responding to Weidong, India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said that the data was shared under the International Charter Space and Major Disasters, of which ISRO is a part, and called it "standard practice".

headlines: No connection between VRS and transfer to Power Ministry: SC Garg
text: Senior IAS officer Subhash Chandra Garg said he discussed his voluntary retirement with Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on July 18, much before his transfer orders were issued on July 24. "It (VRS) has no connection with the orders," he said. Garg was removed as Finance and Economic Affairs Secretary and transferred to the Power Ministry as its top bureaucrat.

headlines: New signing Mendy joins Real Madrid's injury list
text: Real Madrid's list of injured players got joined by new signing Ferland Mendy after the club revealed that he had suffered a muscle injury to his right calf. Real Madrid midfielder Marco Asensio had earlier ruptured his anterior cruciate ligament while winger Brahim Diaz suffered a thigh problem. Real Madrid's La Liga season begins on August 17.

headlines: Punia among 5 wrestlers selected for Senior World C'ships
text: Five wrestlers including Commonwealth Games gold medallist Bajrang Punia have been selected for the 2019 Senior Wrestling World Championships. The tournament is the first phase to earn a spot in the 2020 Olympic Games. Other wrestlers who were selected in their respective categories are Ravi Kumar (57 kg), Deepak Punia (86 kg), Mausam (97 kg) and Sumit (125 kg).

headlines: One dead, 11 injured in explosion at Ludhiana factory
text: A person died while 11 others were injured on Friday after an explosion at a factory in Ludhiana's Mundian Kalan area. The incident took place in DC Steel factory after a pipe exploded due to excessive pressure. "One person was brought dead while nine others with less than 25% burn injuries are admitted to the hospital," a doctor said.

headlines: BJP's silence on job losses dangerous: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday tweeted a report and claimed that jobs of 10 lakh people in the automobile sector were in danger. "The silence of BJP...on job losses...is most dangerous," Gandhi said. Industry body ACMA in its report on Wednesday claimed that jobs of 10 lakh people could be at stake if the automobile industry slowdown continues.

headlines: Bihar youth drowns in floodwater while filming TikTok video
text: A youth died after drowning in a stream of floodwater on Monday while filming a TikTok video in Bihar's Darbhanga. The deceased identified as Afzal, with his two friends, was making TikTok videos in which they were performing stunts by diving into the stream. Afzal drowned while trying to save one of his friends who was struggling to stay afloat.

headlines: It's up to states to enact laws on cow slaughter: Government
text: MoS Animal Husbandry, Dairy and Fisheries Sanjeev Balyan on Friday said preservation of cattle is a matter on which states have exclusive powers to legislate. "Therefore, it's up to the states to enact laws on the slaughter of cows," he added. Balyan said this in response to a question on whether cow slaughter is legally banned all over the country.

headlines: Brazil President's cell phones hacked amid leaked chats scandal
text: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has said that his cell phones were hacked by a group which also targeted other cabinet ministers, prosecutors and judges. Conversations leaked from Justice Minister Sérgio Moro's cell phone revealed that as a judge, he had colluded with prosecutors to keep jailed former President Lula da Silva out of the 2018 presidential race.

headlines: Aus family finds python hiding inside pool table during game
text: A family in Brisbane, Australia, found a python hiding inside a pool table during a game. The snake, a carpet python, popped its head out of the table as a ball slowed to a stop on the edge of the hole. The python was likely seeking a warm and confined space to relax in, according to experts.

headlines: Dhoni doesn't need protection, he will protect citizens: Army chief
text: Talking about MS Dhoni who is set to serve his Army regiment in Kashmir, Army chief General Bipin Rawat said, "Dhoni has carried out his basic training and we know he'll be able to accomplish the task." "I don't think we will need to protect him, he will protect the citizens and garrison entrusted to his task," he added.

headlines: US lawmaker Tulsi Gabbard sues Google for $50mn over suspended ads
text: US Democratic presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard has sued Google for at least $50 million over a six-hour suspension of her campaign's ad account after the first Democratic debate. Gabbard, the first-ever Hindu elected to US Congress, was briefly the most-searched-for candidate on Google after the debate, as per NYT. She accused Google of threatening free speech, fair elections and democracy.

headlines: Yeddyurappa changes name to Yediyurappa ahead of taking oath as CM
text: Ahead of taking charge as Karnataka's new CM, BS Yeddyurappa has reverted to the old spelling of his name, BS Yediyurappa. The Karnataka BJP chief had earlier changed his name to Yeddyurappa from Yediyurappa in 2007. The new spelling of his name, which was mentioned in letter sent to Governor Vajubhai Vala, has also been updated on his Twitter account.

headlines: Cow is the only animal that exhales oxygen: Uttarakhand Chief Minister
text: A video of Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat claiming that cow is the only animal which inhales and exhales oxygen has gone viral. In the video, he also asserted that breathing problems can be cured by massaging a cow. A CMO official defended Rawat saying that he was only stating something which is a common belief in Uttarakhand's hills.

headlines: Your new PM is a liar: UK PM's pic projected onto Buckingham Palace
text: Campaign group 'Led By Donkeys' projected a picture of UK PM Boris Johnson with the message "Your Majesty, your new Prime Minister is a liar" onto the Buckingham Palace. The message was a reference to the lies told by Johnson on various occasions, the group said. A similar projection on the Windsor Castle had called Johnson a "threat to democracy".

headlines: Regulators clear Mahindra's GA8 planes to fly again after crash
text: Aviation regulators in Australia, New Zealand and the European Union have lifted orders grounding the single-engine GA8 planes, made by Mahindra Aerospace. Nine Swedes were killed when a GA8, dubbed the Airvan 8, crashed during a skydiving trip in northern Sweden on July 14. There are 228 GA8 planes worldwide, 63 of which are registered in Australia.

headlines: Bosnian court orders 1 month detention for Lakshmi Mittal's brother
text: A court in Bosnia on Thursday ordered one-month detention for steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal's brother Pramod Mittal, who is suspected of organised crime and abuse of power at a coke plant. Mittal heads the supervisory board and co-owns metallurgical coke producer GIKIL in northern Bosnia. Prosecutors said that he invoked his right to remain silent during the questioning.

headlines: Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay pay tribute to jawans on Kargil Vijay Diwas
text: Paying tribute to jawans on the Kargil Vijay Diwas on Friday, Amitabh Bachchan tweeted, "We salute you for your sacrifice .. your determined fight to protect us all and our Country." Meanwhile, Akshay Kumar tweeted, "May we never forget our soldiers whose courage and heroism lets us live in peace, day after day."

headlines: Mercedes 'in trouble' if Germany stays this hot: Hamilton
text: Speaking about the temperatures in Germany's Hockenheim ahead of the German Grand Prix, Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton said, "[I]f it stays this hot, we're going to be in trouble." Geilenkirchen, a town a few hundred kilometres from Hockenheim, recorded Germany's hottest-ever temperature of 40.5° Celsius on Thursday. "Clearly [cooling is] a big weakness in our package," Mercedes' Valtteri Bottas said.

headlines: Fans sing Les Misérables song for protest at Man City friendly
text: Fans in Hong Kong sung 'Do you hear the people sing?', from the musical Les Misérables, while attending the pre-season friendly match between Manchester City and local outfit Kitchee. Fans in the stadium were also heard chanting 'Free Hong Kong', while some held placards and banners that read 'No Extradition'.

headlines: Federer, Djokovic, Del Potro to skip Rogers Cup in Montreal
text: Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Juan Martin del Potro, who share 37 Grand Slam titles between them, have withdrawn from the upcoming Rogers Cup in Montreal, Canada. Spain's Rafael Nadal is the tournament's top seed, while Frenchman Richard Gasquet and Kazakhstan's Mikhail Kukushkin will take the two available spots in the Montreal main draw as a result of the withdrawals.

headlines: Pochettino apologises to Utd for his team's tackling in friendly
text: Tottenham's manager Mauricio Pochettino apologised to Manchester United for his team's tackling in a 2-1 pre-season defeat on Thursday. "I apologise to United on behalf of our players. I expect the same because there was some action in the second half that they made to us," Pochettino added. United's Eric Bailly hurt his knee when he tried blocking Son Heung-min.

headlines: Yeddyurappa visits National Military Memorial ahead of swearing-in
text: Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa on Friday paid tributes to Kargil War martyrs at Bengaluru's National Military Memorial ahead of swearing-in as the CM. "On this day 20 years ago, Indian armed forces defeated Pakistan...in the Kargil war. As a mark of respect...I have come here to pay my tribute," he said. Yeddyurappa will take oath today at 6 pm.

headlines: Will take back unparliamentary words if BJP does: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Friday said he doesn't think any unparliamentary words were used in Lok Sabha, but he would take back his words if BJP MPs take theirs back. This comes a day after SP MP Azam Khan's remark to BJP MP Rama Devi. Khan's remark was condemned in the Parliament with MPs asking for his suspension.

headlines: Plea for national anthem status to Vande Mataram dismissed
text: Delhi High Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking to declare 'Vande Mataram' the national anthem on par with 'Jana Gana Mana'. The plea filed by BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay also sought to ensure that 'Vande Mataram' is sung in schools every day. Every citizen should cherish and follow the ideals which inspired the struggle for freedom, the petition stated.

headlines: Vice Prez rejects Pak's 'terrorists trained in Kashmir' claim
text: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Thursday said he was happy about Pakistan admitting it has terrorists, but it was wrong in saying they are trained in Kashmir. "They are trained in your part of the country, you should...take steps," Naidu said. Earlier, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said their country has 40,000 militants who trained and fought in Afghanistan and Kashmir.

headlines: 62 celebrities write against letter sent to PM over lynching cases
text: Sixty-two celebrities, including Kangana Ranaut and CBFC chief Prasoon Joshi have written against the open letter sent to PM Narendra Modi by 49 celebrities over rising lynching cases in India. The letter questions their "selective outrage" and "false narrative". "PM has spoken out against [lynching] repeatedly and respective state governments are empowered to take action," their letter further reads.

headlines: Iran releases 9 of 12 Indians held from detained ship MT Riah
text: Iran has released nine out of 12 Indians who were onboard Panama-flagged ship MT Riah, which was detained on July 13. However, 21 Indians are still in Iran's detention, which also includes 18 from British-flagged oil tanker Stena Impero that was seized last week. Meanwhile, Indian Embassy on Thursday got consular access to those Indians who were on Impero.

headlines: Pakistan's Mohammad Amir retires from Test cricket at the age of 27
text: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir has announced his retirement from Test cricket at the age of 27, saying he wants to concentrate on white-ball cricket. Amir, who was Pakistan's highest wicket-taker in the 2019 World Cup, represented his nation in 36 Tests and picked up 119 wickets. Amir had made his Test debut against Sri Lanka as a 17-year-old in 2009.

headlines: Give A$AP Rocky his freedom: Trump asks Sweden for rapper's release
text: US President Donald Trump has called upon Sweden to "give A$AP Rocky his freedom", calling for his release from custody. "Very disappointed in [Swedish] Prime Minister Stefan Löfven for being unable to act. Sweden has let our African American Community down in the US," Trump said. The rapper has been charged with assault over a fight in Stockholm last month.

headlines: SoftBank forms $108 billion Vision Fund 2 with Apple, Microsoft
text: Japan's SoftBank announced a second Vision Fund totalling $108 billion, with backing from Microsoft, Foxconn, Apple and Kazakhstan, among others. SoftBank will invest $38 billion in Vision Fund 2, more than the $28 billion it invested in the first fund. Saudi Arabia, which contributed $45 billion for the first $97 billion fund, was absent from list of investors on Friday.

headlines: Apple buys 'majority' of Intel's smartphone modem biz for $1 bn
text: Apple has announced the acquisition of "majority" of chipmaker Intel's smartphone modem business in a deal valued at $1 billion, which "is expected to close in fourth quarter of 2019". Apple will intake 2,200 Intel workers along with equipment, intellectual property and leases. Notably, Intel had cancelled plans for 5G modems after Apple settled its 2-year-long dispute with Qualcomm.

headlines: Elon Musk's Boring Company gets $120 mn in 1st external funding
text: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk's tunnel-digging startup, The Boring Company, has raised $120 million in its first external funding round. The investment saw participation from Silicon Valley-based 8VC and Dubai-based Vy Capital, among others. This comes months after the startup secured its first contract to build a high-speed underground transit system in Las Vegas for nearly $49 million.

headlines: Nissan to cut 12,500 jobs worldwide; 1,700 in India
text: Nissan has announced it will cut 12,500 jobs globally over the next three years, with 1,700 of them expected to be in India. It said it'll reduce its production capacity and the number of models it produces by 10% by the end of 2022. Nissan, which employs 139,000 people worldwide, posted one of its worst quarterly performances in a decade.

headlines: Chandrayaan-2 successfully enters 2nd of 5 planned orbits: ISRO
text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has announced the second successful orbit-raising move of India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2. The 3,850-kg Chandrayaan-2 spacecraft is planned to undergo three more such orbit raises before attempting India's first soft Moon landing on September 7. If successful, India will become the first in the world to land on Moon's south polar region.

headlines: Tigress beaten to death with sticks in UP after it injures 9 people
text: A tigress succumbed to injuries after a group of villagers attacked her with sticks in a village close to Pilibhit Tiger Reserve in Uttar Pradesh on Thursday, a day after it injured nine people. Post-mortem report revealed that the tigress had fractured ribs and bones and punctured lungs. Forest officials have registered FIR against 31 named and 12 unidentified people.

headlines: Fake US presidential seal used during Trump's speech
text: A fake US presidential seal was used during President Donald Trump's speech at an event in Washington DC on Tuesday. The image included a two-headed eagle resembling that in the Russian coat of arms. The eagle in the image had golf clubs in its left talons, instead of arrows, and cash in its right talons, instead of an olive branch.

headlines: Will go to Iran to tell people the harm their leaders caused: Pompeo
text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has said that he will "happily" go to Iran to address the Iranian people about US foreign policy amid tensions between the two countries. "I'd like a chance to go, not do propaganda but speak the truth to the Iranian people about how their leadership has harmed Iran," he added.

headlines: Missile test a warning to South Korean 'warmongers': Kim Jong-un
text: North Korea leader Kim Jong-un has said that the country's latest missile test was a warning to South Korean "warmongers" to stop importing weapons and conducting joint military drills. He also accused South Koreans of "double-dealing". South Korea's leader should stop such "suicidal acts" and "should not make a mistake of ignoring the warning", Kim added.

headlines: Hoping for the best: Man Utd manager Ole on Bailly's injury
text: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has said that he is 'hoping for best' after defender Eric Bailly had been stretchered off in the team's 2019 International Champions Cup match against Tottenham on Thursday. "It's not worth it when you lose one. He's done his knee but we are not sure how bad it is," Solskjaer added.

headlines: Brazil reach the second spot in FIFA team rankings
text: Brazil reached the second spot in the FIFA national team rankings after they lifted the Copa America title for the ninth time earlier this month. Brazil, who are placed behind Belgium, jumped over the 2018 World Cup-winners France. Algeria climbed 28 places to reach the 40th rank following their Africa Cup of Nations victory over Senegal in the final.

headlines: We will definitely perform better at Tokyo Games: Kiren Rijiju
text: Union Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju addressed the Parliament on Thursday and said India will definitely perform better at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. "We are training more than 14,000 players all over the country in different centres. We are focusing on the rural talent and hope that they will get an Olympic medal for the country in future," Rijiju added.

headlines: Will play as hard as possible despite Malinga's exit: Tamim
text: Speaking about facing Sri Lanka's Lasith Malinga before his retirement, Bangladesh's stand-in captain Tamim Iqbal said, "[W]e will not keep it in our head that it will be his last match and will try to play as hard as possible.'' "I think he is a great ambassador of this game," Tamim added about the 35-year-old Sri Lankan pacer.

headlines: Why is JD(U) with BJP if it opposes triple talaq bill? Rabri
text: RJD leader Rabri Devi on Thursday criticised Bihar's ruling party JD(U) for sharing power with BJP despite opposing it on issues like the triple talaq bill. "The party has been known for...saying something and doing something altogether different," Rabri said. JD(U) staged a walkout from Lok Sabha during the debate on the triple talaq bill brought by the BJP government.

headlines: 26 of 28 Cong Cabinet Ministers in MP are my friends: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Sanjay Satyendra Pathak on Thursday refuted rumours of joining Congress saying, though he is friends with 26 of the 28 Congress ministers in the Madhya Pradesh cabinet, BJP will continue being his home. Rumours of BJP leaders joining Congress started after two BJP MLAs voted along with Congress on an amendment bill in the State Assembly on Wednesday.

headlines: Azam Khan should be disqualified from Parliament: NCW
text: After Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's remark on BJP MP Rama Devi, the National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Thursday demanded Khan's disqualification from Parliament. "This is a shameful remark. He is now doing this repeatedly," she said. "I'm so fond of you...I feel like looking into your eyes," Khan had told the BJP MP.

headlines: Amrapali-like fraud won't happen again: Govt tells SC
text: The government on Thursday told the Supreme Court that a mechanism to check diversion of funds by builders has been put in place to ensure large-scale frauds like Amrapali don't recur. Additional Solicitor General Madhavi Divan said that it is now mandatory for real estate companies to deposit 70% of the money raised from homebuyers in a separate bank account.

headlines: Maybe PM Modi said meditate, Trump heard mediate: Khurshid
text: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Thursday remarked on the Kashmir issue saying, "Maybe Prime Minister Modi wanted to say why don't you meditate for Yoga and [US President Trump] thought Modi was asking to mediate." "It was a problem of communication. But...if you are not able to communicate properly, what kind of diplomacy you are having," Khurshid added.

headlines: Great Learning offers PG in Digital Marketing with Great Lakes
text: Great Learning's PG program in Strategic Digital Marketing helps build job-ready skills by working on real campaigns with ad budgets and showcasing it through e-portfolios. This online program teaches Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Facebook & Instagram ads, MailChimp, SEO and more. Participants get mentored by leading digital marketing experts and receive a PG certificate from Great Lakes Institute of Management.

headlines: BJP stakes claim to form govt in K'taka; Yeddyurappa to be CM
text: The BJP has staked claim to form government in Karnataka three days after the Congress-JD(S) coalition government failed the floor test. BS Yeddyurappa, who met state Governor Vajubhai Vala, will take oath as Chief Minister at Raj Bhavan at 6 PM today. The Congress-JD(S) alliance received 99 votes against the BJP's 105 in the floor test.

headlines: Unforgettable: PM shares pics from his visit to Kargil during war
text: Sharing pictures from his visit to Kargil during the war in 1999, PM Narendra Modi said, "The visit...and interactions with soldiers are unforgettable." "I had the opportunity to...show solidarity with our brave soldiers," he added. PM Modi further said, "This was the time when I was working for my party in J&K as well as Himachal Pradesh."

headlines: Was bleeding while shooting for 'Chaiyya...' on top of train: Malaika
text: Malaika Arora has revealed that a rope was used to stop her from swaying atop the train while shooting for 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' song. "The team tied a rope through my ghaghra to my waist and...to the train so that it'd help me balance my body...When I removed [it], I had cuts near my waist and it started bleeding," she added.

headlines: Yuvraj walks off despite being not out on Global T20 Canada debut
text: Playing for Toronto Nationals in opening match of Global T20 Canada, Yuvraj Singh walked off despite being not out. The 37-year-old was stumped in Vancouver Knights' bowler Rizwan Cheema's over after the wicketkeeper dropped the catch on the stumps. Yuvraj was still in crease as per the replays but he had already walked before the replays were checked.

headlines: Azam Khan has no right to stay in LS: BJP MP on his 'eyes' remark
text: BJP MP Rama Devi has said Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan has no right to stay in Lok Sabha, adding that she would request the Speaker to dismiss him. "Azam Khan has never respected women...He must apologise," Devi said. Azam Khan had told Devi, "I'm so fond of you...I feel like looking into your eyes."

headlines: Snapdeal Founders booked after alleged delivery of fake Woodland items
text: Rajasthan Police have registered a cheating case against Snapdeal Founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal after Congress leader Inder Mohan Singh Honey alleged the online shopping site sent him fake Woodland products. Singh said he took the products to a Woodland showroom after doubting their genuineness. This comes after Casio sued Snapdeal for allegedly selling fake versions of its brand.

headlines: Fake WhatsApp message claims man dead, family gets condolence messages
text: Mumbai's 43-year-old Ravindra Dusange is assuring people he's alive after he came across messages expressing grief over his sudden death over WhatsApp last weekend. So far, his family has received around 400 condolence messages and calls. Dahisar Police have taken a written complaint from Dusange, who suspects an acquaintance is behind this incident.

headlines: You'll get a bloodier nose next time: Army chief Rawat to Pakistan
text: On the occasion of the 20th Kargil Vijay Diwas, Army chief Bipin Rawat in his message to Pakistan said, "You'll get a bloodier nose next time." He also said, "I want to convey to our countrymen that you can rest assured that any task given to defence services will always be accomplished, no matter how difficult it is."

headlines: US resumes use of death penalty after 16 years
text: The US Justice Department is set to resume the use of death penalty after 16 years. The department has immediately scheduled executions of five death row federal inmates. There are currently 62 federal inmates on death row. US President Donald Trump has called for increasing the use of the death penalty for drug traffickers and mass shooters.

headlines: Ukraine seizes Russian tanker that blocked its ships last year
text: Ukraine's security service has seized a Russian tanker that allegedly blocked its ships in the Kerch Strait last year. Russia had allegedly used the tanker to block three Ukrainian naval vessels before detaining them and 24 Ukrainian sailors. Ukraine said the Russian tanker was previously called 'Neyma' and its owners had changed its name to 'Nika Spirit' to avoid detection.

headlines: Sandeep Warrier to replace Navdeep Saini for West Indies A Tests
text: Kerala pacer Sandeep Warrier will replace Navdeep Saini in India A squad which is currently touring West Indies. This comes after Saini was picked for the senior Indian cricket team for the T20I and ODI series against West Indies. Sandeep will fly to West Indies on Friday and will only be available for selection for second and third unofficial Tests.

headlines: 'Funnel Wall' in Germany produces its own music every time it rains
text: A building in the 'Neustadt Kunsthofpassage' in Germany's Dresden city has a colourful drainage system full of pipes and funnels that produces music on its own every time it rains. The system amplifies the sound of rain to produce music. Sculptor Annette Paul and designers Christoph Rossner and André Tempel, who lived in the building itself, created it.

headlines: Shame on Azam Khan: Smriti Irani on his remark on Rama Devi
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Thursday posted a tweet saying, "Shame on Azam Khan" for his remark on MP Rama Devi, further calling him a blot on all male legislators. Khan's shameful remark is a reflection of his character, her tweet read. Irani also criticised SP chief Akhilesh Yadav for defending Khan, saying Yadav proved his thinking is the same.

headlines: Azam Khan needs training on how MPs behave: Sumitra Mahajan
text: Former Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan on Thursday said that only suspension wouldn't suffice, adding that MPs like Azam Khan need special training on how to behave in Parliament. Khan had told BJP MP Rama Devi, "I want to keep looking into your eyes." "Unless he seeks an apology, [Khan] shouldn't be allowed to speak in the House," Sumitra added.

headlines: Take it as compliment: NCP MP on Azam Khan's remark to BJP MP
text: NCP MP Majeed Memon on Friday said Azam Khan's remark on BJP MP Rama Devi should be taken as a compliment for which there should be appreciation. "[Khan] didn't say with meaning any disrespect to the honourable chairperson," Memon said. Khan had told Devi who was presiding over the Lok Sabha session, "I want to keep looking into your eyes."

headlines: Toyota invests $600 million in China's Didi Chuxing
text: Japanese multinational automaker Toyota has invested $600 million in Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing. As part of the deal, the two entities will also set up a joint venture with 'GAC Toyota', GAC Group and Toyota's joint venture, for vehicle-related services for Didi drivers. Didi was reportedly in talks with Nissan and China's Dongfeng Group to form another fleet-management venture.

headlines: SoftBank to commit $40 billion to its 2nd Vision Fund: Report
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank is committing $40 billion to its upcoming second Vision Fund, the Wall Street Journal reported. The second fund has reportedly secured investment from Goldman Sachs and Standard Chartered and is in fundraising talks with Microsoft. The first $100-billion Vision Fund was launched with $60 billion in backing from Saudi Arabia and Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth funds.

headlines: Kanpur policeman suspended for misbehaving with woman complainant
text: The UP Police on Thursday suspended a policeman in Kanpur for misbehaving with a woman who came to the police station to register an eve-teasing complaint. "After taking due note of the conduct of the policeman, the concerned person has been suspended and departmental action has been initiated," said SP Raveena Tyagi. The video of the incident had gone viral.

headlines: Efforts on for making Hindi an official language of UN: Govt
text: MoS for External Affairs V Muraleedharan on Thursday said the government has been making efforts for promotion of Hindi as an official language of UN. An MoU was signed in March 2018 for increasing UN's production of Hindi content, he said. In July 2018, UN launched Hindi versions of its social media content on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram, Muraleedharan added.

headlines: Man arrested for sharing objectionable post on PM Modi
text: The police have arrested a man in Uttar Pradesh for sharing objectionable posts on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "The accused Fayaz Ahmed...has been sent to jail under the IT Act," said Avinash Pandey, SP Meerut (Rural). Recently, a man in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida was also booked for allegedly making objectionable comments against the PM on social media.

headlines: Pak admitted presence of terror camps, should act now: MEA
text: After Pakistan's admission that there were 40 militant groups operating in its territory, External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said it's time for Pakistan to take credible and irreversible action against the terror camps. Kumar further said that while it's a glaring admission, this isn't the first time Pakistan has admitted the presence of terrorists who are sent to India.

headlines: Sonu Sood travels to Sri Lanka to attend female fan's wedding
text: Actor Sonu Sood travelled to Sri Lanka to attend the wedding ceremony of a female fan. Sharing a picture of himself with the newlyweds, Sonu wrote, "Congratulations @madara.w.hemachandra and #tharaka. Have a great life ahead". Photographer Manav Manglani shared the same picture and wrote, "@Sonu_Sood's super sweet gesture for a fan as he attended her wedding in Sri Lanka!"

headlines: Steve Irwin's daughter Bindi gets engaged at zoo, shares pics
text: Bindi Irwin, the daughter of the late 'Crocodile Hunter' Steve Irwin, took to Instagram to share pictures of her engagement to her longtime boyfriend Chandler Powell at Australia Zoo in Queensland on her 21st birthday. The duo had met in 2013 when Powell was visiting the Irwin family's Australia Zoo. Powell is a 22-year-old wakeboarder from Florida.

headlines: Rohit runs up to Kohli to discuss things: Bharat Arun on reports of rift
text: Team India bowling coach Bharat Arun has dismissed reports of rift between Team India captain Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. "Rohit often runs up to Kohli to discuss things. They get along very well, share great admiration for each others abilities," he added. "The spirit in the camp was wonderful throughout [during the 2019 World Cup]," he further said.

headlines: Change in Team India coach may affect team: BCCI official
text: A BCCI official has said that Team India head coach Ravi Shastri and captain Virat Kohli complement each other well and it would be unfair to change half of a team that has been successful. "A change in coach may prove to disturb the equation that exists, which allows the players to have the mental space to excel," he added.

headlines: Yuvraj's father says he's fan of Dhoni after calling him 'filth'
text: After having earlier called MS Dhoni 'filth', Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh said he is MS Dhoni's fan. "There's no doubt...he has been serving India for a long time. He's a legendary player," he added. "The way he has played...the way he has led the side, the kind of decisions he has taken, has been very good," Yograj further said.

headlines: New Zealand's Mike Hesson to apply for India head coach job: Reports
text: Ex-New Zealand coach Mike Hesson is set to apply for the Indian cricket team head coach job, as per reports. Hesson was the head coach of New Zealand for six years before resigning in 2018. Hesson also coached KXIP in the Indian Premier League's 2019 season. BCCI has asked candidates to send their applications on or before July 30.

headlines: Karnataka Speaker disqualifies 3 rebel MLAs till May 2023
text: Karnataka Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Thursday disqualified three rebel MLAs under the anti-defection law till May 2023 when the term of the current Assembly will end. The disqualified MLAs are Independent MLA R Shankar and Congress MLAs Ramesh L Jarkiholi and Mahesh Kumathalli. Karnataka Congress chief Dinesh Gundu Rao tweeted that he "wholeheartedly welcomes" the order.

headlines: SC orders cinema halls to play clips on prevention of child abuse
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday ordered cinema halls across the country to screen clips on prevention of child abuse and prosecution of crimes against children. The court asked the Ministry of Women and Child Development to ensure suitable clips are screened. The apex court also ordered TV channels to show these clips along with child helpline numbers.

headlines: India avails consular access to Indians on board Iran-seized tanker
text: V Muraleedharan, the Minister of State for External Affairs, informed on Thursday that the Indian Embassy in Iran availed the consular access to the Indian nationals on board the British-flagged oil tanker seized by Iran. "All 18 Indian crew members on board are safe and doing fine. Will continue to push for their early release," Muraleedharan wrote in a tweet.

headlines: BJP leader asks filmmaker who wrote to PM on lynchings to go to moon
text: Kerala BJP spokesperson B Gopalakrishnan on Thursday asked veteran filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan to go to the moon if he did not want to hear "Jai Sri Ram" chants. Adoor is one of the 49 celebrities who wrote to PM Narendra Modi over growing incidents of mob lynching in the country, saying, "Jai Sri Ram has become a war cry today".

headlines: SC asks Centre to set up exclusive courts for POCSO cases in 60 days
text: The Supreme Court has ordered the Centre to set up exclusive courts in every district with more than 100 pending cases under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, which would hear only such cases. The SC said the courts would be set up under a central scheme and gave the Centre 60 days to start the courts.

headlines: Buffett lunch winner apologises for 'excessive self-promotion'
text: Chinese cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun, who postponed his $4.6 million charity lunch with Warren Buffett after falling ill with kidney stones, has apologised for "excessive self-promotion". "This has resulted in a bad influence on the public, and incited the worries of the regulatory bodies which care for me," he said. Sun apologised to Chinese leaders and regulators, media and public.

headlines: We need to have teams with separate divisions: Bhaichung Bhutia
text: Former Indian football team captain Bhaichung Bhutia has said that like other countries, India needs to have "a bigger number" of clubs with separate divisions. "[S]ay 1st, 2nd and 3rd divisions, where we can have relegation and promotion system," the 42-year-old added. Notably, there is a rift between ISL and I-League for the senior-most league status in India.

headlines: PCB terms Imam-ul-Haq scandal personal issue, refuses to comment
text: The Pakistan Cricket Board today refused to comment on the scandal surrounding cricketer Imam-ul-Haq, terming it a personal issue. Imam-ul-Haq has been accused of manipulating and cheating on multiple women. Several WhatsApp chats of the 23-year-old cricketer were leaked on Twitter. The user who leaked the chats had said, "Imam kept telling [the women] the whole time how he's single."

headlines: Trump vetoes attempt to block $8-billion arms sales to Saudi, UAE
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday vetoed three congressional resolutions to stop arms sales worth over $8 billion to Saudi Arabia and the UAE. Members of the US Congress have opposed the sales over the use of arms in Yemen's civil war, Saudi Arabia's human rights abuses and the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi in Istanbul last year.

headlines: PMO asks Finance Ministry to restudy issuing overseas bonds: Reports
text: The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has reportedly asked Finance Ministry to reassess the plan of issuing overseas sovereign bonds and have wider consultations with the stakeholders. The PMO wasn't properly informed of the consequences of foreign currency-denominated bonds by ex-Finance Secretary SC Garg, reports said. Reportedly, the Centre may instead issue rupee-denominated offshore bonds.

headlines: Ex-RBI Guv Jalan backs govt's plan to issue overseas bonds
text: Former RBI Governor Bimal Jalan backed the government's plan to raise money through overseas sovereign bonds, saying India is in a "fortunate" position and can go ahead with it. He said, "Our debt to GDP ratio isn't very high...exchange rate is stable...so long-term foreign borrowing isn't a problem." Earlier, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan had warned of the plan's risks.

headlines: Suchitra claims getting message asking for phone sex; shares pic
text: Singer Suchitra Krishnamoorthi has tagged Mumbai Police in a tweet, alleging that she received a lewd message from a man on Facebook. She shared the screenshot of the message, wherein the man asked if they can "have sex on the phone".
