Mumbai Police responded and said they have forwarded her concern to their Social Media cell and Cyber police station.

headlines: Lok Sabha passes Triple Talaq Bill; Congress, JD(U), TMC stage walkout
text: Lok Sabha today passed The Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019, with 303 votes in favour of the Bill and 82 votes against it. Congress, JD(U) and TMC MPs staged walkout from the Lok Sabha in protest against the Bill. The Bill criminalises instant triple talaq and seeks up to three years in jail for the guilty.

headlines: RTI (Amendment) Bill passed in Rajya Sabha amid Opposition walkout
text: The Right to Information (Amendment) Bill, 2019 was passed by Rajya Sabha today even as the Opposition staged a walkout. The bill, proposing to give Centre the power to set tenure and salaries of Chief Information Commissioner and Information Commissioners, was passed in Lok Sabha on Monday. The Opposition argued the bill will take away the independence of RTI authorities.

headlines: I was told I'd be killed: Actor who wrote to PM on lynching cases
text: Actor Kaushik Sen, one of the 49 celebrities who had written a letter to PM Narendra Modi over rising lynching cases in India, has claimed that he received death threat from an unknown number. "I was told that I'd be killed if I don't mend my ways," he said. The phone number has been forwarded to the police, he said.

headlines: My name is inspired from Priyanka's Anjaana Anjaani character: Kiara
text: Actress Kiara Advani, who changed her real name Alia to Kiara on entering Bollywood, revealed that the name was inspired from Priyanka Chopra's character in the 2010 film 'Anjaana Anjaani'. "I thought, 'What a beautiful name. If I have a daughter, I'll call her Kiara'. But before that I needed a name for myself," she added.

headlines: Ireland's 1st Test 5-wicket haul taker had taken 1,181 pro wickets
text: London-born Tim Murtagh, who picked up Ireland's first-ever five-wicket haul in Test cricket on Wednesday against England at Lord's, had picked 1,181 professional wickets before the match. The 37-year-old, who had made his first-class debut for English county side Surrey in 2000, had taken 34 five-wicket haul in 228 first-class matches prior to the Lord's Test against England.

headlines: Rebel K'taka MLA says Siddaramaiah behind resignations, ex-CM denies
text: Two days after the collapse of Karnataka government, rebel Congress MLA Shivaram Hebbar said, "Siddaramaiah was the one who instigated us. We are still with Congress and we have nothing to do with BJP forming government." Former CM Siddaramaiah took to Twitter to respond to the claims and said, "This is nothing but a false allegation with mala fide intention."

headlines: He didn't mean disrespect: Akhilesh on Azam's remark on female MP
text: Defending Samajwadi Party (SP) MP Azam Khan over his statement on BJP MP Rama Devi, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "I don't think he meant any disrespect to Devi. BJP MPs are so rude, who are they to raise fingers?" Khan had told Devi who was presiding over the Lok Sabha session, "I want to keep looking into your eyes."

headlines: College student discovers 65 million-year-old Triceratops skull in US
text: Harrison Duran, a fifth-year biology student at the University of California, Merced, unearthed a 65 million-year-old Triceratops skull during a dig in the Badlands of North Dakota with experienced excavator Michael Kjelland. The skull was found among Cretaceous period plant fossils. "I've been obsessed with dinosaurs since I was a kid, so it was a pretty big deal," Duran said.

headlines: 1st Pakistani to be sent to space in 2022: Pak Science Minister
text: Pakistan's Federal Minister for Science & Technology Fawad Hussain has announced that Pakistan plans to send its first citizen to space in the year 2022. "Selection process for the first Pakistani to be sent to space shall begin from February 2020, 50 people will be shortlisted," he said. "This will be the biggest space event of our history," he added.

headlines: US sanctions can't affect our 'time-tested' ties with India: Russia
text: The US' sanctions cannot affect the "time-tested" bilateral relations between India and Russia, Roman Babushkin, Deputy Chief of Mission, Embassy of Russia, said. Notably, the US has imposed sanctions on purchasing arms from Russia. Babushkin's statement comes as India signed a deal with Russia to purchase five units of S-400 air defence systems.

headlines: Felt like I came after winning World Cup: Pak PM on return from US
text: Following his return to Islamabad from the US, Pakistan PM Imran Khan told a gathering of supporters at the airport, "I felt as if I came home after winning the World Cup and not from an official visit." Khan was on a three-day visit to the US as part of his first official trip to the country since assuming office.

headlines: Cocaine, women & racism unite Imran Khan & UK PM: Khan's ex-wife
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan listed cocaine addiction, racist views and relationship with women as some of the commonalities between her ex-husband and new UK PM Boris Johnson. She further said both the leaders propagate fake news and called them "racist sons of immigrants". Reham added both Khan and Johnson have insecurities, claiming their "childhoods weren't the happiest".

headlines: Saudi oil minister says Reliance-Aramco stake sale talks continue
text: Saudi oil minister Khalid al-Falih has said that state-run Saudi Aramco's talks with Reliance Industries to buy a minority stake in the Indian conglomerate's refining business have not stalled. The Mukesh Ambani-led company operates the world's biggest refining complex at Jamnagar. "The two companies, Reliance and Aramco, are talking with a lot of goodwill, with good intention," al-Falih said.

headlines: Home Minister Amit Shah to head panel on workplace sexual harassment
text: Home Minister Amit Shah will chair a panel of four cabinet ministers to examine ways to prevent workplace sexual harassment. The panel includes Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "The group of ministers was set up on July 18 since the previous panel lapsed ahead of the formation of new government," Home Ministry said.

headlines: Auto parts makers warn of 10 lakh job cuts if slowdown continues
text: The Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India (ACMA) has said the country's auto parts industry could be forced to cut 10 lakh jobs if the slowdown in vehicle sales continues. India's passenger vehicle sales fell 18.4% in the first quarter. The drop in production "has led to a crisis like situation in the auto component sector," the industry group said.

headlines: Ehsan Mani named ICC's financial affairs committee head
text: The ICC has appointed Pakistan Cricket Board's Chairman Ehsan Mani as Chairperson of ICC's Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee (F&CA). Mani, also a part of ICC's Audit Committee, will be taking decisions including identifying the events ICC will host in its next cycle. Mani, who was ICC's first-ever F&CA Chairman will be serving the post for the second time.

headlines: Join cleanliness drive: BJP to Pragya Thakur after 'toilet' remark
text: The BJP on Thursday ordered Bhopal MP Pragya Thakur to take part in a cleanliness drive and show her support to the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan by sweeping. This comes after Thakur said she hasn't been elected to clean drains and toilets. Earlier, she was reportedly asked by the party to not make statements that go against BJP's ideologies and campaigns.

headlines: Tesla posts quarterly loss of $408 million, shares fall 12%
text: Electric carmaker Tesla has posted a loss of about $408 million for the June quarter, alongside revenue of about $6.35 billion for the same quarter. The electric carmaker also announced its Co-founder JB Straubel was stepping down from the role of the CTO after about 16 years. Tesla shares were down nearly 12% in pre-market trading on Thursday.

headlines: Startup iSpace achieves China's 1st private satellite launch
text: Chinese aerospace startup iSpace has successfully launched two satellites into space, marking the first successful orbital launch by a privately funded firm in China. The satellites were carried aboard the startup's Hyperbola-1 rocket. Earlier, Chinese aerospace startups LandSpace and OneSpace had attempted orbital launches in October 2018 and March 2019 respectively but were unsuccessful.

headlines: Bombs hurled, shots fired at West Bengal BJP MP's residence
text: Unidentified miscreants allegedly hurled bombs and fired shots on Wednesday at BJP MP Arjun Singh's residence in West Bengal. Chairman of Bhatpara Municipality and Singh's nephew, Sourav Singh said he was standing outside the house with four others when four bombs were hurled. "We rushed to the spot...Suddenly they started firing and of course, I was their target," he added.

headlines: Guj policewoman dances in police station for TikTok video; suspended
text: A Gujarat policewoman named Arpita Chaudhary has been suspended after a TikTok video in which she was seen dancing in front of a lock-up inside Langhnaj police station went viral. Shot in Gujarat's Mehsana, the video showed the on-duty policewoman dancing to a Bollywood track in civilian clothes. The video was reportedly shot on July 20.

headlines: Abhay Deol shares meme to respond to fans over absence from B'wood
text: Actor Abhay Deol has shared a meme on himself, depicting his absence from films. He wrote, "Found this online. Illustrates very well a question I get asked by the people and the press all the time- 'Why do we not see you more often on the big screen?'" "It's a loaded question, one I cannot answer in short," he added.

headlines: What is the five-team finals series introduced in Big Bash League?
text: A five-team finals series has been introduced for 2019/20 Big Bash League to reward teams that finish in top two in league stage. The series will be played between the top five teams and will comprise five matches: The Eliminator, The Qualifier, The Knock-Out, The Challenger and The Final. The finals series will be played over two weekends.

headlines: Builders cheating homebuyers no less than rape: BJP MP Vijay Goel
text: BJP MP Vijay Goel on Thursday said in the Rajya Sabha that the builders who cheat homebuyers should be hanged because "their crime is no less than rape". Goel also demanded action against the celebrities who promote the projects, and against bank officials and city authorities who are involved in corruption along with the builders.

headlines: Policeman shames girl reporting eve-teasing over 'lot of jewellery'
text: A video has surfaced online, showing a head constable in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur shaming a girl over her attire after she comes to a police station to report eve-teasing. The girl can be seen telling how three youths teased and dragged her, following which the policeman objects, "Why are you wearing a ring and necklace? Why wear so many items?"

headlines: Feel like looking into your eyes, Azam Khan tells MP Devi; criticised
text: Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan told BJP MP Rama Devi who was presiding over the session in Lok Sabha, "I'm so fond of you...I feel like looking into your eyes." "This isn't the way to talk," Devi told Khan, asking to expunge his remarks. "I declare my resignation if I said anything unparliamentary," Khan said as others demanded an apology.

headlines: I've never bowed down to anyone: Pak PM denies 'begging' abroad
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that he has never bowed down before anyone and won't let his nation do so, countering opposition leader Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's claim that he 'begged' abroad. Khan's statement came as he returned to Pakistan from an official visit to the US. Bilawal had said that Khan had caused "embarrassment" to Pakistan during his visit.

headlines: SC Garg resigns from IAS after being moved from Finance to Power Ministry
text: Senior bureaucrat Subhash Chandra Garg on Thursday said he has applied for voluntary retirement from IAS with effect from October 31 following his appointment as Power Secretary. Garg, a 1983 batch IAS officer of the Rajasthan cadre, was serving as Economic Affairs and Finance Secretary. Disinvestment secretary Atanu Chakraborty took charge of the Economic Affairs Department today.

headlines: Moved from Finance to Power Ministry, Garg seeks retirement: Reports
text: Ex-Economic Affairs Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg has reportedly sought early retirement after he was appointed as Secretary in the Power Ministry on Wednesday. The 58-year-old was overseeing India's plan to sell its first offshore sovereign bonds. A 1983 batch IAS officer from Rajasthan, Garg was a member on a panel studying the transfer of RBI's excess reserves to the government.

headlines: Pune mall sets up wax statues of Hollywood celebrities
text: Pune's Phoenix Marketcity mall has set up the 'Hollywood Wax of Fame', showcasing statues of different Hollywood celebrities. Fourteen wax statues, including that of Marilyn Monroe, Will Smith, Jackie Chan and Johnny Depp are spread across the mall. Nitin Desai, owner of ND Studio, which is a film and television production studio is behind the idea of the wax statues.

headlines: Sindhu, Praneeth enter Japan Open quarters; Prannoy ousted
text: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Sai Praneeth progressed to the quarter-finals at the Japan Open while HS Prannoy crashed out of the tournament. World number five Sindhu defeated world number 20 Aya Ohori 11-21, 21-10, 21-13, while world number 23 Praneeth defeated world number 17 Japan's Kanta Tsuneyama 21-13, 21-16. HS Prannoy lost to Denmark's Rasmus Gemke 9-21, 15-21.

headlines: Griezmann features for Barcelona for 1st time in loss to Chelsea
text: French forward Antoine Griezmann, recently signed by Barcelona for £107 million, featured for the club for the first time as his team lost 1-2 to Chelsea in their first pre-season friendly. Forward Tammy Abraham and midfielder Ross Barkley scored for Chelsea in 34th and 81st minute respectively. This was Chelsea's second pre-season friendly win under new manager Frank Lampard.

headlines: HP Enterprise to invest $500 million in India over 5 years
text: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE), the IT and business services entity of HP, has announced it will invest $500 million in India over the next five years. The investment will primarily be to increase its operations, manufacturing and number of employees in the country. HPE said it plans to increase its India workforce by 20% in the next three to five years.

headlines: Facebook admits Sony, Microsoft could access data regularly
text: Facebook, while announcing the record $5-billion FTC fine over privacy scandals, admitted its code had allowed "continued data access" to 12 partners even after it had wound down integrations in late 2018. "Only two (partners), Microsoft and Sony, continued to access limited types of friends data," Facebook said. It added it will "immediately" resolve the bug and end the access.

headlines: 4 BJP MLAs in contact, will reveal when MP CM asks: Computer Baba
text: Self-styled godman Computer Baba claimed that four Madhya Pradesh BJP MLAs are in his contact and whenever CM Kamal Nath will ask, he'll present them before all. He said that they're expecting that they'll be included in government. This comes after two BJP MLAs, on Wednesday, voted in favour of a legislation backed by the Congress in the state Assembly.

headlines: Party united, no groupism: MP BJP chief after 2 MLAs back Cong
text: A day after two BJP MLAs voted in favour of a legislation backed by the Congress in Madhya Pradesh Assembly, state BJP chief Rakesh Singh said that the party is "united" and there's no "groupism". He added, "We didn't seek a division of votes on Wednesday." Singh further said that everything is "conducive" for the party and nothing has happened.

headlines: Andhra Speaker suspends 4 TDP MLAs from Assembly
text: Andhra Pradesh Speaker Thammineni Seetharam on Thursday suspended four TDP MLAs from the state Assembly for the rest of the day for obstructing the proceedings of the House. The Speaker took the move after Legislative Affairs Minister B Rajendranath proposed their suspension. On Tuesday, Deputy Speaker had suspended three TDP MLAs for the rest of the Budget session.

headlines: Man beaten to death by mob in Bihar for shooting teacher
text: A man was beaten to death by a mob in Bihar's Jamui on Wednesday for allegedly shooting a teacher. The deceased, identified as Amar Singh, shot a teacher in the leg and then hid inside a house in the neighbourhood, the police said. The man was later found by the mob and thrashed to death, they added.

headlines: Man held after gun found in his lunch box at Patna airport
text: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) on Thursday arrested a man at Patna airport after a gun was found in the lunch box kept inside his luggage, officials said. The officials informed that the man had booked a ticket to fly to Delhi. He was handed over to the local police and the matter is being investigated, the officials added.

headlines: IndiGo asks ex-PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi to join board: Reports
text: IndiGo's board has reportedly approached former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi for the position of independent director, amid plans to expand the board from six to 10 members. The lack of an independent woman director was one of the governance issues raised by IndiGo Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal in his complaint to SEBI. Four independent directors in total would be brought onboard.

headlines: No one picked on 'Sanju' when he says he slept with 300 girls: Shahid
text: Speaking about 'Kabir Singh' being accused of glorifying 'toxic masculinity', Shahid Kapoor said, "'Sanju' had a scene where the guy [says] he has slept with over 300 women. No one picked on it the way they went after 'Kabir Singh'". However, Shahid added he "thoroughly enjoyed" 'Sanju' because he "didn't watch it to see how people should be."

headlines: England once used 4 wicketkeepers in a Test, no one took a catch
text: During a Test against New Zealand from July 24-29, 1986, England fielded four different wicketkeepers. Designated wicketkeeper Bruce French got injured while batting and got to keep only on the fourth day for one ball. Bill Athey, Bobby Parks and retired cricketer Bob Taylor, who was doing PR work at the stadium, also kept but no one registered a catch.

headlines: Kapil Sharma confirms wife Ginni Chatrath's pregnancy
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma has confirmed that his wife Ginni Chatrath is pregnant with their first child. "I just want to take care of my wife and be by her side for now. We are obviously very excited as it's our first kid but my mother is the most excited," he said. Kapil and Ginni got married in December last year.

headlines: WhatsApp Pay to roll out this year in India, confirms Global Head
text: Facebook-owned WhatsApp's payments service WhatsApp Pay will be rolling out later this year in India, the platform's Global Head Will Cathcart confirmed. Facebook has been beta-testing the payments service in India with about 10 lakh users, the full roll-out of which was stuck over regulatory issues. The RBI had said it didn't comply with the data localisation norms of India.

headlines: Prof allegedly thrashed after students refuse to say 'Mamata zindabad'
text: Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad supporters have allegedly beaten up a college professor in West Bengal's Hooghly on Wednesday after he tried to protect female post-graduate students, who were being forced to chant "Mamata Banerjee Zindabad". The professor also lodged a complaint with the police station in the evening. He also claimed that the supporters had even hit a female student.

headlines: Mumbai NCP President Sachin Ahir joins Shiv Sena
text: Nationalist Congress Party's (NCP) Mumbai unit President Sachin Ahir joined Shiv Sena in the presence of party chief Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday. The move comes months ahead of assembly elections in Maharashtra. Reportedly, former Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal is also planning to quit the party and join Shiv Sena.

headlines: Tesla Co-founder and CTO JB Straubel stepping down after 16 yrs
text: Tesla has announced its Co-founder and Chief Technology Officer (CTO) JB Straubel is stepping down from his role after nearly 16 years. The automaker's Technology VP, Drew Baglino, will take over the role of CTO. "I want to thank JB for his fundamental role...If we hadn't had lunch in 2003, Tesla wouldn't exist," Tesla Co-founder and CEO Elon Musk said.

headlines: Rajnath refers to Foreign Minister as 'Jaishankar Prasad' thrice
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, in Lok Sabha on Wednesday, mistakenly referred to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar as "Jaishankar Prasad". Singh referred to him with the incorrect name on three occasions while making a statement on US President Donald Trump's claim that he was asked to mediate on the Kashmir issue by PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Not religion, Triple Talaq Bill about justice and dignity: RS Prasad
text: Speaking on the Triple Talaq Bill in the Lok Sabha on Thursday, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that the bill is not about religion, but about women justice and dignity. Prasad said despite the Supreme Court verdict striking down the practice of instant Triple Talaq in August 2017, women are still being divorced by 'talaq-e-biddat'.

headlines: 6-month-old, suffering from heart disease, dies on Delhi-bound flight
text: A six-month-old baby girl, who was suffering from a congenital heart disease and had small hole in her heart, died onboard a Patna to Delhi flight on Thursday. The girl was being taken to the National Capital for her medical treatment at AIIMS. Her father and mother, who were accompanying her, suspected no foul play, police said.

headlines: Owner of tanker seized by Iran says crew including 18 Indians 'safe'
text: The Swedish company that owns the British-flagged oil tanker seized by Iran, has said that all 23 crew members, including 18 Indian nationals, are safe. The ship's captain said that "everyone was safe with good cooperation with the Iranian personnel onboard", Stena Bulk said in a statement. Other crew members aboard the tanker are from Russia, Latvia and the Philippines.

headlines: Jaishankar wishes 'good friend' Priti Patel on becoming UK Home Secy
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar took to Twitter to wish Priti Patel, who took charge as the first Indian-origin Home Secretary in the newly unveiled Boris Johnson-led Cabinet in the UK. "Heartiest congratulations to my good friend Priti Patel on her appointment as Home Secretary...Wish you a successful tenure ahead," he wrote.

headlines: Mother asks Mexican soldier to let her enter US with son, pic viral
text: A picture of a mother pleading with a Mexican soldier to let her enter the US with her son has gone viral. "Don't let them send me back. I want to give my son a better life," the woman, identified as a Guatemalan, told the soldier. Mexico has tightened border control to prevent illegal immigration following pressure from the US.

headlines: Murthy's son-in-law Rishi joins new UK Prime Minister's Cabinet
text: Infosys Co-Founder Narayana Murthy's son-in-law Rishi Sunak, the Conservative party MP for Richmond (Yorkshire), has been included in the new UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Cabinet. The 39-year-old Brexiteer was promoted from junior housing minister to Chief Secretary to the Treasury. Sunak had married Akshata Murthy, who was his classmate at Stanford University in the US, in 2009.

headlines: Facebook posts 28% quarterly revenue rise at $16.9 billion
text: Facebook on Wednesday posted a nearly $16.9-billion revenue for the June quarter, representing a growth of about 28% compared to last year. The financial results were announced hours after Facebook was fined a record $5 billion by the US FTC over privacy scandals, particularly related to the Cambridge Analytica data scandal. Facebook's stock was up around 3% in after-hours trading.

headlines: Maximum mob lynching in WB: Dilip Ghosh on celebs' letter to PM
text: Speaking over a letter written by 49 celebrities to PM Narendra Modi, West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh claimed that the maximum mob lynching is happening in Bengal. He said, "Despite this, intellectuals from the state are making maximum noise." Forty-nine celebrities, including actress Konkona Sensharma, have written the letter to PM, expressing concern over incidents of lynching in India.

headlines: Will not work to break NCP, but will strengthen Sena: Sachin Ahir
text: After joining the Shiv Sena on Thursday, former Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Sachin Ahir said that he'll not work to "break" the NCP but will work to strengthen the Sena. The Sena never tried to break any party, but welcomes people "who come wholeheartedly", party chief Uddhav Thackeray said. Thackeray added, "I assure Ahir will not regret his decision."

headlines: MDMK founder Vaiko, 4 others take oath as Rajya Sabha members
text: MDMK founder Vaiko and four other newly-elected Rajya Sabha MPs took oath as members of the Upper House on Thursday. Vaiko is currently the General Secretary of MDMK and this will be his fourth term as the member of the Council of States. Vaiko had also been elected to the 12th and 13th Lok Sabha from Sivakasi parliamentary constituency.

headlines: Can't abandon our Muslim sisters: Prasad on Triple Talaq Bill
text: Speaking over Triple Talaq Bill in Lok Sabha, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that it's an issue of women rights and "we can't abandon our Muslim sisters". He added, "Irrespective of religion, all women are equal in the eyes of law." The issue is of "justice and humanity" and shouldn't be looked upon through "political lenses", Prasad said.

headlines: 5-year-old raped by neighbour in Uttar Pradesh: Police
text: A five-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her neighbour at a village in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The man raped the girl at his home and fled the scene before the victim's family reached his house, hearing her cry, the police added. Another girl from the village alleged that four people tried to rape her on Wednesday, the police said.

headlines: BJP leaders beat toll workers allegedly over toll tax payment
text: Local BJP leaders Vijay Bhati and Sanjeev Sharma along with their supporters were captured on CCTV camera thrashing workers at the Jewar toll plaza on the Yamuna Expressway. The incident took place after the accused allegedly refused to pay the tax. A case has been registered on the basis of a complaint from the toll plaza supervisor.

headlines: 800+ upGrad learners make a successful career transition
text: According to Forbes, AI will see 50 million new jobs by 2022. To enable professionals to transition into Machine Learning and AI, upGrad with IIIT-Bangalore offers a 11-month PG Diploma in Machine Learning & AI that includes 15+ case studies and 360-degree career support. Over 800 upGrad learners have made career transitions with salary hikes as high as 230%.

headlines: 'Blade Runner' actor Rutger Hauer passes away at 75
text: Hollywood actor Rutger Hauer, best known for his role in the 1982 film 'Blade Runner', passed away on July 19 aged 75 in the Netherlands after suffering from a brief illness. Dutch media said Hauer was buried at a private ceremony. Hauer had also starred in films including 'Nighthawks', 'Dracula 3D' and 'Batman Begins'.

headlines: Harsha praises Shubman for expressing disappointment at not being picked
text: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has praised 19-year-old batsman Shubman Gill for expressing his disappointment at not being picked for at least one of the squads for India's tour of West Indies. "Shows hunger & ambition. Now he must channelise this positively by scoring more & not allow those who seed negative thoughts anywhere near him," Bhogle wrote.

headlines: Sri Lankan fast bowler Kulasekara retires from international cricket
text: Sri Lankan fast bowler Nuwan Kulasekara has announced his retirement from international cricket. The 37-year-old former world number one ODI bowler, will finish as Sri Lanka's fifth-highest ODI wicket-taker with 199 wickets in 184 matches. Kulasekara, who had made his ODI debut in 2003, had last played an ODI in 2017. He also played 21 Tests and 58 T20Is.

headlines: Andy Murray to team up with brother Jamie at Washington Open
text: British tennis player Andy Murray will team up with his brother Jamie at Washington Open, reuniting the pairing that helped Great Britain win Davis Cup in 2015. Andy, who underwent hip surgery in January, made a victorious return to professional tennis in June, winning the doubles at Queens with Spains Feliciano Lopez. Washington Open starts on July 27.

headlines: Please be decent: Irani to BJP MP on sexual crimes against kids debate
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani asked her own party's MP Harnath Singh Yadav to be decent during a Parliament debate on sexual crimes against children on Wednesday. "I'd heard of 'popcorn' but never 'porn'," Yadav said while recalling a friend who talked about pornography. "There are women here and this discussion is being viewed by the entire country," Irani said.

headlines: This is ghar wapsi: BJP MLA after voting in favour of MP govt
text: After BJP MLAs Narayan Tripathi and Sharad Kaul voted in favour of a legislation backed by the Congress government in Madhya Pradesh Assembly, Tripathi said, "This is my ghar wapsi (homecoming)." Both the BJP MLAs are former Congress leaders. This comes after BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava said the Congress government won't last 24 hours if BJP's top leadership ordered so.

headlines: Rajiv Gandhi's killer, in jail for 28 years, gets a month's parole
text: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, has been released on a month's parole to make arrangements for her daughter's wedding. During the term of her parole, she cannot speak to politicians or media. Sriharan, who was granted a 12-hour parole in 2016 for her father's funeral, has been in jail for 28 years.

headlines: Priti Patel becomes Britain's 1st Indian-origin Home Secretary
text: Priti Patel on Wednesday took charge as Britain's first Indian-origin Home Secretary in the newly unveiled Boris Johnson-led Cabinet. The 47-year-old has replaced Pakistani-origin Sajid Javid, who has been moved to the Treasury department as the first ethnic minority Chancellor of the Exchequer. Patel previously served as Secretary of State for International Development, but was forced to resign in 2017.

headlines: Atanu Chakraborty replaces SC Garg as Economic Affairs Secretary
text: The government has appointed Atanu Chakraborty as the new Economic Affairs Secretary replacing Subhash Chandra Garg, who will be the new Power Secretary. Chakraborty, a 1985 batch Gujarat cadre IAS officer, was the Secretary, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM). Anil Kumar Khachi will take over from Chakraborty as the secretary in charge of the disinvestment department.

headlines: India may launch $10-billion global bond sale in October
text: India is reportedly considering an option to raise $10 billion in one go from its first overseas bond sale in October. The government would prefer to sell yen or euro-denominated debt so as to offer lower yields, reports added. Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan recently warned that India's plan to issue bonds overseas has enormous risks but no real benefit.

headlines: Oct 8 deadline set for Zimbabwe Cricket to reinstate governing body
text: The ICC has set October 8 as the deadline for Zimbabwe Cricket (ZC) to reinstate its governing body that was elected by the government on June 14. ZC currently stands suspended and all funding from ICC has been stopped after it was found guilty by the ICC of political interference. Zimbabwe can lose membership if the deadline is not met.

headlines: Facebook fined $100 mn by US SEC over Cambridge Analytica scandal
text: Facebook was fined $100 million by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) over misleading investors about the risks it faced from misuse of user data, particularly related to the Cambridge Analytica scandal. British political consultancy firm Cambridge Analytica had accessed 87 million users' data in 2014-15. Notably, Facebook was also fined a record $5 billion by the US FTC.

headlines: Telangana BJP launches 'BJP4TS' app as part of membership drive
text: Telangana BJP has launched an app named "BJP4TS" as part of the membership drive in the state, party leader Bandaru Dattatreya said. He added that "primary members" can register themselves and become "active members" of the party through this app. Dattatreya said, if any active member provides 50 memberships through the app, then they'll be offered posts by the party.

headlines: Kejriwal revengeful, hampering CCTV fitting: AAP MLA Lamba
text: AAP MLA Alka Lamba accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of working with the intent to take revenge by hampering the CCTV installation work in her constituency. She added that this is affecting people's lives in her constituency and she won't let them be a victim of AAP's "vendetta politics". She said, she isn't afraid to fight for the people's rights.

headlines: Happiest while vacating office, worked sincerely: Kumaraswamy
text: Karnataka caretaker CM HD Kumaraswamy said that he is the "happiest" person while vacating the office as he worked sincerely despite several kinds of disturbances. He added that he worked to uplift the state in the last 14 months. HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday resigned as Karnataka Chief Minister after losing the trust vote in the Assembly.

headlines: Cong equates BJP with 'Bakasur', calls it power-hungry party
text: Maharashtra Congress President Balasaheb Thorat on Wednesday likened BJP with 'Bakasur', a mythological demon who always remained hungry. Thorat said this after the reports of BJP eyeing Madhya Pradesh after Karnataka came out. "Wherever there is opposition government in states, they are trying to destabilise them. BJP is such a power-hungry party," he said.

headlines: WeWork looking to go public as early as September: Report
text: Co-working space startup WeWork is reportedly looking to go public as early as September, earlier than previously assumed, and is expected to make its IPO paperwork public in August. The startup is also reportedly looking to raise $5-6 billion through a bond offering before the IPO. Founded in 2010, the SoftBank-backed startup was valued at $47 billion in January.

headlines: 26 million-year-old species of vine snake found in Western Ghats
text: Researchers have discovered a new vine snake species, believed to have evolved around 26 million years ago, in the southern Western Ghats. The species, 'Proahaetulla antiqua', was first discovered in 2011 and looked similar to 'Ahaetulla dispar', a small-sized vine snake with similar morphological characters. The new species faces no major extinction threats at the moment, researchers revealed.

headlines: All schools in Bihar to remain shut as flood situation worsens
text: The Darbhanga District Magistrate Thiyagrajan SM has said that all schools will remain closed until further orders as the flood situation in Bihar worsened due to heavy rains in neighbouring Nepal. The order comes after at least 106 people have lost their lives in the floods. As per reports, over eight million people have been affected by the Bihar floods.

headlines: 6 arrested for illegal mining of coloured stones in Andhra
text: Six persons were arrested by the forest department officials in connection with illegal mining of coloured stones in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police said. The police seized two crowbars, few nets for filtration and 21 coloured stones weighing 7.6 grams from their possession. A country-made weapon along with two bows and three arrows were also seized, the police added.

headlines: Boeing posts its biggest-ever quarterly loss of $2.9 billion
text: Boeing reported its biggest-ever quarterly loss of $2.9 billion for the June quarter, affected by lower plane deliveries due to worldwide 737 MAX groundings after two crashes killed 346 people. Boeing had a $2.2-billion profit in the year-ago period. Its revenue fell 35.1% to $15.8 billion, reduced by a $5.6-billion charge it took to compensate MAX customers.

headlines: Video blogger eats poisonous centipedes, geckos on live stream; dies
text: A 35-year-old Chinese video blogger died during a live stream after eating poisonous centipedes, geckos, mealworms, and drinking alcohol. He was found without vital signs in his apartment with his laptop in live-streaming mode. In his videos, he used to spin a wheel marked with items like centipedes, geckos, vinegar and eggs, and consume items at which the marker stopped.

headlines: Woman can stick magnet on back, says surgeons left metal item in body
text: A woman from Turkey said she is able to stick a magnet to her back after surgeons allegedly left a metal object inside her. She underwent surgery in 2013 to repair the slipped disks on her lower back at a hospital. She said University Medicine Faculty's Forensic Medicine department found a nine-centimetre-long metal item in her lower back.

headlines: WC loss difficult to digest as we didn't make many mistakes: Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli has said that 2019 World Cup semi-final defeat is very difficult to digest as Team India didn't make many mistakes to be knocked out. He added that acceptance becomes difficult as New Zealand outplayed them. "The worst setbacks have not only motivated me but also improved me as a person," he further said about the defeat.

headlines: Surprised not to see Shubman, Rahane in ODI squad: Sourav Ganguly
text: Ex-India captain Sourav Ganguly has said he was surprised not to see Shubman Gill and Ajinkya Rahane in India's ODI squad for West Indies tour. He suggested that players like Rahane and Shubman can play all formats. "Time has come for Indian selectors to pick same players in all formats of the game for rhythm and confidence," he added.

headlines: 19-yr-old Hungarian breaks Phelps' 200m butterfly record by 0.78 sec
text: Hungary's 19-year-old swimmer Kristof Milak broke the men's 200m butterfly world record after winning the event in 1:50.73 seconds at FINA world championships in South Korea's Gwangju. The previous record was set by 23-time Olympic gold medallist Michael Phelps, who had clocked a timing of 1:51.51 seconds in 2009. "It's a tremendous honour," Milak said after setting the record.

headlines: Sarfaraz shouldn't be Pakistan captain in any format: Shoaib Akhtar
text: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Sarfaraz Ahmed shouldn't be captain of Pakistan in any format. "Haris Sohail should be made the captain. He should captain the side in ODIs and T20Is. They should test Babar Azam as captain in Test cricket," he added. He further said Sarfaraz should be used only for his wicketkeeping and battings skills.

headlines: Bail lands on top of stump as batsman gets bowled, Sachin asks out or not
text: Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of a batsman surviving getting bowled after the right-hand bail jumped out of its groove and sat on top of the right stump, while the left-hand bail remained intact. "Found it very unusual! What would your decision be if you were the umpire?" Sachin tweeted. "Batsman arrested but released on bail," a user tweeted.

headlines: Imam-ul-Haq accused of having multiple affairs, chats leaked
text: Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq has been accused of having affairs with multiple women at the same time, with his WhatsApp chats with around four women being leaked on social media. The user who shared the screenshots of the chats, wrote, "Imam was lying, dating, using and manipulating seven and many more women at the same time."

headlines: Tokyo 2020 Olympic medals made from recycled e-waste unveiled
text: The medals for Tokyo 2020 Olympics were unveiled on Wednesday with exactly one year to go until the next year's Games. The medals are 85 millimetres in diameter and feature Greek goddess of victory Nike in their design along with the Olympic symbol. Further, the medals are made from recycled metals, collected from 6.21 million electronic devices donated across Japan.

headlines: Jonty Rhodes applies for India's fielding coach, says he loves India
text: Ex-South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes has applied for Team India fielding coach position. "My wife and I love the country, and it has already given us so much. We've two children born in India," the 49-year-old, who represented South Africa in 245 ODIs and 52 Tests, said. Rhodes spent nine seasons as Mumbai Indians fielding coach from 2009 to 2017.

headlines: Navjot Singh Sidhu meets supporters, says not quitting Congress
text: Former Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu on Tuesday met supporters at his residence and told them he would not leave the Congress. "Sidhu saab told us he has dedicated himself to Amritsar and the people of Punjab and will work for them while staying within the party. There is no question of him leaving," said Jatinder Singh Bhatia, a councillor.

headlines: 2 BJP MLAs vote in favour of MP govt, CM Nath invites them to dinner
text: BJP MLAs Narayan Tripathi and Sharad Kaul voted in favour of the Congress-led Madhya Pradesh government in the Assembly. The Congress reportedly moved them to an undisclosed location after it and invited them for dinner with CM Kamal Nath. This comes after BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava said the Congress government won't last 24 hours if BJP's top leadership ordered so.

headlines: UAPA amendments 'anti-people', will give NIA policing power: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra criticised the amendments to the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) on Wednesday, calling the amendment bill as "anti-federalism, anti-constitutional and anti-people." Moitra said the bill gives policing powers to National Investigation Agency (NIA), as it can go to any state and arrest, seize and search properties, without the knowledge of the state DGP.

headlines: I pray top-most Cong leader is jailed for 10 months under UAPA: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said in Parliament that he wishes and prays that a top-most Congress leader "goes under UAPA and spends at least 10 months" in jail so that the Congress can realise his pain. Owaisi said this during debate on Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, blaming Congress for bringing the law when it was in power.

headlines: PM Modi congratulates Boris Johnson on becoming UK's new PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Boris Johnson on assuming office as the UK's Prime Minister. "I wish you success and look forward to working with you to further strengthen India-UK partnership in all spheres," PM Modi tweeted. Johnson took over as the UK's Prime Minister following his official appointment by the Queen.

headlines: Rajya Sabha passes POCSO amendment bill with death penalty provision
text: The Rajya Sabha on Wednesday passed a bill making amendments to the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act by including death penalty for aggravated sexual assault on children. The bill also provides for fines and imprisonment to curb child pornography. Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani had introduced the bill in the Rajya Sabha.

headlines: TMC leaders meet PM asking him to change West Bengal's name to Bangla
text: A 12-member TMC parliamentary delegation on Wednesday met Prime Minister Narendra Modi to request him to bring a Constitutional amendment bill to change the name of West Bengal to 'Bangla' in the ongoing monsoon session of Parliament. They informed the Prime Minister that the West Bengal Assembly had passed the bill for changing the name of the state last year.

headlines: Trump told staff to falsify records in Russia meddling probe: Mueller
text: Former US Special Counsel Robert Mueller said on Wednesday that US President Donald Trump had asked his staff to falsify records relevant to the investigation into alleged Russian meddling in 2016 US presidential election. While testifying before the House of Representatives, Mueller added that Trump wanted him fired because he was investigating the US President for obstruction of justice.

headlines: Tottenham manager compares Son Heung-Min to David Beckham
text: Tottenham Hotspur manager Mauricio Pochettino praised South Korean forward Son Heung-Min and said he compares Son to former Manchester United captain David Beckham. "We can see how people love Sonny in Asia, he is an icon," Pochettino added. The 27-year-old has scored 42 goals and registered 19 assists in 130 Premier League matches so far for Tottenham Hotspur.

headlines: Bale scores, misses a penalty as Real Madrid beat Arsenal
text: Real Madrid's Welsh winger Gareth Bale scored in 56th minute before missing his spot-kick in shootout as his team beat Arsenal 3-2 on penalties in International Champions Cup on Tuesday. Arsenal were leading in the first-half before Bale and Marco Asensio levelled the score for Madrid in the second half. Both the teams played with 10 men after first-half reds.

headlines: Heavy rain alert in Punjab, govt issues notice to authorities
text: The Punjab government on Wednesday issued a notice to the District Magistrates asking them to stay prepared for heavy rains during the next three days. IMD Chandigarh has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall at few places with extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places during the next two days. Extremely heavy rainfall is predicted in Hoshiarpur, Kapurthala, Jalandhar and Nawanshahr.

headlines: E-cigarette lobby calls for regulations instead of blanket ban
text: An e-cigarette lobby group called Trade Representatives of ENDS (TRENDS) has asked the Indian government to propose regulations on e-cigarettes instead of a blanket ban. "Banning e-cigarettes while more harmful beedis and cigarettes are allowed...is contradictory," TRENDS convenor Praveen Rikhy said. The group recommended regulations like statutory warnings, taxes on products, among others.

headlines: FM rejects demand to remove new 10% import duty on newsprint
text: Rejecting demands for removing 10% import duty on newsprint, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said it was intended to provide a level playing field to domestic manufacturers. She said despite their capacity, Indian producers can't find buyers as most of the newsprint is imported. Centre had imposed duty on newsprint, uncoated paper used for newspapers and lightweight coated paper for magazines.

headlines: Almost dropped my phone: Singer Rihanna on pic of her lookalike
text: Singer Rihanna has shared a picture of a young girl on Instagram and pointed out the resemblance between them. She wrote in the caption, "Almost [dropped] my phone. How?" Reacting to the photo, users wrote comments like "I thought Rihanna used the baby filter" and "They say we all have a twin somewhere! You just found yours".

headlines: No one has ever proposed to me for marriage, I feel sad: Salman Khan
text: Salman Khan revealed in an interview that no one has ever proposed to him for marriage. "I don't do candlelight dinners. I can't see what I'm eating in candlelight. But I feel sad that I haven't been approached yet," the 53-year-old actor said. Salman had earlier said that he doesn't believe in marriage and had called it a "dying institution".

headlines: Forgot how stressful breastfeeding can be: Sameera Reddy
text: Actress Sameera Reddy has shared a picture of herself with her newborn daughter 11 days after her delivery. She wrote, "Happiness galore with no sleep, colic and feeding round the clock! I think I forgot how stressful breastfeeding can be!!" "The pressure is quite real and the whole top feed balance after a C-sec is hectic!" she added.

headlines: Sadhguru criticised for calling sprinter Hima Das 'golden shower'
text: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev has been criticised on Twitter for calling sprinter Hima Das 'a golden shower for India' while congratulating her for winning multiple gold medals in Europe. "Someone please tell him what golden shower means," a user wrote. Notably, golden shower is a slang for the practice of urinating on another person for sexual pleasure.

headlines: US fines FB $5bn, Zuckerberg to lose sole control on privacy decisions
text: Facebook will pay a record $5 billion fine to settle a government probe into its privacy practices, the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said today. Under the settlement, Facebook's board will create an independent privacy committee that removes "unfettered control by CEO Mark Zuckerberg over decisions affecting user privacy". The investigation relates to Cambridge Analytica scandal and other privacy breaches.

headlines: Freshworks planning to go public by 2021, list on Nasdaq: Report
text: California-based software unicorn Freshworks is reportedly planning to go public and is expected to be listed on New York-headquartered stock exchange Nasdaq. Founded by Girish Mathrubootham and Shan Krishnasamy in 2010, the startup has raised about $250 million to date and has made 10 acquisitions. It will reportedly become the first Nasdaq-listed software-based product firm from India.

headlines: A man ejaculated at my shorts in crowded bus when I was 13: O'Brien
text: TMC MP Derek O'Brien, while speaking in Parliament on the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Amendment) Bill, opened up about being sexually molested in a crowded bus as a 13-year-old boy. "After tennis practice, I was in short pants and t-shirt. It was reason enough for an unknown man to ejaculate at shorts of this boy," he stated.

headlines: 28-year-old engineer shot dead 100 metres away from home in Lucknow
text: A 28-year-old bike-borne software engineer was shot dead barely 100 metres away from his house in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Tuesday night. Two assailants, who were also on a motorcycle, chased the victim and shot him from behind. "The victim's family members have not spoken of any motive but our initial probe hints at personal enmity," police said.

headlines: Boris Johnson becomes UK PM after official appointment by Queen
text: Boris Johnson took over as the UK's Prime Minister on Wednesday following his official appointment by Queen Elizabeth II. His appointment came minutes after his predecessor Theresa May submitted her resignation to the Queen. Johnson defeated fellow Conservative Party member Jeremy Hunt to become the party leader and the UK's next Prime Minister.

headlines: Woman smashes laptop on boyfriends head on plane in US, video viral
text: A video of a woman smashing a laptop on her boyfriend's head, claiming that he was looking at other women on an American Airlines flight from Miami to Los Angeles, has gone viral on the internet. When she was warned that she will be charged with assault, she replied, "Fine, whatever." Both the passengers were removed from the aircraft.

headlines: Malaysia ex-King divorces ex-Miss Moscow by triple talaq: Reports
text: Malaysia's former king Sultan Muhammad V who gave away his throne in January after marrying former Miss Moscow Rihana Oksana Voevodina has divorced her by 'triple talaq', reports quoting his lawyer claimed. Sultan is said to have raised doubts over the parentage of their two-month-old son. Rihana has reportedly challenged Muhammad to take a DNA test over the claim.

headlines: They call him 'Britain Trump': Donald Trump on new UK PM Johnson
text: Praising the UK's new Prime Minister Boris Johnson, US President Donald Trump said, "He's tough and he's smart. They call him 'Britain Trump' and people are saying that's a good thing." "They like me over there. That's what they wanted. That's what they need. He'll get it done. Boris is good. He's gonna do a good job," Trump added.

headlines: North Korea seizes Russian vessel with 17 crew members on board
text: North Korea last week seized a Russian fishing vessel with 17 crew members on board, the Russian Embassy in North Korea said on Wednesday. North Korea said the crew was detained for "violating the rules of entry and stay in [its] territory". Among the crew members detained, 15 are Russian and two are South Korean.

headlines: Huawei fires over 600 US employees over getting blacklisted
text: Huawei has fired over 600 employees out of a total of about 850 employees from its US research subsidiary Futurewei Technologies, representing an over 70% reduction of workforce. The Chinese smartphone maker said this was in response to the "curtailment of business operations" by the US government's trade blacklisting. The US had blacklisted Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: Awaiting orders from Delhi: Yeddyurappa on K'taka govt formation
text: Karnataka BJP President BS Yeddyurappa on Wednesday said he was awaiting instructions from BJP's central leadership in Delhi on forming a government in the state. "I can call legislature party meeting any time and go to Raj Bhavan (to stake claim). I'm waiting for it," he added. The Congress-JDS government in Karnataka collapsed on Tuesday after losing the trust vote.

headlines: Mumbai's Haptik acquihires LA-based chatbot startup Convrg
text: Mumbai-based AI chatbot startup Haptik has acquihired Los Angeles-based conversational AI startup Convrg for an undisclosed amount to expand its technical expertise, team and business overseas. This comes months after the Mumbai-based startup raised $100 million from Reliance Industries, which acquired a majority stake of 87% in it. Haptik was founded in 2013 by Aakrit Vaish and Swapan Rajdev.

headlines: 1,905 women officers serving in IAF as of July 1: Govt
text: Minister of State for Defence Shripad Naik on Wednesday said that there are 1,905 women officers currently serving in the Indian Air Force (IAF) as on July 1, 2019. "Of these, eight are Fighter Pilots and 17 are Navigators," he said. Naik further asserted that the IAF is adequately equipped to cater to the threat environment that exists.

headlines: Transgender beaten to death over suspicion of child lifting in WB
text: A transgender was beaten to death on suspicion of being a child lifter in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district, police said. "We managed to rescue the victim but the person died on the way to the hospital," Sub-Divisional Police Officer said. He added that it was just a rumour spread by people and no incident of child kidnapping had taken place.

headlines: If Censor Board allows, films like 'Kabir Singh' can be made: Rajkummar
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao, while speaking about Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' which has been accused of glorifying toxic masculinity, said, "It depends on the kind of person making it...If the Censor Board is allowing them, they can make it." "Then it's up to us if we want to watch it or not...It depends on your personal ideologies," he added.

headlines: You'll find someone worthier: Madhavan on 18-yr-old's marriage proposal
text: Actor R Madhavan has responded to a female fan who commented on one of his pictures on Instagram and wrote that she wants to get married to him. "Is it wrong that I am 18 and wanna get married to you," the fan wrote. "Ha ha ha God bless you...You will find someone way...worthier," Madhavan replied to her.

headlines: It was traumatic, didn't have strength to come back: Rishi on mom's death
text: Speaking about his mother Krishna Raj Kapoor's demise in India while he was in US for cancer treatment, Rishi Kapoor said, "That...was traumatic for me...I didn't have the stamina or strength to come back." "I left...on September 29, and my mother passed away on October 1...My brother [said] by the time I'd get back, it'd be too late," he added.

headlines: 28-year-old Russian boxer suffers brain injury in ring, dies
text: Russian boxer Maxim Dadashev died in a US hospital due to brain injury he sustained in the fight against Puerto Rico's Subriel Matias last Friday. The 28-year-old was hospitalised shortly after the match, which had to be stopped by his trainer Buddy McGirt in the 11th round. Footage from the match showed McGirt begging Dadashev to stop the fight.

headlines: England get all out for 85 vs Ireland in Test 10 days after winning WC
text: England were dismissed for 85 runs in the first innings in one-off Test against Ireland at Lord's on Wednesday, 10 days after winning the 2019 World Cup at the same venue. Ireland pacer Tim Murtagh registered figures of 9-2-13-5, helping his team dismiss England for their fifth-shortest innings by overs (23.4). Only three of England's batsmen scored in double digits.

headlines: IIT team only Asian finalist at SpaceX Hyperloop Pod contest
text: Avishkar Hyperloop, the student team from IIT Madras' Centre For Innovation (CFI), was the only Asian team to enter final round of the 'SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition 2019'. IIT Madras revealed a total of 22 teams had reached the final round, which was held in Los Angeles on July 21. The team met with SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk.

headlines: Rise above party politics: Amit Shah on anti-terror amendment bill
text: Amid debate over amendments to the Unlawful Activities Prevention (Amendment) Bill on Wednesday, Home Minister Amit Shah said, "When it comes to an anti-terror fight, we should rise above party politics." The anti-terror bill seeks to designate a person suspected to have terror links as a "terrorist", which the opposition leaders say has a large scope for misuse.

headlines: Woman withdraws rape case against ex-SP minister Gayatri Prajapati
text: A woman, who had accused former Samajwadi Party (SP) minister Gayatri Prajapati of gang-raping her and trying to molest her minor daughter, withdrew her statement in a court on Tuesday. She said Prajapati didn't rape her, but his two aides did. She had earlier claimed Prajapati and his aides raped her in 2014 when she met him seeking a job.

headlines: Talks with Pak won't be only on Kashmir, but also PoK: Rajnath Singh
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said in the Parliament that if there would be talks with Pakistan on the Kashmir issue, it would also include a discussion on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Singh rejected US President Donald Trump's claim that PM Narendra Modi had asked him to mediate on the Kashmir issue with Pakistan. Earlier, MEA had also rejected Trump's claim.

headlines: AIADMK Rajya Sabha MP Maitreyan breaks down during farewell speech
text: AIADMK Rajya Sabha member V Maitreyan broke down in the Parliament on Wednesday while giving his farewell speech, remembering late Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa. "At this juncture, I place on record a deep sense of gratitude towards my beloved leader, Amma for...sending me to this House for three terms. My unalloyed loyalty to her will always be there," Maitreyan said.

headlines: Pakistan extends Hafiz Saeed's judicial remand for 14 days
text: A Pakistani court on Wednesday extended Jamaat-ud-Dawa (JuD) chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's judicial remand for 14 days. Saeed and his aides were arrested in connection with a terrorism financing case last week. Saeed and other JuD leaders have been booked in over 20 cases related to terrorism financing and money laundering.

headlines: 8 lynched in B'desh on rumours of human sacrifice for building bridge
text: Eight people were lynched in Bangladesh last week over rumours of children being kidnapped for human sacrifice for the construction of the Padma Bridge. More than 30 people have been attacked in similar cases. As many as 103 people have been arrested in 31 cases filed in connection with these incidents, police officials said.

headlines: UK sent mediator to Iran to free seized tanker: Iranian official
text: The UK has sent a mediator to Iran seeking the release of the seized UK-flagged oil tanker, Mohammad Mohammadi-Golpayegani, the head of the Supreme Leader's office said. Iran had seized the oil tanker in the Strait of Hormuz last week. Eighteen among the 23 crew members on board the seized tanker are Indian nationals.

headlines: MP govt won't last 24 hrs once we get top leaders' orders: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava on Wednesday said Congress government in MP won't last for 24 hours once they get orders from party's top leadership. "If we get orders from our number one or number two, [MP] government won't last for 24 hours," he added. This comes after the Congress-JD(S) government in Karnataka fell on Tuesday after losing the trust vote.

headlines: Black chapter in history of democracy: Mayawati on Karnataka
text: After HD Kumaraswamy-led government failed to prove majority in Karnataka Assembly, BSP supremo Mayawati said that the manner in which the BJP pulled down the coalition government will be registered as a "black chapter" in the history of democracy. She alleged that the BJP kept all constitutional norms aside and used "money and power" to pull down the coalition government.

headlines: Rahul, Cong behave like Pak PM's cheerleaders: Giriraj Singh
text: Amid the Opposition's uproar over US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Wednesday said that the Congress and its leader Rahul Gandhi behave like Pakistan PM Imran Khan's cheerleaders. He added, "Imran does not know his worth, he should stop harping on referendum and Kashmir, and start preparing to handover PoK to India."

headlines: MHA revises security cover for Kamal Nath, ISRO Chairman
text: In a full-scale review of security cover for VIPs, the Home Ministry has downgraded security cover of Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath and withdrawn security cover for ISRO Chairman K Sivan. Security of politicians like RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy, has also been downgraded. Security cover for 130 VIPs has been reviewed by the Ministry.

headlines: Never seen this kind of horse-trading in life: Gowda on K'taka
text: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, former PM HD Deve Gowda said that he had never seen in his life the type of horse-trading the BJP leadership allowed. He added that the JD(S) doesn't regret the last coalition government. Gowda further said, "We are not accusing anyone, including the former CM and other senior ministers."

headlines: Uttarakhand CM announces new bridge in place of Laxman Jhula
text: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Wednesday announced the construction of a new bridge in place of the iconic suspension bridge, Laxman Jhula. "The new bridge will be constructed in a modern and high-tech manner and it'll be a tourist attraction," Rawat said. Laxman Jhula was closed down after a report suggested that it was not fit for use.

headlines: Jet Airways' HQ owner moves NCLT for vacation of premises
text: The owner of debt-laden Jet Airways' Mumbai headquarters, Luckystar, has approached NCLT for the property to be vacated. It said Jet and its Resolution Professional (RP) can't occupy the property as it doesn't belong to the carrier, which was admitted for insolvency after the lease's cancellation in June. Luckystar also sought pending rental dues for April and May from Jet.

headlines: 49 celebrities write letter to PM Modi over rising lynching cases
text: Forty-nine celebrities, including directors Anurag Kashyap, Mani Ratnam and actress Konkona Sensharma have written a letter to PM Narendra Modi, expressing concern over rising lynching cases in the country. They wrote, "You've criticised...lynchings in Parliament, but that is not enough! What action has actually been taken?" "Regrettably 'Jai Shri Ram' has become a...'war-cry' today," the letter reads.

headlines: Lost 6 months as I couldn't remember anything: Disha on head injury
text: Actress Disha Patani, in an interview with Mid-Day, revealed that she once lost her memory after falling on her head while she was training on concrete floors. "I lost six months of my life because I couldn't remember anything," she said. Disha, who practises gymnastics and MMA, added, "[Only when] you break your bones and knees do you reach somewhere."

headlines: After Bihar, UP, Rajasthan, 'Super 30' declared tax-free in Gujarat
text: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30' has been declared tax-free in Gujarat, making it the fourth state where the film is now tax-free. Previously, the film had been declared tax-free in the states of Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Thanking Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani, Hrithik tweeted, "Team Super 30 is deeply overwhelmed by your kind gesture."

headlines: Culture of scolding isn't even there in dressing room now: Kohli
text: On being asked if he has to be harsh with youngsters sometimes, India captain Virat Kohli said the culture of scolding isn't even there in the dressing room now. "The atmosphere is such that anyone can say anything to anyone," Virat added. "I tell [the youngsters], 'Listen, I've committed these mistakes, make sure you dont do them'," he further said.

headlines: Centre runs troll armies to attack Opposition: TMC MP Mahua Moitra
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Wednesday accused the Centre of running "propaganda machinery" and "troll armies" to attack the Opposition, which she said runs the risk of being called "anti-national" whenever it disagrees with the government. Speaking on the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Amendment Bill, 2019, Moitra said it sought to designate individuals as terrorists without due process.

headlines: BJP MLA dances with supporters after Cong-JD(S) govt falls in K'taka
text: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka failed the floor test in the Assembly on Tuesday, BJP MLA MP Renukacharya was seen dancing with his supporters outside Ramada Hotel in Bengaluru. There were fireworks outside the hotel as well. Renukacharya was at the hotel to attend a legislature party meeting, hours after he voted against the coalition.

headlines: 3 men reach Kolkata hospital claiming to be newborn girl's father
text: A pregnant woman was admitted to a Kolkata hospital last week and a man accompanying her addressed himself as her husband. Soon another man came there, claiming to be her husband and newborn girl's father. Later, a third man claimed to be the newborn's father, but the woman confirmed that the second man is the newborn's father and her husband.

headlines: Chhattisgarh municipality sets up cafe, to give free food for plastic
text: Ambikapur Municipal Corporation in Chhattisgarh has set up a 'Garbage Cafe' to provide food to citizens in exchange for plastic waste. "We're providing free food to those who bring 1 kg of plastic to us, it'll help us in keeping the city clean," Mayor Ajay Tirkey said. Free breakfast will be offered for those collecting 500 grams of plastic.

headlines: No problem in preparing food inside toilet: MP Minister Imarti Devi
text: Madhya Pradesh Minister Imarti Devi said that there is no problem in cooking food inside a toilet if a partition exists between the toilet-seat and stove. "Utensils can be kept on the bathroom seat," she added. This comes after reports claimed that a toilet in an Anganwadi centre in Karera was being used for preparing food for children.

headlines: Super 30's Anand Kumar to take virtual classes in Delhi govt schools
text: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that Super 30 Founder Anand Kumar will conduct one class every month for Delhi government school students. "This will be an online, virtual classroom for Class 11, 12 students of our schools," Sisodia said. The announcement was made after Anand Kumar visited a Delhi government school with Sisodia on Wednesday.

headlines: 'Pakistan still has 30,000-40,000 terrorists,' PM Imran Khan admits
text: During his visit to US, Pakistan PM Imran Khan revealed his country still has about 30,000-40,000 militants "who have been trained and fought in some part of Afghanistan or Kashmir". He further said that until his Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf government came into power, the governments (in Pakistan) did not have the "political will" to disarm militant groups operating on their soil.

headlines: Russia expressed deep regret for airspace intrusion: South Korea
text: A Russian official has expressed "deep regret" after one of the country's military aircraft intruded into South Korean airspace, South Korea's presidential office said. The Russian official added that the intrusion was not intentional and blamed a device malfunction for the incident. The Russian military aircraft had entered airspace over an island claimed by both South Korea and Japan.

headlines: 29-yr-old postpones $4.5 mn lunch with Buffett due to kidney stones
text: Chinese cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun postponed his $4.57 million charity lunch with Warren Buffett after falling ill with kidney stones. The 29-year-old, who founded Tron cryptocurrency, denied reports that he was involved in illegal fundraising and money laundering. Sun added a report by a Chinese publication stating he had been barred from leaving the country was "completely false".

headlines: Prannoy knocks Srikanth out of Japan Open in first round
text: World number 10 shuttler Kidambi Srikanth crashed out of Japan Open after losing to compatriot and world number 34 HS Prannoy in the first round on Wednesday. Srikanth lost with a scoreline of 21-13, 11-21, 20-22 in 59 minutes. Meanwhile, world number five women's singles player PV Sindhu will begin her Japan Open campaign today against China's Han Yue.

headlines: Apple hires engineer who led design of Tesla's car interiors
text: Apple has hired Steve MacManus, former Vice President of Engineering at Tesla who had led the interior designing for the electric carmaker from 2015, as a Senior Director. Prior to working for Tesla, MacManus had worked for Aston Martin, Bentley Motors and Jaguar & Land Rover. Apple is reportedly working on its own self-driving electric car under its 'Project Titan'.

headlines: WhatsApp head to visit India; may meet IT Ministry, RBI officials
text: WhatsApp's global head Will Cathcart will visit India this week and is reportedly expected to meet officials from the IT Ministry and Reserve Bank of India (RBI). This comes amid regulatory challenges Facebook is facing over the rollout of WhatsApp's payments service WhatsApp Pay. Facebook had also announced it won't launch its cryptocurrency Libra in India over local restrictions.

headlines: One day BJP will discover not everything can be bought: Priyanka
text: After the Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in Karnataka Assembly, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi criticised the BJP saying that one day they'll discover that "everything cannot be bought". She added that until then, the people will have to "endure their unbridled corruption". Priyanka said, one day they'll realise that everyone cannot be bullied and every lie is "eventually exposed".

headlines: Biswabhusan Harichandan takes oath as Andhra Pradesh Guv
text: Biswabhusan Harichandan took oath as the Governor of Andhra Pradesh at a function held at the temporary Raj Bhavan, Vijayawada. Acting Chief Justice of the state High Court C Praveen Kumar administered the oath of office to Harichandan. The swearing-in ceremony took place in the presence of CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu and other dignitaries.

headlines: Congress-JD(S) misrule ended, people happy: Sadananda Gowda
text: After the Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, Union Minister Sadananda Gowda said that the misrule of the coalition has ended and the state people are "very happy". He added that the BJP showed solidarity without taking assistance from the rebel MLAs in the House. Gowda said that the Karnataka BJP should form the government at the earliest.

headlines: TikTok acquires UK-based AI music startup Jukedeck: Report
text: Lip-syncing video platform TikTok's parent ByteDance has reportedly acquired UK-based startup Jukedeck which uses AI to automatically generate music. The startup's Co-founder and CEO Ed Newton-Rex has updated his LinkedIn to reflect he is now the AI Labs Director for ByteDance. Founded in 2012 by Newton-Rex and Patrick Stobbs, Jukedeck has raised £2.5 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: Mark Esper sworn in as US Defence Secretary
text: Army veteran Mark Esper was sworn in as the US' Defence Secretary on Tuesday following confirmation by the Senate. Esper succeeds James Mattis, who resigned in December last year following differences with US President Donald Trump over the withdrawal of American troops from Syria. Esper has also worked as a lobbyist for the military contractor firm Raytheon.

headlines: Protinex starts #DontMissOut campaign for muscle health awareness
text: According to a recent study conducted by Protinex, 6 out of 10 Indians suffer from poor muscle health and fatigue, preventing them from enjoying quality moments with family while giving their 100% at work. Protinex conducted a sensitization initiative among 1 lakh corporates to educate them about the importance of daily protein intake and exercise regime for good muscle health.

headlines: Previous Pak govts lied to US, we had 40 militant groups: Imran Khan
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said his country was fighting the US' war on terror and had "nothing to do with 9/11" but things went wrong as previous Pakistani governments didn't tell the truth to US. "There were 40 different militant groups operating within Pakistan." Khan earlier admitted his country knew about al-Qaeda chief Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan.

headlines: 11 years since Messi got no. 10 from Ronaldinho at Barcelona
text: Forward Lionel Messi wore the number 10 jersey for the first time for Barcelona on July 24, 2008, in a preseason friendly against Scottish side Hibernian. Barcelona legend Ronaldinho Gaúcho had departed Barcelona a week earlier, freeing up the number 10 shirt. Messi donned the number 19 jersey for Barcelona before switching to the number 10 jersey.

headlines: Getting to play Test at Lord's special thing for Ireland: Porterfield
text: Talking about Ireland's upcoming Test match against England at Lord's, Ireland captain William Porterfield said that having the opportunity to play at the 'The Home of Cricket' is a pretty special thing. "We had a taste of it a couple of years ago with the one-dayer here...It's going to be a pretty special moment," he added.

headlines: Democracy, honesty & people of K'taka lost: Rahul on govt collapse
text: Reacting to collapse of Congress-JD(S) government in Karnataka, Rahul Gandhi said, "From its first day, the Cong-JDS alliance in Karnataka was a target for vested interests, both within & outside." He added the "vested interests" saw the alliance as a threat to their path to power. "Their greed won today. Democracy, honesty & the people of Karnataka lost," he stated.

headlines: Narine, Pollard back in West Indies squad for T20Is against India
text: Sunil Narine and Kieron Pollard have been recalled to the West Indies T20I squad for the first two matches against India. Chris Gayle will not feature in the series as he will be participating in the Canada's Global T20 League. Wicketkeeper-batsman Anthony Bramble has earned a maiden call-up, while John Campbell and Khary Pierre also feature in the 14-member squad.

headlines: Chahal only person to represent India in both chess, cricket
text: Indian leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who is celebrating his 29th birthday today, is the only person to represent India in both chess and cricket. Chahal, who is listed on the World Chess Federation's official site, was the U-12 national chess champion in 2002 and has represented India U-16 at the World Youth Chess Championship. Chahal has taken 130 international wickets.

headlines: BCCI formally recognises Indian Cricketers' Association for ex-players
text: The BCCI has officially recognised the Indian Cricketers' Association (ICA), the body formed as per the board's new constitution. The BCCI stated that the ICA is a non-profit company and is aimed at conserving and advancing the welfare of former players. Kapil Dev, Ajit Agarkar and Shantha Rangaswamy are ICA's directors and will hold their positions until elections are held.

headlines: Party that banned cattle auctions conducted one in K'taka: Tharoor
text: After Congress-JD(S) coalition government lost the trust vote in Karnataka, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "So the party that banned cattle auctions has successfully conducted one in Karnataka!" Taking a dig at rebel MLAs, Tharoor added, "My admiration for the courage & principle shown by D.K.Shivakumar & those [Congress] MLAs who were neither cajoled nor cudgelled into changing their allegiance."

headlines: Don't blame BJP if MP govt falls due to Cong infighting: Shivraj Singh
text: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday said his party cannot be blamed if the state government falls because of internal conflicts within the Congress and its coalition partners SP and BSP. Chouhan added BJP will not cause the fall of Madhya Pradesh government. He blamed the Congress leaders for the fall of state governments.

headlines: Man cheats Railways twice by claiming lizard found in food, caught
text: A senior citizen who cheated the Indian Railways for compensation by claiming that lizard was found in his food from the Railway caterers, at two different occasions, was caught by Andhra Pradesh's Guntakal officials on Tuesday. In another incident, he had complained about a blade in the idli. He confessed he was using a fish for his lizard tricks.

headlines: President doesn't make things up: Trumps advisor on Kashmir remark
text: On being asked by reporters about US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation, Trump's Chief Economic Advisor Larry Kudlow said, "The President does not make things up." He further called the question "rude", adding, "I'm going to stay out of that...It's for Mr (National Security Advisor John) Bolton...and President, so I'm not going to comment on that."

headlines: Dude! We are going to energise the country: New UK PM Boris Johnson
text: Addressing Conservative Party members following his election as their new leader and the UK's next Prime Minister, Boris Johnson said, "Dude, we are going to energise the country." He further vowed to deliver Brexit, unite the country and defeat Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn. "(W)e are once again going to believe in ourselves and what we can achieve," he added.

headlines: RBI names Kanungo to run monetary policy after Viral Acharya quits
text: The RBI has assigned Deputy Governor BP Kanungo to run the monetary policy portfolio after the resignation of fellow Deputy Governor Viral Acharya. Kanungo, who will retain his currency management portfolio, would become the sixth member of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). Acharya, who is also a professor at New York Universitys Stern School of Business, left RBI on Tuesday.

headlines: Lakshmi Mittal's brother arrested in Bosnia, faces up to 45 yrs jail
text: Indian businessman Pramod Mittal, younger brother of steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal, was arrested in Bosnia on suspicion of organised crime and abuse of office. Mittal heads the supervisory board at Bosnian coke producer GIKIL. Prosecutors said he could get a jail sentence of up to 45 years if found guilty of the alleged crimes, which reportedly include embezzling $2.8 million.
