headlines: Swaraj India releases 1st list of 10 candidates for Haryana polls
text: Ahead of the upcoming Haryana Assembly polls, Swaraj India party on Tuesday released its first list of 10 candidates, including three women. Party founder Yogendra Yadav said, all the 10 candidates come from "simple and ordinary families" and are committed to public welfare. Yadav said, he'll not contest the Assembly polls and instead work for the success of his candidates.

headlines: NRI voting very much a focus for us: Election Commissioner
text: Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra on Tuesday said that Non-Resident Indians' (NRI) voting is "very much a focus" for the commission because their voice must be heard. He added that it's their constitutional right to participate in the elections. His comment came ahead of provisions being put in place for either proxy voting or voting through embassies and missions for NRIs.

headlines: Fintech startup Zeta gets funding from Sodexo at $300M valuation
text: Bengaluru-based fintech startup Zeta has raised reportedly about $60 million in a Series C funding round at a valuation of around $300 million from French food services and facilities management company Sodexo. This marked the startup's first-ever external funding. Zeta has been funded by Co-founders Bhavin Turakhia and Ramki Gaddipati, who have collectively invested $40 million to date.

headlines: UP woman throws ill 3-month-old from 4th floor of hospital
text: A woman was arrested for throwing her ailing three-month-old son from a hospital's fourth floor in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. In the police complaint, the woman's husband said she was distressed due to their son's continuous medical treatment for liver ailment and jaundice. The incident came to light after the woman claimed that her child had gone missing from the ward.

headlines: 3 Hizbul Mujahideen militants arrested in Srinagar: Police
text: Three newly-recruited Hizbul Mujahideen militants were arrested from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, police said on Tuesday. The overground workers were allegedly involved in lobbing a grenade at a Jammu bus stand in December 2018 and shooting a Special Police Officer in Srinagar's Barzulla. One grenade, 15 rounds of AK-47 rifle, two pistol rounds and a flag were recovered, police said.

headlines: Dhoni doesn't need anybody to tell him what to do: Munaf Patel
text: Reacting to speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said that Dhoni doesn't need anybody to tell him what to do. "He has done so much for the country. What WI have achieved since 1975, Dhoni has done it in a few years. He has won us all trophies. You can't ignore him just like that," he added.

headlines: Eoin Morgan plays cricket with Afghan family, Rashid calls him legend
text: England's 2019 World Cup-winning captain Eoin Morgan took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with an Afghan family. "On the walk home from dinner this evening I was asked to play a game with this lovely Afghan family.. #ThePowerofsport," he wrote alongside the picture. Responding to Morgan's tweet, Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan tweeted, "Legend."

headlines: I am not convinced with Prasad's explanation: Azharuddin on Rayudu
text: Talking about Ambati Rayudu, former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin has said that since Rayudu was among the reserved players for World Cup, he should have been the first-choice as a replacement for an injured player. "Somehow, I am not convinced with the explanation of MSK Prasad (chairman of BCCI selection committee) that the team wanted an opener," he added.

headlines: I was rudely questioned, humiliated at Manchester airport: Wasim Akram
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has claimed he was mistreated by authorities at Manchester airport over his insulin. "I felt very humiliated as I was rudely questioned & ordered publicly to take my insulin out of its travel cold-case & dumped in to a plastic bag," he added. Akram also shared the picture of his insulin in a plastic bag.

headlines: Names on Test jerseys will help spectators identify players: Bhogle
text: After England unveiled their Test jerseys with names and numbers on them, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I like the idea of having numbers and names on shirts in Test cricket." "Helps spectators identify players (as a kid...I was always asking people who a particular player was. Often they didn't know either) and takes nothing away from the game," he added.

headlines: I am the happiest person in the world: Karnataka CM after govt falls
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy, while he was on his way to submit resignation to Governor Vajubhai Vala, told reporters that he is "totally relieved now". "I am the happiest person in the world now," he added. Kumaraswamy resigned shortly after the ruling Congress-JD(S) coalition lost the confidence vote by a margin of six votes in the 225-member state assembly.

headlines: Mayawati expels lone Karnataka BSP MLA for missing floor test
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Tuesday expelled lone Karnataka BSP MLA N Mahesh with immediate effect from the party after he did not attend the trust vote, which the Congress-JD(S) coalition lost 99-105. Mayawati said that Mahesh was asked to vote for the HD Kumaraswamy government and he violated party orders by not appearing in the floor test.

headlines: Iran releases video of crew, including 18 Indians, on captured tanker
text: Iran on Monday released a video of the 23 crew members, including 18 Indian nationals, of a British-flagged tanker that Iran seized on Friday. The crew can be seen talking in a meeting room, operating the ship's systems and cooking in the vessel's kitchen. Iran had earlier announced that all the crew members onboard are safe.

headlines: DCW chief Swati Maliwal posts video of child sex abuse, criticised
text: Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal on Tuesday tweeted a video which showed an old man sexually assaulting a toddler, tagging the Delhi Police's handle and asking them to take action. Many Twitter users criticised Maliwal for posting video of child sex abuse online. A journalist also pointed out that the video was from Hyderabad from March, not Delhi.

headlines: Pakistan willing to give up nuclear weapons if India does: Pak PM
text: When asked during an interview how would Pakistan respond if India said it was giving up its nuclear weapons, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that his country would also be willing to give up its nuclear weapons. "Nuclear war is not an option. And between Pakistan and India, the idea of nuclear war is actually self-destruction", Khan added.

headlines: No rift in Indian team unless players bring it up: CoA
text: The CoA has said as far as they are concerned, there's is no rift in Team India. "The CoA cannot be reacting to reports in the media. If the players have any issue, they can/should bring it up with us," the CoA added. This comes after a section of media reported a rift between Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

headlines: Ex-Barcelona captain Andres Iniesta named La Liga Icon
text: Former Barcelona captain Andres Iniesta has been named the latest La Liga Icon. The La Liga Icons initiative aims to expand La Liga brand through a strategy focused on digital dissemination, allowing La Liga to connect with fans globally. The former Spanish international who scored the team's winning goal in 2010 World Cup final is currently with Japan's J1 League.

headlines: Sehwag shares Chahal's viral pic, wishes him on birthday
text: Former India cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on the occasion of his 29th birthday. Sharing Chahal's viral picture showing him relaxing near boundary during a World Cup match, Sehwag wrote, "Happy Birthday, Yuzvendra Chahal...Isi Attitude ke paise hain, baaki sab ek jaise hain!" Chahal has taken 84 wickets in 49 ODIs.

headlines: Trescothick to join Engs coaching team for 1st 2 Ashes Tests
text: Former cricketer Marcus Trescothick is set to join the England cricket team's coaching staff for the first two Tests of the upcoming Ashes series. According to reports, Trescothick, who played 76 Tests and averaged 43.79, will be with the team both in training sessions and at the team hotel, to support players during the series.

headlines: Dhoni should play aggressively whenever he plays: Azharuddin
text: Former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin has said that whenever MS Dhoni plays, he should play aggressively. "If he plays his natural game more, I feel that will be good for India," he added. "If his interest is still 100 per cent, I feel, he is good player and he should play," he further said amid speculation around Dhoni's retirement.

headlines: New era of development will begin now: Yeddyurappa
text: After the HD Kumaraswamy-led coalition government lost the confidence vote on Tuesday, BJP's Karnataka president BS Yeddyurappa said a new era of development will start from now onwards. "It's the victory of democracy. People were fed up with the Kumaraswamy government," he added. Yeddyurappa further said that his government's focus will be on farmers hit by drought and other problems.

headlines: If Hindus sever connections, Muslims will die of hunger: BJP MLA
text: After Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan's 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark, BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Tuesday said that if Hindus sever connections, Muslims will die of hunger. "This is not the right thing to do...no politician should try to divide society by giving such statements," he added. Earlier today, Hasan said that his words were misinterpreted by the media.

headlines: Congress to hold nationwide protests against BJP: Venugopal
text: Karnataka Congress in-charge KC Venugopal on Tuesday announced that his party will hold nationwide protests against the 'immoral political destabilisation' of BJP. "The subversion of the coalition government...carried out by BJP is one of the most heinous political horse tradings," he said. Earlier today, the Congress-JD(S) alliance lost the trust vote in the state Assembly.

headlines: 272 foreigners, NRIs conferred Padma awards since 1954: Govt
text: MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said that 272 foreigners, Non-Resident Indians, Overseas Citizens of India and Indian-origin people have been conferred with the Padma awards since 1954. "The award is presented...to those who...do extraordinary works and...become an example for...society," Rai said. Anyone without distinction of race, occupation, position or sex is eligible, Rai said.

headlines: Vande Bharat completes test run from Delhi to Katra in 8 hrs
text: India's fastest train Vande Bharat Express on Tuesday successfully completed its test run from New Delhi to Katra in eight hours. The train can run up to a maximum speed of 160 km per hour. Vande Bharat Express has features like Wi-Fi, bio-vacuum toilets, hot case, freezer and GPS-based passenger information system among other amenities.

headlines: Working on compulsory retirement for lazy officials: Uttarakhand CM
text: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on Monday said that the state government is working on a scheme to give compulsory retirement to officials who are lazy and avoid work. There are frequent complaints about officials being slothful and loathe to work, Rawat said. Rawat further said that changing the prevailing work culture among government officials is a necessity.

headlines: Rise in govt borrowing can squeeze corporate sector: Viral Acharya
text: Outgoing RBI Deputy Governor Viral Acharya criticised rising government borrowing saying it risks flooding debt market and makes borrowing more expensive for firms. He added India's borrowing has ranged from 67-85% relative to output since 2000, higher than many emerging markets including China. He also said India should cut back on subsidies and programs that are not delivering long-term growth.

headlines: Kumaraswamy resigns as Karnataka CM after Cong-JD(S) govt falls
text: Amid the political crisis in the state, Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday resigned from the post after meeting Governor Vajubhai Vala. The resignation came after Kumaraswamy-led Congress-JD(S) government lost the trust vote in the Karnataka Assembly. Vala accepted Kumaraswamy's resignation and asked him to continue as the caretaker CM "until alternative arrangements are made".

headlines: K'taka govt falls as Congress-JD(S) alliance fails to prove majority
text: Congress-JD(S) alliance government in Karnataka failed to prove majority in the Assembly during the floor test on Tuesday. The Congress-JD(S) alliance received 99 votes against the BJP's 105. This comes after the Supreme Court said rebel MLAs can't be forced to attend the trust vote.

headlines: Deadline for filing Income Tax Returns extended to August 31
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) on Tuesday extended the due date for filing Income Tax Returns for individuals for FY2018-19 from July 31 to August 31. Earlier, the deadline for employers to provide Form 16 to their employees was extended from June 15 to July 10. This extension had left only 21 days for employees to file returns.

headlines: Vin Diesel's stunt double falls 30 ft on his head while filming stunt
text: Hollywood actor Vin Diesel's 'Fast & Furious 9' stunt double Joe Watts fell at least 30 feet on his head while performing a stunt. It is feared that a safety cable snapped as Joe leapt off a balcony and he suffered serious head injuries. Joe's fiancée wrote, "He's in an induced coma. He is stable and is being monitored closely."

headlines: Stokes turns down 'New Zealander of the Year' nomination
text: New Zealand-born England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said he's flattered to be nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award but it doesn't "sit right" with him. "I've helped England lift World Cup and my life is firmly established in UK [since I was 12]," he added. He further said that New Zealand captain Kane Williamson would be "worthy recipient".

headlines: Test jerseys to have names, numbers for 1st time, England share pics
text: For the first time in 142 years of Test cricket, cricketers will wear jerseys with names and numbers on them. England and Wales Cricket Board released the first look of England's Ashes Test jersey on Instagram, writing, "Happy to see names and numbers on the back of Test shirts?" The first Ashes Test will begin on August 1.

headlines: TikTok deletes 60 lakh Indian videos for violating policy
text: Bytedance-owned lip-syncing video platform TikTok has removed about 60 lakh video clips that violated its content protocol in India. The government had issued a notice to TikTok last week along with a set of questions, warning that a failure to answer and justify the queries could lead to a ban. The platform was accused of facilitating "anti-national" and obscene content.

headlines: Game Of Karma: BJP after HD Kumaraswamy's govt falls in Karnataka
text: After HD Kumaraswamy-led Congress-JD(S) alliance government in Karnataka failed to prove majority in the Karnataka Assembly, the official Twitter account of BJP Karnataka wrote, "Game Of Karma." "Its the victory of people of Karnataka. Its the end of an era of corrupt & unholy alliance. We promise a stable & able governance to the people of Karnataka," it further wrote.

headlines: We have 105 MLAs, we will form a stable govt in Karnataka: BJP
text: After the Congress-JD(S) coalition government failed to prove its majority in Karnataka Assembly on Tuesday, the BJP said that it has 105 MLAs and it will form a stable government in the state. BJP leader Jagadish Shettar said that rebel MLAs of the Congress-JD(s) alliance have to decide whether to join BJP or not after the Speaker accepts their resignations.

headlines: Wholesale trade is a problem, not retail: Siddaramaiah on rebel MLAs
text: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Tuesday took a jibe at rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs, saying that the wholesale trade is a problem. He added that the rebel MLAs who indulged in "wholesale trade" will be disqualified. "If there is retail trade of one or two members then it's not a problem," Siddaramaiah said. Notably, Karnataka's coalition government failed the floor test today.

headlines: Chandrayaan-2 in good health, moving in right direction: ISRO
text: Updating on the status of the nation's second Moon mission aimed at India's first soft landing on Moon, ISRO said the Chandrayaan-2 is in "good health" and moving in the "right direction". If successful, it'll make India the fourth country to accomplish a Moon landing, on September 7. India will also become the first-ever to land near Moon's south pole.

headlines: Former Chinese Premier known as 'Butcher of Beijing' dies aged 90
text: Former Chinese Premier Li Peng died of an illness on Monday at the age of 90, the state media reported. Peng was referred to as the "Butcher of Beijing" for his role in the Tiananmen Square crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in 1989. He served as China's fourth Premier from 1987 to 1998 and held several posts in the Communist Party.

headlines: India should ease law on hiring and firing workers: Panagariya
text: Former NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Arvind Panagariya has said India should ease norms for hiring and firing workers to make it easier for companies to do business. The government has proposed combining multiple laws governing workers to form four sets of labour codes. What's needed is the reform of labour laws and not just streamlining of existing ones, Panagariya added.

headlines: IMF cuts India's 2019-20 GDP growth forecast to 7% from 7.3%
text: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday revised downward India's growth forecast for 2019-20 to 7% from 7.3% due to "a weaker-than-expected outlook for domestic demand". The projection was slashed by 30 bps to 7.2% for the next financial year too. Notably, the World Bank forecast India's GDP to grow by 7.5% during the current and next two financial years.

headlines: After World Bank, China-led development bank drops Amaravati funding
text: China-backed Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) has pulled $200 million of funding for Andhra Pradesh's new capital Amaravati. This comes after the World Bank withdrew $300 million of funding after the central government dropped support for the Amaravati project. The two were due to provide the majority of the $715 million cost of funding for transport, sanitation and water supply.

headlines: Navdeep Saini should also be in India Test team: Munaf Patel
text: Reacting to fast bowler Navdeep Saini being included in India's ODI and T20I teams, former fast bowler Munaf Patel said that the 26-year-old should be in Test team as well. "He is the only bowler who can bowl at 150 kmph," he added. Navdeep, who represents Delhi in the domestic circuit, has picked up 120 wickets in 43 first-class matches.

headlines: Chelsea beat Barcelona 2-1 in pre-season friendly match
text: Chelsea beat Barcelona 2-1 in the sides' pre-season friendly match on Tuesday. Barcelona fielded their new signing, French forward Antoine Griezmann, while Chelsea played Tammy Abraham, who scored in the first half of the match. Chelsea sealed the match in the 81st minute when Ross Barkley scored the winner from the edge of the area.

headlines: ICC bars four Zimbabwe women cricketers to play in England
text: The ICC has barred four Zimbabwe women cricketers including national team's captain Mary-Anne Musonda from travelling to England to represent Women's Global Development Squad. This comes days after the ICC suspended Zimbabwe Cricket on grounds of political interference in its cricketing affairs. Coach Adam Chifo, who was set to accompany the players, was also barred from participating.

headlines: FB removes fake accounts claiming to sell unreleased crypto Libra
text: Facebook has removed several accounts, pages and groups posing to be official hubs offering its unreleased cryptocurrency Libra. "There's a deep irony...Facebook being used as the platform that could undermine trust in the currency Facebook is trying to build trust in," Cornell University Professor Eswar Prasad said. About a dozen fake hubs were spotted in total, including across Instagram.

headlines: Allow only those with less than 3 kids to contest polls: Lok Sabha MP
text: Lok Sabha MP Hanuman Beniwal has said that only those with less than three kids should be allowed to contest elections. Speaking on the bill to amend the Motor Vehicle Act, Beniwal said Indias rising population is one of the reasons for higher road accidents. India should adopt a three-child policy if not the two-child policy of China, Beniwal added.

headlines: MHA removes CRPF cover for Lalu Yadav, Rajiv Pratap Rudy
text: Union Home Ministry has downgraded the security cover of some politicians like RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy, among others. The decision was taken after a comprehensive review of the VIP protectees, provided security by the Central Armed Police Forces. As per reports, Z+ security for Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav has also been withdrawn.

headlines: Former PayU India MD Jitendra Gupta joins BharatPe board
text: Jitendra Gupta, former Managing Director of Naspers' fintech arm PayU's India unit, has been appointed to New Delhi-based fintech startup BharatPe's board. He will be joining BharatPe Co-founders Ashneer Grover and Shashvat Nakrani, Sequoia's Harshjit Sethi and Beenext's Teruhide Sato on the board. Gupta had co-founded Citrus Pay in 2011, which was later acquired by PayU India for $130 million.

headlines: Terror incidents down by 86% in J&K in last decade: Govt
text: MoS for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday said the number of terror incidents in Jammu and Kashmir have reduced by 86% in the last decade from 23,290 to 3,187. Terrorist initiated incidents reduced by 28% and actions initiated by security forces increased by 59% in first half of 2019 as compared to first half of 2018, Reddy said.

headlines: Trump accepts Imran Khan's invitation to visit Pakistan: PTI
text: Pakistan's ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party has said that US President Donald Trump has accepted PM Imran Khan's offer to visit Pakistan. Khan extended the invitation to Trump during his first official trip to the US. "The two leaders had a one-on-one meeting, which was followed by delegation-level talks between the two sides," PTI said.

headlines: IndiGo founders working towards a compromise deal: Reports
text: IndiGo Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia, involved in a dispute, are reportedly working towards a compromise. Reports said both parties are discussing the board's composition which will be expanded up to 10 members and a mechanism where related party transactions (RPT) would need independent directors' approval. Gangwal had accused Bhatia of entering into "questionable" RPTs with IndiGo.

headlines: Section 144 imposed in B'luru for 48 hrs, wine shops shut till 25th
text: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Alok Kumar on Tuesday said, "Today and tomorrow we're imposing Section 144 across the city." "All pubs, wine shops will be closed till 25th. If anyone is found violating these rules, they'll be punished," he added. The decision comes after Congress and BJP workers clashed at Race Course Road in Bengaluru ahead of the Karnataka trust vote.

headlines: If there can be help, it'd be good: Farooq on Trump's offer to mediate
text: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah has said if there can be some help in resolving Kashmir issue, it'd be good. This comes after US President Donald Trump claimed PM Narendra Modi asked him to help with the dispute. Abdullah added, "I congratulate Modiji, he too wants to use everything to solve this issue that's creating tensions between India and Pakistan."

headlines: Anand Piramal invests in Snapdeal
text: Gurugram-based e-commerce startup Snapdeal has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Piramal Group's Executive Director Anand Piramal. The investment has been made by Anand Piramal in his personal capacity. Snapdeal recently said that its consolidated revenue rose by about 73% while losses fell nearly 71% year-on-year in FY19.

headlines: ISRO to launch India's 1st solar mission in first half of 2020
text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has announced the nation's first mission to the Sun, Aditya-L1, aimed at studying its corona. ISRO Chairman K Sivan had revealed the mission is planned to be launched in the first half of 2020. Aditya-L1 satellite will be inserted in a halo orbit around 'L1', 1.5 million kilometres away from the Earth.

headlines: Baby visits PM Narendra Modi in Parliament, pictures go viral
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday shared two pictures of himself playing with a baby who, the Prime Minister said, came to meet him in the Parliament today. PM Modi called the baby "a very special friend" in his social media posts. The child pictured with PM Modi was identified as the grandchild of BJP MP Satyanarayan Jatiya.

headlines: Only 7 IAS officers among 33 new joint secretaries appointed by govt
text: The government has appointed 33 new joint secretaries in the Centre out of which only seven are from Indian Administrative Service (IAS) and four from Indian Revenue Service (IRS). The government brought officers from other services like Indian Railway Service of Mechanical Engineers, Indian Post and Telecommunication Accounts and Finance Service and Indian Defence Accounts Service, among others.

headlines: Surprised by India's reaction to Trump's offer of mediation: Pak PM
text: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan said on Tuesday that he was "surprised" by the reaction of India to US President Donald Trump's offer to mediate between India and Pakistan on the Kashmir issue. "Kashmir conflict...has held subcontinent hostage for 70 years. Generations of Kashmiris have suffered and are suffering daily and need conflict resolution," he further said in a tweet.

headlines: Sad India is on top in deaths due to road accidents: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said that over five lakh road accidents occur in India annually in which about one lakh people die. "It's sad that India is on top in the number of deaths due to road accidents," Gadkari said, while taking up an amendment bill in the Parliament, seeking increased penalties for offences such as drunk driving.

headlines: S Korea fired 360 shots at Russian plane that entered its airspace
text: South Korean warplanes fired as many as 360 warning shots at a Russian military aircraft that entered South Korean airspace on Tuesday, an official at South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) said. However, the Russian Defence Ministry said in a statement that no warning shots were fired from the South Korean warplanes.

headlines: Afghanistan seeks clarification after Trump says could wipe it out
text: Afghanistan has sought clarification from the US after President Donald Trump said he could wipe the country off the face of the Earth. "Afghanistan has not and will never allow any foreign power to determine its fate," Afghan presidential palace said. "If we wanted to fight a war in Afghanistan...I could win the war in a week," Trump had said.

headlines: Who is Boris Johnson, the UK's new Prime Minister?
text: Boris Johnson, the UK's new Prime Minister-designate, rose to prominence in public life when he was the Mayor of London from 2008 to 2016. Johnson has been a supporter of Brexit and vowed to withdraw the UK from the European Union on October 31. The 55-year-old worked as a journalist before entering politics.

headlines: Rio champ Ledecky withdraws from 200m, 1,500m freestyle at WC
text: American swimmer Katie Ledecky has withdrawn from the 200 metres freestyle and will miss her 1,500 metres title defence at the World Aquatics Championships due to illness. Ledecky, who had won Olympic gold in the 200m, 400m and 800m events at the Rio Olympics, had been feeling under the weather since arriving in South Korea last week.

headlines: FINA warns Australian swimmer over podium snub to Chinese rival
text: Swimming's international governing body FINA has issued a warning to Australian swimmer Mack Horton after his refusal to share the podium with Chinese rival Sun Yang at the World Aquatics Championships in South Korea on Sunday. The warning stated that athletes should not use FINA events to make personal statements or gestures.

headlines: England include Jason Roy, Olly Stone for Test vs Ireland
text: England have included Jason Roy and Olly Stone for the one-off four-day England-Ireland Test that is set to be held at Lord's. Roy and Stone will be making their Test debuts in the match ahead of the upcoming Ashes series. Joe Denly, who was dropped for the final 15-man squad for the World Cup, will also take the field.

headlines: BJP MLA condemns Cong minister's remark calling cow 'animal'
text: BJP MLA Vasudev Devnani on Tuesday condemned Congress Minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal's remark calling cow an 'animal' and hurting sentiments of the people. "Dhariwal's comment on cow...is condemnable. The cow is worshipped as a mother in this country," he said. Earlier, Dhariwal had said that cow is a 'highly useful animal' but there is no sense in worshipping it.

headlines: PM should clarify Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation: TMC
text: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Tuesday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should personally clarify US President Donald Trump's remark on Kashmir mediation. This comes after the External Affairs Ministry refuted Trump's claim, adding that all talks with Pakistan are discussed bilaterally. The Rajya Sabha was adjourned till 3 pm due to the ruckus created by lawmakers over Trump's remark.

headlines: Kingpin of drugs trade in state yet to be identified: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that the police has been making efforts to nab the kingpin of the drugs trade in the state. "We're yet to identify the main supplier...but are making all efforts to find him," he added. Sawant claimed that drugs like 'charas' and 'ganja' aren't cultivated in Goa and are being smuggled from neighbouring regions.

headlines: 3 forced to eat excreta over suspected witchcraft in J'khand
text: Three people, including two women, were allegedly thrashed and forced to consume human excreta over the suspicion of practicing witchcraft in Jharkhand's Giridih, police said on Tuesday. Police have arrested four persons in connection with the case while one accused is currently absconding. The accused reportedly suspected that the victims performed rituals that made people fall ill in the area.

headlines: 2 students held for thrashing junior over his friendship with girl
text: Two college students were arrested for allegedly thrashing a junior student over his friendship with a girl in Maharashtra, police said. The girl was a friend of one of the accused but broke up with him sometime back, an official said. The police added that the two accused forcefully took the boy to a secluded place and beat him up.

headlines: 5 arrested for shooting 30-yr-old woman in Delhi: Police
text: Five people, including two contract killers, have been arrested in connection with shooting a 30-year-old woman in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. According to the police, two contract killers were hired by the woman's acquaintances to kill her. The woman sustained injuries on her neck and is currently undergoing treatment in a hospital, the police added.

headlines: JPMorgan to shut one of its Indian NBFCs, surrenders licence
text: American financial services firm JPMorgan is shutting its non-banking financial company (NBFC) JPMorgan Advisors India. "We surrendered the licence as we aren't conducting any business in this firm and will move for closure," JPMorgan said. "We are not exiting our NBFC business. We continue to operate an NBFC in India known as JPMorgan Securities India," the company added.

headlines: Air India plans to revive all 17 grounded planes by October
text: Debt-laden Air India is planning to bring all its 17 grounded planes back into operation by October-end for maximising revenue, Chairman Ashwani Lohani said. Of the 17 planes which were grounded for up to a year due to lack of maintenance and repair funds, eight would begin operations by August-end. The government recently said it's committed to Air India's disinvestment.

headlines: India in far better place than most major economies: RBI Guv
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said India is currently in a far better position than most other major economies, and signs for economic growth recovery are looking good. "This year we've projected 7% [GDP growth]. There was uncertainty...but now monsoon outlook has improved...oil prices remain in $65-range," he added. RBI had cut its 2019-20 GDP growth forecast from 7.2% to 7%.

headlines: Boris Johnson elected UK Prime Minister
text: Boris Johnson was on Tuesday elected as the leader of Britain's governing Conservative Party and the country's next Prime Minister. Johnson will formally take over as Prime Minister on Wednesday, succeeding Theresa May, who stepped down over her failure to get parliament to ratify her Brexit deal. Johnson has in the past served as UK foreign minister and London's Mayor.

headlines: SC extends deadline to publish final Assam NRC list to August 31
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the deadline to publish the final list of National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam from July 31 to August 31. This was after the state NRC coordinator Prateek Hajela had requested the extension, citing floods. The court, however, rejected the Centre's request to allow re-verification of names included in the NRC.

headlines: Was stopped at US airport for over 3hrs due to Iranian roots: Actress
text: 'Sacred Games' actress Elnaaz Norouzi has claimed she was stopped at Chicago airport and had to stay in immigration for over 3 hours and undergo lengthy interrogation due to her "Iranian roots". "Trump has put...ban on [Iranians]...they don't get ESTA anymore," Elnaaz, who holds a German passport, added. She claimed she missed her connecting flight due to the interrogation.

headlines: Lalu's son Tej dresses up as Lord Shiva to offer prayers, shares pics
text: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap Yadav on Monday dressed up as Lord Shiva to offer prayers at a Patna temple and shared his pictures on social media. He also shared a video of himself offering the prayers. Earlier this month, he warned he will "rip apart" those spreading rumours of rift with his brother Tejashwi Yadav.

headlines: Muslims hearing 'kabristan or Pakistan' for 70 years: Azam Khan
text: Reacting to Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan's 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark, party leader Azam Khan said, "It is a sad thing that such a situation arose. But...Who had started this?" "For the last 70 years, we (Muslims) have been hearing either 'go to kabristan (grave)' or 'go to Pakistan'. Who is responsible for it?" he asked.

headlines: I was the reason MTB Nagaraj got a ticket: Congress' DK Shivakumar
text: Congress leader DK Shivakumar has said in Karnataka Assembly that he was the reason MTB Nagaraj got a ticket from Congress. Shivakumar added, "Couldn't we have locked them (rebel MLAs) up? No, because we have trust in them. Bring them here, let them vote against this government." Notably, Speaker has ordered to complete the trust vote by 6 pm today.

headlines: OYO Founder to get $2-billion loan from Japan's Nomura, Mizuho
text: OYO Founder, 25-year-old Ritesh Agarwal, is receiving a $2-billion loan from three Japanese lenders including Nomura, Mizuho and an unknown bank, to purchase the Gurugram-based budget hospitality startup's shares. Agarwal is purchasing a $1.5-billion stake from early OYO investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India. He will be investing the rest $500 million in the startup.

headlines: NASA replies after criticism over tweet congratulating ISRO
text: NASA has responded after criticism for its tweet in which it congratulated ISRO for the successful launch of 'Chandrayaan-2'. After Twitter users claimed that NASA was "boasting about its own capabilities" in the congratulatory tweet, NASA replied, "We're proud to support international exploration missions & see what they learn. The principle of global cooperation is one of our guiding philosophies."

headlines: BJP leader, wife & son shot dead at their home in Jharkhand
text: Local BJP leader, Mago Munda, along with his wife and son, was shot dead by unidentified assailants at his house in Jharkhand's Khunti district on Monday night. Munda was a member of the state working committee of the ST morcha of the party and the vice president of the Murhu block level 20-point programme implementation committee.

headlines: Kashmir issue will never be resolved bilaterally: Pak PM Imran Khan
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said in an interview that the issue of Kashmir will never be resolved bilaterally. Khan's statement came after US President Donald Trump offered to mediate on the Kashmir issue, claiming PM Narendra Modi had also requested him to. However, India has denied Trump's claim, reiterating that all issues with Pakistan are to be resolved bilaterally.

headlines: 251-metre-tall Ram statue in Ayodhya to be world's tallest: UP CM
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that a 251-metre-tall statue of Lord Ram will be built in Ayodhya, which he claimed will be the world's tallest statue. At 251 metres, it'll stand taller than the 182-metre-tall Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel statue (Statue of Unity) in Gujarat. Yogi Adityanath said the Ram statue would be installed on a 100-acre site.

headlines: India's crude oil output in June falls to lowest in four months
text: India's crude oil production in June fell 6.8% from a year earlier to about 2.69 million tonnes, the lowest since February, government data showed. Further, Indian refiners processed 20.30 million tonnes of crude oil in June, down 7.1% from last year. Reliance Industries' Jamnagar refinery and Indian Oil's Barauni refinery were among the key refineries affected by shutdowns in June.

headlines: Zimbabwe all-rounder Solomon Mire announces retirement
text: Following the suspension of Zimbabwe Cricket by the ICC, Zimbabwe's all-rounder Solomon Mire has announced his retirement from cricket. Mire featured in 47 ODIs, nine T20Is and two Tests for Zimbabwe, scoring 955, 253 and 78 runs in the formats respectively. "Representing my country at the highest level for me has been the highest honour and service," Mire wrote.

headlines: James Anderson ruled out of one-off Test vs Ireland
text: English pacer James Anderson has been ruled out of the one-off England-Ireland four-day Test to be held at Lord's. Anderson has failed to recover from the injury sustained to his right leg when playing for his county Lancashire against Durham on July 2. Anderson will continue to be assessed ahead of the first Ashes Test at Edgbaston on August 1.

headlines: China's Boxing Federation names Mayweather as 'special adviser'
text: According to the Chinese Boxing Federation, retired American boxer Floyd Mayweather has agreed to become a "special adviser" to the Chinese Olympic boxing team to help them prepare for the Tokyo Olympics in 2020. China had won four medals in boxing events at the 2016 Summer Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

headlines: Facebook admits Messenger Kids app bug let kids talk to strangers
text: Facebook has admitted that a security flaw on its chat platform dedicated to children, Messenger Kids, could let them talk with strangers who hadn't been approved by their parents. The flaw let group chat admins add their approved contacts to the group, even if they weren't approved by other group member's parent. Facebook said it has closed affected chats.

headlines: Andhra Pradesh Dy Speaker suspends 3 TDP MLAs from Assembly
text: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Speaker Kona Raghupathi suspended three TDP MLAs from the Assembly for obstructing the proceedings of the House. The MLAs started protesting after not being satisfied with the explanation given by the YSRCP over its promise of granting a pension to minority communities' women over the age of 45. They were suspended for the rest of the session.

headlines: It's time for Rahul, his young team to rebuild Cong: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said that the time has come for party leader Rahul Gandhi and his "young team" to take over and rebuild the party. He added that the party has always encouraged young leadership and now the team should take BJP/RSS ideology head-on. He said the team should save the country from this "ideology of hate and violence".

headlines: PM Modi-led govt fully corruption-free: Harsimrat Kaur
text: Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi-led central government is fully "corruption-free". She added that the Ministry of Food Processing Industries registered zero cases of corruption due to strong steps taken against the menace by the Centre. She further said, "The Prime Minister had announced that 'na khaunga, na khane dunga'."

headlines: Woman accuses husband of giving triple talaq; seeks help from PM
text: A woman named Rabiya Rao in Uttar Pradesh has accused her husband of giving her triple talaq in 2017 and forcing her to marry either his brother or his uncle. "I wrote...to PM Narendra Modi to seek help...I even met the UP CM....but I'm still struggling to get justice," she said. The police have registered an FIR in this matter.

headlines: New bills on cyber security, crime against women soon: Govt
text: G Kishan Reddy, MoS for Home Affairs, on Saturday said that the Centre would soon bring new bills on cybersecurity, cyber terrorism and also to check crimes against women and girls. "Protection of women is a state subject, we shall make amendments to IPC," he added. Reddy further said that the Ministry will have online connectivity with all police stations.

headlines: Slippers left after Scarlett Keeling's murder led to man's conviction
text: A pair of orange slippers that beach shack worker Samson D'Souza left behind as he hurriedly abandoned British teenager Scarlett Keeling on Goa's Anjuna beach led to his conviction in the 11-year-old murder case. D'Souza was accused of drugging and sexually assaulting Keeling before leaving her to die. The Bombay High Court last week sentenced him to 10 years' imprisonment.

headlines: SC orders cancellation of registration of Amrapali group of companies
text: The Supreme Court has ordered cancellation of registration of all Amrapali group of companies and directed Enforcement Directorate to conduct a detailed investigation against the group for diverting home-buyers' money. SC also directed the National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) to complete Amrapali's unfinished housing projects in Noida and Greater Noida and handover these to home-buyers.

headlines: Imran Khan admits Pak knew about Osama's presence on its soil
text: In an interview during his visit to the US, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan admitted that the country knew about the presence of al-Qaeda chief Osama bin Laden on its soil. Pakistan's spy agency ISI provided information to the CIA, which helped the US track down Osama, Khan claimed. Pakistan had previously denied having any knowledge of Osama's presence.

headlines: Avatar maker congratulates Avengers on becoming top-grossing film
text: 'Avatar' director James Cameron has congratulated 'Avengers: Endgame' makers after it surpassed the record of 'Avatar' to become the highest-grossing film of all time. "Congratulations to Avengers: Endgame on becoming the new box-office king," the text accompanying a picture of Iron Man with Pandora's creatures read. Cameron also congratulated Marvel when it broke the record of his other film 'Titanic'.

headlines: Was waiting for announcement, disappointed at not being picked: Gill
text: After failing to make it to Team India squads for West Indies tour, 19-year-old batsman Shubman Gill said he was expecting to be selected for at least one of the squads. "I was waiting for the team to be announced...It was disappointing not to get picked," he added. "I'm not going to spend time thinking over it," he further said.

headlines: Ashwin takes wicket with unique action, video goes viral
text: A video of Dindigul Dragons captain Ravichandran Ashwin taking a wicket with a unique action against Madurai Panthers in TNPL-4 has gone viral. Ashwin hid the ball behind his back till the last moment and delivered it while keeping his left hand almost motionless. The batsman was deceived by the slow flight of the ball and got caught at long-leg.

headlines: Ronaldo to not face criminal charges in 10-year-old rape case
text: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo won't face criminal charges over allegations he raped a woman at a Las Vegas hotel in 2009, according to prosecutors. Clark County District Attorney Steve Wolfson said there isn't enough evidence to prove the allegations beyond reasonable doubt. Police said that the initial investigation was closed in 2009 after the woman did not reveal Ronaldo's identity.

headlines: Apple in talks to buy Intel's modem biz for over $1 bn: Report
text: Apple is in advanced talks to buy Intel's smartphone modem business for $1 billion or more, The Wall Street Journal reported. This comes weeks after a report had claimed the iPhone maker was in talks to acquire part of the chipmaker's modem business, Intel's "struggling" Germany unit. Notably, Apple has entered into a six-year licensing agreement with Intel-rival Qualcomm.

headlines: Impossible that PM Modi will ask anyone to mediate on Kashmir: Tharoor
text: While taking a dig at US President Donald Trump over his recent claims that PM Narendra Modi asked him to mediate on the Kashmir issue, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said, "Trump doesn't know what's he saying." "Impossible that (PM) Modi will ask anyone else to mediate because it's our clear policy that we don't want a third-party mediation," he added.

headlines: SP MLA clarifies his 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark
text: Uttar Pradesh Samajwadi Party MLA Nahid Hasan claimed that different meaning was attached to his 'boycott pro-BJP shopkeepers' remark. He linked his remark to demolition of stalls of "poor vendors" due to development projects. "I had said 'the BJP shopkeepers' because the BJP is in power now and some of its leaders are involved in things like this," Hasan added.

headlines: We're hungry: K'taka MLAs tell Speaker in order to delay trust vote
text: As Karnataka Assembly session began at 11 am and continued till 10:30 pm, several JD(S)-Congress coalition MLAs told the Speaker to adjourn the House citing that they were all "very hungry". "I am willing to order food from a hotel, eat and continue," Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar said. Eventually, the Assembly was adjourned at 11:30 pm.

headlines: PM must tell nation what transpired: Rahul on Trump's mediation claim
text: Talking about US President Donald Trump's remarks on Kashmir mediation, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Trump says PM (Narendra) Modi asked him to mediate between India & Pakistan on Kashmir!" "A weak Foreign Ministry denial won't do. PM must tell the nation what transpired in the meeting between him & [Trump]," he added, referring to their meeting amid G20 Summit.

headlines: Give 4 weeks to appear: Rebel MLAs to Speaker on disqualification plea
text: Around 13 rebel Karnataka MLAs have written to Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar seeking four weeks' time to respond to his summons on the disqualification petition moved against them by Congress leader Siddaramaiah. This comes after the Speaker summoned the rebel lawmakers to meet him on Tuesday. Around 16 Congress and JD(S) MLAs had submitted their resignations.

headlines: In no hurry to exit firms in India: SoftBank Vision Fund
text: SoftBank Vision Fund's Managing Partner Munish Varma said the fund is in no hurry to list the Indian companies it has invested in. "Globally, we've had a number of companies that went public - Uber and Slack to name a few," Varma said. "As India grows, the plan is the same...We'll take them public when the time's right," he added.

headlines: AI research lab OpenAI raises $1 billion from Microsoft
text: San Francisco-based AI research lab OpenAI has raised $1 billion from Microsoft. "Our ambition is to democratise AI, while always keeping AI safety front and centre, so everyone can benefit," Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said. OpenAI was Co-founded by Elon Musk in 2015, who left its board and daily operations in 2018 to avoid a conflict of interest with Tesla.

headlines: Policeman jumps into Ganga to save drowning man; dept shares video
text: Uttarakhand Police has shared a video of a policeman jumping into Ganga river to save a Haryana-based man from drowning. The man had gone for a dip when he slipped and fell into the river. He was being carried away by the current of the river when the policeman saw him and jumped in to save his life.

headlines: UP man hiding from dogs set on fire on being mistaken for thief; dies
text: A 28-year-old man succumbed to his injuries at a Lucknow hospital four days after he was mistaken for a thief and stripped, thrashed and set on fire in UP's Barabanki. He was going to his in-laws' place on Thursday when stray dogs forced him to hide in a shed outside a house. Five people have been charged with his murder.

headlines: Afghanistan would be wiped off if US fights a war there: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said if the US wanted to fight a war in Afghanistan and win it, the country could win it in a week. "Afghanistan would be wiped off the face of Earth...literally in 10 days," he added. However, he further said, "I just don't want to kill 10 million people...I don't want to go that route."

headlines: Relations with Pak improved after we ended $1.3 billion aid: Trump
text: During his meeting with Pakistan PM Imran Khan, US President Donald Trump said relations between the two countries improved after the US ended the $1.3 billion aid that it had been giving to Pakistan. "We were paying $1.3 billion...Pakistan was not doing anything for us," Trump added. US ended the aid after Pakistan failed to combat terrorism on its soil.

headlines: South Korea fires at Russian aircraft that entered its airspace
text: The South Korean military fired warning shots at Russian military aircraft that entered South Korean airspace on Tuesday, the Ministry of National Defence in Seoul said. The South Korean government would lodge an official complaint with Russia, the Ministry added. It was the first time Russian military aircraft violated South Korean airspace, an official said.

headlines: IMD issues red alert for 2 Kerala districts, predicts heavy rains
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Kerala's Kannur and Kasargod districts saying that the two districts are expected to receive 'extremely heavy' rains in the next 24 hours. It issued an orange alert for Kozhikode, Malappuram and Wayanad. Schools in Kannur, Kasargod and Malappuram have been closed for today in the view of IMD's warning.

headlines: 3 godowns gutted in fire in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi
text: Three godowns were gutted in a fire on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi, officials said. A bike parked outside one of the buildings was destroyed in the fire and residents of nearby buildings said, they heard blasting noises from the buildings. A fire officer said that they faced problems reaching the spot due to bad roads.

headlines: US reverses Trump's offer to mediate, says Kashmir a bilateral issue
text: Reversing US President Donald Trump's offer to mediate in the Kashmir dispute, US State Department's Acting Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asia Alice Wells said, "Kashmir is a bilateral issue." "Trump administration welcomes Pakistan and India sitting down and the US stands ready to assist," she added. Trump had claimed PM Narendra Modi asked him to mediate.

headlines: PM Modi didn't request Trump to mediate on Kashmir issue: MEA
text: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar has refuted US President Donald Trump's claim that PM Narendra Modi requested him to mediate on Kashmir issue with Pakistan. "It has been India's consistent position that all outstanding issues with Pakistan are discussed only bilaterally," Kumar tweeted. "Any engagement with Pakistan would require an end to cross border terrorism," he added.

headlines: US lawmaker apologises to Indian envoy for Trump's Kashmir claim
text: US Congressman Brad Sherman has apologised to Indian Ambassador to the US Harsh V Shringla over President Donald Trump's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had requested him to mediate on Kashmir issue with Pakistan. "Everyone knows PM Modi would never suggest such a thing. Trump's statement is amateurish and delusional. And embarrassing," Sherman tweeted.

headlines: Alum of Great Learnings PGP-DSE lands job at Fractal Analytics
text: Sneha upskilled with Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and landed a job at Fractal Analytics. The program is designed to help early-career professionals become proficient in data science with a curriculum designed by industry experts and taught by leading academicians. Learners get placement assistance and an average salary hike of 65% upon transitioning.

headlines: Ex-Indian Idol judge Anu Malik to return to TV post #MeToo row: Reports
text: Singer-composer Anu Malik, who had earlier stepped down as the judge of 'Indian Idol' season 10 after being accused of sexual harassment, will return to television with the music reality show 'Superstar Singer', as per reports. "He will make an appearance along with lyricist Sameer in an episode dedicated to the songs composed and written by them," reports stated.

headlines: Sex education should be introduced in schools: Sonakshi Sinha
text: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, while speaking about her upcoming film 'Khandaani Shafakhana', said, "It talks about the importance of sex education, which should be introduced in schools." "We consider ourselves a modern society but we hesitate to talk about sex," she added. Sonakshi will be seen playing a character who is running a fertility clinic in the film.

headlines: 17-yr-old shooter Manu Bhaker gets admission in Lady Shri Ram College
text: CWG 2018 gold medallist shooter Manu Bhaker will pursue Political Science at the Lady Shri Ram College in Delhi. The 17-year-old will pursue the course under the sports quota. "Congratulations to our young #shooting champion. Our TOPS athlete has won gold medals at CWG and various World Cup and has earned quota for 2020 Olympics," Sports Authority of India tweeted.

headlines: Jofra Archer can succeed in Tests: James Anderson
text: England pacer James Anderson has said that pacer Jofra Archer has got a great future ahead of him and that he can succeed in Tests. "To come into a World Cup final and deliver under that sort of pressure was amazing to see...especially for such a young guy," he added. Notably, Archer was England's highest wicket-taker in 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Trust vote should be passed by 6 PM on Tuesday: K'taka Assembly Speaker
text: Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar unilaterally adjourned the assembly till 10 am on Tuesday after failing to conduct a floor test on Monday. He also set a deadline to complete all the proceedings regarding the floor test by 4 PM on Tuesday and added that the trust vote should be completed by 6 PM.

headlines: Man dies of electrocution in Delhi, another dies saving him
text: Two men were electrocuted after a high-tension overhead cable fell on a water-logged street in south Delhi's Fatehpur Beri on Sunday. A plumber died after the cable got entangled in the bike he was riding, while a 54-year-old carpenter was electrocuted when he rushed to save the plumber. A BSES official said their internal accidents committee is investigating the case.

headlines: Resignation letter fake, someone forged my signatures: Karnataka CM
text: After a letter claiming to be a resignation note by Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy went viral on social media, the Chief Minister said that the letter is fake. He alleged that the BJP created the letter and circulated it on internet. The letter had claimed that the Chief Minister was resigning due to personal reasons.

headlines: I like Pakistani reporters much better than US reporters: Trump
text: During his meeting with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan in the White House, US President Donald Trump asked a reporter if he is from Pakistan. He further said, "I want a couple of Pakistani reporters. I like them much better than our [US] reporters." The US President has in the past called his country's media "fake" and "dishonest".

headlines: Kalraj Mishra takes oath as Governor of Himachal Pradesh
text: Former Union Minister Kalraj Mishra on Monday took oath as the new Governor of Himachal Pradesh in Shimla. The 78-year-old succeeded Acharya Devvrat after Devvrat was appointed as the new Governor of Gujarat. Mishra resigned as Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises in 2017 after crossing the age of 75, BJP's unofficial age limit for holding an elected post.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi is and will be captain of Congress: Ashok Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that Rahul Gandhi is still the captain of the Congress and will remain so in future. "[Rahul] had the guts to take on the BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi," said Gehlot. Gehlot refused to comment on the Congress Working Committee's decision on appointing a new chief following Rahul Gandhi's public resignation.

headlines: 2 brothers of martyr rifleman Aurangzeb join Army
text: The two younger brothers of martyred rifleman Aurangzeb joined the Army on Monday in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri. "After our training, we'll fight against terrorism and take revenge for our martyred brother," one of the brothers said. Martyred Aurangzeb was en route home to celebrate Eid when he was abducted and later shot dead by terrorists in June 2018.

headlines: 8 held for killing 4 over suspicion of witchcraft in Jharkhand
text: Eight people were arrested on Monday for killing four elderly people of three different families who allegedly practised witchcraft in Jharkhand's Gumla, police said. As per locals, 10-12 people with their faces covered, dragged the victims out of their homes and beat them to death on Sunday. "We are organising workshops to spread awareness against witchcraft," Superintendent of Police said.

headlines: SBI restores net banking, YONO app after temporary glitch
text: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday evening said it has restored its online banking portal and mobile banking app YONO, which were down since morning after a temporary glitch. Several users took to Twitter to complain that they were unable to carry out transactions on the platforms. SBI responded, "Our services have resumed. We apologise for the inconvenience."

headlines: Fan shares Akshay's autographed picture from 1997, actor responds
text: Akshay Kumar has responded to a fan who shared an autographed picture of the actor that he had sent to the fan in 1997. "I had sent you the appreciation letter, and in return you sent me this photo. Hope you [remember] it," the fan wrote. "Of course I do...good old days of fan mail," Akshay replied.

headlines: I will fix Pakistan cricket team, remember my words: Pak PM Imran
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan, while addressing a gathering of Pakistanis in US' Washington, said that he has decided to fix the Pakistan cricket team. "We'll fix the system and bring one in which best talent comes forward," he added. "The team you see in next World Cup, remember my words, that team will be a professional team," he further said.

headlines: No point of having Saha around if Pant is keeper in Tests: Bhogle
text: Talking about inclusion of both Rishabh Pant and Wriddhiman Saha in Test squad for West Indies tour, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "I hope selectors make it clear who the no. 1 keeper is." "Saha is clearly the better keeper...but if Pant's the keeper they want to go with, there's little to be gained by having Saha hanging around," he added.

headlines: Lasith Malinga to end his 15-year ODI career on July 26
text: Fast bowler Lasith Malinga will retire from ODI cricket after Sri Lanka's first ODI of the three-match series against Bangladesh on July 26. The 35-year-old, who made his ODI debut on July 17, 2004, has taken 335 wickets in 225 ODIs. Only Muttiah Muralitharan (523) and Chaminda Vaas (399) have taken more wickets than Malinga in ODIs for Sri Lanka.

headlines: 'Anti-competitive' legal action: Pine Labs on Innoviti's lawsuit
text: Payment solutions provider Pine Labs on Monday said it'll appear before the District Court in Bengaluru to refute allegations of patent infringement levelled by competitor Innoviti. "We'll defend against such frivolous and anti-competitive legal actions," Pine Labs said. Innoviti alleged Pine Labs infringed its patent for technology enabling Unified Payments Interface at point of sale terminals.

headlines: NASA congratulates ISRO on successful Chandrayaan-2 launch
text: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) on Monday congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of 'Chandrayaan-2', India's second Moon mission. "We look forward to what you learn about the lunar south pole," NASA tweeted. Notably, 'Chandrayaan-2' is the world's first-ever mission aimed towards a soft landing on the Moon's south polar region.

headlines: Trump meets Pak PM Imran Khan, offers to mediate on Kashmir issue
text: US President Donald Trump met Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan at the White House on Monday where he offered to 'mediate Kashmir dispute between India and Pakistan', AFP said. "If I can help, I would love to be a mediator," Trump said. Trump also said that PM Narendra Modi had asked him to help with Kashmir issue, Reuters reported.

headlines: 6 girls flee school after forced to clean toilets; school denies
text: Six girls, students of Kasturba Gandhi residential school in Barabanki, who were found missing from the premises of the school were traced from a nearby village and brought back. The girls accused the warden of forcing them to clean toilets and utensils. The warden and the school denied the allegations, saying they were making such allegations because they were homesick.

headlines: Police accidentally uses cat filter while streaming presser on murder
text: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police in British Columbia accidentally used a cat filter while live streaming a press conference about a murdered couple. After being alerted by social media users, the force said that the cat filter was an "automatic setting" and apologised for the error. It later uploaded an unfiltered version of the conference to its Facebook account.

headlines: Yuvraj Singh trolls Ganguly after Brian Lara asks him 'what's dadagiri?'
text: Yuvraj Singh trolled Sourav Ganguly after former West Indies captain Brian Lara commented on the former India captain's picture on Instagram asking, "What's Dadagiri?" Ganguly explained to Lara that Dadagiri is a reality game show he has been hosting for last seven years. Yuvraj mocked Ganguly, writing, "Basically he is a bully, he bullies youngsters."

headlines: James Anderson can reclaim Test top spot in Ireland Test
text: Pacer James Anderson has a chance to reclaim the top spot in the Test bowler rankings in the upcoming one-off England-Ireland Test that will begin at Lord's from Wednesday. Anderson was overtaken by South Africa's Kagiso Rabada in November last year before Australia's Pat Cummins took the top spot. Anderson will be competing with Cummins during the upcoming Ashes series.

headlines: Harbhajan Singh trolls Pakistan after Chandrayaan-2 launch
text: Veteran Indian off-spinner Harbhajan Singh mocked Pakistan after ISRO successfully launched Chandrayaan-2 on Monday. The 39-year-old tweeted emojis of flags of several countries including Pakistan, writing, "Some countries have moon on their flags," and followed them with emojis of flags of USA, Russia, India and China, writing, "While some countries having their flags on moon."

headlines: Harmeet, Ayhika win gold in Commonwealth TT C'ship 2019
text: Indian table tennis players Harmeet Desai and Ayhika Mukherjee won the men's and women's singles titles at the 21st Commonwealth Table Tennis Championships at Cuttack on Monday. India topped the medal tally with seven gold medals, five silver medals and three bronze medals, finishing ahead of England, who won two silver medals and three bronze medals.

headlines: Smith is always on mission, hits a million balls daily: Paine
text: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has praised ex-captain Steve Smith ahead of the Ashes, saying, "Smith is always on a mission. He's hit a million balls and our coach's arm is falling off already." Paine added that one doesn't become "one of the best players in the world" without having a mission. The Ashes series will begin on August 1.

headlines: I find it quite fascinating: Tim Paine on concussion rule
text: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has called the concussion substitute rule which will come into effect in international cricket from August 1 "quite fascinating". "You can replace a guy halfway through a game. It's going to be interesting," the 34-year-old added. Notably, Cricket Australia had become the first cricket governing body to adopt concussion substitutes in 2016.

headlines: Shane Warne reveals his Aus XI, Eng XI ahead of Ashes 1st Test
text: Former Australia leg spinner Shane Warne has revealed his Australia and England elevens ahead of the sides' first Ashes Test which starts on August 1. Warne included Travis Head, Matthew Wade and James Pattinson in his Australia eleven while choosing Zak Crawley and Ben Foakes in his England eleven for the first Test.

headlines: Apple to launch iPhones with gaming-centric displays in 2020: Report
text: Apple is reportedly considering a gaming-centric switchable 60Hz/120Hz refresh rate screen for its 2020 line-up of iPhones. The company is said to be in discussions with Samsung and LG for the screens. Notably, all of Apple's 10.5-inch and 12.9-inch iPads released since 2017 have ultra-fast refresh rates.

headlines: My ancestors are not rishis: Kanimozhi on BJP MP's remark
text: DMK MP Kanimozhi in the Lok Sabha rejected BJP MP Satya Pal Singh's claim of humans evolving from sages saying, her ancestors are not rishis. "My ancestors are homo sapiens, as science says, and my parents are shudras," Kanimozhi said. Kanimozhi further said, "They were not even born of any god, or part of any god. They were born outside."

headlines: Congress credits Nehru, Manmohan for Chandrayaan-2 launch
text: After the successful launch of Chandrayaan-2, Congress praised the contributions of former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru and Manmohan Singh in a tweet. Nehru had funded space research by setting up INCOSPAR in 1962 and Singh had sanctioned the Chandrayaan-2 project in 2008, the tweet read. The tweet was criticised by BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra for attempting to politicise the issue.

headlines: This year's Amarnath Yatra to conclude on August 15
text: This year's Amarnath Yatra is set to conclude on August 15, coinciding with Raksha Bandhan, Shravan Purnima and the Independence Day. Till Sunday evening, as many as 2.72 lakh pilgrims had paid obeisance at the shrine. Officials revealed that the fresh batch comprising 3,178 pilgrims left in a convoy of 128 vehicles early on Monday.

headlines: Death toll in Bihar floods rises to 102; 72 lakh affected
text: Five more people were killed in the Bihar floods raising the death toll to 102 on Sunday, with over 72 lakh affected in 12 districts, Bihar's Disaster Management Department said. Nearly 1.15 lakh people have taken shelter in 133 relief centres set up across the districts. As many as 776 community kitchens are being run to feed the affected population.

headlines: Man dies in police custody in UP; sub-inspector suspended
text: A 20-year-old man died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh, following which a sub-inspector was suspended, police said on Monday. The deceased fell ill and was taken to the prison hospital but rushed to the district hospital when his condition worsened, where he was declared brought dead. Postmortem revealed he had 17 internal injuries and his liver was badly damaged.

headlines: Problem is people glorifying flawed characters: Taapsee on Kabir Singh
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while speaking about Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' allegedly glorifying misogyny, said, "The problem is not showing flawed characters...The problem is when you glorify them and make what they are doing seem heroic." "This character is so revered that whatever he does is not just accepted, it is celebrated," she added.

headlines: My films may not have worked, but acting wasn't criticised: Sonakshi
text: Actress Sonakshi Sinha has said her films may not have worked, but her performance in the films was never criticised. "I have always been appreciated for my performance which makes me happy and that is the validation that I need," she added. Sonakshi further said she never craved for box-office numbers.

headlines: David Lloyd mocks Dhoni's decision to train with army, criticised
text: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd was criticised for mocking ex-India captain MS Dhoni's decision to train with his Army regiment by commenting on a news report with laughing emojis. "If you cannot respect what you should, you better stay away. Feel sorry for this person," a user wrote. "What's the joke? Please tell us, so we can also laugh," wrote another.

headlines: Twitter to give more context to 'this tweet is unavailable' notices
text: Twitter has said that it will soon begin providing more details on why certain tweets go unavailable in a conversation thread on the microblogging platform. The notice is usually seen due to deleted or protected tweets, or muted keywords. "The fact that the 'unavailable' message is showing with a placeholder row...is confusing. They should be hidden," Twitter's Product Lead said.

headlines: I didn't eat biryani: Karnataka CM on viral pic with IMA scam accused
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Monday responded to the viral picture of him with IMA scam accused Mansoor Khan, and said, "I didn't eat biryani." "I was invited during Ramzan. I went there. I didn't eat biryani...I picked only two morsels of rice," Kumaraswamy said. Earlier, Karnataka BJP shared the picture and accused Kumaraswamy of having biryani with Khan.

headlines: RTI Amendment Bill passed in Lok Sabha amid Opposition protest
text: The Right to Information (Amendment) Bill, 2019, proposing to give Centre the power to set tenure and salaries of Chief Information Commissioner and Information Commissioners was passed in Lok Sabha on Monday. As many as 218 members favoured the bill, while 79 were against it. The Opposition argued that the Bill will take away the independence of the RTI authorities.

headlines: Videos of Sonbhadra massacre surface, hundreds seen fighting with sticks
text: Two videos of the Sonbhadra massacre that left 10 tribals dead and around 28 injured on July 17 have surfaced online. In the videos, hundreds of people can be seen fighting with sticks. A group led by village headman Yagya Dutt can be seen attacking the tribals with sticks and guns. A group of women can be seen mourning deaths.

headlines: Govt panel recommends ban on private cryptocurrencies
text: An inter-ministerial government committee on Monday recommended a ban on private cryptocurrencies and imposing fines and penalties on activities related to digital currencies. The panel cited "risks associated and volatility in the prices of private cryptocurrencies". This comes a day after MoS for Finance Anurag Thakur denied that government was considering a blanket ban on cryptocurrencies.

headlines: Scientists are our new celebrities: Mahindra on Chandrayaan-2 launch
text: After ISRO's successful launch of India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Was waiting to see the ISRO folks hug each other before breathing normally again!" "I stand & salute our scientists. They are deservedly our new celebrities," he added. He called the mission a "validation of our cryogenic technology" and a "technological breakthrough".

headlines: Adam Peaty wins 100m breaststroke world title for 3rd time
text: British swimmer Adam Peaty has won the 100m breaststroke world title for the third time with his victory at the World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea. Peaty's compatriot James Wilby finished in the second spot while Yan Zibei of China ended in the third place. Notably, Wilby's silver medal is his first World Championship medal.

headlines: Australian swimmer Horton refuses to join China's Yang on podium
text: Australian swimmer Mack Horton, who in the past labelled his Chinese rival Sun Yang as a "drug cheat", refused to take the podium with Yang at the World Aquatics Championships in South Korea on Sunday. Horton, who finished second behind Yang in 400m freestyle, had also declined to shake hands with Yang or pose for photos with him.

headlines: 3 held for thrashing national level shooter in UP's Baghpat
text: Three persons were arrested for thrashing Devansh Rana, a national level shooter, in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat, police said. The player said that the accused started beating him when he was out for some work, saying he had threatened their friend. The player's father said that he learnt about the incident through the incident's viral video and then registered an FIR.

headlines: Equifax to pay up to $700 mn to settle US data breach probes
text: Credit reporting company Equifax will pay at least $575 million and up to $700 million, the largest ever US data breach settlement, to settle federal and state investigations into a 2017 data breach. The breach had compromised 143 million American consumers' sensitive information. Equifax will establish an up to $425-million compensation fund for victims and pay $275 million in penalties.

headlines: Maharashtra's Kaas Plateau has over 850 species of flowering plants
text: Maharashtra's 'Kaas Plateau', situated 25 kilometres west from Satara and a three-hour drive from Pune, has over 850 different species of flowers and even endemic butterflies. A UNESCO World Heritage site since 2012, it's commonly called 'Maharashtra's Valley of Flowers'. August to early October is the right time to visit the plateau as the maximum flowers bloom during this time.

headlines: Impose President's rule or dismiss K'taka govt: Sena to Centre
text: Ahead of the floor test in Karnataka Assembly, the Shiv Sena asked the Centre to either impose President's rule or dismiss the state Legislative Assembly. It added, "The country is watching that a CM is struggling to remain in his chair despite losing the majority." It said that CM HD Kumaraswamy should have resigned following the democratic and Parliamentary tradition.

headlines: Acharya Devvrat takes oath as Governor of Gujarat
text: Acharya Devvrat was sworn in as the Governor of Gujarat on Monday at a function held at the Raj Bhavan, Gandhinagar. Devvrat was administered the oath of office by the acting Chief Justice of Gujarat High Court, Anant S Dave. He took the oath in Sanskrit in the presence of CM Vijay Rupani, Deputy CM Nitinbhai Patel and others.

headlines: I-T notice to Durga Puja Committees insult to puja: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday condemned the Income Tax notice to the Durga Puja Committees Forum, calling it an insult to puja. "During the elections, [BJP] take Hindus along, and after the election, they do this," Mamata said. "Many political parties don't have to pay income tax for the funds they spend during the elections," she added.

headlines: Medical cannabis among top priorities for new Thai government
text: Developing a medical cannabis industry is among top policy priorities for Thailand's new government, according to a document released before the formal announcement. "The study and technological development of marijuana, hemp, and other medicinal herbs should be sped up," the policy document said. Thailand legalised marijuana for medical use and research last year.

headlines: Will retaliate if US imposes sanctions over Russian S-400: Turkey
text: Turkey would retaliate against what it called an unacceptable threat of US sanctions over the country's purchase of Russian S-400 missile defence system, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu has said. "This is not a threat or a bluff," he added. However, Cavusoglu further said he thinks US President Donald Trump wants to avoid such measures.

headlines: Govt wants antitrust review of 'Big 4' audit firms: Reports
text: The government reportedly wants antitrust body Competition Commission of India (CCI) to assess whether the "Big Four" auditing firms and affiliates are hurting competition in India. CCI may have to check whether PwC, Deloitte, KPMG, and Ernst & Young are abusing their dominant market position, reports said. The four firms audit for nearly 60% of top 500 companies on NSE.

headlines: Hard to say when the NBFC crisis will be over: RBI Governor
text: It is difficult to say when the crisis in the non-banking finance company (NBFC) sector will be over, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said in an interview. He added RBI is making efforts to ensure there isn't a collapse of "another systematically important NBFC". The NBFC sector saw a liquidity crunch, sparked by IL&FS defaulting on its debt repayments last year.

headlines: Massive fire at MTNL building in Mumbai, 100 feared trapped
text: A level 4 fire has broken out at MTNL building in Bandra, Mumbai and 14 fire tenders are present at the spot. Fire fighting operations are underway. No injuries or casualties have been reported yet but as many as 100 people are feared trapped on the terrace of the building. More details on the incident are awaited.

headlines: Ibrahim should make B'wood debut, he's better looking than me: Saif
text: Saif Ali Khan, when asked if his son Ibrahim will make his Bollywood debut any time soon, said, "He should, he's looking good, better looking than I am!" "I definitely think all of my children would be interested in acting. We're an acting family," he added. However, Saif said he is keen on Ibrahim finishing his studies first.

headlines: He was my only child: Dad of 14-yr-old actor who died in car crash
text: Shivendra Singh, father of 14-year-old 'Sasural Simar Ka' fame child actor Shivlekh Singh who passed away recently in a car accident, said, "He was my only child." Speaking about the accident, Shivendra added, "My wife and I blanked out and when we woke up, we realised he was gone." They were returning to Raipur from Bilaspur when the accident happened.

headlines: Stokes didn't ask us to not award 6 overthrows in WC final: Dharmasena
text: After a section of British media claimed that all-rounder Ben Stokes wanted umpires to not award England 6 overthrows in the 2019 World Cup final, umpire Kumar Dharmasena has said that no such request was made.
