headlines: Kohli to attend selection meet for WI tour on Sunday: Reports
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli is set to attend the team selection meeting for the West Indies tour at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Sunday. As per reports, Kohli will travel to West Indies and will feature in all the three formats. Earlier, reports had stated that Kohli and pacer Jasprit Bumrah will not feature in the limited-overs series.

headlines: Notice to PM after ex-BSF jawan challenges his election from Varanasi
text: The Allahabad High Court has sent a notice to PM Narendra Modi over a petition filed by ex-BSF jawan Tej Bahadur Yadav, challenging his election from Varanasi. The Election Commission had cancelled Yadav's nomination as a candidate from Varanasi. Yadav claimed his nomination papers were wrongly rejected and requested to declare PM Modi's election as an MP null and void.

headlines: Two-headed turtle found in Malaysia, dies days after discovery
text: A rare two-headed green turtle was found on Monday in Malaysia, alongside over 90 other recently hatched turtles. "The right head seems to control the front right flipper, and the left head the front left...Yet they're capable of coordinating movements in order to walk and swim," biologists said. The two-headed turtle, however, only survived a few days after being discovered.

headlines: US calls Hafiz Saeed's arrest by Pakistan 'window dressing'
text: A senior US administration official has called Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest by Pakistan "window dressing". "We've seen this happen in the past. And we have been looking for sustained and concrete steps," the official added. "The previous arrests of Hafiz Saeed haven't made a difference," the US official further said.

headlines: 9 students killed as car crashes into truck on Pune-Solapur highway
text: Nine students were killed after the car in which they were travelling crashed into a truck on Pune-Solapur highway on Saturday. "Those killed in the accident were returning from Raigad and heading to their hometown Yavat," a police official said. "Their bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the matter is being investigated," the official added.

headlines: César Pelli, the architect behind Petronas Towers, dies aged 92
text: César Pelli, the Argentine designer behind the Petronas Twin Towers in Malaysia, has died aged 92. Pelli's other works include the World Financial Center in New York, Canary Wharf Tower in London and renovation work on New York's Museum of Modern Art. Pelli had served as the dean of Yale University's School of Architecture.

headlines: Alia is a huge source of inspiration: Ananya
text: Actress Ananya Panday has called Alia Bhatt a "huge source of inspiration". "(W)hat I've learned from Alia is that she never claimed to be perfect from the start. She was raw in her first film, and then, she grew from there and people could see the evolution," Ananya added. Ananya made her Bollywood debut with 'Student of the Year 2'.

headlines: My most prized memories forever: Ishaan on Dhadak's release 1 yr ago
text: Actor Ishaan Khatter took to Instagram as his movie 'Dhadak' marked a year of theatrical release. Producer Karan Johar, Director Shashank Khaitan and co-star Jahnvi Kapoor "have etched themselves into my life and my most prized memories forever", he added. He also thanked the movie's cast and crew, saying without them the "film's heart would not beat as it did".

headlines: Who is 15-year-old Prithu Gupta, India's 64th Grandmaster?
text: Prithu Gupta, who became India's 64th Grandmaster, is a Class X student of Modern School in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. The 15-year-old had started playing chess at the age of nine and had become an International Master last year before his 14th birthday. He had earlier said that he is "very superstitious" and "passionate" about subjects like Spanish.

headlines: Chrome update to stop sites from checking for Incognito Mode
text: Technology giant Google has said that at the end of July, its internet browser Chrome will "remedy" a loophole that has allowed sites to detect people who are browsing in Incognito Mode. It added it will also change any other methods of detecting Incognito over time. The release of Chrome 76 is scheduled for July 30, Google revealed.

headlines: Australia's picturesque Hutt Lagoon is also known as the 'Pink lake'
text: Australia's Hutt Lagoon located north of the Hutt River is also known as 'Pink lake', and is sometimes bright bubblegum pink, sometimes lilac, and occasionally even red in colour. It gets a pink hue due to carotenoid-producing algae, Dunaliella salina. It's a source of beta-carotene, used as a food-colouring agent and a source of vitamin A in cosmetics and supplements.

headlines: Virgin Orbit to launch small satellites for UK military
text: Virgin Orbit, the small satellite launching arm of billionaire Richard Branson's spaceflight firm Virgin Galactic, has signed an initial agreement to develop small satellite launch capabilities for the UK's Royal Air Force (RAF). Virgin Orbit aims to launch hardware provided by UK-based Surrey Satellites in a demo mission. The deal is part of RAF's Artemis mission.

headlines: Maha man allegedly beaten up, forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
text: A man was allegedly beaten up and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' by a group of unidentified persons in the early hours of Friday in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said. The victim, identified as Imran Ismail Patel, was returning home on a motorbike when the incident took place. Investigation is underway and the complaint is being verified, an official said.

headlines: Rajivs error will be repeated if triple talaq not criminalised: Arif
text: Ex-Union Minister Arif Mohammad Khan on Friday said the Prime Minister Modi-led government will repeat the mistake committed by the Rajiv Gandhi-led government in the Shah Bano case if triple talaq is not criminalised. The Rajiv Gandhi government introduced a bill in 1986 reversing Supreme Courts order saying triple talaq victim has the right to demand maintenance from her ex-husband.

headlines: 2 arrested for sexually assaulting African woman in Gurugram
text: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an African woman in Gurugram, police said. The incident occurred on Thursday night when the victim was returning from a party and hired an auto-rickshaw to go to Guru Dronacharya metro station. The auto-rickshaw driver and his friend instead drove the victim to their house and sexually assaulted her, police added.

headlines: 300 child labourers rescued in July so far: Cyberabad Police
text: Cyberabad Police have said that as many as 300 children, including 267 boys and 33 girls, have been rescued from child labour, begging and rag picking between July 1 and 18. A total of 282 children (251 boys and 31 girls) were sent to shelter homes and 18 children (16 boys and 2 girls) were handed over to their parents.

headlines: Pune student hangs himself to complete Blue Whale-like game
text: A 20-year-old student hanged himself on Wednesday evening to complete a task in a Blue Whale-like online game in Pune, police said. A handwritten suicide note was recovered which read, "The black panther, which was in the cage, is free now...The End." The note also had a black panther drawing along with a line "sun will shine again", added police.

headlines: Ranbir forced me into aircraft and flew to NY with me: Rishi on cancer
text: Speaking about his reaction to his cancer diagnosis, Rishi Kapoor said, "There was no time to react. I was shooting in Delhi...when my son (Ranbir)...came [and] spoke to my producers." "By evening, they got me to Mumbai and soon after, they flew me to New York...My son literally forced me into the aircraft and flew here with me," he added.

headlines: Not sure if Federer is aware: Arbaaz on being called his lookalike
text: Speaking about memes calling him tennis star Roger Federer's lookalike, Arbaaz Khan joked, "I'm aware of this similarity that's being drawn. Not sure if he's aware too." "I've come to know that he has a house in Dubai and when he plays the Dubai Open, he stays there. I plan to try and meet him during that time," he added.

headlines: Biggest shock: Ex-SA pacer Donald on being inducted into Hall of Fame
text: Former South Africa fast bowler Allan Donald, who was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame on Thursday, said, "The biggest shock when you open an e-mail like that." "It hits you, it hits you quite hard because it is a prestigious award and something that you can't take lightly. I thank the ICC for the huge honour," he added.

headlines: MS Dhoni's manager responds to speculation around his retirement
text: Responding to the speculation around MS Dhoni's retirement, the former India captain's manager Arun Pandey said that he has no immediate plans to retire. "Constant speculation over the future of a great player like him is unfortunate," he added. Pandeys comments come ahead of Team India's selection for the West Indies tour which is scheduled for Sunday.

headlines: No govt interference in Zimbabwe Cricket: Zimbabwe sports minister
text: Zimbabwe sports minister Kirsty Coventry on Friday denied that the government had been interfering in the running of the countrys cricket. Coventry, a former Olympic swimming champion, said in a tweet she was "devastated" by the effect on players of a decision by the International Cricket Council (ICC) to suspend Zimbabwe Cricket because of alleged political interference.

headlines: Extremely heartbreaking news for all Zimbabwe cricketers: Ashwin
text: Reacting to Zimbabwe Cricket being suspended by ICC over governmental interference, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin tweeted, "Extremely heartbreaking news for all Zim cricketers and their fans." "I pray the lovely cricket nation returns to its glory asap," he added. Ashwin was reacting to Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza who had tweeted, "How one decision has made so many people unemployed."

headlines: Microsoft posts record Q4 results, shares hit all-time high
text: Microsoft posted its Q4 FY19 earnings report revealing it made $33.7 billion in the quarter, 12% higher than the same quarter last year. The technology giant delivered a "record fiscal year" with a revenue of $125.8 billion, representing a 14% increase from the year before. Microsoft shares rose over 2.6% to record-high of above $140 in after-hours trading on Thursday.

headlines: OYO Founder to buy back $2 billion worth stake in the startup
text: OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal has agreed to invest $2 billion to increase his stake in the SoftBank-backed hospitality startup. Current investors Lightspeed Venture Partners and Sequoia India are selling portions of their holdings to help the 25-year-old CEO increase his stake, the company said. The deal will raise Agarwal's stake in OYO to 30% from about 10% now, reports said.

headlines: No trust vote in K'taka today as well, Assembly adjourned till Monday
text: The Karnataka Assembly was adjourned on Friday without a floor test. The Assembly failed to hold a trust vote at 1.30 pm today after which Governor Vajubhai Vala wrote another letter to CM HD Kumaraswamy, asking him to hold a floor test by 6 pm, which also didn't happen. The trust vote will now be conducted on Monday.

headlines: Our airspace safe for flight operations: Iran amid tensions with US
text: Iran's embassy in India has said the country's airspace is safe for flight operations amid the recent tensions with the US. Iran added it is committed to providing necessary safety and security for international flights passing through its airspace. Several airline companies, including those from India, banned their flights through Iranian airspace after Iran shot down a US military drone.

headlines: US city plays 'Baby Shark' on loop to keep away homeless people
text: Officials in West Palm Beach, US, are playing children's songs, including 'Baby Shark' and 'Raining Tacos' on a loop, to keep away homeless people from sleeping outside a city-owned community building. The move has been "effective" and is a "temporary measure", an official said. This would get homeless people into shelters and houses, West Palm Beach Mayor, Keith James, said.

headlines: Jet Airways lenders approve interim funding for the airline
text: Jet Airways lenders have agreed to provide some interim financing to the bankrupt airline to help it cover legal and other costs. The airline's bankruptcy resolution firm Grant Thornton didn't specify how much interim funding had been approved but reports said that lenders had agreed to provide $10 million. Jet's lenders had also approved the eligibility criteria for potential buyers.

headlines: Do we just burn our kits and apply for jobs? Zimbabwe cricketer Raza
text: After the ICC suspended Zimbabwe Cricket with immediate effect over governmental interference, Pakistan-born Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza said the whole team's pretty heartbroken and shocked at the moment. "I don't know where we go as international cricketers. Do we just burn our kits and apply for jobs?" he added. "I don't know what is the way out," he further said.

headlines: WNBA gives 10-game suspension to player for domestic violence
text: The Women's National Basketball Association has given one of its biggest-ever suspensions after Los Angeles Sparks' Riquna Williams was suspended without pay for ten games as a result of a domestic violence incident. Williams was arrested on April 29, and charged with two felony counts, one involving the assault of an individual with whom she was in a relationship.

headlines: Manchester United manager Solskjaer plays cricket in Perth
text: Manchester United's manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was seen playing cricket with United's players and supporting staff at WACA in Perth, where the team is as a part of its pre-season tour. A video shows Solskjaer asking to be bowled at after which he hits the ball straight to first-team coach Michael Carrick, who takes a single-handed catch.

headlines: Govt to provide extra financial help for football: Rijiju
text: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju said the ministry "will provide extra financial help wherever possible" to help Indian Football move to the next level. "We have seen certain improvements in our men's as well as women's football in recent times," he added. The minister also praised the Indian Senior Women's Team for rising to 57 in the FIFA rankings.

headlines: Sri Lanka to sack coaches after World Cup failure: Officials
text: Sri Lanka's Sports minister Harin Fernando has ordered the sacking of national cricket team coach Chandika Hathurusingha and his assistants following the team's performance at the 2019 World Cup, officials said on Friday. Fernando has ordered the coaches "should go after the Bangladesh tournament," an official said. Sri Lanka crashed out after losing four of their nine World Cup matches.

headlines: IFS officer Vivek Kumar appointed as Private Secretary to PM
text: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Vivek Kumar was appointed as Private Secretary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday. Kumar, a 2004 batch IFS officer, is currently working as a Director in the Prime Minister's Office. He will be succeeding Sanjeev Kumar Singla, who has been appointed India's ambassador to Israel.

headlines: Priyanka's arrest is completely unconstitutional: Robert Vadra
text: Businessman Robert Vadra on Friday targeted the UP government and said that arresting his wife and Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra is "completely unconstitutional". "No documents were produced for the arrest...This is a complete abuse of the law," he added. Priyanka was detained by UP police while she was on her way to visit the families of Sonbhadra firing victims.

headlines: Man allegedly beaten to death after his bike hits woman
text: A man was allegedly beaten to death in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi after his bike accidentally hit a woman. The man identified as Harish was allegedly beaten by the angry relatives of the woman on Tuesday after the accident, police said. "Harish was...referred to Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital where he succumbed to injuries on Friday," Anil Paris Deshmukh, Superintendent of Police Alwar said.

headlines: People didn't take me seriously after father's death: T-Series MD
text: Music label and film production company T-Series' MD Bhushan Kumar said people didn't take him seriously when he took over the company in 1997 after his father Gulshan Kumar was murdered. "They would say 'Your father was a genius in marketing, what can you do?' I had to convince them, literally with folded hands, to trust me," the 41-year-old added.

headlines: What are the new rules introduced by ICC?
text: The ICC has approved like-for-like concussion player replacements in all formats of men's and women's international cricket and first-class cricket. Captains won't be suspended for repeated or serious over-rate breaches. In case of slow over-rate breach, all players will be equally fined. A team will have two competition points deducted for each over it's behind in World Test Championship.

headlines: Porn site users tracked by Google, FB even in incognito mode: Study
text: An analysis of 22,484 pornography sites by researchers from Microsoft, Carnegie Mellon and Pennsylvania University has revealed technology giants including Google, Facebook and Oracle track users even in incognito mode. The study concluded that 93% of pages leak user data to a third party. Google and Facebook said data from these trackers isn't used to build marketing profiles of users.

headlines: WeWork CEO gets $700 mn via stake sale, debt ahead of IPO: Report
text: Adam Neumann, Co-founder and CEO of US-based co-working space startup WeWork, has reportedly taken loans against shares and sold a portion of his stake, receiving over $700 million in total. This comes ahead of WeWork's move to go public, which it had confidentially filed for in April. Neumann still remains the single largest shareholder in the company, the report claimed.

headlines: Sachin Bansal's BACQ in talks to buy Essel Mutual Fund: Report
text: BAC Acquisitions (BACQ), co-founded by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal, is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Essel Mutual Fund, owned by the Zee group. BACQ Co-founder Ankit Agarwal has been meeting with executives of the mutual fund to finalise the details, as per reports. Past reports had claimed Sachin Bansal was in talks to launch a new fintech venture.

headlines: Man thrown 30 feet away as speeding Audi hits 2-wheeler in Jaipur
text: A man was thrown 30 feet away after a speeding Audi rammed into his two-wheeler in Jaipur. The driver of the Audi, Siddharth Sharma, escaped after the collision but was later traced and detained for interrogation. The victim is undergoing treatment at trauma centre of SMS Hospital, police said. The accident took place at around 6:25 am on Friday.

headlines: Female lawyers behind Section 377 verdict come out as a couple
text: Supreme Court lawyers Menaka Guruswamy and Arundhati Katju, who fought the case for the five original petitioners to scrap parts of Section 377 of the IPC which criminalised homosexuality, have come out as a couple. The duo made the revelation in an interview with CNN, saying the court victory was not just a professional benchmark but also a personal win.

headlines: CRPF constable killed as teen rams Mercedes into car in Delhi
text: A CRPF constable was killed after Sanidhya Garg, a teenage son of a Noida businessman, rammed his Mercedes into a car occupied by three paramilitary personnel. The collision occurred just before midnight on Thursday in Delhi's Greater Kailash after the teenager jumped a traffic signal. Garg was arrested by the police and medically examined.

headlines: Thief loots shop, gets caught through Aadhaar card left behind
text: A thief who looted a store in Dehradun was caught after police traced him through the Aadhaar card that he had left behind. The accused had entered the shop through the ceiling and his Aadhaar card was found there by the shop's owner. Police tracked him through informers as he wasn't found at the address mentioned on his Aadhaar card.

headlines: Netherlands 10% liable for Srebrenica massacre: Supreme Court
text: The Netherlands' Supreme Court has ruled that the state is 10% liable for the deaths of 350 Bosnian Muslim men in the Srebrenica massacre in 1995. Dutch UN peacekeepers evacuated the men from their military base near Srebrenica despite knowing that they "were in serious jeopardy", the court said. Bosnian Serb forces killed 8,000 Muslim men in Srebrenica in 1995.

headlines: Budweiser owner sells Australia unit for $11 bn to cut $106 bn debt
text: Budweiser maker AB InBev, the world's largest brewer, is selling its Australian subsidiary Carlton & United Breweries to Japan's Asahi at an enterprise value of $11.3 billion. Most of the proceeds from the deal will be used to reduce its $106 billion debt. The transaction comes only a week after AB InBev shelved the IPO of its Asia-Pacific operations.

headlines: US city renames 'manholes' in a bid to remove gendered language
text: The American city of Berkeley has renamed 'manholes' as 'maintenance holes' under the plan to remove all gendered language from its municipal code. The terms 'men and women' have been replaced by 'people', while the terms 'brother' and 'sister' will be referred to as 'sibling'. "A male-centric municipal code doesn't reflect [Berkeley's] reality", City Council member Rigel Robinson said.

headlines: 96-year-old runs 42-min 5K to shatter age-group world record
text: Roy Englert, 96, ran the 5000-metre with a timing of 42:30.23 to shatter the existing age-group world record mark by nearly eight minutes at the Cyclone Sports Complex in Ames, Iowa. "It's fun. It's not fun while you're doing it, but it's fun when you're finished. It's hard work, actually," Englert said about his feat.

headlines: Wanted to join Juventus even before chat with Ronaldo: De Ligt
text: Dutch defender Matthijs de Ligt has revealed that he had made up his mind to join Serie A champions Juventus even before Cristiano Ronaldo asked him about a potential move to the club. Juventus announced the signing of the 19-year-old on Thursday for 75 million, making the teenager one of the most expensive defenders in the history of football.

headlines: Google Photos flaw lets private photos be accessed publicly
text: Security researcher Robert Wiblin has revealed a new flaw in Google Photos that lets privately-shared images become partially public. Users can access private photos or albums if they get access to the link of the shared content. Wiblin demonstrated in a video that a Google Photos image was accessible on a third-party Google account, even in the incognito mode.

headlines: Instagram to warn if account faces risk of being disabled
text: Instagram will now warn users if their accounts face a risk of getting disabled over violation of rules, through a notification process. The process will also offer the opportunity to appeal content deleted in certain cases, Instagram said. It added it will start removing accounts with a certain number of violations within a set window of time.

headlines: Talked to students about party ideology not membership: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Sushil Singh rubbished the accusation of conducting a membership drive at a school in UP and said he went there to meet the students who were demanding a library in the school. "There was no membership drive. I had talked to the students about [BJP's] ideology...not membership," he added. Singh instead accused the opposition of politicising the event.

headlines: CARS24 gets 6 notices over non-payment of rent: Report
text: Gurugram-based used car buying startup CARS24 has reportedly received legal notices from half-a-dozen landlords in Delhi over alleged non-payment of rent for months. The platform has also reportedly been accused of violating lease agreements by shutting down outlets. "We are currently in the process of addressing anomalies observed with a few properties in our recent audit," CARS24 said.

headlines: AIIMS to not introduce EWS reservation for students this year
text: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) will not introduce the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) reservation for students in this academic session. As per reports, AIIMS' appeal to exempt EWS quota this year was accepted by the Centre. "AIIMS doesn't have enough hostels, lecture rooms...to fit students. In some regional centres, there isn't sufficient academic staff," an official said.

headlines: Assam, Arunachal Pradesh hit by 5.6-magnitude earthquake
text: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and several other northeastern states were hit by a 5.6-magnitude earthquake on Friday. The epicentre of the earthquake was located at a depth of 10 kilometres at East Kameng district in Arunachal Pradesh, the India Meteorological Department said. However, no reports of casualties have been reported till now, the IMD further said.

headlines: Over 75 engineering, technical colleges to shut down nationwide
text: More than 75 engineering and technical colleges across India have opted not to admit students from this academic session and are preparing to shut down. The major reasons behind the closure are fewer takers for the courses or colleges and shortage of funds, an AICTE official said. Majority of the colleges opting for closure are based out of Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: Mumbai Police shares 'Mission Mangal' meme on road safety
text: Mumbai Police tweeted a meme based on a still from the trailer of the upcoming Akshay Kumar starrer 'Mission Mangal' to spread awareness on road safety. It used the dialogue "The chances of this mission succeeding is less than 1%" to discourage drunk driving. "Poori duniya se kaho copy that! #MissionRoadSafety," police captioned the image, taking reference from another dialogue.

headlines: Ram wants to become almost half the size he's now: Wife on weight loss
text: Actor Ram Kapoor's wife, actress Gautami Kapoor, while speaking about his around 30 kg weight loss, said, "He hasn't undergone any surgery as people feel and has opted for the natural way." "Ram...will take another six months to achieve his goals and reduce more weight and become almost half the size that he is now," she added.

headlines: Karnataka Governor asks CM Kumaraswamy to prove majority by 6 PM
text: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala has sent a second letter to Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Friday, asking him to prove majority before 6 PM. The Assembly took up the confidence motion moved by CM Kumaraswamy after the session resumed on Friday. On Thursday, Vala had asked the ruling Congress-Janata Dal (Secular) coalition to prove its majority by 1:30 PM today.

headlines: ShopClues fires about 50% workforce to cut costs: Reports
text: E-commerce platform ShopClues has reportedly fired about 200 employees, reducing its workforce by nearly 50%. "The company is left with almost no money and that is why it didn't even pay the two months standard payout to employees," a report cited its sources as saying. A recent report had earlier claimed ShopClues lost an acquisition deal offered by Snapdeal.

headlines: Family forced to carry body on sling as Odisha hospital denies van
text: A tribal family in the Kalahandi district of Odisha was forced to carry the body of their relative on a sling made of cloth after the hospital refused to provide a van. Nigidi Majhi had died in the hospital following a bout of fever. The medical officers reportedly claimed that the van was not run on Mondays.

headlines: Goa man jailed for 10 years for murder of British teen in 2008
text: The Bombay High Court on Friday sentenced a Goa man to 10 years in jail for the 2008 murder of British teenager Scarlett Keeling. In February 2008, Keeling was found dead on Goa's Anjuna beach. The court convicted Samson D'Souza under various sections of the IPC. A second man, Placido Carvalho, was acquitted by the court.

headlines: Viral pic of drowned 3-month-old not from Bihar floods, police clarify
text: A photo of a 3-month-old infant's body has been going viral on social media, with the claim that he drowned as a result of the ongoing Bihar floods. However, the police clarified the baby died after his mother attempted to kill herself and her four children by jumping into a river in Muzaffarpur. The incident took place on July 16.

headlines: Man who set fire to Japan studio said firm stole his ideas: Reports
text: The man suspected of setting fire to a Japanese animation studio was heard complaining that the studio had stolen his ideas, according to witnesses. The suspect, identified as Shinji Aoba, used large amounts of what appeared to be petrol, to set fire to the three-storey building. Thirty-three people were killed and over 30 others were injured in the arson attack.

headlines: Pak installs biometric machines outside ministry toilets: Reports
text: The Pakistani government has installed biometric recognition machines outside the washrooms of the Ministry of Industries and Production, in a bid to keep it accessible only for top-ranking officers, reports quoting sources said. The move has also been implemented for the convenience of same-ranking officers of other ministries who come to attend meetings over there, reports added.

headlines: Blast near Afghanistan university kills six, injures 27
text: An explosion near the campus of Kabul University in the Afghan capital killed six people and injured at least 27 as students waited to take an examination on Friday, officials said. A police team defused a second bomb placed near the explosion site, Kabul police spokesman Faramarz Firdaws said. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the blast.

headlines: South Koreans boycott Japanese brands amid diplomatic tensions
text: Over 200 South Korean supermarkets and grocery stores are boycotting Japanese products and services amid the diplomatic tensions between the two nations, a trade group said. The boycott impacted sales of several products and services, including beer and tourism. The tensions escalated after South Korea's top court ordered Japanese firms to compensate Koreans they used as forced labour in WWII.

headlines: Release date of Shraddha, Prabhas starrer 'Saaho' postponed
text: The release date of upcoming Prabhas and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Saaho' has been postponed to August 30. The film was originally scheduled to release on August 15 along with Akshay Kumar's 'Mission Mangal'. The makers of the film said, "We want to bring the best to the audience. For bringing finesse to the action sequences we need some more time."

headlines: John Obi Mikel announces retirement from international football
text: Nigeria captain John Obi Mikel on Thursday announced his retirement from international football after helping Nigeria reach the third place in the Africa Cup of Nations 2019. Mikel, retiring with 89 international caps and six goals to his name, had led Nigeria to win a bronze medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics in Brazil as one of the over-aged players.

headlines: Delhi's Prithu Gupta becomes Indias 64th Grandmaster
text: Delhi's Prithu Gupta has become India's 64th Grandmaster after crossing the Elo threshold of 2500 points after beating IM Lev Yankelevich in the fifth round of the Portuguese League 2019. "And we are complete. 64 th GM !! Welcome our newest GM Prithu Gupta !" India's Viswanathan Anand tweeted about Gupta's achievement.

headlines: EU probes Amazon over abuse of merchant data to cut competition
text: The European Union has launched a formal investigation on Amazon over concerns of potential abuse of merchant data that is accessible to it to cut down its own competition. "Based on the Commission's preliminary fact-finding, Amazon appears to use competitively sensitive information," the regulator noted. "We will cooperate fully with the European Commission," the e-commerce giant said.

headlines: There is a dessert museum located in Philippines
text: The Dessert Museum located in Philippines' capital Manila comprises "eight mouthwatering rooms"- Donut, Marshmallow, Candy Cane, Ice Cream, Bubble Gum, Gummy Bear, Cotton Candy and Cake Pop. Visitors can try samples of desserts especially curated to fit the themed room. The museum also provides facts about each dessert to the visitors.

headlines: DCW notice to Delhi Police over sexual assault of 3 minor boys
text: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Thursday issued a notice to Delhi Police over sexual assault of three minor boys and sought details of the actions taken so far. "The accused persons are roaming free and [threatening] the survivors," the notice stated. The minors were allegedly lured by some boys to an isolated place and were then sexually assaulted.

headlines: Father-son duo thrashed after son meets girlfriend in UP village
text: A man and his son were allegedly tied to a tree and thrashed in the Auta village of Uttar Pradesh after the latter reportedly met his girlfriend there. The two were also forced to perform sit-ups. The local police rescued them and said that strict action would be taken against the culprits.

headlines: NZ PM returns home on commercial flight as her plane breaks down
text: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was forced to fly home on a commercial flight on Friday after a technical snag hit her air force plane, following a two-day trip to Australia. In 2016, the then PM John Key had to delay a visit to India after his plane broke down on a refuelling stop in the north of Australia.

headlines: UP govt adds SP leader Azam Khan's name on anti-land mafia portal
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has put Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan's name on government's anti-land mafia portal. Rampur District Magistrate Aunjaneya Singh said that Khan's name was added as he has 2 cases and around 13 FIRs lodged against him. The government will now directly monitor the cases against him and take legal action, Singh added.

headlines: New TVS Ntorq 125 scooter features Bluetooth & smart connectivity
text: The TVS Ntorq 125, India's first scooter comes with Bluetooth support and smart connectivity features. It takes you to places with Navigation Assist and keeps you connected all the time with Caller ID and SMS alerts. Featuring SmartXonnect technology and sporty design, TVS Ntorq 125's special edition will also feature a special 'Scooter of the Year' insignia on the front.

headlines: ITC launches Fiama Scents Body Wash with touch activated fragrance
text: Fiama Scents Body Wash has the most long lasting fragrance amongst top bodywashes in India, basis consumer study on fragrance retentivity by Kantar IMRB. Brand face, Sara Ali Khan, endorses the innovation. Fragrance retentivity studies under lab conditions validate its long-lasting fragrance delivery through skin-friendly micro fragrance capsules that burst on touch, for up to 8 hours after a bath.

headlines: After Bihar, Hrithik Roshan's Super 30 made tax-free in Rajasthan
text: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', which is based on mathematician Anand Kumar's life, has been made tax-free in Rajasthan. CM Ashok Gehlot made the announcement by calling the film an "inspiration" and an "excellent example of exceptional willpower and determination", following which Hrithik thanked Gehlot on Twitter. This follows Bihar government's move of making the film tax-free in the state.

headlines: 65-yr-old driver nominated for Best Actor alongside Amitabh Bachchan
text: Namdev Gaurav, a 65-year-old driver of producer Dheer Momaya, has been nominated in Best Actor category alongside Amitabh Bachchan, Manoj Bajpayee and others at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. He was cast in 'Namdev Bhau: In Search of Silence' as the director was convinced he had "cinematic appeal", revealed Momaya. "It's like living a life I never...dreamt of," said Namdev.

headlines: England's Ben Stokes nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award
text: New Zealand-born England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was named Man of 2019 World Cup final against New Zealand, has been nominated for 'New Zealander of the Year' award. Stokes had moved to England when he was 12. "He might not have been playing for NZ but...there are a few Kiwis who think we can still claim him," an official said.

headlines: Why was Sachin inducted into ICC Hall of Fame after Dravid, Kumble?
text: Sachin Tendulkar was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame on Thursday, a year after Rahul Dravid and four years after Anil Kumble were inducted. A cricketer becomes eligible for this award only after he completes five years of retirement. Dravid and Kumble had retired in 2012 and 2008 respectively, while Sachin had retired from international cricket in November 2013.

headlines: Disgusting: Rahul after sister Priyanka detained by police in UP
text: Congress' Rahul Gandhi has reacted after his sister Priyanka Gandhi was detained by police in UP's Mirzapur while she was on her way to visit the families of 10 people shot dead in land dispute in Sonbhadra. "The illegal arrest of Priyanka...is disturbing. This arbitrary application of power...reveals the BJP Govt's increasing insecurity in UP," Rahul wrote in a tweet.

headlines: Priyanka detained on way to meet kin of shooting victims in Sonbhadra
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has been detained by police in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur while she was on her way to visit the families of 10 people shot dead in land dispute in Sonbhadra. "I don't know where are they (police) taking me...we are ready to go anywhere," Priyanka said. Administration has imposed Section 144 in the region.

headlines: Still ask God why he made me CM: Kumaraswamy ahead of trust vote
text: Resuming the debate on the trust vote in the Karnataka Assembly on Friday, Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy said, "I'm still asking God why he made me the CM at such a time, under such circumstances. This is all about fate." He added, "I'll see how long you (BJP) will last here, after this effort you've put into coming to power."

headlines: Delhi Speaker sends defamation notice to MLA over 'Son of MLA' sticker
text: Delhi Assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel on Thursday sent a defamation notice to Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa. Sirsa had shared a picture of a car on July 15 with a "Son of MLA" sticker on it and claimed that it belonged to Goel's son. The Speaker has sought a written apology within seven days from Sirsa.

headlines: Karnataka Dy CM arranges food for BJP MLAs on overnight dharna
text: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister G Parameshwara arranged for food for the BJP MLAs holding an overnight dharna in state Assembly premises amid the political crisis. Parameshwara said, "It is our duty to arrange food and other things for them. Some of them have diabetes and blood pressure conditions... Beyond politics, we are friends. It is the beauty of democracy."

headlines: 3 people beaten to death on suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar
text: Three men were allegedly beaten to death by locals on the suspicion of cattle theft in Baniyapur area of Bihar's Saran on Friday. The incident reportedly took place when some villagers caught hold of the three men, who were moving around with a pick-up van carrying a cow. Police have launched an investigation into the case.

headlines: India can't be world's refugee capital: Centre on Assam NRC
text: The Centre on Friday asked the Supreme Court to extend the July 31 deadline for the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Assam, stating that lakhs of people have been wrongly included in the draft list. Adding that illegal immigrants need to be removed from the list, the Centre said, "India cannot be the refugee capital of the world."

headlines: Protesting villagers take herd of goats, sheep in Raj govt office
text: Villagers in Rajasthan's Bharatpur took hundreds of goats and sheep inside a government office while protesting against the district administration, demanding the appointment of a deputy tehsildar. The protestors said that despite setting up a registry office, they were unable to avail any facility as no one has been appointed to the post of deputy tehsildar for two years.

headlines: Haven't lost any drone, US shot down its own by mistake: Iran
text: Iranian Deputy Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has denied US claims that it had shot down an Iranian drone in the Strait of Hormuz. "We have not lost any drone...[I am worried that US shot down its own drone] by mistake," Araghchi said. US President Donald Trump had said the drone had flown to within 1,000 yards of the USS Boxer.

headlines: Jio overtakes Airtel to become India's 2nd largest operator by users
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries' telecom unit Reliance Jio has overtaken rival Bharti Airtel to become India's second-largest operator by subscribers as of May. Jio ended the month with 32.3 crore wireless customers as against Airtel's 32.04 crore users, data from the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India showed. Vodafone Idea remained India's top operator with 38.76 crore customers.

headlines: There is a café in Delhi which is run by specially-abled people
text: Echoes café, located in Delhi's Satya Niketan and North Campus, is run by specially-abled people. The café provides customers with notepads to write down their orders on and each table has placards like 'Water Please', 'Menu Please' and 'Bill Please' for requests. All the tables have a light bulb which customers need to switch on to call the servers.

headlines: Odisha hospital gives saplings to new parents post Cyclone Fani
text: A government hospital in Odisha's Bhubaneswar has started handing out saplings to parents of newborn babies as part of an initiative called 'One Baby One Tree'. Capital Hospital's director Dr Ashok Pattnaik said, "We lost a lot of trees in the recent Cyclone Fani. We are taking up this unique initiative to revive the green cover in our beloved city."

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar inducted into ICC Hall of Fame
text: Ex-India batsman Sachin Tendulkar, ex-South Africa pacer Allan Donald and ex-Australia Women pacer Cathryn Fitzpatrick have been inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame. Sachin is the sixth Indian cricketer after Anil Kumble, Sunil Gavaskar, Bishan Singh Bedi, Kapil Dev and Rahul Dravid to be inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame. Sachin played 664 international matches, scoring 34,357 runs.

headlines: Deliver verdict in Babri case within 9 months: SC to CBI judge
text: The Supreme Court has asked special CBI judge SK Yadav to deliver the final verdict in the Babri Masjid demolition case within nine months. The case involves several Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders including LK Advani, Murli Manohar Joshi and Uma Bharti. The conspiracy charge against the BJP leaders was restored by the Supreme Court in April 2017.

headlines: Pak agrees to grant consular access to Jadhav after ICJ verdict
text: Pakistan Foreign Ministry in an official statement on Thursday said it would grant consular access to Kulbhushan Jadhav in accordance with the country's laws. This follows the International Court of Justice's (ICJ) verdict. The ICJ had on Wednesday allowed India consular access to Jadhav and called on Pakistan to review and reconsider the death sentence accorded to him.

headlines: 'Sasural Simar Ka' fame child actor Shivlekh dies in car accident
text: Child actor Shivlekh Singh, who had acted in TV serials including 'Sasural Simar Ka', was killed in a car accident on the outskirts of Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Thursday, police said. The 14-year-old's parents were injured in the accident. The victims were heading for Raipur from Bilaspur when their car hit an oncoming truck.

headlines: I will be contesting for HCA president post: Mohammad Azharuddin
text: Former India captain Mohammad Azharuddin on Thursday confirmed that he would contest for the post of president of Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) whenever the elections are held. The former captains nomination for the post of HCA president was not accepted in 2017. The Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the HCA is expected to deliberate the issue on July 21.

headlines: $5 trillion economy not coming from heaven: Pranab Mukherjee
text: While addressing a lecture on Thursday, former President Pranab Mukherjee said, "The Finance Minister can say that India will become a $5 trillion economy by 2024 because of the strong foundation laid previously. It's not coming out of heaven." He added, "Those who criticise Congress rule for 55 years forget from where we began and where we have come."

headlines: Karnataka BJP chief sleeps on Assembly floor during overnight dharna
text: Former CM and Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa, along with other BJP MLAs, slept in the state Assembly during the overnight dharna staged by them, seeking an immediate trust vote. Yeddyurappa and some other leaders slept after setting up their beddings on the Assembly floor. Some leaders also went for a morning walk in the Vidhana Soudha premises on Friday.

headlines: US Navy shoots down Iranian drone in Strait of Hormuz
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said that a US Navy ship had "destroyed" an Iranian drone in the Strait of Hormuz after the aircraft threatened the vessel. He added that the drone had flown to within 1,000 yards of the ship and had ignored "multiple calls to stand down". Iran in June shot down a US military surveillance drone.

headlines: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa backs yoga startup Sarva
text: Mumbai-based fitness and yoga startup Sarva has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from Tamil superstar Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa R Dhanush. She will lead Sarva's yoga wellness arm Diva Yoga's growth in South India. Founded in 2016, Sarva had recently raised funding from celebrities including Malaika Arora, Jennifer Lopez, Alex Rodriguez, Shahid Kapoor and Mira Kapoor.

headlines: BJP MLA brings bed sheet, pillow to Assembly as party stages dharna
text: BJP MLA Prabhu Chavan arrived at the Assembly with a bed sheet and pillow as BJP decided to stage an overnight dharna. The House was adjourned after the Congress-JD(S) members accused BJP of kidnapping its MLAs and started shouting slogans. In protest, BJP members declared they would stay in the House overnight till the time the trust vote is decided.

headlines: Ratan Tata-backed Teabox gets funding from NB Ventures, others
text: Bengaluru-based premium tea-selling platform Teabox has raised undisclosed funding from Dubai-based NB Ventures, family office of Neelesh Bhatnagar, among others. Teabox has raised a total of $10 million as part of its Series A and B rounds from investors including Accel, JAFCO Asia and others. Ratan Tata, the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, had backed Teabox in 2016.

headlines: Rajasthan govt launches 'police training' for school students
text: The Rajasthan government has launched a training program for class 8 and 9 students to make them aware of basic laws and legal procedures. Students would be trained as Student Police Cadets under this program jointly initiated by the state education board and police departments. The training further aims to curb rising adolescent delinquency and strengthen teenagers mentally and physically.

headlines: Several Bengali film and TV actors join BJP in Delhi
text: Several Bengali film and TV actors, including Parno Mittra, joined BJP at its Delhi headquarters on Thursday in the presence of the party's West Bengal chief Dilip Ghosh. Rishi Kaushik, Kanchana Moitra and Rupanjana Mitra were among the actors who joined the party. This comes after actors-turned-politicians Mimi Chakraborty and Nusrat Jahan won recently-held Lok Sabha elections on TMC tickets.

headlines: Fan names newborn after England captain over WC win, Morgan responds
text: A fan named James Bridgland, who was blessed with a baby boy on July 17, named his newborn after England's 2019 World Cup-winning captain Eoin Morgan. "Eoin, please meet Henry Eoin Morgan-Bridgland...Just to ensure Sunday's events are remembered even more often!" the fan tweeted. Morgan responded to the fan, saying, "That's very cool. Congratulations."

headlines: Dhoni India's best captain only as per statistics: Gautam Gambhir
text: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has said that MS Dhoni is India's best captain only as per statistics. "But that doesn't mean that other captains have done badly. Sourav Ganguly has done good captaincy; we have won outside under him. Under Virat Kohli's captaincy, we have won ODI series in South Africa and Test series in Australia," he added.

headlines: I didn't know there'd be Super Over in case of tie in WC final: Boult
text: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult, who bowled Super Over for New Zealand in 2019 World Cup final against England, has admitted he didn't know there was going to be a Super Over in the final. "When I saw three off two that's when umpires said to us there would be a Super Over [in case of a tie]," he added.

headlines: Vijender challenges Amir for bout, says he should stop fighting kids
text: Indian boxer Vijender Singh has challenged Pakistani-origin British boxer Amir Khan for a bout after winning his 11th straight pro match. "Stop fighting children, I am ready for a bout," Vijender Singh said. "I can reduce my weight a little and he can increase it and we can agree on a mid point. He has done it before," he added.

headlines: Selectors must tell Dhoni he's not India's 1st choice keeper: Sehwag
text: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said that the duty of the selectors is to reach out to MS Dhoni and inform him that he is no more being seen as India's first choice wicketkeeper-batsman going forward. "I wish the selectors had asked me as well about my plans so I would also have been able to inform them," he added.

headlines: 1975 video of woman kissing cricketer goes viral over #SareeTwitter
text: A video of a woman in saree sprinting towards the pitch and kissing the then 22-year-old batsman Brijesh Patel during an India-West Indies Test in 1975 went viral. A user shared the video as part of the #SareeTwitter challenge, writing, "Sorry this #SareeTwitter cannot be beaten." "She definitely wasn't saree about what she did," a user tweeted reacting to it.

headlines: Hima Das wins her fourth international gold medal in 15 days
text: Sprinter Hima Das clinched her fourth gold medal in 15 days after winning the 200m race at Tabor Athletics Meet in Czech Republic. The 19-year-old clocked 23.25 seconds. She had clocked 23.65 seconds to win her first competitive race on July 2. She won Kutno Athletics Meet and Kladno Athletics Meet with time of 23.97 seconds and 23.43 seconds respectively.

headlines: Karnataka Governor asks Kumaraswamy govt to prove majority on Friday
text: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala wrote a letter to Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday, asking him to prove his coalition government's majority on the floor of the House by 1:30 pm on Friday. This comes after the Karnataka Assembly was adjourned without trust vote today. Notably, Vala had asked the Speaker to complete the floor test proceedings on Thursday itself.

headlines: Driver stops Mumbai local train, urinates in front of it; video viral
text: A video of a driver of a Mumbai local train stopping the train and urinating in front of it has gone viral. In the video, the motorman can be seen urinating even as another train passes by on the other track. The train was stopped between Ulhasnagar and Vithalwadi railway stations. The Central Railway said it would investigate the incident.

headlines: Man claims he found pic of his amputated leg on cigarette packets
text: A man in France claimed he found a picture of his amputated leg being used on cigarette packets as a warning against smoking without his consent. His son had discovered the picture, which bore recognisable burns and scars when he bought cigarettes last year in Luxembourg, according to reports. The man had lost his leg in an attack in Albania.

headlines: US President Trump criticised over tweet on Hafiz Saeed
text: US President Donald Trump has been criticised after he said in a tweet that Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed was arrested in Pakistan after a 10-year search. "FYI Pakistan wasn't searching for [Saeed] for 10 years. He's been living freely", the US House Foreign Affairs Committee said in response to Trump.

headlines: Trump was involved in talks to pay pornstar to hide affair: FBI
text: US President Donald Trump was directly involved in the talks to pay pornstar Stormy Daniels to hide their alleged affair, the FBI has said. Trump's then-campaign Press Secretary Hope Hicks was also involved in the talks. Daniels had claimed that she was paid $130,000 by Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen during the 2016 election campaign to maintain her silence.

headlines: Knew Neymar wanted to leave before Copa: PSG manager Tuchel
text: French side Paris Saint-Germain manager Thomas Tuchel said he was aware that Neymar "wanted to leave" the club before Copa America. "I am always disappointed when a player turns up late but it's clear between us, now it's between the club and Neymar," Tuchel added. This comes amid reports of Neymar being linked with a return to former club, Barcelona.

headlines: Tata Chemicals may produce Li-ion batteries for EVs: Reports
text: Tata Chemicals is reportedly planning to set up a factory to manufacture lithium-ion batteries, mainly for the electric vehicle (EV) segment in India. Reports said the firm has already acquired land in Dholera town of Gujarat to build the factory. Tata Chemicals will reportedly play a key role in Tata Motors' plan to devise an EV ecosystem in India

headlines: Software unicorn Druva buys data protection startup CloudLanes
text: US-based cloud backup and data protection unicorn Druva has acquired data protection startup CloudLanes for an undisclosed amount. Founded in the year 2015, CloudLanes introduced a secondary storage platform built on public clouds with a hybrid cloud approach. Sequoia-backed Druva had achieved its unicorn or billion-dollar status in a $130-million funding led by Viking Global Investors in June.

headlines: Pakistan under global gaze in Jadhav's case: Arun Jaitley
text: BJP's Arun Jaitley on Thursday said ICJ's verdict in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case has put Pakistan under a 'global gaze' as to what direction it will follow. "ICJ has given Pakistan an opportunity to comply with the rule of law...Will Pakistan use this opportunity or squander it?" he added. The ICJ on Wednesday directed Pakistan to review Jadhav's death sentence.

headlines: What do Indians mean by non-stop honking: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
text: Mercedes-Benz India CEO Martin Schwenk, who moved to Pune last year, said he doesn't understand what people "mean by the incessant honking". When asked which aspect of India took the most time adjusting to, Schwenk said, "The Indian 'head bob' did take me some time to get used to." He added he finds Indians to be very friendly and competent.

headlines: Ex-Bigg Boss contestant Ajaz held for posting communal TikTok video
text: Former Bigg Boss contestant and actor Ajaz Khan was arrested in Mumbai on Thursday for uploading a TikTok video with objectionable content promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion. "The video created hatred among public at large," police said. A case has been registered against him and further investigation is on by the Cyber Crime Police Station, Mumbai.

headlines: People help rescue whales stranded on US beach; video goes viral
text: Dozens of people helped push a pod of pilot whales back into deeper water after they came close to the shore on Saint Simons Island's East Beach in Georgia, US. The rescuers were able to push back six pilot whales, while three died. Onlookers captured a video of the incident, which has gone viral on social media.

headlines: Bluetooth flaw exposes user locations; Android devices safe
text: Boston University researchers have found a flaw in Bluetooth that could let hackers track user locations, using a third-party algorithm. The flaw was found to be present across platforms including Apple's iOS and Windows 10, with the exception of Android, researchers revealed. "The algorithm does not require message decryption or breaking Bluetooth security in any way," researchers said.

headlines: K'taka Assembly adjourned till tomorrow, BJP to protest overnight
text: Karnataka Deputy Speaker Krishna Reddy deferred the trust vote proceedings in the House and adjourned the Assembly till 11 am on Friday. BJP state chief BS Yeddyurappa, however, said BJP MLAs will hold an all-night protest inside the House till the confidence vote is taken up. This comes after Karnataka Governor asked the Speaker to complete the floor test today.

headlines: Cong protests in K'taka Assembly with photos of its 'missing' MLA
text: Congress MLAs on Thursday protested in Karnataka Assembly with pictures of fellow MLA Shrimant Patil, who had gone incommunicado and was later found to be admitted at a hospital in Mumbai. Congress further blamed the BJP of poaching its MLAs during the trust vote debate. Karnataka Assembly has been adjourned till 11 am on Friday by Deputy Speaker Krishna Reddy.

headlines: Consider trust vote to end by today: Karnataka Governor to Speaker
text: Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala on Thursday asked Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar to complete the process of vote of confidence moved by Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy by the end of the day. Vala's message to Kumar came after a BJP delegation called on him and requested him to direct the Speaker to conduct the vote of confidence on Thursday itself.

headlines: Telangana minister's grandson makes TikTok video atop govt vehicle
text: A TikTok video of Telangana Home Minister Mahmood Ali's grandson Furqan Ahmed, in which he can be seen sitting on top of a government vehicle and lip-syncing to a movie dialogue, has gone viral. He enacted the argument of someone with the Inspector General of Police. Reports said the video was shot outside a hall where Ali attended an event.

headlines: Felt him collapse in arms: Woman loses sons in Mumbai building collapse
text: A 28-year-old woman from Uttar Pradesh lost both her sons in Dongri building collapse on Tuesday. Alima and her sons Shehzad and Arbaaz were in Mumbai, where her husband works as a tailor, and were supposed to return to their village this month. "I kept shouting, no one heard me. I felt my son collapse in my arms," said Alima.

headlines: Tiger caught resting on bed at home to escape Assam floods; pic viral
text: A tiger was spotted resting on a bed inside a house in Assam after it escaped from the flooded Kaziranga National Park, which has around 95% of its area submerged under water. The image of the tiger shared by Wildlife Trust of India is being widely shared on social media. The WTI also sent a team to rescue the tiger.

headlines: Iran says it seized foreign tanker smuggling 1 million litres of oil
text: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps has seized a foreign oil tanker, claiming it was carrying one million litres of smuggled fuel, Iran's state media said. Iran had earlier provided assistance to the same tanker as had it suffered a technical glitch. Iran's move comes after one of its tankers was seized in Gibraltar for allegedly transferring oil to Syria illegally.

headlines: Woman loses kid's custody after bikini pics shown to judge in Saudi
text: Bethany Vierra, an American woman living in Saudi Arabia, lost custody of four-year-old daughter after her ex-husband showed her bikini photos to judge as evidence to prove Vierra is unfit to look after their child. Vierra said the bikini photos were taken in the United States. She lost her daughter's custody despite submitting a video showing her ex-husband doing drugs.

headlines: GoAir names former Airbus executive Miranda Mills as COO
text: Wadia Group-run budget carrier GoAir on Wednesday said it has hired former Airbus executive Miranda Mills as the Chief Operating Officer (COO). She will be reporting to the airline's Managing Director Jeh Wadia. Before joining GoAir, Mills worked with British aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce as Chief Digital Officer and Director (Transformation), of the company's civil aviation vertical.

headlines: China's debt tops 300% of GDP, now 15% of global total: IIF
text: China's total corporate, household and government debt rose to 303% of GDP in the first quarter of 2019, according to the Institute of International Finance (IIF). This is up from 297% in the same period a year earlier and makes up about 15% of all global debt. China's economic growth slowed to a 27-year-low of 6.2% in the second quarter.

headlines: Author of 50-yr-old note in bottle that washed up on shore found
text: The author of a 50-year-old note in a bottle that washed up on shore in Australia has been found. The note, written by Paul Gilmore when he was 13-years-old in 1969, was recently found by a father-son duo during a fishing trip on a South Australian beach. Gilmore's sister said that he's currently on a cruise in the Baltic Sea.

headlines: Congress, NCP MLAs to join BJP soon: Maharashtra BJP chief
text: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Thursday claimed that some Congress and NCP MLAs will resign and join the BJP within a week or 10 days. Patil, however, refrained from revealing names of the opposition legislators likely to join the saffron party. "The fun of life lies in the uncertainty. So, let it remain that way," he said.

headlines: Former Yahoo executives' startup Travelstop gets $3 million
text: Singapore-based corporate travel startup Travelstop has raised $3 million in a pre-Series A round of funding led by Accel. The investment also saw participation from Strive and existing investor SeedPlus. Launched in 2018 by former Yahoo executives Prashant Kirtane, Vijay Aggarwal and Altaf Dhamani, Travelstop had raised seed funding of $1.2 million led by SeedPlus in August 2018.

headlines: Tamil Nadu announces 2 new districts, total reaches 35
text: Tamil Nadu CM K Palaniswami on Thursday announced that two new districts, Tenkasi and Chengalpattu, would be carved out of Tirunelveli and Kancheepuram respectively. With these two, the total number of districts in the state has reached 35. "The bifurcation is done for administrative convenience following representations from Ministers, MLAs and the general public," the CM said.

headlines: CARE sends CEO on leave citing anonymous complaint to SEBI
text: Credit rating agency CARE Ratings on Wednesday said it has sent its CEO and Managing Director Rajesh Mokashi on leave, pending investigation into an anonymous complaint received by regulator SEBI. It has appointed TN Arun Kumar, Executive Director (Ratings), as the interim CEO. Earlier, rating agency Moody's India unit ICRA had sent its CEO and MD Naresh Takkar on leave.

headlines: Kannada TV actress among 5 killed in car accident
text: Kannada TV actress Shobha, who was seen in the show 'Magalu Janaki', died in a road accident on Wednesday. Shobha's car rammed into a truck on National Highway 4 on the outskirts of Chitradurga, Karnataka. Eight people were travelling in the car and along with Shobha, 4 other people lost their lives in the accident while 3 were injured.

headlines: Stitches hurt like mad, says Sameera 5 days after delivering daughter
text: Actress Sameera Reddy has shared a picture of herself 5 days after delivering her daughter. "It's...hard on the body when it's a C section because the stitches hurt like mad," she wrote. "Nothing can ready you for the sleepless nights of endless feeding and your body just feels so out of whack it can really get you down," Sameera added.

headlines: Hard Kaur supports Khalistani group, backs pro-Khalistan referendum
text: Weeks after being booked for sedition, rapper Hard Kaur shared a video in which she extended her support to pro-Khalistan group Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) and their demand for a separate homeland for Sikhs in Punjab. Kaur is seen supporting their 'Referendum 2020' and urging people to vote for Khalistan. India banned SFJ for its alleged anti-national activities last week.

headlines: 4 days after winning World Cup, Bayliss appointed SRH head coach
text: Four days after leading England to 2019 World Cup victory, Trevor Bayliss has been appointed as SunRisers Hyderabad head coach. The 56-year-old Australian's tenure with England will come to an end after the Ashes. It will be Bayliss' second stint in the Indian Premier League, having already led KKR to two IPL titles during his tenure from 2012 to 2015.

headlines: Former Gujarat Congress MLAs Alpesh Thakor, Dhavalsinh Zala join BJP
text: OBC leader Alpesh Thakor, who recently quit as Congress MLA after casting his vote for BJP candidates in Rajya Sabha by-poll in Gujarat, on Thursday joined BJP in presence of Gujarat party chief Jitu Vaghani. Thakor's close aide and former Congress MLA Dhavalsinh Zala also joined BJP. "We were always deceived after joining Congress party," Thakor had earlier said.

headlines: Uber glitch charges people 100 times the normal fare for trips in US
text: An Uber glitch on Wednesday charged riders in several US cities 100 times their normal fare for short trips. Riders in cities including Washington and San Diego took to social media to post about the hiked rates. Uber said the glitch was fixed and the fare would be corrected so riders are charged only the amount for their actual trip.

headlines: Never stop: Ex-BSF officer who qualified for IAS on 5th attempt
text: Harpreet Singh, a former BSF officer, qualified for the Indian Administrative Service on his 5th attempt and made it to the top 20. "I utilised all my time for studying my notes and since I had a clear target in mind, nothing deterred me," said Harpreet, who hails from Punjab. "Never stop chasing your dream...Keep trying," the 27-year-old added.

headlines: Once MBBS aspirant, one of Rajasthan's most wanted man arrested
text: Twenty-eight-year-old Virendra Khinchar, once an MBBS aspirant and now one of the most wanted criminals of Jodhpur range in Rajasthan, was arrested this week. He's in police custody for allegedly kidnapping and killing another alleged criminal. Khinchar scored 80% marks in Class 12 board exams and had cleared the national entrance test for MBBS course and a nursing entrance test.

headlines: This drama has happened 8 times: India on Saeed's arrest in Pak
text: Speaking on JuD chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pakistan, External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said, "This drama, to my count, has happened over eight times since 2001." "It's been happening for a long time...arrest-release. After every major terror incident [Saeed] perpetrates in India, he's been arrested and released on some grounds," Kumar added.

headlines: Jadhav's family has shown exemplary courage: Jaishankar
text: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "Jadhav's family has shown exemplary courage in difficult circumstances." Stating India has made untiring efforts in seeking Jadhav's release and will continue doing so, Jaishankar called on Pakistan to release and repatriate the retired officer.

headlines: Video shows girl dancing to Haryanvi song in DTC bus; driver suspended
text: A video has surfaced online showing a girl dancing to a Haryanvi song in a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus with driver and two other staffers. The staffers reportedly stopped the bus near Janakpuri, where they made the video on July 12. Meanwhile, the driver has been suspended and the conductor has been served show-cause notice for termination.

headlines: Mumbai sex racket involving BSE-listed company busted, Founder held
text: The Mumbai Police has busted a sex racket involving Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)-listed firm Rajnish Wellness, which sells sexual wellness products. The company's Founder Rajnish Singh was arrested, who allegedly ran sex racket under the name of spas and body massage parlours. The Crime Branch of Mumbai Police rescued three women allegedly involved in flesh trade from a three-star hotel.

headlines: Man says 'you die' as he sets fire to Japan animation studio, 30 dead
text: A man screaming "you die" set fire to an animation studio in Kyoto, Japan on Thursday, and at least 30 people were feared dead in the arson attack. The perpetrator had shouted as he poured what appeared to be petrol around the three-storey building, Japan's public broadcaster said. Around 70 people were in the building when the fire started.

headlines: Yes Bank Co-Founder's wealth falls from $1.4 bn to $377 mn in a year
text: Yes Bank Co-Founder and ex-CEO Rana Kapoor has become $1 billion poorer since August 2018 following a 78% drop in the lender's shares. His net worth has fallen to $377 million from $1.4 billion, according to Bloomberg. The 61-year-old, who owns just over 10% of Yes Bank, had pledged to never sell his shares because they were like diamonds.

headlines: Airline bans pics as man posts handwritten menu, later scraps ban
text: Indonesia's flag carrier Garuda banned taking in-flight photos and videos after a popular travel blogger's photo showing a handwritten business class menu went viral. Following a backlash, the airline said customers can still take photos for personal use such as selfies. The blogger said both he and his fiancée were reported to police for alleged defamation over the post.

headlines: Dawood's nephew arrested from airport while trying to escape India
text: The Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested Rizwan Kaskar, the nephew of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim, in connection with an extortion case. Kaskar was arrested from the Mumbai airport while trying to escape the country, an official said. His name had cropped up in an extortion case after the police arrested a close aide of Ibrahim's gang member Fahim Machmach.

headlines: Prisoner allegedly commits suicide in Bihar jail: Police
text: A 30-year-old prisoner, lodged at a divisional jail in Bihar, allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling, police said. The police have registered a case of unnatural death and have started an investigation into the matter. The police informed that the two brothers of the deceased are also lodged in the same jail.

headlines: 28 people killed in Assam floods; 2 killed in landslide
text: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) on Thursday said the death toll due to flood in Assam has increased to 28 with 10 bodies recovered in the last 24 hours. Apart from this, two more people lost their lives in a landslide, the authority added. According to ASDMA, over one lakh people have been shifted to 427 relief camps.

headlines: Residents of unauthorised colonies to get ownership rights: Delhi CM
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the residents of unauthorised colonies in Delhi will soon get ownership rights of their land. He added that the Centre has given a positive response to the Cabinet's proposal on the same. He said the Centre has asked few questions and after answering them the government will soon begin registration for these colonies.

headlines: Maoists kill 2 tribals in Andhra Pradesh: Police
text: According to the police, Maoists killed two tribals in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam after branding them as police informers in an act of revenge. The police also recovered a note in which the Maoists claimed that they killed the two as they were involved in the killing of their fellow Maoists. "Police should take responsibility for these killings," the note read.

headlines: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella blessed with baby boy
text: Actor Arjun Rampal and his girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades were blessed with a baby boy on Thursday. Gabriella was admitted to Hinduja Hospital in Mumbai and her parents also arrived in the city from South Africa to welcome the child. Arjun is already father to two daughters with his ex-wife Mehr Jesia.

headlines: Smriti Irani shares pic from 'Kyunki Saas Bhi...' for FaceApp challenge
text: Union Minister and former actress Smriti Irani on Thursday shared a picture of herself from her show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', showing her as a much older character when the show took a time leap. She wrote in the caption, "When @ektaravikapoor gets to you before the #faceappchallenge #tbt." The show was produced by Ekta Kapoor.

headlines: I am sure my dog won't be too angry at me: Boult on WC final defeat
text: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult, who bowled the final over and Super Over in 2019 World Cup final, said he'll walk his dog along the beach to cope with the defeat. "I'm sure my dog won't be too angry at me," he added. "[The defeat] is...going to be hard to swallow for next couple of years," he further said.

headlines: Neesham's childhood coach died during World Cup final Super Over
text: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham's childhood coach David James Gordon passed away during the 2019 World Cup final Super Over. The former Auckland Grammar School teacher breathed his last, moments after the cricketer hit a six on the bowling of England's Jofra Archer. "How appropriate you held on until just after such a match. Hope you were proud," Neesham tweeted.

headlines: K'taka minister HD Revanna goes barefoot to Assembly for trust vote
text: HD Revanna, Karnataka minister and son of former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda, went barefoot to the state Assembly in Bengaluru for trust vote debate on Thursday. JD(S) leader and Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy's coalition government with Congress faces a floor test in the Assembly today. Notably, rebel JD(S)-Congress MLAs have refused to withdraw their resignations or attend the Assembly.

headlines: 'Uncle Nelson' told me to join politics: Priyanka Gandhi
text: On the 101st birth anniversary of Nobel Peace Prize winner late Nelson Mandela, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra today posted a picture of herself with Mandela. "To me, he was Uncle Nelson (who told me I ought to be in politics long before anyone else did!)," she wrote. "The world misses men like #NelsonMandela more than ever today," she added.

headlines: eBay to buy 5.5% Paytm Mall shares reportedly at $3 bn valuation
text: US-based online marketplace giant eBay has agreed to buy a 5.5% stake in Paytm's e-commerce unit Paytm Mall, reportedly for $170-200 million at a valuation of about $3 billion. This will mark eBay's third investment in Indian e-commerce space. It had invested about $133 million in Snapdeal in 2014 and had sold its 6.55% Flipkart stake after Walmart acquired it.

headlines: Delhi govt plans to put a cap on number of guests at weddings
text: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said the government has finalised a draft policy to cap the number of guests at social functions, like weddings, in order to reduce traffic congestion. He, however, clarified that the guidelines won't cover all banquet halls and wedding venues across the city, but farmhouses and Low Density Residential Areas located primarily in Outer Delhi.

headlines: 23-yr-old man falls to death from 3rd floor while on phone in Noida
text: A 23-year-old man fell to his death from the third floor of a Noida building on Wednesday while he was talking on phone. Jitendra Kumar was a cook at a sweetshop and lived in a leased flat on the third floor of the four-storey building. He got married only a month ago and his wife was in his home town.

headlines: US judge suspended over 'close your legs' remark to rape victim
text: A US judge, John F Russo Jr, has been suspended after he told an alleged rape victim she could've "closed her legs" to prevent the sexual assault in 2016. He faces a hearing to determine whether he's fit for the bench. Meanwhile, a judge, who recommended leniency for a rape-accused as he came from a 'good family', has also resigned.

headlines: US removes Turkey from F-35 programme as it buys Russia's S-400
text: The US has removed Turkey from its F-35 fighter jets programme after it received the first parts of the Russian S-400 air defence system. "The F-35 cannot coexist with a Russian intelligence collection platform that will be used to learn about its advanced capabilities," the White House said. The US had earlier stopped training Turkish pilots on F-35 jets.

headlines: Google removes 7 Play Store apps over risk of spying on user
text: Google has removed seven apps from Play Store over risks of their ability to track user location and access contacts, SMS and call history. The apps were detected by antivirus firm Avast, which claimed all of the seven apps were likely designed by a Russian developer. The apps have been installed a combined 1.3 lakh times, Avast said.

headlines: Instagram to hide number of 'Likes' in 6 more countries
text: Facebook-owned photo-sharing platform Instagram is expanding its test to hide the visibility of the number of 'Likes' on other users' posts to six more countries. This includes Ireland, Italy, Japan, Brazil, Australia and New Zealand. Instagram said the test is "because [it wants] your followers to focus on the photos and videos you share, not how many likes they get."

headlines: Spain's La Sagrada Familia church is under construction for 137 yrs
text: Spain's La Sagrada Familia church is under construction since 1882, longer than it took to build the Egyptian Pyramids, and is expected to be completed in 2026. Despite being under construction, over three million visitors visit it every year. Currently, it's the largest unfinished Roman Catholic church in Barcelona, but it's expected to be the tallest church worldwide on completion.

headlines: I have self-respect, need to clarify: K'taka CM ahead of floor test
text: While addressing the Karnataka Assembly during a debate on the trust vote on Thursday, CM HD Kumaraswamy said, "I have self-respect and so do my ministers." Stating that doubts had been created about the Congress-JD(S) coalition government, Kumaraswamy added, "We have to tell the truth...I have to make some clarifications." He also asked, "Who is responsible for destabilising this government?"

headlines: We will fight till Jadhav is back home: Pilot on ICJ ruling
text: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, Rajasthan Deputy CM Sachin Pilot tweeted, "All of India stands united with you, we will fight till you are back home." Stating that the ruling brings hope, Pilot added, "My prayers and that of India are with you and your family."

headlines: ICJ's verdict positive, hope Pak will return Jadhav: VK Singh
text: Speaking on the ICJ's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav, Union Minister General (retired) VK Singh said that the "judgement is positive". He added that hopefully, Pakistan will realise its mistake and will return Jadhav to India. On Wednesday, the ICJ extended the stay on the death sentence awarded to Jadhav by Pakistan and asked it to review the conviction.

headlines: Huge cache of explosives, illicit liquor seized in Manipur
text: Assam Rifles has seized a huge cache of explosives and 145 cartons of illicit liquor from a man during a raid at a village in Manipur, a Defence release said. According to the release, 190 explosive sticks and 62 detonators were seized during the raid from the man. He was later handed over to the Churachandpur Police for further investigation.
