headlines: Chandrayaan-2 launch rescheduled to July 22, days after being aborted
text: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has announced that India's second Moon mission 'Chandrayaan-2' launch, which was called off due to a technical snag on July 15, is now rescheduled at 2:43 pm on July 22. It will be launched from Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota. Earlier, the mission was aborted just 56 minutes before the scheduled launch time.

headlines: Only Pak ICJ judge voted against India in 15-1 verdict in Jadhav case
text: The International Court of Justice ruled in favour of India in the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and voted 15-1, with the only judge to dissent being former Chief Justice of Pakistan Tassaduq Hussain Jillani. Jillani, who's an ad-hoc judge, agreed with the rest on only one point that the ICJ has jurisdiction to hear India's plea against Pakistan over Jadhav.

headlines: Saravana owner Rajagopal dies days after surrendering in murder case
text: Saravana Bhavan owner P Rajagopal passed away on Thursday aged 72 after suffering a heart attack. Rajagopal had surrendered in court in a murder case on July 9 wearing oxygen mask. He had sought time to surrender stating ill health but the court had denied him more time following which he was taken into custody to serve life imprisonment.

headlines: Prepare for jobs of the future with Great Learnings AI program
text: Tech professionals can future-proof their jobs with the Artificial Intelligence program offered by Great Learning in collaboration with UT Austin and Great Lakes. Rated 4.7 stars by 500+ learners, the program helps learners to improve skills with 12+ hands-on projects to build their Github repository and e-portfolio. Learners also participate in industry-sponsored hackathons to showcase their expertise.

headlines: Will proceed as per law: Pak PM 'appreciates' ICJ's Jadhav verdict
text: After the International Court of Justice ruled in favour of India in the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and stayed his death penalty, Pakistan PM Imran Khan tweeted that the country will proceed further "as per law". "Appreciate ICJ's decision not to acquit, release & return Commander Kulbhushan Jadhav to India. He's guilty of crimes against the people of Pakistan," he added.

headlines: Prosecutors drop case accusing Spacey of sexually assaulting man
text: Prosecutors on Wednesday dropped a case accusing actor Kevin Spacey of groping an 18-year-old man at a bar in 2016 after the accuser refused to testify about a missing phone, which the defence said could prove Spacey's innocence. The man's mother alleged in 2017 that Spacey got her son drunk and sexually assaulted him. Spacey has faced several other accusations.

headlines: Stallone hails Salman's video of specially-abled fan making his portrait
text: Hollywood actor Sylvester Stallone has commented on a video shared by Salman Khan, which shows a specially-abled fan making Salman's portrait. Praising the video, Stallone wrote, "That is love and devotion." While sharing the video, Salman had written in the caption, "God bless...can't reciprocate the love but prayers and much love!!!"

headlines: Will withdraw resignation: Rebel K'taka MLA ahead of trust vote
text: Rebel Karnataka MLA and Congress leader Ramalinga Reddy has announced he would withdraw his resignation and vote in favour of Congress-JD(S) government in the state during the floor test on Thursday. Adding that he had been with the party for 45 years, Reddy said, "I had only resigned as an MLA but I never said I'd move away from Congress."

headlines: Neil Armstrong's Apollo 11 spacesuit goes on display after 13 yrs
text: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum in Washington has put the spacesuit worn by Neil Armstrong, the first man to step on Moon during the Apollo 11 mission, on display after 13 years. Armstrong's son Rick unveiled the display on July 16, marking the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 mission's launch. Neil Armstrong had passed away on August 25, 2012.

headlines: Tamil Nadu man posts beef festival invite on FB, arrested
text: A 33-year-old man named S Ezhilan was arrested on Wednesday for posting a Facebook invitation for a beef festival in Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu. A police officer said that Ezhilan had invited several people and promised to give them "foremost respect" if they showed up. A case was filed following a complaint by Kallappuliyur Village Administrative Officer Sudara Rajan.

headlines: My thoughts are with Jadhav, he's alone in a cell in Pak: Rahul
text: After ICJ ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav, Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "My thoughts tonight are with Kulbhushan Jadhav, alone in a prison cell in Pakistan." Rahul said the verdict brings Jadhav's family a "rare moment of relief, joy & renewed hope, that he will one day be free to return to his home in India."

headlines: Not your fault, ICJ verdict given in English: Giriraj Singh mocks Pak
text: After Pakistan government called the International Court of Justice's verdict in Kulbhushan Jadhav case a 'Big win for Pakistan', Union Minister Giriraj Singh tweeted, "Not your fault...judgment delivered in English." The UN court on Wednesday delivered the verdict in favour of India and found Pakistan guilty of violating Vienna Convention, thereby staying the death penalty to Jadhav by Pakistan.

headlines: L&T chief AM Naik appointed as Mindtree Chairman
text: Larsen and Toubro (L&T) Group Chairman AM Naik has been appointed as the Non-Executive Chairman of mid-sized IT services firm Mindtree on Wednesday. The move follows L&T's acquisition of a controlling stake in the Bengaluru-based company. Mindtree CEO Rostow Ravanan, Executive Chairman Krishnakumar Natarajan and Executive Vice Chairman NS Parthasarathy had resigned earlier this month.

headlines: China search engine project 'Dragonfly' terminated: Google
text: Karan Bhatia, Google's Global Government Affairs and Public Policy VP, has revealed the technology giant has "terminated" its controversial Chinese search engine project 'Dragonfly'. Google had repeatedly faced heavy criticism over its decision to create a censored search engine to comply with Chinese laws. Google CEO Sundar Pichai, in late 2018, had said work on the project was "limited".

headlines: Indonesia ride-hailing unicorn Go-Jek gets funding from Visa
text: Global payments technology provider Visa has invested an undisclosed amount in Indonesian ride-hailing and logistics unicorn Go-Jek's ongoing Series F round of funding. Go-Jek and Visa will be partnering together to offer payment solutions to Southeast Asian Go-Jek users. Founded in 2010, Go-Jek offers on-demand motorbikes and taxis, along with services like grocery delivery and mobile payments.

headlines: Rabri Devi urges PM to declare Bihar floods as national disaster
text: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi urged PM Narendra Modi to declare Bihar floods as a national disaster and send financial assistance to the flood-affected state. According to the state disaster management department, as many as 67 people have died due to floods so far. Officials said, 26 teams of NDRF and SDRF are carrying out rescue operations in the state.

headlines: Pregnant woman shot dead over water dispute in UP, 1 arrested
text: A 25-year-old pregnant woman was shot dead over a water dispute in Etah on Wednesday, said the Uttar Pradesh police. Samaur village head Bhanu Pratap said that the three to four men who shot at the woman had fought several times with other villagers in the past. The main accused, Santosh, has been arrested.

headlines: Boy dies after blood bank allegedly refuses to give blood in MP
text: An eight-year-old boy, who was admitted to a district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, died allegedly after the blood bank in the hospital refused to give him blood. A relative of the boy said that the boy's mother went to people for blood but no one helped. An official at the hospital said, the boy was critical and had severe anaemia.

headlines: Over 2,900 building collapse cases in Mumbai in 6 yrs; 242 killed
text: In response to an RTI, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said at least 242 people were killed in over 2,900 incidents of building collapse in Mumbai between 2013 and 2018. BMC added that 818 were injured in these incidents. BMC further said that 499 buildings have been listed as 'unfit/dangerous' for habitat this year and these need be vacated and demolished.

headlines: 4 policemen suspended for assaulting journo in UP's Mathura
text: Four policemen were suspended after a three-member committee found them guilty of assaulting a journalist in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. He was assaulted after he had asked the policemen to not park their vehicle in the middle of the road, the police added. The police have also sent a letter to higher authorities for their out of zone transfer.

headlines: Coimbatore Traffic Police get 70 body-worn cams for surveillance
text: The Coimbatore Traffic Police on Wednesday received 70 body-worn cameras designed to capture traffic violations, a police official said. The cameras can be used to stream live visuals to the police control room as well as record the visuals in the device at the same time, he added. He said this will bring transparency in the work of police personnel.

headlines: Noida Authority to clean commercial areas at night: CEO
text: The Noida Authority CEO said that the city's commercial areas will be cleaned at night as sanitary workers find it difficult to sweep the areas during the day. She also directed officials to ensure the elimination of open dumping spots by August 31. Thanking the CEO, Sector 18 Market Association President said, markets also need dustbins at various spots.

headlines: My wife doesn't let our son watch GoT: Sonali Bendre's husband
text: Actress Sonali Bendre's husband Goldie Behl has revealed that she doesn't let their son watch 'Game of Thrones'. "I said yes, but my wife (Sonali) didn't allow him. So, he didn't see it," said Goldie. "I am okay with him seeing it at the age of 13-14, in a couple of years he will see anyway," he added.

headlines: Abdul Razzaq reveals he has had 5-6 affairs after marriage
text: Former Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq, during a TV programme, said that he has had "five-six affairs that also had a validity of 1-1.5 years". He further said that all those affairs happened after he got married. "How do people laugh and clap at such statements? Won't be laughing when they're at [the] receiving end," a user tweeted reacting to it.

headlines: I never want to be involved in a Super Over ever again: Ben Stokes
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was named Man of the 2019 World Cup final, has said he never wants to be involved in a Super Over ever again. The 28-year-old hit eight runs in Super Over against New Zealand. He further revealed he had suggested captain Eoin Morgan to send Jos Buttler and Jason Roy to play the Super Over.

headlines: I won't say I have redeemed myself, I am paid to play: Ben Stokes
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who was arrested in 2017 for a street brawl and later found not guilty, has said that the 2019 World Cup win was not his redemption. "I won't look back and say I redeemed myself. I am an athlete and a cricketer and it's what we are paid to do, to win trophies," he added.

headlines: India drawn with Qatar in World Cup 2022 Asian Qualifiers draw
text: The Indian football team has been grouped with 2022 FIFA World Cup hosts Qatar in Group E of Asian Qualifiers for the 2022 World Cup and the 2023 AFC Asian Cup. Along with Qatar, India will also play against Bangladesh and Afghanistan in Group E. India will begin their campaign at home against Oman on September 5.

headlines: If I travel with players, we won't have another Sindhu: Gopichand
text: Talking about not travelling with players like PV Sindhu on the international circuit, national badminton coach Pullela Gopichand said, "If I was just travelling, what happens to the next batch, we would never have a Sindhu come out then." He further said that he needs more coaches as he can't do it alone. "Everybody needs personal attention," he stated.

headlines: Juventus to be called Piemonte Calcio in FIFA after signing PES deal
text: Juventus will be known as 'Piemonte Calcio' in the next FIFA game after signing a naming rights deal with FIFA's rival Pro Evolution Soccer. Piemonte Calcio will have its own badge and kit, designed by EA Sports. This is the first time in 25 years that FIFA will not hold the licence for the Italian first division champions.

headlines: Manchester City players to decide new captain, says Pep Guardiola
text: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that he will let his players decide who will captain the Premier League champions next season following the departure of long-time skipper Vincent Kompany. Kompany left Manchester City at the end of last season after 11 years to take up a player-coach role at Anderlecht, the club at which he started his career.

headlines: India has potential to win 100 Olympic medals by 2032: Rajyavardhan
text: Ex-Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has said that with various steps taken by government for promotion of sports and its infrastructure in the country in last five years, India has the potential to win 100 Olympic medals by 2032. Rathore added that the 'Khelo India' campaign initiated by PM Modi government has changed the attitude of the country towards sports.

headlines: Privacy concerns raised over photo app FaceApp, company responds
text: The Russian company behind the viral photo-editing app 'FaceApp', that lets users virtually look older, responded to the privacy concerns over the users' photos. "Most images are deleted from our servers within 48 hours," FaceApp said. "We might store an uploaded photo in the cloud...We want to make sure users don't upload the photo repeatedly for every edit," it added.

headlines: Working presidents to work on their own: Chacko to Sheila Dikshit
text: Delhi Congress in-charge PC Chacko on Tuesday wrote to Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit, saying that the Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee was constituted with the order that three working presidents will work independently. Chacko added that since Dikshit is "not keeping well", he has authorised the working presidents to hold meetings of district and block committee heads and take decisions.

headlines: ICJ's landmark judgement on Jadhav validates India's position: MEA
text: The Ministry of External Affairs has issued a statement on the International Court of Justice's verdict in favour of India in the case related to retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav. It said that the "landmark judgement validated India's position". It added Pakistan is expected to immediately inform Jadhav of his rights and allow Indian consular officers access to Jadhav.

headlines: Court withdraws order to distribute Quran for bail over communal post
text: A Jharkhand court has modified its earlier order which had mandated a student, accused of writing a communal post on social media, to distribute five copies of the Holy Quran for bail. The court withdrew the order after the police filed an application saying it was difficult to implement the condition. Notably, the student had refused to obey the order.

headlines: Pakistan's conduct is under watch: Salve after ICJ verdict on Jadhav
text: Responding to ICJ's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav, senior lawyer Harish Salve, who had represented him, said, "Pakistan's conduct is under watch and if what they do is another farcical attempt, we'll be back in the [world] court." "We expect Pakistan to do whatever it has to do including appropriate legislative measures to guarantee a fair trial [for Jadhav]," he added.

headlines: 3 TN SRM Institute students kill themselves in same manner in 60 days
text: A 21-year-old student killed himself at Tamil Nadu's SRM Institute of Science and Technology's Kattankulathur campus on Monday, the third such incident there in a span of 60 days using the same method. The police said it has been understood that the victim had multiple arrears in his exam. In May, two students killed themselves inside the same campus.

headlines: 18-yr-old defender Gahlot becomes India's 2nd youngest goalscorer
text: India's 18-year-old defender Narender Gahlot on Tuesday became the second youngest footballer to score a goal for the national team. Gahlot achieved the feat after his 51st-minute header in India's last league match of 2019 Intercontinental Cup against Syria. Jerry Zirsanga, who scored aged 16 in May 2004, is the youngest footballer to score for India.

headlines: Inshorts is hiring Content Managers & Specialists for regional news
text: Inshorts is looking to hire Content Managers & Content Specialists for Gujarati, Telugu, Bengali, Marathi, Tamil, Malayalam, and Kannada. Eligibility criteria include bachelors/masters in Mass Communication with an experience of 1-5 years for Content Specialists and 5-8 years for Content Managers in the media industry. Swipe left to read the full description and to apply.

headlines: Why are leaked sex scenes not being spread under actor's name: Radhika
text: Actress Radhika Apte, while talking about her sex scenes with Dev Patel from 'The Wedding Guest' getting leaked, said, "The scenes are being spread in my name. Why are people not spreading them under the male actor's name?" "[The film] has many other beautiful sequences...That one particular sex scene got leaked because of the psychotic mentality of society," she added.

headlines: Who would have won WC final had both teams hit equal boundaries?
text: If England and New Zealand had hit equal boundaries both in Super Over and the match in World Cup final, a count-back from Super Over's final ball would've decided the winner. The team with the higher scoring delivery would've been declared the winner. England would've won as they hit a four on the last ball, while New Zealand scored one.

headlines: ICC mock WC final Super Over by showing England players as aged men
text: The ICC took to Instagram to mock 2019 World Cup Super Over by showing England cricketers Eoin Morgan, Jofra Archer, Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root as elderly men holding the trophy. "That's what a Super Over will do to you!" the ICC captioned the picture. "They will not be holding that when they're that old," a user wrote.

headlines: Shubman should be groomed for India's no. 4 batting spot: Whatmore
text: Former Sri Lanka coach Dav Whatmore has said that batsman Shubman Gill should be groomed for Team India's number four batting position. "He has got the technique to be a number four...I am sure he will have a long career," he added. The 19-year-old Shubman was the player of the tournament in 2018 Under-19 World Cup.

headlines: Twitter gets trolled after unveiling redesigned desktop site
text: Micro-blogging platform Twitter was trolled on Twitter after it unveiled a redesigned layout for its website. The platform has added new dark mode options and shifted the top navigation bar to the left sidebar, which contains a new explore tab. Twitter will redesign the entire site and make it ugly, but wont give us an edit button, a user said.

headlines: Good: Elizabeth Warren on Peter Thiel saying she is 'dangerous'
text: US politician Elizabeth Warren shared an article on Twitter that revealed PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel called her the most "dangerous" Democratic presidential candidate and responded saying, "Good." "I think she's the one who's actually talking about the economy, which is the only thing...I think matters by far the most," Thiel said. "All the others are almost equally unimpressive," he added.

headlines: Cleric invited home to teach Quran to 9-yr-old girl molests her, held
text: Uttar Pradesh Police on Wednesday arrested a cleric for allegedly sexually harassing a nine-year-old girl in Aligarh. The girl's mother alleged that the cleric who is associated with an Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) mosque was invited to their home to teach her daughter Quran but he molested her. The accused said, "Padhane jaata tha sir, to thoda-bahut chhedkhani ho gayi."

headlines: Kerala IPS officer Merin Joseph brings child rape accused from Saudi
text: A team led by Kollam Police Commissioner Merin Joseph arrested a man accused of raping a 13-year-old Kerala girl from Saudi Arabia and brought him to India on Tuesday. The accused, a Kollam native who works in Saudi Arabia, allegedly raped his friend's niece for three months in 2017. The child and her uncle later committed suicide.

headlines: Telangana govt employees shoot TikTok videos at work; transferred
text: Several employees of the Telangana government's Khammam Municipal Corporation (KMC) were transferred and their wages were reduced after a series of their TikTok videos shot at work went viral on the internet. In the videos, they can be seen singing, dancing and playing pranks during office hours. According to KMC officials, 11 outsourced employees were found involved in the activity.

headlines: Trump reacts to Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pak
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday reacted to Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed's arrest in Pakistan. "Great pressure has been exerted over the last two years to find him!" Trump said about Saeed in a tweet. Saeed, who's been designated a terrorist by the US, was arrested on terror financing charges.

headlines: Indian drugmaker dumped key files in 200L drum in scrapyard: US
text: A US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) investigator found that India's Strides Pharma Science dumped batch records for US drug products in a 200-litre drum in the scrapyard of its Puducherry plant. Strides, which sells numerous drugs in the US, was also caught attempting to shred quality-control documents. Ibuprofen is among the drugs the company makes at the Puducherry plant.

headlines: Sindhu enters Indonesia Open 2nd round, Prannoy loses on b'day
text: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu came from a set behind to beat Japans Aya Ohori 11-21, 21-15, 21-15 to enter the $1,250,000 Indonesia Open's second round. Meanwhile, HS Prannoy, who turned 27 today, lost 21-19, 18-21, 20-22 to world number two Shi Yuqi in the first round. Further, Kidambi Srikanth won his first-round match by defeating Japans Kenta Nishimoto 21-14, 21-13.

headlines: Expect BJP govt in Karnataka next week: BJP National Gen Secy
text: BJP National General Secretary P Muralidhar Rao on Wednesday claimed that a BJP government is expected to take charge in Karnataka next week. He said that the coalition government is in 'clear minority' and should go. Rao added that BJP is confident that the Congress-JDS government would lose the trust vote in the Legislative Assembly on Thursday.

headlines: Crypto exchange Cryptokart shuts down over regulatory uncertainty
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Cryptokart has decided to shut down its operations after about two years. The RBI had barred banks from serving cryptocurrency exchanges and firms in April 2018. Cryptokart Co-founder Gaurang Poddar said that since this decision, the general interest in cryptocurrency in India has "tanked" and regulatory uncertainty "just makes any long term planning difficult".

headlines: NCRB doesn't maintain specific data on lynching cases: MHA
text: MoS for Home Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) doesn't maintain specific data of lynching incidents in the country. He said this in response to a question on whether mob lynchings have increased in the last six months. "State governments are responsible for prevention, detection and investigation of crimes and for prosecuting criminals," he added.

headlines: Truth and justice prevail: Kejriwal on Jadhav's ICJ verdict
text: After the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Wednesday ruled in favour of India in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Truth and justice prevail." "I warmly welcome the ICJ judgment (of) staying the execution...and granting consular access to India," he wrote. "This son of our soil must be back soon with his family," the CM added.

headlines: Will pray for Jadhav's early return: Cong after ICJ verdict
text: The Congress party said it is a big win for India after the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Wednesday ruled in favour of retired Indian Naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav. "We welcome the ruling...we will continue to pray for his early return," the Congress tweeted. In its verdict, ICJ has directed Pakistan to review the death sentence given to Jadhav.

headlines: I'm sure Jadhav will get justice: PM Modi after ICJ verdict
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday welcomed the verdict by International Court of Justice (ICJ) in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case. "Truth and justice have prevailed. Congratulations to ICJ for a verdict based on extensive study of facts. I'm sure Jadhav will get justice," he tweeted. "Our government will always work for the safety and welfare of every Indian," the PM added.

headlines: Australia urges China to let Uighur mother and son leave country
text: The Australian government has called on China to let an ethnic Uighur mother and son to leave the country. Sadam Abdusalam, an Uighur-Australian, has made a public call for the release of his wife and son, whom he has never met. China is believed to have held nearly 10 lakh Uighur Muslims in detention camps in the Xinjiang province.

headlines: Govt may list 5 units of world's top coal miner Coal India
text: The government may reportedly list units of state-run Coal India (CIL), the world's largest coal miner, as separate companies to raise government funds and boost competition. Reports said the Coal Ministry is studying a proposal to list CIL's four production coalfields, constituting over three-fourths of its output, and its exploration unit. In 2017, think-tank NITI Aayog suggested a similar move.

headlines: ICJ rules in India's favour, asks Pak to review Jadhav death sentence
text: The International Court of Justice on Wednesday ruled in favour of India, finding Pakistan guilty of violating the Vienna Convention in retired Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav's case for denying him consular access. The ICJ also extended the stay on the death sentence awarded to Jadhav by Pakistan on espionage and terrorism charges and asked it to review the conviction.

headlines: I am locked in for good: Nick while explaining saat pheras on US show
text: During his appearance on a US talk show, Nick Jonas talked about his marriage to actress Priyanka Chopra. "We [had our marriage] in Jodhpur, at a palace there which was beautiful," he said. "So you do the pheras, in which seven walks around the fire symbolise seven lives together. So I'm locked in for good now," he jokingly added.

headlines: Woke up wondering if it was a bad dream: Williamson on World Cup final
text: Reacting to losing World Cup final on boundaries to England, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said, "I woke up wondering if it was just a bad dream and it wasn't, was it?" "It sort of hits you in waves. You forget about it for 10 minutes...and then it comes back to you and you go...'Did that just happen?'" he added.

headlines: MS Dhoni's parents want him to retire: Childhood coach Banerjee
text: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni's childhood coach Keshav Banerjee has revealed that the former India captain's parents want their son to retire from international cricket. "Dhoni's parents told me that the entire media is saying that Dhoni should retire and they feel that the media is right. They said they can't handle their big property alone anymore," he added.

headlines: Suspended BJP MLA seen dancing with guns in video expelled for 6 yrs
text: Uttarakhand BJP MLA Kunwar Pranav Singh Champion, who was already suspended from party, was on Wednesday expelled for six years after a video of him consuming alcohol and dancing with guns surfaced online. BJP had issued him a notice asking why he shouldn't be expelled and he couldn't give a satisfactory reply. He was earlier suspended for threatening a journalist.

headlines: Rivigo fires up to 100 employees, cancels on-campus offers
text: Gurugram-based billion-dollar logistics startup Rivigo has fired up to about 100 employees, mainly in its freight marketplace team, over the last few months. The startup had to withdraw around 50 offers from 10 premier campuses before joining dates, including IIT and IIM, among others. Rivigo Co-founder Gazal Kalra, confirming the firings, said they were over "performance and market dynamics".

headlines: NIA (Amendment) Bill passed in Rajya Sabha amid doubts by Opposition
text: The Rajya Sabha has passed the National Investigation Agency (Amendment) Bill, 2019. Although the bill was passed unanimously, the Opposition raised doubts over its possible misuse. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "I assure the House that the bill will not be misused...Both Houses need to prove to the world and the terrorists that we are united in this fight."

headlines: Great victory for India: Sushma as ICJ stays Jadhav's execution
text: Former Union Minister Sushma Swaraj said it was a great victory for India after the International Court of Justice (ICJ) stayed retired naval officer Kulbhushan Jadhav's death sentence by Pakistan. ICJ ordered Pakistan to give India consular access to Jadhav and also review Jadhav's conviction. "I hope it will provide the much needed solace to Jadhav's family," added Swaraj.

headlines: Drunk woman stopped for not wearing helmet, hits traffic policeman
text: A woman and her friend were arrested for misbehaving with a traffic policeman in West Delhi's Mayapuri on Tuesday, after she and the man on whose scooter she was riding pillion were stopped for not wearing helmets. In a video, the woman can be seen pushing and hitting the policeman. According to police, both of them were heavily drunk.

headlines: Rajasthan Police seize drugs & tweet, "Did anyone lose their smack?"
text: Rajasthan Police on Wednesday shared a picture of seized smack on Twitter and wrote, "Oops! Did anyone lost (lose) their #Smack? If yes, we have them!" in order to track down its owners. "If you want them back contact us ASAP! Or else it'll be lost forever," police tweeted. "We promise free stay & food at our expense!" police added.

headlines: I don't have a racist bone in my body: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he does not have a "racist bone" in his body. The US President has been accused of racism over his recent remarks on four US Congresswomen, who are all minorities. Trump had said that the women should "go back" to the "broken and crime-infested" countries they "came from".

headlines: Tata India's most valued brand at $19.6 bn, LIC next at $7.3 bn
text: The brand 'Tata' has again been ranked as India's most valuable brand in 2019, according to a report by London-based consultancy Brand Finance. Tata's brand value rose 37% from last year to $19.6 billion, surpassing the combined value of the second and third most valued brands in India, LIC ($7.3 billion) and Infosys ($6.5 billion), respectively.

headlines: Lagarde resigns as International Monetary Fund chief after 8 yrs
text: International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Christine Lagarde on Tuesday announced that she would leave the global crisis lender on September 12. Lagarde has held the top role at the IMF since 2011 and is in line to succeed European Central Bank President Mario Draghi in November. A former French finance minister, Lagarde was the first woman to head the IMF.

headlines: Twitter CEO visits Apple HQ, talks to marketing team: Report
text: Micro-blogging platform Twitter's Co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey addressed Apple employees from the marketing department at the iPhone maker's headquarters, Bloomberg reported. Dorsey is one of several speakers talking to select Apple employees as part of an ongoing series, the report claimed. The address itself didn't point to a new partnership between Dorsey's companies and Apple, it added.

headlines: VIP darshans at Tirupati temple to end soon: TTD Chairman
text: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) board Chairman has announced that the three categories (L1, L2 and L3) VIP darshans at the Tirupati temple would be abolished soon. The Chairman's comment came after a PIL was filed against the categorisation of devotees terming the TTD move illegal. He said TTD will introduce pilgrim-friendly seva tickets to provide "hassle-free darshan to pilgrims".

headlines: 2 arrested for raping 14-yr-old girl in J&K's Kathua: Police
text: Police on Wednesday arrested two persons for allegedly raping a 14-year-old girl at her house in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The police said that the victim's father lodged a complaint alleging that the accused raped his daughter last week when she was alone at home. The police are waiting for the medical examination reports of the girl.

headlines: 90% of Kaziranga National Park submerged in floodwater
text: The Assam Ministry of Forest and Environment said in a statement that 90% of the Kaziranga National Park in Assam's Golaghat and Nagaon districts is submerged in floodwater. Also, 155 out of the 199 anti-poaching camps in the park are affected by the floods. The officials assured that the authorities are working round-the-clock to check poaching at the National Park.

headlines: 81 students in Karnataka fall ill after eating mid-day meal
text: After consuming the mid-day meal, 81 students of a government school near Karnataka's Belagavi were rushed to hospital with complaints of health problems on Tuesday. As per reports, students were alerted after a teacher found a dead lizard in the rice container. After treatment, 69 students were discharged while 12 were kept under observation for a day in the hospital.

headlines: Vedanta to invest $650 million in new oil blocks
text: Vedanta has said it'll invest $650 million in the oil and gas blocks it won in last two rounds of government auctions. It had won 53 oil and gas blocks in Discovered Small Fields (DSF) and Open Acreage Licensing Policy (OALP) rounds. Over next three years, Vedanta further plans to infuse $2.9 billion into oil and gas exploration, and production.

headlines: I lost 26 kg as I had no appetite for first 4 months: Rishi on cancer
text: Speaking about battling cancer, Rishi Kapoor revealed, "I had lost 26 kg as I had no appetite for the first four months. Now, I've gained 7-8 kg." Rishi, who has been undergoing treatment in New York, added, "It's been nine months and 16 days...I really miss home." The actor further said he is hoping to return to India by August-end.

headlines: Williamson's silence 48 hours since WC final is remarkable: Shastri
text: India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to laud New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's "composure" and "dignity" after boundary count rule decided the winner of 2019 World Cup. "Your dignified grace and silence 48 hours since is simply remarkable. We know you've one hand on that WC," Shastri wrote. "You not just Kane. You Kane and Able," he added.

headlines: Terrible judicial precedent: Cong on SC order on rebel K'taka MLAs
text: After the Supreme Court ordered that the rebel Karnataka MLAs cannot be forced to take part in the trust vote in the Assembly tomorrow, Congress Spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said it set a "terrible judicial precedent". "Blanket protection to MLAs, who are driven not by ideology but by far baser concerns, is unheard of," added Surjewala.

headlines: Magnificent desolation: 2nd man to step on Moon recalls experience
text: The second man to walk on the Moon, Buzz Aldrin, talking about his experience on the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 Moon mission's rocket launch, recalled his description of the lunar surface as "magnificent desolation". The now 89-year-old astronaut said it was his "greatest good fortune" to have joined Neil Armstrong and pilot Michael Collins on the Saturn V rocket.

headlines: If not in schools, kids should be given eggs at home: Chhattisgarh
text: The Congress-led Chhattisgarh government has said that if some parents are against serving eggs in mid-day meals in schools, authorities should make arrangements to serve them to non-vegetarian children at their homes. It added that separate seating arrangements should be made for students who don't consume eggs, and they should also be served alternatives like soya milk and fortified biscuits.

headlines: Woman rescued from Mumbai building debris as rescuers spot gold ring
text: A 23-year-old woman named Zinat Rehman Salmani was rescued from the debris of the 100-year-old Mumbai building that collapsed on Tuesday after the fire brigade and NDRF rescue workers spotted her gold ring. She was trapped under iron beams, a wooden door, and an LPG cylinder for over two hours. Zinat was rescued from the debris after a one-and-a-half-hour operation.

headlines: 9 killed, 20 injured in UP gunfight between 2 groups over property
text: At least nine people have been killed and around 20 people have been injured after a gunfight between two groups allegedly over a property dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra district on Wednesday. The gunfight reportedly took place for one hour and involved nearly 100 people. Meanwhile, District Magistrate Ankit Kumar Agrawal said they are investigating the case.

headlines: UP court dismisses 20-year-old murder case against CM Yogi
text: A special MP-MLA court in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj dismissed a 20-year-old murder case against Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday. The case pertains to the murder of police constable Satya Prakash Yadav in Maharajganj district. The Crime Branch, Crime Investigation Department (CB-CID) had probed the case and given a clean-chit to CM Yogi.

headlines: Fire breaks out at SBI building in Delhi, no injuries reported
text: A fire broke out on the sixth floor of the SBI building in Delhi's Sansad Marg on Wednesday, Chief Fire Officer Atul Garg said. Seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the blaze was brought under control within 20 minutes. No injury has been reported, while an effort to ascertain the cause of the fire is ongoing.

headlines: Terrorist killed in encounter in J&K, arms recovered
text: A terrorist was killed in an encounter with security forces in Sopore in Baramulla district, Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The security forces had launched a search and cordon operation following inputs regarding the presence of terrorists in the Gund Brath area. Arms and ammunition have been seized from the encounter site, the police said.

headlines: Pakistan Minister criticises Trump on Twitter, deletes tweet later
text: Pakistan's Human Rights Minister Shireen Mazari wrote on Twitter purportedly criticising US President Donald Trump but deleted the tweet later. "When racism and bigotry become acceptable political norms in democracies," Mazari had tweeted. "Anti-American" Mazari deleted the tweet in view of the forthcoming meeting of PM Imran Khan and Trump, former Pakistani diplomat Husain Haqqani said.

headlines: Sudan's ruling military and opposition sign power-sharing deal
text: Sudan's ruling military and opposition leaders have signed a power-sharing deal. The deal establishes a new transitional ruling body which will comprise of civilians and military leaders. A general will head the body for the first 21 months, then a civilian-run administration would take over for the remaining 18 months, followed by elections, as per the agreement.

headlines: United to resume Delhi, Mumbai flights as Pakistan reopens airspace
text: United Airlines said it'd restart daily non-stop service between New York/Newark, New Delhi and Mumbai from September 6, after Pakistan lifted airspace restrictions. The restrictions, imposed in February, added flight time for passengers and fuel costs for airlines as they were forced to take long detours. India said Pakistan's reopening of airspace brought in "significant relief for airlines".

headlines: Will identify, deport infiltrators from every inch of India: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah said that the government will identify illegal immigrants and infiltrators living in every inch of this country and deport them as per the international law. Shah's comment came during a debate over the NRC in the Rajya Sabha. Shah said the people elected the BJP as it promised action against illegal immigrants in its poll manifesto.

headlines: Former SP leader Atiq Ahmed's residence raided by CBI
text: The CBI raided the residences of jailed former SP leader Atiq Ahmed in Prayagraj on Wednesday. The raids occurred about a month after Ahmed and 17 others were booked for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a real estate dealer in December last year. The dealer was allegedly forced to transfer his business to the accused.

headlines: Committed to ensuring justice for all: Mamata on Int'l Justice Day
text: On the occasion of International Justice Day on Wednesday, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee tweeted, "#InternationalJusticeDay #Bangla Govt is committed to framing good laws for people and ensuring good justice for all." She added, "19 human rights courts have been set up in #Bangla in the last 8 years."

headlines: Police arrest 3 after shootout on Delhi's Dwarka Expressway
text: The Crime Branch of Gurugram Police has arrested three gangsters after a shootout on Delhi's Dwarka Expressway, an official said on Wednesday. The criminals were wounded during the shootout and were later admitted to a hospital, the official said. The accused have committed crimes including murder, dacoity and kidnapping for ransom in Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi, he added.

headlines: Vadra granted 2 weeks to reply to plea against anticipatory bail
text: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday granted two weeks' time to Robert Vadra to file his reply to the Enforcement Directorate's plea against his anticipatory bail. The court has listed the matter for further hearing on September 26. Earlier today, Vadra's counsel sought more time for responding stating that Vadra was outside India when the notice was served to him.

headlines: 2 injured, 1 feared trapped in Arunachal Pradesh landslide
text: Two people were injured and one is feared to be trapped in a landslide that occurred due to intermittent rains in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar on Wednesday. With the help of five excavators, the NDRF, ITBP and CRPF are carrying out rescue operations in the area, officials said. The local administration said that many vehicles have been damaged in the landslide.

headlines: Over 5,000 flood-affected people lodged in Mizoram relief camps
text: More than 5,000 people have been shifted to relief camps due to the flood situation following heavy rains for the last seven days in Mizoram, officials said. At least five people have died due to rain-related incidents and 4,322 people were being evacuated. The officials added that the state government was gearing up relief operations in the affected areas.

headlines: European Commission elects its first female President
text: Germany's Ursula von der Leyen was elected as the first female President of the European Commission by the European Parliament on Tuesday. Von der Leyen has resigned from the post of Germany's Defence Minister to take over the new role at the European Union's executive body. She will succeed Jean-Claude Juncker who is set to step down on October 31.

headlines: Stokes asked umpires to not award 4 overthrows in final, they ignored
text: England pacer James Anderson has revealed what all-rounder Ben Stokes requested umpires after the ball deflected off his bat and England got four overthrows in World Cup final's last over. "Stokes...said, 'Can you take that four runs off. We don't want it'," Anderson said. The umpires ignored the request because it was a four as per rules, Anderson added.

headlines: Can't force MLAs for trust vote, Speaker to decide on resignations: SC
text: The Supreme Court has said Karnataka Assembly Speaker is free to decide on the status of the rebel MLAs' resignations, adding that he cannot be forced to take a decision within a time frame. However, the court stated the rebel MLAs cannot be compelled to participate in proceedings of Assembly, including the July 18 trust vote, till the Speaker decides.

headlines: 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed arrested in Pak: Reports
text: Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed was arrested in Pakistan's Lahore on Wednesday and sent to judicial custody, as per reports. Pakistan registered cases of terror financing against Saeed, his brother-in-law and other aides. The move follows Financial Action Task Force's warning to Pakistan to improve efforts against terrorism financing or face action.

headlines: You could've squeezed in: Brad to Leonardo on 'Titanic' door scene
text: Brad Pitt trolled his co-star Leonardo DiCaprio during an interview while promoting their upcoming film 'Once Upon A Time In Hollywood'. When the host asked if Jack, Leonardo's character, could have fit on the floating door in the scene towards the end of 'Titanic', Brad said, "You could've [squeezed in there], couldn't you?" Responding to this, Leonardo said, "No comment".

headlines: Google gaining unchecked power: 2nd protest walkout organiser quits
text: Meredith Whittaker, one of seven Google employees who organised mass walkouts in November 2018 against the handling of sexual misconduct complaints, has quit after 13 years. "Google, in the conventional pursuit of quarterly earnings, is gaining significant and largely unchecked power," Whittaker wrote. This comes weeks after another walkout organiser Claire Stapleton quit Google in June.

headlines: Musk's Neuralink unveils 'threads' that link brains to computers
text: Elon Musk has unveiled his new startup Neuralink's flexible "threads" designed to be inserted in brains to link them directly to computers. Musk said Neuralink, in the long term, is about finding a way to "achieve a sort of symbiosis with artificial intelligence." "We hope to have this in a human patient by the end of next year," Musk added.

headlines: Bill Gates no longer world's 2nd richest person, overtaken by Arnault
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates is no longer the world's second-richest person as his wealth was surpassed by French luxury goods tycoon Bernard Arnault's wealth, Bloomberg said today. Gates is now the world's third-richest person with $107 billion as compared to second-richest person Arnault's $108 billion wealth. Arnault derives most of his wealth from his holdings in Louis Vuitton owner LVMH.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi shares 22-yr-old photo as #SareeTwitter trends online
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra shared a picture of herself in a saree under #SareeTwitter, which is trending online. "Morning puja on the day of my wedding (22 years ago!)," she wrote. The #SareeTwitter trend began earlier this week, with several people, including celebrities and politicians, sharing their pictures on the microblogging website.

headlines: BJP councillor beats health inspector, Udupi CMC staff go on strike
text: BJP municipal councillor Yogish Salian allegedly thrashed junior health inspector Prasanna Kumar at Udupi City Municipal Council office in Karnataka on Tuesday. The two had reportedly argued over a delay in getting a drain cleaned. Kumar, who was injured near his eye, was admitted to a hospital even as CMC staff observed a pen down strike, barring emergency services.

headlines: US, Pune-based tech startup Icertis now unicorn with $115 mn funding
text: Washington and Pune-based technology startup Icertis has become a unicorn (achieved billion-dollar valuation) after raising $115 million in an advanced-stage funding round co-led by Greycroft Partners LLC and Wipro's Azim Premji's PremjiInvest. Existing investors including B Capital Group and Cross Creek Advisors participated. Founded in 2009, Icertis helps businesses manage contracts in the cloud.

headlines: 2 men assault traffic policemen on being stopped for drunk driving
text: Two men have been arrested for allegedly assaulting traffic policemen and smashing their motorcycle after one of them was prosecuted for drunk driving in north Delhi's Netaji Subhash Place on Sunday evening, police said. A video of the incident showed them hurling abuses at the two traffic policemen, scuffling with them and repeatedly kicking their motorcycle to the ground.

headlines: Jadhav's friends wear 'India with Kulbhushan' t-shirts on verdict day
text: Ahead of International Court of Justice's verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav case on Wednesday, Jadhav's friends wore t-shirts with his photo and 'India with Kulbhushan' slogan and offered prayers. The 49-year-old was arrested by Pakistan in March 2016 and was given death penalty on the charges of espionage. Pakistan's ruling was challenged by India in the ICJ.

headlines: Ex-MLA claims threat to life during train journey, hides in toilet
text: Former Madhya Pradesh MLA from Samajwadi Party Sunilam has claimed that he was forced to hide inside a train toilet after an unidentified youth allegedly threatened to kill him. The incident happened when Sunilam was travelling from Nizamuddin to Multai in Gondwana Express on the intervening night of Monday-Tuesday. He also tweeted about it to Railway Minister Piyush Goyal.

headlines: Lok Sabha sits till midnight for second time in less than a week
text: The Lok Sabha sat till midnight on Tuesday to conclude discussion on demands for grants for the agriculture and rural development ministries. This was for the second time in less than a week that the Lower House continued its discussions till midnight, with first being on July 11. The ongoing Budget Session of the Parliament will conclude on July 26.

headlines: Sibal, his wife fired journos without pay, sent bouncers: Barkha Dutt
text: Journalist Barkha Dutt has accused Congress leader Kapil Sibal and his wife Promila Sibal of not giving salaries to 200 journalists working at Tiranga TV and asking them to leave without the promised compensation. She also accused them of sending bouncers to intimidate employees protesting inside the office. However, the Sibals denied the allegations, saying the due salaries were cleared.

headlines: Tourists escape as elephant rams into jeep in S Africa; video viral
text: A video taken during a jungle safari in South Africa shows an elephant running and ramming into a tourists' jeep multiple times. The jeep's driver can be seen driving the jeep in reverse to help the tourists escape even as the elephant continued to charge towards them. Many tourists in the jeep were reportedly from Australia.

headlines: RSS economic wing says India should not issue foreign currency bonds
text: RSS' economic wing Swadeshi Jagran Manch's co-convener Ashwani Mahajan has demanded that government review its plan to raise money by selling foreign currency bonds. He said the experience of countries that have taken loans from international markets to meet the budget deficit "has been far from good". "We are confident that government will withdraw its decision," Mahajan added.

headlines: Kailash Gahlot appointed Delhi's environment minister
text: Following a Cabinet reshuffle in CM Arvind Kejriwal's government, Delhi Law Minister Kailash Gahlot on Tuesday was given an additional charge of the Environment, Forest and Wildlife Department, an official said. Imran Hussain, who previously held the department, will now have Food and Supply and Election portfolios. Gahlot also has Revenue, Transport, IT and Administrative Reforms portfolios.

headlines: Have to guard our MLAs as BJP wants to disturb Cong: Kharge
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that the party has to guard its MLAs as the BJP wants to create disturbance in the party. He also accused the Centre of "inducing" the rebel Congress MLAs. Kharge further said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition will win the vote of confidence in Karnataka Assembly on Thursday.

headlines: All animals have a life span: BJP MLA after cows die in UP shelter
text: After the death of several cows at a shelter in Barabanki district, UP BJP MLA Ajay Singh on Tuesday said, "There is so much outcry but most of the cattle have died a natural death." He added, "Every animal has a life span." He further said he'd told CM Yogi Adityanath that an ambulance service should be started for animals.

headlines: Over 2L pilgrims perform Amarnath Yatra, break last 4-yr record
text: Over two lakh pilgrims have performed the Amarnath Yatra in the past 16 days, which is the highest number to visit the cave shrine during the first fortnight in the last four years, an official said. On Wednesday, 1,972 pilgrims left for Baltal while 2,612 for Pahalgam base camps. According to the officials, 16 pilgrims have died during the Yatra.

headlines: Citizenship given to 1,310 migrants in Rajasthan: MoS Home
text: MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said that 1,310 migrants have been given citizenship in Rajasthan. Rai added that Rajasthan government gave citizenship to 82 migrants, while District Collectors of Jodhpur, Jaisalmer, and Jaipur gave citizenship to 1,113, 7 and 108 respectively. The Citizenship Amendment Act seeks to provide citizenship to non-Muslims who came to India before December 31, 2014.

headlines: I am just playing a character: Priya on Sridevi Bungalow controversy
text: Speaking about the controversy around her film 'Sridevi Bungalow', Priya Prakash Varrier said, "It is actually the director's and the producer's concern because I am just portraying a character they gave me." "There was no intention to hurt anybody," she added. Earlier, Boney Kapoor sued the film's makers after its teaser showed the death of an actress in a bathtub.

headlines: GoT season 8 creates record with 32 nominations at Emmy Awards
text: 'Game of Thrones' season 8 has secured 32 nominations at 71st Emmy Awards, creating a record for the most number of Emmy nominations received in a single year. It secured nominations for Outstanding Drama Series, as well as for editing, cinematography and directing along with acting categories. Drama series 'NYPD Blue' earlier held the record with 27 nominations in 1994.

headlines: 2019 World Cup trophy could have been shared: Whatmore
text: Former Sri Lanka coach Dav Whatmore has said that the 2019 World Cup trophy could have been shared with New Zealand as it would have been a fair reflection of the two teams' "tenacity". It is a learning curve. These sort of things could have been handled better, may be have a re-match," he added.

headlines: Saqlain Mushtaq gets extension as England spin consultant
text: Ex-Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq, who was part of Englands World Cup-winning squads support staff, has been rewarded with a 55-day extension which'll cover the entire Ashes series. The England team spin consultant said the team worked very hard in the few years for World Cup success. He further said that he is always available to work for the Pakistan team.

headlines: Amazon launches 'JEE Ready' app, enters edtech space in India
text: American e-commerce giant Amazon has entered the edtech sector in India with the launch of an IIT-JEE exam preparation app called 'JEE Ready'. The JEE Ready app is currently in its beta testing phase and available only on Android devices. Amazon has reportedly partnered with coaching institutes to prepare 'All India Mock Test' to be offered in the app.

headlines: 1 Vistara, 1 Air India, 2 SpiceJet pilots suspended over safety norms
text: Directorate General of Civil Aviation has suspended a Vistara pilot, a pilot and a crew member of Air India and two SpiceJet pilots for violation of safety norms. SpiceJet pilots were suspended for damaging runway lights during landing. Air India pilot and cabin crew member were suspended for fighting after the pilot asked the crew member to wash his tiffin.

headlines: Vistara flight makes emergency landing with just 10 mins of fuel left
text: A Mumbai-Delhi Vistara flight, with 153 passengers onboard, made an emergency landing in Lucknow after it had just 10 minutes of fuel left on Monday. The plane was supposed to land in Delhi around 5 pm but couldn't due to poor weather conditions. It landed in Lucknow around 6.30 pm after the pilot declared 'Mayday' over critical fuel levels.

headlines: UP man gives Triple Talaq in 24 hrs of marriage for not getting bike
text: A man from Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki allegedly gave Triple Talaq to his wife within 24 hours of marriage after the woman's family failed to give him a motorcycle in dowry. The woman's father said that they gave all other things that were demanded in the dowry list by the groom. Police registered a case against the groom and his family.

headlines: Ex-South Africa footballer Marc Batchelor shot dead at 49
text: Former South Africa footballer Marc Batchelor was shot dead near his home in Johannesburg. "He was attacked by two men who were driving a motorbike," a police spokesman Col Lungelo Dlamini said. The 49-year-old, who played for South African teams Kaizer Chiefs, Orlando Pirates and Mamelodi Sundowns, was shot in his car.

headlines: Yeddyurappa plays cricket with BJP MLAs in Bengaluru
text: BJP state president BS Yeddyurappa was seen playing a game of cricket with BJP MLAs at the Ramada resort in Bengaluru on Tuesday. Amid the political crisis in Karnataka, BJP MLAs have been staying at the Ramada resort while Congress and JD(S) have shifted their MLAs to the Taj Yeshwantpur and Prestige Golfshire Club.

headlines: TMC objects to repeated queries on WB violence in Parliament
text: The TMC on Tuesday objected to the repeated queries raised in both Houses of Parliament on the political violence in West Bengal, claiming that this is in violation of the rules. "Why is the Bengal government being targeted in such a manner?" the party wrote in separate letters to Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu and Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla.

headlines: UP madrasa vandalised over cattle slaughter rumours: Police
text: A mob vandalised a madrasa and pulled down its boundary wall following rumours of cow slaughter in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur district on Tuesday, police said. Some things dumped outside the madrasa's gate were also reportedly set ablaze. A case against two persons who are absconding and an FIR against unknown persons for vandalising the madrasa have been registered by police.

headlines: SP, VHP leaders shot dead in two separate incidents in UP
text: A VHP leader and SP leader were shot dead in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh. VHP's Pranav Mishra was killed by unidentified bike-borne assailants and SP leader Akhilesh Yadav (not to be confused with SP President) was killed when he was working out at a gym. "Criminals have no fear of police in the state," SP President Akhilesh Yadav said.

headlines: Will enact law against mob lynching, honour killing: Rajasthan CM
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said that his government has decided to enact a law to curb incidents of mob lynching and honour killing. Gehlot made the announcement while replying to debate on the state budget in the Vidhan Sabha. Recently, the Uttar Pradesh Law Commission framed draft legislation to deal with mob lynching cases in the state.

headlines: Red alert in Kerala after 'extremely heavy rain' forecast
text: The IMD has raised red and orange alerts in various parts of Kerala for four days from July 17. The red warning is issued in Idukki and Malappuram districts for July 18, 19 and 20 and Wayanad and Kannur for July 19. Extremely heavy rains (more than 204 mm in 24 hours) are forecasted in these districts.

headlines: Easiest thing in the world is to rant about rules: Bhogle on WC final
text: Reacting to criticism over boundary rule that decided World Cup winner, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "The easiest thing...is to rant about the rules." "There are pluses and minuses with every system but teams and players are shown [the rules] and they agree to play within them," he added. He further stated the boundary rule has been there for a long time.

headlines: Who were the highest wicket-takers in 2019 World Cup?
text: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc, who was the joint-highest wicket-taker in 2015 World Cup, finished 2019 World Cup as the highest wicket-taker with 27 wickets in 10 matches. Runners-up New Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson followed Starc with 21 wickets. England pacer Jofra Archer, who made his international debut in May, finished joint-third with Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman (20 wickets).

headlines: Jofra Archer's old tweets resurface, users connect it with WC final
text: England fast bowler Jofra Archer's old tweets went viral, with fans connecting them to the 2019 World Cup final. Users related his 2013 tweet reading, "16 from 6" with the target set for New Zealand by England in the Super Over. Users also shared his 2015 tweet reading "What stupid rule is this," after the final ended on boundary count.

headlines: British PM hosts World Cup-winning England team, shares pictures
text: British PM Theresa May hosted England's World Cup-winning team at 10 Downing Street. Sharing pictures on Twitter, May wrote, "Here we've a team that'll be spoken of in awe for generations to come. On behalf of the whole country, congratulations to England's World Cup winners!" "You've helped the nation fall in love with cricket once again," she told the players.

headlines: Sharing World Cup should be considered in case of a tie: NZ coach
text: New Zealand coach Gary Stead has said sharing World Cup trophy in case of a tie in final should be considered. This comes after England won 2019 World Cup for scoring more boundaries after both the final and Super Over were tied. He added that ICC must've never expected such a World Cup final when they were writing the rules.

headlines: Fatness doesn't necessarily lead to happiness: Adnan to Neesham
text: Reacting to New Zealand all-rounder James Neesham asking kids to not take up sport and die at 60 really fat and happy after 2019 World Cup defeat, singer Adnan Sami said that fatness doesn't necessarily lead to happiness. "Hey chin-up mate! You guys were brilliant. You all taught the world the most important lesson of how to fight," he added.

headlines: Rohit Sharma 3rd Indian to score most runs in a World Cup edition
text: India opener Rohit Sharma ended 2019 World Cup as the highest run-scorer with 648 runs in nine innings. The 32-year-old became the third Indian to end a World Cup edition as the top run-getter after Sachin Tendulkar (1996, 2003) and Rahul Dravid (1999). Rohit was followed by Australia opener David Warner, who scored 647 runs in the 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Grass tasted like never before: Djokovic shares post on Wimbledon win
text: After defeating world number three Roger Federer to win the Wimbledon for the fifth time, world number one Novak Djokovic shared a post on Instagram, writing, "It was a match to remember forever. Match that had everything in it. Match that transcends our sport." Djokovic, who ate grass following his win, added, "Grass tasted like never before."

headlines: Breathtaking: Biologist on finding rare human-sized jellyfish
text: Wildlife host and biologist Lizzie Daly, sharing her encounter with a rare human-sized barrel jellyfish, described it as a "breathtaking" and "serene, grounding experience". "I know barrel jellyfish get really big in size but I have never seen anything like it before," Daly said. The giant 1.5-metre-long barrel jellyfish was spotted off the south-western coast of England last week.

headlines: Record 5,000 rocket launch attempt marks 50 yrs of Apollo 11 launch
text: US Space & Rocket Center has attempted a Guinness World Record of launching 5,000 model rockets simultaneously to mark the 50th anniversary of Apollo 11 mission's launch. Apollo 11, which landed Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on the Moon, was launched at 7:02 pm IST on July 16, 1969. The previous such record included the launch of 4,231 rockets.

headlines: 959 students write same answers, make same errors in Guj 12th exam
text: Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB) detected a mass copying incident where 959 students wrote the same answers and made the same mistakes in Class 12 exams. The students admitted the teachers at exam centres dictated answers to them. Their results have been withheld till 2020 and they've been failed in the subjects in which they allegedly cheated.

headlines: Madras Christian College prof sacked for sexually harassing students
text: Madras Christian College in Chennai has sacked Zoology professor R Raveen after an internal inquiry found him guilty of sexually harassing female students. Several students had complained that Raveen made lewd remarks about their clothes, harassed them and behaved inappropriately during a department trip earlier this year. Another faculty Samuel Tennyson was accused of abetting Raveen's behaviour.

headlines: Odisha girl breaks silence weeks after gangrape by classmates, 4 held
text: A girl studying at a degree college in Odisha's Sundargarh was allegedly gangraped by five classmates last month, but she didn't report it. After the alleged incident, she stopped going to college which caused her family to think something was wrong. After being persuaded by her family, she lodged a police complaint on Monday, following which four accused were arrested.

headlines: Democracy restored in Thailand as PM declares end of military rule
text: Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has declared the end of military rule in the country after he resigned as the head of the military junta. Prayut had led the coup in 2014 and served as junta leader and Prime Minister. He will continue to serve as the Prime Minister with the support of the Parliament.

headlines: US Air Force warns as 13L volunteer to storm Area 51 'to see aliens'
text: The US Air Force has warned that it's "ready to protect America and its assets" after 13 lakh people signed up for a Facebook event to "storm" Area 51 to "see aliens". "[Area 51] is an open training range...we'd discourage anyone from trying to come into the area where we train armed forces," a US Air Force spokesperson said.

headlines: Embarrassed: Mahindra as woman points out plastic bottles in meeting
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday responded to a woman who pointed out the plastic bottles at a boardroom meeting in a picture shared by him. "I think the boardroom should have Steel Bottle instead of Plastic bottle," the woman tweeted. "Plastic bottles will be banished. We were all embarrassed to see them that day," Mahindra responded.

headlines: Saravana Bhavan owner allowed to shift to private hospital
text: Madras High Court has allowed Saravana Bhavan owner P Rajagopal, who is serving a life term for murder, to seek treatment at a private hospital. He was admitted to the prisoners ward of Government Stanley Medical College Hospital after surrendering on July 9. His son Saravanan said that his father's condition worsened as the doctors changed the medication and treatment.

headlines: NZ should be forever proud of their 2019 WC performance: Vettori
text: Praising New Zealand's performance in the 2019 World Cup final, former Kiwi captain Daniel Vettori said, "They should be forever proud of how they performed." The 40-year-old added there were far more positives than negatives to take away from the final which New Zealand lost on boundary count. "It's the time to celebrate what went right," Vettori further stated.

headlines: 30% driving licences in India are fake: Nitin Gadkari
text: While presenting the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Bill in the Lok Sabha on Monday, Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari said 30% of drivers in India carry fake licenses. He added that India is the easiest country to obtain a driving license around the world. As a part of the amendments to the bill, traffic violation penalties would increase significantly.

headlines: Toddler's half-burnt body found 2 days after he went missing
text: The half-burnt body of a three-year-old boy was found near his home in Bhopal's Bairagarh Chichli village on Tuesday. DIG Irshad Wali said father of the child identified the body which was found covered in a piece of cloth in an abandoned house. The toddler was allegedly kidnapped on Sunday evening after he had gone out to buy chocolates.

headlines: Nayara Energy to invest $850 mn to build petrochemical plant
text: Nayara Energy, backed by Russian oil major Rosneft, on Tuesday announced an investment of $850 million for its expansion into petrochemicals. The company said it is planning to set up a 4,50,000-tonne-a-year Polypropylene plant. Nayara added it has licensed technology from American chemicals firm WR Grace to produce a range of phthalate-free products at its refinery complex in Gujarat's Vadinar.

headlines: Shahid smoking in 'Kabir Singh' doesn't make him a smoker: Rakul Preet
text: Reacting to criticism over her smoking scene in the teaser of Telugu film 'Manmadhudu 2', actress Rakul Preet said, "[In] 'Kabir Singh', if Shahid [Kapoor] is smoking in the film it does not make him a smoker." "People should dissociate from what we are playing on-screen. [It] is different and it is a story of that one person," she added.

headlines: #SareeTwitter trends online as women share their pictures in sarees
text: #SareeTwitter has been trending on Twitter as women shared pictures of themselves in sarees with the hashtag. Several famous personalities, including actress and politician Nagma, BJP leader Nupur Sharma and actress Suzanne Bernert shared their pictures. Meanwhile, Assamese politician Gaurav Gogoi shared his wife's pictures and wrote, "Can husbands get on the #SareeTwitter train?"

headlines: What is the eligibility criteria for Team India head coach?
text: According to the eligibility criteria for Team India head coach, a candidate should've coached a full-member Test-playing nation for at least two years or a domestic side for at least three years. Further, the candidate should be below 60 years of age. He should've played at least 30 Tests or 50 ODIs, or should have BCCI Level 3 Certification.

headlines: Former Samajwadi Party Rajya Sabha member Neeraj Shekhar joins BJP
text: Former Samajwadi Party leader Neeraj Shekhar, who resigned from the Rajya Sabha on Monday, joined the BJP in the presence of working president JP Nadda at party headquarters in Delhi on Tuesday. The 50-year-old Uttar Pradesh politician, who is the son of former Prime Minister Chandra Shekhar, resigned from Rajya Sabha a year before his term was to end.

headlines: UK gives Tata Motors' Jaguar $620 million loan guarantee
text: The UK government has given Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) a $620-million loan guarantee to support the design, manufacture and export of electric cars. Prime Minister Theresa May made the announcement after a round-table meeting with auto-industry representatives. Earlier this month, the Tata Motors subsidiary announced a new range of electrified cars to be made at a plant in central England.

headlines: Sorry f**k*rs: Boyfriend shares pics after killing Instagrammer
text: Bianca Devins, a 17-year-old Instagrammer, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend who shared pictures of the killing on social media. "Sorry f**k*rs, you're gonna have to find someone else to orbit," Brandon Clark wrote alongside a picture shared on gaming website Discord. Clark called 911 to confess about the murder and authorities found him stabbing himself as they approached him.

headlines: We'll never be a socialist or communist country: US Prez Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said in a series of tweets on Tuesday that the US will never become a socialist or a communist nation. "If you are not happy here, you can leave! It is your choice, and your choice alone," he tweeted. He further said that those who hate the US are "anti-Israel" and "pro-al-Qaeda".

headlines: I put them into trouble: Ex-South Africa Prez on Gupta brothers
text: Former South African President Jacob Zuma has said that he'd suggested businessmen brothers, Ajay and Atul Gupta, to start a newspaper and television channel, both of which have collapsed. "It's me who put them into trouble...I said your paper is so successful and so your TV thing can be successful," he told a commission probing allegations of corruption against him.

headlines: Won't sell my stake in IndiGo: Billionaire Gangwal amid dispute
text: IndiGo's billionaire Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal said he won't sell his shareholding in India's largest airline amid a dispute with his partner Rahul Bhatia. "I am focusing on governance issues that have gone awry in this company and I am not seeking any additional control," Gangwal said. Gangwal and his affiliates own 37% of IndiGo while Bhatia's InterGlobe Enterprises controls 38%.

headlines: India's exports fall for the first time in nine months
text: India's merchandise exports contracted for the first time in nine months in June while imports shrank first time in four months. Exports fell 9.71% from a year ago to $25 billion, compared with a 3.9% gain in May while imports declined 9.1% to $40.3 billion. Oil imports in June dropped 13.3% to $11 billion, partly due to low oil prices.

headlines: England pacer Dernbach retires on day of England's World Cup win
text: England's 33-year-old pacer Jade Dernbach, who last played an international match in 2014, announced his retirement from international cricket on the day England won 2019 World Cup. The Surrey cricketer said, "I think this is a good time...The team are in a good place moving forward." Dernbach, who made his international debut in 2011, represented England 58 times.

headlines: AI algorithm can solve Rubik's cube in about 1 second
text: California University researchers have created an AI algorithm that can solve a Rubik's cube in a "fraction of a second", the human record for which stands at 3.47 seconds. DeepCubeA algorithm solved 100% of all test configurations, finding shortest path about 60% of the time. DeepCubeA, however, is three times slower than MIT's non-AI 'min2phase' algorithm, the current fastest.

headlines: Delhi govt built 23 flyovers in last 4.5 years: CM Kejriwal
text: After inaugurating the Rao Tula Ram (RTR) flyover, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday claimed that his government has built 23 flyovers in the last 4.5 years. Kejriwal added, "We believe in doing our work and not indulging in dirty politics." He said that a few more such projects will be coming up before the end of his government's tenure.

headlines: Nearly 400 terrorists infiltrated into J&K in last 3 yrs: Govt
text: G Kishan Reddy, MoS for Home Affairs, on Tuesday informed the Lok Sabha that nearly 400 terrorists infiltrated into J&K in last three years and 126 of them have been killed by the security forces. Reddy added that 27 security personnel lost their lives during the engagements with the infiltrators. Four terrorists have been arrested so far, he further said.

headlines: Very well prepared for Kargil-like war again: IAF Chief
text: Indian Air Force Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa on Tuesday said, "If Kargil comes again, we are very well prepared." Dhanoa was addressing an event marking the 20th anniversary of IAF's Operation Safed Sagar during the Kargil war. Dhanoa further said that the Balakot strikes showed that the IAF is capable of carrying out precision strikes accurately and from standoff distances.

headlines: Man held for selling cannabis near schools in Kolkata
text: The police have arrested a man for selling cannabis near schools and colleges in Kolkata's Park Street area and also seized 1.5 kg of cannabis from his possession. The police said that they recovered packets of cannabis from the man's motorcycle. The police have registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

headlines: Need NITI Aayog to turn Uttar Pradesh into Uttam Pradesh: CM
text: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday asked NITI Aayog to prepare a plan to help turn Uttar Pradesh into 'Uttam Pradesh' similar to the Centre's 'Transformation of Aspirational Districts' programme. The plan was launched to improve the socio-economic status of 117 districts across 28 states. The states are judged on 49 parameters like human development index, water resources and infrastructure.

headlines: Mindtree, L&T's IT firms to be run at an arm's length: L&T
text: L&T CEO SN Subrahmanyan said Mindtree, which L&T acquired, and its own IT and engineering services firms will be run at an arm's length basis. L&T acquired a 60.06% stake in Mindtree in a hostile takeover. "There are other major conglomerates...like Tata, Mahindra, Hinduja and HCL which have also been running multiple IT companies successfully," he said.

headlines: Coca-Cola India & SW Asia names Sarvita Sethi as VP for M&A
text: Coca-Cola India & South West Asia on Tuesday announced it has appointed Sarvita Sethi as its Vice President of Mergers and Acquisitions, and New Ventures. Sethi earlier held the role of Vice President of Finance for Coca-Cola India & South West Asia. Meanwhile, Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages CFO Harsh Bhutani will take over Sethi's role from August 1.

headlines: 3 bodies found with blood splattered on Shivling in Andhra temple
text: In an incident of suspected human sacrifice and black magic, three people were found dead with slit throats in the premises of an under-construction temple in a village in Andhra Pradesh's Anantapuramu. Moreover, blood was found splattered over the Shivling inside the temple. The deceased have been identified as the temple caretaker, his sister and a woman from the village.

headlines: Swatantra Dev Singh appointed as Uttar Pradesh BJP President
text: The BJP on Tuesday appointed Uttar Pradesh Transport Minister Swatantra Dev Singh as the party's new state chief. Singh replaced Mahendra Nath Pandey who was inducted as a Union Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship in May. The decision comes a day after Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath met party chief Amit Shah and working president JP Nadda in Delhi.

headlines: Chandrakant Patil replaces Raosaheb Danve as Maharashtra BJP chief
text: Chandrakant Patil was appointed as the new chief of BJP Maharashtra on Tuesday. Patil, a cabinet minister in the state government, replaced Raosaheb Patil Danve who resigned from the post earlier in the day. The development comes months ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls. Danve was made a Minister of State for Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution in May.

headlines: Byju's valuation hikes $2 bn to $5.5 bn in latest funding round
text: The valuation of India's most valuable edtech startup, Bengaluru-based Byju's, hiked by about $2 billion since its last funding to $5.5 billion in its ongoing Series F round. The startup has raised over $460 million in the round so far, as per data intelligence platform paper.vc. Byju's had confirmed raising $540 million from Naspers, among others, in December 2018.

headlines: Conjoined twin girls separated after 55 hours of operations
text: Two-year-old sisters Safa and Marwa Ullah, from Charsadda in Pakistan, have been separated at the Great Ormond Street Hospital in London after 55 hours of operations.
