The rare conjoined twins underwent four operations. "Safa and Marwa have a long road ahead - but we are hopeful they will be able to live active, happy lives!" the hospital tweeted.

headlines: Chandrayaan-1 also faced glitch before launch: Ex-ISRO chief
text: Hours after ISRO's decision to delay India's second Moon mission Chandrayaan-2's launch over a "technical snag", former ISRO chief K Madhavan Nair revealed Chandrayaan-1 had also faced a glitch before launch. "There was a leakage in propellent...detected two hours before the launch of Chandrayaan-1," he said. However, the leakage was fixed and ISRO had proceeded with Chandrayaan-1's launch.

headlines: Court asks Hindu girl to distribute Qurans over FB posts, she refuses
text: A local court in Jharkhand granted college student Richa Bharti bail for purportedly sharing offensive Facebook posts against Muslims and put a condition to distribute five copies of the Quran to government-owned educational organisations. The court also asked Bharti to present a copy to the complainant. She has refused to abide by the condition set by the court for bail.

headlines: BMC asked to demolish Mumbai building 2 yrs ago that collapsed today
text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) in a letter dated August 7, 2017, had asked the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) to immediately evacuate and demolish the 'Kesarbai' building that collapsed today. "In the event of any mishap this office won't be responsible," the BMC had said. The 100-year-old building in Dongri collapsed today, killing at least 12 people.

headlines: JNU guard cracks university's entrance exam, to study Russian
text: A security guard at the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has cracked the university's entrance examination for admission into BA (Hons) in Russian. "Everyone - teachers and students - encouraged me; now they congratulate me. I feel like I have become famous overnight," Ramjal Meena said. "I follow newspapers through apps...students also helped me get PDF notes," he added.

headlines: Married man reported kidnapped found waiting for girlfriend in park
text: A 30-year-old married man from Noida who was reported kidnapped by his family, was found waiting for his girlfriend in a park on Monday, police said. He went 'missing' on Saturday, and his family approached the police on Sunday. He said he had fled to Rajasthan with his girlfriend, but they returned after his girlfriend's worried family started calling her.

headlines: Air-to-air missile seized from 3 men in Italy
text: Italian police have seized an arsenal of weapons, including an air-to-air missile and a rocket launcher in raids on three neo-Nazi sympathisers. Assault rifles, pistols, bayonets and almost a thousand cartridges were also found. The raids were part of an investigation into Italian far-right extremists who had fought alongside the Russian-backed separatist forces in eastern Ukraine.

headlines: Winning World Cup will give England confidence in Ashes: Root
text: England Test captain Joe Root has said that winning the 2019 World Cup will give the team confidence going into a "series like Ashes". "It's what we set out to do two-three years ago and we're halfway there, the 28-year-old said ahead of Ashes which begins in England from August 1. He added that the atmosphere of Ashes is unmatchable.

headlines: Facebook hires ex-Vine GM for new experimental apps division
text: Facebook has hired former Vine GM Jason Toff as the Project Management Director for its recently announced experimental apps division, New Product Experimentation (NPE) Team. Toff left Vine in 2016 and was most recently working for Google as a Partner for its Area 120 incubator, where employees work on experimental projects. Toff will be joining Facebook in next two weeks.

headlines: Can't tell Speaker how to decide on resignation of MLAs: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that it cannot say how the Speaker should decide on the resignations or disqualification of the rebel Karnataka MLAs. "We cannot fetter him. The question here is if there is any constitutional obligation for him to decide resignation before disqualification or to club his decision on both," CJI Ranjan Gogoi said.

headlines: 199 relief camps have been set up so far: Bihar CM on floods
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said the flash floods have affected over 25 lakh people in the state. So far, 199 relief camps have been set up where 1.16 lakh people are taking shelter, Kumar added. "Availability of clean drinking water and medicines to check the outbreak of water-borne diseases...is also being ensured," the CM further said.

headlines: 2 children die as roof of their house collapses due to rains in UP
text: Two children of a family died while five other members were injured after the roof of their house collapsed following heavy rainfall in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Tuesday, police said. The police added that the house was not properly maintained and was a "kutcha house". According to the police, there were nine people inside the house when the incident occurred.

headlines: Man kills pregnant daughter for marrying against his wishes
text: The Mumbai Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his pregnant daughter who had married against his wishes. According to the police, the accused called his daughter to meet him in Ghatkopar on the pretext of giving her some money and murdered her with a sharp weapon. The accused confessed to the crime after being interrogated, the police said.

headlines: Take relief ops in flood-affected states: Rahul to Cong workers
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday appealed to the Congress workers to carry out relief operations in the flood-affected states like Assam, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Tripura and Mizoram. Flood situation due to heavy rains across the country has affected the lives of people, particularly in the eastern and north-eastern states. At least 15 people have died due to Assam floods.

headlines: Collapse of building in Mumbai is anguishing: PM Modi
text: After a building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri area on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the incident is 'anguishing' and hoped for quick recovery of the injured. "My condolences to the families of those who lost their lives...Maharashtra Government, NDRF and local authorities are...assisting those in need," he added. At least 12 people are reported dead in the collapse.

headlines: SPs Neeraj Shekhar quits Rajya Sabha, may join BJP
text: Samajwadi Party leader Neeraj Shekhar on Monday resigned as a member of the Rajya Sabha and his resignation was accepted by its Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. Later, Neeraj reportedly met BJP President Amit Shah and Rajya Sabha MPs Bhupendra Yadav and Anil Baluni, among others. According to reports, he may join the BJP.

headlines: Man chained and thrashed by 5 men in Punjab, one arrested
text: A man was chained and thrashed by five men in the Gholia Khurd village of Moga, Punjab. "Five people had chained and thrashed the man. They suspected that he had complained about them indulging in electricity theft," the police said on Monday. An FIR has been registered and one person has been arrested.

headlines: Bihar opposition leaders protest over floods, allege govt inaction
text: Opposition leaders in Bihar, including RJD leader Rabri Devi, on Tuesday protested outside the state Assembly alleging inaction by the Bihar government in dealing with the flood situation. The protestors raised slogans and urged CM Nitish Kumar-led government to set up relief camps in the flood-affected areas. As many as 25 people are reported dead in the floods till now.

headlines: Farmer held for killing scientist whose body was found in Nazi bunker
text: A local farmer has been arrested on suspicion of murdering American scientist Suzanne Eaton on the Greek island of Crete. The 27-year-old has reportedly confessed to the murder, with the police saying sexual abuse was a likely motive. The body of Eaton, a molecular biologist, was found by the Greek authorities inside a bunker used by the Nazis during WWII.

headlines: Reebok signs Varun Dhawan as its brand face
text: Leading fitness brand Reebok announces Bollywood actor and fitness enthusiast, Varun Dhawan, as their Indian brand ambassador. The brand recently also signed in Katrina Kaif as the new face. With Varun, Reebok launches its biggest campaign Sole Fury, that aims to disrupt conventionality and celebrates those who dare to #SplitFrom the ordinary.

headlines: 12 dead in Mumbai building collapse; CM says building 100-yr-old
text: At least 12 people have been killed after a four-storey building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri, Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority Chairman Uday Samant said. Five people have reportedly been rescued so far. "The building is around 100 years old. Entire focus is on rescuing the people trapped. Investigation will be done," Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said after the incident.

headlines: RTR flyover to reduce traffic jams on way to airport opens in Delhi
text: After almost a three-year delay, the Rao Tula Ram (RTR) flyover opened on Tuesday to reduce traffic jams on the way to the IGI airport from South and East Delhi and Noida. The flyover on Outer Ring Road will also smoothen the journey to Gurugram. The flyover branches out of Munirka flyover and ends before Army Research and Referral Hospital.

headlines: First pictures of Pooja Batra's wedding to Nawab Shah out
text: The first pictures of actress Pooja Batra's wedding to actor Nawab Shah have surfaced online. The couple got married on July 4 in a private ceremony in Delhi, which was attended only by family members. Speaking about Pooja, Nawab said in a recent interview, "Pooja entered my life like sunshine...I wanted to marry her right after our first meeting."

headlines: BCCI invites applications for Team India head coach, July 30 deadline
text: The BCCI on Tuesday issued an official advertisement, inviting applications for support staff of Team India. The BCCI asked interested candidates for the positions of head coach, batting coach and bowling coach, among others, to send their applications on or before July 30. The current coaching staff will get an automatic entry in the recruitment process, it added.

headlines: Facebook's cryptocurrency Libra could be used for terrorism: US
text: The US Treasury Department has said it has "very serious concerns" that Facebook's upcoming cryptocurrency Libra could be misused for terrorism and money laundering. Labelling the digital currency as a "national security issue", the department added, "Our overriding goal is to maintain the integrity of our financial system and protect it from abuse." Facebook announced the cryptocurrency in June.

headlines: FBI, CIA should investigate Google over links to China: Peter Thiel
text: Billionaire PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel has said the FBI and CIA should investigate Google over its "seemingly treasonous" actions over alleged ties to the Chinese military. Thiel, a Facebook board member, suggested that AI developed by Google's sister firm DeepMind should be thought of as a potential "military weapon". Google responded saying it does not work with the Chinese military.

headlines: MP BJP MLA gets into argument with SDM over power cuts
text: BJP MLA Mahesh Rai got into an argument with SDM KL Meena over the issue of power cuts at the latter's office in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar on Monday. Rai demanded immediate action over an alleged discrepancy in electricity bills, and stated, "You don't know how to talk to an MLA." Meena responded that shouting would not resolve the issue.

headlines: Delhi HC issues notice in plea to link property docs with Aadhaar
text: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Central and Delhi governments in a petition seeking directions to them to link citizens' movable and immovable property documents with their Aadhaar number in an effort to curb corruption. The court sought their reply to the plea and scheduled the next hearing on October 15.

headlines: Give me names of MPs absent from Parliament duty: PM Modi
text: At a weekly meeting of the BJP parliamentary party, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reportedly asked for the details of all the Union Ministers who skipped Parliament duty despite being asked to be present for the session. PM Modi also asked BJP MPs to "work beyond the sphere of politics" and perform "unique work" in their constituencies, BJP leaders have revealed.

headlines: Ashok Leyland shuts Pantnagar plant for 9 days due to weak demand
text: Commercial vehicle manufacturer Ashok Leyland said it is shutting down its Pantnagar facility in Uttarakhand for 9 days starting Tuesday because of "weak demand and outlook for the industry". The plant can manufacture 1.5 lakh units annually. The Hinduja Group company's total vehicle sales in June stood at 12,810 units, down 19% from last year.

headlines: Human chain searches for survivors in collapsed Mumbai building
text: People formed a human chain to remove the debris with their hands of the four-storey building that collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri, to search for survivors on Tuesday. The narrow lanes and a dense neighbourhood came as a challenge for rescue workers to find the trapped survivors. At least 12 people have died due to the building collapse.

headlines: Society watchman paraded naked for allegedly molesting 6-yr-old
text: A 22-year-old watchman of a residential complex in Maharashtra's Palghar district was beaten up and paraded naked on the streets after being accused of molesting a six-year-old girl, police said on Monday. The girl's mother complained that the watchman touched the girl inappropriately when she returned from tuitions. While the police has booked the watchman, he is currently hospitalised.

headlines: Video of UK PM Theresa May dancing at an event goes viral
text: A video of UK PM Theresa May dancing at the Henley Festival has gone viral on social media. May sang and danced to several songs by pop band Abba, including 'Mamma Mia', 'Take A Chance On Me' and 'Money Money Money'. "Living her best life it seems," a Twitter user wrote on her dancing.

headlines: London Mayor rejects billionaire's plan for 1000-ft 'Tulip' tower
text: London Mayor Sadiq Khan on Monday rejected a proposal by Brazilian billionaire Joseph Safra to build a 1,000-foot tulip-shaped skyscraper. Design of 'The Tulip' was deemed not to be good enough for such a prime location. "The tower would result in harm to Londons skyline and impact views of the nearby Tower of London world heritage site," Khan's office said.

headlines: Grofers raises $10 mn from Abu Dhabi's Capital Investments
text: Gurugram-based online grocery delivery startup Grofers has raised $10 million from Abu Dhabi's Capital Investment in its ongoing $200-million Series F round, as per regulatory filings accessed by paper.vc. The SoftBank-backed startup raised $130 million from its parent entity. Founded in 2013 by Albinder Dhindsa and Saurabh Kumar, Grofers has raised nearly $472 million to date, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: PM Modi, Rahul, other leaders greet nation on Guru Purnima
text: PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and other political leaders extended their greetings to the people of the country on the occasion of Guru Purnima. The PM said that it's a day to "bow" to the gurus who have played an important role in "shaping our society". Vice President Venkaiah Naidu also greeted the nation on the occasion.

headlines: No plan to replace New Pension Scheme with old scheme: Govt
text: State Finance Minister Anurag Thakur on Monday informed the Lok Sabha that there is no proposal to replace the New Pension Scheme (NPS) with the old pension scheme for central and state government employees recruited since 2004. Employees have been demanding the old pension scheme as it was based on a fixed pension amount and provided more security upon retirement.

headlines: 2 Rohingyas arrested in Tripura: Police
text: The police have arrested two Rohingyas from Tripura near the India-Bangladesh International Border on Tuesday. The police said that the preliminary investigation revealed that the two entered into the Indian territory in search of jobs. The police also recovered refugee cards from them and the duo confessed that they stayed at a Rohingya refugee camp in Bangladesh.

headlines: Delhi Police arrest suspected Jaish terrorist from Srinagar
text: A special cell of Delhi Police have arrested suspected Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorist Basir Ahmad from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, officials said on Tuesday. Ahmad was arrested in 2007, however, he got acquitted by a lower court. He was later sentenced by a High Court but had not been appearing for hearings leading to a non-bailable arrest warrant against him.

headlines: upGrad sees 500+ learners graduate in Machine Learning & AI course
text: upGrad and IIIT-Bangalore witnessed 500+ learners graduate across multiple cohorts with PG Diploma in Machine Learning & AI. The program, ranked No. 1 by AIM in 2018 saw 1500+ enrolments with a 50% bump in the last quarter. It features cutting-edge concepts like neural networks, deep learning and offers 1-1 mentorship with industry experts along with 360 degree career support.

headlines: 40 feared trapped as 4-storey building collapses in Mumbai
text: At least 40 people are feared trapped after a four-storey building collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri area on Tuesday. A team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has rushed to the building collapse site. Last month, a compound wall collapsed due to heavy rains in Mumbai's Malad. The incident had killed 27 people and had left several others injured.

headlines: Pak opens airspace for Indian flights 140 days after Balakot strike
text: Around 140 days after the Balakot strike, Pakistan for the first time opened its airspace "for all type of civilian traffic", including that from India, on Tuesday. The country had earlier claimed it would not open its airspace for commercial flights until India removed its fighter jets from forward Indian airbases. Several airlines incurred losses due to the shut airspace.

headlines: Great Learnings Data Science course includes placement support
text: Companies such as Uber, Swiggy, Oyo and 100+ other companies participate in hiring drives for Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and Engineering. The hiring drives are a part of the career assistance offered to program participants, in addition to 1-1 career mentorship and interview preparation sessions. Learners have seen an average salary hike of 65% upon transitioning.

headlines: 'Arjun Reddy' actor criticises reporter asking actress about breakup
text: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Vijay Deverakonda criticised a journalist who asked his co-star Rashmika Mandanna about her broken engagement with actor Rakshit Shetty. "I don't even understand the question...how is it anyone's business," he told the reporter during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Dear Comrade'. Rashmika, who got engaged to Rakshit in 2017, broke up with the actor last year.

headlines: I had to live on beaches, sleep on platforms: Kher on struggling days
text: Speaking about his struggling days in Mumbai, Anupam Kher revealed, "At one point I had no work, money or help. I had to live on beaches and sleep on platforms." He added that he soon got a role in Mahesh Bhatt's film but was replaced. However, he was signed when Bhatt "saw the vigour with which he wanted to act".

headlines: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30' made tax-free in Bihar
text: Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', which is based on mathematician Anand Kumar's life, has been made tax-free in Bihar. Tweeting about the same, Kumar wrote, "Thanks a lot to CM Nitish Kumar ji and Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi ji...It will help more and more people see the film." Hrithik replied to the same tweet and also expressed his gratitude.

headlines: Taapsee takes dig at 'Kabir Singh' citing girl's murder by boyfriend
text: Taapsee Pannu has been criticised for taking a veiled dig at 'Kabir Singh' while citing a Maharashtra murder case, wherein a man allegedly killed his 19-year-old girlfriend suspecting her 'character'. "Or maybe let's just say...this 'act' was to validate his TRUE love," Taapsee tweeted. Earlier, 'Kabir Singh' director said he doesn't see any emotion if lovers "can't slap each other".

headlines: Learn to listen, Owaisi sahab: Amit Shah during LS discussion
text: During a discussion on an amendment bill seeking to strengthen anti-terror agency NIA, Home Minister Amit Shah told AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi, "Learn to listen also Owaisi sahab, this will not work." Shah made the statement after Owaisi objected to a part of BJP MP Satya Pal Singh's speech during the discussion on the amendment bill.

headlines: Researchers find 4.2 mn-yr-old fossil of monkey that weighed 1kg
text: Researchers working in Kenya have found a 4.2 million-year-old fossil of a miniature monkey which only weighed one kilogram. The newly discovered species, 'Nanopithecus browni', is the same size as the world's smallest Old World monkey, the talapoin. The dry grassland Kenyan habitat that 'Nanopithecus browni' lived in is also where some of earliest human ancestors' fossils have been discovered.

headlines: Man survives in sea for 5 days by holding onto a bamboo pole
text: A West Bengal man, who jumped off a fishing vessel that capsized, survived for five days by holding onto a bamboo pole in the Bay of Bengal. Rabindranath Das was spotted by a Bangladeshi vessel near Chittagong. "I did not eat during the entire time. There was intermittent rain and big waves. I drank water when it rained," he said.

headlines: 51 kids electrocuted by high-tension wire in UP school, hospitalised
text: Around 51 students of a primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district were hospitalised due to electric shock attributed to a high-tension wire coming in contact with trees in the school. The students had taken off their footwear to sit on gunny bags on the ground and came in contact with electricity that apparently passed through trees and moist ground.

headlines: Mumbai Mayor's vehicle found in no-parking zone; fined
text: The Mumbai traffic police on Monday issued a challan after Mayor Vishwanath Mahadeshwar's official vehicle was found parked under BMC's no-parking signboard. His vehicle was spotted outside a popular coastal fish food joint between Andheri and Vile Parle, a senior police official said. Since last week, the BMC has started a drive against unauthorised parking in the city.

headlines: Give adequate security to BJP MLA's daughter, her husband: HC
text: The Allahabad High Court on Monday directed police to ensure BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra or his family members do not interfere in the married life of his daughter Sakshi and Ajitesh Kumar. The court asked the couple to apply for registration of their marriage, while issuing a notice to Mishra to file his reply by the next date of hearing.

headlines: PM calls Assam CM, assures support to tackle flood situation
text: PM Narendra Modi called Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and took stock of the flood situation in the state, assuring all support from the Centre in dealing with it. Around 15 people died and over 43 lakh people were affected due to the floods, officials said. According to the officials, over 90,000 hectares of agricultural land got affected in the state.

headlines: 2 sisters held hostage, raped for 2 months in Rajasthan: Police
text: The Rajasthan Police said that a man allegedly abducted and raped two sisters multiple times for over two months in Dholpur. The police added that the incident came to light after the minor sister managed to escape and lodged an FIR on Saturday. The elder sister is still held captive and efforts are on to locate her, the police said.

headlines: Hopeful that Centre will soon resolve mining issue: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant said that he was hopeful that the Centre will soon resolve the mining issue of the state. He added, "We're of the belief that even if fresh extraction doesn't start, at least some mining activities can resume." Sawant said that instructions to restart the e-auctions have already been given and it'll restart within next 15-20 days.

headlines: Differently-abled UPSC topper trolled on social media, shares post
text: Differently-abled UPSC 2014 topper Ira Singhal in a Facebook post said she was cyberbullied by a person who commented "kubdi" on her Instagram post to troll her. "Unfortunately someone who cannot be bullied is being attempted to be bullied," she said. "This is why we need our education system to focus on producing better human beings," she added.

headlines: I have the capacity to play in the shorter format of the game: Pujara
text: Batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has said he has the capacity to play in the shorter format of the game as he has been performing well in Tests. "I am improving my skills in ODIs and T20Is and in domestic matches...I want to play all the formats," he added. "It would've been nice play the World Cup," he further said.

headlines: Right time for Rohit to become ODI captain: BCCI functionary
text: Amid rumours of a rift between captain Virat Kohli and vice-captain Rohit Sharma, a BCCI functionary said the board is mulling split captaincy. "This would be the right time for Rohit to take over ODI captaincy. We all know some areas need a re-look," he added. He further said that the board will get to bottom of the rumours.

headlines: Don't know how much time will I take to get fit: Shaw before WI tour
text: Batsman Prithvi Shaw on Monday said that he wasn't sure when he would recover from his hip injury. "I'm working with the physios to get back to fitness but cant put a timeline on it right now," he added. Shaw is yet to feature in any international match for India since making his debut against the West Indies in October.

headlines: Some rules definitely need a serious look in: Rohit on WC final
text: Referring to 2019 World Cup final winner being decided on boundaries, the tournament's highest run-scorer Rohit Sharma tweeted, "Some rules in cricket definitely need a serious look in." England won the final on virtue of scoring more boundaries than New Zealand after the match and Super Over both ended in a tie. It was England's first ever World Cup victory.

headlines: ICC criticised for calling Stokes 'greatest' in pic with Sachin
text: The ICC has been criticised for calling Ben Stokes 'the greatest cricketer of all time' in picture with Sachin Tendulkar. "Agree, because Sachin isn't a cricketer but God of cricket," a user tweeted. "Really?? It should be other way around...Congratulations Stokes for winning the Cup," wrote Harbhajan Singh. Sachin presented Stokes with Man of the 2019 World Cup final award.

headlines: Ridiculous rule: Gambhir on WC final being decided on boundaries
text: Reacting to England defeating New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup final on the virtue of scoring more boundaries after tied match and tied Super Over, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "A ridiculous rule. It should've been a tie." "Don't understand how the game of such proportions, the #CWC19Final, is finally decided on who scored the most boundaries," he wrote.

headlines: I'm probably most hated father in NZ: Stokes' father after WC final
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes father Ged, who stays in New Zealand, joked that he's the most hated father in New Zealand after his son's performance in 2019 World Cup final. "I really am disappointed for the Black Caps...Hand on heart, I am overjoyed for Ben and the team, but I am still a New Zealand supporter," Ged added.

headlines: India squad for West Indies tour to be announced on July 19
text: India squad for next month's tour of West Indies will be announced on July 19. Captain Virat Kohli and pacer Jasprit Bumrah are expected to be rested for limited-overs leg comprising three T20Is and three ODIs, as per reports. Talking about MS Dhoni's future, a BCCI official said, "Only he can decide whether he wants to carry on or not."

headlines: Olympian accidentally runs over and kills son on his 1st birthday
text: Sprinter Isaac Ntiamoah, who represented Australia in 2012 Olympics, accidentally ran over and killed his son while reversing his car out of his driveway. The incident happened when Ntiamoah was leaving the house to collect supplies for his son's first birthday party. New South Wales Police are investigating circumstances of the incident, which is being treated as a tragic accident.

headlines: Amit Shah is Home Minister, not God: Owaisi after spat in Lok Sabha
text: Following a verbal spat with Home Minister Amit Shah in Lok Sabha during discussion on NIA (Amendment) Bill, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said Shah threatens by raising his finger but he is a Home Minister, not God. Owaisi alleged that whoever doesn't support their (BJP) decisions, they call them anti-nationals. NIA (Amendment) Bill was passed by Lok Sabha on Monday.

headlines: DIG-rank officer booked for sexually harassing woman on train
text: Railway Protection Force Deputy Inspector General Vijay Khatarkar, currently posted with West Central Railway in Jabalpur, has been booked for allegedly sexually harassing a railway official's wife on board a train. As per police, the complainant was sleeping on a lower berth when the DIG sexually harassed her. The complainant told police that she resisted DIG's advances and alerted co-passengers.

headlines: CRPF personnel jump in stream to save girl from drowning in J&K
text: Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel saved a 14-year-old girl from drowning in a river in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Monday. The girl had slipped into the stream and was being washed away by strong currents. Six CRPF personnel rushed to save the girl and two constables, MG Naidu and Nalla Upendra, jumped into the stream to catch her.

headlines: Kolkata Metro starts high-level probe into passenger's death
text: Two days after the death of a passenger in Kolkata Metro, senior railway safety officials visited the accident spot and started a high-level probe on Monday. Commissioner of Railway Safety (CRS-Metro division) Sailesh Garg examined the metro rake, a door of which had allegedly malfunctioned. The passenger had died after his hand got stuck between the gates of the train.

headlines: Man jailed for posts against Trivendra Singh Rawat in Uttarakhand
text: A man was sent to jail in Uttarakhand for allegedly posting offensive and objectionable posts against Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on his Facebook account. Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police Pankaj Bhatt said that the accused was arrested from Purola area on Sunday. He was produced before a court of the Chief Judicial Magistrate which sent him to jail.

headlines: 4 Australian children take car on 1,000-kilometre road trip; held
text: Four Australian children took a car on a 1,000-kilometre road trip before being nabbed by police, officials said. The children, including a 14-year-old boy, two 13-year-old boys and a 10-year-old girl, began their journey on Saturday when they took cash and packed fishing rods in the vehicle. The car belonged to the family of one of the kids.

headlines: It was a day when sport won: Sania on World Cup, Wimbledon finals
text: Reacting to 2019 World Cup and Wimbledon men's singles final which took place on Sunday, Sania Mirza tweeted, "What a day...It was a day when sport won." England defeated New Zealand on boundaries after the match and Super Over both ended in a tie. Meanwhile, Djokovic defeated Federer in four hours and 57 minutes to win his fifth Wimbledon title.

headlines: Not worried about outrage over same-sex relationship: Dutee
text: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand has revealed that the outrage over her relationship with a girl does not bother her anymore. Chand has returned after winning a gold medal in the 100m event in the World University Games at Napoli. "I got so many encouragements from eminent personalities which boost up my self-confidence to achieve this prestigious recognition," Chand added.

headlines: All who watched at home will try to be the next Stokes: Morgan
text: Praising Ben Stokes, England captain Eoin Morgan said, "[E]verybody watching at home will hopefully try and be the next Ben Stokes." Morgan further said, "It is almost superhuman. He has really carried the team and our batting line-up." Stokes ended the 2019 edition of the World Cup with a total of 465 runs and seven wickets.

headlines: No exemption for Phogat, Punia from WC trials: WFI
text: The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) has specified that there will be no exemption for Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia for the World Championship trials. WFI will conduct the men's trials on July 25 in Sonipat while the women will compete on July 26 in Lucknow. The World Championship will be held in Kazakhstan from September 14.

headlines: Assam floods death toll rises to 15; nearly 43 lakh affected
text: The death toll in the Assam floods, caused by heavy rainfall and landslides in the region, rose to 15 on Monday. The second wave of floods has increased the number of people affected to nearly 43 lakh in 30 of the state's 33 districts. The National Disaster Response Force has deployed 15 teams comprising 380 personnel to tackle the situation.

headlines: Woman dies after fight over water at public tap in Andhra
text: A 38-year-old woman was killed in a fight over filling water from a public tap in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district. The victim was standing in a queue at the tap when another woman tried to break it, leading to an argument which turned violent. The victim died on the spot after sustaining head injuries and police have detained the attacker.

headlines: Plea in Delhi HC seeks linking of Aadhaar with property documents
text: A petition seeking a direction to the Centre and Delhi government for linking of people's movable and immovable property documents with their Aadhaar numbers was filed in Delhi High Court on Monday by BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay. He said the move could help curb corruption, black money generation and 'benami' transactions. The petition is likely to be heard on Tuesday.

headlines: Asked reporter 'Did your mom look hot when you were born?': Sameera
text: Recalling an interaction with a reporter during her pregnancy, Sameera Reddy revealed he had asked her 'Will you return back looking hot like Kareena Kapoor did very soon or will you take time...like Aishwarya did?'. She added, "I went on to tell him, 'Where did you come from? Did your mom look hot when she gave birth to you?'"

headlines: Saki Saki a blockbuster song, felt bad on hearing the remix: Koena
text: Actress Koena Mitra who featured in the original 'Saki Saki' song from the film 'Musafir', while speaking about the song's remix version, said, "This is a blockbuster song...The...remix has just made me sad." "Why are [composers] messing with...cult songs? These songs have a separate solid fan-base," she added. Koena said composers should make new songs instead of "damaging old ones".

headlines: Bigg Boss Telugu organiser asked how I could live without sex: Actress
text: Actress Gayathri Gupta has filed a complaint against Bigg Boss Telugu organisers alleging that they cheated her and hurt her self-respect by asking inappropriate questions. She claimed that during her meeting with the show's coordinator from Mumbai, he asked her how she could live for 100 days without sex. Gayathri further alleged her contract for the show was abruptly terminated.

headlines: I'm still sexually attracted to women, hate the term wife: Miley
text: Speaking about her sexuality, singer Miley Cyrus said, "I'm in a hetero relationship, but I still am very sexually attracted to women." "People become vegetarian for health reasons, but bacon is still f**king good," she added. Talking about marrying actor Liam Hemsworth, Miley said, "I definitely don't fit into a stereotypical wife role. I don't even like that word."

headlines: Taken out of context: Scarlett on 'politically correct casting' remark
text: Hollywood actress Scarlett Johansson, while commenting on the controversy around her remark that as an actor, she "should be allowed to play any person, or any tree, or any animal" because that is her job, said the comment was "widely taken out of context". "The question I was answering...was about the confrontation between political correctness and art," she added.

headlines: Allah was also with us: Eoin Morgan on 'luck' in World Cup final
text: On being asked whether "the luck of an Irishman" got England over the line in World Cup final, Dublin-born England captain Eoin Morgan said, "We had Allah with us as well." "I spoke to Adil Rashid. He said...'Allah is definitely with us'. It's the rub of the green. It actually epitomises our team. Quite diverse backgrounds and cultures," he added.

headlines: Williamson's reaction on being named Player of World Cup goes viral
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's reaction on being named Player of the 2019 World Cup has gone viral. On being told by an official from the organising team that he had won the award, Williamson looked seemingly surprised and asked, "Me?" "A bit of a LOL for you after a tough result!" New Zealand Cricket tweeted while sharing the video.

headlines: Man held for threatening to kill self if not allowed to sell liquor
text: A man was arrested in Gujarat's Rajkot on Saturday for threatening to set himself and his family on fire if the government didn't permit him to sell alcohol or run a gambling den. He was granted bail after he assured he wouldn't take any extreme step. He said he cannot do physical labour after losing a leg in an accident.

headlines: Saravana owner suffers heart attack, extremely critical: Doctors
text: Saravana Bhavan restaurant chain Founder and murder case convict P Rajagopal suffered from a heart attack on Saturday and remains extremely critical, doctors have said. Rajagopal, who is currently on ventilator support, surrendered in Chennai on July 9 to serve a life term. He had arrived in an ambulance with an oxygen mask strapped to his face to surrender himself.

headlines: Air India pilot suspended for 3 months for failing alcohol test
text: An Air India pilot was suspended for three months after he tested positive in a pre-flight breath-analyser test on Saturday. The pilot wanted to fly as a passenger from Delhi to Bengaluru, but as the flight was full, he requested to fly in the cockpit as an additional crew member. However, he was deplaned after he failed the alcohol test.

headlines: 1 arrested for violence against doctors at Mumbai hospital
text: A man was arrested on Monday by Mumbai Police in relation to the attack on three doctors of Nair Hospital. Three people were named in the FIR, out of which two were women. Family members of the patient allegedly attacked the doctors on Sunday after he died during treatment. Police said efforts were underway to arrest the other accused.

headlines: Mathematician who cracked Nazi code for WWII win to be on £50 note
text: English mathematician Alan Turing, who helped Britain win the Second World War by cracking Nazi code, will appear on Bank of England's new £50 polymer note by the end of 2021. The note features a ticker tape of binary code that depicts his birthday (June 23, 1912). He committed suicide in 1954 after he was chemically castrated for being homosexual.

headlines: Leaving India big mistake, will return in 24 hrs: IMA scam accused
text: Bengaluru-based IMA Jewels ponzi scam accused Mansoor Khan, who is believed to be in Dubai, claimed in a video on Monday that he will return to India within 24 hours. "It was a big mistake to leave India...but certain circumstances forced me to do so," he said. "I don't even know my family's whereabouts in the country," he added.

headlines: British PM Theresa May to host World Cup-winning England team
text: British Prime Minister Theresa May will host the World Cup-winning England cricket team at her Downing Street office later on Monday. "Yesterday was a brilliant performance by a brilliant team. They showed flair, courage and an absolute determination to become world champions. The achievement... on home soil will live forever in our sporting history," May's spokesman said.

headlines: Act against forceful chanting of religious slogans: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Monday called the "new wrong practice" of forcefully making people chant religious slogans in states including Uttar Pradesh a "violent trend" and asked central and state governments to take strong action against it. This comes after 12 youths were booked for allegedly pulling an imam's beard and forcing him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Muzaffarnagar.

headlines: Mark Cuban, Serena Williams invest $3 mn in startup for new moms
text: Investor Mark Cuban and tennis star Serena Williams have invested $3 million in Mahmee, a US-based startup that delivers data-driven care coordination and personalised support to new mothers. It provides online group discussions with other moms, connection to medical service providers and support from trained maternity coaches. It was founded in 2014 by Melissa Hanna, Linda Hanna and Sunny Walia.

headlines: 7-yr-old drowns in Mumbai drain, 3rd such incident in a week
text: In the third such incident in the past seven days, a seven-year-old boy drowned after falling into an open drain in Mumbai's Dharavi on Monday. The boy was pulled out and rushed to a hospital where he was declared brought dead. Police have filed a case of negligence against the officers and staff involved in supervision work of the drainage.

headlines: Abortion will rise after media reports of MLA's daughter: BJP MLA
text: Madhya Pradesh BJP MLA Gopal Bhargava on Sunday said that the reports run by national channels on BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra's daughter Sakshi will lead to a rise in abortion and female infanticide across the country. There will be a huge difference in the sex ratio which we will see in social surveys over the next three years, Bhargava said.

headlines: 1.14 lakh affected by floods in Meghalaya's West Garo Hills
text: At least 1.14 lakh people in 154 villages have been affected after rainfall and rising waters of two rivers led to floods in Meghalaya's West Garo Hills district, officials said on Monday. The low-lying areas of the state's capital Shillong have also been flooded. Efforts are on to evacuate the flood victims and take them to safer locations, officials added.

headlines: C'garh govt criticised over proposal to add egg in mid-day meals
text: The Chhattisgarh government's proposal to add egg in the Mid-day Meal Scheme to fight malnutrition in students was criticised by social organisations and the BJP opposition. "This is a move to promote non-vegetarian food. There are other vegetarian options to fight...malnourishment," said an opposer. The government had reached out to the group through a committee, however, no solution was found.

headlines: Sameera Reddy shares first photo of her newborn daughter
text: Actress Sameera Reddy on Monday shared the first photo of her daughter who was born on Friday. "This little girl gave me the strength of wild horses. She wanted me to find myself again. She knew I was lost and she showed me the way," she wrote. Sameera added, "We prayed for a #babygirl and we are #blessed!"

headlines: Hema has picked broom only in films: Dharmendra to fan on viral video
text: After Hema Malini was criticised over a viral video of her sweeping Parliament premises, her husband Dharmendra responded to a fan who asked if she has actually picked a broom in life. "Haan films main, mujhe bhi anaadi lag rahi thi," he replied. Dharmendra added he was good at using a broom since he helped his mother with household chores.

headlines: SRK to be awarded honorary doctorate at Indian Film Fest of Melbourne
text: Australian University La Trobe will award actor Shah Rukh Khan with an honorary doctorate at the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne on August 9. It's the first Australian University to award Khan with an Honorary Doctor of Letters. "I would like to sincerely thank La Trobe for choosing to recognise my achievements in such a humbling way," the actor said.

headlines: ICC announces Team of World Cup, two Indians feature on the list
text: The ICC on Monday named the Team of the 2019 World Cup, which features two Indians, opener Rohit Sharma and fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah. New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson, who won the player of the tournament award, has been named the captain of the team. The 12-member team includes four players from the tournament-winning side, England.

headlines: Awarding England 6 runs on overthrow a clear mistake: Simon Taufel
text: Ex-umpire Simon Taufel has said awarding England six runs on overthrow in World Cup final was "a clear mistake". The five-time ICC best umpire award winner added that England should have been awarded five runs as per the rules. He added that Ben Stokes and Adil Rashid had not crossed for their second run at instant of Martin Guptill's throw.

headlines: K'taka MLAs write to Mumbai Police again, seek protection from Cong
text: The 14 Karnataka rebel MLAs, staying at a Mumbai hotel, wrote to the police again, seeking protection from Congress leaders who may try to meet them. "We have absolutely no intention to meet Shri Mallikarjun Kharge ji or Ghulam Nabi Azad ji or any Congress dignitaries or functionaries from Maharashtra and Karnataka...we anticipate a serious threat from them," they said.

headlines: Suspecting 'character', man kills girlfriend by crushing face: Police
text: A 19-year-old aspiring model was allegedly killed by her boyfriend on suspicion of her "character" in Maharashtra's Nagpur, police said, adding that the accused has been arrested. A police official said they received information on Saturday morning about the body of a woman found on a highway with her face crushed. The boyfriend allegedly suspected her "closeness" with some youths.

headlines: Don't use 'My Lord' while addressing judges: Rajasthan HC to lawyers
text: Rajasthan High Court has asked lawyers to stop addressing judges as "My lord" and "Your Lordship" in order to "honour the mandate of equality enshrined in the Constitution". A bench of justices in 2014 had observed that it wasn't compulsory to call judges "My Lord", "Your Lordship" or "Your Honour". "We only say address us respectfully," the bench had said.

headlines: Delhi govt to give free safety kits to sanitation workers: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his government will give free safety kits to sanitation workers. Speaking at a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) workshop, Kejriwal said he feels dejected to hear about the deaths of sanitation workers. DJB Vice Chairman Dinesh Mohaniya said the one-day workshop was organised to make sanitation workers aware about the use of safety kits.

headlines: Kalraj Mishra appointed HP Governor, Acharya Devvrat moved to Gujarat
text: Senior BJP leader and former Union Minister Kalraj Mishra was on Monday appointed as the Governor of Himachal Pradesh, replacing Acharya Devvrat, who has been transferred and appointed as the Governor of Gujarat. A Rashtrapati Bhavan press communique said the appointments of Mishra and Devvrat will come into effect from the dates they will assume charge of their respective offices.

headlines: SC to hear PIL on decriminalising abortion, sends notice to Centre
text: Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to Centre while agreeing to hear a PIL by three women seeking directions to decriminalise abortion, so that women have the choice of reproduction. The PIL said restrictions and exceptions in Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act violate women's rights. The petition was filed by a teacher, a digital marketeer and a PR executive.

headlines: Iran threatens to return to situation before nuclear deal
text: Iran will return to the situation before its nuclear deal with world powers unless European countries fulfil their obligations, the spokesman for Iran's nuclear agency, Behrouz Kamalvandi, has said. He added that under the 2015 deal, Iran gave much more than what it received because the other side, particularly after the US withdrawal from the deal, forgot its obligations.

headlines: Mochizuki first Japanese player to win boy's Grand Slam title
text: Shintaro Mochizuki on Sunday became the first Japanese player to win a boy's Grand Slam title, beating Carlos Gimeno Valero of Spain 6-3, 6-2 in the Wimbledon final. The 16-year-old, who was playing just his third grass-court tournament, said he had learned a lot from his compatriot, 2014 US Open finalist Kei Nishikori.

headlines: Vinesh Phogat wins gold medal at Yasar Dogu International
text: Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat on Sunday beat Russia's Ekaterina Poleshchuk to win the gold medal at Yasar Dogu International in the 53 kg category. Phogat, who was the third wrestler to win gold in the women's competition for India, tweeted, "Strong performance over the last couple of days at the #YasarDogu here in Istanbul."

headlines: Sebastian Vettel apologises to Max Verstappen, admits mistake
text: Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel apologised to Red Bull's Max Verstappen immediately after Sunday's British Grand Prix after he had rammed into the Red Bull car after the Dutchman had passed him. Following the incident, Vettel had to make a pit stop while Verstappen rejoined the race and finished fifth, missing out on a possible podium finish.

headlines: Queen sends congratulatory message to WC-winning Eng team
text: Queen Elizabeth II sent her congratulations to the England team after they beat New Zealand to lift their maiden World Cup title on Sunday. "Prince Philip and I send our warmest congratulations to the England Men's Cricket team after such a thrilling victory in today's World Cup final," wrote The Royal Family official Twitter account.

headlines: Oracle loses court appeal against $10 bn US govt contract
text: US-based Oracle has lost its legal challenge against US Pentagon's $10-billion contract for 'JEDI' cloud infrastructure, which it alleged unfairly favoured Amazon. The Federal Claims Court said there were no "organisational conflicts of interest" and because Oracle didn't meet bid's criteria, it can't allege prejudice in the bidding. The US can now award the contract to Amazon or Microsoft.

headlines: Centre issued 10 advisories to WB in just 10 days: TMC leader
text: Accusing the Centre of targeting West Bengal government, TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay on Monday said that the Centre has issued "10 advisories" to the state government in "just 10 days". He added that this is "hurting the parliamentary democratic system". "Why the West Bengal government is being targeted? We will not allow it," the TMC leader said.

headlines: Appalled to learn of Sidhu's resignation: Shatrughan Sinha
text: Congress leader Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday took to Twitter to say that he was appalled to learn of Navjot Singh Sidhu's resignation from the Punjab Cabinet. Sinha said, "He has been a...talented and popular sportsman/politician...a wonderful human being and...a dear friend." "[W]e cannot question his decision, one would...pray for remedial measures soon towards...this unfortunate move," he added.

headlines: Worst not yet over in auto sector: Mahindra MD on sale slump
text: The worst isn't yet over for the auto industry amid a slowdown in sales, Mahindra and Mahindra's MD Pawan Goenka said. "I suggest...government remove the cess on small cars and keep 17% single cess rate for large cars for next four-six months," he added. Diesel vehicle costs are expected to rise after BS-VI emission norms come into effect in 2020.

headlines: Girl dies after fire breaks out in hostel room in Telangana
text: A Class 4 girl died of suffocation and burn injuries after a fire broke out in a hostel room in Telangana's Khammam, a fire official said. He added that the room was engulfed in a fire triggered by a short circuit. He said that the room had only one exit which made it difficult for the children to rush out.

headlines: Violence erupts in West Bengal, train services disrupted
text: Violence broke out in West Bengal's Kankinara on Monday following which the locals disrupted train services in the Barrackpore-Naihati division of Eastern Railway (ER), an official said. The services were affected for about two hours and 16 local trains were delayed, the official added. Miscreants hurled bombs, prompting the administration to deploy the RAF to control the situation, he said.

headlines: Wholesale inflation falls to 23-month low of 2.02% in June
text: India's wholesale inflation, measured by the Wholesale Price Index (WPI), declined to a 23-month low of 2.02% in June, government data showed on Monday. The fall was driven by a decline in the prices of vegetables, manufactured products, fuel and power items. The inflation fell for the second time in a row, from 2.45% in the month of May 2019.

headlines: Don't take up sport, die at 60 fat & happy: Neesham after final loss
text: After losing the 2019 World Cup against England on boundary count, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "That hurts. Hopefully there's a day or two over the next decade where I don't think about that last half hour." He added, "Kids, don't take up sport. Take up baking or something. Die at 60 really fat and happy."

headlines: We all aged a year in that Super Over: NZ PM after team's defeat
text: After England beat New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup final on Sunday, New Zealand Prime Minster Jacinda Ardern said, "I think as a nation we all aged a year in that Super Over." "That was undeniably an incredible game...Congratulations to England. And to the Black Caps, I feel nothing but pride. What a team," she added.

headlines: Karnataka coalition government to take floor test on Thursday
text: The Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka will take the floor test on Thursday, former Chief Minister of Karnataka and Congress leader Siddaramaiah said on Monday. This comes after several MLAs of the coalition government submitted their resignations to the Assembly Speaker. The resignations by the MLAs have not been accepted by the Assembly Speaker.

headlines: England is a winner because of stupid f**king rules: Anurag Kashyap
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, while criticising the ICC after New Zealand lost the 2019 World Cup final to England over boundary rule, tweeted, "England is a winner because of stupid f**king rules...New Zealand is a true winner." "@ICC has made cricket such a batsmen game...It's all about the batsmen scores and the wickets are treated like the lower caste," he added.

headlines: It is kind of silly: GoT's Nikolaj on criticism against final season
text: 'Game of Thrones' actor Nikolaj Coster-Waldau has reacted to the criticism received by the show's final season. "For anyone to...think that the two creators of this show are not the most passionate...and to for a second think that they didn't spend the last 10 years thinking about how they were gonna end it, is kinda silly," he said.

headlines: Apple to stop iPhone SE, iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6s Plus India sales: Report
text: Apple will reportedly stop selling its lower-priced smartphones iPhone SE, iPhone 6, 6 Plus and 6s Plus in India. The company reportedly does not want to chase volumes by discounting at the cost of profit in the country. These models will reportedly be phased out to increase the average selling price of iPhones in India and boost profit and revenue.

headlines: I have no issues with him: Punjab CM after Sidhu's resignation
text: After Navjot Singh Sidhu resigned as Minister from Punjab Cabinet, Chief Minister Amarinder Singh said, "I have no issues with him, I had in fact given him a very important portfolio after the reshuffle. It was his decision to quit the Cabinet." "I will go through his resignation letter and then see what is to be done," he added.

headlines: Swiggy looking to raise $500 mn in funding round: Report
text: Food delivery app Swiggy is reportedly in talks with South Korean funds including Korea Investment Partners, Mirae Asset Management and others for a $500 million funding round. Swiggy's largest investor, South African internet giant Naspers, may reportedly lead the round. The round is said to value Swiggy at around $4 billion.

headlines: SC dismisses Asaram's bail plea in sexual assault case
text: The Supreme Court has dismissed the bail plea of self-styled godman Asaram in connection with a sexual assault case lodged against him in Gujarat. The SC bench said the trial needs to be completed first. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta informed the bench that the trial in the case was going on and that 210 witnesses were yet to be examined.

headlines: Will cut business ties with US firms that sell arms to Taiwan: China
text: China's government and companies will cut business ties with US firms involved in selling arms to Taiwan, China's foreign ministry has said. However, the ministry did not specify which companies would be affected. This comes after China threatened to impose sanctions on US firms involved in a deal to sell $2.2-billion worth of tanks, missiles and related equipment to Taiwan.

headlines: Zidane leaves Canada training camp as his brother passes away
text: Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane left the team's training camp in Canada after his elder brother Farid passed away aged 54. The club confirmed the news on social media and shared a picture of players and staff holding a minute's silence in Montreal. Assistant manager David Bettoni will take charge of training until Zidane returns.

headlines: US Army to test robotic combat vehicles in 2020
text: The US Army will start testing robotic combat vehicles in 2020 which soldiers will control from the back of modified Bradley Fighting Vehicles. The upgraded Bradleys, called Mission Enabler Technologies-Demonstrators (MET-Ds), have a remote turret for 25 mm main gun, 360-degree cameras and crew stations with touchscreens. Initial testing will include two MET-Ds and four robotic combat vehicles.

headlines: Have sent resignation as Punjab minister to CM: Navjot Sidhu
text: Cricketer-turned-politician Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said that he has sent his resignation as a Punjab Cabinet minister to CM Captain Amarinder Singh and it has been delivered to his official residence. Sidhu had earlier submitted his resignation letter to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi instead of CM Singh. In June, Sidhu's portfolio was changed after a Cabinet reshuffle.

headlines: Cong is filled with 'fake Gandhis': Shivraj Singh Chouhan
text: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised the Congress saying that the party is filled with "fake Gandhis" and that's why people are "rejecting" it in all states. Commenting on Rahul Gandhi's resignation as Congress President, Chouhan said Rahul left his party as he was unable to run it "efficiently". He added Rahul "escaped" from the party President's post.

headlines: Pune-based agritech startup Ecozen raises Series A funding
text: Pune-based agritech startup Ecozen has raised an undisclosed amount of funding in Series A round from Hyderabad-based Caspian and the Hivos-Triodos Fund. Mumbai-based investment firm Omnivore, which originally invested in Ecozen in 2015, also participated in this round. Founded in 2010 by three IIT Kharagpur alumni, Ecozen provides renewable energy based solutions to increase farmer income.

headlines: 8 suspended, notice to 3 for negligence in cattle care in UP
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday suspended eight officials and issued show-cause notices to three others for negligence after 35 cattle were found dead in a temporary shelter in Prayagraj. Addressing the state's District Magistrates through video call, Yogi warned criminal proceedings in the future. He had earlier asked officials to ensure that cow shelters are self-reliant.

headlines: Muslims with 50 wives, 1,050 kids 'animalistic': BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh said that Muslims who have 50 wives and 1,050 children possess "animalistic tendency". Singh added, in 2024, when the RSS will complete 100 years, India would be declared a Hindu Rashtra. He termed West Bengal as 'Lanka' and said that half of Bengal had been "destroyed" and the remaining would be finished after the Assembly elections.

headlines: NDMC to rename 31 schools after ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee
text: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has issued an order to change the names of 31 NDMC Schools after ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee. It has decided to rename schools from 'Nagar Palika School' to 'Atal Adarsh Vidyalaya' from the academic session 2019-2020. The move has been made to improve "enrolment" and the "public perception" of the schools, the NDMC said.

headlines: 4 dead, around 18 lakh affected due to floods in Bihar
text: At least four people have died and around 18 lakh were affected due to floods in nine districts of Bihar, an official report said. The report added that five rivers of the state are flowing above the danger level due to torrential rains in the catchment areas bordering Nepal. CM Nitish Kumar conducted an aerial survey of the flood-affected areas.

headlines: Iran ready to talk if US lifts sanctions: President Rouhani
text: Iran is ready to hold talks with the US if it lifts sanctions and returns to the 2015 nuclear deal it quit last year, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Sunday. "We have always believed in talks," Rouhani added. US President Donald Trump's administration has said it is open to negotiations with Iran.

headlines: New Zealand-born Stokes named Man of 2019 WC final vs New Zealand
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes, who scored 84*(98) in the 2019 World Cup final against New Zealand, was named Man of the Final. The 28-year-old, who was born in New Zealand's Christchurch, became the first-ever England player to win the Man of the World Cup Final award. Stokes also hit eight of England's 15 runs in the Super Over.

headlines: World Cup to be decided on Super Over for the first time ever
text: The 2019 World Cup final will be decided in Super Over after New Zealand dismissed England for 241 runs in their 50 overs. Needing 15 runs off the last over, England scored 14 runs and lost two wickets. New Zealand had put up 241/8 in their 50 overs. This is the first time that World Cup final has been tied.

headlines: England win World Cup for first time for hitting more boundaries
text: England won the World Cup for the first time due to hitting more boundaries after tied scores in World Cup history's first-ever Super Over forced a boundary count-back. The match went into Super Over wherein both the teams scored 15 each after hitting 241 runs apiece in their respective 50 overs. England scored 26 boundaries while New Zealand hit 17.

headlines: Djokovic defeats Federer to win 2nd straight Wimbledon title
text: World number one Novak Djokovic defeated world number three Roger Federer in fifth-set tie-break on Sunday to win his second straight Wimbledon title. Overall, it was Djokovic's fifth Wimbledon title and 16th Grand Slam title. The 32-year-old Serbian has become the fourth man after Federer, Rafael Nadal and Rod Laver to win four major titles since turning 30.

headlines: Williamson second captain to win Player of the World Cup award
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson, who led Kiwis to 2019 World Cup final, has been named Player of the World Cup. The 28-year-old became the second captain in World Cup history to win the award after late New Zealand captain Martin Crowe in 1992 edition. Williamson scored 578 runs in ten 2019 World Cup matches at an average of 82.57.

headlines: ISRO calls off 'Chandrayaan 2' launch for today after technical snag
text: The Indian Space Research Organisation on Monday called off the launch of India's second Moon mission 'Chandrayaan 2' for today "as a measure of abundant precaution" after a technical snag was observed in launch vehicle system at T-56 minute. "Revised launch date will be announced later," ISRO tweeted. The launch for 'Chandrayaan 2' was scheduled for 2:51 am today.

headlines: 6 Army men among 7 dead in Himachal building collapse
text: At least seven people, of which six were Army men, died and several more were injured after a multi-storey building housing a small eatery on Kumarhatti-Nahan road in Himachal Pradesh's Solan district collapsed on Sunday. Seven Army personnel are still feared trapped. The wife of the restaurant owner was also among the seven people killed in the incident.

headlines: Husband of BJP MLA's daughter who released video beaten up
text: The husband of BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra's daughter Sakshi Mishra was allegedly beaten up by some people at Allahabad High Court on Monday. Sakshi had sought police protection and had released a video accusing her father of threatening her life following her marriage to the Dalit man. Sakshi's father had said the man was "nine years older than her".

headlines: Vicky shares note by fan who joined Indian Navy after watching Uri
text: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to his Instagram story to share a message by a fan, who joined the Indian Navy after being inspired by his film 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'. "Thank you for making such a masterpiece for it will remain forever in our mind and spirit," the fan wrote in the note sent to the film's director Aditya Dhar.

headlines: Pooja Batra confirms marrying Nawab Shah in secret wedding ceremony
text: Actress Pooja Batra has confirmed that she got married to actor Nawab Shah in a secret wedding ceremony. "[We] exchanged vows in Delhi, with only our families in attendance...We had an Arya Samaj wedding, and we'll register our marriage this week," she said. Earlier, reports of their marriage surfaced after videos shared by the couple showed Pooja wearing bridal choora.

headlines: I'll be apologising to NZ for rest of my life: Stokes on deflected four
text: Talking about the overthrow incident in last over of 2019 World Cup final, England all-rounder Ben Stokes said he told New Zealand captain Kane Williamson that he'd be apologising to them for the rest of his life. The ball had raced to the boundary for four overthrows after deflecting off Stokes' bat. The 28-year-old was named man of the final.

headlines: Twitter to begin testing 'hide replies' feature in Canada
text: Twitter is rolling out the 'hide replies' feature to its users in Canada for testing purpose. When users look at the replies, they'll be able to select any of them and choose "hide reply" option. These tweets won't be fully removed from Twitter as users will be able to tap on a grey icon to view hidden replies.

headlines: Uttar Pradesh officials consider to list Azam Khan as land mafia
text: Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district administration is considering listing Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's name under the "land mafia" category on the state government's "anti-bhoo mafia" (anti-land mafia) portal. Khan has over 30 cases, mostly linked to grabbing of either government or farmer land. The portal was set up by CM Yogi Adityanath after he took power in UP in 2017.

headlines: 9 killed as plane crashes during skydiving trip in Sweden
text: Nine Swedes were killed after a plane crashed during a skydiving trip in northern Sweden, authorities said. The plane designed to carry parachutists crashed on an island in the Ume river shortly after takeoff from Umeå airport. Sweden's PM Stefan Löfven said the government was in close contact with the relevant authorities as they investigate the cause of the crash.

headlines: Go back to countries you came from: Trump tells Congresswomen
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday told a group of Congresswomen to "go back" to the "totally broken and crime infested" countries they came from rather than "loudly and viciously telling the people of the US" how to run the government. Trump appeared to be referring to US Congresswomen Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Ilhan Omar, Ayanna Pressley and Rashida Tlaib.

headlines: BJP will win over 65 seats in Jharkhand, says JP Nadda
text: Ahead of the forthcoming Assembly elections in Jharkhand, BJP national working President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the saffron party will win more than 65 seats in the state. He added that the "double-engine" (the Centre and the state government) was providing the much-needed growth to the state. Nadda also appreciated CM Raghubar Das-led government's performance in Jharkhand.

headlines: Speaker doesn't have right to disqualify anybody: Yeddyurappa
text: BJP Karnataka President BS Yeddyurappa on Sunday said the Speaker doesn't have the right to disqualify anybody because of the Supreme Court's decision. The court had directed the Speaker to maintain status quo on the rebel MLAs resignations until July 16. Earlier, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said the MLAs who vote against government in Confidence Motion will lose their membership.

headlines: Delhi govt should work in harmony with Centre: Sitharaman
text: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Delhi government should work in harmony with the Centre and the municipal corporations for the development of the national capital. She said blaming the Centre and municipal corporations for creating hindrance in development work is "wrong". Sitharaman also accused the Delhi government of not being concerned about the cleaning of Yamuna river.

headlines: It's good Navjot Sidhu resigned: Union Minister Som Parkash
text: Union Minister Som Parkash said that it was good that Navjot Singh Sidhu resigned as Cabinet Minister from CM Captain Amarinder Singh-led government in Punjab. He added, "It's the first time in the country that a minister's portfolio was changed and he resigned." In June, Sidhu was given Power and New and Renewable Energy Sources portfolios after a Cabinet reshuffle.

headlines: Dead patient's kin attack 3 resident doctors in Mumbai hospital
text: Three resident doctors and security guards of Mumbai's Nair Hospital were allegedly abused and attacked by the kin of a patient who died during treatment, police said. The relatives also damaged the hospital property, the police added. Condemning the attack, Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors (MARD) has urged the government to make necessary changes to ensure the protection of doctors.

headlines: Assam floods death toll rises to 11; over 26 lakh affected
text: The death toll in the Assam floods, which have affected over 26 lakh people, rose to 11 after four more people were killed on Sunday. Barpeta district is the worst hit with 7.35 lakh people affected, followed by Morigaon with 3.5 lakh people affected. The India Meteorological Department has predicted more rainfall in the state for the next 24 hours.

headlines: India says Deloitte misreading law against call for 5-yr ban: Report
text: The government reportedly told a tribunal that Deloitte was misreading law by arguing that the case against it should be dismissed as its term at IL&FS unit IFIN had ended when the fraud was alleged. "Fraud continuing till date on account of errant past auditor...can be covered under law," it added. India is seeking a 5-year ban on Deloitte India.

headlines: No 'Greta effect' on Lufthansa's passenger numbers, says CEO
text: Lufthansa expects the number of its passengers to rise four per cent this year, not seeing any "Greta effect" on booking levels, the German airline's CEO Carsten Spohr said. This follows activists led by 16-year-old Swedish activist Greta Thunberg boycotting air travel amid carbon emission concerns. "Climate change discussions aren't causing restraint with bookings. People want to fly," he said.

headlines: RJ Stutee claims RWA president harassed her for coming home late
text: RJ Stutee has alleged that RWA president Micky Bedi and his wife harassed her and refused to let the guard open the gate as she was coming back late due to work. "This is a major security issue...My parents are worried, Stutee, who stays in GK, Delhi tweeted. She also shared pictures of the police complaint filed by her mother.

headlines: A man was masturbating on video call, alleges Mumbai scriptwriter
text: A Mumbai scriptwriter has alleged that a man flashed his private parts at her and also masturbated during a video call on Skype. "I was unable to see the face of the person...After taking screenshots to lodge a complaint, I disconnected the call," she stated in her police complaint. On Saturday morning, a case was registered in the matter.

headlines: NZ set same target for Eng which first-time winners SL got in 1996
text: New Zealand have set a target of 242 for England in the final of 2019 World Cup at Lord's Cricket Ground on Sunday. In the final of the 1996 World Cup, Sri Lanka were also given a target of 242 by Australia. Sri Lanka chased down the target in 46.2 overs to win the World Cup for first time.

headlines: Woman promoting porn website tries to invade World Cup final pitch
text: A woman promoting her son's porn website attempted to invade the pitch during England-New Zealand 2019 World Cup final at Lord's Cricket Ground on Sunday. The security guards stopped the streaker near the boundary ropes and dragged her out of the ground. Notably, her son's girlfriend had invaded the pitch during the Champions League final in June.

headlines: AI system to warn about spoilers in online reviews developed
text: Researchers have developed an AI-based system called 'SpoilerNet' that figures out spoilers in online reviews of books and TV shows and warns about them to the users. The system can be used to build a browser extension to shield people from spoilers. The researchers collected over 1.3 million book reviews annotated with spoiler tags by book reviewers for the system.

headlines: BL Santosh appointed BJP's National General Secretary (Organisation)
text: Bharatiya Janata Party has appointed BL Santosh as its National General Secretary (Organisation). Santosh, previously the party's Joint General Secretary (Organisation), took over from Ramlal, who went back to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh after serving for one of the longest terms in the key party post. The BJP said in a statement that Santosh's appointment comes into immediate effect.

headlines: K'taka MLA reaches Mumbai day after announcing resignation withdrawal
text: A day after announcing the withdrawal of his resignation, Karnataka Congress MLA MTB Nagaraj on Sunday arrived at the Mumbai hotel where 14 rebel MLAs of Congress-JD(S) coalition are staying. Nagaraj was accompanied by BJP MLA R Ashok at the hotel. Following the development, Karnataka BJP President BS Yeddyurappa said he will request CM HD Kumaraswamy to resign immediately.

headlines: Karnataka woman falls into pond while shooting TikTok video, dies
text: A 20-year-old woman from Karnataka lost her life after falling into a farm pond while trying to enact a scene from a movie for a TikTok video. Her father told the police that the incident occurred when Mala, a final year BA student, went out to get cattle fodder. Mala's college principal said she was an aspiring actor.

headlines: 2 dead, 23 rescued in three-storey building collapse in HP's Solan
text: As many as two bodies have been recovered and 23 people have been rescued after a three-storey building collapsed on Kumarhatti-Nahan road in Himachal Pradesh's Solan district due to heavy rains on Sunday. Out of the 23 people, 18 are Army men and five are civilians. Fourteen people are still feared trapped as rescue operations continue.

headlines: Bullet train passengers may be charged for extra baggage: Report
text: The National High Speed Rail Corporation (NHSRCL) executing the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project plans to charge travellers for the bags they check in. "Basically, the idea is to discourage passengers from carrying heavy luggage," the NHSRCL said. Every coach is said to contain sufficient space for hand baggage and the last coach will have space for the extra check-in luggage.

headlines: 2 killed, 26 injured as joyride collapses in Ahmedabad adventure park
text: At least two people were killed and 26 others injured when a joyride at an adventure park in Ahmedabad's Kankaria collapsed on Sunday. The injured were rushed to the LG Hospital. Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) Commissioner Vijay Nehra said, "Police along with the FSL team is investigating the matter."

headlines: BJP leader's nephew does stunts in sports car in Delhi, video viral
text: A video of a Nissan GT-R sports car performing dangerous stunts near the Parliament in Delhi on Saturday at around 4 am has gone viral. Police said the sports car was being driven by Sarvesh Sindhu, the nephew of Haryana Finance Minister Captain Abhimanyu. The sports car owned by Sarvesh was found at a farmhouse in Delhi's Kapashera area.

headlines: Internship at White House worst career advice I've received: Lewinsky
text: American television personality Monica Lewinsky today tweeted that "an internship at the White House will be amazing on your resume" is the worst career advice she's ever received. Over 20 years ago, former US President Bill Clinton and Lewinsky, a White House intern, were named in a sex scandal. Clinton was impeached by the House for lying about the affair.

headlines: Twitter spat between Mazumdar-Shaw, Pai on Godrej's hate crime remark
text: A Twitter spat broke out between Biocon MD Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw and Infosys' ex-Director Mohandas Pai over Godrej Group's Adi Godrej's "Rising hate crimes can damage growth" remark on Saturday. As Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "well spoken", Pai said she's falling for a "fake narrative". "He says economy isn't in good shape n (and) we shd (should) not be in denial," Mazumdar-Shaw responded.

headlines: Vijay Shankar to undergo fitness tests at NCA for injured toe
text: All-rounder Vijay Shankar is set to undergo tests at National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru to determine the extent of his toe injury which he suffered during 2019 World Cup. Shankar was hit by a yorker from Jasprit Bumrah during practice. Shankar scored 58 runs and took two wickets in the 2019 World Cup before being replaced by Mayank Agarwal.

headlines: Hungary thrash South Korea 64-0 in water polo World C'ships
text: Hungary set the record for the largest margin of victory in a water polo game at the world championships after thrashing South Korea 64-0. Hungary scored its 64 goals from 67 shots, with Rebecca Parkes scoring 11 goals. Song Ye-seo, who had South Korea's lone shot on goal in the first quarter, said, "[W]e'll try to do better next time."

headlines: Mercedes' Hamilton wins record sixth British Grand Prix
text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton won a record sixth British Grand Prix at Silverstone on Sunday. Hamilton has surpassed record-holders Jim Clark and Alain Prost, who both had five wins in the British Grand Prix. Hamilton's Finnish partner Valtteri Bottas came in the second place while Ferrari's Charles Leclerc took the third spot.

headlines: Vijender Singh remains unbeaten, wins 11th professional bout
text: Indian boxer Vijender Singh continued his unbeaten run after clinching a Technical Knockout over Mike Snider, on his debut in the US professional circuit on Sunday. This is the 33-year-old's 11th consecutive victory in the circuit. "Vijender is a good boxer and I believe I underestimated his experience and technique," Snider said about Vijender.
