headlines: Chandrababu Naidu will go to jail for corruption: BJP Secy
text: BJP National Secretary Sunil Deodhar on Sunday said former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu will go to jail for corruption in two years. Deodhar further said that Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy should send files on Naidu's corruption to CBI and ED for inquiry. "The theft should be brought to the notice of public and central government," Deodhar added.

headlines: Make mother tongue mandatory for primary schools: VP Naidu
text: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday said that every state government should make the medium of instruction in the mother tongue mandatory up to class 5 or 8. Naidu also suggested that state governments link employment with native languages so every officer is familiar with the local language. "Don't impose any language, but don't oppose any language too," Naidu said.

headlines: 4-year-old leopard rescued from well in Pune's Shirur Taluka
text: A four-year-old leopard was rescued from a well by a team of Shirur Range Rescue and Wildlife SOS in Pune's Shirur Taluka on Sunday. The rescue team reached the spot after receiving information about the incident from a rescue volunteer of Shirur Range. The leopard was later shifted to Manikdoh Leopard Rescue Centre for preliminary treatment.

headlines: I-T Dept snooping people's social media a misconception: CBDT
text: The notion that Income Tax Department snoops people's spending patterns on social media platforms to find tax evaders is a "misconception", Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) Chairman PC Mody said. "We already get to know actual...financial transactions of people from authentic sources," he said. However, he said CBDT has deployed a data analytics system to profile entities' transaction trail.

headlines: Ed Sheeran confirms he is married to girlfriend Cherry Seaborn
text: After months of speculation, singer Ed Sheeran has confirmed he's married to longtime girlfriend Cherry Seaborn. He revealed this while talking about the lyrics of 'Remember The Name' from his new album 'No.6 Collaborations Project'. Ed Sheeran said, "It was actually before me and Cherry got married, and I knew that we'd be married by the point...the song came out."

headlines: A first in India: Akshay on women scientists leading Chandrayaan 2
text: Akshay Kumar took to social media to wish the female scientists who are behind ISRO's Chandrayaan 2 mission. "India's second space mission to the moon, Chandrayaan 2 is led by two women scientists of Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), a first in India's history. Sending my best to the rocket women and ISRO team, more power to you," he tweeted.

headlines: British Army's parachute team delivers ball to umpires in WC final
text: Red Devils, the British Army's Parachute Regiment display team, jumped from a helicopter and landed at the Lord's Cricket Ground to deliver match ball to umpires to mark the opening of 2019 World Cup final. "Not your standard match ball delivery method," wrote Cricket World Cup's official Instagram handle. Hosts England are bowling first in the final against New Zealand.

headlines: ISRO asks people what they would take to Moon, shares responses
text: Ahead of the launch of Chandrayaan 2, the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) asked people what they would like to take to the Moon. ISRO shared responses, with one person saying he would carry the Indian National Flag, a weighing machine and a smartphone. Another person said he would carry water from river Ganga and a DSLR with lens kit.

headlines: Pakistan agrees to daily 5,000 Indian pilgrims on Kartarpur corridor
text: Pakistan on Sunday agreed to build a bridge across zero line of the Kartarpur corridor to provide all-weather connectivity and allow 5,000 Sikh pilgrims to travel daily after the corridor becomes operational, an official said. "Pakistan also agreed for visa-free access for pilgrims," he added. India also handed over a copy of the notification banning pro-Khalistan outfit Sikhs for Justice.

headlines: 20-yr-old law student kills himself over harassment by friends in UP
text: A 20-year-old law student allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself at his home in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad after being harassed by his four friends. The deceased's father filed a police complaint. His father also gave police the deceased's mobile with a recorded video clip in which he alleged that his friends harassed him which led him to take his life.

headlines: US Congresswoman's aide criticised for Subhas Chandra Bose t-shirt
text: US Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's Indian-American aide Saikat Chakrabarti is being criticised for wearing a t-shirt with Subhas Chandra Bose's image printed on it. Chakrabarti had appeared in a video wearing the t-shirt in December last year, but the video went viral recently after a controversy. Notably, Bose is seen by some as "an Indian nationalist who collaborated with the Nazis".

headlines: France to create space command within air force: Prez Macron
text: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday said he approved the creation of a space command within the French air force to improve the country's defence capabilities. However, he said the investment involved was yet to be determined. Last year, US President Donald Trump's administration announced a plan to create a new 'Space Force' as the sixth branch of the military.

headlines: French Prez booed, told to step down ahead of Bastille Day parade
text: French President Emmanuel Macron was booed by protestors who demanded his resignation as he arrived at the annual Bastille Day parade in Paris on Sunday. This comes just one day after the 'yellow vest' protestors took to the streets, marking the 35th consecutive week of the nationwide protest against the Macron-led government's policies.

headlines: Spoke up when Infosys' core values were thrown into dustbin: Murthy
text: Talking about concerns expressed by him after retirement from Infosys, Co-founder Narayana Murthy said he spoke up when he saw core values of Infosys were being thrown into the "dustbin". "(In) 2014 CEO (Sikka) was given 55% hike on (salary of) $7 million...COO was given a 30% hike," said Murthy. "No middle-level fellow was given salary increase," he added.

headlines: On the day of test you're not going to read many books: Federer
text: Speaking ahead of his Wimbledon 2019 title clash against Novak Djokovic, Swiss tennis player Roger Federer said, "This is like a school. The day of the test, you're not going to read... many books that day." "It's been a rock-solid year... From that standpoint I can go into the match very confident," the eight-time Wimbledon champion said.

headlines: Ashwin picks 6-for against Surrey in County C'ship match
text: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, playing for Nottinghamshire, picked up a six-wicket haul against Surrey in the County Championship. Ashwin's performance helped Nottinghamshire dismiss Surrey for 240 on the first day. Nottinghamshire subsequently ended the day's play at 20/1. The second-best figures behind Ashwin's 6/69 were Liam Patterson-White's 3/62.

headlines: Huawei plans extensive job cuts at US research unit: Report
text: Chinese technology giant Huawei is planning extensive layoffs across its US-based research and development arm Futurewei Technologies, the Wall Street Journal reported. Hundreds of about 850 employees at the unit are reportedly expected to be laid off, with some Chinese staff being given an option to return to China staying within Huawei. The US had blacklisted Huawei over espionage allegations.

headlines: There is a Disgusting Food Museum located in Sweden
text: Disgusting Food Museum in Sweden has a display of "bizarre looking and smelling" food items. It features 80 foods from around the world, including frog smoothies from Peru, fruit bat soup, Iceland's shark meat and more. Visitors can also taste and smell some of the food items which are on display at the museum.

headlines: 'Jugaad' govt demolishing itself: Naqvi on Karnataka crisis
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said, the Congress had formed the government with "jugaad" which now appears to be demolishing itself due to internal conflicts. He added, "Let's see whether 'jugaad' will win or the people." On Saturday, five dissident MLAs approached the Supreme Court against Karnataka Speaker for not accepting their resignations.

headlines: Satellite imagery startup Pixxel raises funding from growX, others
text: Bengaluru-based early-stage spacetech startup Pixxel has raised an undisclosed pre-seed round of funding from growX ventures and angel investors such as Raju Reddy, Dileep Nath, Pawan Sarda and others. Pixxel was founded in late 2018 by Kshitij Khandelwal and Awais Ahmed, two undergraduates at BITS Pilani. Pixxel is building a constellation of nanosatellites for real-time satellite imagery.

headlines: Delhi man stabbed to death for intervening in couple's fight
text: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death for intervening in his neighbour's fight with his wife in Delhi, police said on Saturday. The accused reportedly went to the victim's room later and stabbed him in his chest and thigh. The victim was declared brought dead at the hospital and police have nabbed the accused from his friend's house in Zamrudpur.

headlines: Maharashtra woman throws daughters in well, attempts suicide
text: A 30-year-old woman threw her six-month-old twin daughters into a well before jumping in herself in a bid to commit suicide in Maharashtra's Buldhana district on Saturday, said police. The incident occurred reportedly after the woman, named Shital Mohan Bhagat, got into an argument with her family. The toddlers drowned but Bhagat was pulled out and admitted to a hospital.

headlines: 20 drug suppliers held near educational institutes in Noida
text: Twenty people were arrested on Saturday for their alleged involvement in drug trade near educational institutes in Noida and Greater Noida, police said. The police added that about 7.5 kg of marijuana, 5.8 kg of low-quality heroin, 1.3 kg of hashish were recovered from them. The arrests were made under the 13th edition of 'Operation Clean', the police said.

headlines: RSS affiliate SJM urges PM to ban 'anti-national' app TikTok
text: An RSS affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) urged PM Narendra Modi to ban social media applications like 'TikTok' and 'Helo', claiming these applications have become a hub for "anti-national" content. It alleged that these apps were exposing India's youth to being influenced by "vested interests". It said these Chinese establishments have negative intentions with regards to India's "integrity".

headlines: Students forced to go home for toilet in UP school with no building
text: Students of a government primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur study in the open and reportedly go home to use the toilet or to drink water due to lack of infrastructure. "There is no space for cooking mid-day meal...the food is cooked at another school and...brought here," a teacher said. The school remains closed when it rains, the teacher added.

headlines: 930 kids got ill after having mid-day meals in last 3 yrs: Govt
text: The Ministry of Human Resource Development said that 930 children were reported ill and none of them died after consuming mid-day meals in the last three years. In the same period, the ministry received 35 complaints from 15 states and union territories about food quality. The overall responsibility for providing nutritious mid-day meals lies with state governments, an official said.

headlines: J&J faces probe on denial of carcinogen in baby talc: Report
text: The US Justice Department is now reportedly pursuing a criminal investigation into whether Johnson & Johnson (J&J) lied to public about cancer risks related to its 'Baby Powder'. Reports said a grand jury was examining documents about what J&J knew regarding any carcinogens in its products. A J&J spokesperson denied the new development, adding, "[It] doesn't contain asbestos...or cause cancer."

headlines: JetPrivilege lets you book any seat, any flight, across airlines
text: JetPrivilege now allows you to book flight tickets across 7000+ airlines worldwide. You can now earn JPMiles across these airlines only if booked on jetprivilege.com. As part of an exclusive offer, Earn 1000 Bonus JPMiles on your 1st flight booking today.

headlines: As actor, I should be allowed to play any person, tree, animal: Scarlett
text: Hollywood actress Scarlett Johansson, while speaking about withdrawing from playing a transgender following criticism, said, "You know, as an actor I should be allowed to play any person, or any tree, or any animal because that is my job and the requirements of my job." She added that art should be "free of restrictions".

headlines: Bigg Boss Telugu organisers asked how I'll satisfy the boss: Journo
text: A Hyderabad-based female journalist, who was nominated for the third season of Bigg Boss Telugu, has alleged that the organisers asked for sexual favours in exchange for being selected for the final round. "They...asked me how I'm going to satisfy the boss. They also body-shamed me," the journalist claimed. A case has been registered against four members of the show.

headlines: Why would I watch the film again: 'Arjun Reddy' actor on 'Kabir Singh'
text: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Vijay Deverakonda, when asked if he has seen the film's remake 'Kabir Singh' starring Shahid Kapoor, said, "I know the story, I have done that film, why will I watch again?" "Shahid has done that film, and he has gone through the character, and there is nothing for me to watch again," he added.

headlines: All World Cup finals at Lord's have been won by team that lost toss
text: Lord's Cricket Ground in London, which will be hosting 2019 World Cup final between England and New Zealand today, has previously hosted four World Cup finals (1975, 1979, 1983 and 1999). In each of those four finals, the team that lost the toss went on to win the match. Team batting first emerged victorious in three of the four matches.

headlines: Dharmasena only World Cup champ to take field in 2019 World Cup final
text: Ex-Sri Lanka off-spinner Kumar Dharmasena is the only World Cup champion to take the field in 2019 World Cup final between England and New Zealand. The 48-year-old umpire, who will officiate the match, was in Sri Lanka's squad that won World Cup in 1996. None of the players in New Zealand and England sides have won a World Cup before.

headlines: Williamson registers most runs by a captain in a World Cup edition
text: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson has set the record for most runs by a captain in World Cup history. The 28-year-old took his tally of runs in 2019 World Cup to 549 after opening his account against England in the final on Sunday, breaking the record set by Sri Lanka's Mahela Jayawardene, who aggregated 548 runs in 2007 World Cup.

headlines: How have England and NZ fared in their previous World Cup finals?
text: Prior to 2019 World Cup, England had reached three World Cup finals and New Zealand had reached one World Cup final. England lost 1979 final to West Indies by 92 runs, while Australia and Pakistan defeated them in the 1987 and 1992 finals by 7 and 22 runs respectively. Australia defeated New Zealand in the 2015 final by 7 wickets.

headlines: TV show 'Startup ki Baat' to air on DD National every Sunday
text: As a part of Startup India initiative, a new television show on startups, 'Startup ki Baat', will air on DD National every Sunday. Startups will share their entrepreneurial journey on the show once in a week. The development comes a week after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a dedicated TV programme for startups while presenting the Union Budget 2019.

headlines: 7 UP policemen injured while arresting man accused of cow smuggling
text: Seven policemen were injured in an attack by villagers when they went to arrest a man wanted for cow smuggling in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj district. "Strict action will be taken and those involved in the attack will be arrested soon," said Ashutosh Mishra, SP Crime, Prayagraj. A large number of police personnel were deployed in the village after the incident.

headlines: RBI plans app to help visually challenged identify currency notes
text: The Reserve Bank of India is planning to come up with a mobile application to help visually challenged people to identify currency notes. The app would be able to identify the denomination of notes by capturing the image of the notes placed in front of the mobile camera. It will also generate an "audio notification" of the currency note denomination.

headlines: Former Bangladesh military ruler Ershad dies aged 89
text: Former Bangladesh military ruler Hussain Muhammad Ershad died on Sunday aged 89 following age-related health complications. Ershad had been on life support for 10 days in a military hospital in the capital Dhaka. He had seized power in a coup in 1982, overthrowing the then President Abdus Sattar. Ershad declared himself President in 1983.

headlines: Ex-UK envoy to US said Trump left Iran deal to offend Obama: Report
text: Former UK envoy to the US Kim Darroch had said that US President Donald Trump abandoned the 2015 Iran nuclear deal to "spite (offend) his predecessor Barack Obama", according to a report by the Daily Mail. Darroch described the US withdrawal as an act of "diplomatic vandalism". Darroch resigned from the post earlier this week.

headlines: Jacques Kallis steps down as Kolkata Knight Riders head coach
text: South African all-rounder Jacques Kallis has stepped down as the head coach of the Indian Premier League outfit Kolkata Knight Riders. "After nine fantastic years with KKR since 2011, as a player, mentor and Head Coach, it's time to explore new opportunities...I would to like to thank the owners, management and fellow players for many happy memories," Kallis wrote.

headlines: Cabal-Farah 1st Colombians to win Grand Slam men's doubles title
text: Juan Sebastian Cabal and Robert Farah became the first Colombians to win a Grand Slam men's doubles title on Saturday. They beat France's Nicolas Mahut and Edouard Roger-Vasselin 6-7 (5), 7-6 (5), 7-6 (6), 6-7 (5), 6-3 in a Wimbledon final that clocked just under 5 hours. A part of the match was played under the closed Centre Court roof.

headlines: Australia ignore Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis for Ashes 2019
text: Australia have excluded all-rounders Glenn Maxwell and Marcus Stoinis from a 25-player squad for an intra-Australia clash that will help in deciding the final squad for the upcoming Ashes 2019. The 25-member list has seven players from the World Cup campaign, 15 from the Australia A squad touring England and pacer Peter Siddle, batsmen Cameron Bancroft and Marnus Labuschagne.

headlines: Cong ready to settle demands of rebel MLAs: DK Shivakumar
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the party is ready to settle the demands of the rebel MLAs. He added that the MLAs know the law and if they vote against confidence motion in the Assembly, then they'll lose their membership. Shivakumar further said, "We're getting signals that they will save our government."

headlines: Muslim barbers refuse haircuts to Dalits in UP village
text: The Dalit community in Uttar Pradesh's Pipalsana village has alleged that Muslim barbers are refusing them haircuts. An incident had occurred between the two groups earlier following which barbers refused to cut their hair, an official said. The barbers reportedly closed their shops following police mediation and a case has been registered against three people.

headlines: NIA arrests 2 from Tamil Nadu for suspected terror links
text: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two persons with suspected terror links from Tamil Nadu on Saturday. The NIA accused the two of collecting funds and planning terror attacks in India with "the intention to establish Islamic rule". The anti-terror agency recovered nine mobile phones, 15 SIM cards, three laptops and other items during the bust.

headlines: 5,000 Bihar villages to be digitally equipped: Prasad
text: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that 5,000 villages of Bihar will be digitally equipped through Wi-Fi and other online services in future. He added that there are 297 IT and BPO centres operational in 120 small towns and cities across the country. Prasad said, eight BPO centres are operational in Patna, while one such facility is functional at Muzaffarpur.

headlines: China holds military drills after Taiwan buys arms from US
text: China's military recently carried out air and naval drills along its southeast coast following the latest arms sales from the US to Taiwan. Earlier, China said it would impose sanctions on US firms involved in a deal to sell $2.2 billion worth of tanks, missiles and related equipment to Taiwan, saying it harmed China's sovereignty and national security.

headlines: You will be a mother by your next birthday: Ambani wishes Shloka
text: India's richest man Mukesh Ambani wished his daughter-in-law Shloka Mehta a happy birthday in a video. "By the time I wish you next year, not only will I be a grandfather but you will be a mother, so this is an eventful year," Ambani said. The video also featured wishes from Isha Ambani, Anand Piramal and Anant Ambani among others.

headlines: Balasaheb Thorat replaces Ashok Chavan as Maharashtra Cong Chief
text: Balasaheb Thorat was appointed as the president of the Congress' Maharashtra unit on Saturday, replacing Ashok Chavan who resigned in May. Thorat has served as Minister of Revenue and Khar Lands in the State government. Nitin Raut, Baswaraj M Patil, Vishwajeet Kadam, Yashomati Chandrakant Thakur and Muzaffer Hussain have been named the new working presidents.

headlines: Sidhu resigns as Punjab minister, shares letter written to Rahul
text: Navjot Singh Sidhu has resigned as Minister from the Punjab Cabinet. Sidhu on Sunday took to Twitter to share his resignation letter dated June 10 that he had submitted to the then Congress President Rahul Gandhi. This comes after Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh in June divested Sidhu of his Local Government and Tourism and Cultural Affairs portfolios.

headlines: When was the last time a team won the World Cup for the first time?
text: Cricket World Cup will get first-time winners after New Zealand and England face each other in 2019 World Cup final on Sunday. The last time a team won World Cup for the first time was on March 17, 1996, when Sri Lanka defeated Australia in the final in Lahore. Pakistan won the World Cup for the first time in 1992.

headlines: What will happen if 2019 WC final ends in a tie or gets washed out?
text: If England-New Zealand final ends in a tie, a Super Over will be used to determine the winner. The group stage standings or Net Run Rate will count for nothing. In case, the match gets washed out today, it'll be played on reserve day tomorrow. England and New Zealand will be declared joint-winners if reserve day also gets washed out.

headlines: Jasprit Bumrah reacts to fan's elderly mother imitating his action
text: After a video of a fan's elderly mother imitating Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action went viral, the Team India fast bowler took to Twitter to react to it. "This made my day," the 25-year-old wrote. "Just like rest of us...the mothership was so impressed with Bumrah's performance in World Cup that she decided to mimic his run-up," the fan had tweeted.

headlines: Computer password inventor Fernando Corbató passes away at 93
text: US-born Fernando José "Corby" Corbató, credited with inventing the computer password, passed away in Massachusetts at the age of 93. Corbató led the development of the Compatible Time-Sharing System (CTSS), regarded as one of the world's first operating systems. It allowed multiple people to use a computer at the same time.

headlines: 50 killed as monsoon rains cause floods, landslides in Nepal
text: Flash floods and landslides in Nepal triggered by monsoon rains have killed 50 people while 33 others have gone missing, officials said. Officials added that the Kosi river in eastern Nepal, which flows into the state of Bihar, had risen above the danger mark. Nepal's security forces have been deployed to assist ongoing search and rescue operations.

headlines: Will release tanker if Iran guarantees it won't travel to Syria: UK
text: British foreign minister Jeremy Hunt has said the UK would facilitate the release of the detained Iranian oil tanker if the Middle East nation gave guarantees it would not go to Syria. The tanker was seized last week by British Royal Marines off the coast of the British Mediterranean territory of Gibraltar on suspicion of violating sanctions against Syria.

headlines: Rising intolerance, hate crimes can damage India's growth: Godrej
text: Godrej Group Chairman Adi Godrej has said that rising intolerance, social instability, hate crimes, violence against women, moral policing, caste and religion-based violence can "seriously damage" India's economic growth. "It's not all a rosy picture now. One must not lose sight of the massive (impoverishment) plaguing our nation which can...prevent us from realising our potential," he added.

headlines: World Bank court orders Pak to pay $5.8 billion to Tethyan Copper
text: A World Bank arbitration court has ordered the Pakistani government to pay damages of $5.8 billion to Tethyan Copper. The company discovered vast mineral wealth more than a decade ago in Pakistan's Reko Diq. Tethyan said it had invested more than $220 million by the time Pakistan, in 2011, refused to grant them the mining lease needed to keep operating.

headlines: Ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More named USA's interim coach
text: Former India wicketkeeper Kiran More has been appointed as the interim coach of USA's senior national team. The 56-year-old has been named alongside advisors including James Pamment, the Mumbai Indians fielding coach, former Australia assistant coach David Saker and former Indian players Pravin Amre and Sunil Joshi. Gujarat-born More played 94 ODI's and 49 Test matches for India.

headlines: Microsoft to end Hearts, Spades net games for Windows XP, ME, 7
text: Microsoft is ending its internet games including Hearts, Spades, Checkers, Backgammon, MSN Go and Reversi from Windows version XP, ME and 7. While these Microsoft Internet Games services on Windows XP and ME will end on July 31, 2019, they'll end for Windows 7 on January 22, 2020. Microsoft said it's doing so to invest resources towards more recent technologies.

headlines: Human-mirroring robot mastered #BottleCapChallenge, says MIT
text: MIT's Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab (CSAIL) has shared a video of its RoboRaise robot, saying it has "mastered" a new skill, the bottle cap challenge. The RoboRaise mirrors a human by copying the movement through data collected from a person's hand. The muscle activity is monitored using electromyography (EMG) sensors on a user's biceps and triceps, MIT revealed.

headlines: 107 TMC, Cong, CPI(M) MLAs will join BJP in WB: Mukul Roy
text: BJP leader Mukul Roy on Saturday claimed that a total of 107 West Bengal MLAs from TMC, Congress and CPI(M) will join the saffron party soon. He further said, "We've their list prepared and they are in contact with us." However, on Saturday, nine councillors of the Kanchrapara Municipality, who had defected to the BJP, returned to the TMC.

headlines: India needs to create more 'agripreneurs': Anurag Thakur
text: The Minister of State for Finance Anurag Thakur has said the rural startup ecosystem needs to be strengthened to encourage rural startups by rural youth. "Agri-based e-commerce platforms, farm monitoring, linking with fintech will help youth become 'agripreneurs'," he added. Thakur was speaking at the National Bank For Agriculture & Rural Development's (NABARD) 38th Foundation Day's inauguration.

headlines: 50-yr-old teacher held for raping 4-yr-old in Punjab school
text: A 50-year-old school teacher was arrested on Saturday for allegedly raping a four-year-old girl inside the school premises in Punjab, police said. In her complaint, the victim's mother said that her daughter informed her that the teacher sexually assaulted her and that her blood-stained clothes were washed by a school maid. The police also arrested the maid for destroying evidence.

headlines: 5 arrested with illicit liquor in Bihar's Gaya
text: The Excise Department arrested five persons in possession of illicit liquor in separate cases in Bihar's Gaya on Saturday. The arrests were made as a part of a special drive conducted to curb the sale of illicit liquor in the region, police said. In addition to liquor, police have also seized three two-wheelers, two cars and mobile phones from them.

headlines: 60 cartons of illicit liquor seized in UP's Etah
text: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Saturday seized as many as 60 cartons of illicit liquor from Etah district. According to the police, the illicit liquor has been recovered from the smugglers during checking in Sakit area in the district while two accused smugglers fled the spot. On July 13, the Excise Department in Bihar arrested five people with illicit liquor.

headlines: 15 policemen injured in bus accident in Jharkhand
text: At least 15 policemen of the Jharkhand Armed Police were injured after the bus in which they were travelling met with an accident, officials said. The incident occurred when the bus driver lost control while taking a steep turn and dashed against the sidewalls of the rock, officials added. The policemen were rushed to a hospital for treatment.

headlines: Ravindra Jadeja was inconsolable after India's loss: Wife Rivaba
text: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba has revealed that her husband was inconsolable after losing the 2019 World Cup semi-final. "He kept saying, 'If I wouldn't have got out, we could've won'," she added. "When you lose a match after coming this close, it really hurts and it'll be a while before he comes to terms with it," she further said.

headlines: Dhoni dropped Yuvraj, Gambhir, Sehwag using his influence: Yograj
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh has said that MS Dhoni dropped Yuvraj Singh, Gautam Gambhir and Virender Sehwag using his influence. "He reasoned their fielding and fitness for dropping," he added. "Why did we lose 2015 World Cup semi-final? Because of Dhoni. Why did we lose 2019 World Cup semi-final? Again because of Dhoni," he further said.

headlines: Always admired your calmness and self belief: Gilchrist to Dhoni
text: Following India's 18-run defeat against New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup semi-final, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist tweeted a message for former India captain MS Dhoni. "Not sure if you are playing on but thanks @msdhoni You have given the game so much. Always admired your calmness and self belief," wrote Gilchrist.

headlines: Was Dhoni run-out on no-ball in World Cup semi-final vs New Zealand?
text: A small graphic showing six players outside the 30-yard circle ahead of delivery on which MS Dhoni got run-out against New Zealand semi-final had gone viral. However, only five fielders are allowed outside the circle in the third powerplay. The graphic was a broadcasting error as Lockie Ferguson had called up a fielder inside the circle before bowling the delivery.

headlines: It wasn't meant to be: David Warner after Australia's World Cup exit
text: After Australia lost to England in the 2019 World Cup semi-final, opener David Warner took to Instagram to share pictures from Australia's World Cup campaign and wrote, "It wasnt meant to be!" "We gave it our best but came up a little short. Will take some great memories away from this World Cup," he added.

headlines: First-ever image of quantum entanglement unveiled
text: Glasgow University physicists have unveiled the first-ever image capturing quantum entanglement, or "Bell entanglement", depicting two photons interacting and sharing physical states for an instant. A pair of photons were shot from a laser, split and sent on separate paths before being captured by a special camera. The image shows the photons mirroring each other to form a ring shape.

headlines: Man dies as Kolkata Metro takes off with his hand stuck in door
text: Sajal Kanjilal, a middle-aged man, died after his hand got stuck between the gates of a metro train in Kolkata on Saturday. Sajal was trying to board the overcrowded AC coach but the automatic door closed while his arm was inside the train. The man died after falling on the tracks after the first four bogies left the platform.

headlines: Man gives wife's police uniform to girlfriend to loot people, both held
text: A woman was arrested along with her boyfriend for committing robberies by impersonating a police officer in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The boyfriend had given a police uniform of his wife, who is posted as an inspector in Madhya Pradesh Police. Police also seized a fake police identity card from the accused.

headlines: Teen accused of making vulgar calls to 40 female Rajasthan professors
text: Jaipur Police on Friday detained a teenager from Haryana's Hisar for allegedly making lewd internet-generated calls to around 40 women professors of Rajasthan University. According to the police statement, the accused used the Wi-Fi connection of a university where his father is a professor, to make those lewd calls. He allegedly got the professors' phone numbers from Rajasthan University's website.

headlines: Head constable beaten to death with rods, sticks by mob in Rajasthan
text: Abdul Gani, a head constable posted at Bhim Police Station of Rajsamand district of Rajasthan was allegedly beaten to death by a mob on Saturday. The 45-year-old was allegedly attacked with sticks and rods in Brar area of Bhim, where he had gone to investigate a land dispute case. Gani's postmortem will be conducted on Sunday, a police official said.

headlines: Anand Mahindra confirms Super 30 teacher refused his donation offer
text: Billionaire Anand Mahindra has confirmed that Anand Kumar, Founder of 'Super 30' coaching programme, "courteously" declined his offer for financial support when he met him. "I remain an admirer of how he's changed the lives of so many," Mahindra added. "Our Prime Minister...tycoons like Mukesh Ambani or Anand Mahindra have offered donation but I haven't accepted anything," Kumar had said.

headlines: Those calling me chor are losers: Mallya on pic posted by Gayle
text: After being trolled over a picture with Chris Gayle, Vijay Mallya said those calling him chor (thief) are losers. "Ask...banks to take their full money that I'm offering for the past one year. Then decide on who is chor," he added. Mallya was recently granted permission by a London court to appeal the UK's decision to extradite him to India.

headlines: Weightlifter Pardeep wins gold; sets Commonwealth record
text: Indian weightlifter Pardeep Singh on Saturday set a new record and went on to win a gold medal at the Commonwealth Championships in Apia. Pardeep, who competed in the 109 kg category, broke the record in the clean and jerk category by lifting 202 kg. Two-time Commonwealth Games medallist Vikas Thakur won silver medal in the men's 96 kg event.

headlines: India women's football team jumps 6 spots to 57 in FIFA rankings
text: The Indian women's football team jumped six places to reach the 57th spot in the latest FIFA team rankings. Among the Asian countries, the Indian women's team is ranked 11th. The team, which is set to take part in the COTIF Cup in Spain later this month, won eight and lost five out of their 14 competitive matches since January.

headlines: Long loses wedding ring, key to New York in WC win celebrations
text: American footballer Allie Long was robbed of her wedding ring, cash and the key to New York while celebrating her team's FIFA Women's World Cup victory. Long and her teammates were attending an event in Los Angeles when her room in the Ritz-Carlton hotel was burgled. New York's Mayor Bill de Blasio had presented the ceremonial key to Long.

headlines: Apple Co-founder Wozniak criticises FB, asks people to get off it
text: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak has criticised Facebook and its photo-sharing platform Instagram for selling users' privacy to advertisers. He said that for some people, the benefits of Facebook are worth the loss of privacy. "To many like myself, my recommendation to most people is, you should figure out a way to get off Facebook," he added.

headlines: So much to learn from you: Vadra praises Rahul as youth icon
text: Businessman Robert Vadra on Saturday praised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, saying, "There's so much to learn from you." He added, "The Indian populace, which comprises 65% of the young (under 45 years), looks up to you and other young leaders for direction." Vadra said he is with Rahul in service to the nation, which is bigger than any party post.

headlines: Probe launched into leak of emails in which UK envoy criticised Trump
text: The Metropolitan Police has launched a criminal investigation into the alleged leak of emails in which the UK's former ambassador to the US, Kim Darroch, had criticised US President Donald Trump's government. He'd called the Trump government "inept" and "incompetent". The alleged leak has "damaged UK international relations", Neil Basu, Assistant Commissioner of the Metropolitan Police, said.

headlines: Philippine President mocks Iceland, says people there 'eat ice'
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has mocked Iceland after the country led a UN resolution to investigate his war on drugs. "What's the problem of Iceland? You've too much ice and there is no clear day and night there...you can understand why there's no crime, no policeman either, and they just go about eating ice," he said about the Nordic country.

headlines: World no. 7 Halep beats 7-time champ Serena to win maiden Wimbledon
text: World number seven Simona Halep on Saturday defeated seven-time champion Serena Williams 6-2, 6-2 in the women's singles final to clinch her first-ever Wimbledon title. With this, the 27-year-old became the first Romanian to win the Wimbledon singles' title. Meanwhile, 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena has now lost each of her previous three Grand Slam finals.

headlines: Kangana gives 24-hour ultimatum to Journalists' Guild to withdraw ban
text: Actor Kangana Ranaut has sent a legal notice to Entertainment Journalists' Guild, demanding that the ban imposed on coverage of matters related to her be lifted within 24 hours. The Guild had boycotted Kangana Ranaut after she accused a journalist of "running a smear campaign" against her. Press Club of India had also backed Guilds decision to ban her.

headlines: Yuvraj, Kohli lend support to De Villiers over World Cup controversy
text: Cricketers Yuvraj Singh and Virat Kohli took to Instagram to lend support to ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers, who broke silence over 2019 World Cup selection controversy. "There was never a chance for SA in World Cup to win without you," wrote Yuvraj. "Seeing people enter your personal space has been sad to see and uncalled for," Kohli said.

headlines: Apple HQ valued at $4.17 bn; one of world's costliest buildings
text: Apple's doughnut-shaped headquarters in Cupertino, California, nicknamed 'spaceship', was valued at about $4.17 billion in a recent assessment, making it one of the world's most expensive buildings. The 2.8 million-square-foot headquarters was constructed for about $5 billion. Based on the valuation, Apple would be required to pay over $40 million in property taxes per year in California.

headlines: 5 more rebel MLAs move SC over Speaker not accepting resignations
text: Five more Karnataka Congress MLAs, who had submitted their resignations, approached the Supreme Court on Saturday against Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar for not accepting the resignations. The MLAs alleged they were "being forced to support the government on the threat of disqualification". Earlier, 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs had approached the top court, which'll continue hearing the matter on July 16.

headlines: Please practice how to wield broom in private: Omar to Hema Malini
text: Reacting to the video of BJP MP Hema Malini sweeping the Parliament premises for 'Swachh Bharat Mission', ex-J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah tweeted, "Ma'am, please practice how to wield the broom in private before your next photo op." "This technique you've employed won't contribute much to improving cleanliness in Mathura (or anywhere else for that matter)," he added.

headlines: Hafiz Saeed challenges terror financing cases against him in Pak
text: Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief and 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed and his aides have challenged the cases of terror financing against them in the Lahore High Court. "The Indian lobby made allegations against them (Saeed and others) that they are involved in Mumbai attacks but there is no such evidence," their petition read. They argued that they're not associated with Lashkar-e-Taiba.

headlines: Sleep with loaded gun: Journo after she accused Trump of sex assault
text: Journalist E Jean Carroll, who accused US President Donald Trump of sexually assaulting her, has said that she sleeps with a loaded gun by the bed, following the accusation. Carroll added that she has received death threats on social media and now stays offline. She said she decided to come forward with the accusation after the #MeToo movement gathered prominence.

headlines: Foreign investors ask India to reconsider high taxes after Budget
text: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have urged Indian government to reconsider its decision to increase taxes on them. Budget documents revealed the new tax will apply not just for individuals but also for FPIs setup as trusts to invest in Indian markets. About 40% of roughly 9,400 FPIs are reportedly registered as trusts while the rest are registered as corporates.

headlines: My daughter doesn't consider me 'woke' enough: Raghuram Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has said that he would call himself a feminist but his daughter feels that he falls short on many dimensions. "There is this term 'woke' that is very popular these days, but she doesn't consider me woke enough," the 56-year-old said. "So, I have to pay attention to what she has to say," he added.

headlines: If my replacement needs 1 yr to be mentored, I don't want them: Puri
text: HDFC Bank Managing Director Aditya Puri, who retires in October 2020, on Friday said that his successor should be able to learn his job in 15 days. "If my replacement wants to be mentored for one year, I don't want that replacement," he said. Puri is India's longest-serving bank chief, having helmed HDFC Bank since its inception in 1994.

headlines: Would like to have Rahane at the No. 4 slot: Ex-BCCI Secretary
text: Former BCCI Secretary Sanjay Jagdale said that he would like to have Ajinkya Rahane at the number four slot in the Indian batting lineup. "[H]e has been performing well outside the sub-continent. So why can't you have somebody like Rahane just to ensure that you play out the 50 overs when situations get tight?" Jagdale added.

headlines: One of my favourite matches ever: Federer on win vs Nadal
text: Speaking after his win over Rafael Nadal in 2019's Wimbledon semi-final, Swiss tennis player Roger Federer said, "It's definitely going to go down as one of my favourite matches to look back on because it's Rafa, it's at Wimbledon." This was the pair's 40th career meeting to move into his 31st Grand Slam final where he will face Novak Djokovic.

headlines: Kane Williamson is New Zealand's greatest: Ian Smith
text: Kiwi commentator Ian Smith praised New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's batting and his leadership quality, terming the 28-year-old 'New Zealand's greatest player'. "I think even Martin [Crowe] would have acknowledged that Kane is pretty special, and it's hard to deny that," Smith said about the late former New Zealand captain Martin Crowe.

headlines: I don't feel sorry for Rayudu, Karthik: Former BCCI Secretary
text: Speaking about India's team selection for the World Cup 2019, former BCCI Secretary Sanjay Jagdale said, "I don't feel sorry for Rayudu. Rayudu, Karthik; they had enough chances." "I feel sorry for somebody like Manish Pandey. Shreyas Iyer, too, was unfortunate... They were backing the wrong players," Jagdale added about the Indian team selection.

headlines: US court dismisses Oracle lawsuit over $10-bn Pentagon contract
text: A US federal court has dismissed Oracle's lawsuit against the US Department of Defence's decade-long $10-billion JEDI cloud contract. The lawsuit had alleged the Pentagon's contract with a single-vendor award was unfair and illegal. Oracle, which didn't meet the criteria for a bid, had claimed the contract violates federal procurement laws and is 'unfairly tainted' by conflicts of interests.

headlines: Microsoft may make Windows 10 password-free by 2020
text: Microsoft has started testing a way to sign in to its Windows 10 operating system without using a password, which it may reportedly enforce by 2020. The software giant is planning to replace passwords with face recognition, PIN or fingerprint authentication over the relatively high security offered by these methods. The test presently has the password-less method as optional.

headlines: Samsung working on foldable AR glasses, suggests patent
text: South Korean technology giant Samsung has filed a patent for foldable Augmented Reality (AR) glasses with thick frames to accommodate its electronic components. The current design, as explained by Samsung, is an eyepiece that automatically switches on whenever it's unfolded. Samsung is planning to use magnetic sensors to restrict the glasses from being folded unintentionally.

headlines: $73-million NASA contract to 3D print spacecraft parts in orbit
text: NASA has awarded an over $73-million contract to Silicon Valley-based startup Made In Space to demonstrate the ability of a small spacecraft, Archinaut One, to 3D print spacecraft components in low-Earth orbit. The spacecraft will print two beams extending 32 feet out from each side of the spacecraft, NASA said. It could launch as early as 2022, it added.

headlines: Politician, journo among 26 killed in terror attack on Somalia hotel
text: A local politician, a journalist, three Kenyans, two Americans and one Briton were among 26 people killed in a terror attack on a hotel in Somalia, officials said. Gunmen stormed the hotel in the Kismayo city after a suicide bomber rammed a car loaded with explosives into the building on Friday. Al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

headlines: Bitcoin miners steal $3-million electricity in China; 22 arrested
text: East China police have busted a ring of illegal bitcoin miners who stole nearly $3-million worth of electricity for mining the digital currency, state news agency Xinhua reported. The police found the criminal gang had rented nine factories with installed mining equipment after a two-month investigation and arrested 22 people. They also confiscated around 4,000 mining devices.

headlines: FTC approves $5B Facebook fine; its largest on a tech firm: Reports
text: The US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has approved a roughly $5-billion fine on Facebook to settle its investigation on privacy leaks by the social media giant, reports claimed. If approved by the US Justice Department, the fine would be the largest-ever by FTC on a technology firm. Facebook's stocks rose by about 1.8% after reports of the settlement.

headlines: Trying to stay in Cong, need some time to decide: Rebel K'taka MLA
text: After Congress leader DK Shivakumar and Karnataka Deputy CM G Parameshwara visited rebel MLA MTB Nagaraj's house on Saturday, Nagaraj said, "I'm trying to stay back in [Congress]. I resigned because I had differences." He further said he has asked the party to give him some time as he needs to discuss the issue with another rebel MLA K Sudhakar.

headlines: Rajasthan govt can fall at anytime: BJP MLA amid K'taka crisis
text: Amid crisis over Congress MLAs resigning in Karnataka and Goa, Rajasthan BJP MLA Kalicharan Saraf said, "The infighting between (CM Ashok) Gehlot and (Sachin) Pilot has endangered the government and it can fall anytime." Another BJP MLA Ashok Lahoti said, "There'll be political instability in Rajasthan in two months." Congress' Shakuntala Rawat rejected the claims, calling it "BJP's pipe dreams".

headlines: No intrusion by Chinese soldiers in Ladakh's Demchok: Army Chief
text: Amid reports of some Chinese soldiers crossing the Line of Actual Control on Dalai Lama's birthday on July 6, Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said, "There is no intrusion." He added, "Celebrations were going on our side by our Tibetans in Demchok sector...Some Chinese also came to see what was happening. But there have been no intrusions. Everything's normal."

headlines: Shabaash: Smriti Irani shares meme on working weekends
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday took to Instagram to share a meme on working weekends. The meme shows a picture of Aamir Khan from movie 'Dangal', saying, "Shabaash" and her caption read, "When you tell the weekend...agle hafte aana aaj busy hu (come next week, today I'm busy)." Replying to her post, Ekta Kapoor wrote, "Waah wat weekend!"

headlines: 3 dead in massive fire at rubber factory in Delhi's Jhilmil
text: At least three people died after a massive fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Jhilmil industrial area on Saturday, Chief fire officer Atul Garg said. A team of 26 fire tenders was rushed to the spot to extinguish the fire. The factory is reportedly housed in a building that consists of a ground floor and three upper floors.

headlines: Out on bail in murder case, man beheads 2 kids in Jharkhand
text: A 35-year-old man was arrested for allegedly beheading an 11-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl in Latehar district, the Jharkhand police said on Friday. The accused, who reportedly showed signs of mental illness, had allegedly killed his brother-in-law and uncle in 2009 and was currently on bail. Meanwhile, the bodies of the two children were handed over to their families.

headlines: Brazil President Bolsonaro invites son to be ambassador to US
text: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has invited his son Eduardo to become the country's next ambassador to the US. Denying that it was an act of nepotism, Bolsonaro said, "It's not up to me, it's up to my son to accept and then he'll be subject to Senate approval." Eduardo Bolsonaro is currently serving as a congressman.

headlines: India's overseas debt plan has enormous risks and no benefit: Rajan
text: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that India's plan to issue bonds overseas has enormous risks but no real benefit. Rajan added India should worry about short-term "faddish investors, buying when India is hot, and dumping us when it's not". He said the lower dollar interest rate is offset in the long run by higher principal repayments as the rupee depreciates.

headlines: 60 birds fall from sky in suspected poisoning in Australia
text: Nearly 60 birds have died after falling from the sky in a suspected case of poisoning in Adelaide, Australia. Most of the birds killed were long-billed corellas, which is a protected species. "They couldn't fly any more, they were bleeding out of their mouths," Sarah King, the founder of Casper's Bird Rescue, said.

headlines: Will be appointed minister when they need me: MP BSP MLA
text: Replying to a question on whether she is unhappy for not being made a minister in the Madhya Pradesh government, BSP MLA Ramabai said, "They will do it when they will need me." She added, "CM Kamal Nath is a good person...Despite me being ill-treated I am with him." Earlier, she'd claimed she was offered a ministerial berth by BJP.

headlines: Karnataka rebel MLAs visit Sai Baba temple in Shirdi
text: The rebel Karnataka MLAs on Saturday visited Sai Baba temple in Shirdi. The rebel MLAs are staying at a hotel in Mumbai after resigning and withdrawing support to the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in Karnataka. On Thursday, the rebel MLAs met the Karnataka Assembly Speaker to submit their resignations in Bengaluru but returned to the hotel the same day.

headlines: 2 die, several injured after bus gutted in fire in Haryana
text: At least two people died and several others were injured after a double-decker bus caught fire in Haryana's Kurukshetra. "At least 14-15 people were admitted to our hospital, two among them were critically injured and the rest were given proper treatment," a hospital official said. On Thursday, five people were killed in a car accident near Punjab's Jalandhar.

headlines: 3 people murdered inside building compound in Navi Mumbai
text: Three people were found murdered inside a building compound in Navi Mumbai on Saturday morning, said the police. The deceased have been identified as 20-year-old Irshad Sheikh, 14-year-old Naushad Sheikh and 28-year-old Rajesh. The deceased used to work in the scrap business and the police suspect that they were killed with a sharp weapon.

headlines: Surgical strikes showed India's political resolve: Army Chief
text: Army Chief General Bipin Rawat said that surgical strikes after the 2016 Uri attack and 2019 Pulwama attack have demonstrated India's political resolve against terror. Speaking at an event on the 20th year of the Kargil conflict, he added that any act of terror will not go "unpunished". He said any misadventure will be repelled with a "punitive response".

headlines: US Labour Secretary resigns amid row over Epstein sex crimes case
text: US' Labour Secretary Alexander Acosta has resigned amid controversy about his handling of a 2008 sex crimes case involving multimillionaire Jeffrey Epstein when he was a US attorney. Epstein was jailed for 13 months, although he was allowed to leave during the day to work at his office. Acosta is accused of not notifying Epstein's victims of the arrangement.

headlines: Upskill with the Cybersecurity program from Stanford faculty
text: According to a NASSCOM report, 1 million cybersecurity professionals would be needed in India by 2020. Working professionals can meet this demand with Stanford Center's Professional Development's Advanced Computer Security Program, delivered & supported by Great Learning. The 6-month online program delivers industry-relevant skills through project-based and mentor-driven learning. Participants will receive a certificate from Stanford Center for Professional Development.

headlines: John Cena shares meme showing Shilpa as ex-WWE wrestler, she responds
text: John Cena on Friday shared a meme, which shows actress Shilpa Shetty's face morphed onto the body of former WWE wrestler Steve Austin, better known by the ring name 'Stone Cold'. "Stone Cold Shilpa Shetty Kundra", the caption in the meme reads. Shilpa reposted the meme and wrote, "This is hilarious... I certainly 'Didn't SEE' this coming @johncena."

headlines: Audience didn't like 'Kalank' as it was a bad film: Varun Dhawan
text: Talking about his film 'Kalank', actor Varun Dhawan said, "It (Kalank) was not accepted by the audience because it was a bad film and somewhere we all failed collectively." Asserting it was wrong to blame just the director and producer of the film, Varun added, "Being a part of the team, I will take part of the blame as well."

headlines: Dubbed a scene in Lion King twice as Aryan and I sounded alike: SRK
text: Talking about dubbing along with his son Aryan Khan for the Hindi version of 'The Lion King', Shah Rukh Khan said he had to re-dub a scene as they both "sounded too much like each other". He further said he never thought they sounded alike. "It was a sweet thing for a father to know...extremely special and heart-warming," he added.

headlines: Shocked by abusive language for media: Press Club criticises Kangana
text: Press Club of India has condemned Kangana Ranaut's argument with a journalist at 'Judgementall Hai Kya' promotional event. Reacting to her video calling journalists "deshdrohi", it said, the club is shocked with the actress using "uncivilised, uncultured, filthy and abusive language" against media persons. The club extended support to Entertainment Journalists' Guild who decided to boycott her.

headlines: MS Dhoni may join BJP after retirement: Ex-Union Minister
text: Amid speculations on MS Dhoni's retirement from cricket, BJP leader and former Union Minister Sanjay Paswan said the cricketer may join BJP after retirement. "Dhoni is my friend, he is a player of world fame and there have been discussions on bringing him into the party fold," he stated. The decision will be taken only after his retirement, Paswan added.

headlines: Confident of winning trust vote, BJP has black sheep: Siddaramaiah
text: After Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy called for a floor test amid the ongoing political crisis in the Congress-JD(S) coalition government, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said, "We are confident. That is why we are moving a vote of confidence motion." He added, "The BJP is afraid because they know there are black sheep in their party."

headlines: VW to put $2.6 bn in Ford-backed self-driving startup Argo
text: German multinational automaker Volkswagen is investing $2.6 billion in capital and assets into Ford-backed self-driving startup Argo AI, at a valuation of over $7 billion, the startup revealed. The deal is part of a broader alliance between the German automaker and US-based Ford, which covers autonomous and electric vehicles. Ford had invested $1 billion in Argo AI two years ago.

headlines: MP govt transfers police dogs, handlers; 3 dogs shifted to CM's house
text: Madhya Pradesh government has issued an order transferring 46 police dog handlers across the state along with their canines. Handlers of tracker, sniffer and narco dogs from 23 Battalion Dog Squad have been given new postings in different districts, it stated. Three sniffers, one each from Chhindwara, Satna and Betul, have been shifted to CM Kamal Nath's house in Bhopal.

headlines: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh's 75-yr-old wife faints at cleanup drive
text: Patiala MP and Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh's wife, Preneet Kaur, fainted at the plastic cleanup campaign 'Swachhta Shramdan' drive in her constituency on Saturday, officials said. She later got her blood pressure checked, which a doctor said was fine. "I urge all of you to join this movement and help us make our surroundings cleaner," she tweeted.

headlines: Pak removes pro-Khalistani from Kartarpur panel after India objects
text: Ahead of the second round of India-Pakistan meeting on Kartarpur Corridor on Sunday, Pakistan's federal cabinet removed pro-Khalistani leader Gopal Singh Chawla, a Pakistan Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (PSGPC) member, from his post. The cabinet reconstituted PSGPC, thereby dropping Chawla from the panel. The talk was originally scheduled for April 2 but India objected to Chawla being part of the project.

headlines: Student stabbed at Kerala University campus, triggering protests
text: A third-year BA Political Science student named Akhil was stabbed inside the Kerala University campus in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday. Akhil and his assailants reportedly belonged to Students' Federation of India, which is a student organisation affiliated to CPI(M). Following the incident, Akhil was rushed to the hospital while students held protests demanding justice.

headlines: MP govt issues transfer order for Panchayat head instead of secy
text: A transfer order was released for Panchayat Sarpanch instead of the Panchayat Secretary by administration in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district. The state's Rural Development Minister Kamleshwar Patel called it a "clerical mistake" at lower level. Notably, Sarpanch is elected by the people and is not entitled to be transferred by the state government.

headlines: Indian pilots taking to Rafale amazing: French Air Force Chief
text: Following the Indo-French Garuda VI exercise held at a French air base, French Air Force Chief of Staff General Philippe Lavigne said, "Indian pilots taking to Rafale jets during the Indo-French Garuda VI exercise was amazing." Lavigne added, "After two or three flights, it feels very comfortable and the feedback I've gotten from the squadron says 'Wow'."

headlines: US officer mistakes 17-yr-old girl's fake gun as real, shoots her dead
text: US' California police on Friday released body-camera footage showing an officer shooting dead a 17-year-old girl after he mistakes her fake gun as real. The video shows the girl pointing the fake gun at the officer after he chased and stopped her from driving her vehicle at high speed. The video shows her pleading for help after being shot.

headlines: Video shows Trump kissing ex-aide; his team says it 'wasn't forceful'
text: US President Donald Trump's legal team shared a three-year-old video of him kissing ex-campaign aide Alva Johnson, who accused Trump of kissing her forcibly and without consent. Trump's lawyer said the video shows an "innocent interaction that's mutual and not forcible". However, Johnson's lawyer said that the video shows exactly what his client alleged "an unwanted kiss from Defendant Trump".

headlines: IBM patents smartwatch that can transform into a tablet
text: American multinational IT giant IBM has secured a patent for a smartwatch that can be transformed into a tablet. IBM, in the patent, explained this may be achieved as "a set of auxiliary display panels may be packed in layers behind a primary display panel." The patent revealed the inventor of the technology as Ranjeeth Pasupathi from Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu.

headlines: Trinamool Congress leader shot dead in Bengal's Murshidabad
text: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader was shot dead by some unidentified assailants in West Bengal's Murshidabad district on Friday, police said. The leader was travelling in his car when miscreants surrounded the vehicle, forced him to alight and fatally shot him. The police later reached the site of the crime and took possession of the body.

headlines: 6 killed, over 4 lakh affected due to floods in Assam
text: Six people died and over four lakh have been affected as the Assam flood situation worsened with rivers flowing above the danger level, officials said. NDRF and SDRF teams have been deployed and temporary relief camps have been set up to shelter flood-hit people, officials added. CM Sarbananda Sonowal instructed the officials to step up operations to rescue flood-affected people.

headlines: Gadkari inaugurates underpass to ease traffic to Delhi airport
text: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated a three-lane underpass at Parade Road junction near Manekshaw Centre on the Dhaula Kuan-Airport stretch on National Highway-8. According to officials from the National Highways Authority of India, travel from the Delhi airport to Dhaula Kuan will become signal-free with the opening of the underpass.

headlines: 2 arrested for allegedly poaching blackbuck in Maharashtra
text: The Maharashtra Police on Friday arrested two people for allegedly poaching a blackbuck in Aurangabad. "We received a tip-off that a few people were planning to cook the meat of blackbuck and have a party," an official said. The police recovered carcass of the blackbuck, sharp knife and liquor bottles after reaching the spot, while three accused fled the scene.

headlines: State Bank of India MD Anshula Kant named MD and CFO of World Bank
text: State Bank of India Managing Director (MD) Anshula Kant has been appointed as the MD and Chief Financial Officer of the World Bank Group. Kant is a graduate in Economics Honours from Lady Shri Ram College for Women and holds a masters degree in economics from Delhi School of Economics. The 58-year-old joined SBI as a probationary officer in 1983.

headlines: Roger Federer defeats Rafael Nadal to reach his 12th Wimbledon final
text: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated his long-time rival Rafael Nadal in their first meeting at Wimbledon after 11 years to reach the final for the 12th time. The 37-year-old won the match with a scoreline of 7-6(7-3), 1-6, 6-3, 6-4 in 3 hours and 2 minutes. Federer will face world number one Novak Djokovic in the final on Sunday.

headlines: Badshah's 'Paagal' gets 75 mn views in 24 hrs, breaks world record
text: The video of rapper Badshah's new song 'Paagal' has become the most watched video on YouTube in 24 hours, after crossing 75 million views in a day. It broke the previous record set by K-Pop group BTS' video of 'Boy With Luv', which received 74.6 million views. Paagal, released on July 10, has received over 82 million views.

headlines: Had dent on my back, never felt pain like that: Kim on Met dress
text: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian revealed in an interview that she got indentations on her back and her stomach due to the dress she wore at the 2019 Met Gala. Kim added that she had to take breathing lessons in order to wear the dress. "I have never felt pain like that in my life," Kardashian further said.

headlines: Vivek posts meme on Indian fans after World Cup exit, gets criticised
text: Vivek Oberoi has been criticised on Twitter for posting a GIF, captioned, "This is what happened to Indian fans in WC semi-finals!" In the GIF, a man can be seen advancing towards a woman for a hug but she ignores him and hugs another man. "Mr Oberoi, be mature otherwise people will always take you lightly," a user tweeted.

headlines: Heartbreaking that our dreams have come to an end: KL Rahul
text: Following Team India's World Cup exit, KL Rahul took to Instagram to express his gratitude to the fans. "Heartbreaking that our dreams have come to an end. As a team and as a nation we've stood strong together through the last 6 weeks. Big thank you and lots of love to everyone," Rahul wrote.

headlines: Who were India's top run-scorers, wicket-takers in 2019 World Cup?
text: Rohit Sharma top-scored for India in 2019 World Cup with 648 runs in nine innings, while captain Virat Kohli followed him with 443 runs. KL Rahul ended as India's third highest-scorer with 361 runs. Pacer Jasprit Bumrah took 18 wickets in nine matches to finish as India's highest wicket-taker. He was followed by pacer Mohammad Shami (14 wickets, four matches).

headlines: Gilchrist calls Vaughan idiot for mocking Australia's bonding session
text: Ex-Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist called ex-England captain Michael Vaughan an "idiot" after the latter suggested that Australia should try bowling barefoot against England. Vaughan had made the comment mocking Australia over their team bonding session wherein they had walked barefoot in the stadium ahead of the semi-final. Responding to Gilchrist, Vaughan shared a GIF showing bare feet.

headlines: Why even talk about MS Dhonis retirement: Javed Akhtar
text: Reacting to speculation about MS Dhoni's retirement, lyricist Javed Akhtar said there's still a lot of cricket left in ex-India captain. "As a middle-order batsman or a wicketkeeper, MS Dhoni's totally dependable and trustworthy. Virat is graceful enough to accept that Dhoni's understanding of game is an advantage for the team...Why even talk about his retirement?" he tweeted.

headlines: Casio sues Snapdeal over alleged sale of its fake products
text: Japanese consumer electronics giant Casio has sued Gurugram-based e-commerce startup Snapdeal and sellers on the platform over an alleged sale of its counterfeit products. The Tis Hazari court has restrained Snapdeal and the other accused parties from selling, displaying and advertising goods with the Casio trademark. "Casio has...extended its battle against the fakes on the internet," Casio said.

headlines: 15 dead, 133 buildings collapse in 4 days due to rain in UP
text: As many as 15 people have lost their lives and 133 buildings have collapsed from July 9 to 12 due to rain-related incidents in 14 districts of Uttar Pradesh. According to official data, 23 animals were also killed in the affected districts, which include Prayagraj and Gorakhpur. Heavy rainfall in East Uttar Pradesh is expected on Saturday, according to IMD.

headlines: SC refuses to stay installation of CCTV cameras in Delhi govt schools
text: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to put a stay on the installation of CCTV cameras in government schools in Delhi and live-stream the footage to students' parents. The court's order came on a PIL wherein the petitioner argued the installation would violate the fundamental right to privacy of students, especially girls, as well as female teachers.

headlines: SC allows calling off rescue ops for trapped miners in Meghalaya
text: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Meghalaya government to call off rescue operations to retrieve the remains of 13 coal miners who were trapped in an illegally operated rat-hole coal mine in December 2018. Families of the trapped miners had given their consent to call off the rescue operations in May. Two bodies had been recovered so far.

headlines: Child Sex Ratio has declined in 21 states/UTs: Smriti Irani
text: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani in Lok Sabha on Friday stated that as per the Census 2011, the Child Sex Ratio (CSR) has declined in 21 states and Union Territories in comparison of Census 2001. She further stated that India's Sex Ratio at Birth (SRB) has increased from 923 to 931 between 2015-16 and 2018-19.

headlines: 'Paan ki dukaan' has done well: IndiGo's Bhatia responds to Gangwal
text: Reacting to IndiGo Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal's comment that a "paan ki dukaan" would've handled things better than IndiGo, fellow Co-Founder Rahul Bhatia said, "Paan Ki Dukaan has apparently done well and continues to do well." "Gangwal's allegations about lack of corporate governance are much ado about nothing," Bhatia added. Gangwal asked SEBI to take away Bhatia's "unusual" controlling rights.

headlines: Sports Minister takes up #BottleCapChallenge to promote fitness
text: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju took to social media to share a video of himself attempting the viral #BottleCapChallenge. "Say no to drugs and stay fit. Take #BottleCapChallenge into positive stride", Rijiju wrote while sharing his video. The challenge requires one to open a bottle's cap using their foot in the middle of a kick without knocking the bottle down.

headlines: FIFA doubles ban to 10 games for racist behaviour
text: Football's governing body FIFA is set to double the minimum ban for player incidents involving racism to 10 games. Additionally, a football match will be forfeited by the team if their supporters are found to be guilty of racist and other discriminatory behaviours. FIFA also expanded the scope of what is to be considered discriminatory behaviour.

headlines: 'Robot umpires' make debut at Atlantic League All-Star game
text: A "robot" umpire made its debut officiating at the Atlantic League All-Star Game. The home plate umpire Brian deBrauwere had a phone in his back pocket that was connected to the ball-tracking 'TrackMan' system and a headphone, through which deBrauwere heard the system's calls and signalled accordingly. The umpire can override the system if he disagrees with it.

headlines: Lucky to get direct hit: Guptill on Dhoni run-out in semi
text: New Zealand opener Martin Guptill, who ran MS Dhoni out in 2019 World Cup semi-final, said, "Lucky enough to get a direct hit from out there, lucky...he was out of his ground." Guptill hit the stumps directly from short fine leg area when Dhoni was trying to take a second run. India required 25 runs when Dhoni got out.

headlines: Govt sold driving licence data to private companies: Surjewala
text: Citing a news report, Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said that the government has sold people's driving licence data to private companies. He added that the privacy of citizens has become a "severe casualty" under the BJP government. Surjewala said, "Not only Big Brother is watching, but his crony friends are too!"

headlines: Maoists set ablaze 16 vehicles, assault 6 in Jharkhand
text: Maoists set ablaze 16 vehicles at a railway siding and also assaulted six labourers in Jharkhand's Latehar, police said on Friday. The denial of levy from the area is said to be the reason for the attack as coal transportation is done from the railway siding. Following the attack, coal transportation has been stopped from the railway siding.

headlines: 13-year-old suicide bomber kills 5 at wedding in Afghanistan
text: At least five people were killed and 40 others were injured after a 13-year-old suicide bomber blew himself up at a wedding in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province on Friday, officials said. The wedding was organised by Malik Toor, commander of a pro-government militia. Toor died in the attack and was likely the target of the bomber.

headlines: Stupid stories: Boney on IPS officer implying Sridevi was murdered
text: Producer Boney Kapoor has reacted to IPS officer Rishiraj Singh's insinuation that Kapoor's wife Sridevi was murdered. "Such stupid stories keep coming. This is somebody's figment of imagination," he said. Singh claimed that a forensics expert friend thought Sridevi didn't die of accidental drowning in her bathtub as according to him, a person will never drown in one-foot deep water.

headlines: Rashid named Afghanistan captain across formats, Asghar his deputy
text: Twenty-year-old Rashid Khan has been appointed as captain of Afghanistan across all formats, while Asghar Afghan, who was sacked as captain ahead of World Cup, has been named as Rashid's deputy. Ahead of the 2019 World Cup, the Afghanistan Cricket Board had replaced Asghar Afghan as captain with Gulbadin Naib in ODIs, Rashid in T20Is and Rahmat Shah in Tests.

headlines: Roy calls umpire's decision 'f***ing embarrassing', fined 30% fee
text: England opener Jason Roy was fined 30% of his match fee after he argued with the umpires and refused to leave the pitch after being wrongly given out in England's 2019 semi-final victory over Australia. The 28-year-old was heard yelling, "That's f***ing embarrassing," to umpires. He was given caught behind out despite the gloves and bat not touching the ball.

headlines: Ticketless Team India stranded in England until World Cup final
text: After being knocked out by New Zealand from 2019 World Cup in semi-final, India players have been left stranded in England till July 14 as team management failed to procure tickets immediately. The players will arrive in India in batches as and when they get tickets, an official said. India-New Zealand semi-final took place on July 9 and 10.

headlines: Djokovic reaches his 6th Wimbledon final, to face Federer or Nadal
text: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated Bautista Agut 6-2, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 in two hours and 48 minutes on Friday to reach his sixth Wimbledon final. The 32-year-old will next face eight-time Wimbledon champion Roger Federer or two-time champion Rafael Nadal. The final will be Djokovic's 25th in Grand Slam history.

headlines: Nagaland Police personnel march to 'Dhal Gaya Din' song
text: A video of Nagaland Police personnel marching to the tunes of the Bollywood song 'Dhal Gaya Din' has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, Sports and Youth Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said that "anything from (North East) means friendship and happy memories". "Aage jaake kya karega...peeche mur," he further wrote in a tweet.

headlines: Don't play with fire: China warns US over Taiwan
text: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi has warned the US not to "play with fire" after the US approved a potential arms sale of an estimated $2.2 billion to Taiwan. The deal is for 108 Abrams tanks, 250 Stinger missiles and related equipment. China claims Taiwan as part of its territory, but the island has been autonomously ruled since 1949.

headlines: Brazil seeks WTO panel over India's sugar subsidies
text: Brazil on Thursday said it had asked the World Trade Organization (WTO) to establish a panel aimed at resolving its dispute over India's sugar subsidies. Australia and Guatemala also lodged complaints against India on Thursday, Brazil said. The South American nation argues that Indian subsidies are distorting global sugar markets causing significant losses for Brazilian exporters.

headlines: NCLAT to hear Dutch court administrator in Jet insolvency case
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has agreed to hear a petition by a Dutch court-appointed administrator in the Jet Airways insolvency case and asked SBI to respond. It also stayed parts of NCLT order which declared the insolvency proceedings in the Netherlands court null and void. Meanwhile, the administrator agreed not to sell a confiscated Jet Airways plane.

headlines: India's retail inflation hits eight-month high of 3.18% in June
text: India's retail inflation hit an eight-month high in June on higher food prices but stayed below the RBI's medium-term target of 4% for an eleventh straight month. Annual retail inflation in June was 3.18%, up from 3.05% the previous month. Food prices grew 2.17% during the month compared to 1.83% in May.

headlines: Former England striker Peter Crouch retires from football at 38
text: Former England football team striker Peter Crouch has retired from football at the age of 38. Crouch had made his debut with QPR before going on to play for nine clubs, including Liverpool, Portsmouth, Tottenham and Stoke. Notably, Crouch holds the record for the most headed goals in the history of the English Premier League.

headlines: BCCI chief praises Team India for WC semi performance
text: BCCI president CK Khanna on Thursday praised Indian cricket team for their 2019 World Cup semi-final performance saying, "It was a tough game...our boys played their hearts out. Each player tried really hard." "Team...played brilliant cricket in league phase...Congratulations to New Zealand team," he added. India crashed out after losing to New Zealand by 18 runs.

headlines: Hamilton unhappy British GP being held same day as WC final
text: Lewis Hamilton stated that he is unhappy with the scheduling of the upcoming British Grand Prix, which is scheduled for the same day as the World Cup 2019 and Wimbledon 2019 finals. "[S]uch a special weekend needs the focus of the whole country. People will be switching between channels on Sunday not knowing what to watch," Hamilton said.

headlines: Apple suspends development of its AR/VR headset: Report
text: Apple has reportedly suspended the development of its head-mounted display (HMD) AR/VR headsets. The technology giant has already disbanded its team for the development of AR/VR HMDs, which has now been transferred to other product lines, as per a report. Earlier, reports had claimed Apple could launch its AR/VR glasses as early as 2020.

headlines: Goa CM unhappy with ministers taking people for granted: Dy Speaker
text: Discussing the possibility of a Cabinet reshuffle in Goa, Deputy Speaker Michael Lobo on Friday said, "The Chief Minister will do the correction that is needed." Lobo added, "The Chief Minister said he was unhappy with the functioning of certain ministers as they were taking people for granted. They were acting as if they were the government."

headlines: TDP's Legislative Council member Annam Prabhakar joins BJP
