text: TDP's Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council member Annam Satish Prabhakar on Friday joined BJP in the presence of its working president Jagat Prakash Nadda. Prabhakar had recently resigned from TDP citing his failure to win Bapatla constituency in two consecutive Assembly elections. He thanked TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu for giving him the opportunity to contest from Bapatla.

headlines: CollegeDekho acquires overseas admission consulting firm SFS
text: Gurugram-based edtech startup CollegeDekho has acquired New Delhi-based overseas admission consulting firm Scholarship Facilitation Services (SFS) for an undisclosed amount. Started in 2012 by Manik Kubba, Umesh Sharma and Vikaas Wahi, SFS offers need-based, budget and university-based admission counselling. CollegeDekho was founded by Ruchir Arora, Rohit Saha, Saurabh Jain and Rajiv Singh.

headlines: Mysterious black hole disc found 130 mn light-years away
text: Astronomers using Hubble Space Telescope have found a thin disc of material encircling a supermassive black hole at the heart of a spiral galaxy 130 million light-years away. Astronomers said the presence of the black hole disc in "such a low-luminosity active galaxy" was surprising. The disc's material was measured to be spinning at over 10% the speed of light.

headlines: Man held for posing as PMO official in Delhi
text: A man, impersonating an official of Prime Minister's Office (PMO), was arrested by the Delhi Police on Friday. The man visited a showroom in Delhi on Thursday and tried posing as a PMO official to seek favours and threatened the salesmen. The man was taken into custody following a complaint by the manager of the showroom.

headlines: 35 cattle found dead at temporary shelter in UP's Prayagraj
text: Around 35 cattle were found dead at a temporary cow shelter home in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Prayagraj District Magistrate said, "Prima facie it appears that 35 cattle have died due to lightning." The incident came days after CM Yogi Adityanath directed officials to ensure that the cow sheds are self-reliant and all the facilities to protect them are available there.

headlines: Vikas Swarup appointed Secretary of Overseas Indian Affairs
text: India's current High Commissioner to Canada Vikas Swarup has been appointed as Secretary in the Consular, Passport, Visa and Overseas Indian Affairs division, with effect from August 1. The 1986-batch IFS officer takes over from Sanjiv Arora, who was appointed to the post earlier this year. Swarup is a former spokesperson of the External Affairs Ministry.

headlines: 4 lakh people volunteer to storm Area 51 'to see aliens'
text: Over 4 lakh people have signed up for a Facebook event to "storm" Area 51 in Nevada, US, to "see aliens". There have been several conspiracy theories related to Area 51, most importantly those pertaining to the US government's cover-up of secrets related to UFOs and aliens. In 2013, the US government acknowledged Area 51 as a military site.

headlines: AB de Villiers breaks silence on World Cup selection controversy
text: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers took to Twitter to break his silence on 2019 World Cup selection controversy. The 35-year-old said that he "made no demands at all" to overturn retirement and did not force his way into World Cup squad. Adding that he was unfairly described as arrogant, selfish and indecisive, De Villiers said, "My conscience is clear."

headlines: Singer R Kelly arrested over 13 charges including child pornography
text: R&B singer R Kelly has been arrested on 13 federal charges, including child pornography and obstruction of justice, in US' Chicago. This was the second time this year that the Grammy winner was arrested on the sex charges. In 2008, Kelly was acquitted of child pornography charges connected to a videotape of him allegedly having sex with an underage girl.

headlines: Google admits private conversations being accessed via Assistant
text: Google has admitted its contractors can listen to recordings of private conversations of users with its AI-based Assistant. This came after some of the recordings in the Dutch language were leaked. Google has said only 0.2% of all recordings are accessed by humans for transcription, and that all identifiable user information is delinked from the audio files.

headlines: JD(U) leader hangs himself in Bihar police station's toilet
text: JD(U) leader Ganesh Ravidas, detained in connection with a case of a minor girl's kidnapping, allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself inside a police station's toilet in Bihar's Nalanda district. Two police officers have been suspended after locals staged a protest outside the police station following the incident. An inquiry has been ordered into the 52-year-old's custodial death.

headlines: Suspended MLA, who danced with guns, expelled from BJP: Reports
text: BJP reportedly expelled its suspended Uttarakhand MLA Pranav Singh Champion on Friday after a video showing him dancing with guns went viral on social media. Champion was earlier suspended from the party for three months for threatening a journalist. "BJP is a party which does not compromise on principles," party's state unit chief Ajay Bhatt had said.

headlines: Tiger Global to sell its 21% PolicyBazaar stake for $300M: Report
text: American hedge fund Tiger Global is reportedly looking to sell its 21% stake in Gurugram-based insurance aggregator PolicyBazaar for $300 million at a $1.5-billion valuation. Softbank Vision Fund (SVF) and Chinese internet giant Tencent are reportedly among investors looking to buy the same. Tiger Global has reportedly invested about $60 million in PolicyBazaar's parent firm in past five years.

headlines: India lifted 27.1 crore people out of poverty between 2006-16: UN
text: India lifted 27.1 crore people out of poverty between 2006 and 2016, the UN Development Programme said in its 2019 global Multidimensional Poverty Index report. Among the four poorest states Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh Jharkhand made the most progress. Multi-dimensional poverty takes into consideration several indicators, including income, nutrition, and quality of work.

headlines: Man asks for marriage certificate after 16 years, told to wed again
text: A man seeking an attested marriage certificate from Sub-Registrar's office in Kerala's Kozhikode 16 years after he got married was asked to marry once again by officials. State Registration Minister G Sudhakaran revealed the officials made fun of him and asked him to wait for three days. The minister added that he has suspended four officials for the same.

headlines: Won't open our airspace until India removes its jets: Pakistan
text: Pakistan's Aviation Secretary Shahrukh Nusrat has said the country won't open its airspace for Indian flights until India withdraws its fighter jets placed forward. He added that the "Indian government approached asking (them) to open the airspace". Pakistan closed its airspace in February after the Indian Air Force strike on a Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camp in Balakot.

headlines: Turkey receives S-400 missile parts from Russia defying US warning
text: Turkey on Friday received the first parts of the Russian S-400 air defence system, defying the US' warning against the purchase. The US has said that Turkey cannot have both the S-400 air defence system and US' F-35 fighter jets. The US claims that the Russian system could be used to analyse and collect intelligence on the F-35.

headlines: You censorious thug: Journalist tells Pakistan's Foreign Minister
text: Canadian journalist Ezra Levant criticised Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi over censorship on Twitter, calling him a "censorious thug" at a conference in London. Levant claimed that Twitter had removed one of his tweets on the request of the Pakistani government. "You don't like free speech...shame on you," the journalist further told the Pakistani minister.

headlines: SBI waives off IMPS charges for online fund transfers from Aug 1
text: State Bank of India (SBI), the country's largest lender by assets, has decided to do away with charges on fund transfer using IMPS for internet banking and mobile banking customers from August 1. SBI had waived off charges on NEFT and RTGS transactions through internet and mobile banking from July 1 after RBI decided to remove these charges.

headlines: Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are not money: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he's not "a fan of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies", saying they aren't money and their "value is highly volatile and based on thin air". "We have only one real currency in USA, and it's stronger than ever...It's by far the most dominant currency anywhere in the World...It's called the US Dollar!" he added.

headlines: Proud of India's performance at 2019 World Cup: Sunil Chhetri
text: The Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to commend the Indian cricket team's performance at the ongoing World Cup 2019. "It was a fantastic journey that fell a few yards short, but I'm sure you boys will pick yourselves up soon. Very proud of Team India," read part of Chhetri's tweet about the Indian team.

headlines: Google Maps now shows 45,000 public toilets in 1,700 cities
text: Google Maps now displays over 45,000 community and public toilets covering 1,700 Indian cities as part of the Central government's "Loo Review" initiative. The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs joined hands with Google to launch the 'Loo Review' campaign in September 2018. The campaign encourages local guides in India to rate and review public toilets on Google Maps.

headlines: SC notice to Sikkim CM on plea challenging his appointment
text: The Supreme Court issued a notice to Sikkim CM Prem Singh Tamang on a plea challenging his appointment to the post. The petitioner contended that Tamang was earlier convicted and sentenced to a year's jail in a corruption case, making him ineligible to be appointed as the CM. The court also issued a notice to the Centre and Sikkim Governor.

headlines: Madrasa students thrashed, forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in UP
text: A group of Madrasa students playing cricket was allegedly thrashed with cricket bats and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Unnao, Uttar Pradesh on Thursday. Three of the students were injured in the incident. Meanwhile, the police said the accused were identified with the help of their social media accounts, on which they had shared certain pictures.

headlines: K'taka Speaker to not take decision on resignations till July 16: SC
text: During the hearing on resignations by Karnataka Congress and JD(S) MLAs, the Supreme Court ordered to maintain status quo on the resignations and the disqualification proceedings against them. This comes after Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar said he was bound to decide on disqualification petitions before deciding on the resignations. The court stated the matter would be heard again on Tuesday.

headlines: SC refuses to put stay on Maratha quota on jobs and admissions
text: The Supreme Court has refused to stay Bombay High Court's decision on Maratha reservation in jobs and education. However, the top court said it'll hear the appeals against the reservation and issued a notice to Maharashtra government over such pleas. The High Court had brought down the quota from the proposed 16% to 12% in education and 13% in jobs.

headlines: Actress Sameera Reddy blessed with a baby girl, shares 1st glimpse
text: Actress Sameera Reddy and her husband Akshai Varde were blessed with a baby girl on Friday. Sameera, who was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai last night, shared the first glimpse of the newborn on Instagram. Both the baby and the mother are doing fine, said the actress' mother. The couple is already parents to a son named Hans Varde.

headlines: Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Super 30' hits the theatres
text: In Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Super 30', which released today, "emotional manipulation gets in the way of inspiration", Hindustan Times wrote. "Hrithik Roshan pulls off a solid performance essaying Anand Kumar," said Times of India. NDTV wrote, "Super 30 is overly simplistic and excessively fanciful when it is not downright vapid." It has been rated 2/5 (HT, NDTV) and 3.5/5 (TOI).

headlines: Event organiser trying to malign my image: Sonakshi on cheating case
text: Responding to cheating allegations against her, Sonakshi Sinha tweeted, "An event organiser who couldn't live up to his commitment obviously thinks he can make a fast buck by maligning my crystal clear image in the press." She urged media not to "fan" his "bizarre claims". He accused Sonakshi of not turning up for an event after taking the booking amount.

headlines: Archer's old tweets 'foretelling' England's semi-final win go viral
text: England pacer Jofra Archer's tweets ranging from 2013-2018 'foretelling' England's World Cup semi-final win went viral. The Guardian related his "Umpire you smoking a spliff from zac? Da ain out" tweet to Jason Roy being wrongly given out, while "All batsmen buy 2 helmets cause went we meet they'll be in use" tweet was connected to him hitting Alex Carey.

headlines: Ready to prove majority of my govt: Karnataka CM to Speaker
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said that he's ready to prove his government's majority and sought a trust vote in the Assembly, adding that he wasn't here to cling to power. Kumaraswamy also asked Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar to fix the time for it. This comes after several Congress and JD(S) MLAs submitted their resignations.

headlines: Cong to move court for disqualification of Goa MLAs who joined BJP
text: Goa Congress in-charge A Chellakumar on Thursday said Congress will move court seeking the disqualification of the 10 MLAs who resigned from the party and joined the BJP. Stating that Congress will appoint a new leader in the upcoming Assembly session, Chellakumar added, "If somebody is leaving they don't damage the party in any way...We're not bothered about individuals."

headlines: Mumbai doctors remove female reproductive organs from man's body
text: A 29-year-old man, who had sought cure for infertility, was found to have non-functioning female reproductive organs. Doctors at a government-run Mumbai hospital operated on him last month and removed a uterus, partial vagina, fallopian tubes and cervix from his body. A doctor said the condition is called Persistent Mullerian duct syndrome and only 200 such cases have been found.

headlines: Pakistan violates ceasefire in J&K's Poonch, Rajouri districts
text: Pakistan violated ceasefire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Krishna Ghati sector of Poonch district and Nowshera sector of Rajouri district on Friday. No injuries have been reported so far, while the Indian Army has launched an effective retaliation. On Wednesday night, Pakistan had violated ceasefire in Poonch district's Digwar sector.

headlines: Rafale-Sukhoi potent combination against Pak: Air Marshal Bhadauria
text: After taking a sortie on a Rafale aircraft at a French air force base, IAF Vice Chief Air Marshal RKS Bhadauria said, "Once the Su-30MKI and the Rafale start operating together, it will be a potent combination against our adversaries, be it Pakistan or anybody else." He added, "The attrition that we will inflict would be very very high."

headlines: Lok Sabha debate continues till midnight; Minister calls it 'record'
text: The Lok Sabha sat till 11.58 pm on Thursday to conclude debate on demands for grants for the Railway Ministry. Nearly 100 members participated in the debate, which began in the afternoon. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi called it a "record", saying it's for the first time in nearly 18 years that the Lower House has sat for this long.

headlines: 1st 50-wagon train carrying 25-lakh-litre water reaches Chennai
text: The first train carrying 25-lakh-litre water from Jolarpettai railway station in Vellore district has reached Chennai on Friday. The train has been decorated with flowers and has a poster reading 'Drinking water for Chennai'. As many as 50 wagons have been brought from Rajasthan to be attached to the train and carry 50,000 litre of water each.

headlines: Kalyani Rafael gets $100 mn order for Barak-8 missile kits for Army
text: Kalyani Rafael Advanced Systems (KRAS) has bagged a $100 million order from Israel's Rafael Advanced Defense Systems for the supply of 1,000 Barak-8 MRSAM missile kits to the Indian Army and Air Force. KRAS is a joint venture between Baba Kalyani-led Bharat Forge and Rafael. The missile kits will be supplied to state-run Bharat Dynamics for further integration.

headlines: One of our worst performances overall: Aus captain Aaron Finch
text: Speaking after his side's loss to hosts England in the World Cup 2019 second semi-final, Australia captain Aaron Finch termed the loss as 'one of our worst performances overall for the tournament'. "Really proud of where we have come from and the gains that a lot of players have made over the last 12 months in particular," Finch said.

headlines: India-made top-end iPhones may come to stores from next month
text: Apple's top-end iPhones including XR and XS models, assembled in India by Foxconn's local unit, are likely to come to Indian stores next month, Reuters reported. Apple is yet to secure some approvals, Reuters cited a source as saying. This could reportedly lead to Apple reducing the prices of the models as it'll save on high taxes levied on imports.

headlines: PM Modi meets BJP's women MPs over breakfast
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met women MPs of the BJP over breakfast at his residence on Friday. According to reports, BJP MPs have been divided into seven groups and PM Modi has already met party parliamentarians belonging to OBC, SC and ST categories. Pralhad Joshi and Amit Shah are the only Union Ministers present at these meetings, an MP said.

headlines: BJP and its leaders hardly care about Constitution: Azad
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Karnataka, Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad criticised the BJP saying that the party and its leaders "hardly care" about the Constitution. He added, "It looks as if the BJP government has come to power just to finish democracy and Opposition." This comes after the resignations of over 10 Congress-JD(S) coalition MLAs in Karnataka.

headlines: Cong-JD(S) going strong despite efforts to destabilise: K'taka CM
text: Amid the ongoing political crises in Karnataka, CM HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition in the state is going strong despite efforts being made to destabilise it. His comment came ahead of the commencement of the Monsoon session of the Legislative Assembly. Kumaraswamy further added, "We're confident and prepared for smooth and fruitful conduct of legislative sessions."

headlines: No plans to form e-commerce regulatory authority: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said the government is not considering any proposal to create an e-commerce regulatory authority to monitor and regulate e-commerce business in India. Measures to check malpractices by e-commerce firms including predatory prices and deep discounts are laid down in the Competition Act 2002, he said. He added it also checks anti-competitive agreements.

headlines: 153 booked for drinking in public places in Delhi
text: Around 153 people were booked on Thursday for violating the Delhi Excise Act by drinking in public places in Outer North Delhi area, police said. "Group patrolling teams were constituted and tasked to nab such violators from vehicles, near markets," the police added. On July 6, around 474 people were arrested in Noida and Greater Noida for a similar offence.

headlines: 9,500 buses to ply on Delhi roads by May 2020: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that by May 2020, Delhi will have as many as 9,500 buses plying on the roads. He added that 4,000 buses will be added in the current fleet of 5,500 buses in Delhi. Sisodia further said, "The first batch of the buses will start coming in July 2019 and it'll continue till May 2020."

headlines: Rohit Sharma reacts to India's exit from 2019 World Cup
text: Following Team India's exit from 2019 World Cup, opener Rohit Sharma said that they failed to deliver as a team when it mattered. "30 minutes of poor cricket... and that snatched away our chance for the cup. My heart is heavy as I'm sure yours is too," he tweeted. He further thanked the fans for their "incredible" support.

headlines: I puked while auditioning, filmmaker thought it was brilliant: Ranveer
text: Ranveer Singh revealed he once puked during an audition after his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' released. "The scene was that a character...a teetotaller happens to drink one night, and starts dancing. I performed and danced my heart out. Such was the intensity that I puked at the end," he said. "The filmmaker thought it was sheer brilliance," Ranveer added.

headlines: Dhoni has a lot of cricket left in him, youngsters need him: Edulji
text: Committee of Administrators (CoA) member Diana Edulji has said that she still feels that MS Dhoni has a lot of cricket left in him. "The youngsters in the team still need his mentorship," she added. "I completely appreciate the way he played in the whole tournament. That (retirement) is his personal decision," she further said.

headlines: Smith gets run-out after ball goes between his legs, video viral
text: A video of England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler producing a nutmeg run-out to dismiss Australia batsman Steve Smith in 2019 World Cup semi-final has gone viral. Buttler caught Smith short of crease after nailing a direct hit which went between Smith's legs at non-striker's end when the latter chanced a leg-bye. "That is an astonishing bit of fielding," a user tweeted.

headlines: Halep becomes first Romanian woman to reach Wimbledon final
text: Simona Halep became the first Romanian woman to reach Wimbledon final after defeating Ukraine's Elina Svitolina 6-1, 6-3 on Thursday. The world number seven, who took 73 minutes to win the semi-final, will face Serena Williams, who is chasing her 24th Grand Slam, in the final. "I'm desperate to win Wimbledon more than to stop her," said Halep.

headlines: Serena reaches her 11th Wimbledon final, to face Simona Halep
text: Seven-time champion Serena Williams defeated world number 54 Barbora Strycova in straight sets on Thursday to reach the Wimbledon final for the 11th time. Serena dropped just three games in the semi-final and fired 27 winners and four aces to win the match with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-2. The 37-year-old will face world number seven Halep in the final.

headlines: Twitter suffers an hour-long worldwide outage
text: Twitter suffered an hour-long global outage on Friday and displayed a message saying, "Something is technically wrong. Thanks for noticing - we're going to fix it up and have things back to normal soon." DownDetector showed that Twitter began having issues since 12:20 AM IST. Twitter returned at about 1:15 AM IST but took few minutes to regain full functionality.

headlines: Can't work at lightning speed: K'taka Speaker on meeting rebel MLAs
text: After receiving the resignations again from rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs, Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Thursday said, "I am not acting in haste because I have to convince myself first. I cannot work at a lightning speed." He added that the resignation letters are now in correct format and he would decide overnight "whether these were genuine and voluntary".

headlines: Sued ex-Tesla employee admits to storing Autopilot source code
text: Former Tesla employee Guangzhi Cao has admitted that he stored the source code of the electric carmaker's Autopilot on his iCloud but refuted allegations of trade theft, as per court documents. Cao, who joined Tesla-rival Xiaopeng Motors in November 2018, argued he made "extensive efforts to delete and/or remove any such Tesla files". Tesla had sued Cao in March.

headlines: Raj Police to re-open cow smuggling case against Pehlu Khan's sons
text: An Alwar court has permitted the Rajasthan Police to reinvestigate the case of cattle smuggling against the sons of Pehlu Khan, a 55-year-old dairy farmer who was killed by a group of gau rakshaks in 2017. This comes after the police sought the court's permission to re-open a chargesheet that named the victim's sons as accused in the case.

headlines: Over-qualification is disqualification for govt job: Madras HC
text: The Madras High Court on Thursday ruled that if overqualified applicants are employed for Group-4 services and basic services, the quality of public administration would be brought down. Stating that over-qualification is also disqualification for a job, it dismissed two petitions of engineering graduates who were rejected for posts of metro train operator and revenue department assistant.

headlines: Air Canada passengers hit plane's ceiling due to turbulence; 37 injured
text: An Australia-bound Air Canada flight on Thursday suffered intense turbulence, which led unbuckled passengers to hit the plane's ceiling and therefore, forcing the plane to land in Hawaii. Around 37 people on the flight were injured. A passenger said, "The plane just dropped...I woke up and...the next thing I knew there's just literally bodies on the ceiling of the plane."

headlines: India's new e-commerce rules regressive: Walmart told US govt
text: Walmart, which acquired Flipkart for $16 billion, told the US government in January that India's new FDI rules for e-commerce were regressive. The rules, implemented from February 1, barred companies from selling products via firms in which they have an equity interest. Walmart argued that the policy discriminated against foreign firms and not just in favour of small local players.

headlines: Dhoni is an absolute legend: Akhtar after India's semi loss
text: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar praised MS Dhoni's performance at 2019 World Cup semi-final saying, "Dhoni...you are an absolute legend... You have proved you're a great batsman and a great brand ambassador for the team." Akhtar, who also praised Jadeja, added Dhoni should have dived to avoid getting run-out. India crashed out after losing to New Zealand by 18 runs.

headlines: WhatsApp may let users edit sent, received photos within app
text: WhatsApp is testing a new feature to let users edit images that have already been sent or received by them, WABetaInfo revealed. The editing tools will reportedly be the same as the ones available before an image is sent. The new 'Edit' button will be introduced next to 'Share' and 'Favourite' buttons, as per screenshots shared by WABetaInfo.

headlines: Decision on new Cong Prez should be taken at earliest: Scindia
text: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that a lot of time has "elapsed" and the decision on a new Congress President should be taken "at the earliest". He added that the party needs to "reinvent" itself and must win faith, love and blessings of the country. On July 3, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi officially resigned as the party President.

headlines: 20 students hospitalised after consuming mid-day meal in Andhra
text: At least 20 students of Ramakrishna Mission School were hospitalised on Thursday allegedly after they consumed mid-day meal in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur. They were rushed to a hospital when they complained of vomiting and unconsciousness soon after consuming the food. According to the doctors, all the students are stable and no inquiry has been initiated in the case so far.

headlines: 2 girl students dead as hostel wall collapses in Arunachal
text: Two girl students were killed and at least one was injured after the boundary wall of a government school hostel collapsed in Arunachal Pradesh's Tawang on Thursday. The wall reportedly collapsed due to a landslide following incessant rainfall in the region. As many as 19 girl students were sleeping in the hostel when the incident took place.

headlines: World Cup to get first-time winners as Eng beat Aus to reach final
text: Three-time runners-up England defeated five-time champions Australia by 8 wickets in the second 2019 World Cup semi-final to reach World Cup final for the fourth time and the first time since the 1992 edition. In the final, England will face New Zealand, who also haven't won the World Cup so far. The final will take place at Lord's on Sunday.

headlines: I will give my best till my last breath: Ravindra Jadeja to fans
text: Following India's 18-run defeat against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday, all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja tweeted, "Sports has taught me to keep on rising after every fall & never to give up." "Can't thank enough each & every fan who has been my source of inspiration...Keep inspiring & I'll give my best till my last breath," he added.

headlines: Australia lose a semi-final for the first time in World Cup history
text: The eight-wicket defeat against England today was the first instance of Australia losing a World Cup semi-final. Australia had won six of their previous seven semi-finals and their 1999 semi-final against South Africa had ended in a tie. Australia were dismissed for 223 by England, only the second time they lost all their 10 wickets in a World Cup semi-final.

headlines: Virat Kohli backs IPL-style playoffs for World Cup
text: Following India's exit from the 2019 World Cup, Team India captain Virat Kohli backed IPL-style playoffs for World Cup. "If topping the table means anything. I think these things can come into consideration, looking at the magnitude of this tournament," he added. India crashed out of 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-finals.

headlines: 24-yr-old man drowns in lake during TikTok video shoot in Hyderabad
text: A 24-year-old man drowned in a lake located on the outskirts of Hyderabad while he was taking a bath along with his cousin, police said. The man drowned after he moved deep into the lake when his cousin was recording a video of them bathing, for TikTok app, police added. The victim did not know how to swim.

headlines: Fast-track Maldives' re-admission as member: India to Commonwealth
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has called to fast-track the process of re-admitting the Maldives as a member of the Commonwealth. The Maldives had quit the Commonwealth in 2016, accusing it of interfering in its domestic affairs. Ex-Maldives President Abdulla Yameen had taken the step after the Commonwealth asked to address the deteriorating human rights issue in the country.

headlines: US and UK will regret seizing our tanker: Iran
text: The US and UK will "regret" seizing an Iranian oil tanker, a deputy commander of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps said. The tanker was seized off Gibraltar, with the British Royal Marines claiming it was carrying oil to Syria in breach of sanctions. "An action that doesn't need ability but stupidity has been carried out by them," the official added.

headlines: N Korea revises constitution to make Kim Jong-un head of state
text: North Korea has revised its constitution to declare Kim Jong-un as the official head of the state. The revised constitution states that the Chairman of the State Affairs Commission (SAC) serves as its supreme leader that "represents the country". Previously, the President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly represented the country as the constitutional head of the state.

headlines: IndiGo's $20 billion CFM deal led to Co-Founders' dispute: Reports
text: The $20-billion agreement IndiGo recently signed with aircraft engine maker CFM may have triggered the dispute between Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia, as per reports. The decision was reportedly not supported by Gangwal, who has been managing the technical aspects of IndiGo since its inception. The airline previously relied on engines from United Technologies' Pratt and Whitney.

headlines: Rupee hits 11-month high of 68.45 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee, along with other Asian currencies, strengthened against the US dollar on Thursday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell signalled that the US central bank could soon cut interest rates. The rupee gained 12 paise to end at 68.45, an 11-month high. The rupee has risen 1.9% against the dollar so far this year.

headlines: Mayhem with new ball: Boult on WC semi-final win vs India
text: After New Zealand defended their 240-run target to win 2019 World Cup's first semifinal against India on Wednesday, pacer Trent Boult said, "It was mayhem out there with the new ball." "It was a dream start for us," said Boult, whose team reduced India to 24/4 in first ten overs. "Our best balls are good enough for anyone," he added.

headlines: Playing vs Federer always unique: Nadal ahead of Wimbledon semi
text: Ahead of their Wimbledon semi-final, world number two Rafael Nadal said that playing against Roger Federer is "always a unique situation" and he's "excited" to play him at Wimbledon after 11 years. The duo will meet for the 40th time on Friday, which will also be their fourth Wimbledon encounter. Notably, Nadal won French Open semi-final against Federer last month.

headlines: McAfee may go public again, get $1 bn at $5-bn valuation: Report
text: Cybersecurity software firm McAfee is planning to return to the public market, The Wall Street Journal reported, adding that an IPO could raise at least $1 billion at an over $5-billion valuation. This comes weeks after McAfee CEO said going public again could widen the firm's options. McAfee responded to the report saying it "does not comment on rumours".

headlines: Cong media coordinator quits, says 'No sign of new party president'
text: Congress' national media coordinator Rachit Seth on Thursday resigned from his post, saying there was no meaning in holding any political position after Rahul Gandhi's resignation. "45 days have gone and...there is no sign of the new Congress President," he said. Seth further said that there was no point in blaming the BJP if the fault lay within the party.

headlines: TMC MP plays football in Lok Sabha, appeals PM to promote it
text: TMC MP Prasun Banerjee on Thursday began playing football in the Parliament premises in a bid to promote the game. The retired international footballer said he will appeal to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to promote the game nationally as well as internationally. "I hope India will play football in the World Cup...We will try to achieve it," Banerjee said.

headlines: India is fully committed to Kartarpur corridor: Govt
text: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar on Thursday said that India is fully committed to the Kartarpur Sahib corridor project and wants the work to be completed expeditiously. This comes amid reports that India is lagging behind in the construction of the corridor. The passenger terminal and the four-lane highway will be completed by September and October 2019, Kumar said.

headlines: Missing US scientist found murdered in Nazi bunker in Greece
text: The body of Suzanne Eaton, an American scientist who went missing over a week ago, has been found in a bunker used by the Nazis during WWII on the Greek island of Crete, authorities said. Eaton was attending a conference in Crete and is believed to have disappeared during a run. A post-mortem examination found that she was asphyxiated.

headlines: Vodafone CEO takes $1.6 million bonus cut after shares fall
text: Vodafone Group CEO Nick Read and CFO Margherita Della Valle have voluntarily requested a 20% reduction in their three-year share awards after company's shares fell 30% in 12 months. The company said Read will give up stock worth $1.6 million, reducing his share bonus to about $6.4 million. This follows a shareholder advisory group objecting to Vodafone's latest remuneration plan.

headlines: Please don't think about retirement: Lata Mangeshkar to MS Dhoni
text: Legendary singer Lata Mangeshkar took to Twitter to request former India captain MS Dhoni to not think about retirement as India needs him. "I am hearing a lot these days that you want to retire. Please don't think like this. The thought of retirement shouldn't come to your mind," she wrote. Dhoni scored 273 runs in the 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Starc registers most wickets in a World Cup, breaks McGrath's record
text: After taking his first wicket in the 2019 World Cup semi-final against England on Thursday, Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc set the record for taking most wickets in a World Cup edition. The 29-year-old took his tally to 27 wickets in the current edition, overtaking Glenn McGrath, who had taken 26 wickets in the 2007 World Cup.

headlines: 10 rebel Congress MLAs from Goa join BJP
text: Ten rebel Congress MLAs from Goa who resigned on Wednesday met BJP's Working President JP Nadda in Delhi on Thursday and formally joined the BJP. Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant accompanied the MLAs to the meeting in Delhi. After their merger with the BJP, the party's strength in the Goa Assembly has increased to 27.

headlines: Smith 1st batsman to hit 4 straight 50+ scores in WC knockout matches
text: Australia batsman Steve Smith has become the first-ever batsman to slam four consecutive 50-plus scores in World Cup knockouts. The 30-year-old, who scored 65, 105 and 56* in 2015 World Cup quarter-final, semi-final and final respectively, slammed 119-ball 85 against England in 2019 World Cup semi-final. He equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record for most 50-plus scores (4) in World Cup knockouts.

headlines: Fan dies of heart attack in Kolkata after Dhoni gets run-out
text: A cycle shop owner, 33-year-old Srikanta Maity, died of heart attack in his shop in Kolkata after MS Dhoni got run-out in World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. Maity was watching the match on his phone. "We saw him lying unconscious...We took him to Khanakul hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival," a sweet shop owner in the area said.

headlines: BSF constable loses hand in smugglers' bomb attack at B'desh border
text: Anisur Rehman, a BSF constable lost his right hand and suffered serious injuries in a country-made bomb attack by Bangladeshi cattle smugglers along the India-Bangladesh border in West Bengal. Rehman fired a round from his pump action gun in self-defence before he fell unconscious. One Bangladeshi smuggler sustained injuries but managed to flee away to Bangladesh, as per intelligence report.

headlines: Dalit husband's family gets security after BJP MLA's daughter's video
text: Bareilly Police on Thursday provided security to the family of a Dalit man whose wife, BJP MLA Rajesh Kumar Mishra's daughter, claimed a threat to their lives over their inter-caste marriage, in a viral video. The MLA's daughter, Sakshi Kumar Mishra, moved Allahabad High Court seeking security. The couple got married at a Prayagraj temple on July 4.

headlines: Bihar CM denies Guru Purnima holiday, asks lawmakers to work extra
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar rejected a demand by lawmakers for a state holiday on the occasion of 'Guru Purnima' on July 16. "I think we should work two additional hours on Guru Purnima as a mark of respect for our gurus," Kumar told the lawmakers. "Who will take classes if teachers do not come to class?" he further questioned.

headlines: HDFC Bank MD says Mallya not a friend, explains why he refused loan
text: HDFC Bank MD Aditya Puri said Vijay Mallya was not his friend, adding that friendship and banking are not correlated. Puri said, "Somebody in Mallya's office will tell you, every time the call came from me, Mallya used to abuse." He added that when Mallya's officials came to him for a loan, he gave them coffee and sent them back.

headlines: Apple opens 1st China app design and development accelerator
text: Apple has opened the first app design and development accelerator for China in Shanghai to help local developers create better apps. Apple said over 2.5 million developers from Greater China have earned over $29 billion since App Store's China launch in 2010. The accelerator is similar to the one that the technology giant had opened in Bengaluru two years ago.

headlines: I-T dept finds Google, FB underreporting Indian revenues: Report
text: The Income Tax department has reportedly decided to scrutinise global firms including technology giants like Google and Facebook over allegations of underreporting Indian revenues. "Revenues reported in India are not reflective of the actual advertisement revenues earned from users in India," the report quoted an I-T official. The firms are reportedly doing so to avoid paying a withholding tax.

headlines: FDI norms forcing Flipkart to scale down wholesale biz: Report
text: Flipkart is being forced to scale down its B2B wholesale business due to compliance with the revised FDI norms, which came into effect from February 1, as per a report. Flipkart has started curtailing or altogether stopped buying products directly from companies, the report said. It is also reportedly asking preferred sellers to buy merchandise directly from manufacturers.

headlines: Treebo fires 15% workforce after failing to raise funds: Report
text: Bengaluru-based budget hotel chain Treebo Hotels has reportedly fired over 120 employees, representing about 15% of its around 900-employee workforce, Entrackr reported citing over half a dozen sources including employees. "The firm has been trying to raise funds from quite some time," Entrackr's sources said, adding, "It looks like the fundraising plan is far from materialising."

headlines: Used to such threats: Govt on Al-Qaeda's video on Kashmir
text: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar on Thursday reacted to Al-Qaeda's video saying, "We are used to such threats...this should [not] be taken seriously." Our security forces are well equipped and capable of maintaining our territorial integrity, he added. On Wednesday, the Al-Qaeda in a video message called for militants in Kashmir to inflict unrelenting blows on the Indian Army.

headlines: 6 people killed, 100 injured in 20-minute storm in Greece
text: At least six people were killed and 100 others were injured in a storm that hit northern Greece on Wednesday, officials said. The storm had lasted only for about 20 minutes, as per reports. Hail storms and strong winds of over 100 kmph damaged buildings, overturned cars and uprooted trees in Halkidiki, near the city of Thessaloniki.

headlines: 11 killed, 60 injured in Pakistan train collision
text: At least 11 people were killed and over 60 others were injured after a passenger train crashed into a freight train in Pakistan's Punjab province on Thursday. Five carriages were destroyed and workers cut through the metal of the carriages to rescue the trapped passengers. Pakistan PM Imran Khan blamed decades of neglect of railway infrastructure for the crash.

headlines: Govt to check IndiGo shareholder pact for violation: Reports
text: The Centre will reportedly scrutinise the disputed shareholders' agreement between IndiGo Co-Founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia. Reports said any Companies Act violation could cause the annulment of special rights held by Bhatia's IGE Group to appoint IndiGo's three board directors, MD and CEO. Gangwal had accused Bhatia of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with IndiGo.

headlines: RBI cancelled licences of 1,701 NBFCs in 2018-19
text: The RBI cancelled licences of 1,701 non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) in 2018-19 for not meeting minimum capital requirements, according to data compiled by Livemint. Nearly 779 licences were cancelled in October and November 2018, soon after IL&FS defaulted on debt repayments, sparking a crisis in the sector. RBI had cancelled 26 NBFC licences in 2017-18.

headlines: Swara tweets to Mumbai Police about man who said she's a 'call girl'
text: Actress Swara Bhasker tweeted to Mumbai Police and complained about a man who called her a "call girl". "In his own words 'mad, proud and fortunate nationalist & Hindu' bringing shame upon his (and my) religion and nation!" she wrote while quoting his Twitter bio. Replying to her tweet, Mumbai Police wrote, "We will look into this on priority."

headlines: Shraddha Kapoor, rumoured boyfriend Rohan to marry in 2020: Reports
text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor and her rumoured boyfriend, photographer Rohan Shrestha will get married in 2020, as per reports. They have been dating for a couple of years, reports added. Shraddha's mother, Shivangi Kapoor, is already busy with wedding preparations, reports further said. Her father Shakti Kapoor has however denied the rumours about their marriage.

headlines: Aus' Carey gets hit on face, continues to bat with bleeding chin
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Alex Carey was hit on the face by a 139-kmph delivery bowled by England pacer Jofra Archer in eighth over of Australia's innings in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Thursday. Carey's helmet was detached after he copped the ball on the chin. He continued to play with bleeding chin before his jaw area was covered up with a bandage.

headlines: SC rejects K'taka Speaker's plea for more time on MLAs' resignations
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday rejected Karnataka Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar's plea seeking more time to decide on rebel MLAs' resignations. The SC said it had already passed the order in the morning asking the Speaker to decide on the resignations during the course of the day. Sixteen MLAs, including Housing Minister MTB Nagaraj, have resigned.

headlines: Virgin Orbit successfully performs its 1st rocket drop test
text: Billionaire Richard Branson's spaceflight firm Virgin Galactic's sister firm Virgin Orbit has successfully performed its first rocket drop test with a 70-foot dummy LauncherOne rocket. The test was performed using its Boeing 747-based launch aircraft, nicknamed "Cosmic Girl", from an altitude of 35,000 feet. CEO Dan Hart estimated the cost of a launch using LauncherOne to be about $10-15 million.

headlines: Volkswagen ends production of its iconic Beetle car after 8 decades
text: Volkswagen's Beetle production officially came to an end after over eight decades as the last Beetles produced rolled off the assembly line in Puebla, Mexico on Wednesday. A special ceremony at factory marked the end of production. The last Beetles will be sold on Amazon in a move symbolising Volkswagen's embrace of the future, Volkswagen Mexico CEO Steffen Reiche said.

headlines: Local authorities can bar malls from collecting parking fee: Guj HC
text: Gujarat High Court on Wednesday said local authorities can prohibit owners of malls and multiplexes from collecting parking fee, under the provisions of the Comprehensive General Development Control Regulation, 2017. This comes after a firm challenged the order of single-judge bench, barring commercial complexes from collecting fee for parking vehicles for the first hour.

headlines: Pak hasn't acknowledged presence of PoWs in its custody: India
text: Pakistan has not acknowledged the presence of any missing Indian defence personnel or Prisoners of War (PoWs) in its custody so far, despite consistent efforts from India to ensure their release, the government said on Wednesday. However, the government added that as per available information, around 83 missing Indian defence personnel including PoWs, are believed to be in Pakistan's custody.

headlines: US man missing for months found to be eaten by his 18 pet dogs
text: A 57-year-old man, who was reported missing in US' Texas in May, was completely eaten by his 18 pet dogs at his trailer home, police said. DNA testing determined that pieces of bone and clothes recovered from the dogs' faeces were of their owner. It's unclear whether the dogs killed their owner or just consumed his body after he died.

headlines: Kidney 'has a very special place in the heart': Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that "the kidney has a very special place in the heart". His remarks came as he signed an executive order aimed at improving medical care for people who have kidney-related health issues. Trump also said that his administration would work on encouraging the development of new treatments.

headlines: US seizes JPMorgan-owned ship with $1.3 billion worth of cocaine
text: US customs authorities have seized a large container ship operated by Switzerland-based Mediterranean Shipping Company weeks after they found about 20 tons of cocaine worth $1.3 billion on the vessel. The MSC Gayane is owned by JPMorgan Asset Management and chartered to MSC. Worth about $90 million, the ship was built in 2018 and has capacity for around 10,000 containers.

headlines: What's the necessity for me to resign: K'taka CM Kumaraswamy
text: Responding to reports that claimed he was ready to step down amid the political crisis in Karnataka, Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy today asked, "What is the necessity for me to resign now?" He added, "In 2009-10, when the same (BJP state chief) Yeddyurappa was CM, at that time 18 MLAs including eight ministers opposed him."

headlines: Sonia, Rahul protest outside Parliament over Karnataka crisis
text: Congress leaders, including Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, held a protest against the ruling BJP in the Parliament complex on Thursday over the political crisis in Karnataka and Goa. They also carried placards with messages like 'Save Democracy'. Leaders of Samajwadi Party, TMC, NCP and RJD also took part in the protest.

headlines: Japan spacecraft lands on asteroid 300 mn km away for 2nd time
text: Japan's space agency JAXA has confirmed that its Hayabusa2 spacecraft has successfully landed on asteroid Ryugu about 300 million km away from Earth for second time. The $270-million spacecraft had dropped a 2-kg bomb to create a small crater on the asteroid in April. Hayabusa2 will again fire a bullet at the asteroid to collect sub-surface samples blown by it.

headlines: Waterlogging due to rains forces schools to shut in UP's Azizpur
text: Heavy rainfall led to massive waterlogging in several parts of Azizpur, UP on Wednesday. Reportedly, there were traffic jams and several schools declared holidays due to the waterlogging. A primary school student said, "Each year we face the same issue...We had earlier filed a complaint regarding this but no action was taken by the authorities."

headlines: Parties should come together for a population control law: Giriraj
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Thursday took to Twitter to say all policial parties should come together to make a law for population control. Religious disruption to population control is one of the reasons for cultural division, Singh added. The BJP leader shared statistics showing the increase in India's population from 30 crore in 1947 to 140 crore in 2019.

headlines: 7-yr-old raped by 65-yr-old man in Bihar; video circulated
text: Police on Wednesday arrested a 65-year-old man for allegedly luring a seven-year-old girl into a temple with chocolate and raping her in Bihar's Bhojpur district. A youth was also arrested for filming the act and uploading the video on social media. The matter came to light when the victim's parents learned about the video and lodged a police complaint.

headlines: Toddler falls into open drain in Mumbai, feared washed away
text: A toddler fell into an open drain in Mumbai's Goregaon on Wednesday night, said officials. Rescue operations started soon after he fell in and continued through Thursday morning, but the child is feared to have been washed away. His parents blamed BMC for the open drains and angry relatives have threatened to block roads if the boy is not found.

headlines: Former Miss Iraq may lose her citizenship for defending Israel
text: Former Miss Iraq Sarah Idan has said that her citizenship may be revoked after she spoke in defence of Israel at the United Nations Human Rights Council. She'd also spoken against the human rights abuses by Iraq. Idan's family fled Iraq following death threats after she posted a picture of herself with Miss Israel at the 2017 Miss Universe pageant.

headlines: SC asks rebel K'taka MLAs to submit resignations to Speaker by 6 pm
text: Supreme Court has asked 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs of Karnataka "to meet the Karnataka Assembly Speaker at 6 pm today and submit their resignations if they so wish." The Speaker has to take a decision in the remaining part of the day. It also ordered DGP of Karnataka to provide protection to the MLAs and adjourned the hearing for tomorrow.

headlines: Not against marriage, but boy is 9yrs older: MLA on daughter's video
text: After his daughter accused him of threatening her life following her marriage to a Dalit man, BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra denied the allegations. "I am not opposed to the marriage of my daughter. My only concern is that the boy is more than nine years older than her...[and] doesn't earn much." "I want them (couple) to return home," he added.

headlines: Runwal Group launches Runwal Pinnacle, Mulund's tallest towers
text: Situated in the heart of the city, Runwal Pinnacle offers the luxuries of high rise living. The 67 storeyed towers provide a panoramic view of the mangroves and Sanjay Gandhi National Park. It has two levels dedicated to clubhouse and recreational amenities, along with a sky deck and a rooftop leisure zone 200 meters above ground.

headlines: SC hearing on Ayodhya land dispute from July 25 if mediation fails
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked the Ayodhya land dispute mediation panel headed by Justice FMI Kalifulla to submit the status report by July 18. The court said that in case the report indicates that mediation should be concluded, it'll start hearing the appeals from July 25. Sri Sri Ravi Shankar and Sriram Panchu are also part of the panel.

headlines: Super 30 founder Anand Kumar reveals he's suffering from brain tumour
text: Mathematician Anand Kumar, founder of IIT coaching programme 'Super 30', has revealed that he's suffering from a non-cancerous tumour on the main nerve, leading from the inner ear to the brain. "In 2014, I was unable to hear...After some tests...I came to know that 80-90% of hearing ability was destroyed," he added.

headlines: How have Australia and England fared in World Cup semi-finals?
text: Australia have featured in seven semi-finals in World Cup and emerged victorious in six, while one ended in a tie. England, who last played a World Cup semi-final in 1992, have won three of their five World Cup semi-finals. England and Australia last met in a World Cup semi-final in 1975, with Australia winning the low-scoring encounter by four wickets.

headlines: Video of Rohit signalling 'you are strong' to Jadeja goes viral
text: A video of Team India opener Rohit Sharma making the 'you are strong' gesture to all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja during the 2019 World Cup semi-final against New Zealand has gone viral on social media. After Jadeja completed his half-century off 39 balls, Rohit applauded the all-rounder and made the gesture. "You guys won our hearts," a user reacted to the video.

headlines: What a moment of brilliance: ICC on Guptill's run-out of MS Dhoni
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a video of New Zealand's Martin Guptill running out India's MS Dhoni in 2019 World Cup semi-final, writing, "What a moment of brilliance!" Guptill hit the stumps directly from short fine leg area when Dhoni was trying to take a second run. India required 25 runs off 10 balls when Dhoni got run-out.

headlines: My father's path of politics ended on March 17: Parrikar's son
text: After 10 Congress MLAs resigned and joined BJP, former Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal said BJP took a different direction after his father's demise. Utpal added, "The path of trust which Parrikar established in his politics ended on March 17." He said he's willing to help in re-establishing the philosophy of trust among members of the BJP.

headlines: Opposition's work most enjoyable, easy: Rahul to Congress workers
text: Addressing party workers in Amethi on Wednesday, former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi said, "We have to do the work of opposition now. You know that the work of opposition is most enjoyable, it is easy." He added, "You know the condition of the economy, employment, corruption, so there is no dearth of issues."

headlines: Rivigo raises $65 mn in Series E round led by Warburg Pincus, SAIF
text: Gurugram-based logistics startup Rivigo has raised $65 million in its ongoing Series E round led by existing investors Warburg Pincus and SAIF Partners. Prior to this round, Rivigo raised $216.2 million from investors and the last tranche of $35.6 million of Series E round was at around $950-million valuation. Reports said Rivigo raised the funding at over $1-billion valuation.

headlines: Bus driver suspended for shooting TikTok video while driving
text: Punjab Roadways has suspended a bus driver after he took a TikTok video while driving a bus from Jalandhar to Delhi and it went viral on social media. "The shocking negligence could not be ignored," said Punjab Roadways General Manager Parneet Singh Minhas. A strict warning has been issued to other employees against using their phones while driving, he added.

headlines: 8 killed after speeding truck rams into wedding pandal in Bihar
text: At least eight people died and six people have been injured after a speeding truck rammed into a wedding pandal in Bihar's Lakhisarai district at 2 am on Thursday. Five members from the bride's side and three from the groom's family were killed on the spot, police said. Reportedly, the driver fled from the spot leaving his vehicle behind.

headlines: Ex-BJP MP, 6 others get life sentence for RTI activist's murder
text: A CBI court in Ahmedabad has sentenced former BJP MP Dinu Solanki and six others to life imprisonment in RTI activist Amit Jethwa's murder case, who was shot dead outside Gujarat High Court in 2010. All the seven accused were convicted by the court on Saturday. Jethwa reportedly exposed illegal mining around Gir Wildlife Sanctuary in which Solanki was involved.

headlines: UK says Iran attempted to block its oil tanker in the Gulf
text: The UK has said that three Iranian boats tried to block one of its oil tankers through the Strait of Hormuz. The Iranians withdrew after a UK warship escorting the tanker aimed its guns and warned the Iranians to move away. This comes after the UK helped Gibraltar seize an Iranian tanker claiming it was carrying oil to Syria illegally.

headlines: Samsungs VC arm debuts in India, puts $8.5 mn in 4 startups
text: Samsung Venture Investment Corporation (SVIC), the venture capital arm of South Korean technology giant Samsung, has invested around $8.5 million in total in its maiden investment in the Indian startup ecosystem. SVIC has acquired 20% stake in Mumbai system apps startup Indus OS. It has also backed Bengaluru's Gnani.ai and Silvan Innovation Labs and an undisclosed computer vision startup.

headlines: Google testing new social networking app 'Shoelace' in NYC
text: Technology giant Google is testing a new hyperlocal social media platform called 'Shoelace' in New York City that lets users "connect with others who have the same interests". The app, which runs on both iOS and Android, is currently functioning on an invite-only basis. Notably, Google had officially shut down its social media platform Google+ after eight years in April.

headlines: Apple apologises for Watch app bug that risked iPhone eavesdropping
text: Apple has disabled its Watch's Walkie-Talkie app due to an unspecified vulnerability that could allow a person to listen to another customer's iPhone without consent. Apple apologised for the bug and for the inconvenience of being unable to use the feature while a fix is made. Apple said there is no current evidence that the bug was exploited.

headlines: I'm Wayanad MP but ties with Amethi are 3 decades old: Rahul
text: During his first visit to Amethi since he lost the parliamentary seat to Union Minister Smriti Irani, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reportedly said, "I am the MP from Wayanad but my ties with Amethi are three decades old." He added, "The development of Amethi will not be hampered... I will fight for Amethi in Delhi."

headlines: God save this country: Goa Congress as 10 MLAs resign, join BJP
text: After 10 of 15 Congress MLAs submitted their resignations and merged with the ruling BJP in Goa, state Congress chief Girish Chodankar said, "God save this country." He added, "People are watching this naked game of destruction of democracy and they will certainly teach a lesson to those involved in this utter shameful act of murdering democracy."

headlines: Moglix raises $60 million co-led by Tiger Global, Sequoia
text: Asia-based B2B marketplace for industrial goods Moglix has raised $60 million in its Series D funding round led by Tiger Global Management and Sequoia Capital. The funding round also saw participation from a new investor, Hong Kong-based Composite Capital. Founded in 2015 by former Google executive Rahul Garg, Moglix procures and supplies industrial goods like safety tools and hardware.

headlines: My life threatened by my father: BJP MLA's daughter on marrying Dalit
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Rajesh Mishra's daughter has alleged that her life is threatened by her father after she got married to a Dalit man. In a video message, the 23-year-old asked her father and brother to recall the goons sent by them and to stop bothering her husband and his relatives. "Papa, please change your mentality," she asserted.

headlines: Mom was protective, sent my cousin on my dates with Rishi: Neetu
text: Actress Neetu Kapoor, while recalling the days when she was dating Rishi Kapoor, revealed, "My mother was very protective of me and used to send my cousin Lovely on my dinner dates with Rishi." "I was very young, and I had never really been on a date before. This went on for three years," she added.

headlines: Canadian man swept over Niagara Falls survives 188-foot fall
text: A Canadian man, who was swept over Niagara's Horseshoe Falls on Tuesday, survived a fall of nearly 188 feet into the Lower Niagara River, Niagara Falls Park Police said. Officers found the man sitting on the rocks at the bottom of the falls. He was taken to the hospital for treatment.

headlines: By bits and pieces, Ravindra Jadeja ripped me apart: Sanjay Manjrekar
text: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar, who earlier called Ravindra Jadeja a "bits and pieces" player, praised the all-rounder saying he ripped him apart by "bits and pieces" during India-New Zealand World Cup semi-final. "Bits and by pieces of sheer brilliance just proved me wrong on all fronts...This is the Jadeja we haven't seen before. Today he was brilliant," he added.

headlines: Just wish it hadn't rained yesterday: Aamir as India lose WC semi
text: Reacting to India losing the 2019 World Cup semi-final to New Zealand on Wednesday, Aamir Khan tweeted, "I just wish it hadn't rained yesterday...the result might have been different." "For me, India had already won the World Cup when we qualified for the semi-finals at the top of the list as the number one team," he added.

headlines: Performance of the India-NZ semi-final came from Jadeja: Bhogle
text: Talking about the 2019 World Cup semi-final match between India and New Zealand, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "It is convention to give the player of the match award to someone from the winning side." "Matt Henry was fantastic today but the performance of the match came from Ravindra Jadeja. He is my player of the match,"' he added.

headlines: Rafael Nadal to face Roger Federer at Wimbledon after 11 years
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated Sam Querrey 7-5, 6-2, 6-2 on Wednesday to reach his seventh Wimbledon semi-final. With this, Nadal set up his 40th matchup and first at Wimbledon since their 2008 final, with longtime rival Roger Federer. Nadal had beaten Federer in the French Open semi-final last month.

headlines: We gave everything we had: Kohli to fans after World Cup exit
text: Following India's exit from 2019 World Cup, captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to express his gratitude to fans. "We're all disappointed & share the same emotions as you. We gave everything we had. Jai Hind," he wrote. "You made it a memorable tournament for all of us & we definitely felt the love showered upon the team," he added.

headlines: India lose a major ICC semi-final or final for 5th straight time
text: The 18-run defeat against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup semi-final was India's fifth consecutive defeat in a semi-final or final of a major ICC tournament. India finished runners-up in 2014 T20 World Cup and were knocked out of 2015 World Cup in semi-final. India lost 2016 T20 World Cup semi-final and lost Champions Trophy final in 2017 against Pakistan.

headlines: Federer beats Nishikori to win 100th Wimbledon match, reaches semi
text: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated Kei Nishikori on Wednesday to advance to the semi-finals of Wimbledon for the 13th time. The quarter-final victory was Federer's 100th at Wimbledon, making him the first player in history to earn 100 victories at Wimbledon. Federer also holds the record for winning most matches in Australian Open (97).

headlines: BJP trying to have One Nation One Party: Cong after 10 Goa MLAs quit
text: After 10 of the 15 Goa Congress MLAs resigned and merged with the BJP, Goa Congress President Girish Chodankar said that BJP is attempting to have One Nation One Party, instead of One Nation One Election. Chodankar added that BJP exposed its "intense insecurity" with its coalition partners and within its camp by inducting 10 Congress MLAs in its camp.

headlines: Matter of shame: Cong's Shivakumar on being deported back to K'taka
text: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar, who was detained by Mumbai police and deported to Bengaluru, said, "Mumbai is known for its hospitality...but BJP and officials misused their authority. It's a matter of shame." Shivakumar was detained after he was waiting to meet the rebel MLAs outside the hotel they were staying at. Police had imposed Section 144 in the area.

headlines: PayU India Co-founder & MD Shailaz Nag quits after 8 years: Report
text: Shailaz Nag, the Co-founder and Managing Director of South African conglomerate Naspers-owned PayU's India arm has reportedly quit after eight years. The Harvard Business School alumnus is looking out for opportunities in the payments space, the report cited its sources as saying. This comes days after Managing director for PayU India's LazyPay Jitendra Gupta had also announced his departure.

headlines: Practice Vajrasana: UP Minister to drivers 2 days after bus accident
text: Two days after 29 passengers died when their bus fell into a drain on Yamuna Expressway, Uttar Pradesh Transport Minister Swatantra Dev Singh advised drivers to practice 'Vajrasana' (a yoga pose) after a heavy meal. Singh said he received the tip from a video by Sadhguru. A probe suggested the accident occurred after the driver dozed off at the wheel.

headlines: Spoke like teacher to class of students: FM over Budget queries
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she "spoke like a teacher to a class of students" after she elaborated on some questions on Budget asked by MPs. "And even if that's not sufficient, I'm quite happy to receive Members to room number 36 with due respect," she said. Leader of Congress in Lok Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, objected to Sitharaman's comment.

headlines: Billion broken hearts: Rahul Gandhi on India's WC semi loss
text: Reacting to India crashing out of the 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-final, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Though there are a billion broken hearts tonight, Team India, you put up a great fight." Gandhi added that Team India deserve "our love and respect". The Wayanad MP also congratulated New Zealand for their "well-earned win".

headlines: India still the best team in world: Tharoor on WC semi loss
text: Following India's 2019 World Cup semi-final loss, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "They had a great run in World Cup, topped the table...lost only one match in group stage. They're still the best team in world cricket." "Let's be gracious enough to congratulate Kiwis," the Thiruvananthapuram MP further wrote. India lost to New Zealand by 18 runs.

headlines: Djokovic defeats Goffin in straight sets to reach 9th Wimbledon semi
text: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated world number 23 David Goffin in straight sets on Wednesday to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals for the ninth time. The 32-year-old won the match with the scoreline of 6-4, 6-0, 6-2 in one hour and 57 minutes. Djokovic is pursuing his fifth title at Wimbledon.

headlines: Why is BJP in a hurry to capture all states, asks Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday accused the BJP of indulging in horse-trading in Karnataka, and asked, "Why they are in such a hurry to capture all states?" Mamata added, "I do not understand why they are so greedy...This is dirty politics. After Karnataka, they will turn to Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan. Is it their job to break governments?"

headlines: Delhi HC bars Amazon, Flipkart from selling Amway products
text: The Delhi HC has passed an interim order to prevent e-commerce platforms including Amazon, Flipkart and Snapdeal from advertising, displaying or selling Amway products without the brand's consent. Platforms were accused of violation of the Direct Selling Guidelines, 2016 by offering unauthorised sale. Amazon responded to the claims saying it was only an intermediary and couldn't be held liable.

headlines: Brookfield plans offer for majority stake in Suzlon: Reports
text: Canada-based Brookfield Asset Management is reportedly planning an offer to buy majority stake in debt-laden Suzlon Energy. The investment firm is reportedly in talks with Suzlon's creditors to restructure its $1.6-billion debt in a one-time settlement plan, asking SBI-led lenders to take a 50% haircut. Reports said Brookfield may offer to buy new shares, followed by shares from existing holders.

headlines: Wasn't aware I was pregnant with Alia, smoked for a scene: Mom Soni
text: Actress Alia Bhatt's mother Soni Razdan has revealed that she was pregnant with Alia during the shooting of the 1993 film 'Gumrah' but was not aware about it. "And did that scene where I smoked soooo many cigarettes," she added. Directed by her husband Mahesh Bhatt, the film starred Sridevi and Sanjay Dutt in lead roles.

headlines: Manjrekar criticised for 'sarcastic' tweet praising Ravindra Jadeja
text: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has been criticised for his 'sarcastic' tweet praising all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his performance in 2019 World Cup semi-final. Manjrekar wrote, "Well played Jadeja!" followed by a wink emoji. "Verbal diarrhea in action," a user tweeted. "We would've accepted it as a sportsman spirit but you lost people's respect by using a winking emoji," wrote another.

headlines: 45 minutes of poor cricket cost us a place in the final: Virat Kohli
text: During the post-match press conference after losing the 2019 World Cup semi-final to New Zealand, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "Very disappointed, we have played outstanding cricket throughout the tournament." "To go out after 45 minutes of poor cricket is saddening. It breaks your heart too. A spell of bad cricket and you're out of the tournament," he added.

headlines: Good to see India's fighting spirit till very end: PM on WC semi loss
text: Reacting to India crashing out of the 2019 World Cup after losing to New Zealand in the semi-final, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "A disappointing result, but good to see #TeamIndias fighting spirit till the very end." "Wins and losses are a part of life. Best wishes to the team for their future endeavours. #INDvsNZ," he added.

headlines: Dhoni has not told us anything about his retirement: Virat Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli has said that MS Dhoni hasn't told them anything about his retirement plans amid speculation that he may quit after team's semi-final exit from the World Cup. MS Dhoni, who hit 50 runs off 72 balls in the semi-final, scored 273 runs in eight innings in the 2019 World Cup. It was Dhoni's fourth World Cup.

headlines: Facebook permits death threats against 'dangerous individuals'
text: Facebook has updated its Community Standards policy, which now accepts calls for "high-severity violence" including death threats if the targets are 'dangerous individuals or organisations'. Facebook stated targets can be "described as having carried out violent crimes or sexual offences", wherein criminal/predator status has been established by media reports, market knowledge of news event, etc.

headlines: Night or 4 am I'd be here: Rahul to Amethi in 1st visit after defeat
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday visited Amethi constituency in Uttar Pradesh for the first time after his defeat in Lok Sabha elections against BJP's Smriti Irani. Rahul said, "I was Amethi MP for 15 years, I have old ties with Amethi. Whenever Amethi would need me, be it at night or four in the morning, I would be here."

headlines: Rebel Karnataka MLA chased by police, pushed and sent into his car
text: Rebel Karnataka Congress MLA K Sudhakar, who submitted his resignation to the Speaker of the Assembly, was chased by the police. The police pushed Sudhakar into his car after catching him and sent the car away. A scuffle between the BJP and Congress leaders took place at Karnataka Secretariat, forcing police to bring the situation under control.

headlines: 1st pics of 'Baahubali' rocket that will launch Chandrayaan-2 out
text: The first images of India's heaviest rocket GSLV MkIII-M, referred to as 'Baahubali', were released by ISRO on Wednesday ahead of India's second Moon Mission 'Chandrayaan-2' launch scheduled for July 15 from Sriharikota. The three-stage vehicle, India's most powerful launcher to date, will carry Chandrayaan-2 to its designated orbit. The mission aims to place robotic rover 'Pragyan' on the Moon.

headlines: CBI books former SP minister, 4 IAS officers in UP sand mining scam
text: CBI has registered two new cases in Uttar Pradesh sand mining scam, accusing four IAS officers and Gayatri Prajapati, former minister in Samajwadi Party government. UP government had ordered e-tendering for renewal and award of fresh leases in 2012. CBI alleged that two beneficiaries used Prajapati's influence to get their lease renewed in violation of e-tendering policy of the government.

headlines: Pro-Khalistani group Sikhs for Justice banned for anti-national acts
text: The Centre on Wednesday banned the US-based pro-Khalistani group, Sikhs for Justice (SFJ), for its alleged anti-national activities. SFJ pushes for Sikh Referendum 2020 as part of its separatist agenda. It openly supports the cause of Khalistan and its primary objective is to establish an "independent and sovereign country" in Punjab, said an official.

headlines: Merkel seen shaking for 3rd time in a month amid health concerns
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel was seen shaking for the third time in a month as she stood alongside Finland PM Antti Rinne during a ceremony in the capital Berlin on Wednesday. Following the incident, Merkel said she was "very well" and there was "no need to worry", adding that she was still psychologically "processing" her first shaking episode.

headlines: Facebook to not launch Libra in India due to local restrictions
text: Facebook said it has no plans to offer its Calibra digital wallet services in India, effectively ruling out the rollout of its Libra cryptocurrency in the country. "As you may know, there are local restrictions within India...Calibra will respect the legislation," Facebook said. "But we're looking to work with regulators to see if the legislation can be updated," it added.

headlines: Airtel Africa becomes Nigeria's third biggest company
text: Airtel Africa listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange on Tuesday in a $4.4 billion flotation, after raising about $750 million in London last month. Airtel Africa, the continent's second-largest wireless carrier by subscribers, has become Nigeria's third-largest listed company displacing Nestle Nigeria. Dangote Cement is Nigeria's most valuable stock followed by telecom market leader MTN Nigeria.

headlines: Media have an agenda against Paul Pogba: Man Utd manager
text: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has said Paul Pogba has "never been a concern" and that the media have an "agenda" against the France midfielder. "Agents talk all the time...We have not had any bids from any clubs," Solskjaer added. Pogba's agent Mino Raiola had recently revealed that the 26-year-old is determined to leave Manchester United.

headlines: Russian blogger sues Instagram over plans to make 'likes' private
text: Russian blogger Ruslan Zakharkin claimed he has sued Facebook-owned Instagram over its plans to make the number of 'likes' on a post private. He argued the move will be the end of blogging as a source of income. "I'm representing the community of all Russian bloggers," Zakharkin said, adding Instagram owes him 500 thousand rubles in compensation for moral damages.

headlines: Swiggy may put $100 million into micro-delivery through Supr
text: Bengaluru-based Swiggy is reportedly planning to invest about $100 million for its subscription-based delivery business under Supr Daily, a Mumbai-based micro-delivery startup it reportedly acquired last year. The foodtech platform reportedly plans to do so over the next two to three years. Supr Daily was founded in 2015 by IIT-Bombay alumni Puneet Kumar and Shreyas Nagdawane.

headlines: Fintech startup NiYO gets $35 million from Tencent, Horizons
text: Bengaluru-based digital banking fintech startup NiYO Solutions has raised $35 million in Series B round. The round saw participation from China's Tencent Holdings, Hong Kong-based Horizons Ventures and existing investor JS Capital. Founded in 2015 by Vinay Bagri and Virender Bisht, NiYO helps employees increase cash flows by claiming tax-saving allowances on CTC disbursed by their employer.

headlines: Indonesia assures it will cut tariffs on Indian sugar imports
text: Indonesia will better facilitate imports of sugar by reducing tariffs on the commodity from India, Indonesian Trade Minister Enggartiasto Lukita told Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal in a bilateral meeting. He also requested India to cut duty on refined palm oil imports. Goyal in the meeting raised concerns about India's trade deficit with Indonesia, which was $10.57 billion in 2018-19.

headlines: IAS officer Arun Kumar appointed as full-time DGCA chief
text: Arun Kumar, the Additional Secretary and Financial Adviser in Civil Aviation Ministry, has been appointed as the Director General (DG) of Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Tuesday. A 1989-batch IAS officer of Haryana cadre, Kumar has been holding additional charge as the DG since the former DG BS Bhullar retired on May 31.

headlines: Co-founders' dispute has nothing to do with IndiGo, says CEO
text: IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta has written to the airline's employees saying that the dispute between its co-founders Rakesh Gangwal and Rahul Bhatia has nothing to do with the airline and its functioning. "The issues between them will eventually get sorted out," he said. Gangwal has accused Bhatia and his firms of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with the airline.

headlines: New Zealand defeat India to reach their 2nd straight World Cup final
