text: New Zealand defeated India by 18 runs in the first semi-final of the 2019 World Cup at Manchester on Wednesday to reach World Cup final for the second straight time. This is the second straight time that India have been eliminated from World Cup in semi-finals. The semi-final was played over two days after rain interrupted play on Tuesday.

headlines: Ravindra Jadeja smashes a fifty in ODI cricket after 5 years
text: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed a fifty in ODI cricket after five years after reaching the 50-run mark off 39 balls against New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. With this, he became the first player to score a fifty batting at number eight or lower in World Cup knockout matches.

headlines: I don't eat anything for 16 hrs daily: Ram Kapoor on 30kg weight loss
text: Actor Ram Kapoor, whose pictures after weight loss went viral, revealed his workout and diet routine. "I do an hour of weight-lifting on empty stomach after waking up and do cardio just before sleeping," the actor who lost about 30 kilograms said. "I eat limited food during an eight-hour period. For the rest...16 hours, I don't eat anything," Ram added.

headlines: Wife's impersonator cheating people as Amazon casting head: Shreyas
text: Actor Shreyas Talpade has warned that a woman is misleading people on social media by using his wife Deepti's name as the Amazon casting head. "She's using the picture of Deepti and me as her profile picture and contacting people through the same WhatsApp identity," he said. "Deepti is an independent producer...She isn't the casting director at Amazon," Shreyas added.

headlines: Kohli got out to left-arm pacers in his 3 WC semis, scored 11 runs
text: India captain Virat Kohli was dismissed LBW for 1(6) off New Zealand left-arm pacer Trent Boult in 2019 World Cup semi-final on Wednesday. Interestingly, in 2011 World Cup semi-final, Pakistan left-arm pacer Wahab Riaz dismissed him for 9(21), while in the 2015 World Cup semi-final, he was dismissed for 1(13) on the bowling of Australia left-arm pacer Mitchell Johnson.

headlines: Mortified: Bumble CEO on allegations of owner promoting drugs
text: Bumble Founder and CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd, responding to the Forbes report accusing Bumble's billionaire owner Andrey Andreev of promoting sexism, porn and drugs, said she was "mortified by the allegations". "We at Bumble have never seen or heard of any of this behaviour from any team members, and if we had we would have never tolerated it," she added.

headlines: Indonesian minister challenges Mark Zuckerberg to paddle race
text: Indonesian minister Susi Pudjiastuti challenged Mark Zuckerberg to a race after the Facebook founder posted a picture of himself paddling on a lake. She asked for 10% stake in Facebook if she won. Pudjiastuti added she'd sell the shares back to Zuckerberg and use the money to buy a "few big patrol vessels" to protect Indonesian waters from illegal fishing.

headlines: Mumbai hotel serves tea, doughnuts to Shivakumar after denying room
text: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar was served tea and doughnuts by the Mumbai hotel that cancelled his room booking on Wednesday. The media and the police personnel outside the hotel were also offered food. It was not clear whether the snacks were paid for or if the hotel served them as a courtesy gesture after denying entry to Shivakumar.

headlines: Is keeping licensed gun a crime? Suspended BJP MLA on viral video
text: Hours after suspended Uttarakhand BJP MLA Pranav Singh Champion's video of brandishing guns while drinking alcohol went viral, he questioned, "Is drinking alcohol and keeping licensed gun a crime?" He said, "This is a conspiracy. They are licensed weapons and not loaded." He added, "I'm not pointing towards anyone or threatening anyone. What's the crime?"

headlines: Detained Shivakumar, Deora kept at Mumbai University's Kalina campus
text: Detained Congress leaders including DK Shivakumar and Milind Deora have been kept at Mumbai University's Kalina campus rest house. They were sitting outside Renaissance Mumbai Convention Centre Hotel, where 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) Karnataka MLAs are staying, when they were detained after the MLAs refused to meet them. Sixteen Congress-JD(S) MLAs have submitted resignations to Karnataka Speaker.

headlines: Now a dancer will help BJP win votes: JJP leader on Sapna Choudhary
text: Two days after Haryanvi dancer Sapna Choudhary joined the BJP, Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) leader Digvijay Chautala on Tuesday remarked, "Ab thumke lagane wali (Sapna Choudhary) BJP ke liye votes layegi (Now, a dancer will help the BJP win votes)." He also called her art "vulgar". The Haryana State Commission For Women has issued a notice to the JJP leader.

headlines: Detained Cong leaders released in Mumbai, Shivakumar to be sent back
text: Congress leader Milind Deora's office has said that Mumbai Police has released Congress leaders including Deora who were detained earlier today for waiting outside the hotel where rebel Karnataka MLAs are staying. Deora's office further said that the police is taking Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar directly to the airport from where he will be "forcibly" sent back to Bengaluru.

headlines: Dawood's D-Company transformed into terrorist network: India at UN
text: Underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company has transformed from a criminal syndicate into a terrorist network, which poses a "real and present danger" in the region, Indian Ambassador to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin, told the Security Council. The D-Company is engaging in illegal economic activities such as gold smuggling and arms and drug trafficking from a "safe haven", Akbaruddin added.

headlines: Pak news anchor shot dead in Karachi, suspect attempts suicide
text: Pakistani news anchor Mureed Abbas was shot dead outside a cafe in Karachi on Tuesday over a personal dispute, police officials said. Abbas' friends informed the police that he had a monetary dispute with someone whose identity had been withheld. The suspect was caught attempting suicide when the police raided his house and he's been admitted to hospital.

headlines: Pregnant women, children killed in Papua New Guinea massacre
text: Pregnant women and children were among 24 people murdered in a tribal massacre in Papua New Guinea's (PNG) Hela province. The killings were in retaliation for an earlier attack that killed six people, officials said. The killings occurred in the district represented by PNG's PM James Marape, who called it "one of the saddest days of (his) life".

headlines: It feels like coming home: Rahul on Amethi visit
text: During his first visit to Amethi since he lost the parliamentary seat to BJP's Smriti Irani, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "It feels like coming home". "I'm very happy after coming to Amethi," Rahul tweeted after reaching Amethi. Earlier today, Rahul thanked his Twitter followers after his follower count on the social media platform reached 10 million.

headlines: AAP rules out forming alliance with JJP for Haryana polls
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has ruled out an alliance with the Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) for the upcoming Assembly elections in Haryana. However, the AAP and the JJP together fought the Lok Sabha elections on all 10 Haryana parliamentary seats. The Assembly elections in Haryana are due in October 2019.

headlines: SpaceX wins $50-mn NASA contract for black hole research mission
text: NASA has awarded an over $50-million contract to Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX to launch its Imaging X-Ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE) mission. The IXPE mission is aimed towards studying polarised light from sources including supermassive black holes, neutron stars and pulsar wind nebulae. The mission is presently scheduled to launch in April 2021 on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket from Florida.

headlines: June passenger vehicle sales fall 17.5%, car sales down 24%
text: India's domestic passenger vehicles sales declined by 17.54% year-on-year in June to 2,25,732 units, according to the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). The domestic sales of passenger cars in June fell by 24.07% to 1,39,628 units compared to 1,83,885 units in June 2018. Earlier, India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki cut production for a fifth straight month in June.

headlines: UK to give free HPV vaccines to boys, aims to stop 1L cancer cases
text: The UK has announced that starting September, boys in the year 8 of the country's schooling system, aged around 12-13, will receive free vaccination against sexually-transmitted Human Papillomavirus (HPV). The move aims to prevent over 1 lakh cancer cases by 2058. About 5% of all cancers worldwide are linked to HPV virus, UK's Public Health England said.

headlines: Appreciate Ekta's stand but will continue ban on Kangana: Journalists
text: Entertainment Journalists' Guild of India has accepted producer Ekta Kapoor's apology over Kangana Ranaut's argument with a reporter. "The Entertainment Journalists Guild appreciates Ms Ekta Kapoor's support and standing for what is right through her official statement," the body wrote. "However, we will continue the ban on Ms Kangana Ranaut across all media platforms," the statement further read.

headlines: It is very unfair to criticise MS Dhoni: Kapil Dev
text: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said it is very unfair to criticise ex-India captain MS Dhoni. "It has happened to those who have been rated as all-time greats. They aren't going to be 20 all over again," he added. "The most important thing is Dhoni is doing good as far as team is concerned," he further said.

headlines: Sehwag jokingly suggests DLS method for salaries during rainy days
text: After rain interrupted India-New Zealand semi-final on Tuesday, Virender Sehwag mocked the Duckworth Lewis method. "Will it be advantage employees if salary is given by Duckworth Lewis in rainy months. If baarish mein bhi employee is coming to office. What do HR log think?" he tweeted. "Cricket mein DLS aur Salary mein CTC kisiko samajh aaya hai?" a user tweeted.

headlines: India register the lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup
text: India registered the lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup after being restricted to 24/4 in the first 10 overs against New Zealand in the semi-final on Wednesday. India's top three batsmen got out for one run each in the innings. The previous lowest powerplay score in 2019 World Cup was recorded by New Zealand (27/1) in the same match.

headlines: Woman claims American Airlines told her to cover up outfit with blanket
text: A US doctor has alleged she and her 8-year-old son were denied boarding on an American Airlines flight over her outfit. "I was asked to 'cover up'...I was threatened with not getting back on the flight unless I walked down the aisle wrapped in...blanket," she tweeted while sharing her outfit's pictures. "We apologise...for their experience," the airline's spokesperson said.

headlines: Ghulam Nabi Azad, other Cong leaders detained for protesting in B'luru
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad and other party leaders were detained on Wednesday near Raj Bhawan in Bengaluru while protesting against the alleged horse-trading in Karnataka. JD(S) chief and former PM HD Deve Gowda and Congress leaders Siddaramaiah and KC Venugopal were also present at the protest site. Notably, Congress leaders DK Shivakumar and Milind Deora were detained in Mumbai.

headlines: 7 more arrested for murder of Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary
text: Seven more people were arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of Haryana Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary, who was shot dead outside a gym in Faridabad on June 27. Four other people allegedly involved in planning the murder and supplying weapons to the perpetrators had been arrested earlier. Earlier, the police said Vikas was murdered over a financial dispute.

headlines: Don't want to insult Shivakumar, but can't meet him: Rebel Cong MLA
text: After rebel Karnataka MLAs refused to meet Congress leader DK Shivakumar who came to Mumbai, rebel Congress MLA ST Somashekar said, "We don't intend to insult Shivakumar. We've faith in him but there's a reason we've taken this step." He added, "Friendship, love and affection are on one side, [but] we request him to understand why we can't meet him."

headlines: Orange alert for heavy rainfall in 9 Uttarakhand districts
text: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert in Uttarakhand from July 11-14, predicting that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to occur at isolated places in nine districts. The alert has been issued for Nainital, Champawat, Udham Singh Nagar, Pithoragarh, Chamoli, Tehri Garhwal, Pauri Garhwal, Dehradun and Haridwar districts.

headlines: Wrong placement of height barrier blamed for Dubai bus crash
text: The placing of the height barrier in which a bus crashed in Dubai last month, killing 17 people including 12 Indians, was blamed for the accident in a UAE court. The bus had wrongly entered a road and crashed into a height barrier. The distance between the warning signboard and the barrier was only 12 metres, the court was told.

headlines: Trump calls UK PM May 'foolish' and her ambassador 'wacky'
text: US President Donald Trump called UK PM Theresa May "foolish" and the UK's Ambassador to the US, Kim Darroch, "wacky" and "a very stupid guy". Trump said May failed in her Brexit negotiations as she ignored his advice. He earlier said the US will no longer deal with Darroch after leaked emails revealed that he called Trump administration "dysfunctional".

headlines: UK Ambassador to US resigns after calling Trump govt 'incompetent'
text: Kim Darroch, the UK's Ambassador to the US, has resigned after leaked emails revealed that he'd called President Donald Trump's administration "dysfunctional" and "incompetent". This comes after Trump said that the US would no longer deal with Darroch. "The current situation is making it impossible for me to carry out my role as I'd like," Darroch said in a statement.

headlines: Indian ethnic group workers in UK earn more than white British
text: Chinese and Indian ethnic group workers in the UK had higher median hourly pay than white British employees in 2018, an official survey revealed. Chinese ethnicity group is the highest paid, receiving £15.75 an hour, followed by Indian workers at £13.47. The median pay of white British workers was £12.03 an hour compared with £9.60 for people of Bangladeshi ethnicity.

headlines: Google to buy Israeli-US cloud storage startup Elastifile
text: Google has announced it plans to acquire Israeli-US cloud storage startup Elastifile reportedly for around $200 million, which will join Google Cloud post-acquisition. This marks another acquisition under former Oracle executive Thomas Kurian, who was named as the new Google Cloud CEO in November 2018. Founded in 2013, Elastifile has raised about $75 million from Huawei and Lenovo, among others.

headlines: Delhi has an entire museum dedicated to toilets
text: The Sulabh International Museum of Toilets in West Delhi area has numerous items to display the transition in toilet-related technology, sanitation habits and hygiene etiquettes. It also has several humorous and intellectual poems, stories, jokes and phrases on toilets from various times. The museum is the brain-child of Sulabh International Social Service Organisation's Founder Bindeshwar Pathak.

headlines: Cong hasn't allowed RS to function over K'taka issue: Javadekar
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar accused the Congress of not allowing Rajya Sabha to function on the issue of the political crises in Karnataka. While the House was disrupted on Tuesday, Congress leaders staged a walkout on Wednesday over the Karnataka issue. Javadekar said, "The entire episode (Karnataka issue) is done by Congress and BJP has nothing to do with it."

headlines: Kumaraswamy has no right to continue as K'taka CM: Yeddyurappa
text: Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa on Wednesday said he met Karnataka Governor Vajubhai Vala on Wednesday and conveyed to him that the Congress-JD(S) coalition does not have the required strength in the state Assembly. Yeddyurappa added, "Kumaraswamy has no moral right to continue as Chief Minister as they do not have the numbers."

headlines: US' General Catalyst may invest in CRED's $120-million round
text: Bengaluru-based credit card bill payment startup CRED is reportedly in talks with US-based venture capital fund General Catalyst to secure investment in its $120-million funding round. Past reports had claimed CRED is looking to raise $100 million funding at a $400-million valuation from China's Hillhouse Capital and existing investors. CRED was announced by FreeCharge Founder Kunal Shah in 2018.

headlines: LocalCircles approaches FM over startups' tax, customs issues
text: Community and governance-focussed communication platform LocalCircles approached Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman over issues startups face around taxes and customs. Even when several measures have been taken to help startups and SMEs in the Budget, there's still scope of resolution of important issues, LocalCircles CEO said in a letter. Concerns regarding TDS, GST and ESOPs were raised.

headlines: Ex-Sequoia MDs close A91 Partners' 1st fund at $351M, exceed target
text: Mumbai-based VC fund A91 Partners has announced the closure of its maiden fund at $351 million, exceeding its target corpus pegged at about $250-300 million. A91 Partners was floated by former Sequoia Capital Managing Directors VT Bharadwaj, Gautam Mago and Abhay Pandey. It's focused on making mid-stage investments between $10-30 million, in Series B and C funding rounds.

headlines: US imposes sanctions on Hezbollah lawmakers for the first time
text: The US has imposed sanctions on Hezbollah lawmakers Amin Sherri and Muhammad Hasan Ra'd, who are accused of supporting Iran, in the first such move directly targetting members of the group's elected politicians. The US also designated Wafiq Safa, in-charge of Hezbollah's Liaison and Coordination Unit, which is responsible for coordinating with Lebanese security agencies.

headlines: Philippine President urges US to declare war on China
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte called on the US to declare war on China amid tensions over the South China Sea. "When (the US) enters the South China Sea, I'll enter. I'll tell the Americans 'let's bomb everything'," he said. The Philippines is one of the nations who lay claims in the South China Sea, with the US opposing China's claims.

headlines: SC to hear K'taka MLAs plea on Speaker's delay in accepting resignations
text: Karnataka's Congress and JD(S) MLAs, who submitted their resignations, have approached the Supreme Court accusing the Assembly Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar of abandoning his constitutional duty and deliberately delaying acceptance of their resignations. The Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi has agreed to hear the MLAs' plea on Thursday. This comes after Kumar rejected eight MLAs' resignation over incorrect format.

headlines: Makers of 'JudgeMentall...' apologise as journalists boycott Kangana
text: The makers of Kangana Ranaut starrer 'JudgeMentall Hai Kya' have issued an apology after Entertainment Journalists' Guild of India boycotted Kangana and asked her and the film's producer Ekta Kapoor to issue a public statement over Kangana's argument with a reporter. "We'd like to maintain that our intention was not to disrespect or hurt anyone's sentiments," the statement further read.

headlines: Shivakumar, Deora detained from outside of Mumbai hotel housing MLAs
text: Congress leaders DK Shivakumar, Sanjay Nirupam and Milind Deora, who were outside Renaissance Mumbai Convention Centre Hotel after being denied entry, were detained on Wednesday and Section 144 was imposed in the area. They wanted to meet 10 rebel Congress-JD(S) MLAs staying at the hotel. The MLAs had sought protection from Mumbai Police Commissioner claiming threat to their lives.

headlines: IndiGo shares fall 19% amid fight between co-founders
text: Shares of InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo airline, fell by around 19% on Wednesday after one of its co-founders, Rakesh Gangwal, raised corporate governance issues with the SEBI. Gangwal has accused co-founder Rahul Bhatia and his firms of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with the airline, adding Bhatia has "unusual rights" in the firm.

headlines: CBFC removes scene of politician touching dancer in Super 30
text: The Censor Board has removed two shots from the song 'Paisa' in Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', including a shot of a politician touching a dancer. These have been replaced with regular dancing shots. Besides this, the words 'Ramayan mein' were replaced with 'Raj Puran mein' in a particular dialogue of the film, which has been granted a U-certificate.

headlines: Setting 250-run target for India may just be enough for NZ: McCullum
text: Talking about India-New Zealand World Cup semi-final, ex-Kiwi captain Brendon McCullum said New Zealand must set at least 250-run target. "Around 250 would never be enough in a bilateral series between...two teams on this surface but in a World Cup semi-final...it may just be!" he added. New Zealand scored 211/5 in 46.1 overs before rain stopped play on Tuesday.

headlines: Vaughan asks Manjrekar to unblock him, shares his pic on Chahal meme
text: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan took to Instagram to share a picture of commentator Sanjay Manjrekar's face morphed onto Yuzvendra Chahal's meme. "Come on Sanjay unblock me on Twitter...It's only Bantz...!!!! #India," Vaughan wrote alongside the picture. Manjrekar blocked Vaughan after the latter taunted Manjrekar over his remark that he isn't a fan of "bits and pieces" players like Ravindra Jadeja.

headlines: Mumbai hotel cancels Congress leader Shivakumar's room booking
text: The Mumbai five-star hotel, where the rebel Karnataka MLAs are staying, has cancelled Congress leader DK Shivakumar's room booking amid heightened security at the hotel for the rebel MLAs' protection. Responding to the cancellation, Shivakumar said, "They should be proud of a customer like me. I love Mumbai. I love this hotel. Let them cancel. I have other rooms also."

headlines: Rebel MLAs will call: Congress' Shivakumar outside Mumbai hotel
text: After rebel Congress and JD(S) MLAs refused to meet Congress leader DK Shivakumar, who arrived in Mumbai on Wednesday, Shivakumar said, "I'll not go without meeting my friends (rebel MLAs)...they'll call me." "Their heart is beating to meet their friend," he added as he waited outside the hotel after being denied entry by the security.

headlines: Suspended BJP MLA poses with guns, dances to Bollywood songs in video
text: A video showing suspended Uttarakhand BJP MLA, Pranav Singh Champion, has surfaced online, showing him posing with several guns while dancing to Bollywood songs reportedly after getting a leg surgery. Champion, who was suspended from the party for threatening a journalist, could also be heard using abusive language in the video. Meanwhile, police said they'll investigate the matter.

headlines: Air France asks 26 flyers to 'voluntarily' leave flight over glitch
text: As many as 26 passengers of Paris-bound Air France flight were asked to exit the plane with their checked-in luggage at the Delhi airport over an unspecified technical problem on Wednesday morning. A video of the incident shows the flight crew requesting the passengers to deboard "voluntarily" so that the plane could take off.

headlines: Minor girl pregnant after being gangraped by 5 men in K'taka
text: A 17-year-old girl is six months pregnant after she was allegedly raped repeatedly by five men in a village in the Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka. The accused had threatened the girl not to divulge the matter to anyone. A case has been registered under Sections 376, 506 and 34 of the IPC.

headlines: Not my fault that I'm gay: 20-yr-old posts on Facebook before suicide
text: Avinshu Patel, a 20-year-old salon worker in Chennai, committed suicide by jumping into the sea last week. "The way I walk, think and talk is like a girl. People in India don't like that...It's not my fault I was born gay," he had posted on Facebook. He also called a friend to tell that he wanted to end his life.

headlines: Pakistanis are not trustworthy: Al-Qaeda chief in video message
text: Al-Qaeda chief, Ayman al-Zawahiri, has released a video, in which he said, "Pakistanis are not trustworthy." Zawahiri futher called Pakistan's army and government "toadies of America", adding they're interested in exploiting the mujahideen for political objectives, "only to dump or persecute them later". Meanwhile, he also told 'Mujahideen in Kashmir' to inflict "unrelenting blows" on Indian Army.

headlines: Sex offender freed by Aus court, allowed to visit prostitutes
text: An Australian court has released a 61-year-old sex offender from prison and permitted him to solicit prostitution to reduce his risk of reoffending. He's been released under a 10-year supervision order with 52 conditions, including no alcohol and no access to sex workers without approval. The offender has gained a rudimentary understanding of the concept of consent, a judge said.

headlines: 1 in 4 kids in Pak won't complete primary education by 2030: UNESCO
text: One in four Pakistani children won't be able to complete their primary education by 2030, as per projections by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organ­isation (UNESCO). Pakistan will only half-way complete the target of 12 years of education for all, with 50% of youth still not completing upper secondary education at the current rates, the UN body added.

headlines: ICC CEO calls India's Jasprit Bumrah a 'top-class performer
text: The International Cricket Council's Chief Executive Officer Dave Richardson called Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah a 'top-class performer'. "India is in tremendous form, especially their batting. People like Bumrah are top-class performers," Richardson said about the Indian team. India are facing New Zealand in the semi-final of the 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Will celebrate in Amethi: Rahul on 10 million Twitter followers
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who now has 10 million Twitter followers, on Wednesday tweeted, "Thank you to each and every one of you!" He added, "I will celebrate the milestone in Amethi, where I will be meeting our Congress workers & supporters today." His visit to Amethi will be the first since he lost the LS seat to Smriti Irani.

headlines: BJP to sit on dharna in front of Vidhana Soudha: Yeddyurappa
text: BJP leader BS Yeddyurappa said the party will sit on dharna in front of Vidhana Soudha, Bengaluru as the Governor hasn't accepted the resignations of the Congress-JD(S) MLAs which are in a correct format. Yeddyurappa added that according to the Speaker, five to six MLAs have submitted the resignations in a correct format and the Governor must accept them immediately.

headlines: Man held for creating fake IDs to defraud govt ministries
text: The Delhi Police arrested a man for creating fake IDs of a Pay and Accounts Officer of the central government to siphon off money from the bank accounts of various ministries. The police said that he was released on bail recently for a similar fraud with the Health Ministry. He was planning to fraud four different ministries, the police added.

headlines: Byju's raises $150 million led by Qatar Investment Authority
text: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Byju's has raised $150 million in a funding round led by Qatar Investment Authority, the sovereign wealth fund of the State of Qatar, with participation from Owl Ventures. The deal reportedly marks the two entities' first-ever investment in an Indian startup. Billion-dollar startup Byju's was started in 2008 by Byju Raveendran as an offline teaching centre.

headlines: Over 5,500 Kashmiri youth register for Army recruitment in J&K
text: Over 5,500 Kashmiri youth have registered for the Indian Army recruitment drive being organised in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla. Starting today, the Army recruitment drive will continue till July 16. "We are indeed very grateful to local formations like Sector 10 Headquarters of Rashtriya Rifles for providing us with all the support in conducting this rally," an Army official said.

headlines: 12 children rescued from wire factory in J&K's Kathua
text: As many as 12 children, including two girls, were rescued from a cable assembling factory in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua, police said. "These labourers migrated from West Bengal to Kathua in search of work; they were pushed by their parents to work as labourers," the police added. The police are currently trying to trace the family members of the children.

headlines: All were naked, doing coke: Ex-worker says Bumble owner promoted drugs
text: A Forbes report has accused US-based dating app Bumble's billionaire owner Andrey Andreev of encouraging sexism, porn and drugs at the parent firm Badoo quoting former employees. A former Badoo employee claimed "everyone was naked and doing lines of coke" at a party of employees. It's also reported that internal engineering updates were named after pornstars, which was discontinued later.

headlines: Gavaskar was mistakenly exchanged at birth, later returned
text: Former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar, who turns 70 today, was almost exchanged at birth after a nurse accidentally placed him next to a fisherwoman in the hospital. Gavaskar's uncle had noticed a birthmark near his ear and when he didn't see it in the other child, he brought the matter to the parents' notice, following which Gavaskar was returned.

headlines: Gavaskar once got a haircut from an umpire while batting
text: Sunil Gavaskar, who turns 70 today, got his hair trimmed from umpire Dickie Bird while batting in a Test against England in 1974. Gavaskar, who wasn't wearing a helmet, asked Bird to cut his hair as they were getting in his eyes. Bird chopped Gavaskar's hair with a pair of scissors he had kept to cut threads from ball's seam.

headlines: I can't explain but was never settled with any IPL franchise: Yuvraj
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has said that he could never settle with any IPL franchise. "I can't explain but I was never settled with a franchise...I didn't really get settled where you are made to play for one franchise or maybe two," he added. Yuvraj played for six IPL franchises in his career.

headlines: Ashwin takes five-wicket haul for Nottinghamshire against Somerset
text: Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took five wickets for 59 runs to help Nottinghamshire bowl out Somerset for 169 in their second innings of the County Championship Division One match in Taunton on Tuesday. The 32-year-old registered match figures of eight for 123 in 64.3 overs. It was Ashwin's second County match of the season.

headlines: Johanna Konta crashes out as Strycova enters her 1st Wimbledon semi
text: World number 54 Barbora Strycova reached her maiden Wimbledon semi-final after defeating world number 18 Johanna Konta 7-6(7-5), 6-1 in one hour and 37 minutes. The 33-year-old had only previously reached one major quarterfinal (Wimbledon in 2014). In the semi-final, Strycova will face Serena Williams, who defeated Alison Riske in the quarter-finals.

headlines: Marriott to face $123-mn UK fine for exposing 383 mn guests' data
text: American hotel chain Marriott faces a fine of over $123 million from UK's data protection authority for a data breach that exposed about 383 million guests. Marriott revealed last year that its acquired Starwood properties had its central reservation database hacked. Around five million unencrypted passport numbers and nine million credit card records were said to have been leaked.

headlines: We feel threatened: K'taka MLAs write to Mumbai Police, get protection
text: Ten rebel Karnataka MLAs, who've been staying at a Mumbai hotel, sought police protection in a letter stating, "We've heard that Shri Kumaraswamy and DK Shivakumar and others are going to storm the hotel premises...we feel threatened ". Police forces were deployed outside the hotel as the letter requested their help to stop Kumaraswamy and Shivakumar from entering the premises.

headlines: Born together, die together in politics: Shivakumar on rebel MLAs
text: As Congress leader DK Shivakumar arrived at Mumbai hotel to meet the rebel Karnataka MLAs, he said, "We were born together in politics, we'll die together in politics." "They're our party men. We've come to meet them," he added. Mumbai Police had deployed forces outside the hotel after the rebel MLAs had sought their protection stating that they "feel threatened".

headlines: Cong's Shivakumar not allowed in hotel after rebel MLAs' request
text: Congress leader DK Shivakumar was stopped from entering the hotel in Mumbai, where ten rebel Karnataka MLAs are staying, after they wrote to police for protection from him. Meanwhile, Shivakumar said he has booked a room in the hotel. "There's no question of threatening, we love and respect each other," he asserted after the MLAs had claimed they felt threatened.

headlines: SpiceJet technician dies after he gets stuck in landing gear door
text: A SpiceJet technician lost his life after he got stuck in main landing gear door while working on an aircraft at Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport in Kolkata at around 1 am on Wednesday. His body was removed from landing gear with the help of fire brigade. Police have launched an investigation into the incident.

headlines: 1 dead as under-construction building collapses in Bengaluru
text: At least one person was killed and several others were injured when an under-construction building collapsed in Bengaluru on Wednesday morning. Meanwhile, eight people were rescued from the debris and sent to the Bowring and Lady Curzon Hospital. The adjoining building was also damaged in the incident.

headlines: 'Paan ki dukaan' would manage affairs better than IndiGo: Co-founder
text: IndiGo's American co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has accused co-founder Rahul Bhatia and his firms of entering into "questionable" related party transactions with the airline. Gangwal said that "even a 'paan ki dukaan' would have handled these matters with more grace". He said Bhatia has "unusual rights" including the right to appoint three out of six directors, MD, CEO, President, and Chairman.

headlines: Journalists' Guild boycotts Kangana after her argument with reporter
text: Entertainment Journalists' Guild of India has decided to boycott Kangana Ranaut and "not give her any media coverage" after she argued with a reporter during the song launch of 'Judgemental Hai Kya'. The body has asked Kangana and the film's producer Ekta Kapoor to issue a public statement. Kangana had accused the journalist of "running a smear campaign" against her.

headlines: Bangladesh part ways with coach Steve Rhodes
text: After Bangladesh finished eighth in the 2019 World Cup, Steve Rhodes left his role as team's head coach. Rhodes, who was appointed in June 2018, was contracted until after next year's T20 World Cup in Australia. The Bangladesh Cricket Board has not yet selected a new coach for Bangladesh's upcoming series against Sri Lanka.

headlines: Thought I would be out of WC after mid-series injury: Roy
text: England opener Jason Roy, who has scored 341 runs so far in 2019 World Cup, said he was scared of getting out of the tournament after getting injured in the league match against West Indies. The 28-year-old added, "I was staying around the lads...so I had to keep giving out positive vibes." I'm mentally and physically fit now, he stated.

headlines: Have unfinished business with South Africa: Coach Gibson
text: South Africa coach Ottis Gibson, after returning from 2019 World Cup, said he feels like he has "unfinished business with the Proteas" as Twenty20 World Cup is around the corner. The contract of ex-West Indies all-rounder ends in September but Gibson said he had already talked about a renewal. South Africa were eliminated after losing five of their nine matches.

headlines: 910 of 1641 projects completed in Uttarakhand: CM Rawat
text: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat said that 910 out of 1641 projects commissioned at the Chief Minister's level have been completed in the state. Reviewing the progress on all the announcements made at the CM's level, Rawat added that officers' negligence in the implementation of the announcements will not be tolerated. He said all announcements should be completed in time.

headlines: Didn't ask for front row seat for Rahul in Parliament: Cong
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury dismissed reports claiming that the party demanded a front row seat in the Parliament for the party leader Rahul Gandhi. He added that neither Rahul nor the party has ever put forward such demand in the Parliament. He said the party has proposed seat no. 466 for Rahul, who recently stepped down as Congress President.

headlines: Centre using Guvs to topple opposition govts in states: Azad
text: Amid the ongoing Karnataka political crises, Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad alleged that the Centre is using Governors to topple opposition governments in various states. He said the country is anguished at the way the Centre and Governors are conducting themselves. Azad added, "From Arunachal Pradesh to Karnataka, the Governors side with defectors and help them in coming out of...Congress."

headlines: Walmart Labs acquihires Bengaluru startups FloCare, BigTrade
text: Walmart's technology arm Walmart Labs has acquihired two Bengaluru-based startups, healthtech platform FloCare and B2B wholesale trading platform BigTrade, for undisclosed amounts. The technology arm had acquihired micro-app startup Appsfly and machine learning startup inti.ai in 2018, and data annotation startup DataTurks in February. Notably, Walmart acquired a 77% Flipkart stake in May 2018.

headlines: UPSC proposes aptitude test removal from civil services exam: Report
text: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has proposed to remove the mandatory Civil Services Aptitude Test (CSAT) and introduce a penalty for absenteeism, reported ThePrint. The CSAT tests candidate's comprehension, communication and decision-making skills. Due to mass protests, it was made a 'qualifying' test in 2015 and candidates have to score a minimum of 33% to qualify for the exam.

headlines: India-NZ semi-final to continue tomorrow as rain interrupts play
text: The India-New Zealand 2019 World Cup semi-final will continue on the reserve day tomorrow after rain interrupted play today. No play was possible on Tuesday after New Zealand scored 211/5 off 46.1 overs. In case the match gets washed out tomorrow, India will advance to the final as they have more points in league stage (15) than New Zealand (11).

headlines: Vaughan reveals Manjrekar blocked him on Twitter after Jadeja banter
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has revealed that commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has blocked him on Twitter after banter over Ravindra Jadeja. Vaughan shared a screenshot on Instagram, writing, "My life is now sorted!" Earlier, Vaughan had taunted Manjrekar multiple times after the latter had said that he is not a fan of "bits and pieces" players like Jadeja.

headlines: Williamson records most runs by a New Zealand batsman in a World Cup
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has set the record for scoring most runs by a New Zealand batsman in a World Cup edition. With his 95-ball 67-run knock against India in the 2019 World Cup semi-final on Tuesday, Williamson took his tally of runs in the tournament to 548. The previous record was set by Martin Guptill (547, 2015 edition).

headlines: Italian Olympic bronze medallist swimmer saves drowning newly-wed
text: Italian Olympic bronze-medal winning swimmer Filippo Magnini saved a man drowning in the sea off the coast of Sardinia on Sunday. The newly-wed man, Andrea Benedetto, was floating with his husband on an inflatable unicorn when he fell into the water. "When I reached him, he couldn't even speak...we laid him on an airbed provided by bathers," Magnini said.

headlines: Ye public hai, sab jaanti hai: Shatrughan Sinha on Karnataka crisis
text: Congress leader Shatrughan Sinha on Tuesday tweeted, "Ye public hai, sab jaanti hai (The public knows everything)", referring to the political crisis in Karnataka where several JD(S)-Congress MLAs submitted their resignations last week. "Is this man, muscle and money power-fight really necessary? Why are we making a mockery of democracy in this country?" wrote Sinha without naming any party.

headlines: BJP MP Hans Raj Hans' iPhone stolen during procession in Delhi
text: Sufi singer and BJP MP Hans Raj Hans lost his iPhone Xs Max on Tuesday while he was at a procession in Delhi. The procession was taken out to commemorate the installation of idols at the temple vandalised in Hauz Qazi last week. A case under Section 379 (punishment for theft) of the IPC was registered by the police.

headlines: Will bring law to reserve 70% private jobs for MP locals: Kamal Nath
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath has said his government will bring a law to reserve 70% jobs for locals in private sector. Nath said it will ensure that unemployed youth get adequate representation in the private sector. "The law will make it mandatory for both private and government sectors to give more employment to domiciles of MP," Nath added.

headlines: Boy declared brain dead sheds tears before funeral, brought to senses
text: Telangana's 18-year-old Gandham Kiran, who was declared brain dead by doctors following a week-long coma, was taken back to the hospital after his mother noticed tears flowing from his eyes during his funeral preparations. Doctors treated him in consultation with experts from Hyderabad. "Within three days, Kiran came to senses and started talking to us," his mother said.

headlines: 11-year-old boy saves woman & child from drowning in Assam river
text: An 11-year-old boy, Uttam, from Assam's Missamari saved a woman and one of her two children from drowning in a river on Sunday. Lakhya Das, Sonitpur District Magistrate, said the woman was trying to cross the river with her children when the water level suddenly increased. Das added he talked to Deputy Commissioner to acknowledge Uttam's bravery at national level.

headlines: Russia denies inviting Pak PM Imran Khan to Eastern Economic Forum
text: The Russian Foreign Ministry has denied media reports that Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has been invited to attend the Eastern Economic Forum, which is scheduled to take place in Vladivostok in September. The Russian ministry said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Mongolian President Khaltmaa Battulga, Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad and Japanese PM Shinzo Abe will be attending the meet.

headlines: Hasina rejects proposal to merge Myanmar's Rakhine with B'desh
text: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina has rejected a proposal by US lawmaker Bradley Sherman to integrate Myanmar's Rakhine State with Bangladesh. "It's never right to create troubles inside a sovereign country...The issue they've touched upon is a burning one...This isn't acceptable," Hasina said about the proposal. Over 7 lakh Rohingya Muslims fled to Bangladesh following the violence in Rakhine State.

headlines: Mexico uses X-ray scanner, finds migrants hidden inside trucks
text: Mexican authorities found several migrants hidden inside secret compartments of trucks using an X-ray scanner at checkpoints. The migrants are now in the custody of the National Migration Institute. Mexico has increased efforts to stop the flow of Central American migrants to the US following a deal under which it avoided tariffs threatened by US President Donald Trump.

headlines: If Aus project wasn't viable, wouldn't have pursued it: Gautam Adani
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani rejected criticism over the environmental impact of the controversial Carmichael coal mine planned by his company in Australia and defended the investment rationale. "If the project wasn't viable, we wouldn't have pursued it," said the Adani Enterprises Chairman. "Renewable energy is good for the nation (India), but it can't meet our baseload power needs," he added.

headlines: Some sitting outside India, not able to get them back: HC to Goyal
text: Jet Airways Founder and ex-Chairman Naresh Goyal on Tuesday told the Delhi High Court that he needed to travel overseas to explore funding for the bankrupt airline. Denying Goyal permission to fly overseas, Justice SK Kait said, "I won't name but some people are sitting outside the country, and India is not able to bring them back."

headlines: Former India goalkeeper AU Celestine dies aged 73
text: Former Indian football team goalkeeper AU Celestine passed away, aged 73, after a brief illness in Chennai on Monday. Celestine, who represented India in 1969 Merdeka Cup in Malaysia, had played for Tamil Nadu men's team in the senior nationals as a goalkeeper. He also coached the Tamil Nadu state junior, sub-junior and women teams.

headlines: Simona Halep into her second Wimbledon semi-final
text: Former world number one Simona Halep has reached the semi-final stage of the Wimbledon 2019. Halep beat Shuai Zhang to book a spot in Wimbledon 2019 semi-finals. "I expected her to play so well. She beat me the last two times that we played. I was a little bit nervous before the match," Halep later said.

headlines: Boxer Amit Panghal gets direct entry to World Championships
text: Boxer Amit Panghal has secured a direct entry to India's eight-member squad of AIBA Men's World Championships which will be held in Russia in September. He was given the spot for fulfilling the original criterion of winning gold at Asian Championships. Meanwhile, four-time Asian Championships medallist Shiva Thapa failed to secure a spot after losing to CWG silver-medallist Manish Kaushik.

headlines: WI's top run-getter in 2019 WC gets his 1st central contract
text: Cricket West Indies gave batsman Nicholas Pooran, who was team's highest run-scorer (367 runs) in 2019 World Cup, his first central contract on Tuesday. Oshane Thomas, who took nine wickets in the 2019 World Cup, and all-rounder Fabian Allen were also given their maiden central contracts. Seven players, including captain Jason Holder and Shimron Hetmyer, got all-format contracts.

headlines: Not invited to White House social media summit, confirms Facebook
text: Facebook has confirmed part of a report that claimed that it, alongside micro-blogging platform Twitter, was not invited to a White House summit on social media being held on July 11. Twitter declined Reuters' request to say if the report was true. The move reportedly comes over allegations of political bias and spread of fake news on the said platforms.

headlines: Things become easier when you get into an IIT: Meesho Co-founder
text: Facebook-backed Meesho's Co-founder and CTO Sanjeev Barnwal said he got into engineering because that was the option he knew and was aware of, making it a "choice by exclusion". "Best place for engineering is IIT...If I do anything, I want to be best at it," Barnwal said. "Things become easier when you get into an IIT," the IIT-Delhi alumnus added.

headlines: 13,000 affected as heavy rains cause flash floods in Assam
text: Heavy rains for the past two days have caused flash floods in parts of Assam affecting nearly 13,000 people. Over 200 people have been moved to relief camps as 43 villages in five districts of the state have been flooded. Excess water from the Ranganadi Hydro Electric Project has also been released in Assam's Lakhimpur district, adding to the flood.

headlines: Titan says demand hit by high gold prices, shares fall 12%
text: Shares of Titan Company on Tuesday fell 12.26% lower after it reported subdued jewellery segment growth due to "very high gold prices" in the June quarter. The company on Monday announced a lower than expected first-quarter growth owing to tough macro-economic environment and weak consumption. Revenue from its jewellery segment, mainly comprising Tanishq, grew by a muted 13%.

headlines: 1-yr-old slips from grandfather's arms, falls 11 floors from cruise
text: An over 1-year-old girl apparently slipped from her grandfather's hands and fell 11 floors (around 150 feet) from a cruise ship docked in Puerto Rico, police said on Monday. She landed on the hard concrete of the dock and died in hospital. The girl was travelling with her parents, two siblings and two sets of grandparents.

headlines: What will be India's target today in case NZ don't bat again?
text: If New Zealand's innings concludes on their current score of 211/5 in 46.1 overs, the 46-over target for India will be 237. In case, more overs are reduced in the semi-final, India's 40-over target will be 223 and the 35-over target will be 209. India would have to make 148 if their innings is reduced to 20 overs.

headlines: Pics of Ram Kapoor's transformation after weight loss go viral
text: Pictures shared by actor Ram Kapoor, which show his transformation after his weight loss, have gone viral. Ram, known for appearing in shows like 'Kasamh Se' and 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain', wrote in the caption, "Wassssup peeps!! Long time no see." The pictures received comments like "You're beyond recognition" and "[You] looked good even with your weight."

headlines: Surprised Shami is not playing in the semi-final: Harsha Bhogle
text: Reacting to Team India pacer Mohammad Shami not playing against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup semi-final, commentator Harsha Bhogle said, "I admit I'm surprised by the dropping of Shami." "He takes wickets upfront and if you do, the death overs aren't as critical," he added. Shami has taken 14 wickets in the tournament so far.

headlines: IBM closes $34-bn Red Hat acquisition deal; its biggest in history
text: IT giant IBM has closed its $34-billion deal to acquire open-source software company Red Hat, marking its biggest-ever acquisition in its over 100-year history. IBM, which had agreed to buy Red Hat in October 2018, paid $190 a share for acquiring the firm, representing a 63% premium. The deal is the world's second-largest technology deal ever, Bloomberg claimed.

headlines: Law student, junior CCI researchers initiated CCI's probe on Google
text: CCI's probe on Google over alleged abuse of Android's dominance in India was started by two of the regulator's junior researchers and a law student who had interned with the CCI. Government officials told Reuters that the three, all aged in their twenties, acted in their personal capacity. CCI had launched the probe in April after they filed the case.

headlines: BJP appoints CMs in bars: Ghulam Nabi Azad on Karnataka crisis
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad has accused the BJP of planning Karnataka MLAs' resignations and added that BJP appoints chief ministers "in bars and restaurants". "There is a BJP hand in Karnataka crisis. BJP state chief Yeddyurappa's PA was in the plane with rebel MLAs," added Azad. He said that BJP did this before in Manipur and Arunachal Pradesh also.

headlines: Nagpur university includes RSS' role in nation building in BA course
text: The Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University has included the role of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) in nation building in the second year BA (History) course. Satish Chafle, university's Board of Studies member, said this was done so that students can learn about the "new trends" in history. Meanwhile, Congress said that the education sector was being used for RSS' agenda.

headlines: Anna Hazare appears as witness in activist Nimbalkar's murder case
text: Anna Hazare on Tuesday appeared as a witness before a Mumbai court in the 2006 murder case of Congress leader and political activist Pawanraje Nimbalkar, in which former MP Padamsinh Patil is the main accused. "I learnt about Nimbalkar's murder through media. I also came to know through media that a contract was given to kill me," said Hazare.

headlines: India's tariffs on American products no longer acceptable: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday tweeted that "India has long had a field day putting Tariffs on American products. No longer acceptable!" India recently slapped higher tariffs on 28 American products including apples and almonds in retaliation to US unilaterally imposing import tariffs on steel and aluminium last year. Trump has repeatedly called out India for its high tariffs.

headlines: Calmness behind skipper Kohli's captaincy is Dhoni: Panesar
text: Speaking about the Indian team's performance, former England spinner Monty Panesar said, "Virat Kohli is able to express himself as a captain but the calmness behind that is MS Dhoni." "This is probably Dhoni's dream because this could be his last one-day he plays and retires with winning the World Cup," Panesar added.

headlines: 30 youths from various fields join BJP amid membership drive
text: A total of 30 youths from different fields joined the BJP on Tuesday at the party headquarters in Delhi amid the ongoing membership drive, including 29-year-old Special Olympics medallist Disha Maru. Disha, who has Down Syndrome, won a silver medal at the 2015 Special Olympics and two bronze medals in the 2013 Asia Pacific Special Olympics in swimming.

headlines: Ex-Apple India head co-launches social commerce app Sofyx
text: Former Apple India Country Manager Sanjay Kaul has launched a new social commerce startup, 'Sofyx', along with former GAIN Capital CTO Mukesh Kachroo. The Gurugram-based platform is aimed at general traders dealing in smartphones and accessories. "Sofyx will enable a significant number of these stores by partnering with them as their single point technology partner," Kaul said.

headlines: Competition with China's Didi Chuxing very healthy: Uber CTO
text: Uber CTO Thuan Pham, speaking about the ride-hailing giant's rivalry with Chinese competitor Didi Chuxing, said, "This competition is definitely a very healthy thing, it's very very necessary." "If you don't have competition then you can become complacent because there's no competition to challenge," he added. Notably, US-based Uber had exited the China market in the year 2016.

headlines: Milkbasket acquihires Bengaluru-based e-grocer PSR Supply Chain
text: Gurugram-based grocery delivery startup Milkbasket has acquihired Bengaluru-based local e-grocer PSR Supply Chain for an undisclosed amount. Milkbasket has integrated the startup's customers and offering into its portfolio, it said in a statement. Founded in 2015 by Anant Goel, Ashish Goel, Anurag Jain and Yatish Talvadia, Milkbasket had acquired Noida-based Veggie India earlier in March.

headlines: 6 children die in Bihars Gaya, AES suspected
text: Six children are suspected to have died of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Gaya since July 2, but it is not confirmed yet, said an official. Around 22 children have been admitted, of which four are suspected to be suffering from AES, the official added. A total of 142 children died due to AES in Muzaffarpur, as per reports.

headlines: Mandatory NCC training in Punjab schools, colleges bordering Pak
text: Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday announced a pilot project making National Cadet Corps (NCC) training mandatory for students of class 9 and 11 and the first two years of college in three districts bordering Pakistan. Singh said it would help youngsters become employable in the armed and paramilitary forces besides inculcating a sense of discipline in them.

headlines: Cow carrier certificates to check lynching in Uttar Pradesh
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday ordered the Gau Seva Aayog to issue certificates for transportation of cattle in a bid to curb incidents of lynching. Yogi further said that those carrying proper certificates while transporting cows would be given police protection. Yogi also directed Aayog officials to check cow smuggling and asked them to inspect cow shelters.

headlines: UAE partially withdraws troops from Yemen amid civil war: Report
text: The UAE has partially withdrawn its troops from Yemen from areas including the port city of Hodeidah, an official said on condition of anonymity. The withdrawal had been discussed with Saudi Arabia, the official added. The UAE is part of the Saudi Arabia-led coalition fighting the Iran-backed Houthis in Yemen's civil war.

headlines: INS urges govt to remove newly imposed 10% duty on newsprint
text: The Indian Newspaper Society (INS) has urged the government to remove the 10% customs duty imposed on newsprint, uncoated paper used for newspapers and lightweight coated paper for magazines. In Budget 2019-20, the import duty on these papers was raised from zero to 10%. INS said publishers were already under severe financial pressure from "lower advertisement revenues and higher costs".

headlines: Right time to raise funds through overseas sovereign bonds: CEA
text: Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian has said it's the right time for India to raise funds through overseas sovereign bonds at rates cheaper than in domestic market. He added the Centre would study "risks and returns" to raise such funds, likely in the fiscal's second-half. The government had said it'll begin raising some of its gross borrowings in external markets.

headlines: 'Tere Naam' maker hints Salman Khan could feature in sequel
text: 'Tere Naam' director Satish Kaushik, on being asked if Salman Khan will feature in the film's sequel, said, "I have something on my mind, but I haven't sounded out Salman yet." "I know the audience is waiting for it," he added. Earlier, Satish had confirmed that the 2003 film is set to get a sequel 16 years after its release.

headlines: Kirron Kher praises Rohit Sharma with 'Sharma ji ka beta' post
text: BJP MP and actress Kirron Kher on Tuesday took to Instagram to wish Team India and praise cricketer Rohit Sharma after his record five centuries in a single World Cup. "2 games to go, which means 2 more Tons from Sharma Ji ka honhaar beta," she wrote. "Put your best foot forward boys...The whole country stands beside you," she added.

headlines: Interview was edited: Sandeep on 'lovers slapping each other' remark
text: 'Kabir Singh' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga has said the interview in which he said that he "doesn't see any emotion if lovers can't slap each other" was edited. "They cut out portions...Now people don't know what I said before and after those comments," he added. "Violence may be [my protagonist's] way of expressing love. It's not mine," he said.

headlines: Jasprit Bumrah has now bowled most maiden overs in 2019 World Cup
text: India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has now bowled the most number of maiden overs in the 2019 World Cup. The 25-year-old took his tally of maiden overs to nine after not conceding a single run in his first over against New Zealand in the semi-final on Tuesday. Bumrah is followed by England pacer Jofra Archer, who has bowled eight maidens.

headlines: Filth like MS Dhoni will not remain forever: Yuvraj's father Yograj
text: Reacting to Ambati Rayudu's retirement from all forms of cricket, former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh said that people like MS Dhoni will not remain forever. "Rayudu, my son, you took the decision in haste. Come out of retirement and show them what you are capable of. Filth like Dhoni will not remain forever," he added.

headlines: K'taka Speaker rejects resignation of 8 MLAs over incorrect format
text: Days after 13 Congress-JD(S) MLAs submitted their resignations in Karnataka, Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Tuesday rejected the letters of eight such legislators for not being in proper order and asked them to send letters as per the correct format. The Speaker also asked five MLAs whose resignations were in order to meet him personally on Friday and Monday.

headlines: Rahul still chief, must form panel to pick successor: Janardan Dwivedi
text: Congress veteran Janardan Dwivedi on Tuesday said that Rahul Gandhi was technically still Congress President, and that he should form a committee for suggesting the name of his successor. This comes a day after another senior Congress leader Karan Singh said that a month was wasted in pleading Rahul to take back his resignation, instead of honouring his "bold decision".

headlines: Richard Branson's aerospace firm Virgin Galactic to go public
text: British billionaire Richard Branson's aerospace firm Virgin Galactic on Tuesday announced it's planning to go public. The company will be listing its shares through a minority acquisition by Social Capital Hedosophia, a special purpose acquisition firm created by former Facebook executive Chamath Palihapitiya. Virgin Galactic is set to become the first publicly traded human spaceflight firm.

headlines: NestAway Co-founder Deepak Dhar to leave, to start fintech firm
text: NestAway's Co-founder Deepak Dhar has decided to leave the home rental portal and start his own fintech business. Dhar was a founding member and operations head of Citrus Payment Solutions, a consumer payments and mobile banking services provider, before co-founding NestAway in 2015. He will reportedly start a fintech company along with a former Citrus Pay executive.

headlines: Couple on bike tries to cross bridge in Navi Mumbai, washed away
text: A couple was washed away while crossing a bridge above Gadi river on a bike at Umroli village in Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. Police said the river was swollen because of incessant rains in the area over the past few days. The bridge was not high and it had no railings, and the river water was flowing above the bridge.

headlines: Saravana Bhavan owner surrenders, arrives with oxygen mask on face
text: Saravana Bhavan owner P Rajagopal surrendered at the Madras High Court today to serve life term for murder, hours after Supreme Court denied his plea for an extension on medical grounds. He arrived in an ambulance with an oxygen mask strapped to his face. Rajagopal was convicted of killing the husband of an employee's daughter, whom he wanted to marry.

headlines: A man once called me Dabangg: Mumbai woman auto driver in viral post
text: A Humans of Bombay post on Shireen, who began riding autorickshaw to take care of her three kids after losing her mother, sister and a broken marriage, has gone viral. "Other rickshaw drivers harassed me...But I didn't let it bother me," she said. She said once a male passenger called her 'Dabangg lady' when he realised she was a woman.

headlines: Swiss Air Force flies over wrong festival, blames old technology
text: The Swiss Air Force's 'Patrouille Suisse' aerobatic display team performed over the wrong festival. The team was scheduled to fly over Langenbruck to mark the 100th death anniversary of Swiss aviation pioneer Oskar Bider, but instead flew over nearby Mümliswil-Ramiswil. The navigation technology of the Tiger F5 aircraft is outdated and they aren't equipped with GPS, a military spokesperson said.

headlines: Pak channel mutes voice of ex-PM Sharif's daughter during speech
text: Maryam Nawaz, the daughter of Pakistan's ex-PM Nawaz Sharif, shared a video wherein a news channel muted her voice during a live telecast of her rally. "Want to see what censorship looks like? Here it is! It's the truth that's feared", she wrote. Separately, reports claimed that three Pakistani news channels were taken off-air for airing Maryam's press conference.

headlines: Multimillionaire Epstein ran network of underage girls for sex: US
text: US prosecutors have charged multimillionaire hedge fund manager Jeffrey Epstein of running a "vast network" of underage girls, some as young as 14, for sex. The 66-year-old, who pleaded not guilty, allegedly lured minors to visit his mansions from 2002-2005 and paid them for sex acts. He was once a friend of Donald Trump, Bill Clinton and Britain's Prince Andrew.

headlines: Sarfaraz asked us to make strong comeback after India loss: Wasim
text: Pakistani cricketer Imad Wasim said that the captain Sarfaraz Ahmed asked his teammates to make a strong comeback after the team's loss against India at the World Cup 2019. "In my opinion, if you don't win the World Cup, you have to at least reach the final or semis, so this was not satisfactory," Wasim said.

headlines: Neymar can leave PSG if we get an offer: PSG Club Director
text: French club Paris Saint-Germain's Director of Football Leonardo said Brazilian footballer Neymar Jr is free to leave the French champions but there have been no offers for him. "[T]o date, we do not know if anyone wants to buy him or at what price. All this is not done in a day, that's for sure," Leonardo added.

headlines: BookMyShow may raise $100 mn led by General Atlantic: Report
text: Mumbai-based online ticketing platform BookMyShow is reportedly in advanced talks to raise over $100 million led by private equity major General Atlantic. The funding will reportedly push BookMyShow's valuation to over $1 billion, turning it into a 'unicorn'. Singapore's sovereign wealth fund Temasek and investment bank Goldman Sachs will reportedly participate in the investment among others.

headlines: Hero MotoCorp appoints Rajat Bhargava as head of EV business
text: India's largest two-wheeler maker Hero MotoCorp on Tuesday appointed Rajat Bhargava as the head of its new 'Emerging Mobility' business unit. Hero created the unit to give an impetus to new mobility trends such as Electric Vehicles, the company said. Currently, Bhargava is the Head of Strategy & Performance Transformation and Global Business at the company.

headlines: OYO planning to go public overseas in next 2-3 years: Report
text: India's most valuable private hotel chain OYO is reportedly planning to go public in the next two to three years. It may choose an overseas stock exchange as it hasn't turned profitable yet and "the US markets seem...more receptive to such business models", the report cited its sources as saying. Gurugram-based OYO was founded by Ritesh Agarwal in 2013.

headlines: Woman files FIR against husband for filming intimate moments
text: A woman has accused her husband of 'breach of privacy' for filming their intimate moments on their wedding night in 2018 in Uttar Pradesh. The woman said her husband promised to delete the videos but later refused and unnaturally assaulted her when she tried to delete them herself. Police have booked the accused and he is yet to be arrested.

headlines: FIR against TikTok 'influencers' for video on Jharkhand lynching
text: Mumbai Police on Monday registered an FIR against a group of people for allegedly circulating a video on the mob lynching of Tabrez Ansari on TikTok. It shows five youths saying, "You may have killed...Tabrez Ansari, but tomorrow if his son takes revenge, don't say...all Muslims are terrorists". TikTok has removed the video and suspended the accounts of the accused.

headlines: Man run over by train while trying to nab phone thief in Mumbai
text: A man on Sunday was run over by a local train after he jumped out of it and fell onto the tracks while trying to catch a phone snatcher in Mumbai. The thief reportedly jumped into the train's compartment, snatched the victim's phone and jumped off. The victim was found with multiple injuries and died on the spot.

headlines: I'm Sindhi, how can I pay double price for an apartment: Tamannaah
text: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has denied reports that said she bought a sea-facing apartment in Mumbai for double price. Revealing that her Hindi teacher from school texted her after the reports surfaced, she added, "I told him, I'm Sindhi, how can I pay double...price for an apartment?" "I've bought a house, but I didn't pay double for it," said Tamannaah.

headlines: Yo Yo Honey Singh booked by police over 'vulgar' lyrics in song
text: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh has been booked by Punjab Police after a complaint by the state women's commission chief Manisha Gulati over the alleged vulgar lyrics of his song 'Makhna'. Gulati had written to the state DGP over the song's lyrics, recommending action against the rapper. The song contains lyrics including 'Main hoon womaniser' and 'Silicon wali ladki'.

headlines: How has India's head to head record been against NZ in ODI cricket?
text: Two-time World Cup champions India have faced New Zealand 106 times in ODIs. India have won 55 matches and New Zealand have emerged victorious in 45, while one match was a tie and five produced no result. India have won three of their seven World Cup matches against New Zealand. India last faced New Zealand in World Cup in 2003.

headlines: Dhoni becomes 2nd Indian cricketer after Sachin to play 350 ODIs
text: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni on Tuesday became the second Indian cricketer after Sachin Tendulkar to play 350 matches in ODI cricket. Dhoni has scored 10,723 runs at an average of 50.58 and has effected 443 dismissals (320 catches and 123 stumpings) in his first 349 ODIs. Overall, MS Dhoni is the tenth cricketer to reach 350 ODIs.

headlines: We don't want to go to White House: US soccer captain after WC win
text: US women's soccer team co-captain Megan Rapinoe has said that the team does not want to go to the White House after their World Cup victory to attend any congratulatory reception. She, however, accepted Senator Chuck Schumer's invitation to visit the Congress. Rapinoe had earlier called US President Donald Trump "sexist", "misogynistic", "small-minded", "racist" and "not a good person".

headlines: Sidhu absent but draws salary, enjoys perks: BJP to Punjab Guv
text: BJP leader Tarun Chugh has written to Punjab Governor VP Singh Badnore claiming a "constitutional crisis" has arisen due to a feud between CM Amarinder Singh and Navjot Singh Sidhu. Chugh said, "It's been over a month since a minister who took oath of office has been absent, even though he's drawing a salary and enjoying perks of his office."

headlines: We respect SC judges, they should avoid harsh words: RS Prasad
text: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Monday said Supreme Court judges should avoid using "harsh words," stating, "We respect Supreme Court judges but the use of words such as constitutional fraud should not happen." He was seemingly responding to Justice DY Chandrachud calling the passage of Aadhaar Act as a money bill "a fraud on the Constitution" in September 2018.

headlines: HC refuses to intervene in ban on condom ads between 6 am to 10 pm
text: Delhi High Court has dismissed a plea seeking to lift the ban on condom advertisements between 6 am and 10 pm. The court said it cannot intervene as it is a policy decision of the government. The petitioner stated that the usage of condoms in India is low and efforts need to be taken to increase awareness for its use.

headlines: IMD predicts heavy rains in Himachal, issues flash flood warning
text: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rainfall across Himachal Pradesh this week. It also issued an advisory urging people to stay away from the Beas river and its tributaries as flash floods could occur during the rains. Meanwhile, the Kullu district tourism department on Monday ordered a temporary ban of two days on rafting activities in the Beas river.

headlines: Goa may make HIV tests mandatory before marriage registration
text: Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Tuesday said the state government is considering making HIV tests mandatory before the registration of marriages. Rane added that the proposal is currently being vetted by the Law Department. "If it is cleared by the Department soon, then we will table the law in the monsoon session of the state Legislative Assembly," he stated.

headlines: New idols to be reinstalled at temple vandalised in Delhi
text: The temple, which was vandalised during communal tensions in Delhi's Hauz Qazi area recently, will be renovated and new idols will be installed there Tuesday onwards. Moreover, Vishva Hindu Parishad is holding a Shobha Yatra in the area. To give a message of peace and brotherhood, members of Aman Committee also distributed food to people participating in the yatra.

headlines: 35-yr-old touches girl inappropriately on Mumbai-Dubai flight, held
text: A 35-year-old man identified as Suman Bal has been arrested for allegedly touching a 17-year-old girl inappropriately on a Mumbai to Dubai flight a few days ago. The accused, seated behind the girl, allegedly touched her inappropriately while she was asleep. The girl narrated the incident to a relative after reaching Dubai, who approached the police and filed a complaint.

headlines: Trump says won't deal with UK envoy who called his admin 'inept'
text: US President Donald Trump has said that the US will no longer "deal" with Kim Darroch, the UK's Ambassador to the country. This comes after leaked documents revealed that Darroch had called the Trump administration "dysfunctional, unpredictable, faction-riven, diplomatically clumsy and inept". "I don't know the Ambassador, but he isn't liked or well...thought of within the US," Trump added.

headlines: Not comfortable with Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency: India
text: Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said the design of Facebook's upcoming cryptocurrency Libra "has not been fully explained". "But whatever it is, it would be a private cryptocurrency and that's not something we have been comfortable with," he added. The RBI last year restricted banks from providing services to individuals and businesses dealing with cryptocurrencies.

headlines: Anti-bullying Instagram tool warns before posting offensive comment
text: Instagram has added a new AI-based anti-bullying tool to warn users if they are posting offensive comments. The Facebook-owned photo-sharing platform has also added another tool to "restrict" problematic followers. Comments by restricted followers will not appear publicly unless approved and these followers won't be able to see when a user is active or has read their direct messages.

headlines: Facebook uses 'Stormchaser' tool to track false info about itself
text: Facebook uses a special software program called 'Stormchaser' that helps the social media giant track misinformation about itself, including rumours spread on WhatsApp, Bloomberg revealed. Developed in 2016, Stormchaser has been used to follow viral posts and was sometimes used to debunk false claims. The tool was primarily used only to detect false news and not fight it, Facebook said.

headlines: Cong proposes Adhir Chowdhury's name for PAC Chairman: Reports
text: According to reports, the Congress has proposed the name of party MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury for the post of chairman of Public Accounts Committee (PAC). PAC is a committee of selected Members of Parliament, which audits revenue and expenditure of the Central government and traditionally goes to the main Opposition. Chowdhury is also Congress' leader in the Lok Sabha.

headlines: Embark on padayatra for Gandhi's birth anniversary: PM to BJP MPs
text: PM Narendra Modi has instructed BJP MPs to embark on a padayatra in their constituencies and cover a distance of 150 km between October 2 and October 31, Mahatma Gandhi and Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's respective birth anniversaries. "These yatras will focus on revival of villages and making them self-reliant, plantation drive and zero budget farming," Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said.

headlines: Couple held for suspected involvement in Naxal activities in MP
text: Uttar Pradesh Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) on Tuesday arrested a couple for suspected involvement in Naxal activities in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. The couple was arrested on charges of concealing their identity after fake identification papers were recovered. Some Naxal literature and other items were also recovered from their possession.

headlines: Devotees at Puri Rath Yatra create human corridor for ambulance
text: In a video shared on the SP Puri Twitter handle, devotees at Lord Jagannath Rath Yatra in Odisha's Puri can be seen creating a human corridor for an ambulance to pass through. Reportedly, around 1,200 volunteers and 10 organisations made the corridor. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "This is commendable," while another wrote, "Now this is amazing."

headlines: Reebok signs Katrina Kaif as brand face
text: Leading fitness brand Reebok, which boasts of global assets like Victoria Beckham has announced Bollywood actor and wellness enthusiast, Katrina Kaif, as their new Indian brand ambassador. According to Katrina, 'Being a fitness aficionado myself, the brand serves as a motivation for me to be disciplined and also gives me a platform to endorse the need to be fit.'

headlines: How have India and New Zealand fared in World Cup semi-finals?
text: Out of their six World Cup semi-finals, India have won three and lost three. India's biggest semi-final win had come in the 2003 edition when they defeated Kenya by 91 runs, while their biggest defeat took place in 2015, with Australia winning by 95 runs. Meanwhile, New Zealand hold the record for losing the most semi-finals (six out of seven).

headlines: SC denies Saravana founder's plea seeking more time to surrender
text: Supreme Court has refused to grant relief to Saravana Bhavan founder, P Rajagopal, who sought a direction for more time to surrender in a 2001 murder case on medical grounds. Rajagopal had failed to surrender to the police before his July 7 deadline, after he reportedly got admitted in a hospital on Thursday. He has been sentenced to life imprisonment.

headlines: Media fraternity to demand public apology from Kangana: Reports
text: After Kangana Ranaut got into an argument with a journalist during a song launch event for 'Judgemental Hai Kya', media fraternity has decided to demand a public apology from her, as per reports. They want the film's producer Ekta Kapoor to take a stand against Kangana's behaviour. Media will boycott the film's promotions if she doesn't apologise, reports further said.

headlines: I was 1st to take tough stand: Hrithik on #MeToo claims against Bahl
text: Speaking about the sexual harassment allegations against 'Super 30' director Vikas Bahl, Hrithik Roshan said, "When Vikas' name cropped up, I was perhaps the first one to take a...tough stand." "I sincerely believe...exploitative attitude towards women must stop," he added. "Since a designated ICC committee has exonerated Vikas, we are not in... position to take away his credit," said Hrithik.

headlines: How could toss play a decisive role in India-NZ semi-final match?
text: The venue for India-New Zealand 2019 World Cup semi-final is Manchester's Old Trafford. As many as five 2019 World Cup matches have taken place at Old Trafford, with teams batting first winning each time. Toss-winning captains, apart from Sarfaraz Ahmed in India-Pakistan match, opted to bat first here. The average first-innings score at the venue in the tournament is 323.

headlines: Urmila criticises Sanjay Nirupam's aides in letter after LS polls
text: In a letter dated May 16, actress-turned-politician Urmila Matondkar criticised Congress leader and her senior colleague Sanjay Nirupam's aides Sandesh Kondvilkar and Bhushan Patil for their conduct ahead of the Lok Sabha results. The letter, which was addressed to ex-Mumbai Congress chief Milind Deora, outlined the duo's "total lack of coordination, honesty and efficiency, ensuring a disastrous outcome".

headlines: We want disqualification of rebel MLAs for anti-party activity: Cong
