text: Swara Bhasker and Divya Dutta are set to play lovers in Faraz Arif Ansari's 'Sheer Khurma'. The film also stars veteran actor Surekha Sikri, and traces the journey of a queer woman searching for a sense of belonging, an identity and acceptance from her family. The film will be wrapped up by the end of the year.

headlines: No time to waste on this: Taapsee on Rangoli's 'sasti copy' remark
text: Taapsee Pannu, when asked about her reaction to Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel calling her a "sasti copy" of Kangana, said, "Short life, no time to waste on this." "I've...many happier...things happening in my life to look at right now," she added. Rangoli had taken a dig at Taapsee for not mentioning Kangana while praising 'Judgemental Hai Kya' trailer.

headlines: Love can't turn into hate: Hrithik on equation with ex-wife Sussanne
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan, while speaking about his equation with ex-wife Sussanne Khan, said, "It's a beautiful relationship. With our kids, with us as friends, it's all about wisdom." "One thing is for sure: Love can't turn into hate. If it's hate, it wasn't love. The flipside of love...is also love," he added. Hrithik and Sussanne got divorced in 2014.

headlines: Staff who prints Budget can't leave North Block till presentation
text: The Union Budget is printed in Delhi's North Block and the Finance Ministry staff involved in the budget printing process cannot leave the building till the Budget Presentation in the Parliament. This is done to ensure complete secrecy and prevent leakages before the presentation. Notably, the printing process of the Union Budget 2019-20 began on June 22.

headlines: National Sports Education Board to be set up to popularise sports
text: While presenting the Union Budget in the Parliament, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that to popularise sports at all levels, National Sports Education Board will be set up for the development of sportspersons under 'Khelo India'. She also proposed setting up of Electronic Fundraising Platform, a social stock exchange, to list social enterprises.

headlines: 2 IITs, IISc Bangalore in world's top 200 institutions: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said not a single Indian institution was in the top 200 in the world rankings five years ago. "Today, we have three institutions, two IITs and IISc Bangalore in the top 200 institutions of the world," she said. She added that foreign students will be encouraged to come to India under 'Study In India'.

headlines: Delhi man vandalises eateries, brandishes sword; case filed
text: The Delhi Police have registered a case against a man named Salman after a video showing him allegedly vandalising eateries and threatening shop owners with a sword went viral. Salman, who is absconding, was demanding "protection money" and was reportedly drunk at the time. The police said he's a habitual offender with seven cases, including murder, registered against him.

headlines: 30-year-old Ugandan woman arrested for prostitution in Goa
text: The Goa Police on Thursday booked a 30-year-old Ugandan woman for allegedly soliciting male customers in an open place for the purpose of prostitution. The woman has been booked under various provisions of the Immoral Traffic Prevention Act. She has been sent to police custody for questioning in connection with the case.

headlines: School principal held for raping, threatening teacher in Delhi
text: The principal of south Delhi's Jasola school was arrested on Thursday for allegedly repeatedly raping a 27-year-old female teacher and threatening to make a video of the act viral, said the police. He had first raped her in June 2017 after asking her to take extra classes after school hours and giving her a drink laced with sedatives.

headlines: All rural families will have water by 2024, power by 2022: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman while presenting the Union Budget 2019 on Friday said that all rural households will have water supply by 2024 under Jal Jeevan Mission. The Jal Jeevan Mission will work on creation of local infrastructure for sustainability, she added. Sitharaman further said that by 2022 every single rural family will have electricity and clean cooking facility.

headlines: NRIs will get Aadhaar without waiting for 180 days after return
text: While presenting the Union Budget 2019-20, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed to issue Aadhaar cards to NRIs with Indian passport. She added that the NRIs would get the Aadhaar card after arrival in India without the mandatory wait for 180 days. "NRI portfolio investment route will be merged with foreign portfolio investment route," she further said.

headlines: Public shareholding in listed firms to be raised from 25% to 35%: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said the government will ask SEBI to increase minimum public shareholding in listed companies to 35% from 25% now. She also proposed to create an electronic fundraising platform for listing "social enterprises and voluntary organisations". She further said the government is contemplating organising annual Global Investors Meet in India.

headlines: Government aims to achieve housing for all by 2022: Sitharaman
text: During her Union Budget 2019-20 speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government aims to achieve housing for all by 2022. "1.95 crore houses are proposed to be built for the poor & eligible beneficiaries by 2022," she added. She further said that 1.5 crore houses have been built in the last 5 years.

headlines: Exclusive TV programme dedicated to startups to be launched
text: Presenting her maiden Union Budget on Friday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a new television programme dedicated to startups will be launched under Doordarshan. It will be designed and executed by the startups themselves and will provide a platform for startup promotion and 'matchmaking' with venture capitalists, she added. Startup taxation matters will also be discussed on the platform.

headlines: Plan to streamline KYC to make it more investor-friendly: Sitharaman
text: While presenting the Union Budget 2019 on Friday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "We plan to streamline KYC to make it more investor-friendly." "As key source of capital to Indian economy, it is important to ensure hassle-free experience to foreign portfolio investors," she added. She also said that 100% FDI will be permitted for insurance intermediary.

headlines: 9.6cr toilets built, 5 lakh villages open-defecation free: Sitharaman
text: While presenting the Union Budget 2019 today, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said 9.6 crore toilets have been constructed under the Swachh Bharat Mission since its launch on October 2, 2014. She added that over five lakh villages are now open-defecation free. Sitharaman also proposed to expand Swachh Bharat Mission to undertake solid waste management in every village.

headlines: 2 crore villagers made literate in digital technology: Sitharaman
text: Presenting her maiden Union Budget on Friday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that 2 crore villagers have been made literate in digital technology under PM's digital literacy program. She added that 80 livelihood business incubators and 20 technology business incubators will be set up in 2019-20 under ASPIRE to develop 75,000 skilled entrepreneurs in agro-rural industries.

headlines: Local sourcing rules for single-brand retail FDI to be eased
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday said that mandatory 30% local sourcing norms for FDI in single-brand retail will be eased. India will consider raising foreign direct investment limits in the media, aviation, animation and insurance sectors. She also proposed to raise limits on foreign portfolio investment to be at par with foreign direct investment.

headlines: Rental laws archaic, will prepare model tenancy law soon: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman called India's current tenancy laws as archaic while delivering her Union Budget speech. She said that a model tenancy law will be designed and circulated with the states soon as part of measures to reform rental housing. She added that the government will make available a blueprint for gas grid, water grid, i-Ways and regional airports.

headlines: 100% FDI will be permitted for insurance intermediary: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that 100% FDI will be permitted for insurance intermediaries. "The government will invite suggestions for further opening up of FDI in aviation sector, media, animation and insurance sectors in consultation with all stakeholders," she added. "Local sourcing norms for FDI will be eased in single-brand retail sector," she further said.

headlines: 'Gandhipedia' encyclopedia on Gandhian values to be made: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in her maiden Union Budget that a 'Gandhipedia', which is like an encyclopedia on Mahatma Gandhi, is being developed to sensitise the youth about positive Gandhian values. She added it is developed by National Council of Science Museums. Sitharaman said India will become open defecation free by October 2, the 150th birth anniversary of Gandhi.

headlines: India to be open defecation free by Gandhi's birth anniversary: FM
text: While presenting the Union Budget 2019-20 on Friday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced, "We aim to make India open defecation free by October 2, on the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi." She added that 95% of Indian cities have already become open defecation free and 9.6 crore toilets have been constructed since Oct 2, 2014.

headlines: US complains at WTO about India's retaliatory tariffs
text: The US has complained at the World Trade Organization (WTO) about Indian tariffs imposed in response to US steel and aluminium tariffs last year. The US stated that India doesn't impose these duties on like products originating from any other WTO member nation. The dispute follows similar complaints against China, European Union and others who retaliated in the same way.

headlines: Urjit Patel blames govt, RBI and banks till 2014 for bad loan crisis
text: Former RBI Governor Urjit Patel has said that failures of the central bank, the government and state-run lenders in the years till 2014 led to India's bad loan crisis. He said the RBI should've acted earlier by ensuring that state-run banks followed stringent risk management processes. Patel added that the government encouraged state-run banks to overlend to boost growth.

headlines: upGrad empowers 5000+ students through its data science program
text: upGrad's PG Diploma in Data Science in collaboration with IIIT-Bangalore provides 1-1 mentorship and 360 degree career support, helping learners transition to Data Science. upGrad's curriculum, pedagogy and learning experience is especially designed and developed with best in class faculty for working professionals. upGrad students have transitioned to companies like Microsoft, KPMG, Big Basket, Uber, Tech Mahindra, Apple and more.

headlines: Finance Minister carries budget in a red cloth, breaks tradition
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman broke tradition by carrying the budget in a red cloth instead of the usual leather briefcase. Chief Economic Adviser K Subramanian said, "It symbolises our departure from slavery of Western thought". Finance Ministers in the past have carried the budget in a leather briefcase. The tradition was established by first Finance Minister RK Shanmukham Chetty.

headlines: Who are members of the team that prepared Union Budget 2019?
text: The team that helped Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in preparing 2019 Budget includes Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian, Economic Affairs and Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg and Revenue Secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey. It also includes Department of Financial Services Secretary Rajiv Kumar and Department of Investment and Public Asset Management Secretary Atanu Chakraborty.

headlines: India will grow to be a $3 trillion economy this year: FM Sitharaman
text: While presenting the Union Budget 2019-20 today, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Indian economy will grow to become a $3 trillion economy in the current year itself. "From $1.85 trillion in 2014, the economy has now reached $2.7 trillion, we can very well reach $5 trillion in the next few years," she added.

headlines: Sitharaman believes leather items aren't auspicious: CEA on bahi khata
text: Chief Economic Advisor Krishnamurthy Subramanian said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman broke the tradition of carrying the budget in a leather briefcase as she believes leather products aren't auspicious for the big occasion. "She took the 'bahi khata' wrapped in the red cloth," he said. "Also, ditching briefcase symbolises our departure from the slavery of western thought," he added.

headlines: Producer of The Wolf of Wall Street arrested on money-laundering charges
text: Former Malaysia PM Najib Razak's stepson Riza Aziz was arrested on Thursday and will face money-laundering charges in a scandal over billions of dollars in missing government funds. Riza, who produced 'The Wolf of Wall Street', was released on bail. He joins his mother, stepfather and a longtime friend in facing charges in the disappearance of nearly $4.5 billion.

headlines: Sitharaman's parents at Parliament for her maiden Union Budget
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's parents, Savitri Sitharaman and Narayanan Sitharaman, arrived at the Parliament on Friday for her maiden budget speech. Sitharaman broke the tradition of carrying budget in a leather briefcase and carried the 'bahi khata' in a red cloth. "Ditching briefcase symbolises our departure from slavery of western thought," CEA Krishnamurthy Subramanian said.

headlines: Cabinet approves Union Budget 2019-20
text: In pre-Budget meeting today, the Cabinet approved the country's Union Budget for the financial year 2019-20. The Budget is being presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in the Parliament today. This is the first Budget under the NDA government's second tenure and is expected to focus on economic reform with an objective to make India a $5-trillion economy by 2024.

headlines: Departure from slavery of western thought: CEA on 'bahi khata'
text: Talking about Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman keeping budget documents in four-fold red cloth instead of a briefcase, Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian said that it's in Indian tradition. "It symbolises our departure from slavery of western thought. It's not..budget, but a 'bahi khata'(ledger)," he added. This is the first time Nirmala Sitharaman would be presenting the Budget.

headlines: Nadal defeats Kyrgios to reach Wimbledon 3rd round for 10th time
text: Two-time champion Rafael Nadal defeated Nick Kyrgios 6-3, 3-6, 7-6(7-5), 7-6(7-3) on Thursday to reach the Wimbledon third round for the 10th time in his career. Nadal will next face two-time semi-finalist Jo-Wilfried Tsonga, who defeated Lithuanian Ricardas Berankis 7-6(7-4), 6-3, 6-3 in the second round. Nadal now leads the head-to-head against Kyrgios 4-3.

headlines: PSG sign ex-Manchester United midfielder Ander Herrera on 5-yr deal
text: Spanish midfielder Ander Herrera has joined PSG on a free transfer after leaving Manchester United, the French champions announced on Thursday. The 29-year-old has signed a five-year contract which will keep him at the club until June 2024. Herrera had joined United in 2014 from Athletic Bilbao and scored 20 goals in 189 appearances during his five-year stint.

headlines: Lucky loser Davis knocks defending champ Kerber out of Wimbledon
text: US' Lauren Davis, who entered Wimbledon main draw as a lucky loser, defeated defending champion Angelique Kerber of Germany 2-6, 6-2, 6-1 to reach the third round. World number 95 Davis won the match in one hour 54 minutes to reach Wimbledon third round for the second time in her career. Lauren Davis will next face Carla Suárez Navarro.

headlines: Cong takes Guj MLAs to resort, conducts mock polls ahead of RS bypolls
text: Ahead of voting for the Rajya Sabha bypolls for two seats in Gujarat, Congress shifted around 65 state MLAs to a resort on Wednesday to avoid any horse trading. The party also conducted a mock poll for its newly elected legislators at the resort. The seats became vacant after Smriti Irani and Amit Shah got elected to Lok Sabha.

headlines: Maruti Suzuki to be investigated for discounting practices
text: The Competition Commission of India on Thursday said it had ordered an investigation into how Maruti Suzuki controlled discounts its dealers could offer. Reuters had reported in May that the antitrust regulator was looking into allegations that Maruti forces its dealers to limit the discounts they offer. Maruti has a 51% market share and nearly 3,000 dealers in the country.

headlines: Maharashtra minister blames crabs for dam breach that killed 18
text: Maharashtra Water Conservation Minister Tanaji Sawant on Thursday said that the dam breach in Ratnagiri district, which claimed the lives of 18 people, was due to a large number of crabs that gathered around the dam. The Tiware dam developed the breach earlier this week after heavy rains in the region. NDRF teams have been deployed for relief operations.

headlines: SpiceJet plane stuck on Mumbai airport runway pulled out after 2 days
text: A SpiceJet plane, which was stuck on the main runway at Mumbai airport since Tuesday, was finally pulled out on Thursday night. The aircraft had overshot the runway while landing amid heavy rain and got stuck at the end of it. The runway was shut after the mishap and an alternate runway was made operational at the airport.

headlines: Tibet issue no more struggle for political independence: Dalai Lama
text: The Tibetan issue is no longer a struggle for political independence, Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama said, adding there's a need to focus on preserving the Tibetan culture and identity. China should follow a more realistic approach to resolve the issue, he further said. He'd earlier said that he preferred Tibet remaining with China, with "some kind of reunion".

headlines: Britain seizes Iran oil tanker; US calls it 'excellent news'
text: Britain has seized an Iranian oil tanker in Gibraltar for trying to take oil to Syria in violation of EU sanctions. Iran summoned the British ambassador over the "illegal and unacceptable seizure". Meanwhile, the US called the seizure "excellent news", saying, "America & our allies will continue to prevent regimes in Iran & Syria from profiting off this illicit trade."

headlines: 1.37 lakh Pakistanis declare assets worth $19 bn in amnesty scheme
text: Nearly 1.37 lakh Pakistanis declared assets worth $19 billion and paid $443 million as tax under the government's tax amnesty on hidden assets. Of this, nearly 1 lakh were first-time tax filers. Prime Minister Imran Khan introduced the scheme as part of a drive to widen Pakistan's narrow tax base. Less than 1% of Pakistan's 208 million population file returns.

headlines: Budget must focus to foster the crypto industry in India: WazirX CEO
text: Ahead of the Union Budget, bitcoin and cryptocurrency exchange WazirX's CEO Nischal Shetty said, "The Union Budget 2019 must begin a step towards positive regulation so as to foster the crypto industry in India." He said this will help India participate in crypto like other countries. He added that any step towards the crypto ban will only promote money laundering.

headlines: HP, Google plan to move some production out of China: Report
text: Multiple technology firms are reportedly planning to shift production outside of China spurred by US-China trade war. HP and Dell Technologies are reportedly planning to reallocate up to 30% of their notebook production out of China. Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Sony and Nintendo are also reportedly looking to move some of their gaming console and smart speaker manufacturing out of China.

headlines: Sensex reclaims 40,000 mark ahead of Sitharaman's maiden budget
text: The Sensex hit the 40,000-mark in early trade ahead of Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's maiden Budget on Friday, the first time since June 11. The Nifty opened at 11,964.75, edging closer to 12,000. Globally, Asian shares hovered near two-month highs on Friday, holding recent gains as investors awaited US employment data.

headlines: Pak have chance if lightning strikes Bangladesh team, jokes Yousaf
text: Ex-Pakistan batsman Mohammad Yousaf has joked that Pakistan have a chance to qualify for 2019 World Cup semi-finals if lightning strikes Bangladesh and they get all out for 10 runs. "This scenario is very very difficult. Even if you are playing against a fake team, to win by 316 runs according to me is a tough job," he said.

headlines: Miracles can happen, we will try to score 500 vs B'desh: Sarfaraz
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed has said his team will try to score 500 runs against Bangladesh in their 2019 World Cup match tomorrow. "If Allah helps, miracles can happen...It's like you score 600, 500, 400 on a pitch, then you can think to get the other team out for 50 and then win by a 316-run margin," he added.

headlines: Tharoor hails Sachin for rightly predicting WC semi-finalists in May
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor took to Facebook to praise Sachin Tendulkar for rightly predicting 2019 World Cup semi-finalists in an interview in May. "Amazing! Does this man know his cricket or not!??" wrote Tharoor, sharing Sachin's interview. Sachin had predicted that India, England and Australia will reach the semi-finals, while either New Zealand or Pakistan will earn the fourth spot.

headlines: Afghanistan's Ikram Ali Khil 3rd youngest batsman to hit a WC fifty
text: Afghanistan's Ikram Ali Khil on Thursday became the third youngest batsman to score a fifty in the World Cup, achieving the feat aged 18 years and 278 days against West Indies in the 2019 World Cup. Bangladesh's Tamim Iqbal and Mohammad Ashraful are the youngest and second youngest players to score a fifty in World Cup, respectively.

headlines: Virat Kohli arranges tickets for 87-year-old fan who went viral
text: India captain Virat Kohli has arranged tickets for 87-year-old Charulata Patel, who went viral after being spotted cheering for Team India in their match against Bangladesh. Charulata's granddaughter Anjali revealed Kohli promised tickets to Charulata after requesting her to come for all of India's matches. "We asked for a few more tickets, but he couldn't arrange that many," she added.

headlines: Federer reaches third round of a Grand Slam for the 70th time
text: Eight-time champion Roger Federer defeated world number 169 British tennis player Jay Clarke 6-1, 7-6(7-3), 6-2 to reach the Wimbledon third round for the 17th time, equalling Jimmy Connors Open Era record. Federer has now reached the third round of a major for the 70th time in his career. Federer has now won 97 matches at Wimbledon.

headlines: Kohli is a run-machine, but Sachin is my all-time favourite: Lara
text: Former West Indies captain Brian Lara has said that Virat Kohli is a run-machine but his all-time favourite is Sachin Tendulkar. Adding that Kohli is the best in today's era, Lara said, "Rohit might have got four centuries in WC...if you want somebody to bat in T20, T10, 100 balls (cricket) or Tests, it's going to be Virat Kohli."

headlines: Hima Das wins 200m gold in Poznan Athletics Grand Prix in Poland
text: Sprinter Hima Das clocked 23.65 seconds to win the women's 200m gold in the Poznan Athletics Grand Prix in Poland. This was Hima's first competitive 200m race of the year. The world junior champion and national record holder in 400m has a personal best of 23.10 seconds in 200m, which she had clocked last year.

headlines: Nothing dead about game against South Africa: Australia coach Langer
text: Australia head coach Justin Langer has said that his team won't get complacent against South Africa in their last 2019 league match. "For this game, some people said it was a dead rubber. There's nothing dead about it," he added. "Were playing good cricket, so we want to continue the momentum of winning going forward," he further said.

headlines: Mamata greeted with 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans at Rath Yatra event
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee was greeted with 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans by BJP supporters on Thursday when she visited Mahesh area in Hooghly district to inaugurate the 623-year-old Ratha Yatra festival. The slogan was heard from a section of the gathering as Banerjee was alighting from the dais amidst chants of 'Jai Jagannath' over the public address system.

headlines: They will win if you arrest me: Cong MLA who threw mud on engineer
text: Congress MLA Nitesh Rane, who surrendered before Kankavali Police for throwing buckets full of mud on a government engineer, was seen telling the police in a video to not arrest him today, otherwise, they (government) will win. "Whatever you want to do, do it tomorrow, or else people of Kankavali will keep dying like this," said Rane to the police.

headlines: Sit-ups made compulsory at Haryana govt school, termed 'brain yoga'
text: Government-run Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan School in Haryana's Bhiwani has made sit-ups mandatory for students under the State School Education Board Pilot Project. State School Education Board Secretary Rajiv Prashad said, "It's super brain yoga. It's scientifically proven that it increases brain efficiency." "We're starting this from tomorrow," he added.

headlines: Govt orders fraud investigation into Jet Airways, Jet Privilege
text: The Corporate Affairs Ministry has ordered an investigation into grounded Jet Airways and six group companies including Jet Privilege over alleged mismanagement of funds. The Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) has been ordered to complete the probe in six months. Separately, reports said that ex-Chairman Naresh Goyal moved Delhi High Court to quash a Look Out Circular issued against him.

headlines: Cult.Fit denies charges after cheating case filed against Hrithik
text: Fitness chain Cult.Fit has denied cheating charges levelled by a gym user after a case was registered by Hyderabad Police against its brand ambassador Hrithik Roshan and three Cult.Fit officials. Cult.Fit alleged the complainant had behaved violently and inappropriately with its staff, which constrained them to take action against him. They said Hrithik was wrongly dragged into the case.

headlines: WI win 2nd match in WC after 34 days, Afghanistan finish winless
text: West Indies defeated Afghanistan by 23 runs at Leeds on Thursday to register their second victory in 2019 World Cup, 34 days after their first. With this, West Indies ended their 2019 World Cup campaign with five points, while Afghanistan failed to win a single match in the tournament. Afghanistan have now lost 12 straight matches in World Cup history.

headlines: Apple may change keyboard design in MacBooks: Report
text: Apple is switching to a scissor switch-based keyboard design, purportedly featuring glass fibre to reinforce the keys, analyst Ming-Chi Kuo's report said. The keyboards will reportedly appear in MacBook Air expected later this year and MacBook Pro in 2020. Apple will reportedly drop butterfly design-based MacBook keyboards that have repeatedly received user complaints over faulty mechanism.

headlines: Drones, CCTV cameras to improve security of Punjab prisons
text: The Punjab government on Thursday proposed a host of measures aimed at improving prison security after the recent cases of violence in state prisons. Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh directed officials to install CCTV cameras and deploy drones over the prisons to strengthen the security. As per reports, rules will also be amended to make parole difficult for the convicts.

headlines: 1 more arrested in Chandni Chowk violence; 10 arrested so far
text: Delhi Police arrested one more person in connection with the vandalisation of temple in Chandni Chowk's Hauz Qazi area in Delhi. According to the police, out of the 10 people arrested so far, five are juveniles. Earlier today, the court sent the juveniles to observation home while four other accused were sent to judicial custody for 14 days.

headlines: 100 civilians killed in South Sudan violence after peace deal: UN
text: Over 100 civilians have been killed in South Sudan's Central Equatoria region after a peace deal was signed last year to end the civil war, a UN report said. Armed groups also committed sexual violence, including rape, against around 100 women and girls. South Sudan descended into civil war two years after its independence from Sudan in 2011.

headlines: Congress MLA Nitesh surrenders after FIR for throwing mud on engineer
text: Congress MLA Nitesh Narayan Rane and his two supporters surrendered before Kankavli police on Thursday after an FIR was registered against them for throwing mud on an engineer in Maharashtra. The search for another supporter is on. This comes after a video of Rane and his supporters throwing mud on an engineer at a bridge near Mumbai-Goa highway went viral.

headlines: ICJ to deliver verdict on Kulbhushan Jadhav case on July 17
text: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) will deliver its verdict on retired Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav's case on July 17. Jadhav, who is currently lodged in a Pakistani jail, was sentenced to death in 2017 by a Pakistani military court on charges of espionage and terrorism. India has urged the ICJ to annul Jadhav's death sentence and sought his release.

headlines: West Bengal CM Mamata attends TMC MP Nusrat Jahan's wedding reception
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday attended TMC's Lok Sabha MP and actress Nusrat Jahan's wedding reception along with TMC Lok Sabha MP Mimi Chakraborty and TMC leader Kalyan Banerjee. Earlier today, Mamata Banerjee and Nusrat Jahan flagged off the annual Jagannath Rath Yatra in Kolkata. Nusrat Jahan got married to Kolkata-based businessman Nikhil Jain in Turkey last month.

headlines: Mahie Gill shares daughter's pics after revealing she has a child
text: Actress Mahie Gill has shared first photos of her nearly three-year-old daughter Veronica, days after revealing that she has a biological daughter with her live-in boyfriend. "When I got pregnant, I took a break for a year from acting...Thus, my pregnancy never came in the public eye," she said. Mahie further revealed she first met her boyfriend 10 years ago.

headlines: Sachin thanks Rayudu for his contribution to Indian cricket
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to wish Ambati Rayudu best for his life after retirement. "Thank you for all your contribution to Indian Cricket, Ambati. Have fond memories of spending time with you during your stint at Mumbai Indians. Wishing you all the best for your 2nd innings," he tweeted. Rayudu represented India in 55 ODIs.

headlines: Retirement age set to rise due to higher life expectancy: Eco Survey
text: The Economic Survey, tabled by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, said, "[A]n increase in the retirement age is perhaps inevitable". This is because India's population is expected to grow under 0.5% during 2031-41 due to increase in life expectancy and decline in fertility rate. The Survey added it was worthwhile to signal this change now so the workforce can be prepared.

headlines: Eco Survey cites Hinduism, Islam, Christianity to stop loan defaults
text: The Economic Survey, authored by Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian, cited Hindu scriptures, quoted Prophet Muhammad and the Bible to note that wilful defaults and tax evasion lead to bad fortune. In Hinduism, non-payment of debts is a sin and also a crime, and under Islam, "a person cannot enter Paradise until his debt was paid off", the Survey said.

headlines: 180 IndiGo passengers asked to deplane after pilot fails to turn up
text: Around 180 passengers were left stranded at Chandigarh International Airport as IndiGo cancelled its 7:55 AM flight to Delhi on July 3 after the pilot failed to turn up, according to Hindustan Times. Passengers had already boarded the plane when they were asked to deplane after waiting for 45 minutes. The airline refunded the booking amount to all passengers.

headlines: Govt dancing to tunes of private entities: Owaisi on Aadhaar bill
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi, while discussing the Aadhaar bill in Lok Sabha on Thursday, said the government was dancing to the tunes of private entities rather than protecting the privacy of public. Owaisi added the bill was a marriage between the state and corporate and remarked the government doesn't believe in 'Jiyo aur jeene do' but only in 'Jio Jio'.

headlines: Will see work with stick in hand: Rane after throwing mud on engineer
text: Former Maharashtra CM Narayan Rane's son and Congress MLA Nitesh Narayan Rane, who threw mud on an engineer on Thursday, said that he will now oversee the repair work on the highway by himself with a stick in hand. "Everyday at 7 am I will reach here. Let me see how does the government system win against us," he added.

headlines: There's no standard of privacy & security: TMC MP Moitra on Aadhaar
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra, while debating Aadhaar bill in Parliament, said there was no standard of privacy and security as there was no Data Protection Act. "In absence of such Act, how can you ask me to give up my information to a private agency?" added Moitra. She said there were no specified means of recourse if Aadhaar ecosystem failed.

headlines: Imran Khan to meet Trump on July 22 on first official visit to US
text: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan will meet US President Donald Trump on July 22 during his first official visit to the country, Pakistan's Foreign Office spokesperson Mohammad Faisal said. Khan is visiting the US on Trump's invitation, he added. Trump has in the past criticised Pakistan over its inaction against terror groups and suspended over $1 billion in aid.

headlines: California 1st US state to ban discrimination against natural hair
text: California has become the first state in the US to ban discrimination against people based on their natural hair. The law prohibits employers and schools from enforcing a dress code against hairstyles such as afros, braids, twists, and locks. The law especially aims to end policies that discriminate against black people.

headlines: 99th-min goal helps Netherlands reach 1st women's WC final
text: Netherlands on Wednesday beat Sweden 1-0 after a 99th-minute goal by Manchester United Women midfielder Jackie Groenen, to reach their first ever Women's World Cup final. The match marked the first time a women's World Cup semi-final had gone to extra time. The European champions will now face defending champions, the United States, in Lyon on Sunday.

headlines: Vande Bharat completes its 2nd trial run from Delhi to Kanpur
text: Semi-high speed intercity train Vande Bharat Express on Thursday successfully completed its second trial run from Delhi to Kanpur. The train comes fitted with deep freezer, WiFi, GPS-based passenger information system, climate control system that automatically adjusts the temperature, among other amenities. Vande Bharat began its first commercial run in February on the Delhi-Varanasi route.

headlines: AAP's Raghav Chadha challenges South Delhi poll defeat in Delhi HC
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) spokesperson Raghav Chadha has challenged the South Delhi constituency election results in Delhi High Court alleging that the winner, BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri, concealed his criminal record. Chadha accused Bidhuri of not disclosing about an FIR lodged against him for making derogatory remarks at a Bihar rally. Chadha's petition urged the court to declare Bidhuri's election void.

headlines: Ministry of Environment gets electric cars for official use
text: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MOEF&CC) tweeted that it has acquired electric cars for official use. MOEF&CC added it will be utilising in-house charging facilities and setting an example in pollution-free commutes. Recently, government think tank NITI Aayog reportedly proposed that only electric vehicles be sold in the country after 2030.

headlines: Zomato, Swiggy, others summoned over deep discounting: Report
text: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade has reportedly called Swiggy, Zomato, Uber Eats and Foodpanda for a meeting after restaurants complained they engaged in "deep discounting" and "predatory pricing". The meeting was scheduled for July 4. DPIIT reportedly wants restaurants and online players to discuss mutual interest areas and develop viable solutions for equitable growth.

headlines: 16 bodies recovered, 8 still missing after Tiware dam breach
text: As many as 16 bodies have been recovered and eight more are missing from around the Tiware dam in Maharashtra's Ratnagiri which burst amid heavy rains in the area. At least 24 are feared dead following a flood-like situation in villages near the dam. Several agencies including the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) are carrying out rescue operations.

headlines: Heavy rains lead to waterlogging in parts of Gurugram
text: The national capital and the neighbouring areas on Thursday received rainfall after a dry-spell of 16 days. However, severe waterlogging and traffic jams were reported in parts of Gurugram due to heavy rains. Earlier today, the Indian Meteorological Department issued a statement saying that thunderstorms with moderate rains would be occurring over the entire Delhi region and the surrounding areas.

headlines: 9 get death penalty for attack on Bangladesh PM Hasina 25 yrs ago
text: A Bangladeshi court has sentenced nine Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) leaders to death for an attack on Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in 1994. The court also sentenced 25 other BNP leaders and activists to life in prison for the attack. Hasina, an Opposition leader in 1994, was travelling by train for a campaign when her coach was attacked.

headlines: Possible for an Indian city to be 'Detroit of EVs': Eco Survey
text: The Economic Survey 2018-19 has stated that it's possible for an Indian city to emerge as the "Detroit of Electric Vehicles", citing the country's potential to be an EV manufacturing hub. Proper policy measures are needed to reduce the lifetime ownership costs of EVs to promote their sale, it added. It further called for the creation of proper EV-charging infrastructure.

headlines: Amazon can be held liable for 3rd-party sales, rules US appeals court
text: A US appeals court ruled Amazon can be held liable for consumer injuries caused by third-party sellers' defective goods sold on Amazon under Pennsylvania law. In 2016, a woman sued Amazon claiming she was blinded in one eye when a retractable dog leash, purchased via third-party seller, snapped and recoiled. The ruling reversed a lower court decision on the case.

headlines: Taapsee to portray India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj: Reports
text: Taapsee Pannu will portray Indian Women ODI captain Mithali Raj in an upcoming biopic on her, as per reports. "The script is not in place so it's too early to talk about it. Right now, they're collecting material and the script has not been written yet," said Taapsee. The actress further said she really wants to do a sports biopic.

headlines: Hrithik Roshan booked by Hyderabad Police in cheating case
text: Hyderabad Police have registered a case of cheating against Hrithik Roshan, brand ambassador of fitness chain Cult.Fit Healthcare on a complaint filed by a gym user. The complainant said the fitness centre enrolled more people than it could accommodate and failed to give the slots as promised. In addition to Hrithik, the board of directors of Cult.Fit were also booked.

headlines: Steve Irwin's son recreates scene, feeds same crocodile at same place
text: Robert Irwin, the son of late Australian conservationist Steve Irwin, recreated a photo from 15 years ago, feeding the same crocodile at the same place as his father did. "Dad and me feeding Murray...two photos 15 years apart," he captioned the post. Steve died aged 44 in 2006 after being stabbed in the chest by a stingray.

headlines: Give top taxpayers fast access at airports, toll booths: Eco Survey
text: The Economic Survey 2018-19 has said that top 10 taxpayers within a district can be given expedited boarding privileges at airports, fast-lane privileges at toll booths, and special "diplomatic" type lanes at immigration counters. The Survey further suggests that highest taxpayers over a decade could be recognised by naming monuments, roads, trains, universities, hospitals and airports after them.

headlines: Picture of MS Dhoni spitting blood after England match goes viral
text: A picture of former India captain MS Dhoni spitting blood after India's 2019 World Cup match against England has gone viral on social media. Dhoni was hit on the thumb while batting and spat the blood out after sucking the injured thumb while walking back to pavilion. Reacting to the picture, a user tweeted, "Hats off to MS Dhoni."

headlines: Economic Survey proposes national level minimum wage
text: The Economic Survey 2018-19 has called for a national level minimum wage that will allow states to fix minimum wages at levels not lower than the floor wage. It said the present system in India has 1,915 minimum wages defined for various scheduled job categories. The Minimum Wages Act, 1948, doesn't cover one in every three workers, the Survey added.

headlines: Govt seems pessimistic about economy: Chidambaram on Economic Survey
text: Speaking on the Economic Survey released on Thursday, Congress leader and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said the government seems to be "pessimistic about the economy". He further said, "The first sentence of Volume-1, Chapter 01 is self-congratulatory ('During the last five years, India's economy has performed well')." Chidambaram added that there were no sector-wise growth projections.

headlines: Bahut Badhiya: Pichai responds to pics with Sachin in Dhoni style
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Wednesday responded to his pictures with former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar by tweeting, "As Mahi bhai would say, "Bahut Badhiya"." Pichai added, "Pleasure watching the game with you, brought back great memories, till next time." Pichai was at Edgbaston Cricket Ground to watch India's 2019 World Cup match against England earlier this week.

headlines: Chelsea appoint former midfielder Frank Lampard as their new manager
text: Chelsea have appointed their former midfielder Frank Lampard as their new manager on a three-year deal. The 41-year-old succeeds Maurizio Sarri, who left Chelsea in June to take charge at Juventus. Lampard had spent 13 years at Chelsea as a player before leading Derby to the Championship play-off final in his first season as a manager.

headlines: Samsung sued in Australia over water-resistant Galaxy phone claims
text: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) has sued Samsung for allegedly making misleading claims about water-resistant properties of Galaxy smartphones. It alleged Samsung's adverts made "false" claims about using its smartphones while swimming and surfing. It said Samsung's IP68 water resistance rating shown in adverts doesn't cover saltwater or the water found in swimming pools.

headlines: Personnel brave stones to save Amarnath pilgrims, ITBP shares video
text: The ITBP personnel braved stones at a snow slope by placing a shield wall to ensure the safe passage of Amarnath pilgrims on Baltal route, a video of which was shared by the ITBP on Thursday. Earlier, the ITBP personnel also administered oxygen to over 25 pilgrims who were feeling breathlessness. The annual Amarnath Yatra started on July 1.

headlines: This is wrong: Ex-Maha CM Rane on son throwing mud on engineer
text: Former Maharashtra CM and Rajya Sabha MP Narayan Rane, while speaking on his son and Congress MLA Nitesh Rane throwing buckets full of mud on government engineer Prakash Shedekar, said, "This behaviour is wrong". He added that protest over the highway issue was correct but the violence by his son's supporters was not correct.

headlines: Let's not get fooled by Pak's cosmetic steps: India on Saeed's case
text: After Pakistan registered terror financing cases against 26/11 Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed, MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said, "Let us not get fooled by such cosmetic steps." "Pakistan's sincerity to take action...will be judged on the basis of their ability to demonstrate irreversible action against terror groups and not on the basis of half-hearted measures," he added.

headlines: IMF board approves $6 billion loan package for Pakistan
text: The IMF's executive board has approved a three-year $6-billion bailout plan requested by Pakistan. "Pakistan is facing significant economic challenges on the back of large fiscal and financial needs and weak and unbalanced growth," IMF said. The first disbursement will be $1 billion, with the remainder to be phased in over the period of the programme subject to quarterly reviews.

headlines: Keep your hands off Hong Kong: China warns UK
text: China has told the UK to keep its hands off Hong Kong amid violence in the former British colony. British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt had asked China to grant basic freedoms to Hong Kong. Hong Kong has witnessed violent protests against a now-suspended bill that would allow the extradition of criminal suspects to mainland China.

headlines: Boeing offers $100 million to families of 737 MAX crash victims
text: Boeing on Wednesday said it would give $100 million to local governments and non-profit organisations to help families and communities affected by two crashes of its 737 MAX jet. The crashes killed a total of 346 people. "These funds will support education, hardship and living expenses for impacted families, community programs, and economic development in impacted communities," the company said.

headlines: Name airports, roads, monuments after highest taxpayers: Eco Survey
text: The Economic Survey 2018-19 has said that top 10 taxpayers within a district can be given expedited boarding privileges at airports, fast-lane privileges at toll booths, and special "diplomatic" type lanes at immigration counters. The Survey further suggests that highest taxpayers over a decade could be recognised by naming monuments, roads, trains, universities, hospitals and airports after them.

headlines: Chinese publisher loses licence over game that mocked President Xi
text: Chinese video game publisher Indievent has reportedly lost its business licence over its involvement in the Taiwanese horror game Devotion, which compared Chinese President Xi Jinping to 'Winnie the Pooh'. The game was reportedly removed from Steam in February after a "Xi Jinping Winnie-the-Pooh moron" poster was spotted in it. The game's Taiwanese developer had apologised for the incident.

headlines: SAD MLA installs posters accusing Kejriwal of corruption in Delhi
text: Posters accusing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of corruption and theft have surfaced in the national capital on Thursday. The posters were installed by Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) Manjinder Singh Sirsa outside BJP office and nearby areas. One of the posters with Kejriwal's caricature image read, "The one who claims himself to be honest, turned out to be the biggest thief."

headlines: Kiran Bedi expressed regret about tweet on Tamil Nadu: Rajnath
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday appealed to the opposition to put to rest the controversy over a tweet by Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi on the people of Tamil Nadu. Singh said she has deleted the tweet and expressed deep regret. In her now-deleted tweet, Bedi blamed "selfish and weak people", among other things for Tamil Nadu water crisis.

headlines: Make rules to blacklist those who assault doctors: Hema Malini
text: Expressing concern over attacks on doctors across the country, BJP MP Hema Malini said that the Centre should make rules to blacklist those who assault doctors and should debar them from facilities, including hospitals. She added that doctors are "superheroes and national assets". Last month, a nationwide doctor's strike took place after a junior doctor was assaulted in West Bengal.

headlines: Tejashwi Yadav will not resign like Rahul Gandhi: RJD
text: The RJD on Thursday made it clear that unlike Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav will not resign and will continue as the Leader of Opposition in the Bihar Assembly. This comes after the growing demands for Yadav's resignation following his long absence from the state. Tejashwi won't leave the responsibility of leading the Opposition midway, RJD said.

headlines: Flipkart plans to bring 50,000 MSMEs on its platform by 2019-end
text: Flipkart has announced plans to bring 50,000 micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) onto its platform by 2019-end. Flipkart claims to already have around 1,00,000 MSME sellers on its platform. CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy said Flipkart's knowledge of the Indian ecosystem let it create frameworks like 'Growth Capital' via which, sellers can scale their businesses and create more job opportunities.

headlines: Stalin's son becomes head of DMK Youth Wing his father led for 35 yrs
text: DMK President MK Stalin's son and Tamil film producer and actor Udhayanidhi Stalin was appointed as the secretary of DMK's youth wing on Thursday, a post held by MK Stalin for 35 years. Udhayanidhi is also the Managing Director of the family-owned Murasoli Trust. Udhayanidhi has become the fourth member of the Karunanidhi family occupying key positions in the party.

headlines: Court to reject Salman's bail in poaching case if he misses hearing
text: The Jodhpur court has warned Salman Khan that if he fails to appear before them in the next hearing in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case, his bail will be rejected. This came after he failed to appear in the hearing today. In 2018, Salman was convicted in the case and was granted bail after spending two nights in jail.

headlines: How can Pakistan still qualify for the World Cup semi-finals?
text: To qualify for the 2019 World Cup semi-finals, Pakistan would need to score at least 308 runs batting first and dismiss Bangladesh for 0. If Pakistan score less than 308, they cannot qualify. If Pakistan score 350 or 400, they would need to win by 312 and 316 runs respectively to advance. Further, Pakistan cannot qualify if they bat second.

headlines: Why does the Economic Survey 2018-19 have a sky blue cover?
text: Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian said that team for Economic Survey 2018-19 was guided by "blue sky thinking." "The Survey adopts an unfettered approach in thinking about the appropriate economic model for India. This is reflected in sky blue cover," he added. The design of inter-linked gears "captures the idea of investment, savings, exports, growth and jobs being complementary".

headlines: HK Kumaraswamy named state chief of Karnataka JD(S)
text: JD(S) supremo HD Deve Gowda on Thursday appointed HK Kumaraswamy as the Karnataka state president of the party and Nikhil Kumaraswamy as its Youth Wing president. HK Kumaraswamy replaces AH Vishwanath, who recently resigned from the post. Meanwhile, Madhu Bangarappa has been appointed to the post of JD(S) working president.

headlines: US-based software engineer dies in ATV accident in Telangana
text: A US-based software engineer from Hyderabad was killed after the four-wheeled All Terrain Vehicle he was riding overturned at a resort in Vikarabad district, said Telangana police. The deceased, 45-year-old Arvind Kumar Peechara, was apparently riding the vehicle without a guide. The vehicle tumbled and overturned on Arvind, who suffered grievous injuries and died on the way to a hospital.

headlines: Ex-Maharashtra CM Rane's Congress MLA son throws mud on engineer
text: Former Maharashtra CM Narayan Rane's Congress MLA son Nitesh Narayan Rane and his supporters threw buckets full of mud on engineer Prakash Shedekar at a bridge near Mumbai-Goa highway in Maharashtra's Kankavli on Thursday. The incident took place when they were inspecting the pothole-ridden highway. They also tried to tie the engineer to the bridge over the river.

headlines: Blast takes place in Panchayat Health Centre in WB's Birbhum
text: A blast took place in an old building of a Panchayat Deputy Health Centre in Birbhum, West Bengal on Thursday, officials said. The blast, which caused damage to the building and blew off its roof, was caused by explosives that were kept inside the building. The building is located about 50 metres away from Labpur police station.

headlines: Mamata, Nusrat Jahan flag off Jagannath Rath Yatra in Kolkata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and TMC MP from Basirhat, Nusrat Jahan, on Thursday flagged off the annual Jagannath Rath Yatra in Kolkata. Kolkata ISKCON had invited Jahan as a special guest for this year's Rath Yatra, saying that her stand on religion and inclusiveness was "in sync" with the ISKCON's spirit of "social harmony".

headlines: 12 pilots grounded in 6 cases of planes overshooting runways
text: Aviation regulator DGCA grounded 12 pilots and served them show-cause notices after six recent cases of aircraft overshooting runway or taxiway, an official said. GoAir has been involved in one, Air India Express in two and SpiceJet in three such incidents in the last few days. Recently, Mumbai airport's main runway was shut after a SpiceJet plane veered off it.

headlines: Man, woman forced to share stretcher at Indore hospital
text: A female and a male patient were made to share a stretcher while being taken for X-ray examinations at state-run Maharaja Yeshwantrao Hospital in Indore. The woman's husband said, "We were helpless as we wanted to get our patient treated." After a video of the incident went viral, the on-duty staff including doctors and nurses were served show-cause notices.

headlines: Australian student detained in North Korea freed from detention
text: Alek Sigley, a student who claimed he's the only Australian national in North Korea, has been freed from detention. The 29-year-old, who studies at Kim Il Sung University in North Korea, went missing last month after he lost contact with his friends and family. Sweden helped broker the release of Sigley.

headlines: Threats can come back to bite you: Trump warns Iran
text: US President Donald Trump has warned Iran to be "careful with threats" as they can "come back to bite you". Trump's warning came after Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said that the country will raise its level of uranium enrichment beyond the limit set under the nuclear deal. Iran has warned other parties to the deal to save the pact.

headlines: Ex-UK soldier jailed for murder of Britain's Got Talent finalist
text: A former British soldier has been jailed for life for killing his girlfriend, a finalist on Britain's Got Talent. Desmond Sylva had stabbed Simonne Kerr more than 70 times in August last year. Sylva had admitted manslaughter but denied murder, claiming his depression impaired his mental function, but he was found guilty by a jury.

headlines: Live-tweeting while watching TV reduces enjoyment: Study
text: Live-tweeting or using social media while viewing television lessens a person's ability to escape reality and enjoy a show, according to a new University of Connecticut study. To come to the conclusion, researchers separated 230 college students into two groups. They asked one group to tweet while watching "Friends" and the other group to watch the show without tweeting.

headlines: Rahul doesn't cease to be our leader: Salman Khurshid
text: After Rahul Gandhi publicly announced his resignation as Congress President, party leader Salman Khurshid said, "He left the office of party president, he doesn't cease to be our leader." Khurshid added, "Sonia Gandhi isn't president anymore but she remains our leader. By way of natural standing they'll continue to have admiration, affection, the confidence of party workers in them."

headlines: Om Birla urges Lok Sabha MPs not to walk out during Zero Hour
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Thursday urged Members of Parliament (MPs) not to walk out whenever an MP starts speaking during Zero Hour. His comment came after BJP MP Khagen Murmu started speaking and some parliamentarians stood up to leave in between. During Zero Hour, parliamentarians can raise matters of great importance without the mandatory ten days advance notice.

headlines: Will fight BJP, RSS with 10 times more vigour: Rahul Gandhi
text: A day after publicly announcing his resignation as Congress president, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said he will continue his 'ideological fight' with the BJP and RSS. "I will continue the fight with 10 times more vigour than I did during the last five years," he added. "I'm with the poor, farmers and labourers. This fight will continue," Gandhi further said.

headlines: Ola raises $11 million in its ongoing Series J funding round
text: Ola has raised over $11 million as part of its ongoing Series J funding round from investors including Sweden-based DIG Investment Ab and US-based Deshe Holdings, among others, filings stated. Ola's Series J funding round reportedly includes $300-million investment by Hyundai Motor Company and KIA Motors announced earlier this year. Ola's Series J round is reportedly estimated at $1 billion.

headlines: German cockroaches developing resistance to insecticides: Study
text: A Purdue University study found evidence that German cockroaches are becoming more difficult to eliminate as they develop cross-resistance to various insecticide combinations. Researchers found "those that survived a treatment and their offspring would be immune to that insecticide and also gained resistance to other classes of insecticides". "This is a previously unrealised challenge in cockroaches," the lead researcher said.

headlines: Economic Survey 2019 outlines vision to achieve $5tn economy: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi said that the Economic Survey 2019 outlines a vision to achieve a $5 trillion economy. The PM's comment came after the Economic Survey was tabled in the Rajya Sabha projecting GDP growth of 7% for the financial year 2019-20. "It also depicts the gains from advancement in the social sector, adoption of technology...energy security," the PM tweeted.

headlines: 5-year-old gangraped by 2 minor boys in Delhi
text: A five-year-old girl was gangraped by two minor boys in a park in Delhi's Kapashera area. The victim was playing in the park when the accused, aged 11 and 10 years, caught hold of her and raped her, a police officer said. The police officer said that the accused were apprehended on Tuesday and sent to a juvenile correction home.

headlines: Use DJs but don't play film songs during Kanwar Yatra: UP CM Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said there will be no ban on DJs during the Kanwar Yatra starting from July 17 across the state. However, he stated that the kanwariyas could play only bhajans during the yatra and not film songs. The CM also instructed the district administration officers to shower flower petals from helicopters on devotees.

headlines: Economic Survey predicts 7% GDP growth in 2019-20
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday tabled the Economic Survey for the financial year 2019-20 in the Rajya Sabha, projecting gross domestic product (GDP) growth of 7%. The Survey, prepared by Chief Economic Adviser Krishnamurthy Subramanian, projects the growth higher than the five-year low economic growth of 6.8% for the year ended March 31.

headlines: 1st official pic of GoT actress Sophie & Joe Jonas' wedding released
text: 'Game of Thrones' actress Sophie Turner and her husband singer Joe Jonas on Thursday shared the first official photo of their second wedding ceremony held in France and captioned it 'Mr and Mrs Jonas'. The wedding ceremony was attended by their family members including Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas. The couple earlier had an impromptu wedding in Las Vegas.

headlines: This is desperate: Anurag to Rangoli for calling Taapsee 'sasti copy'
text: Anurag Kashyap has criticised Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel after she took a dig at Taapsee Pannu and called her a 'sasti copy' of Kangana for not naming her while praising 'Judgemental Hai Kya' trailer. "This is really...desperate...Praising the trailer means praising all aspect of it. Which includes Kangana," Kashyap tweeted. Earlier, Rangoli criticised Varun Dhawan for not mentioning Kangana.

headlines: Vicky's uniform as Field Marshal Manekshaw has errors: Army veteran
text: Retired Lt Gen Syed Ata Hasnain has pointed out on Twitter that actor Vicky Kaushal's uniform in the first look as Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw has errors. "Vicky Kaushal...is wearing wrong colour badges of rank. Sam was a Gurkha, never wore brass, always black badges," Hasnain wrote. "I'm proud to wear that too being a Garhwali Bhulla," he added.

headlines: Android Co-founder Andy Rubin accused of running sex-ring by ex-wife
text: Android Co-founder Andy Rubin has been sued by his former wife Rie Rubin who accused him of running a 'sex-ring', according to court documents. She alleged Rubin paid for women's expenses in exchange for offering them to other men. She further alleged Rubin cheated her of millions of dollars via a prenuptial agreement that allowed him to conceal his wealth.

headlines: TMC's Mahua Moitra falsely accused of plagiarising my work: US author
text: After TMC MP Mahua Moitra was accused of plagiarising her Parliament speech from Washington Monthly article 'The 12 Early Warning Signs of Fascism', its author Martin Longman came out in her support. "I'm internet famous in India because a politician is being falsely accused of plagiarising me. It's...funny, but right-wing a**holes seem to be similar in every country," he tweeted.

headlines: Few have the courage that you do: Priyanka to Rahul on resignation
text: After Rahul Gandhi announced his resignation from the post of Congress President, his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tweeted, "Few have the courage that you do [Rahul Gandhi]. Deepest respect for your decision." Rahul had shared his resignation letter, in which he wrote, "As the President of the party, I am responsible for the loss of the 2019 election."

headlines: CBI court allows Indrani Mukerjea to turn approver in INX Media case
text: A special CBI court has approved Indrani Mukerjea's application to become an approver in the INX Media case. Ex-Finance Minister P Chidambaram and his son Karti are also facing probe in the case. Karti has been accused of illegally getting foreign investment clearance for INX Media when his father was the Finance Minister.

headlines: Each new student in Rajasthan's engg colleges to plant a tree
text: The Rajasthan government has ordered a plantation drive wherein every new student in state-run engineering colleges will have to plant a tree on campus this academic session. The students will look after the trees until they graduate, said Technical Education Minister Dr Subhash Garg. Further, faculty members and students will be encouraged to dig ponds to help conserve rainwater.

headlines: Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, MP likely to receive heavy rainfall: IMD
text: Heavy rainfall is expected over parts of Uttarakhand, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh, the India Meteorological Department predicted on Thursday. It also issued a warning for thunderstorm, accompanied by lightning, in Bihar. Further, it stated that coastal Karnataka, Kerala, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may also witness heavy downpour.

headlines: Student pours kerosene on B'desh prof over obscene remarks in lectures
text: A student of a private university in Bangladesh's Chittagong poured kerosene on a professor over alleged "incoherent" and "sexually explicit" remarks in his English Literature lectures. The professor said students dragged him from his office and one of them poured kerosene on him to set him ablaze. Several teachers staged a demonstration in the city against the attack on Wednesday.

headlines: Irish pub CCTV shows woman putting glass shard in mouth, fakes choking
text: A pub diner was caught on CCTV camera putting a shard of glass into her mouth in a bid to claim compensation in Ireland. The incident's video shows the woman reaching into her top, pulling something out and placing it in her mouth before she begins to choke. She then told the staff that the glass was in her food.

headlines: Rahul will always remain my leader: Congress MP Ahmed Patel
text: After Rahul Gandhi announced that he is no longer Congress' President, Rajya Sabha MP Ahmed Patel stated, "He is and will remain my leader, our leader and will continue to provide solid strength for the Congress." Calling Rahul's resignation unfortunate, Patel added, "He has... already made tremendous contributions in strengthening the party and we all believe his endeavour should continue."

headlines: Prasad accuses Opposition of 'double standards' on EVM issue
text: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad accused the Opposition of adopting "double standards" on the issue of EVMs. He said Manmohan Singh became PM twice based on elections held with EVMs and leaders like Akhilesh Yadav and Mamata Banerjee became CMs under EVMs. He asked, "If the country's people elect [PM] Narendra Modi, then EVM is faulty. What is this logic?"

headlines: Without Gandhis, Congress can't be united: Karnataka Minister
text: After Rahul Gandhi announced that he has submitted his resignation and is no longer Congress' President, Karnataka Minister DK Shivakumar stated, "Without Gandhi family Congress cannot be united, without Congress being united country cannot be united." Shivakumar added, "Gandhi family is the only strength to keep this party strong, united and rebuild this party to bring it back to power."

headlines: PM made people believe in country's democratic system: Shah
text: Addressing an event in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi made the poor people repose their faith in the country's democratic system. He added that people were losing faith in the multi-party democratic system under the then Congress-led governments. He further said that a new India would emerge under PM Modi's leadership.

headlines: Prez, PM greet citizens on occasion of Jagannath Rath Yatra
text: President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi greeted the citizens of the country on the occasion of Lord Jagannath Rath Yatra. While the PM prayed for everyone's good health, the President said, "May the blessings of Lord Jagannath bring peace, happiness and prosperity to everyone's lives." The annual Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath and his siblings commenced from today.

headlines: 10,000 security personnel deployed for Rath Yatra in Odisha
text: The Odisha government has deployed 10,000 security personnel in Puri for the annual Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath which is starting today, an official said. "We are prepared for any situation apart from VVIP security," said a senior official. During the Rath Yatra, devotees pull the chariots of Lord Balabhadra, Lord Jagannath and Devi Subhadra through the streets of Puri.

headlines: What is the #BottleCapChallenge that's going viral on social media?
text: The #BottleCapChallenge, that's going viral on social media, requires a person to open a bottle's cap using his or her foot in the middle of a kick without knocking the bottle down. Famous personalities, including Hollywood actor Jason Statham and former UFC champion Conor McGregor have attempted it. On Wednesday, actor Akshay Kumar also shared a video captioned, "Couldn't resist".

headlines: England beat New Zealand, qualify for World Cup semis after 27 years
text: England defeated New Zealand by 119 runs in their last league match of 2019 World Cup today to qualify for World Cup semi-finals for the first time since the 1992 edition. England are the third team to qualify for the semi-finals of 2019 edition after India and Australia. New Zealand and Pakistan remain in contention for the fourth semi-final spot.

headlines: Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp restored after being down for 9 hours
text: Facebook Inc said on Thursday an issue with uploading or sending media files on its apps and platforms has been resolved after an outage that lasted for at least 9 hours. Earlier, many users globally faced technical issues on its social media platforms including WhatsApp and Instagram. It blamed the outage on an error triggered during a "routine maintenance operation".

headlines: Bhagyashree's husband arrested over alleged role in gambling racket
text: Himalaya Dasani, husband of actress Bhagyashree who's known for starring in 'Maine Pyar Kiya', was arrested by Mumbai Police for his alleged involvement in a gambling racket. A few days back, the police had raided a poker racket in Andheri, and in their bust, discovered Himalaya Dasani's involvement, said reports. However, Bhagyashree has said her husband has been "falsely implicated".

headlines: Baby rhino tries to wake mother killed by poachers; officer posts video
text: An Indian Forest Officer has shared a video of a baby rhino trying to wake up its dead mother, who was killed by poachers. "The picture of poaching!! A baby #rhino tries to wake #mother...killed by poachers for the #horn. Devastating & eye-opening," the officer wrote. The baby could be seen trying to suckle some milk and shoving her.

headlines: Kya yeh Sundar pic-hai: Sachin shares pictures with Sundar Pichai
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to social media to share two pictures of himself with Google CEO Sundar Pichai, writing, "Kya yeh Sundar pic-hai?" Pichai had attended the India-England 2019 World Cup match on Sunday. Earlier, Pichai had said that he is rooting for an India-England World Cup final.

headlines: Virat Kohli wishes Ambati on retirement, calls him a top man
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter on Wednesday to wish Ambati Rayudu luck for his retirement from all forms of cricket. "Wish you the best going forward Ambati. You are a top man," Kohli wrote. In his retirement letter to the BCCI, Rayudu had thanked Kohli for always showing belief in him. Ambati represented India in 55 ODIs.

headlines: ICC shares Rohit's 2011 tweet on WC snub after 4th ton in 2019 WC
text: After Rohit Sharma smashed his fourth hundred in 2019 World Cup, the ICC took to social media to share Team India opener's 2011 tweet, wherein he had expressed his disappointment over World Cup snub. "The power of not giving up on your dreams...#LoveCricket," the ICC wrote. Notably, Rohit Sharma is currently the highest-run scorer in 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Novak Djokovic reaches Wimbledon 3rd round for 11th straight year
text: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated USA's Denis Kudla 6-3, 6-2, 6-2 in 92 minutes to reach the Wimbledon third round for the 11th consecutive year. The top seed will next meet Poland's Hubert Hurkacz, who beat Argentina's Leonardo Mayer 6-7(4-7), 6-1, 7-6(9-7), 6-3 to reach the third round of a Grand Slam for the first time.

headlines: Brand new drama of Grand Old Party: Naqvi on Rahul's resignation
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday called Rahul Gandhi's announcement of his resignation as Congress President on Twitter as a "brand new drama of the Grand Old Party". Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, unlike Congress, the organisational structure was already in place in the BJP. Javadekar added, "If nothing is happening in the other party, what can I do?"

headlines: Karnataka girl's video surfaces months after gangrape, 5 arrested
text: Puttur police on Wednesday arrested five college students for the alleged gangrape of a college girl that took place earlier this year. The incident came to light after the video of the crime was found to be circulating on social media. The girl was allegedly gangraped after being taken to a forest area in a car.

headlines: TMC MP responds to plagiarism charges on her signs of fascism speech
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra, whose maiden Lok Sabha speech on the 'seven signs of fascism' went viral, said plagiarism is when one does not disclose the source. She added she mentioned the source in her speech, which was a US Holocaust Museum poster by political scientist Dr Laurence Britt. It was alleged that Moitra plagiarised from a Washington Monthly article.

headlines: Cabinet gives approval for leasing out three airports to Adani
text: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on Wednesday approved leasing out of Ahmedabad, Lucknow and Mangaluru airports to Adani Enterprises. Earlier this year, Adani had won the bids to operate the three airports for a period of 50 years. The Gautam Adani-led company also won the bids to operate Jaipur, Guwahati and Thiruvananthapuram airports.

headlines: Bairstow 3rd England batsman to smash multiple World Cup tons
text: Jonny Bairstow has become the third England batsman to smash multiple hundreds in World Cup history. The 29-year-old, who scored 111 runs against India on June 30, slammed 106 runs against New Zealand in their 2019 World Cup match on Wednesday. Joe Root and Kevin Pietersen are the other two England players to slam at least two World Cup hundreds.

headlines: Wimbledon debutant defeats 3-time Grand Slam champ Wawrinka
text: USA's 21-year-old Reilly Opelka, who made his Wimbledon debut on Monday, defeated three-time Grand Slam champion Stan Wawrinka 7-5, 3-6, 4-6, 6-4, 8-6 in his second-round 2019 Wimbledon match on Wednesday. Meanwhile, women's world number seven Simona Halep defeated Romania's Mihaela Buzarnescu, 6-3, 4-6, 6-2 to reach the third round of the tournament for the fifth time in six years.

headlines: Ex-Barcelona midfielder Yaya Toure signs for Chinese club
text: Former Manchester City and Barcelona midfielder Yaya Toure on Wednesday signed for Chinese second-tier club Qingdao Huanghai. "Qingdao is a very exciting young club with a lot of potential and we share the same philosophy," Toure said in a statement. The former Ivory Coast international, who has won the Premier League three times, has not played since December.

headlines: People with ruling party are spreading anarchy: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Wednesday took to Twitter and targeted BJP party workers on instances of violence and misbehaviour. "It's a matter of serious concern that people associated with the ruling party are taking the law into their hands and spreading anarchy in the country," she said. Mayawati added that mere rebukes by the BJP leadership aren't helping at all.

headlines: Rahul's resignation will help in Cong's restructuring: Sena
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut expressed hope that the resignation of Rahul Gandhi as Congress President will pave the way for the restructuring of the Congress party. He added, "The [PM] Modi storm has uprooted Rahul. It's during [PM] Modi's tenure that the Congress has become Gandhi family-mukt." His comment came after Rahul on Wednesday formally resigned as Congress President.

headlines: UP CM promises piped water for every rural home within 2 yrs
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday promised piped water for every rural home in the state within two years. In a meeting with Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat, Yogi said the state government has already started working on the piped water program. He also expressed displeasure over Namami Gange's implementation and said sincere efforts are required for the project.

headlines: Petition claims PayPal India ops illegal, Delhi HC issues notice
text: The Delhi High Court reportedly issued notices to PayPal and RBI over a petition alleging that PayPal Payments' operations in India are illegal. The petition claims PayPal has violated section 4(1) of Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007. The section states that no person other than RBI, shall commence or operate a payment system except in accordance with RBI-issued authorisation.

headlines: Emotional moment but there is a tomorrow: Bhogle as Rayudu retires
text: Reacting to batsman Ambati Rayudu announcing his retirement from all forms of cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Really feel for Rayudu. Always gave it everything he had but sometimes was left holding the wrong cards." Adding that he hopes that Rayudu continues in domestic white ball cricket, Bhogle said, "This is an emotional moment but there is a tomorrow."

headlines: Rohit Sharma gifts autographed hat to fan who got hit by his six
text: Rohit Sharma gifted an autographed hat to a fan named Meena, who got hit by one of the sixes smashed by the opener during India's 2019 World Cup match against Bangladesh. Rohit also met Charulata Patel, an 87-year-old fan, who was spotted in stands blowing a horn while cheering. Rohit was named Man of the Match for his hundred.

headlines: Rohit Sharma is the best ODI player around: Virat Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli has said opener Rohit Sharma is the best ODI player around. "I've been watching Rohit for years now...He's a joy to watch and is having the tournament of his life," he added. "When he plays well, we know we're heading for a big score. He gives everyone confidence to go out and bat," he further said.

headlines: Anand Mahindra offers to sponsor tickets for 87-year-old India fan
text: Mahindra Group's billionaire Chairman Anand Mahindra has offered to sponsor tickets of Team India matches for 87-year-old Charulata Patel who went viral on social media after cheering for India in their match against Bangladesh. In a tweet, Mahindra called her the "match-winning lady" and said she should be present at 2019 World Cup semi-finals and the final as well.

headlines: Kohli always showed belief in me: Rayudu in retirement letter
text: In his retirement letter to the BCCI, Ambati Rayudu wrote that it was an honour and a privilege for him to have represented India. "I would like to thank the captains I have played under, MS Dhoni, Rohit Sharma and especially Virat Kohli who always had shown great belief in me throughout my career with the Indian team," he added.

headlines: 5 selectors combined wouldn't have made runs Rayudu has: Gambhir
text: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has blamed Team India selectors for Ambati Rayudu's retirement from all forms of cricket. "Five selectors combined would not have made the runs Rayudu has in his career. I feel extremely sad about this retirement," Gambhir added. He further said that anyone in Rayudu's place would have felt equally bad after multiple snubs.

headlines: Heard enough of your verbal diarrhoea: Jadeja criticises Manjrekar
text: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Twitter to criticise commentator Sanjay Manjrekar, who had said that he is not a fan of "bits and pieces" players like Jadeja. "Still I've played twice the number of matches you have played and I'm still playing. Learn to respect ppl who have achieved. I've heard enough of your verbal diarrhoea," Jadeja wrote.

headlines: Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp down for users worldwide
