text: Users from around the world took to Twitter on Wednesday to report issues with Facebook and Facebook-owned platforms Instagram and WhatsApp. While several users complained they were unable to see images or refresh their Facebook and Instagram feed, many users said image download failed on their WhatsApp. Online outage tracker DownDetector said WhatsApp began having issues from 7:28 PM IST.

headlines: PM Modi meets man who cycled 1,100 km as BJP won over 300 seats
text: PM Narendra Modi today met Khimchandbhai from Gujarat, who had decided that if BJP wins more than 300 seats in the Lok Sabha elections, he would cycle 1,100 km from Amreli to Delhi. "He kept his word and am told that his cycle journey drew several admirers," said PM Modi. "I was deeply impressed by his humility," the PM added.

headlines: Body of 19-yr-old found stuck between two Noida buildings at 120 ft
text: The body of a 19-year-old domestic help was found stuck 120 feet above the ground in a 1.5-foot space between two-high rise residential buildings in Amrapali Silicon City in Noida's Sector 76 on Tuesday. Noida Police called in officials with the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) to recover the body. The victim's body was disfigured, swollen and bore injury marks.

headlines: I've no information: Vora on reports he will be interim Cong chief
text: Veteran Congress leader and former Union Minister Motilal Vora on Wednesday said he has no information about him being considered to be the interim chief of the party after Rahul Gandhi resigned as Congress President. Reports said that according to the Congress constitution, 90-year-old Vora, who is the senior-most General Secretary, will take over the President's duties after Rahul's resignation.

headlines: Pakistan registers cases of terror financing against Hafiz Saeed
text: Pakistan has registered cases of terror financing against 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind and Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief Hafiz Saeed, his brother-in-law and other aides. The government targeted five outfits that operated as charities and facilitated funds to terrorists. The move follows the Financial Action Task Force's warning to Pakistan to improve efforts against terrorism financing or face action.

headlines: Putin signs law suspending nuclear arms treaty with US
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday signed a law suspending the Cold War-era Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty. The 1987 treaty banned both the countries from stationing short and intermediate-range, land-based nuclear missiles in Europe. The US is set to withdraw from the pact on August 2, claiming Russia's development of a missile violated the accord.

headlines: Shaw out of India A squad for West Indies series over injury
text: Prithvi Shaw has been ruled out of India A's one-day series against West Indies due to injury. Maharashtra's 22-year-old batsman Ruturaj Gaikwad has been named as Shaw's replacement, while Rishabh Pant, who was called up to World Cup squad, has been replaced by Ishan Kishan. Punjab's Anmolpreet Singh has also been included in the squad in place of Mayank Agarwal.

headlines: Apple sued for alleged patent infringement over iOS low-power mode
text: Apple is being sued for alleged patent infringement tied to iOS 'low-power mode', 'core location' and 'facedown detection' across devices, including iPhone and iPad. Filed by LBT IP I, the lawsuit leverages five patents "originally assigned to Location Based Technologies, who commercialised the technology in its PocketFinder GPS Devices". LBT sent notice of potential infringement to Apple in June.

headlines: Colombia's Rock of Guatapé offers panoramic view of Guatapé Lake
text: At 2,135 metres above the sea level, Colombia's El Peñón de Guatapé (Rock of Guatapé) offers a panoramic view of Guatapé Lake. Around 650 stairs lead visitors through a narrow crack on the edge of the rock formed millions of years ago. It offers a view of the new El Peñol town as the old El Peñol town is underwater.

headlines: Women with informed political choice voted for development: Smriti
text: After TMC's Derek O'Brien claimed that government data was used to target women in general elections, Union Minister Smriti Irani said women voted for development and it was their informed political choice. "According to his statement, women can't take an informed political decision," she added. "To bring this issue on the ground of suspension is very disgraceful," Irani further said.

headlines: I think Rahul will work towards building Congress: Farooq
text: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah on Wednesday congratulated Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for sticking to his decision and stepping down from the post of party President. "I think he will now work towards building the party," he said. "He had always wanted someone else in that position, I can't say that defeat did this," Abdullah added.

headlines: Tesla delivered record 95,200 cars in second quarter of 2019
text: Elon Musk-led electric automaker Tesla announced it has achieved record production of 87,048 vehicles and record deliveries of approximately 95,200 vehicles in the second quarter of 2019. In the first quarter, Tesla had produced approximately 77,100 vehicles and delivered approximately 63,000 vehicles. Tesla said it will enter the third quarter with an increase in its order backlog.

headlines: Kalaari-backed fintech startup Rubique scales down operations
text: Kalaari Capital-backed online lending startup Rubique's CEO Manav Jeet said it's scaling down its operations and trimming its workforce amid rising liquidity concerns affecting the overall non-banking lending sector. Rubique decided to focus only on three products including personal and business loan. Employee headcount has reportedly fallen from 100 in November 2018 to 47 after long delays in salary payments.

headlines: Woman finds husband on TikTok after he went missing 3 yrs ago in TN
text: A Tamil Nadu-based woman found her husband, who went missing three years ago, after she saw him with a transgender woman in a video on TikTok application. In 2016, the man had left for work and never returned. After the police located the man with the help of the video, he revealed he left home as he wasn't happy there.

headlines: Punjab Women panel seeks action against Honey Singh on 'vulgar' lyrics
text: Manisha Gulati, Chairperson of Punjab State Women Commission, has written to the Additional Chief Secretary, Home, Punjab DGP and IG Crime, Punjab, recommending action against singer Yo Yo Honey Singh over alleged vulgar lyrics in his song 'Makhna'. Gulati expressed disapproval of lines such as 'Main hoon womaniser' and 'Silicon wali ladki'. She also demanded the song should be banned.

headlines: Hard Kaur accuses fellow artist of physical assault, shares pics
text: Rapper Hard Kaur took to Instagram to accuse a fellow artist of physically assaulting her in 2017. "He attacked me from the back. Just because I was making the mixtape," she wrote while sharing pics and revealed that the accused is Mo Joshi from Azadi Records. "I did not strike her in any way," Joshi wrote in a Facebook post.

headlines: Firmino, Jesus score as Brazil beat Argentina to reach Copa final
text: Roberto Firmino and Gabriel Jesus scored a goal each to help Brazil defeat Argentina to reach the Copa América final. Notably, Argentina have not beaten Brazil in a major competitive fixture since 2005. Brazil will play the winners of Wednesday's second semi-final between champions Chile and Peru in Sunday's final at Maracana Stadium.

headlines: Hyderabad airport begins trials for face recognition entry system
text: The Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad has begun trials for a face recognition entry system which will last till July 31. To register, passengers need to provide any valid government ID proof with their details and face towards the camera, which generates their unique traveller ID. More than 180 travellers registered themselves on the first day of trials.

headlines: Man jumps onstage, pours water on head of Baidu CEO during speech
text: An unidentified man jumped onstage and poured water over the head of Chinese search giant Baidu's CEO Robin Li while he was delivering a speech at an event on Artificial Intelligence on Wednesday. "What's your problem?" the billionaire shouted in English to the perpetrator. Li froze in place for a few seconds, wiped his face and resumed his speech.

headlines: Arunachal Pradesh's Ziro valley is home to friendly 'Apatani' tribe
text: Arunachal Pradesh's Ziro valley is home to the friendly 'Apatani' tribe, whose women have facial tattoos. The tribe believes their women are so beautiful that they need to tattoo their faces in order to not let men from other tribes steal them. Talley Valley Wildlife Sanctuary, Meghna Cave Temple and Siddheshwar Nath Temple can also be visited near Ziro valley.

headlines: Every living cell in my body resists BJP's idea of India: Rahul
text: Announcing his resignation as Congress President, Rahul Gandhi in a letter wrote, "I have no anger or hatred towards the BJP but every living cell in my body instinctively resists their idea of India." "The attack on our Constitution is designated to destroy the fabric of our nation," wrote Rahul. "In no way...I'm stepping back from this fight," he added.

headlines: Congress moves Gujarat MLAs to Mt Abu ahead of Rajya Sabha by-polls
text: Two days before by-polls in Gujarat for two Rajya Sabha seats, the Congress has moved 65 of its MLAs to Mount Abu in Rajasthan, purportedly to prevent any advances by the BJP that could lead to cross-voting. The by-polls were necessitated after Union Ministers Amit Shah and Smriti Irani vacated their seats after being elected to the Lok Sabha.

headlines: Free, fair election requires institutions' neutrality: Rahul Gandhi
text: In a letter announcing his resignation as Congress President, Rahul Gandhi wrote, "A free and fair election requires the neutrality of a country's institutions." "An election cannot be free without arbiters - free press, independent judiciary and transparent election commission," he wrote. "Nor can an election be free if one party has a complete monopoly on financial resources," he added.

headlines: Tripura man mob lynched on suspicion of stealing cattle
text: A 36-year-old man, named Budhi Kumar Tripura, succumbed to his injuries on Wednesday after being thrashed by villagers late on Tuesday night on suspicion of stealing cattle in Tripura's Dhalai district, police said. "He died in the hospital early this morning. Post-mortem will be done. After that, we will take a case," said Suleman Reang, officer-in-charge of Raishyabari police station.

headlines: 260 get food poisoning at Philippine ex-First Lady's b'day party
text: More than 260 fell ill from suspected food poisoning during the 90th birthday party of Imelda Marcos, the former First Lady of the Philippines, officials said. However, Marcos, the widow of late dictator Ferdinand Marcos, was not affected. An estimated 2,500 people attended the birthday celebration of the former First Lady on Wednesday.

headlines: Maria Sharapova out of Wimbledon after retiring in 1st round
text: Former champion Maria Sharapova crashed out of Wimbledon after she was forced to retire from her first round match against Frances Pauline Parmentier due to an injury on Tuesday. The former world number one trailed 6-4, 6-7 (4-7), 0-5 before she pulled out. Sharapova had not won a main draw match at Wimbledon since 2015.

headlines: Nadal enters Wimbledon 2nd round, to face Nick Kyrgios
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated Japan's Yuichi Sugita 6-3, 6-1, 6-3 to enter second round of Wimbledon on Tuesday. The 18-time Grand Slam champion will next face Australia's world number 43 Nick Kyrgios, who defeated his compatriot Jordan Thompson in five sets in the first round. Nadal and Kyrgios have played against each other six times, both winning thrice.

headlines: Sony co-announces $185 million fund to invest in startups
text: Japan's Sony and Daiwa Capital Holdings announced a joint venture company to establish a new fund, aiming to be around $185 million in size, to invest in startups within "key high-growth industries". Osaka Shoko Shinkin Bank, among others, signed on to Innovation Growth Fund as a limited partner. Sony's previous fund targeting AI and robotics startups made over 40 investments.

headlines: Stood alone against PM, RSS & I'm proud of it: Rahul Gandhi
text: After officially resigning as the Congress President following the election defeat, Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said in an open letter that Congress fought a strong and dignified election. "I personally fought the PM, the RSS...At times, (I) stood completely alone and am extremely proud of it," he added. Gandhi has asked the Congress Working Committee to find his replacement soon.

headlines: Flipkart compliant with FDI rules on e-commerce, ready for audit: CEO
text: Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy said Flipkart is fully compliant with India's FDI rules and is ready to face audit to check compliance. In a meeting, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal had reportedly asked Flipkart to prove compliance with FDI norms for online marketplaces implemented earlier this year. Krishnamurthy declined to comment on that but said Flipkart takes legal compliance "seriously".

headlines: China's Didi Chuxing removes 3,00,000 drivers amid safety overhaul
text: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing has removed over 3,00,000 drivers who dont meet its standards since launching a safety overhaul last year. Two passengers of Didi's carpooling service Hitch were killed in separate incidents last year following which, Hitch was suspended. Didi is reportedly contemplating resuming Hitch and plans to engage public in talks on how to increase Hitch's safety.

headlines: Officials didn't act on complaints about Tiware dam: Locals
text: The residents and an MLA of Maharashtra's Chiplun alleged that the officials ignored warnings about cracks in the Tiware dam, which burst amid rains killing at least nine people. "There was a confusion among...officials that under whose jurisdiction the dam comes, leading to no action," a local said. As many as 15 people are reported missing after the incident.

headlines: India's services sector activity contracts for 1st time in a yr
text: India's services sector growth contracted for the first time in over a year in June, owing to weak sales, high competition and unfavourable taxation, a private survey showed. The Nikkei India Services Purchasing Managers' Index fell to 49.6, the lowest since May 2018. It dropped below the 50-mark threshold, which separates expansion from contraction, from 50.2 in the previous month.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi officially resigns as Congress President, shares letter
text: Rahul Gandhi has officially resigned as the Congress President, saying that he was responsible for Congress' defeat in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. "Accountability is critical for future growth of our party," he wrote in an open letter. He further said that it would not be correct for him to select the next Congress President.

headlines: LPU promises to give right setting for students' development
text: Lovely Professional University (LPU) is the only private university to be visited by Hon. Prime Minister, and also the first private university to be granted NABL accreditation by Quality Council of India. From placement records and research and development opportunities to infrastructure and scholarship opportunities, LPU promises to provide the right setting for a student's overall development.

headlines: Pancholi drugged me, got forcefully physical & took pics: Actress
text: An actress who accused Aditya Pancholi of rape has alleged in her statement that in 2004, Pancholi spiked her drink during a party and on the pretext of dropping her home, got forcefully physical with her in his car. "He...took photographs of me, which I wasn't aware of," she added. The actress alleged that Pancholi blackmailed her with the photos.

headlines: Lee Iacocca, who created Ford Mustang and rescued Chrysler, dies
text: Lee Iacocca, the US auto industry executive who created the Ford Mustang and saved Chrysler from bankruptcy in the 1980s, has died at the age of 94. Iacocca, who joined Ford in 1946, became its President in 1970 but was fired eight years later by the founder's grandson, Henry Ford II. He retired as Chrysler's chairman and CEO in 1992.

headlines: Supreme Court to translate orders in 6 regional languages
text: Supreme Court has reportedly decided to make its judgements available in six regional languages, Assamese, Hindi, Kannada, Marathi, Odia and Telugu, on its official website by this month-end. Judgements are currently written in English and uploaded on the website. The reason behind the move is to enable the litigants to check the status of their cases without depending on lawyers.

headlines: WB school asks boys, girls to come on different days over eve-teasing
text: After receiving several complaints on eve-teasing, a government school in Malda, West Bengal issued a directive for alternate day attendance of boys and girls. "Since its implementation, operations have been smooth," the school's headmaster said. "Such a decision can never be supported. We have asked the officials to inquire into the matter," said West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee.

headlines: Waterlogging outside Shiv Sena chief's house in Mumbai due to rains
text: Waterlogging was witnessed outside Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray's residence, 'Matoshree', in Mumbai due to heavy rainfall. His party has been controlling the BMC, India's richest civic body, for over two decades. Moreover, waterlogging has been reported in several areas, causing traffic jams and affecting local trains in the city.

headlines: Disappointing that SC orders will not be translated in Tamil: Stalin
text: DMK chief MK Stalin on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to translate its orders into regional languages but said it was disappointing that Tamil was not one of the languages included. He added that Tamil is an official language of the country and its exclusion will lead to various doubts in the minds of Tamils across the world.

headlines: Favouritism, casteism in appointment of judges: HC judge to PM Modi
text: Allahabad High Court judge Rang Nath Pandey has written to PM Narendra Modi, alleging "nepotism, favouritism and casteism" in appointment of judges. He said the appointments take place behind closed doors and "over cups of tea". "In the last 34 years of my service as a judicial officer, I've seen people with...poor knowledge of the law being appointed," he added.

headlines: Noida to be made plastic-free, free cloth bags to be distributed
text: Noida Authority on Tuesday said it has decided to start a 'Say No to Plastics' campaign by distributing cloth bags, beginning July 4. "Our motive is to make Noida a no-plastic city, where people completely stop depending upon plastic bags," said Alok Tandon, CEO, Noida Authority. It will start the distribution of cloth bags to vendors, traders and residents.

headlines: Khalid Qasimi, fashion designer & son of Sharjah's ruler, found dead
text: Sheikh Khalid bin Sultan Al Qasimi, son of Sheikh Sultan bin Muhammad Al Qasimi, the ruler of Sharjah in the UAE, was found dead at his home in London. The 39-year-old was a fashion designer by profession and started his own brand in 2008. A post-mortem examination proved inconclusive and results of further tests are awaited, a police statement said.

headlines: 40 killed after air strike hits migrant detention centre in Libya
text: At least 40 people were killed and 80 others were injured after an air strike hit a migrant detention centre in Libya on Tuesday, officials said. This comes amid an ongoing offensive between the Libyan National Army (LNA) and the UN-backed Government of National Accord (GNA). The Tripoli-based GNA has blamed the LNA for the air strike.

headlines: Waymo gets California permit to transport people in self-driving cars
text: Alphabet's self-driving unit Waymo received California regulators' approval to transport passengers in its robotaxis, TechCrunch stated. Waymo said California Public Utilities Commission allows it to participate in their Autonomous Vehicle Passenger Service pilot, letting its staff hail its vehicles and bring guests on rides. Waymo cant charge for rides and must have safety drivers in vehicles.

headlines: US govt officials told to treat Huawei as blacklisted: Reuters
text: US Export Enforcement Office's Deputy Director in an email told enforcement staff to continue to treat Huawei as blacklisted, Reuters reported. It reportedly stated applications by firms seeking approval to sell to Huawei should be considered on merit and flagged with language noting it's on "Entity List". Recently, US President Donald Trump said he'll ease ban on sales to Huawei.

headlines: Speculative: ShopClues on report of Snapdeal ending acquisition talks
text: ShopClues has denied an Entrackr report stating Snapdeal pulled out of discussions to acquire it, terming it entirely speculative. Sources privy to the development reportedly said that ShopClues' outstanding liabilities are about $40-50 million, of which, at least $25-30 million are payable immediately to operational creditors. They reportedly added senior staff members' salaries are in arrears for past few months.

headlines: CBI registered 316 corruption complaints in 2018: Government
text: The government on Wednesday said that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) registered as many as 316 corruption complaints in 2018. In the past five years, 2,157 corruption complaints were registered by the central probe agency. Out of the total, 547 were filed in 2014, followed by 489 in 2015, 417 in 2016 and 388 in 2017, the government added.

headlines: Auto-rickshaw collides with bus in Karnataka; 12 dead, 20 injured
text: As many as 12 people died and over 20 others were injured after an auto-rickshaw collided with a bus in Karnataka's Chintamani on Wednesday. The injured have been admitted to a nearby hospital for treatment. On Monday, as many as 30 people were killed after a bus fell into a deep gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district.

headlines: Sedition law will not be scrapped: Home Ministry
text: Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai on Wednesday told the Parliament that the controversial sedition law won't be scrapped. Rai said there was "need to retain the provisions to effectively combat anti-national, secessionist and terrorist elements." Sedition law has been debated upon for its alleged misuse to curb the essential rights of citizens like freedom of speech among others.

headlines: 5-month pregnant woman beaten up by miscreants in UP's Etah
text: A five-month pregnant woman was allegedly beaten up by unknown miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Etah during a wedding ceremony. The mother-in-law of the victim said that eight to ten goons barged into the function and started hitting the guests. She added, "The goons also pulled the hair of my two daughters. They had hit me also."

headlines: Aircraft overshooting runways due to rains: Aviation Minister
text: After some incidents of aircraft overshooting runways were reported in the past few days, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Wednesday said such incidents occur sometimes due to excessive rains. "All is under control...there is no cause of concern," he added. Earlier, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) directed airlines to follow set precautions during monsoon operations.

headlines: Biker swept away in flood water in Madhya Pradesh, rescued
text: A man along with his bike swept away while crossing a flooded road in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone on Tuesday. The victim was later rescued safely by the people present at the spot and the entire incident was captured on a mobile phone by a bystander. Several roads in the tribal areas of Khargone district were waterlogged due to heavy rains.

headlines: I have a 3-year-old daughter, will marry when I want to: Mahie Gill
text: Actress Mahie Gill has revealed that she has a daughter named Veronica who will turn 3 years old in August this year, as per Navbharat Times. "Yes, I have not been married yet, when I want to marry, I will do it," she was quoted as saying. The actress further revealed that she is currently in a live-in relationship.

headlines: Ambati Rayudu announces retirement from all forms of cricket
text: Batsman Ambati Rayudu has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket after being overlooked for World Cup spot multiple times by BCCI. In November 2018, the 33-year-old had retired from first-class cricket to focus on 50-over and T20 cricket keeping World Cup in mind. Rayudu represented India in 55 ODIs and six T20Is, scoring 1,694 and 42 runs respectively.

headlines: Age is just a number: Kohli meets 87-year-old India fan; shares pics
text: Following India's 28-run victory against Bangladesh in the 2019 World Cup match, Team India captain Virat Kohli met an 87-year-old fan, Charulata Patel, and sought her blessings. Sharing pictures on social media, Kohli wrote, "She's 87 and probably one of the most passionate & dedicated fans I've ever seen. Age is just a number, passion takes you leaps & bounds."

headlines: I am no longer the Congress President: Rahul Gandhi
text: Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that he has already submitted his resignation and he is no longer the Congress party's President. "Party should decide on the new President quickly without further delay, I'm nowhere in this process," he said. "Congress Working Committee should convene a meeting at the earliest and decide," he added.

headlines: Another FIR against Azam Khan for his remarks against Jaya Prada
text: Another FIR has been registered against Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan and 10 other people for allegedly making derogatory remarks against BJP leader Jaya Prada on June 30. The FIR was filed by Akash Saxena, a supporter of Jaya Prada. During the LS elections as well, Khan was banned from campaigning for 72 hours for his remarks against Jaya Prada.

headlines: HC doesn't stay demolition of house for which BJP MLA beat official
text: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has dismissed a petition seeking a stay on demolition of a house for which BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya had thrashed a municipal official with a bat. However, it directed Indore Municipal Corporation to provide temporary shelter for the family living there. Akash had thrashed the official after a municipal team arrived to demolish the structure.

headlines: Tribal woman gangraped in moving truck in Bhopal, 3 arrested
text: Three men have been arrested for allegedly raping a tribal woman in a moving truck in Bhopal on Monday night, the police said. The woman and her husband had taken a lift in the truck, following which the accused started sexually harassing the woman. Her husband tried to stop them, but they threw him out of the truck.

headlines: Monsoon headed to Delhi, heavy rain unlikely before July 10: IMD
text: Monsoon is likely to advance to several parts of northwest India, including Delhi, Haryana, Chandigarh, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh, in the next two to three days, the India Meteorological Department predicted on Tuesday. However, widespread and heavy rain will be unlikely before July 10 in Delhi, the IMD scientists further predicted.

headlines: 3 killed, many feared trapped after 3 buildings collapse in Mizoram
text: At least three people were killed and nine injured after three buildings in Mizoram's Aizawl collapsed following a landslide in Durtlang hills on Tuesday evening. Many people are believed to be trapped under debris and a search and rescue operation is underway. The buildings are part of a housing complex under a Centre-sponsored scheme, Basic Services to the Urban Poor.

headlines: Woman gives birth to baby boy at railway station in Maharashtra
text: A 29-year-old woman gave birth to a baby boy at the platform of Maharashtra's Dombivli railway station on Wednesday. Doctors and nurses at the One Rupee Clinic attended to her, and she and her baby were later shifted to a hospital. A nurse said, "This is the eighth delivery at the railway station assisted by One Rupee Clinic staff."

headlines: Amit Shah summons Delhi Police chief over Chandni Chowk violence
text: Home Minister Amit Shah summoned Delhi Police Commissioner Amulya Patnaik on Wednesday over communal violence in Delhi's Chandni Chowk area. "It was a general briefing on the Chandni Chowk incident, was asked about the situation and action had been taken against people identified," Patnaik said after the meeting. Four people were arrested in connection with the incident.

headlines: Dog given shelter at police station after its owners were jailed
text: Madhya Pradesh's Chhoti Bajaria Police Station is giving shelter and food to a Labrador named Sultan after its owners were sent to jail in a murder case. Station Incharge Manisha Tiwari said she decided to take care of Sultan after getting to know of the situation. Manisha said she'll hand over Sultan to someone if they wish to adopt it.

headlines: Declared dead by UP hospital, man found alive just before burial
text: Twenty-year-old Mohammad Furqan was wrongly declared dead by a private hospital in Lucknow following an accident. However, just before he was about to be buried, his family members noticed movement in his limbs and brought him to a Delhi hospital. A doctor said, "The patient is in critical condition but definitely not brain dead...He has been put on ventilator support."

headlines: J&K teacher threatens to kill student with axe, case filed
text: The J&K Police have registered a case after a video purportedly showing a teacher threatening to kill a crying student with an axe emerged online. The teacher, believed to be employed in a private school in Kupwara, threatened the child in front of other students. Former CM Mehbooba Mufti demanded action against him, stating, "Was distressing just to watch this."

headlines: I turned out to be such a waste: IIT student hangs himself in hostel
text: A student of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Hyderabad, allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling fan in his hostel room, the police said on Tuesday. In the note, the 20-year-old stated he may not get good marks and in a message for his parents, he wrote, "I'm sorry I turned out to be such a waste."

headlines: US designates Pak-based Baloch Liberation Army as terrorist group
text: The US has designated the Pakistan-based Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) as Specially Designated Global Terrorist (SDGT). The designation bans anyone in the US from assisting the group and freezes any assets that it may have in the US. BLA has carried out several terrorist attacks, including an attack on the Chinese consulate in Karachi last year.

headlines: 2 passengers killed in shooting at Lahore airport
text: At least two passengers were killed and two others were injured after gunmen opened fire at Lahore's Allama Iqbal International Airport on Wednesday. The two suspects arrested by the authorities said that they were targetting one of the victims with whom they had a long-running dispute. The second victim of the shooting was an unrelated taxi driver.

headlines: Vaibhav Yadav claims WBC Asia title with a knockout win
text: Indian pro boxer Vaibhav Yadav became the WBC Asia silver welterweight champion after defeating Thailands Fahpetch Singmanassak in Patayya on Sunday. The 24-year-old Delhi-based boxer secured the title by claiming a third-round knockout win over local favourite Singmanassak. Yadav, who is nicknamed 'Ahir Boxer', is the cousin of Commonwealth Games gold medallist boxer Vikas Krishan.

headlines: Yoga should be made part of compulsory education: BJP MP
text: Addressing Rajya Sabha, BJP MP Saroj Pandey on Tuesday demanded that yoga should be made a part of compulsory education. She said, "If the children are taught yoga from an early age, then they'll be able to face the challenges in life in a better way." Terming yoga as life's important component, she said it's the culture of India.

headlines: Stop blaming EVMs for LS defeat, Maha CM tells Opposition
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has appealed to Opposition leaders to stop blaming EVMs and accept they lost the 2019 LS polls "due to their own deeds." He said, "People...have rejected them and it is a bitter but important truth." He added, "Even I had once fallen into a similar trap," stating that he'd approached the Supreme Court some years ago.

headlines: Yogi govt initiates action against 600 corrupt officers
text: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government asked 200 officials, found guilty in corruption cases, to take voluntary retirement and warned over 400 corrupt officials of severe punishment. On June 20, Adityanath had reviewed the work of Secretariat Administration department and said that there was no place for corrupt officers. He had also asked to prepare a list of corrupt officers.

headlines: Parliament like university where MPs can learn a lot: PM
text: During a parliamentary party meeting, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday told BJP MPs that the Parliament is like a university where they can learn a lot. The PM reportedly invoked the example of LJP leader Chirag Paswan and urged newly elected MPs to learn from him. The PM also expressed displeasure over low attendance of MPs in the Parliament.

headlines: Kolkata biker hits pedestrian, drags traffic constable for 100m
text: A traffic constable was dragged for nearly 100 metres on the road on Monday in Kolkata by a biker, who was trying to flee the scene after hitting a pedestrian, police said. The constable suffered serious injuries in a bid to get hold of the evading biker, the police added. CCTV footages were being scanned to ascertain the biker's identity.

headlines: I also want to pay Kingfisher employees and move on in life: Mallya
text: Vijay Mallya said he's repeating his offer to pay back the banks that lent money to Kingfisher Airlines in full "despite the good court result" for him on Tuesday. "Please take the money. With the balance, I also want to pay employees and other creditors and move on in life," he added. Mallya was granted permission to appeal his extradition.

headlines: Mentors at Springboard help learners master Data Science
text: Springboard, a US-based online learning platform has launched Data Science and AI/ML career track for Indian working professionals. Data scientists from companies like Flipkart, InMobi, Swiggy, PayTm and Ola will help learners execute projects, understand concepts and learn about its real-life applications, thereby enabling successful career transitions.

headlines: World's smallest MRI scan performed on single atoms
text: Researchers at the IBS Center for Quantum Nanoscience (QNS) have performed the world's smallest magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to visualise the magnetic field of single atoms. They used a Scanning Tunneling Microscope, which consists of an atomically sharp metal tip that allows researchers to image and probe single atoms. Two elements, iron and titanium, were investigated in the work.

headlines: India is a friend forever: Iran on oil imports amid US sanctions
text: Amid tensions between Iran and US over sanctions, Iran's Ambassador to India Ali Chegeni on Tuesday said, "India is a friend forever. We understand India will act according to its national interest (on oil imports issue)." Chegeni asserted that his country can provide "affordability, accessibility and security" of energy to India, adding India's relations with other countries doesn't affect Iran.

headlines: Nafisa Ali, who was diagnosed with cancer, seeks work on Instagram
text: Actress Nafisa Ali, who was diagnosed with stage 3 cancer, has shared a post on Instagram seeking work. "I'd like an elegant role to portray in Indian cinema. So looking for a perfect script as a senior actor," the 62-year-old wrote while sharing a black and white photo. Nafisa has featured in films like 'Major Saab' and 'Life In A...Metro'.

headlines: Rayudu offered permanent residency by Iceland after 2019 WC snub
text: Iceland Cricket have offered batsman Ambati Rayudu permanent residency in their country after he was overlooked for World Cup spot by the BCCI. "Come join us Ambati. We love the Rayudu things," Iceland Cricket tweeted, sharing an application form for permanent residency. Rayudu was also not called up to the squad following injuries to Shikhar Dhawan and Vijay Shankar.

headlines: Gayle gifts Rihanna signed bat after World Cup match
text: West Indies opener Chris Gayle gifted a signed bat to singer Rihanna following his team's World Cup match against Sri Lanka on Monday. "It was pleasure meeting you. Thanks for the cheers and support! May god continue to bless you. I hope you take up the offer to come to my birthday party on September 20," Gayle wrote on Instagram.

headlines: We can beat India and end World Cup on a high: SL spinner Dhananjaya
text: Following Sri Lanka's 23-run victory against West Indies in the 2019 World Cup, off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva said his team can win two matches in a row by defeating India in their last 2019 World Cup match. "We are trying hard to win every game and if we beat India then we can finish fifth," he added.

headlines: Federer reaches Wimbledon second round for 17th successive year
text: Eight-time champion Roger Federer reached the Wimbledon second round for the 17th successive year on Tuesday, defeating South Africa's Lloyd Harris 3-6, 6-1, 6-2, 6-2. "I struggled early on, my legs were frozen and the ball was not going where I wanted it to," said Federer. Harris was making his Wimbledon debut.

headlines: Asaduddin Owaisi condemns attack on temple in Delhi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday took to Twitter to condemn the attack on a temple in Delhi's Chandni Chowk area. "Attack on any place of worship or worshippers is an attack on the very pluralism & diversity of our dear country," wrote Owaisi. He also demanded that the culprits be prosecuted and convicted in a time-bound manner.

headlines: Noida temples recycling floral waste into organic colours, agarbatti
text: Temples in Uttar Pradesh's Noida are recycling floral waste into organic colours, agarbatti (incense sticks) and compost with the help of NGOs working with destitute women, officials said. Noida Authority has tied up with some NGOs under the 'Zero Waste Project' to check the dumping of floral waste in rivers. Noida Authority's CEO said, "All products are 100% eco-friendly."

headlines: Budweiser owner seeks $9.8 bn for Asia unit in year's largest IPO
text: Budweiser owner AB InBev, the world's largest brewer, is planning to raise up to $9.8 billion with a Hong Kong listing of its Asia-Pacific unit, marking the year's biggest IPO so far. The listing could value Budweiser Brewing Company APAC at nearly $64 billion. The unit had a profit of $1.4 billion in 2018, while revenue was $8.5 billion.

headlines: We will try restoring pride in India series: WI's Nicholas Pooran
text: After West Indies lost their sixth match in 2019 World Cup on Monday, batsman Nicholas Pooran said they will try restoring pride in West Indies cricket in the series against India next month. Pooran, who scored 118 runs in the match against Sri Lanka, added, "Hopefully...guys like me, Shimron Hetmyer, Shai Hope and Fabian Allen have learned from this tournament."

headlines: Man Utd's Rashford signs new 4-year deal worth £200,000-a-week
text: England forward Marcus Rashford on Monday signed a new four-year contract worth £200,000-a-week with Manchester United with an option to extend for a further year. "Manchester United has been everything in my life... The club has shaped me, both as a player and as a person," said Rashford. The 21-year-old has made 170 appearances for the club.

headlines: Alphabet's internet balloons set for 1st commercial trial in Kenya
text: Alphabet-subsidiary Loon's balloons will reach Kenya for its first commercial trial in the coming weeks, Reuters quoted Loon. The test with Telkom Kenya will reportedly let mountain villagers buy 4G service at market-rate prices for undefined period. Loon aims to bring connectivity to remote areas by floating solar-powered networking gear over areas where cell towers are too expensive to build.

headlines: 4 killed after water tank collapses in Maharashtra's Nashik
text: At least four people were killed and two others injured after a water tank collapsed at an under-construction building in Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday. Three were brought out dead from the debris, while one succumbed to his injuries in the hospital. The matter was raised in the Maharashtra Assembly where Nationalist Congress Party accused the state government of poor infrastructure.

headlines: Delhi Commission for Women sets up Transgender Cell
text: The Delhi Commission for Women on Monday set up a Transgender Cell within the body to look into complaints of violence, abuse, harassment and discrimination against the transgender community. The cell will also create awareness and advocate the cause of the community. Notably, the Supreme Court passed a verdict recognising 'transgender' as a legal third gender in 2014.

headlines: Government buildings to have aerators in taps to save water
text: In its recent order, the Jal Shakti Ministry has asked all the ministries and departments to install aerators in the taps of government buildings in a bid to conserve water. An aerator is a device that can control water flow from the taps. The ministry said every step to conserve water would go a long way in tackling water scarcity.

headlines: Take action on public complaints in 7 days: Uttarakhand CM
text: Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Tuesday heard complaints and suggestions of about 170 people at a public meeting and directed authorities to resolve their issues within seven days. He instructed various government departments to take action on complaints related to their departments. Rawat also directed officials to inform the complainant and the CMO about the actions taken.

headlines: 87-year-old woman blowing horn to cheer for Team India goes viral
text: Charulata Patel, an 87-year-old woman, blowing a horn in the stands to cheer for Team India against Bangladesh in the 2019 World Cup has gone viral on social media. "I have been watching cricket for last many decades...Earlier, I used to watch on TV when I was working, but now that I am retired I watch it live," she said.

headlines: India defeat Bangladesh to qualify for 2019 World Cup semi-finals
text: India defeated Bangladesh by 28 runs at Edgbaston in Birmingham on Tuesday to become the second team after Australia to qualify for the 2019 World Cup semi-finals. This is the third straight time that India have reached World Cup semi-finals. With their fourth defeat in the tournament, Bangladesh are now officially out of the semi-finals race.

headlines: Finally, we have found our no. 4 batsman for future: Yuvraj on Pant
text: Reacting to wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant's 41-ball 48-run knock against Bangladesh in the 2019 World Cup on Tuesday, former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "I think finally we have found our no 4 batsman for the future!" He added, "Let's groom him properly yeah!" Rishabh slammed six fours and a six during his knock.

headlines: Shakib 1st cricketer to score 500 runs, take 10 wickets in a WC
text: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has become the first cricketer in history to score 500 runs and take 10 wickets in a World Cup edition. The 32-year-old, who has taken 11 wickets in 2019 World Cup, crossed the 500-run mark during his innings against India today. No other cricketer has even managed 400 runs and 10 wickets in an edition.

headlines: You want to kill me: Mortaza as journo asks if he'll be PM in 15 yrs
text: After a journalist asked whether he will be Bangladesh's Prime Minister after 10-15 years, Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said, "You want to kill me. Surely not." The 35-year-old had become a Member of Parliament from Bangladesh's Narail-2 constituency last December. Mortaza has played six 2019 World Cup matches so far, taking one wicket and scoring 11 runs.

headlines: Plane skids off Kolkata runway, flyers safe; 5th mishap in 3 days
text: A SpiceJet aircraft from Pune veered off from the runway at Kolkata airport because of wet tarmac and heavy rainfall on Tuesday, SpiceJet's spokesperson said. All passengers and crew members were safe, the spokesperson added. Notably, this was the fifth mishap on a runway in the last three days, with previous incidents happening at Mangaluru, Surat, Kozhikode and Mumbai airports.

headlines: DGCA issues Air Safety Circular after multiple flight mishaps in rain
text: Director General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued an Air Safety Circular for airlines with guidelines on aircraft operations after multiple cases of flight mishap on runways due to rain. It asked the airlines to carry out risk assessment before operating during adverse weather conditions. DGCA further directed the airlines to "make available sufficiently experienced crew in the cockpit".

headlines: Man hides in landing gear, falls to death as plane prepares to land
text: A man hiding inside the landing gear of a plane travelling from Kenya to London fell to death as the Kenya Airways flight prepared to land at Heathrow Airport. A bag, water and some food were found in the plane's landing-gear compartment, police said. The man reportedly fell just a metre from a resident who was sunbathing in his garden.

headlines: 14 sailors killed in fire on Russian Navy research vessel
text: At least 14 sailors were killed after a Russian Navy research deep-water vessel caught fire, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. The crew members died as a result of poisoning from the fumes of the fire. The vessel was conducting a biometric measurement operation in Russian territorial waters when the fire broke out on board.

headlines: Dalai Lama apologises for his 'attractive' female successor remark
text: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama has issued an apology over his recent statement that if a female leader succeeds him, then she should be "more attractive". "His Holiness consistently emphasises the need for people to connect with each other on a deeper human level, rather than getting caught up in preconceptions based on superficial appearances," an official statement read.

headlines: Dale Steyn joins first ever Euro T20 Slam as marquee player
text: South African pacer Dale Steyn has joined the first ever Euro T20 Slam as a 'marquee player'. Five other cricketers, including Imran Tahir, Babar Azam and Chris Lynn have also been designated as marquee players by the league. Euro T20 Slam, co-hosted by cricket boards of Scotland, Ireland and the Netherlands, will have a total of six franchises.

headlines: Tharoor mentions reports of data sharing with China; TikTok responds
text: Chinese lip-syncing video app TikTok has refuted allegations of illegally collecting and sharing data with China. This comes after Congress leader Shashi Tharoor in Lok Sabha mentioned reports which stated that China's government receives data from TikTok via state-owned China Telecom. TikTok added Indian users' data is stored in the US and Singapore at "industry-leading third-party data centres".

headlines: US state updates 'revenge porn' law to include deepfakes
text: The US state of Virginia has updated its 'revenge porn' law to include deepfakes or "falsely created videographic or still image". The law criminalises the malicious sharing or selling of explicit photos or videos to "coerce, harass or intimidate". Virginia's General Assembly reportedly passed a bill in March to update its 2014 law, which only came into effect this week.

headlines: BJP corporator dumps dirt during Municipal Corporation meet
text: BJP corporator Manoj Prajapati in Chhattisgarh's Raipur dumped sludge during a Municipal Corporation meeting, in protest against the civic body for not working efficiently in his area. In the video of the incident, he is seen carrying a bag filled with sludge and dumping it on the floor. Prajapati can also be seen raising slogans against the Municipal Corporation.

headlines: Provide more freedom to Indian entrepreneurs: Murthy to govt
text: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy has said that creating a free atmosphere for entrepreneurs is the foremost step to ensure India's prosperity. "As entrepreneurs create jobs...we can create wealth...pay more tax," he added. While acknowledging the government's initiatives for startups, he reportedly emphasised the need for a free environment for industries and investors.

headlines: Maharashtra jail capacity stagnant, inmate population up 18%: CAG
text: The population of jail inmates in Maharashtra prisons has increased by 18% from 2013-14 to 2017-18 while their capacity remained stagnant during the period, a report by CAG revealed. The population went up from 27,883 to 32,810 in that period. In nine Central Prison and Correctional Centres, overcrowding of prisoners increased from 125% to 155% of capacity, the report said.

headlines: Forest guards attacked for stopping encroachment in Telangana
text: Two forest guards were assaulted with rods and sticks by villagers for stopping people from encroaching forest land in Telangana. The guards got reports of encroachment by villagers, after which they reportedly detained some people and seized three tractors before the attack. This comes two days after a woman forest official was attacked with sticks by a mob in Telangana.

headlines: Bangladeshi terror group using WB madrasas for recruitment: MHA
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Tuesday said Bangladeshi terror outfit Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen is using some madrasas in West Bengal for "radicalisation and recruitment activities". MHA added that relevant inputs are regularly shared with the state governments and agencies concerned with the advice to take appropriate action. MHA said this in a written reply to a query in Lok Sabha.

headlines: 160 ISIS members, sympathisers arrested across India: Govt
text: Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday informed the Lok Sabha that 160 members and sympathisers of the terrorist organisation ISIS have been arrested across the country. Reddy further said some instances of individuals from different states, including Kerala, joining the ISIS have come to the notice of central and state security agencies.

headlines: Demonetisation had no effect on economy: Nirmala Sitharaman
text: Three days before presenting the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the Rajya Sabha that demonetisation has had no effect on the Indian economy and India is still the fastest growing economy in the world. While responding to a question, Sitharaman said that the manufacturing sector has had a certain fall, but that is not attributable to demonetisation.

headlines: Dawood Ibrahim's aide Riyaz Bhati arrested in Mumbai
text: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested underworld don Dawood Ibrahims aide Riyaz Bhati for allegedly forging documents to get Mumbai Cricket Association membership in 2013. Riyaz Bhati, who is a builder, has several offences registered against him, including a firing case at Khandala in 2007 and 2008 and a land grabbing case at Malad in 2009.

headlines: 50 dead after fuel tanker turns over and catches fire in Nigeria
text: At least 50 people were killed in Nigeria after a fuel tanker turned over and caught fire on Monday, a government spokesperson said. The driver of the tanker lost control of the vehicle after trying to avoid a pothole, eyewitnesses said. Some local residents even attempted to take fuel from the tanker, the eyewitnesses added.

headlines: Moody's India unit sends CEO on leave amid credit rating probe
text: Global rating agency Moody's India unit ICRA has sent its CEO and MD Naresh Takkar on leave as it examines an anonymous complaint forwarded to the company by SEBI. Reports said the complaint was about interference by ICRA's top officials in assigning top investment grade ratings to IL&FS before it defaulted. The government has taken control of IL&FS' management.

headlines: Youth shouldn't worry about work-life balance at this time: Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy said India's youth shouldn't be bothered about work-life balance at this time. He reportedly said India has become a respected country in various fields for first time in past 300 years and urged youth to not let go of this opportunity to alleviate poverty. He called upon the youth to work extra hours like Chinese counterparts.

headlines: I pushed Galaxy Fold through before it was ready: Samsung CEO
text: Samsung Electronics CEO DJ Koh, while talking about the company's first foldable phone Galaxy Fold, said, "It was embarrassing...I pushed it through before it was ready." He said Samsung is in the process of recovery and testing 2,000 devices in all aspects. Samsung delayed the phone's launch after some technology reviewers testing the device experienced issues with its foldable screen.

headlines: Delhi man pulls chain on train for mother to finish breakfast, held
text: A man travelling in Delhi-Bhopal Shatabdi Express on Sunday pulled the chain at Mathura Junction so that his mother could finish her breakfast before the two got down at the platform. The man, who's from Delhi, was arrested under the Railways Act and was released on bail later. He's required to a pay penalty after appearing before the railway magistrate.

headlines: Vijay Mallya gets permission to appeal against extradition order
text: Vijay Mallya has been granted permission by a London court to appeal the UK's decision to extradite him to India. There's a "real risk" that political pressures "will undermine the fairness of any trial", Mallya said. He also claimed that Barrack 12 of Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail is "unbearably hot in the summer" and is infested with rats and insects.

headlines: Girl stuck for 12 hours under debris of collapsed Mumbai wall dies
text: A girl who was stuck under debris of the collapsed wall in Mumbai's Malad for over 12 hours has been declared dead. "Her legs were stuck in debris, so it took long to rescue her. We tried our best to bring her up alive," doctors said. "We lost her because it took long to take her out," her family said.

headlines: Big B shares meme on Mumbai rains featuring him and Zeenat Aman
text: Amitabh Bachchan has shared a meme on the Mumbai rains which featured him and veteran actress Zeenat Aman. The meme shows a clip from the song 'Do Lafzon Ki Hai Dil Ki Kahani', picturised in Venice's The Grand Canal, from their film 'The Great Gambler'. Commenting on the tweet, a user wrote, "Abhi toh pura Mumbai jal sa hai sir."

headlines: Regret it: Raveena deletes tweet criticising Zaira on quitting B'wood
text: Actress Raveena Tandon while reacting to reports that Zaira Wasim was forced to quit Bollywood, tweeted, "If this is true, then I do feel sad for the girl." "After seeing this, I now regret my first immediate tweet after reading her statement," she added. Raveena further said she has deleted the initial tweet, in which she called Zaira's views "regressive".

headlines: Really unfair that focus is only on MS Dhoni: Sanjay Manjrekar
text: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said it's really unfair that critics' focus is only on MS Dhoni. "If at this stage of Dhoni's career, there aren't other batsmen around who can help India win matches, then it isn't healthy for Indian cricket," he added. He further said pressure should be put on KL Rahul and others to start delivering.

headlines: Cong worker attempts suicide near Cong office over Rahul's resignation
text: A Congress worker attempted suicide by trying to hang himself from a tree outside the party office in New Delhi on Tuesday. "Rahul Gandhi should take back his resignation, or else I will hang myself," he said. The policemen whisked the man away while some supporters were heard chanting, "Rahul Gandhi zindabad".

headlines: Govt looking into overpricing of bottled water, packaged food: Paswan
text: Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan has said the government is looking into complaints of bottled water and packaged food and drinks being sold at prices above the maximum retail price in public places like railway stations, airports, hotels and multiplexes. "There are provisions in the Legal Metrology Act, 2009 to prevent charging above MRP," Paswan told the Lok Sabha.

headlines: 7-yr-old raped in Jaipur, internet suspended after violent protests
text: A seven-year-old girl was abducted and raped by a motorcycle-borne man in Jaipur's Shastri Nagar on Monday, triggering violent protests by locals, police said. As tension prevailed in the area, mobile internet services were suspended on Tuesday in 13 police station areas and security was stepped up to prevent violence, police added. The child's condition is stated to be stable.

headlines: 10 Delhi policemen transferred in tempo driver assault case
text: Delhi Police on Tuesday informed the Delhi High Court that 10 personnel, who were allegedly involved in the assault on a tempo driver and his minor son in Mukherjee Nagar last month, were transferred. The police added that the personnel should have "exhibited greater patience and professionalism, instead of indulging in the impulsive unprofessional conduct of dragging them".

headlines: Unsung heroes: Mahindra praises paper boys for braving Mumbai rain
text: Mahindra Group's billionaire Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to praise newspaper boys for delivering papers despite torrential rain in Mumbai. "Mumbai Airport runway shut, schools closed, train stations flooded, but...newspapers arrived in my house on time & dry! I've to salute those quiet, unsung heroes who brave torrential rain just so we can experience a 'normal day'," he tweeted.

headlines: Mumbai receives highest rain over a 24-hour period after 2005 floods
text: The rainfall in the 24-hour period before 8.30 am Tuesday was the highest that Mumbai witnessed since the July 2005 floods, prompting the government to declare a public holiday on Tuesday. The death toll due to rain-related accidents in Maharashtra climbed to 27. Officials said 72 others were admitted to hospitals, where the condition of at least four was critical.

headlines: SL police chief held over alleged failure to prevent Easter bombings
text: Sri Lanka's police chief Pujith Jayasundara and ex-Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando have been arrested over their alleged failure to prevent Easter Sunday bombings. Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena had accused the two of failing to act on an intelligence report about the bombings. Sri Lanka's Attorney General had said that the two should be charged with "grave crimes against humanity".

headlines: Bidvest allowed to sell Mumbai airport stake in setback to GVK
text: The Delhi High Court has allowed Bidvest to sell its 13.5% stake in Mumbai International Airport to a third party, in a setback to GVK's bid to increase its ownership. The court said GVK, which had right of first refusal, failed to show any preparedness to purchase the shares. GVK is trying to increase its stake to 74% from 50.5%.

headlines: SA didn't know their best XI, had no plan B: Rhodes on World Cup
text: Talking about South Africa's performance in 2019 World Cup, ex-South Africa cricketer Jonty Rhodes said neither did the team know about their best eleven nor did they have plan B. The 49-year-old added that Proteas batsmen failed to convert "40s and 60s into hundreds". South Africa are already out of the semi-finals race after losing five matches in the tournament.

headlines: Felix 1st man born this century to win at Wimbledon
text: Canadian tennis player Felix Auger-Aliassime became the first man born this century to win at the All England Club after winning his first-round match against Vasek Pospisil 5-7, 6-2, 6-4, 6-3. "[I]t's a bit exaggerated to put me as maybe a fifth- or sixth-favourite to win the title. That's a bit crazy," Felix said about talks of being a favourite.

headlines: Leicester reject Man Utd's £70 million bid for Maguire: Report
text: Former English Premier League champions Leicester City have reportedly rejected Manchester United's £70 million bid for defender Harry Maguire. Reports claim that talks between both Manchester clubs and Leicester have been ongoing for several weeks. Reports further claim that Maguire is not keen on forcing a move away from the former champions.

headlines: US-based billion-dollar meditation app Calm raises $27 million
text: US-based meditation app Calm has raised $27-million funding from Lightspeed Venture Partners alongside TPG and some celebrity angels, Lightspeed announced. This funding adds to Calm's $88-million TPG-led Series B funding round, which was announced in February, that also valued Calm at $1 billion. Founded in 2012, Calm also offers Sleep Stories told by celebrities like Matthew McConaughey.

headlines: SHEIN partially shuts India ops after customs crackdown: Report
text: Chinese e-tailer SHEIN has reportedly partially shut India operations and is refunding money to customers after Mumbai customs seized around 500 of its parcels in June. The crackdown was over Chinese e-tailers shipping products as 'gifts' to avoid paying customs duties. SHEIN's mobile app and website show message stating, "We're upgrading...systems for newer experience...Request you to hold back for sometime."

headlines: Hope for corporate tax reduction: EarlySalary CEO ahead of Budget
text: Ahead of the upcoming Union Budget 2019, EarlySalary CEO Akshay Mehrotra has said, "We hope to see some special incentives offered to startups...overall reduction in corporate tax, which unfortunately didn't happen in the last budget". He believes the interim budget was aimed largely at the middle-classes and the salaried section, by offering tax relief via increasing income tax exemption levels.

headlines: Leopard shot dead after 48-hour long struggle to capture it
text: A leopard hiding in a medical college building in Uttarakhand since over 48 hours was shot dead in self-defence after it attacked officials trying to capture it on Tuesday. Six people suffered minor injuries in the attack by the leopard. Two security guards and a college employee were also injured on Sunday when the leopard entered the college building.

headlines: Rohit 2nd player in history to smash 4 tons in a World Cup edition
text: India opener Rohit Sharma has become the second cricketer to smash four hundreds in a World Cup edition. The 32-year-old, who slammed 122*, 140 and 102 against South Africa, Pakistan and England respectively earlier in 2019 World Cup, reached the three-figure mark against Bangladesh in 90 balls today. Ex-Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara had achieved the feat in 2015 edition.

headlines: Rohit breaks Dhoni's record for hitting most ODI sixes by an Indian
text: With his fourth six against Bangladesh in World Cup today, opener Rohit Sharma took his tally of ODI sixes to 229, setting the record for most sixes hit by an Indian in ODI cricket. The 32-year-old overtook ex-captain MS Dhoni, who has smashed 228 sixes in ODIs. Notably, Dhoni hit seven out of his 228 ODI sixes for Asia XI.

headlines: Will return to India if asked to do so: Mallya tells outside court
text: Vijay Mallya appeared at the London High Court today as he seeks permission to appeal against an extradition order. When asked if he is ready to fly back to India, Mallya told reporters, "If this is what has to happen that will happen. I am prepared for any eventuality." Mallya was accompanied by his son Sidhartha and partner Pinky Lalwani.

headlines: India's playing XI against Bangladesh features 4 wicketkeeper-batsmen
text: As many as four wicketkeeper-batsmen are featuring in India's playing XI in their 2019 World Cup match against Bangladesh. KL Rahul opened for India, while Rishabh Pant, who replaced Shikhar Dhawan in the 15-member squad, came to bat at number four. MS Dhoni will keep the wickets, while Dinesh Karthik replaced Kedar Jadhav for today's match.

headlines: Sunny Deol clarifies on appointing 'representative' after criticism
text: BJP MP from Punjab's Gurdaspur, Sunny Deol, on Tuesday issued a statement after facing criticism for appointing a "representative" to attend meetings and follow important matters on his behalf. Deol said that his personal assistant Gurpreet Singh Palheri was appointed to ensure smooth flow of work whenever he is out of his constituency so that work is not delayed.

headlines: Antarctica lost ice 4 times size of France between 20142017: Study
text: Between 2014 and 2017, Antarctica lost an area of ice more than four times larger than the size of France, a study by NASA scientist Claire Parkinson said. The study also said that between 1979 and 2014, the sea ice cover expanded. "The Antarctic lost almost as much as the Arctic over almost 40 years," Parkinson added.

headlines: Tamil Nadu to follow 69% reservation in medical college admissions
text: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has said the government will follow the existing 69% reservation policy in medical college admissions. Palaniswami added a decision on 10% quota for economically weaker sections (EWS) will be taken after discussions with recognised political parties. Earlier, DMK chief MK Stalin had asked the government to call an all-party meeting to discuss EWS reservation.

headlines: 3 held for Hauz Qazi clash, Harsh Vardhan appeals for harmony
text: Three people including a minor were arrested on Tuesday in connection with a clash that broke out between two groups belonging to different communities over a parking issue in Hauz Qazi area, Delhi. Further, Union Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan visited the area to take stock of the situation and appealed people to maintain harmony.

headlines: US Senate passes bill to give India NATO ally-like status
text: The US' Senate has passed a bill to bring India on par with NATO allies. The amendment to the US' Arms Export Control Act provides for increased US-India defence cooperation in the Indian Ocean. It needs to be passed by both the Senate and the House of Representatives before it can be signed by the US President into law.

headlines: Will bullet train help Mumbai when city drowns? Deora on mangroves
text: Reacting to mangroves being razed for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, Congress' Milind Deora tweeted, "Mangroves protect Mumbai from storms, winds, waves & floods." "Will the train (bullet train) shift Mumbaikars to Ahmedabad when our city drowns?" he questioned. "I urge Maharashtra CM to urgently intervene. Planting trees across Maharashtra won't save Mumbai," he added.

headlines: Undisguised challenge to our rule: China on Hong Kong violence
text: China has called the violent protests in Hong Kong as an "undisguised challenge" to the way it rules over the city. Protesters stormed into Hong Kong's parliament and vandalised the building. Hong Kong, a former British colony, is part of China but run under a "one country, two systems", that guarantees it a level of autonomy.

headlines: World no. 6 Tsitsipas crashes out of Wimbledon in 1st round
text: World number six Stefanos Tsitsipas crashed out of the Wimbledon 2019 after losing to Italian Thomas Fabbiano in the first round. "I was so frustrated knowing already how things are going to be, based on my feelings on the court, how I felt. I was very mad with myself yesterday," said Tsitsipas, who saved two match points at one point.

headlines: US startup that detects guns using AI raises over $2 million
text: US-based startup Aegis AI, which identifies firearms in security camera feeds using AI to enable early warning to law enforcement and building occupants, raised over $2-million funding, TechCrunch stated. Bling Capital led the round. Co-founder Sonny Tai said his mother decided they should immigrate to America after a family friend was fatally shot in his own home 20 years ago.

headlines: Virtual reality massage centre to open in Los Angeles
text: Esqapes Immersive Relaxation, a massage centre that offers virtual reality environments for relaxation to its customers, will open in America's Los Angeles later this week. Users will reportedly sit on automated massage chairs wearing a VR headset and get to choose from 10 environments including a 'Snowbank Cabin' with a crackling fireplace. Each session will last for around 30 minutes.

headlines: Bihar trains to soon have 'Entertainment-on-Demand' facility
text: The Danapur division of East Central Railway will soon introduce 'Entertainment-on-Demand' (EoD) facility in eight trains from Bihar through an in-coach video and audio streaming platform. The passengers can avail EoD through their devices like laptop, smartphones using Wi-Fi in the coaches. The facility would be free of cost for the entire journey.

headlines: RJD protests outside Bihar Assembly for 2nd day over AES deaths
text: The RJD MLAs protested for the second day outside Bihar Assembly building against increasing deaths due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in the state. The MLAs demanded the resignation of Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey as over 150 children died due to AES in the state. They also protested on Monday, the first day of the Bihar Assembly's monsoon session.

headlines: PM's comment on Akash Vijayvargiya is an eyewash: Congress
text: Congress spokesperson Shobha Oza on Tuesday alleged PM Narendra Modi's comment on misbehaviour by BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya is just an 'eyewash' and he should instead take action on the MLA. "Who's stopping PM Modi and BJP President Amit Shah to take action against him?" she asked. "It's a tradition of BJP to reward these type of leaders," Oza added.

headlines: Will reply to those who talk of breaking India in their tone: Shah
text: Discussing the Centre's approach to dealing with militancy in Jammu and Kashmir, Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said, "Our approach is clear, those who talk of breaking India, we will respond to them in the same language." Shah added that the state is an integral part of India and no one can separate it from the country.

headlines: No accurate data on exact number of illegal immigrants: Govt
text: Union Minister Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said the government doesn't have accurate data on the number of illegal immigrants in India. However, Rai asserted that the government is committed to ensure that India's demographic and social structure isn't changed due to illegal immigrants. Immigrants secretly enter India through mountainous and riverine terrain along the international borders, he added.

headlines: 3 killed, 4 injured as van rams into Army vehicle in J&K
text: At least three people were killed and four others were injured on Tuesday after a van rammed into an Army vehicle in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. "The injured have been shifted to hospital and an FIR lodged into the incident," police said. On Monday, as many as 30 people were killed in a road accident in J&K's Kishtwar district.

headlines: 12-yr-old shot dead by coach for leaving academy in Haryana
text: A 12-year-old was shot dead in his house while he was asleep by his wrestling coach in Haryana's Sonipat district. The accused was angry that the victim, identified as Ayush, had withdrawn from his wrestling academy, as per the police complaint. Preliminary investigation has revealed that the victim's brother had some issues with the accused, due to which he withdrew.

headlines: Child falls in gap between train & platform, Aus govt shares video
text: The Australian government has released footage of a child falling into a gap between a station platform and a train, asking parents to be vigilant. The child was rescued apparently uninjured. "The most important message I'd like to share with parents is please don't rush around stations or platforms," an official said.

headlines: Karthik plays his first World Cup match 15 years after ODI debut
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Dinesh Karthik, who replaced Kedar Jadhav in India's playing XI against Bangladesh today, is featuring in his first ever World Cup match 15 years after making his ODI debut. The 34-year-old was selected in India's 2007 World Cup squad but did not play a single match in the edition. Karthik had last played an ODI in January.

headlines: Girl found alive under debris of Mumbai wall collapse, asks for water
text: A 10-year-old girl and a lady have been found alive under the debris of the school wall, which collapsed on hutments in Mumbai's Malad. While the efforts to rescue them are on, the girl was able to communicate with the officials and asked for water. "We all pray & hope for the well-being of both woman & child," BMC tweeted.

headlines: Zoya, Anurag among Indians invited to be Oscars Academy members
text: Filmmakers Zoya Akhtar, Anurag Kashyap and actor Anupam Kher are among the Indians invited to be members of the Oscars Academy. They would join 842 new members from 59 countries including Lady Gaga, Tom Holland and Adele. The Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences said half of the new invitees are women and 29% are people of colour.

headlines: 15-yr-old Coco knocks 39-yr-old Venus Williams out of Wimbledon
text: US' 15-year-old tennis player Cori 'Coco' Gauff knocked 39-year-old five-time champion Venus Williams out of Wimbledon in the first round. Coco defeated Venus with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-4 in an hour and 19 minutes. "My dream was to win. That's what happened...I want to be the greatest," the teenager said after her victory.

headlines: Facebook evacuates 4 buildings after deadly chemical detected in mail
text: Facebook Inc evacuated four buildings on Monday after a package at the firm's Silicon Valley mail facility tested positive for nerve agent sarin, which is a toxic chemical compound that disrupts nervous system. People who came in contact with the package didn't show any symptoms of exposure to sarin. "Authorities have not yet identified the substance found," Facebook spokesperson said.

headlines: Beijings new starfish-shaped airport completed, to open in Sept
text: Beijing's second international airport, shaped like a starfish, has been completed after nearly five years of construction, with operations set to begin on September 30. The new airport will be able to handle 72 million passengers a year by 2025, and 100 million by 2040. The building was designed by Anglo-Iraqi architect Zaha Hadid, who died in 2016.

headlines: Ola Electric turns unicorn with $250 mn funding from SoftBank: Report
text: Ola Electric has raised $250 million from SoftBank in Series B funding round at a valuation of $1 billion, reports said on Tuesday. Ola Electric, which raised $56 million earlier this year, plans to bring 10,000 e-vehicles to the road by the year-end. Its parent group raised $300 million from Hyundai and Kia for electric vehicle solutions earlier this year.

headlines: Flyers stuck at Mumbai airport as 54 flights diverted, 52 cancelled
text: Passengers were stranded at the Mumbai airport on Tuesday as at least 54 flights were diverted from the airport and another 52 flights were cancelled. The main runway of the airport was closed late on Monday night after an aircraft overshot the runway during landing amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai. The airport authorities informed that an alternative runway is functional.

headlines: 2 drown in submerged car in Mumbai after getting trapped inside
text: Two men lost their lives after drowning in a submerged car in Malad, Mumbai. The bodies of the two people have been sent to Shatabdi Hospital in Kandivali. Their car's door had jammed, and the car was stuck near a showroom where the roads were flooded. They could not open the door and were trapped inside.

headlines: 3-year-old girl loses parents, brothers in Kishtwar accident
text: A 3-year-old girl named Adiba has lost both her parents and two brothers in the bus accident in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir on Monday. One of her relatives, Babar Ali said, "She is the only one left in her immediate family now... We will not let her be an orphan, we will raise her like our own."

headlines: ISKCON sends Rathayatra inauguration invite to Nusrat; she accepts
text: Actress-turned-politician Nusrat Jahan has been invited as a special guest at the inauguration ceremony of the Kolkata ISKCON Rathayatra on Thursday. Jahan accepted the invitation and will be attending the event with her husband Nikhil Jain. Thanking her for accepting the invite, ISKCON's spokesperson said the TMC MP represented an "all inclusive India" and was "really showing the road forward".

headlines: Seriously? Iran after US says it violated deal before its existence
text: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif asked "seriously?" after the White House said that Iran violated the terms of the 2015 nuclear deal even before its existence. "The US and its allies will never allow Iran to develop nuclear weapons. Maximum pressure on the Iranian regime will continue until its leaders alter their course of action," the White House added.

headlines: Vaughan makes his prediction for WC 2019 semi-finalists
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan, who earlier said that the team defeating India will go on to win the tournament, has now picked Australia, India, New Zealand and England as his four picks for the semi-finals. Vaughan predicted that Australia will face New Zealand in first semi-finals at Old Trafford while England will face India in second semi-finals at Edgbaston.

headlines: CM may change but govt won't fall: Karnataka Congress MLA
text: Amid alleged tension between JD(S) and Congress, Karnataka Congress MLA S Ramappa on Monday said that the CM of the state may change but the government will not dissolve. His comment comes a day after two Congress MLAs, Anand Singh and Ramesh Jarkiholi, resigned from the Assembly. Ramappa added that he is not "bothered about the resignations of MLAs".

headlines: Sonia Gandhi opposes move to privatise Raebareli coach factory
text: Addressing Lok Sabha, Congress Parliamentary Party chief Sonia Gandhi opposed the move to privatise Raebareli coach factory on Tuesday. She said privatisation will lead to several workers getting unemployed and is against the motive for which the factory was set up. She added, the employees also haven't been taken into confidence and it's sad that their future is in danger.

headlines: Ratan Tata-backed data platform Atlan gets $2.5M led by WaterBridge
text: Singapore-headquartered startup Atlan has raised about $2.5 million in pre-Series A funding round led by WaterBridge Ventures. Atlan counts Ratan Tata and former Google VP India and Southeast Asia Rajan Anandan among investors and advisors. Atlan lets data teams like analysts come together on the same platform to democratise an organisation's data and processes, Co-founder Prukalpa Sankar said.

headlines: Self-proclaimed brother of 1,000 sisters held for raping 11-yr-old
text: A corporator who calls himself 'brother of a thousand sisters' has been booked for raping an 11-year-old girl for over a year in Madhya Pradesh. The accused, Rajendra Singh alias Kendu Baba, surrendered after police launched an investigation on receiving an anonymous letter about the matter.
