Singh had threatened the victim's family against lodging a police complaint, an official said.

headlines: 2 dead, 3 injured after truck rams into sweet shop in Lucknow
text: Two people died and three others were injured after a truck rammed into the wall of a sweet shop in Lucknow on Tuesday. Tanu Upadhyay, the Circle Officer of Cantonment area, said the driver is still stuck inside the vehicle and that efforts are on to rescue him. Meanwhile, the injured have been taken to a nearby hospital.

headlines: Iran playing with fire: Trump after nuclear deal limit breached
text: US President Donald has said that Iran is "playing with fire" after it breached the enriched uranium stockpile limit set under 2015 nuclear deal. Iran has said that the move was not a violation of the accord, adding that it was exercising its right to respond to the US' withdrawal from the deal last year.

headlines: Mumbai airport main runway shut, may take 48hrs to restore operations
text: Mumbai airport authorities have said it could take up to 48 hours to re-open the main runway after it was closed last night after a SpiceJet flight suffered a runway excursion while landing amid heavy rain. "Please expect delays in flight operations. Please check with your airline before reaching the airport," read a tweet by Mumbai airport's Twitter handle.

headlines: Temple in Delhi's Chandni Chowk vandalised by mob
text: A mob vandalised a temple in Delhi's Chandni Chowk after clashes broke out between two groups belonging to different communities reportedly over a parking issue. The people from the community that protested against the vandalism were reportedly pelted with stones by a group from the other community. "We're trying to identify miscreants who tried to harm communal peace," police said.

headlines: Protestors occupy Hong Kong parliament chamber, spray-paint walls
text: Protestors forced their way into the central chamber of Hong Kong's parliament after hours-long siege. The protestors, who broke through parliament's reinforced glass doors, then spray-painted messages on the walls. They also tore portraits of political leaders and smashed furniture. The unrest followed a peaceful protest involving hundreds of thousands over the China extradition law.

headlines: Doesn't matter whose son you're: PM as leader's son beats officer
text: After Akash Vijayvargiya, son of BJP's National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya, thrashed a Municipal Corporation officer in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, PM Narendra Modi said it doesn't matter whose son you are. Akash had thrashed the officer with a bat. The PM also said that if party decorum is not maintained then the BJP should rethink about keeping such people.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas attend Paris Fashion Week
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas attended the Dior show at the Paris Fashion Week. They were among the first row attendees at the event. Priyanka wore a dark, flowy emerald gown and Christian Dior black logo belt, while Jonas wore a black jacket with a grey rose on it, black cargo pants and a grey collared shirt.

headlines: Fuel tank of airborne IAF jet falls in TN farm, causes 3-ft depression
text: A fuel tank of a Tejas aircraft of the Indian Air Force fell down in a farm land near Sulur air base in Tamil Nadu during a flight on Tuesday. This led to a three-foot-deep depression and a minor fire, police said. The aircraft's pilot managed to land the aircraft safely and a probe has been ordered into the incident.

headlines: Will not tolerate separatist movement, terrorism in J&K: Amit Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that separatist movement and terrorism will not be tolerated in Jammu and Kashmir. He added that central agencies such as NIA and tax department are working to choke separatist financing in the state. "Terrorists...have no place in the government's scheme of things. They will face severe action and difficulties," Shah said.

headlines: 20 people killed as school, college walls collapse in Mumbai, Pune
text: At least 13 persons were killed in Mumbai after the compound wall of a school in Malad crashed on some adjoining hutments early on Tuesday. Meanwhile, in another incident in Pune, the compound wall of Sinhgad College crashed on some hutments next to it, killing around seven people. Rescue operations are underway on both the sites.

headlines: Navy deploys boats to rescue people stranded due to rain in Mumbai
text: Indian Navy has deployed various teams to provide assistance to rain-hit and stranded people in Mumbai's Kurla area following a request by BMC. The teams could be seen using boats to effectively carry out the rescue operations. Around 1,000 people have been shifted to safety with the help of Naval teams, NDRF, fire brigade and local volunteers.

headlines: Mumbai airport's main runway shut, 54 flights diverted amid rain
text: The main runway of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport was closed on Monday night after a SpiceJet flight overshot the runway while landing amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai. Fifty-four flights have been diverted, although the secondary runway is operational. Several flights have been cancelled, and passengers have been advised to check for delays and diversions before leaving for the airport.

headlines: Public holiday in Mumbai, Thane as death toll due to rain reaches 16
text: At least 16 people were killed in two separate wall crash incidents in Malad, Mumbai and Kalyan, Thane. In the wake of the heavy rain, the Maharashtra government has declared a public holiday in Mumbai on July 2. Schools and colleges in Mumbai, Thane and Navi Mumbai will remain shut today. Only emergency services will remain functional in Mumbai.

headlines: SpiceJet plane overshoots runway while landing in Mumbai amid rain
text: A SpiceJet plane from Jaipur overshot the runway while landing at Mumbai airport amid heavy rains on Monday night. All the passengers are safe and no injury was reported, a Mumbai airport official said. Further, following the incident, the main runway was closed although a secondary runway is operational.

headlines: Donald Trump calls Afghanistan the 'Harvard of terrorists'
text: US President Donald Trump has called Afghanistan "Harvard of terrorists". Trump said he wants to pull troops out of Afghanistan but is concerned that without American military presence, the country could be used as base for terrorist attacks on the US. Trump added the US would leave a "very strong intelligence" presence in Afghanistan if it decides to withdraw troops.

headlines: Iran rejects US accusation it long violated nuclear deal
text: Iran on Tuesday rejected a White House accusation that it was long violating the terms of its nuclear deal with world powers. White House Press Secretary Stephanie Grisham had said, "There is little doubt that even before the deal's existence, Iran was violating its terms." Iran on Monday said it had amassed more low-enriched uranium than permitted under the accord.

headlines: World's 4th richest man Warren Buffett donates $3.6 bn company shares
text: World's fourth richest person Warren Buffett is donating $3.6 billion worth of his company Berkshire Hathaway's stock to five charities. These charities include the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, a charity run by his friend and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and his wife. This brings the total amount of stock he's given the foundations to about $34 billion since 2006.

headlines: Have right to ask Mamata to stop political killings in WB: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that it's his right to send advisories to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to stop "political killings" in the state. He added, "Political killing is not good for a healthy democracy." Shah's comment came after TMC's Derek O'Brien criticised the Centre for issuing advisories to Bengal and remaining silent on children's death in Bihar.

headlines: PM Modi thanks lawmakers for passage of J&K bills
text: PM Narendra Modi thanked lawmakers in both the Houses of Parliament for passing two bills on Jammu and Kashmir. Both the bills, the extension of President's Rule for another six months in the state and J&K Reservation (Amendment) Bill, (tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah) were eventually passed by both the Houses. "Such bipartisan support is gladdening," PM Modi tweeted.

headlines: Nadda reviews preparations for BJP's nationwide membership drive
text: BJP working President JP Nadda on Monday held a meeting to review the preparations for the party's five-week nationwide membership drive scheduled to kickstart on July 6. At present, BJP has about 11 crore members and is planning to increase the number by at least 20%. Moreover, members will be enrolled through missed calls along with paper verification this time.

headlines: Polavaram project will cause us permanent injury: Odisha CM to PM
text: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik has asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to give directions to stop the Polavaram project on the Godavari river in Andhra Pradesh. Patnaik wrote, "If the project is allowed to be completed before the resolution of all the pending cases, it will cause permanent injury to the interest of the state of Odisha and its people."

headlines: Bihar may be heading for a terrible drought: CM Nitish Kumar
text: Addressing the state Assembly, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that he doesn't believe scientists' sayings and that his experience tells that Bihar is heading for a 'terrible drought'. He said the entire world is hit by water crises and Bihar won't remain immune to it. He further urged all MLAs and MLCs to discuss means to combat the impending crisis.

headlines: Several injured after bus falls in gorge in Andhra Pradesh
text: Several people sustained injuries after a private bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram, police said. The driver lost control of the bus which was coming from Varanasi and fell into the gorge, the police added. Around 25 people were travelling on the bus and the injured have been shifted to a hospital.

headlines: BMC not responsible for deaths due to Mumbai wall collapse: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) isn't responsible for the deaths of around 18 people after a compound wall collapsed due to heavy rains in Mumbai's Malad. He added, "It's an accident. It's because of heavy rainfall." He said that there are several illegal constructions in Mumbai and "BMC has nothing to do with it".

headlines: Singer Rihanna cheers for West Indies against Sri Lanka in World Cup
text: Singer Rihanna was seen cheering for West Indies in their 2019 World Cup match against Sri Lanka at Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street. "Look who came to rally with the #MenInMaroon today!"' wrote West Indies' official Twitter account, sharing her pictures. Notably, Rihanna and West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite, who scored 8 runs in the match, were classmates in school.

headlines: Hindu actresses should quit acting like Zaira: Swami Chakrapani
text: A day after 'Dangal' actress Zaira Wasim announced her "disassociation" from the field of acting, Hindu Mahasabha President Swami Chakrapani asked Hindu actresses to follow her example. "Film actress Zaira's decision to distance herself from films for religious beliefs is praiseworthy. Hindu actresses should also take inspiration from Zaira," Swami Chakrapani said in a tweet.

headlines: Would batting be as listless if India's place was at stake: Omar
text: Following India's 31-run defeat to England in the 2019 World Cup, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah questioned India's batting. "Would the batting be as listless if our place in the semifinals was at stake here rather than England's & Pakistan's?" he tweeted. India only hit one six during their unsuccessful chase of 338 runs.

headlines: Dhoni's approach in last few overs vs England was baffling: Manjrekar
text: Criticising former India captain MS Dhoni for his performance against England in 2019 World Cup, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Dhoni's approach in the last few overs however was baffling." "If there was any team that had the ability to stop India's winning run. It was England," he added. India scored 39 runs in their last five overs against England.

headlines: Jadeja could play against Bangladesh: Sanjay Bangar
text: Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja could feature in the playing XI against Bangladesh. "All players are up and figure in the team combinations we're thinking of," he added. Bangar further said that Jadeja could be a handy option for number eight batting position. India face Bangladesh on Tuesday.

headlines: Surprised there are questions on Dhoni's batting everyday: Bangar
text: Talking about criticism of MS Dhoni's batting in the 2019 World Cup, India batting coach Sanjay Bangar said the ex-India captain has done the role always except for one odd innings. "I'm surprised this question continues to come up everyday. He's doing the job for the team and overall we're very happy with the intent he's batting with," Bangar added.

headlines: Sri Lanka hand West Indies their 6th defeat in 2019 World Cup
text: Sri Lanka defeated West Indies by 23 runs at Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street on Monday to register their third victory in the 2019 World Cup and move to sixth place on points table. Meanwhile, it was West Indies' sixth defeat in the tournament. Notably, both the teams are out of contention for a place in the semi-finals.

headlines: French Open 2019 finalist Vondrouová out of Wimbledon in 1st round
text: French Open 2019 women's singles finalist Markéta Vondrouová crashed out of the Wimbledon in the first round on Monday after losing to Madison Brengle. The 20-year-old Vondrouová lost the match to Brengle with a scoreline of 4-6, 4-6. Meanwhile, men's singles defending champion Novak Djokovic advanced to the second round after defeating Philipp Kohlschreiber 6-3, 7-5, 6-3.

headlines: 4-time Pikes Peak winner Carlin Dunne killed in race crash at 36
text: Professional motorcycle racer, Carlin Dunne, also known as 'The King of the Mountain' died aged 36 after crashing his bike during Pikes Peak Hill Climb race. Dunne reportedly hit one of the bumps at high speed that caused his front wheel to spin out near the summit. He had won the Pikes Peak race in 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2018.

headlines: If Article 370 is temporary, so is J&K's accession: Farooq Abdullah
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that if Article 370 is temporary, then the state's accession to India is also temporary. Abdullah added, "When Maharaja Hari Singh acceded, it was temporary. It was said at that point of time that a plebiscite will happen and people will decide whether to go with India or Pakistan."

headlines: Sahitya Akademi awardee, freedom fighter's relative excluded from NRC
text: Sahitya Akademi awardee Durga Khatiwada and the family members of Baijyanti Devi, the first woman martyr of Assam Agitation, were excluded from the complete draft of the National Register of Citizens (NRC), said a Gorkha organisation. Manju Devi, the great-granddaughter of freedom fighter Chabilal Upadhyay was also left out of the NRC upgrade process, added Bharatiya Gorkha Parisangh.

headlines: Doctor films female client during body hair removal treatment, booked
text: Mumbai Police has booked a Lokhandwala-based doctor for filming a 27-year-old woman while she was undergoing a body hair removal procedure. The woman noticed a camera installed inside the smoke detector when she was taking off her clothes in presence of three women assistants, police said. The doctor reportedly told her that all footage is deleted automatically after 15 days.

headlines: A private car on a public road is a public place: Supreme Court
text: The Supreme Court on Monday clarified that a private car travelling on a public road can be deemed as a 'public place'. The judgment was announced in an appeal against a Patna High Court decision. The appellants were charge-sheeted under Section 53(a) of Bihar Excise (Amendment) Act, 2016 on the ground that they were found drunk inside a private vehicle.

headlines: Bairstow likes fire in his belly: Morgan on his ton vs India
text: After England opener Jonny Bairstow scored a match-winning 109-ball 111-run knock against India in 2019 World Cup, England captain Eoin Morgan said, "He likes some fire in his belly." Praising Bairstow's batting and fielding in the match, the 32-year-old skipper added that "getting fired up" suits Bairstow. Prior to the match, Bairstow had registered two ducks in the tournament.

headlines: Jony Ive dispirited by Apple CEO's lack of interest in design: Report
text: Jony Ive, who recently left his role as Apple's Chief Design Officer, was reportedly "dispirited" by Apple CEO Tim Cook's lack of interest in design. Ive was reportedly coming into Apple's offices less frequently than before after Apple Watch's release. He reportedly disagreed with some "Apple leaders" on how to position the Watch, which he viewed as a fashion accessory.

headlines: Gates Foundation, Tata Trusts set up India Agritech Incubation Network
text: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and Tata Trusts have partnered to set up India Agritech Incubation Network (IAIN) and launch 'Social Alpha Quest for Agritech Innovations'. Envisioned as an incubators' network to promote smallholder farmers innovations, the IAIN's first hub will be at IIT-Kanpur's Innovation and Incubation centre. Up to 12 Quest winners will get incubation support for 12-24 months.

headlines: NASA's TESS mission finds its smallest exoplanet to date
text: NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) has discovered a planet 'L 98-59b', around 80% Earth's size, the tiniest exoplanet discovered by TESS to date. TESS also discovered two other planets in the same system that are 1.4 and 1.6 times the Earth's size. NASA's Kepler satellite has found smaller planets including Kepler-37b, which is only 20% larger than the Moon.

headlines: 1,248 ceasefire violations by Pakistan in 6 months: Govt
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday said in the Rajya Sabha that Pakistan violated ceasefire 1,248 times along the LoC in the last six months and four Indian jawans lost their lives in the violations. Singh added that 203 violations took place in January, 215 in February, 267 in March, 234 in April, 221 in May and 108 in June.

headlines: Delhi man stabbed for objecting to man abusing his brother
text: A 27-year-old man was stabbed after he raised an objection to a man abusing his brother in Delhi, said police. The victim, identified as Shambhu, had gone to his elder brother's house to attend his nephew's birthday party. The accused, Sujeet, was arrested on Sunday while he was trying to flee to Bihar and the weapon used was also recovered.

headlines: BJP leader defends son who beat municipal officer with bat
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Monday defended his son MLA Akash Vijayvargiya saying both the official and Akash are novice players. Kailash further said that it was not a big issue, but was blown out of proportion and that there was mishandling from both sides. Akash, who was recorded thrashing an official with a bat, was granted bail on Saturday.

headlines: Heavy to very heavy rains expected in Mumbai in the next 3 days: IMD
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday said that heavy to very heavy rains are expected in Mumbai in the next three days. Following the forecast, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Barve tweeted, "I request Mumbaikars to check weather updates and plan the day accordingly." "Take care, stay safe and reach out to us at Mumbai Police for help," he added.

headlines: Utsav slut-shamed me to a guy who said he liked me: Aditi Mittal
text: Comedian Aditi Mittal has alleged that former AIB employee Utsav Chakraborty, who was accused of sexual harassment, had slut-shamed her to a guy who said he liked her. "He [said] 'Be careful of Aditi, she's been around'," she added. Aditi revealed this while criticising AIB co-founder Tanmay Bhat after he revealed he was diagnosed with depression after the #MeToo row.

headlines: Cut her some slack, she's a teenager: Tanushree as Zaira quits B'wood
text: Actress Tanushree Dutta, while speaking about actress Zaira Wasim being criticised for quitting Bollywood citing religion, said, "Cut her some slack...she is only a teenager." "Let her do what her heart calls her towards at this moment and who knows maybe someday if she finds something worth her time she may even do something in Bollywood again," Tanushree added.

headlines: Maybe she was forced to take the decision: Kher as Zaira quits B'wood
text: Speaking about Zaira Wasim quitting Bollywood citing religion, Anupam Kher said, "Maybe she's forced to take that decision." "If she has taken this decision in the name of religion then maybe it's not her decision," he added. "But it's her life, if she wants to take that decision, I respect [it]. I think we should leave her alone," said Kher.

headlines: Aamir gave us amazing actor Zaira, sad she crushed her dreams: Kher
text: Speaking about Zaira Wasim quitting Bollywood citing religion, actor Anupam Kher, said, "I was saddened because a young girl crushed her dreams." "Aamir Khan gave us such an amazing actor. I looked at it from an actor's point of view," he added. "I run an acting school, so many people come with a dream of becoming something," said Kher.

headlines: Only 1 Big B this week and that's Budget, says Mahindra; actor replies
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Monday tweeted, "With due apologies to Amitabh Bachchan, there's only one 'Big B' this week...the Big Budget." The actor responded to Mahindra by tweeting, "HAHAHA...'BIG B' is a media created epithet, one that I've never subscribed to." "The 'BIG B' this week that you mention, will create media...that many shall subscribe to," Bachchan added.

headlines: David Warner, Candice welcome their third daughter; share picture
text: Australia opener David Warner and his wife Candice became parents for the third time after the birth of their third daughter on Sunday. David shared a picture on social media, writing, "We welcomed our newest family member Isla Rose Warner at 10:30pm late last night...Mum and Bub doing very well and her big sisters are over the moon."

headlines: Agarwal, who replaces Shankar in WC squad, has never played an ODI
text: Batsman Mayank Agarwal has been named injured all-rounder Vijay Shankar's replacement in India's 2019 World Cup squad. The 28-year-old, who has never played an ODI, has featured in 75 List A matches, scoring 3,605 runs at an average of 48.71. Shankar was ruled out after sustaining an injury on his toe from a Jasprit Bumrah yorker in the nets.

headlines: SL's Avishka 3rd youngest to slam a ton in WC, breaks Kohli's record
text: Sri Lanka batsman Avishka Fernando on Monday became the third youngest batsman to smash a hundred in World Cup history, achieving the feat aged 21 years and 87 days. Avishka slammed 104(103) including two sixes and nine fours against West Indies. Virat Kohli was the previous third youngest batsman to smash a World Cup hundred (22 years and 106 days).

headlines: I leave office at 6 pm for family when in India: Amazon India Head
text: Amazon's India Head Amit Agarwal in an interview said he leaves the office at 6 pm to spend quality time with his family and kids. "When I'm with my family, I'm present there...When I'm at work, I'm really intense about doing that," he added. Agarwal usually spends 15 days in the US and 15 days in India in a month.

headlines: SC judge Indu Malhotra recuses from Maharashtra beef ban case
text: Supreme Court judge, Justice Indu Malhotra, has recused herself from hearing a case challenging a Bombay High Court order which decriminalised beef possession if animals were slaughtered outside Maharashtra. Malhotra said she had earlier represented a party in the case as a lawyer. The case will be put up before CJI Ranjan Gogoi to be referred to an appropriate bench.

headlines: GST slabs of 12% & 18% can be merged with revenue increase: Jaitley
text: Former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said that the 12% and 18% GST slabs can be merged into one rate with further increase in revenue. He added except for luxury and sin goods, 28% slab has almost been phased out, and zero and 5% slabs will always remain. He said that GST will be a two-rate tax after slabs merger.

headlines: Businessman tells Mumbai airport security he's suicide bomber, held
text: A 35-year-old businessman has been arrested after he told a CISF official at Mumbai airport security checkpoint that he is a "suicide bomber". Atul Patel, who was on his way to attend a meeting in Dubai, didn't give any reason for what he did, as per officials. He was handed over to police after no explosive was found with him.

headlines: ONGC discovered 230 million tonnes of oil reserves in 3 years
text: State-owned Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) has discovered over 230 million tonnes of in-place oil reserves in the last three years, Petroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Monday. ONGC as on April 1, 2019, has in-place oil reserves of 459.84 million tonnes, he added. The money spent on crude oil imports was highest since 2013-14, he further said.

headlines: Atletico's Diego Godin signs for Italy's Inter Milan
text: Atletico Madrid's Uruguayan defender Diego Godin has signed a three-year deal with Italian club Inter Milan on Monday. Meanwhile, Luca Pellegrini became reigning Serie A champions Juventus' first summer signing after moving from Roma on a $25 million (approx) four-year deal. Leonardo Spinazzola was sent to Roma as part of the Pellegrini deal.

headlines: Wish team tells Dhoni to play run-a-ball from start: Manjrekar
text: Indian commentator and former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said that he wishes that the Indian team management tells MS Dhoni to play 'run-a-ball' from the start of his innings. "I love Dhoni best when he has gone in to bat like the warm-up matches. I like when he scores 30 runs from 30 balls," Manjrekar wrote.

headlines: For India to do well one spinner must perform: Panesar
text: Former England spinner Monty Panesar has said that for the Indian team to do well one of the two spinners must perform. "[T]hey are going to have a bad day at some point in time. It shows when both don't bowl well in tandem then India can't go the distance," said Panesar about India's spin duo.

headlines: Bhuvneshwar was fit to play against England as well: Bangar
text: India's batting coach Sanjay Bangar revealed that pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar was fit to play in the match against England in the World Cup 2019. Bhuvneshwar, who suffered a hamstring injury in the team's match against Pakistan on June 16, was ruled out from the team's next two-three games. Bhuvneshwar has taken five wickets in the tournament so far.

headlines: Air India flight tail-tips while landing at Kerala airport
text: An Air India flight from Dammam, Saudi Arabia with 180 passengers onboard suffered a tail-tip while landing at Kerala's Kozhikode airport on Monday. Tail-tip is when the plane's rear part touches the surface during landing due to a weight imbalance towards the back of the plane. The plane suffered no major damage and all passengers have been declared safe.

headlines: Petrol pumps in India may get electric vehicle charging points
text: The government is reportedly looking to implement a battery manufacturing and charging framework including using petrol pumps for electric vehicle charging points. Currently, there are reportedly about 60,000 state-run petrol pumps in India with plans to add about the same number. This reportedly comes amid auto lobby resistance to proposal to convert two-wheelers under 150 cc to electric by 2025.

headlines: Rajasthan police rescue abducted newlywed woman; 1 arrested
text: Rajasthan Police on Sunday arrested a man for allegedly abducting a woman four days after her wedding. The two were in a state roadways bus on the Bhilwara-Jaipur highway when police found them. As per the complaint by the victim's family, the accused abducted her on Tuesday when she was returning from court after submitting documents for her marriage certificate.

headlines: Rajasthan man stripped, thrashed over suspicion of eloping
text: A man was allegedly stripped naked, tied to a tree and thrashed by locals over a suspicion that he might elope with a woman in Rajasthan's Hariyajun village. The victim claimed that it was not him, but a friend who was planning to elope with the woman. He said that the villagers tortured him and circulated his video on WhatsApp.

headlines: Iran breaches nuclear stockpile limit set under 2015 deal
text: Iran has breached the limit of its enriched uranium stockpile set in a 2015 deal with major powers, Foreign Minister Javad Zarif has said, according to the ISNA news agency. However, Iran said its steps to decrease its commitments to the deal were "reversible". The IAEA said its inspectors were verifying whether Iran had accumulated more enriched uranium than allowed.

headlines: Discovering spirituality beautiful, but dont demean others: Raveena
text: Speaking about Zaira Wasim quitting Bollywood citing religion, Raveena Tandon tweeted, "Discovering spirituality is beautiful, but don't demean others." "When girls in industry are wronged, I'm the first to protest," she added. "I respect her decision to quit, announce to her fans...Would've been more graceful if she had not condemned all as the reason for doing so," Raveena's tweet read.

headlines: Zaira's Twitter wasn't hacked, she wrote post herself: Manager
text: After reports surfaced that said he had claimed actress Zaira Wasim's Twitter account was hacked, her manager Tuhin Mishra said, "We have never said that her account was hacked." "We just said we'd definitely like to know what has happened. And the post was done by her," Mishra added. Zaira had written that she is quitting Bollywood citing religion.

headlines: Few champions badly failed sportsmanship test: Waqar on India's loss
text: Following India's 31-run defeat against England in the 2019 World Cup, ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis questioned India's sportsmanship. Pakistan needed an India win to better their chances to advance to the semi-finals. "Me not bothered if Pakistan gets to the semis or not but one thing is for sure...Sportsmanship of few Champions got tested and they failed badly," he tweeted.

headlines: Patanjali's messaging app 'Kimbho' is on hold: Patanjali IT Head
text: Baba Ramdev's messaging app 'Kimbho', that challenged Facebook-owned WhatsApp, is still "on hold", according to Abhitab Saxena, Patanjali's Senior Vice President and Head of Information Technology. Launched last year, the app disappeared from Google Play Store and App Store over security concerns. A trial version reappeared in August with Patanjali promising a final version in a couple of days.

headlines: Emirates launches shortest Airbus A380 flight between Dubai & Muscat
text: Emirates on Monday launched the shortest Airbus A380 flight between Dubai and Muscat, that lasts for 40 minutes. "The average flight time is only five minutes more than the time taken to clean an Airbus A380 by 42 people," Emirates said. The new flight broke Emirates' own record of previously operating the shortest A380 flight between Dubai and Doha.

headlines: Shah moves resolution in Rajya Sabha to extend Presidents rule in J&K
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday moved a resolution in Rajya Sabha to extend President's rule in Jammu and Kashmir by six months, which is ending tomorrow. The Samajwadi Party announced its support for the resolution, while the Congress opposed it. "Do not make excuses like Ramzan and Amarnath Yatra to not hold Assembly polls," said Congress MP Viplove Thakur.

headlines: 4 of family found dead in Gurugram in suspected murder-suicide
text: Four members of a family were found dead inside their house in Sector 49 of Gurugram on Monday, police said. Police said they suspect that Prakash Singh killed his wife, daughter and son before hanging himself. A note was also recovered from Singh's pocket which stated that he was ending everybody's life and no one was responsible for it.

headlines: Knives, lighters, chillums & mobiles found during raid in UP jail
text: At least 47 knives, 21 scissors, 11 pointed rods, 8 cutters, and 20 blades were found among other things during a surprise check at Naini Central Jail in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Sunday. District Magistrate Bhanu Chandra Goswami accompanied by senior police officials also recovered mobiles, Saudi currency (1 Riyal), chillums, lighters and pan masala during the raid.

headlines: Only people in 'decent clothes' to be allowed in Imambaras: DM
text: District Magistrate (DM) of Lucknow Kaushal Raj Sharma has issued dress code and other guidelines for tourists visiting the Bara Imambara and Chhota Imambara in the city. "Only people with decent clothes will be allowed inside the premises of the monuments. Carrying camera, tripod, video cameras inside Bara and Chhota Imambara is prohibited," the guidelines issued by DM Sharma read.

headlines: Protestors storm Hong Kong legislature over China extradition law
text: Hong Kong protestors stormed the Legislative Council on the anniversary of the city's 1997 return to Chinese rule on Monday amid anger over laws that would allow extraditions to China. Protestors smashed the Legislative Council's windows with metal objects. Leader Carrie Lam had suspended the extradition bill on June 15, however, protestors are now demanding that Lam should step down.

headlines: Hailstorm buries cars, covers streets with 5-ft-thick ice in Mexico
text: A hailstorm that struck Guadalajara, one of Mexico's most populous cities, buried vehicles and covered the streets with up to 5-foot-thick ice. "I've never seen such scenes in Guadalajara. Then we ask ourselves if climate change is real. These are never-before-seen natural phenomenons," said an official. Nearly 200 homes and businesses reported hail damage.

headlines: Single GST rate not possible in country with poor people: Jaitley
text: As GST completed two years of implementation on Monday, former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in a blog wrote, "Those who argued for a single slab GST must realise that a single slab is possible only in extremely affluent countries without poor people." "As revenue increases, it'll allow policymakers to possibly merge 12% and 18% slab into one," he added.

headlines: Hawai chappal & Mercedes can't be taxed at same rate: Jaitley on GST
text: As GST implementation completed two years on Monday, former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in a blog wrote, "Hawai chappal and Mercedes car cannot be taxed at the same rate." "This isn't to suggest that the rationalisation of slabs is not needed," he said. "Except on luxury and sin goods, the 28% slab has almost been phased out," he added.

headlines: B'desh will play according to conditions vs India: Walsh
text: Speaking ahead of Bangladesh's match against India in World Cup 2019, Bangladesh fast bowling coach Courtney Walsh said, "We have to assess what's going to happen here in Birmingham." "I think it's on the day what the surface has to hold and how well we react on the day," Walsh added about the team's plans for the match against India.

headlines: Messi, Aguero will have to sweat against Brazil: Gabriel Jesus
text: Speaking ahead of his side's Copa America semi-final clash against Argentina, Brazilian forward Gabriel Jesus said, "[T]hey have [Lionel] Messi... and they have [Sergio] Agüero... but they're going to have to sweat to get in behind." "We're playing at home and we have more pressure to win, but it's a 'Clasico' against Argentina," Jesus added about the match.

headlines: Spain beat Germany 2-1 to claim Euro Under-21 title
text: Spain claimed the Under-21 European Championship title after beating Germany 2-1 in Italy on Sunday. The Spaniards have now equalled hosts Italy's record of five Under-21 European Championship titles. The Spaniards had suffered a 1-0 defeat by the Germans in the 2017 edition's final. For Spain, Fabian Ruiz and Dani Olmo were on target.

headlines: Inclusion of 17 OBCs in SC list 'unconstitutional': Mayawati
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Mayawati termed the state government's decision to include 17 Other Backward Castes (OBCs) in the Scheduled Caste (SC) list as "unconstitutional and politically motivated". She said that under Article 341, no government can include or remove any caste from the SC list. She added, "It's clear that Yogi government issued this order to deceive these castes."

headlines: Insincere govt employees will be forced to retire: Tripura CM
text: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said that the state government employees found to be "insincere, incompetent and remiss" would be forced to go on retirement. He added, "However, these employees would be provided with their due financial benefit." Deb said that after every three months the "performances of the employees would be reviewed" and accordingly action would be taken.

headlines: Only Rahul can lead Congress in current scenario: Gehlot
text: Ahead of the meeting of Chief Ministers of Congress-ruled states with party President Rahul Gandhi, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that only Rahul can lead the party in the current scenario. Rahul's "commitment" towards the country's well being is "uncompromised", Gehlot added. The meeting comes in the backdrop of continuing suspense over Rahul's future role in the party.

headlines: Govt screwed us: Crypto startup CoinRecoil Co-founder in letter to PM
text: Shut cryptocurrency exchange CoinRecoil Co-founder Kunal Barchha wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stating, "[G]overnment screwed us. Pardon me." He wrote he has three personal loans to pay as CoinRecoil spent a year fighting the government. CoinRecoil had filed a petition against 2018 RBI notice barring banks from serving cryptocurrency exchanges and firms.

headlines: Factory owner, aides held for assaulting man over commission
text: A garment factory owner and three of his aides were arrested for assaulting a worker over the suspicion of stitching dresses for a commission in Mumbai on Sunday. The victim said that the owner and his relatives tortured him by trying to burn his hair, forcing him to smoke cigarettes, tearing his clothes and thrashing him in the factory's unit.

headlines: Delhi hospital docs go on strike after attack by patient's family
text: Resident doctors of Delhi's Hindu Rao Hospital went on a strike on Monday two days after an attack by a patient's relatives left two doctors injured. The patient had kidney failure and died during treatment, however, her relatives claimed medical negligence. This comes weeks after doctors in West Bengal held state-wide protests against an attack by a patient's relatives.

headlines: Vijay Shankar ruled out of 2019 World Cup due to toe injury
text: Team India all-rounder Vijay Shankar has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup due to a toe injury. The 28-year-old scored 58 runs and took two wickets in three 2019 World Cup matches. He was replaced by Rishabh Pant in the playing XI against England. Batsman Mayank Agarwal is likely to replace him in the squad, as per PTI.

headlines: Not charging any extra fee for transactions, clarifies Paytm
text: Denying reports of Paytm beginning to charge customers a transaction fee from today, the digital wallet said, "Paytm neither charges nor will charge any convenience or transaction fee." It said a few merchants do not absorb the credit card charges. "In such cases, we recommend users to pay through their debit cards and UPI to avoid these charges," Paytm added.

headlines: We've had that conversation: Malaika on telling son about relationship
text: Malaika Arora, on being asked how her 16-year-old son has reacted to her relationship with Arjun Kapoor, said, "We've had that conversation and I'm so glad that everyone is in a much happier space." "It's important to tell your near and dear ones what's happening in your life and...give them time and space to understand and process things," she added.

headlines: It came as a shock to me: 'Dangal' director as Zaira quits Bollywood
text: 'Dangal' director Nitesh Tiwari has said the actress' decision to quit Bollywood citing religion came as a shock to him. "But at the end of the day, it is her life and she has the right to lead it the way she [deems fit]," he added. Tiwari further called it a "loss" as Zaira is an "extremely talented actress".

headlines: What a moronic decision: Author Taslima on Zaira quitting Bollywood
text: Author Taslima Nasreen has criticised actress Zaira Wasim for quitting Bollywood citing religion. Taslima wrote, "Bollywood's talented actress Zaira Wasim now wants to quit acting because she thinks her acting career almost destroyed her faith in Allah. What a moronic decision!" "So many talents in Muslim community are forced to go under the darkness of the burqa," she added.

headlines: Orange-blue jersey ended India's win streak in WC: Mehbooba Mufti
text: Ex-J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti blamed the orange-blue jersey for India's first defeat in the 2019 World Cup. Following India's 31-run defeat to hosts England, Mufti tweeted, "Call me superstitious but I'd say it's the jersey that ended India's winning streak in the #ICCWorldCup2019." India sported the away jersey against England following ICC's home and away rule for the tournament.

headlines: History doesn't repeat, it rhymes: Mahindra to Pak after Ind Vs Eng
text: Minutes after India lost to hosts England in the 38th ODI of the 2019 World Cup, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Until now, it seemed as if Pakistan was eerily replicating its '92 league journey towards snatching the Cup." He added, "But I guess, as Mark Twain is supposed to have said: 'History doesn't repeat itself but it rhymes'."

headlines: SC notice to WB for late release of BJP worker who posted CM's meme
text: Supreme Court has issued a notice to the West Bengal government on a contempt plea over the delay in releasing the BJP worker who was arrested for posting a meme on WB CM Mamata Banerjee. Priyanka Sharma was released nearly 24 hours after SC's order. In the post, Mamata's face was superimposed over Priyanka Chopra's picture from Met Gala.

headlines: Family robbed at gunpoint at Delhi house; video surfaces online
text: A video showing a family being robbed at gunpoint at their house by three masked men has surfaced online. The incident happened at 3 am on Monday in Delhi's Model Town. In the video, the masked men can be seen entering the house as the family parked the car. The men fled the scene after the incident.

headlines: US should show some respect if it wants to negotiate: Iran
text: Iran Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif on Monday said if the US wants talks with Iran it should show some respect, adding that Iran will never succumb to US pressure. US President Trump has called for talks with Iran with "no preconditions". However, Iran ruled this out, saying Trump should return to the nuclear deal if he wants to negotiate.

headlines: Canada cartoonist loses job after illustration of Trump goes viral
text: A Canadian cartoonist lost his job after his depiction of US President Donald Trump and the border crisis went viral. The cartoon by Michael de Adder featured Trump standing by a golf cart, asking "Do you mind if I play through?" while looking at bodies of a father-daughter duo who drowned as they tried to cross the Mexico-US border.

headlines: NS Vishwanathan reappointed as Deputy Governor of RBI for 1 year
text: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the reappointment of NS Vishwanathan as Deputy Governor of RBI for a period of one year from July 4, 2019. NS Vishwanathan's term as Deputy Governor was supposed to end on July 3, 2019. Earlier, RBI Deputy Governor Viral Acharya resigned citing personal circumstances.

headlines: No bank has power to employ bouncers to recover loans: Government
text: No bank has the power to employ bouncers for forceful recovery of loans from customers, Union Minister of State for Finance Anurag Thakur said on Monday. He added that there's a clear directive of the RBI to appoint recovery agents only after police verification and certain formalities are fulfilled. Lenders can't persistently bother borrowers at odd hours, he added.

headlines: Aus still searching for perfect performance: Mitchell Starc
text: Australian pacer Mitchell Starc assessed his team's performance at the World Cup 2019 so far by saying, "We're showing glimpses of what we are capable of..but we have still got room to improve." Australia have already reached the semi-final stage of the tournament. Starc is the current World Cup edition's highest wicket-taker so far.

headlines: I'm personally happy to see Murray back: Rafael Nadal
text: Speaking about Andy Murray's return to competitive tennis, Rafael Nadal said, "I am happy for him personally that he's able to keep playing... Everybody should be happy to see him back." Nadal called Murray one of the most important tennis players in the last 10 years. "Hopefully he will have the chance to keep playing in singles," Nadal added.

headlines: Indian startups raised record $3.9 bn in first half of 2019: Report
text: Indian startups have raised about $3.9 billion from venture capitalists in the last six months across about 292 deals, reports citing Venture Intelligence data said. This reportedly marks a 44.4% jump from the about $2.7 billion received by startups in the first half of 2018. The funding reportedly came in as seed, or very early investments, to Series F deals.

headlines: Rabri Devi demands probe into AES deaths in Bihar
text: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi demanded an investigation by any central investigating agency into the deaths of over 150 children in Bihar due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). She alleged that the state government didn't take proper steps for the distribution of the "ration" as dealers deny giving it without ration card. She said, "Those found guilty should be punished."

headlines: PM Modi, Shah condole deaths in J&K's Kishtwar accident
text: PM Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday offered condolences to the families of those killed in a bus accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar. At least 30 people died and 22 were injured after the bus fell into a deep gorge. Former J&K CMs Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti also offered their condolences to the bereaved families.

headlines: Summer breaks for all Haryana schools extended till July 7
text: Due to the prevalent heatwave in Haryana, the state government on Monday announced that summer holidays would be extended up to July 7 for all government and private schools. The schools, which were scheduled to open on July 1, will now open on July 8. IMD, however, has predicted "partly cloudy sky with possibility of rain" in Haryana for today.

headlines: SC reopens today after 6 weeks, to hear key cases like Rafale
text: The Supreme Court reopened on Monday after six-week summer vacation and is expected to deliver verdict soon on several key cases like Rafale review petition, Sabarimala and others. The court is expected to deliver a verdict on whether the RTI act is applicable to the CJI's office. Besides, it'll also take up cases including sexual harassment allegations against the CJI.

headlines: Second batch of 4,417 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims start journey
text: The second batch of 4,417 Amarnath pilgrims left a Jammu base camp in a fleet of 142 vehicles for Pahalgam and Baltal. Escorted by the CRPF, 2,800 pilgrims left the base camp for Pahalgam route, while 1,617 pilgrims for the Baltal route, officials said. The second batch of Amarnath Yatra pilgrims comprised of 3,543 males, 843 females and 31 children.

headlines: Keshni Anand Arora new H'yana Chief Secy, 3rd in family to hold post
text: The Haryana government on Sunday appointed 1983-batch IAS officer Keshni Anand Arora as the new Chief Secretary of the state. She's the third sister of her family to hold the top administrative post of the state after her sisters, MA Chaudhary (2005-06) and Urvashi Gulati (2009-12). Arora said, "Good governance and transparency in the system will be my top priority."

headlines: Manish shares pic of Michael Jackson wearing sherwani designed by him
text: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra has shared an old picture of himself with late singer Michael Jackson, in which the singer can be seen dressed in a sherwani designed by Malhotra. "Not only did he wear the outfit he also thanked me on stage at the Famous #BollywoodAwards USA," Malhotra wrote. "[It] became a memorable moment for me," he added.

headlines: If I want to marry a younger man, it's not your problem: Malaika
text: Talking about trolls on social media, actress Malaika Arora said, "You have a problem that I have found love again, you have a problem that my partner (Arjun Kapoor) is younger than me." "I don't care about your problems...I'm not here to please anybody," the 43-year-old actress said. "Age difference doesn't pop up when you're in a relationship," she added.

headlines: India's only six in defeat against England came in the 50th over
text: India smashed just one six during their unsuccessful chase of 338 runs against hosts England in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday. MS Dhoni slammed the six on the bowling of Chris Woakes on the first delivery of the 50th over. Meanwhile, England, during their innings, smashed 13 sixes, with Jonny Bairstow smashing the most (six).

headlines: I see Hardik as India's no. 5 in a year and a bit: Harsha Bhogle
text: Following all-rounder Hardik Pandya's 33-ball 45-run knock against England, commentator Harsha Bhogle said that he sees Hardik as India's number five batsman in a year and a bit. "India seem to thrust Hardik Pandya into situations where he has to start hitting right away. He is a better player than that," Bhogle added.

headlines: Rohit responds to Rishabh Pant batting at no. 4 on World Cup debut
text: On being asked by a journalist if he was surprised to see World Cup debutant Rishabh Pant bat at number four against England, opener Rohit Sharma jokingly said, "Not really, because you guys wanted him to play, right?" "All you guys, right from India, were like, 'Where is Rishabh Pant, where is Pant?' There he's at number four," he added.

headlines: Google CEO Pichai meets Sachin at Ind vs Eng match, BCCI shares pic
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai met former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar during the India vs England World Cup ODI in Edgbaston on Sunday, a picture of which was shared by the BCCI. A few days ago, Pichai said he's "rooting" for India and predicted an India vs England final. He also admitted to dreaming of becoming a cricketer during his growing-up years.

headlines: Aparna Kumar becomes 1st IPS officer to complete 7 Summits Challenge
text: Uttar Pradesh cadre IPS officer Aparna Kumar has become the first civil servant and IPS officer to complete the 'Seven Summits' Challenge, which includes scaling the highest mountains from each of the seven continents. Kumar hoisted India's tricolour on Mount Denali (20,310 ft) in Alaska, US, the highest peak of North America. She scaled the summit in her third attempt.

headlines: SpiceJet plane overshoots runway at Surat airport, all flyers safe
text: A SpiceJet aircraft from Bhopal carrying 43 passengers and four crew members on board overshot the runway during landing at the Surat airport on Sunday. However, none of the passengers and the crew were injured in the incident. The pilot reportedly could not apply brakes on time to stop the aircraft due to low-visibility and the aircraft overshot the runway.

headlines: 10 killed as plane crashes into hangar during takeoff in US
text: Ten people were killed when a small airplane crashed into a hangar as it was taking off from an airport in Texas, US. The twin-engine Beechcraft BE-350 King Air was destroyed by fire from the crash. The plane had just lifted off the runway when it veered left, dropped its left wing and slammed into the hangar.

headlines: Batting our problem, we couldn't even hit a ton: SL captain
text: Ahead of Sri Lanka's clash against West Indies on Monday, team's captain Dimuth Karunaratne said, "I think the batting is the main collapse...We played five matches, we couldnt get a hundred." The 31-year-old added that a team requires strong batting line-up to defeat a "good side". Sri Lanka's highest total so far at 2019 World Cup is 247/10 against Australia.

headlines: Red Bull's Max Verstappen wins Austrian Grand Prix
text: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday, beating Ferrari's Charles Leclerc, who registered his best finish in a Formula 1 Grand Prix. Mercedes' Valtteri Bottas finished third in the race. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton, who is leading the championship table, finished fifth while former world champion Sebastian Vettel was at the fourth place.

headlines: 9.2 million text messages collected with single wiretap in US
text: For four months in 2018, authorities in Texas, US collected over 9.2 million messages under a single court-authorised wiretap order, TechCrunch reported citing government figures. Targeting 149 individuals, it was reportedly granted by a federal judge as part of a narcotics investigation and became the federal wiretap with the most intercepts in 2018. To date, reportedly no arrests were made.

headlines: UK startup's AI may tell police when a suspect hides truth
text: UK-based startup Facesoft has built a face-reading AI system that detects hidden emotions based on micro-expressions, The Times stated. "If someone smiles insincerely, their mouth may smile, but the smile doesn't reach their eyes," Co-founder and CEO Allan Ponniah said. Facesoft has approached Mumbai police about using the system for monitoring crowds to detect the evolving mob dynamics.

headlines: TMC leader shot dead in WB, party calls for 12-hour bandh
text: A TMC leader was shot dead on the railway tracks at Bandel junction in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Saturday, police said. Dilip Ram, who was a railway employee, was shot in the head and succumbed to his injuries on the way to the hospital. TMC accused "BJP-backed miscreants" of the murder and called for a 12-hour bandh in Chinsurah.

headlines: Dialogue only way forward for peace in J&K: Farooq Abdullah
text: National Conference President Farooq Abdullah said that dialogue with Pakistan and all the stakeholders was the only way forward to herald peace in Jammu and Kashmir. He added, "The beneficiaries of the dialogue will be J&K people, who have been bearing the brunt of the hostilities." He asserted that Indo-Pak talks would lead to the end of violence in J&K.

headlines: BJP candidates for state polls to be finalised by Sept: Haryana CM
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that considering "winnability" a key factor, the BJP candidates for the upcoming state Assembly polls will be finalised by September. He added, "After ground-level surveys and studying media reports and recommendations, BJP's parliamentary board will finalise the candidates." Selection wouldn't be dependent on whether the party member is new or old, he said.

headlines: Stop calling luxury cars 'sin' goods, reduce GST: JLR to govt
text: As per Jaguar Land Rover India, the government should stop classifying luxury cars as 'sin' goods and reduce the tax burden on them. "If you classify [luxury vehicles] as sin goods...every five-star hotel should be sin...people going there should be called sinners," MD Rohit Suri said. He added luxury vehicles' market size is small due to the high GST rate.

headlines: 11 die of Encephalitis in Assam, Centre sends team to review cases
text: As many as 11 people have died due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) and Japanese Encephalitis (JE) in Assam. Concerning the same, Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Sunday sent a central team to review and analyse the Encephalitis situation in the state. Vardhan said that the Centre is "coordinating with the Assam government for the prevention and management of JE".

headlines: 1 dead, over 20 injured in road accident in Andhra Pradesh
text: One person died and more than 20 others were injured after a mini-truck rammed into a minibus near Andhra Pradesh's Theddupadu village on Sunday. The bus, carrying 24 members of a family, was returning to Guntur from Rayachoti after they attended a marriage function. The accident happened when the mini-truck carrying guavas lost control and rammed into the bus.

headlines: Tiger chases forest officials riding on bike in Kerala, video viral
text: A video captured by Forest Department officials inside Muthanga Wildlife Sanctuary in Kerala showing a wild tiger chasing them as they ride on a bike has gone viral on social media. For a few seconds, the tiger kept chasing the bike before disappearing into the jungle at the roadside. Forests and Wildlife Protection Society (FAWPS) shared the video on Facebook.

headlines: NSCN (I-M) hideouts destroyed, huge ammunition recovered
text: Assam Rifles along with police destroyed two NSCN (I-M) hideouts, one in Jongrum and another near the Indo-Myanmar border. A heavy cache of arms, including AK series rifle, were also recovered from these hideouts. The operation was part of the ongoing crackdown by the Army and Assam Rifles under Spear Corps on insurgent organisations active in south Arunachal Pradesh.

headlines: Rainwater at Statue of Unity design, not leakage: Officials
text: Officials claimed that the accumulation of water in the viewing gallery of Gujarat's 'Statue of Unity' was not leakage. The official handle of 'Statue of Unity' announced on Twitter, "The rainwater has been blown by high-velocity winds inside the viewing gallery. It's by design that it has to be kept open for a better view which tourists can enjoy."

headlines: Rohit 2nd Indian in history to smash 3 hundreds in a World Cup
text: Opener Rohit Sharma has become the second Indian batsman in history to smash three hundreds in a World Cup edition. The 32-year-old, who slammed 122* against South Africa and 140 against Pakistan earlier in 2019 World Cup, reached the three-figure mark in 106 balls against England today. Ex-India captain Sourav Ganguly had smashed three hundreds in the 2003 World Cup.

headlines: Kohli first captain to score five straight fifties in WC history
text: India captain Virat Kohli has become the first skipper to score five consecutive fifties in World Cup history. The 30-year-old achieved the feat after reaching the 50-run mark against England in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday. Kohli is only the second player ever to score five fifties in a row in World Cup history after Australia's Steve Smith.

headlines: Hosts England hand India their first defeat in 2019 World Cup
text: Hosts England handed India their first defeat in 2019 World Cup by beating them by 31 runs on Sunday. With the victory, England moved to the fourth spot on the points table, while Pakistan slipped one place to the fifth position. Notably, India and England have now played 100 ODIs against each other, with England emerging victorious 42 times.

headlines: Keep your regressive views to yourself: Raveena as Zaira quits B'wood
text: Hours after 'Dangal' actress Zaira Wasim announced leaving the film industry citing her religion, actress Raveena Tandon tweeted, "Doesn't matter if two film olds are ungrateful to the industry that gave them all." She added, "Just wish...they'd keep their regressive views to themselves." "I consistently interfered with my imaan...my relationship with my religion was threatened," Zaira had said.

headlines: Rohit Sharma becomes 3rd fastest batsman to score 25 ODI hundreds
text: India opener Rohit Sharma today became the third-fastest batsman to reach 25 ODI hundreds, achieving the feat in 2019 World Cup match against England. The 32-year-old batsman took 206 innings to reach the milestone. South Africa's Hashim Amla is the fastest to reach 25 ODI hundreds (151 innings), while Virat Kohli took 162 innings to hit 25 ODI tons.

headlines: B'deshi doctor claims he was transferred for criticising Mortaza
text: A paediatric doctor in Bangladesh has claimed he was transferred to a remote rural clinic after criticising Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza on social media. In his post, the doctor criticised Mortaza for "taking pleasure in bowling Bangladesh doctors". His post came after Mortaza, who is also an MP, visited a state-run hospital and became infuriated when he found doctors absent.

headlines: Substitute Jadeja takes diving catch near boundary to dismiss Roy
text: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who had come on as a substitute for KL Rahul, took a diving catch near the boundary to dismiss England opener Jason Roy. Roy had rushed down the pitch to Kuldeep Yadav's googly after which Jadeja dived full length forward after running to his left from long on and took the catch inches from the ground.

headlines: Rugby player dislocates knee, pushes it back and continues playing
text: Joe Westerman, a rugby league player for Hull FC in the Betfred Super League, dislocated his knee while playing against Hull Kingston Rovers. During the 76th minute of the match, Westerman was involved in a collision when his right knee cap dislocated. However, Westerman slapped his kneecap into place and carried on playing.

headlines: Building for which BJP MLA beat official to be demolished on Tuesday
text: The building in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, for which BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya had thrashed a civic body official with a cricket bat, will be demolished under police protection on Tuesday, said Municipal Commissioner Ashish Singh. "The building is in a very dilapidated condition. We cannot allow it to exist in monsoon season as it can collapse any time," added Singh.

headlines: Former Equifax exec gets 4 months prison for insider trading
text: Former Equifax US Information Solutions Chief Information Officer Jun Ying was sentenced to four months in prison for insider trading. In March, he pleaded guilty for selling his stock in the company in 2017 before Equifax publicly announced its data breach wherein over 145 million users' personal information was stolen. His prison sentence will be followed by one-year-long supervised release.

headlines: Strongly deny that banks said no to join Libra: Facebook exec
text: David Marcus, the co-creator of Facebook's digital currency 'Libra', has denied a report stating that certain banks had rejected invitations to join the Libra Association. "I want to absolutely and strongly deny that we've approached banks and banks have said no," Marcus said. He added he expects that when Libra launches next year, banks will be members.

headlines: InMobi names Harvard professor Khanna as independent director
text: InMobi Group's Board of Directors has appointed Harvard professor Tarun Khanna as an independent director of the firm. "InMobis journey...being the first unicorn to becoming a successful global company to emerge out of India is an inspiration for any entrepreneur," Khanna said. A member of the faculty since 1993, Khanna is the Jorge Paulo Lemann Professor at Harvard Business School.

headlines: UP teenager gang-raped by cousins for scoring better marks
text: A 16-year-old girl was sedated and gang-raped by her cousins several times over the past two years for scoring better marks than them, said police. A teacher also participated and recorded the act every time, which was then circulated among family members on a WhatsApp group. The incident came to light on Friday when the victim's parents saw the recordings.

headlines: Andhra woman dies on getting wrong blood type; 5 suspended
text: A 32-year-old woman died after being given B positive instead of O positive blood type during a transfusion in a government hospital in Andhra Pradesh's Anantapur district on Thursday. Hospital staff tried to cover up and told her husband that she died of a heart attack. Following an investigation, two doctors, two staff nurses and a lab technician were suspended.

headlines: 4 TN fishermen injured after Sri Lankan navy attacks them
text: Four fishermen from Tamil Nadu were seriously injured after they were attacked by personnel of the Sri Lanka Navy while fishing in the island's territorial waters on Saturday, said police. The fishermen claimed that the personnel attacked them with stones, bottles and sticks. One of them suffered a hip fracture, while the other three had extensive hand injuries, officials said.

headlines: Salman, Aamir to star in Andaz Apna Apna sequel, confirms co-writer
text: Dilip Shukla, the co-writer of 1994 film 'Andaz Apna Apna' has confirmed that Salman Khan and Aamir Khan will star in the film's sequel. "The sequel cannot be complete without Salman Khan and Aamir Khan. They will be there along with three other new cast members," said Dilip, who is also writing the sequel.

headlines: Soundarya deletes pool pics after criticism over Chennai water crisis
text: Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajnikanth deleted pictures on Twitter of herself with her son in the swimming pool after users criticised her in light of the Chennai water crisis. "Removed the pictures shared...from my #TravelDiaries considering the sensitivity around the current #WaterScarcity we're facing," she tweeted. Soundarya added the pictures were to emphasise the importance of physical activities for children.

headlines: MS Dhoni opts not to take DRS for catch despite ball hitting gloves
text: On the fifth delivery of England's 11th over bowled by all-rounder Hardik Pandya, India appealed for a caught-behind dismissal against opener Jason Roy but the umpire signalled not-out. India then opted not to take DRS after wicketkeeper MS Dhoni was convinced that the ball had not touched Roy's bat or gloves. However, the replays showed Roy had gloved the delivery.

headlines: Chahal gives away most runs ever by an Indian in a World Cup match
text: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal conceded most runs by an Indian in a World Cup match after giving away 88 runs against England on Sunday. The 28-year-old, who registered figures of 10-0-88-0, went past ex-pacer Javagal Srinath, who had leaked 87 runs against Australia in 2003. Notably, Chahal also holds the Indian record for conceding most runs in a T20I (64).

headlines: Shami makes it 13 wickets in 3 WC matches after maiden 5-wicket haul
text: Pacer Mohammad Shami on Sunday picked up his maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs, registering figures of 10-1-69-5 against England in 2019 World Cup. With this, Shami became the sixth Indian bowler after Kapil Dev, Robin Singh, Venkatesh Prasad, Ashish Nehra and Yuvraj Singh to take a World Cup five-for. Shami has taken 13 wickets in three 2019 World Cup matches.

headlines: Karun Nair gets engaged to longtime girlfriend, shares proposal video
text: Karun Nair, the second Indian cricketer to score a triple century in Test cricket, got engaged to his longtime girlfriend Sanaya Tankariwala. The 27-year-old Karnataka and Kings XI Punjab batsman shared a video of himself proposing to Sanaya with sea in the background and captioned the post, "She said 'YES'." Nair has represented India in six Tests and two ODIs.

headlines: Biggest China casinos use Artificial Intelligence to spot who'll lose
text: China's biggest casinos are using Artificial Intelligence-enabled hidden cameras, facial recognition technology and digitally-enabled poker chips and tables to identify which customers are likely to lose the most money. The technology uses algorithms that process how customers behave at the table to determine their appetite for risk. The higher the risk appetite, the more a gambler stands to lose.

headlines: Grofers works to convert 200 physical stores into own branded outlets
text: Online grocery platform Grofers is working on converting about 200 brick-and-mortar stores into its own branded outlets over the next few months. The SoftBank-backed startup has already converted about 100 such 'kirana' outlets in Delhi-NCR. This model will have no "adverse effect" on the online sales, Yeshu Bansal, VP Operations at Grofers, said.

headlines: Cong seeks FIR over video showing BJP MLA Akash's supporter firing
text: Congress has demanded registration of a criminal case after a video emerged wherein a suspected supporter of BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya, who was arrested for beating up an officer with a bat, was seen firing in the air on Vijayvargiya's release on Sunday. BJP, however, said that neither the party nor any of its worker was linked to the incident.

headlines: Woman forest officer attacked by TRS workers in Telangana
text: A female Forest Range Officer and her team on Sunday were attacked by a mob of TRS workers led by MLA Koneru Konappa's brother in Telangana, said officials. The team was in Sarsala to carry out a mass tree plantation programme. A video of the incident shows the mob attacking vehicles with sticks as the officer stood atop a tractor.

headlines: WH Press Secy manhandled by N Korea security guards: Reports
text: Stephanie Grisham, newly appointed White House Press Secretary, was on Sunday reportedly manhandled by North Korean security guards. Grisham, who reportedly suffered bruises, was seen pushing back the guards who were blocking the US press. She reportedly tried to create a path for the press to join the meeting between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

headlines: India now producing cheapest solar power among G20 countries: Survey
text: India is now producing the cheapest solar power among the G20 countries, an International Renewable Energy Agency survey shared by the World Economic Forum stated. The costs of building large-scale solar installations in India fell by 27% in 2018, year-on-year, it added. Average solar prices of large-scale Indian installations were under a third of Canada's, where costs were the highest.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra wears Sabyasachi saree at Sophie and Joe's wedding
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra wore a powder pink saree by fashion designer Sabyasachi for 'Game of Thrones' actress Sophie Turner's second wedding ceremony to American singer Joe Jonas in France on Saturday. She completed her look with Sabyasachi jewellery, dewy makeup and roses in her bun. Pictures which surfaced online showed her posing with other members of the Jonas family.

headlines: Three arrested in Kolkata for assaulting female boxer
text: Three individuals were arrested and reportedly sent to four days police custody on Saturday for allegedly assaulting a national level female boxer in Kolkata. Professional boxer Suman Kumari had written a Facebook post in which she revealed that she had been assaulted. Kumari had recently won a title at the Taiwan Professionals Boxing Championship.

headlines: Sour grapes: CM Yogi on Priyanka Gandhi's tweet on UP crimes
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday responded to Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's criticism of the state's law and order situation, saying, it is a case of sour grapes. "Her party president lost from UP so...they have to comment something...to remain in headlines," Yogi said. Priyanka had earlier tweeted, "Criminals are roaming free...Crimes are being committed one after the other."

headlines: Apollo Mission Control that helped land men on Moon reopened
text: NASA has reopened the Apollo Mission Control Center at Johnson Space Center after restoring it to appear as it did in 1969. This comes before the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon landing on July 20. The restored control room, visitor's gallery and adjacent simulation support room's pieces are original artifacts or recreated items based on original samples.

headlines: Nurse commits suicide by setting self on fire in AIIMS Jodhpur
text: A nurse on Saturday committed suicide by setting herself on fire in a gallery behind the operation theatre in AIIMS Jodhpur, said police. The woman, Biju Punoj, hailed from Kerala and was employed in the hospital for the past two years. The incident came to light after passersby saw fumes coming out of a room, following which authorities were informed.

headlines: UP CM Adityanath visits hospital in Moradabad for inspection
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday visited district hospital in Moradabad for inspection and interacted with several patients and their family members. The CM's visit comes following more than a hundred deaths in the neighbouring state Bihar due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). On Saturday, the CM took a round of a district hospital in Saharanpur.

headlines: Driver, 3 grandkids die in Rajasthan after tractor falls into pond
text: A driver of a tractor and his 3 grandchildren died after their tractor fell into a pond in Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Sunday. The incident occurred when the four were returning from their farm and the tractor skidded-off a road and fell into the pond. "The family does not want a police investigation at present," police said.

headlines: MP woman who ran away with Dalit man thrashed by family
text: A 21-year-old woman was thrashed by a group of men from her family for reportedly refusing to marry a man from her community in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district. She had run away with a Dalit man following which her family filed a complaint and police tracked her down. The incident came to light after a video surfaced on social media.

headlines: Summer vacation extended till July 8 in Delhi schools up to Class 8
text: Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia has said that summer holidays have been extended till July 8 for Delhi schools up to Class 8 because of the rising temperatures. He added this order would apply to both government and private schools. He further said that the schools will re-open on Monday as per the schedule for Classes 9-12.

headlines: Article 15 screening stalled in Kanpur after religious group protests
text: The screening of Ayushmann Khurrana starrer 'Article 15' has been suspended in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh following protests by a religious group, which entered two theatres. They shouted slogans against the filmmaker and tore posters. Anticipating further trouble, the exhibitors held a meeting on Saturday and decided to put the film's screening on hold till adequate security is provided.

headlines: I feel almost paralysed: Tanmay on depression after AIB #MeToo row
text: Comedian Tanmay Bhat on Saturday took to Instagram to reveal that he was diagnosed with clinical depression following the sexual harassment allegations against former All India Bakchod (AIB) employee Utsav Chakraborty in October last year. "I feel almost paralysed, unable to participate socially, offline or online," said Tanmay. AIB had released a statement saying Tanmay was aware of Utsav's actions.

headlines: India's first openly gay prince celebrates 'WorldPride' in New York
text: Prince Manvendra Singh Gohil, the first openly gay prince from India, is celebrating the 'WorldPride' in New York and also served as the keynote speaker at Pride's Human Rights Conference. WorldPride is an event that promotes LGBTQ+ issues through parades and other activities throughout June. Prince Manvendra Singh Gohil, 53, is the son of the Maharana of Rajpipla in Gujarat.

headlines: Around 20 fans invade pitch after Pakistan-Afghanistan match
text: Around 20 fans charged onto the pitch following Pakistan's last-over victory against Afghanistan in the 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Afghanistan all-rounder Mohammad Nabi was mistakenly taken out by a security guard as he chased pitch invaders. Earlier in the match, several fans of both the sides were seen clashing with each other in the stands.

headlines: Rishabh Pant makes his World Cup debut, replaces Vijay Shankar
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant is featuring in his first World Cup match after replacing all-rounder Vijay Shankar for India's match against England at Birmingham today. The 21-year-old has played five ODIs for India, scoring 93 runs. Shankar has featured in three 2019 World Cup matches so far, scoring 58 runs and taking two wickets.

headlines: Should India lose to England to put Pakistan out of semis: Mahindra
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday took to Twitter to ask, "Should India play a 'chess' move and lose to England to put Pakistan out of the semis?" He added, "Happily, the majority say that Team India should always play to win." Team India is facing England in the 38th ODI of World Cup 2019 in Edgbaston in Birmingham.

headlines: Discovering 'Arthashastra' was a revelation: Bill Gates' aide David
text: Historian David Christian, Co-founder of online history syllabus for schools 'Big History Project' with Bill Gates, said that discovering the 'Arthashastra' was a revelation for him. He said it offers a clear statement of a widespread view of politics in the pre-modern world. "Ancient religious traditions will have a lot to contribute to our ethical thinking today," he added.

headlines: Japanese mayor asks Kim to rename Kimono shape-wear collection
text: The mayor of Kyoto, Japan has written a letter to Kim Kardashian asking her to 'reconsider' changing the name of her 'Kimono' shape-wear line. "Its culture...shouldn't be monopolized," he wrote. Kim has said she has no intention 'to design or release any garments that would resemble or dishonour the traditional garment' but declared that she won't change the name.

headlines: Trump, Kim Jong-un agree to resume stalled nuclear talks
text: US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un have agreed to resume nuclear talks between the two nations, which were stalled following the Vietnam summit between the two leaders. Trump and Kim held a closed-door meeting for nearly an hour. "The meeting was a very good one, very strong," Trump said.

headlines: I was surprised to see your invitation: Kim Jong-un to Trump
text: During a meeting with US President Donald Trump on Sunday, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said, "I was surprised to see your message that you wanted to meet me." "This is an expression of his willingness" to work towards a new future, Kim added. "We moved mountains" to arrange the meeting at such short notice, Trump replied.

headlines: India ranked 74th in money with Swiss banks, UK retains top spot
text: An analysis by the Swiss National Bank has ranked India at 74th position in terms of money parked by individuals and enterprises in Swiss banks, about 0.07% of funds by all foreign clients of Switzerland-based banks in 2018. The UK topped the list with over 26% of such funds. It's followed by the US, West Indies, France and Hong Kong.

headlines: Williamson urges NZ to 'move on' after Australia defeat
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has urged his side to 'move on' after their defeat to Australia at the World Cup 2019. "There are so many variables in this sport and the World Cup. It's about moving on to the next game," Williamson said. New Zealand are set to face hosts England in their next match on July 3.

headlines: Pakistan fans supporting India a rare thing: Virat Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli, during the toss against England on Sunday, said it is a rare thing that Pakistani fans would be supporting India to win.
