Pakistan need India to beat England to better their chances to qualify for the semi-finals. Pakistan are currently fourth on the 2019 World Cup points table, while England are on the fifth position.

headlines: Murray, Serena mulling to play doubles together at Wimbledon 2019
text: Former world number ones Andy Murray and Serena Williams are mulling on playing in the mixed doubles event at the upcoming Wimbledon 2019. Serena spoke about considering partnering up with Murray, saying, "I'm available. I'm feeling better now, so I'm definitely available... Let's see how my knee's going. I'm finally doing good."

headlines: Suárez misses penalty as Peru beat Uruguay in Copa America
text: Luis Suárez was in tears after he missed a shootout penalty against Peru as 15 times Copa America champions Uruguay crashed out of the Copa America 2019. The match saw three goals being ruled out for offside by VAR. Peru will face neighbours Chile in the last four, with tournament hosts Brazil meeting rivals Argentina in the other semi-final clash.

headlines: System of fitness bracelet, phone and app judges staff performance
text: A team including Dartmouth College researchers has created a mobile-sensing system that can judge workers' performance by using smartphones, fitness bracelets and a custom app. It monitors workers' physical, emotional and behavioural well-being to classify high and low performers. Tested on 750 US workers over one year, it was found to distinguish between high and low performers with 80% accuracy.

headlines: BJP Parliamentary Party meeting to be held on July 2
text: BJP Parliamentary Party meeting is scheduled to take place in Parliament library in New Delhi on July 2. "All BJP Members of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha are requested to attend the meeting in time," a press release issued by the Parliament Office secretary read. This meeting is taking place ahead of the Union Budget presentation on July 5.

headlines: Experienced void while not addressing Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that it was like "experiencing a kind of void" for the last four months as he couldn't address the nation through 'Mann Ki Baat'. Addressing 'Mann Ki Baat', he added, "You possibly don't know that you're the ones who make me walk, who make me run and keep me full of life and zest."

headlines: Nitin Gadkari proposes Alibaba-like platform for MSME sector
text: Union Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) Nitin Gadkari has suggested the development of an Alibaba or Amazon-like "marketing platform" to make MSMEs accessible to the world. He proposed the creation of a website named 'Bank of ideas, innovation and research' where people can post suggestions. The MSME sector currently contributes to 29% of the GDP, he said.

headlines: Blast takes place in Meghdoot club in West Bengal's Birbhum
text: A blast took place inside the Meghdoot club in the Mallarpur area of West Bengal's Birbhum on Saturday night, causing a ruckus in the villages located near the club. Explosives were already present in the Meghdoot club which led to the blast, officials said. Police reached the spot after receiving information and no casualties in the matter have been reported.

headlines: UK Prince William, wife Kate Middleton to visit Pakistan
text: UK Prince William and his wife Kate Middleton will visit Pakistan in the autumn at the request of Britain's Foreign Office, Kensington Palace has said. "The upcoming visit is a reflection of the importance the UK attaches to its relations with Pakistan," Pakistan's High Commissioner in London Mohammad Nafees Zakaria said. "The two countries enjoy historical links," he added.

headlines: Taliban kills eight election commission employees in Afghanistan
text: Militant group Taliban killed eight election commission employees on Saturday inside a district centre in Afghanistan's southern province of Kandahar, officials said. The employees of the Independent Election Commission were stationed there to register voters. Separately on Saturday, Taliban fighters killed eight Afghan soldiers and injured eight others at a military checkpoint.

headlines: Trump meets Kim Jong-un at border separating North, South Korea
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday met North Korean leader Kim Jong-un at the border separating North and South Korea. This is the third meeting between the two leaders. Trump arrived in South Korea on Saturday for talks with South Korean President Moon Jae-in after attending the G20 summit in Japan, during which he made an offer to meet Kim.

headlines: Trump 1st sitting US President to set foot on North Korean soil
text: Donald Trump has become first-ever sitting US President to step foot into North Korea after he greeted North Korean leader Kim Jong-un at the border separating the two Koreas. "I didn't expect it. Stepping across that line was a great honour," Trump said. Bill Clinton visited Kim's father Kim Jong-il in 2009, but he went as a former US President.

headlines: Dangal actress Zaira Wasim quits B'wood after 5 yrs, cites religion
text: 'Dangal' actress Zaira Wasim has announced her "disassociation" from the field of acting after 5 years, saying she wasn't happy as her career was invading her religion. "While I continued to work in an environment that...interferes with my 'imaan', my relationship with my religion was threatened," she wrote. "No amount of success, fame...is worth...losing your peace for," the 18-year-old added.

headlines: Who are we to question Zaira's choices: Omar as actress quits B'wood
text: After 'Dangal' actress Zaira Wasim quit Bollywood citing religion, former J&K Chief Minister took to Twitter to express his support. "Who are any of us to question @ZairaWasimmm's choices? It's her life to do with as she pleases," he wrote. "All I will do is wish her well & hope that whatever she does makes her happy," Omar added.

headlines: GoT's Sophie marries Joe Jonas in 2nd wedding ceremony in France
text: 'Game of Thrones' actress Sophie Turner got married to American singer Joe Jonas in a second wedding ceremony in France. Several pictures have surfaced online, showing Joe, Sophie and their family members including Nick Jonas and Priyanka Chopra. The wedding also attended by Sophie's GoT co-star Maisie Williams. The couple had an impromptu wedding ceremony in Las Vegas in May.

headlines: Pakistan is standing with you: Akhtar to India before England match
text: Ahead of the India-England 2019 World Cup match, former Pakistani fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a video, said, "India, all of Pakistan is standing with you." "I request that all the Pakistanis based in England, should also support India. Because if India beat England, the game is over. Pakistan then has to win just one game to qualify," he added.

headlines: Table-toppers Australia hand New Zealand their 2nd straight defeat
text: Table-toppers Australia handed New Zealand their second straight defeat in the 2019 World Cup after beating them by 86 runs on Saturday. The victory was Australia's eighth against New Zealand in 11 World Cup matches. The match witnessed fast bowler Trent Boult become the first New Zealand bowler to take a hat-trick in World Cup.

headlines: India's previous WC game vs England ended in tie, both scored 338
text: The last time India and England played against each other in an ODI World Cup was on February 27, 2011 in Bengaluru. The match ended in a tie, with both India and England managing to score 338 in their respective innings. Sachin Tendulkar and Andrew Strauss slammed hundreds, with the latter winning Man of the Match for his 158.

headlines: Had good time in jail: BJP MLA who beat municipal officer with bat
text: Akash Vijayvargiya, BJP MLA and son of BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya, who was arrested for thrashing a Municipal Corporation officer with a cricket bat has said he had a "good time" in jail. "I am not guilty or embarrassed...A woman was being dragged brutally in front of the police and I couldn't think of doing anything else," he added.

headlines: Only original recording left of 1st steps on Moon to be auctioned
text: Art dealer Sotheby's in New York is auctioning three tapes identified as the "only surviving" original recording of the first Moon landing in 1969. The tapes include the first man to step on Moon, Neil Armstrong's famous line, "That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind." They have been viewed only thrice since June 1976, Sotheby's revealed.

headlines: Employee drags patient to X-ray room on bed sheet at MP hospital
text: A video showing an employee at a Madhya Pradesh hospital taking a patient to X-ray room by dragging him on a bed sheet has surfaced online. The incident took place at the Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Medical College in Jabalpur. Senior officials at the college said three people were suspended after the incident and the administration has launched an inquiry.

headlines: If Kim had not shown up, press would've made me look bad: Trump
text: While addressing the press along with Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said, "If the North Korean leader would have not shown up despite my social media invitation, the press would have made me look very bad." "You made us both look very good," Trump told Kim. Trump described the meeting with Kim as a "historic moment".

headlines: Those calling me 'selected PM' manufactured by dictators: Pak PM
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that the country's opposition leaders who use the phrase 'selected Prime Minister' for him "were themselves manufactured in the nursery of military dictatorship". Several Pakistani lawmakers have used the phrase for Khan, apparently hinting that he was brought to power with the help of the Pakistani military.

headlines: PwC resigns as statutory auditor for Eveready Industries
text: Global audit firm PwC on Friday resigned as statutory auditor for battery maker Eveready Industries. PwC said it has not been able to analyse the impact of financial support extended by the company to its promoter group entities. Singhi & Co has been appointed as the new auditor for Eveready with effect from June 29.

headlines: Boeing 737 MAX software outsourced to workers from HCL, Cyient
text: Boeing engaged workers from India's HCL and Cyient to develop 737 MAX's flight-display and flight-test equipment software, Bloomberg reported. The work done by HCL engineers "was far less efficient than Boeing engineers just writing the code," an ex-Boeing software engineer said. Boeing said it didn't rely on HCL and Cyient for MCAS system, which was linked to two recent crashes.

headlines: Instil fear in criminals, trust in public: Yogi to officials
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed administrations of Saharanpur, Muzaffarnagar and Shamli to form police teams so as to instil fear in criminals and trust in the public. Reviewing the law and order situation, he said, "The state doesn't need officials who're corrupt or are just doing formalities." He also asked officers to conduct surprise visits in their areas.

headlines: MP Congress to soon get new president: Kamal Nath
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Saturday said that the state party is soon going to have a new president. This comes days after he had revealed that he had offered to quit from the state party President post following the party's debacle in Madhya Pradesh in the Lok Sabha elections. "We've to fight the BJP's election machinery," he added.

headlines: Battery module caused Shanghai car fire, not system defect: Tesla
text: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla has said the Shanghai parked Model S car explosion in April was due to a single battery module and isn't a system defect. Tesla has revised its software update to change battery charge and thermal management settings. The update was first announced in May after an investigation into another Hong Kong fire incident.

headlines: First batch of 2,234 Amarnath yatris flagged off from Jammu
text: Advisor to the Jammu and Kashmir Governor, KK Sharma on Sunday flagged off the first batch of 2,234 devotees for the Amarnath Yatra from the Jammu base camp. The pilgrims comprised of 1,839 males, 333 females, 17 children and 45 sadhus left the base camp amid tight security. The annual pilgrimage to Shri Amarnath Cave Shrine is commencing from Monday.

headlines: 5 people injured in clash between TMC and BJP in Bengal
text: At least five people were injured in a clash which broke out between TMC and BJP workers in West Bengal's Bardhaman on Saturday. In one of the incidents that was reported on Saturday, two TMC workers were admitted to a hospital after they were attacked with a sharp weapon. Two more such incidents were reported from Bengal's Purba Bardhaman yesterday.

headlines: 'Jan Jan Judega, Jal Bachega': PM Modi on water conservation
text: Addressing the nation in radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat' after winning the 2019 general elections, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday urged people to conserve water saying, "Jan Jan Judega, Jal Bachega." Talking about water scarcity, he added that a combined contribution can make the impossible possible. He also urged the nation to share knowledge of traditional methods of water conservation.

headlines: Terrorist shot down in encounter in J&K's Budgam
text: At least one terrorist was shot down in an encounter which broke out with the security forces on Sunday in Chadoora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam district. Reportedly, mobile internet services have been suspended in Budgam. On Friday, security forces gunned down a terrorist when a gunfight broke out between the forces and militants in Budgam.

headlines: Man resigns by giving 'very sorry for your loss' card to boss in UK
text: A 22-year-old man working at a call centre in the UK recently resigned from his job by giving a condolence card to his boss, which has gone viral. "So very sorry for your loss...My last day at work is the 28th July," the card read. "We're a very close team...I knew my boss would find it funny," the man said.

headlines: I remain Muslim, no one should comment on what I wear: TMC MP Nusrat
text: Actor-politician TMC MP Nusrat Jahan on Saturday tweeted, "I represent an inclusive India...which is beyond the barriers of caste, creed and religion." She added, "As much as I respect all religions...I remain a Muslim...and non (no one) should comment on what I choose to wear." Earlier today, Deoband clerics issued fatwa against Nusrat for marrying a non-Muslim and wearing sindoor.

headlines: Afghanistan cricketers are from Peshawar: Shoaib Akhtar
text: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, in a video, said that all Afghanistan cricketers are from Pakistan's Peshawar according to their original ID cards. He added that the team can even be banned by ICC for this. "India has invested tremendously in Afghanistan, but the one thing India couldnt inject into them is a sense of maturity," he added.

headlines: Sri Lanka's Nuwan Pradeep ruled out of World Cup with chickenpox
text: Sri Lanka pacer Nuwan Pradeep has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup due to chickenpox. Pradeep, who took a match-winning four-wicket haul against Afghanistan on June 4, could only play in three out of Sri Lanka's seven games so far. Fast bowler Kasun Rajitha has been named as Pradeep's replacement.

headlines: Pak record 3rd straight win, move to 4th on 2019 WC points table
text: Pakistan defeated Afghanistan by 3 wickets in the last over on Saturday to register their third straight victory and move from the sixth to the fourth position in the 2019 World Cup points table. Afghanistan have now lost each of their first eight 2019 World Cup matches. Pakistan will face Bangladesh in their last league stage match on Friday.

headlines: I am probably good at hiding pressure: Virat Kohli
text: Talking about pressure ahead of India-England 2019 World Cup match, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "I would say that's a lie if I say I am not under pressure." "I am probably good at hiding it. If I don't (feel pressure) then probably I don't have enough motivation to play any more," he added.

headlines: Bairstow entitled to his opinion just like critics to theirs: Morgan
text: England captain Eoin Morgan has said wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow has every right to express his opinion as much as the critics. "I think critics are there to be critical. We haven't performed well, so they're going to be critical. They're entitled to their own opinion," he added. This comes after Bairstow said some people were waiting for England to fail.

headlines: Williamson third fastest batsman to score 6,000 runs in ODI cricket
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson on Saturday became the third-fastest batsman to reach 6,000 ODI runs, achieving the feat during his 51-ball 40-run knock against Australia in 2019 World Cup. Williamson reached the milestone in his 139th ODI innings, three more than India captain Virat Kohli. South Africa's Hashim Amla is the fastest to reach the 6,000-run mark (123 innings).

headlines: Shaheen records best figures by a teenager in a World Cup match
text: Pakistan's 19-year-old fast bowler Shaheen Afridi recorded the best ever figures by a teenager in a World Cup match during his team's match against Afghanistan in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Shaheen registered bowling figures of 10-0-47-4 to achieve the feat. Shaheen's dismissals included Afghanistan captain Gulbadin Naib, Hashmatullah Shahidi, Najibullah Zadran and Rashid Khan.

headlines: Both hat-tricks in 2019 WC came in 3rd, 4th, 5th balls of 50th over
text: Trent Boult on Saturday became the first New Zealand bowler to take a World Cup hat-trick. The pacer dismissed Australia's Usman Khawaja, Mitchell Starc and Jason Behrendorff with the third, fourth and fifth deliveries of 50th over respectively. Interestingly, India pacer Mohammad Shami took 2019 World Cup's first hat-trick with the third, fourth and fifth deliveries of Afghanistan's 50th over.

headlines: I'll tell my grandchildren, I got 'driving' lessons from Sachin: SRK
text: After Sachin Tendulkar trolled Shah Rukh Khan for not wearing a helmet while riding a bike, the actor tweeted, "My friend Helmet pehenkar, On Drive..Off drive & Straight drive, karna aap se zyaada behtar kaun sikha sakta hai!" "Will tell my grandchildren, I got my 'driving' lessons from the great Sachin himself...See u soon over some fish curry," he added.

headlines: 5 months ago, Pune building residents warned of wall that killed 15
text: Pune's Alcon Stylus housing society residents alleged on Saturday that they had warned the society developer of the condition of the retaining wall that was tilting outward five months ago. A resident claimed that the developer told them that the wall was safe. A portion of the wall collapsed today and fell on the nearby shanties, killing 15 people.

headlines: All 12 members of UK family who fled to Syria to join ISIS killed
text: All 12 members of a British family who fled to Syria to join ISIS have been killed, a relative said. Two elderly members died of natural causes, three others were killed fighting for ISIS, while the remaining ones died in an air strike. The 12 relatives had not been seen after visiting their home country of Bangladesh in 2015.

headlines: We believe in MS Dhoni, he can't be told what to do: Kohli
text: Ahead of the India-England 2019 World Cup match, Team India captain Virat Kohli said that the team believes in MS Dhoni. "He knows what he needs to do, he cannot be told what to do. He has stood for the team every single time. We are very happy with how the batting is going," he added.

headlines: Wimbledon ditches plastic wrapping for restrung racquets
text: Players will no longer be given their racquets in polythene wrapping bags when they break a string or want a replacement at the Wimbledon. The new rule will result in 4,500 fewer such polythene bags at this year's Wimbledon. "We believe that Wimbledon...has a vital role to play in helping to protect the environment," said Wimbledon's chief executive.

headlines: Dutch enter the Women's World Cup semis for the 1st time
text: The Netherlands reached the semi-final of the Women's World Cup for the first time on Saturday after beating Italy 2-0. The Dutch will now face either Germany or Sweden in the semi-final stage of the tournament. Italy conceded two headers, with the first one being Netherlands' all-time top scorer Vivianne Miedema's 61st international goal.

headlines: England upbeat despite 'external pressures': Jos Buttler
text: Speaking about England team's mood in the face of a chance of elimination from the World Cup 2019, Jos Buttler said, "Mood in the camp is still very good. Naturally, there are some external pressures." "Everything is still within our hands, these are stuff we can control and that's what we will be aiming to do," Buttler added.

headlines: Mass resignations in Cong part of scripted drama: BJP leader
text: BJP's Tom Vadakkan on Saturday claimed that the recent mass resignations in Congress are a part of a 'scripted drama'. "People who have been following Congress know that the script is the same...You will have a horde of resignations coming which has no meaning," he said. Vadakkan also claimed that it is all masterminded by a "particular senior leader".

headlines: AAP leader shown black flags while inaugurating mohalla clinics
text: Delhi Labour Minister Gopal Rai on Saturday inaugurated two mohalla clinics in the national capital amid a protest allegedly by BJP workers. Rai alleged that BJP workers protested against the inauguration of a mohalla clinic in North Ghonda area. He later tweeted the video of the incident that showed some people waving black flags and raising slogans at the event.

headlines: AN-32 search & rescue team retrieved from crash site after 17 days
text: The search and rescue team for AN-32 aircraft was rescued on Saturday by an Indian Air Force (IAF) chopper. The 15-member team comprising eight officials from the IAF, four from the Indian Army and three civilians were stranded at the crash site since June 12 due to adverse weather conditions. All members are reported to be in good health.

headlines: Over 25,000 cops, CCTVs, drones to secure Gujarat Rath Yatra
text: Over 25,000 police personnel, CCTVs and drone cameras have been put in place for the 142nd Lord Jagannath Rath Yatra on July 4 in Ahmedabad. The procession will travel a distance of 14 kilometres. The route has been divided into 26 zones which will be manned by 37 teams of state police along with 15 Quick Response Teams, officials said.

headlines: Indian women forced to work as bar dancers in Dubai rescued
text: Four women from Tamil Nadu were rescued by Dubai Police following a tip-off from the Indian consulate. The women were reportedly told they will work for an event management company, but their employer detained them and forced them to work as bar dancers. The matter came to light when one of the women managed to contact her family through WhatsApp.

headlines: Pak, Afghan fans fight at stadium over Balochistan slogan on plane
text: During Pakistan-Afghanistan 2019 World Cup match, a fight broke out between fans of the two teams after a plane carrying 'Justice for Balochistan' slogan flew over the stadium in Leeds. A few of the fans had to be evicted from the stadium. A video of several fans hitting each other outside the stadium using steel barricades surfaced online.

headlines: Aisa lag raha hai sukhane laya hoon: Kohli while unveiling jersey
text: While unveiling the orange-blue jersey ahead of his press conference, India captain Virat Kohli jokingly said, "Aisa lag raha hai sukhane laya hoon (It feels as if I got it here to dry it)." "This jersey's an 8/10 for me," he added. "I don't think it [will be our permanent jersey], blue has always been our colour," he further said.

headlines: 3rd Google undersea internet cable to link Africa and Europe
text: Google has announced a new undersea internet cable 'Equiano', its third private international cable after 'Dunant' and 'Curie', that will link Europe and Africa. "Equiano will be the first...to incorporate optical switching at the fibre-pair level," it said. Google also claimed it will have around 20 times more network capacity than the last cable built to serve this region.

headlines: BJP MLA Vijayvargiya who beat municipal officer with bat gets bail
text: Madhya Pradesh BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya was granted bail by Bhopal's Special Court on Saturday. The first-time MLA was arrested for beating a Municipal Corporation officer with a cricket bat in Indore on June 26. Akash Vijayvargiya is the son of senior BJP leader and party's National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya.

headlines: Pehlu Khan's name not in chargesheet submitted by police: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday tweeted, "Name of Late Pehlu Khan isn't in the chargesheet submitted by Rajasthan Police in December 2018." He added, "This is a separate case registered and investigated under the previous government in 2017-18 against Arif, Irshad and Khan Mohd." "Our government will see if the investigation was done with predetermined intentions," he added.

headlines: 5 Indian sailors kidnapped in Nigeria released after two months
text: Five Indian sailors who were kidnapped by pirates from a ship in Nigeria in April have been released, Minister of State for Shipping, Mansukh L Mandaviya, said. The Indian government had convened the Inter-Ministerial Group of Officers to deal with the situation. Family members of the abducted sailors claimed that they got ransom calls for $1 million from the abductors.

headlines: Anand Mahindra replies to man who asked him to buy Jet Airways
text: Mahindra Group's billionaire Chairman Anand Mahindra replied to a man who asked him to buy Jet Airways and rename the airline 'Mahindra Airways'. "Remember the quote: 'If you want to be a millionaire, start with a Billion dollars and then start (buy) an airline!'" Mahindra replied. The Mumbai-based airline is currently undergoing bankruptcy resolution.

headlines: US oil output exceeds 12 million barrels a day for first time
text: US crude oil output in April rose to a fresh monthly record, surpassing 12 million barrels per day for the first time. Booming shale production, helped by fracking technology, has enabled US oil output to overtake Saudi Arabia and Russia. The US produced 12.16 million barrels a day of crude in the month, up 2.1% from a month earlier.

headlines: Would like to make film on 2019 WC, if India wins: '83 makers
text: Makers of '83, a film based on India's victory in the 1983 Cricket World Cup, have said that they would like to make a film on 2019 Cricket World Cup if India wins it. Actor Ranveer Singh will portray former India captain Kapil Dev in '83. Directed by Kabir Khan, '83 is slated to release on April 10, 2020.

headlines: Who is Man Utd's new £50 million player Aaron Wan-Bissaka?
text: Manchester United on Saturday announced that they have signed England Under-21 right-back Aaron Wan-Bissaka from Crystal Palace for five years in a £50 million deal. The 21-year-old, who made his first-team debut for Palace last year, is the English football club's fifth-biggest signing, behind Paul Pogba, Romelu Lukaku, Angel Di Maria and Fred.

headlines: Rapinoe's brace takes USA past hosts France into WC semis
text: Megan Rapinoe struck twice as the United States beat hosts France 2-1 in the Women's World Cup quarter-finals at the Parc des Princes on Friday to set up a last-four clash with England. USA maintained its record of never missing the Women's World Cup semi-finals. "We hit them where it hurt, we took our chances," Rapinoe said.

headlines: Twitter to label political leaders' tweets that violate rules
text: Twitter will start to add a notice on certain tweets which violate its rules but might be in "the public's interest to have access to". Twitter will consider tweets from accounts representing or belonging to government officials, those running for office or those considered for a government position. The accounts would need to have over 1,00,000 followers and be verified.

headlines: Anti-Romeo squad will encourage hooliganism: Aam Aadmi Party
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday opposed the idea of anti-Romeo squad in the national capital proposed by BJP Delhi chief Manoj Tiwari. AAP spokesperson Sanjay Singh said the anti-Romeo squad will encourage hooliganism by the BJP party workers. "There are many instances where the members of this squad have misbehaved with the father-daughter on the streets," Singh added.

headlines: Employee skill improvement startup Degreed gets $75 million
text: US-based startup Degreed, that helps organisations improve staff skills, has raised $75 million in a mix of equity and debt funding. The $35-million equity funding saw participation from existing investors including Owl Ventures and Jump Capital along with new investor AllianceBernstein, which also separately invested $40 million in venture debt. Degreed was founded in the year 2012.

headlines: Relatives vandalise Bihar hospital after newborn goes missing
text: Relatives of a woman on Saturday vandalised a hospital and vehicles parked at the premises, including an ambulance, after her newborn baby went missing, in Bihar's Nalanda district. The family alleged that the infant was stolen from the hospital premises by another woman. Police said that the situation was brought under control and an investigation has been launched.

headlines: Ex-Army man arrested for rape, murder of 4-yr-old in Chennai
text: Police have arrested former Army man Meenakshi Sundaram for allegedly raping and murdering a four-year-old girl in Chennai. Sundaram, who was a relative and neighbour of the victim, had gone with her parents to file a complaint at the police station to avoid suspicion. The 60-year-old's wife, Rajamma, has also been arrested for attempting to obstruct justice by cleaning evidence.

headlines: Uttar Pradesh govt includes 17 OBC castes in Scheduled Castes list
text: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has included 17 Other Backward Classes (OBC) castes in the Scheduled Castes (SC) list. These castes include Kashyap, Mallah, Kumhar, Rajbhar and Prajapati among others. The people of these castes will get the benefits of reservation and other facilities on par with other SC castes.

headlines: Woman takes pic of bird feeding cigarette butt to chick at US beach
text: A woman named Karen Mason recently took a picture of a mother bird feeding a cigarette butt to her chick at a beach in Florida, US. "If you smoke, please dont leave your butts behind," she wrote on Facebook. She posted another picture of the chick and wrote, "It's time we clean beaches and stop treating them like an ashtray."

headlines: Google Maps now predicts how crowded trains, buses will be
text: Google Maps has announced a new feature that predicts how crowded a train or bus will be, based on past rides. "You'll start to see [the feature] roll out...in nearly 200 cities around the globe on both Android and iOS [now]," Google said. Earlier, several social media users had noted Google was asking them how crowded their commute was.

headlines: Delhi CM tweets review of Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Article 15', trolled
text: After Ayushmann Khurrana starrer 'Article 15' released on Friday, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Watched Article 15. V powerful movie." Several users responded to the tweet, with one saying, "Welcome Back Arvind Kejriwal ji...Finally you're back in business!!" "Watched Delhi Loksabha election results. V powerful verdict," another tweet read, while someone tweeted, "Become a professional movie critic, leave this job."

headlines: Russia will do all it can to improve relations with US: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that Russia will do all that it can to improve relations with the United States. When asked during a news conference at the G20 Summit about the probability of more US sanctions against Russia, Putin said it was up to the US to decide how best to build relations with his country.

headlines: US deploys F-22 jets to Qatar for 1st time amid tensions with Iran
text: The US has deployed F-22 stealth fighter jets to Qatar for the first time amid tensions with Iran. The jets arrived at the Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar on Thursday, a statement by the US Air Forces Central Command said. This comes after Iran shot down a US military drone, which it claimed was flying in its territory.

headlines: India, Indonesia set $50 billion target for bilateral trade by 2025
text: India and Indonesia on Saturday set a $50 billion target for bilateral trade by 2025. Trade between the two countries in 2018-19 stood at $21.1 billion, with Indonesia's exports to India reaching $15.84 billion. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Indonesian President Joko Widodo, who were in Japan for the G20 Summit, met and discussed ways to boost bilateral ties.

headlines: After losing 95% of market cap, Deutsche may fire 20,000 employees
text: Germany's biggest lender Deutsche Bank is planning to cut as many as 20,000 jobs, representing over one-fifth of its global workforce of about 91,000, the Wall Street Journal reported. The layoffs would take place over the coming year and would spread across regions and businesses, it added. Deutsche shares have erased 95% of their value since record highs in 2007.

headlines: Trump says he'll allow China's Huawei to buy from US suppliers
text: Following talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Saturday, US President Donald Trump said he will allow Huawei to buy products from US suppliers. "We're talking about equipment where there's no great national security problem with it," he added. The Trump administration has alleged the Chinese government could use Huawei's products to spy on countries, a charge the company denies.

headlines: Brahman Samaj moves SC over title of film 'Article 15'
text: Brahman Samaj of India has moved the Supreme Court against Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Article 15', seeking direction for the Censor Board to cancel the certification granted to it with respect to the film's title. It claimed that using the articles of the Constitution for film's title without government's approval is illegal. It also stated that the film shows various objectionable dialogues.

headlines: Trump shares fist bump with PM Modi at G20 summit
text: US President Donald Trump shared a fist bump with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe as they met during the G20 summit in Osaka, Japan on Friday. The three leaders held trilateral talks on the sidelines of the summit. Trump also congratulated PM Modi on his recent victory in the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: England qualify for 2020 Olympics after France WC defeat
text: Host nation France's elimination from the Women's World Cup after defeat to the United States on Friday helped Great Britain's women's team qualify for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Out of the 12 qualifiers for the women's football competition at next year's Olympic Games, three come from the three best performing European sides at this World Cup.

headlines: Samsung making out-folding phone, may launch before Huawei: Report
text: South Korean technology giant Samsung is reportedly mass producing an outward-folding phone, which may launch even before Chinese smartphone maker Huawei's first, similarly folding phone. Huawei's out-folding phone Mate X is reportedly set to launch in September. This comes a few days after reports said Samsung may be working on a foldable phone with a clamshell-like, vertically foldable design.

headlines: Andhra govt reduces former CM Chandrababu Naidu's security
text: The Jagan Mohan Reddy-led Andhra Pradesh government on Friday reduced the security cover provided to former Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to 2+2 gunmen. However, Naidu will continue to have Z plus category security provided by the Centre. This comes days after the security of Naidu's son and former state minister Nara Lokesh was reduced from Z category to 2+2 gunmen.

headlines: Dalits stopped from using public well in Tamil Nadu village
text: People belonging to the Dalit community were reportedly restricted from drawing water from a public well in a Tamil Nadu village. Locals said the well is 'sacred' and over 150 people use its water for drinking purposes. "Untouchability is prevalent in the village...People who practice untouchability must be [prosecuted] under the SC/ST Act," said Kathiravan, an NGO official.

headlines: India should become best in disaster management: Amit Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said it's time to work and ensure that India becomes the best nation in disaster management. "The path...is long but that should be our target," he added while addressing the National Disaster Response Force's (NDRF) conference. Shah emphasised that there should be a clear 'chain of command' when multiple stakeholders combat a disaster.

headlines: PM Modi meets Turkey's President on sidelines of G20 summit
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday met Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the sidelines of the two-day G20 Summit. The Prime Minister's Office tweeted, "A productive meeting with President Erdogan on the sidelines of the #G20 Summit. Both leaders talked about the strong development partnership between India and Turkey."

headlines: Start Anti-Romeo squads in Delhi as well: Manoj Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari on Saturday praised the anti-Romeo squads introduced by the Uttar Pradesh government, adding that they should be started in Delhi as well. "It should be welcomed as it is related to women's safety," Tiwari said. The squads were started to check stalkers and eve-teasers after Yogi Adityanath assumed the office of Chief Minister in 2017.

headlines: Centre freezes advertisements in Times, ABP, Hindu: Report
text: The Centre froze advertisements in three newspaper groups namely the Times Group, the ABP Group and The Hindu, reported Reuters on Friday, which the government has denied. They claimed that they were deprived of ads worth lakhs of rupees even before the general elections. The freeze could be because of unfavourable reports published, an executive was quoted as saying.

headlines: Fictional: Sunaina's boyfriend on rumours of being already married
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina's boyfriend Ruhail Amin turned down the rumours stating he's currently married to another woman as 'fictional'. "Fictional pieces floating around my personal life are dumbed down versions of gossip journalism," he tweeted. "I would like the so called "family source"...to come out in the open and substantiate this gibberish," he said in response to an article.

headlines: Don't 'Chuck' De helmet, Sachin trolls SRK for riding without helmet
text: Sachin Tendulkar trolled Shah Rukh Khan after the latter shared a video on completing 27 years in Bollywood. In the video, Shah Rukh was seen approaching the camera on a bike without wearing a helmet. "Dear Baazigar, don't 'Chuck' De helmet. Wear one when on a bike Jab Tak Hai Jaan. Congratulations on completing 27 years!" Sachin tweeted.

headlines: Team India don orange-blue jersey for first time, pics out
text: The first photos of Team India players donning the orange-blue jersey ahead of their 2019 World Cup match against England are out. Several players, including Yuzvendra Chahal and Mohammad Shami, took to social media to share pictures of themselves wearing the new kit for a photoshoot. "Ready to rumble in new jersey," wrote Chahal in his Instagram post.

headlines: DeepNude app which created fake nude pics of women shut by creators
text: DeepNude app which used Artificial Intelligence to create women's fake nude pictures has been closed by its Estonian creators fearing "misuse" hours after it went viral. "We created this project for the user's entertainment...We thought we were selling a few sales every month in a controlled manner," the makers said. "We don't want to make money this way," they added.

headlines: Sheila Dikshit dissolves all 280 Delhi Congress block committees
text: Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit dissolved all the 280 block-level committees of the party with immediate effect on Friday, hours after meeting party president Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit took this decision "keeping in line with" a report submitted by a five-member fact-finding committee constituted to probe the reasons behind Congress' defeat in the Lok Sabha elections, a party statement said.

headlines: I was undergoing treatment: Tejashwi on his absence after polls
text: Responding to speculations related to his absence after the Lok Sabha polls, RJD leader and Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav said he has been busy undergoing treatment for a knee injury for the last few weeks. "However, I'm amused to see political opponents as well as a section of media cooking up spicy stories," he added.

headlines: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes to go to trial for fraud in 2020
text: Shut down Silicon Valley-based blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes, along with former Theranos President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, is set to stand trial next year on fraud charges. The two were indicted in June 2018 on 11 counts of conspiracy and wire fraud. Notably, The Wall Street Journal had first questioned the reliability of the startup's blood-testing device in 2015.

headlines: Bullet train station reworked to reduce affected mangroves to 32,044
text: The National High Speed Rail Corporation Limited (NHSRCL) has said that they have reworked the design of the bullet train station in Maharashtra's Thane to reduce the number of affected mangroves from the estimated 53,000 to 32,044. All the required wildlife, forest and CRZ clearance has been taken. Around 1,60,000 new mangroves will be planted by the NHSRCL in compensation.

headlines: Heavy rainfall in Mumbai for next 3 days, predicts IMD
text: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rainfall in Mumbai for the next three days. Further, on Saturday, the minimum and maximum temperatures are expected to hover around 24 degree Celsius and 31 degree Celsius with relative humidity at 89%. According to Skymet, so far Mumbai has recorded 404 mm of rainfall against the average of 493 mm.

headlines: UP doctor beaten up by patient's relatives; he was allegedly drunk
text: An allegedly drunk doctor was beaten up by a patient's relatives at a community health centre in Uttar Pradesh's Kasganj. "My relative was injured in a road accident. The doctor didn't attend him and instead fell on him," a relative said. Meanwhile, another relative said the doctor had hit the patient's differently abled brother, which led to a fight.

headlines: Swine flu claimed over 1,000 lives in India this year
text: As many as 1,076 people died due to swine flu in India this year until June 23, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has stated. The number of people infected by the virus stands at 26,140. Over 200 people died due to swine flu in Rajasthan, which recorded the highest death toll from the virus among states in India.

headlines: India invites G20 nations to join coalition on disaster management
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has invited G20 nations to join the International Coalition on Disaster Resilient Infrastructure. The infrastructure is required not only for development, but it is also necessary to combat natural calamities, PM Modi said. Calling upon nations to join the coalition, PM Modi added that disasters affect poor people the most.

headlines: Police replies after Priyanka says criminals roaming free in UP
text: UP Police has responded after Congress' Priyanka Gandhi questioned the law and order situation in the state. Gandhi had said in a tweet, "Criminals are roaming free in the state. Crimes are being committed one after the other." "Serious crimes have been investigated by the police and 9225 criminals have been arrested in 2 years," the UP Police tweeted.

headlines: Chile beat Colombia on penalties to reach Copa semi-finals
text: Chile reached the semi-final stage of the Copa America 2019 after beating Colombia on penalties on Friday. Chile are aiming to win their third straight Copa America title. Manchester United's Chilean forward Alexis Sanchez scored the decisive penalty of the shootout. Chile will face the winner of the match between Uruguay and Peru.

headlines: New jersey will look striking on a lush green field, tweets user
text: Reacting to India's away jersey for the ongoing edition of the World Cup, a user's tweet read, "That will look striking on a lush green field... The colour scheme seems to be inspired from the classic black and orange." "Love the front. Little more blue at the back and we could use this for at least T20Is," read another tweet.

headlines: No favourite in Argentina-Brazil Copa semi-final: Messi
text: Argentine forward and national team captain Lionel Messi said that there is no favourite team ahead of his side's Copa America 2019 semi-final against hosts Brazil. Argentina reached the semi-final stage of the tournament after beating Venezuela 2-0 on Friday. "We respect them, we know what Brazil represent," Messi added ahead of the clash.

headlines: Extremely saddened: Maha CM after wall collapse leaves 15 dead
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis offered condolences to the families of the 15 people who lost their lives in the wall collapse incident in Pune on Saturday. Fadnavis said he was extremely saddened by the incident, and added, "Praying for speedy recovery of the injured." He further said he has ordered an in-depth inquiry into the mishap.

headlines: Article 370 has to go lock, stock & barrel: BJP's Ram Madhav
text: BJP National General Secretary Ram Madhav on Saturday said the Central government is committed to repealing Article 370, which gives special autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir. Madhav added, "Article 370 has to go lock, stock and barrel... When it was introduced by former PM Nehru, he himself had said that it was temporary and would erode on its own."

headlines: Starship spacecraft's 1st commercial flight likely in 2021: SpaceX
text: Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX has announced it plans to launch the first commercial flight of 'Starship', the spaceship of its now-renamed BFR rocket, in 2021. SpaceX revealed it's presently in talks with three telecom firms for the first mission. The goal is to get orbital as quickly as possible, "potentially even this year", SpaceX added on flying the Starship.

headlines: 1 dead, 2 missing while working in Delhi Jal Board drain
text: One labourer died and two others went missing while working at a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) drain in Khyala area of the national capital on Friday. As per reports, the labourers were washed away when the Delhi Jal Board started the water supply. The labourers were reportedly repairing a bar screen that filters large objects from sewage water.

headlines: 70 wedding guests hospitalised after lizard found in food
text: Over 70 wedding guests underwent a medical check-up in a hospital after a dead lizard was found in the food at a marriage ceremony in Dumka district, Jharkhand. Several guests reportedly fell ill and started vomiting after the lizard was found. Meanwhile, SP YS Ramesh said that doctors confirmed that the guests were out of danger.

headlines: 3 guests warned for violating Team India's privacy at UK hotel
text: Three guests were given an official warning for violating Team India's privacy at their hotel in Birmingham. As per reports, the guests, who were seemingly drunk, shouted and turned aggressive in the lobby of the hotel. The trio pestered for photographs with Team India members and also clicked photos of their family members. The security was enhanced following the incident.

headlines: Negative, pathetic mindset: Vaughan on Bairstow's remark
text: After England wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow said that people were waiting for England to fail, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "How wrong can Bairstow be." "Never has England team had so much support but its you and your team that has disappointed Jonny," he added. "Its not the medias fault you have lost 3 games," he further said.

headlines: Dhoni a legend of the game, has a keen understanding: Kohli
text: Following MS Dhoni's unbeaten 61-ball 56-run knock against West Indies in 2019 World Cup, India captain Virat Kohli said, "He's a legend of the game. He has such a keen understanding of the game." "Dhoni knows exactly what he wants to do...When he has an off day here and there, everyone starts talking but we've always backed him," he added.

headlines: Female boxer assaulted in broad daylight in Kolkata, 3 arrested
text: Suman Kumari, an international woman boxer, was allegedly verbally abused and physically assaulted in broad daylight in Kolkata on Friday by a man when she was going to office on a two-wheeler. Suman said the man threw abuses at her and then beat her up "for absolutely no reason". As many as three men have been arrested in the case.

headlines: BJP leader beats govt official with sticks in MP, denied bail
text: BJP Panchayat President Ram Sushil Patel was denied bail and sent to judicial custody on Friday for allegedly thrashing Satna Nagar Panchayat Chief Municipal Officer Devratna Soni with sticks in Satna, MP. Several others were also involved in the assault on Devratna, who is currently undergoing treatment for injuries in a hospital. Meanwhile, Patel is claiming that he was thrashed.

headlines: Serve almonds, not biscuits in ministry meetings: Health Ministry
text: Health Ministry has issued a circular stating that only healthy snacks like dates, almond, walnuts and 'bhuna channa' would be served in official meetings of the department and biscuits will be avoided. The circular further stated that the departmental canteen would no longer dispense biscuits or cookies. It also urged officials to follow order of not using plastic water bottles.

headlines: UP woman buries 2-month-old baby, sets house on fire; arrested
text: A woman has been arrested after she allegedly buried her two-month-old daughter in her house and set it on fire in Sitapur, Uttar Pradesh. Assistant Superintendent of Police Madhuban Singh said, "She was depressed as her daughter was ill and was not responding to any treatment. After her daughter died, she... set fire to the house and fled."

headlines: Team sent to retrieve bodies of AN-32 victims stuck at crash site
text: A team of 12 rescuers that retrieved bodies of 13 people who were on board IAF's AN-32 aircraft which crashed in the mountains of Arunachal Pradesh this month has been stuck at the crash site. "The weather condition is not conducive at all to lift them," officials said. The rescuers have been at the crash site since June 12.

headlines: Australian PM tweets 'Kitna acha hai Modi'; PM Modi responds
text: While sharing a selfie with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison wrote, "[Kitna] acha [hai] Modi!" Responding to Morrison's tweet, PM Modi wrote, "Mate, I'm stoked about the energy of our bilateral relationship!". The two leaders met during the G20 Summit in Osaka, Japan. PM Modi met several world leaders during the summit.

headlines: IPS trainee gets notice for hands in pocket when senior passed by him
text: A show-cause notice was issued to an Indian Police Service trainee in Hyderabad because he had kept his hands in his trouser pockets when a senior officer's car was passing by on June 22. The letter called the incident "an act of indiscipline and misconduct" and gave him 2 days to reply. The officer has completed 22 months of training.

headlines: Would like to meet Kim for 2 mins at North, S Korea border: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said he would like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un at the demilitarised zone (DMZ) on the border of North and South Korea. "I would meet him...just to shake his hand and say hello...If he's there, we'll see each other for two minutes," Trump added. Trump will arrive in South Korea later on Saturday.

headlines: N Korea responds after Trump says want to meet Kim for 2 minutes
text: After US President Donald Trump said that he would like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un for two minutes, North Korea called it a "very interesting suggestion". However, North Korea said it hasn't received an official proposal. Trump had said he would like to meet Kim at the demilitarised zone (DMZ) on the border of North and South Korea.

headlines: India's forex reserves hit record high of $426.42 billion
text: India's foreign exchange reserves touched a life-time high of $426.42 billion as of June 21, up $4.215 billion from a week ago, the RBI said on Friday. The previous high was attained on April 13, 2018, when it was $426.08 billion. Foreign currency assets, a major component of the overall reserves, increased by $4.2 billion to $398.65 billion.

headlines: Apple shifts Mac Pro production to China from US: Report
text: Apple is shifting manufacturing of its new $6,000 Mac Pro computer to China from the US, The Wall Street Journal reported. This comes weeks after the Trump administration hiked tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese imports to 25%. "Mac Pro...includes components from several countries including the US," Apple said, adding, "Final assembly is only one part of the manufacturing process."

headlines: In India, it's barely day one for Amazon: India head Amit Agarwal
text: Amit Agarwal, Senior VP and Country Manager of Amazon India, in an interview with YourStory said the e-commerce giant is committed to India and the transformation ahead of itself. "It's barely day one for us," he said, adding, "It's very humbling to see the momentum we have gained in last six years." Amazon was launched in India in June 2013.

headlines: Ola to invest in Bengaluru online lending startup Avail Finance
text: Ola has announced it plans to invest an undisclosed amount in Bengaluru-based online lending platform Avail Finance. The ride-hailing giant is entering into a strategic partnership with the lending platform to build financial solutions for its 15 lakh drivers. Last year, Avail Finance had raised $17.2 million from Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal, Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal, among others.

headlines: Grab gets $300 million from American investment manager Invesco
text: Southeast Asian ride-hailing startup Grab has raised $300 million, at a reported valuation of over $14 billion, in a Series H funding round. The investment came from American investment management firm Invesco. This comes a few months after Grab's CEO Anthony Tan announced the SoftBank-backed startup is looking to raise $2 billion more in its $4.5-billion Series H round.

headlines: PM Modi meets Indonesian president on sidelines of G20 summit
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday held a bilateral meeting with Indonesian President Joko Widodo in Japanese city Osaka on the sidelines of the G20 summit. PM Modi congratulated Widodo for winning a second term in the April 17 presidential elections in Indonesia. The leaders also discussed trade and investment, as well as expanding cooperation in defence, maritime and space.

headlines: Trump is an illegitimate President: Ex-US President Jimmy Carter
text: Former US President Jimmy Carter has said US President Donald Trump is an "illegitimate" President. "If fully investigated, it'd show that Trump didn't actually win the election in 2016. He lost the election and he was put in office because the Russians interfered...on his behalf," he added. Trump should condemn the meddling by Russia in the elections, he further said.

headlines: Bingo! releases anthem Come on India for all cricket lovers
text: Bingo! has announced the release of sports anthem Come on India, composed by Shameer Tandon in the voice of Shaan. The iconic cheer of Come on India from the late 90s has been brought to life in this latest anthem. The video features 'dancing uncle', who went viral in the recent past along with several popular TVF web-series actors.

headlines: No hero wanted to work with me as film was named 'Khoobsurat': Sonam
text: Sonam Kapoor has revealed in an interview that no male actor wanted to work with her in the movie 'Khoobsurat' because of its title. "I had to get Fawad Khan from Pakistan. And look what happened. Fawad became a huge star. He had the confidence," she said. 'Khoobsurat', which released in 2014, was Fawad Khan's first Indian movie.

headlines: Dhoni's innings against West Indies was top rated: Jasprit Bumrah
text: Talking about ex-India captain MS Dhoni's knock of 56*(61) against West Indies in 2019 World Cup on Thursday, fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah said it was a top-rated innings. "The innings that he played is the kind which is very underrated. Sometimes you might feel...he's batting slow but sometimes it is important that he takes time, which he did," he added.

headlines: People were waiting for us to fail: England's Jonny Bairstow
text: Reacting to ex-cricketers criticising England in World Cup, wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow said that, "People now are paid to have an opinion, so theyve got to have an opinion." "Because weve done so well, any opportunity for someone to see weve lost two games, they were always going to jump on it. People were waiting for us to fail," he added.

headlines: Chris Gayle playing Test is a backward step: Curtly Ambrose
text: After West Indies opener Chris Gayle said that he could play a Test against India at home after the 2019 World Cup, ex-West Indies pacer Curtly Ambrose said that bringing Gayle back to play a Test is a backward step. "Gayle hasn't played Test matches for five years. What kind of message are you sending to younger players?" he added.

headlines: I am there to get Kohli out: Moeen ahead of India-England match
text: Ahead of India-England World Cup match, England all-rounder Moeen Ali said he is there to get Virat Kohli out. "It means a lot to get a player like him out but you can be still be friends trying to do it. The key here is respect," he added. "We have known each other since our under-19 days," he further said.

headlines: Cottrell reacts to Shami copying his salute celebration in Hindi
text: Reacting to Team India pacer Mohammad Shami copying his salute celebration, West Indies pacer Sheldon Cottrell tweeted in Hindi. "Great fun! Great bowling. Nakal Karna Hi Sabse Badi Chaploosi Hai," he wrote. Cottrell was responding to a tweet by Fox Sports Asia which read, "Blatant disrespect to the Army or just plain fun? What did you make of Shami's celebration?"

headlines: Amla-Du Plessis' unbeaten 175-run stand helps SA beat SL by 9 wickets
text: South Africa opener Hashim Amla and captain Faf du Plessis shared an unbeaten 175-run stand to help their team defeat Sri Lanka by nine wickets in the 2019 World Cup on Friday. South Africa are now eighth on the points table with five points from eight matches, while Sri Lanka are seventh with six points from seven matches.

headlines: Karnataka government bans carpooling by Ola and Uber
text: The Karnataka Transport Department on Friday imposed a ban on carpooling service offered by cab aggregators Ola and Uber. Transport Commissioner VP Eickery has said that carpooling is not permissible under the current provisions of the licences afforded to the aggregators, and action would be taken against Ola and Uber if they continue to feature the option.

headlines: IAF shares video of bird hit incident, praises pilot for saving lives
text: The IAF today shared a video of Jaguar jet which suffered an engine failure after flying into a flock of birds near Ambala airbase. The IAF commended the pilot for jettisoning the fuel drop tanks and Carrier Bomb Light Stores (CBLS) Pods, and safely landing the aircraft. The quick thinking by the pilot saved lives of many civilians, IAF added.

headlines: 1 migrant child died every day since 2014: UN
text: At least one migrant child died every day since 2014 while they tried to reach safety, the United Nations' International Organization for Migration (IOM) said. At least 32,000 migrants globally, including 1,600 children died in their journeys. Most of the fatalities occurred while crossing the Mediterranean, the report titled 'Fatal Journeys', revealed.

headlines: France records its highest temperature in history
text: France recorded a temperature of 45.9°C in Gallargues-le-Montueux on Friday, the highest in its history. France's weather service has issued a red alert for four areas amid a heatwave in all of Europe and officials have advised people to stay indoors. As many as 4,000 schools in France have been closed or introduced measures to protect children from the heat.

headlines: EU clears $34-billion IBM deal to buy software firm Red Hat
text: EU's antitrust authority on Thursday unconditionally approved IT giant IBM's biggest acquisition deal of $34 billion to take over open-source software company Red Hat. If approved by authorities worldwide, the tie-up will be the third biggest tech merger in history, according to CNBC. "The Commission concluded the transaction would raise no competition concerns," the antitrust authority said.

headlines: Challenge to take party to booth level: Chhattisgarh Cong head
text: Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee's (CPCC) newly appointed chief Mohan Markam on Friday said it's a big challenge to take the party to booth level again in the state. "It is a challenge for me as the CPCC President...(and) I will meet these challenges," he added. Markam was appointed as the Chhattisgarh unit chief earlier today by Congress President Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: No possibility of Rahul Gandhi continuing as Cong chief: Moily
text: Congress leader M Veerappa Moily on Friday said there is no possibility of the party President Rahul Gandhi continuing on his post and Congress Working Committee (CWC) would decide on the matter. "Today, I don't...(think there) is even 1% (possibility) of his coming back," he added. "Unless his resignation is accepted by CWC, speculations...will go on," Moily further said.

headlines: Shah's argument for extending Prez Rule in J&K unacceptable: Omar
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah on Friday said Home Minister Amit Shah's argument for extending President's Rule in J&K for six months is "unacceptable". "Argument is that because Congress used Article 356 more times than anyone else, [BJP] is justified in denying the people of J&K an elected government," he tweeted. However, Lok Sabha later approved Shah's proposal.

headlines: 3 dead, 5 injured due to heavy rains in Mumbai
text: Three persons lost their lives and five others were injured in rain-related incidents on Friday in Mumbai. A Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) spokesperson said that three died of electric shocks, while two others were injured in two separate incidents in the western suburbs. Waterlogging was also reported in many parts of the city after a few hours of heavy rains.

headlines: Hyderabad police to honour those following traffic rules
text: Drivers following traffic rules in Hyderabad will now be honoured with appreciation certificates by the city police under their 'Patrol for Happy Driving' program. The program was launched by Rachakonda Police Commissionerate on Thursday. Rachakonda traffic police will identify 8,000 safe drivers and they will be honoured with a 'safe driver' sticker on their vehicle and a certificate.

headlines: Doing whatever is needed to be done: Paswan on AES outbreak
text: Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan on Friday said he's doing whatever needs to be done to deal with the Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) outbreak in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. "If somebody goes there you call it nautanki, if we don't then you say why didn't you go," he told media. As per reports, over 150 children have died due to the outbreak.

headlines: AES deaths due to administrative failure, state apathy: Report
text: A team from AIIMS in its report has blamed administrative failure and state's apathy for the deaths due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. As per the report, all deaths occurred in children aged 1.5-12 years, belonging to families of lower socio-economic strata. The AES outbreak in the state has claimed the lives of 154 children this year.

headlines: India's orange-blue jersey for England match officially unveiled
text: The official apparel sponsor of BCCI, Nike, today formally unveiled Team India's orange-blue jersey for their World Cup match against England. India will wear the away jersey on June 30, so it doesn't clash with England's blue jersey. The ICC had said various colour options were given to BCCI and they chose the combination that "looked the best to them".

headlines: Lok Sabha approves extension of President's Rule in J&K
text: The Lok Sabha on Friday approved a proposal to extend proclamation of President's Rule in Jammu and Kashmir for six more months. The House also passed the Jammu and Kashmir Reservation (Amendment) Bill, 2019, which proposes to give reservation in educational institutions and government jobs to people living within 10 km of the International Border in J&K.

headlines: Swarm of bees temporarily halt SA-SL match, players lie on ground
text: A huge swarm of bees passing through the Riverside Ground stadium at Chester-le-Street temporarily halted the 2019 World Cup match between South Africa and Sri Lanka. All the players and umpires on the field lay down on the ground, waiting for the bees to cross. Interestingly, a Sri Lanka-South Africa ODI in 2017 was also temporarily halted because of bees.

headlines: Nasser asks Pak fans who they are supporting in India-England match
text: Former England captain Nasser Hussain took to Twitter to ask Pakistan fans who they're supporting in India-England match as an India win could better Pakistan's chances of qualifying for World Cup semi-finals. "Neighbours over invaders," a fan tweeted, while another wrote, "Neighbours first." Hussain later tweeted he was half expecting "anger and aggression", but he received "love and humour".

headlines: I don't fight with women, jokes Rijiju as Mary Kom asks him to fight
text: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju took to Twitter to share a video of himself meeting athletes including six-time boxing champion Mary Kom at Delhi's Indira Gandhi Stadium sports training centre. He revealed Kom insisted he fight with her but he was so scared that he had to make an excuse. "So...I said, 'I don't fight with women'," he jokingly added.

headlines: CCI found Google likely misused Android dominance in India: Reuters
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) had found Google may have misused its dominant position and reduced ability of device manufacturers to opt for alternate versions of Android. CCI, in a 14-page order reviewed by Reuters, alleged this seemed to amount to imposition of "unfair conditions" under India's competition law. CCI had ordered a probe on Google in April after this.

headlines: Nehru gave that portion of Kashmir to Pakistan: Amit Shah
text: While speaking on the Kashmir issue in the Parliament, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "Jawaharlal Nehru gave that portion of Kashmir to Pakistan." He further said, "Jawaharlal Nehru had called for ceasefire back then without taking the then Home Minister Sardar Patel into confidence." "The nation is paying heavy price for these mistakes," Shah added.

headlines: Interest rate on Small Savings Schemes reduced, PPF to fetch 7.9%
text: The government has reduced interest rate on Small Savings Schemes, including Public Provident Fund (PPF), which will now fetch 7.9% interest rate for the July-September quarter, down from existing 8%. The 5-year Senior Citizen Savings Scheme will fetch 8.6%, while Sukanya Samriddhi Account Scheme 8.4%. The interest rate on small savings schemes was last revised for the October-December quarter.

headlines: Lady shot in fight charged with her foetus' death as she started it
text: Marshae Jones, a US woman, who during a fight was shot in the stomach when she was pregnant, has been charged for the death of her unborn child as she had initiated the fight. Jones was five months pregnant in December last year when she was shot by Ebony Jemison. Police said that Jemison had shot Jones to defend herself.

headlines: Paris bans 60% of its cars as heatwave worsens air pollution
text: The French capital of Paris has banned up to 60% of registered cars from its roads as a record heatwave worsens air pollution, officials said. The ban has been placed on nearly five million vehicles, covering older and less efficient ones. Notably, France recorded its all-time hottest temperature of 45.1°C amid a heatwave in all of Europe.

headlines: End irresponsible activity to improve relations: UK PM to Putin
text: British PM Theresa May told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday that Russia must end its "irresponsible and destabilising activity" if relations between the two countries were to improve. Relations between the two countries soured after the poisoning of a former Russian spy in the UK. May also told Putin to hand over Russian suspects Britain blames for the poisoning.

headlines: Lego family to buy Legoland and Madame Tussauds owner for $7.5 bn
text: A consortium led by the family that controls toymaker Lego has agreed to buy UK's Merlin Entertainments for $7.5 billion including debt. Merlin operates theme parks including Legoland and counts Madame Tussauds wax museums and the London Eye among its attractions. Last year, Merlin had 67 million visitors at its more than 120 attractions across 25 countries, including India.

headlines: Ishaan Khatter denies reports of starring in 'Ishq Vishk 2'
text: Ishaan Khatter has denied reports of starring in 'Ishq Vishk 2', a sequel to his half-brother Shahid Kapoor's 2003 film. Ishq Vishk was Shahid's debut movie as a leading man. Confirming reports of a sequel, producer Ramesh Taurani said, "We are definitely making the sequel to Ishq Vishk. But we haven't decided the cast as yet."

headlines: AC Milan out of Europa League 2019-20 due to fair play breach
text: Seven-time European champions AC Milan have been excluded from competing in the 2019-20 season of the Europa League for breaching UEFA's Financial Fair Play (FFP) rules. Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) revealed in its statement that the Italian club had breached its FFP break-even obligations during the 2014-17 and the 2015-18 monitoring periods.

headlines: This is my last WC, but I wont retire after WC: Mortaza
text: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said that the ongoing World Cup will be his last World Cup but he will not be retiring from cricket after the tournament's end. "I don't want to think about it at the moment, especially with the tournament still in progress. It is a distraction. People become emotional during these times," Mortaza added.

headlines: Wayne Rooney scores from own half in MLS match
text: Former Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney scored from inside his own half while playing for DC United against Orlando City in the MLS on Wednesday. Rooney, who scored from around 70 metres out at the 10th-minute mark, had earlier scored from inside his own half for Everton against West Ham United in the Premier League in 2017.

headlines: MLA Mohan Markam appointed head of Chhattisgarh Congress
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday appointed Mohan Markam as head of the party's Chhattisgarh unit, which was previously headed by the state's Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel. Markam is the MLA from Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon. Notably, CM Baghel recently said that he has asked Gandhi to appoint someone to head the state unit as his hands are full as the CM.

headlines: Shah seeks report from MP BJP on Akash Vijayvargiya incident
text: BJP President Amit Shah has sought a report from the Madhya Pradesh BJP after party's MLA Akash Vijayvargiya thrashed a Municipal Corporation officer in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. As per reports, Shah has asked the state leadership to provide the exact sequence of events. BJP will take a final call on Vijayvargiya after studying all the facts, the reports said.

headlines: BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiyas assault victim admitted to ICU
text: Municipal Corporation officer Dhirendra Singh Bais, who was attacked by BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya with a cricket bat on Wednesday, has been admitted to the ICU of a private hospital. Bais was admitted late on Thursday night for treatment of high blood pressure, said a doctor of the medical facility. His condition is now stable, the doctor added.

headlines: Facebook-backed Meesho in talks with Naspers to raise $130M: Report
text: Bengaluru-based e-commerce startup Meesho is reportedly in talks with South African multinational conglomerate Naspers to raise up to $130 million. This investment can raise Meesho's valuation to $600-650 million, almost three times more than its previous funding round, the report added. This comes weeks after Facebook made its first direct India startup investment of reportedly about $25 million.

headlines: NASA mission to Saturn's largest moon to search for signs of life
text: NASA, under its Dragonfly mission, will send an eight-rotor drone-like vehicle to Saturn's largest moon Titan to search for origins and signs of life. Dragonfly is scheduled to launch in 2026 and arrive on Titan in 2034. Planned to last at least 2.7 years, Dragonfly will become the first to fly its entire science payload to new places outside Earth.

headlines: 50% of 9,000 vacancies in Railways for women: Piyush Goyal
text: Railways Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday announced that recruitment in 50% of over 9,000 vacancies coming up for the posts of Constables and Sub-Inspectors in the Indian Railways will be for women. In January, Goyal had announced that four lakh people, including 10% quota for economically weaker section in general category, will be hired by the Indian Railways by 2021.

headlines: 5, including child, killed after bus collides with truck in UP
text: At least five people, including a child, died and around 40 others were injured after a bus collided with a stationary truck on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The accident occurred after the bus' driver fell asleep on the wheel. The drivers of both vehicles fled the scene, leaving the victims trapped inside the bus, police said.

headlines: Happy to do it: Kangana as CBFC orders 'Mental Hai Kya' title change
text: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has ordered the makers of Kangana Ranaut and Rajkummar Rao starrer 'Mental Hai Kya' to change the title of the film. Speaking about the order, Ranaut said, "There'll be a mild, small change in the title...So we're more than happy to do that." This comes after medical fraternity objected to the film's title.

headlines: Rohit shares proof showing he was not out against West Indies
text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma, who was controversially declared caught-behind out by the third umpire against West Indies, shared proof on Twitter showing that he was not out. The 32-year-old shared a collage of two pictures, which showed that the ball had hit his pad and not the bat. Responding to the post, Mumbai Indians tweeted, "How?"

headlines: I'd consider Pant at no. 4 if I was part of management: Srikkanth
text: Ex-India cricketer Kris Srikkanth has said if he was in team management, he'd consider batting wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant at number four. "They've brought him over here now, he's ready to go and...importantly, he has played in England before so he understands the conditions," he added. "In middle order...Vijay Shankar and Kedar Jadhav are yet to really convince," he further said.

headlines: Mannequin Challenge videos help Google researchers train its AI
text: Google researchers revealed they used around 2,000 YouTube videos of the viral 2016 Mannequin Challenge to help its AI model better predict depth in videos shot with a moving camera. Researchers turned the clips into 2D images, estimated the camera pose and then created depth maps. This could help self-driving cars and robots better navigate unfamiliar areas, researchers said.

headlines: I take responsibility for Congress' defeat in MP: CM Kamal Nath
text: Madhya Pradesh CM and state Congress Committee chief Kamal Nath on Thursday said that he takes responsibility for Congress' defeat in Madhya Pradesh in the Lok Sabha elections. He further said that he had also offered his resignation as the state party chief. Congress won only one out of 29 seats in the state in the General elections.

headlines: We should give Rahul free hand: Congress RTI cell head quits
text: Rajya Sabha MP Vivek Tankha has resigned as chairman of Congress' Legal, Human Rights and RTI department. Tankha stated, "We all should submit our resignations from party positions and give Rahulji a free hand to choose his team." His resignation came after reports claimed that Rahul Gandhi was unhappy with state Congress chiefs allegedly not taking responsibility for LS results.

headlines: Saudi Arabia raises India's Haj quota by 30,000
text: Saudi Arabia has increased India's Haj quota from 170,000 to 200,000. The issue of India's Haj quota was discussed during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's bilateral talks with Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman in Japanese city Osaka. The two leaders also discussed the deepening cooperation in trade and investment, energy security and counter-terrorism.

headlines: Traffic jam, water-logging on roads, tracks as heavy rains hit Mumbai
text: Water-logging was reported at railway tracks and many places like Dharavi, Western Express Highway, and Andheri subway in Mumbai due to heavy rainfall on Friday. Routes have also been diverted in the city due to traffic jams. Moreover, some airlines have issued advisories for the passengers, asking them to take note of traffic jams and also check for delays.

headlines: He was declared a bad character: H'yana CM on Cong leader's death
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar while talking to media about Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary, who was shot dead in Faridabad, said, "He had 13 FIRs against him and he had been declared a bad character." He further said, "Anything could be possible with such a person, it could be personal enmity. Police teams have been formed, culprits won't be spared."

headlines: You deserve it: Trump congratulates PM Modi on election victory
text: US President Donald Trump congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his election victory as the two leaders met on the sidelines of the G20 summit. "You deserve it (victory). You've done a great job...I remember when you first took over, there were many factions and they were fighting with each other and now they get along," Trump told PM Modi.

headlines: Impeach me, I'll jail you: Philippine Prez Duterte to opponents
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has threatened opponents with prison if they try to impeach him. This comes as Duterte was accused of siding with China over the June 9 sinking of a Filipino fishing boat by a Chinese vessel. "I am challenging you to do it. You sons of bit**es," he further said.

headlines: Controlled explosion demolishes remains of collapsed Italy bridge
text: The remains of a collapsed bridge in the northern Italian city of Genoa were demolished in a controlled explosion, paving the way for a new structure. The Morandi bridge collapsed last year, killing 43 people.
