Thousands of people had been evacuated ahead of the explosion to bring down two large towers consisting of about 4,500 tonnes of concrete and steel.

headlines: Airtel Africa starts trading in London at $3.7 billion valuation
text: Airtel Africa listed on the London Stock Exchange on Friday at a 6.25% discount to its issue price, giving it a market capitalisation of $3.7 billion. With almost 100 million subscribers across 14 countries, Airtel Africa is the continent's second-largest mobile operator behind MTN Group. The company also listed its shares on the Nigerian Stock Exchange in a secondary listing.

headlines: ONGC invites partners to raise output from 64 oil and gas fields
text: State-run ONGC said it has issued a tender seeking partners to work with it on boosting output from 64 small oil and gas fields. The fields, located in 17 areas, were handed to ONGC without competition. Companies that work with ONGC will be free to market and sell their share of oil and gas output for up to 20 years.

headlines: Canon fined $32 mn by EU for unapproved takeover of Toshiba arm
text: The European Commission has imposed an around $32-million fine on Japanese multinational corporation Canon for partially implementing its acquisition of Toshiba's medical systems arm before notification and merger control approval. Canon said in a statement it "disagrees with the European Commission's legal assessment, which violates fundamental principles of law". It added it would appeal the fine.

headlines: Delhi BJP worker, son shot at by relative over property dispute
text: A 60-year-old local BJP worker named Raj Rani and her 35-year-old son Netrapal were allegedly shot at by their relative in Delhi on Friday morning over a property dispute. Raj, who received bullet injuries on her leg, is in a stable condition. However, her son, who was shot in his abdomen and hand, is in a critical condition.

headlines: Workers protest outside hospital after Cong leader's murder
text: A day after Haryana Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary was shot dead in Faridabad, Congress workers staged a protest outside the hospital over the delay in handing over Chaudhary's body. "Yesterday they informed us...all formalities were over but till now they haven't handed over the body. As chief minister is here, everyone is busy with him," said Congress leader Ashok Tanwar.

headlines: Former Andhra CM Naidu gets notice to vacate official residence
text: The Andhra Pradesh government on Thursday issued a notice to former CM N Chandrababu Naidu to vacate his current official residence. The notice sent by the Andhra Pradesh Capital Region Development Authority asked the occupants to vacate the premises within seven days. The notice was issued days after the government demolished Praja Vedika, a convention hall built by Naidu's government.

headlines: Upcoming US trip on personal expenses, clarifies Karnataka CM
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy today clarified that he'll be travelling to the US on personal expenses. He said, "I'm travelling to New Jersey to participate in a foundation laying ceremony of Adichunchanagiri Math. It's not an official tour." Earlier, after being criticised for holding meetings in a five-star hotel, he'd responded, "Have I submitted any expenditure bill to the government?"

headlines: 8-year-old killed by lightning strike in Maharashtra
text: An eight-year-old boy was struck by lightning amid heavy rains in a village near Maharashtra's Palghar district on Thursday, police said. The boy, identified as Mahendra Badga, was playing in the courtyard of his house when the lightning strike hit him, killing him on the spot. A case of accidental death has been registered by the local police.

headlines: 4-yr-old found raped, murdered in bucket at home in Chennai
text: A four-year-old girl was found allegedly raped and murdered in the bathroom of her house in Chennai's Thirumullaivoyal on Thursday. Her body was stuffed into a plastic bag which was placed inside a water bucket. Police said that there were injury marks on the body and blood stains on the underwear, which was the only garment she was wearing.

headlines: LG emerges as the most trusted TV Brand in 2019: Report
text: As per TRA's Brand Trust Report for 2019, LG TVs have been named the most trusted Television Brand for 2019. With a plethora of advanced TV Technologies like AI ThinQ, OLED and NanoCell, LG Intends to consistently enhance the TV Viewing experience regardless of the price bracket, the reason LG leads this category by a wide margin.

headlines: India is one of my favourite places in the world: Enrique Iglesias
text: Spanish singer Enrique Iglesias has shared a video of his previous trip to India, in which a fan can be seen following his car. The fan asks, "Are you Enrique?" and after the singer answers yes, the fan says, "We all love you here a lot." "One of my favourite places in the world! I love you #India," wrote Enrique.

headlines: Ayushmann Khurrana starrer 'Article 15' hits the theatres
text: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Article 15', which released today, is an "essential film about cops and caste", said Hindustan Times (HT). The film "may have an unsatisfactory element or two, but...it rushes in to tread forgotten grounds," wrote The Indian Express. Bollywood Hungama called it a "hard-hitting film". It has been rated 4.5/5(HT), 3/5 (The Indian Express) and 3.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama).

headlines: Akshay Kumar backs smart wearables startup GOQii
text: Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar has invested an undisclosed amount of money in California-based smart wearables startup GOQii's Series C round of funding. Akshay Kumar has also joined the startup's board as an investor and strategic advisor. Founded in 2014, GOQii has raised over $43 million till date from investors including Mitsui & Co, DSG Consumer Partners, Cheetah Mobile among others.

headlines: Actors won Oscars for such characters: Shahid's mom on Kabir Singh
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor's mother Neelima Azeem, while defending his film 'Kabir Singh' against criticism by fans who called it "misogynistic", said, "In Hollywood, actors have won Oscars for characters like these." Neelima questioned, "Tomorrow, if you play a psychopathic serial killer, will everybody watching the movie become one?" She further said actors have the freedom to play morally controversial characters.

headlines: 'Salute' posters in MP for BJP Gen Secy's son who thrashed official
text: After BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya's MLA son Akash had beaten up a municipal official with a bat in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, posters with 'Salute Akash ji' message were put up in the city. However, Indore Municipal Corporation got the posters removed hours later. Akash was arrested on Wednesday and has been sent to judicial custody till July 7.

headlines: Upset over not having son, woman kills 5 daughters, ends life
text: A woman allegedly killed her five minor daughters, aged between 3 and 13, by pushing them into a water tank before jumping in herself, in Rajasthan's Chohatan area on Wednesday, the police said. She was allegedly upset over not having a son. The incident took place when her husband, a teacher in a government school, had gone to work.

headlines: 5 members of a family bludgeoned to death in UP's Hamirpur
text: Five members of a family were found bludgeoned to death in UP's Hamirpur district on Thursday, Hamirpur SP Hemraj Meena said. "Head of the family, Noorbaksh, had gone to attend a marriage and he informed police after he returned and saw the bodies," Meena added. Prima facie, the incident seems to be the fallout of an enmity, Meena added.

headlines: Cab driver unzipped, stimulated genitals: Woman shares incident
text: A woman has shared her ordeal on Instagram along with videos of a cab driver, who she said unzipped and stimulated his genitals while staring at her. The woman added that the incident took place at 9:30 am. "Being in Mumbai I always felt safe and have never come across any such situation before," she wrote in her Instagram post.

headlines: Toll attendant dragged on speeding car's bonnet; act caught on CCTV
text: An attendant at a toll booth in Gurugram was dragged on the bonnet of a car, with the act being caught on CCTV camera. The video shows the attendant clinging on to the bonnet as four other men run after the car. After the attendant got off the car, the driver dodged them and sped off.

headlines: Amit Shah tables bill to extend Prez rule in J&K, his 1st in Lok Sabha
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday moved a Bill to extend the President's rule in J&K for six more months, which is the first bill to be tabled by him in the Lower House. He also moved the J&K Reservation Amendment Bill, saying it'll give benefits of reservation in recruitment and admission to those living near the International Border.

headlines: 15 IAS officers, 21 jail officials transferred in UP
text: The Uttar Pradesh government transferred 15 IAS officers on Thursday night. It also transferred 21 jail officials. Meanwhile, after a video of prisoners brandishing firearms in Unnao jail went viral, a proposal was sent to the Home Department for the transfer of some prisoners to another jail.

headlines: Don't meddle in US elections: Trump jokingly tells Putin
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday told his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin not to meddle in the American elections next year, laughing as he told the Russian leader. The two leaders were holding talks on the sidelines of the G20 summit. "It's a great honour to be with President Putin...We've many things to discuss, including trade and disarmament," Trump said.

headlines: Indian-origin Uber driver gets 3-yr jail for 'kidnapping' US passenger
text: An Indian-origin Uber driver, Harbir Parmar, has been sentenced to three-year jail for kidnapping a female passenger and dropping her off on an isolated highway in 2018. The 25-year-old had changed the New York's passenger's destination location to Boston when she fell asleep in the backseat. After the woman woke up, he dropped her at an isolated highway in Connecticut.

headlines: India wins trade dispute with US over solar panel incentives
text: The World Trade Organisation (WTO) ruled that a series of US renewable energy incentives violated international trade rules. A WTO panel upheld India's claim that seven US states illegally incentivised the use of local content, thereby discriminating against Indian and other imported solar suppliers. The US, however, told the WTO panel that the ruling would have little or no impact.

headlines: Godrej family seeks external advice in dispute over 3,400 acres land
text: The Godrej family has sought advice from external partners to help rework an agreement related to landholdings of group companies, Godrej Group Chairman Adi Godrej and Godrej & Boyce Chairman Jamshyd Godrej said in a joint statement. The talks are reportedly focused on the 3,400 acres held by Godrej and Boyce in Mumbai, which are being developed by Godrej Properties.

headlines: Flipkart to turn 40% delivery fleet electric by March 2020
text: Bengaluru-based e-commerce giant Flipkart has said it aims to replace about 40% of its delivery fleet with electric vehicles by March 2020. It revealed it will start with deploying about 160 electric vans across cities by the end of 2019. "The objective is to be 100% EV," Amitesh Jha, Senior Vice President for Ekart and Marketplace at Flipkart said.

headlines: Terrorist killed in encounter in J&K's Budgam, arms recovered
text: A terrorist was killed in an encounter with a joint team of Army, CRPF and police personnel in the Budgam district of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday morning. Arms and ammunition were recovered following the encounter, and a search operation is currently underway. The identity and group affiliation of the terrorist is being ascertained, the police said.

headlines: PM Modi meets Saudi Prince Salman in Osaka
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held bilateral talks with Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Osaka on Friday. Calling Saudi Arabia "an invaluable strategic partner," the External Affairs Ministry tweeted that the two leaders discussed deepening cooperation in trade and investment, energy security, and counter-terrorism, among other areas.

headlines: Still planning to sell Air India, clarifies government
text: The government on Thursday said it's committed to the sale of Air India and its five subsidiaries. Continued support from authorities improved Air India's financial and operational performance, it added. This comes after Hardeep Singh Puri, Minister of State for Aviation, earlier told Parliament that the present economic environment wasn't conducive for Air India's sale in "immediate near future".

headlines: I've got a good life but I saw my dad struggle: Jaaved Jaaferi's son
text: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi's son Meezaan has said he has a good life but he saw his father struggle. "I have literally seen the good and also the dark phase of my father's career. There was a time when my father...did films so that he could pay bills for many things including my education," he added.

headlines: It was required: Super 30 actress defends Hrithik's 'brownfacing'
text: Actress Mrunal Thakur, who features opposite Hrithik Roshan in 'Super 30', while defending the actor's alleged 'brownfacing' in the film, said, "I think it was required for the character." "Whenever I saw Hrithik in his dark complexion, I would end up calling him Anand," she added. Hrithik has played mathematician Anand Kumar in the film.

headlines: Not affected by ek-dedh mahine ke comments: Shahid on Kabir Singh
text: Speaking about the criticism received by 'Kabir Singh' for allegedly being "misogynistic", Shahid Kapoor said, "I don't get affected by ek-dedh mahine ke liye ye jo comments aate hai; that's not important." "Everything will find its meaning, once people will see it in totality," he added. "For me, now it is about putting a body of work behind," said Shahid.

headlines: Don't know about football, but Manchester was blue today: Kohli
text: Following India's 125-run victory over West Indies at Manchester in 2019 World Cup on Thursday, India captain Virat Kohli shared a selfie video of himself with fans. "Don't know about football, but Manchester was blue today!" the caption read. Notably, Manchester is popular for Manchester United and Manchester City football clubs, known for their red and blue colours respectively.

headlines: Whoever beats India will win the World Cup: Michael Vaughan
text: Following India's 125-run victory against West Indies in the 2019 World Cup, former England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted, "Will stick to it...Whoever beats India will win the World Cup!" Notably, India are the only team to remain unbeaten in the tournament so far. "Dominance of the highest level from Team India!" tweeted former India fast bowler RP Singh.

headlines: New Zealand wont panic after defeat to Pakistan: Daniel Vettori
text: Following New Zealand's first defeat in the 2019 World Cup, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said that New Zealand won't panic after their defeat to Pakistan. "This team doesn't panic and hasn't for a long time. They have been playing a style of cricket that has delivered success," he added. "That success breeds confidence and calmness," he further said.

headlines: Naive to expect to go unbeaten: NZ's Neesham after Pakistan loss
text: After New Zealand suffered their first defeat in 2019 World Cup against Pakistan, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham said it was "naive" to think that New Zealand would go unbeaten at the World Cup. "We prepared for a tournament where we'd probably lose one or two games, but for us it's all about making it to the semi-finals," he added.

headlines: MS Dhoni plucks one-handed diving catch to dismiss Carlos Brathwaite
text: Former India captain MS Dhoni successfully held onto the ball one-handedly to dismiss West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite for 1(5) in their 2019 World Cup match on Thursday. Brathwaite had edged a Jasprit Bumrah delivery in the 27th over when Dhoni dived towards his right and took the catch. Brathwaite had scored 101 runs in the previous match.

headlines: Messi lookalike denies sleeping with 23 women pretending to be Messi
text: Lionel Messi's Iranian lookalike Reza Parastesh has denied reports of himself sleeping with 23 women after seducing them pretending to be the footballer. "Please don't play with people's reputation and credibility...If this news was true I'd be in jail right now," he wrote on Instagram. "I want the police to find the source of this fake news," he further wrote.

headlines: New Harvard robot 'bee' with solar cells is lighter than paper clip
text: Harvard has unveiled a new bee-like robot RoboBee X-Wing, which is only one-quarter the weight of a paper clip and is the first version to not require an electricity cable. It uses solar cells, however, researchers revealed it requires light three times the Sun's intensity to generate enough power. The team is creating a 25% larger version of it.

headlines: Apple announces departure of chief design officer Jony Ive
text: Apple has announced that chief design officer Jony Ive will depart the company this year to form an independent design company which will count Apple among its primary clients. "Jony is a singular figure in design world and his role in Apple's revival cannot be overstated," CEO Tim Cook said. The announcement wiped around $9 billion from Apple's market cap.

headlines: Manmohan Singh cites Vajpayee in letter to PM to retain support staff
text: Former PM Manmohan Singh has written a letter to the PM Office, requesting PM Narendra Modi to reinstate full 14-member staff given to him. In the letter, Singh cited that the UPA government had also extended the term of complementary staff for former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee. Vajpayee government also gave similar benefits to ex-PM PV Narasimha Rao.

headlines: Can't ask others to resign, it's up to them: Rahul to Cong leaders
text: At a meeting with party leaders from Haryana state coordination committee, Congress chief Rahul Gandhi said, "I have resigned after taking full responsibility and ensuring accountability for the party's defeat in the Lok Sabha elections." He added, "I cannot ask others to resign too. It is up to them if they want to take responsibility."

headlines: Mother, daughter tonsured for resisting molestation attempt in Bihar
text: A woman and her daughter were allegedly tonsured for resisting molestation attempt in Bhagwanpur area of Vaishali district in Bihar. Sanjit Kumar, SHO, said, "Some men entered their home and tried to molest the daughter. When they resisted, a ward member called a barber and got their heads shaved." Two men have been arrested in the case, Kumar added.

headlines: DU's 1st cut-off released; Hindu College sets highest with 99%
text: Delhi University announced its first cut-off list for admission to undergraduate courses with Hindu College pegging the highest score of 99% for Political Science Honours. This is followed by 98.75% cut-off set by LSR College for BA Programme and Psychology Honours and SRCC for Economics Honours. Hindu College has the highest cut-off for science courses at 98.3% for Physics Honours.

headlines: Terrorism the biggest threat to humanity: PM to BRICS leaders
text: Speaking at an informal meeting of BRICS leaders in Japanese city Osaka, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Terrorism is the biggest threat to humanity. It not only kills innocents but also severely affects economic development and social stability." He added that there is a need to stop all the mediums of support to terrorism and racism.

headlines: India to be big part of our Asia biz: Canada's biggest life insurer
text: Canada's biggest life insurer Manulife's CEO Roy Gori has said that India can be "quite a significant part" of its business in Asia in the next 10 to 20 years. Manulife last week announced a mutual fund joint venture with Mahindra Finance, marking its entry into India. "The first phase for us is all about asset management," Gori further said.

headlines: We don't have tools to make Russian govt stop: Zuckerberg
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said, the US government has the tools to apply pressure to Russia, not Facebook. "After [Russian intervention in the 2016 US presidential election] when the government didn't take any...counteraction, the signal that was sent...was that okay we're open for business," he said. Since then we've seen increased activity from Iran and other countries, he added.

headlines: India record their biggest ever victory vs West Indies in World Cup
text: India registered their biggest ever victory (by runs) against West Indies in World Cup history by defeating them by 125 runs in 2019 World Cup on Thursday. India's previous biggest victory against West Indies in World Cup (80 runs) had come in the 2011 edition. West Indies had last defeated India in a World Cup match in the 1992 edition.

headlines: India may lose vs B'desh, SL to stop Pak from reaching semis: Basit
text: Ex-Pakistan batsman Basit Ali has said that India might purposely lose their matches against Bangladesh and Sri Lanka to stop Pakistan from reaching the 2019 World Cup semi-finals. "India have played only five matches so far, and they would never want Pakistan to qualify for the semi-final," he added. "The way India played against Afghanistan...everyone saw it," he further said.

headlines: 229mn watched India-Pak on TV in India, 381mn saw 1st 27 WC matches
text: As per Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) India, 229 million people in India watched the India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup clash (match 22) on June 16. Meanwhile, the first 27 matches of the 10-team tournament attracted 381 million viewers in India, the report added. India's first four matches drew a combined total of 321 million viewers.

headlines: Give Vijay Shankar a break, what is with angst against him: Bhogle
text: Reacting to criticism of all-rounder Vijay Shankar, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "What's with the angst against Vijay Shankar and hype around Rishabh Pant." "VS has only batted twice, made 15* and 29...took a huge wicket at a difficult time against Pakistan and averages 11 more than RP in their short ODI career. Give him a break...wish him well," he added.

headlines: Shami copies Cottrell's salute celebration after bowler's wicket
text: India pacer Mohammad Shami copied West Indies pacer Sheldon Cottrell's salute celebration after leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took Cottrell's wicket in their 2019 World Cup match on Thursday. Cottrell was dismissed LBW by Chahal for 10(8) in the 30th over. Cottrell had earlier revealed that he is a soldier by profession and his celebration is a tribute to Jamaica Defence Force.

headlines: 100 drivers follow shortcut to airport on Google Maps, end up in mud
text: Around 100 car drivers who used Google Maps to get to Denver International Airport in the US ended up on a narrow and muddy road last week. They were trying to avoid a traffic jam and followed a shortcut shown on Google Maps. Google said issues can arise due to factors like weather and drivers should use their best judgment.

headlines: Unaware if staff worked on China military projects, says Huawei
text: Responding to a Bloomberg report that Huawei's employees worked on Chinese military research projects, the smartphone maker said it's unaware of its employees' personal projects. "Huawei doesn't customise products nor provide research for the military," it reiterated. The US had recently put Huawei, the world's largest telecoms equipment maker, on its 'Entity List' over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: Jharkhand mob lynching victim was given poisonous water: Uncle
text: An uncle of Shams Tabrez Ansari, who died last week after being thrashed by a mob in Jharkhand, has claimed Tabrez was given water mixed with dhatura (a form of a poisonous leaf) after being beaten. Mohammad Masroor said a police chargesheet should be filed immediately and the accused must be punished. Police has arrested 11 people in the case.

headlines: 3 of a family asphyxiate to death in Tamil Nadu after fridge bursts
text: A 36-year-old Tamil Nadu-based journalist, his wife and mother asphyxiated to death on Thursday after a refrigerator caught fire in their house on the outskirts of Chennai. According to preliminary investigations, the fire started after the compressor of the fridge burst due to high voltage. The fire burnt the plastics and created more smoke, reports said.

headlines: 4 nurses told to go on leave for TikTok videos in newborn care unit
text: The four Odisha nurses who recorded TikTok videos inside the special newborn care unit (SNCU) of the Malkangiri District Headquarter Hospital were on Thursday told to go on leave. The four nurses were issued a show-cause notice on Wednesday for their act. In the videos, they were seen lip-synching and dancing inside the SNCU in their official uniforms.

headlines: My female successor should be attractive: Dalai Lama
text: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama said in an interview that if a female leader succeeds him, then she should be "more attractive". Making a facial expression during the interview, the Dalai Lama added, "I think, people would prefer not [to] see her, that face." He'd earlier said that his female successor must be "very attractive, otherwise not much use".

headlines: Vijender who last fought in 2017 to fight in US on July 13
text: Boxer Vijender Singh, who last competed in 2017, will face US' Mike Snider on July 13 in Newark to mark his debut in US professional circuit. Vijender was scheduled to make his US debut in April but he failed to compete due to an injury he sustained while training. The 33-year-old Haryana-born recently lost in 17th Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Scientists use AI to control robotic arm that can pack boxes
text: America's Rutgers University-New Brunswick scientists have used artificial intelligence to control a robotic arm that provides a more efficient way to pack boxes. The study focussed on placing objects from a bin into a small shipping box and tightly arranging them. The robotic arm consists of a vacuum-based end-effector that allows it to pick up, push and arrange objects.

headlines: Google, US university face lawsuit over shared patient data
text: A lawsuit filed against Google and the University of Chicago Medical Center alleges the hospital of sharing thousands of patients' records with Google without stripping date stamps or doctors' notes. It was alleged that the dates' inclusion violates HIPAA, which requires hospitals to hide personally identifiable information. Google said it follows all relevant rules in handling health data.

headlines: My govt will make Karnataka number 1 state: CM Kumaraswamy
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday asserted that the Congress-JD(S) government led by him will be stable and would work towards making Karnataka the country's number one state. "For the next four years, this government...will work for the all-round development of the state," he said. Kumaraswamy also accused BJP for trying to topple his government during the last one year.

headlines: Hinduja backs UK startup harvesting energy from footsteps
text: UK-based startup Pavegen, which harvests energy and data from footsteps, has raised around £2.6 million on its crowdfunding push, having doubled its initial £950,000 target. The campaign secured funds from over 1,400 investors, including partnership and anchor investment from Hinduja Group and Tamar Capital. Pavegen offers interoperable flooring system that generates power and data from footsteps.

headlines: Karnataka farmers hold protests over loan waiver, water issue
text: Farmers in Karnataka held a protest on Thursday in the state's Ujalamba village during Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy's 'Janatha Darshan' programme. They were protesting over issues of loan waiver, crop insurance, among others. The farmers in Karnataka's Mandya have also been protesting for the release of water from the Cauvery basin for their standing crops and animals.

headlines: Cheques given to families of BJP workers killed by terrorists in J&K
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday distributed cheques to families of BJP workers who were killed by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, in recent months. He further praised the work of J&K Police in countering terrorism and militancy. Earlier today, Shah also met the family members of SHO Arshad Khan who was martyred in a terror attack on June 12.

headlines: Court grants anticipatory bail to CPM leader's son in rape case
text: A Mumbai court on Thursday granted anticipatory bail to Kerala CPM chief Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's son Binoy Kodiyeri till July 1 in connection with a rape case filed against him. He is accused of sexually assaulting a woman on the pretext of marriage. Earlier, the Kerala CPM chief said that neither he nor his party will protect his rape-accused son.

headlines: He might be under a spell: China as Pompeo criticises BRI project
text: China has said US' Secretary of State Mike Pompeo might be "under a spell" after he criticised their Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). Pompeo had said that China's deals under BRI come "not with strings attached, but with shackles". Pompeo's "attempts to persuade other countries out of BRI cooperation are not getting anywhere", Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Geng Shuang said.

headlines: Swara invites people to march for lynching victim after it's over
text: Actress Swara Bhasker was trolled by social media users after she invited people to a candlelight march for Jharkhand lynching victim Shams Tabrez Ansari, which was held in Delhi on Wednesday, several hours after it got over. A user commented on her post "26th June? It's over then?" Replying to this, Swara later replied, "Yes sorry...this is over."

headlines: I was thrown out of films as I wasn't dating the hero: Mallika
text: Actress Mallika Sherawat has revealed that she has lost roles as she wasn't dating the hero. "There've been instances when I was thrown out of films because the actor, director or producer preferred their girlfriend to be the heroine," she added. However, Mallika said she wouldn't like to discuss the details of the incidents as they happened in the past.

headlines: Mumbai Police file FIR of rape against actor-producer Aditya Pancholi
text: The Mumbai Police on Thursday filed an FIR of rape against actor-producer Aditya Pancholi based on an actress' statement. The police have said that it would be difficult to prove the case and gather evidence since the case is almost 10 years old. In her complaint, the actress said that she was raped on several occasions by Aditya Pancholi.

headlines: MS Dhoni changes bat for last ball against WI, smashes 79-metre six
text: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni changed his bat after scoring 10 runs off five balls in the last over against West Indies pacer Oshane Thomas in 2019 World Cup on Thursday. The 37-year-old former India captain went on to pull the last ball for a 79-metre six over the deep square leg, helping India put up a total of 268/7.

headlines: ICC allows Sri Lanka to continue wearing 'lucky' yellow jersey in WC
text: The ICC has permitted Sri Lanka to continue wearing their second choice 'yellow jersey' in their remaining World Cup matches as the team considers it "lucky". Sri Lanka had formally asked ICC if they could wear it after beating hosts England wearing the same jersey. The ICC gave the permission as the jersey doesn't clash with colours of other teams.

headlines: UP BJP MLA's son threatens policeman with transfer in 3 days
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Devendra Singh Rajput's son Jasveer has allegedly threatened to get Soron Gate police station in-charge, SP Singh, transferred in three days after he arrested two men for creating a ruckus on road. Jasveer reportedly came to the station after one of the arrested men called him, and created a ruckus there, demanding their release.

headlines: 1 killed, 35 hurt in clash at Ludhiana Central Jail; CM orders probe
text: One inmate was killed and 35 others, including several policemen, were injured at the Ludhiana Central Jail on Thursday after a clash between two groups of prisoners. The police had to open fire after the two groups started pelting stones at each other. Punjab CM Amarinder Singh has ordered a magisterial inquiry by the Ludhiana Deputy Commissioner into the incident.

headlines: 11 students on excursion killed in J&K as bus falls into gorge
text: Eleven students including nine girls of a private computer training institute were killed, while seven others were injured on Thursday in a road accident on Mughal Road in Jammu and Kashmir. The students were on an excursion from Surankote tehsil in Poonch district to Mughal road. Their bus crashed into a road divider before plunging into the gorge.

headlines: Man who claimed to be only Australian in N Korea feared detained
text: Alek Sigley, a student who claimed he's the only Australian national in North Korea, is feared detained in the country after his parents say they have not heard from him since Tuesday. Sigley, 29, had been studying at Kim Il Sung University and runs a tour company that organises trips for foreign students. Australia is seeking clarification about Sigley's whereabouts.

headlines: Gambia ex-Prez raped me after I refused to marry him: Pageant winner
text: A 23-year-old Gambian beauty pageant winner named Fatou (Toufah) Jallow has accused 54-year-old former President Yahya Jammeh of raping her during his term. Jallow said Jammeh's "ego was bruised" when she refused to marry him and he raped her after "rubbing his genitals" on her face. She claimed Jammeh injected a syringe into her arm before raping her.

headlines: Looking at Facebook's crypto carefully: US Federal Reserve
text: The US Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the central bank is looking very carefully at Facebook's newly announced digital currency Libra. He said given Libra's possible scale, the central bank's expectations from consumer protection and regulatory standpoint are going to be "very, very high". He added authority for overseeing Libra is going to be in a number of places.

headlines: Huawei loses trade secret case against ex-employee's startup CNEX
text: Huawei has lost a case against startup CNEX, co-founded by its former employee Yiren Huang, accusing it of stealing trade secrets. The jury found Huang breached his employment contract by not notifying Huawei of patents obtained within a year of leaving the firm but awarded no damages to Huawei. It also did not offer damages to CNEX for its countersuit.

headlines: BJP MLA threatens official for not inviting her to an event
text: BJP MLA Leena Jain from Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha was caught on camera threatening an official after he allegedly forgot to invite her to an official event. "You are violating my rights. You won't be able to do your job in Gyaraspur," she said. Jain was also allegedly angry over a former MLA attending the event while she wasn't invited.

headlines: 3 TDP, 2 Congress leaders join Bharatiya Janata Party
text: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leaders E Peddi Reddy, Bode Janardhan and Suresh Reddy joined BJP on Thursday at the party headquarters in the national capital. Along with them, Telangana Congress leaders Shashidhar Reddy and Sheik Rahmatullah also joined the saffron party. This comes after TDP faced a defeat in the recently concluded Andhra Pradesh Assembly election and Lok Sabha election.

headlines: Indian diaspora chants 'Jai Shri Ram' for PM Modi in Japan
text: Slogans of 'Vande Mataram' and 'Jai Shri Ram' were raised at a community event in Japan's Kobe after PM Narendra Modi concluded his address to the Indian diaspora. "When it comes to India's relations with the world, Japan holds an important position," PM Modi said in his speech. The PM is in Japan for his sixth G20 Summit.

headlines: 2 killed, 7 injured as plane makes emergency landing in Russia
text: Two people were killed and seven others were injured on Thursday after a plane made an emergency landing in Russia's Buryatia region after one of its engines failed. The plane overshot the runway after landing, hit a small building and caught fire. The plane was carrying 48 people, including 5 crew members.

headlines: Won't compromise national interest in trade talks: Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said the government wouldn't allow trade negotiations to overtake issues of national interest. He added that the US took a "unilateral position" in withdrawing GSP benefits. The decision "isn't exactly as per WTO and GATT norms which are multilateral trade agreements," Goyal further said. India exported goods worth over $6 billion under GSP in 2018.

headlines: US regulator cites new flaw on grounded Boeing 737 MAX
text: US aviation regulator FAA said it has identified a new safety risk on Boeing's 737 MAX that must be addressed before the grounded jet can return to service. The flaw could cause the plane to dive in a way that pilots had difficulty recovering from in simulator tests, reports said. It was discovered during a simulator test last week.

headlines: GoAir inducts 50th plane, to add one aircraft each month
text: Budget carrier GoAir on Thursday said it has inducted its 50th aircraft, an Airbus A320neo, doubling its fleet size in less than two years. The Wadia Group-run airline further plans to add one aircraft per month in the future. GoAir is India's fourth largest airline, with a domestic market share of 11.1% in May.

headlines: Kohli fastest to 20,000 int'l runs, breaks Sachin, Lara's record
text: India captain Virat Kohli has become the fastest batsman to reach 20,000 international runs, achieving the feat in his 417th innings during the 2019 World Cup match against West Indies today. Kohli surpassed Sachin Tendulkar and Brian Lara, who both took 453 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had become the fastest batsman to reach 19,000 international runs in January.

headlines: Fans question whether Rohit's caught-behind vs WI was out or not
text: Rohit Sharma was declared caught-behind out by third umpire during India's match against West Indies on Thursday. The 32-year-old seemingly edged a Kemar Roach delivery after which the on-field umpire gave him not-out. West Indies took DRS and the third umpire reversed the decision. Several fans questioned the decision after replays couldn't conclude if the ball hit bat or pad.

headlines: India topple England to become world number one ODI side
text: Virat Kohli-led India have toppled England to become the world number one ODI side as per the latest rankings. India are currently on top of the ranking with 123 points, leading England by one point. If India lose to West Indies, they will slip one point behind England to 121 points. New Zealand are placed third with 114 points.

headlines: Govt may build own chat app to end dependence on foreign apps
text: The government is reportedly planning to build its own chat app and making its use by government employees compulsory for official communications to cut reliance on foreign firms and apps. "We should have some form of a 'sarkari' WhatsApp," a government official was quoted as saying. The move reportedly comes over the US' decision to ban Chinese smartphone maker Huawei.

headlines: We gave you food, shelter and you vote for BJP: Siddaramaiah
text: Congress leader and Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, while addressing a rally in Badami on Thursday, said, "We gave you food and shelter. Panchayat Bhawan was made by us. You vote for BJP, I wonder why." This comes a day after Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy shouted at protestors to approach PM Narendra Modi with their problems as they voted for him.

headlines: Uber buys startup Mighty AI to advance work on self-driving cars
text: Uber has acquired Seattle-based AI startup Mighty AI, which specialises in computer vision to help understand the surroundings of self-driving vehicles, for an undisclosed amount to advance work on self-driving cars. Uber will acquire the startup's intellectual property, tooling, tech talent and labelling community. Founded in 2014, Mighty AI has raised about $27 million, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: Anti-satellite missile test debris still in space: Harvard astronomer
text: Jonathan McDowell, a Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics astronomer, claimed that 41 pieces of debris from Indian anti-satellite missile test are still orbiting around the Earth. At the time of the test in March this year, the DRDO had said that it expects all debris to vanish within 45 days. At the time, NASA had called the debris "a terrible thing".

headlines: From making cars, India and Japan now making bullet train: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing the Indian diaspora in Japan on Thursday, said, "There was a time when we were collaborating in building cars and today we are collaborating in building a bullet train." He is in Japan to attend the G20 Summit to be held from Friday. PM Modi also met Japan's PM Shinzo Abe ahead of the summit.

headlines: Indian student in Rome to present paper robbed, escapes acid attack
text: An Indian student escaped an acid attack during a robbery in Italy's capital Rome, having lost his money, passport and bag. Harshit Agrawal, a cybersecurity researcher, was in the city to present a paper at a conference. Following the incident, Agrawal took to Twitter to seek the government's help to return to India.

headlines: Bomb threat to Mumbai-Newark flight that landed in London was hoax
text: The bomb threat to Air India Mumbai-Newark flight that made a precautionary landing at London Stansted Airport on Thursday was a hoax, as per an airline official. A hoax call was received at Mumbai airport, the official said, adding that there is no security threat. London Stansted Airport's runway was temporarily closed after the plane landed.

headlines: CBI claims accused in Dabholkar murder case confessed to killing him
text: The CBI has claimed that Sharad Kalaskar, an accused in the murder of rationalist Narendra Dabholkar, confessed to killing him during a forensic psychological analysis test. The agency told this to a court while opposing bail of another accused. In their chargesheet, the CBI has identified Kalaskar as one of the two shooters who killed Dabholkar in 2013 in Pune.

headlines: Looking into demand to have bank exams in local languages: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said she's looking into demands of MPs from southern states for conducting bank recruitment exams in local languages as well. "I am seized of the matter. I will look into it and come back to the House," Sitharaman stated. The issue was raised by Congress MP GC Chandrashekhar in the Rajya Sabha in Kannada.

headlines: SpaceX now makes up two-thirds of Tesla CEO Elon Musks wealth
text: Commercial space company SpaceX now makes up two-thirds of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $22.4 billion wealth, with the carmaker accounting for most of the remaining third, according to Bloomberg. Tesla was responsible for most of his fortune in previous years. One of the world's most valuable privately held companies, SpaceX is worth $34 billion, according to an analysis by EquityZen.

headlines: Wipro splits Rishad Premji's role among three executives
text: Wipro has split the current role of its Chief Strategy Officer Rishad Premji, who is set to become the Executive Chairman on July 31, among three executives. CEO Abidali Z Neemuchwala will oversee mergers and acquisitions while CFO Jatin Dalal will handle Wipro Ventures, the company's $100-million startup fund. Government relations will be handled by Wipro's General Counsel, Deepak Acharya.

headlines: Pak made life difficult for us: Williamson on NZ's 1st loss in WC
text: After Pakistan handed New Zealand their first defeat in 2019 World Cup, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said, "On a tough surface...a very strong Pakistan side outplayed us." The world number 13 ODI batsman added Pakistan bowled really well and "made life difficult for us". Following their victories against South Africa and New Zealand, Pakistan are sixth on points table.

headlines: It's not in my knowledge: Khattar over Cong leader's killing
text: On being asked about Haryana Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary's killing on Thursday morning, the state's Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said that he has no information about it. "It's not in my knowledge right now," Khattar added. The Congress leader was shot dead by unidentified men in Faridabad when he was in his car outside a gym.

headlines: UP government orders officials to reach office by 9 am
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed state government officials, including district and police officials, to reach their respective offices by 9 am at any cost, said the Chief Minister's Office (CMO) on Thursday. The CMO added that action could be taken against those who do not follow directions.

headlines: 4-year-old elephant rescued from well after 18-hour operation
text: A four-year-old elephant was rescued by forest and police department officials in an 18-hour-long operation after it fell into a 25-foot-deep open well in Kannur district, Kerala. Locals said that they noticed the calf after a herd of 11 elephants started circling the well desperately. Meanwhile, veterinarians said that no visible injuries were found on the calf despite the fall.

headlines: Waitress spits on Trump's son at Chicago bar, sent on leave
text: Eric Trump, son of US President Donald Trump, has said that he was spat on by a waitress at a bar in Chicago on Tuesday. The waitress was detained by the Secret Service and the Chicago Police and was released after Eric decided not to press charges against her. The bar has sent the employee on leave.

headlines: Bosnian arrested in Germany over 2015 Paris attacks that killed 130
text: A Bosnian national has been arrested in Germany in connection with the 2015 Paris attacks that killed 130 people and injured several others. The 39-year-old, detained on a European arrest warrant issued by the Belgian authorities, is accused of abetting a terrorist organisation linked to the attacks. The Islamic State had claimed responsibility for the attacks.

headlines: FSSAI calls for colour-coded labels on high fat, sugar items
text: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has issued draft regulations aiming to mandate packaged food companies to display red colour coding in front of packets of products with high fat, sugar and salt content. The food labels will also declare nutritional information such as calories, trans-fat and added sugar per serve on the front of the pack.

headlines: Bombay HC confirms Maratha quota, but says 16% is not justifiable
text: The Bombay High Court on Thursday confirmed the Maharashtra government's decision to grant quota to Marathas in government jobs and educational institutions. However, it said that the 16% quota is not justifiable and should be reduced to 12% or 13%. In November last year, the Maharashtra legislature passed the reservation bill under the Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) category.

headlines: If I had to play a sports person, it would be my father: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone has said if she had to play a sports person in a film, it'd be her father, former badminton player Prakash Padukone or any sports legend from that era. "That's because of what they achieved in the circumstances, within the limited exposure and knowledge versus the kind of funds, facilities and visibility available to athletes today," she added.

headlines: Can't talk if rape threats given to my sisters, deceased mom: Sinha
text: In a letter addressed to Brahmin groups and Karni Sena, 'Article 15' director Anubhav Sinha wrote that a conversation won't be possible if they keep "threatening to kill him or rape his sisters and deceased mother". He said he "forgives them for crossing all limits of disagreement and protest". The outfits claimed the film shows Brahmins in a poor light.

headlines: Tej Pratap announces online platform 'Tej Sena' for 'change makers'
text: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap Yadav has announced "online platform for change makers" Tej Sena, which will be launched on June 28. He also shared a mobile number on which one can register to be a part of the movement. The poster of the announcement also has the RJD symbol.

headlines: Indian crypto exchange Koinex shuts down 1 year after RBI ban
text: Indian cryptocurrency exchange Koinex's Co-founder Rahul Raj has announced the closing of its operations, citing lack of banking support and regulatory uncertainty. The RBI had barred banks from serving cryptocurrency exchanges and firms in April 2018. "We took on immense financial burden to continue trading of digital assets," the IIT-Kharagpur alumnus stated as the reason behind the shutdown.

headlines: CCTV cameras help avert two rail accidents in Maharashtra
text: Two railway accidents that could have resulted from minor landslides on the Pune-Mumbai ghat section were averted recently due to timely alerts from CCTV cameras installed along the route, Central Railway senior spokesperson AK Jain has revealed. "Last year, there were 3 major landslide incidents in which we were able to identify the boulders through CCTV," Jain added.

headlines: IAF jet suffers bird hit, pilot drops practice bombs before landing
text: An Indian Air Force pilot of Jaguar fighter jet jettisoned small practice bombs and fuel tanks of the aircraft during emergency landing after one of the jet's engines failed on being hit by a bird. However, the pilot managed to land the plane safely at the Ambala Air Base. The pilot was reportedly going for a training mission.

headlines: Didn't get proposal on free metro rides by AAP govt: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday informed Lok Sabha that Delhi's AAP government did not send any proposal for free rides for women in metro. Puri was replying to TMC MP Saugata Roy's question. AAP said it's their proposal as they have 50% stake in Delhi Metro and Delhi government will bear the cost and pay directly to Metro.

headlines: Nirmala Sitharaman meets Manmohan Singh days before her 1st Budget
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman met former PM Manmohan Singh at his residence in Delhi on Thursday. The meeting comes ahead of Sitharaman's first Union Budget presentation in the Parliament on July 5 after taking charge as the Finance Minister. Notably, the ex-PM had served as Finance Minister from 1991-1996 and the Governor of the RBI from 1982-1985.

headlines: 39kg cocaine found on Brazil Prez's plane bound for G-20 summit
text: Thirty-nine kilograms of cocaine was found by the authorities aboard a Brazil presidential plane bound for the G-20 summit in Japan. A Brazilian airman aboard that aircraft was arrested in Spain when the plane made a stop-over. The plane was reportedly carrying a military delegation protecting Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, while the leader was travelling on a separate plane.

headlines: Hope Pak will crack down on Islamist militants: US State Secretary
text: US' Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, who's currently on a visit to India, said on Wednesday that he remained hopeful that Pakistan would choose the "right course" in cracking down on Islamist fundamentalists. "They cannot be supporting terror, whether that's cross-border terror between Afghanistan or Pakistan or whether it's terror that emanates from Pakistan and comes to (India)," Pompeo added.

headlines: What I tell Putin is none of your business: Trump tells journalist
text: US President Donald Trump told a journalist on Wednesday that what he plans to say to his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin when they meet at the G20 summit is "none of your business". Trump's statement came after the journalist asked him if he would tell Putin not to interfere in the 2020 US presidential election.

headlines: US police name baby found in plastic bag 'India', release video
text: Police in the US state of Georgia have released a video of officers finding an abandoned newborn girl inside a plastic bag and named her 'Baby India'. The video shows the infant crying as the officers rip open the tied-up bag to rescue her on June 6. The police said they're following leads and attempting to locate her mother.

headlines: After acquiring Costa, Coca-Cola may buy stake in Coffee Day
text: American beverage maker Coca-Cola is reportedly in talks to buy a significant stake in India's largest coffee chain Café Coffee Day. Coca-Cola completed its $4.9 billion acquisition UK-based coffee chain Costa Coffee in January this year. Shares of Coffee Day Enterprises, which runs the Café Coffee Day outlets, surged as much as 12% on Thursday following the reports.

headlines: Google staff demand San Francisco Pride Parade to ban company
text: Over 120 Google employees have signed a petition to exclude Google from representation in the San Francisco Pride Parade on June 30. They stated, whenever they press for change, Google says it'll "take a hard look at [LGBTQ+-related] policies" but doesn't give a commitment to improve. However, San Francisco Pride has confirmed Google as a continued participant in the parade.

headlines: It's Mamata's nature to go back on her words: Congress leader
text: A day after West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said parties like Congress and CPI(M) should join hands with TMC to fight BJP, Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury responded, "People say something and then go back on their words, it's her nature." Chowdhury added, "If she is serious, she'll have to talk to our senior leadership."

headlines: Kumaraswamy has lost his mental balance: BJP's Pralhad Joshi
text: After a video showed Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy shouting at protestors to go to PM Narendra Modi with their problems as they voted for him, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "He's lost his mental balance." Claiming Kumaraswamy became CM due to an "unhealthy alliance" with Congress, Joshi asked, "Is he CM for the entire state or only for JD(S) voters?"

headlines: Delhi HC restrains hoteliers association from boycotting OYO
text: The Delhi High Court has restrained the Hotelier Welfare Association from issuing any notices to hoteliers and service providers seeking to boycott or ban OYO Rooms. The court said it appeared the association was pushing others to act in breach of their contract with OYO, which would be prima facie illegal. The matter will be heard next in August.

headlines: Taxi driver claims he was thrashed, forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
text: Twenty-five-year-old taxi driver Faisal Usman Khan has claimed he was thrashed by three people and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' in Thane after he didn't give way to their scooter as his car had broken down. He'd initially told police he was thrashed, and later claimed he was also targeted for his religion. Meanwhile, three people have been booked.

headlines: India's tariff hike unacceptable: Trump ahead of meeting with PM Modi
text: Ahead of US President Donald Trump's meeting with PM Narendra Modi in Japan, Trump tweeted he looks forward to speaking with PM Modi about India's recent tariff hike against US. "For years having put very high Tariffs against the United States, [India] just recently increased the Tariffs even further. This is unacceptable and the Tariffs must be withdrawn," he wrote.

headlines: Lost out on Vicky Donor as I was overweight by few kilos: Radhika
text: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that she lost out on the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor' as she was "overweight by a few kilos". "I had gone on a holiday for a month, drank a lot of beer, ate loads of food. I told them...I'll come back and lose it. But they did not want to take a chance," she added.

headlines: Babar Azam becomes second-fastest batsman to reach 3,000 ODI runs
text: Pakistan's Babar Azam has become the second-fastest batsman to reach 3,000 ODI runs, achieving the feat during his knock of 101*(127) against New Zealand in 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. Azam reached the milestone in his 68th innings, overtaking ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards (69). South Africa's Hashim Amla is the fastest batsman to reach 3,000 ODI runs (57 innings).

headlines: India only team to remain unbeaten in 2019 WC as Pak beat New Zealand
text: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by six wickets on Wednesday to hand them their first defeat in the 2019 World Cup. With this, India remain the only team to remain unbeaten in the 10-team tournament. New Zealand remain on the second spot on the points table, while Pakistan moved to the sixth spot with their second straight victory.

headlines: Neeraj Goyat ruled out of Amir Khan showdown after accident
text: Indian professional boxer Neeraj Goyat has been hospitalised after suffering "severe injuries" following a car accident, ruling him out of next month's WBC Pearl World Championship clash against British boxer Amir Khan. The 27-year-old from Haryana met with the accident when he was returning home after training. The organisers are now looking for a replacement for Neeraj.

headlines: Govt trying to saffronise everything: Cong leader on orange India jersey
text: Reacting to India's orange-coloured jersey for 2019 World Cup match against England, Congress lawmaker Arif Naseem Khan said, "For the past five years, the Modi-led government is trying to saffronise each and every thing. Be it sports, cultural activities or anything for that matter." According to ANI, India opted for orange to distinguish itself from England, who also wear blue.

headlines: Reduction in prize money attempt to kill sports in Haryana: Bajrang
text: Wrestler Bajrang Punia has criticised Haryana government for "cut in prize money" for athletes, saying "the move is an attempt to kill sports in the state." "At a time when we need to be given support, an attempt is being made to break our morale," he added. This comes after several athletes claimed they received reduced amount in their accounts.

headlines: Man does push-ups on car with Delhi Police logo in TikTok video
text: A TikTok video showing a man doing push-ups on a car that has 'Delhi Police' inscribed on its bonnet went viral on social media on Wednesday. The Delhi Police later clarified that it was not a police vehicle, but instead a private vehicle hired through a contractor. The man in the video is not a policeman, it added.

headlines: Prisoner killed as police lathicharge inmates amid gang clash
text: One prisoner was killed and another was critically injured on Tuesday after police allegedly resorted to lathicharge following a clash between two rival gangs inside Ghaghidih Central Jail, Jharkhand. Three home guards were arrested and four jail wardens were suspended following the incident. The deceased, Manoj Singh, had been serving a ten-year sentence in a dowry case since 2013.

headlines: Haryana Cong leader hit by more than 10 bullets outside gym, dies
text: Haryana Congress leader Vikas Chaudhary was shot dead by unknown men in Faridabad on Thursday, officials said. He was hit by more than ten bullets by the men after he came out of a gym. "He was brought to the hospital in the morning. Doctors tried their best to save him...But we could not save him," a doctor said.

headlines: Woman gangraped by brothers-in-law dies in Agra
text: A woman who was allegedly gangraped and thrashed by her two brothers-in-law has succumbed to her injuries in a hospital in Agra. Prashant Tyagi, Station Officer Khandauli, said the two accused had a dispute with their wives, who are sisters of the deceased, and wanted to teach them a lesson by raping their sister. Both of them have been arrested.

headlines: 14-yr-old Assam girl hangs self allegedly over name missing from NRC
text: A minor girl in Assam's Darrang committed suicide by hanging herself, with her relatives and members of a students' organisation linking the incident to the National Register of Citizens. Her relative said she was confident her name will appear in NRC this time and took the extreme step after her father informed her that her name wasn't on the list.

headlines: Pic shows man, daughter drowned at US-Mexico border; Trump responds
text: A photo of a drowned Salvadoran man and his two-year-old daughter, who's tucked inside his shirt, lying face down in Rio Grande river at US-Mexico border has surfaced online. Responding to the incident, US President Donald Trump said, "I hate it...That father...was probably a wonderful guy." The pair was reportedly trying to swim across the river to enter US.

headlines: Indian-American man sentenced to life for adopted daughter's death
text: Wesley Mathews, the Indian-American adoptive father of three-year-old Sherin Mathews, was sentenced to life in prison by a judge in Dallas, US on Wednesday for the death of the Indian toddler in 2017. Mathews pleaded guilty to a lesser charge of injury to a child. He was originally charged with capital murder by authorities in the US state of Texas.

headlines: SpiceJet got 43% new slots in Mumbai, Delhi post Jet grounding: Elara
text: SpiceJet benefitted the most from the Jet Airways grounding as it fetched 43% of new domestic slots at the Mumbai and Delhi airports, during the March-June 2019 period, Elara Capital said in a report. During the same period, IndiGo fetched 32% new slots while GoAir fetched 13% new slots. A bankruptcy court recently accepted an insolvency petition against Jet Airways.

headlines: Playing India always a big game for West Indies: Holder
text: Talking about West Indies' 2019 World Cup match against India at Old Trafford on Thursday, captain Jason Holder said, "Playing India is always a big game for West Indies." The 27-year-old added the team have shown "glimpses of what they can produce" and want to win their remaining three games. West Indies are currently placed eighth on the points table.

headlines: 2,000 'high-risk' fake apps found on Google Play Store: 2-yr study
text: Australia's CSIRO and Sydney University researchers have identified over 2,000 fake apps categorised as 'high-risk' out of a total of 49,608 potential counterfeit ones. The researchers had tested over a million apps on the Play Store using neural networks and machine learning, over a period of about two years. The researchers' algorithm had flagged 7,246 plagiarised apps on the store.

headlines: Instagram not listening to your private conversations: CEO Mosseri
text: Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri has said the Facebook-owned photo-sharing platform neither listens to private conversations nor looks at users' chats. "Doing so would be super problematic for a lot of different reasons. But I recognize you're not gonna really believe me," Mosseri was quoted as saying. He said this when asked about personalised ad targetting.

headlines: 8 years after murder of live-in partner, suspected killer dies
text: Over eight years after 29-year-old Neetu Solanki was murdered, the Delhi Police said her suspected killer and live-in partner Raju Gehlot died of a liver ailment at a hospital on Tuesday. Solanki's body was found outside New Delhi railway station and a peacock tattoo had helped her parents identify it. Notably, Gehlot had evaded arrest by assuming a fake identity.

headlines: I-T Dept to share details of loan defaulters with banks
text: The CBDT has directed the Income Tax Department to share in "public interest" details of assets and accounts of loan defaulters against whom a state-run bank has made a plea. The move is aimed at cracking down on such entities and recovery of public money. The I-T Department will obtain information on a defaulter from the ITR of an assessee.

headlines: Mindtree CEO Rostow Ravanan may resign soon: Reports
text: Mindtree CEO Rostow Ravanan is likely to resign in coming weeks with L&T becoming a majority shareholder in the company, reports stated. L&T is currently in the process of an open offer to buy an additional 31% stake. Mindtree promoters including Subroto Bagchi, NS Parthasarathy and Krishnakumar Natarajan may reportedly sell their total stake of 13% in the open offer.

headlines: Fan writes to ICC complaining about Manjrekar's 'biased' commentary
text: Addie Kumar, a cricket fan from Australia, wrote to the ICC complaining about Sanjay Manjrekar's commentary in the 2019 World Cup, saying he finds Manjrekar's commentary "utterly biased and unprofessional". Addie said that he complained about Manjrekar after the latter called Dhoni "our watchdog behind the stumps" while commentating. He added that there is no "us" and "our" in commentary.

headlines: Neesham 1st NZ player to remain unbeaten in 90s in a World Cup match
text: All-rounder Jimmy Neesham has become the first New Zealand cricketer to remain unbeaten in 90s in a World Cup match. The 28-year-old, who scored 97*(112) including five fours and three sixes against Pakistan on Wednesday, is also the second player after James Taylor to remain unbeaten in 90s in a World Cup match batting at number six or lower.

headlines: James Neesham, Colin de Grandhomme share record partnership
text: All-rounder James Neesham and Colin de Grandhomme shared the highest sixth-wicket partnership by a New Zealand pair in World Cup history. The duo achieved the feat against Pakistan in the 2019 World Cup on Wednesday, registering 132 runs. The previous record of 91 runs was set by Colin de Grandhomme and Kane Williamson against South Africa on June 19.

headlines: I'm definitely up there with greats of West Indies cricket: Gayle
text: West Indies opener Chris Gayle has said that he is definitely up there with the greats of West Indies cricket, without a doubt. "I enjoy each and every moment playing for West Indies. I could not have had a better career as a player representing the West Indies," he added. Gayle will be playing his 296th ODI tomorrow.

headlines: Hockey player returns after missing dad's funeral to help India win
text: Indian women's hockey team forward Lalremsiami, who lost her father to heart attack on Friday and helped India win FIH Women's Series Finals on Sunday, returned to her village in Mizoram on Tuesday. Photos of her embracing her mother and addressing a gathering surfaced online. "I believe my father will be proud of my achievement, wherever he is," she said.

headlines: Congress leader sacked for praising PM Modi joins BJP
text: Former Congress MLA from Kerala, AP Abdullakutty, who was recently expelled from Congress for praising PM Narendra Modi, joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of party Working President JP Nadda. Further, the only Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) member in Rajya Sabha, Ram Kumar Kashyap, also joined BJP today. Telugu Desam Party (TDP) spokesperson Lanka Dinakar also joined BJP.

headlines: Over 60 Kochi hotels protest against OYO, refuse bookings for 2 days
text: Over 60 hotels in Kerala's Kochi, affiliated to Kerala Hotel and Restaurant Association (KHRA), are participating in a 48-hour booking shutdown to protest against OYO. The association alleged since last December, OYO has forced hotel owners to bear the discounts which it had earlier offered itself. OYO has said it will take legal action if hotels disrupt the agreement.

headlines: Biker contacts police for wrong tripling challan, fined for no helmet
text: A biker took to Twitter on Wednesday to call out Cyberabad Traffic Police for wrongly handing him out a challan for tripling when he was riding along with only one pillion rider. "Look closely sir we were only two," he tweeted. The Cyberabad Traffic Police responded, "We've placed a request to change the violation from Triple riding to W/O helmet."

headlines: You voted for Narendra Modi, go ask him: Kumaraswamy to protestors
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy was caught on camera on Wednesday shouting at protestors to go to PM Narendra Modi with their problems as they voted for him. Kumaraswamy was going to Karegudda village of Raichur district as part of his village stay programme, when workers from Yermarus Thermal Power Station protested in front of his bus, shouting slogans against him.

headlines: Kolkata girl tries to slit wrist in school washroom, staff saves her
text: A student at Ballygunge Shiksha Sadan School in Kolkata tried to slit her wrist with a blade in the washroom on Wednesday but was saved by the school staff in time. The staff handed the girl over to her parents following primary treatment. Sudeshna Banerjee, the Vice-Principal of the school, said that the girl was undergoing psychiatric treatment.

headlines: Odisha nurses shoot TikTok video in newborn care unit, served notice
text: Four nurses working in the District Headquarter Hospital of Odisha's Malkangiri have been served show cause notices after TikTok videos they shot in the special newborn care unit went viral. In a video, a nurse carried a newborn baby while a Hindi song played in the background. The service of nurses may be terminated, if necessary, an official said.

headlines: 226 districts in country facing water crisis: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday informed Rajya Sabha that around 226 districts in the country are facing water crisis. He said he is considering how water-related issues can be prioritised in MP Local Area Development (MPLAD) funds. He added it is also important to make society aware about water issues so that future generations can be saved from water crisis.

headlines: Payment firms can process abroad but must bring data back in 24 hrs
text: The RBI has said foreign payment firms can process transactions outside of the country but the related data should be brought back for local storage within 24 hours. Such data must be "deleted from the systems abroad", it added. The previous RBI directive in April 2018 didn't specify whether data can be processed abroad or should only be done locally.

headlines: No bail for son of BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya for thrashing official
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya's son and BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya's bail plea was rejected by a court in Indore on Wednesday after he was arrested for beating up a Municipal Corporation officer with a bat. He has been sent to judicial custody till July 7. Akash, who represents the Assembly seat of Indore-3, was seen thrashing the officer on camera.

headlines: Parents charged after 10-week-old girl in US died with 96 fractures
text: Authorities in Texas, US, have charged the parents of a 10-week-old girl who died with a cracked skull and 96 fractures last year. The girl passed away 12 days after she was brought home from the hospital, with an autopsy showing that she died from being hit in the head. The girl also had bruises on her face and scalp.

headlines: 3 right-armers play together, why can't Starc and I: Jason
text: Australia's left-arm fast bowler Jason Behrendorff, who took a five-wicket haul in his team's win against England in 2019 World Cup, said, "Sometimes you play three right-armers, so why cant we play two left-arm pacers (Mitchell Starc and him)?" Behrendorff and Starc shared nine wickets between them against England on Tuesday. "Mitchell and I have different roles," the 29-year-old added.

headlines: Lowering GST on automobiles would help the economy: Mahindra
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has said lowering GST on automobiles would help the economy. The auto industry has a huge multiplier effect on small companies and employment, he tweeted. Mahindra's statements come amid a sales slump in the industry, with passenger vehicle sales recording the steepest decline in nearly 18 years in May when it dropped by over 20%.

headlines: PM Modi's visit proof that our country is safe: Sri Lanka Minister
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Sri Lanka after the Easter blasts is proof that the country is safe, Sri Lankan Minister John Amaratunga said. PM Modi visited some of the damaged churches and it was a successful visit, Amaratunga further said. "India accounts for almost 20% of tourists coming to Sri Lanka...we'd like to take it further," he added.

headlines: Saudi scraps 49% ownership cap for foreign strategic investors
text: Saudi Arabia on Wednesday said it has relaxed a 49% limit for foreign strategic investors in shares of listed companies. The move is aimed to help "enhance the market's...attractiveness and...expand the institutional investments base," it said. There will be no minimum or maximum ownership limit, although the owners must hold the shares for two years before they can sell.

headlines: I live the most normal & regular life: 'Spider-Man' actor Tom Holland
text: 'Spider-Man' actor Tom Holland has said he has done "a good job of only being in the spotlight when [he needs] to be". "I don't get paparazzied. I don't go to fancy parties," he added. "I live the most normal and regular life...When I'm not on...press tour, you will never see me in the newspaper," the 23-year-old said.

headlines: Avengers: Endgame beats Avatar's original box-office collection
text: With $2.75 billion worldwide earnings, 'Avengers: Endgame' crossed the collections of the 2009 film 'Avatar' before the latter was re-released. In its original theatrical run, 'Avatar' earned $2.749 billion worldwide and grossed an additional $33 million in its 2010 re-release, which featured nine minutes of unseen footage. Notably, 'Avengers: Endgame' will also be re-released in America with additional footage.

headlines: 93-year-old woman arrested by UK Police to complete her dying wish
text: The Greater Manchester Police in the UK recently arrested a 93-year-old woman named Josie Birds, who had committed no crime, because she said it was her "dying wish". She was 'arrested' and taken to a police station to experience it. "A big thank you to Greater Manchester Police for 'arresting' my Gran Josie today," the woman's granddaughter tweeted.

headlines: We bleed blue, not aware of jersey colour vs England: Bharat Arun
text: After several reports stated that India will wear orange-coloured jersey against England in 2019 World Cup, team's bowling coach Bharat Arun said, "We aren't aware what colours we will be wearing." "We haven't given any thought to it. Our focus is on tomorrow's match (against West Indies). We bleed blue," he added. India will face England on June 30.

headlines: Starc reveals English fan sledged him for overeating before match
text: Mitchell Starc has revealed an English fan sledged him at breakfast ahead of Australia-England 2019 World Cup match. "He was having a go at my strapping tape and me eating too much and how it was going to affect my bowling. I was just hungry," he said. Earlier, Starc's wife Alyssa Healy claimed the supporter had fired up her husband.

headlines: Saw wife crying when I reached room: Sarfaraz on fat shaming video
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed has revealed he saw his wife crying when he went back to his hotel room after a video of a fan calling him pig went viral. "I tried to explain to her that this is just one video and that we have had people walk up to us and tell things on our faces," he added.

headlines: Sarfaraz Ahmed takes one-handed diving catch to dismiss Ross Taylor
text: Pakistan wicketkeeper-captain Sarfaraz Ahmed dived to his right to successfully complete a one-handed catch to dismiss New Zealand's Ross Taylor in the 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. Taylor had edged a Shaheen Afridi delivery in ninth over when Sarfaraz dived and stretched his right hand to hold on to the ball. Taylor got out for three runs off eight balls.

headlines: Apple cancels $22-million deal for new iPhone camera tech: Report
text: Apple has reportedly cancelled an around $22-million deal with British technology firm Nanoco for advanced iPhone camera sensor. The 'quantum dot' technology, being developed by Nanoco, allows camera sensors to gather light more efficiently compared to silicon designs. Nanoco's stock plummeted 74% last week on announcement of losing a deal with a client, which has now been reported as Apple.

headlines: BJYM workers recite Hanuman Chalisa on road to counter namaz in WB
text: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) members recited Hanuman Chalisa on the road in West Bengal's Howrah on Tuesday. BJYM's OP Singh said, "GT Road is blocked to offer Friday namaz. Patients die, people can't reach office on time." He added, "As long as it continues, we'll recite Hanuman Chalisa on Tuesdays on all main roads near Hanuman temples."

headlines: San Francisco bans e-cigarettes days after JUUL buys 28-floor office
text: San Francisco has become the first-ever US city to officially ban e-cigarettes, passing the legislation with a unanimous vote from the city's Board of Supervisors. This comes days after e-cigarette startup JUUL, headquartered in San Francisco, bought a 28-floor office tower there. Mayor London Breed, who has already expressed support for the legislation, has 10 days to review the legislation.

headlines: Delhi triple murder case solved, daughter of victim's friend arrested
text: Three days after an elderly couple and a nursing attendant were found murdered in Vasant Vihar, the Delhi Police on Wednesday said they've solved the case. The daughter of the slain elderly woman's friend has been arrested along with her live-in partner. Police said the CCTV footage showed the two left the house seven hours before the bodies were discovered.

headlines: Bihar boy fractures left hand, doctors cast plaster on right
text: The staff at Darbhanga Medical College & Hospital in Bihar plastered the right hand of a seven-year-old boy who had fractured his left hand. The boy said, "I tried telling them while they were giving me the treatment but they didn't listen to me." His mother said, "This is utter negligence. We were not even provided with a single tablet."

headlines: Hindus donate land for graveyard to Muslims in Ayodhya
text: Hindus in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya have donated land to Muslims for a graveyard. "The land is by the side of a graveyard and some Muslims buried their dead here. There were disputes and tension, but now we've settled the matter," said a signatory to the land deed. The registered deed for 1.25 bissas of land was signed on June 20.

headlines: Ravi Shankar Prasad countered by BJP MP in Lok Sabha
text: Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad was countered by BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy in Lok Sabha. Prasad said during natural calamities such as floods and cyclones, only state-run telecom companies BSNL and MTNL provide free services, which Rudy contradicted by saying private operators also give free services. Prasad then said private companies provide free services only for a few days.

headlines: Internal organs of Indian kid killed in US were eaten by maggots
text: The internal organs of Sherin Mathews, the Indian toddler killed in the US in 2017, were eaten by maggots before her body reached the morgue, the doctor who performed the autopsy on her told jurors. Sherin's adoptive father admitted that he "physically assisted" her in drinking milk and that she choked and after coughing for a while, her breathing slowed.

headlines: Shakib will go down as the greatest Bangladesh player: Hussey
text: Ex-Australia cricketer Michael Hussey has said all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan will go down as "one of the greats of the game and certainly as the greatest Bangladesh player". Hussey credited Shakib for putting Bangladesh in the fifth position on points table.
