Shakib recently became the first-ever all-rounder to score 400-plus runs and take 10 wickets in a World Cup edition.

headlines: Won't tolerate FDI norms violations: Govt warns e-commerce firms
text: Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal, in his recent meeting with stakeholders including e-commerce firms, warned strictly against the violations of FDI norms by the e-commerce firms. Goyal addressed the chief executives of close to 25 e-commerce companies, including Flipkart, Amazon India and Zomato. The government is planning to bring out a national policy on e-commerce within the next 12 months.

headlines: Charged football-like molecules found in space for 1st time
text: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has helped confirm the presence of electrically charged version of football-like molecules called "Buckminsterfullerene" in the interstellar medium (ISM) for the first time. The molecule comprises 60 carbon atoms (C60) arranged in a hollow sphere. It gets ionized when ultraviolet light from stars tears off an electron from it, giving it a positive charge, NASA said.

headlines: Won't let US use our territory to attack Iran, says Iraq
text: Iraq won't allow the US to use its bases there to launch an attack on neighbouring Iran, Iraq's President Barham Salih said. "This part of the world has been going through a cycle of conflict for so many years, we don't need another war," he added. Tensions between the US and Iran escalated after the downing of an American drone.

headlines: Britannia denies speculation over resignation of MD Varun Berry
text: FMCG major Britannia Industries on Wednesday denied speculations over the resignation of its Managing Director Varun Berry. Terming the speculations as "incorrect and baseless", Britannia said Berry was re-appointed as the MD for five years from April 1, after an earlier six-year term. Berry had joined the company in 2013, after having worked at PepsiCo.

headlines: Data storage rules kept out of e-commerce policy: Reports
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has reportedly decided to keep data localisation norms out of the final e-commerce policy. In a meeting with e-commerce companies, Goyal reportedly said data protection would now be handled by the IT Ministry. He added that the government's effort would be to bring convergence of interests of e-commerce platforms and small retailers, reports further said.

headlines: India's May steel exports fall to lowest in three years
text: India exported 319,000 tonnes of finished steel in May, down 28% from the year-ago period, Reuters reported citing preliminary government data. This is the lowest level since April 2016. Steel exports to the EU dropped 55% amid 'safeguard' measures to prevent a surge of steel imports as a result of US' tariffs, while exports to Nepal were down 22%.

headlines: Pamela breaks up with footballer Adil Rami, accuses him of cheating
text: Actress-model Pamela Anderson took to Instagram to reveal that she has broken up with World Cup-winning footballer Adil Rami and also accused him of cheating on her. "How is it possible to control 2 women's hearts and minds like this. I'm sure there were others. He is the monster," she wrote. Pamela and Adil had been dating since 2017.

headlines: I come from Haryana, women don't get a chance at life there: Mallika
text: Mallika Sherawat, who was born in Haryana's Moth village said, "Where I come from, Haryana, women don't get a chance at life." "For me, the fact that I'm on my own feet...and I live life on my own terms, is the biggest achievement," she added. Mallika further said, "Till the women of this country don't come up, India won't rise."

headlines: Proud of Chinmayi, it takes guts: Samantha on singer's #MeToo story
text: Actress Samantha Akkineni, who had supported Tamil singer and dubbing artist Chinmayi Sripaada after she made sexual harassment allegations against lyricist Vairamuthu, has said that she is proud of Chinmayi. "It takes a lot of guts to do what she has done," Samantha added. Chinmayi was ousted from the dubbing union weeks after she came forward with her #MeToo allegations.

headlines: Ishaan replies as troll says he is justifying Shahid's Kabir Singh
text: Actor Ishaan Khatter has responded to a troll who commented on one of his posts that he is justifying his half-brother Shahid Kapoor's 'Kabir Singh', while adding that the film is ''misogynistic". In the post, Ishaan had praised Shahid's performance in the film. Replying to the troll, Ishaan wrote, "Everybody should have an opinion. I don't agree with yours."

headlines: Gayle reverses decision to retire from ODIs, wants to play vs India
text: West Indies opener Chris Gayle, who had announced that he will retire from ODI cricket following the 2019 World Cup, has reversed his decision. The 39-year-old said that he would like to play the home series against India, which is scheduled to take place in August-September. Gayle also said that he might feature in a Test match as well.

headlines: Apple confirms acquisition of self-driving car tech startup Drive.ai
text: Apple has confirmed it has acquired startup Drive.ai, which worked on developing kits using AI to turn regular cars into autonomous ones, for an undisclosed amount. Drive.ai had reportedly told US officials it planned to close its business and lay off 90 workers by Friday in a permanent closure. Apple has reportedly hired dozens of Drive.ai engineers.

headlines: Congress can neither digest victory nor accept defeat: PM Modi
text: Seemingly referring to Congress' victory in three state elections in December 2018 and loss in recent LS polls, PM Narendra Modi said, "I'm shocked looking at Congress. You were in power so long, but it seems you can neither digest victory nor accept defeat." He added, "This isnt the last election ever...Whats the point in getting so disappointed over defeat?"

headlines: Lust to divide, no desire to unite: TMC MP lists signs of 'fascism'
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra, in Parliament, listed seven signs of how India is moving towards fascism. "There's a powerful...nationalism that's searing into our national fabric...It's a lust to divide...not the desire to unite," she stated. While ministers can't produce their degrees to show their qualification, poor people are expected to show papers to prove their citizenship, she added.

headlines: Does Congress party's loss in elections mean India's loss? PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi in the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday said, "If Congress loses then does that mean India lost?" He said, "There is a limit to arrogance. Congress could not win a single seat in 17 states." He added, "I was saddened when some leaders said BJP won the elections but the nation lost, the democracy lost."

headlines: NASA to ask US school students to name its 1,000-kg Mars rover
text: NASA has announced a "Name the Rover" contest, open to US school students from kindergarten to grade 12, to name the space agency's over 1,000-kg Mars 2020 rover. NASA had earlier asked people to give names that will fly to Mars in 2020. It had also asked for song suggestions to be added to playlist of 2024 Moon mission's astronauts.

headlines: BJP General Secy's son held for beating municipal official with bat
text: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya's son and BJP MLA Akash Vijayvargiya was arrested today for thrashing a Municipal Corporation officer with a bat in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. A case was registered against him and 10 others after a video of him beating the officer surfaced online. Akash claimed the officers were carrying out an illegal drive to demolish a building.

headlines: We have no right to defame Jharkhand: PM on mob lynching incident
text: Speaking about the mob lynching incident in which a Muslim man was assaulted on the suspicion of theft in Jharkhand, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said, "We have no right to defame Jharkhand." "We are all saddened by the lynching of the youth. But, is it right to claim that the whole of Jharkhand state is the culprit," he added.

headlines: Bihar children's deaths due to AES matter of shame for us: PM Modi
text: Speaking for the first time on the deaths of children in Bihar due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES), PM Narendra Modi said it is unfortunate and a matter of shame for us. He said Centre is in regular touch with the state and providing all possible support. "I'm sure we will collectively come out of this crisis soon," he added.

headlines: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya cycles to Parliament
text: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya was seen cycling to Parliament on Wednesday. A car was seen closely following Mandaviya, who had also cycled to Rashtrapati Bhavan in May to take oath as a minister for another term in the PM Narendra Modi-led government. The 47-year-old Patidar leader became a member of the Rajya Sabha in 2012 and was re-elected last year.

headlines: Uttarakhand cabinet minister's son killed in road accident in UP
text: Two persons including the son of Uttarakhand cabinet minister Arvind Pandey were killed and another was critically injured in a road accident near Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly during wee hours of Wednesday. Minister Arvind Pandey's son Ankur Pandey along with Munna Giri, died on the spot. Their car collided with a truck coming from the opposite direction.

headlines: Amitabh Kant to be NITI Aayog CEO for two more years
text: The government on Wednesday extended think-tank NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant's tenure by two years till June 30, 2021. Kant, who graduated in economics from Delhi's St. Stephen's College, is a 1980 batch IAS officer of the Kerala cadre. Earlier this month, PM Narendra Modi approved the reconstitution of NITI Aayog and retained Rajiv Kumar as the Vice Chairman.

headlines: 23-year-old student's dead body found in UP forest
text: The dead body of Rahul Verma, a 23-year-old student, was found in a forest in Lalganj area of Pratapgarh district in Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday, the police said. They added that prima facie it appeared that he was hacked to death. The body has been sent for postmortem, the police further said.

headlines: Woman beats up man with iron rod in road rage case, arrested
text: A woman has been arrested in Chandigarh after she beat up a man and vandalised his car with an iron rod in a road rage incident. The woman, identified as Sheetal Sharma, was reversing her car when the man's car rammed into her vehicle. The man was taken to hospital and a case has been registered against the woman.

headlines: France held responsible for air pollution in first such ruling
text: A French court has held the country responsible for failing to limit air pollution in and around Paris, in the first such ruling in France. The ruling came in a case filed by a woman after she and her daughter suffered respiratory ailments due to pollution. There was insufficient evidence to award damages for the ailments, the court said.

headlines: Situation in WB akin to state of emergency: Javadekar
text: Addressing reporters outside Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, The way CM Mamata has been conducting things in WB, is no less than a state of emergency." Javadekar added, "She is doing a very bad job at running the state." He was speaking on the 44th anniversary of Emergency imposed by late PM Indira Gandhi in 1975.

headlines: Terrorist affiliated with Zakir Musa group killed in J&K's Tral
text: At least one terrorist was killed after security forces cornered 2-3 militants in Tral forest area in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Wednesday. Arms and ammunition were recovered, while the terrorist was identified as Shabir Ahmad Malik. The police said, "He was initially affiliated with proscribed outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba and later on was part of the Zakir Musa group."

headlines: Adani Power to acquire debt-laden GMR Chhattisgarh Energy
text: Adani Power on Tuesday said it will acquire GMR Chhattisgarh Energy (GCEL) after a consortium of lenders led by Axis Bank approved its resolution plan for the debt-laden firm. The Gautam Adani-led company will buy 52.38% stake from lenders and the remaining from the GMR Group. GCEL owns an operational 1,370 MW thermal power plant in Chhattisgarh's Raikheda.

headlines: Balakot air strike planner Samant Goel appointed as new RAW chief
text: PM Narendra Modi has appointed Samant Goel, who was part of planning the Balakot air strikes, as the next chief of India's Research and Analysis Wing (RAW). Goel earlier headed operations for the external intelligence agency and also had a role in surgical strikes after Uri attack. Meanwhile, Arvind Kumar has been appointed as the Director of Intelligence Bureau.

headlines: L&T gets control of Mindtree in India's first hostile takeover in IT
text: Engineering conglomerate Larsen and Toubro (L&T) has acquired a controlling 51% stake in IT services company Mindtree. L&T's hostile bid to acquire a controlling stake in Mindtree is the first in India's software services industry. In March, L&T bought 20.32% of Mindtree from VG Siddhartha and his Coffee Day Enterprises and said it planned to raise its stake to 66%.

headlines: Learning platform Unacademy raises $50 million in Series D funding
text: Bengaluru-based learning platform Unacademy on Wednesday announced it has raised $50 million in Series D funding round from Steadview Capital, Sequoia India, Nexus Venture Partners and Blume Ventures. Aakrit Vaish (Co-Founder & CEO, Haptik) and Sujeet Kumar (Co-Founder, Udaan) also participated in the round. Unacademy was founded by Gaurav Munjal, Roman Saini and Hemesh Singh in 2015.

headlines: Kangana, Rangoli summoned by court over defamation case by Pancholi
text: Kangana Ranaut and her sister Rangoli Chandel have been summoned by a Mumbai court over the defamation case filed by Aditya Pancholi in 2017. "The next hearing in the matter is on 26th July, where the actress is supposed to be present," said Pancholi's lawyer. Kangana had alleged in 2017 that she was in an abusive relationship with Pancholi.

headlines: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio shares post on Chennai water crisis
text: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio took to Instagram to express his concern over the water crisis in Chennai. The actor shared a post by BBC which read, "'Only rain can save Chennai from this situation'...The acute water shortage has forced the city to scramble for urgent solutions." Leonardo is an environmental activist and also has a foundation in his name.

headlines: Pak's 2019 WC results are identical to their 1992 WC results so far
text: Pakistan's results of their first six matches in 2019 World Cup are identical to their results from the first six matches in the 1992 edition, which they won. Pakistan lost to West Indies in the opening match on both the occasions, while their third match in both the editions was washed out. Pakistan face New Zealand in World Cup today.

headlines: Google Maps to alert Indian users if their cab deviates from route
text: Google Maps on Wednesday rolled out a new feature 'Stay Safer' for its Indian users who travel in taxis and autorickshaws. The users will get 'off-route alerts' if their driver deviates more than 0.5 kilometres from the Google Maps' suggested route. Users can also share their live trip with friends and family from that screen to make them aware.

headlines: Mamata is trying to create West Bangladesh: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
text: Accusing the Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government of allowing infiltrators from Bangladesh to settle in West Bengal, state BJP chief Dilip Ghosh said, "She is trying to combine Bengal and Bangladesh and create West Bangladesh." Ghosh added, "They are saying that you have to learn Bengali to go to West Bengal...The chief minister is very interested in becoming prime minister."

headlines: BJP General Secy's son beats up Municipal official with bat in MP
text: Akash Vijayvargiya, BJP MLA and son of BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya, thrashed a Municipal Corporation officer with a cricket bat in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. Officials were in the area for an anti-encroachment drive. "This is just the beginning, we'll end this corruption and goondaism. 'Aavedan, nivedan aur fir dana dan' this is our line of action," Akash said later.

headlines: OYO China denies employees were fired, says hired 1,500 more
text: OYO China rejected recent reports which claimed it was firing about 1,000 employees from its development team, with the operations team slated to be reduced by half. "In the last few months, we've hired over 1,500 people and will have over 10,000 full-time employees on the roll," OYO said. "A large-scale layoff is absolutely incorrect, baseless and misleading," it added.

headlines: TapChief raises $650,000 from 500 Startups, Kunal Shah and others
text: Networking platform for professionals TapChief has raised $650,000 from over 50 investors including VC firm 500 Startups, AngelList India, Stanford Angels, and SucSEED Venture Partners. Existing investors Paytm, NuVentures, and marquee angel investors like FreeCharge's Kunal Shah also participated. TapChief was founded in 2016 by BITS Pilani alumni Shashank Murali, Binay Krishna and Arjun Krishna.

headlines: There was no intelligence failure in Pulwama attack: Government
text: G Kishan Reddy, the MoS in the Ministry of Home Affairs, on Wednesday said there was no intelligence failure in the Pulwama attack. "All agencies are working in a coordinated manner and intelligence inputs are shared among various agencies on a real-time basis," he said. On 14 February this year, 40 CRPF jawans were martyred in a Jaish-e-Mohammed terror attack.

headlines: SHO held for drinking alcohol in police station in dry Bihar
text: A station house officer (SHO) of Kharik police station in Naugachia district was arrested on charges of consuming liquor in dry Bihar on Monday night. The SHO, identified as Dilip Kumar Yadav, was allegedly found in an inebriated condition at his own police station and sent to 14-days police custody. He has been booked under relevant sections of the CrPC.

headlines: Veterinary science university's VC booked for raping woman in MP
text: Dr PD Juyal, the Vice Chancellor of state-run Nanaji Deshmukh Veterinary Science University in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur, has been booked for allegedly raping a 40-year-old woman. The woman claimed that Juyal had raped her after calling her to his hotel room on the pretext of offering her a job in March 2018.

headlines: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo meets PM Modi, NSA Doval
text: United States Secretary of State Mike Pompeo met Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his residence on Wednesday morning. Pompeo later met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and National Security Advisor Ajit Doval. According to reports, US-India trade relations and H1-B visas were among the topics discussed between the two sides.

headlines: Turkey will lose F-35 jets if it buys Russian S-400 missiles: US
text: Turkey will be removed from the F-35 fighter jet programme if it goes ahead with the purchase of Russian S-400 air defence system, Kay Bailey Hutchison, US Ambassador to NATO, said. "We cannot have the F-35 in any way affected by, or destabilised by, having this Russian system," she added. The US earlier stopped training Turkish pilots on the jets.

headlines: 4 Indians held in Malaysia after 5,200 turtles, meth seized from them
text: Four Indian nationals have been arrested in Malaysia after more than 14 kilograms of methamphetamine and over 5,200 turtles were seized from them at the Kuala Lumpur airport. Two men found with the turtles said that they were meant to be sold as pets in India. Two other men, believed to be drug mules, face the death penalty if convicted.

headlines: Apple patents smartwatch band with adjustable built-in camera
text: Apple has received a patent for a smartwatch band with an adjustable built-in camera. The design places an "optical sensor" at the end of the flexible watch strap, letting users twist and turn this section to get a photograph. The concept reportedly allows for the possibility of cameras on both sides of the band and may allow for 360-degree imagery.

headlines: 3 children dead, 1 injured due to lightning in UP's Sultanpur
text: At least three children died and another was critically injured after lightning struck the Haji Patti village in Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday. The injured child has been admitted to the district hospital. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department said that thunderstorms, accompanied by lightning and gusty winds, are very likely in isolated places over Rajasthan, West Bengal and Odisha.

headlines: Delhi man murders friend to marry his wife, arrested
text: Twenty-year-old factory worker Gulkesh allegedly bludgeoned his friend with a brick and left him unconscious on a railway track in West Delhi. "A train ran over the body, dragging and tearing it and scattering pieces," the police said. Following this, Gulkesh tried to mislead the police but later confessed that he had killed his friend to marry the deceased's wife.

headlines: Melania Trump's spokesperson to be new White House Press Secretary
text: US First Lady Melania Trump has announced that her spokesperson Stephanie Grisham will be the next White House Press Secretary and Communications Director. Grisham will succeed Sarah Sanders who's set to step down at the end of June. Melania said that she and US President Donald Trump "can think of no better person to serve the Administration & our country".

headlines: JetPrivilege offers multiple ways to earn & redeem JPMiles
text: JetPrivilege members can now earn and redeem JPMiles on flight bookings across airlines worldwide, on all hotel bookings, all your shopping, every time you refuel and in many other ways. As part of their exclusive offer, you can earn 1000 bonus JPMiles on your first flight booking only on jetprivilege.com*.

headlines: Pakistan, China back India's bid for non-permanent UNSC seat
text: Pakistan, China and 53 other members of the United Nations' Asia-Pacific Group of countries have backed India's candidature for a non-permanent seat at the Security Council for a two-year term in 2021-2022. Elections for five non-permanent members for the 2021-2022 term will reportedly be held around June 2020. India has served as a non-permanent member of the UNSC seven times.

headlines: 1 lakh people excluded from Assam NRC, will have to prove citizenship
text: The Additional Draft Exclusion List of National Register of Citizens in Assam has the names of 1,02,462 people, who now have to file claims to prove their citizenship. In July last year, over 40 lakh people were excluded, of which 36 lakh had filed claims against their exclusion. The final list of the NRC will be published on July 31.

headlines: Aaja baith ja: Deepika jokingly tells photographer to sit in her car
text: A video of actress Deepika Padukone jokingly telling photographers to sit in her car has surfaced online. In the video, the photographers can be seen taking pictures of Deepika as she exits the Mumbai airport and walks towards her car while telling a photographer, "Aaja baith ja." Commenting on the video, a user wrote, "Wish these celebrities had...their personal space."

headlines: Journalist files complaint of assault & robbery against Salman
text: A journalist has filed a criminal complaint against Salman Khan in a Mumbai court on charges of assault and robbery. "My client...was attacked by Salman on April 24...[He] snatched my client's cell phone...When my client tried defending himself, he was abused by Salman," said the journalist's lawyer. The journalist was trying to shoot Salman's video when the incident happened.

headlines: Real Madrid sign late footballer Jose Antonio Reyes' 11-yr-old son
text: The 11-year-old son of ex-Arsenal and Spain footballer Jose Antonio Reyes, who died in a car accident in June, has signed a contract with Real Madrid, the team that his father represented more than ten years ago. Jose Reyes Lopez, who plays as a forward, will join the Real Madrid academy ahead of next season.

headlines: Starc bowls Stokes with 145-kmph yorker, deemed as 'ball of 2019 WC'
text: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc clean bowled England all-rounder Ben Stokes for 89(115) with a 145-kmph inswinging yorker in 2019 World Cup on Tuesday, with many terming it as the 'ball of the tournament'. Stokes lost his bat after getting bowled and kicked it away before walking back. "Now that was an absolute beauty," ex-England spinner Graeme Swann tweeted.

headlines: Our fate is in our own hands: Eoin Morgan after losing to Australia
text: Following England's defeat to Australia in 2019 World Cup, England captain Eoin Morgan said that their fate is in their own hands. "I thought...we were outplayed, Australia played and missed a lot and built a good partnership, and us losing early wickets wasn't ideal," he added. England are currently fourth on the points table.

headlines: Excited about progress on understanding Alzheimer's: Bill Gates
text: World's second-richest person Bill Gates shared a May 2019 article on Twitter about advancement in Alzheimer's research, and said, "I'm excited about the progress we're making." "For the first time, MIT researchers have completed an analysis of genes that are expressed in individual brain cells of Alzheimer's patients," the Microsoft Co-founder added about the article.

headlines: Congress members merge with BJP in Mizoram autonomous council
text: All the 20 Congress members of a tribal council in Mizoram have recently merged with the BJP to form its next executive committee. "The Congress legislators were being pressurized by Mizo National Front... to merge with them. But instead of merging with a regional party, the Congress legislators decided to join the BJP," Mizoram BJP president JV Hluna said.

headlines: Woman delivers baby in UP health centre's toilet; nurse transferred
text: A government community health centre's nurse was transferred and two officials were warned after a pregnant woman delivered her baby in the clinic's toilet in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, an official said on Tuesday. The nurse is accused of not attending to the pregnant woman, while the superintendent and medical officer referred her to another centre instead of taking prompt action.

headlines: 2.35 crore people used Railways' free WiFi at 1,600 stations in May
text: Around 2.35 crore users logged onto the Indian Railways' free WiFi service at 1,606 stations across its network in May, Railways' digital arm RailTel said. It further stated that the facility of free internet would be extended to another 4,791 stations within this year. RailTel claimed that the Howrah station alone saw 4.9 lakh user logins in a month.

headlines: 3-yr-old dies of burn injuries after falling into pot of hot food
text: A three-year-old child died after falling into a pot of hot food in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, police said on Tuesday. The child fell into the pot while playing at home and suffered severe burns on the face. His mother rushed him to a nearby hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries during treatment.

headlines: Walls closing in on me: YouTuber in last video before being found dead
text: US-based YouTuber and gaming vlogger Etika was found dead in New York's East River, nearly a week after he went missing. "You know I wasn't suicidal before...But one thing I didn't realise was the walls were closing around me so fast," the 29-year-old said in a video before he went missing. The cause of his death is not known yet.

headlines: Fertility doctor's license revoked for using own sperm in Canada
text: An 80-year-old Canadian fertility doctor's license was revoked on Tuesday for having used the wrong sperm, including his own, to inseminate patients over decades. He was also fined over Can$10,000 by a disciplinary panel. The doctor had already given up his medical license in 2014 after being disciplined in a prior case for inseminating three women with the wrong sperm.

headlines: Ravi Jaipuria's Devyani buys 61 more KFC outlets in India
text: Devyani International, the largest franchisee for Pizza Hut and KFC in India, is buying 61 more outlets of US-based Yum! Brands' KFC India. Devyani, owned by Ravi Jaipuria's RJ Corp, will acquire the outlets across Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. With this sale, less than 10% of KFC India's 400 outlets across the country are now company-owned.

headlines: Doctor uses Apple Watch to diagnose heart condition in restaurant
text: A US-based ophthalmologist revealed he used the ECG feature of his Apple Watch Series 4 to diagnose a person with a heart condition in a restaurant. "It's much faster...than finding an ECG machine at a public restaurant," doctor Tommy Korn wrote on Twitter. He added that since the recording can be deleted, it won't interfere with one's own health record.

headlines: Banking platform Open raises $30 million led by Tiger Global
text: Bengaluru-based Open, a neo-banking platform for SMEs and startups, has raised around $30 million in a Series B funding round led by Tiger Global Management. The funding round also saw participation from 3one4 Capital and Tanglin Venture Partners, among other investors. As per Crunchbase, the startup has raised $37.4 million in disclosed funding so far.

headlines: Govt plans to add 500 GW renewable energy by 2030
text: The government has said it plans to add 500 gigawatts of renewable energy to its electricity grid by 2030. The move aims to clean up the air in cities and increase the share of renewables in its electricity grid. The country would have installed 175 GW of renewable energy capacity by 2022 without taking into account large hydro, government added.

headlines: Warner Bros gets first female CEO in studio history
text: WarnerMedia has named Ann Sarnoff as the CEO of Warner Bros. Sarnoff, currently President of BBC Studios Americas, will be the first woman to head the studio behind 'Wonder Woman' and 'Friends'. The 57-year-old will be replacing Kevin Tsujihara, who quit in March following accusations of using his influence to secure work for an actress after the two had sex.

headlines: Growth in fuel demand to be at 4-4.5% this year: Indian Oil
text: Indian Oil Chairman Sanjiv Singh has said the growth in India's overall demand for fuel will remain at 4-4.5% this year. The growth rate could be lowest for the country since FY14, according to government data. Singh further said the demand for petrol and jet fuel is expected to rise by 7-8% this year, down from 9-10% previous year.

headlines: Australia defeat England, become 1st team to qualify for semis
text: Australia defeated England by 64 runs at Lord's Cricket Ground on Tuesday to become the first team to qualify for the 2019 World Cup semi-finals. England have now lost each of their four World Cup matches against Australia since the 2003 edition. England are currently fourth on the points table with eight points from seven matches.

headlines: Starc 2nd Australia pacer to take 15 wickets in multiple World Cups
text: Mitchell Starc has become the second Australia fast bowler after Glenn McGrath to take 15 wickets in multiple World Cup editions, achieving the feat against England in 2019 World Cup today. Starc took 22 wickets in 2015 World Cup, while McGrath took 15-plus wickets in the 1999, 2003 and 2007 editions. McGrath is the highest wicket-taker in World Cup history.

headlines: Feels good to be at a place where a dream started 36 yrs ago: Sachin
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with Sunil Gavaskar at Lord's Cricket Ground. "Feels good to be at a place where a dream started 36 years ago on this very day, at the very ground, with a person whom I emulated and considered my idol. #Nostalgia #1983WorldCup," he captioned the picture.

headlines: If someone is out on bail, let them enjoy: PM Modi on Sonia, Rahul
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said, "Kisi ko jamanat milti hai to enjoy kare, usme kya hai? (If someone gets bail, he/she should enjoy it)". He added this isn't Emergency that government will imprison people, it's the judiciary's job. Congress MP Adhir Chowdhury had asked if Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi were corrupt, why did the government not jail them.

headlines: 3-day deadline to find out how skeletons ended up at Bihar hospital
text: Muzaffarpur District Magistrate Alok Ranjan Ghosh on Monday formed a three-member committee to find how the human skeletal remains that were found last week near Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, ended up there. Ghosh asked the committee to file its report within three days. The panel began its probe at SKMCH on Tuesday.

headlines: Wimbledon seeding system disrespects world rankings: Nadal
text: Spanish tennis player Rafael Nadal criticised Wimbledon's seeding system, calling it disrespectful towards the ATP world rankings. Nadal is ranked second in the ATP rankings but is expected to be seeded third behind Swiss world number three Roger Federer. "I will accept three and fight to win the matches I have to win," Nadal said about his seeding.

headlines: Amazon India head Amit Agarwal takes over as IAMAI Chairman
text: The Internet and Mobile Association of India (IAMAI) has named Amit Agarwal, the SVP and Country Manager of Amazon India, as the new Chairman of the association. Agarwal takes over the position from former Google India and South East Asia VP Rajan Anandan. Yatra CEO Dhruv Shringi was named Vice Chairman, while Times Internet Vice-Chairman Satyan Gajwani was named Treasurer.

headlines: All-electric trucks make no sense for long-distance travel: BMW CTO
text: BMW CTO and Board of Management member Klaus Fröhlich, while talking about battery-powered long-haul tractor-trailer trucks versus fuel cells, insisted fuel cells have a future while batteries don't. "If you look at the range of a truck you would need a 16-ton payload only for the battery which is...nonsense," he said. "All-electric trucks are complete bullshit for long-distance," he added.

headlines: Govt to bring out national e-commerce policy within 12 months
text: The government will put in place an institutional framework to bring out a national policy on e-commerce within the next 12 months, an official said. This was reportedly informed by the Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal in his recent meeting with stakeholders including e-commerce firms. Earlier in February, the government had released a draft policy on e-commerce.

headlines: BMW to offer 25 e-vehicles in 2023, two yrs earlier than planned
text: BMW Board of Management Chairman Harald Krüger said, "We will offer 25 electrified vehicles already in 2023  two years earlier than originally planned." Over half of the 25 models will be fully electric. "We expect to see a steep growth curve towards 2025: Sales of our electrified vehicles should increase by an average of 30% every year," Krüger said.

headlines: NASA confirms high levels of methane found by rover on Mars
text: NASA confirmed its Curiosity rover had last week recorded the largest amount of methane ever during its mission on Mars at about 21 parts per billion units by volume. A follow-on experiment over the weekend revealed methane levels have sharply decreased. The finding suggests that last week's detection was one of the transient methane plumes that have been observed earlier.

headlines: Man forced to carry son's dead body due to lack of ambulance
text: A man on Tuesday was forced to carry the dead body of his eight-year-old son due to the unavailability of an ambulance at a government hospital in Bihar's Nalanda. The child had complained of fever and abdominal pain and was admitted to a private clinic. He was then referred to the hospital where he was declared brought dead by doctors.

headlines: Runaway bride found living with same-sex partner in Haryana
text: A Rajasthan woman, who went missing 23 days after her wedding, was found living with her same-sex partner of four years in Haryana on Monday, said police. The couple was produced before a magistrate where they argued that as adults they had a right to choose their partners. They were released and allowed to go wherever they want, police added.

headlines: Every inmate's right to seek parole: Haryana CM on Ram Rahim
text: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said every inmate has the right to seek parole. Dera Sacha Sauda's Gurmeet Ram Rahim, who was convicted in two rape cases and the murder of a journalist, has applied for parole for farming his fields in Sirsa. "The decision rests with the divisional commissioner and the report is awaited," Khattar added.

headlines: 733 terrorists killed in J&K since 2016, 113 in 2019: Govt
text: Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday said that 733 terrorists have been killed in Jammu and Kashmir since 2016, with 113 terrorists killed in 2019 till June 16. Reddy further said that terror-related incidents have tripled in the state since 2014 and as many as 112 civilians have lost their lives between 2016 and 2019.

headlines: Engine of Samaleshwari Express catches fire, 3 staffers dead
text: Three railway employees were killed after the Howrah-Jagdalpur Samaleshwari Express hit a tower car doing repair work and its engine caught fire in Odisha on Tuesday. The engine, the front guard-cum-luggage van and one general second class coach got derailed in the accident. At least eight occupants were present in the maintenance train, as per eyewitness accounts.

headlines: Govt warns Amazon, Flipkart over steep discounts: Reports
text: The government has reportedly warned foreign e-commerce firms such as Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart against providing steep online discounts, affecting small shopkeepers. It also asked online retailers to ensure compliance with new Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) rules, reports said. The government said it was prepared to listen to the foreign firms' concerns about the rules, reports added.

headlines: India's annual coal demand rises 9.1% to nearly 1 bn tonnes
text: Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday said the country's annual coal demand rose 9.1% to 991.35 million tonnes during the year ended March 2019. Consumption by India's utilities, which accounted for three-fourths of the total demand, rose 6.6% to 760.66 million tonnes, he added. Imports rose to 235.24 million tonnes in 2018-19 from 208.27 million tonnes in 2017-18.

headlines: I'm fine, just chilling in my hospital bed: Lara releases audio msg
text: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara, who was hospitalised in Mumbai after complaining of chest pain, said in an audio message that he's "fine and recovering". "I'm just chilling in my hospital bed and watching England vs Australia," he added. He further said that he felt uneasy after an extended workout session and felt it was best to see a doctor.

headlines: Trump warns Iran of obliteration if it attacks 'anything American'
text: US President Donald Trump warned in a series of tweets on Tuesday that any attack by Iran on "anything American" will be met with "great and overwhelming force" and in some cases with "obliteration". "Iran leadership doesn't understand the words 'nice' or 'compassion', they never have. Sadly, the thing they do understand is strength and power", the US President said.

headlines: Video of crow that appears to be a gorilla goes viral
text: A video shared by a Twitter user named Keitaro Simpson from Japan, which shows a crow that appears to be a gorilla has gone viral. The crow can be seen perched with its wings spread in such a way that they are obscuring the view of its legs. Corvid expert Kaeli Swift explained that the crow is "sunning itself".

headlines: Cricketer interacts with media from pool after taking 4 wickets
text: Sussex pacer Chris Jordan interacted with the media from a swimming pool after taking four wickets against Durham. Sussex took to Twitter to share a picture of the interaction with the caption, "4 for 41 for @CJordan today...and one of the stranger media sessions afterwards." "I've got a meeting tomorrow, might get...hot tub heated up a bit!" a user tweeted.

headlines: Stay at 5-star personal issue, don't need BJP certificate: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday said that staying at a five-star hotel is his personal issue. "Have I submitted any expenditure bill to the government? I'm not interested in getting a certificate from friends from BJP," Kumaraswamy said. This comes after the Opposition criticised him for staying at a five-star hotel in Bengaluru.

headlines: Congress ministers once said Muslims' reform not their job: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi said in Lok Sabha, "A Congress minister at the time of Shah Bano case said in an interview that some party ministers said it was not Congress' responsibility to uplift the Muslims." He added, "They said if Muslims want to lie in the gutter, let them be." PM Modi, however, said he has not verified the interview.

headlines: Eating ant eggs for survival: Padma Shri 'Canal Man of Odisha' Naik
text: Padma Shri farmer Daitari Naik, known as 'Canal Man of Odisha', said he and his family are eating ant eggs for survival. Naik alleged villagers say manual labour is below his dignity now and don't offer him work. Naik won the award in 2019 for carving a 3-km-long canal with a crowbar to bring drinking water from a mountain stream.

headlines: 39 booked for protesting AES deaths, lack of water supply in Bihar
text: An FIR was registered against 39 people in Harivanshpur village in Bihar on Tuesday after they protested against the deaths of children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) and the lack of water supply in the area. "Our children have died. Men against whom FIR has been registered have left the village. They were the only breadwinners," said a villager.

headlines: Cyclone Fani killed 64, affected 1.4 lakh hectare cropland in Odisha
text: As many as 64 people died and over 1.4 lakh hectare cropland was affected due to Cyclone Fani in Odisha, the Home Ministry said on Tuesday. Cyclone Fani affected three states, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and West Bengal. In Odisha, 5.56 lakh houses and huts were damaged, 6,281 cattle was lost, and 6,416 boats and 8,828 nets were damaged, it added.

headlines: Tamil Nadu man finds 35-year-old meteorite stone in his farmhouse
text: A man named Lakshmi Narayan found a 35-year-old meteorite stone in his farmhouse in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore, which was confirmed by the Geological Survey of India. "While I was cleaning the farmhouse, I found the stone which landed 35 years ago," he said. He visited the collectorate office to hand over the stone to the respective authorities on Monday.

headlines: Trump names dead Iran leader while putting sanctions on current one
text: While announcing sanctions against Iran's current Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, US President Donald Trump mistakenly said he was issuing the measures against former Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini. Iran's founder and revolutionary leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini died in 1989, and the country has since been led by Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

headlines: FedEx sues US over 'impossible' task of monitoring exports to China
text: FedEx has sued the US government saying it should not be held liable if it inadvertently shipped products that violated a ban on exports to some Chinese companies. Export restriction rules "essentially deputize FedEx to police the contents of the millions of packages it ships daily even though doing so is a virtually impossible task," the US courier group said.

headlines: Maker of worlds best-selling drug to buy Botox maker for $63 bn
text: US drugmaker AbbVie, which makes the world's best-selling drug Humira, has said it would buy Ireland's Allergan for about $63 billion. Allergan's portfolio is best known for Botox, a popular non-surgical cosmetic treatment, but the company also makes drugs that are used in eye care, gastroenterology and to treat the central nervous system. Humira is used to treat rheumatoid arthritis.

headlines: Neymar informally accepts pay-cut to return to Barca: Report
text: PSG's Brazilian footballer Neymar Jr has reportedly verbally agreed to return to his former club Barcelona while taking a pay-cut. French side PSG had paid a world record 222 million to sign him from Barcelona two years ago. It has been further reported that Neymar will have to make a public apology before rejoining the club.

headlines: Chelsea get permission from Derby to hold Frank Lampard talks
text: English club Derby County have granted manager Frank Lampard permission to open talks with Chelsea regarding their managerial vacancy. Lampard led Derby to the Championship play-off final in his first year as a manager. Lampard scored a record 211 goals in over 13 years for the London-based club.

headlines: 2026 Winter Olympics to be staged in Milan/Cortina dAmpezzo
text: The International Olympic Committee on Monday announced that the 2026 Winter Olympics will be staged at the Italian venue of Milan/Cortina d'Ampezzo after beating off a bid from Sweden's Stockholm/Are. The Winter Games will run from February 6-22 in 2026. Italy has twice previously hosted the Winter Olympics, firstly in 1956 in Cortina d'Ampezzo and then in 2006 in Turin.

headlines: Beating India won't be easy: Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan
text: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan reckons that defeating India in the sides' World Cup 2019 match would not be easy. "They are the top side. They are someone who is looking at the title. So it's not going to be easy, but having said that, we'll give our best shot," Shakib added about the upcoming India-Bangladesh match.

headlines: 18-yr-old player with 8 fingers and 7 toes earns Wimbledon wildcard
text: British tennis player Francesca Jones has earned a wildcard for Wimbledon Grand Slam, which begins on July 1, despite having a rare genetic disorder. The 18-year-old world number 297 player has eight fingers, seven toes and less teeth than most people. "I always say the greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do," she said.

headlines: 'Bye Bye Camera' app removes people from photos, fills background
text: 'Bye Bye Camera' app can automatically remove people from photos and fill in the background. It reportedly works by combining functionality from an image recognition app YOLO with a neural network that analyses the background and tries to repaint it. "I consider [it] an app for the post-human era," Damjanski, the artist who reportedly helped to create the project said.

headlines: OYO China to fire over 1,000 underperforming staff: Reports
text: OYO China is reportedly firing over 1,000 employees across its business development and operations teams. While the development team will face around 1,000 firings, the operations team is slated to be reduced by half, reports claimed. Without confirming the firings, OYO said its corporate management culture is performance-oriented and it will not tolerate continual failure to meet targets.

headlines: Hero, Bajaj, TVS object NITIs move for all-electric two-wheelers
text: Hero MotoCorp, Bajaj Auto and TVS Motor have criticised NITI Aayog's plan to convert all two-wheelers below 150cc to electric, saying it's uncalled for and could jeopardise the industry. The transition "won't reduce one iota of pollution", TVS Motor Chairman Venu Srinivasan said. Targeting two- and three-wheelers and not cars makes the initiative incomplete, Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj said.

headlines: Inter-caste couple's heads shaved, paraded in Odisha
text: Locals of Odisha's Mandua village shaved the heads of an inter-caste couple and paraded them on the streets when the boy went to visit the girl's house on Saturday night, said police. The incident came to light after a video showing the shaving went viral on social media. Police have arrested three of the 21 people booked so far.

headlines: We will never build a nuclear weapon: Iran
text: Iran has said that it will never build a nuclear weapon because of the Islamic nation's religious views. Earlier this month, Iran said that it will breach the uranium enrichment limit set out in the 2015 nuclear deal. Iran had agreed to restrictions on its nuclear programme in exchange for the lifting of economic sanctions under the deal.

headlines: Nalanda Capital sells 10.61% in Mindtree to L&T: Reports
text: Singapore-based Nalanda Capital has reportedly sold its entire 10.61% stake in Mindtree to L&T in an ongoing open offer for shareholders of the Bengaluru-based IT firm. This comes after markets regulator SEBI reportedly asked if Nalanda acted in concert with Mindtree Founders without triggering an open offer. The transaction has brought L&T closer to acquiring a 51% stake in Mindtree.

headlines: French consulting firm Capgemini to buy Altran for $4 bn
text: French business consultancy firm Capgemini on Monday said it will buy engineering and digital services company Altran for $4.1 billion. Capgemini would also assume Altran's net debt of $1.6 billion. The combination of the two companies will result in a group with $19.4 billion in annual revenue and more than 2.5 lakh employees.

headlines: Finch 2nd Australia captain to slam 2 tons in a World Cup edition
text: Aaron Finch today became the second player since Ricky Ponting in 2003 to smash at least two hundreds as Australia captain in a World Cup edition. The 32-year-old, who had scored 153 against Sri Lanka on June 15, smashed a 116-ball 100 against England on Tuesday including two sixes and 11 fours. Overall, it was Finch's 15th hundred in ODIs.

headlines: WI's Cottrell responds to fan who asked him about his less followers
text: West Indies fast bowler Sheldon Cottrell responded to a fan on Twitter who questioned why the 29-year-old had less number of followers on Twitter. "Bc my skills are better on the field than in 280 characters," Cottrell tweeted. "Coz you don't have to be famous especially on social media to create a change!" a user tweeted.

headlines: 11-year-old boy's Samsung tablet overheats and burns bed in UK
text: An 11-year-old UK boy escaped injury after his Samsung tablet overheated while on charge for nine hours and burnt his bed as he slept last week. The boy had taken the gadget into his room and fell asleep with the device next to him. The tablet was bought new four years ago and was connected to an original charger.

headlines: You can't push us: 1st-time MP Nusrat as media surrounds her, Mimi
text: After actors-turned-politicians Nusrat Jahan and Mimi Chakraborty took oath as MPs on Tuesday, they were approached by several media reporters outside the Parliament. Feeling uncomfortable, Jahan said, "Aap dhakka nahin maar sakte sir, samajhiye baat ko (You cannot push us sir, please try to understand)". The duo took security personnel's help to make way and get to their vehicle.

headlines: On night of June 25, 1975, Emergency destroyed India's soul: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday brought up the Emergency during his speech in the Lok Sabha, saying, "On that night of June 25, 1975, the country's soul was crushed." He further said, "Who imposed the Emergency? Who trampled over the spirit of the Constitution, gagged the media and bullied the judiciary? We can't forget those dark days."

headlines: Uber's real threat in London is Ola, not Bolt: Morgan Stanley
text: Multinational investment bank Morgan Stanley's analysts have said that real threat faced by Uber in London is Bengaluru-based Ola and not Estonia-based startup Bolt. Mercedes-parent Daimler-backed Bolt re-entered the London market about two weeks ago, two years after its operating licence was revoked. Meanwhile, Ola has announced it plans to rival Uber in London before the end of 2019.

headlines: SpaceX rocket's reusable core booster misses landing, explodes
text: The reusable core booster of Elon Musk-led aerospace startup SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rocket crashed into the ocean and exploded after failing to land on a drone ship. SpaceX was able to successfully recover the rocket's two side boosters, which were reused for the first time since their April launch. SpaceX hasn't successfully recovered a Falcon Heavy's centre core to date.

headlines: Man tries to molest woman, drives car over family in UP; 2 dead
text: Two elderly women died and two others were injured after a man, who had allegedly tried to molest a woman from their family, ran his car over them in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Monday. Police said one person has been arrested, however, they have not found any molestation attempt in the CCTV footage yet, but further investigation is under way.

headlines: Mumbai man tries to commit suicide inside BMC HQ, arrested
text: A man named Sudam Shinde was arrested after he tried to commit suicide inside the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) headquarters in Mumbai on Tuesday. According to reports, Shinde was upset as his complaint regarding a toilet structure near his residence was allegedly not being addressed. The matter is being investigated.

headlines: Downed US drone was in Iranian airspace: Russia
text: The US drone shot down by Iran last week was in Iranian airspace, Nikolai Patrushev, Secretary of Russia's Security Council, said, citing Russian intelligence. The US has, however, claimed that the drone was shot down in international airspace. Patrushev added that US' evidence claiming Iran was behind attacks on ships in the Gulf of Oman was poor quality and unprofessional.

headlines: He's 100% right: Iran after Trump says no US presence needed in Gulf
text: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif has said that US President Donald Trump is "100% right" over his statement that the US doesn't need to be present in the Gulf to protect the shipping lanes for other countries. Amid escalating tensions between the US and Iran, Trump has told nations to protect their own oil shipments in the Gulf.

headlines: Former Rear Admiral Surendra Ahuja to head Boeing Defense India
text: US defence and aerospace major Boeing on Tuesday appointed Surendra Ahuja as the Managing Director of Boeing Defense India. Ahuja had served as Rear Admiral before opting for early retirement in 2018. A former Indian Navy test pilot, he has flown 22 different types of aircraft and was the first Indian pilot to fly from a US Navy aircraft carrier.

headlines: We will definitely be back firing: Rabada after WC failure
text: Speaking about his side's failure at the ongoing World Cup 2019, South African pacer Kagiso Rabada said, "We will definitely be back firing and looking to really nail some of the things we wanted to nail in this tournament." "I got a lot more results in the IPL. In this tournament, I think I have just done okay," Rabada added.

headlines: England football coach attends England's WC match vs Australia
text: England national football team coach Gareth Southgate was seen attending the England cricket team's match against Australia in the World Cup at the Lord's Ground on Tuesday. Southgate was seen talking to English actor and producer Damian Lewis and former England cricketer and ECB's Managing Director of England Men's Cricket Ashley Giles.

headlines: The day that started it all: Sehwag on India's 1983 WC win
text: Reacting to the 36th anniversary of India's World Cup 1983 triumph, former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag tweeted, "The day that started it all. Landmark moment in the history of Indian sports. 25th June, 1983 -the day we were World Champions the first time." "[T]he face of Indian cricket changed with this victory," read part of VVS Laxman's tweet.

headlines: Govts must define speech for content-sharing platforms: Google
text: Google's SVP Global Affairs Kent Walker in a blog post stated it's important for governments to draw clear lines between legal and illegal speech on content-sharing platforms. He added, without clear definitions, there exists a risk of arbitrary enforcement that limits access to legitimate information. Content-sharing platforms are working to make and enforce responsible content policies, he said.

headlines: Raspberry Pi 4 computer with dual display support launched
text: The Raspberry Pi Foundation, a UK-based charity, has launched the Raspberry Pi 4 computer, which features dual monitor support at resolutions of up to 4K. The Pi 4, reportedly three times faster than Pi 3, features 1GB, 2GB and 4GB RAM options which price it at $35, $45 and $55 respectively. It has two USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 ports.

headlines: Security reduced for ex-Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu's family
text: The YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led Andhra Pradesh government on Tuesday reduced the security provided to the family of former Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu. His son and former state minister Nara Lokesh, who earlier had Z category security, will now be provided with 2+2 gunmen. The security provided to the other members of Naidu's family has been completely withdrawn.

headlines: Razorpay founders get majority control of board: Report
text: Online payments solution provider Razorpay's co-founders Harshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar have reportedly amended their board rights, giving them majority control of their board. They will reportedly now hold two votes per board seat, while investors will hold one vote per seat. Razorpay reportedly has five board seats wherein Tiger Global, Sequoia Capital and Ribbit Capital hold one seat each.

headlines: 6 dead, 43 injured as bus falls into gorge in Jharkhand
text: At least six people were killed and 43 were injured after a bus skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Jharkhand's Garhwa district on Tuesday. CRPF jawans had to break the windows of the bus to evacuate the passengers inside, said police. Six bodies were recovered while some were still stuck inside the bus.

headlines: Brian Lara admitted to hospital in Mumbai after chest pain complaint
text: Former West Indies captain Brian Lara was admitted to the Global Hospital in Parel in Mumbai on Tuesday after he complained of chest pain. The 50-year-old is in India as an expert for host broadcasters of 2019 Cricket World Cup. As per sources, Lara was at an event in a nearby hotel when he complained of discomfort.

headlines: Doctor files complaint against 'Kabir Singh', says it maligns doctors
text: A doctor has filed a complaint with Mumbai Police against the makers of Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' for allegedly portraying doctors in a poor light in their film. In a letter to the Censor Board, the doctor urged the body to stop the film from being screened. The letter was also addressed to the Health Minister, among others.

headlines: Pride protests violate code of conduct: Google warns employees
text: Google, in an internal memo to its employees, has warned that Pride protests against it violate the company's code of conduct. This comes weeks after Google-owned YouTube decided that videos posted by YouTuber Steven Crowder, containing racist and homophobic comments, "didn't violate its policies". Crowder had used terms like "gay Latino" and "lispy queer" while referring to a Vox journalist.

headlines: Greenland may lose over 99% ice by the year 3000, suggests study
text: A new study led by Alaska Fairbanks University researchers suggests if emissions continue to increase at their present rate, Greenland may lose over 99% of its ice by 3000. The study claimed if emissions are cut significantly, the loss may change to 8-25% by 3000. This will contribute up to approximately 6.5 feet of sea level rise, it added.

headlines: Crew members return to Earth after 204 days on space station
text: A Russian Soyuz MS-11 spacecraft's capsule has brought three Expedition 59 crew members successfully back to Earth after they spent 204 days aboard the International Space Station (ISS). The three members include Russian cosmonaut Oleg Kononenko, Canadian Space Agency astronaut David Saint-Jacques and NASA astronaut Anne McClain. They landed in Kazakhstan roughly 3.5 hours after departing the ISS.

headlines: 47-yr-old held for raping 16-yr-old daughter for a year in Dehradun
text: A 47-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 16-year-old daughter for one year and giving her birth-control pills to prevent pregnancy in Dehradun, police said on Monday. A police official said that the survivor's mother passed away five years ago. The incident came to light after the girl informed one of her school teachers of the alleged rape.

headlines: 78 bombs seized in 2 districts of West Bengal, 8 arrested
text: As many as 78 bombs were seized from the Paschim Bardhaman and North 24 Parganas districts in West Bengal on Monday. Eight people have been arrested in connection with the crime, said the police. Two persons were killed while several others were injured on Thursday after clashes broke out between two groups suspected to be affiliated to TMC and BJP.

headlines: UP locals save students as van gets stuck in waterlogged underpass
text: A driver was arrested after a school van carrying eight children got stuck in a waterlogged underpass in Ramkola, Uttar Pradesh on Monday. Locals said the children were running late for their school and the driver was in a hurry, adding, "We warned him that the water is too deep." The children were later rescued by the locals.

headlines: US Supreme Court ends ban on foul language trademarks
text: The US Supreme Court on Monday struck down a ban on trademarks on "immoral" or "scandalous" words and symbols. The ruling came in a case involving Los Angeles streetwear designer Erik Brunetti, who was turned down by US Patent and Trademark Office when he sought to trademark his brand name FUCT. The law had been in place since 1905.

headlines: Thai boys return to cave to honour diver who died during rescue
text: The 12 Thai football players who were trapped in the Tham Luang cave last year returned there on Monday to honour former Navy SEAL Saman Kunan who died during the rescue operation. The boys and their coach also held a religious ceremony marking the one year anniversary of their trapping in the flooded cave.

headlines: Iran not allowed to attend UN meeting on downing of US drone
text: Iran has been blocked from participating in a UN Security Council briefing regarding its downing of a US drone, the country's UN envoy Majid Takht-Ravanchi has said. "As a country whose airspace has been violated by US Iran was entitled to participate in the Council's meeting today," he added. "Unfortunately we were denied of exercising this right." he further said.

headlines: India may offer incentives to firms moving from China amid trade war
text: India is reportedly planning to offer tax incentives to attract companies moving out of China amid its trade war with the US. Industries identified for incentives include electronics, consumer appliances, electric vehicles, footwear and toys, according to a government document seen by Bloomberg. Other measures include setting up affordable industrial zones across the country's coastline.

headlines: Up to $490 billion in black money stashed abroad by Indians: Studies
text: Government-sponsored studies conducted by three institutes have found that unaccounted wealth held by Indians outside the country till 2010 could be as high as $490 billion. This was part of a report of the standing committee on finance tabled in Parliament on Monday. The panel said that reliable estimation of black money in and outside India was not possible.

headlines: Hrithik's sister told me her family sedates her: Rangoli
text: Sharing a report on the ongoing controversy surrounding Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina, Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli tweeted, "[Sunaina] told me her family doesn't only hit her but sedates her as well." "[S]ince she spoke to the media her phone is off," her tweet further read. Rangoli earlier alleged that Sunaina's family was physically assaulting her for dating a Muslim man.

headlines: It's speculation: Sonakshi on starring in film on Paralympian Deepa
text: Addressing reports which stated that she will be starring in an upcoming biopic on Rio Paralympics silver medallist Deepa Malik, Sonakshi Sinha said, "It's all speculation right now." "People can speculate...but when my films have to be announced, the right people will do it," she added. Deepa was the first Indian woman to win a medal in Paralympics in 2016.

headlines: Was borderline depressed while filming 'Game Over': Taapsee
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that she experienced borderline depression while filming her recently released film 'Game Over'. "I had to keep thinking about my biggest fears, again and again, for 35 days, every single day, for 12 hours," the actress added. "I used to text my sister, since she is my only bouncing board," Taapsee further said.

headlines: Warner becomes first batsman to score 500 runs in 2019 World Cup
text: Opener David Warner has become the first batsman to reach 500 runs in 2019 World Cup, achieving the feat during his team Australia's match against hosts England at Lord's Cricket Ground on Tuesday. The 32-year-old reached the milestone in his seventh innings of the tournament. Warner has slammed three fifties and two hundreds in 2019 World Cup so far.

headlines: Apple plans to add 2,000 jobs in Seattle within next 5 years
text: Apple in a news conference announced it plans to add 2,000 engineering jobs in Seattle within the next five years, starting with 200 additional jobs this year. Currently, Apple reportedly employees 500 people in Seattle in retail stores and an office, focused on machine learning. Last year, Apple announced plans to hire around 1,000 employees in Seattle within three years.

headlines: No one laughs at Salman more than he laughs at himself: Archana
text: Archana Puran Singh, while speaking about Salman Khan's humorous nature, said, "No one laughs at Salman more than he laughs at himself." "Even before someone can think of making fun of him, he starts cracking jokes on himself," she added. Archana further said there are very few people in the film industry who can take a joke on themselves.

headlines: Nusrat sworn-in as MP days after missing oath-taking for marriage
text: Actress-turned-politician Nusrat Jahan took oath as MP in Lok Sabha on Tuesday days after she missed the oath-taking ceremony for her wedding to businessman Nikhil Jain in Turkey. Actress Mimi Chakraborty also took oath as she had also missed the oath-taking ceremony since she was attending Nusrat's wedding. Both the actresses, who are first time MPs, took oath in Bangla.

headlines: Fans who pay their money entitled to boo Smith, Warner: Shane Warne
text: Ahead of England-Australia 2019 World Cup match, ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne said that he doesn't like any player being booed in any sport but if the fans who pay their "$$" want to boo Steve Smith and David Warner, they're entitled to. "But do it at your own peril as I know this won't effect them...but could inspire!" Warne added.

headlines: Wait & watch, Dhoni will peak at right time: Sandeep Patil on criticism
text: Ex-chief selector Sandeep Patil has said MS Dhoni will peak at the right time in 2019 World Cup and that critics should "wait and watch". He added that India might've scored less than 200 against Afghanistan if it hadn't been for Dhoni-Kedar Jadhav's partnership. "For me, Dhoni's role...is primarily of an advisor, wicket-keeper second and batsman third," he further said.

headlines: BJP workers try to burn Telangana CM's effigy, injure themselves
text: Three BJP workers, including Warangal district party President Rao Padma, received burn injuries as they were burning the effigy of Telangana CM K Chandrasekhar Rao while protesting a 9-month-old baby's rape and murder in the state. The party workers were rushed to a hospital, where one of them is said to be in critical condition.

headlines: Ex-Congress leader sacked for praising PM Modi to join BJP
text: AP Abdullakutty, a former lawmaker from Kerala's Kannur expelled from the Congress for praising PM Narendra Modi for BJP's victory in the Lok Sabha elections, is set to join the BJP. He met PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah in New Delhi on Monday. Before joining Congress, he was expelled by CPI(M) for praising then Gujarat CM Modi.

headlines: Cure.fit gets $45 million, closes Series D round at $120 million
text: Bengaluru-based health and fitness startup Cure.fit has raised $45 million, taking the total funding raised in its mixed equity and debt Series D round to about $120 million. The round was led by Chiratae Ventures, Accel, Kalaari Capital and Oaktree Capital. Cure.fit was founded in 2016 by Myntra Co-founder Mukesh Bansal and former Flipkart executive Ankit Nagori.

headlines: Kejriwal asks Centre to increase Delhi's water share
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday asked the Centre to increase Delhi's water share, which has reportedly remained "unchanged" in over two decades. Kejriwal said the city's population increased from 1.25 crore to 2.25 crore in that time, but its water share has not been increased proportionally. He added his government would provide round-the-clock supply of drinking water by 2024.

headlines: 15 criminals who went to celebrate gang leader's release arrested
text: The Delhi Police has arrested 15 criminals of Kapil Sangwan gang, who had gathered to celebrate the release of Kapil Sangwan on parole. The police arrested the criminals from Dwarka. Last year in December, police had arrested three criminals from the Kapil Sangwan gang when they were planning to eliminate members of a rival gang led by Manjit Mahal.

headlines: Iran says US sanctions on Supreme Leader mean end of diplomacy
text: Iran said on Tuesday that US sanctions imposed on Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and other top officials in the country permanently closed the path to diplomacy between the two countries. Iran further said that US President Donald Trump's administration is "destroying the established international mechanisms for maintaining world peace and security".

headlines: Not my type: Trump on journo who said he thrust penis inside her
text: Talking about the journalist who claimed that Donald Trump sexually assaulted her in a dressing room of a department store around 23 years ago, the US President said, "She's not my type." Trump further said that she is "totally lying", adding, "I don't know anything about her." E Jean Carroll has claimed that Trump "thrust his penis inside her".

headlines: 'Cocaine King of Milan' escapes through hole in prison roof
text: An Italian mafia boss known as the 'Cocaine King of Milan' has escaped from prison in Uruguay where he was awaiting extradition to Italy. Rocco Morabito fled the prison in Uruguay's capital Montevideo through a hole in the roof of the building. Three other prisoners awaiting extradition to Brazil and Argentina escaped with the 52-year-old.

headlines: A lot of effort, money goes into looking fit: Arjun on fat-shaming
text: While speaking about being fat-shamed, Arjun Kapoor said, "Anyone who has been through a journey of weight loss, weight gain and health issues will know how hard it is." "A lot of effort, money and time go into looking that way. It's important to be healthy," he added. Arjun further said people should be encouraging, instead of putting others down.

headlines: Anurag confirms his cameo in Nawazuddin's 'Bole Chudiyan'
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has confirmed that he will be making a special appearance in the upcoming Nawazuddin Siddiqui starrer 'Bole Chudiyan'. "Yes, I am doing the film, but that's all I know for now," the filmmaker added. Anurag has previously collaborated with Nawazuddin in the 'Gangs Of Wasseypur' film series, as well as 'Raman Raghav 2.0'.

headlines: Last year, I felt women had lesser lines in duets: Neeti Mohan
text: While speaking about discrimination in playback singing, singer Neeti Mohan said, "[L]ast year, I [felt] the female part in a duet song is much shorter than male part." "[I]t is slowly changing. This year I did not have such a song," she added. Neeti further said that a song about a woman's feelings should be sung by a female singer.

headlines: Won't rely on my family name: Bhansali's niece on acting debut
text: Speaking about her upcoming acting debut, filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's niece Sharmin Segal said, "I won't rely on my family name to get work, but only on talent and hard work." "I will work hard to justify every opportunity that comes my way," she added. Sharmin will be making her acting debut in Bhansali's forthcoming film 'Malaal'.

headlines: Tired of denying these reports: Varun on marriage rumours
text: Actor Varun Dhawan has denied reports which stated that he will be tying the knot with his girlfriend and fashion designer Natasha Dalal in December this year. "It's just not true. I am tired of denying these reports over and over again," the actor said. Earlier reports stated that the couple will be getting married in Jodhpur, Rajasthan.

headlines: England batting one-dimensional, not versatile: Geoffrey Boycott
text: Former England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott called the current team's batting as 'one-dimensional'. "[D]on't seem to have a plan B or C... If they do have alternative plans, they do not execute them very well," Boycott added. Boycott praised Joe Root, saying, "Joe Root is the exception because his run-scoring in all cricket is based on an excellent technique."

headlines: Gujarat Congress moves HC for disqualification of ex-MLA Alpesh
text: The Gujarat High Court on Monday issued a notice to state Assembly Speaker Rajendra Trivedi and former Congress MLA Alpesh Thakor after Congress demanded that Thakor must be disqualified as an elected representative. Congress said, "Thakor was elected on the mandate of Congress. When he has resigned from all other posts, he should cease to be an MLA as well."

headlines: India went through Super Emergency for last 5 years: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday tweeted, "Today is the anniversary of the Emergency declared in 1975. For the last five years, the country went through a 'Super Emergency'." She added, "We must learn our lessons from history and fight to safeguard the democratic institutions in the country."

headlines: No one tried settling rape allegation against my son: CPI(M) leader
text: Kerala CPI(M) state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan on Monday said that nobody has attempted to settle the rape allegation levelled against his son Binoy Kodiyeri by a Mumbai-based woman. Balakrishnan stated, "Neither me nor my party will interfere in the matter," while adding that his wife went to Mumbai only to inquire about the issue as a mother.

headlines: Irony is even Hrithik was married to a Muslim: Sunaina's boyfriend
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina Roshan's boyfriend Ruhail Amin, while speaking about the actor's father calling him a "terrorist" due to his religion, said, "Calling someone a terrorist just because of his identity is unacceptable." When asked why there is a problem now since Hrithik was married to Sussanne, a Muslim, Ruhail said, "Everyone can see the irony here".

headlines: Bangladesh beat Afghanistan as Shakib Al Hasan sets World Cup record
text: Bangladesh defeated Afghanistan on Monday to register their third victory in 2019 World Cup. Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan became the second cricketer after Yuvraj Singh (2011) to score a fifty and take five wickets in a World Cup match. He also became the first-ever all-rounder to score 400-plus runs and take 10 wickets in a World Cup edition.

headlines: 6-time Grand Slam champion Becker auctions trophies to pay off debts
text: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker is auctioning off 82 items including medals, cups, watches and photographs to partially clear his debts. The trophies and personal souvenirs will be auctioned online from Monday by British firm Wyles Hardy. The sale will end on July 11, Wyles Hardy said on its website. The 51-year-old German was declared bankrupt in 2017.

headlines: Ashleigh Barty becomes first Australian world no. 1 in 43 years
text: Ashleigh Barty has become the first Australian in 43 years to climb to the top of the WTA singles ranking after she won the Birmingham Classic title on Sunday. Barty dethroned Naomi Osaka, who lost in the second round of the tournament. The 23-year-old former cricketer had won the French Open earlier in June.

headlines: BJP gets 1st Zilla Parishad in WB as TMC members, MLA join BJP
text: BJP on Monday took control over its first Zilla Parishad in West Bengal, after 10 of the 18 members of South Dinajpur Zilla Parishad and TMC MLA Wilson Champramary joined BJP. "Yeh trailer hai, film abhi baki hai (This is just a trailer, the film is yet to begin)," BJP leader Mukul Roy said after the leaders switched parties.

headlines: Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project to affect 54,000 mangroves
text: Around 54,000 mangroves spread over 13.36 hectares will be affected due to Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, Maharashtra's Transport Minister Diwakar Raote said on Monday. "There will be no chopping of trees and there will be no threat of flooding to some parts of Navi Mumbai," Raote said. "The pillars will be high and won't damage the environment much," he added.

headlines: Biggest challenge is to develop trust among people: Pragya Thakur
text: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur, who defeated Digvijaya Singh to win Bhopal constituency, said, "The biggest challenge is to develop trust among people, as they voted for my party and not for me." She claimed she must create a special place in people's hearts with her work and make Opposition realise "there is no term like Hindu terrorist and terrorism."

headlines: BJP leaders Shah, Rajnath pay tribute to late Rajasthan BJP chief
text: BJP leaders, including Home Minister Amit Shah, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Working President JP Nadda, paid tributes to late Rajasthan BJP chief Madan Lal Saini in Delhi. The 75-year-old leader who was suffering from lung infection passed away at AIIMS today. "The passing away of Shri Madanlal Saini Ji is a major loss for BJP family," tweeted PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Litchis didn't cause Encephalitis: Litchi research centre head
text: Director of Muzaffarpur-based National Research Centre on Litchi, Vishal Nath, has denied the link between litchi and the outbreak of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES), which has claimed 169 lives in Bihar. He asserted that research had found nothing wrong in the fruit. Had litchi caused the AES, it would have affected those living in other states also, Nath added.

headlines: No one, not even my family knew: IAF pilot part of Balakot mission
text: An IAF pilot who was part of the air strike on a JeM terror camp in Balakot has revealed that the mission was carried out with such secrecy that "no one, not even [his] close family knew". "Next day, when news broke, my wife asked...whether I was part of the attack. I kept quiet and slept off," the pilot added.

headlines: BJP leader slaps Home Guard, drags him on car on entering wrong side
text: A car with BJP leader Satish Khoda dragged along a Home Guard jawan on its bonnet in Haryana's Rewari. The officer ordered to stop the car after it entered the wrong side, but it rammed into him, and reportedly carried him along for about 300 metres. "Khoda slapped me when I said they were on the wrong side," said jawan.

headlines: Police vans to play 'Jagte Raho' tune in Lucknow's Hazratganj
