text: Sirens of Police Response Vehicles (PRV) will play tunes of 'Jagte Raho' in Lucknow's Hazratganj to curb the menace of criminals, as part of a pilot project, said the police on Tuesday. "The tune will be played in PRVs all night to alert the public, like watchmen used to do. Its success will be monitored," the police added.

headlines: Leader from Pakistan PM's party beats up journalist on live TV
text: A video showing a senior leader from Pakistan PM Imran Khan's party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, beating up a journalist on live TV has surfaced online. Masroor Ali Siyal was seen arguing with the journalist before pushing him and slapping him. The journalist, who fell down after Siyal pushed him, can be seen getting up and retaliating.

headlines: No one discusses caste and religion in Bollywood: Ayushmann
text: Denying the existence of discrimination on the basis of caste and religion in Bollywood, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "Nobody discusses caste and religion." "It is purely on the basis of merit...If you are good, you are applauded and rewarded," the actor added. Ayushmann further said that there's no discrimination in the film industry as it is very democratic and secular.

headlines: Ready to sign no backdoor agreement with Indian govt: Huawei
text: Huawei India CEO Jay Chen told PTI, "We are proposing to the Indian government that we are ready to sign 'no backdoor' agreement." Huawei encouraged other original equipment manufacturers to also sign such agreement with the government and telecom operators. This comes after the US blacklisted Huawei and its affiliates over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: New Google curriculum teaches kids how to spot disinformation
text: Google has announced it is expanding its 'Be Internet Awesome' curriculum, focussed on teaching children online safety, to now include six new media literacy activities. The new curriculum will help teach children how to spot disinformation like fake URLs or misleading headlines. The curriculum also includes lessons like 'It's Cool to be Kind,' which teaches kids about online harassment.

headlines: Naspers' investment talks with Capital Float fall through
text: Capital Float Co-founder Sashank Rishyasringa confirmed the startup and South Africa's Naspers have abandoned investment talks. The parties mutually decided the best route to collaborate would be via business initiatives in the future rather than via a strategic investment, he said. Reportedly, the up to $200-million investment would've been Naspers' biggest in an Indian fintech startup so far.

headlines: IPO long-term strategy, focused on e-commerce growth: Flipkart
text: Flipkart said that an IPO has always been part of its long-term strategy, but it doesn't have a time frame on that right now. Flipkart added it's currently focused on driving the growth of e-commerce in India to get 200-300 million new customers into e-commerce fold. A recent report stated Flipkart will tap into the US equity market by 2022.

headlines: Give us fair rules like everyone else: Walmart CEO to govt
text: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon has urged the Indian government to ensure a level playing field for the company, which acquired Flipkart last year. "We'd like to invest more...so just give us fair, consistent rules just like everyone else," he said. This comes as government tightened FDI norms, barring online retailers from selling products of companies in which they have stake.

headlines: Rajasthan BJP chief Madan Lal Saini passes away aged 75
text: Rajasthan BJP chief Madan Lal Saini passed away aged 75 at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi. He was reportedly suffering from lung infection and was admitted to AIIMS on June 22. Saini, a Rajya Sabha MP since April 4, 2018, was appointed Rajasthan BJP President on June 30, 2018.

headlines: Trump signs new sanctions against Iran to target Supreme Leader
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday announced "hard-hitting" new sanctions on access to key financial resources and support on Iran and its Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. The sanctions follow Iran shooting down an unmanned US drone last week. He said the US would "continue to increase pressure on Tehran", adding that "never can Iran have a nuclear weapon".

headlines: Hrithik's parents put security ring around Sunaina: Boyfriend Ruhail
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina's boyfriend Ruhail Amin has said that her parents put a "security ring around her" after they learnt about her friendship with him. "My first reaction was of disbelief and later a good laugh," he added. "She wants to restart her life on a positive note and wants her family to support her decisions," said Ruhail.

headlines: I wanted to commit suicide after defeat to India: Pakistan coach
text: Pakistan coach Mickey Arthur has said he wanted to commit suicide after his team's defeat to India in 2019 World Cup on June 16. "The guys were incredibly hurt..by media, by public, by social media...The guys didn't sleep much," he added. "It's a World Cup. Media scrutiny, public expectations and then you almost go into survival mode," he further said.

headlines: Arjun Tendulkar bowls at England batsmen in nets ahead of Aus match
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar on Monday helped England batsmen prepare for their World Cup match against Australia. The 19-year-old fast bowler, who has represented India Under-19, was seen bowling to England batsmen under England bowling consultant Saqlain Mushtaq. Last week, Arjun played for MCC Young Cricketers against Surrey 2nd XI, picking up two wickets.

headlines: Sarfaraz, we are sorry: Pak fans apologise as Pak stay alive in WC
text: After Pakistan defeated South Africa to stay alive in 2019 World Cup, several Pakistani fans apologised to captain Sarfaraz Ahmed for criticising him following defeat against India. Fans shared a picture of a supporter posing with a banner reading "Sarfaraz, We are sorry". The Pakistan Cricket Board also shared a video of fans shaking Sarfaraz's hands after the match.

headlines: Rohit mentions wrong year in CT 2013 win throwback pic, gets trolled
text: Rohit Sharma was trolled for using 'Champions Trophy 2017' hashtag while sharing throwback picture of himself celebrating India's 2013 Champions Trophy win on Twitter. "These are some memories you cherish for long #ChampionsTrophy2017 #23rdJune," Rohit had captioned the now-deleted post. "Indeed memories to cherish for life brother, but ones from 2013. You got me tricked too," Suresh Raina wrote.

headlines: India working on chip-enabled e-passports: S Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said his ministry has proposed to manufacture chip-enabled e-passports on priority so that passports with advanced security features can be rolled out in the near future. Jaishankar said the ministry has initiated discussions with the 'India Security Press' regarding the project. E-passports usually contain biometric information to authenticate the identity of the holder.

headlines: Cong MP calls PM Modi 'gandi naali' in Lok Sabha, apologises later
text: Congress MP Adhir Chowdhury compared PM Narendra Modi to "gandi naali" in Lok Sabha, however he later apologised. Chowdhury said it wasn't right to compare PM to Swami Vivekananda just because Vivekananda's name was Narendranath Datta. A BJP leader said at least they don't say things like "Indira is India", and Chowdhury replied, "Kahan Ma Ganga aur kahan gandi naali".

headlines: Party will cooperate, if Centre stops issuing advisories: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Saugata Roy on Monday said if the government stops issuing advisories to West Bengal, his party will cooperate with the Centre. "Many people ask me why TMC isn't attending PM's dinner and why we aren't attending 'One Nation One Election' meeting. If the Home Minister keeps sending advisories...it will never happen," he said in the Lok Sabha.

headlines: 5 suspects held, 2 policemen suspended in Jharkhand lynching case
text: Five men have been arrested and two policemen suspended in Jharkhand mob lynching incident, wherein a Muslim man was forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans and thrashed for hours last week, leading to his death on Saturday. They were suspended for not reporting the issue to higher authorities and not registering a case of lynching on the same day.

headlines: Army warns soldiers of suspected spy's Instagram profile 'Oyesomya'
text: The Army's intelligence unit has issued an advisory to its personnel against an Instagram profile 'Oyesomya'. The Instagram profile is suspected to be of an enemy spy. The spy is trying to target Army officers and Special Forces' troops through the Instagram profile, the Army's intelligence unit said.

headlines: UP Police point gun at people during bike checking, SSP responds
text: A June 20 video showed Uttar Pradesh Police pointing gun at people during regular vehicle checking in Wazirganj, Budaun. Responding to the video, Budaun SSP Ashok Kumar Tripathi said, "There've been incidents where people of criminal mentality fired at the police during vehicle checking." "We suffered casualties in such incidents, that's why a tactical technique is being used," he added.

headlines: West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell ruled out of 2019 World Cup
text: West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup due to knee injury. The 31-year-old featured in four of West Indies' six 2019 World Cup matches so far, scoring 36 runs in three innings and taking five wickets. Russell will be replaced by 26-year-old batsman Sunil Ambris in the squad.

headlines: Navdeep Saini summoned as net bowler after Bhuvneshwar's injury
text: Following Bhuvneshwar Kumar's hamstring injury, the Indian team management has summoned Navdeep Saini as a net bowler. Khaleel Ahmed was India's designated net bowler till Nottingham before heading back as he will be playing for India A in the series against Windies A, starting next month. Bhuvneshwar was announced to be out of contention for two or three matches.

headlines: Jason Roy to miss England's WC match against Australia
text: England opener Jason Roy has been ruled out of the team's upcoming World Cup 2019 match against Australia. This is the third match that Roy is going to miss following his injury, which he suffered in his side's match against the Windies. James Vince, who opened in the absence of Roy, has accumulated 40 runs from two outings so far.

headlines: Murray considering US Open singles after Queen's doubles title
text: Former world number one Andy Murray is mulling returning to play singles at the US Open 2019 after having won the men's doubles title with Feliciano Lopez at Queen's Club Championship. "I don't have to be getting to the US Open this year and be really competitive or have to win the tournament for me to enjoy it," Murray said.

headlines: Changing to batteries won't cut an iota of pollution: TVS MD
text: TVS Motor Chairman and Managing Director Venu Srinivasan has said changing from conventional two-wheelers to battery-operated ones running on thermal power "will not reduce one iota of pollution". The two-wheeler accounts for 20% of automotive pollution, he added. His statements come as the NITI Aayog proposes transition to electric vehicles for three-wheelers by 2023 and two-wheelers by 2025.

headlines: Speed keeps me up most at night: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon
text: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon has said that speed is the thing that keeps him up most at night. "As a company, we have got to move faster," he said, adding, "The world isn't going to slow down and wait for us...it's not going to operate more slowly in a year or three years than it does now."

headlines: Kerala govt willing to operate Thiruvananthapuram airport
text: CPI(M) MP KK Ragesh on Monday opposed the proposed privatisation of five airports, including the Thiruvananthapuram airport, with the Adani Group as their operator. He added that the Kerala government is willing to operate the airport at Thiruvananthapuram. The airport was built on land given by the state government, he said, further questioning why "national wealth was being privatised".

headlines: Rana Kapoor's family plans mortgage unit sale: Reports
text: Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor's family is reportedly planning to sell a stake in their six-year-old mortgage finance company, The Three Sisters: Institutional Office. The family office, run by Kapoor's three daughters, is working with Nomura Holdings on the potential deal, said reports. It has reached out to several private equity firms to gauge their interest, reports added.

headlines: Glenmark hits 6-yr low as product fails to get US FDA nod
text: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals shares fell up to 8% to their lowest in six years on Monday after the US FDA didn't approve its nasal spray Ryaltris, delaying its launch. The FDA cited deficiencies in drug master file pertaining to one of the active pharmaceutical ingredients and in manufacturing facilities of the Maharashtra-based company. The deficiencies were, however, not specified.

headlines: Ranveer, Hardik should be scared of Brock Lesnar: Lesnar's advocate
text: WWE wrestler Brock Lesnar's advocate Paul Heyman, who served a legal notice to Ranveer Singh for copying his catchphrase, said the duo should be scared of Lesnar as he's the baddest dude on the planet. He added Ranveer and Hardik stole a catchphrase that is worth a lot of money. "It is something they shouldn't have done," he further said.

headlines: Dad put extra A & two Es in my name due to numerology: Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu has revealed that there's an extra A and two Es in her name as her father believes in numerology. "T-A-P-S-I, for him, in numerology, wasn't good enough," she added. Taapsee further revealed that her name is spelled as 'Tapasee' in her legal documents and she changed it to 'Taapsee' to avoid confusion over the pronunciation of her name.

headlines: Filmmakers can't be constantly bullied: Article 15 maker on Karni Sena
text: Speaking about Karni Sena's threats against his film 'Article 15' over allegations that it is 'anti-Brahmin', filmmaker Anubhav Sinha said, "[People] can disagree, but such overt threats must stop, once and for all. Filmmakers can't be constantly bullied." "There were enough...Brahmins associated with the making of the film to know [that it doesn't showcase them in bad light]," he added.

headlines: Shakib 1st Bangladesh batsman to score 1,000 World Cup runs
text: All-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has become the first-ever Bangladesh batsman to score 1,000 runs in World Cup history. The 32-year-old achieved the feat during the 2019 World Cup match against Afghanistan on Monday. He also went past the 50-run mark for the fifth time in six innings in the current edition. Overall, he has scored 44 ODI fifties.

headlines: Media firms liable for comments on their Facebook pages: Aus court
text: Australia's New South Wales Supreme Court ruled in a case that media companies are liable for comments on their Facebook pages. It held three media companies responsible for comments on a story about an indigenous youth detainee, Dylan Voller, in 2016 and 2017. Voller had said that comments on their Facebook pages alleging that he was a rapist were defamatory.

headlines: Scientists capture video of giant squid in US waters for first time
text: For the first time, a living giant squid has been filmed in US waters by researchers on an expedition funded by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The 10-12 feet long squid was captured in pitch black waters over 750 metres below the surface of the Gulf of Mexico. A specialised camera system called Medusa' was used for the video.

headlines: BJP, RSS increased hatred for Muslims: Owaisi on Jharkhand lynching
text: Speaking about Jharkhand mob lynching wherein a Muslim man was killed on suspicion of theft, AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi said BJP and RSS have increased hatred against Muslims. He added they have created a mindset where Muslims are seen as terrorists, anti-nationals and cow slaughterers. "So much for sabka vishwas when we can be killed over mere 'suspicions'," tweeted Owaisi.

headlines: T'gana man holds record for creating miniature art sculptures
text: Mattewada Ajay Kumar, a micro-artist from Warangal, has made it to the Limca Book of Records for creating world's smallest functional violin, weighing less than a milligram. The first time Kumar made it to the Limca Book of Records was in 2004 with the tiniest functional lock. He also set a record in 2015 for a pair of miniature scissors.

headlines: SC seeks reply from Centre, Bihar in 7 days over 'brain fever' deaths
text: The Supreme Court today asked both Centre and Bihar government to file an affidavit within seven days, detailing the steps taken to check deaths of children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). This comes after the death toll from AES rose to 169 in Bihar. "It cannot go on. This requires some consideration. We'll need definite answers," the court said.

headlines: Abhinandan's moustache should be made national moustache: Cong MP
text: Leader of Congress in Lok Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, on Monday said that IAF Wing Commander Abhinandan should be awarded and his moustache should be made 'national moustache'. Abhinandan was held by Pakistan after the crash of his MiG-21 and returned to India two days later. Abhinandan had shot down Pakistan's F-16 before crashing.

headlines: Drones being used in Kanpur to monitor traffic, prevent accidents
text: Drone cameras are being used to monitor traffic and prevent accidents in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, police said on Sunday. "We are targeting 10% reduction in cases of deaths due to accidents in the city," Superintendent of Police (SP) Traffic, Kanpur City, Sushil Kumar said. The drones will enable traffic cops to get live feed about traffic at any given place.

headlines: Congress raises RBI independence issue after Deputy Governor resigns
text: Congress on Monday questioned Reserve Bank of India Deputy Governor Viral Acharya's "abrupt decision" to resign, saying could it have anything to do with his stance on reaffirming RBI's independence from BJP-led NDA government. Acharya resigned from his position at the central bank six months before the scheduled end of his three-year term, citing "unavoidable personal reasons".

headlines: Downing of US drone was 'firm response', can be repeated: Iran
text: Iran on Monday described its shooting down of a US drone in the Gulf last week as a "firm response" to the United States and warned it could be repeated, saying that the "enemy knows it". "Everyone saw the downing of the unmanned drone," Iran Navy Commander Rear Admiral Hossein Khanzadi was quoted as saying by the Tasnim news agency.

headlines: Can't bear pain anymore: B'desh Tree Man asks doctors to cut hands
text: Bangladesh's 28-year-old Abul Bajandar, known as 'Tree Man' due to bark-like growths on his body, said on Monday that he has asked the doctors to cut off his hands to relieve him of unbearable pain. Bajandar has had 25 operations since 2016 to remove growths from his hands and feet. He suffers from a rare genetic condition 'Epidermodysplasia verruciformis'.

headlines: Fila's 73-year-old Chairman now worth $830 million
text: Sporting goods company Fila's 73-year-old Chairman Yoon Yoon-soo is estimated to be worth about $830 million through his stake in Fila Korea, which acquired the global Fila brand in 2007. Fila Korea shares surged 400% from the start of last year through Friday, valuing the company at $4.3 billion. Yoon and his family own about 20% of the company.

headlines: Deepika Padukone invests in spacetech startup Bellatrix Aerospace
text: Bengaluru-based spacetech startup Bellatrix Aerospace has raised $3 million in a pre-Series A funding round led by IDFC Parampara, StartupXseed, Karsemven Fund, and Survam Partners. Notably, the investors also included actress Deepika Padukone, who invested through KA Enterprises. Founded in 2015, Bellatrix works on developing orbital launch vehicles and electric propulsion systems for satellites.

headlines: Governments must regulate social networks: Facebook executive
text: Facebook VP, Global Affairs and Communications, Nick Clegg has said, "It's not for private companies, however big or small, to come up with those (social media) rules." Clegg, a former Deputy PM of the UK, said, "It's for democratic politicians in the democratic world to do so." He added there was a "pressing need" for new rules on privacy.

headlines: Auto driver masturbated in front of me: 19-year-old Mumbai girl
text: A 19-year-old Mumbai girl has alleged that an auto driver masturbated in front of her when she went out for jogging on Saturday night. "I was at...Delphi Building in Hiranandani Powai at 11:54 pm...A man came out of an auto and started masturbating," she tweeted while tagging Mumbai Police. "We've followed you. Please share your contact details," police replied.

headlines: RBI confirms Deputy Guv resigned citing 'personal circumstances'
text: The Reserve Bank of India on Monday confirmed media reports that said Deputy Governor Viral Acharya has resigned. "A few weeks ago, Dr Acharya submitted a letter...informing that due to unavoidable personal circumstances, he is unable to continue his term...beyond July 23, 2019. Consequential action arising from his letter is under consideration of the Competent Authority," a press release read.

headlines: Dad an ex-IAF officer, inspired by him: Ushoshi on fighting goons
text: Ex-Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta, who stood up to goons who had attacked her cab and beat up her Uber driver, said she was inspired by her father, who is a former Indian Air Force officer. "He is extremely brave...I grew up watching him in uniform...He would stand up against anything wrong and fight his own battles," she added.

headlines: Told man 'Phone andar rakh' as he took pics without asking: Taapsee
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has revealed that she once confronted a man who was taking her photos without her permission at a traffic signal while she was on the pavement. "It's not like he asked for a picture. I'm a public figure; not a public property," she said. "I went, 'Phone andar rakh le, nahi toh tod dungi!'," Taapsee added.

headlines: He is a senior player, should show intent: Sachin criticises Dhoni
text: Ex-India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar criticised MS Dhoni for scoring 28 runs off 52 balls against Afghanistan in 2019 World Cup. MS Dhoni is a senior player and should show positive intent. He faced too many dot balls and this hampered a strong finish for India," he added. "I believe MS Dhoni needs to up his ante," he further said.

headlines: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar formally joins BJP
text: External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar on Monday formally joined the BJP in the presence of party working President JP Nadda at the Parliament House. Jaishankar had served as Foreign Secretary from January 2015 to January 2018 and succeeded Sushma Swaraj as External Affairs Minister last month. Jaishankar also served as the Indian ambassador to the US from 2013 to 2015.

headlines: Elon Musk trolled for using pic of Moon instead of Mars in tweet
text: Billionaire entrepreneur and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk was trolled for using an image of Moon instead of Mars in his tweet that read, "Occupy Mars." Reacting to Musk's tweet, a user wrote, "Are we occupying Mars during a lunar eclipse." "You would be so much more entertaining if you were fictional," another Twitter user wrote.

headlines: Probe ordered against Harsh Vardhan & Bihar minister over AES deaths
text: Muzaffarpur Chief Judicial Magistrate Surya Kant Tiwari has ordered a probe against Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan and Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey, in a case of negligence, in connection with the deaths of children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). The complaint alleged that they failed to fulfil their duties and did nothing to create awareness and sensitise people.

headlines: Ravi Shankar Prasad introduces Aadhaar bill in Lok Sabha
text: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad introduced Aadhaar and Other Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2019 in Lok Sabha on Monday. It proposes the voluntary use of Aadhaar as an identity proof for opening bank accounts and for procuring mobile phone connections. It also proposes to give children an option to exit from the biometric ID programme on attaining 18 years of age.

headlines: 'Metro Man' E Sreedharan resigns as advisor to Lucknow Metro
text: The Principal Advisor to Lucknow Metro Rail Corporation (LMRC), 'Metro Man' E Sreedharan has submitted his resignation, LMRC Managing Director Kumar Keshav has said. "I requested him not to resign but he said his health was not supporting him at this point of time...His valuable guidance was crucial in construction of the underground section," Keshav added.

headlines: Muslim man made to chant 'Jai Shri Ram', mob lynched in Jharkhand
text: A 24-year-old Muslim man died in Jharkhand on Saturday, four days after he was allegedly beaten up by a mob and forced to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Jai Hanuman' on the suspicion of motorcycle theft. Shams Tabrez Ansari was reportedly tied to a pole and beaten by a mob for several hours, before being handed over to the police.

headlines: Policeman commits suicide in Jammu
text: A policeman allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself with his service rifle at a training centre in Jammu, officials said on Monday. Selection Grade Constable Arjun Dev was on sentry duty, when he reportedly took his life around midnight. Dev's colleagues rushed to his post after hearing a gunshot and found him dead with a bullet injury in the face.

headlines: Had bhang lassi: UK PM candidate on naughtiest thing ever done
text: UK PM candidate Jeremy Hunt on being asked about the naughtiest thing he has ever done, said, "When I was backpacking through India, I once had a bhang lassi, which is a kind of cannabis lassi." He further said that his rival Boris Johnson was a coward for avoiding public head-to-head debates on what to do about Brexit.

headlines: Australia rescues children of dead ISIS fighters from Syria
text: Australia has rescued the eight children and grandchildren of two dead Islamic State fighters from a Syrian refugee camp and will resettle them in the country, PM Scott Morrison said on Monday. "They can't be held responsible for the crimes of their parents," he added. "They have got off to a horrible start in life," Morrison further said.

headlines: Australian hospital removes wrong side of cancer patient's bowel
text: An investigation is underway after a cancer patient had the wrong side of his bowel removed at Northern Beaches Hospital in Sydney, Australia. The mistake was the result of a privately contracted laboratory mishandling the patient's pathology results. New South Wales's health minister Brad Hazzard has asked the hospital to provide all possible support for the patient and his family.

headlines: Defending world champ Hamilton wins his 6th race of the season
text: Mercedes' British driver and defending world champion Lewis Hamilton registered his sixth win of the season after winning the French Grand Prix on Sunday. Valtteri Bottas took second spot as Mercedes ensured both another one-two finish and their eighth consecutive win this season. Charles Leclerc managed to finish third ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen, while Sebastian Vettel finished fifth.

headlines: Pakistan's Amir has not conceded a six in his last 46 overs
text: Pakistani pacer Mohammad Amir has not conceded a six in his last 276 balls (46 overs), while having picked 15 wickets in the World Cup 2019 so far, the joint-highest with Jofra Archer and Mitchell Starc. Indian pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar, who is currently recovering from an injury, has not conceded a six in his last 136 deliveries.

headlines: Robot that helps clear weeds from rice paddies made
text: A Nissan engineer has created a robot that can help clear weeds from rice paddies. The prototype, reportedly being tested in Japan's Yamagata Prefecture, roams in rice paddies, muddying the water to prevent weeds from getting enough sunlight to grow. The robot, which isn't manufactured or sold by Nissan, was reportedly made by the engineer to help a friend.

headlines: RBI committee delays report on capital reserves again
text: An RBI panel reviewing the size of capital reserves the central bank should hold has again delayed submitting its report due to lack of consensus, officials said. The six-member panel, headed by former RBI Governor Bimal Jalan, will submit the report after the federal budget in July. The committee had previously deferred the submission on June 12.

headlines: SA out of 2019 WC semi-finals race after 49-run loss vs Pakistan
text: South Africa are now officially out of the 2019 World Cup semi-finals race after suffering a 49-run defeat against Pakistan on Sunday. This is the first time since the 2003 edition that South Africa have failed to make it to the knockout stage of the World Cup. With the victory, Pakistan moved to the seventh position in 2019 World Cup.

headlines: BSP to fight all elections alone over behaviour of SP: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party supremo Mayawati has said her party will contest all the future elections alone over behaviour of the Samajwadi Party after the Lok Sabha elections. "The attitude of the SP compels BSP to think whether it will be possible to defeat the BJP in the future," she tweeted. Notably, SP-BSP alliance won 15 seats in Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: RBI Deputy Guv resigns 6 months before his term ends: Reports
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Viral Acharya has resigned six months before the scheduled end of his term in office, as per reports. Acharya will return to the New York University Stern School of Business in August to teach, reports added. He was appointed as Deputy Governor towards the end of 2016 for a term of three years.

headlines: Great Learning alum starts career as Business Analyst at Uber
text: Alvino, an alumnus of Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science and Engineering has landed his first job as Business Analyst at Uber, through a recruitment drive organised as part of the program. In addition to placement assistance, Great Learning also offers CV building, interview preparation and career guidance to help fresh graduates and professionals start their Data Science career.

headlines: Sophie, Joe to have 2nd wedding in Paris on June 30: Reports
text: 'Game of Thrones' actress Sophie Turner and singer Joe Jonas will have their second wedding ceremony in Paris on June 30, as per reports. The speculations started after the host of talk show 'Dr Phil' on Sunday commented on Sophie's photo of her and Jonas, "1 week to go!...See you at the wedding!" Sophie had shared the photo from Paris.

headlines: New India will be when you, your family quit politics: Ranvir to Rahul
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi described a picture of Army dogs doing yoga as 'New India', actor Ranvir Shorey took to Twitter to criticise him. The actor first wrote, "Hate much?" followed by "'New India' will actually be realised when you and your family quit politics." Earlier, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya had also criticised Rahul for his remark.

headlines: Hum to dube hai sanam, tujhe bhi lekar dubenge: Naib to Bangladesh
text: On being asked about their approach towards Bangladesh in their World Cup match, Afghanistan captain Gulbadin Naib said, "Hum to dube hai sanam, tujhe bhi lekar dubenge (We have already drowned darling, but we will take you with us)." Afghanistan are currently last on the points table, with six defeats from six matches, while Bangladesh are sixth with five points.

headlines: New Zealand fined for slow-over rate in match against West Indies
text: New Zealand have been fined for maintaining a slow over-rate in their victory against West Indies on Saturday. Match referee David Boon adjudged that the Kiwis had bowled one over short of their target after time allowances were taken into consideration. Captain Kane Williamson was fined 20% of his match fee while his teammates were handed 10% fine each.

headlines: The most difficult part is to wait for your turn to bat: Jadhav
text: Following his 68-ball 52-run knock against Afghanistan in the 2019 World Cup, Team India batsman Kedar Jadhav said, "The most difficult part is to wait for your turn to bat." "It's like you get to bat so many deliveries maybe once in a tournament. It has been like this from the time I started playing for India," he added.

headlines: Wasn't happy with Jadhav-Dhoni stand, it was very slow: Sachin
text: Reacting to MS Dhoni and Kedar Jadhav's 84-ball 57-run partnership against Afghanistan on Saturday, former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said that he was not happy with the stand as it was very slow. "We didn't score many runs till the 45th over after Virat Kohli got out...The intent could have been much better by the middle order batsmen," he added.

headlines: Delhi Police replies after CM tweets about 9 murders in 24 hours
text: The Delhi Police has responded after CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Nine murders reported in last 24 hours across the city. Whose door should be knocked for safety & security of Delhiites?" "Overall heinous crimes down by 10% this year compared to 2018. Similarly heinous crime committed against senior citizens also down by 22%," the Delhi Police tweeted in response.

headlines: Bodies of 7 of 8 climbers missing near Nanda Devi recovered
text: Seven bodies, including that of a woman and an Indian, believed to be of the mountaineers who went missing last month on the way to Nanda Devi East peak in Uttarakhand were recovered on Sunday. The search for the eighth mountaineer will be carried out tomorrow. Four Britons, two Americans, an Australian and an Indian had gone missing last month.

headlines: Maharashtra court lets woman have baby with estranged husband
text: A Maharashtra family court has ordered a couple locked in a divorce battle to seek consultation with Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART) expert after the woman pleaded to have a second baby with the man. However, the woman's husband opposed the plea citing social norms. While the court upheld the woman's reproductive rights, it also said the husband's consent is necessary.

headlines: 7 killed, 30 injured in road accident in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur
text: Seven people were killed and over 30 others were injured when the canter in which they were travelling turned upside down in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur on Sunday. The victims, mostly women, were taken to the District Hospital for treatment, where many of them were either declared brought dead or succumbed to their injuries. The seriously injured were referred to Jaipur.

headlines: 17-yr-old girl gangraped by 6 people including 3 minors for a week
text: A 17-year-old girl was gangraped by six people including three minors after being locked up in a room in Andhra Pradesh's Ongole for almost a week. The accused were arrested on Sunday. The police's Shakti team came to know about the crime when the victim was let off by the accused and was seen on the streets looking disoriented.

headlines: US cyber attack on Iran targets unsuccessful, Iran minister says
text: Amid reports that the US launched a cyber attack to disable Iran's rocket launch systems, Iran's minister for information and communications technology Mohammad Javad Azari Jahromi said the cyber attack was not successful. Earlier, US President Donald Trump said he called off a military strike to retaliate for the Middle East nation's downing of an unmanned US drone.

headlines: Was that ball in air for 25 seconds: Neesham on Brathwaite's wicket
text: New Zealand all-rounder James Neesham dismissed West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite on Saturday to help his team defeat West Indies. Brathwaite lofted the ball towards long-on, where fast bowler Trent Boult took a catch near the boundary ropes. Reacting to the dismissal, Neesham later tweeted, "Was that ball in the air for 25 seconds or was it just me?"

headlines: NASA system hacked, data stolen using Raspberry Pi computer
text: In 2018, NASA's network was hacked and approximately 500 megabytes of data from 23 files on their system was stolen, a report by the NASA Office of Inspector General revealed. NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory network was accessed by targetting a Raspberry Pi computer that wasn't authorised to be attached to it. The attack went undetected for nearly a year.

headlines: Chhattisgarh policeman killed by Maoists in front of his family
text: A policeman was killed by Maoists when he went to a weekly market with his family in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Sunday, said police. The assistant constable, Chaitu Kadti, was stabbed with knives by a team of Maoists who fled the scene. Kadti died on the way to the hospital, but the rebels did not harm his family, police added.

headlines: Former TN DGP who arrested Indira Gandhi in 1977 dies at 91
text: Former Director General of Police, Tamil Nadu VR Lakshminarayanan, who arrested late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in a corruption case in 1977, passed away at the age of 91 on Sunday. He is survived by a son and two daughters. Lakshminarayanan had worked under various Prime Ministers including Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, Charan Singh and Morarji Desai.

headlines: Govt considers demerging of 3 state-run insurers: Reports
text: The government is reportedly looking at demerging National Insurance Company, United India Insurance Company and Oriental Insurance Company into smaller units. Following this, it will consider the strategic sale of a few operations to the private sector, reports said. The government was earlier considering merging the three public sector general insurance firms to create one large entity.

headlines: Flight gets delayed in NZ as passengers wait for WC match to end
text: A flight in New Zealand was delayed on Saturday after passengers asked authorities to wait till New Zealand's World Cup match against West Indies got over. New Zealand MP Kieran McAnulty revealed the plane was loud from live streams and all passengers erupted in unison when New Zealand won. "Only then...amongst the cheers...did the plane start to move," he added.

headlines: ABD's wife responds to fan who said she ruined her husband's life
text: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers' wife Danielle responded to a fan on Instagram who said that she was the reason behind the cricketer not playing World Cup and that she ruined his life. "Tread carefully when you comment so ridiculously on...sanctity of marriage. Consider this a friendly warning to never grace us with your pathetic...opinion ever again," she wrote.

headlines: 40-year-old Tahir becomes SA's highest wicket-taker in WC history
text: South Africa's 40-year-old leg-spinner Imran Tahir has become the highest wicket-taker among South Africans in World Cup history. Tahir achieved the feat by taking two wickets against Pakistan on Sunday, taking his tally to 39 wickets in World Cups. He overtook former South Africa fast bowler Allan Donald, who had taken 38 wickets across World Cup editions.

headlines: My 20-year-old self is so disgusted with my current self: Bill Gates
text: Speaking at an event hosted for founders, world's second-richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said, "My 20-year-old self is so disgusted with my current self." He said, "You could over worship and mythologise the idea of working extremely hard...I didn't believe in vacations." He added, "Once I got into my 30s, I could hardly imagine how I'd done that."

headlines: Man tries to open IndiGo plane door mid-air, forces emergency landing
text: A Guwahati-bound IndiGo flight from Hyderabad was forced to make an emergency landing on Sunday at Bhubaneswar airport after a passenger created a mid-air ruckus. The passenger attempted to open the aircraft door mid-air and was restrained with the help of a few passengers, an official said. The man was headed to Guwahati as his mother had passed away.

headlines: Priests worship cows in Hyderabad to prevent child rapes in India
text: Priests worshipped cows at Chilkur Balaji temple in Hyderabad on Sunday to prevent child rape cases in India. Priest Ranga Rajan said, "Three cows will do three Pradakshina (circumambulation) around Balaji temple sanctum to prevent evil thoughts and deeds like rapes. Three Pradakshinams represent words, deeds and thoughts." He added cow worship is an old method to combat any crisis.

headlines: 4 IS-inspired terrorists killed in Shopian a huge success: DGP
text: The Shopian encounter was a huge success, security forces and police eliminated four Islamic State (IS)-inspired terrorists, Director General of Police (DGP) Dilbag Singh said on Sunday after the gunfight in Jammu and Kashmir. "All four were commanded by Shaukat Ahmad Butt, who was earlier working with Hizbul Mujahideen and since 2015 he had joined Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind," Singh added.

headlines: Returning from daughter's engagement, policeman burnt alive in car
text: A police sub-inspector was charred to death on Sunday after his car caught fire following a collision with a truck near Panwadi village in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh district. The policeman was returning home after attending his daughter's engagement when the incident happened. He was posted as the incharge of Leemachauhan police station in Rajgarh district.

headlines: Bengaluru pub owner arrested after 2 fall to death from 2nd floor
text: The Cubbon Park police on Saturday arrested the owner of Bengaluru's #BeiR on charges of negligence causing death. This comes after two private firm employees died after stumbling out of the window next to the staircase on the second floor of the pub on Friday. The police added that the owners of the building had not followed safety norms.

headlines: Pakistan Army Chief watching Pak-SA WC match at Lord's
text: Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff General Qamar Javed Bajwa arrived at the Lord's to witness the World Cup 2019 match between Pakistan and South Africa on Sunday. Bajwa met British Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt and was seen sitting with Major General Asif Ghafoor, the spokesperson of the Pakistan Armed Forces.

headlines: Will study coaching, managing: Retiring Spain footballer Torres
text: Spanish forward Fernando Torres, who announced his retirement from football a few days back, spoke about his future, saying, "[I need to] think about my next step, I don't know if it will be coaching or managing." "I think I will study both things and just wait for the call," Torres added about his future plans.

headlines: Brazil crush Peru to reach Copa America 2019's last-eight
text: Brazil thrashed Peru 5-0 in Sao Paulo to reach the last-eight stage of the Copa America 2019 on Saturday. Five different Brazilian players, including defender and captain Dani Alves, managed to get their names on the scoresheet. The hosts will face one of the best third-placed countries from Group B or C in the quarter-finals.

headlines: Devastated not to get over the line: Brathwaite after loss
text: Windies' Carlos Brathwaite said that he was devastated to not get the team over the line against New Zealand in their World Cup 2019 game on Saturday. "I thought it had enough bat on the final shot... It's a game of margins. One or two yards more, we would have been victorious tonight," Brathwaite added.

headlines: US launched cyberattack on Iranian weapons systems: Reports
text: The US reportedly launched a cyberattack on Iranian weapons systems on June 20 as the country's President Donald Trump pulled out of air strikes on Iran. This comes after Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps said that it shot down a US military drone over Iranian airspace. The cyberattack disabled computer systems controlling rocket and missile launchers, the Washington Post said.

headlines: Microsoft bans Slack, discourages Google Docs internal use: Report
text: Microsoft reportedly put workplace chat software Slack in the "prohibited" category of its internal list of technologies it doesn't want staff to use on a daily basis. An internal entry reportedly said multiple Slack versions except Enterprise Grid don't provide controls to properly protect Microsoft IP. Google Docs is reportedly "discouraged" for use and needs "business justification" to be used.

headlines: Man files complaint against Rahul Gandhi over Yoga Day tweet
text: A Mumbai-based advocate Atal B Dubey on Saturday filed a complaint against Congress President Rahul Gandhi for his tweet showing the Army's canine unit doing yoga. Dubey in his complaint said that Rahul indulged in public mischief with the intention to disrespect the Indian Army as well as International Yoga Day. Rahul should be prosecuted as per law, Dubey added.

headlines: Tejashwi spent govt funds on bungalow, ACs: Bihar Deputy CM
text: Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi on Saturday said that RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav lavishly spent government funds on his bungalow during his charge as Deputy CM. Sushil alleged that Tejashwi had 44 air conditioners, 35 leather sofas, 464 LED lights and 108 fans installed in the house, along with a billiards table, wooden panel on walls and granite flooring.

headlines: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative gives $68 mn to fund Human Cell Atlas
text: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative has announced a $68-million funding for Human Cell Atlas (HCA) and its selection of 38 collaborative teams to launch CZI's Seed Networks for the HCA projects. HCA is an international effort to map all cells in the human body. The three-year Seed Networks projects' participants will focus on mapping specific tissues in a healthy human body.

headlines: Methane levels detected on Mars hint at possibility of life
text: NASA's Curiosity rover detected high levels of methane in the Martian air, which could be a sign of microbes living on the planet, the NYT reported. It's reportedly also possible that the methane is ancient and trapped inside Mars but escaping intermittently through cracks. At 21 parts per billion, the quantities are reportedly thrice the amount Curiosity spotted in 2013.

headlines: Part of roof falls outside ICU in hospital with AES patients
text: A portion of the ceiling collapsed outside the pediatric ICU of Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital in Bihar's Muzaffarpur on Sunday. As many as 43 children are being treated for Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) and 109 patients died fighting the disease at the hospital, reported ANI. This comes a day after human skeletons were found behind the hospital premises.

headlines: 4 prisoners flee Neemuch jail in Madhya Pradesh
text: Four prisoners, who were convicted in different crimes including rape, murder and drug trafficking, escaped from the high-security Neemuch district jail in Madhya Pradesh in the early hours of Sunday, said jail authorities. Officials said the prisoners cut the jail bars with a saw and jumped the wall using a rope. A search operation has been launched to nab them.

headlines: Take measures for revival, reward performers: BSNL engineers to PM
text: An engineers and account professionals association at BSNL has sought PM Narendra Modi's intervention to provide budgetary support to BSNL amidst liquidity crunch. It has also said non-performing employees should be held accountable and good performers rewarded. BSNL has been reporting losses since being asked to pay auction determined spectrum price in 2010 for all its circles.

headlines: States should have the power to determine minimum wages: CII
text: Industry body CII has said states should have the power to determine minimum wages as the concept of a national minimum wage will affect job creation. It added that the minimum wages fixed by states should be based on geographic location, skill and occupation. However, it cannot be lower than the minimum wage fixed by the Centre, CII further stated.

headlines: Tata Steel to seek reappointment of TV Narendran as CEO & MD
text: Tata Steel on Sunday said it will seek shareholders' nod for reappointment of TV Narendran as its CEO and MD effective September 2018, not liable to retire by rotation. The 54-year-old was appointed as the company's MD for five years effective September 2013. Tata Steel will also seek approval for reappointment of Mallika Srinivasan and OP Bhatt as independent directors.

headlines: 14 dead after tent collapses during Ramayan Katha event in Rajasthan
text: At least 14 people were killed and around 24 others injured after a tent collapsed during dust storm at Jasol village in Rajasthan's Barmer. Scores of people had gathered at the spot for 'Ramayan Katha'. The deceased include two women and a 15-year-old boy. As per reports, electric current spread across the area due to rain after the tent collapsed.

headlines: Salman Khan shares video of him beating a horse in a race
text: Salman Khan has shared a video in which he can be seen beating a horse in a race. "Overpower horse power," he wrote in the video's caption. Commenting on the video, users wrote, "Bollywood ka iron man" and "Tiger vs horse" while another user commented, "This is so inspiring." Salman is reportedly undergoing training for his upcoming film 'Dabangg 3'.

headlines: Dhoni told me WC hat-tricks are rare, just bowl a yorker: Shami
text: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami has revealed that he had former India captain MS Dhoni's words in mind while he was running in to deliver the hat-trick ball in the final over against Afghanistan. "He told me, 'World Cup hat-tricks are rare, just bowl a yorker. This is your chance.' That's what I did," he added.

headlines: Spirit of Cricket: ICC on pic of Williamson consoling Brathwaite
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a picture of New Zealand captain Kane Williamson consoling West Indies' all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite after the latter got out for 101(82), writing, "One centurion consoles another. #SpiritOfCricket." Brathwaite, trying to hit a six on 49th over's last delivery, was caught by Trent Boult in the deep as West Indies lost by five runs.

headlines: Federer wins same title 10 times for first time in his career
text: World number three Roger Federer defeated David Goffin 7-6(7-2), 6-1 in the final on Sunday to win the Halle Open for the 10th time. It is the first time that the 37-year-old has won the same title 10 times in his career. It was Federer's 102nd tour-level title and his 19th tour-level title on grass.

headlines: Gambhir installs CCTVs, says 1 focused on Kejriwal's false promises
text: BJP MP from East Delhi Gautam Gambhir on Saturday tweeted that he was getting CCTV cameras installed in his constituency for the safety of women and to check crime. He also took a jibe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, tweeting, "By the way, Muffler wale Sir ji, one of my cameras is also focused on your false promises."

headlines: Smriti Irani to build her own house in her constituency Amethi
text: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani has announced she'll be making her own house in her constituency Amethi in Uttar Pradesh. She said Amethi would now be her permanent home so that she would be accessible to the people. Irani defeated Congress' three-time Amethi MP Rahul Gandhi to win the seat in the 17th Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Girl who cracked JEE, AIIMS picks research on mental illness at MIT
text: Gujarat's Stuti Khandwala, who cleared competitive exams NEET, JEE Main, AIIMS MBBS and JIPMER, has decided to pursue research on mental illness from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in the US. "I've secured a 90% scholarship offer from MIT. I'll be doing research from there for the next four years," Stuti said. The 18-year-old secured AIR 10 in AIIMS exam.

headlines: Telangana municipality allegedly poisons and dumps 100 street dogs
text: Close to 100 street dogs were poisoned to death in Telangana's Siddipet and Vikarabad and dumped in landfills, allegedly on the orders of the municipality authorities. An animal rights activist recorded a video of the dead dogs piled on top of one another on the back of a trailer truck in Siddipet. Police has filed FIRs in both the places.

headlines: Woman falls at Smriti Iranis feet in Amethi for help in land case
text: A woman fell at MP Smriti Irani's feet in Amethi on Saturday, complaining of land grabbing by her family members. Irani, Union Minister for Women and Child Development, took cognisance of the matter and assured her of action. Irani along with Goa CM Pramod Sawant also met the family of her close aide who was shot dead last month.

headlines: Elderly couple, maid found dead with throats slit in Delhi
text: An elderly couple and their maid were found dead with their throats slit inside a house in Vasant Vihar in south Delhi, police said on Sunday. The deceased were identified as 78-year-old Vishnu Mathur, his 75-year-old wife Shashi Mathur and their 20-year-old full-time domestic help Khushbu. Police said they were informed about the murders at 8:40 am by another maid.

headlines: Slug blamed for stopping trains, delaying 12,000 people in Japan
text: A slug was responsible for causing a power outage that halted trains and delayed 12,000 passengers in Japan on May 30, Kyushu Railway Company said on Sunday. It was forced to cancel 26 train journeys and delay other services. In a statement, the company said the slug caused power failure after entering an electrical power device near rail tracks.

headlines: Dhawan praises Shami after India's win over Afghanistan
text: Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan, who was ruled out of the World Cup 2019 due to an injury, praised Indian pacer Mohammad Shami after his hat-trick helped India win the match against Afghanistan. "Game-changing innings by @MdShami11! What a spell & an amazing hat-trick! Well done team India, congratulations on the victory!" read Dhawan's tweet.

headlines: Smriti Irani distributes 240 laptops among Lekhpals in Amethi
text: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani on Sunday distributed laptops among 240 Lekhpals of the district in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi. The BJP MP was attending an event in her parliamentary constituency for a mass baby shower and 'Annaprashana', a Hindu ritual in which an infant eats solid food other than milk for the first time.

headlines: Most land for Bullet Train to be acquired by December
text: The National High Speed Rail has said it is hopeful of acquiring a major part of land required for the 508-km-long Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train project by December. It has acquired 39% of the 1,380 hectares of land till date. The agency has failed to take over any of nine hectares required in Dadra and Nagar Haveli.

headlines: Govt has no business to be in mining business: Vedanta chief
text: Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal has told PM Narendra Modi that government should privatise five mining firms to partly save $400-billion annual spending on imports. "The government has no business to be in the business," he said. It should divest stake in firms like Hindustan Zinc, Hindustan Copper, Kolar Gold, Uranium Corporation, Shipping Corporation of India and NMDC, Agarwal added.

headlines: Infosys hired over 9,000 people in US between Apr 2017-Mar 2019
text: IT major Infosys said it has hired over 9,000 people in the US between April 2017-March 2019. The Bengaluru-based company had in 2017 announced that it will set up four technology and innovation hubs, and hire about 10,000 locals in the US over a two-year period. North America is the largest market for Infosys, accounting for 61.2% of its revenue.

headlines: Insolvency proceedings against Jet Airways initiated
text: Jet Airways on Sunday said Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) has been initiated against the cash-strapped carrier as per National Company Law Tribunal's (NCLT) order. Following this, the powers of the company's board of directors have been suspended and shall be exercised by the Interim Resolution Professional, it added. Jet Airways is the first domestic airline to go into bankruptcy.

headlines: Kohli fined 25% match fee for excessive appealing vs Afghanistan
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has been fined 25% match fee for excessive appealing against Afghanistan in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. Kohli had advanced towards umpire Aleem Dar in an aggressive manner in Afghanistan's 29th over while appealing for an LBW decision. Earlier in the match, Kohli was also seen arguing with the on-field umpires after a DRS call.

headlines: TCS to open a major centre in Patna: IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad
text: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Saturday announced that Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is ready to start a "major" centre in Bihar's Patna. Prasad made the announcement after meeting Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran in New Delhi. "Investment by India's largest IT company in Bihar should promote IT investments in the state," the minister said.

headlines: Bear falls asleep in wardrobe after entering US home
text: A black bear was on Friday found sleeping in a wardrobe after apparently locking itself into a room in a home in the US state of Montana. Police shared pictures of the bear on Facebook and said it stretched and yawned when they knocked on the window to wake it up. The animal eventually had to be tranquillised and removed.

headlines: I think Kangana can portray me perfectly onscreen: Dutee Chand
text: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand, on being asked which actress she would prefer to portray her onscreen, said, "I think Kangana Ranaut can portray me perfectly on screen." She added that Anil Kapoor and filmmaker Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra have reached out to her for the rights of her biopic. Reacting to this, Kangana said, "I am humbled."

headlines: Man plants cameras in women's bathroom on James Bond sets, held
text: An unidentified man has been arrested for allegedly planting cameras in the women's bathroom of the London studio where Daniel Craig starrer upcoming 'James Bond' film is being shot. The man, reportedly a 49-year-old, has been charged with voyeurism and will be presented in court on June 29. The upcoming film, title 'Bond 25', will release on April 8, 2020.

headlines: I was offered the role of Mogambo in Mr India: Anupam Kher
text: Anupam Kher, while remembering late actor Amrish Puri on his 87th birth anniversary on Saturday, said, "In 'Mr India', Mogambo's role was offered to me before him but...makers of that film replaced me with Amrish Puriji." "When I watched 'Mr India' and saw Amrishji's work as Mogambo then, I thought that makers...took the right decision," he added.

headlines: Does Shahid have no responsibility: Sona on his film 'Kabir Singh'
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra has criticised Shahid Kapoor for doing 'Kabir Singh', calling the film "misogynistic and patriarchal". She added, "Does the actor have no responsibility for choosing to play a part in a narrative that can set us back as a society?" This was in response to a tweet by actor Nakuul Mehta, who praised Shahid for his performance.

headlines: Sarfaraz reacts to criticism over yawning on field in India match
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, who was caught yawning by cameras while wicketkeeping during World Cup match against India, said, "I just yawned. It's a normal thing. I didn't commit a crime." "It just comes when it comes," he added. He further joked that he is happy that media was able to make a lot of money out of his action.

headlines: My biggest mistake is causing MS not to be what Android is: Gates
text: World's second-richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said, "The greatest mistake is the whatever mismanagement I engaged in that caused Microsoft not to be what Android is." He said, "Android is the standard non-Apple phone platform...That was a natural thing for Microsoft to win." He added, "We're a leading company..if we got that one right, we'd be 'the' company."

headlines: Muzaffarpur resident doctor suspended as AES death toll rises to 129
text: Dr Bhimsen Kumar, senior resident doctor at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) in Muzaffarpur, Bihar, was suspended for negligence of duty as death toll due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) rose to 129. Out of the 129 deaths, 109 were reported at SKMCH. Kumar, a paediatrician at Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH), was deployed on June 19.

headlines: Manish Sisodia installs CCTV cameras in his constituency in Delhi
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia installed CCTV cameras in his assembly constituency Patparganj on Sunday. "With the increase in crime, especially against women, our government has decided to install CCTV cameras across the city. Project of installing 3 lakh cameras has started," said Sisodia. "The feed will be available to local SHO and RWA (Resident Welfare Association)," added Sisodia.

headlines: Air India suspends pilot for shoplifting wallet from Sydney airport
text: Air India has suspended Captain Rohit Bhasin after he allegedly stole a wallet from a duty-free shop at Sydney airport just before he was to operate a flight to Delhi. Air India has also instituted an inquiry against Bhasin, who's also working as Air India's Regional Director (Eastern Region). The pilot reportedly told authorities that he was in a hurry.

headlines: Iran executes ex-defence contractor over spying for CIA: Reports
text: Iran has executed a former defence ministry contractor convicted of spying for the US' Central Intelligence Agency, according to reports. He was reportedly convicted by a military court and executed at the Rajai Shahr prison in the city of Karaj. His contract with the defence ministry had been terminated nine years ago, reports said.

headlines: Ethiopia's military chief killed following failed coup attempt
text: Ethiopia's military chief Seare Mekonnen has been shot dead by his bodyguard at his residence in Addis Ababa. The incident follows a coup attempt by an army general in the northern state of Amhara. Ethiopia Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said his government foiled the coup attempt. Regional government officials were in a meeting when the coup attempt occurred.

headlines: Woman left inside empty plane after she fell asleep during flight
text: A woman was left alone in a "dark" plane after falling asleep during flight. She took the Air Canada flight from Quebec to Toronto on June 9. Tiffani Adams fell asleep during the journey but woke up to find the aircraft empty, cleared and parked in Toronto. She was rescued by a man driving a luggage cart.

headlines: Military action against Iran still on the table: Donald Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said he is still considering military action against Iran after it downed an unmanned US drone, saying the use of force is "always on the table until we get this solved". However, Trump said "we very much appreciate" a decision by Iran not to shoot down a US plane carrying more than 30 people.

headlines: Dani Alves to leave PSG after not extending contract
text: Brazilian footballer Dani Alves is set to leave French side Paris Saint-Germain after having spent two years at the club. The 36-year-old won two Ligue 1 titles and one French Cup in his two seasons at the Parc des Princes. Alves announced his departure just hours after leading Brazil to a 5-0 win over Peru in the Copa America.

headlines: 'Harry Potter: Wizards Unite' rolls out for users in India
text: 'Harry Potter: Wizards Unite', co-developed and co-published by Pokémon GO-creator Niantic and WB Games under Portkey Games label, is available for users in India. It was reportedly installed about 4,00,000 times, with gross player spending of at least $300,000 across App Store and Google Play in the first 24 hours after launch in the US and UK.

headlines: Walmart tracks checkout theft via AI cameras in 1,000 stores
text: Walmart is using camera-based computer vision technology to monitor checkouts and deter potential theft in over 1,000 stores. The surveillance program notifies attendants if an issue arises like an item moving past a scanner without an actual scan, so they can intervene. The cameras track and analyse activities at self-checkout and cashier-manned registers.

headlines: Renault's $3.3 mn went to firm linked to ex-Chairman: Report
text: A Lebanese investment company controlled by former Renault Chairman Carlos Ghosn received about $3.3 million from the French carmaker via a car distributor in Oman, a report stated. The funds, part of a "CEO reserve", were allegedly moved to the company in 2011. This adds to prosecutors' accusations that money from Renault's partner Nissan was channelled to the same firm.

headlines: I've lived in 17 rented houses: Ishaan on growing up with single mom
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor's half-brother Ishaan Khatter, while speaking about growing up with a single mother, said, "We used to move a lot. I have lived in about 17 houses." "We lived in rented houses and those were years when my mother was doing various jobs on television. She was a single mother. She would earn for us," he added.

headlines: 7 yrs ago my life got ruined: Kashyap on 7 yrs of Gangs of Wasseypur
text: On the occasion of his film 'Gangs of Wasseypur' completing 7 years of release, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Saturday tweeted, "Seven years back is exactly when my life got ruined." "Since then all everyone wants me to do is the same thing over and over again. Whereas I've only been unsuccessfully trying to get away from that expectation," he added.

headlines: Hard-fought win over Afghanistan important for us: Virat Kohli
text: After defeating Afghanistan by 11 runs, India captain Virat Kohli said the hard-fought win was important for the team. "This game was way more important for us...because things didn't go as planned. That's when you need to show character and bounce back," he said. "At the halfway stage...we had our doubts in minds, but we also had self-belief," he added.

headlines: Hassan Ali responds to video of fan fat-shaming Pak captain Sarfaraz
text: Pakistan pacer Hassan Ali took to Twitter to respond to the video of a Pakistani fan fat-shaming Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, saying "this shameful act has left me devastated." "You can criticise us on our performances...but insulting and abusing our captain in public when he's holding his son is unacceptable. Please guys it's a request...respect our families," he added.

headlines: Shami 2nd Indian bowler to take a hat-trick in World Cup history
text: Pacer Mohammad Shami has become the second Indian bowler to take a hat-trick in World Cup, achieving the feat in the last over of India-Afghanistan match. The 28-year-old dismissed Mohammad Nabi, Aftab Alam and Mujeeb Ur Rahman in consecutive balls and finished with figures of 9.5-1-40-4. Ex-India pacer Chetan Sharma had taken the first-ever World Cup hat-trick in 1987 edition.

headlines: BCCI criticised for using word 'thump' to describe India's win
text: The BCCI has been criticised for using the word 'thump' in one of their tweets to describe India's 11-run victory against Afghanistan in the 2019 World Cup. "Thump? That is hugely disingenuous to a team that pushed you to the last over," a user tweeted. "That's not called "thump". That's called escaping by the skin of their teeth," another wrote.

headlines: NZ beat WI to go top of table as Brathwaite's 101(82) goes in vain
text: New Zealand defeated West Indies by 5 runs on Saturday to go top of the 2019 World Cup points table with five victories from six matches. The match witnessed West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite slam 101(82) batting at number six. Notably, West Indies had last defeated New Zealand in a World Cup match in the 1999 edition.

headlines: Williamson 3rd captain to record back-to-back tons in World Cup
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has become the third captain after Australia's Ricky Ponting and Zimbabwe's Brendan Taylor to register back-to-back centuries in World Cup. Williamson, who scored 106* against South Africa, slammed 148(154) against West Indies on Saturday. Ponting had achieved the feat in 2003/2007 World Cups, while Taylor had slammed two straight tons in 2015 World Cup.

headlines: Sab khuda ban ke baithe hain: Sarfaraz on criticism by ex-players
text: Reacting to ex-players criticising Pakistan team for their performance in World Cup, Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said, "Unke nazar mein to hum player hi nahi hain...Sab khuda ban ke TV pe baithe hain (In their eyes, we aren't even players. They've become gods on television)." "If I say anything then it'll become an issue, so I say nothing," he added.

headlines: India women's rugby team record their 1st ever international 15s win
text: The Indian women's rugby team claimed their first-ever international 15s victory on Saturday by defeating Singapore 21-19 in the Asia Rugby Women's Championship Division 1. India's scrum-half Sumitra Nayak handed India the win after kicking a penalty in the dying minutes of the match. The victory helped India finish third in the tournament.

headlines: Japan to send rover to Mars moons with help from Germany, France
text: Japanese space agency JAXA has partnered with the space agencies of Germany (DLR) and France (CNES) to send a rover to Mars' moons Phobos and Deimos. If successful, the rover will reportedly become the first-ever to land on a minor body in the solar system. JAXA is targeting the launch of the Martian Moons eXploration (MMX) mission for 2024.

headlines: Delhi govt to pay exam fee of students at govt schools from 2020
text: The Delhi government will pay examination fee charged by CBSE from students in government schools from next year, announced CM Arvind Kejriwal. "It's our dream that every child born in this country must get...high-quality education, regardless of their financial background," said Kejriwal. "Soon, the government will arrange coaching for the NEET and JEE aspirants," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

headlines: India responds to US report, says proud of secular credentials
text: Commenting on a US State Department report on religious freedom and attack on minorities in India, the External Affairs Ministry said, "We see no locus standi for a foreign entity to pronounce on the state of our citizens' constitutionally protected rights." "India is proud of its secular credentials and its status as the largest democracy," the External Affairs Ministry added.

headlines: Journalist shot at while driving; attackers threw eggs on her car
text: A journalist was shot at by a group of masked men while she was in her car at east Delhi's Vasundhara Enclave, police said. The masked men fired two shots at her, with the bullets piercing through the front windshield and one of them hitting her arm. Mitali Chandola said the attackers first threw eggs on the car's windshield.

headlines: I'll be Iran's 'best friend' if it acquires no nukes: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that if Iran does not acquire a nuclear weapon, it will be prosperous and have him as a "best friend". "I hope that happens...Let's make Iran great again," Trump added. Trump last year withdrew the United States from an international accord designed to curb Iran's nuclear activities in exchange for sanctions relief.

headlines: West Indies' Cottrell dismisses both NZ openers for golden duck
text: West Indies' pacer Sheldon Cottrell dismissed both New Zealand openers for a golden duck in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. The 29-year-old dismissed Martin Guptill LBW off the first ball of his first over and bowled Colin Munro off the over's fifth ball. It was the third time in ODI history that both openers departed for a golden duck.

headlines: Roger Federer reaches Halle Open final for the 13th time
text: World number three Roger Federer defeated Frenchman Pierre-Hugues Herbert 6-3, 6-3 on Saturday to reach Halle Open final for the 13th time. The 37-year-old will face David Goffin in the final on Sunday. If Federer wins the final, it will be the first time that he has lifted 10 trophies at a single tournament.

headlines: Turning down Murray was hardest decision ever: Barty
text: Australian tennis player Ashleigh Barty revealed that turning down Andy Murray's request to pair up for the mixed doubles event at Wimbledon 2019 was the 'hardest decision ever'. Barty revealed that she rejected the opportunity as she is already playing singles and women's doubles with Victoria Azarenka at the All England Club next month.

headlines: Over 1 crore fake businesses listed on Google Maps: Report
text: Over 1 crore estimated fake businesses are listed on Google Maps, some of which contain phone numbers that reroute to competing businesses, The Wall Street Journal reported. Scammers are also reportedly using the fake listings to impersonate legitimate businesses and lure unsuspecting customers. Google responded to the reported claims saying it took down all identified fake listings.

headlines: New NASA missions to study Sun, its effects on space weather
text: NASA has selected two missions to study the Sun and its effects on space weather. NASA revealed the first mission, Polarimeter to Unify the Corona and Heliosphere (PUNCH), will track solar wind as it leaves the Sun. The second, Tandem Reconnection and Cusp Electrodynamics Reconnaissance Satellites (TRACERS), will study how magnetic fields around Earth interact with the Sun, it added.

headlines: Maharashtra villagers organise wedding of dolls amid drought
text: Locals of a village in Maharashtra's Wardha organised a wedding of two dolls to pray for rainfall on Friday. Villagers said that 22 people had to get married but couldn't because of the drought, so they contributed to marry the dolls instead. Several parts of Maharashtra have been affected by the drought due to delayed monsoons in the region.

headlines: Shami takes last-over hat-trick as India beat Afghanistan
text: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami took a last-over hat-trick as India defeated Afghanistan in a low-scoring match on Saturday to continue their unbeaten run in 2019 World Cup. With this, India became the third team after Australia (67) and New Zealand (52) to win 50 World Cup matches. India have now accumulated nine points from five matches in the tournament.

headlines: Video of Mumbai airport guard asking Deepika for her ID goes viral
text: A video of a security guard asking Deepika Padukone for her ID card at Mumbai airport went viral. In the video, Deepika can be seen entering the airport with her father Prakash Padukone when someone in the background says, "ID ID". On realising that the security personnel is asking for her ID, Deepika can be seen turning and asking, "Chahiye?"

headlines: Sarfaraz doesn't deserve this: Riteish on fan body-shaming him
text: Reacting to Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed being body-shamed by a fan in front of his family in a mall in England, actor Riteish Deshmukh condemned the incident, calling it "harassment". "Every captain in history has lost an important match. #SarfarazAhmed doesn't deserve this...for heaven's sake he is with his child," he tweeted. The fan had called Sarfaraz a pig.

headlines: Man urinates off Berlin bridge, many injured on boat passing under
text: Several people were injured on a tourist boat in Germany's capital Berlin on Friday after a man urinated from the low-lying Jannowitz Bridge onto the boat. A number of people on board the boat jumped up, hitting their heads as the boat passed under the bridge. Four people were taken to hospital with head lacerations.

headlines: I didn't look at social media for 15 days after mankading: Ashwin
text: Kings XI Punjab captain Ravichandran Ashwin has revealed he didn't use social media for 10-15 days after mankading controversy in IPL 2019. He further said that several people including former cricketers Kapil Dev and Murali Kartik called him to tell him that he did nothing wrong by mankading. "The controversy did not bother me at all," he added.

headlines: Facebook's crypto is brilliant & frightening: Co-founder Hughes
text: Facebook Co-founder Chris Hughes said the platforms cryptocurrency Libra has a long way to go before being successful, but in theory, its brilliant and frightening. Hughes said he initially thought itd reinforce Facebooks corporate power, which would be a problem. He added the bigger problem is a new layer of monetary control between central banks and individuals, mediated by corporations.

headlines: China supercomputer firms, institute banned from buying US parts
text: After Huawei, the US has decided to put Chinese companies and a government-owned institute involved in supercomputing with military applications on its 'Entity List'. This effectively bars them from buying US parts and components without government approval. Notably, the US had put the world's largest telecoms equipment maker Huawei on the list last month over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: Telangana Prison Dept holds job fest for ex-inmates, 81 recruited
text: As many as 81 released prisoners were recruited in a job fest organised by the Telangana Prison Department on Saturday. This was the fifth time the fest was organised in the state by the Prison Department. Some of the released prisoners have been hired as computer operators, marketing executives and carpenters, among others, in a similar job fest organised earlier.

headlines: India gets new centralised air traffic flow management system
text: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Saturday inaugurated the Central Command Centre for Air Traffic Flow Management (ATFM) in Delhi. Countries including the US, Australia and Japan have a centralised air traffic flow management system. The system will help balance capacity against demand for optimum utilisation of resources like airspace and aircraft at capacity-constrained airports.

headlines: Mauritania holds election for 1st time since independence 60yrs ago
text: Mauritania went to polls for the first time on Saturday since the African nation gained independence from France nearly 60 years ago. President Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz, who seized power in a coup in 2008, agreed to step down and abide by the maximum two five-year elected terms. Non-elected military governments have mostly ruled the country following independence.

headlines: China says it needs $440 billion to clean up rural environment
text: China's Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs has said the country needs to spend nearly $440 billion over three years to improve village sanitation and clean up its heavily polluted rural environment. The funds would be required to meet state targets to build clean rural toilets, treat household waste, and construct village sewage treatment plants, it added.

headlines: FedEx rejects package with Huawei phone sent to US from UK
text: FedEx rejected a package containing a used Huawei phone being sent from the UK to the US. The phone was being sent to a PCMag.com phone analyst, who posted a tweet about the package being sent back to London. "The package in question was mistakenly returned to the shipper, and we apologize for this operational error," FedEx said.

headlines: Pietersen begs England to 'NOT F this tournament up' after SL loss
text: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen posted a tweet after England's loss to Sri Lanka in which he pleaded England to 'NOT F this tournament up'.
