England, the world number one ODI team, has lost matches to Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the ongoing edition of the World Cup. England will face Australia on June 25.

headlines: Babar won't become Kohli if he scores 50-60 runs: Afridi
text: Speaking about comparisons between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli, Shahid Afridi said, "It is my hope that Babar Azam will become a bigger player like Virat Kohli. But he won't become that player if he plays 50-60 balls, scores 50-60 runs but doesn't help Pakistan win the game." Babar scored 48 in 57 balls against India at the World Cup.

headlines: Pankaj Advani completes 'career grand slam' in cue sports
text: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani has completed his 'career grand slam' in cue sports after winning the 35th men's Asian Snooker Championship. With his win, Advani has now won the ACBS Asian Snooker events, 6-red (short format) and 15-red (long format), along with the IBSF World Championships in both formats too.

headlines: 1st time an Indian XI has each player from a different Ranji team
text: The Indian team playing against Afghanistan on Saturday is the first time when all the eleven players of the team are from a different Ranji Trophy team. The Indian team opted to play two specialist spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal against Afghanistan, while Afghanistan chose to play three specialist spinners.

headlines: Kohli equals record of 3 straight WC 50s as India captain
text: India's Virat Kohli on Saturday equalled Mohammad Azharuddin's record of scoring three straight scores of over 50 in the World Cup as India's captain. Before Saturday's 67 against Afghanistan, Kohli had scored 82 and 77 runs against Australia and Pakistan respectively in India's last two games in the ongoing edition of the ICC Men's World Cup.

headlines: YouTube tests new layout with comments hidden by default
text: YouTube is testing a new layout which has video comments hidden by default. The test features a separate section that users can view after clicking the 'Comments' button present between the Thumbs Down and Share buttons, below the video. "We're testing a few different options on how to display comments...This is one of many small experiments," the platform said.

headlines: Party, I wont protect rape-accused son: CPI(M) Kerala chief
text: Kerala CPI(M) chief Kodiyeri Balakrishnan on Saturday said that neither he nor his party will protect his rape-accused son Binoy Kodiyeri. Binoy, who is absconding, was accused by a Mumbai-based woman of raping her for years after promising to marry her. She claimed she has an 8-year-old child out of the relationship and was not aware that Binoy was married.

headlines: Halwa Ceremony held ahead of printing of Budget documents
text: The 'Halwa Ceremony' was held at the Finance Ministry on Saturday to mark the beginning of the printing of the Union Budget 2019-20 documents. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also participated in the ceremony. After the ceremony, the concerned officials will be locked up in the basement of the Ministry until the presentation of the Budget in the Lok Sabha.

headlines: MP man declared dead found alive in morgue; dies later
text: A 72-year-old man, who was declared dead by a doctor in a Madhya Pradesh district hospital, was found alive when his body was being taken for postmortem after spending a night in the morgue. However, he could not be revived and died 90 minutes later. The hospital has initiated an investigation against the doctor who ordered the autopsy.

headlines: 4 kids electrocuted to death after live wire falls into pool
text: Four children on Friday were electrocuted to death after a live wire broke and fell into the tubewell pool in which they were bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. Their bodies were discovered hours later by a farmer who happened to be passing by. Prima facie it appears to be negligence on the Electricity Department's part, police said.

headlines: 11-year-old raped, head crushed with bricks in UP's Unnao
text: An 11-year-old girl was raped and murdered and her head was crushed with bricks in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao district. The girl, who was sleeping outside her house, was found missing after her father woke up in the middle of the night. Her naked body was found later bearing injury marks around her neck and private parts.

headlines: Staff leaves unconscious patient inside clinic as duty ends
text: The staff of a community healthcare centre allegedly locked up and left after their duty got over with an unconscious female patient still inside in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The 30-year-old regained consciousness a few hours later and cried for help, following which locals informed officials who rushed to the spot. A panel has been set up to investigate the incident.

headlines: 7-storey building collapses in Cambodia; 7 dead, 30 feared trapped
text: At least seven people were killed and more than 30 others are feared trapped after a seven-storey building collapsed in Cambodia on Saturday, authorities said. The under-construction building in the Cambodian city of Sihanoukville was owned by a Chinese company. Four people have been arrested in connection with the accident.

headlines: Dhoni, who has 121 ODI stumpings, gets stumped for 2nd time in ODIs
text: India wicketkeeper-batsman MS Dhoni, who has effected 121 ODI stumpings so far, got out stumped for 28(52) off Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. This is the second time in his ODI career that the 37-year-old got out stumped. Dhoni was stumped in an ODI for the first time in 2011 World Cup against West Indies.

headlines: 18-yr-old Mujeeb 1st spinner to take a wicket vs India in 2019 WC
text: Afghanistan's 18-year-old spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman has become the first spinner to take a wicket against India in the 2019 World Cup. Mujeeb clean bowled opener Rohit Sharma for 1(10) on the second delivery of his third over on Saturday. Before this, Indian batsmen had played 55.1 overs of spin in the tournament without getting out.

headlines: Imran Khan's aide shares pic of Sachin claiming it's Pak PM, trolled
text: Naeem ul Haque, Special Assistant to Pakistan PM Imran Khan was trolled for sharing an old picture of Sachin Tendulkar and claiming it was Imran Khan in 1969. "Imran Khan mistakes Tagore's quote as Gibran's...His people mistake Sachin Tendulkar as Imran Khan," a user wrote. Another user shared a picture of MS Dhoni and captioned it, "Kamran Akmal in 2007."

headlines: Spotify claims it overpaid songwriters, asks for money back
text: Music streaming platform Spotify has claimed it overpaid reportedly "millions of dollars" to US songwriters and publishers as per new US Copyright Royalty Board (CRB) regulations in 2018. The platform is now asking for the overpaid money back. "Rather than [collecting] the 2018 overpayment immediately, we have offered to extend the recoupment period through the end of 2019," Spotify said.

headlines: Odisha minister calls self 'God', CM Patnaik 'Lord Jagannath'
text: Odisha Revenue and Disaster Management Minister Sudam Marndi called himself "God" and equated state Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik with Lord Jagannath on Friday. Marndi added that the attendants of Haribaldev Jew temple should have held a meeting with him before setting off on a padayatra for the fulfilment of their eight demands. The march was later withdrawn.

headlines: Advocate who killed UP Bar Council's 1st woman President dies
text: Advocate Manish Sharma, who shot dead first ever woman President of Uttar Pradesh Bar Council Darvesh Yadav, succumbed to his injuries during treatment at a Gurugram Hospital on Saturday. Sharma had shot himself after killing Yadav inside the Agra court premises on June 12. Her family had alleged Sharma had embezzled funds which led to her murder.

headlines: Indian airlines to avoid flying over some Iran-controlled airspace
text: Aviation regulator DGCA on Saturday said that all Indian airlines have decided to avoid "the affected part of Iranian airspace to ensure safe travel for the passengers". The decision comes after Iran shot down a high-altitude US drone with a surface-to-air missile, raising fears of a military confrontation between the two countries. Indian carriers will re-route flights suitably, DGCA added.

headlines: 12-year-old Kota boy chokes to death during TikTok challenge
text: A 12-year-old boy in Kota accidentally choked to death allegedly while attempting to shoot and upload a video of himself on mobile app TikTok, said the Rajasthan police on Friday. His family said he was sporting sindoor, a mangalsutra and bangles when he was found hanging from a noose in his bathroom. A case has been registered.

headlines: Official blames bats for power cuts in MP; minister scolds him
text: In a review meeting in Bhopal, an official of Madhya Pradesh's power distribution company blamed bats hanging on the power supply lines as the main cause of power cuts in the city. However, state Energy Minister Priyavrat Singh said overloaded power transformers were responsible for the power outage, adding that he "pulled up" the official who blamed bats.

headlines: Trump shares video suggesting he could be President forever
text: US President Donald Trump on Saturday shared a video on Twitter that depicts him running for office indefinitely. The video, which appeared to mock an October 2018 TIME magazine cover titled "How Trumpism Will Outlast Trump", shows Trump campaign yard signs lasting beyond 2020. The video ended with Trump standing behind a yard sign that read "TRUMP 4EVA".

headlines: Bitcoin breaches $10,000 for first time in 15 months
text: The price of the world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin breached $10,000 for the first time in about 15 months on Saturday. The cryptocurrency surged to $10,900, gaining nearly 200% so far this year, data from CoinMarketCap showed. Bitcoin reached an all-time high of around $20,000 in December 2017, capping a nearly 1,400% increase that year.

headlines: I've been able to prove myself without using my dad's name: Tiger
text: Tiger Shroff said that he didn't want to be known solely as Jackie Shroff's son in Bollywood and wanted to build an identity for himself. "[I]t's fair to say I've been successful at proving myself, my identity in my own manner without using my father's name," Tiger said. "I was always aware of my [father's]...impact on the industry," he added.

headlines: Woman named Marijuana Pepsi gets PhD by dissertation on black names
text: A woman named Marijuana Pepsi in the US has earned a PhD in higher education leadership with a dissertation on "Black names in white classrooms". The 46-year-old said that throughout her life she was made fun of because of her name. Her mother picked out her name and said that it would "take her around the world", she added.

headlines: Pakistan PM Imran is a huge fan of Kohli's batting: Ramiz
text: Pakistani commentator Ramiz Raja said that Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan is a huge fan of Indian captain Virat Kohli's batting. Ramiz revealed during India's World Cup match against Afghanistan that Imran Khan reckons that Kohli scores runs for India when the team needs it. Imran had tweeted advice for Sarfaraz Ahmed ahead of Pakistan's World Cup match against India.

headlines: New tool helps spot deepfake videos with up to 96% accuracy
text: America's UC Berkeley and Southern California University researchers have created a new tool which they claim detects realistic 'deepfake' videos with up to 96% accuracy. The tool searches for 'soft-biometric signatures' such as eyelids movement to detect fakes. It was trained on a dataset of about 1,000 manipulated videos and uses significantly less computing power and time, researchers said.

headlines: Huawei sues US Commerce Department for seizing its equipment
text: World's largest telecoms equipment maker Huawei has filed a lawsuit against the US Commerce Department over the seizure of its equipment. Huawei sent the equipment from China to a testing laboratory in California which was being sent back to China after the testing was done. Huawei is challenging whether the case is covered by the US Export Administration Regulations.

headlines: Man pulls out gun on rickshaw puller over fare dispute in UP
text: A man on Friday pulled out a gun on a rickshaw puller allegedly after a fight broke out over the fare demanded by the rickshaw puller in Uttar Pradesh's Mau district. Police said that the weapon the man brandished during the dispute was licensed. A case has been registered by the police and an investigation is underway.

headlines: Sri Lanka extends emergency for 3rd month after Easter bombings
text: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena has extended the state of emergency in the country for the third month following the Easter Sunday serial blasts that killed over 250 people. The Islamic State had claimed responsibility for the bombings that targeted churches and hotels. Sri Lankan authorities have said that operations are still underway to find any remaining suspects.

headlines: Bournvita Lil Champs launches new campaign with Kareena Kapoor
text: Bournvita Lil Champs has roped in Kareena Kapoor to introduce the concept of motor skills - the true measure of toddler growth. It refers to physical and mental growth that allows the child to explore the world. The campaign encourages parents to think beyond their child's height and weight. The toddler health drink contains DHA, protein and minerals that aids growth.

headlines: Want our kids to achieve but only merit speaks: Kiran on nepotism
text: While sharing her take on nepotism, filmmaker Kiran Rao said, "[W]e'll always want to make our children achieve what they want to and if that's called nepotism, then it is." "But everyone has to be aware that ultimately, only merit will speak," Kiran added. She further said that she believes nepotism exists in every part of society.

headlines: Kareena confirmed to star with Aamir in 'Lal Singh Chaddha'
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan will star opposite Aamir Khan in the upcoming film 'Lal Singh Chaddha', Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh has confirmed. Directed by Advait Chandan, the film is a Hindi adaptation of Oscar-winning Hollywood film 'Forrest Gump', which released in 1994. Shooting for the film is slated to commence in October, as per reports.

headlines: Yograj Singh to feature in Rajinikanth's 'Darbar': Reports
text: Indian cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh has joined the cast of the upcoming Rajinikanth starrer 'Darbar', as per reports. The forthcoming Tamil film will also see actors Suniel Shetty, Prateik Babbar and actress Nayanthara in lead roles. Yograj, who is also a former Indian cricketer, has previously featured in films like 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', which released in 2013.

headlines: India's previous ODI meeting with Afghanistan ended in a tie
text: The last time India and Afghanistan played against each other in an ODI was on September 25, 2018 in Asia Cup in Dubai. It was the second-ever ODI between the sides, with the match ending in a second-last ball tie after both teams scored 252 runs each. The match witnessed MS Dhoni lead India for the 200th time in ODIs.

headlines: India have not lost a single wicket to spin in 2019 World Cup so far
text: Team India, who are currently unbeaten in the 2019 World Cup, have not lost a single wicket to spin bowling in the tournament so far. India have played 53 overs of spin bowling in their three innings, scoring 339 runs. Meanwhile, India have scored 571 runs in 94.3 overs of fast bowling, losing 14 wickets.

headlines: Didn't know he was with son: Fan apologises for calling Sarfaraz pig
text: The Pakistani fan, who body-shamed Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed in front of his son by calling him a pig in a mall, has apologised for his behaviour. He said that he wasn't aware that the kid was Sarfaraz's son. He further claimed that he had deleted the video after apologising to Sarfaraz and had no idea how it went viral.

headlines: Naspers may buy Capital Float instead of just investing: Report
text: South Africa's most valuable public firm Naspers is in talks to acquire Bengaluru-based lending platform Capital Float instead of just investing in it, Entrackr reported. Naspers' PayU reportedly hadn't agreed to Capital Float seeking a $500-550 million valuation for its fundraising. The value of the transaction would be in the range of $350-380 million, Entrackr cited its sources as saying.

headlines: NITI Aayog plans to convert 2-wheelers below 150cc to electric by 2025
text: Government think-tank NITI Aayog has proposed that two-wheelers with an engine capacity less than 150 cc to be converted to electric by 2025. Moreover, it also aims to make three-wheelers to be fully electric by 2023. Niti Aayog has reportedly asked conventional two-wheeler and three-wheeler makers to suggest concrete steps towards transition to electric mobility within two weeks.

headlines: 2 fall to death from window at second floor of Bengaluru pub
text: Two private firm employees, identified as Pawan and Vedha, died after they fell from the second floor of a Bengaluru pub on Friday. They were getting down from the third floor when they lost their balance and stumbled out of the window next to the staircase, police said. The man landed on a car and succumbed to his injuries later.

headlines: Gym owner who punched female toll plaza worker arrested
text: A gym owner named Manjeet has been arrested for allegedly punching a female toll plaza employee in the face after she refused to let him pass without paying the toll tax in Gurugram. Manjeet was booked for murder in 2011 and for possessing an illegal weapon in 2018. The SUV he was driving, which belongs to his friend, was seized.

headlines: Human skeletons found at Muzaffarpur hospital where 108 died of AES
text: Human skeletal remains have been found behind Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, where 108 children have died due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome. The hospital's Medical Superintendent Dr SK Shahi said that he will talk to the Principal, who heads the post-mortem department, and ask him to constitute an investigating committee.

headlines: 9 killed as skydiving plane crashes in Hawaii
text: Nine people aboard a skydiving aircraft were killed on Friday after it crashed on the Hawaiian island of Oahu, with officials saying that no survivors were expected to be found. The plane was engulfed in flames when fire department personnel arrived. The Federal Aviation Administration and the National Transportation Safety Board will take over the investigation.

headlines: Putin bans Russian flights from carrying Russian citizens to Georgia
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a decree temporarily banning Russian airlines from carrying Russian citizens to Georgia from July 8. This comes after a Russian MP's speech in Georgia's Parliament triggered widespread protests and clashes, with Russia calling it "an anti-Russian provocation". The decree also ordered to assure the return of Russian citizens currently in Georgia.

headlines: Just want to spend time with family: SRK on not signing films
text: Shah Rukh Khan has said that he has not signed any films as he wants to spend time with his family. "Usually what happens is when your one film is coming to an end, you begin work on your next film," he said. "But this time I am just not feeling like...My heart doesn't allow me to," Shah Rukh added.

headlines: Holder rules out Russell for Windies' WC match vs New Zealand
text: Speaking ahead of his side's match against New Zealand at the World Cup 2019, Jason Holder said, "We're trying to manage niggles... I think one guy who probably may be definitely out tomorrow is Russell. I don't think he's fit enough to go tomorrow." Russell did not bowl his quota of ten overs in Windies' last two matches.

headlines: Amazon wins patent to use drones for 'surveillance' service
text: E-commerce giant Amazon has secured a new US patent to use its drones to also provide "surveillance as a service" to its customers besides deliveries. "Surveillance images may be limited to authorised property, so privacy is ensured for private persons and property," Amazon said in the patent. It had filed the application for the said patent back in 2015.

headlines: 4 killed in car accident on Uttar Pradesh highway
text: Four people were killed on the spot after their speeding car rammed into an electric pole on National Highway 30 in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, police said. The accident took place after the driver lost control of the vehicle near the turn leading to Bareilly. One other passenger was injured and his condition is stated to be stable.

headlines: 18 injured after bus turns upside down in J&K's Kishtwar
text: At least 18 people were injured on Saturday after a minibus skidded and turned upside down in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. Police said the minibus was on its way from Kandni village to Kishtwar when the driver lost control of the wheel. The injured passengers, including the driver, were shifted to the district hospital for treatment, said an official.

headlines: Uruguay govt ordered to sell Nazi eagle recovered from WWII ship
text: A court in Uruguay has ordered the country's government to sell a Nazi bronze eagle that was recovered from a German WWII battleship. The ship sank off the coast of Uruguay at the beginning of WWII. The eagle, with a swastika under its talons, has been kept hidden inside a sealed crate in an Uruguayan Navy warehouse.

headlines: Uber encourages citizens to rethink urban spaces with new campaign
text: Uber India's new campaign #ParksNotParking aims to raise awareness about the ills of growing congestion and pollution in cities which is turning many of them into giant parking lots. Recognising the urgent need to better utilise urban spaces for building parks, Uber seeks to encourage citizens to choose smarter and shared mobility solutions.

headlines: Never met her in my life: Trump on journo's sexual assault allegation
text: Rejecting Journalist E Jean Carroll's sexual assault allegations against him as "fake news", US President Donald Trump said, "I've never met this person (Carroll) in my life." "Shame on those who make up false stories of assault to try to get publicity for themselves," Trump said, stating she has no evidence. Carroll claimed Trump assaulted her around 23 years ago.

headlines: I would erase 'Shaandaar' from my career if I could: Shahid
text: While speaking about his acting career, Shahid Kapoor revealed that he would remove his 2015 film 'Shaandaar' from his career trajectory if he could. "I have done some really crappy films," the actor added. "No one from this generation of actors can claim that a bad film did well just because they were in it," Shahid further said.

headlines: Disha Patani gets injured on sets of 'Malang': Reports
text: Disha Patani sustained an injury while shooting a sequence for her upcoming film 'Malang', as per reports. Required medical treatment was administered and the actress will resume shooting for the film as scheduled. Earlier, Disha revealed that she had broken her knee during rehearsals for the song 'Slow Motion' from the Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif starrer 'Bharat'.

headlines: Why are you fat like a pig: Fan tells Sarfaraz in front of his son
text: A video of a Pakistan fan body-shaming Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed in front of his kid at a mall has gone viral. In the video, the fan can be heard telling Sarfaraz, "Why are you fat like a pig? You have made Pakistan so proud. You should diet less." The fan made the remark after Sarfaraz obliged for a selfie.

headlines: K'taka CM sleeps on floor in village, says 'ready to sleep on road'
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy, accompanied by several ministers, spent the night in a school at Chandraki village on Friday after his visit to another village was postponed due to heavy rains. Kumaraswamy, who slept on the floor, denied reports that he was enjoying 5-star treatment in the village and said he was "ready to sleep on the road."

headlines: Researchers train seals to sing 'twinkle twinkle' tune, share video
text: Researchers in Scotland's University of St Andrews have shown that three trained seals were able to imitate parts of popular tunes. In a video footage shared by them, the seals could be heard trying to imitate tunes of 'twinkle twinkle, little star' and 'Star Wars' theme. The study gave the researchers a better understanding of the evolution of vocal learning.

headlines: UP Minister makes staffer tie his shoe, says act should be appreciated
text: A video has surfaced online that showed Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Laxmi Narayan getting his shoelaces tied by a government employee at a Yoga event in Shahjahanpur. The minister used Ramayana's reference to defend the act, saying, "You should appreciate it. India was a country where Bharat ruled Lord Ram's kingdom for 14 years with latter's 'khadau' on the throne."

headlines: PM Modi voted 'World's Most Powerful Person' in UK magazine poll
text: PM Narendra Modi was voted the 'World's Most Powerful Person 2019' in the reader's poll conducted by UK-based British Herald magazine. PM Modi received 30.9% of total votes to beat US President Donald Trump, Russian President Vladimir Putin, and Chinese President Xi Jinping. PM Modi will feature on the cover page of the July 15 edition of the magazine.

headlines: Hindu groups attacked minorities in India throughout 2018: US report
text: Mob attacks by "violent extremist Hindu groups" against minorities, especially Muslims, continued throughout 2018 amid rumours that victims traded or killed cows for beef, official US' report on religious freedom said. It pointed out that some BJP officials made inflammatory speeches against minorities. According to some NGOs, the authorities often protected perpetrators from prosecution, it added.

headlines: Yoga Day participants steal mats at event attended by Amit Shah
text: At an International Yoga Day event, which was also attended by Home Minister Amit Shah and CM Manohar Lal Khattar in Haryana's Rohtak, participants were seen stealing mats from the venue. A video shows people fighting over mats and snatching them from volunteers, who were trying to stop them. Volunteers can also be seen having heated arguments with the participants.

headlines: Curb terror funding by Oct or face action: Global body warns Pak
text: As Pakistan has failed to complete its action plan on terror financing, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has warned the country to meet its commitment by October or face action. This could lead to Pakistan getting blacklisted and facing global sanctions. Pakistan is currently on the grey list of countries which have inadequate controls over curbing terrorism financing.

headlines: Career began when I came to Mumbai for sound engineering: Gajendra
text: 'Emptiness' and 'Tera Ghata' singer Gajendra Verma in an interview said that his music career began when he went to Mumbai for sound engineering. "I've always liked to sing from my childhood...Everyone in my family sings," he said. He also said that he sang 'Emptiness' in the last year of his college and someone leaked it.

headlines: Film with Abhishek, Rajkummar not Life In A Metro sequel: Director
text: Speaking about his upcoming film with Abhishek Bachchan and Rajkummar Rao, director Anurag Basu said the film won't be a sequel to his 2007 film 'Life In A Metro'. "The genre is different. 'Life' had drama, love story and revolved around multiple stories about relationships," he said. "This isn't that. This film has...crime and black humour in it," Anurag added.

headlines: Deepika Padukone approached to replace Kangana Ranaut in Imali
text: Deepika Padukone has been approached to replace Kangana Ranaut in the upcoming film 'Imali', the film's director Anurag Basu has confirmed. "We were supposed to start [shooting] in November but couldn't because [Kangana] got busy with 'Manikarnika' and 'Panga'," Anurag explained. Kangana earlier confirmed that she had exited the film as she wanted to focus on her upcoming directorial venture.

headlines: No plan to hike production outside China: New Foxconn Chairman
text: World's largest electronics contract manufacturer Foxconn's new Chairman Liu Young-Way said Foxconn has no plan to increase production capacity outside China right now. Young-Way told Reuters he wasn't aware of client requests for Foxconn to shift part of its production outside China. Notably, Foxconn Founder Terry Gou stepped down as the Chairman to contest Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.

headlines: New mind-controlled robot arm 1st to work without brain implant
text: A team of US-based researchers has developed the "first-ever successful" mind-controlled robotic arm that works without a brain implant. The team created a brain-computer interface (BCI), using sensing and machine learning techniques, that could reach signals deep within the brains of participants wearing EEG head caps. The arm has the ability to continuously track and follow a computer cursor.

headlines: All fair in BJP brand of politics: Mayawati on TDP MPs joining BJP
text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Friday criticised BJP for "engineering defection" after four TDP Rajya Sabha MPs joined the party, adding, "It's clear that everything is fair in BJP brand of politics and nothing is wrong." Mayawati claimed that BJP had accused two of these MPs of corruption but now, after joining the party, they have become "doodh ka dhula" (pure).

headlines: 1st NASA 'Astrobee' robot flies on its own in space for 1st time
text: NASA has revealed its first cube-shaped 'Astrobee' robot, called Bumble, flew under its own power in space for the first time on June 14. Astrobee is a free-flying robot system designed to help astronauts reduce time spent on routine duties. The system comprises two more robots 'Honey' and 'Queen', software and a docking station used for recharging.

headlines: He thrust his penis inside me: Journo accuses Trump of sexual assault
text: Journalist E Jean Carroll has claimed that US President Donald Trump sexually assaulted her in a dressing room of a department store around 23 years ago. Trump forced "his fingers around my private area, thrust his penis halfway- or completely, I'm not certain- inside me", she said. Carroll said that she didn't come forward earlier as she "dreaded public humiliation".

headlines: After scoring 397 in previous match, England fail to chase SL's 232
text: After putting up a total of 397/6 in their previous match against Afghanistan, England failed to chase down Sri Lanka's 232 in 2019 World Cup on Friday. It is England's fourth straight defeat against Sri Lanka in World Cup history. Sri Lanka have now moved to fifth place on 2019 World Cup points table with two victories from six matches.

headlines: Decisions can't be taken on someone's tweet: Hafeez on toss row
text: Speaking on India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup toss row, Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez said team's decision can't be made on basis of what someone has tweeted. "It was teams decision. We didnt bowl well and thats why we lost," he added. Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed had opted to bowl first despite Pakistan PM Imran Khan suggesting him to bat first on Twitter.

headlines: Warner reveals teammates call him 'Hum-bull' after return from ban
text: Australia opener David Warner, who slammed match-winning 166 runs against Bangladesh on Thursday, revealed that his teammates have given him a new nickname. "They call me Hum-bull (humble) now," added the 32-year-old, who is playing his first international tournament after serving a one-year ban. Warner was known as "Bull" early in his career before he was nicknamed "Reverend".

headlines: Foxconn Founder urges Apple to shift plants from China to Taiwan
text: Apple's largest iPhone assembler Foxconn's Founder Terry Gou has asked the technology giant to move part of its production chain out of China. "I'm urging Apple to move to Taiwan," said the 69-year-old billionaire, who is currently the richest man in Taiwan. Notably, Gou has announced his resignation as the manufacturing giant's Chairman to contest Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.

headlines: Pic of martyr's remains wrapped in BJD flag viral, probe ordered
text: After a picture of martyr Ajit Kumar Sahoo's coffin draped in BJD flag went viral, BJD spokesperson Sasmit Patra said the "unfortunate" incident will be investigated. Three of BJD members from Cuttack district have been placed under suspension from the party. Sahoo succumbed to injuries he sustained in an IED blast in Pulwama on June 17.

headlines: BMW heirs worth $34 billion say their wealth can be a burden
text: Susanne Klatten and Stefan Quandt, the BMW heirs who are worth a combined $34.5 billion, said that dealing with the responsibility and jealousy from inheriting wealth is a misunderstood burden. Klatten said some parts of being rich "aren't so nice". Meanwhile, Quandt said he might've wanted to work a few years as a "simple" product manager somewhere or study architecture.

headlines: Under-construction warship in Mumbai catches fire, 1 dead
text: A major fire broke out at an under-construction warship of Indian Navy at Mazagon Dockyard on Friday evening. A senior city fire brigade official said that one person suspected to be trapped inside died. The blaze erupted on the second deck of INS Visakhapatnam. Eight fire-fighting engines and a quick-response vehicle have been pressed into service to extinguish the blaze.

headlines: One can only pray to God to give him sense: Rajnath on Rahul's tweet
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi mocked Yoga Day by terming a picture of Army dogs doing yoga as 'New India', Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticised him. "One can only pray to God to give him sense," he tweeted. "These are proud members of the Indian Army and they contribute to the safety of our nation," he added.

headlines: Irani deletes daughter's selfie, reposts it with msg for her bully
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani took to Instagram to share a selfie of her daughter and revealed she deleted it yesterday after Zoish was bullied in her class. Adding that she deleted it as she couldn't stand her daughter's tears, Irani said, "I realised my act just supported the bully." "Bully her all you want, she'll fight back," she further wrote.

headlines: Pak tweets yoga asana & tricolour emoji on Yoga Day, deletes it later
text: On the occasion of International Yoga Day on Friday, the Pakistan government's official Twitter handle shared a post with the hashtag #YogaDay and as a result, posted a yoga asana and tricolour emoji. The tweet was later deleted and replaced with one that didn't have the emoji. "Yoga is an ancient physical, mental and spiritual practice," their tweet read.

headlines: India raises concerns over rising oil prices with Saudi Arabia
text: Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan expressed concerns about rising crude oil prices to his Saudi Arabian counterpart, Khalid Al-Falih. Global oil prices rose sharply on fears of a US military attack on Iran. Pradhan told Falih by telephone that he wanted Saudi to play an active role within OPEC and OPEC+ to keep oil prices at a reasonable level.

headlines: GST Council extends anti-profiteering authority's tenure by 2 yrs
text: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council led by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday decided to extend the tenure of the National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA) by two years. If the profiteered amount is not deposited in 30 days, penalty to the extent of 10% of the profiteered amount will be imposed on the company, Revenue Secretary AB Pandey said.

headlines: Shakib picked by team for GT20 league in Canada
text: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has been picked to play for the Brampton Wolves in the second edition of the GT20 Canada. The tournament is set to start on July 25 and will take place until August 11. Shakib is Bangladesh's leading-wicket taker in T20I cricket, having scalped 88 wickets with the best figures of 5/20, achieved against the Windies.

headlines: Sharapova crashes out in 2nd round in 1st tournament after Jan
text: Former world number one tennis player Maria Sharapova made a winning return to competitive tennis with a win over Viktoria Kuzmova in the second round of the Mallorca Open. The five-time Grand Slam champion, who went on to lose to Angelique Kerber in the next round, had not played since the end of January after having suffered a shoulder injury.

headlines: PM to attend G20 meet; will raise black money, terrorism issues
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend G20 summit in Japan next week and will raise the issues of financial stability, black money and terrorism, among others. "This would be the sixth time that PM would be participating in the summit," MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said. "He would also hold bilateral meetings and participate in plurilateral meetings," Kumar added.

headlines: Cong opposing Triple Talaq bill matter of great distress: BJP
text: Union Law and Justice Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Friday termed Congress's opposition to the Triple Talaq bill as 'a matter of great distress'. "Today Congress was siding with the likes of (AIMIM chief) Asaduddin Owaisi who were opposing it," he said. The Minister added that it is 'painful' and 'deeply regrettable' to see Congress party taking an anti-woman stand.

headlines: Student found with slashed wrist, plastic over head in Kolkata; dies
text: A teenage girl was found in her school's toilet with her wrist slashed and a plastic bag over her head in Kolkata. The girl, believed to be a class 10 student, was taken to the hospital where she was pronounced dead. As per local media reports, a three-page suicide note has been recovered and an investigation is underway.

headlines: 17 of 59 accidents in 2018-19 due to track defects: Railways
text: Railways Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday told the Parliament that 17 accidents of the total 59 in 2018-19 had taken place due to track defects. Goyal further said that there were 20 accidents in 2015-2016 and 34 in 2016-17 due to track defects. "Safety is...the highest priority...and all possible steps are undertaken...to ensure safe running trains," he added.

headlines: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar avoids questions on AES deaths
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday was caught on camera avoiding journalists' questions on the deaths of children in the state due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). Kumar, who had come to the Legislative Assembly, kept a smile on his face and continued walking towards his car. AES has claimed 122 children's lives in Bihar so far, ANI reported.

headlines: Bill passed for 16% Maratha quota in PG medical courses
text: The Maharashtra Legislative Council on Friday cleared a bill to provide 16% reservation to the Maratha community students in post-graduate (PG) medical courses. This comes a day after the bill was unanimously passed in the Legislative Assembly. As both the Houses of the Legislature have cleared the bill, it will now be sent to the Governor for his approval.

headlines: 'Om' chants at UN General Assembly to mark Yoga Day
text: In a first of its kind Yoga Day celebration, a yoga event was held at the UN General Assembly (UNGA) hall. The UN officials and diplomats along with many others did various asanas, chanted 'Om, Shanti' and meditated. The event was called 'Yoga with the Gurus', and the theme of the event was 'Yoga for Climate Action'.

headlines: Facebook lifts ban on Led Zeppelin album cover with naked children
text: Facebook has lifted the ban on the cover of English rock band Led Zeppelin's album 'Houses of the Holy', which featured images of naked children. "We know this a culturally significant image. Therefore, we're restoring the posts we removed," Facebook said. The social media platform had said the posted cover was "flagged by other members of the community".

headlines: Indian fan proposes to girlfriend in stands during India-Pakistan match
text: A Team India fan proposed to his girlfriend in the stands during India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup match at Manchester on June 16. The fan got down on one knee and proposed to the girl amid cheering from the crowd. The girl later shared the video and wrote, "So this happened." "Aisa sirf filmon main hota hai," a user tweeted.

headlines: Billionaire Foxconn chief steps down to run for Taiwan president
text: Taiwan's richest person and the world's largest electronics contract manufacturer Foxconn's founder Terry Gou has stepped down from the role of Chairman to contest Taiwan's 2020 presidential election. The 69-year-old, with a net worth of $6.6 billion as per Forbes, had founded Foxconn 45 years ago. "I will never come back," added Gou, who will remain on the company's board.

headlines: 2 Bengaluru startups get India's 1st drone certifications
text: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has, in a first, certified one drone model each of two Bengaluru startups, Skylark Drones and Throttle Aerospace Systems. The drones are compliant with the NPNT (no permission, no take-off) protocol under the new drone policy. Under this protocol, a software layer allows drones to fly only after they get automated permission from authorities.

headlines: Joyride at Chennai theme park crashes to the ground, 12 injured
text: A joyride at a theme park in Chennai crashed to the ground after the steel cables holding the platform snapped, injuring at least 12 people. The incident forced the management to temporarily shut down the amusement park. Assistant Commissioner Muthuvel Pandi revealed the accident occurred two months after a notice was sent to the park following complaints against equipment there.

headlines: How'll a man give allowance if arrested: Owaisi on Triple Talaq bill
text: Talking about Triple Talaq bill, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the bill is unconstitutional and if it becomes a law, it'll be even greater injustice against women. "If a man gets arrested, how will he give allowance from jail?" he added. "He'll be jailed for 3 years but marriage will be intact...What law is PM Narendra Modi forming?" he added.

headlines: Railways plans to offer passengers option to give up fare subsidy
text: The Railways is planning to launch a campaign urging passengers to give up fare subsidy at the time of booking their train tickets to increase earnings. According to Railways, it recovers only 53% of the cost incurred on the passenger transport business. The government had previously launched a campaign urging people to forgo the subsidy for their LPG cylinders.

headlines: US was 'cocked and loaded' for Iran attack but I stopped it: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday said that he stopped an attack on Iran 10 minutes before the scheduled strike as killing 150 people was "not proportionate to shooting down an unmanned drone". "I am in no hurry, our Military is rebuilt, new, and ready to go, by far the best in the world," he further wrote on Twitter.

headlines: US plane with 35 people accompanied drone, didn't down it: Iran
text: Iran has said that it refrained from shooting down a US plane with 35 people on board that was accompanying the downed drone. Iran added the purpose of downing the drone was to warn the US that it could also target the plane. Iran further said it warned the US twice of a strike if the plane didn't change course.

headlines: People in New Zealand can now vote at supermarkets, malls
text: New Zealand has allowed placing ballot boxes in supermarkets and malls to make it easier for people to vote. The government has brought in other changes, including introducing same-day enrolment for voters and measures to make voting from overseas easier. "It's important that ballot boxes are placed where people are going about their normal business," Justice Minister Andrew Little said.

headlines: 30 killed in fire at Indonesia home used as matchstick factory
text: At least 30 people were killed in Indonesia after a fire ripped through a house that was also used as a matchstick factory, Indonesian disaster agency's officials said on Friday. At least three children were among the victims, officials added. The cause of the fire is not yet clear, a police spokesperson said.

headlines: Increase duties immediately to deter Chinese imports: Steel Ministry
text: The Steel Ministry has sought an immediate increase in import duties on finished steel products to 15% from a range of 7.5% to 12.5%, citing a threat from Chinese imports. "The US-China trade war is threatening Indian markets as China looks for alternative markets for its steel exports, the ministry said in an internal note reviewed by Reuters.

headlines: Neymar made a mistake in leaving Barcelona: Rivaldo
text: Former Barcelona and Brazil footballer Rivaldo said that his compatriot Neymar Jr made a mistake in leaving Barcelona for French club Paris Saint-Germain. "I would love for him to return... If he returns, Barcelona will have a chance to win the Champions League and he will have a chance to become the best in the world," Rivaldo said.

headlines: Federer reaches last-8 at Halle after win over Tsonga
text: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer reached the last-eight stage at the Halle ATP event after registering a three-set win over France's Jo Wilfried Tsonga on Thursday. Federer, who is set to face Roberto Bautista Agut on Friday, is looking to win his tenth title at Halle. "I had a bit of everything, happiness, sadness, frustration," Federer later said.

headlines: Mats Hummels rejoins Borussia Dortmund from Bayern Munich
text: German defender Mats Hummels is set to rejoin his former club Borussia Dortmund on a three-year deal after leaving Bayern Munich for a fee estimated to be 38 million. The 30-year-old defender had twice won the Bundesliga title in his eight years at Dortmund before joining Bayern for 35 million in 2016. Hummels was part of Bayern's youth system.

headlines: Kaleshwaram project gift from Maharashtra to T'gana: Fadnavis
text: At the inauguration of Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project on Friday, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said the project is a gift from the people of Maharashtra to the people of Telangana. "This project will change the face of the state," he added. Notably, after years of disagreement, in 2016, the Maharashtra government accepted Telangana's water-sharing arrangement, paving way for the project.

headlines: Daily water supply will help: TN on Kerala's one-time supply offer
text: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami on Friday welcomed Kerala's gesture of one-time supply of two million litres water to the state but said that everyday supply would be more useful. "It won't be sufficient. We're supplying 525 million litres water (in Chennai) daily," he said. "If two million litres could be given daily, it'll be more useful," Palaniswami added.

headlines: UP government to introduce khadi school uniforms
text: The Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday announced that khadi uniforms will be introduced in the primary schools of some districts on a pilot project basis to promote the fabric among children. The uniform for boys will be dark brown trousers and pink shirts, while for girls it will be dark brown skirts and pink tops.

headlines: Thousands protest in Georgia after Russian MP speaks in Parliament
text: Thousands of people protested in Georgia's capital Tbilisi on Thursday, trying to storm the Parliament after a Russian MP took the Speaker's seat. Police used tear gas and fired rubber bullets to stop the protestors from entering the building. Georgia and Russia don't have diplomatic ties since they fought a war over the breakaway region of South Ossetia in 2008.

headlines: Northern Hemisphere witnesses longest day of the year today
text: June 21 marks the beginning of summer in Earth's Northern Hemisphere, referred to as the 'summer solstice', the year's longest day and shortest night. A solstice is an astronomical event when the tilt of Earth's axis with respect to the Sun is maximum. After summer solstice, days start getting shorter till winter solstice on December 21, Northern Hemisphere's shortest day.

headlines: Yoga helped my mom after knee surgery: Akshay shares pic on Yoga Day
text: On the fifth International Yoga Day, actor Akshay Kumar shared a picture of his mother doing Yoga to express how it helped her. "Sharing something I'm extremely proud of...post her knee surgery at the age of 75, my mother started doing yoga and now it is part of daily routine, improving one day at a time," Akshay wrote on Instagram.

headlines: Indecent experience in B'wood left me shaken: Punjabi actress Neeru
text: Canada-born Punjabi actress Neeru Bajwa, who featured in the 2013 film 'Special 26', said she was left shaken after facing an "indecent" experience during a meeting for a Hindi film. "I was told, 'This is what you've to do to make it here'," she said. "Since then, I didn't try my luck in Bollywood, and I never will," Neeru added.

headlines: Gautam Gambhir mocks AAP's lookalike claims with pic of daughter
text: BJP MP and former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir trolled Aam Aadmi Party's claims that he used a lookalike during election campaign by sharing a picture of himself and his daughter Anaiza on Twitter. "Some ppl thought I had a clone........proving them right," he captioned the picture. AAP had claimed that Gambhir used a lookalike to avoid heat.

headlines: Debit card startup says Facebooks crypto project copied its logo
text: US debit card startup Current's CEO Stuart Sopp has accused Facebook of "ripping off" his company's logo for its new crypto project. Current tweeted a comparison of the two images with the caption, "this is what happens when you only have 1 crayon left". Facebook's newly created subsidiary Calibra will offer a digital wallet for the Libra cryptocurrency.

headlines: Rahul terms pic of Army dogs doing yoga as 'New India'; criticised
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi has been criticised for describing a picture of Army dogs doing yoga as 'New India'. "He still hasn't learnt his lessons. In one go, he has insulted our Army, brave Jawans, the incredible dog unit, Yoga tradition & our country," wrote BJP MP Tejasvi Surya. The picture was tweeted by Defence Spokesperson on International Yoga Day.

headlines: Bill pending for over 5 yrs in RS should be considered lapsed: VP
text: Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu suggested that any Bill pending for over five years in the Upper House should be considered lapsed. Notably, Bills introduced in Rajya Sabha don't get lapsed if they're pending for consideration in the House. Naidu said 22 bills pending in Rajya Sabha had lapsed with dissolution of the 16th Lok Sabha.

headlines: Woman toll plaza staffer punched in face by car driver in Gurugram
text: A woman toll plaza worker was punched in the face by a car driver at Kherki Daula Toll Plaza in Gurugram on Friday morning. The man assaulted her when she allegedly refused to let him pass without paying the toll tax. The woman reportedly started to bleed from the nose following the assault, even as others tried to intervene.

headlines: There are kids in Parliament: Ram Madhav on Rahul checking phone
text: Taking a jibe at Congress chief Rahul Gandhi for checking his phone during the President's address, BJP's Ram Madhav said, "There are kids in schools, there are kids in Parliament also." Calling it the "kiddish temperament of an unstable mind", Madhav added, "They cant even focus on the speech by our President." Madhav was addressing a gathering that included children.

headlines: 16 arrested after clashes in West Bengal's Bhatpara
text: Sixteen people have been arrested in connection with clashes that erupted between two groups of unidentified people in Bhatpara, West Bengal on Thursday. Police personnel have been deployed in the area, prohibitory orders have been put in force and internet services have been temporarily restricted following the clashes. Two people were killed and 11 others were injured in the clashes.

headlines: Trump warns Iran that US is about to attack: Report
text: Iran has received a message from US President Donald Trump through Oman warning that a US attack on Iran was imminent, according to a Reuters report quoting Iranian officials. "Trump wants to talk to Tehran about various issues ... he has given a short period of time to get our response," the officials reportedly said.

headlines: UK minister suspended for grabbing female activist by neck
text: UK MP Mark Field has been suspended as a Foreign Office minister after a video showed him grabbing a female Greenpeace activist by the neck and forcing her out during an event. Field said he regrets the incident at the chancellor's Mansion House speech. Field added he had been "genuinely worried" she may have been armed.

headlines: Iran shares video claiming its missile shot down US drone
text: Iran's military has shared a video it claims shows a missile striking a US drone. Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif said that the aircraft had taken off from the United Arab Emirates "in stealth mode and violated Iranian airspace". Both the US and Iran differ over whether the drone was shot down over international airspace or within Iranian airspace.

headlines: UK's Prince Charles tours sets of 25th James Bond film
text: UK's Prince Charles on Thursday toured the sets of the upcoming 25th instalment of the 'James Bond' film franchise at Pinewood Studios near London. Prince Charles met the film's lead actor Daniel Craig as well as Ralph Fiennes and Naomie Harris, who portray secret service head 'M' and secretary Moneypenny respectively. The film is being directed by Cary Joji Fukunaga.

headlines: Rasika Dugal to play Naseeruddin Shah's daughter in short film
text: Actress Rasika Dugal will star with Naseeruddin Shah in an upcoming short film which revolves around a father and daughter's relationship. "Naseer sir...taught me while I was a student at...Film and Television Institute of India. Anything I know about acting is thanks to him," Rasika said. Directed by Kaushal Oza, the film will release by the end of the year.

headlines: Rahul has lot of potential, he should score big runs: Vengsarkar
text: Former Indian chief selector Dilip Vengsarkar praised KL Rahul, saying, "[He] has a lot of potential but he should score big runs. A century was there for the taking (against Pakistan) yet he chucked his wicket away." "He played some stupid shots which I would not recommend to anyone... He must be hungry for runs," Vengsarkar added.

headlines: Pak's 9th spot in WC hurting us: Mohammad Hafeez
text: Speaking about Pakistan's chances at the ongoing World Cup 2019, Mohammad Hafeez said, "[T]o see the team at number nine is hurting all of us... We failed collectively as a team. We could not produce a team effort." "All is not finished for us. We are focused on our next game and we are eager to win," Hafeez added.

headlines: SP supports what Quran says: Azam Khan on Triple Talaq bill
text: On being asked about Samajwadi Party's (SP) stand on the Triple Talaq bill tabled in the Lok Sabha on Friday, party leader Azam Khan said they support what is written in the Quran. "Triple Talaq is not a political issue, it's a religious issue," he added. Khan further said that no religion has given more rights to women than Islam.

headlines: Kejriwal meets PM; discusses water harvesting, Ayushman Bharat
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday met PM Narendra Modi and discussed Delhi's water needs and Ayushman Bharat scheme. "Ayushman Bharat was briefly discussed. Informed...PM that Delhi government's Delhi Health Scheme is much bigger and wider in scope," Kejriwal tweeted. The CM also discussed the plan for water conservation during the rainy season and requested Centre's support for it.

headlines: India's forest cover increased in last one year: Javadekar
text: Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar on Friday said India's green cover has gone up by 1% in last one year. If one tree is chopped for development work, three to four are planted either in the same area or elsewhere, he added. According to India State of Forest Report 2017, over 24% of India's geographical area constitutes of green cover.

headlines: Thunderstorm, lightning likely in Bihar and Jharkhand: IMD
text: Thunderstorm accompanied by gusty winds and lightning are very likely to occur over isolated places in Bihar and Jharkhand on Friday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said. Meanwhile, it has also predicted that Assam, Meghalaya, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Telangana, Chhattisgarh and Odisha are likely to receive heavy rainfall.

headlines: Walmart fined $282 mn over bribery allegations in India, overseas
text: Walmart has said it'll pay $282 million to settle a seven-year-long probe into whether its overseas units in India and a few other nations violated the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. US Justice Department's Assistant Attorney General said senior Walmart employees were aware of the failures of its anti-corruption-related internal controls. Walmart Brazil has pleaded guilty to the accusations.

headlines: India deploys warships to protect its vessels amid US-Iran row
text: The Indian Navy has deployed its warships in the Gulf of Oman and the Persian Gulf to reassure the Indian vessels operating and transiting in the region. This comes amid heightened tensions between US and Iran over recent attacks on oil tankers which the US blamed on Iran. On Thursday, Iran shot down a US surveillance drone.

headlines: People forget 10 good days, remember one bad day: Rashid Khan
text: Talking about the criticism he faced on becoming the first spinner to concede 100-plus runs in an ODI, Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan said he isn't thinking "too much" about it. "People forget 10 good days and conveniently remember that one particular bad day," he added. "No point thinking about the criticism. I need to keep things simple," he further said.

headlines: Pak's Hassan Ali backs India to win World Cup, deletes tweet later
text: Responding to an Indian cricket fan, Pakistan fast bowler Hassan Ali backed Team India to win 2019 World Cup. The fan had congratulated India for their victory against Pakistan and had tweeted, "Let's capture the World Cup now," to which Hassan replied, "Hogi ap ki dua pori congratulation (Your wish will be fulfilled, congratulations)." Hassan later deleted his tweet.

headlines: TikTok, PUBG creating safety issue for children: Goa govt to schools
text: Goa Education Department has asked schools to discourage students from downloading video-sharing app TikTok and multiplayer game PUBG. In a circular to the heads of educational institutions, the department said the app and the game "create issue of safety and security of children in Goa". "The action in time may be of great help in saving some lives," it added.

headlines: Triple Talaq Bill tabled in Lok Sabha; Congress and AIMIM oppose
text: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Friday introduced the Triple Talaq Bill in the Lok Sabha saying rights of Muslim women will be protected. However, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi opposed the bill, saying the new bill won't empower women. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he's against instant talaq but is opposed to consider a civil offence as a criminal offence.

headlines: ITBP performs Yoga at 18,000 ft in Ladakh at -20°C, shares pictures
text: On the occasion of fifth International Yoga Day, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel performed Yoga at an altitude of 18,000 feet in northern Ladakh at -20° Celsius temperature. They also performed Yoga in Rohtang Pass and at an altitude of 19,000 feet in Sikkim. Their unit also performed Yoga in water and shared pictures of the personnel on Twitter.

headlines: Satellite images show before & after state of dried up Chennai lakes
text: Amid ongoing water crisis in Tamil Nadu, satellite images have revealed the extent to which water bodies in Chennai have dried up. The images show a comparison between the water bodies' state on June 15 in 2018 and 2019. They show an overview of Puzhal lake and Chembarambakkam Lake in the Tamil Nadu capital.

headlines: No plans to cap H-1B visas over data localisation rules: US
text: The US State Department has said that it has no plans to place caps on the H-1B visa programme in retaliation to nations forcing foreign companies to store data locally. The US' statement comes after a report claimed that the US had conveyed to India that it was considering restricting H-1B visas. Indians account for over 70% of H-1B workers.

headlines: Georgia carries out 1,500th US execution since penalty reinstated
text: Georgia on Thursday carried out the 1,500th execution in the United States since 1976, the year capital punishment was reinstated, by putting to death a man convicted of killing an off-duty prison guard in 1996. Marion Wilson, executed on Thursday, had been convicted in 1997. Texas leads all states in executions, with 561, according to Texas Department of Criminal Justice.

headlines: What is RQ-4 Global Hawk drone, the US aircraft shot down by Iran?
text: The RQ-4 Global Hawk drone, made by Northrop Grumman Corp, is used for intelligence-gathering over water and coastal areas. It's designed to fly at high altitudes of up to 60,000 feet. It can fly for up to 32 hours and has a range of up to 12,300 nautical miles. Iran shot down a US RQ-4 Global Hawk drone on Thursday.

headlines: US bars airlines from flying through Iranian airspace
text: The US' Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has barred America-registered aircraft from flying through Iranian airspace over the Strait of Hormuz and the Gulf of Oman. The US issued an emergency order in this regard after one of its military drones was shot down by Iran on Thursday. Meanwhile, United Airlines has suspended its flights to India through Iranian airspace.

headlines: Govt's plan to add over 78,000 petrol pumps uneconomical: Crisil
text: Government's plan to double number of petrol pumps doesn't make sense as more number of outlets would only cut into each other's sale, leading to some becoming unprofitable, rating agency Crisil said. Indian Oil, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum had advertised to open 78,493 more petrol pumps. Crisil added that US, a mature fuel retail market, has about 1,50,000 pumps.

headlines: Maharashtra CM orders probe into attack on crew of web series
text: A day after the crew of an upcoming web series was attacked on set in Mumbai, Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has ordered an inquiry into the incident. Several crew members met the Chief Minister to discuss the incident on Thursday. The show's lead actress Mahie Gill and producer Sakett Saawhney earlier alleged that the crew was attacked by drunk goons.

headlines: Shahid Kapoor, Kiara Advani starrer 'Kabir Singh' hits theatres
text: Shahid Kapoor and Kiara Advani starrer 'Kabir Singh', which released today, "is a hugely problematic film," wrote NDTV. Hindustan Times (HT) called the film "the most misogynistic Indian film in a long time". "Kapoor...is so good here that it's heart-breaking to see him use his gift thus," Firstpost wrote. The film has been rated 1.5/5 (NDTV, HT) and 1/5 (Firstpost).

headlines: Glowing with sweat and positivity: Bipasha Basu on Yoga Day
text: Bipasha Basu shared a picture with her Yoga teacher on the occasion of International Yoga Day, and wrote, "Glowing with sweat and positivity post a wonderful practice of Yoga." "I started practising 15-years-ago and...I felt a significant alternation-from being a cynical pessimist to...an optimist," Twinkle Khanna tweeted. "'Let your whole body breathe,' says my yoga teacher," Anupam Kher wrote.

headlines: Was in love once, it was only long relationship I've had: Kiara
text: When asked about her past relationships, actress Kiara Advani said, "In my head, I believe I've only been in love once." "It was the only person I had a proper longish relationship. We grew up together so it was a different kind of equation," the actress added. Kiara further said that she is still friends with her former boyfriend.

headlines: Enough is enough: Akram on Pakistans first-class structure
text: Speaking about Pakistan's first-class structure, Wasim Akram said, "Enough is enough, only pick players in the PSL who have performed well in first-class cricket." "Indian cricket invested everything in their first-class cricket over the years. And we as Pakistan have hardly done anything for our first-class cricket," Akram added.

headlines: Yoga mustn't be misunderstood as a religious practice: Kerala CM
text: On the occasion of the fifth International Yoga Day on Friday, Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan urged citizens not to misunderstand yoga as a religious practice. Vijayan said, "Anyone can practice yoga. People irrespective of religious and caste boundaries should practice yoga." He added, "Yoga provides us with all kinds of exercises for our body."

headlines: Army's dog squad practices yoga on International Yoga Day
text: The official Twitter handle of the Defence spokesperson shared pictures of the Army's dog squad practising yoga with their trainers on the fifth International Yoga Day on Friday. Indian Army personnel performed yoga on the Himalayan ranges, while Navy personnel performed yoga onboard INS Viraat (Decommissioned) at the Western Naval Dockyard in Mumbai.

headlines: Yoga Day not an event but an integral part of life: Prez Kovind
text: On the occasion of International Yoga Day, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "It's not just an event, it's a way to make yoga an integral part of our life." He added, "I'm happy that like previous years, we're celebrating Yoga Day this year too...I pray for your good health and extend my greeting to you all on International Yoga Day."

headlines: SoftBank in talks to invest up to $350mn in Cure.fit: Report
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank is reportedly in talks to invest up to $350 million in Bengaluru-based health and fitness startup 'Cure.fit'. The funding may push the startup's valuation over the billion-dollar mark, the main aim behind which is reportedly to take it global. Cure.fit was founded in 2016 by Myntra Co-founder Mukesh Bansal and former Flipkart executive Ankit Nagori.

headlines: BSF's equestrian team performs yoga on horseback on Yoga Day
text: The BSF's equestrian team performed yoga on horseback at the BSF camp in Gurugram to mark the fifth International Yoga Day on Friday. Further, the dog squad of the BSF also performed yoga with their trainers. Earlier, BSF troopers performed yoga in the Naxal-affected Malkangiri district in south Odisha and near the International Border in RS Pura, Jammu and Kashmir.

headlines: Caps on H-1B visas would weaken US companies: Nasscom
text: The US' reported plans to cap H-1B work visas would imply a "further crunch" for businesses to access skilled workforce, industry lobby group Nasscom said. It would weaken US companies that depend on advanced tech workers, it added. Reuters had reported that the US is considering caps on H-1B visas for nations forcing foreign companies to store data locally.

headlines: Fire near Kalindi Kunj Metro Station; Magenta Line services stopped
text: Fire broke out at a furniture market near Kalindi Kunj Metro Station on Friday, following which 15 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. It also disrupted Magenta Line metro service, with officials saying no train would run between Shaheen Bagh and Botanical Garden stations till the fire is brought under control. No casualty has been reported in the incident.

headlines: PM Modi leads 30,000 people in Int'l Yoga Day event in Ranchi
text: PM Narendra Modi led around 30,000 people in Jharkhand's Ranchi to mark the fifth International Yoga Day celebrations. "Yoga belongs to everyone and everyone belongs to yoga," PM Modi said while addressing the crowds. Meanwhile, 400 makeshift toilets, over 200 water kiosks, 28 screens for live telecast, medical teams and 21 ambulances were arranged at the venue.

headlines: Madras HC stays director Pa Ranjith's arrest till June 21
text: The Madras High Court issued a stay on an arrest warrant against Tamil filmmaker Pa Ranjith till June 21. A case was earlier filed against Ranjith for allegedly "inciting caste enmity" following his comments against Chola dynasty King Raja Raja Chola during a public event. The court further scheduled a hearing on the director's anticipatory bail for Friday.

headlines: Danced, did flips despite injuring my knee: Disha on 'Bharat'
text: Actress Disha Patani has said that working on the recently-released Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat' was among the toughest things she has done in her career. "I injured my knee while shooting and still had to do the flips, dance, jump the fire hoops, etc." the actress explained. "In fact, my knee has still not recovered!" Disha further said.

headlines: Good Punjabi film better than Hindi film with bad script: Diljit
text: While speaking about the growth of regional cinema, actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh said, "A good Punjabi film is better than a Hindi film with a bad script." "Content is the king. Nothing changes or no film gets superior because of language," the actor added. Diljit further said that Hindi films do more business as more people understand the language.

headlines: Aus-B'desh match breaks record for most runs in a World Cup match
text: A total of 714 runs were aggregated in Australia-Bangladesh 2019 World Cup match on Thursday, breaking the record for the most runs scored in a World Cup match. Australia put up a total of 381/5, while Bangladesh recorded their highest ODI total of 333/8. The previous record of 688 runs was set in Australia-Sri Lanka match in 2015 World Cup.

headlines: Florida city agrees to pay hackers $600,000-Bitcoin ransom
text: Florida's Riviera Beach has agreed to pay a ransom of $600,000 worth of Bitcoin to hackers who have its systems hijacked for the past several weeks. A police department employee had opened a malicious email that allowed hackers to inject the city's network with malware. Notably, Maryland's Baltimore city also recently faced similar ransomware asking for about $76,000 in Bitcoin.

headlines: Yoga is above religion, faith: PM on International Yoga Day
text: Leading an event in Ranchi to mark the fifth International Yoga Day on Friday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Yoga is above religion, above faith, above everything." He added, "Now, I have to take the journey of modern yoga from the cities to the villages, to the poor and tribals' houses." He also interacted with people after the Ranchi event.

headlines: Kerala says it offered 20L litres water to TN but state rejected it
text: With Tamil Nadu facing a severe water crisis, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday said that it had offered to supply 20 lakh litres of drinking water to the state. However, Vijayan said that Tamil Nadu Chief Minister's Office declined the offer, saying it "wasn't necessary". This comes after four reservoirs that supply water in Chennai completely dried up.

headlines: Death toll rises to 44 in Himachal Pradesh bus accident
text: About 44 passengers were killed and over 30 injured on Thursday after a bus fell in a 500-foot-deep gorge in Kullu district of Himachal Pradesh, officials said. The number of deaths could rise as several passengers were sitting on top of the bus, reports said. The private bus was filled with over 70 people going to Gada Gushaini from Banjar.

headlines: Who are the 2 final candidates in the race to become UK's next PM?
text: Conservative Party leaders Boris Johnson and Jeremy Hunt face each other in the race to become the UK's next Prime Minister. Johnson has previously served as the UK's Foreign Secretary and London's Mayor and supports leaving the European Union. Hunt, who succeeded Johnson as the Foreign Secretary, earlier headed the portfolio of Health and Social Care and had opposed Brexit.

headlines: Trump ordered strike against Iran but later called it off: Report
text: US President Donald Trump had approved a military strike against Iran in retaliation for the downing of an unmanned surveillance drone, but pulled back from launching the attack, a report said. Planes were in the air and ships were in position, it added. However, it is not clear whether attacks on Iran might still go forward, the report further said.

headlines: Stayed in hostel for few days to prepare for 'Kabir Singh': Kiara
text: Kiara Advani revealed that she stayed in a hostel for a few days to prepare for her role as a medical student in the film 'Kabir Singh'. "Since I'm from Mumbai and also went to college in Mumbai I'd never stayed in a hostel before," she added. "I...wanted to understand how life in a hostel is for...students," Kiara further said.

headlines: Why is June 21 celebrated as World Music Day globally?
text: World Music Day is celebrated every year on June 21 to mark summer solstice, the longest day of the year. This was proposed by American artist Joel Cohen in 1976. However, in 1982, when French composer Maurice Fleuret discovered that one French person out of two played an instrument, it led him to bring people out on streets with music.

headlines: Apple issues voluntary recall for 2015 MacBook Pro batteries
text: Apple has issued a "voluntary" recall of some of its 15-inch mid-2015 MacBook Pro models with Retina displays over concerns of potential battery overheating and safety risk. The models were sold primarily between September 2015 and February 2017, Apple said. Users can see if their systems qualify for replacement through Apple menu in system finder, using the computer's serial number.

headlines: MIT helps AI learn how to make pizza using just its photos
text: MIT and Qatar's QCRI researchers have developed a neural network PizzaGAN that learns how to make pizza using just its pictures. Researchers claimed the AI, trained on thousands of synthetic and real pizza pictures, identifies individual toppings and can distinguish their layers and their order. PizzaGAN identified the right order 88% of the time with two toppings, they added.

headlines: Future Apple Watch may have glucose meter for diabetic users
text: Apple Watch will soon receive improved glucose tracker support for people with diabetes, according to Kevin Sayer, CEO of glucose monitoring systems manufacturer Dexcom. Notably, Apple CEO Tim Cook was spotted wearing a glucometer that was connected to his smartwatch back in 2017. The technology giant had launched its Apple Watch Series 4 last year with an ECG monitor.

headlines: Fintech startup Active.AI raises $3 mn from Kalaari, others
text: Singapore-headquartered, AI-based fintech startup Active.Ai has raised $3 million in an extended Series A funding round. The round saw participation from investors including Spanish banking group Banco Sabadell's investment arm InnoCells along with Kalaari Capital, Chiratae Ventures and Vertex Ventures. Active.Ai was founded in 2016 by Parikshit Paspulati, Ravi Shankar and Shankar Narayanan.

headlines: PIL against Dream11 over gambling and tax evasion dismissed
text: The Bombay High Court has dismissed a PIL against fantasy sports platform Dream11 that alleged the platform was conducting gambling and evading taxes. The court held that Dream11 is a game of skill and not a game of chance, and doesn't amount to gambling. Since Dream11 doesn't allow gambling, the court said the allegation of GST evasion holds no merit.

headlines: Sunaina is telling Kangana that she'll commit suicide: Rangoli
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel has claimed in a tweet that Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina is telling Kangana that she will commit suicide. "Sunaina is crying all the time and asking Kangana for help," she wrote. In another tweet, Rangoli wrote, "Right now my biggest worry is that Sunaina's phone is off and she is not reachable."

headlines: Kohli any teacher's delight, always ready to do boring stuff: Trainer
text: Team India trainer Shanker Basu has said that captain Virat Kohli is any teacher's delight. "His biggest attribute is that he's ready to do boring stuff every single day...He knows his body and if he's training, he'll have 100 questions with regard to routines. Once he gets the answers, he follows them with all sincerity," he added.

headlines: Williamson criticised for not walking despite edging delivery vs SA
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson was criticised for not walking despite edging an Imran Tahir delivery that was caught by wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock in 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. "Why didn't Kane Williamson walk? If Kane Williamson was Mankad after he didn't walk. Would he be upset," wrote ex-South Africa spinner Paul Adams.

headlines: David Warner smashes 166 as Australia defeat Bangladesh by 48 runs
text: Opener David Warner smashed 166 runs as Australia defeated Bangladesh by 48 runs in 2019 World Cup on Thursday. The match witnessed Bangladesh record their highest-ever total in ODIs (333-8). Australia are now on top of 2019 World Cup points table with five victories in six matches. Australia have beaten Bangladesh in each of their three meetings in World Cup.

headlines: Women's cricket nominated for inclusion at Commonwealth Games 2022
text: Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF) on Thursday nominated the inclusion of women's cricket in the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham. Beach volleyball and Para table tennis have also been recommended for inclusion in the Games. For the sports to be confirmed, the federation will need to receive a positive response from a minimum of 51% of the Commonwealth Games Associations (CGAs).

headlines: Williamson has to be NZ's greatest ODI player of all time: Vettori
text: Following New Zealand captain Kane Williamson's match-winning hundred against South Africa in 2019 World Cup, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said that Williamson has to be New Zealand's greatest ODI player of all time. "The innings like that against South Africa tells you exactly why," he added. "Kane has done so much in such a short period," he further said.

headlines: Starc becomes Australia's 2nd highest wicket-taker in World Cup
text: Fast bowler Mitchell Starc has become Australia's second highest wicket-taker in World Cup history, achieving the feat against Bangladesh in the 2019 World Cup on Thursday. The 29-year-old overtook former fast bowler Brett Lee, who took 35 wickets in 17 World Cup matches. Notably, Glenn McGrath holds the Australian record for taking most wickets in World Cup (71 wickets)

headlines: Yuvraj Singh to play for Toronto Nationals in Global T20 Canada
text: All-rounder Yuvraj Singh, who recently announced his retirement from international cricket and Indian Premier League, has been signed up by the Toronto Nationals for the 2019 season of Global T20 Canada. The 37-year-old has played 231 T20s, scoring 4,857 runs and taking 80 wickets. Yuvraj had appeared in four matches for Mumbai Indians in IPL 2019, scoring 98 runs.

headlines: Raised in a log cabin without power, Slack CEO now worth $1.8 bn
text: Canadian entrepreneur Stewart Butterfield, who helped found Slack Technologies, became a billionaire after the successful IPO of his company. The CEO was raised in a log cabin without electricity and running water for the first few years of his life. The workplace communication company listed on Thursday at a valuation of $23.2 billion, making Butterfield's 8% stake worth $1.8 billion.
