headlines: Rahul was translating difficult Hindi words on phone: Congress
text: Hours after the BJP criticised Congress President Rahul Gandhi for using his phone during President Ram Nath Kovind's speech to the joint session of the Parliament, the Congress defended Gandhi. Rahul was using the phone to translate difficult Hindi words which weren't heard properly, Congress spokesperson Anand Sharma said. "He (Rahul) was listening to whatever was necessary," he added.

headlines: J&K teacher caught on camera beating kids for being late, suspended
text: A teacher was suspended for allegedly thrashing students for turning up 10 minutes late for classes at Gujjar Bakerwal Boys Hostel in Doda, Jammu and Kashmir. A video of the incident went viral on social media on Thursday. A student said that the teacher had first made them stand for an hour, and then caned them for about 10 minutes.

headlines: Who said you can't say Vande Mataram, Bharat Mata ki Jai: LS Speaker
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Thursday told a journalist, "Who said you can't say 'Vande Mataram' and 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'?", when she questioned his speech, saying it was the first time that a Speaker began and ended his speech with 'Vande Mataram' slogan. Earlier, Birla had said that he would not allow chanting of religious slogans in Parliament.

headlines: Pitch will miss you, but hope you recover at earliest: PM to Dhawan
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to wish speedy recovery to Shikhar Dhawan, who was ruled out of the 2019 World Cup due to fractured thumb. "No doubt the pitch will miss you but I hope you recover at the earliest so...you can once again be back on field and contribute to more wins for the nation," he wrote.

headlines: Nadal to play in exhibition tournament ahead of Wimbledon
text: World number two men's singles player Rafael Nadal will play in Aspall Tennis Classic, an exhibition tournament played on grass every year ahead of Wimbledon. The 33-year-old, who recently won his 18th Grand Slam title will play two matches at the tournament which starts on June 25. Notably, Nadal had earlier said he won't play on grass before Wimbledon 2019.

headlines: Kristyna beats twin sister Karolina, registers career-best win
text: World number 112 Kristyna Pliskova defeated her twin sister and world number three Karolina Pliskova 6-2, 3-6, 7-6(7) at Nature Valley Classic, in their first meeting in a WTA event to register her career's biggest win on Wednesday. "I think we played the best that we could but it was not easy for us," Kristyna said after reaching tournament's quarterfinals.

headlines: Most Galaxy Fold display issues fixed, ready for launch: Samsung
text: A Samsung Display executive has said that the company's foldable smartphone 'Galaxy Fold' is ready to "hit the market", South Korea-based The Investor reported. The executive reportedly said that most issues related to the device's display had been fixed. It was originally set to release in April, but Samsung indefinitely delayed it after multiple review units experienced display issues.

headlines: China asks India to make 'independent judgement' on Huawei
text: China has urged India to make an "independent judgement" about Huawei's operations in the country without being guided by US' ban on the company. It further urged India to provide an "unbiased and non-discriminatory" environment for Chinese businesses. India is yet to decide on allowing Huawei to participate in upcoming 5G trials, scheduled to commence in less than 100 days.

headlines: Bagchi exits Mindtree; L&T CEO Subrahmanyan joins board
text: Mindtree on Thursday appointed five new directors including L&T CEO and Managing Director SN Subrahmanyan and two more representatives of the engineering conglomerate to its board. Mindtree Co-founder Subroto Bagchi, who retires on July 16, has not offered to be re-appointed. L&T's open offer to buy 31% Mindtree shares commenced on June 17 and will end on June 28.

headlines: Jet referred to NCLT after exhausting all other options: SBI
text: SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar said lenders referred Jet Airways to the NCLT only after exhausting all options to revive the airline. "Only [one] conditional bid was received...the investor's requirement for SEBI exemptions and resolution of creditors is possible [through the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code]," SBI had said. The NCLT admitted lenders' insolvency plea against the airline on Thursday.

headlines: Jet enters bankruptcy process, gets 270 days for resolution
text: A bankruptcy court on Thursday admitted SBI's petition for insolvency proceedings against Jet Airways. Under India's Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, a resolution plan has to be decided within 270 days, failing which the company will be liquidated. The National Company Law Tribunal has declared a moratorium on the recovery of dues from Jet Airways, which suspended operations on April 17.

headlines: Shivaji's portrait on crop field visible on Google Maps goes viral
text: A portrait of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj made in a crop field in Maharashtra's Nilanga is going viral for its visibility on the satellite view of Google Maps. As per reports, the crop art which stretches out over 2,40,000 square feet was made using over 2,500 kilograms of seeds. Artist Mangesh Nipanikar created it for Shivaji Jayanti earlier this year.

headlines: Days after scoring lowest T20I total, Mali Women concede highest total
text: Two days after recording the lowest ever total (six) in T20I history (both men's and women's), Mali Women conceded the highest ever total (314/2) against Uganda Women. This is the first time in T20I history that a team registered a total of over 300 runs. Uganda won by 304 runs, the biggest ever margin of T20I victory by runs.

headlines: Xiaomi fires employee for using artist's work without permission
text: Chinese smartphone manufacturer Xiaomi was accused of stealing three pieces of art from a 3D artist to help promote its devices in Spain. The promotion allegedly contained elements from the artist's other illustrations commissioned by South Korean electronics giant LG. Xiaomi responded saying it terminated the employee responsible for this and also issued an apology to the artist.

headlines: 3 TDP Rajya Sabha MPs join BJP in JP Nadda's presence, 1 to join later
text: Three TDP MPs of Rajya Sabha, YS Chowdary, CM Ramesh and TG Venkatesh, joined BJP in the presence of BJP Working President JP Nadda on Thursday. BJP said TDP Rajya Sabha MP GM Rao will formally join later as he is unwell. The four also wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu announcing their decision to merge with BJP.

headlines: 1st-ever 'song' from rare right whale recorded, say scientists
text: US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has announced scientists have recorded the first-ever 'song' of one of the rarest, North Pacific right whale off Alaska's coast. The song, classified by marine biologists as an underwater call using distinct pattern of sounds, is guessed to be a mating call. The tune was first heard in 2010, which couldn't be distinguished then.

headlines: Chicken found in veg dish in Maharashtra canteen; CM orders probe
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has ordered an inquiry after chicken pieces were found in a vegetarian dish served in Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan's canteen. On Wednesday, a government official found chicken pieces in vegetarian Maharashtrian dish 'matki usal' he ordered from the canteen. The probe will find out if food safety norms were followed by the kitchen while preparing the dish.

headlines: Who is Sanjiv Bhatt, Gujarat's ex-IPS sentenced to life imprisonment?
text: Expelled IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt was sentenced to life imprisonment in 1990 custodial death case today. It pertains to Jamnagar communal riot in which over 100 people were detained and one of them died after release. Bhatt was alleged of torturing the deceased, and in 2011, he was suspended on charges of remaining absent from duty and misusing official vehicles.

headlines: Prince Harry & Meghan to split from joint charity with William, Kate
text: UK's Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle are to split from the Royal Foundation, the charity they shared with Prince William and his wife Kate Middleton. Prince Harry and Meghan, plan to set up their own charitable foundation. Earlier this year, Prince Harry and Meghan split from the household of Kensington Palace, where Prince William and Kate live.

headlines: 17-year-old's jaw broken after e-cigarette explodes in his mouth in US
text: A 17-year-old teenager broke his jaw after an e-cigarette exploded in his mouth in the US. After the accident, the teenager travelled more than 400 kilometres in two hours with a bloody mouth and a hole in his jaw to reach a pediatric hospital in Utah. A CT scan revealed his shattered jaw and a couple of blown-out teeth.

headlines: Oil prices jump 4.5% after Iran shoots down US drone
text: Brent crude, the global benchmark, rose more than 4.5% on Thursday after Iran shot down a US military drone, raising fears of a military confrontation between the two countries. The US claimed the drone was downed in international airspace while Iran said the drone was flying over southern part of the country. Notably, India imports two-thirds of its oil needs.

headlines: Iran made a very big mistake: Trump after US drone shot down
text: After an American military drone was shot down by Iran on Thursday, US President Donald Trump tweeted that "Iran made a very big mistake". The US has said that the drone was shot down in international airspace, while Iran claimed that it was in their territory. "This was an unprovoked attack on a US surveillance asset," the US earlier said.

headlines: Japan officials cause nuclear scare after ticking wrong box on form
text: Two officials at a Japanese nuclear power plant triggered an atomic scare by ticking the wrong box on a fax message following an earthquake. The officials wrongly conveyed to the government that there was a power supply abnormality related to the cooling of the spent fuel pool. They noticed the error 17 minutes later and released a correction.

headlines: I'm a slow worker, I don't sign tonnes of films at once: Disha
text: Speaking about her acting career, Disha Patani said, "I'm not the kind who will sign tonnes of projects at a time." "I'm a bit of a slow worker and really enjoy my work. I feel that I should focus on one thing at a time," she added. Disha further said she takes time to decide which films to take up.

headlines: Plea filed in Madras HC against telecast of 'Bigg Boss Tamil'
text: A petition filed in Madras High Court seeks to stop the upcoming season of reality show 'Bigg Boss Tamil' from being broadcasted on television without a censor certificate. The petition states that the show, hosted by actor-politician Kamal Haasan, uses abusive language to increase its ratings. Following the petition, the court issued notices to nine respondents, including the Censor Board.

headlines: Teams don't have spinners like Kuldeep, Chahal: Harbhajan
text: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh said that no team in the 2019 World Cup have got two spinners like Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal. Harbhajan added that the duo's wrist spin makes them successful even in English conditions and oppositions aren't used to playing spin in middle overs. Kuldeep and Chahal have taken nine wickets together in three World Cup matches.

headlines: CCI asks phone makers to share Google agreements info: Report
text: The CCI's investigation wing reportedly sought details of agreements between Google or its group companies and several smartphone makers like Samsung and Xiaomi. This reportedly comes as CCI deepens its probe into alleged misuse of market share by Android. It also sought details of whether Google imposed any restrictions on using its mobile apps and services since April 2011.

headlines: Break up before regulators force it: Activists urge Alphabet
text: Shareholder activists have urged Google parent Alphabet to break itself up before regulators force it to, Reuters reported. The proposal was presented at Alphabet's annual shareholder meeting by consumer group SumOfUs, which campaigns to hold big corporations accountable. As per preliminary tally, the proposal was among 13 shareholder proposals opposed by the company which were voted down.

headlines: Twitter bug notifies users of being followed when unfollowed
text: Twitter is sending push notifications to some affected users informing them that they have been "followed back" when someone unfollows them. Describing the issue as a bug, a Twitter spokesperson told VICE that the microblogging platform is working to fix it. Several users have reportedly been complaining of the bug since early June.

headlines: Fadnavis will be CM again with everyone's support: BJP leader
text: After reports of Shiv Sena aiming for its own Chief Minister in the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections, BJP leader Ram Kadam said CM Devendra Fadnavis will return to power with everyone's support. "Fadnavis is appreciated by all...opposition leaders are of the opinion that he should be the CM," Kadam added. Elections in Maharashtra will take place in October this year.

headlines: Women are being pushed into environment of fear in UP: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday expressed concern over the increasing violence against women and children in Uttar Pradesh. "Predators are victimising innocents. Women are being pushed into an environment of fear...But the government is not seeing anything," she tweeted. "When will the UP government start taking responsibility for the security of women and girls?" she added.

headlines: AI-based mental health chatbot Wysa raises $2 million
text: Wysa, an AI conversational agent that helps in improving mental health, has raised about $2 million in a pre-Series A funding round from pi Ventures and Kae Capital, among other investors. Earlier in 2017, Wysa had raised about $1.3 million in seed funding. Wysa was founded by IIT Delhi graduate Jo Aggarwal and IIT Kanpur graduate Ramakant Vempati.

headlines: OYO plans to invest $300 million for expansion in US: CEO
text: OYO's CEO and Founder Ritesh Agarwal in an interview said the startup plans to invest $300 million for expansion in the US. The startup reportedly already operates over 50 properties across several cities in the country including Dallas and Miami. Launched in 2013, the startup had reportedly opened its first US hotel at the beginning of the year.

headlines: Gurugram's vehicle marketplace Droom raises $10 million
text: Gurugram-headquartered Droom, an online marketplace for buying and selling new and used vehicles, has raised $10 million in a Series F funding round from its Singapore-based holding entity, according to RoC filings. As per Crunchbase, Droom has raised $133 million in disclosed funding so far. Founded in 2014, the startup counts Lightbox and BEENEXT among its backers.

headlines: Sequoia-backed Druva gets $130 mn, becomes billion-dollar startup
text: US-based cloud backup and data protection startup Druva has raised $130 million in a funding round led by Viking Global Investors. The funding took the Sequoia and Nexus-backed startup's valuation "well past the $1-billion mark", giving it a 'unicorn' status, Founder and CEO Jaspreet Singh said. Druva was founded in Pune by Singh along with Milind Borate and Ramani Kothandaraman.

headlines: No official communication from US on H-1B visa issue: Govt
text: The government on Thursday said it's engaged with the US on H-1B work visas but has received no official communication on capping such permits for Indians. It added it's in talks with the US regarding the issue of data localisation. Reuters had reported that US is considering caps on H-1B visas for nations forcing foreign companies to store data locally.

headlines: 25 dead, 35 injured as bus falls in gorge in Himachal's Kullu
text: Twenty-five passengers died and 35 others were injured on Thursday after their bus fell into a deep gorge near Banjar area of Kullu in Himachal Pradesh. The private bus was on its way from Banjar to Gadagushani area. The number of casualties could rise as many were sitting on the top of the bus, reports said.

headlines: 4 of TDP's Rajya Sabha MPs quit party, say they have merged with BJP
text: Four Rajya Sabha MPs from Chandrababu Naidu-led Telugu Desam Party (TDP) on Thursday resigned from the party. YS Chowdary, CM Ramesh, TG Venkatesh and GM Rao passed a resolution to merge Legislature Party of TDP with BJP. They met Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu and submitted their resignation letter.

headlines: Warner 2nd fastest to reach 16 ODI tons, equals Kohli's record
text: Australia opener David Warner has become the joint-second fastest batsman to reach 16 hundreds in ODIs, achieving the feat against Bangladesh in 2019 World Cup on Thursday. The 32-year-old reached the milestone in his 110th innings, same as Team India captain Virat Kohli. South Africa batsman Hashim Amla is the fastest batsman to score 16 ODI hundreds, taking 94 innings.

headlines: Warner 1st batsman to smash two 150+ scores in World Cup history
text: Australia opener David Warner has become the first batsman to score two 150-plus scores in World Cup history. The 32-year-old, who had scored Australia's highest score in World Cup by hitting 178 runs off 133 balls against Afghanistan in 2015 World Cup, smashed 147-ball 166 against Bangladesh in 2019 World Cup today. Warner has now scored three World Cup hundreds.

headlines: Rahul busy on phone during President's address, BJP shares video
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi was seen busy checking his phone as President Ram Nath Kovind addressed a joint session in the Parliament on Thursday. Following the incident, the Bharatiya Janata Party Kisan Morcha tweeted a video showing Rahul busy on his phone. The Rajya Sabha began its first day of the session today.

headlines: SheIn, Club Factory parcels seized over tax evasion: Report
text: Mumbai customs has reportedly seized around 500 parcels of Chinese apparel e-tailer SheIn and sealed its warehouse in the city. A small number of parcels from Club Factory's local unit Globemax were also reportedly seized. The move was reportedly part of the government's action against Chinese e-tailers escaping custom duty and taxes in the name of duty-free gifts and samples.

headlines: Blue Origin will one day refuel our lander using Moon ice: Bezos
text: World's richest person and aerospace startup Blue Origin's founder Jeff Bezos has said the 'Blue Moon' lunar lander will one day be refuelled using ice from the Moon. Bezos said Blue Moon is powered by BE-7 engine, which uses hydrogen and oxygen as its fuel sources. He further added these propellants will be made "on the surface of the Moon".

headlines: Water crisis-hit Chennai receives first rain in 200 days
text: Water crisis-hit Chennai witnessed rainfall on Thursday, with Kelambakkam, Tambaram, OMR and ECR getting their first rain in nearly 200 days. The four major reservoirs of Chennai have run completely dry, with water levels falling to one of the lowest levels in 70 years. The water shortage started several weeks ago and Madras High Court criticised state government for inaction.

headlines: Mumbai hospital shut down for 4 hours after patient beats up doctors
text: Shatabdi hospital in Mumbai's Kandivali held a flash strike on Thursday morning and was shut down for over four hours after doctors and nurses were allegedly beaten up by a patient. The medical staff claimed they were assaulted by a 'drunk' woman patient brought by the police. The striking staff forced out patients from OPDs and emergency sections.

headlines: Lesbian couple in Uttar Pradesh seeks police protection to marry
text: A lesbian couple in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district has sought police protection after their families opposed their decision to get married and allegedly threatened them with dire consequences, police said. The two women, both in their early twenties, from different villages of UP, met while studying in a Ghaziabad college and are in love since past six months, it added.

headlines: Saudi officials heard calling slain journalist 'sacrificial lamb'
text: The United Nations has released a report that reveals conversations between Saudi officials prior to the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. In a recording, one man was heard asking someone if "the sacrificial lamb" has arrived, purportedly referring to Khashoggi's arrival at the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. Khashoggi's body was allegedly dismembered and dissolved in acid.

headlines: New Zealand government website wipes Israel off its map
text: Immigration New Zealand, an official government website, published a fact sheet with a map of the Middle East that erased Israel, showing the entire region as Palestine. The fact sheet, which offered information about Palestinian immigrants in New Zealand, also identified East Jerusalem as "the designated capital of the State of Palestine".

headlines: Blackstone CEO, never an Oxford student, gives university $190 mn
text: US private equity firm Blackstone's Co-Founder and CEO Stephen Schwarzman has pledged $190 million to Oxford University, the biggest single donation in its history. The contribution will help pay for a new humanities building and the creation of an institute to study the ethics of artificial intelligence. The billionaire studied at Yale University and then got an MBA from Harvard.

headlines: Jet Airways shares surge 122%, biggest ever gain since 2005 listing
text: Shares of bankrupt Jet Airways surged 122% on Thursday, their biggest ever gain since listing in 2005, after hitting an all-time low earlier in the day. The stock, however, has declined over 80% in the last one year. A bankruptcy court is set to rule today whether an insolvency application by the crisis-hit airline's lenders can be admitted.

headlines: Sidharth is my co-star, that's it: Tara denies link-up rumours
text: Denying link-up rumours with actor Sidharth Malhotra, actress Tara Sutaria said, "I am doing my second film [Marjaavan] with him. And that's it." "I [earlier] said he is a good boyfriend material since someone had asked me that question specifically," the actress added. Tara further said that she feels people care too much about actors' personal lives.

headlines: Crew member stabbed on sets of actress Anne Hathaway's film
text: A crew member of the upcoming Hollywood film 'The Witches', starring Anne Hathaway, was stabbed in the neck during a confrontation with a co-worker on the film's sets. The injured person was taken to a hospital and his alleged attacker was arrested, police said. The incident took place at Warner Bros. Studios, which is located in UK's Hertfordshire.

headlines: There are some films of mine I wouldn't waste time watching: Shahid
text: Speaking about his acting career, Shahid Kapoor said, "There are some films of my own I won't waste time watching as they don't do it for me." "Sometimes I watch a film and realise it wasn't the kind of film I'd go to the theatre for," he added. Shahid further said 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro' (1983) is his favourite film.

headlines: Have asked Rahul not to resign as Cong President: Deve Gowda
text: Former PM HD Deve Gowda said that he has briefed Rahul Gandhi and told him to reconsider his stand to resign from the post of Congress President. His statement comes amid reports that Rahul is adamant over his decision to resign. Reportedly, Rahul on Thursday said his party will decide on who his successor will be and not him.

headlines: DMK MPs raise Cauvery issue during President's Parliament address
text: DMK MPs on Thursday raised the issue of Cauvery river water as soon as President Ram Nath Kovind began his address to the joint sitting of both the Houses of Parliament. Holding placards, DMK members briefly raised slogans on the issue of Cauvery water distribution. Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu was seen pacifying them and asked them to sit down.

headlines: BJP, TMC claim man's body, allege the other party killed him
text: BJP Yuva Morcha workers took out a protest on Wednesday against the killing of a man named Ananda Pal, who they claim was their party's worker. However, Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers have claimed that Pal was a worker of their party and not BJP. Both of them are alleging that the other party's workers were behind his killing.

headlines: RJD boycotts PM's dinner over AES outbreak in Bihar
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Misa Bharti said her party will boycott the dinner hosted by PM Narendra Modi on Thursday over Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) outbreak in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. "Medicines and live equipment can be procured from the amount being spent on this dinner," she added. As per reports, around 132 children have died of AES in the state.

headlines: UK's arms sales to Saudi Arabia unlawful: Court
text: The UK's arms sales to Saudi Arabia were unlawful as they might have been used in Yemen's civil war, the UK Court of Appeal ruled. The UK didn't assess whether Saudi violated international humanitarian law in the war, the court said. The court's decision puts a stay on the granting of new export licences to sell arms to Saudi Arabia.

headlines: Moser Baer Solar fails to find buyer, heads for liquidation
text: The NCLT directed Moser Baer Solar to go under liquidation on May 30, after the cash-strapped company failed to get a resolution plan from any buyer within the mandated 270 days. The tribunal appointed a liquidator for the process. Moser Baer Solar is a subsidiary of optical storage media maker Moser Baer India, which is also undergoing liquidation.

headlines: Temperatures in Kuwait and Pak 3rd and 4th hottest measured on Earth
text: The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) has officially verified the third and fourth hottest temperatures measured on Earth. It recorded extreme temperatures of 53.9°C (± 0.1°C) in Kuwait's Mitribah on July 21, 2016, and 53.7°C (± 0.4°C) in Pakistan's Turbat on May 28, 2017. The WMO accepted Mitribah's temperature as the highest temperature ever recorded for the continental region of Asia.

headlines: Pahlaj Nihalani's daughter-in-law passes away at the age of 43
text: Former Censor Board chief Pahlaj Nihalani's daughter-in-law Justine Rumeau Nihalani passed away on Sunday at the age of 43. Justine, an Italian by birth, was suffering from a terminal disease for the past 1 year, which got aggravated in the last 6 months. Justine's last rites were carried out on Monday morning and prayer meet was organised on Wednesday.

headlines: FIR filed against Hard Kaur for abusive posts on UP CM, RSS chief
text: An FIR has been registered against rapper Hard Kaur for her comments against UP CM Yogi Adityanath and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. Hard Kaur had earlier written on Facebook, "If this guy was a superhero his name would be-Rapeman Yogi" while criticising Yogi Adityanath. She also criticised Bhagwat and wrote that he's "responsible for all terrorist attacks in India".

headlines: I didn't warn, I served notice to Ranveer: Brock Lesnar's advocate
text: WWE wrestler Brock Lesnar's advocate Paul Heyman has said he didn't warn Ranveer Singh but served a legal notice to him for paraphrasing his mantra 'Eat. Sleep. Conquer. Repeat.' while praising Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya. He further asked media houses to refer to him as an advocate and not a manager, saying, "I am the best advocate in history."

headlines: Feel for Dhawan, getting injured during WC heartbreaking: Sachin
text: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to share a message for opener Shikhar Dhawan, who has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup. "Feel for you, Shikhar. You were playing well & to be injured in the middle of such an important tournament is heartbreaking. I'm sure you'll come back stronger than ever," he wrote.

headlines: India's data usage per smartphone highest in world: Report
text: India region, which includes Bhutan and Nepal as well, had the world's highest data usage per smartphone at an average of 9.8GB per month in 2018, a report by Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson stated. The report further said that the usage will almost double to 18GB by 2024. Meanwhile, North East Asia comes second with 7.1GB per month.

headlines: Video shows BJP MLA hitting self with stone during fight with police
text: A scuffle broke out between police and BJP MLA Raja Singh and his supporters after the MLA attempted to erect a statue of freedom fighter Rani Avanti Bai in Hyderabad on Wednesday. While Singh sustained injuries in the incident, a video showed him hitting himself with a stone. Police said Singh didn't have permission to erect the statue.

headlines: Masood Azhar's terrorist tag shows world stands with India: Prez
text: Addressing a joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "Today the whole world stands with India on the issue of terrorism." President Kovind added, "Designation of Masood Azhar, responsible for dastardly terrorist attacks on our soil, as a global terrorist by United Nations is a major testimony to this fact."

headlines: SoftBank portfolio will grow 33 times in 20 years: Masayoshi Son
text: SoftBank founder and CEO Masayoshi Son has projected that the Japanese conglomerate's portfolio could potentially grow 33 times to reach a $1.8-trillion valuation in the next two decades. "This isn't a business plan, it's a big dream...so you should give it some discount," he added. Son further revealed that the company's earnings for 2018 crossed $18.5 billion.

headlines: Balakot strikes demonstrated India's capability: Prez Kovind
text: While addressing a joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "India has amply demonstrated both her intent and capabilities, first through surgical strikes and then through air strikes after the Pulwama attack." President Kovind added, "In future too, all possible steps will be taken to ensure our security."

headlines: 17-yr-old boy among 2 killed as clash breaks out in West Bengal
text: At least two people have been killed and three injured after a clash between two groups of unidentified people on Thursday in West Bengal's Bhatpara. One of the deceased has been identified as a 17-year-old puchka seller. Reportedly, crude bombs were hurled and gunshots were fired by the miscreants, prompting police to use tear gas shells to disperse them.

headlines: US Senate committee schedules hearing over Facebook's crypto
text: The US Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs has scheduled a hearing on July 16 on Facebook's proposed digital currency and data privacy concerns. Although no witnesses have been announced yet, David Marcus, who is the head of Facebook's digital wallet for its cryptocurrency, is reportedly expected to testify. Facebook's cryptocurrency 'Libra' is expected to launch next year.

headlines: 700 DMK workers detained for protesting against TN water crisis
text: Around 700 DMK workers were detained and later released on Wednesday for protesting outside the Coimbatore City Corporation Office (CCCO) against the water crisis in Tamil Nadu. The protest was held to urge the CCCO to take steps to resolve the crisis affecting the state. "We're doing all that we can despite the deficient rain," a state minister said.

headlines: One nation, one election need of the hour: President Kovind
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Thursday supported the idea of one nation, one election. "One nation, simultaneous elections is the need of the hour, which would facilitate accelerated development, thereby benefitting our countrymen," he said. "With such a system in place, all political parties...will be able to better utilise their energy towards development and public welfare," he added.

headlines: AIIMS to begin study on cause of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome
text: AIIMS Delhi will soon begin a study into the cause of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome, which has caused deaths of 117 children in Bihar's Muzaffarpur this month. The project is being jointly funded by the Union Health and Family Welfare Ministry and India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited. Dr Sheffali Gulati said, "The project needs special equipment that we recently procured."

headlines: Navy commandos rescue mother, daughter from J&K's Wular lake
text: The Indian Navy's MARCOS commandos on Wednesday rescued a mother-daughter duo after their boat, which was loaded with domestic items, capsized in Jammu and Kashmir's Wular Lake. Rafiqa Begum, who was one of the two persons who were rescued, thanked and praised the MARCOS divers while locals applauded them for undertaking the rescue operation.

headlines: World's shortest woman takes part in yoga day event in Nagpur
text: Jyoti Amge, who is recognised as being the world's shortest living woman by Guinness World Records, took part in a yoga session in Nagpur on Thursday, a day before International Yoga Day. Twenty-five-year-old Amge was seen stretching into a yoga pose while sitting on the hands of yoga practitioner Dhanashri Lekurwale.

headlines: BSF personnel perform yoga near IB in J&K's RS Pura
text: Ahead of International Yoga Day, Border Security Force (BSF) personnel performed Yoga near International Border (IB) in Jammu and Kashmir's RS Pura. "Yoga has helped us to perform our duties in extreme conditions at the border," a jawan said. Another jawan added, "Yoga is the best exercise for body and mind as it makes you strong both internally and externally."

headlines: Stanford Executive Education offers Design Thinking course
text: Stanford Executive Education in collaboration with Great Learning is offering a ten-week-long Design Thinking course aimed at fostering innovation among entrepreneurs and executives. Design Thinking originated at Stanford University, and is used by professionals at companies like Apple, Netflix, Google to deliver profitable products and services. This course offers a certificate from Stanford Graduate School of Business Executive Education.

headlines: Iran shoots down US military drone
text: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps has said that it shot down a US military drone over Iranian airspace. The US military confirmed that one of its drones was taken down, but said it was in international airspace over the Strait of Hormuz. The incident comes amid escalating tensions between the two nations, leading to a military build-up in the Gulf.

headlines: Actress Mahie Gill, crew attacked on show's sets by drunk men
text: Actress Mahie Gill and Sakett Saawhney, the producer of her web series have alleged that the crew of their show was attacked by drunk goons while they were shooting in Mumbai. "They manhandled women, attacked our director of photography, our director has dislocated his shoulder," said Saawhney. "The cops were there...they were encouraging them to beat everyone up," Mahie alleged.

headlines: Neesham jokingly mocks Kane Williamson for not bowling him vs SA
text: New Zealand all-rounder James Neesham took to Instagram to jokingly mock captain Kane Williamson for not bowling him against South Africa. The 28-year-old shared a picture of Williamson appearing to be tense and captioned it, "When you realise you totally forgot to bowl Neesh." He further praised Williamson for his match-winning hundred, writing, "But seriously, how good is this guy?!?!"

headlines: You cannot comment on anyone's family: Sehwag on Sania dinner video
text: Reacting to Pakistan World Cup squad dinner controversy involving Sania Mirza, ex-India cricketer Virender Sehwag said no one can connect athletes' personal lives to their professional lives. "I had said this before as well when Virat Kohli got out and Anushka Sharma was there...No matter how emotional you are about your team...you cannot go into their personal life," he added.

headlines: Congratulate EC, security forces for successful LS polls: Prez
text: While addressing a joint sitting of both the Houses of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind congratulated the Election Commission and security forces for successfully conducting the Lok Sabha elections. President Kovind added, "All voters deserve to be congratulated for the success of this election."

headlines: Slack prices its IPO at $26, gains valuation of $15.7 billion
text: Workplace chat software startup Slack has priced its Initial Public Offering (IPO) at $26 per share, gaining a valuation of around $15.7 billion. Slack, launched by Flickr Co-founder Stewart Butterfield, was initially built as a side project to support team communication for Butterfield's game company Tiny Speck. It is set to debut on the NYSE under the symbol "WORK".

headlines: Won't allow chanting of religious slogans in LS: Speaker Om Birla
text: Newly elected Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday stated he wouldn't allow chanting of religious slogans, which took place during swearing-in of MPs. "I don't think Parliament is the place for sloganeering [or] for showing placards...Whatever people want to say here...however they want to attack the government they can, but they can't...do all this," he said.

headlines: US tells India it may limit H-1B visas issued to Indians: Reports
text: The US has reportedly told India it is considering caps on H-1B work visas for nations forcing foreign companies to store data locally. The US plans to cap H-1B visas issued each year to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the annual quota, reports said. An estimated 70% of the 85,000 H-1B visas granted each year go to Indians.

headlines: Pragya's plea for permanent exemption in Malegaon blast case rejected
text: A special NIA court in Mumbai has rejected BJP MP Sadhvi Pragya's application for a permanent exemption from attending the court once a week in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. Pragya had told the court that she has to attend the Parliament on a day-to-day basis as she is an MP. However, the court gave her an exemption for today.

headlines: Pak media claims PM Modi has agreed for peace talks; India denies
text: A Pakistani media report has claimed that India has agreed to revive peace talks with Pakistan. It said PM Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar wrote letters to their Pakistani counterparts, adding, "Pakistan has also lauded this gesture". Meanwhile, India denied agreeing for talks, stating that PM Modi and Jaishankar only responded to congratulatory messages received from Pakistan.

headlines: Indian couple held for torturing, starving mother to death in Dubai
text: A 29-year-old Indian national and his wife have been charged at a Dubai court with physically assaulting the man's mother, causing her injuries and rib fracture, internal bleeding and starving her to death. The torture is believed to have lasted from July-October 2018, with a forensic doctor stating that the mother weighed 29 kg at the time of her death.

headlines: Sacked IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt gets life term in custodial death case
text: Gujarat's Jamnagar Sessions Court on Thursday sentenced sacked IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt, along with another officer Praveen Singh Jhala, to life imprisonment in 1990 custodial death case. According to the prosecution, Bhatt had detained over hundred people during a communal riot in Jamnagar and one of the detainees had died in hospital after he was released.

headlines: 9 men rape 3 sex workers at Noida farmhouse; 7 arrested
text: Three sex workers were allegedly raped by nine men at a Noida farmhouse after being picked up from Delhi, said police. Most of the accused are private security guards, while one is a cab driver, they said, adding that seven of the accused have been arrested. The women also told police that they were thrashed by the men.

headlines: Xi arrives in N Korea in 1st visit by a Chinese leader in 14 yrs
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived in North Korea on Thursday, marking the first visit by a Chinese leader to the country in 14 years. Xi is expected to discuss a range of issues with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, including denuclearisation. Xi's visit comes as the two countries are set to mark 70 years of the establishment of diplomatic ties.

headlines: Police searching for 3 absconding harassers of Ex-Miss India Universe
text: After seven men were arrested for assaulting former Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta, Kolkata police has launched a search for three absconding men who were also involved. The model-actress accused the men of assaulting her as well as the driver of the Uber she was travelling in on Monday. The seven arrested are being questioned about the missing men's whereabouts.

headlines: Anupriya Goenka, who featured in Padmaavat, to star in Hrithik's film
text: Anupriya Goenka, best known for portraying Shahid Kapoor's character's first wife in the 2018 film 'Padmaavat', has joined the cast of Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff's upcoming action-thriller film. "Working with this esteemed team is both a learning experience and is so much fun," the actress said. Directed by Siddharth Anand, the film is slated to release later this year.

headlines: Article 15 not anti-Brahmin, it doesn't take sides: Ayushmann
text: Addressing the criticism his upcoming film 'Article 15' has received for allegedly maligning the Brahmin community, actor Ayushmann Khurrana said, "Our movie doesn't take any sides." "It has no intention to showcase any community in a bad light and has been certified by the CBFC," he added. Ayushmann further urged people to watch the film before forming judgements about it.

headlines: Our goal is to empower every person: President Kovind
text: Addressing the joint session of both the Houses of the Parliament, President Ram Nath Kovind on Thursday said, "To empower every person is our goal." He added, "This journey is inspired by Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas." The President further said, "I call upon all MPs to seriously consider the development-oriented proposal of 'One Nation, One Election' together."

headlines: BJP working prez Nadda meets ex-party chiefs Advani, Joshi
text: Two days after being appointed as BJP working president, Jagat Prakash Nadda called on former party presidents Murli Manohar Joshi and Lal Krishna Advani in New Delhi on Wednesday. Nadda tweeted, "I met and sought the blessings of our senior leader and former BJP president Murli Manohar Joshi." Further, he called Advani "our mentor" and "a source of inspiration."

headlines: Water crisis among biggest challenges of 21st century: Prez Kovind
text: While addressing a joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament, President Ram Nath Kovind called the creation of Jal Shakti Ministry a decisive step, stating, "One of the biggest challenges of the 21st century is water crisis." He added, "Climate change and global warming will lead to worsening of this problem...We have to conserve water for our future generations."

headlines: Had a great meeting, multiple issues were discussed: PM Modi
text: After the conclusion of the all-party meeting, PM Narendra Modi said the meeting with the Presidents of various political parties was "great". Thanking the leaders for their "informed suggestions", he added, multiple issues of national importance like "One Nation, One Election" were discussed. He also announced setting up of a committee to examine the feasibility of 'One Nation, One Election'.

headlines: 7 children missing after vehicle carrying 29 falls into canal in UP
text: Seven children are missing after a vehicle carrying around 29 passengers fell into a canal in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Thursday. Reportedly, the passengers were returning from a wedding when the driver lost control over the vehicle and it fell into the canal. CM Yogi Adityanath directed SDRF to assist in rescue operations and around 22 people have been rescued.

headlines: Sunaina is in an unfortunate situation: Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne
text: Speaking on the dispute between Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina with her family, his ex-wife Sussanne Khan said, "In my life span of being a part of this close knit family, I know Sunaina, to be an extremely loving...person, who is in an unfortunate situation." "Please respect a family's tough period, each family goes through such times," she added.

headlines: Guptill smashes stumps with foot after slipping, gets out hit wicket
text: Martin Guptill has become the first New Zealand batsman to get out hit wicket in World Cup. The 32-year-old smashed the stumps with his foot after slipping while facing South Africa pacer Andile Phehlukwayo in 15th over of their 2019 World Cup match on Wednesday. It was the 10th instance of a batsman getting out hit wicket in World Cup.

headlines: May be watching WC: RJD VP on Tejashwi's absence amid AES crisis
text: After a reporter asked RJD Vice-President Raghuvansh Prasad Singh about Tejashwi Yadav's absence amid Acute Encephalitis Syndrome crisis in Bihar, Singh said, "Maybe he has gone to watch the World Cup, I'm not sure about it." Meanwhile, Singh sought CM Nitish Kumar's resignation on moral grounds over the death of around 100 children due to AES in Muzaffarpur.

headlines: Rudratej Singh, former Royal Enfield President, to head BMW India
text: BMW Group India, which comprises BMW, MINI and Motorrad brands, on Wednesday named Rudratej Singh as its President and CEO. In his last assignment, Rudratej Singh was the Global President at Royal Enfield and previously worked with Unilever in India and international markets for over 16 years. He holds an MBA degree in Marketing and Finance from IMT, Ghaziabad.

headlines: US startup supplies water to space station; 1st-ever to do so
text: US-based orbital fuel supply startup Orbit Fab has successfully supplied the International Space Station with water, marking a first for any private company. In its experiment called "Furphy", the startup demonstrated the ability to transfer water between two satellite testbeds in a demonstration for potential future refuelling. The test was carried out with the help of ISS US National Laboratory.

headlines: Himalayan glaciers lost around 2ft ice each year since 2000: Study
text: Himalayan glaciers across India, China, Nepal and Bhutan have been losing equivalent of over a vertical foot and half of ice each year since 2000, a study by Columbia University team revealed. The study indicated that the melting of the glaciers almost doubled since 2000. The analysis was based on four decades of observations using declassified US spy satellite images.

headlines: 4-day-old UP girl dies after being moved between hospital buildings
text: A four-day-old girl died after being shuttled around from one government hospital building to another in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly for over three hours on Wednesday. The critically ill infant was brought to men's wing but instead of stabilising the child, her family was sent to women's wing that referred them back. A doctor has been suspended in the case.

headlines: England seaside town witnesses 1,000 lightning strikes in 1 hour
text: Eastbourne, a seaside England town, witnessed about 1,000 lightning strikes in one hour on Wednesday as torrential rain and thunderstorms lashed part of the UK overnight. Homes were left without power and roads were flooded in parts of south-east England as the areas were hit by lightning. A yellow weather warning was issued for thunderstorms across the south-east of England.

headlines: Why are Kangana, Rangoli obsessed with my family: Hrithik's cousin
text: After Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli claimed that Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina was being assaulted by her family for being in love with a Muslim, Hrithik's cousin Eshaan tweeted, "Why are these sisters obsessed with this family?" "It's a very sensitive period for our family. I request these people to be sensitive and not act as vultures," his tweet further read.

headlines: I have butterflies in my stomach: Ayushmann on working with Big B
text: While speaking about working with Amitabh Bachchan in the upcoming film 'Gulabo Sitabo', actor Ayushmann Khurrana said, "I have butterflies in my stomach." "I dont know how will I feel when I face Mr Bachchan for the first time on screen together," the actor added. Directed by Shoojit Sircar, the forthcoming film is slated to release in April next year.

headlines: 'Kabir Singh' gets A certificate, makers asked to change drug scene
text: The Central Board of Film Certification has given the upcoming Shahid Kapoor starrer 'Kabir Singh' an 'A' certificate and has asked the film's makers to make a few changes. A scene in which a character is seen snorting drugs has been modified following the Censor Board's orders. Warnings against drug abuse have also been inserted in scenes depicting drug use.

headlines: Reduce term of J&K Assembly from 6 to 5 years: BJP
text: Jammu and Kashmir's BJP lawmakers have demanded that the state Assembly's term should be reduced from six years to five years like other states. BJP spokesperson Balbir Ram Rattan said, the state must have laws similar to those enacted by the Parliament for the entire country. Criticising the NC, Rattan said people should understand its "dubious role" on the issue.

headlines: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik supports 'One Nation, One Election'
text: Addressing all-party meeting convened by PM Narendra Modi on 'One Nation, One Election' issue, Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik said that the BJD "fully supports the idea". He added, "Frequent elections affect the pace of development and also rock the spirit of cooperative federalism." Patnaik also strongly advocated a re-look into the Land Acquisition Act and the Forest Conservation Act.

headlines: Wear traditional dress to office at least once a week: Mizoram govt
text: Mizoram's Mizo National Front government has issued circular asking government employees to wear traditional dress to office voluntarily at least once a week. The decision has been taken to ensure the citizens' "closeness to the culture" and to promote "innovation in the production of cultural attires". The conservation of cultures depends much on how they are embraced, the circular read.

headlines: India won't allow multi-brand retail by foreign firms: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal, in a meeting with e-commerce firms including Amazon, eBay and Flipkart, said the government wouldn't allow multi-brand retail trade by foreign e-commerce firms. He added such platforms could only be described as "agnostic" platforms. He also asserted that 'predatory pricing' will not be allowed and necessary action will be taken against defaulters.

headlines: 3D face models made using info stored in brain, claim scientists
text: Glasgow University neuroscientists claimed they successfully constructed 3D facial models using unique information stored in an individual's brain when recalling the face of a familiar person. The information was first mathematically represented and then rendered graphically, researchers said. It could have applications for eyewitness testimony, AI, gaming technology and more, they added.

headlines: Maoist killed in encounter in Jharkhand's Simdega
text: A Maoist was shot down on Wednesday in an encounter with the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and the district police personnel in Jharkhand's Simdega district. Additional Director General of Police (Operation), Murari Lal Meena said that an AK-47 was recovered from the spot of the encounter. Earlier on Wednesday, Maoists in Chhattisgarh killed abducted Samajwadi Party leader Santosh Punem.

headlines: Won't extend July 8 deadline to save nuclear deal: Iran
text: Iran has said that it will not extend the July 8 deadline given to European signatories to save the nuclear deal. Iran partially suspended its commitment to the deal in May in response to the US' decision to pull out of the agreement and reimpose sanctions. The UK, France, China, Russia and Germany constitute the other parties to the deal.

headlines: FM discusses liquidity, financial stability with regulators
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday discussed liquidity issues faced by lenders and stability of financial sector with members of the Financial Stability and Development Council. The regulators further offered suggestions for the Union Budget. The meeting was attended by RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi, IRDAI chief Subhash Chandra Khuntia and other officials.

headlines: New Zealand defeat South Africa to go top of 2019 WC points table
text: New Zealand defeated South Africa by 4 wickets in the last over to continue their unbeaten run in 2019 World Cup. With four victories in five matches, New Zealand are now on top of the points table, while South Africa are eighth with four defeats. The match witnessed New Zealand captain Kane Williamson smash his 12th ODI hundred.

headlines: If UP CM was a superhero his name would be Rapeman: Hard Kaur
text: Rapper Hard Kaur took to Facebook to criticise Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and wrote, "If this guy was a superhero his name would be Rapeman Yogi." "You call him when you want your sisters, mothers, daughters raped," she added. The rapper also criticised RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and wrote he is "responsible for all terrorist attacks in India".

headlines: Dhawan's injury a blow but India will make semis: Sourav Ganguly
text: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has said that opener Shikhar Dhawan's injury is a blow to Team India but they are in good form and will make it to the semi-finals. "Injuries are part and parcel nobody has control on it. Hope others come and do well," he added. Dhawan was ruled out of the 2019 World Cup today.

headlines: PCB should penalise players spotted at Sheesha cafe: Ex-Pak captain
text: Former Pakistan captain Intikhab Alam has said that Pakistan Cricket Board should hold an enquiry and penalise the players who were spotted at a sheesha cafe days before their match against India in the 2019 World Cup. "It is wrong as the players are on their national duty and there must be a discipline to be followed strictly," he added.

headlines: Iceland Cricket apologise for mocking Rashid for conceding 110 runs
text: Iceland Cricket have apologised for mocking Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan for giving away 110 runs in 9 overs against England in 2019 World Cup on Tuesday. This comes after several cricketers criticised Iceland Cricket for their tweet on Rashid wherein they had written, "Well batted young man." Rashid's figures were the most expensive by a spinner in ODI history.

headlines: Williamson becomes fastest batsman to score 1,000 ODI runs in England
text: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has become the fastest batsman to reach 1,000 ODI runs in England. The 28-year-old batsman reached the landmark in 17 innings, overtaking Team India opener Rohit Sharma, who achieved the feat in 18 innings. The third fastest batsman to reach 1,000 runs in England is Shikhar Dhawan, who took 19 innings.

headlines: MP Police clerk's son killed in custody, says family; 5 suspended
text: Five policemen in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal were suspended after a 25-year-old man's family alleged he was killed in police custody, said Yogesh Deshmukh, Inspector General, Bhopal Zone. His father is a head clerk in the police cyber cell. The deceased's friend claimed that their car met with an accident, and the police took them to station where they were beaten.

headlines: From economy to WC, every news depressing us: Pak Chief Justice
text: Pakistan's Chief Justice Asif Saeed Khan Khosa has said that people in his country are only receiving "depressing news", be it on the state of the economy, politics or Pakistan's performance in the 2019 Cricket World Cup. He further praised Pakistan's judiciary saying it's the one sector in the country from where some "good news" is coming.

headlines: Stop showing kids in vulgar manner on dance shows: Govt to channels
text: The I&B Ministry on Tuesday advised all private satellite TV channels to avoid showing children in a vulgar, indecent, suggestive and inappropriate manner. The Ministry noticed that some dance competitions on television show young kids performing dance moves originally performed by adults. "Such acts may have a distressing impact on children, affecting them at a young age," the Ministry said.

headlines: Amla 2nd fastest to 8,000 ODI runs, takes 1 innings more than Kohli
text: South Africa opener Hashim Amla has become the second fastest batsman to reach 8,000 runs in ODI cricket, achieving the feat during his 83-ball 55-run knock against New Zealand on Wednesday. The 36-year-old achieved the feat in his 176th innings, taking one innings more than Virat Kohli, who had set the record on June 15, 2017.

headlines: US warns India against sharing US goods with Huawei: Report
text: The US has reportedly warned the Indian government that companies found supplying American-origin products or equipment to Huawei or its units could face punitive action. In response to it, the Ministry of External Affairs reportedly approached DoT, NITI Aayog, MeitY, Department of Commerce and Principal Scientific Adviser on the implications of the US' curbs on Huawei for Indian firms.

headlines: No Google Search relaunch in China without right conditions: Pichai
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with CNN said that the technology giant has no plans to consider relaunching its Search service in China. "We think about serving the next billion users...Our mission compass is to provide information...but we would need the right conditions to exist," he said. Censorship-free internet is an "important condition" for Google, he further said.

headlines: Wall using 15,000 waste plastic bottles built near Mussoorie
text: A 150 feet long and 12 feet high 'Wall of Hope' made using 15,000 discarded bottles was unveiled on Tuesday in Banglow ki Kandi village near Mussoorie. It's built to encourage tourists to handle the waste responsibly. The wall has been constructed with the help of over 50 volunteers from schools and colleges across Mussoorie, and women from the village.

headlines: Govt plans to exempt electric vehicles from registration fee
text: The Road Transport and Highways Ministry has issued draft rules to exempt electric vehicles (EVs) from paying registration fee. The proposed exemption will apply to all categories of electric vehicles including scooters, motorbikes, autorickshaws and cars. This is part of the government's plan to encourage adoption of such vehicles to curb pollution and reduce dependence on oil imports.

headlines: Starving polar bear spotted in Russian city
text: A polar bear, reportedly starving and exhausted, was spotted hundreds of kilometres from its natural Arctic habitat in Russia's Norilsk. It's the first polar bear seen in the city in over 40 years, Reuters reported. Oleg Krashevsky, a local wildlife expert who filmed the polar bear up close, said the animal had watery eyes and could clearly not see well.

headlines: Owner, mahout jailed after elephant dies due to ill-treatment
text: The owner and mahout of a female elephant in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh were jailed after the animal died due to ill-treatment. The tusker was also forcefully used for entertainment and begging in the streets. The autopsy report found that eyes of the tusker were damaged, turning it blind and there was also a severe deficiency of blood and failure of kidneys.

headlines: ED arrests 2 ex-directors of IL&FS in money laundering probe
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday arrested Arun Saha and Karunakaran Ramchand, former directors of IL&FS, in connection with alleged money laundering investigation at the group. The agency alleged that the duo sanctioned and disbursed loans without proper security. They were placed under arrest as they were "not cooperating" and were "evasive" in their responses, it added.

headlines: IndusInd to merge with Bharat Financial Inclusion on July 4
text: IndusInd Bank on Wednesday said its merger with Bharat Financial Inclusion (BFIL) will be effective from July 4. BFIL's current CEO MR Rao will take charge as CEO of IndusInd Financial Inclusion, which will house the Business Correspondent undertaking of BFIL. "The merger...will enable our 8.8 million microfinance customers to access savings, deposits and other banking products," Rao said.

headlines: Akhtar responds to rumours of him wanting to kidnap Sonali Bendre
text: Reacting to rumours of him wanting to kidnap actress Sonali Bendre, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar denied the claims and said he has never even met Sonali in his entire life. "I was never her fan. I did watch her movies once or twice," he added. He further said that he never carried Sonali's pictures in his pockets as reported.

headlines: My dad slapped me as I'm in love with a Muslim guy: Hrithik's sister
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina has alleged that her father, filmmaker Rakesh Roshan slapped her as she's in love with a Muslim man. She added, "My father...told me...the guy I loved was a terrorist, which Ruhail isn't. If he was one, would he go scot-free and work in the media?" Sunaina further revealed she had met the person on Facebook.

headlines: Hrithik's family assaulting Sunaina as she loves a Muslim: Rangoli
text: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel has claimed that Hrithik Roshan and his family are physically assaulting his sister Sunaina as she's in love with a Muslim man from Delhi. "They got a lady cop who slapped her, her father...hit her, her brother is trying to put her behind bars. I fear her dangerous family might harm her," Rangoli added.

headlines: Afghanistan coach says he will expose chief selector after World Cup
text: Afghanistan head coach Phil Simmons has said he'll expose team's chief selector Dawlat Ahmadzai after 2019 World Cup. This comes after Ahmadzai said that coaching staff led by Simmons couldn't prepare Afghanistan for the World Cup. Simmons added that he would tell Afghan people about part Ahmadzai played in Afghanistan's preparation and in dismissal of Asghar Afghan as captain.

headlines: Batted on despite getting hit on head for my mother: Afghan player
text: Afghanistan's 24-year-old batsman Hashmatullah Shahidi, who was struck by a short ball that broke his helmet and ignored advice to retire hurt against England on Tuesday, said he did it for his mother. "I got up so quickly...because my mum is always thinking of me. I lost my father last year so I didn't want her to hurt," he added.

headlines: PUBG haram, insults Islam: Indonesia Muslim group issues fatwa
text: Indonesia's top Muslim clerical body, Indonesian Ulema Council, has issued a fatwa against online multiplayer battle royale game PUBG, claiming it insults Islam. "Our fatwa says that PUBG and other similar games are haram (forbidden) because they can trigger violence," deputy chairman of the Aceh chapter of the council said. Aceh is the only region in Indonesia with Islamic law.

headlines: PM Modi announces committee to examine 'One Nation, One Election'
text: PM Narendra Modi will set up a panel to give suggestions on 'One Nation, One Election' proposal, Union Minister Rajnath Singh said on Wednesday after an all-party meeting to discuss simultaneous polls. Singh said that most parties who attended the meeting were supportive of the concept. However, the Left parties had concerns about the implementation of the proposal, added Singh.

headlines: Sri Lanka's 1st satellite 'Raavana-1' launched into orbit
text: Sri Lanka's first satellite 'Raavana-1', designed and developed by two Sri Lankan engineers, was released into orbit from the International Space Station on Monday. The satellite is expected to fulfil five missions including capturing pictures of Sri Lanka and surrounding regions. Designed for a minimum lifespan of 1.5 years, Raavana-1 is expected to be active for about five years.

headlines: Is speaking truth a crime: Suspended Congress MLA Roshan Baig
text: A day after being suspended from Congress for indulging in "anti-party activities", senior Karnataka legislator Roshan Baig said, "It is obvious I have been specifically targeted by the state leadership. Is speaking truth a crime?" Baig had criticised state party leadership after Congress' debacle in the Lok Sabha polls. He had also called Congress General Secretary KC Venugopal a "buffoon".

headlines: Don't spare accused Muslims: Kolkata's Muslim citizens to Mamata
text: Prominent Muslim citizens of Kolkata wrote to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, asking her not to spare the accused Muslims in the doctors' assault case and the attack on ex-Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta. "This will send out a message that members of one community are not being appeased," they wrote. The letter was shared online by columnist Mudar Patherya.

headlines: Engineer held after woman he met on Tinder says he left her after sex
text: A 29-year-old Bengaluru engineer was arrested after a woman's complaint against him alleging that he broke up with her the morning after they had sexual intercourse after a month of dating. The duo working in the IT industry began dating after the man approached the woman on Tinder. "I felt so disgusted that I was used," the woman said.

headlines: IIT Bombay top Indian institute in QS World University Rankings
text: IIT Bombay has emerged as India's top institute in QS World University Rankings for 2020 where it has been placed at the 152nd spot globally, rising ten places from last year. In India, IIT Bombay is followed by IIT Delhi (182) and Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru (184). The list was topped by MIT, followed by Stanford and Harvard universities.

headlines: Pakistan PM Imran Khan goofs up, shares Tagore's quote as Gibran's
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan committed a goof up on Wednesday as he shared a quote by poet Rabindranath Tagore on Twitter but wrongly gave its credits to Lebanese-American writer Kahlil Gibran. Soon after his goof up, #RabindranathTagore started trending on Twitter. Last week, he was trolled for breaking the diplomatic protocol at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit's opening ceremony.

headlines: Teen plots friend's murder after man offers $9mn to record killing
text: An 18-year-old girl in the US allegedly conspired to murder her friend after a man she met online offered her $9 million to carry out the killing and send him pictures and videos of the act. The man used someone else's photo online, pretending to be a millionaire. The 19-year-old victim's body was found on a riverbank.

headlines: Maharashtra identifies site for $44-billion Saudi-backed refinery
text: Maharashtra has identified a new site for the planned $44-billion oil refinery that Indian state-run firms are building with Saudi Aramco and ADNOC, CM Devendra Fadnavis said. The new site would be at Raigad district. Thousands of farmers at Nanar village in Ratnagiri district had refused to surrender land, fearing the project could affect Alphonso mango and cashew plantations.

headlines: Australia's Stoinis declared fit, might play against Bangladesh
text: Australia all-rounder Marcus Stoinis, who suffered a side strain while bowling against India has recovered and might feature in team's match against Bangladesh in the 2019 World Cup tomorrow. Mitchell Marsh, who was called as cover for Stoinis has re-joined Australia A in Northampton. "He's an elite athlete...an elite professional," Australia coach Justin Langer said praising Stoinis.

headlines: Rashid a star player, giving 110 runs not a big deal: Naib
text: After Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan conceded 110 runs in nine overs against England in 2019 World Cup on Tuesday, captain Gulbadin Naib said, "He's a star player in world cricket...I don't think it's a big deal." "He's one of the best spinners...it can happen with any player, not just Rashid," Naib added about the world number three ODI bowler.

headlines: Baig should've met leaders in Delhi: Karnataka Cong chief
text: On Congress leader Roshan Baig's expulsion from the party, Karnataka Congress President Dinesh Gundu Rao on Wednesday said that Baig should have gone to leaders in Delhi with his grievances instead of speaking to the media. "Now, AICC will decide on the future course of action after further enquiry," he added. Baig was suspended on Tuesday for anti-party activities.

headlines: After Maruti, Renault to stop selling diesel vehicles in India
text: French automaker Renault has announced plans to stop selling diesel vehicles in India from next year, when BS-VI emission norms come into effect. The regulations in most countries were devised to support electrified vehicles and Renault would significantly reduce its exposure to diesel, CEO Thierry Bolloré said. Maruti Suzuki had also announced plans to stop selling diesel cars.

headlines: ONGC, partners to invest $20 bn in Mozambique LNG project
text: ONGC Videsh and its partners have agreed to invest $20 billion in constructing a gas liquefaction and export terminal in Mozambique, the largest single LNG project approved in Africa. The partners include Bharat Petroleum, Oil India and US' Anadarko. Gas from an Anadarko-operated offshore field will be sent to the processing plant, where it will be liquefied and then exported.

headlines: I support Kangana: Hrithik's sister after family dispute
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina, who recently revealed she's facing issues with her family, tweeted that she supports actress Kangana Ranaut. Kangana's sister Rangoli claimed Sunaina is in contact with them and has apologised for not supporting Kangana during her legal battle with Hrithik. Sunaina had earlier said it's like a "living hell" while talking about the row with her family.

headlines: Google to invest $1 bn for 20,000 homes in San Francisco
text: Google has announced a $1-billion investment to help build around 20,000 homes in San Francisco Bay Area over the next 10 years. It said $750-million worth of its property will be rezoned from commercial to residential. This comes over backlash from local activists who claim Google and other firms' growth and high salaries led to rising rents and housing shortages.

headlines: Google Calendar being used to carry out new scams: Kaspersky
text: Google Calendar is being used by scammers to carry out new phishing attacks by exploiting the platform's event invites feature, Kaspersky revealed. Users are sent links to fake surveys with short event descriptions like, "You've received a cash reward". The fake surveys gather users' bank details or ask them to pay a transfer fee to receive the money, it added.

headlines: Need to be frenemies with Facebook: Winklevoss twins on Libra crypto
text: Reacting to Facebook's cryptocurrency 'Libra', twin brothers and billionaires Cameron Winklevoss and Tyler Winklevoss have said they now need to be "frenemies" (friendly enemies) with Facebook. The Harvard graduates accused Mark Zuckerberg of stealing their idea for a social network and won a $65 million settlement with Facebook. They founded 'Gemini', a New York-based cryptocurrency exchange.

headlines: Remove illegal lingerie mannequins, it embarrasses women: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena corporator Sheetal Mhatre has asked the BMC administration to remove illegal lingerie mannequins from shops. She said there are places in the city where mannequin busts are hanging on tree branches with lingerie, adding that it's "very embarrassing for women". Mhatre asserted that there's no need to advertise lingerie as women know where to find it.

headlines: Nexus-backed API development startup Postman to get $50 mn
text: API development and collaboration platform Postman has secured $50 million in its Series B funding round led by US-based CRV, with participation from existing investor Nexus Venture Partners. Founded in 2014 by Abhinav Asthana, Abhijit Kane and Ankit Sobti, Postman helps developers and companies streamline and optimise API workflow. It raised $7 million in Series A from Nexus in 2016.

headlines: Gujarat girl cracks NEET, AIIMS, JIPMER, JEE Main and gets into MIT
text: Gujarat's Stuti Khandwala has cracked JEE Main 2019, NEET 2019, JIPMER MBBS 2019 and AIIMS MBBS 2019. She secured AIR 10 in AIIMS MBBS, AIR 71 in NEET, AIR 27 in JIPMER MBBS and rank 1086 in JEE Main. She has been selected by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and would be travelling to the US to pursue bio-engineering.

headlines: 9-month-old girl sexually assaulted and murdered in Telangana
text: A nine-month-old girl in Telangana was allegedly sexually assaulted and murdered on Tuesday by a neighbour. According to the police, the child was picked up by the accused when she was sleeping with her parents on the building terrace. When the parents woke up, they looked for her and found the accused sexually assaulting her. She died in the hospital.

headlines: Chennai runs out of water as 4 reservoirs supplying the city dry up
text: Tamil Nadu's capital Chennai is in crisis after the four reservoirs that supply water to India's sixth largest city have completely run dry. The water shortage in Chennai started several weeks ago and the Madras High Court has criticised the state government for inaction. The city is entirely dependent on the northeast monsoon which begins in October.

headlines: Govt to remove minimum qualification for driving transport vehicle
text: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has decided to remove the minimum educational qualification required to obtain a licence for driving a transport vehicle. According to the present Central Motor Vehicles Rules, 1989, a transport vehicle driver is required to have passed Class 8th. The move will help a large number of underprivileged and unemployed youth, the Ministry said.

headlines: 2 policemen suspended for sleeping on duty in Indore
text: Two Indore Police personnel have been suspended and posted to police lines after they were caught sleeping on duty during a surprise inspection by Superintendent of Police Yusuf Qureshi on Monday night. While a police constable was found absent from duty, a show cause notice was issued against a sub-inspector who was found patrolling in his personal vehicle.

headlines: Saudi Crown Prince liable for Jamal Khashoggi's murder: UN report
text: UN special rapporteur Agnes Callamard said in a report there's "credible evidence" that Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is liable for the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Khashoggi, a critic of the Saudi government, was killed inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul last year. He was the victim of extrajudicial killing for which Saudi Arabia is responsible, Callamard added.

headlines: Germany's Merkel seen shaking during ceremony, blames dehydration
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel was visibly shaking during a ceremony to welcome Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Berlin. When asked by reporters about the incident, the 64-year-old leader said that it was due to dehydration. "I've drunk at least three glasses of water and so I'm doing very well now," she added.

headlines: I wasn't molested: Ex-Miss India Universe who was dragged out of car
text: Former Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta, who earlier alleged that some men beat up her Uber driver and dragged her out of the car, has criticised media for "sensationalising" the news. She wrote, "Neither me nor my colleague...were molested. This isn't about women safety this is about people safety!" "Don't sensationalise the news and dilute the whole purpose," she added.

headlines: US overtakes China as India's largest goods trading partner
text: The US overtook China to once again become India's top goods trading partner in 2018-19. The bilateral goods trade between India and the US stood at $87.95 billion during the fiscal compared to $87 billion between India and China. India's trade surplus with the US declined to $16.8 billion from $21.2 billion a year ago.

headlines: Urvashi Rautela accuses ex-publicist of maligning her character
text: Urvashi Rautela shared a post accusing her former publicist Kapil Mishra of maligning her image by getting the media to publish negative news about her. "It's...catastrophic that media has given integrity to my (ex-pr for 5 years) cocaine-alcohol addict, who was in jail for blackmailing me," she wrote. Mishra was allegedly fired after he first attempted to damage Urvashi's career.

headlines: Mental Hai Kya trailer launch cancelled over row with doctors: Report
text: The trailer launch event for the upcoming Kangana Ranaut and Rajkummar Rao starrer 'Mental Hai Kya' was cancelled as several doctors are opposing the film's title, as per reports. The film's makers are also still awaiting clearance from the Censor Board, reports further suggested. Multiple psychiatrists and mental health experts criticised the film after its poster was released in April.

headlines: Apple may move 15-30% production capacity from China: Report
text: Apple has reportedly asked its major suppliers to assess the cost implications of moving 15-30% of their production capacity from China to other regions amid the US-China trade war. The countries being considered reportedly include Mexico, India, Vietnam, Indonesia and Malaysia. Reportedly, Apple has decided the risks of relying heavily on manufacturing in China are too great and even rising.

headlines: Pokémon Go maker buys London game developer Sensible Object
text: Pokémon Go creator Niantic has acquired London-based Sensible Object, which has been developing games that combine physical and digital play. Founded in 2014, Sensible Object will offer support for its existing slate of titles during a transition period after which it'll focus its efforts on building new real-world AR experiences with Niantic as the core of Niantic London, Niantic stated.

headlines: Will run the House impartially: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla
text: Newly-elected Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday said he will run the House in an impartial manner while asserting that the Speaker's chair should not be biased. "I will safeguard the interests of the members irrespective of the strength of their parties," he said. Birla's nomination was supported by all major Opposition parties, including Congress, TMC, DMK, and BJD.

headlines: Holding simultaneous polls anti-democratic, anti-federal: CPI(M)
text: The CPI(M) on Wednesday said holding simultaneous polls to Parliament and state Assemblies is "fundamentally anti-federal and anti-democratic". CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said it would "tamper" with the constitutional scheme of accountability of the government to the legislature. He added CPI(M) is totally opposed to any "artificial attempt" to bring about simultaneous elections.

headlines: Walmart in acquisition talks with a dozen Indian startups: Report
text: Walmart is eyeing acquisition of several startups out of close to a dozen early-stage Indian startups which it is in talks with, the Financial Express reported quoting sources. "Walmart is looking for entrepreneurial talent primarily hoping to build great technologies and products," the report said. Walmart may spend around $100,000-200,000 in acquiring such startups, the report stated.

headlines: Our AI can predict breast cancer a year before it appears: IBM
text: IBM researchers claim their AI model can predict malignant breast cancer development in patients within the year, at rates comparable to human radiologists.
