It makes decisions from both imaging data and a comprehensive patient's health history. IBM said its model could correctly predict the development of breast cancer in 87% cases it analysed and could correctly interpret 77% non-cancerous cases.

headlines: DMK workers hold protests against water crisis in Tamil Nadu
text: The Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) party workers on Wednesday held protests outside the Coimbatore City Corporation Office against the water crisis in Tamil Nadu. The workers waved DMK flags and held bright plastic pots over their heads during the protest. On the matter, Tamil Nadu Fisheries Minister D Jayakumar said they're doing all they can despite the deficient rain.

headlines: Shikhar Dhawan ruled out of 2019 World Cup, Pant replaces opener
text: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup as he is not in a position to recover in time from a fractured thumb. Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant, who was sent to England as a cover for Dhawan, replaces him in the World Cup squad. Dhawan had sustained the injury during India's match against Australia.

headlines: 7 arrested for allegedly assaulting Ex-Miss India Universe
text: Seven men were arrested for allegedly assaulting former Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta as well as the driver of the Uber cab she was travelling in on Monday night. The arrests were made on the basis of CCTV footage as well as videos of the incident captured by Sengupta. The actress-model was travelling home from work when the incident occurred.

headlines: Took me 3 yrs to lose 50 kg when I was 20, never gave up: Arjun
text: Talking about his battle with obesity in an Instagram post, actor Arjun Kapoor wrote, "I vowed never to give up in the 3 years it took me to lose 50 kgs when I was 20 years old." "Keeping the belief is key, [you] gotta keep at it...One day you will reap the benefits...We all gotta keep the faith," he added.

headlines: Paytm Money may raise up to $1.2 bn at $5-bn valuation, turn unicorn
text: Paytm's financial services arm Paytm Money is reportedly in talks to raise up to $1.2 billion at a valuation of $5 billion, which would turn it into a 'unicorn' or a billion-dollar startup. Existing investors, including SoftBank and Alibaba's Ant Financial, are reportedly interested in the investment. Paytm Money was operating on a $10-million commitment from its parent firm.

headlines: Ramdas Athawale's b'day wish for Rahul makes PM Modi, Sonia laugh
text: BJP ally Republican Party of India (A)'s chief Ramdas Athawale on Wednesday wished Congress President Rahul Gandhi on his birthday in Lok Sabha, which made PM Narendra Modi and UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi laugh. Athawale said, "When you were in power, I was with you. Before elections, Congress people asked me to join Congress but I knew Modiji will win."

headlines: Sikh driver who attacked us assaulted Gurdwara sevadar in Apr: Police
text: The Sikh tempo driver and his son, who were beaten up by policemen allegedly after he attacked one of them with a sword in Delhi, was booked in April for assaulting a 'sevadar' of the Bangla Sahib Gurdwara, police said. He allegedly assaulted the sevadar after he complained about the driver and his sleeping near the sarovar for 3-4 days.

headlines: 11 inmates of Jamshedpur jail test positive for HIV: Report
text: Eleven inmates of a Jamshedpur jail were found to be HIV positive, the ART (Anti-Retroviral therapy) Centre at Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Medical College Hospital has revealed. An official said that three of the inmates were released recently. As many as 2,000 prisoners were tested between April to June 2019, and reports of 1,300 inmates have come till now.

headlines: Rocket hits headquarters of ExxonMobil in Iraq, 3 injured
text: A rocket landed at the headquarters for several global oil firms, including ExxonMobil, near the Iraqi city of Basra early on Wednesday, injuring three Iraqi workers, police said. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. This came after two separate attacks on bases housing US military personnel in Iraq.

headlines: 4 men to face charges for shooting down MH17 that killed 298 people
text: Three Russians and one Ukrainian national will face murder charges in the downing of the Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 in 2014 that killed 298 people. The passenger plane was shot down with a missile over territory held by pro-Russian rebels in Ukraine. Russia has denied the claim that the plane was brought down by a Russian military missile.

headlines: No. of people displaced around the world hits record 7 crore: UN
text: The number of people forcibly displaced around the world due to war, persecution and conflict, has reached a record 7.08 crore in 2018, the UN refugee agency UNHCR said. The agency attributed the increase from 2017 mainly to the displacement in Ethiopia and Venezuela. In 2018, every second refugee was a child, many of them alone and without their families.

headlines: Trade row with India hurts California almond growers: US Senator
text: US Senator Dianne Feinstein criticised President Donald Trump for "damaging" trade ties with India, saying his actions are hurting California almond growers. India had imposed higher retaliatory tariffs on 28 US products including almonds, apples and walnuts. India is the largest buyer of US almonds, paying $543 million for more than half of US almond exports in 2018.

headlines: Bernard Arnault joins Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos in $100-billion club
text: Europe's richest man Bernard Arnault, the Chairman of Louis Vuitton owner LVMH, on Tuesday joined Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates in the $100-billion club. The 70-year-old Frenchman's fortune of $100.4 billion now equals more than 3% of his country's economy, according to Bloomberg. Arnault's net worth has increased by almost $32 billion this year.

headlines: Adidas' three-stripe trademark is invalid, rules EU court
text: German sporting goods company Adidas' three-stripes have been ruled invalid as a trademark by a European Union court which said they lacked a "distinctive character" recognizable throughout the bloc. Adidas, however, said the ruling only affects a particular use of the symbol. Belgium's Shoe Branding Europe had challenged the Adidas trademark, registered in 2014 for clothing, footwear and headgear.

headlines: Clean chit possibly bought to resurrect Nana's career: Tanushree
text: Days after the police case against Nana Patekar for alleged sexual harassment was closed, Tanushree Dutta said, "[T]his clean chit was possibly bought...to resurrect Nana Patekar's failing Bollywood career." Speaking about the report filed by the police, she added, "This report is corrupt and full of lies." Tanushree further alleged that the report seeks to repair Nana's public perception.

headlines: Facebook should halt work on its cryptocurrency: US lawmaker
text: The US House Financial Services Committee Chairwoman Maxine Waters has requested Facebook to agree to halt development of its cryptocurrency pending review by Congress and regulators. Waters said, with the announcement of cryptocurrency launch plans, Facebook is continuing its unchecked expansion and extending reach into users' lives. Facebook's cryptocurrency Libra is expected to launch in 2020.

headlines: Called Modi a fascist and I stand by it: Telangana CM
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said he called Prime Minister Narendra Modi a "fascist" and he stands by it. "I called him the most fascist ruler of the country. It was on the record," he added. On not inviting PM Modi for the inauguration of Kaleshwaram project, Rao said that there's no rule of inviting the PM for every function.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi replies 'thank you' to PM for birthday wishes
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi replied "thank you" to PM Narendra Modi's greetings on his 49th birthday and said he appreciates it. "Best wishes to Rahul Gandhi...May he be blessed with good health and long life," the PM tweeted. "Thank you all for your best wishes and greetings...I'm overwhelmed and grateful for your love and affection," Gandhi wrote in another tweet.

headlines: Siddaramaiah could be reason for my suspension: Cong's Roshan Baig
text: Karnataka Congress MLA R Roshan Baig has alleged that former CM Siddaramaiah could possibly be the reason for his suspension from the party. He added, "I've not mocked [Congress President] Rahul Gandhi. I had only spoken about [the] poor performance of the party [in general elections]." On Tuesday, Baig was suspended from the party with immediate effect for "anti-party" activities.

headlines: AICC decides to dissolve Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee
text: The All India Congress Committee (AICC) on Wednesday decided to dissolve the Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC). However, the president and working president of the KPCC would remain unchanged, the party said in a statement. The development comes amid reports that all is not well between the ruling allies in the state.

headlines: Death toll due to severe heatwave in Bihar rises to 137
text: The severe heatwave in Bihar has claimed 137 lives of which 60 casualties were reported from Aurangabad. Places like Gaya reported 41 deaths, Nalanda 13, Nawada 12, Munger five, Kaimur and Vaishali two each and Ara and Samastipur one each. Due to the heatwave, the state government ordered the suspension of academic activities in all educational institutes till June 22.

headlines: 8 killed, 11 injured in road accident in UP's Sambhal
text: At least eight people were killed and 11 others were injured after their vehicle collided with a mini-goods carrier on the Moradabad-Agra national highway in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal, police said on Wednesday. Superintendent of Police, Yamuna Prasad said, "The victims were returning home after attending a wedding." CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the loss of lives in the accident.

headlines: Cognizant to buy Irish life sciences firm Zenith Tech
text: US-headquartered Cognizant on Tuesday announced the acquisition of Zenith Technologies, a life sciences manufacturing technology services company. More than 800 of the Ireland-based company's employees will become part of Cognizant's Life Sciences business unit post the transaction. This is the second Irish company being acquired by Cognizant this year following the acquisition of Meritsoft.

headlines: Redmi K20 Pro now world's fastest phone based on AnTuTu score
text: Ahead of its official India launch, Redmi K20 Pro has outscored every other device in the market with an AnTuTu score of 388,803. "Which is the World's Fastest Smartphone? #RedmiK20Pro of course!", Xiaomi India MD Manu Kumar Jain tweeted. The Snapdragon 855-powered Redmi K20 Pro received a higher AnTuTu score than the recently launched OnePlus 7 Pro.

headlines: WWE's Heyman threatens Ranveer for 'using' catchphrase for Pandya
text: WWE's Paul Heyman, the manager of Brock Lesnar, threatened to sue Ranveer Singh for paraphrasing his mantra 'Eat. Sleep. Conquer. Repeat.' while praising Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya. "Eat. Sleep. Dominate. Repeat. The name is Hardik. Hardik Pandya," Ranveer had tweeted for Pandya. "Are you f*n kidding me? I am litigious...EAT. SLEEP. DEPOSITION. REPEAT," Heyman tweeted.

headlines: YouTube too big to be completely fixed: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
text: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai has said company-owned video sharing platform YouTube is "too big" to be completely fixed in terms of videos of hate speech. YouTube has recently made "significant revisions" to its hate speech policy and removed over nine million videos in the last quarter, Pichai said. "Let's say we're getting it right 99% of the time," he added.

headlines: SP leader Santosh Punem kidnapped, killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh
text: Maoists have killed Samajwadi Party leader Santosh Punem in the insurgency-hit Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh, police said on Wednesday. Punem, who also worked as a contractor, was abducted from a construction site in Marimalla village on Tuesday evening. Police stated that the crime spot is "deep in the jungles" and a police party has been sent there for investigation.

headlines: I see my dear friend Rajiv in you: Punjab CM to Rahul on birthday
text: Wishing Congress chief Rahul Gandhi a happy birthday, Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh tweeted, "Proud of who you have become over the years; I see my dear friend Rajiv in you." Sharing a photograph of himself with Rahul, Amarinder added, "May God bless you with a long, healthy and prosperous life."

headlines: Mithai lelo: Rahul distributes sweets among journos on birthday
text: On the occasion of his 49th birthday, Congress President Rahul Gandhi distributed sweets among media personnel at the AICC Headquarters in New Delhi on Wednesday. Thanking media personnel who wished him a happy birthday, he said, "Arre, mithai toh lelo." He also tweeted, "Thank you all for your best wishes... I'm overwhelmed & grateful for your love & affection."

headlines: Swiggy in talks to raise up to $200 mn from Carlyle Group: Report
text: Swiggy is in talks to raise up to $200 million, seeking a valuation of $4.5 billion, from US-based private equity fund Carlyle Group, Livemint reported. Swiggy was reportedly valued at $3.3 billion following a $1-billion Naspers-led funding round in December 2018. If successful, this would be Carlyle's second Indian technology startup bet after e-commerce logistics firm Delhivery, Livemint added.

headlines: Most Vision Fund investors want to join 2nd fund: SoftBank CEO
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son on Wednesday said that most of its $100-billion Vision Fund's investors are willing to join its forthcoming second fund. He added the discussions with the investors will begin soon. Son had officially announced the second fund in May, adding it would be launched 'soon' even if SoftBank was initially the only investor.

headlines: 3 students injured as roof plaster falls during class in Maharashtra
text: At least three girl students of a school in Maharashtra's Ulhasnagar were injured on Tuesday after a portion of the roof's cement plaster fell on them as they were attending a class. The incident took place in Jhulelal School and was captured on the CCTV camera installed in the classroom. The school administration said it was a "minor incident".

headlines: Kerala teacher expelled for giving birth after 4 months of marriage
text: A 33-year-old government school teacher in Kerala has alleged the school did not let her rejoin service after her maternity leave because she gave birth after four months of marriage. She accused the parent-teacher association of verbally abusing her. She had reportedly started living with her partner before marrying him because of a delay in divorce from her first husband.

headlines: Amid Encephalitis deaths in Bihar, Odisha to test litchis
text: Amid the outbreak of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district, the Odisha government directed officials to ascertain the toxic content in litchis being sold in the state. Reports have claimed Encephalitis is spreading in litchi growing areas of Bihar, and that litchi consumption is one of the factors that helped spread the disease.

headlines: 6 MBBS students suspended for beating up shopkeeper in Lucknow
text: Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Institute of Medical Sciences in Lucknow suspended six MBBS students on Tuesday for allegedly beating up a shopkeeper. The shopkeeper had reportedly objected when a student sprayed deodorant over his shirt from a new, sealed bottle without asking him. The shopkeeper said about two dozen students entered the shop and beat him up.

headlines: US Defence Secy nominee quits race over alleged domestic violence
text: US' Acting Defence Secretary Patrick Shanahan has announced his decision to withdraw from consideration over a permanent role over allegations of domestic violence. The FBI is investigating a 2010 incident in which Shanahan and his ex-wife accused each other of assault. Public disclosure of the incident would traumatise his children, Shanahan said while announcing his decision.

headlines: Trump launches campaign to run for US President again in 2020
text: US President Donald Trump officially launched his campaign to run for office again in 2020 on Tuesday. "A vote for any Democrat in 2020 is a vote for the rise of radical socialism and the destruction of the American dream," the Republican President said. "I promise you I will never ever let you down," Trump told his supporters.

headlines: Deepika, Kendall attend Youth Anxiety Center charity event in NY
text: Deepika Padukone and model Kendall Jenner were photographed together on Tuesday at a fundraising dinner hosted by New YorkPresbyterian Hospital. The event sought to raise funds for the Youth Anxiety Center in New York, which offers treatment to young people dealing with depression and anxiety. Deepika spoke about her battle with depression while addressing the audience at the event.

headlines: Sonakshi to star in film on Paralympics medallist Deepa Malik: Report
text: Sonakshi Sinha will reportedly star in a biopic based on Rio Paralympics silver medallist Deepa Malik, who became the first Indian woman to win a medal in Paralympics in 2016. The film will be produced by actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar and producer Ritesh Sidhwani's production company Excel Entertainment. Sidhwani had announced that the film's script was being developed in 2017.

headlines: I spoke about my past relationship as media was interested: Katrina
text: While speaking about sharing details of her past relationship with the media, actress Katrina Kaif said, "I chose to talk about it because the media was interested." "If I had my way, I would have never spoken about my relationship," she added. Katrina further said that although heartbreak was difficult to deal with, it helped her evolve as a person.

headlines: Twitter to remove precise location tagging in tweets
text: Twitter through its Support account on the platform tweeted it will remove precise location tagging in tweets as most people don't use this feature. However, the microblogging platform tweeted, users will still be able to tag precise location in tweets through its updated camera. "[W]e're removing this ability to simplify your Tweeting experience," the tweet further stated.

headlines: Would've attended all-party meeting if it was on EVMs: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati said she would've attended the all-party meeting called by the PM if it was on EVMs. She added that the talks about "one nation, one election" are just a "diversionary tactic" from public issues like poverty. Mayawati said the government's "stubbornness" of conducting elections through EVMs instead of the ballot paper is the "real threat" to democracy.

headlines: Cong worker performs havan outside Rahul's home on his birthday
text: Congress worker Phool Singh performed a havan outside the residence of Congress President Rahul Gandhi on his 49th birthday on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot tweeted, "Warmest birthday greetings to Shri Rahul Gandhi Ji. May he be blessed with long and healthy life." Further, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala praised Rahul's "indomitable courage in face of every adversity".

headlines: Bira beer maker looking to raise $100 million in funding
text: B9 Beverages, the maker of Bira 91 brand of craft beer, has launched its "biggest-ever fundraise of as much as $100 million", Livemint reported. Of this amount, $20 million will reportedly be raised in an internal round. Earlier this year, Delhi-based B9 Beverages had raised about $4.3 million in a funding round from Sixth Sense Ventures, as per regulatory filings.

headlines: CRPF to launch 'save environment' campaign during Amarnath Yatra
text: Apart from performing its primary duty of providing security, the CRPF will launch a "save environment" campaign during the Amarnath Yatra starting from July 1. The CRPF has prepared the hoardings and banners and will display these on prominent places along the yatra route, an official said. "We expect the pilgrims and locals to extend their cooperation," the official added.

headlines: Iceland Cricket mock Rashid over 110 runs, cricketers defend him
text: Iceland Cricket mocked Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan for conceding 110 runs against England. Defending Rashid, Stuart Broad tweeted, "He's a world class bowler & a delight to watch. Everyone has bad days in our sport." Meanwhile, Luke Wright wrote, "Rubbish tweet. Rather than trying to be funny why not be respectful to someone that has done so much for cricket."

headlines: BJP MP Om Birla takes charge as new Lok Sabha Speaker
text: BJP MP from Kota, Om Birla, has been elected as the next Lok Sabha speaker. Birla is a two-time MP from Kota and a three-time MLA from the Kota South Assembly seat. He will take the charge from party MP Virendra Kumar, who was appointed as the pro-tem speaker of the lower house on Monday.

headlines: Actor who featured in 'Bharat' works as delivery boy in free time
text: Actor Chetan Rao, who has done small character roles in the Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat' and in the TV series 'Savdhaan India', works as a delivery boy in Delhi during his free time to support himself financially. "Sometimes people recognise me, sometimes they don't. It feels good when they say they've seen my work," the 29-year-old said.

headlines: Tahira apologises after criticism for sitting on Buddha's statue
text: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife Tahira Kashyap has apologised to fans on Instagram after being criticised for sharing a photo in which she was seen sitting on a statue of Lord Buddha. "I absolutely never want to be a source of hurt and pain for anyone. Sorry for unintentionally agonising few people," she wrote. Tahira also deleted the picture from Instagram.

headlines: Body of India's Got Talent post producer found in a lake in Mumbai
text: Sohan Chauhan, a senior post producer, who has worked on shows like India's Got Talent 7 and MasterChef India 6, has been found dead. His body was recovered from a pond in the Royal Palms society in Mumbai. According to the CCTV footage of his building, Sohan was seen stepping out on Sunday with a bottle in his hand.

headlines: Man invades pitch during Afghanistan-England match, dislodges bails
text: During Afghanistan's 24th over against England in the 2019 World Cup on Tuesday, a man invaded the pitch after evading security and managed to knock the bails off. Security personnel then managed to catch a hold of him and escorted him out of the stadium. It was the first case of pitch invasion in the 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Mali Women record lowest ever total in T20I cricket history
text: Mali Women recorded the lowest ever total in T20I history (both men's and women's) after getting all out for 6 runs in 9 overs against Rwanda on Tuesday. Ten of Mali's players failed to open their account, while their opening batsman top-scored with 1(6). Rwanda chased down the target in four deliveries. The previous lowest total was 14 (China Women).

headlines: Wash my lunchbox: Air India pilot orders crew; argument delays flight
text: An Air India pilot and a crew member got into an altercation in a flight at Bengaluru airport after the former allegedly ordered the junior staff to wash his lunchbox on Monday. The incident delayed the flight by around two hours. An Air India spokesperson confirmed the incident, adding the pilot and the crew member have been de-rostered pending inquiry.

headlines: Union Minister's 26-yr-old son held in attempt to murder case in MP
text: Union Minister Prahlad Singh Patel's son Prabal Patel was arrested on Tuesday in an attempt to murder case that left four people injured in a clash in Madhya Pradesh. Six more people were arrested and the minister's nephew and BJP MLA JS Patel's son Monu has also been booked. Prabal is alleged to have led the attack following an altercation.

headlines: Water scarcity not created in a day: HC criticises TN govt
text: The Madras High Court has criticised the Tamil Nadu government for alleged mismanagement of water resources. It said the government knew very well there'd be water scarcity but didn't take any water management efforts. The government submitted a report, by Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board, stating water supply to Chennai was reduced from 830 MLD to 525 MLD.

headlines: My land is taken, parents threatened: Jawan seeks help on video
text: A 26-year-old Army jawan, S Swamy, from Telangana has alleged that his family's six-acre agricultural land has been "encroached" and his parents have been threatened. Swamy in a video message accused a man who 'managed' Revenue Department employees. "In our country everyone says 'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan', but there's no protection to properties belonging to jawans or farmers," he added.

headlines: Boeing wins first order for 737 Max jet since Ethiopian crash
text: British Airways parent IAG has announced plans to buy 200 Boeing 737 Max aircraft, in the US planemaker's first deal for the model since the Ethiopian Airlines crash in March. The fleet, a mixture of 737 Max 8 and Max 10 variants, is valued at $24 billion at list prices. Boeing's been working on a software fix for the jet.

headlines: Priyanka's 4th wax statue unveiled at Madame Tussauds London
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra's fourth wax figure was unveiled at the Madame Tussauds wax museum in London. The actress' statue, dressed in a gold sequinned Ralph Lauren gown, has been styled to match her appearance at the 2017 Golden Globe Awards. Besides London, Priyanka also has wax statues in New York, Sydney and Singapore.

headlines: GoT actor who played Ser Rodrik Cassel to feature in Madhavan's film
text: Actor Ron Donachie, best known for playing Ser Rodrik Cassel in 'Game of Thrones', will feature in R Madhavan's upcoming film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. Actress Phyllis Logan, who portrayed Mrs Hughes in British drama series 'Downton Abbey', will also be seen in the film. Thanking them for being part of his film, Madhavan shared a picture with the actors.

headlines: Sexuality seen as more offensive than violence: Abhay on censorship
text: Speaking about censorship on digital platforms, actor Abhay Deol said, "[I]t baffles me how sexuality seems to be far more offensive than violence." "If you have to be thorough in censoring content, you would have to censor the Internet," he added. Abhay further said that he is in favour of granting age-based certification.

headlines: Ex-Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh's son booked in chit fund scam
text: Former Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh's son Abhishek Singh and 19 others were booked on the charge of cheating in an alleged chit fund scam in Surguja, police said. Abhishek, ex-BJP MP Madhusudan Yadav and Congress' Naresh Dakaliya had allegedly acted as star campaigners for the company, which shut operations in 2016. Meanwhile, Abhishek denied having any connection with the company.

headlines: Wish you good health, long life: PM to Rahul on his birthday
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on the occasion of his 49th birthday on Wednesday, tweeting, "Best wishes to Shri Rahul Gandhi on his birthday. May he be blessed with good health and a long life." Meanwhile, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "Greetings and good wishes to Shri Rahul Gandhi on his birthday."

headlines: Karnataka Cong's Roshan Baig suspended for anti-party activities
text: Karnataka Congress MLA R Roshan Baig was suspended on Tuesday with immediate effect on account of anti-party activities. The AICC approved the proposal sent by the KPCC to take action against Baig and suspended him on the basis of an inquiry, a Congress release said. Following Congress' debacle in recent general polls, Baig had criticised state party leadership too.

headlines: Ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah holds 'chai pe charcha' in Jammu
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday held a National Conference (NC) version of 'chai pe charcha' at a tea stall of one of his fans in Jammu. Abdullah said J&K was passing through a difficult phase and urged people to show grit "for the restoration of democracy". He added there's no substitute to a democratically elected government.

headlines: Waiter stabs colleague to death outside Delhi restaurant
text: A waiter from Nepal has been arrested for allegedly stabbing to death his 22-year-old colleague Rahul outside a restaurant in Delhi on Monday night. The accused, Kamal, had quarrelled with Rahul after questioning him on the way he served customers. Rahul's friend Pawan, who was injured while trying to save him, is stated to be out of danger.

headlines: UK Sinha panel on MSMEs submits report to RBI
text: The RBI on Tuesday said the UK Sinha-led panel, formed to look into the issues of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs), has submitted its report. The eight-member panel was formed in January to comprehensively review and propose long-term solutions for revival of the sector. Its members included SBI Managing Director PK Gupta and ICICI Bank Executive Director Anup Bagchi.

headlines: England go top of WC points table with 150-run win over Afghanistan
text: England defeated Afghanistan by 150 runs today to go top of 2019 World Cup points table with four victories in five matches. The victory was England's third biggest in World Cup history, while Afghanistan have now lost each of their first five 2019 World Cup matches. Afghanistan are the only team without a victory in 2019 World Cup so far.

headlines: Jasleen files complaint against Deepak over 'distasteful' video on her
text: Bigg Boss 12 contestant Jasleen Matharu has filed a complaint against co-contestant Deepak Thakur over an alleged 'distasteful' video on her. In the video, Deepak can be seen asking his young cousin what he would do inside the 'Bigg Boss' house, after which the child says that he'd like to have fun and go to the swimming pool with Jasleen.

headlines: What records were broken during England-Afghanistan World Cup match?
text: England smashed the most sixes by a team (25) in an ODI, while their captain Eoin Morgan recorded most sixes by a batsman in an ODI (17). Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan became the first ever bowler to concede 11 sixes in an ODI. Morgan smashed seven sixes off Rashid, the most by a batsman against any bowler in an ODI.

headlines: BCCI turns down Afghanistan's request to host APL in India
text: The BCCI has turned down Afghanistan Cricket Board's request to host its T20 league in India. "It wouldn't be appropriate to consider hosting Afghanistan Premier League (APL) in India as we have our own league (IPL)," an official said. The ACB officials had conveyed their request to BCCI CEO Rahul Johri and GM Cricket Operations Saba Karim on May 16.

headlines: Yuvraj writes to BCCI, seeks nod to play in overseas T20 leagues
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has formally written to the BCCI seeking the boards permission to play in T20 leagues around the world. This comes after the all-rounder announced his retirement from international cricket on June 10. Notably, the BCCI doesn't allow an active cricketer to take part in overseas T20 leagues.

headlines: Rohit Sharma will be 2019 World Cup's Man of the Series: Yuvraj
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has predicted that Team India opener Rohit Sharma will win the 2019 World Cup's Man of the Series award. The 32-year-old Rohit has scored 319 runs in three innings in the 2019 World Cup so far. Notably, Yuvraj Singh had won the Man of the Series award in the 2011 World Cup.

headlines: Pakistani cricketers are allowed to have burgers: Harbhajan Singh
text: After Pakistani fans criticised Pakistan cricketers for having burgers and pizzas ahead of their match against India in 2019 World Cup, Harbhajan Singh said that Pakistani cricketers are allowed to have burgers. "It's their wish what they want to do," he added. Harbhajan further said that if Pakistan don't get into the semi-finals, Sarfaraz Ahmed will lose his captaincy.

headlines: Looking tough, but not impossible: WI captain on reaching WC semis
text: West Indies captain Jason Holder has said that his team's chances of reaching 2019 World Cup semi-finals are looking tough at the present moment but it's not impossible. "We have to play every game here now as a final," Holder added. West Indies are currently seventh on the points table after one victory and three losses in five matches.

headlines: India intimidate Pakistan: Former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis
text: Former Pakistan captain Waqar Younis has said that the current Indian cricket team intimidates Pakistan. "When Pakistan teams head into these games, they are always under pressure and feel like they're the weaker team," he added. "That culture needs to change first, and then the fitness level needs to match the Indian players," he further said.

headlines: Viral image shows scale of melting ice in Greenland
text: A photo showing sled dogs wading through water ankle-deep on top of a melting ice sheet in Greenland has gone viral. The picture taken by Steffen Olsen from the Centre for Ocean and Ice at the Danish Meteorological Institute shows the scale of melting ice in Greenland. Olsen said the ice sheet beneath the water was 1.2 metres thick.

headlines: NIFT fires 56 housekeepers who accused staffer of sexual harassment
text: NIFT Hyderabad has fired 56 female housekeepers who accused a senior employee of sexual harassment and asked their agency to send replacements. Housekeeping staff supervisor Ratna Kumari lodged a case against Srinivas Reddy in October 2018 for sexually harassing employees. Some of the housekeeping staffers who have been asked to leave worked at the campus for more than ten years.

headlines: 2 dead, 6 injured as raft capsizes in J&K's Pahalgam
text: Two persons, including a tourism department employee, died and at least six others were injured on Tuesday when a raft capsized in Lidder river in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. The incident took place during a rafting championship held as a tribute to Rauf Ahmad Dar, a local guide who died last month while rescuing five tourists in the same river.

headlines: Teen who suggested shooting Prince Harry for marrying Meghan jailed
text: A teenager who called UK's Prince Harry a "race traitor" for marrying Meghan Markle and suggested to shoot him was jailed for over four years. Michal Szewczuk had created an image of Harry with a pistol to his head against a blood-covered background. Szewczuk along with another teenager promoted the ideology of right-wing groups influenced by neo-Nazism, the court said.

headlines: I will avenge Pakistan's loss to India on July 12: Boxer Amir Khan
text: Pakistani origin British boxer Amir Khan has said he'll avenge Pakistan's defeat against India in 2019 World Cup by knocking Indian boxer Neeraj Goyat out in their upcoming fight on July 12. He also offered to help Pakistan team with some advice on how to stay fit and strong. Pakistan's defeat was their worst against India in World Cup history.

headlines: David Warner more of a thinking cricketer now: Michael Slater
text: Former Australian opener Michael Slater spoke about Australian opener David Warner, saying, "I think this is the new David Warner, he is more of a thinking cricketer now." "He has been adjusting to the conditions and has understood his role better," Slater said about Warner, who has hit half-centuries against Afghanistan and India at the World Cup 2019.

headlines: Nobody forced Neymar to sign for PSG: PSG chief
text: Speaking about PSG forward Neymar Jr, PSG chief Nasser Al-Khelaifi said, "Nobody forced him to sign here. Nobody pushed him. He came knowingly to join a project." Neymar has scored 34 goals in 37 Ligue 1 games but has missed 47 matches across all competitions since arriving at the Parc des Princes from Barcelona.

headlines: Google Calendar faces outage an hour after promotion on Twitter
text: Google Calendar experienced a service outage, wherein affected users were unable to access the service, about an hour after G Suite tweeted a video promoting it. The service reportedly went down majorly in regions including the US, UK and Europe. "We expect to resolve...issue impacting a majority of Google Calendar users today at 10:40 am PT," Google tweeted.

headlines: Delhi Cong protests against AAP over water, power shortage
text: Delhi Congress on Tuesday protested in all 70 Assembly constituencies of the national capital over alleged water and power scarcity. The protests were led by party's Delhi chief Sheila Dikshit. "We're holding protest to remind (Aam Aadmi Party) government to improve Delhi's water and electricity issues. Nobody should suffer because of the scarcity of these basic necessities," she said.

headlines: Protestors shout 'go back' as Nitish Kumar meets AES patients
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday faced protest by a crowd shouting "wapas jao (go back)" as he met Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) patients and their families. Protestors were upset as it was the CM's first visit since the AES outbreak in the region. As per reports, 133 children have died due to AES till now.

headlines: SAT grants relief to Prannoy, Radhika Roy against SEBI order
text: The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) on Tuesday granted a three-month stay on market regulator SEBI's order barring NDTV promoters Prannoy Roy and Radhika Roy from holding managerial positions at the news network. SEBI had held that Roys didn't disclose material information about three loan agreements to minority shareholders. The couple called the SEBI order "outrageous and bad in law".

headlines: Sanjay Dutt likely to be the face of Centre's anti-drug campaign
text: Actor Sanjay Dutt will likely become the brand ambassador for Centre's anti-drug campaign, reports quoting officials aware of the development said on Tuesday. "Dutt is an icon, who has spoken about his experience with drug abuse," a Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment official said. The Ministry has prepared a national action plan for drug demand reduction for 2018-2025.

headlines: Afghanistan captain tries to pull Eoin Morgan to get him run out
text: Afghanistan captain Gulbadin Naib tried to pull England captain Eoin Morgan to get him run out while the latter was turning back to his crease after deciding against a single. The resulting collision knocked Morgan's bat out of his hands, but he reached the crease safely. Seeming apologetic, Naib laughed and picked up the bat and handed it to Morgan.

headlines: Hussain mocks himself after fan trolls him over Morgan's 6s record
text: Former England captain Nasser Hussain mocked himself after a fan compared Eoin Morgan's record for most sixes in an ODI innings with his career sixes' record. "Eoin Morgan 17 sixes today. Nasser Hussain hit 15 sixes in 88 ODIs," the fan wrote. "And [Morgan] did it with a bad back," Nasser responded, referring to Morgan's injury.

headlines: Amir urges Pakistan fans to not abuse players after loss vs India
text: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir has urged Pakistan fans to not abuse the players after their 89-run defeat against India in the 2019 World Cup. "Please don't use bad words for the players...yes you guys can criticise our performance...we will bounce back. InshAllah. We need your support," he tweeted. Notably, Pakistan have never defeated India in World Cup history.

headlines: EC shares pic of officials who travelled 480 km in jungle for 1 voter
text: Election Commission of India (ECI) has shared a picture of officials who travelled 480 kilometres to set up a polling booth for a single voter in Malogam, Arunachal Pradesh during the 17th Lok Sabha elections. They took over four days to travel through the remotest jungle terrains. "ECI expresses gratitude to such Silent Ranks for their dedication," the ECI said.

headlines: Ration in kind provision restored for army officers in peace areas
text: The Centre has restored the provision of ration in kind to military officers stationed in peace areas. The government had stopped the ration for such officers in 2017 based on a recommendation of the Seventh Central Pay Commission and had instead started paying them a certain amount per day. Ministry of Defence had proposed the restoration of ration in kind.

headlines: Millionaire jailed after man helping him build nuclear bunker dies
text: Daniel Beckwitt, an American millionaire stock trader has been jailed for nine years over the death of a man hired to dig tunnels for a secret nuclear bunker under his house. Askia Khafra was carving out passageways under Beckwitt's house when a fire broke out. Beckwitt was building the bunker over concerns about a possible nuclear attack by North Korea.

headlines: Anyone who is anything has definitely been trolled: Shahid
text: When asked about his take on trolling during an episode of 'BFFs With Vogue', actor Shahid Kapoor said, "Anybody who is anything in this generation has definitely been trolled." "If you have not, then you are not anybody," the actor added. Shahid further said that he tells himself that the more he gets trolled, the more important he is.

headlines: England register their highest ever team total in a WC match
text: England registered their highest ever team total in a World Cup match after reaching 397/6 against Afghanistan at the World Cup 2019 on Tuesday. This was also England's sixth highest team total in ODI history. The innings featured 25 sixes, with England captain Eoin Morgan hitting 17. England hit a total of 21 fours in their innings.

headlines: Keen on deepening engagement with Indian startups: WhatsApp
text: WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose said the platform is focussed on deepening engagement with the startup ecosystem in India. WhatsApp also announced the five winners of the 'Startup India - WhatsApp Grand Challenge', who were awarded $50,000 each. The winning startups, selected from close to 2,000 entries that applied to the challenge, were MinionLabs, MedCords, Melzo, Javis, and Gramophone.

headlines: TMC MLA, 12 councillors, Congress spokesperson join BJP
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Biswajit Das along with 12 TMC councillors and Congress spokesperson Prasanjeet Ghosh joined BJP on Tuesday. They joined the saffron party in presence of BJP leaders Kailash Vijayvargiya and Mukul Roy. "Many TMC leaders are joining our party because West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has spread violence...and her party members no longer support her," Vijayvargiya said.

headlines: Only e-vehicles should be sold after 2030 in India: NITI Aayog
text: NITI Aayog has reportedly proposed that only electric vehicles be sold in India after 2030. NITI Aayog reportedly moved a cabinet note, asking that responsibilities be assigned to different ministries, proposing that the Road Transport and Highways Ministry prepare a framework to phase out diesel and petrol vehicles' sale by 2030. It reportedly also proposed piloting an e-highways programme.

headlines: Myntra, Jabong ex-CEO invests in scooter rental startup Vogo
text: Bengaluru-based scooter rental startup Vogo has raised an undisclosed amount from a clutch of investors including former Myntra and Jabong CEO Ananth Narayanan. Serial entrepreneur K Ganesh, among others, also participated in the round. Founded by Anand Ayyadurai, Padmanabhan Balakrishnan and Sanchit Mittal, Vogo has raised $120.6 million in disclosed funding so far, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: No doubt SpaceX capsule explosion will delay flight program: NASA
text: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine has said that the April explosion of SpaceX's Crew Dragon capsule, meant for human spaceflight, will "no doubt" change the schedule for NASA's flight program. The program is NASA's drive to return Americans to the International Space Station from US soil later this year, Reuters reported. "It wont be what was originally planned," Bridenstine further added.

headlines: Militants hurl grenade at J&K police station, 10 civilians injured
text: Militants on Tuesday threw a grenade at a police station in Kashmir's Pulwama injuring at least 10 civilians. As per the reports, three civilians got severely wounded and were referred to a hospital in Srinagar. The attack was carried out hours after an encounter in Anantnag which led to the elimination of two Jaish-e-Mohammed operatives.

headlines: Xi Jinping to be 1st Chinese President to visit N Korea in 14 yrs
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit North Korea on Thursday, becoming the first Chinese leader to visit the country in 14 years. Xi's visit comes amid renewed tensions between the US and North Korea over efforts to persuade the regime to give up its nuclear weapons. The invitation was made by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

headlines: Indiabulls Housing appoints Chief Risk Officer after new rules
text: Indiabulls Housing Finance on Monday said it has named Naveen Uppal as Chief Risk Officer to comply with regulator National Housing Bank's direction. Uppal has been associated with Indiabulls Housing Finance for 12 years and presently heads Risk and Compliance. He'll directly report to the company's Vice-Chairman, MD and CEO or the board-constituted risk management committee of the company.

headlines: Domestic air traffic grows 3% in May after slump in April
text: India's domestic air passenger traffic grew 3% year-on-year in May, after registering a slump in April amid the grounding of Jet Airways, aviation regulator DGCA revealed. Domestic carriers carried a total of 1.22 crore passengers in May compared to 1.19 crore passengers a year ago. IndiGo clocked in a 49% market share during the month by carrying 59.8 lakh passengers.

headlines: Govt considers selling control in some weak banks: Reports
text: The government is reportedly considering selling controlling stakes in some of the smaller state-run banks to raise funds for the rural housing programme. If the plan is finalised, the government will need to amend a law to enable it to sell majority control in state-run banks. The plan could be included in the Union Budget, reports added.

headlines: Eoin Morgan breaks world record for hitting most sixes in an ODI
text: England captain Eoin Morgan set the world record for most sixes (17) in an ODI, achieving the feat during his 71-ball 148-run knock against Afghanistan in World Cup today. The previous record (16 sixes) was jointly held by Rohit Sharma, Chris Gayle and AB de Villiers. Morgan also smashed the fastest World Cup hundred by an England player (57 balls).

headlines: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury named leader of Congress in Lok Sabha
text: Congress has named Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury as its leader in the Lok Sabha, reportedly after party President Rahul Gandhi refused to take up the post. The decision was taken at a meeting in the presence of Rahul and Sonia Gandhi. A letter has been written to Lok Sabha, mentioning Chowdhury would represent the party at all important selection committees.

headlines: Fan leaves her wedding celebrations to meet actor Vikrant Massey
text: A fan of actor Vikrant Massey left her wedding celebrations to meet him on the sets of his film in Delhi. Vikrant, who met the fan, said, "I was very humbled but...I couldn't let her leave her wedding functions on the day she was getting married." "I had to ensure that she returns safely to her family," he added.

headlines: It was my loss: Parineeti on not being able to star in 'Piku'
text: Parineeti Chopra revealed on 'BFFs with Vogue' that she was approached for the 2015 film 'Piku'. "I didn't really turn down the film...there was confusion. I was going to do another film at the same time and then that film also didn't happen, so it was my loss," she said. Deepika Padukone eventually went on to play the titular role.

headlines: Morgan smashes fastest hundred by an England player in World Cup
text: England captain Eoin Morgan reached the three-figure mark off 57 balls against Afghanistan on Tuesday to record the fastest hundred by an England player in World Cup history. He also became the second fastest player to slam a hundred as captain in World Cup history. Overall, it was the fourth fastest hundred in World Cup history.

headlines: Rashid Khan 1st spinner in history to give away 100 runs in an ODI
text: World number three ODI bowler Rashid Khan has become the first spinner in history to give away 100 runs in an ODI. The 20-year-old Afghan conceded 110 runs including 11 sixes and three fours off his nine overs against England in their 2019 World Cup match today. As many as 12 fast bowlers have conceded 100+ runs in an ODI.

headlines: What is Facebook's new Libra cryptocurrency and who controls it?
text: Facebook's new cryptocurrency Libra, expected to launch next year, is a 'stablecoin' backed by a collection of currencies and other assets. The currency will be serviced by Geneva-based not-for-profit organisation Libra Association, whose members include Mastercard, Uber and Vodafone. Facebook will launch Calibra, a wallet that individuals and merchants can use to store, send and receive Libras.

headlines: Mamata unlikely to attend all-party meet called by PM Modi tomorrow
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is unlikely to attend the meeting with all political party chiefs called by PM Narendra Modi in Delhi on Wednesday. Mamata wrote a letter to Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi, saying 'one nation, one election' issue, which is one of the agendas of the meeting, requires expert consultations, instead of dealing with it hurriedly.

headlines: Owner of car used in Pulwama attack on CRPF killed in encounter
text: Jaish-e-Mohammed operative Sajad Bhat, owner of the car used in the February 14 Pulwama terror attack on CRPF jawans, was killed in an encounter in J&K's Anantnag on Tuesday. Tawseef Ahmad Bhat, another Jaish operative linked to the Pulwama attack, was also killed in the encounter. As many as 40 CRPF jawans were martyred in the attack earlier this year.

headlines: 'Mandir wahin banayenge' slogans raised as Sakshi Maharaj takes oath
text: Slogans of 'Mandir wahin banayenge' were raised in Lok Sabha as Sakshi Maharaj, BJP MP from Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, took oath on Tuesday. He took the oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans, following which someone shouted, "Mandir wahin banayenge". Notably, he had won by a margin of four lakh votes.

headlines: Woman with drugs hidden in sanitary pads held at Bengaluru airport
text: Officials of the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) have arrested a woman from Bengaluru airport, recruited to smuggle drugs from Bengaluru to Doha by hiding them inside sanitary pads. Following her arrest, three others who accompanied her to the airport and their two handlers were arrested. Drugs, including 510 grams of methamphetamine and 572 Lyrica capsules, were concealed inside the pads.

headlines: 6 boys dragged me, 15 beat my Uber driver: Ex-Miss India Universe
text: Former Miss India Universe Ushoshi Sengupta claimed six boys dragged her out from her Uber cab and tried to delete a video she took showing them attack her car in Kolkata on Monday. "Few boys on a bike hit my Uber...In a fraction of second, there were 15 boys...they beat the driver," Ushoshi said. She further accused police of inaction.

headlines: Bella Hadid apologises to Saudi, UAE after Insta story sparks row
text: Model Bella Hadid has issued an apology to Saudi Arabia and the UAE after an Instagram story shared by her was deemed offensive by some social media users. Hadid had shared an image which showed her foot in front of planes bearing the flags of Saudi Arabia and the UAE. "I never noticed the planes in the background," she said.

headlines: Pakistan central bank chief dismisses idea of free floating rupee
text: New State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) Governor Reza Baqir on Monday dismissed the idea of a free floating rupee. Pakistan's policy is a "market-based exchange rate system" that follows supply and demand, but that will not be left completely to the market, Baqir said. Notably, the Pakistani rupee has lost almost 50% of its value since December 2017.

headlines: Indian cricket bowling has never been healthier: Manjrekar
text: Sanjay Manjrekar praised India's bowling unit, saying, "While talking about Bhuvi's injury, Virat said we have Shami in the reserves, just in case. I could see the pride in his eyes when he said that. Indian cricket (bowling) has never been healthier." Kohli talked about Bhuvneshwar's injury, saying that he might miss two or three matches at the World Cup.

headlines: Deleted Samsung tweet advises users to scan smart TV for malware
text: Samsung Support USA's account in a now-deleted tweet advised users of its smart TVs to scan them every few weeks to prevent malicious software attacks. The tweet highlighted Samsung's QLED TV and included an instructional video to help users scan for viruses, screenshots in reports showed. Samsung said it was simply a way to inform consumers about a product feature.

headlines: 10 parties support Om Birla's nomination as LS speaker
text: NDA candidate for Lok Sabha Speaker's post, Om Birla has got the support of ten political parties including Biju Janata Dal (BJD) and YSR Congress Party for his candidature. "I've spoken to Congress leaders...They haven't signed till now but I think they wouldn't oppose (it)," Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said. Birla won from Kota seat in the general election.

headlines: Hema Malini takes oath as LS MP, ends it with 'Radhe Radhe'
text: BJP's Hema Malini took oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha on Tuesday and concluded it with "Radhe Radhe! Krishnam Vande, Jagat Guru." Malini won Mathura seat for the second time in a row, defeating RLD candidate Kunwar Narendra Singh by over 2.9 lakh votes. In 2014 Lok Sabha elections, Malini won by over 3 lakh votes.

headlines: E-tailers told to submit draft e-comm policy concerns in 10 days
text: Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal has asked e-commerce representatives to submit their concerns pertaining to the draft e-commerce policy to the government within 10 days. This was discussed during a meeting held by the minister with e-commerce and technology industry representatives. Goyal reportedly assured all industry representatives that the government will address each concern.

headlines: Man dies after jumping in front of metro at Civil Lines
text: A man committed suicide on Tuesday by jumping in front of a metro train at Civil Lines Metro Station in Delhi, causing disruption in services on the Yellow Line. The DMRC took to Twitter to inform commuters about the delay in services between Vishwavidyalaya and Kashmere Gate. The services were later resumed to normal at around 2 pm.

headlines: Man who shared NZ mosques shooting video jailed for 21 months
text: A man who shared the video of the shootings at the two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, earlier this year, was sentenced to 21 months in prison on Tuesday. Philip Arps had pleaded guilty to two charges of distributing objectionable material after sharing copies of the video with about 30 people. The suspected gunman had live-streamed the shootings on Facebook.

headlines: Last two directors on Jet Airways board step down
text: Jet Airways on Tuesday said Ashok Chawla and Sharad Sharma, the last two directors on its board, have resigned. The independent directors quit due to the board's non-compliance with provisions of the Companies Act, non-appointment of additional directors and the halt in the process of bank-led resolution plan. Jet's lenders have moved NCLT to initiate insolvency proceedings against the airline.

headlines: ONGC to auction over 60 fields to private operators: Reports
text: State-run ONGC will shortly auction over 60 small and marginal fields to private companies under the production enhancement contracts (PEC) mechanism, reports said. Under PEC, private firms invest and introduce comprehensive technologies to improve production, while the ownership of the fields rests with ONGC. The small and marginal fields are said to contribute only 5% to ONGC's total production.

headlines: If someone rapes you, you don't text him 'Hi Sweety': Karan Oberoi
text: Speaking about the false rape allegations against him, actor Karan Oberoi said, "If somebody rapes you, then you don't text him saying, 'Hi Sweety!'" "Also, you won't ask for sex or plead with the 'rapist' to answer your calls...You can't make these charges in a frivolous manner," he added. The woman who made the false allegations was arrested on Monday.

headlines: 4 get life imprisonment in 2005 Ayodhya terror attack case
text: A special court in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj today sentenced four accused in the 2005 Ayodhya terror attack to life imprisonment and acquitted another. On 5 July 2005, a terrorist conducted a suicide bombing to breach Babri Masjid-Ram Janmabhoomi site's security and five terrorists subsequently attempted to attack the 'Sita Rasoi' area. All five terrorists were gunned down by CRPF personnel.

headlines: Virat Kohli changed the face of Indian cricket forever: Ranveer
text: Ranveer Singh, while praising captain Virat Kohli following Team India's World Cup victory against Pakistan, wrote on Instagram, "I've witnessed a brash boy evolve into the very embodiment of class." "Displaying a rare brand of ferocity and passionate expression, he changed the face of Indian cricket forever...Leading our country like a true alpha warrior," he added.

headlines: Ex-UEFA Prez Platini arrested over decision to award Qatar 2022 WC
text: Ex-UEFA President Michel Platini has been arrested over the decision to award Qatar the FIFA World Cup in 2022. Platini was detained by French police on Tuesday in Nanterre as part of the investigation into corruption surrounding the awarding of hosting rights of 2022 World Cup. The 63-year-old was UEFA president from January 2007 until he stepped down in 2016.

headlines: 2 Cong leaders held for trying to install Ambedkar bust in Hyd
text: Congress leaders V Hanumantha Rao and Harsha Kumar and their supporters were arrested on Tuesday morning while allegedly trying to install a statue of Dr BR Ambedkar at Punjagutta centre in Hyderabad. The Congress leaders and their supporters allegedly tried to resist arrest. Meanwhile, the police seized the statue and the lorry it was brought in.

headlines: Vande Mataram against Islam: SP MP Shafiqur Rahman in Lok Sabha
text: After concluding his oath as the Member of the Parliament on Tuesday, Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq said, "Vande Mataram is against Islam, we cannot follow it." Slogans of the national song 'Vande Mataram' were raised in the Lok Sabha following his remark. Earlier in 2013, he had walked out of the Parliament while 'Vande Mataram' was being played.

headlines: 'Jai Sri Ram' slogan raised during Owaisi's oath in Lok Sabha
text: Slogans like 'Jai Sri Ram' and 'Vande Mataram' were raised when AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi went to take oath as Lok Sabha member. Owaisi ended his oath with 'Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allah-hu-Akbar, Jai Hind' slogan. "It's good they remember such things when they see me. I hope they'll also remember...deaths of children in Muzaffarpur," he said later.

headlines: Chained body of magician who went missing after stunt found
text: The police has recovered the body of a magician who went missing after he entered the Ganga river in Kolkata tied up in steel chains. Chanchal Lahiri's body, limbs still tied with steel chains, washed up about 1 km away from the site of attempt. "This is a big loss for Indian magic community," a historian of Indian magic said.

headlines: Dalit child stripped, made to sit on hot tiles on suspicion of theft
text: An eight-year-old Dalit boy in Maharashtra's Wardha was allegedly made to sit on hot tiles, causing him to suffer severe burns. A man accused the boy of stealing some coins from the temple, tied his hands, stripped his pants off and forced him to sit on hot tiles in the afternoon. The police has arrested the accused man.

headlines: India, Pakistan increasing size of their nuclear arsenals: Report
text: India and Pakistan are increasing the size of their nuclear arsenals while also developing new systems, a report by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI) revealed. The overall number of nuclear warheads in the world has decreased but the nuclear powers are modernising their arsenals. Nine countries possessed an estimated 13,865 nuclear weapons in 2019, 600 less from 2018.

headlines: Suspected IED defused near school in Navi Mumbai
text: The Navi Mumbai police defused a suspected IED placed in a handcart near a school on Monday. An analogue watch and a 12-volt battery were attached to the device while a petrol can was found lying nearby, the police said. The police are analysing CCTV cameras installed in the school and nearby areas to identify the persons behind the crime.

headlines: Govt fires 15 senior customs officials facing corruption charges
text: The government on Tuesday fired 15 senior customs officials who are facing corruption charges. The sacked officials include the ranks of Principal Commissioner, Commissioner, Additional Commissioner, and Deputy Commissioner of Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs. This comes almost a week after the government sacked 12 senior income tax officers on charges of corruption and professional misconduct.

headlines: Don't open 'Pandora's Box' in Middle East: China warns US
text: China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Tuesday warned against the opening of a 'Pandora's Box' in the Middle East amid the tensions between the US and Iran. "Any unilateral behaviour has no basis in international law...it'll only create an even greater crisis," he added. His statement came after the US announced the deployment of 1,000 additional troops to the region.

headlines: Iran to break uranium stockpile limit set under nuclear deal
text: Iran announced on Monday that it will breach the limit on its stockpile of enriched uranium set under the 2015 nuclear deal on June 27. The deal limited Iran's stock of low-enriched uranium to 300 kilograms. Iran said other parties to the deal had the option to save it by finding a way to protect the country from US sanctions.

headlines: Nobody else had guts to play flawed roles in B'wood: Shahid
text: While speaking about his film choices, Shahid Kapoor said that he was drawn to flawed characters at a point when nobody else "had the guts" to take up such roles. "You have to make choices which people around you say aren't safe," he added. "You have to learn to believe in yourself when no one else does," Shahid further said.

headlines: Don't care if 15-20 leave TMC after accepting cash: Mamata
text: After Nowpara MLA Sunil Singh and several TMC councillors defected to the BJP on Monday, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she doesn't "care if 15-20 councillors quit the party by accepting cash". She added, "We don't want thieves in our party." Mamata further said that if one person leaves the party then she'll "prepare 500 more".

headlines: Yogi government to issue press releases in Sanskrit also
text: In a bid to promote Sanskrit, the Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government will now issue press releases in Sanskrit along with Hindi, English and Urdu, an official said. The state government's Information Department issued the first press note in Sanskrit on Monday. The government will take help of Lucknow-based Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan for translating CM's speeches for public release.

headlines: Uber was outspending us almost 5:1 to the dollar to compete: Ola
text: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said that at their competition's peak in India, "Uber was outspending [Ola] almost 5:1 to the dollar". He noted that when Uber entered India, Ola was a "tiny company" operating in two cities. "Yet, we held on to our market share and even today we have 2:1 market share against our competition," he further added.

headlines: Bike-sharing startup Bounce raises $72 mn in Series C funding
text: Bike and scooter-sharing startup Bounce has raised $72 million in a Series C funding round led by Falcon Edge and B Capital, the venture capital firm co-founded by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin. Reportedly, with this round, the total funding raised by Bounce has reached over $92 million. The startup counts Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's co-founded BAC Acquisitions among its investors.

headlines: Paytm Mall names Rudra Dalmia as Exec Director, Board member
text: Paytm Mall has named Rudra Dalmia as the Executive Director and also appointed him to its board. Dalmia is an SRCC alumnus and has an MBA from Cornell University's Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management. "I welcome [Dalmia] to Paytm family...am proud to see him as a board member of Paytm e-commerce," Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said.

headlines: No plans to change name of 737 MAX, clarifies Boeing
text: Boeing on Monday said it had no plans to change the name of the 737 MAX. This comes after news reports said the US planemaker would be prepared to do so to improve its future marketing. "Our immediate focus is the safe return of the MAX to service and re-earning the trust of airlines and the travelling public," Boeing said.

headlines: RBI to review data storage rules for payment firms
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will look into concerns about data storage rules that have been raised by companies, the government said. This comes a day after Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal held a meeting with payment companies. The RBI had last year mandated companies to store payments data of Indian users solely within the country for "unfettered supervisory access".

headlines: Great Learning helps techies switch to AI without quitting jobs
text: According to a TOI report, Artificial Intelligence courses are increasingly witnessing enrollments from experienced tech professionals. The average salary hike for AI professionals is around 40-50%, compared to 20% for other techies, the report added. Professionals with programming experience can upskill in AI/ML without quitting their jobs by pursuing Great Learning's AI & Machine Learning PG program.

headlines: Can't provide security to doctors at cost of other citizens: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday deferred the hearing on a plea seeking protection of doctors in government hospitals. "We understand it is a serious issue but we can't provide security to doctors at the cost of other citizens," the apex court said. Since doctors have called off their strike, there is no urgency to hear the matter, the SC added.

headlines: MIT-WPU aims to get students ready for various industry roles
text: Figuring the need for diversity of knowledge and qualifications in today's world, MIT-WPU has designed UG and PG programs across various disciplines so that students can choose the path they want to for an enriching industry career. From BA Social Sciences to B.Com, B.Tech integrated(after 10th), B.Pharmacy, it offers 150+ study programmes, aiming to create intellectual capital for society.

headlines: Sania responds after Veena Malik says she took son to sheesha place
text: After a video of Pakistani cricketers dining at a restaurant surfaced, Veena Malik accused Sania Mirza of taking her son to a sheesha place and said junk food isn't good for athletes. Sania said she didn't take her son to a sheesha place. "I'm not Pakistan cricket team's dietician nor am I their mother or principal or teacher," Sania added.

headlines: Govt asks WhatsApp for digital fingerprinting of every text: Report
text: Government has reportedly asked WhatsApp to digitally fingerprint messages sent on its platform without breaking the encryption. The move is aimed to ensure the traceability of every message sent on the platform. The government wants WhatsApp to be able to identify where a message originated and how many people have read and forwarded it without having to read the message.

headlines: Facebook announces digital currency Libra for users around the world
text: Social media giant Facebook on Tuesday announced its own digital currency 'Libra', powered by blockchain technology, for users around the world. Facebook's 'Calibra' digital wallet will let users save, send and spend Libra with a smartphone. The digital wallet, expected to launch in 2020, will be available in Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp and as a standalone app.

headlines: AAP's Mann takes oath as LS MP, ends with 'Inquilab Zindabad'
text: AAP leader Bhagwant Mann took oath as the member of the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, and concluded it with 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogan. Mann, who won from Punjab's Sangrur constituency for the second time, is the only AAP member in the lower house of the Parliament. The oath was officiated by pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar.

headlines: Sunny takes oath in LS, says 'withhold' instead of uphold sovereignty
text: Actor-turned-politician Sunny Deol, who won from Gurdaspur constituency in Punjab, took oath as the member of 17th Lok Sabha on Tuesday. While taking the oath in English, Deol mistakenly says "withhold the sovereignty and integrity of the country" instead of "uphold the sovereignty and integrity of the country". He corrected his mistake quickly.

headlines: Online payments provider Razorpay raises $75 mn in Series C funding
text: Bengaluru-based online payments solution provider Razorpay on Tuesday said it has raised $75 million as part of its Series C funding round led by new investors Ribbit Capital and Sequoia India. Existing investors Tiger Global Management and Y Combinator also participated in the round. Previously, Razorpay had raised $31.5 million across Series A (2016) and Series B (2018) rounds.

headlines: Pak spokesperson responds after Shah's strike remark on WC match
text: Following Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remark on India-Pakistan World Cup match, Pakistan Armed Forces spokesperson Major General Asif Ghafoor said, "Two things with different denominators can't be compared. So are strikes & match." "Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same," Shah had tweeted. India have defeated Pakistan seven out of seven times in World Cup.

headlines: Kerala CPM leader's son accused of rape by 33-year-old woman
text: Binoy Vinodini Balakrishnan, the son of Kerala CPM leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan, has been booked on charges of rape and cheating following a complaint by a 33-year-old woman in Mumbai. She accused him of sexually assaulting her on the pretext of marriage. She claimed they got into a relationship and had a child before she found out he was already married.

headlines: Two Army personnel martyred in IED attack on convoy in J&K
text: Two Army personnel who were injured in an IED attack on a mobile vehicle patrol in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday have succumbed to their injuries. The vehicle was moving on Arihal-Pulwama road when terrorists detonated the IED. Following the incident, Army personnel had fired in the air and launched a search and cordon operation, an official said.

headlines: Delhi ACP beaten up by people protesting assault on tempo driver
text: A Delhi Police ACP was beaten up outside the Mukherjee Nagar police station by people who were protesting against an assault on a tempo driver. KG Tyagi was beaten up after he went out to "control the gathering". "The incident is being investigated. Such incidents often happen in professional policing," said Madhur Verma, PRO, Delhi Police.

headlines: AES death toll rises to 108; Bihar CM Nitish Kumar visits hospital
text: As death toll due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) reached 108 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, CM Nitish Kumar visited Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital where at least 89 children died due to the disease. Reportedly, the CM interacted with doctors and parents of the ailing children. Locals were seen protesting outside the hospital during the CM's visit.

headlines: US to send 1000 more troops to middle-east amid Iran tensions
text: Amid heightened tensions between the US and Iran, Acting US Secretary of Defence Patrick Shanahan has said the country is sending an additional 1,000 troops to the Middle East in response to "hostile behaviour by Iranian forces". This comes after the US blamed Iran for attacks on two oil tanker ships in the Gulf of Oman.

headlines: Kareena to feature in Saif's film 'Jawaani Jaaneman': Report
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan will feature in her husband and actor Saif Ali Khan's upcoming film 'Jawaani Jaaneman', as per reports. Kareena will play the role of Saif's character's former girlfriend in the forthcoming film, reports further stated. Directed by Nitin Kakkar, the film will also star Pooja Bedi's daughter Alaia Furniturewalla and Tabu.

headlines: Khabib refuses Barca fan photo unless he says Hala Madrid
text: UFC champion Khabib Nurmagomedov on being asked to pose for a photo by a young Barcelona fan jokingly refused and said that he would pose only if the Barcelona fan said 'Hala Madrid', which is Real Madrid's slogan. On being asked about his liking for the Madrid-based club after Cristiano Ronaldo's departure, Khabib said, "It doesn't matter, Ronaldo or not."

headlines: iOS 13 may warn before deleting app with active subscription
text: Apple's iOS 13 may warn users if they're deleting an app with an active subscription, an iOS 13 beta 2 screenshot tweeted by MacStories' Editor-in-Chief Federico Viticci showed. The notification informs users when their subscription will renew and also contains a 'Manage Subscription' option. It clarifies the subscription can still be used on other devices even after deleting the app.

headlines: Will try to strengthen BJP as its worker: Working prez JP Nadda
text: After he was appointed as the working president of the BJP, JP Nadda tweeted, "I will try to strengthen the party as its worker...Serving the party is like worship for me." He also thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi and party chief Amit Shah for reposing faith in him. He further said that PM Modi's guidance has always inspired him.

headlines: Rajnath, Army Chief to pay homage to martyred Major Ketan Sharma
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Tuesday will pay homage to Major Ketan Sharma who was martyred on Monday in an encounter with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district. Reportedly, two terrorists were killed in the encounter. Earlier today, a jawan was martyred and two others were injured in an ongoing encounter in Anantnag.

headlines: Indian TV show accused of copying scene from Game of Thrones
text: Indian TV show 'Aladdin - Naam Toh Suna Hoga' has been accused of plagiarising a scene from season 8 of 'Game of Thrones'. The scene in question shows a man stabbing a skeleton by switching hands at the last moment. GoT fans recognised its similarity to the scene in which Arya Stark kills the Night King using a similar move.

headlines: Man drinks poison in front of Maha minister to protest no electricity
text: A 39-year-old farmer attempted suicide by drinking poison in front of Maharashtra Energy Minister C Bawankule to protest not getting electricity connection despite constant efforts. "My grandfather had applied for electricity connection in 1980 but we still don't have it," the man said. He claimed he had warned district administration that he would commit suicide, adding that they didn't care.

headlines: Woman claims man flashed his private parts at her in metro station
text: A 29-year-old Delhi-based woman alleged on Twitter that a man flashed her while masturbating inside Huda City Centre Metro Station in Gurugram on June 14. She said she slapped the man and nobody came to help her, following which she went to a police chowki but found it closed. After her tweets, police contacted the woman to file an FIR.

headlines: Mamata accepts doctors' demand of having panic button in hospitals
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday accepted the protesting doctors' demand of installing panic buttons in hospitals that could be used to alert the local police station about a potential threat. She also accepted the demand to control access to emergency wards of hospitals. She met with 31 representatives of the protesting doctors after the week-long strike.

headlines: 80 items including keys, coins & chillams removed from man's stomach
text: Doctors removed more than 80 items including keys, coins, chillam pipes, nail-cutter, and safety pins, among other things from a 25-year-old man's stomach in Rajasthan's Udaipur. He was admitted in hospital after complaints of severe stomach ache. According to reports, he was not speaking to anyone at home and was suffering from drug addiction from last one year.

headlines: 11 killed, 122 injured as two earthquakes hit China
text: At least 11 people have been killed and 122 others have been injured in two earthquakes that hit China. The quakes, roughly 30 minutes apart, hit the southwestern province of Sichuan. In May 2008, Sichuan was hit by an earthquake that killed almost 70,000 people. Authorities have dispatched 5,000 tents, 10,000 folding beds and 20,000 quilts to the quake-hit areas.

headlines: Pakistan Minister slaps journalist for calling him 'Indian spy'
text: Pakistan Science & Technology Minister Fawad Hussain slapped a journalist at a wedding last week for calling him an "Indian spy". "That incident shouldn't have happened but it did, unfortunately," Fawad said, adding that the journalist had "misbehaved". Pakistan PM Imran Khan reportedly released a statement on the altercation, saying, "The leadership of PTI does not support any personal action."

headlines: Arbaaz to feature in Priya Prakash Varrier's 'Sridevi Bungalow'
text: Actor Arbaaz Khan will feature in actress Priya Prakash Varrier's upcoming film 'Sridevi Bungalow', which will mark her debut in Bollywood. Confirming the news, the film's director Prasanth Mambully said, "Arbaazji plays a Bollywood superstar and his character is very important to the script." The actor's character in the film is also named Arbaaz Khan, the film's director further revealed.

headlines: Swara to play Shabana Azmi's role in 'Arth' remake: Reports
text: Swara Bhasker has reportedly been approached to star in the upcoming remake of the 1982 film 'Arth', which saw Shabana Azmi, Smita Patil and Kulbhushan Kharbanda in lead roles. Swara will reportedly play Shabana's role in the film, which will be directed by actress-filmmaker Revathy. Earlier reports stated that Jacqueline Fernandez will play Smita Patil's character in the forthcoming remake.

headlines: Audience has given me free pass to do different roles: Ayushmann
text: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he feels his audience has given him a "free pass" to take up diverse roles in films. "They have allowed diverse voices like me to create a space of my own," he added. "I'll hate to disappoint them and not give them what they expect from me every time my film releases," Ayushmann further said.

headlines: Want to be known as pan-India artiste in film industry: Kiara
text: While speaking about her career in the film industry, actress Kiara Advani said, "I want to be known as a pan-India artiste." "One has to look at every avenue because there is so much work out there- regional films, web. Language is not a barrier anymore," she added. Kiara further said she has become more careful while picking films.
