headlines: Zeenat Aman joins cast of Arjun starrer 'Panipat'
text: Veteran actress Zeenat Aman has joined the cast of the upcoming Arjun Kapoor starrer 'Panipat', which is based on the third battle of Panipat. "It's an absolute honour and a fan moment to be directing Zeenatji...What is most fascinating...is her humility despite all the stardom," director Ashutosh Gowariker said. Zeenat will play the role of Sakina Begum in the film.

headlines: Rishi to star with Juhi in film post cancer treatment: Report
text: Actors Rishi Kapoor and Juhi Chawla will star together in an upcoming film, as per reports. Shooting for the film, which was announced last year, was halted after Rishi left for the US to undergo treatment for cancer. Rishi and Juhi were last seen together in the Farhan Akhtar starrer 'Luck By Chance', which released in 2009.

headlines: Bulk of money in B'wood is invested in mediocre films: Konkona
text: Speaking about Bollywood, actress-director Konkona Sen Sharma said, "Every year there's a handful of good films coming as a ray of hope." "[B]ut bulk of the money is invested in films that are mediocre, which is just upholding the same stereotype," she added. Konkona further pointed out that small-budget films have to compete for screens and show-times with big-budget films.

headlines: Actor Vidyut Jammwal acquitted in 12-year-old assault case
text: Actor Vidyut Jammwal on Monday was acquitted in an assault case filed against him in 2007 for allegedly smashing a bottle on a person's head. Reacting to the verdict, Vidyut said, "The action hero only does action in the movies is all I'll say." No evidence was found against Vidyut and his friend, who was also accused in the case.

headlines: Membership drive a way to expand BJP's reach: Amit Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah has said that the aim of the BJP's membership drive is to expand its reach and make it inclusive so that it reaches people from all walks of life. He added that in the coming three years the party will adopt all possible measures to expand its base. The BJP, however, has 11 crore members.

headlines: Students fall off bus roof while celebrating 'Bus Day' in TN
text: A bunch of college students in Tamil Nadu fell off the roof of a bus when they were taking out a procession to celebrate 'Bus Day'. In a video, the students can be seen dancing on the roof of the moving bus and fell off the moment it applied the brakes. Police detained some students in connection with the incident.

headlines: 6 killed, several injured in road accident in UP's Sitapur
text: At least six people died and several others were injured after an oil tanker hit a tractor-trolley in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur, police said. The victims were travelling in the tractor-trolley to attend a wedding when the speeding tanker hit it from behind, the police added. Three people were critically injured and were referred to Lucknow for treatment, the police said.

headlines: 581 children rescued from child labour, trafficking in Cyberabad
text: In the span of one year, Telangana's Cyberabad police have rescued 581 children who were forced into child labour and human trafficking, under an initiative called Operation Smile. Three teams were constituted by the Cyberabad Police Commissioner in June 2018 to take part in the initiative. The teams operated in three zones.

headlines: Circular economy can create 1.4 cr jobs in 5-7 yrs: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has said circular economy has potential to generate 1.4 crore jobs in next 5-7 years and create lakhs of new entrepreneurs. Kant added sustainable development and resource circularity is the need of the hour to implement this. Circular economy implies reusing waste back into the production cycle and extracting maximum value during usage of resources.

headlines: B'desh beat WI, record 2nd highest successful chase in WC history
text: Bangladesh chased down the target of 322 against West Indies on Monday to record the second highest successful chase in World Cup history. The previous second highest successful chase in World Cup was also recorded by Bangladesh when they chased down the target of 319 against Scotland in 2015. Notably, it is also Bangladesh's highest ever chase in ODI cricket.

headlines: Boxer Amir Khan offers to help Pak with fitness after India defeat
text: Pakistani origin British boxer Amir Khan has expressed his desire to help Pakistan cricket team stay fit and strong. "Would love to [give them advice on]...how to be disciplined on food, diet and training. The team has talent but need to improve on strength & conditioning and focus," he tweeted. This comes after India defeated Pakistan in 2019 World Cup.

headlines: Having a daughter has put me in good space: Rohit on good form
text: On being asked about his good form, India opener Rohit Sharma said he is batting "beautifully" as he's undergoing a very good phase in his life. "Having...a newly born daughter in my life actually has put me in a good space. So...yeah...I think I'm enjoying my cricket coming off a great IPL campaign and then starting off here," he added.

headlines: Sachin responds after ICC compares Rohit's six vs Pakistan to his
text: The ICC tweeted a video of Sachin Tendulkar and Rohit Sharma playing identical shots for a six against Pakistan's Shoaib Akhtar and Hassan Ali in 2003 and 2019 World Cup respectively and asked who played it better. Responding to it, Sachin tweeted, "We both are from INDIA and in this case...AAMCHI MUMBAI as well...So heads I win, tails you lose!"

headlines: Players were in rooms before deadline night before India match: PCB
text: Pakistan Cricket Board has said all Pakistani players were in their rooms before curfew time night before India match. This comes after several Pakistani cricketers were criticised after a video of them dining outside surfaced online. "The video under discussion was of two days back," a spokesperson said. He added players went out with their families after taking due permission.

headlines: Kolkata Police troll Sarfaraz with IAF pilot Abhinandan's remark
text: Kolkata Police congratulated India on their victory against Pakistan in World Cup by tweeting a meme inspired by IAF pilot Abhinandan's remark. Kolkata Police uploaded a collage of Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed and Virat Kohli. In the picture, Sarfaraz asks, "How do you win every time?" to which Kohli replies, "I am not supposed to tell you that."

headlines: Didnt we tell, following signals helps? Mumbai Police on India win
text: Following India's victory against Pakistan in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday, Mumbai Police tweeted, "Didnt we tell you, following the signals always helps?" Mumbai Police was commenting on its tweet wherein it trolled Pakistan cricket team by sharing a picture of a green traffic signal, signifying Pakistan's jersey colour, and tweeting, "India, see green? Accelerate. Like you always do."

headlines: Kohli checks on Riaz after he slips, gets praised for sportsmanship
text: India captain Virat Kohli was praised for his sportsmanship after he checked on Wahab Riaz after the bowler slipped in his follow-through while bowling. Kohli patted Riaz, who was not getting up on his feet for a while, and asked him if he was fine. "This warmth between the players is what makes India vs Pakistan special," a user tweeted.

headlines: Bihar Health Minister asks for cricket score at meet on AES deaths
text: A video of Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey asking for latest cricket score of India-Pakistan World Cup match on Sunday during State Health Department meeting over Muzaffarpur Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) deaths has surfaced online. In the video, Pandey can be heard saying, "Kitna wicket hua tha?" Health Minister Harsh Vardhan was also present at the meeting.

headlines: How can a captain be so brainless? Akhtar criticises Sarfaraz
text: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed following their defeat against India in 2019 World Cup on Sunday, calling him "brainless". He added Sarfaraz had a chance to win half the match by batting first after toss but he committed a mistake by deciding to bowl first. "How could he forget that we don't chase well?" Akhtar added.

headlines: MP Pragya takes oath in 3 attempts after row around her name
text: BJP MP Sadhvi Pragya took oath in three attempts after an uproar erupted in the Lok Sabha when she used the name 'Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri', suffixing her name with her spiritual guru's. As the Opposition objected to it, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar said the name written in her election certificate would go on record.

headlines: Minister says wasn't asleep, but was thinking during AES presser
text: Denying the reports that he was sleeping during a press conference on children killed by Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar, MoS Health and Family Welfare Ashwini Kumar Choubey said he was "thinking". Choubey said, "Main manan chintan bhi karta hoon na, main so nahi raha tha." The press conference was held by Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Sunday.

headlines: India will overtake China as most populated nation in 8 yrs: UN
text: India will overtake China to become the world's most populated country in eight years and will remain so through the end of the current century, a United Nations report stated. India is expected to add nearly 27.3 crore people between now and 2050, it added. In China, the population is projected to decrease by 3.14 crore between 2019 and 2050.

headlines: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan named in Bihar children deaths case
text: A case has been filed against Health Minister Harsh Vardhan and Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey on charges of negligence leading to deaths of 82 children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in the past fortnight in Muzaffarpur. The petition said that Harsh Vardhan and Mangal Pandey failed to fulfill their duties to control the outbreak of AES.

headlines: Egypt's ousted President Morsi dies after collapsing in court
text: Former Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi died on Monday after collapsing in a court while on trial for espionage charges. Morsi, the first democratically elected head of state in Egypt's modern history, had been in jail since being toppled by military in 2013 after barely a year in power. He was a top figure in the now-banned Islamist movement Muslim Brotherhood.

headlines: Bus crashes as man grabs steering after argument with driver
text: Twelve people were killed and several others got injured in a traffic accident in Indonesia on Monday after a bus passenger forcefully grabbed the steering wheel of the vehicle following an argument with the driver, police said. The bus driver was killed, according to authorities, while the passenger was severely injured. The bus was heading to Cirebon from Jakarta.

headlines: Tech firms can't dodge responsibility for chaos they create: Tim Cook
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook, who was speaking at Stanford University, said, "Lately it seems this (technology) industry is becoming better known for a less noble innovation...belief that you can claim credit without accepting responsibility." "It feels a bit crazy that anyone should have to say this, but if you built a chaos factory, you cant dodge responsibility for...chaos," he added.

headlines: Hope trend of using Parliament as rubber stamp is reversed: Cong
text: Alleging that during its previous tenure, NDA government used Parliament as a "rubber stamp", the Congress hoped that this trend is "reversed" and key bills aren't pushed without legislative scrutiny using "brute majority". Legislation through an ordinance is a "very unhealthy practice", it said. This comes after PM Narendra Modi's remark that the Opposition need not "bother about their numbers".

headlines: KCR invites Jagan for Kaleshwaram Project's inauguration
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao met his Andhra Pradesh counterpart YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Monday and invited him to attend the inauguration ceremony of the Kaleshwaram Project. KCR had lunch at Jagan's residence and the two reportedly discussed pending issues between the two states as a result of the bifurcation.

headlines: Referendum is needed on use of EVMs in polls: Veerappa Moily
text: Congress leader M Veerappa Moily asserted that there are "serious doubts" over EVMs and has sought a referendum on its use in the electoral process. He added that the Election Commission should go back to the electoral process through ballot paper. Moily said if necessary, the government should take people's referendum on it, but that too on the ballot paper.

headlines: Fitch cuts India growth forecast for FY20 from 6.8% to 6.6%
text: Fitch on Monday lowered India's economic growth forecast to 6.6% for the current fiscal from 6.8% projected earlier. This comes as the country's manufacturing and agriculture sectors showed signs of slowing down over the past year. The global rating agency retained its GDP growth forecast for the next financial year at 7.1% and for FY22 at 7.0%.

headlines: Pfizer acquires Array BioPharma in $11 billion deal
text: US pharmaceutical giant Pfizer on Monday announced the acquisition of Array BioPharma, a biotechnology firm that specialises in cancer drugs. Pfizer offered $48 per share in cash for Array, putting an $11.4 billion value on the company. The deal is Pfizer's biggest since 2016 when it signed a $14-billion deal to buy Medivation, which also specialises in cancer drugs.

headlines: JP Nadda named BJP working President, Amit Shah to remain President
text: JP Nadda was appointed as the working President of the BJP on Monday, while Amit Shah will continue to be BJP National President. Nadda, a Member of Parliament from the Rajya Sabha, served as the Health Minister in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's previous government. Nadda will take care of the day-to-day operations of the BJP for the next six months.

headlines: West Bengal doctors call off week-long strike after meeting CM Mamata
text: Doctors protesting in West Bengal for a week called off their strike on Monday after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee met them and accepted their demand to scale up their security. She met with 31 representatives of the striking doctors in the state. Earlier today, Mamata said that five arrests were made in the NRS Hospital violence.

headlines: Sotheby's goes private after 31 years, bought by Drahi for $3.7 bn
text: American art dealing company Sotheby's on Monday announced that it has signed a definitive merger agreement to be acquired by French-Israeli billionaire Patrick Drahi in a $3.7 billion cash deal. The deal implies that Sotheby's would go private, 31 years after its IPO on the New York Stock Exchange. Drahi is an art collector and media and telecom entrepreneur.

headlines: Bella Thorne releases her nude pics after hacker threatens her
text: Hollywood actress Bella Thorne on Saturday released nude pictures of herself after an alleged hacker threatened to release her nude images. Posting a series of pictures showing screenshots of WhatsApp chat where the hacker threatened her, Bella wrote, "F**k u and the power u think you have over me." "The FBI will be at your house shortly," she added.

headlines: Shakib 4th player to take 250 wickets, score 6,000 runs in ODIs
text: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has become the fourth cricketer to score 6,000 runs and take 250 wickets in ODI cricket. Shakib achieved the feat after reaching 6,000 ODI runs during the 2019 World Cup match against West Indies on Monday. The 32-year-old all-rounder is only the second batsman to score 6,000 ODI runs for Bangladesh after Tamim Iqbal.

headlines: Virat Kohli clearly doesn't say Ben Stokes when he curses: Stokes
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has joked he'll leave Twitter as he's tired of being mentioned in tweets which suggest Virat Kohli pronounces his name when he curses. "I don't [want] to see another tweet reading, "He's saying Ben Stokes"(when he's clearly not) in reply to videos of Virat saying you know what...it was funny the first 100,000 times," he wrote.

headlines: I will tell if I become their coach: Rohit on advice to Pak batsmen
text: On being asked by a Pakistani journalist about what advice he will give Pakistani batsmen to come out of crisis, India opener Rohit Sharma said, "I'll definitely tell them if I ever become the coach for Pakistan. What can I say now?" Rohit slammed 140 runs against Pakistan on Sunday to register the highest score in India-Pakistan World Cup matches.

headlines: Hassan jumps at Wagah border, shows no energy on field: Akhtar
text: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has criticised fast bowler Hassan Ali after the latter registered the most expensive figures by a Pakistani bowler in World Cup history. "Hassan Ali goes to Wagah Border and jumps around to show off his energy but why can he not display the same energy for Pakistan in the World Cup?" he said.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi forgets to sign after taking oath, Rajnath reminds him
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi, who has been elected to Parliament for the fourth time, took oath as a Member of the 17th Lok Sabha on Monday. However, after the oath, he forgot to sign the parliament register and was reminded of the same by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and others. Gandhi was elected to Parliament from Kerala's Wayanad last month.

headlines: 3 killed as under-construction water tank collapses in Bengaluru
text: Three workers were killed and around 20 injured after a portion of an under-construction water tank, meant to treat about 110 million litres of sewage water per day, collapsed in Bengaluru on Monday. The 40-foot-deep tank constructed by Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board collapsed when labourers were working inside it. Several labourers are also feared trapped under the debris.

headlines: 15-yr-old stabbed, thrown in canal by father, brother for not marrying
text: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly stabbed by her father after which her brother pushed her into a canal in Uttar Pradesh because she had refused to marry as she wanted to study. She suffered injuries in the stomach and face but managed to swim to a nearby village. ASP Dinesh Tripathi said, "Investigation is underway. Strict action will be taken."

headlines: Terrorists target Army convoy with IED in Jammu & Kashmir's Pulwama
text: Terrorists attacked an Army convoy with an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) at Arihal village in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday. According to reports, the terrorists attacked the armoured vehicle of 44 Rashtriya Rifles and the Casper vehicle was damaged in the attack. Firing is currently underway at the spot.

headlines: After earlier denying, Harsh Vardhan gives statement on AES deaths
text: Speaking on Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) deaths in Bihar, Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday said, "Our teams are stationed there and are working from the very first day. I've gone and met the patients. I even went through their case-sheet and spoke to doctors in detail." Notably, he had denied to comment on the issue earlier in the day.

headlines: We were a good team in 90s, now India are better: Sarfaraz
text: Following Pakistan's seventh loss against India at World Cup, Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said, "The Pakistan teams of the 90s used to enjoy upper hand but now India is better than Pakistan. That's why they win matches." "We should try to be positive... [W]e didn't play good cricket but let's try and win four games," Sarfaraz added.

headlines: Shami sharper than you think: Sachin on Bhuvneshwar's absence
text: Speaking about Mohammad Shami, who might get featured for India at the World Cup 2019 after Bhuvneshwar Kumar's injury, Sachin Tendulkar said, "He is sharper than you think... [I]f Mohammad Shami plays the next game, he is a dangerous customer upfront." "This is going to give Shami some match practice and come back to form," Sachin added.

headlines: We need our best games to beat 'big 3': Stefanos Tsitsipas
text: Speaking about the 'big three' of Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic, Greek youngster Stefanos Tsitsipas said, "We are responsible as the new generation to work hard to come up with something new and our best games to beat them." Tsitsipas had beaten Federer and Nadal at the Australian Open and Madrid Open respectively this year.

headlines: Google accused of copying song lyrics by lyrics website
text: Genius.com, which specialises in song lyrics, has accused Google of reducing its website's traffic with lyrics cards and sometimes copying lyrics. Genius used straight and curved apostrophes as a watermark that spells out "Red Handed" in Morse code to identify copying. Google said it's investigating the issue and will end agreements with partners that don't uphold good practices.

headlines: MIT's new AI can learn to 'see by touching, feel by seeing'
text: An MIT CSAIL team created a predictive AI that can learn to see by touching, and learn to feel by seeing. They used a KUKA robot's arm with a tactile sensor named GelSight. To teach the AI, they recorded videos of 200 objects being touched over 12,000 times and then broke the videos into static frames to compile a dataset.

headlines: Amazon may invest in agritech startup Ninjacart: Report
text: Amazon has reportedly held talks, which are at an exploratory stage, with B2B fresh produce supply chain firm Ninjacart for a potential investment. Earlier this year, Ninjacart had raised around $90 million in a Series C funding round led by New York-based Tiger Global Management. As per Crunchbase, Ninjacart has raised $139.5 million in disclosed funding till date.

headlines: IndiGo orders 280 jet engines from CFM in $20 billion deal
text: IndiGo on Monday announced it has placed a $20-billion order for LEAP-1A engines with French-US engine maker CFM International to power its future fleet of 280 Airbus A320-family jetliners. This is the largest ever single engine order in history, IndiGo said. CFM, a joint venture of US' General Electric and France's Safran, will deliver the first engine by 2020.

headlines: Bitcoin at 1-year high amid reports of Facebook's own crypto
text: Bitcoin climbed past $9,000 on Sunday, to its highest since May 2018, following reports that social media giant Facebook is looking to create its own cryptocurrency. The Bitcoin price reached highs of $9,387 on Bitstamp, up almost 7% over the last 24-hour trading period. Facebook's potential rival to Bitcoin has reportedly secured backing from Uber, Spotify, and Visa.

headlines: Jet Airways lenders to take airline to bankruptcy court
text: An SBI-led consortium of banks on Monday said they plan to take cash-strapped Jet Airways to the NCLT under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). This comes after the banks received no acceptable offers from Etihad Airways and Hinduja Group to revive the suspended carrier. The lenders are likely to file their insolvency plea before June 20.

headlines: Vedanta to complete pilot floating solar plant in 2-3 months
text: Vedanta has said its group firm Hindustan Zinc plans to complete its first pilot floating solar plant in the next two-three months. The 1 MW solar plant, being developed by Kolkata-based Vikram Solar, is located at Rajasthan's Ghosunda Dam. The solar plant is expected to have an energy yield of 1,993 MWh a year and power 1,400 houses a year.

headlines: No protesting doctor booked, 5 held in NRS incident: Mamata
text: During her meeting with protesting doctors, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said no protesting doctor has been booked and five people involved in NRS hospital incident have been arrested. Mamata also directed formation of grievance redressal units in WB hospitals as proposed by doctors. She further suggested one nodal officer must be appointed to supervise security situation at the hospital.

headlines: Female astrologer arrested for false rape allegation on Karan Oberoi
text: Mumbai Police on Monday arrested the female astrologer who accused actor Karan Oberoi of raping and blackmailing her. She is accused of filing a false complaint against Oberoi and orchestrating an attack on herself on May 25 when she was taking a morning walk. Her lawyer has also surrendered confessing that the woman paid his cousin for the staged attack.

headlines: Kalank deserved not to do well: Varun Dhawan on film's failure
text: Actor Varun Dhawan, while speaking about the failure of film 'Kalank', said, "The film wasn't liked by the audience. And it deserved not to do well." "It is very clear if the audience likes a film it should do well and they did not like Kalank. It is a learning for me," he added.

headlines: Mani Ratnam resumes work after check-up due to cardiac problems
text: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam underwent a routine health check-up at a corporate hospital in Chennai and is back to work, his publicist said on Monday. The clarification from the director's office comes amid reports in a section of media that he had been admitted to the hospital with suspected cardiac issues. Mani Ratnam had suffered a heart attack some years ago.

headlines: Jodhpur court acquits Salman Khan on fake affidavit charges
text: A sessions court in Jodhpur has acquitted actor Salman Khan of the charges of submitting a fake affidavit in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. Reportedly, in the affidavit, it was written that he had lost the license documents of his weapons while they were sent for renewal. Salman's counsel argued his intention wasn't to submit a false affidavit.

headlines: US ban to hit Huawei's revenues by $30 billion: Huawei Founder
text: Huawei Founder and CEO Ren Zhengfei on Monday said that the company's revenues will be $30 billion less than the forecast over the next two years. Huawei will reduce capacity but the US moves to restrict our business will not stop us, he added. He said Huawei expected $100 billion in revenues annually for the next two years.

headlines: Section 144 imposed in Bihar's Gaya district due to extreme heat
text: Section 144 has been imposed in Bihar's Gaya district due to extreme heat. The District Magistrate has also banned governmental/non-governmental construction works, MGNREGA labour work and any cultural programme or gathering in open spaces between 11 AM to 4 PM. Further, all government and government-aided schools in Bihar will remain closed till June 22 in view of prevailing heatwave conditions.

headlines: Harsh Vardhan refuses to comment as Bihar AES death toll crosses 100
text: As death toll of children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) crossed 100 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan refused to comment on the matter, saying, "I've spoken, aaj byte wyte koi nahi". According to reports, over 290 children are admitted in ICU of the Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital, where over 80 children have already died.

headlines: Army Major martyred, officer and 2 jawans injured in J&K encounter
text: An Army Major was martyred while another officer of the same rank and two troopers were injured in an encounter with militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Monday. Two militants were also killed in the gunfight, police said. The injured soldiers, who belong to 19 Rashtriya Rifles, were rushed to the 92 base hospital of the Army in Srinagar.

headlines: 1,400 Ganja chocolates seized from pan shops near Hyderabad; 2 held
text: Two people were arrested after Telangana excise department officials in Medchal-Malkajgiri district conducted raids and seized over 1,400 chocolates infused with 9.4 kg marijuana. Marijuana was mixed in chocolate and wrapped in normal chocolate covers, before being sold at pan shops. "After being caught once, the accused changed their modus operandi and began preparing marijuana chocolates," an official said.

headlines: AES to be under control next yr if we work on it now: Muzaffarpur MP
text: As death toll of children due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) crossed 100 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, BJP MP Ajay Nishad said, "If we work on it now, situation will be under control next year." He added that children from entire Bihar come to Muzaffarpur for treatment and 70% get cured. He said the number of ICUs need to be increased.

headlines: Srikkanth compares Kohli-led India to West Indies team of 1970s
text: Former Indian cricketer and former Indian team selector Krishnamachari Srikkanth compared the current Virat Kohli-led Indian World Cup side to the West Indies team of the 1970s that won two consecutive World Cup titles. "Teams are worried about facing India and how they will cope with them, which immediately puts them on the back foot," Srikkanth wrote.

headlines: I never lost my rhythm: Kuldeep Yadav after win over Pakistan
text: Speaking about his bowling performance in India's win over Pakistan in the World Cup 2019, Indian spinner Kuldeep Yadav said, "Everyone is talking about my rhythm but I never thought that I lost it." "[O]ne of the best deliveries in this tournament for me. I had earlier dismissed Babar Azam when we played the Asia Cup last year," Kuldeep said.

headlines: Instagram tests new methods to help recover hacked accounts
text: Instagram is testing changes to make it easier to recover hacked accounts. Users will receive a six-digit code to regain access using the email or number linked with their account or the ones used to sign up on Instagram, a spokesperson wrote to VICE. Instagram will prevent hackers from using these codes to access the account from a different device.

headlines: Xiaomi launches own VC firm with $29M registered capital: Report
text: China's Xiaomi has reportedly set up its own venture capital firm named Chongqing Xiaomi Venture Capital with a registered capital of 200 million yuan (around $29 million). Reportedly, the firm, which will focus on investing and consulting, will be wholly owned and controlled by the smartphone manufacturer. Xiaomi has reportedly invested 29 billion yuan in over 270 firms so far.

headlines: One nation, one election fancy idea of BJP: CPI's Suravaram
text: The CPI on Monday said that the BJP's one nation, one election is a "fancy idea" that is "neither possible nor necessary". CPI's General Secretary Sudhakar Reddy Suravaram asked what will happen to all those states where governments fail to complete their term? He said people can't be asked to wait until the next elections by denying their democratic rights.

headlines: TMC Nowpara MLA, 12 councillors set to join BJP in Delhi
text: TMC's Nowpara MLA Sunil Singh along with 12 councillors are set to join the BJP in Delhi on Monday. Singh said, "In Delhi, there's [PM Narendra] Modi Ji's government and we want the same government to be formed in the state so that we can develop West Bengal." Singh will be the third MLA to quit TMC after general elections.

headlines: PV Ramashastri appointed UP ADG Law and Order
text: IPS PV Ramashastri on Monday assumed the charge as Additional Director General (ADG) Law and Order, Uttar Pradesh. This comes after CM Yogi Adityanath, on Friday, transferred six senior police officers after reviewing state's law and order situation. Praising his predecessor, Ramashastri said during former ADG (Law and Order), Anand Kumar's tenure, there were "stern actions against hardcore criminals".

headlines: 5 killed, 17 injured as tractor-trolley overturns in UP
text: At least five persons, including three belonging to a family, were killed when the tractor-trolley in which they were travelling overturned into a roadside ditch on Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, police said. The police added that 17 people were also injured in the incident. The police further said that the injured have been admitted to the district hospital.

headlines: Boeing CEO acknowledges 'mistake' over 737 MAX warning light
text: Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg has said the company made a "mistake" in handling a problematic cockpit warning system in its 737 MAX jets before the fatal crashes in Indonesia and Ethiopia. Boeing's communication "was not consistent" and that's "unacceptable", he stated. Boeing hadn't told regulators for over a year that a safety indicator in MAX cockpit didn't work as intended.

headlines: Yes Bank plans to raise $1.2 billion to boost capital: CEO
text: Yes Bank CEO Ravneet Gill has said the lender plans to raise $1.2 billion over 18 months to boost its capital through share sales. The infusion would happen in two tranches with the first likely by the end of September, he added. Yes Bank's capital buffers have declined sharply as bad-loan provisioning surged, constraining its ability to extend credit.

headlines: Mamata to meet protesting doctors today; meeting to be recorded
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will hold a meeting, that will be recorded, with doctors protesting against the attack on a junior doctor. Mamata will be meeting two representatives from each medical college of the state at 3 pm today. The information was conveyed in a press release by the Director of Medical Education West Bengal PK Mitra.

headlines: OnePlus announces the launch of its Student Ambassador Program'19
text: OnePlus announced the launch of its Student Ambassador Program'19, which is to begin from July 15. The program aims to recruit a network of students in India who will be associated with OnePlus in predefined activities, for the purpose of providing them with professional experience. Additionally, they will launch a sub-forum for all the updates and queries called 'Student Community'.

headlines: SC to hear petition seeking security of govt doctors on Tuesday
text: The Supreme Court has said it'll hear a plea seeking safety and security of doctors in government hospitals across the country on Tuesday. It was filed in wake of doctors' protests in West Bengal. The plea also sought directions to West Bengal government to take the strictest action against those who assaulted junior doctors at NRS Medical College and Hospital.

headlines: What records were broken during India-Pakistan World Cup match?
text: India recorded their biggest victory against Pakistan in World Cup by defeating them by 89 runs (DLS method). Rohit Sharma recorded the highest score (140) in India-Pakistan World Cup matches and became the fastest batsman to reach 1,000 ODI runs (18 innings) in England. Virat Kohli became the first Indian to win his first three World Cup matches as captain.

headlines: Pakistan fan blames burger, pizza for defeat vs India; video viral
text: A video of a Pakistani fan blaming burger and pizza for Pakistan's defeat against India in World Cup has gone viral on social media. "They should leave cricket and start wrestling as they aren't bothered about their fitness," the fan says. "We had so much expectations from them and they are busy eating burgers and pizzas," he further said.

headlines: Elon Musk tweets 'Just deleted my Twitter account', changes username
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "Just deleted my Twitter account", and changed his username on the micro-blogging site to 'Daddy DotCom'. The URL daddy.com leads to a website for new or expecting fathers to help them with parenting tips. Reacting to Musk's tweet, a person commented, "Incorrect. You just tweeted."

headlines: Magician feared drowned after entering Ganga tied in chains: Police
text: Magician Chanchal Lahiri who entered the Ganga river from Kolkata's Howrah bridge tied up in steel chains for a stunt on Sunday is feared drowned, police said. "We tried to spot him. But it seems the stream swept him away. Our divers dived deep, but couldn't locate him," said police. "There were no proper security measures with him," police said.

headlines: Policemen suspended for beating driver who attacked them with sword
text: Three Delhi policemen were suspended after a video surfaced which showed them beating a tempo driver who had pulled out a sword during an altercation. The incident reportedly happened after an accident between their vehicles. Police claimed two of their men were injured in the attack while the driver alleged that he was attacked by the cops first.

headlines: Bar dancer stripped, beaten up for refusing to have sex
text: A bar dancer was allegedly stripped and thrashed in Hyderabad by four of her fellow dancers on Sunday after she denied to engage in paid sexual intercourse with customers. According to the police, the victim had joined the bar a few months back. A man, who is on the run, was also involved in the incident.

headlines: Israel names new community in occupied Golan Heights after Trump
text: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu along with US Ambassador to Israel David Friedman on Sunday attended a ceremony to unveil a sign for a new community named after US President Donald Trump in the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights. The sign of the community, named 'Trump Heights', was decorated with the Israeli and US flags and planted on a patch of synthetic grass.

headlines: Power cut leaves 4.8 crore South Americans without electricity
text: A power cut left an estimated 4.8 crore people across areas of South America without electricity on Sunday. All of Argentina and Uruguay and parts of Paraguay were hit by the blackout after what was described as the collapse of a "key interconnection system". "This case is unprecedented and will be deeply investigated," Argentine President Mauricio Macri said.

headlines: Virendra Kumar sworn in as Pro-tem Speaker of 17th Lok Sabha
text: Former Union Minister and seven-time MP Virendra Kumar on Monday took oath as the Pro-tem Speaker of the 17th Lok Sabha. President Ram Nath Kovind administered the oath in the presence of Vice President Venkaiah Naidu and PM Narendra Modi. Kumar will administer the oath to the newly elected MPs and will also oversee the election of Lok Sabha speaker.

headlines: Harsh Vardhan takes oath as member of 17th Lok Sabha in Sanskrit
text: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Monday took oath as the member of the 17th Lok Sabha in Sanskrit. Union Ministers Shripad Naik and Ashwini Choubey also took the oath in Sanskrit, administered by Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar. On the other hand, Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh took the oath as the member of the 17th Lok Sabha in Dogri language.

headlines: PM Modi, Shah, Rajnath take oath as members of 17th Lok Sabha
text: PM Narendra Modi, Union Ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh on Monday took oath as the members of the 17th Lok Sabha. Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar administered the oath on the first day of the maiden session of the 17th Lok Sabha. The swearing-in ceremony of the newly elected MPs will be spread over two days.

headlines: Qatar Investment Authority may invest up to $250M in Byju's: Report
text: Qatar's sovereign wealth fund Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) is close to investing $200-250 million for less than 5% stake in Byju's, as per a report. The report further states that both parties have signed the term-sheet. Backed by investors like Tencent Holdings and General Atlantic, the Bengaluru-based edtech startup was last valued at around $5.4 billion earlier in March.

headlines: Some of the earliest evidence of cannabis use found in China
text: International researchers have found some of the earliest clear evidence of cannabis use for its psychoactive properties in western China, a study stated. Traces of the drug were identified in funerary incense burners and stones exhumed from the 2,500-year-old Jirzankal Cemetery, which suggests people were selecting plants with higher levels of THC and burning them as part of mortuary rituals.

headlines: 2 militants killed in gunfight in J&K's Anantnag
text: At least two militants were killed on Monday in a gunfight with the security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, police said. Following information about their presence, Rashtriya Rifles and Special Operations Group of state police personnel surrounded a village in Achabal area, after which hiding militants opened fire. Identities of the slain militants is being ascertained, the police added.

headlines: Man killed in celebratory firing in UP's Banda
text: A 22-year-old man was killed allegedly in celebratory firing at his cousin's wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Banda, police said on Monday. The man died after being hit by a bullet fired allegedly by his other cousin, the police added. The police further said that the accused fled from the scene after the incident.

headlines: IMA on nationwide strike today in support of Bengal doctors
text: In the wake of the recent assault on West Bengal doctors, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) is on a nationwide strike today demanding a comprehensive central law in dealing with violence on doctors. The IMA has decided to withdraw all non-essential services, including OPD services, on Monday (June 17). However, it added, emergency and casualty services will continue to function.

headlines: 40,000 Maharashtra doctors boycott work to support WB colleagues
text: As many as 40,000 doctors in Maharashtra are boycotting work today as part of a strike call given by the IMA in support of their agitating colleagues in West Bengal, an official said. The OPD services have been suspended at various hospitals in support of the strike call, an IMA official added. West Bengal doctors' protest enters day seven today.

headlines: India beat Pak in World Cup again, extend 100% win record to 7-0
text: India defeated Pakistan by 89 runs (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed match at Manchester on Sunday to register their third victory in 2019 World Cup. With this, India extended their 100% winning run against Pakistan in World Cup to seven matches. The match witnessed India register their highest ever total (336/5) against Pakistan in a World Cup match.

headlines: 1st session of 17th LS begins; PM says Opposition's role important
text: The 1st session of 17th Lok Sabha began on Monday. Ahead of the session, PM Narendra Modi said, "The role of...Opposition is important and they need not bother about their numbers in the Parliament." "People have given us the chance to serve the country again. I request all parties to support decisions that are in favour of people," he added.

headlines: Tanushree questions PM Modi after Nana Patekar gets clean chit
text: Actress Tanushree Dutta, while questioning PM Narendra Modi after actor Nana Patekar got a clean chit in the sexual harassment case against him, said, "What happened to a corruption free India??" She added, "A daughter of the country gets harassed by a serial offender, attacked by a mob in public...and your police force say her complaint is false and malicious!!!"

headlines: Another strike on Pak by India, result is same: Amit Shah on WC game
text: Reacting to India defeating Pakistan in 2019 World Cup on Sunday, Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same." "Congratulations to entire team for this superb performance. Every Indian is feeling proud and celebrating this impressive win," he added. India have now defeated Pakistan seven out of seven times in World Cup.

headlines: India, see green? Accelerate: Mumbai Police trolls Pakistan team
text: Mumbai Police trolled Pakistan cricket team by sharing a picture of a green traffic signal, signifying the jersey colour of Pakistan, and tweeting, "India, see green? Accelerate. Like you always do." "Hats off...What a level of trolling and social message.. appreciate," a user tweeted. "Savage Mumbai Police," wrote another user. India are playing against Pakistan in the World Cup today.

headlines: Pak husband, Indian wife wear combined jerseys at World Cup match
text: A man from Pakistan and his Indian wife attended the India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup match wearing combined jerseys of India and Pakistan. "We are supporting peace today... We decided that we are going to support both the countries... Whoever plays their best game today, should win. And cricket and peace should win today. That's it," the husband said.

headlines: Encephalitis death toll reaches 100 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur
text: Superintendent at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) on Monday said that the death toll in Bihar's Muzaffarpur due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) has risen to 100. On Saturday, Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey had said that the state government is doing its best to save the children. Union Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan had visited SKMCH on Sunday.

headlines: AAP leader questions pic of protest by AIIMS docs, gets trolled
text: Questioning a picture of AIIMS doctors which was captured during a protest against attack on a West Bengal doctor, AAP leader Sanjay Singh tweeted, "Why are they all hurt in one place." Singh got trolled, with Twitter users saying, "IQ, GK...all should be missing to be an AAP member as a prerequisite." He had also asked if it was photoshopped.

headlines: 4 of Indian-origin family found dead in US house with gunshot wounds
text: Four members of an Andhra Pradesh family were found dead with gunshot injuries inside their house in US' Iowa on Saturday, police said. They were identified as Chandrasekhar Sunkara, 44, Lavanya, 41 and two boys aged 15 and 10. There were other family members, including two adults and two children, living in the house as guests, when the incident occurred.

headlines: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle share 1st pic of their baby's face
text: UK Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have shared the first picture of their baby boy Archie Harrison Mountbatten-Windsor's face on Instagram. The picture was shared along with a Father's Day message. Archie, who was born on May 6 this year, is the first mixed-race baby in the British monarchy's modern history. He is seventh in line to the throne.

headlines: Afridi congratulates India on win vs Pak, match yet to be over
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi congratulated Team India on their victory against Pakistan while their 2019 World Cup match is yet to be officially over. "The standard of cricket being played has been exceptionally high & credit goes to IPL for not only helping identify & harness talent, but also in equipping younger players with pressure handling techniques," he tweeted.

headlines: Joshna Chinappa wins record 17th national title
text: Indian squash player Joshna Chinappa won a record 17th national title after beating Sunayna Kuruvilla 11-5, 11-4, 7-11, 11-5. Chinappa broke the 16-time national champion Bhuvneshwari Kumari's record, which stood for 27 years. Rajasthan's Bhuvneshwari had won the national titles from 1977 to 1992. In the men's final, Mahesh Mangaonkar won the title.

headlines: Hasan registers Pakistan's most expensive figures in a WC match
text: Pacer Hasan Ali posted the most expensive figures for a Pakistani bowler in a World Cup match. Though he bowled only 9 overs, Ali conceded 84 runs, 2 more than the second-most expensive figures, which were registered by Wahab Riaz against England earlier in this edition of the World Cup. Ali managed to pick up Rohit Sharma's wicket on Sunday.

headlines: Uber, others to put $10 mn each in Facebook's crypto: Report
text: Facebook has reportedly secured the backing of over a dozen companies for its upcoming Libra cryptocurrency set to be unveiled this month and launched next year. Uber, Mastercard and Visa, among others, will each invest around $10 million in a consortium that will govern the digital coin, the report said. The money will reportedly fund the coin's creation.

headlines: Youre there for me always: Jeff Bezos shares pic on Father's Day
text: World's richest person Jeff Bezos on Father's Day tweeted a picture of himself with his father Miguel Bezos captioned, "Youre there for me always...I feel it. I love you, Dad." Miguel Bezos is not Jeff's biological father and adopted him as a four-year-old in 1968. Earlier, Jeff had revealed that Miguel came to Miami from Cuba alone aged 16.

headlines: Cabinet expansion for regional balance, new faces: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the cabinet expansion on Sunday was for regional balance and to create an opportunity for other party workers to serve. He added that no one in the cabinet was removed because of "poor performance". 13 ministers were inducted into the state government on Sunday, and six serving ministers tendered their resignations to the CM.

headlines: BJP will be at forefront of pro-people governance: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday tweeted that the NDA family looks forward to fulfilling the dreams of 130 crore Indians. "We assure our fellow Indians we will be at the forefront of pro-people governance and facilitating legislation that manifests the spirit of Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas," he wrote. "We shall...work untiringly for national progress," the PM added.

headlines: Will set up AES research centre in Muzaffarpur: Harsh Vardhan
text: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Sunday said the Centre would set up a state-of-the-art research centre in Muzaffarpur within a year to deal with Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES). "The research centre will work in collaboration with the ICMR and the WHO," Vardhan added. The Minister went to Muzaffarpur for reviewing the situation after the death toll rose to 84.

headlines: SHO shot in Anantnag attack succumbs to injuries at AIIMS
text: The Station House Officer (SHO) Arshad Khan of Jammu and Kashmir Police, who was injured in Anantnag terror attack on June 12, succumbed to his injuries on Sunday at the AIIMS Delhi. He was flown to the national capital earlier in the day after his condition deteriorated. Five CRPF personnel attained martyrdom and three others were injured in the attack.

headlines: RSS chief Bhagwat criticises Mamata for turmoil in Bengal
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for failing to contain the ongoing turmoil and protests by the doctors in the state. He added, "What is happening in Bengal today? Does it happen after elections?" Bhagwat further said that it is the duty of the government to establish rule of law using its "dandashakti" (power).

headlines: Fearing breakup, Delhi woman throws acid on boyfriend, held
text: Fearing breakup, a woman in Delhi allegedly threw acid on her boyfriend, while riding pillion on his bike, police said. The police added that the incident was reported five days ago and it wasn't clear who orchestrated it. The police interrogated the woman after getting a lead from the youth, following which she confessed to the crime and was arrested.

headlines: ArcelorMittal accused of environmental violation in Africa
text: ArcelorMittal South Africa (AMSA), a subsidiary of Lakshmi Mittal's global steel empire, is facing charges of contravening environmental pollution laws in South Africa's Vanderbijlpark. The company had allegedly been given more than a decade to bring about required changes for legal compliance. It faces a fine of up to around $1 million or imprisonment for those responsible, if found guilty.

headlines: J&K Bank to be under RTI, Vigilance Commission guidelines
text: The Jammu and Kashmir Bank will now come under the purview of Right to Information Act and Central Vigilance Commission (CVC) guidelines, an official said on Saturday. The decision was taken by the lender's board to ensure greater transparency and accountability. This comes days after J&K Bank's Chairman Parvez Ahmed was removed over alleged corruption, nepotism and favouritism.

headlines: Kohli walks despite ball not touching his bat off Amir's bowling
text: India captain Virat Kohli walked despite ball not touching his bat after Pakistan appealed against him for a caught behind off Mohammad Amir's bowling in 48th over. The 30-year-old tried to hook an Amir bouncer but couldn't connect, following which Pakistani players made a half-hearted appeal. Kohli looked at his bat and started walking despite umpire not making a call.

headlines: Vaughan trolls Sarfaraz after Pak PM advises him to bat 1st vs India
text: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan trolled Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed for choosing to bowl first against India in World Cup after winning the toss despite Pakistan PM Imran Khan advising him to bat first. "Unless pitch is damp, Sarfaraz must win the toss & bat," Khan had tweeted. Vaughan responded to the tweet saying, "The skipper obviously isnt on Twitter PM."

headlines: My father sold his house to buy a rifle for me, reveals Gagan Narang
text: On the occasion of Father's Day, Olympic bronze medallist shooter Gagan Narang revealed his father sold his house to buy him a rifle 20 years ago. "It was when I came back home crying from...shooting range because the owner of the gun I was using sold it to another shooter," he added. "I cannot repay this debt ever," he wrote.

headlines: Vijay Shankar takes wicket off his first ever delivery in World Cup
text: Team India all-rounder Vijay Shankar dismissed Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq LBW off his first ever delivery in World Cup. The 28-year-old medium pacer was asked to finish Bhuvneshwar Kumar's third over after the latter had to go off the field after sustaining an injury. Imam-ul-Haq was dismissed for seven runs off 18 deliveries.

headlines: India record their highest total vs Pakistan in a World Cup match
text: India put up a total of 336/5 against Pakistan in 2019 World Cup on Sunday to record their highest ever total against their arch-rivals in World Cup history. India's previous highest World Cup total against Pakistan had come in 2015 edition when they scored 300/7 in their allotted 50 overs. Notably, India have never lost to Pakistan in World Cup.

headlines: Pak captain Sarfaraz yawns on field during India's batting, trolled
text: Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed was seen yawning while wicketkeeping during India's batting in their 2019 World Cup match. Twitter users trolled the 32-year-old, with one user writing, "Sarfaraz yawning in field reminds me of how I yawn in my office after lunch time." Another wrote, "That yawn by Sarfaraz is the gap between the quality of both teams today."

headlines: Jadugar Mandrake tied in chains enters Ganga for stunt, goes missing
text: Chanchal Lahiri, known by his stage name 'Jadugar Mandrake', went missing on Sunday after he entered the Ganga river in Kolkata tied up in steel chains. "If I open it up it'll be magic, but it'll be tragic if I can't," Lahiri had said. He claims he successfully performed a similar stunt 21 years ago at the same venue.

headlines: 8 on way to Taj Mahal killed on Expressway after car rams into truck
text: Eight people, including five women, two men and a girl child, died in a road accident on Yamuna Expressway near Mathura after their car rammed into a moving truck on Sunday. They were headed to the Taj Mahal in Agra from the Jewar area of Gautam Buddh Nagar. Five of them died on the spot while three succumbed to injuries.

headlines: IAF Chief BS Dhanoa gifts his 'wings' to new flying officer
text: Indian Air Force Chief BS Dhanoa has gifted his wings to Flying Officer GNK Reddy, who joined the Indian Air Force topping his course and winning the Sword of Honour. "While I hang my uniform in September, let my wings be worn by a young boy," Dhanoa said. Wings are a badge worn by Indian Air Force pilots.

headlines: I hope to be remembered for being virgin: Pornstar trolls Sanders
text: Pornstar Stormy Daniels has trolled White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders for saying that she hopes she'll be remembered as being "transparent and honest". "And I hope to be remembered for being a virgin," Stormy Daniels tweeted. Sanders had said this after US President Trump announced that she will be stepping down from the post by the end of June.

headlines: Vedanta lost $200 mn since Tamil Nadu plant shutdown: Anil Agarwal
text: Vedanta has lost about $200 million in profits since Sterlite Industries Ltds copper plant in Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu, was shut down after protests last year, executive chairman Anil Agarwal said on Sunday. He further claimed the shutdown forced India to import copper, spending precious foreign exchange. The Tamil Nadu government ordered the permanent shutdown of the plant in May 2018.

headlines: Mbappe throws first pitch at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles
text: French forward Kylian Mbappe threw the ceremonial first pitch at the Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles on Saturday ahead of the LA Dodgers-Chicago Cubs match. Earlier in the week, Mbappe met LeBron James, the LA Lakers player and Liverpool supporter, and sat courtside as the Toronto Raptors managed to win the NBA title.

headlines: First Parliament session of 17th LS to commence tomorrow
text: The first session of new Lok Sabha after the general elections will commence on Monday. The first two days of the session will be devoted to oath-taking by 542 members of the 17th Lok Sabha. The oath-taking will be overseen by Virendra Kumar, who'll be sworn in as Pro-tem Speaker by President Ram Nath Kovind ahead of the session.

headlines: Can't win hearts by disrupting functioning of Parliament: PM
text: In the all-party meeting on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi urged all leaders to keep political differences aside and not to disrupt the functioning of the Parliament. "All parties must...commit themselves to tirelessly work in the direction of the nation's progress," he said. While the government put forth its legislative agenda, Opposition raised other issues like farmer distress and water crisis.

headlines: Want Uber Air in India as soon as possible: John Badalamenti
text: John Badalamenti, Head of Design, Advanced Programs & Aviation at Uber said, "In my perfect world, [Uber Air] would want to be in India as soon as possible." The commercial launch of the aerial ridesharing network in Dallas and Los Angeles is set for 2023, he said, adding, "We need to learn first...takes time to understand how things will work".

headlines: UP Police constable sacked for seeking Yogi govt's dismissal
text: Constable Munish Yadav of UP police was sacked for demanding the dismissal of CM Yogi Adityanath's government. Yadav on Saturday wore a red Samajwadi (Party) cap with his uniform and went to the district collectorate carrying a placard which said, "Yogi sarkar ko barkhast karo". He said the government should be dismissed as it couldn't control law and order situation.

headlines: Beti Bachao committees to ensure safety of daughters: Ex-MP CM
text: Former MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Saturday announced that soon Beti Bachao committees will be formed in all the colonies of Bhopal to ensure safety and security of girl child. "The campaign (for the same) begins from [Sunday]," he said. Chouhan added that the campaigners will take out a rally on July 7 to demand death penalty for rapists.

headlines: Declare Abdul Kalam's birthday as Students Day: BJP leader
text: BJP's Ananda Bhaskar Rapolu wrote to HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal requesting to observe October 15, birth anniversary of former President APJ Abdul Kalam, as National Students Day. "As the Missile Man dreamt, the day can be utilised as an occasion to ignite minds of students," he wrote. "Ensure [it's] observed in all the educational institutions of all levels," he added.

headlines: Cyclone Vayu may weaken before recurving towards Gujarat: IMD
text: Cyclone Vayu is likely to gradually weaken before recurving towards Gujarat coast, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). During the next 12 hours, it is likely to weaken into a Cyclonic Storm and then further slow down during the subsequent 12 hours, added IMD. Heavy rainfall is also forecasted in different regions of the state on Monday and Tuesday.

headlines: Aramco's planned IPO is on track, says Saudi Crown Prince
text: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman said state-run oil producer Aramco's IPO will take place as soon as 2020, though no decision has been made on where the stock will trade. The world's top crude exporter aims to list Aramco on its domestic exchange and at least one international exchange. The prince has projected Aramco's value at about $2 trillion.

headlines: Govt may fix minimum benchmark price for various tea grades
text: The Commerce Ministry's Tea Board is considering Indian Tea Association's (ITA) demand to set up minimum benchmark prices for different grades of tea leaves, an official said. The move would help tea companies deal with the sector's cost-disparity problem, according to ITA. The benchmark price is based on tea production and previous month's auction rates.

headlines: Kohli fastest to 11,000 ODI runs, takes 54 fewer innings than Sachin
text: India captain Virat Kohli has become the fastest batsman to score 11,000 runs in ODI cricket, achieving the feat in his 222nd innings, against Pakistan in 2019 World Cup on Sunday. The 30-year-old overtook Sachin Tendulkar, who reached 11,000 runs in his 276th innings, against England in 2002. Kohli was also the fastest to 8,000, 9,000 and 10,000 ODI runs.

headlines: Rohit slams his 2nd ton in 2019 World Cup, overall his 24th in ODIs
text: Opener Rohit Sharma smashed his second hundred in 2019 World Cup, reaching the three-figure mark off 85 balls against Pakistan on Sunday. It is the 32-year-old batsman's second ODI hundred against Pakistan and overall 24th in ODI cricket. Rohit is the fourth Indian batsman after Sachin Tendulkar, Sourav Ganguly and Shikhar Dhawan to score at least three World Cup hundreds.

headlines: Ready to meet CM Mamata in presence of media: West Bengal doctors
text: After a general body meeting was held, junior doctors of NRS Medical College and Hospital have said they're ready to meet West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee at the venue of her choice. "We want immediate end to this impasse by discussion, which, to maintain transparency, shouldn't be behind closed doors, but open to media under camera coverage," the doctors added.

headlines: I do not understand what is Father's Day: Big B on pic with daughter
text: Amitabh Bachchan on Sunday has shared a picture with his daughter Shweta Nanda. "I don't understand what is Father's Day, it is Father's Day for me every day but since Avinash Gowariker clicked this picture and put it up, I accept it, thank you," he wrote. Last year, Bachchan had penned down a poem for Shweta and his granddaughter Navya.

headlines: Alligator seen swimming with a knife stuck in middle of head in US
text: An alligator swimming with a knife stuck in the middle of its head was photographed in Texas, US by a woman named Erin Weaver near her home "It looked like a steak knife...I feel that somebody did this on purpose," the woman said. A Texas wildlife agency is expected to check the alligator next week.

headlines: India may boost exports of 350 products to US, China amid trade war
text: India can boost exports of over 350 products to the US and China amid the trade war between the two countries, a Commerce Ministry study said. Around 151 products including diesel and certain chemicals have the advantage to displace the US exports to China. Similarly, 203 Indian goods including rubber have the advantage to displace Chinese exports to the US.

headlines: Israel PM Netanyahu's wife convicted of misusing public funds
text: An Israeli court on Sunday convicted the wife of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of fraudulently using $100,000 of state funds to order catered meals. Sara Netanyahu falsely declared that there were no cooks available at the PM's residence. She has been ordered to pay the state 45,000 shekels ($12,490) in reimbursement and a 10,000 shekels ($2,775) fine.

headlines: 13-year-old arrested by Saudi in 2014 won't be executed: Report
text: Murtaja Qureiris, who was arrested by Saudi Arabia in 2014 at the age of 13, will not be executed and could be released by 2022, according to a Reuters report quoting a Saudi official. Saudi authorities arrested Qureiris, who had participated in a bike protest during the 2011 Arab Spring, while he was travelling with his family to Bahrain.

headlines: Rahul-Sharma 4th pair to score a century stand vs Pak in WCs
text: Openers KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma became the fourth Indian pair to register a century stand against Pakistan in World Cup matches. Virat Kohli features twice in the list with his century stands with Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina in 2015. Sachin Tendulkar and Mohammad Kaif were the first pair to achieve the feat with their 102-run stand in 2003.

headlines: Very relieved: Faf du Plessis after SA's 1st win at WC 2019
text: Speaking after South Africa's first win at the World Cup 2019, South Africa captain Faf du Plessis said, "Very relieved and a little bit lighter." "I was really pleased with the bowlers and once again Andile and Chris were very good in the middle there," Du Plessis said. South Africa will now face New Zealand on June 19.

headlines: Rohit joins list of Indians with most consecutive 50+ ODI scores
text: Indian opener Rohit Sharma joined the list of Indian players with most consecutive 50+ scores in ODI cricket after scoring his fifth 50+ score in the sides' match against Pakistan on Sunday. The other players in the list are Sachin Tendulkar, Ajinkya Rahane, Rahul Dravid and Virat Kohli, who has achieved the feat twice in his career.

headlines: It's a huge honour every time: Buttler on taking captaincy role
text: Speaking about taking the captaincy role in Eoin Morgan's absence, England's Jos Buttler said, "If it comes to it and I have to captain its obviously a huge honour every time." "From behind the stumps you have a fantastic view of whats going on but its just down to yourself to manage those two jobs and separate them," Buttler said.

headlines: MoS Anurag Thakur holds pre-Budget meeting with startups
text: The Minister of State for Finance & Corporate Affairs Anurag Thakur held a pre-Budget consultation meeting with representatives of the digital economy and startups in connection with forthcoming General Budget 2019-20. Experts and representatives gave suggestions related to enhancement of public services through data analytics, building big data capacity for MSME sector, Angel Tax, among others.

headlines: UP CM Yogi Adityanath pays homage at National War Memorial
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday paid homage at the National War Memorial and the National Police Memorial in New Delhi. "The sacrifice of our soldiers will continue to inspire millions," the CM added. Adityanath further said that PM Narendra Modi has provided an inspirational site for the present and future generations of the country.

headlines: Rare turtle weighing 42 kilogram found in Odisha
text: A turtle of a rare variety weighing 42 kilogram was found on Saturday at the construction site of Biju Expressway in Odisha's Kalahandi district. The forest officials later reached the spot and rescued the rare turtle species. Notably, the state is home to more than 90% of the turtle population in India.

headlines: AIIMS conducts yoga seminar ahead of 5th International Yoga Day
text: Ahead of the fifth International Yoga Day, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi, organised a yoga seminar on Sunday. The initiative was taken up by the department of Centre for Integrative Medicine and Research, AIIMS. The seminar was organised to inculcate the habit of yoga and reduce stress amongst the staff, AIIMS Director, Dr Randeep Guleria, said.

headlines: Man shot dead by Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
text: A man was shot dead by Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Sukma, police said on Sunday. The victim was sleeping in his house on Saturday night when a group of Naxals raided the house and shot him multiple times, the police added. The police said that the motive behind the killing isn't known as Naxals didn't leave any pamphlet at the spot.

headlines: GST Council may extend anti-profiteering authority by 1 year
text: The GST Council is likely to extend the tenure of the National Anti-profiteering Authority (NAA) till November 2020, at its next meeting on June 21, an official said. The NAA deals with customer complaints regarding not receiving tax cut benefits. It was established in November 2017 and has passed 67 orders in various cases.

headlines: Waive dues, can deliver 25,000 flats in 3 months: Builders to UP CM
text: Around 25,000-30,000 flats can be delivered within three months if Noida and Greater Noida authorities waive some dues to developers, a group of builders told Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. Adityanath was meeting a group of builders and buyers to resolve delays in delivering flats to owners. Buyers' interest is supreme to the government and won't be harmed, he said.

headlines: Rating agencies, auditors under SEBI lens over IL&FS fraud
text: Several individuals and entities, including independent directors, rating agencies and auditors associated with crisis-hit IL&FS may face action by market regulator SEBI for alleged fraud at the group, officials said. SEBI is also looking into the role of some listed borrowers, who were allegedly given multiple fresh loans despite earlier defaults. SEBI's probe at IL&FS was launched last year.

headlines: Metal piece found in Lupin drug in US, 18,000 bottles recalled
text: Lupin is recalling over 18,000 bottles of Cefdinir for Oral Suspension, used to treat bacterial infections, from the US market. The Mumbai-based drugmaker is recalling the lot due to "complaint received of metal piece identified in the product bottle prior to the reconstitution", as per the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA). It has been classified as a Class-II recall.

headlines: Ready for WC match with spirit of Father's Day: SRK on pic with son
text: Shah Rukh Khan on Sunday shared a picture of himself with his son Aryan Khan and wrote, "Ready for the match with the spirit of #FathersDay. Go India Go!!" Shah Rukh is seen wearing a jersey which has 'Mufasa' written on it and Aryan's jersey has 'Simba' written on it, who is Mufasa's son in The Lion King movie.

headlines: Rohit smashes most int'l sixes by an Indian, breaks Dhoni's record
text: Opener Rohit Sharma has set the record for hitting the most number of sixes by an Indian in international cricket, achieving the feat after hitting his first six against Pakistan in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday. The 32-year-old overtook ex-captain MS Dhoni, who has slammed 355 sixes in international cricket. Rohit reached 50 off 34 balls in the match.

headlines: Gayle shares pic wearing 'India-Pak suit' ahead of India-Pak match
text: Ahead of India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup match, West Indies opener Chris Gayle shared a picture wearing a suit, with Indian tri-colour and Pakistan colours printed on his blazer. "Yup! I'm rocking my India-Pakistan suit, all love and respect!...I really love it and this will be one of my outfit at my birthday party on September 20th...it's lit," the caption read.

headlines: Vijay Shankar makes his World Cup debut as Pakistan bowl first
text: All-rounder Vijay Shankar is featuring in his first World Cup match after replacing injured opener Shikhar Dhawan for India's match against Pakistan at Manchester today. Dhawan had injured his hand during the match against Australia and is currently being monitored by BCCI medical team. Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed has won the toss and elected to field first.

headlines: By what margin did India beat Pak in their previous 6 WC matches?
text: India and Pakistan faced each other in World Cup for the first time in 1992, with India emerging victorious by 43 runs. In 1996 edition, India knocked out Pakistan in quarter-finals in a match known for Venkatesh Prasad-Aamer Sohail altercation. India defeated Pakistan by 76 runs in 2015 edition to record their biggest victory against Pakistan in World Cup history.

headlines: Who have won Man of the Match award in India-Pak World Cup matches?
text: Sachin Tendulkar was named Man of the Match in the first India-Pakistan World Cup encounter in 1992 for scoring 54* and taking a wicket. He also won the award in 2003 and 2011 for scoring 98 and 85, respectively. Navjot Sidhu won the award in 1996 for scoring 93, while Venkatesh Prasad won it for taking 5 wickets in 1999.

headlines: Pakistan fan arrives on horse for India-Pakistan match, video viral
text: A video of a Pakistani fan arriving at Old Trafford cricket stadium for India-Pakistan World Cup match in Manchester on a horse has gone viral. In the video, the fan can be seen holding a Pakistan flag, while a bus carrying Pakistani fans can be seen following him. India are currently fourth on the points table, while Pakistan are ninth.

headlines: India may be favourites, but Pak must banish fear of losing: Pak PM
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has tweeted that though India are favourites for today's World Cup match, Pakistan should banish all fear of losing. "Fear of losing leads to negative & defensive strategy & crucially mistakes by opponents are not pounced upon," the 1992 World Cup-winning captain wrote. "The power of...mind will decide the outcome of the match today," he added.

headlines: Don't regulate tech just for the sake of it: Google CEO Pichai
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has cautioned against those who may want to regulate big technology businesses "for the sake of regulating". "This doesn't mean you don't scrutinise large companies, but you've to balance it with the fact that you want big, successful companies as well," he added. His remarks came after news of a possible US antitrust probe into Google.

headlines: Ex-Congressman Vikhe Patil sworn in as minister in Fadnavis cabinet
text: Former Congressman and Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra, Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil was sworn in as a minister in Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' cabinet on Sunday. He was sworn in by Governor CV Rao at a function in Raj Bhavan. A total of eight ministers and five ministers of state were sworn in.

headlines: Fix ATMs to walls, pillars or floor by September end: RBI to banks
text: The RBI has asked banks to ensure their ATMs are fixed to a wall, pillar, or floor by September 30, 2019, to enhance their security. ATMs installed in high-security premises such as airports, with adequate CCTV coverage and guards, are exempted from the decision. Additionally, all ATMs shall be operated for cash replenishment only with digital One Time Combination locks.

headlines: Woman returns 2 years after husband was jailed for her murder
text: A woman returned to her mother's house in Ranchi, Jharkhand on Friday, nearly 2 years after her husband spent three months in jail on charges of abduction and murder following her mother's complaint. She had fled her husband's house, leaving him and their five-year-old son in 2017. Before leaving, she had left a letter accusing her husband of torturing her.

headlines: Casual touch does not outrage woman's modesty: Bombay HC
text: Casual touch by a colleague does not constitute an offence of outraging the modesty of a woman, the Bombay high court said on Saturday. The court said this while striking down criminal prosecution of a school headmaster for touching the hands of one of his colleagues in class. The bench noted that it cannot be termed as a deliberate act.

headlines: Switzerland may share details of 50 Indians with Swiss bank accounts
text: Swiss authorities are in the process of sharing details of 50 Indians with accounts in Switzerland-based banks. They include businessmen associated with companies, including the dummy ones, in sectors ranging from real estate, financial services, technology, paints to gems and jewellery among others. They've been given a final opportunity to appeal against the proposed sharing of their details.

headlines: Don't want war, Saudi says as it blames Iran for attack on tankers
text: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has blamed Iran for attacks on two oil tankers in the Gulf of Oman and called on the international community to take a "decisive stand". However, he said that the kingdom does not want a war in the region. He added that Saudi won't hesitate to deal with any threats to its people.

headlines: US planted offensive malware in Russia's power grid: Report
text: The US' Cyber Command has planted "potentially crippling" malware inside Russia's electrical grid, the NYT reported. It's reportedly meant to serve as both a warning and a way to build retaliatory capabilities in case of a conflict between Moscow and Washington. The US has reportedly put reconnaissance probes into control systems of the Russian electric grid since at least 2012.

headlines: No one can stop Modi-led govt from building Ram temple: Uddhav
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said that under the "strong leadership" of PM Narendra Modi, no one will be able to stop Ram temple from being constructed in Ayodhya. He added, "We strongly believe...the temple will be constructed at the earliest." Uddhav, his son Aditya Thackeray along with 18 Sena MPs offered prayers at the makeshift Ram Lalla shrine today.

headlines: By-polls to 6 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on July 5: EC
text: The Election Commission (EC) has announced that by-polls to the six vacant Rajya Sabha seats will take place on July 5. Out of the six seats, two seats are vacant in Gujarat, one in Bihar and three in Odisha. Two seats from Gujarat fell vacant after sitting MPs Amit Shah and Smriti Irani were elected to the Lok Sabha.

headlines: 4 killed in separate incidents of lightning in Chhattisgarh
text: Four people were killed in separate lightning incidents during rain and thunderstorm in Chhattisgarh, police said. It added, a 16-year-old boy and his eight-year-old brother, died after lightning struck them in Balrampur. In another incident, a 17-year-old girl and her 18-year-old cousin sister were struck by lightning while they were taking bath at a farm in Korba, the police said.

headlines: BSF troopers perform yoga in Naxal-affected areas of Odisha
text: Ahead of the International Yoga Day on June 21, BSF troopers on Sunday performed yoga in south Odisha's Naxal-affected Malkangiri district. The BSF personnel were seen doing different types of 'asanas' (body postures) as they gear up for the D-Day. On Friday, Indo-Tibetan Border Police troopers also performed yoga at an altitude of 18,000 feet in Jammu and Kashmir's Ladakh.

headlines: 13-yr-old boy sodomised by 4 men in UP's Shahjahanpur: Police
text: A 13-year-old boy was allegedly sodomised by four men in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur, police said on Sunday. The incident took place on Saturday evening when the accused forcibly took the boy to an orchard and allegedly sodomised him, the police added. The boy subsequently narrated his ordeal to his family, who filed a complaint with the police.

headlines: Uber Eats offers fans a chance to win tickets to ICC WC 2019
text: This ICC World Cup, Uber Eats is sending cricket fans to watch the match live in England. Users can now make their Home Advantage count by scoring runs with every order and stand a chance of winning tickets to the world cup, official ICC merchandise and exclusive Uber Eats offers.

headlines: Rajasthan's Suman Rao crowned Miss India 2019
text: Rajasthan's Suman Rao was named Miss India at the 56th Femina Miss India 2019. Miss India 2018 Anukreethy Vas crowned Suman, a CA aspirant, who'll go on to represent India at Miss World. Sanjana Vij of Telangana was runner-up, while Bihar's Shreya Shanker was crowned Miss India United Continents 2019. Huma Qureshi and Chitrangda Singh were among the judges.

headlines: Who is Miss India 2019 winner Suman Rao?
