text: Rajasthan's Suman Rao, who was crowned Miss India 2019 on Saturday, was brought up in Mumbai and is a CA aspirant. The 20-year-old from Udaipur has also been the 1st runner up at Miss Navi Mumbai 2018. Suman, who is 5 feet 10 inches tall, is interested in dancing and has undergone training in Kathak.

headlines: Match between India-Pakistan a 'final' before the final: Inzamam
text: Pakistan chief selector Inzamam-ul-Haq has said the 2019 World Cup match between India and Pakistan is a 'final' before the final. "People are always excited about the match. The stadium has a capacity of 24,000 but 8 lakh people applied for the tickets of this match. So, it gives you an idea of how big the match is," he added.

headlines: SA beat Afghanistan, register their 1st win in 2019 WC in 5th match
text: South Africa defeated Afghanistan by nine wickets (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed match on Saturday to register their first victory in 2019 World Cup in their fifth match. South Africa leg-spinner Imran Tahir, who finished with figures of 7-0-29-4, was named Man of the Match. Afghanistan remain the only team without a victory in the 2019 World Cup so far.

headlines: Former WeWork VP alleges age discrimination at work, sues it
text: A former WeWork Vice President, Richard Markel, has sued the US-based co-working space startup alleging it discriminated against him based on his age. The lawsuit claimed WeWork misrepresented the job position, characterising it as long-term, and retaliated against him for approaching HR against the discrimination. WeWork hired someone 20 years younger than him with the same title, it added.

headlines: Russian scientists mock Elon Musk, launch toy car to space
text: Russian scientists conducted successful tests of their first automatic stratostat drifting with a toy car, apparently mocking billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk. Musk had launched his own cherry-red Tesla Roadster car in his aerospace startup SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rocket's first flight with a dummy 'Starman'. Russian scientists' toy car carried a cutout of Roscosmos chief Dmitry Rogozin to space.

headlines: Open for talks with Mamata, will decide venue later: Doctors
text: Junior doctors of NRS Medical College have said they're open for talks with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee while adding, "If... meeting is to be held, we'll discuss venue in general body meeting." The doctors earlier turned down an invite for a closed-door meeting. They also refuted Mamata's claims that some of their colleagues visited her at the state secretariat.

headlines: Putin gifts Xi box full of ice cream on his 66th birthday
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin presented his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping with a box full of ice cream for his 66th birthday before a summit in Tajikistan on Saturday. "Happy birthday, my best wishes... I am delighted to have a friend like you," Putin told Xi. Replying to Putin, Xi said, "You enjoy great authority in the hearts of Chinese people."

headlines: Trump admin still owes $7 million for 2017 inauguration: Report
text: US President Donald Trump's administration and Congress reportedly owe District of Columbia over $7 million in expenses from the 2017 presidential inauguration. Of the $20 million Congress had appropriated for the inauguration, about $14 million was spent on policy deployments, $3.6 million was allocated for fire and emergency medical services and $2.2 million went toward transportation services.

headlines: New mango variety named after Home Minister Amit Shah
text: A new variety of mango has been named after Home Minister Amit Shah by celebrated mango grower, Haji Kalimullah. The new variety will be "good in weight and taste" and will be called 'Shah' mango. Kalimullah said he has been impressed by Shah's personality, "who possesses the ability to weave the social fabric and bring people on to one platform."

headlines: Samsung Galaxy Fold launch further delayed beyond July: Report
text: South Korean technology giant Samsung has reportedly further extended the launch of its foldable smartphone Galaxy Fold beyond July. The smartphone was originally set to release on April 26, but Samsung indefinitely delayed the device after multiple review units experienced display issues. Samsung CEO DJ Koh had earlier in May said, "We will not be too late."

headlines: Maharashtra's six districts to be diesel-free: Nitin Gadkari
text: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said that he has taken up an initiative of making six districts in Maharashtra diesel-free for a period of five years. The selected districts include Nagpur, Bhandara, Gondia, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli and Wardha. "I have set up six factories where bio-CNG will be made for trucks and buses," he added.

headlines: Rahul should get married to become stronger: Ramdas Athawale
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Saturday gave a piece of advice to Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying that the leader should get married to become "stronger". His comment came after reports re-surfaced claiming Rahul being adamant on his resignation as party chief. Praising Rahul's efforts, Athawale further said that he "worked hard" during the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Sena appoints Vinayak Raut as leader of party in Lok Sabha
text: The Shiv Sena on Saturday appointed Member of Parliament from Maharashtra's Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg constituency, Vinayak Raut, as the leader of the party in the Lok Sabha. Raut was previously elected as a member of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly from Vile-Parle for 1999-2004. Shiv Sena has a strength of 18 members in the 17th Lok Sabha.

headlines: Lucknow Development Authority building road using plastic waste
text: In a first, the Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) is constructing a road using plastic waste. "Mixing plastic waste increases the durability of roads by 40-50%. They'll be durable for a longer time," chief engineer Indu Shekhar Singh said. He added, "LDA will be following all the guidelines of the Central Road Research Institute (CRRI) in the construction of this road."

headlines: Terrorism has shrunk in Valley: J&K Guv at NITI Aayog meet
text: Addressing the 5th Governing Council meeting of NITI Aayog, Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that terrorism has shrunk in the Valley as the people of the state aren't giving shelter to militants. Malik said that the time has come to focus on the state's development. He added, "We also need to focus on agricultural products."

headlines: India imposes retaliatory tariffs on 28 US products
text: India has decided to impose retaliatory tariffs on 28 US products, including almonds, apples and walnuts, after the US withdrew duty-free benefits for Indian exporters. India announced these higher tariffs in June 2018 after the US refused to exempt it from new steel and aluminium tariffs. India is the largest buyer of US almonds and second-largest buyer of US apples.

headlines: Rishabh Pant joins Team India in Manchester, says 'Good to be back'
text: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant took to Twitter to share a picture of himself after joining Team India in Manchester as a cover for injured opener Shikhar Dhawan. "Good to be back. Thank you for all your support and love India. Bharat Mata ki Jai!" he captioned the picture. The 21-year-old was seen taking tips from MS Dhoni at the ground.

headlines: SL collapse from 205/3 to 247/10 as Aus win their 4th 2019 WC match
text: Australia registered their fourth victory in 2019 World Cup after defeating Sri Lanka by 87 runs at The Oval on Saturday. Sri Lanka, who were 205/3 at one stage, were dismissed for 247 as fast bowlers Mitchell Starc and Kane Richardson took seven wickets between them. Australia have now defeated Sri Lanka in eight of their 10 World Cup matches.

headlines: Told friends don't ask me for passes, watch India-Pak on TV: Kohli
text: Captain Virat Kohli, in a press conference ahead of India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup match, said he told his friends to watch the match on TV and not ask him for passes. "If you start the process of organising tickets or passes...then there's no end to it," he added. "I prefer there aren't many people asking for passes," he further said.

headlines: Want India to win match against Pak: Pak captain's uncle in UP
text: Mahmood Hassan, the maternal uncle of Pakistan cricket team captain Sarfaraz Ahmed, on Saturday said, "I want India to win the match against Pakistan." He added, "I also wish my nephew to perform well in the match tomorrow so that he remains the captain of his team." Sarfaraz Ahmed's uncle Mahmood Hassan lives in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah.

headlines: Haryana Roadways bus tried to kill me: Shooter Bhaker on accident
text: India's 17-year-old shooter Manu Bhaker survived a road accident after a speeding bus hit the car she was in. Bhaker took to Twitter to share a picture of the damaged car, writing, "Haryana Roadways tried to kill me. Running Rush drive and overtaking on very high speed...Bus no. 5483...Driver name Mohan...said he has to reach Chandigarh and can't wait!"

headlines: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani booked for 'fake' video defaming school
text: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani has been booked for allegedly sharing a fake video on social media and defaming a private school. On May 20, Mevani shared a video showing a half-naked student being beaten up by someone, who he claimed was the school's teacher. The school's principal lodged a case against Mevani, saying the video was not from her school.

headlines: 34-yr-old Kerala woman police officer burnt to death; attacker in ICU
text: A 34-year-old woman Civil Police Officer in Kerala's Alappuzha on her way home was burnt to death after she was stabbed and set on fire by a man in broad daylight on Saturday. The attacker has been identified as Ajaz, a police officer posted at Aluva traffic station. Ajaz also suffered burn injuries and is being treated in ICU.

headlines: Railways withdraws proposal to offer massage after negative feedback
text: The Railways today said the proposal on providing head, neck and foot massages to passengers of 39 trains originating from Indore had been withdrawn. The services were proposed to be offered into three categories gold, diamond and platinum. The decision was taken after Western Railways received negative feedback from passengers and a BJP MP wrote to Railways Minister Piyush Goyal.

headlines: MP makes buying 2 helmets mandatory for registering two-wheelers
text: The Madhya Pradesh government has issued a directive that mandates buyers of two-wheelers to purchase two helmets and show the receipt to the Transport Department to get their vehicle registered. The Transport Department has also instructed automobile dealers to sell/provide helmets along with the two-wheelers. The state government's move aims to curb the rise in road accidents.

headlines: Ivanka Trump, husband made up to $135 mn last year while in govt
text: Ivanka Trump and husband Jared Kushner earned up to $135.1 million last year in outside income while working as unpaid senior advisers to her father, President Donald Trump. Ivanka made $4 million from her 7.5% stake in her father's Washington hotel last year. She also made at least $1 million from her line of branded apparel, jewellery and other merchandise.

headlines: Trump warns of massive stock market crash if he's not re-elected
text: President Donald Trump on Saturday warned that US would face a massive stock market crash if he's not re-elected in 2020. "If anyone but me takes over...there will be a Market Crash the likes of which has not been seen before!" the 73-year-old tweeted. The Dow Jones index, whose performance Trump often references, last peaked over eight months ago.

headlines: Ex-chemistry teacher now Asia's richest self-made woman at $10.5 bn
text: China's Zhong Huijuan, a former chemistry teacher who founded Hansoh Pharmaceutical in 1995, became Asia's wealthiest self-made woman with a $10.5-billion fortune, according to Bloomberg. Hansoh, in which she holds a 68% stake, surged 37% during its first day of trading. Zhong's wealth has now surpassed her husband Sun Piaoyang's separate $9.4-billion fortune from his pharma firm Jiangsu Hengrui.

headlines: Instagram is made to make you feel bad, says Madonna
text: American singer-songwriter Madonna, at a recent interview, said, "I think Instagram is made to make you feel bad." "People are a slave to winning other's approvals...I refuse to bend a knee to convention and what society expects of me as a woman," she said. "You get caught up in comparing yourself to other people," the 60-year-old artiste further added.

headlines: Rahul most technically-gifted batsman in the Indian team: Lara
text: Former West Indies cricketer Brian Lara said that according to him KL Rahul is the most technically-gifted batsman in the Indian team. "In the event of a top-order collapse, Rahul can repair the damage," Lara added. "India is strong in all departments. Jasprit Bumrah is the best limited-overs fast bowler in the world," Lara said about the Indian team.

headlines: Caster Semenya rejects Diamond League 800m invitation
text: Two-time Olympic champion Caster Semenya will not run the 800m race at the Diamond League in Rabat on Sunday as she declined the organisers' invitation. "She received an invitation but is unable to organise her schedule to come to Rabat," organiser Alain Blondel said. Semenya has been named in South Africa's preliminary squad for the World Championships later this year.

headlines: It is going to be India or England: Yuvraj predicts WC winner
text: On being asked to predict the winner of the ongoing World Cup 2019, former Indian international cricketer Yuvraj Singh said, "I think we have a great chance. I definitely think, either it is going to be India or England." "Australia definitely is right up there. West Indies or New Zealand is possibly coming up as the fourth team," Yuvraj added.

headlines: US woman sues Amazon over Alexa recording kids' voices
text: Amazon is facing a new lawsuit filed by a woman in US' Massachusetts on behalf of her 10-year-old daughter and children from eight other states, over Alexa recording kids' voices. It alleged Amazon holds "a massive database of billions of voice recordings containing private details of millions of Americans." Amazon responded saying it allows users to voluntarily delete voice recordings.

headlines: Terrorism gravest threat people face in Asia: Foreign Minister
text: At the fifth Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA) Summit on Saturday, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar said that terrorism poses the "gravest threat" to the people in Asia. The CICA members are also victims of terrorism, he added. "It should be clear that terrorists and their victims must never be equated," Jaishankar further said.

headlines: Give reports on political violence, doctors' strike: MHA to WB govt
text: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) issued an advisory to the West Bengal government and sought reports on doctors' strike and measures taken to contain political violence in the state. The Ministry said, "Unabated violence over the years is evidently a matter of deep concern." "Continued trend of political violence...is indicative of the failure of state's law enforcement machinery," MHA added.

headlines: Rajasthan CM meets Sitharaman, seeks timely release of funds
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday to discuss his state's various financial issues. Gehlot said as the practice of releasing a state's share in central taxes on the first date of the month has changed, "the states are facing financial issues". He also requested for finance approval of seven pending drinking water projects in Rajasthan.

headlines: US grants sanctions waiver to Iraq to import gas from Iran
text: The US has allowed Iraq to import Iranian gas for its power grid for another three months by extending a waiver to sanctions. "An additional 120-day waiver was granted to allow Iraq to continue to pay for electricity imports from Iran," the US said. The US reimposed sanctions on Iran's oil industry last year after withdrawing from 2015 nuclear deal.

headlines: We have accepted all their demands: Mamata on doctors' protest
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee today addressed the media on the ongoing doctors' protest and said, "We've accepted all their demands." She added, "I sent my ministers, principal secretary to meet the doctors, waited for five hours to meet doctors' delegations, but they didn't come." Calling the assault "unfortunate", Mamata said the state is fully committed to take necessary steps.

headlines: Finch hits highest WC score by Aus captain, breaks Ponting's record
text: Australia opener Aaron Finch smashed 153 runs off 132 balls against Sri Lanka in the 2019 World Cup on Saturday to record the highest ever score by an Australian captain in a World Cup match. The previous record was held by Ricky Ponting, who slammed 140 runs off 121 balls against India in the 2003 World Cup final.

headlines: Disappointed by pettiness India vs Pak match is reduced to: Bhogle
text: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has criticised commercials being run in India and Pakistan for their World Cup match. "I'm disappointed by pettiness and jingoism that #INDvsPAK at cricket is being reduced to," he wrote. The host broadcaster in India ran a commercial terming India as Pakistan's father, while a private channel in Pakistan mocked IAF pilot Abhinandan in its ad.

headlines: Fan asks Ravichandran Ashwin to keep mankading, spinner says 'Deal'
text: Kings XI Punjab captain Ravichandran Ashwin was asked by a fan on Twitter to keep mankading to which the spinner replied, "Deal". The fan had commented on Ashwin's tweet which read, "99 percent can't be honest to themselves. One big joy of life is to stay in denial." Ashwin was criticised for mankading Rajasthan Royals' Jos Buttler in IPL 2019.

headlines: Will invest heavily in countries where we're welcome: Huawei
text: World's largest telecoms equipment supplier Huawei has said it will invest heavily in countries where it is welcomed. This comes after the US put Huawei on its 'Entity List' over alleged espionage concerns, effectively banning it from US communications networks. Huawei added rolling out 5G technology globally would be much more challenging if the US goes ahead with its sanctions.

headlines: Apple CEO Tim Cook meets Donald Trump amid US-China trade war
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook on Thursday met with US President Donald Trump in the White House amid ongoing trade tensions between the US and China. Trump's meeting with Cook was disclosed by his daughter and adviser Ivanka Trump, however, the details of the conversation weren't uncovered. Notably, the US has imposed tariffs on $250-billion worth of Chinese products so far.

headlines: Two friends secure second and third ranks in JEE-Advanced 2019
text: Two youngsters who have been friends for the last one-and-a-half years, Himanshu Gaurav Singh and Archit Bubna, on Friday secured the second and the third ranks respectively in JEE-Advanced 2019. The two studied in separate branches of the same coaching institute. "We have learnt a lot from each other and we used to exchange insights on our preparation," Singh said.

headlines: Was away from social media, used basic phone: JEE Advanced topper
text: JEE Advanced 2019 topper, Maharashtra's Kartikey Chandresh Gupta said he was away from social media for two years and used a basic Nokia phone instead of a smartphone. He obtained 346/372 marks - 121 in Mathematics, 113 in Physics and 112 in Chemistry. He said dinnertime conversations with his friends were the best part of his hostel life in Mumbai.

headlines: UK joins US in blaming Iran for attacking tankers in Gulf of Oman
text: The UK has joined the US in accusing Iran of attacking two oil tankers in the Gulf of Oman on Thursday. "No other state or non-state actor could plausibly have been responsible," the UK government said. The UK further blamed Iran for an attack on four oil tankers off the coast of UAE last month.

headlines: Swiss women burn bras, go on strike to protest inequality
text: Thousands of women in Switzerland turned to the streets to protest against inequality and called for equal pay, recognition of their work and greater representation in positions of power. The protesters walked off the job, burned bras and blocked traffic in the nationwide strike. This comes 28 years after Switzerland's first nationwide women's strike for equal rights.

headlines: US baby cut out of murdered 19-year-old mother's womb dies
text: A baby boy cut out of his mother's womb with a butcher knife during an attack in US' Chicago has died after around two months on life support. Ochoa-Lopez was allegedly strangled with a cable after she went to a woman's house to pick up free baby clothes. Three people have been charged in the killing of the 19-year-old mother.

headlines: 28-yr-old Myanmar doctor's licence cancelled for posting bikini pics
text: Myanmar's 28-year-old model and doctor Nang Mwe San will appeal against a medical council decision to revoke her licence for posting photos of herself on Facebook in bikinis. A general physician for four years, San stopped practising two years ago to pursue a modelling career. "Did I dress in sexy outfits when I was meeting my patients? Never," she said.

headlines: Mallya, Nirav's jail cell has French windows, 24x7 water: Report
text: The cell at Mumbai's Arthur Road jail, where Nirav Modi and Vijay Mallya are likely to be lodged if extradited, reportedly has large French windows and a toilet with 24x7 water supply. The 300-square-foot freshly painted cell also has fans, lights and cushioned cots, reports added. The cell is located in Barrack 12, which is away from the main building.

headlines: IIT students may file fresh suit against 'Super 30' release
text: Four IIT students may file a fresh suit against the release of 'Super 30', film based on mathematician Anand Kumar. The students filed a PIL against Kumar last year stating he makes false claims about the number of his students who get into IIT. They said a film celebrating Kumar shouldn't be released as he's still facing a court case.

headlines: Sri Lanka first team to concede 19 tons in World Cup matches
text: The Sri Lankan team became the first international cricket team to concede 19 individual centuries in World Cup matches after Australia's Aaron Finch hit a ton against Sri Lanka at the World Cup 2019 on Saturday. Zimbabwe have conceded 18 tons, while New Zealand have conceded 16 centuries in World Cup matches.

headlines: Real Madrid confirm signing of 'Japanese Messi' Takefusa Kubo
text: Real Madrid confirmed the signing of Japanese teenager Takefusa Kubo on Friday. Kubo, who is known as the 'Japanese Messi', will play for Madrid's B team, Castilla, next season. Kubo made his full international debut against El Salvador earlier this month and was also linked with Barcelona, Paris Saint-Germain and Premier League champions Manchester City.

headlines: Take strict action against assault on doctors: Health Minister to CMs
text: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Saturday wrote to CMs of all states and union territories asking them to take strict action against anyone who assaults doctors. "It's state's duty to ensure safety of doctors who assure society's healthcare needs are met," he wrote. This comes after the recent assault on doctors in West Bengal triggered nationwide protest by medical professionals.

headlines: Pakistan says will hold talks with India on 'basis of equality'
text: Pakistan will hold talks with India on the "basis of equality", Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi said. "India has to make this decision, we are neither in haste nor troubled. When India prepares itself, it would find us prepared, but we will hold talks on the basis of equality, in a dignified manner," he added.

headlines: Brazil's Supreme Court makes homophobia a crime
text: Brazil's Supreme Court has voted to criminalise homophobia and transphobia in the same way as racism under the country's laws until the Congress creates a specific law for the subject. Brazil's laws banning racism were passed in 1989 and provide a jail sentence of up to five years. Notably, Brazil legalised same-sex marriages in 2013.

headlines: Why is June celebrated as LGBTQ pride month around the world?
text: The LGBTQ pride month is celebrated in June to commemorate the anniversary of Stonewall riots at Stonewall Inn in New York, a gathering space for LGBTQ community during the 60s. On June 28, 1969, police raided the inn, leading to the gay liberation movement in the US. 'Mother of Pride' Brenda Howard organised the first pride parade a year later.

headlines: Sachin reveals he played full 2009 NZ tour with fractured finger
text: Ex-India batsman Sachin Tendulkar has revealed he played the entire tour of New Zealand in 2009 with a fractured finger. He added he sustained the injury in the very first match of the tour and still played the entire tour with "huge padding protecting" his fingers. He further said that Shikhar Dhawan is a fighter and he'll come back fighting.

headlines: Warner hugs net bowler he struck, gifts him autographed jersey
text: Australia opener David Warner met the Indian-origin net bowler he struck last week during practice, hugged him and gifted him an autographed Australia jersey. Jaykishan Plaha was hospitalised for a couple of days after getting hit on the head and was monitored by doctors for delayed signs of concussion. Warner also met Plaha's family ahead of match against Sri Lanka.

headlines: Only idiots see beautiful women as problem: Dutch MP on F1 grid girls
text: Dutch MP Roy van Aalst has said that grid girls should be re-introduced to Formula 1, adding that the decision of removing the practice is "the umpteenth form of female patronisation". "Grid girls belong just as much to Formula 1 as the cars. Only a huge idiot can see a beautiful woman as a problem," he added.

headlines: Amazon shuts Instagram-like shopping platform Spark: Report
text: E-commerce giant Amazon has quietly shut down its Instagram-like shopping social networking platform Spark, less than two years after it was launched, TechCrunch reported. Spark was focused on users posting images, stories and ideas about products and purchases. Amazon declined to comment on the apparent shutdown of Spark, but the service is gone from the website and app, TechCrunch added.

headlines: Punjab Cong councillor's brother beats woman after fight over money
text: The brother of Congress Councillor Rakesh Chaudhary and his aides allegedly assaulted a woman after fight over a money-lending issue in Punjab's Muktsar on Friday. Images of the incident show men kicking and hitting the woman while she's lying on the ground. The police have arrested six people in the matter and the woman has been admitted to a hospital.

headlines: Trolled after Digvijaya's defeat, Vairagyanand seeks self-immolation
text: Trolled on social media for not taking 'Samadhi' after Congress candidate Digvijaya Singh's defeat in Lok Sabha elections from Bhopal as promised, Swami Vairagyanand Giri has approached the collector of Bhopal. In his application, Swami Vairagyanand has sought permission for self-immolation. "I wish to undergo a Samadhi at 2:11 oclock on June 16 to fulfil my resolve," he stated.

headlines: Bomb hurled at TMC workers' house in WB, 2 dead
text: TMC workers Khairuddin Sheikh and Sohel Rana died after a bomb was allegedly hurled at their residence in Murshidabad district, West Bengal. Fifty-five-year-old Khairuddin and 19-year-old Sohel are from the same family. "We were sleeping. Suddenly our house was bombed. They shot my father. Few days back, my uncle was also killed. Congress is behind this," claimed Khairuddin's son Milan.

headlines: Landing humans on Moon could cost up to $30 bn extra: NASA chief
text: NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine, in a recent interview with CNN, said the total cost of landing astronauts back on the Moon could hike up to $30 billion on top of what has already been spent. "But, of course, that would be spread over five years," he added. NASA's 2019 annual budget is estimated at about $21 billion.

headlines: IMD predicts thunderstorm, lightning in Himachal, Uttarakhand
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that thunderstorms accompanied by lightning and strong winds are very likely at isolated places in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand on Sunday. It further predicted that some isolated places in Jammu and Kashmir, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, among other states, are likely to be hit by dust storms accompanied by lightning and strong winds on Sunday.

headlines: PM's letter on rainwater harvesting hand-delivered to village heads
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has written a personal letter requesting gram pradhans for rainwater harvesting during the forthcoming monsoon, which has been hand-delivered to them. The letter, bearing PM's signature, was delivered to the village heads through respective district magistrates and collectors in the districts. In Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra, 637 village heads received the PM's letter.

headlines: PMO shares pics of PM Modi wearing hat, coat gifted by Kyrgyz Prez
text: The Prime Minister's Office shared pictures of PM Narendra Modi wearing a traditional Kyrgyz hat and coat which were gifted to him by Kyrgyzstan's President Sooronbay Jeenbekov. He also presented PM Modi with a 'Samovar', which is a container to heat or boil water. PM Modi held bilateral talks with Jeenbekov on Friday following the conclusion of the SCO summit.

headlines: Pained by Metro Man's viewpoint: Sisodia on free rides to women
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has responded to 'Metro Man' E Sreedharan's letter to PM Narendra Modi against AAP's proposed plan for free metro rides to women. Sisodia said he's "surprised and pained" by Sreedharan's viewpoint. "Delhi government will buy around a million coupons in bulk from the DMRC on a daily basis and provide these to women," Sisodia added.

headlines: No former PMs to be in Parliament during this Budget session
text: No former Prime Ministers will be present in the upcoming budget session of the Parliament, with Manmohan Singh's nearly 30-year-long tenure as an RS member having ended on Friday and HD Deve Gowda having lost the Lok Sabha elections from Tumkur constituency. Notably, the first Budget session after the constitution of the new government will start on June 17.

headlines: Over 600 companies urge Trump to resolve trade dispute with China
text: More than 600 companies including the world's largest retailer Walmart have urged US President Donald Trump in a letter on Thursday to resolve the trade dispute with China. "Tariffs are taxes paid directly by US companies...not China," the letter read. Additional 25% tariffs on $300 billion in imports would wipe out more than 2 million US jobs, the letter said.

headlines: UK bans advertisements depicting gender stereotypes
text: The UK has banned advertisements depicting "harmful gender stereotypes". The ban was enforced after the UK's advertising watchdog found that gender-stereotypical imagery "can lead to unequal gender outcomes in public and private aspects of people's lives". The watchdog would assess each advert by looking at the content and context to determine if new rules have been violated.

headlines: Pak province's govt live streams press conference with cat filter
text: The provincial government in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region was trolled after live streaming a press conference on Facebook with cat filter on. Commenting on the live stream a Facebook user wrote, "Remove the filter. The man has turned into a cat." Reacting to the video a Twitter user wrote, "We now have a cat in the cabinet."

headlines: Turkey seeks jail for 2 Bloomberg journos for currency crisis story
text: Turkish prosecutors are seeking a jail term of between two and five years for two Bloomberg reporters following a complaint from the country's banking regulator. The charges relate to an August 2018 story about how authorities and banks were responding to a sharp decline in the Turkish lira. Bloomberg said it fully stands by the reporters and will support them.

headlines: Fatherhood makes me feel good about myself: Tusshar Kapoor
text: While speaking about raising his son, Tusshar Kapoor said, "Fatherhood makes me feel good about myself." "It has also made me manage my time and be more organised because you've to work with a clock work precision when you're a father," the actor added. Tusshar is a single father to a three-year-old son named Laksshya, whom he welcomed via surrogacy.

headlines: I admire her cool attitude: Anupam on pic with Anushka in London
text: Anupam Kher shared a picture with Anushka Sharma after he met the actress in London, and wrote, "I have always admired her for her work and her cool attitude." "Had fun talking to her about films...army life and of course our favourite Virat Kohli," his caption further read. The actors last featured together in the film 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan'.

headlines: Malayalam actor booked for verbally abusing female activist
text: A case has been registered against Malayalam actor Vinayakan after an activist accused him of verbally abusing her over the phone. In a Facebook post, the woman claimed that Vinayakan asked her to sleep with him and used abusive language when she called to invite him for an event. She stated that she has a recording of the phone call.

headlines: Couple adopts 45 HIV+ kids, employs ex-sex workers as caretakers
text: Chennai's 52-year-old Solomon Raj and his wife Felvia Shanthi have adopted 45 HIV positive children. In 2005, they started an NGO named 'Shelter Trust' to take care of the adopted kids in an organised way. They also employ former commercial sex workers suffering from HIV as caretakers.

headlines: Facebook to improve comment ranking for 'meaningful' chats
text: Facebook has said it'll improve its comment ranking on public posts to promote "meaningful conversations". Comments on public posts will be shown more prominently when a Page or person interacts on their posts or they get comments or reactions from the person's friends. "We'll continue to take other signals into account so we don't prominently show low-quality comments," Facebook added.

headlines: Manmohan Singh meets UPA CMs ahead of NITI Aayog meeting
text: Ahead of the NITI Aayog meeting, former PM Manmohan Singh on Saturday met Chief Ministers of states ruled by the Congress and its allies. As per reports, they discussed agenda/issues of their states to be taken up with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the meeting. Chief Ministers of Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Karnataka, Puducherry and Chhattisgarh were present at the meeting.

headlines: It's a rumour, we won't use Prashant Kishor's services: TDP
text: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) on Friday said the rumours about the party planning to use political strategist Prashant Kishor's services are baseless. "We haven't taken any such decision. We strongly condemn this propaganda," TDP spokesperson Lanka Dinakar said. TDP won three out of 25 seats in Lok Sabha polls and won 23 out of 175 seats in assembly polls.

headlines: Everyone should have freedom of expression: Chhattisgarh CM
text: Stating that he had directed police to withdraw sedition charges against a man who had allegedly spread rumours of power cuts on social media, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said, "Everyone should have freedom of expression." He added, "It was in our manifesto that Section 124A will be scrapped." However, he stated that people shouldn't misuse social media to spread rumours.

headlines: Tanushree didn't state sexual harassment in 2008 FIR on Nana: Police
text: In its closure report on Tanushree Dutta's sexual harassment case against Nana Patekar, Mumbai Police said there was no mention of sexual harassment in the complaint she made in 2008. "Witnesses claim that...Dutta was aware of changes in dance sequence," it added. Last year, Dutta alleged Patekar misbehaved with her while shooting a dance number for 'Horn 'Ok' Pleassss'.

headlines: Anushka's 'Sui Dhaaga' to compete at Shanghai Film Festival
text: Anushka Sharma and Varun Dhawan's 'Sui Dhaaga: Made In India' has been selected to compete at the Shanghai International Film Festival's Belt And Road Film Week. "I eagerly look forward to the audience response at a platform as prestigious as The Shanghai International Film Festival," producer Maneesh Sharma said. The festival will take place between June 15 and June 24.

headlines: Won't take advantage of Hrithik's sister's family dispute: Kangana
text: After Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli claimed that Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina has been calling the actress to apologise for not supporting her, Kangana said, "she has been in touch with me." "[B]ut I don't want to take advantage of her family dispute," Kangana added. Sunaina had earlier revealed that she was facing issues with her family.

headlines: Britney's ex-manager banned from contacting singer, her family
text: Singer Britney Spears' former manager Sam Lutfi has been banned from contacting the singer and her family after a five-year restraining order was filed against him. A Los Angeles judge issued the restraining order on Thursday after hearing the testimonies of Sam as well as Britney's father James Spears. James accused Sam of harassment and called him a "predator".

headlines: Adobe's AI detects Photoshopped faces up to 99% of the time
text: Adobe and UC Berkeley researchers have trained a new AI model which helps detect if faces were manipulated in images using Photoshop, up to 99% of the time. The model was also able to revert images to what it predicted was their original state. In contrast, humans were able to detect the manipulation only 53% of the times, Adobe said.

headlines: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to skip NITI Aayog meeting
text: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao will skip the NITI Aayog meeting scheduled to be held in Delhi on Saturday. According to reports, he is busy with preparations for the inauguration of an irrigation project in Telangana. Earlier, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had announced her refusal to attend the NITI Aayog meeting.

headlines: 26 children rescued from Raipur biscuit factory, sent home
text: As many as 26 children were rescued from a Raipur biscuit factory and sent to their homes on Friday. District Child Protection Officer N Swarnkar said, "We will do their counselling on Saturday and take action against the factory management." As part of a drive against child labour, 24 children were earlier rescued in Raipur.

headlines: Death toll from Encephalitis rises to 66 in Bihar's Muzaffarpur
text: The number of children who have died due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in the Muzaffarpur district of Bihar has risen to 66, officials have said. Till now, over 130 children have been hospitalised in the district. Encephalitis is a viral infection that causes mild flu-like symptoms such as fever, convulsions and headaches.

headlines: Female labour force falls in India, among world's bottom 10: Report
text: India's female Labour Force Participation Rate has fallen to a historic low of 23.3% in 2017-18, the Periodic Labour Force Survey data published by the NSSO showed. This means over three out of four women over the age of 15 in India are neither working nor seeking work. Only nine countries have a lower labour female participation rate than India.

headlines: Special veg meal served to PM Modi at dinner hosted by Kyrgyz Prez
text: A special vegetarian meal was prepared for PM Narendra Modi at the dinner hosted by Kyrgyzstan President Sooronbay Jeenbekov for the world leaders attending SCO summit in Bishkek. The meal included vegetable salad, Pullav without meat, and special pie as dessert. The leaders were served a four-course meal, with a 10-minute difference between the meal courses.

headlines: Rail staff avert train accident on seeing crashing boulder on CCTV
text: Indian Railways staff prevented a train accident on Thursday after Mumbai-Kolhapur Sahyadri Express was stopped on time before it could hit a fallen boulder in the hilly section of Mumbai-Pune route. The CCTV monitoring staff had noticed the 2.2-metre-wide boulder crashing on the tracks and alerted the higher authorities. The train was then held up for two hours.

headlines: 7 people suffocate to death while cleaning hotel sewer in Gujarat
text: As many as seven people, including four sanitation workers, suffocated to death on Saturday while cleaning sewer of a hotel in Gujarat's Vadodara district. Three hotel employees were among those killed. "When one sanitation worker failed to come out of the manhole, others went inside. All of them died due to asphyxiation," District Collector Kiran Jhaveri said.

headlines: Cars fall in river as bridge collapses; video surfaces online
text: A video showing two cars falling into a river after a section of a bridge in China collapsed on Friday has surfaced online. A 44-year-old man was rescued by security guards, while two people are still missing, China's Xinhua News Agency reported. The bridge spans the Dongjiang river in Guangdong province. The cause of the collapse is under investigation.

headlines: Hong Kong leader suspends China extradition bill after protests
text: Hong Kong's leader Carrie Lam has suspended indefinitely government's efforts to pass an extradition law following mass protests and violence. Lam said she had "done her utmost" but admitted that the bill had "caused a lot of division" in society. The bill would have enabled authorities to send criminal suspects to be tried in mainland China.

headlines: Vatsal Sheth joins cast of Aditya Roy Kapur starrer 'Malang'
text: Actor Vatsal Sheth, who has featured in films like 'Taarzan: The Wonder Car', has joined the cast of the upcoming Aditya Roy Kapur and Disha Patani starrer 'Malang'. "I am very excited to be the part of this film. Its going to be an exciting ride," Vatsal said. The film is slated to release on February 14 next year.

headlines: 'Kabir Singh' was emotionally, physically challenging: Shahid
text: While speaking about his upcoming film 'Kabir Singh', actor Shahid Kapoor said, "[It] has been an extremely challenging film for me emotionally and physically." " Since I had three distinct looks in the film, I had to transform myself to quite an extent," the actor added. Shahid further said that he enjoys taking up roles that challenge him.

headlines: I'm very secure as an actress, but not as a star: Taapsee
text: Speaking about her career in the film industry, actress Taapsee Pannu said, "I'm very secure as an actor, but not as a star." "I don't know where will I be sent back to if a couple of my films fail at the box office," the actress added. Taapsee further said that the uncertainty is what keeps her on her toes.

headlines: Hazard presented at Real Madrid's Santiago Bernabeu
text: Belgian forward Eden Hazard was presented at the Real Madrid stadium Santiago Bernabeu. "My dream ever since I was a child has been to play for Real Madrid... I'm not a Galactico, but I'll try to be, for now I'm Eden Hazard," Hazard said. Hazard revealed that he jokingly requested Luka Modric for the number 10 jersey but was denied.

headlines: India's first Dinosaur Museum and Fossil Park opens in Gujarat
text: A Dinosaur Museum and Fossil Park has opened in Gujarats Mahisagar district's Raiyoli village, the first such facility in our country and third in the world. Spread across 72 acres, the park showcases fossilised remains of dinosaurs in the natural form. The museum has 10 galleries showcasing the Earths inception, world dinosaurs, Indian dinosaurs and it also screens 3D movies.

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi to meet party workers twice a week
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has decided to meet ground-level party workers between 10 am and 1 pm every Tuesday and Thursday without any formal appointment. She will also visit Uttar Pradesh to connect with grassroots level workers, and is expected to try to get a sense of Congress' organisational conditions on the ground.

headlines: Ex-Andhra CM undergoes checking, made to travel in bus at airport
text: Former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu, who still has Z-plus security, had to undergo frisking at Vijayawada Airport on Friday. Naidu was also denied VIP access to the aircraft and had to travel in ferry bus along with other passengers to catch his IndiGo flight. A TDP leader said this was second or third time this happened with Naidu.

headlines: Deepika shed it all for her role in Chhapaak: Director Meghna
text: While speaking about Deepika Padukone's portrayal of an acid attack survivor in her upcoming film 'Chhapaak', director Meghna Gulzar said, "She shed it all to play this part." "She completely shed off things as we know of her as Deepika Padukone, the face, the brand, the actor," Meghna added. The forthcoming film is slated to release on January 10, 2020.

headlines: Sweet of them to visit: Rishi on pic with Pak actress Mawra
text: Responding to a picture shared by a Twitter user which featured Rishi Kapoor along with Pakistani actress Mawra Hocane and her friend Khatija, Rishi wrote, "Sweet of them to visit us." Mawra and her friend visited Rishi in New York, where he is currently undergoing treatment for cancer. Mawra made her Bollywood debut with the 2016 film 'Sanam Teri Kasam'.

headlines: Manikarnika's selection in fest is slap for movie mafia: Kangana
text: After her film 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi' was selected to be screened at Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival in South Korea, Kangana Ranaut said, "We are thrilled." "The movie mafia tried to kill this film but for 'Manikarnika' to get...international recognition...is a big slap on movie mafia's face," she added. The film also marked Kangana's debut as a director.

headlines: I watch videos of Kohli's batting, try to learn from them: Babar
text: Ahead of India-Pakistan 2019 World Cup clash, Pakistan batsman Babar Azam revealed he watches videos of Virat Kohli and tries to learn from them. "Kohli's winning ratio is higher (for India) so I am trying to achieve that as well," the 24-year-old added. "All of us are confident the Indian pace attack will be properly handled," he further said.

headlines: Will not beg India to play cricket with us: PCB chief Ehsan Mani
text: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Ehsan Mani has insisted that his team will "not beg" India to play cricket with them. "We want resumption of bilateral cricket ties with India in a decent and dignified manner," he added. India and Pakistan have not played a bilateral series since January 2013, however, they have met several times in the multilateral events.

headlines: We don't need to make gestures: PCB chief Mani on Dhonis gloves
text: Pakistan Cricket Board chief Ehsan Mani has said that the controversy over Indian Army insignia on MS Dhoni's gloves won't impact Sunday's World Cup match between India and Pakistan. "You wont get any spillover from the Pakistan side. They are there to play cricket, full stop. We dont need to make gestures," he added.

headlines: YSRCP manifesto a holy document, each dept to get copy: Andhra Guv
text: The Andhra Pradesh government will provide all departments with YSRCP's election manifesto to ensure that all promises are being implemented, Governor ESL Narasimhan has said. Calling the manifesto a "holy document", he added, "Our government is committed to implementing all the promises made to the people and a beginning to this effect has already been made, generating euphoria among people."

headlines: Indian girl died near US-Mexico border as mother sought water
text: A six-year-old girl from India died of heat stroke in an Arizona desert after her mother left her with other migrants to go in search of water, a medical examiner and US Border Patrol have said. The girl and her mother were among a group of five Indian nationals dropped off by smugglers in the area near the US-Mexico border.

headlines: Won't attend meeting called by CM Mamata: Protesting doctors
text: The doctors protesting in West Bengal have said they won't attend the meeting called by CM Mamata Banerjee at the state secretariat today. The state of West Bengal is witnessing protests by doctors, triggered after an attack on a junior doctor. According to Health Ministry sources, over 300 doctors from across the state have submitted their resignations till now.

headlines: Southern Railways withdraws order asking staff to use only Eng, Hindi
text: The Southern Railways, in a circular to Chennai division staff, said official communication between Divisional Control Offices and Station Masters should either be in Hindi or English as using regional language could lead to miscommunication. However, the order was withdrawn and a revised circular directed staff to be highly cautious when communicating but gave no direction on language usage.

headlines: Govt says 'Vayu' may hit Guj hours after CM ordered evacuees' return
text: Secretary of Earth Sciences Ministry M Rajeevan on Friday said Cyclone Vayu is likely to recurve and hit Gujarat's Kutch on June 17-18, hours after CM Vijay Rupani ordered return of around 3 lakh evacuees. Rupani had announced that Vayu posed no threat to Gujarat. Meanwhile, Rajeevan stated that the intensity of the very severe cyclonic storm may also reduce.

headlines: Trump says UK Queen had more fun with him than in 25 years
text: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that Queen Elizabeth II had more fun with him during his state visit to the United Kingdom this month than she has had in 25 years. "I have such a great relationship, and we were laughing and having fun," Trump added. Earlier, the US President called the Queen an "incredible lady".

headlines: My mental fabric changes a bit after every film I do: Taapsee
text: While speaking about her acting career, Taapsee Pannu said, "[A]fter every film, my mental fabric changes a bit." "Usually, I shoot most of my films at one stretch and that is why for that time being, I become someone closer to my charactereven in real life," she explained. Taapsee further said that she feels actors approach reality differently.

headlines: Trying to return to India by August-end: Rishi on cancer treatment
text: Actor Rishi Kapoor, who is undergoing treatment for cancer in New York, has said that he is trying to return to India by the end of August. "I have recovered well and I'm feeling good. Must be 100% fit by the time I am back," Rishi added. The actor recently revealed that he is cancer-free and in remission.

headlines: CERN drops Microsoft after 20 years as fee hikes by 10 times
text: European Organisation for Nuclear Research (CERN) has announced it is dropping the use of Microsoft products after about 20 years as its licence fee has increased by over ten times. CERN's last contract ended in March, following which Microsoft revoked its "academic institution" status, which had provided it with a discounted licence. CERN added it will switch to open-source software.

headlines: Amit Shah meets several CMs ahead of NITI Aayog meet
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday met with Chief Ministers of Goa, Sikkim, Assam and Andhra Pradesh and governors of Goa, Sikkim, Assam, Haryana, Meghalaya and UP. The state heads are in Delhi to attend fifth Governing council meeting of NITI Aayog on Saturday. The key issues to be discussed at the meeting are rainwater harvesting, drought situation, among others.

headlines: Modi is PM, I'm CM, we need to work together: Jagan Reddy
text: Stating that it's very important that he receives PM Narendra Modi when the latter visits Andhra Pradesh, CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy said, "He's the PM and I'm the CM, and we need to work together." Reddy added, "I need him to run the state finances. So it's very important that the relations between the state and Centre are cordial."

headlines: NASA to retire Spitzer Space Telescope after 16 yrs in 2020
text: NASA has announced it will permanently switch off its Spitzer Space Telescope on January 30, 2020, after nearly 16 years of exploring the cosmos in infrared light. Designed for a minimum of 2.5 years, the spacecraft will have operated for more than 11 years beyond its prime mission, NASA added. The telescope had helped reveal a new ring around Saturn.

headlines: NASA probe breaks own record for closest cosmic body orbit
text: NASA spacecraft OSIRIS-REx broke a space exploration record after entering into the closest-ever orbit around an extraterrestrial body, about six months after previously breaking it. The probe is now orbiting at around 930 metres away from asteroid Bennu's centre of gravity. Bennu, about 110 million kilometres away from Earth, is the smallest celestial body ever orbited.

headlines: Rot in hell: Raveena on video of man smashing cake on lion's face
text: Actress Raveena Tandon has reacted to a video of a man smashing a cake on a lion's face, with other men posing near the lion while another person is recording their video. "Pathetic bunch of loser human [beings]....hope they rot in hell," she tweeted. Criticising the video, users wrote comments like "This not funny" and "No words for them".

headlines: Akshay reacts as Rohit gets criticised for moving film date for Salman
text: Akshay Kumar has responded after fans criticised filmmaker Rohit Shetty for shifting the release date of Akshay's 'Sooryavanshi' for Salman Khan's 'Inshallah'. "I can...understand your angst, all I can do is request you all with folded hands not to start/ participate in such trends," he tweeted. 'Sooryavanshi', which was supposed to release on Eid 2020, will now release in March.

headlines: Getting Ind-Pak match tickets from Dhoni since 2011: Pak superfan
text: Pakistan superfan Mohammad Bashir (aka Chacha Chicago) has revealed ex-India captain MS Dhoni has been arranging India-Pakistan match tickets for him since 2011. "I don't call him as he is so busy. I keep in touch only through text messages," he added. "Imagine I get the ticket for free when most would pay a fortune for it," he further said.

headlines: NZ coach encourages players to be with families during WC breaks
text: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead has recommended that his players spend time with their families in the long breaks between matches during the 2019 World Cup. "I think its important that you manage your breaks," he added. New Zealand will next face South Africa in the 2019 World Cup on June 19.

headlines: Root slams 16th ODI ton as England register 3rd win in 2019 WC
text: England defeated West Indies by 8 wickets to register their third victory in four matches at the 2019 World Cup. The match witnessed Joe Root, who opened the innings for England, smash his second hundred of the tournament and overall his 16th ODI hundred. England have now defeated West Indies six times in seven matches in World Cup history.

headlines: Root becomes first England batsman to smash 3 hundreds in World Cup
text: Joe Root has become the first England batsman to smash three hundreds in World Cup history, achieving the feat against West Indies today. The 28-year-old scored 100*(94) including 11 fours to help England beat West Indies by 8 wickets. Root had hit one hundred in 2015 World Cup and has slammed two in the ongoing tournament.

headlines: Warner on course to be highest run-scorer in 2019 WC: Ricky Ponting
text: Australia assistant coach Ricky Ponting has said David Warner will be the leading run-scorer in 2019 World Cup if he keeps playing like he played against Pakistan. "Warner at his best is difficult to bowl to and I think he was back to somewhere near his best," he added. Warner has hit a hundred and two fifties in the tournament.

headlines: We could be somebody's video game right now: Elon Musk
text: Elon Musk at an event in LA said he has a running joke that "if reality was a video game, graphics are great, plot is terrible and spawn time is really long". He said in future, either civilisation will end or games will be "so realistic you can't tell the difference", adding, "We could be somebody's video game right now."

headlines: Kejriwal tweets about 5 murders in a day, Delhi Police shares data
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was trolled by Delhi Police after he appealed to Lieutenant Governor of Delhi and Home Ministry to look into law and order situation following five murders in 24 hours. Adding the murders were personal enmity related, Delhi Police said overall heinous crime, crime by use of firearms and crime against women have decreased in 2019.

headlines: 5 policemen martyred in Maoist attack in Jharkhand's Seraikela
text: At least five police personnel including two sub-inspectors and three jawans were killed in a Maoist attack in Jharkhand's Seraikela on Friday. Maoists attacked a police patrolling team when it reached the weekly market at Kukdu Bazar. Rescue and relief operations are being conducted, Additional Director General (Operations ) ML Meena said.

headlines: Stop trying to mess up Hong Kong: China warns US
text: China has warned the US against interfering in the protests in Hong Kong over possible extradition to the mainland. US lawmakers have introduced legislation that would require an assessment of Hong Kong's autonomy to determine whether it qualifies for special trade status. "Relevant people in the US (should) abandon the illusion of attempting to mess up Hong Kong," China said.

headlines: Swiss bank UBS suspends economist after 'Chinese pig' comment
text: Swiss bank UBS placed its chief economist Paul Donovan on leave following a backlash after he made a reference to Chinese pigs when discussing inflation. He attributed rise in Chinese consumer prices to sick pigs, referring to the impact of African swine fever on pork prices. "Does this matter? It matters if you are a Chinese pig," Donovan had said.

headlines: India allows 1 lakh tonnes of corn imports at lower duty
text: India has allowed two state-run trading companies, MMTC and NAFED, to import 1 lakh tonnes of corn for poultry farms in 2019-20 at a concessional 15% import tax. This comes after prices of the animal feed jumped in the country because of drought. The government otherwise imposes a 60% import tax on the grain.

headlines: NDTV's Prannoy, Radhika Roy can't hold top posts for 2 years: SEBI
text: Markets regulator SEBI has barred NDTV Co-founders Prannoy Roy and Radhika Roy from accessing securities market for two years. They have also been restrained from holding any board or top management role at the company in this period. SEBI held that Roys didn't disclose material information to shareholders about loan agreements entered into by them with Vishvapradhan Commercial and ICICI.

headlines: Sports Minister visits JLN Stadium, tries javelin throwing
text: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju made a surprise visit to the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium in Delhi where he tried javelin throwing on Friday. The Sports Minister spent time talking to athletes and coaches from various disciplines and asked for suggestions to improve the overall sporting culture in the country, including infrastructure, coaching needs and other facilities.

headlines: India stay at 101 in latest FIFA national team rankings
text: The Indian football team found its position in the FIFA national team rankings unchanged at the 101st position in the refreshed FIFA rankings. India, who recently participated in King's Cup in Thailand, lost one match and won the other in the tournament. The Igor Stimac-coached side will next face Tajikistan on July 7 in the Intercontinental Cup.

headlines: Tried contacting Mamata, no response from her: WB Governor
text: West Bengal Governor Keshari Nath Tripathi on Friday said he tried to get in touch with state's CM Mamata Banerjee over doctors' strike but there was no response from her. "If she calls me then we'll discuss the matter," he added. On Thursday, after meeting representatives of doctors association, Tripathi appealed the protesting junior doctors to resume their duty.

headlines: Would give issue-based support to NDA government: TRS leader
text: On being asked about Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's policy towards the BJP-led NDA government, Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader K Keshava Rao on Friday said his party would give issue-based support to the government. "No animosity, no friendship," he added. The TRS backed NDA government on issues like demonetisation and GST during its last term.

headlines: Jagan meets Amit Shah; discusses special category status to AP
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy met Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday to discuss the issue of special category status to his state. "I met Home Minister to try and prevail upon him and also soften PM's heart on special category status," he said after meeting. Reddy added he will raise this issue in Niti Aayog's meeting on Saturday.

headlines: Water crisis worsens in Nashik; only 5% water left in dams
text: The water crisis in Maharashtra's Nashik has worsened as 15 out of 24 water reservoirs have gone dry. The overall water stock in reservoirs has also decreased to 5% of its capacity, officials said on Friday. Reportedly, pre-monsoon rainfall in Nashik from June 1 to June 14 was 292.1 mm, compared to 436 mm during the same period last year.

headlines: DU's new admission norms could've been announced earlier: HC
text: After hearing pleas against Delhi University for effecting new admission norms a day before registrations were to begin, Delhi High Court on Friday said it could've been announced much earlier. "You could've given three months prior notice to students," the HC further said. "No one's saying your decision isn't right, but your timing may not be right," the HC added.

headlines: Was scared to play college boy at 38: Shahid on 'Kabir Singh'
text: While speaking about portraying a college student in his upcoming film 'Kabir Singh', actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I was shit scared." "I thought my...children when they will grow up and see this, they'll say Why did you need to do this papa? Did you forget you were 38-years-old?'" he added. The forthcoming film is slated to release on June 21.

headlines: Bangladesh batsman copies Dhawan's message for Yuvraj's retirement
text: Bangladesh batsman Soumya Sarkar copied Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan's tribute message for Yuvraj Singh on his retirement. Sarkar posted his message for Yuvraj on Facebook around six hours after Dhawan had tweeted the same message. "It's a nice gesture but you should have written the caption on your own rather than copying from Dhawan," a user wrote on Facebook.

headlines: Toronto Raptors beat Golden State Warriors to win 1st NBA title
text: Toronto Raptors clinched their maiden NBA championship title with a 114-110 victory in the Game 6 on Thursday to claim a 4-2 Finals Series triumph over Golden State Warriors. Raptors forward Kawhi Leonard was named the NBA Finals Most Valuable Player. Notably, Toronto Raptors are the lone Canadian team in the NBA.

headlines: Yousuf & I were going to fight with forks during 2003 WC: Harbhajan
text: Harbhajan Singh has revealed he and ex-Pakistan batsman Mohammad Yousuf were going to attack each other with forks during 2003 World Cup. He said he was having lunch when Yousuf remarked about his religion. "I gave him a fitting reply. Before anyone realised we both had fork in our hands and got up ready to attack each other," he added.

headlines: I got interested in tech because of video games: Elon Musk
text: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk, while speaking at the E3 event in Los Angeles, said the reason he got interested in technology was video games. "I probably wouldn't have started programming if it wasn't for video games," he said. "Video games are a very powerful source for getting young kids interested in technology," the SpaceX and Tesla CEO further added.

headlines: If you are in Bengal, you have to speak Bangla: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has insisted those living in West Bengal will have to learn to speak in Bangla. "We've to bring Bangla forward. When I go to Bihar, UP, Punjab, I speak in their language, if you're in Bengal you have to speak Bangla," she said. She further said that outsiders instigated the doctors' agitation in the state.

headlines: Cheating spouse can't seek divorce, S Korean court upholds ruling
text: A cheating spouse who's responsible for the breakdown of a marriage cannot seek a divorce, a South Korean court said, adding only the aggrieved party in a marriage could initiate a legal separation. The court upheld a 2015 ruling while rejecting a divorce suit filed by filmmaker Hong Sang-soo. He had admitted to having an extramarital relationship with an actress.

headlines: Confident airline capacity issues will be solved: Aviation Minister
text: New Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said he is confident that airline capacity shortage problems following the grounding of Jet Airways will be solved. The Mumbai-based airline's lenders have been searching for new investors. "We have made mistakes in civil aviation in the past which we need to correct," Puri further said.

headlines: It's all about absorbing pressure: Sachin before Ind-Pak match
text: Speaking ahead of India's World Cup match against Pakistan, former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said, "Mentally it's all about absorbing pressure, staying calm, staying in the present." "I was watching Pakistans game against Australia. They built a lot of partnerships but lost wickets in crucial junctures," Tendulkar added about Pakistan's performance against Australia at the World Cup.

headlines: We can't copy teams like India: SL skipper Karunaratne
text: Sri Lankan captain Dimuth Karunaratne said, "We are a team with limited talent... [W]e have to work within those limitations. We have to compete, but we can't copy India." "For example, the India side has someone who hits a hundred virtually in every match. In our team, we've only had one or two centurions all year," Dimuth added.

headlines: IBM's AI debating model argues for and against legalising weed
text: IBM on Thursday held a live robot debate using its AI-based model 'Project Debater - Speech by Crowd' which argued both for and against the legalisation of weed. The model was given 1,000 opinions from a few people in Israel. It wrongly categorised a 'pro' argument that legalisation would kill black markets, as a 'con', due to the word "kill".

headlines: Telegram CEO links cyber attack during HK protests to China
text: Telegram Co-founder and CEO Pavel Durov has linked the origin of the "powerful" cyber attack which disrupted the platform's services for about an hour on Wednesday to China. He added it majorly came during protests in Hong Kong, where Telegram was allegedly used to coordinate demonstrations. The protests were held against the government's plans to enable extraditions to mainland China.

headlines: Let's work towards serving masses: WB minister to doctors
text: West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee on Friday took to Facebook and appealed striking junior doctors to "keep aside" misunderstandings and withdraw their agitation. "Just like you need security, patients also need treatment. I would appeal to all of you to think over it," he said. "I believe that all of us should work towards serving the masses," Chatterjee added.

headlines: Flipkart dispute settled via constant communication: GOQii CEO
text: Smart wearables startup GOQii has settled its legal dispute with Flipkart over "unauthorised 70-80% discount" on its products via "constant communication", GOQii CEO Vishal Gondal revealed. Flipkart had earlier reportedly called the allegations of violation of sales agreement baseless, claiming product's resale value is decided by resellers. The details of the settlement were not disclosed.

headlines: WeWork may buy 70% stake in India arm for $1.9 bn: Report
text: US-based co-working space startup WeWork is considering a $1.9-billion deal to acquire 70% stake in its India subsidiary at a valuation of around $2.75 billion, Bloomberg reported. Reportedly, the transaction isn't finalised so terms may change or the talks could break down. WeWork India is controlled by real estate billionaire Jitu Virwani and his son Karan Virwani's firm Embassy Buildcon.

headlines: Countries sponsoring terrorism must be held accountable: PM
text: Addressing leaders of member states at the SCO summit in Bishkek, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said, "Countries that provide encouragement, support, and finances to terrorism must be held accountable." Stating that India stands for a terrorism-free society, PM Modi added, "To tackle the danger of terrorism, all humanitarian powers should come forward together."

headlines: Rahul appeals youth to donate blood on World Blood Donor Day
text: On World Blood Donor Day, Congress President Rahul Gandhi took to social media to appeal the youngsters to donate blood whenever they find an opportunity for it. "Blood donation done by you is a lifeline for the needy. I congratulate all blood donors," he wrote on Facebook. Reportedly, in 2015-16 India was 1.1 million units short of its blood requirements.

headlines: Numbers of Encephalitis cases declining: Harsh Vardhan
text: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Thursday said Centre and Bihar government are doing their best to deal with Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) cases in the state. "I have assured of providing all possible help. The numbers of cases are declining," he added. Till now 57 children have died due to AES in Bihar's Muzaffarpur while another 130 are hospitalised.

headlines: New Zealand mosques attack suspect pleads not guilty to all charges
text: The main suspect behind the shootings at two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, has pleaded not guilty to all charges. He has been charged with the murder of 51 people, 40 counts of attempted murder and also of engaging in a terrorist act. The suspect had live-streamed the shootings in March on social media.

headlines: F*ck the int'l community: Philippine Secy amid South China Sea row
text: The Philippines' Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr rejected seeking international support to resolve the South China Sea dispute. "F*ck the international community. It can be bought. This is our fight and in the end ours alone," he said. This comes after a Chinese fishing vessel allegedly rammed into a Filipino fishing vessel in the South China Sea.

headlines: Imran Khan a player who'll be thrown out of stadium: Nawaz Sharif
text: Accusing Pakistan PM Imran Khan's government of corruption, the country's former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif said, "Imran Khan is a player who will soon be thrown out of the stadium by spectators." "I am not a seer or a fortune teller, but I know Imran Khan's downfall is imminent," he added. Sharif is currently serving a seven-year jail sentence.

headlines: Altroz website unveiled after receiving 1 lakh clicks within a day
text: Tata Motors unveiled the official website of its premium hatchback 'Altroz' today. The website was to go fully live after 1,00,000 visitors hit the page, which was expected to happen in a few days' time. However, much beyond Tata Motors' expectations, the website got unveiled within 24 hours.

headlines: 3.5L doctors to participate in nationwide strike on June 17: IMA
text: Amid the protests across the country over the attack on a doctor at a Kolkata hospital, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) has announced a nationwide doctors' strike on June 17. The IMA said 3.5 lakh doctors will participate in the nationwide strike on Monday. Earlier, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee gave a 4-hour ultimatum to doctors protesting in the state.

headlines: BJP worker shot dead in West Bengal, party blames 'TMC goons'
text: BJP worker Saraswati Das was allegedly shot dead by assailants in the North 24 Parganas district in West Bengal. Das, who was a homemaker, had played an active role in the recent Lok Sabha elections. The BJP blamed her murder on "TMC goons" and stated, "Law and order has totally collapsed in West Bengal, where no one is safe."

headlines: Striking doctors hurled abuses at me, but I've forgiven them: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused the striking junior doctors of Kolkata's SSKM Hospital of verbally abusing her during her visit there. She said, "The language they used when I was there and the manner they abused me...Had somebody else been there in my place, some other action would have followed." "But, I've forgiven them," she added.

headlines: Mamata's 4-hr ultimatum made doctors angry: Harsh Vardhan
text: As a strike by doctors in West Bengal hospitals entered its fourth day, Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan said, "I appeal to CM Mamata Banerjee to not make this an issue of prestige." Vardhan said the doctors became angry when Mamata gave them a four-hour ultimatum to resume work. Doctors across India have extended their support to the strike.

headlines: Jaipur doctors wear black bands to support WB doctors' strike
text: Doctors at a hospital in Jaipur carried out their duties while wearing black bands to support protesting doctors in West Bengal. Members of Trivandrum's Indian Medical Association also protested over violence against doctors, while doctors at a Raipur hospital raised slogans of 'We Want Justice'. The protests started after doctors were thrashed by relatives of an elderly patient who died.

headlines: Cyclone Vayu no more a threat, evacuees can return: Gujarat CM
text: Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani has said cyclonic storm Vayu no longer posed any threat to the state as it had moved away westward. Rupani further asked the authorities to let around 2.75 lakh people who had been shifted to safety to return to their homes. It was earlier predicted that the cyclone would make landfall on Gujarat coast Thursday afternoon.

headlines: 2 militants killed in encounter in J&K's Pulwama district
text: Two militants were killed in an encounter with security forces in Awantipora in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Friday. Their bodies, along with arms and ammunition, have been recovered from the site and their identities and affiliations are being ascertained, said police. Security forces had launched an encounter following a tip-off about the presence of militants in the area.

headlines: Hold symbolic protests only, Health Minister appeals to doctors
text: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan today appealed to striking doctors across India to "hold only symbolic protests and continue to carry out their duties." He said the government is committed to ensuring doctors' safety. Doctors in WB hospitals have gone on strike demanding security after junior doctors was thrashed by relatives of an elderly patient who passed away.

headlines: Centre reduces rate of ESI contribution from 6.5% to 4%
text: The government on Thursday reduced the total rate of contribution towards the Employees State Insurance (ESI) scheme from 6.5% to 4% for the first time since 1997. Effective July 1, the employer's share will be 3.25% while the employee's share will be 0.75%. The move is expected to benefit 3.6 crore employees and 12.85 lakh employers.

headlines: West Bengal CM Mamata's nephew joins doctors' protest in Kolkata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abesh Banerjee, who is a student at Kolkata's KPC Medical College and Hospital, has joined the doctors' protest that entered its fourth day on Friday. A video also showed him leading a protest march. This comes after Mamata threatened action against the protesting doctors and called the protest a conspiracy by BJP and CPI(M).

headlines: Bombay HC grants bail to 4 accused in Malegaon blast case
text: The Bombay High Court on Friday granted bail to four accused in the 2006 Malegaon blast case, namely Manohar Nawaria, Rajendra Chaudhary, Dhan Singh and Lokesh Sharma. The accused, who have been in jail since their arrest in 2013, had approached the HC in 2016. The bomb blasts near Hamidia mosque in Malegaon had left at least 37 people dead.

headlines: US shares video claiming Iran removed unexploded mine from tanker
text: The US military has released a video which it said showed Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) removing an unexploded mine from an oil tanker that was allegedly attacked in the Gulf of Oman on Thursday. The US suggested that Iran sought to remove evidence of its involvement from the scene. However, Iran has rejected the accusations.

headlines: Man who killed his kids, drove around with bodies sentenced to death
text: A US man convicted of killing his five children was sentenced to death on Thursday, even after his ex-wife asked jurors to "let him live" because the kids loved him. After killing them, he drove around with their bodies for nine days before dumping them in garbage bags on the side of an Alabama road. The incident happened in 2014.

headlines: Sarah Sanders to step down as White House Press Secretary
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday took to Twitter to announce that White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders will step down from the position at the end of June. "She's a very special person with extraordinary talents, who has done an incredible job! I hope she decides to run for Governor of Arkansas - she would be fantastic," Trump tweeted.

headlines: Three booked for sharing morphed pics of actor Sahil Khan
text: Three people, including two women, were booked for allegedly sharing morphed pictures of actor Sahil Khan on social media, police said. As per the actor's police complaint, the trio shared morphed pictures of him along with 'sexist' and 'obscene' captions. He further alleged that one of the accused shared a post insinuating that the actor was involved in prostitution.

headlines: John to star in Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Vedalam': Report
text: John Abraham will reportedly star in an upcoming Hindi remake of the Tamil film 'Vedalam', which featured actor Ajith in the lead role. The director and the rest of the cast for the forthcoming remake are yet to be finalised, reports further stated. The original film, which released in 2015, also featured Shruti Haasan, Rahul Dev and Kabir Duhan Singh.

headlines: India, US can lead on setting up privacy standards: Sundar Pichai
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, while addressing the US-India Business Council's (USIBC) India Ideas Summit, said that the two countries can lead on standardisation of privacy frameworks. "Both in US and India, we've reasonably aligned notions around a free and open internet; both countries have safeguarded principles of free expression," he added. Pichai received USIBC's 2019 Global Leadership Award.

headlines: NDA destroyed economy but 'Modi, Modi' all you hear: Siddaramaiah
text: Criticising the NDA government, former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Thursday said, "They destroyed the country's economy. Despite this, all you hear is Modi, Modi, Modi. I don't know why." Accusing the NDA of misleading people with "emotional" issues, Siddaramaiah asked, "As the Prime Minister for five years, what did he do for economic development?"

headlines: JEE Advanced 2019 results out, Maharashtra's Kartikey Gupta tops
