text: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Roorkee on Friday declared the JEE Advanced 2019 results. Maharashtra's Kartikey Gupta has bagged All India Rank 1 with 346 out of 372 marks. Kartikey had secured All India Rank 18 in JEE Main 2019 results earlier this year by scoring 100 percentile. Twenty four candidates had scored 100 percentile in JEE Main.

headlines: Gully Boy, AndhaDhun to be screened at South Korean film fest
text: Ranveer Singh starrer 'Gully Boy', Ayushmann Khurrana's 'AndhaDhun' as well as Kangana Ranaut's 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi' will be screened at the Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival in South Korea. Tamil film 'Super Deluxe', which features Vijay Sethupathi and Samantha Akkineni in lead roles, will also be screened. The festival will be held between June 27 and July 7.

headlines: Only hope of judgement is from God: Tanushree on Nana's clean chit
text: After police closed the sexual harassment case filed by her against Nana Patekar, actress Tanushree Dutta said, "My only hope of judgement now is from God." "How will credible evidence be produced, if the accused is making sure that no evidence against him reaches the police?" she added. Nana was granted a clean chit yesterday due to lack of evidence.

headlines: Shift WC to India, we need rain: Big B as Ind-NZ match abandoned
text: After the India-New Zealand 2019 World Cup match was abandoned due to rain on Thursday, Amitabh Bachchan tweeted, "Shift the tournament WC 2019 to India...we need the rain." He made the comment on a Twitter user's tweet. The user had tweeted, "Shame on ICC for organising such an important tournament at...a time when half the matches are getting washed away!"

headlines: Perfectly preserved head of 40,000-year-old wolf found in Russia
text: Scientists have found the furry head of an Ice Age wolf perfectly preserved in Siberia. The head of the wolf, which died 40,000 years ago, was discovered in the Russian Arctic region of Yakutia. A researcher said the animal belonged to an ancient subspecies of wolf that lived at the same time as the mammoths and became extinct alongside them.

headlines: AIIMS, Safdarjung doctors in Delhi go on strike over West Bengal case
text: Over 3,500 resident doctors from AIIMS and Safdarjung Hospital in Delhi went on strike on Friday in support of the doctors who were beaten up in West Bengal's Kolkata. While all out-patient clinics and routine services will remain suspended, senior doctors will run the emergency department and ICUs. Meanwhile, the doctors' strike in West Bengal has entered day four.

headlines: Two RJD leaders shot at in Bihar's Muzaffarpur
text: Local RJD leaders Surendra Yadav and Umashankar Prasad were shot at by unknown assailants in Muzaffarpur district, Bihar on Thursday. DSP Mukul Ranjan said, "One person was hit by two bullets and the other one was hit by four. Both are out of danger." Stating that an investigation is underway, he added, "Those involved in this will be arrested soon."

headlines: Deeply ashamed: Kolkata Mayor's doctor daughter supports protest
text: Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim's daughter Shabba Hakim, who is a doctor, has come out in support of the strike by doctors in West Bengal in a post on Facebook. Stating that doctors have right to peaceful protest and safety at work, Shabba wrote, "As a TMC supporter, I am deeply ashamed at the inaction and the silence of our leader."

headlines: Pak PM sits while other world leaders stand for assembly at SCO meet
text: While world leaders during assembly at the SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan's Bishkek stood due to diplomatic courtesy, Pakistan PM Imran Khan entered the hall and sat in his seat. In a video, Khan can be seen standing up after realising other leaders are standing and then sitting down again even though leaders of other countries are still entering the hall.

headlines: Kareena approached to star in Aamir's 'Lal Singh Chaddha': Report
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has been approached to star opposite Aamir Khan in the upcoming film 'Lal Singh Chaddha', as per reports. Directed by Advait Chandan, the film is a Hindi adaptation of Oscar-winning Hollywood film 'Forrest Gump', which released in 1994. Shooting for the film is slated to commence in October, reports further suggested.

headlines: Jackie, Suniel join cast of John's gangster-drama 'Mumbai Saga'
text: Actors Jackie Shroff and Suniel Shetty have been roped in to star along with John Abraham and Emraan Hashmi in the upcoming gangster-drama film 'Mumbai Saga'. Directed by Sanjay Gupta, the film will also feature Amole Gupte, Prateik Babbar, Gulshan Grover and Rohit Roy. The film will be set in Mumbai between the 1980s and 1990s.

headlines: Chris Hemsworth's 'Men In Black: International' hits theatres
text: Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson's 'Men In Black: International', which released today, "is a shockingly unambitious film," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). "It's a serviceable if unremarkable diversion from the real world, not a trip through it, despite its name," Washington Post (WP) said. Pinkvilla said the film "had some thrilling moments." It's rated 1/5 (HT), 2.5/4 (WP) and 3/5 (Pinkvilla).

headlines: Malayalam actor Roshan Mathew to star in Anurag's next film
text: Malayalam actor Roshan Mathew has joined the cast of filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's upcoming film. "[Anurag] said that he has a script for a film that he's planning to do, and asked me...whether I'm interested in it. It was as simple as that," Mathew said. The actor features in the upcoming bilingual film 'Moothon', which has been co-produced by Anurag.

headlines: His life was enriched by many: Karnad's son post his demise
text: Journalist Raghu Karnad took to Instagram to share a picture of his father and veteran actor-playwright Girish Karnad following his demise. "His life and work were enriched and elevated by gurus and professors, aunts and sisters, friends, collaborators...and many drinking companions," the picture's caption read. "We're all feeling a lot of love, relief and gratitude," Raghu further wrote.

headlines: MIT's new algorithm helps robots predict human movements
text: MIT researchers have developed an algorithm that can predict the path of movement of a human being and help with robot movements. The algorithm also helps motion predictors to accurately anticipate the timing of a person's motion. When implemented to BMW factory floor experiments, it helped a robot overcome previous complications where it would freeze due to being over cautious.

headlines: We see the best and some of the worst of humanity: Facebook COO
text: Facebook Chief Operating Officer (COO) Sheryl Sandberg, at the platform's first-ever International Press Day, said, "We see the very best and we actually see some of the very worst of humanity." "What we're focussed on right now is making sure that we're running our company differently so that we do everything we can to prevent the bad," she added.

headlines: Chinese ambassador warns UK over excluding Huawei from 5G
text: China's ambassador to the UK Liu Xiaoming warned Britain's government that barring the use of Huawei equipment from the country's 5G network could hurt trade relations and investment. Speaking to the BBC's Newsnight, he said, "If [the] UK collaborates with Huawei there would be a promising future." He added excluding Huawei would send bad message to Huawei and Chinese businesses.

headlines: Mamata and her goons converted WB into mini Pak: BJP leader
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and her "goons" have converted the state into a "mini Pakistan," Tripura BJP Mahila Morcha chief Papia Datta said on Thursday. She added that the Tripura unit will send postcards saying 'Jai Shri Ram' to Mamata. Datta also accused Mamata of being "allergic to Ram" and advised her to start chanting 'Jai Shri Ram'.

headlines: upGrad learner kickstarts his career as a Data Analyst
text: Online education platform upGrad has now started admissions for PG Diploma in Machine Learning and AI, ranked No.1 by AIM. The program provides 1-1 mentorship and 360 degree career support. One learner, Tejas Wagh joined the program as a fresher, got an internship with Ola and later turned it into a full-time job as a Data Analyst.

headlines: Kohli, Jadeja can intimidate batsmen with their fielding: R Sridhar
text: India fielding coach R Sridhar has said Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja can intimidate batsmen with their fielding in the 30-yard range. "I'm very happy with the...resources I have. We've a terrific slip catcher and a safe catcher in Rohit," he added. "To complement that...we have a player in Hardik Pandya, who can really help when needed," he further said.

headlines: Very sad to know that you are retiring: Nehwal to Lee Chong Wei
text: After Malaysian badminton legend Lee Chong Wei announced his retirement, Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal took to Twitter to wish him. "Really loved your performances for many years...You are great badminton legend and its very sad to know that you are retiring," she wrote. "I wish you the best for future and please take care of your health," she further said.

headlines: Spain's WC-winning captain Iker Casillas denies retirement reports
text: Spain's 2010 World Cup-winning captain Iker Casillas has denied reports that he's retiring from football after suffering a heart attack during training with Porto last month. The 38-year-old added he's yet to be told by medical experts whether he has recovered enough to play football again. Earlier, Casillas had said that he will announce his retirement when the time comes.

headlines: Andhra MLA takes oath in the name of CM Jagan, says he is his god
text: YSRCP MLA K Sridhar Reddy on Wednesday took oath in Andhra Pradesh Assembly in the name of CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy. However, Sridhar had to take the oath again in the name of god after Pro-tem Speaker Sambangi Appala Naidu asked him to follow Assembly rules. "What's wrong if I consider my leader as my god?" Sridhar had said.

headlines: BJP asking doctors not to treat Muslim patients: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused the BJP of asking the doctors not to treat the Muslim patients. "It is the Home MinistryAmit Shah who is trying to create trouble here. The BJP is using the situation to create a communal divide," said Mamata. The doctors refused to end their strike despite a four-hour ultimatum by the CM.

headlines: Coast Guard rescues Army officer drowning on beach; shares pics
text: An Indian Coast Guard helicopter on Thursday rescued an Army officer "swept out to sea by strong waves in extremely rough weather conditions off Cabo-de-Rama beach in Goa". Pictures of the operation were shared on Twitter. A life-guarding agency said the officer could not be rescued using a jet ski due to rocky terrain, high waves and dangerous conditions.

headlines: BJP IT cell member arrested for communal Facebook post in Assam
text: Assam Police has arrested Nitu Bora, secretary of local IT cell of BJP, for derogatory remarks against a particular community on Facebook. Further, two other persons linked to BJP were called in for questioning after similar complaints. One posted fake news of the rape of a tribal woman by a particular community's member, while the other also posted communal content.

headlines: US blames Iran for attack on oil tankers in Gulf of Oman; Iran denies
text: Mike Pompeo, the US Secretary of State, has blamed Iran for attacks on two oil tankers in the Gulf of Oman on Thursday that led to increase in crude oil prices. Pompeo said that the US assessment is based on intelligence and the weapons used among other things. Meanwhile, Iran denied the allegation, saying that US "must stop warmongering".

headlines: Microsoft launches AI Digital Labs with 10 colleges in India
text: Microsoft announced the launch of AI Digital Labs in collaboration with 10 higher educational institutions in the country. The institutes covered under this program include BITS Pilani, ISB, SRM University, among others. As part of the three-year program, Microsoft will support selected institutions with infrastructure, curriculum and content, access to cloud and AI services and developer support.

headlines: Slack's public listing may value it at up to $17 bn: Report
text: Workplace chat software startup Slack is reportedly likely to be valued by investors at $16-17 billion when it lists its shares publicly later this month. Slack was reportedly valued at around $7.1 billion in private funding round in August 2018. Slack is reportedly going public through 'direct listing' where its investors will be allowed to begin selling existing shares immediately.

headlines: Table salt compound spotted on one of Jupiter's moons
text: Caltech and NASA scientists have found that yellow colour visible on parts of Jupiter's moon Europa's surface is sodium chloride or table salt. Hubble Space Telescope helped identify a distinct absorption in the visible spectrum, which matched irradiated salt. "Sodium chloride is a bit like invisible ink on Europa's surface. Before irradiation you can't tell it's there," a scientist said.

headlines: World's highest weather stations installed atop Mount Everest
text: A team of Tribhuvan University and National Geographic Society scientists and researchers have installed the world's highest, fully automated weather stations atop Mount Everest. Total five weather stations, including one at a record height of 27,657 feet, were installed on the Earth's highest mountain above sea level. The team also collected ice core samples from the highest point ever.

headlines: Pakistan extends airspace closure on India border to June 28
text: Pakistani airspace on its eastern border with India will remain closed until June 28, the country's Civil Aviation Authority said. Pakistan closed its airspace in February after the Indian Air Force strike on a Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terror camp in Balakot. Foreign carriers using Indian airspace have been forced to take costly detours as they cannot fly over Pakistan.

headlines: PwC's observations baseless, unjustified: Reliance Capital
text: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Capital has said PwC's observations about its accounts were "completely baseless and unjustified". "PwC has acted prematurely without even statutory discussions with the audit committee," it said. This comes after PwC resigned as auditor of Reliance Capital and Reliance Home Finance citing unsatisfactory response to "certain observations" made during audit.

headlines: NMDC resumes work at Chhattisgarh mines after six days
text: NMDC on Thursday resumed production at two iron ore mines in Chhattisgarh's Bailadila hills following the state government's intervention, six days after protests by tribal communities halted work. The tribals had claimed that one of the hills houses their deity. NMDC Chairman Baijendra Kumar said the company would put all efforts to make up for production loss during this period.

headlines: CFM wins one of largest engine orders from IndiGo: Report
text: French-US engine-maker CFM International has reportedly won one of the world's largest jet engine orders, with a deal for over 600 engines, from IndiGo. CFM, which was competing with IndiGo's existing supplier Pratt & Whitney, will provide power for 280 A320-family jetliners already on order from Airbus by the Delhi-based carrier. CFM is owned by General Electric and France's Safran.

headlines: NRS Medical College Principal resigns over violence against doctors
text: Professor Saibal Kumar Mukherjee and Saurabh Chattopadhyay resigned as the Principal and Vice Principal of Kolkata's NRS Medical College and Hospital on Thursday over the June 10 violence against the doctors. This comes after the doctors refused to end their strike despite West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's four-hour ultimatum. The doctors have demanded enhanced security for themselves at hospitals.

headlines: Never got more than 38% marks for my studies: Anupam Kher
text: Actor Anupam Kher, who spoke at the Oxford Union in England, tweeted ahead of the event on Wednesday, "I studied at DAV Higher Secondary Hindi medium School in Shimla. Never got more than 38 percent marks for my studies." "Life mei by god...#KuchBhiHoSaktaHai," he added. After the event, Kher tweeted, "It was a learning experience".

headlines: I'm a survivor of date rape: Oscar-winning actress Mira Sorvino
text: Oscar-winning actress Mira Sorvino, who earlier accused producer Harvey Weinstein of sexual harassment, revealed during a press conference that she's also a survivor of date rape. "I'm doing...to try and help, because there are all these survivors out there right now who need justice," she added. "In situations of second-degree rape...you feel that somehow it was your fault," said Sorvino.

headlines: Vicky responds to fan, thanks his wife for respecting his privacy
text: Vicky Kaushal on Wednesday responded to a fan who wrote a message to him on behalf of his wife. The fan said his wife spotted the actor and wanted to greet him, but she didn't want to invade his privacy. Vicky replied, "I appreciate her for respecting my privacy. Next time, feel free, I'd be happy to have a conversation."

headlines: Jadhav asks UK rain to go away to Maharashtra, video surfaces online
text: A video of Team India all-rounder Kedar Jadhav asking the rain to go away from UK's Nottingham to drought-hit Maharashtra has surfaced online. Jadhav can be seen standing on the ground with his hands folded and pleading with rain gods in his mother tongue Marathi. India's 2019 World Cup match against New Zealand was abandoned due to rain today.

headlines: Japan qualify for U19 WC as PNG players suspended for shoplifting
text: Japan have qualified for the 2020 Under-19 World Cup after being declared winners of East Asia-Pacific Region Qualifier. This comes after Papua New Guinea (PNG) failed to field their team in the final. PNG's cricket board had suspended 10 of their players after they were caught shoplifting. The players have also been ordered to undertake 60 hours of community service.

headlines: Ola to build US tech centre for self-driving, electric vehicles
text: Bengaluru-based Ola has said it'll set up an Advanced Technology Center in San Francisco Bay Area, primarily focussing on electric, connected and autonomous vehicles. Ola will reportedly be the only Indian consumer internet company after Flipkart to launch a technology centre there. Earlier reports had claimed Ola is in talks with India's top automakers to buy custom-made electric vehicles.

headlines: India-Pakistan relations are at lowest point: Imran Khan
text: The bilateral relations between India and Pakistan are currently at its "lowest point", Pakistan PM Imran Khan said. "Now that (PM Narendra Modi) has big mandate, we hope he'll use this mandate to develop better relationship," he added. "There's no way two nuclear-armed countries should think of resolving differences through military means...we hope we can use dialogue," he further said.

headlines: Delhi businessman stole own Mercedes for insurance money: Police
text: Mumbai Police arrested a 62-year-old Delhi businessman for stealing his own Mercedes car and said he staged the theft for insurance amount. He asked two business acquaintances to transport his Mercedes to Mumbai saying his friend needed it and instructed them to stay at a particular lodge. The duo found the car missing on the morning after they reached Mumbai.

headlines: 17-yr-old 'accidentally' shot dead during TikTok video, 2 arrested
text: A 17-year-old boy died on Wednesday after the trigger of a country-made pistol was accidentally pressed while he was posing for a TikTok video with his relatives in Maharashtra's Shirdi, police said. Police took Pratik to a government hospital where he was declared dead before admission. Two of his relatives were arrested while another relative has not been traced yet.

headlines: Names of IAF personnel who lost their lives in AN-32 crash released
text: The photos and names of the 13 IAF personnel who lost their lives on board the crashed AN-32 aircraft were released on Thursday. The personnel's bodies and the black box of the aircraft were recovered from the crash site in Arunachal Pradesh earlier in the day. Reports said that the bodies would be brought in choppers from the crash site.

headlines: Work from home: Chennai IT firms tell employees amid water crisis
text: Several IT companies with offices at the Old Mahabalipuram Road (OMR) in Chennai have told employees to work from home amid the water crisis in the city. An employee said her company instructed employees to not come to the office for two weeks in May. A Wipro employee said they were told washrooms on only alternate floors will be operational.

headlines: Man films people coming out of manhole in US near Mexico border
text: A man in US' Texas has captured a video showing men crawling out of a manhole in the middle of a busy street in a border town, which is around a kilometre away from the US-Mexico border. The video was shot from inside a car. However, It is not clear whether the people in the video are migrants.

headlines: Doing business in India was tough: US State Secretary Pompeo
text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Thursday revealed he had a "tough" time as a businessman in India while trying to sell machine parts for the aerospace industry. Pompeo said he had spent some time in Chennai and Bengaluru trying to sell products to Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL). "I'll tell you what. It was tough," Pompeo said.

headlines: Trump mistakenly calls UK's Prince Charles 'Prince of Whales'
text: US President Donald Trump called UK's Prince Charles the "Prince of Whales", misspelling 'Wales' in a tweet. Trump referred to his recent meeting with Prince Charles as an example to say that he doesn't need to disclose his conversations with world leaders to the FBI. Trump later deleted the tweet and replaced it with the one that spelt Wales correctly.

headlines: Chemistry teacher who founded pharma company now worth $7.9 bn
text: China's Zhong Huijuan, who quit her job teaching chemistry in middle school to start her drug business, is now worth $7.9 billion, according to Bloomberg. Hansoh Pharmaceutical Group, in which Zhong holds a 68% stake, is set to list with a market value of $10.4 billion. Notably, her husband Sun Piaoyang, who runs another pharmaceutical company, is worth $9.3 billion.

headlines: Grow up: Manoj Tiwary to ex-England cricketer who criticised Kohli
text: Batsman Manoj Tiwary took to Twitter to criticise ex-England batsman Nick Compton for his statement that Virat Kohli had no right to tell fans to stop booing Steve Smith. "What's wrong with this man? Humanity is far more beyond just rights and wrongs in life. Grow up...You won't understand how we Indians feel about certain things in life," Tiwary wrote.

headlines: Liverpool to open Premier League 2019/20 season on August 9
text: Premier League 2019/20 season will start with 2018/19 runners-up Liverpool hosting recently promoted Norwich City on August 9 (BST). Defending Champions Manchester City would open their title defence on August 10 against West Ham United. Manchester United, who finished sixth last season will face Chelsea on August 11. Manchester City and Liverpool will face each other on November 9.

headlines: Huawei applies to trademark own mobile OS globally after US ban
text: Huawei has applied to trademark its "Hongmeng" operating system in at least nine countries and Europe, Reuters reported citing WIPO data. Huawei filed an application in Peru on May 27, Peru's anti-trust agency Indecopi said, adding, it needs more information from Huawei before it can register a trademark. This comes after the US blacklisted Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: Govt accuses Deloitte, KPMG arm of aiding 'organised crime'
text: The government has accused Deloitte Haskins & Sells, and KPMG affiliate BSR & Associates of aiding and abetting "organised crime" at IL&FS Group's main lending unit IFIN. The government said it detected at least 22 violations of auditing standards by the firms while investigating fraud at IFIN. It urged the NCLT to impose a five-year ban on the two auditors.

headlines: India-NZ match abandoned due to rain, both teams get 1 point each
text: The India-New Zealand 2019 World Cup match was abandoned due to rain on Thursday without a ball being bowled, with both the teams getting one point each. As many as four matches have now been abandoned in the 2019 World Cup due to rain. India and New Zealand are the only two unbeaten teams in the tournament so far.

headlines: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan confirms her relationship
text: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan has confirmed that she is dating musician Mishaal Kirpalani. During an 'Ask me anything' session on Instagram, Ira was asked by a follower if she is dating anyone. Responding to the same, she uploaded a photograph in which she can be seen hugging Mishaal and tagged him in it.

headlines: Now quickly go and have two kids: Akhtar to Yuvraj on retirement
text: Following Yuvraj Singh's retirement from international cricket, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar advised the Indian to have two kids. "Now quickly go and have two kids. This is more important now because you haven't had kids yet. Earlier, you used to feed the bowlers, now it's time to feed your kids," he said in the video.

headlines: Sorry, I didn't win Olympic gold: Wei retires after cancer battle
text: Ex-world number one and three-time Olympic silver medallist Lee Chong Wei announced his retirement from badminton on Thursday. "I'm sorry I didn't deliver an Olympic gold. But I know I've no regrets as I've tried my best. My very best," he wrote in a Facebook post. Wei, who fought nose cancer, revealed he is quitting over risk of its recurrence.

headlines: FB makes its 1st direct funding in Indian startups with Meesho
text: Facebook has backed Bengaluru-based e-commerce startup Meesho with a reported $25-million investment, marking its first-ever direct investment in an Indian startup. This comes months after reports had surfaced that the social media giant is in early-stage talks to back several regional content startups in India. Meesho was founded by IIT-Delhi alumni Vidit Aatrey and Sanjeev Barnwal in 2015.

headlines: Traffic at Mount Everest did not kill climbers: Nepal
text: Heavy traffic on Mount Everest was not responsible for the death of climbers atop the world's highest peak, the Nepalese government said. The post-mortem reports of the deceased climbers showed that they died due to high altitude sickness, weakness or adverse weather conditions, Nepal's Department of Tourism said. Eleven people have died on Everest this season, according to Nepalese officials.

headlines: India slips 5 places on Global Peace Index 2019 to 141; Iceland tops
text: India's rank slipped five places to 141 among 163 countries on the Global Peace Index 2019, while Iceland ranked one, a position it has held since 2008. Australian think tank Institute for Economics & Peace ranks countries based on the level of societal safety and security, the extent of ongoing domestic and international conflict, and the degree of militarisation.

headlines: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) to oppose Triple Talaq bill in Rajya Sabha
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's party and BJP ally Janata Dal (United) has said it will not support the BJP-led NDA government in the Rajya Sabha on the issue of Triple Talaq. Senior JD(U) leader and Bihar minister Shyam Rajak said Triple Talaq is a social issue and it should be resolved by the society at a social level.

headlines: UP CM Yogi gets Madrassa chief arrested for triple talaq to wife
text: The director of a Madrassa in Uttar Pradesh's Agra was arrested on Tuesday for using triple talaq against his wife after his in-laws approached CM Yogi Adityanath's office. The Malpura police station tried to pressure her to compromise, forcing her to approach the CM, the woman said. Her relatives accused the Madrassa director of beating her up and demanding dowry.

headlines: AIIMS doctors work in helmets & bandages to back WB doctors' strike
text: Resident Doctors' Association of AIIMS Delhi worked wearing helmets and bandages on Thursday to support protesting doctors in West Bengal. They held boards reading, "We are not terrorists! We are doctors, we save you. We demand safe workplace". The protests started after a doctor was allegedly wounded by the family of an elderly patient, who died in a Kolkata hospital.

headlines: Chop off limbs of 8-yr-old girl's rapist publicly: MP minister
text: Madhya Pradesh Women and Child Welfare Minister Imarti Devi on Wednesday asked to publicly chop off the nose, ears and limbs of the alleged rapist and murderer of an eight-year-old girl. Devi said, "He should be punished publicly to prevent others from even thinking of committing such a crime." The girl's body was found in a drain last week.

headlines: 2 oil tankers hit by explosions in Gulf of Oman, crew rescued
text: Two oil tankers were hit by explosions in the Gulf of Oman on Thursday, although the cause of the blasts is unknown. Iran said its Navy had rescued 44 crew members after the two vessels, which were carrying highly inflammable material, caught fire. The incident comes a month after four oil tankers were attacked off the coast of UAE.

headlines: 'Mainstream' is an abused word in film industry: Ayushmann
text: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he feels the film industry shouldn't discriminate between films by labelling them as 'mainstream' and 'non-mainstream'. "To me, mainstream is an abused word...The world has progressed to being anti-label, high time our industry too moves away from labelling audiences and films," he added. "[N]ot every film is meant to appeal to everyone," Ayushmann further said.

headlines: Australia not playing well, but winning games: Allan Border
text: Australia's World Cup-winning captain Allan Border has said defending champions Australia aren't playing at their best but they are winning matches at 2019 World Cup. "They hung in there, rode out some pressure and came out with the victory," he added after Australia's 41-run win against Pakistan. With three wins in four matches, Australia are placed second on points table.

headlines: Apple may buy Intel's German smartphone modem unit: Report
text: Apple is reportedly in talks to buy the German operations of Intel's "struggling" smartphone modem business in a deal which could help its plans to internally develop a modem for its devices. Reportedly, any deal with Intel for the business would likely send hundreds of modem engineers to Apple. The foundation of Intel's modem business is reportedly in Germany.

headlines: Emails show CEO Zuckerberg knew about FB's privacy issues: Report
text: Facebook has uncovered emails which allegedly reveal CEO Mark Zuckerberg's connection to the platform's privacy issues, the Wall Street Journal reported. The emails were reportedly uncovered as part of an FTC investigation over a report of Cambridge Analytica data scandal involving over 50 million Facebook users. "At no point did Mark...knowingly violate the company's obligations," Facebook said.

headlines: If Amazon had a working grocery model, we wouldn't exist: Grofers
text: Grofers Co-founder Albinder Dhindsa has said, "If Amazon India had a working model in grocery, we wont even exist". "It's been five years since [Amazon's] launch, and their growth has been insignificant, he said. Dhindsa said he believed players like Dunzo and Swiggy in the grocery space weren't a competition to Grofers, adding that their models were "hard to execute".

headlines: Pentagon world's largest producer of greenhouse gases: Report
text: The Pentagon, headquarters of the US Department of Defense, is world's "single largest producer" of greenhouse gases, a report from America's Brown University's 'Costs of War' project claimed. US defence operations reportedly released about 59 million metric tons of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases in 2017. However, the US nation is reportedly second to China in global CO2 emissions.

headlines: US' KKR to buy Business Insider publisher in $7.7-billion deal
text: US private-equity giant KKR has agreed to take Business Insider's German publisher Axel Springer private in a deal that values the company at $7.7 billion. KKR offered a 40% premium to buy out minority investors of Axel Springer, in a move backed by founder's 76-year-old widow Friede Springer and CEO Mathias Döpfner. Friede and Döpfner control 45.4% of Axel Springer.

headlines: Not trying for seat on Yes Bank board, clarifies Rana Kapoor
text: Yes Bank's former MD and CEO Rana Kapoor on Thursday denied reports that he is attempting a comeback to the bank. He added that he has "the fullest confidence and conviction" in his successor Ravneet Gill. The RBI had asked Kapoor to step down from Yes Bank by January 31 due to concerns including poor governance and loan practices.

headlines: Alibaba files to list in HK, may raise $20 billion: Reports
text: China's biggest e-commerce company Alibaba has filed confidentially for a Hong Kong listing that will take place as soon as the third quarter of this year, reports said. The listing could reportedly raise as much as $20 billion. Notably, Alibaba holds the record for the world's largest IPO with its $25 billion float in New York five years ago.

headlines: India is planning to have its own space station: ISRO Chairman
text: India is planning to set up a separate station in space, ISRO Chairman K Sivan announced on Thursday. "It will be a smaller module, mainly used to carry out microgravity experiment...We hope to take the project ahead only after the successful completion of Gaganyaan in 2022," he said. Sivan added that it would be conceptualised over the next 5-7 years.

headlines: All 13 bodies, black box of crashed AN-32 aircraft recovered
text: All 13 bodies and the black box of Indian Air Force's AN-32 aircraft that crashed in Arunachal Pradesh have been recovered from the crash site. Choppers would be used to ferry the bodies from the site. The IAF had earlier today announced that there were no survivors in the crash, which took place on June 3.

headlines: You don't pick friends based on gender: Disha on dinner with Aaditya
text: Disha Patani responded after being trolled over going to dinner with Aaditya Thackeray, Yuva Sena President and son of Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray. "You don't choose friends on the basis of gender. I don't need to only befriend females," said Disha. Trolls took a dig at Disha and her rumoured boyfriend Tiger Shroff after she was spotted with Aaditya.

headlines: Corrupt police, legal system: Tanushree on clean chit to Nana
text: Actress Tanushree Dutta has issued a statement after police closed the sexual harassment case filed by her against Nana Patekar due to lack of evidence. "A corrupt police force and legal system giving a clean chit to an even more corrupt person Nana who has been accused...in the past of bullying...and harassment by several women," her statement read.

headlines: Stopped getting work over rumours that I'm unprofessional: Divyanka
text: Television actress Divyanka Tripathi has revealed that during her initial days in the industry, people stopped giving her work due to rumours which said she is unprofessional. She added some people in the production house tried to malign her image as they didn't like her. Divyanka further said she is sharing this in the light of "recent rumours" about her.

headlines: I thought I might never score hundred for Australia again: Warner
text: Opener David Warner, who scored 107 runs against Pakistan on Wednesday, said the thought of never scoring a hundred for Australia again was going through his mind while he was serving his ban. "I think that's what drove me to keep being as fit as I can," he added. "I really...knuckled down and trained my backside off," he further said.

headlines: Jeff Bezos shares story of his mother graduating at 40
text: World's richest person, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos shared a video of his mother Jackie Bezos speaking about graduating college when she was 40, at Cambridge College's 47th Commencement. She spoke about giving birth to Jeff two weeks past her 17th birthday and being initially told she wouldn't be allowed to finish high school. "My mom's incredible story...So proud", Jeff wrote.

headlines: Facebook collected device data of 1,56,000 Indians with Research app
text: Facebook obtained personal and sensitive device data of 1,87,000 users in the world, of which 1,56,000 were Indians, through its now-defunct 'Facebook Research' app. The app was banned by Apple earlier this year for violating its rules. A Facebook spokesperson said they didn't review all of the data and the user data obtained from Research app has now been deleted.

headlines: 4 railway policemen booked for thrashing journalist in UP
text: Four Government Railway Police (GRP) personnel were booked for allegedly beating up a journalist in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district, GRP Superintendent of Police, Moradabad, Subhash Chandra Dubey said. In a purported video of the incident, the accused personnel can be seen repeatedly slapping and punching television journalist Amit Sharma, who was covering the derailment of a train in Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: 43 kids die in Bihar this month, state cites low blood sugar
text: Two children died on Wednesday in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district due to Hypoglycaemia, taking the death toll this month to 43. Muzaffarpur is suffering from Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) outbreak, however, the authorities said these casualties were not caused by AES. Hypoglycaemia causes abnormally low-level of sugar in blood or deficiency of sodium or potassium in the body, officials said.

headlines: Man stabs girlfriend to death over suspicion of cheating
text: The Maharashtra police filed a case of murder against 25-year-old IT engineering drop-out Kiran Shinde for allegedly stabbing his 22-year-old girlfriend over suspicions that she was cheating on him. Shinde had not been in contact with anyone for five days, following which she and his friend visited Pune to look for him. Shinde then stabbed her four times.

headlines: US-Russia relations are getting worse and worse: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said in an interview that his country's relations with the US are getting worse and worse, criticising the sanctions imposed by the Trump administration. In contrast, Putin highlighted Russia's growing ties with China. "We really hope that common sense will prevail in the end," the Russian President added.

headlines: David Dhawan denies rumoured fallout with producer Vashu Bhagnani
text: Denying reports of a fallout with filmmaker Vashu Bhagnani, director David Dhawan said, "There are absolutely no differences between us." "We've always been on the same page," David added. Earlier reports stated that the fallout occurred as Vashu wanted his son to star in the upcoming 'Coolie No 1' remake instead of David's son Varun Dhawan.

headlines: I think Kangana will make an amazing director: Sujoy Ghosh
text: When asked which actor he feels would make a good director, actor-director Sujoy Ghosh said that he felt actress Kangana Ranaut would make an "amazing" filmmaker. "If I have to put my money on anyone, I would put it on her," Sujoy added. Kangana made her directorial debut with the 2019 film 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi'.

headlines: SRK to be chief guest at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
text: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will be the chief guest at the 10th Indian Film Festival of Melbourne in Australia. "I'm honoured and delighted to accept the invitation from the Victorian government and the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne," the actor said in a statement. The film festival will be held between August 8 and August 17 this year.

headlines: I get scared when critics give my films good reviews: Salman
text: In a recent interview, Salman Khan was asked how he feels when critics give his films good reviews, to which he replied, "I get scared...because their thinking never matches with the audience." "Then I wonder oh what if this doesnt do well," the actor added. Salman further said his validation for a good film comes from its box office collection.

headlines: Randeep volunteers for drought relief efforts in Maharashtra
text: Actor Randeep Hooda joined a group of volunteers from the international humanitarian organisation Khalsa Aid and participated in relief efforts in a drought-hit village near Nashik, Maharashtra. Hooda shared a video in which he is seen urging the government to find "permanent solutions" for drought victims. In the video, several volunteers are seen providing the villagers with drinking water.

headlines: Griezmann to play for Barcelona next season: Atlético CEO
text: Atlético Madrid CEO Miguel Ángel Gil Marín has said it has been known to him since March that club's World Cup-winning French forward Antoine Griezmann will play for Barcelona next season. "There are players who feel they're greater than the squad," Marín added. The 28-year-old has been with Atlético Madrid since 2014 and has scored 133 goals for the club.

headlines: CPPIB may buy 8% stake in Delhivery for $150 million: Report
text: Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) is reportedly in the process of making a $150-million investment in logistics startup Delhivery. The deal will see CPPIB buy an 8% stake in Delhivery from Multiples Alternate Asset Management, the report said. As per Crunchbase, the Gurugram-based startup has raised about $670 million in funding from investors like SoftBank.

headlines: Flyrobe in talks with Amazon, others for acquisition: Report
text: Fashion rental platform Flyrobe is exploring acquisition deals with multiple entities including Amazon, Future Group and Myntra, Entrackr stated quoting sources. As per Crunchbase, Flyrobe has raised $10.7 million in disclosed funding to date. Founded by IIT-Bombay alumni Pranay Surana, Shreya Mishra and Tushar Saxena, the Mumbai-based startup offers occasion wear on rent for men and women.

headlines: Road caves in near IIT Madras, traffic affected
text: A portion of a road near IIT Madras caved in at Chennai's Adyar area on Thursday, affecting traffic movement after the spot was barricaded. Meanwhile, there were no reports of casualties. While officials said it is unclear why the road caved in, some reports claimed it caved in due to the impact of underground drainage work being carried out nearby.

headlines: Cong condemns J&K terror attack in which 5 jawans were martyred
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala on Thursday condemned the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag in which five jawans were martyred. Surjewala said, "Government and intelligence agencies must take suitable action so that attacks be curtailed in future." On Wednesday, reportedly three terrorists attacked a police patrol party in Anantnag and shot at around eight soldiers.

headlines: Police close Tanushree's sexual harassment case against Nana
text: The police have closed the sexual harassment case filed by actress Tanushree Dutta against actor Nana Patekar, citing that there has been no evidence to corroborate the charges. "The complainant can file a protest report to challenge the closure report," lawyer Sujay Kantawala said. Dutta had accused Patekar of sexual misconduct on the sets of 'Horn 'Ok' Pleassss' in 2008.

headlines: OnePlus launches Alexa Skill, offers chance to win OnePlus 7
text: OnePlus has launched Alexa Skill dedicated to its latest OnePlus 7 series. It can be accessed on all Alexa-enabled devices including the new Echo Show. Once enabled, users can answer quiz questions through voice commands. Users will be served three questions daily till June 30 and those who get seven correct answers stand a chance to win a OnePlus 7.

headlines: How has India's head to head record been against NZ in World Cup?
text: Two-time World Cup champions India have faced New Zealand seven times in World Cup history. India have won three matches, while New Zealand have emerged victorious in the other four. New Zealand defeated India by four and eight wickets in 1975 and 1979 World Cup respectively. India won both their matches against New Zealand in the 1987 World Cup.

headlines: India haven't faced New Zealand in World Cup since 2003 edition
text: India and New Zealand last faced each other in ODI World Cup in the 2003 edition, with India winning the clash by seven wickets. India and New Zealand have played seven World Cup matches against each other, out of which New Zealand have won four and India three. India lead the overall head to head against New Zealand 55-45.

headlines: Will find out who did not work for us: Priyanka to Cong workers
text: Addressing party workers in Rae Bareli on Wednesday, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi said, "I will find out about those who did not work for the party in the elections." She stated, "I didn't want to deliver any speech here but since I have been made to speak, let me speak the truth." Congress won only one UP LS seat.

headlines: More than half the world population is now using internet: Report
text: The number of people active online in 2018 was approximately 3.8 billion, or 51% of the world's population, an annual report on internet trends by venture capitalist Mary Meeker stated. India accounted for 12% of the world's internet users, second only to China, which accounted for 21%. Meanwhile, US is at third position with 8% of global internet users.

headlines: Google CEO Pichai apologises to staff on anti-gay videos row
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, in an internal email to employees, apologised over YouTube's decision that YouTuber Steven Crowder's videos with anti-gay and racist slurs "didn't violate its policies". "I...especially regret that this happened during Pride month," Pichai said. Steven Crowder had used terms like "gay Latino" and "lisping queer" while referring to a Vox journalist in several videos.

headlines: India has 16 billion-dollar startups, 4th most in world: CB Insights
text: India ranks fourth in the list of countries with most 'unicorns' or startups with a valuation of $1 billion or more, with a 4% global share comprising 16 unicorns out of total 361, CB Insights reported. It claimed Paytm is India's highest valued unicorn at $10 billion. Paytm was followed by Snapdeal at $7 billion and Ola at $6.2 billion.

headlines: Minor girl pregnant after being raped by friend, accused on run
text: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her friend in northwest Delhi six months ago, said the police. The girl was taken to the hospital after she complained of uneasiness, following which she was found to be pregnant. The accused, who is currently absconding, had befriended the girl and threatened her not to disclose the incident to anyone.

headlines: Govt to provide free UPSC, bank exam coaching to Muslim girls: Naqvi
text: Union Minister of Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has announced that the Centre will extend free coaching to Muslim girls preparing for UPSC, banking and state service exams. He further announced that the government will provide 100% funding to build schools, colleges, hospitals, community centres, common centres, and hostels on Waqf properties, which will be geo-tagged and digitised.

headlines: Need 8 months to implement free Delhi Metro rides for women: DMRC
text: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has said that it will need eight months to implement the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP)-led Delhi government's proposed scheme of free metro rides for women. The Delhi Metro will initially install separate counters and vending machines for women for free tokens. In the longer run, it plans to change the system software, tokens, and cards.

headlines: UK signs order for WikiLeaks founder Assange's extradition to US
text: UK Home Secretary Sajid Javid has signed a request for WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to be extradited to the US. Assange is accused of obtaining and publishing classified information and conspiring to hack into a government computer. The final decision on Assange's extradition will be taken by the UK courts, Javid said.

headlines: Pak action against terror groups after Pulwama still reversible: US
text: The actions taken by Pakistan against terror groups after the terror attack in Pulwama in February are still reversible, Alice Wells, US' top diplomat for South and Central Asian Affairs, said. Terrorist organisations such as Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed will continue to pose a risk to international peace as long as they are able to operate freely in Pakistan, she added.

headlines: Adani wins final approval for controversial Australian coal mine
text: Adani has been cleared to start construction of its controversial Carmichael coalmine in Australia after Queensland state approved its groundwater management plan. The mine has faced opposition by environmental groups since it was proposed in 2010. Adani plans to self-finance Carmichael after failing to secure external funding and having down-sized the mine from an original $11-billion project.

headlines: Google to stop auto syncing files between Drive, Photos on July 10
text: Starting July 10, Google Drive and Google Photos will no longer automatically sync photos and videos, Google said, citing, "feedback that the connection between these services is confusing". Photos and videos deleted by users in Drive won't be removed from Photos and vice versa. Any photos or videos from Drive in Photos uploaded before this change will remain in Photos.

headlines: SpaceX re-launches, recovers Falcon 9 1st stage flown in March
text: SpaceX launched three satellites that make up the RADARSAT Constellation Mission, to be used by the Canadian government, from California's Vandenberg Air Force Base. The launch included use of a Falcon 9's first stage, which previously supported Crew Dragon's first demonstration mission in March. Following stage separation, Falcon 9's first stage returned to land on SpaceX's Landing Zone 4.

headlines: Raj court gives death sentence to man for raping, killing 4-yr-old
text: A court in Rajasthan's Alwar has awarded death sentence to a man for raping and killing a 4-year-old girl. Special public prosecutor Vinod Kumar Sharma said that a complaint was registered in February 2015 against the accused, who raped and killed the girl at a deserted place. He added, "After sexually abusing her, he crushed her head with a stone."

headlines: Four arrested for smuggling heroin in Jammu
text: Four members of an interstate gang of narcotic smugglers were arrested in Jammu city and 175 grams of heroin was seized from them, said officials on Thursday. A police team had intercepted the vehicle they were travelling in. A case was registered against the accused, two of whom belong to Punjab while the others are from J&K and Himachal Pradesh.

headlines: Nitish holds high-level meeting over liquor ban in Bihar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar held a high-level meeting to tighten liquor prohibition in the state. Kumar directed the police personnel to take in writing from each police station that illegal alcohol trade was not taking place in their area. He said if still alcohol is recovered from the area, then they won't be given postings for the next 10 years.

headlines: 9 held in Assam while trying to smuggle cattle to Bangladesh
text: Nine people have been arrested while they were trying to smuggle cattle to Bangladesh from the India-Bangladesh border areas, Assam Police said. "We had received information that smugglers used to cut fences at the border and smuggle cattle," Superintendent of Police (South Salmara Mankachar, Assam) Kankanjyoti Saikiya said. He added that nine cattle were also recovered from them.

headlines: CRPF pays tribute to 5 jawans martyred in J&K terror attack
text: A wreath-laying ceremony was conducted in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Thursday morning to pay tribute to five CRPF jawans who were martyred in the terrorist attack in Anantnag on Wednesday. Nearly three terrorists attacked a police patrol party on Wednesday and shot at around eight soldiers. Reportedly, one terrorist was killed on the spot by the security forces.

headlines: I'd take it: Trump if a foreign power offered info on opponent
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he would be open to accepting damaging information on a political opponent if it were offered to him by a foreign government. In the run-up to the 2016 presidential election, Trump's son Donald Trump Jr had met a Russian lawyer who had promised "dirt" on his opponent Hillary Clinton.

headlines: Dell emerges as India's most trusted brand in 2019: Report
text: Dell has emerged as the most trusted brand of India in 2019, according to a research by TRA's The Brand Trust Report. Dell climbed five ranks over the previous year to grab the top spot and also introduced the laptop category in the report. Notably, it has established a widespread network of Dell Exclusive Stores in over 680+ cities.

headlines: No survivors found at crash site of IAF's AN-32 carrying 13 people
text: The Indian Air Force has said no survivors have been found at the site in Arunachal Pradesh where the AN-32 aircraft carrying 13 people crashed. On Wednesday, a team of rescuers was airlifted to the crash site, which was at an altitude of 12,000 feet. The wreckage of the aircraft, which went missing on June 3, was found on Tuesday.

headlines: Had 1st boyfriend in 10th grade, was scolded by mom: Kiara Advani
text: Actress Kiara Advani has revealed that she had her first boyfriend at the age of 16 when she was in the 10th grade. She added, "We broke up because I was in the tenth standard and my mom got to know about him and she shouted at me saying how can I have a boyfriend in the tenth standard?"

headlines: David Warner gifts his Man of the Match award to young fan in crowd
text: Australia opener David Warner, who scored a match-winning hundred against Pakistan in their World Cup match, gifted his Man of the Match award to a young fan while signing autographs after the match. "It feels really cool and awesome. We were just waving the flag and he came over and gave it to us," the fan said.

headlines: New frog found in Assam, named after Northeast India
text: A team of scientists including Delhi University researchers discovered a new species of 'paddy frog' in Assam. The frog 'Micryletta aishani' was named after the Sanskrit word 'aishani', meaning northeast, in reference to Northeast India. Researchers revealed the new frog is reddish-brown in colour and measures about 2.2-2.8 cm in length and has an absence of web on its feet.

headlines: TN ISIS module leader arrested, 14 mobile phones recovered
text: The NIA on Wednesday arrested Mohammed Azarudeen, the alleged leader of ISIS' Tamil Nadu module who was a Facebook friend of Sri Lanka attacks mastermind Zahran Hashim. The agency had conducted raids at 7 locations in Coimbatore, during which it recovered 300 air-gun pellets, 29 SIM cards, 14 phones, 3 laptops, a dagger and a large number of incriminating documents.

headlines: Pak opens its airspace for PM Modi after India chooses Oman route
text: Pakistan on Wednesday said it will "specially" open its airspace for PM Narendra Modi's flight to Kyrgyzstan's Bishkek to attend the two-day SCO summit, even as India decided not to use the nation's airspace for the purpose. Calling it a "goodwill gesture", Pakistan's Aviation Minister Ghulam Sarwar Khan said airspace will be opened for a period of 72 hours.

headlines: Amitav Ghosh 1st Indian writer in English to win Jnanpith Award
text: Amitav Ghosh was conferred with the 54th Jnanpith Award for 2018 by ex-West Bengal Governor Gopalkrishna Gandhi in Delhi on Wednesday. Notably, he is the first Indian writer in English to win the award. "Ghosh treads through historical settings to the modern era and weaves a space where the past connects with the present in relevant ways," Bharatiya Jnanpith said.

headlines: Indore corporators stop National Anthem midway to sing Vande Mataram
text: Recital of the National Anthem was abruptly stopped by corporators to sing National Song 'Vande Mataram' at the budget session of the Indore Municipal Corporation. IMC Chairman AS Naruka said, "The mistake was possibly committed following a corporator's slip of the tongue." Traditionally, IMC's budget session starts with the recital of National Song and ends with National Anthem, he added.

headlines: Exchanges to impose trading restrictions on Jet Airways stock
text: BSE and NSE on Wednesday announced that shares of grounded airline Jet Airways would be shifted to the 'trade-for-trade' segment from June 29. Under this category, delivery of shares is compulsory and no netting off is allowed. Trading of the stock in the futures and options (F&O) segment of the exchanges will be also removed.

headlines: Gully Boy's Vijay Varma to star in Mira Nair's international series
text: 'Gully Boy' actor Vijay Varma will star in the upcoming international television adaptation of Vikram Seth's novel 'A Suitable Boy', directed by filmmaker Mira Nair. "I'm glad...this project came my way and I'm looking forward to...working with a stellar team," he said. The series will see Vijay playing the role of Rasheed, a student and also an Arabic teacher.

headlines: It bothers me when identities are viewed through religious lens: Dia
text: Actress Dia Mirza said that it bothers her when a person's identity is viewed through a religious lens, as she grew up in a secular atmosphere. "[E]very time human beings have moved towards majoritarianism, they have gone away from inclusivity and they have suffered," she added. "People want to control us by driving or re-enforcing fear," Dia further said.

headlines: All alleged stories: Kiara denies link-up rumours with Sidharth
text: Denying link-up rumours with actor Sidharth Malhotra, actress Kiara Advani said, "They all are 'alleged' stories which are reported." "Earlier I used to read such stories...and get upset...but now I laugh about it and it's fun," the actress added. Kiara further said that she realised over time that rumours like these are part and parcel of the entertainment industry.

headlines: Salman, Katrina host 'Bharat' screening for partition survivors
text: Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif hosted a screening of their recently-released film 'Bharat' for survivors of the 1947 India-Pakistan partition and their families. Sharing a picture from the event on Twitter, Salman wrote, "Honoured to meet all of them! Salute to the real Bharat families." The depiction of the partition is central to the film.

headlines: 12 Cong MLAs collectively decided to join TRS: Rega Kantha Rao
text: The 12 MLAs who defected from Congress on June 6 have collectively decided to merge into the TRS party, lawmaker Rega Kantha Rao has said. He added that the "lack of Congress leadership" is the main reason behind the decision. Rao's remark came after the Telangana High Court issued a notice to the MLAs who defected from Congress.

headlines: 6 ministers occupy chambers in Andhra Pradesh Secretariat
text: Six ministers on Wednesday occupied chambers in the state Secretariat on the first day of the Andhra Pradesh Assembly session. CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy entered the state Assembly as the Chief Minister for the first time amid Vedic chants and hymns. Also, Sambangi Appala Naidu took charge as the Pro-tem Speaker of the state Assembly.

headlines: WB has become Gujarat, may become Ayodhya or Varanasi: Sena
text: Days after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she wouldn't allow BJP to turn "Bengal into Gujarat", the Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece, 'Saamana' said "Bengal has become Gujarat" and it may soon become Ayodhya or Varanasi. Sena added the "sleeping Hindus of Bengal" had been "awakened" by Mamata's "excesses". It said Mamata was responsible "for her own downfall".

headlines: Solved 85% missing person cases in 2018: Telangana Police
text: Telangana Police has claimed that it had traced on an average 85% people who went missing in 2018. The statement came after a media report published by a daily claimed that the number of persons missing in Telangana escalated in the last year. The police said that it isn't correct to say that the police are neglecting missing person cases.

headlines: 2 sisters gangraped by 4 at gunpoint in UP's Muzaffarnagar
text: Two minor sisters were allegedly raped by four men at gunpoint on Tuesday in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar, police said. According to a complaint, the sisters aged 13 and 15 years were gangraped when they went to look for their mother near a sugarcane field, the police added. The accused allegedly threatened to shoot the girls if they cried for help.

headlines: EU must respond further to Trump's steel tariffs: Lakshmi Mittal
text: ArcelorMittal Chairman Lakshmi Mittal has said the European Union should "urgently" take further measures to offset the impact of the US' import tariffs. The European Commission had announced "safeguard" measures to prevent a surge of steel imports as a result of the 25% tariffs imposed by the US. Mittal said the measures announced by the EU were not effective.

headlines: I stand by it: Actress 9yrs younger to Salman on playing his mom
text: Actress Sonali Kulkarni, who is 9 years younger than Salman Khan and played his mother in 'Bharat', has reacted to criticism over her role. "I've to stand by my choice proudly, which I do," she said. "I also played Hrithik's adoptive mom in Mission Kashmir...People will...comment, and they're right...It's not like every time it comes out of criticism," Sonali added.

headlines: HBO submits worst rated GoT season 8 episodes for Emmys, criticised
text: HBO has submitted the worst rated episodes in 'Game of Thrones' history on IMDb, including 'The Last of the Starks' and 'The Iron Throne', for Emmy Awards. These were among episodes that led to a petition demanding a remake of the final season. Criticising the submissions, a user wrote, "Who thought [this] was a good idea."

headlines: Esha criticises UIDAI, says can't travel as server down for 3 days
text: Actress Esha Gupta took to Twitter to criticise UIDAI claiming the government agency's server is down for three days, adding that she can't travel due to the issue. When the agency asked her to send across the website's screenshot on Twitter, the actress refused. "Imagine people who can't tweet you, what they must be going through, ridiculous," she tweeted.

headlines: Dwayne deletes daughter's pool pic with no swimsuit on over criticism
text: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson deleted a picture of himself with his 3-year-old daughter Jasmine at a swimming pool after he was criticised because she wasn't dressed. The picture received comments like "They made bathing suits for a reason" and "Why would you expose a...child's body to millions of people?" However, some users also wrote there's "nothing sexual" about the picture.

headlines: Hrithik's sister has been calling Kangana to apologise: Rangoli
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel has claimed that Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina has been calling her and Kangana to apologise. "[She] has been calling and messaging...only to apologise that she didn't stand up for [Kangana] when Hrithik framed her," Rangoli tweeted. Sunaina had earlier revealed that she is going through some issues with her family.

headlines: Australia defeat Pakistan as Warner slams 1st ton after serving ban
text: Australia defeated Pakistan by 41 runs on Wednesday to register their third victory in four 2019 World Cup matches and rise to second place on the points table. The match witnessed Australia opener David Warner smash his first ODI hundred since his return to international cricket after serving one-year ban. The defeat is Pakistan's second in the tournament.

headlines: US beat Thailand 13-0, record biggest victory in women's WC history
text: Alex Morgan scored five times as US opened their women's World Cup defence with a 13-0 victory over Thailand. It is the biggest victory in women's World Cup history, eclipsing Germany's 11-0 win over Argentina in 2007. Morgan became the first player to score five goals in a women's World Cup match since Michelle Akers in 1991.

headlines: Facebook unveils paid research app that can track competitors
text: Facebook has announced launch of a new market research app called 'Study from Facebook'. Currently announced only for India and US, users will be paid to let Facebook access data such as their app downloads and time spent on the apps including its competitors. Facebook had shut down a similar research effort earlier this year which collected data from teenagers.

headlines: Medical services disrupted in WB as doctors' strike enters 2nd day
text: Medical services across West Bengal remained disrupted for the second day on Wednesday as junior doctors in government and private hospitals continued their strike demanding security. The protest was triggered after a junior doctor at a government hospital in Kolkata was beaten up by an elderly patient's family on Monday. The doctor who suffered a head injury was stable today.

headlines: Kerala to re-examine govt award to cartoon on rape accused bishop
text: The Kerala government on Wednesday ordered the state-run Lalithakala Akademi to re-examine an award presented to a cartoon on rape-accused bishop Franco Mulakkal made by artist KK Subhash. This comes after the Kerala Catholic Bishops' Council (KCBC) demanded the withdrawal of the award. The KCBC called the cartoon "very provocative and condemnable" and demanded an apology from the Akademi.

headlines: US' Pompeo cites 'Modi hai to mumkin hai' slogan ahead of India visit
text: In his major India policy speech ahead of his visit to India later this month, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo cited BJP slogan 'Modi hai to mumkin hai'. "As PM (Narendra) Modi said in his latest campaign, 'Modi hai to mumkin hai' or 'Modi makes it possible', I'm looking forward to exploring what's possible between our people," Pompeo stated.

headlines: Reach office on time, avoid work from home: PM Modi tells ministers
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday instructed the Council of Ministers to reach office on time and avoid working from home to set an example for others. He also requested the ministers not to make plans of outside visit during the 40-day Parliament session. Moreover, he asked Cabinet Ministers to share important files with Ministers of State to enhance productivity.

headlines: Top traders' body asks government not to ban e-cigarettes
text: The Confederation of All India Traders has asked the government not to ban e-cigarettes saying that a research has shown these are less harmful than regular cigarettes. It said the government should come out with appropriate regulations for sale of e-cigarettes instead of banning them. The Health Ministry last year advised states to stop the sale and import of e-cigarettes.

headlines: I want Hardik Pandya to be better than me: Kapil Dev
text: Former Indian World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said that he wants India all-rounder Hardik Pandya to be a better player than him. Kapil also urged people not to compare Hardik with him and "let him play". "Yes, he is a batting all-rounder. I can feel that, so I hope he can improve in his bowling," the former all-rounder added.

headlines: All tactics were used to win LS polls: Sonia criticises BJP
text: Addressing her first rally after retaining Rae Bareli Lok Sabha seat, UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi criticised the BJP, saying that all types of tactics were adopted to win the elections. She added, "I feel this is the greatest misfortune that limits of dignity are crossed to retain...power." Sonia said everyone knows whatever happened in the elections was "moral or immoral".

headlines: Canada PM announces plan to ban single-use plastics by 2021
text: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the country will ban harmful single-use plastics like plastic bags, straws, among other items, as early as 2021, "where supported by scientific evidence and warranted". Canada plans to introduce targets and standards for firms that manufacture plastic products or sell items with plastic packaging so they become responsible for their plastic waste.

headlines: No timetable for 737 MAX's return to service: US regulator
text: US' Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Wednesday said it does not have a specific timetable on when Boeing's grounded 737 MAX aircraft would return to service. The US aviation regulator added that it will act "only when it is safe to return to service". The Boeing 737 MAX has been grounded since March, following two fatal crashes within 5 months.

headlines: You can't date a man & accuse him of rape: Zarina on Aditya-Kangana
text: Defending her husband against Kangana Ranaut's allegations, Aditya Pancholi's wife Zarina Wahab said, "You can't be in a relationship with someone for years and...accuse him of rape just because the relationship has ended." "Aditya has done no wrong," she added. Kangana's sister sent an application to police against Pancholi regarding an 'assault and exploitation' incident that happened 13 years ago.

headlines: Hum paron se nahin hoslon se udte hain: Shikhar Dhawan amid injury
text: Opener Shikhar Dhawan, who is presently under observation of BCCI medical team following his injury, took to Twitter to share a shayari by Dr Rahat Indori. "Ye kainchiyaan humein udne se khaak rokengi...Ke hum paron se nahin hoslon se udte hain (These scissors can't stop us from flying, we fly with courage, not wings)," part of the shayari read.

headlines: England not fit for hosting cricket tournaments, suggests Tharoor
text: Reacting to three 2019 World Cup matches getting abandoned due to rain, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor suggested that England is not fit for hosting cricket tournaments. "Their summers are increasingly turning into monsoons!" he tweeted. "Should England be banned from hosting cricket tournaments until the world solves climate change or...MCC invests in covered stadia?" he asked.

headlines: Ex-Eng player apologises after criticism over remark on Kohli
text: Former England cricketer Nick Compton has apologised publicly after being criticised by fans for his remark on Team India captain Virat Kohli. The 35-year-old had said that Kohli had no right to tell Indian fans to stop booing at David Warner and Steve Smith. "Im sorry if people feel my comments regarding Virat Kohli were unfair," he tweeted.

headlines: Yuvraj Singh should have got farewell from the ground: Kapil Dev
text: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev has said he would have loved to see a player like Yuvraj Singh get farewell from the ground. "Yuvraj will be in my all-time eleven whenever I sit down to make my team," he added. The 37-year-old Yuvraj retired from international cricket on Monday, two years after playing his last international match.

headlines: Amir confessed to spot-fixing after Afridi slapped him: Razzaq
text: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq has claimed pacer Mohammad Amir confessed to spot-fixing only after then ODI captain Shahid Afridi slapped him. "Afridi told me to leave the room but after sometime I heard sound of a slap and then Amir told the whole truth," Razzaq added. Amir was accused of deliberately bowling no-balls in a Test against England in 2010.

headlines: 2 Indian women named in IBM's list of top 40 women in AI
text: Two Indian women have been featured on American multinational IT firm IBM's list honouring 40 women in Artificial Intelligence (AI) from 15 different countries. The list includes Harmeen Mehta, Chief Information Officer for Bharti Airtel. Seema Gaur, Executive VP and Head IT for IFFCO Tokio General Insurance Company was also named on the list.

headlines: Govt approves new agency to make weapons for space wars: Report
text: The Central Government has approved the formation of Defence Space Research Agency (DSRO) to develop weapon systems and capability enhancing technologies for space wars, ANI reported. DSRO will reportedly comprise scientists who'll work with integrated officers of the three armed forces. Separate military agency Defence Space Agency (DSA) was also reportedly set up to fight any future space wars.

headlines: Praying for safety: PM before Cyclone Vayu's landfall in Gujarat
text: PM Narendra Modi has asked people to follow the real-time information by government agencies on Cyclone Vayu, which is expected to hit the Gujarat coast on Thursday. "Praying for the safety and wellbeing of all," tweeted PM Modi. IMD has said that the cyclone will cross Gujarat coast as a 'Very Severe Cyclonic Storm' with wind speed of 155-165 kmph.

headlines: China appoints its ex-envoy to Pak as new Ambassador to India
text: China has appointed its former envoy to Pakistan, Sun Weidong, as the new Ambassador to India. Sun is currently the Director General of the Policy Planning Department at China's Foreign Ministry. Sun succeeds Luo Zhaohui as the Ambassador to India after he was appointed as China's Vice Foreign Minister.

headlines: 119 people booked for abusing Kerala CM since govt came into power
text: As many as 119 people were booked for allegedly abusing Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on social media over the last three years since he took charge, a document uploaded on the Legislative Assembly website revealed. Cases have been registered against 12 state government/semi-governmental employees and one central government employee. The Opposition compared CM Vijayan to UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

headlines: Drop your guns, come and have lunch with me: J&K Guv to militants
text: Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik on Wednesday urged the militants to drop their guns and come to Raj Bhawan to have lunch with him. "Take everything from us, we will give our life, but through love and dialogue," he said. "For that PM Narendra Modi is ready, we're ready," he added.

headlines: 2 more CRPF jawans martyred in J&K attack, death toll rises to 5
text: Two more CRPF jawans have been martyred in a shootout with militants in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Wednesday, taking the death toll to five. A militant was also killed in the crossfire and an AK series assault rifle was recovered from him, police said. Firing is still underway and the area has been cordoned off.

headlines: Will continue to pursue Malaysia to extradite Zakir Naik: Centre
text: External Affairs Ministry on Wednesday said that it would continue to pursue Malaysia to extradite Islamic preacher Zakir Naik. This comes two days after Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad said the country has the right to not extradite him. Naik is facing a probe in India after his sermons were cited as a reason by Bangladesh for the 2016 Dhaka attack.

headlines: Union Cabinet clears fresh Triple Talaq bill
text: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday cleared a fresh bill to ban the practice of instant Triple Talaq, which, once passed by Parliament, will replace an ordinance issued earlier this year. The controversial bill had lapsed with the dissolution of the 16th Lok Sabha last month, as it could not be passed by Parliament and was pending in the Rajya Sabha.

headlines: Feel bad when big player like Dhawan is injured: Kapil Dev
text: Reacting to India opener Shikhar Dhawan's thumb injury in 2019 World Cup, India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev said, "You feel bad when such a big player is injured." He added, "I feel sorry for him and...the team but you can't do much about injuries." Notably, wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant is being flown to England as cover for injured Dhawan.

headlines: Mbappé scores 100th career goal at 20, beats Ronaldo & Messi
text: France's 20-year-old forward Kylian Mbappé scored his 100th career (club and international) goal as France beat Andorra 4-0 to go top of their Euro 2020 qualifiers group. Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi were both 22 when they scored their respective 100th career goals. Mbappé was named best young player at 2018 World Cup for scoring four goals in seven appearances.

headlines: Walmart may infuse $1.2 bn for funding Flipkarts operation
text: Walmart may use $1.2 billion of cash and cash equivalents lying in its reserve for funding Flipkarts operation, YourStory reported citing filings with the SEC. "Approximately $1.2 billion can only be accessed through dividends or inter-company financing arrangements subject to approval by Flipkart minority shareholders," filings stated. Walmart acquired 77% stake in Flipkart last year.

headlines: Tesla might go into mining business for EV batteries: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the automaker is currently matching its product rollout with the scaling up of its electric vehicle battery production. "As we scale battery production to very high levels...we might get into the mining business," Musk said. "We will do whatever we have to do to ensure...we can scale at the fastest rate possible," Musk added.

headlines: Trafficking suspected as 65 Rohingyas found stranded in Thailand
text: As many as 65 Rohingya Muslims, including 31 women and 29 men, were found stranded on a boat off the coast of southern Thailand. The captain and crew of the boat carrying them have been charged with assisting foreign nationals to enter the country illegally. Authorities are trying to determine if the Rohingyas are victims of human trafficking.

headlines: India's retail inflation hits 7-month high of 3.05% in May
text: India's annual retail inflation rose to a seven-month high of 3.05% in May from 2.99% the previous month, government data showed on Wednesday. The inflation measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) remained within RBI's medium-term target of 4% for the tenth straight month. The consumer food price inflation for the month jumped to 1.83% compared to 1.1% in April.

headlines: RBI panel on capital reserves defers report again
text: The Bimal Jalan committee, which is reviewing the size of capital reserves the RBI should hold, delayed submitting its report again on Wednesday due to a difference of opinion, officials said. Originally scheduled for submission in April, the report will now be submitted by June-end. The six-member panel will have one more meeting before finalising its report.

headlines: Humans swallow 1 credit card's worth of plastic each week: Study
text: Humans may be ingesting five grams of plastic each week, the equivalent of a credit card, a study commissioned by the World Wide Fund for Nature said. The largest source of plastic ingestion is drinking water, with the plastic particles found in bottled, tap, surface and groundwater. The findings are the first to estimate the ingestion of microplastics by humans.

headlines: 3 CRPF jawans martyred in J&K terrorist attack; heavy firing underway
text: Three CRPF jawans were martyred and at least two others were injured after a police patrol party in J&K's Anantnag was attacked by terrorists on Wednesday, following which heavy firing is underway. At least two militants attacked them with automatic rifles followed by the hurling of grenades. Anantnag's SHO was critically injured in the attack and one terrorist was neutralised.

headlines: UP Bar Council's 1st woman President shot dead inside Agra court
text: The first-ever woman President of UP Bar Council, Darvesh Yadav was shot dead in Agra Civil Court today, two days after her election to the post.
