Yadav was allegedly shot thrice by lawyer Manish Sharma and was declared dead on arrival at hospital. Sharma, who also shot himself, has been admitted to the hospital and is in a critical condition.

headlines: Severe dust storm in Delhi-NCR, 'intense rain' predicted
text: Delhi-NCR and surrounding areas experienced a severe dust storm on Wednesday. 'Intense rain' is expected in Delhi, and Gurugram and Noida may see heavy showers, private weather agency Skymet said. On Tuesday, the government said that a dust storm originated over Sistan basin in Afghanistan could hit North India within the next 48 hours.

headlines: Sania Mirza criticises World Cup match ads by India, Pakistan
text: Sania Mirza has criticised advertisements being run by India and Pakistan for World Cup match, calling them "cringeworthy". "You don't need to 'hype up' or market the match anymore specially with rubbish!" she wrote. The host broadcaster in India ran a commercial terming India as Pakistan's father, while a private channel in Pakistan mocked IAF pilot Abhinandan in its ad.

headlines: Lok Sabha election 2019 most inclusive poll: India to UN conference
text: Lok Sabha election 2019 was the most historic and "inclusive" poll as it ensured every person exercises their right to vote, including those with disabilities, Centre on Tuesday informed a UN conference. The facilities extended included obstacle-free access to voting compartment, accessible toilets, separate entry and exit, braille ballot guide, EVMs and voter slips, and wheelchairs, among others.

headlines: Warner smashes his 15th ODI hundred, 3rd straight against Pakistan
text: Australia opener David Warner smashed his 15th ODI hundred off 102 balls against Pakistan in 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. It is Warner's first hundred since his return to international cricket and his third straight century against Pakistan in ODI cricket. With the ton, the 32-year-old became the sixth Australian batsman to score at least two hundreds in World Cup.

headlines: Md Amir records second-best World Cup figures by a Pakistan pacer
text: Mohammad Amir registered the second-best bowling figures by a Pakistan pacer in World Cup, taking five wickets for 30 runs against Australia in 2019 World Cup today. The figures of 10-2-30-5 are also the 27-year-old's career-best bowling figures in ODI cricket. Wasim Akram registered the best World Cup bowling figures (9-1-28-5) by a Pakistan pacer against Namibia in 2003.

headlines: I'll f*ck*ng bury you: McAfee says he will expose corrupt US officials
text: Software firm McAfee's fugitive founder John McAfee, accused of US tax evasion, on Twitter said, "I've collected files on corruption in governments. For the first time, I'm naming names and specifics." "Leave me the f*ck alone, or go down with the corruption you have embraced," he said, adding, "Because I will f*ck*ng bury you if you continue."

headlines: BJP forms Parliamentary Party Executive Committee, headed by PM Modi
text: BJP has constituted its Parliamentary Party Executive Committee with PM Narendra Modi as Leader of the Party and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh as Deputy Leader of the Party in the Lok Sabha. Union Minister of Social Justice and Empowerment Thawarchand Gehlot is the Leader of the Party in the Rajya Sabha while Railways Minister Piyush Goyal is the Deputy Leader.

headlines: PM's advisers to issue point-by-point rebuttal to ex-CEA's claims
text: PM's Economic Advisory Council has refuted ex-Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian's claims that India's GDP numbers could have been overestimated in recent years. The council said it will come out with a point-by-point rebuttal on the issue in due course. It added that by his own admission, Subramanian "has taken time to understand India's growth numbers and is still unsure".

headlines: JNU to give Distinguished Alumni Award to Sitharaman and Jaishankar
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University has approved a proposal to give Distinguished Alumni Award to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar during convocation in August. Sitharaman did her Masters in Economics and MPhil in International Studies from JNU, while Jaishankar did Masters in Political Science and MPhil and PhD in International Relations from the university.

headlines: Was told 'cover up or leave' at public pool for breastfeeding: US mom
text: A woman named Misty Daugereaux in Texas, US has claimed she was asked to "cover up or leave" by a public pool's staff for breastfeeding her 10-month-old son on Sunday. Nessler Park Family Aquatic Center claimed Misty had "both breasts" out and had been "cussing out" staff. She was escorted out after staff claimed there were seven complaints against her.

headlines: The subjects of my films can be made into documentaries: Ayushmann
text: When asked whether he thought his upcoming film 'Article 15' might be considered a documentary as it deals with caste-based issues, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "Every film of mine deals with subjects that can be made into documentary." "What's the point of a film addressing a social issue if there's no reach? The reach will only come with entertainment," he added.

headlines: Indian cinema should learn from how H'wood plans films: Dhanush
text: When asked how he feels filmmaking in Hollywood differs from Indian cinema, actor Dhanush said, "[T]he way they plan things ahead is something we can take note of." "We need to understand how much money we can save by planning it from before," the actor added. Dhanush is starring in the upcoming Hollywood film 'The Extraordinary Journey of the Fakir'.

headlines: Tesla has a James Bond-like submarine car design: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed the automaker has a design for a submarine car like the Lotus Esprit featured in the James Bond film 'The Spy Who Loved Me'. The billionaire said it was technically possible to have a submarine car adding the market for it would be "small" but "enthusiastic". Tesla might make one as a show car.

headlines: 5-yr-old boy killed as Congo's Ebola outbreak spreads to Uganda
text: A five-year-old boy who is said to have travelled across the border with his family from DR Congo died from Ebola in Uganda, officials said. A total of three cases of Ebola have been confirmed in Uganda, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. More than 2,000 cases have been recorded in DR Congo in the last 10 months.

headlines: PwC quits as Reliance Capital auditor over some transactions
text: Global auditing firm PwC has resigned as the statutory auditor of Reliance Capital citing certain "observations or transactions" in its assessment. It added that the Anil Ambani-led company threatened legal action against the firm, which further impaired its ability to complete the audit in a fair manner. Reliance Capital said it does not agree with PwC's reasons for resignation.

headlines: Upward GDP revisions for note ban, GST years surprising: Ex-CEA
text: Former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian has said the Statistics Ministry's "substantial" upward revisions to GDP estimates for FY17 and FY18 seemed "surprising". He noted that they were the years when the short-term impact of demonetisation and GST would have been "most severe". Subramanian suggested that India's GDP growth was overestimated by 2.5 percentage points between FY12 and FY17.

headlines: Italy proposes tax on savings hidden in safety deposit boxes
text: The Italian government has proposed imposing a tax on cash and other valuables locked in safety deposit boxes held with banks. Deposit boxes were a way of hiding income and assets from the authorities, Italy's Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini said. Those who voluntarily declared their deposit-box holdings would be taxed at a low rate of about 15%, he added.

headlines: Ekta responds after criticism over 'wrong' rocket on show's poster
text: Producer Ekta Kapoor has responded after criticism over showing the "wrong" rocket on the poster of her show 'M.O.M- Mission Over Mars', inspired by the story of the women behind India's Mangalyaan mission. She wrote, "Cannot use... isro rocket!!! Legal boundaries!" Earlier, social media users said the rocket on the poster is not PSLV-C25, aboard which Mangalyaan mission was launched.

headlines: Why are Pakistan players sporting black armbands vs Australia?
text: Pakistan players are sporting black armbands in their ongoing 2019 World Cup match against Australia. They are wearing armbands to mourn deaths of former Pakistan cricketer Akhtar Sarfaraz and former umpire Riazuddin. Riazuddin, who had stood in 12 Tests and 12 ODIs, died aged 60 due to cardiac arrest, while Akhtar, who played 4 ODIs, died aged 43 on Monday.

headlines: FB to not remove Zuckerberg, Donald Trump's faked Instagram videos
text: Facebook has said it won't remove deepfake videos featuring Co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg, celebrity Kim Kardashian and US President Donald Trump, among others, from Instagram. "If third-party fact-checkers mark it as false, we will filter it from Instagram's recommendation surfaces," the photo-sharing platform said. Zuckerberg's real video from 2017 was used to create his fake video.

headlines: 2 men posing as CID officers arrested in UP, fake pistol seized
text: Two Ghaziabad residents who allegedly posed as CID officers to extort money from people were arrested in Rampur on Tuesday. The police said, "They used to pose as CID and Intelligence Bureau officers to extort money from unassuming people. Fake CID identity cards, fake stamps, walkie talkie sets, several ATM cards and a fake pistol were seized from them."

headlines: 4 Kerala Express passengers died due to excessive heat: Autopsy
text: After four senior citizens travelling from Agra to Coimbatore aboard the Kerala Express died on Monday, their autopsy reports confirmed heat stroke was the cause of their deaths. One woman passed away before boarding the train, and three men and a woman died during the journey. A few of them reportedly began vomiting and collapsed inside the train near Jhansi.

headlines: IAF airdrops personnel near AN-32 crash site to search for survivors
text: Indian Air Force on Wednesday successfully airdropped 8-10 personnel in two helicopter sorties near the crash site of AN-32 aircraft in Arunachal Pradesh. The personnel started moving towards the site searching for more wreckage and possible survivors. The wreckage of the aircraft, which had 13 people on board, was found yesterday, eight days after it went missing.

headlines: 3 lakh people being evacuated as Cyclone Vayu approaches Gujarat
text: Gujarat has launched a massive evacuation exercise to shift three lakh people from low-lying areas in Saurashtra and Kutch regions, as Cyclone Vayu advances towards its coast. A two-day holiday has been declared in schools and colleges in 10 districts, while the Coast Guard, Army, Navy, Air Force and BSF have been put on high alert.

headlines: Govt to make company directors sit for exams before appointment
text: Independent directors on company boards will soon have to clear an exam before they can be appointed, said Injeti Srinivas, the top bureaucrat in charge of corporate affairs. "We want to demolish the myth that independent directors don't have any fiduciary duty," Srinivas said. The online exam will cover the basics of Indian company law, ethics, and capital market norms.

headlines: Dettol maker names PepsiCo's Laxman Narasimhan as next CEO
text: Reckitt Benckiser, the maker of Dettol cleaners and Durex condoms, on Wednesday named PepsiCo's Global Chief Commercial Officer Laxman Narasimhan as its next CEO, to succeed Rakesh Kapoor. Narasimhan will be the first outside leader of the British consumer goods group since its formation in 1999. Before joining PepsiCo in 2012, he worked for 19 years at consultancy firm McKinsey.

headlines: Team India watches Bharat in England during WC, Salman reacts
text: Salman Khan responded to a picture shared by Kedar Jadhav, in which the cricketer is seen with several members of the Indian team at a screening of Salman's film 'Bharat' in England. "Thank you Bharat team for liking 'Bharat'...best wishes for upcoming matches," Salman tweeted. MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya, Shikhar Dhawan, and KL Rahul are also seen in Kedar's picture.

headlines: You feel Karan's films and the emotions linger on: Bhumi
text: Praising filmmaker Karan Johar for his work, Bhumi Pednekar said, "You feel Karan's films and the emotions linger on." "Karan's films are larger than life and aspirational yet at the same time, where the emotions are concerned, they are very real," the actress added. Bhumi will be featuring in Karan's films 'Takht' and 'Bhoot Part One: The Haunted Ship'.

headlines: Tamil director Pa Ranjith booked for comments against Chola king
text: A case was filed against Tamil director Pa Ranjith for allegedly "inciting caste enmity" following his comments against Chola dynasty King Raja Raja Chola during a public event. Ranjith accused the ruler of taking over lands owned by Dalits and handing it over to temples. Hindu Makkal Katchi, a Hindu nationalist party, filed a complaint against Ranjith for his comments.

headlines: Votes from minority community members a blessing: Varun Gandhi
text: During a visit to his constituency, newly elected Pilibhit MP Varun Gandhi on Monday called the votes he received from members of minority communities a "blessing". Varun said, "I did not receive too many votes from the minorities, but what I have got also proves that people from the community who cast their votes in my favour have blessed me."

headlines: Sheila Dikshit meets Kejriwal over Delhi's power, water woes
text: Delhi Congress chief Sheila Dikshit on Wednesday met CM Arvind Kejriwal over the power and water woes being faced by the city people. Delhi Congress working president Haroon Yusuf said that Dikshit demanded the withdrawal of fixed charge hike in electricity bills from Kejriwal. He added, Kejriwal assured that the fixed charges will be brought to the previous lower rates.

headlines: Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka visit Rae Bareli to thank voters
text: UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi and her daughter Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Wednesday arrived in Rae Bareli to thank voters for their support in the recently concluded general elections. This is Sonia's first visit to the constituency after retaining the seat in the elections. Rae Bareli is the only seat that the Congress won in Uttar Pradesh in the general elections.

headlines: Go-Jek acquires Bengaluru recruitment platform AirCTO
text: Indonesia-based billion-dollar startup Go-Jek has acquired Bengaluru-based recruitment platform AirCTO for an undisclosed amount. As part of the deal, the AirCTO team will join Go-Jek with immediate effect. Founded in 2010, Go-Jek, which offers various on-demand services like transportation, payment, among others, has also opened its second engineering and development centre in Gurugram.

headlines: 3 jailed for violating 'No Helmet, No Petrol' rule in Noida
text: Three men were arrested for violating "No Helmet, No Petrol" rule in Noida, officials said. Reportedly, the three engaged in a scuffle with petrol pump staffers who refused to refuel their motorcycle as they weren't wearing helmets under the rule. This is the first arrest made since the rule came into effect in Noida and Greater Noida on June 1.

headlines: SpiceJet flight faces tyre burst, lands safely in Jaipur
text: A SpiceJet Dubai-Jaipur flight landed safely at Jaipur airport on Wednesday after one of its tyres burst after taking off from Dubai. All 189 passengers and crew members are safe, while a team of engineers is examining the aircraft. The flight landed at 9:03 am, and a SpiceJet spokesperson said, "The flight was uneventful."

headlines: Wouldn't have allowed picking Kim's brother as CIA informant: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he wouldn't have allowed recruiting North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's half-brother, Kim Jong-nam, as an informant of the US' intelligence agency CIA. According to the Wall Street Journal, Kim Jong-nam travelled to Malaysia in 2017 to meet his CIA contact. He was killed at the Kuala Lumpur airport on his way back home.

headlines: US formally asks UK to extradite WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange
text: The US has formally requested the UK to extradite WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. He is accused of offences including computer misuse and the unauthorised disclosure of national defence information in the US, the UK's Home Office said. The UK won't extradite Assange to any country where he could face torture or death penalty, Ecuador had said.

headlines: Amitabh Bachchan pays off loans of 2,100 farmers from Bihar
text: Amitabh Bachchan has revealed he has paid off loans of 2,100 farmers from Bihar. "Paid off their amount with a OTS (One Time Settlement) with the Bank..called some of them over to Janak and personally gave it to them at the hands of Shweta and Abhishek," he wrote. Last year, he cleared loans of over 1,000 Uttar Pradesh farmers.

headlines: Pakistan fans won't boo Smith & Warner, they love cricket: Sarfaraz
text: On being asked if he will ask Pakistan fans to not boo Australia batsmen Steve Smith and David Warner, Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said, "I don't think Pakistan fans will boo them...They love cricket." He added, "Pakistani people love to support...they love their players." This comes after Team India captain Virat Kohli asked Indian fans to stop booing Smith.

headlines: Rishabh Pant to fly to England as cover for injured Shikhar Dhawan
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant is being flown to England by the BCCI as cover for injured Shikhar Dhawan at the request of the team management. This comes after the BCCI said Dhawan will remain under observation in England after injuring his thumb against Australia. Pant won't be considered as replacement till team management takes a final call on Dhawan's availability.

headlines: Visitors to be charged more for spending over 3 hrs at Taj Mahal
text: Visitors spending more than three hours at the Taj Mahal will now be charged an additional fee, a circular implementing the rule stated. Entry is only through token which is valid for three hours, exceeding which, a visitor is required to recharge it at exit gates. To prevent unauthorised entry, turnstile gates have been installed at entry and exit points.

headlines: CBI raids rape accused ex-UP Minister's home over illegal mining
text: CBI on Wednesday carried out raids in the residence and office of former Mining Minister and Samajwadi Party leader Gayatri Prajapati in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi in connection with the illegal mining scam. Prajapati is lodged in jail since March 2017 on charges of gangraping a woman. A total of 22 places in UP and Delhi were raided by the agency.

headlines: Madrasas don't breed nature like that of Godse, Pragya: Azam Khan
text: After the government's decision to connect madrasas to formal and mainstream education, SP leader Azam Khan said, "Madrasas don't breed a nature like that of Nathuram Godse or a personality like Pragya Thakur." He added the government should first announce that those propagating Godse's thinking will be declared enemies of democracy and those convicted for terror activities won't be rewarded.

headlines: BJP workers marching in Kolkata lathi-charged, water cannon used
text: Clashes broke out between the police and BJP workers in West Bengal's Kolkata on Wednesday, where the party workers were holding a march to protest against the TMC government over the killing of BJP workers. Kolkata Police lathi-charged and used water cannons and tear gas against the BJP workers. They were marching towards Lal Bazar from Subodh Mullick Square.

headlines: Police couldn't verify alibi of man acquitted in Kathua case: Court
text: The prosecution's failure to verify accused Vishal Jangotra's alibi during the probe in the Kathua rape case led to his acquittal, the special court stated. It raised the issue of the prosecution failing to question Inspector Kewal Kishore, who did most of the investigation regarding Vishal's alleged role. Six other men were convicted in the gangrape and murder case.

headlines: Man involved in Gauri Lankesh's murder held for Pansare's killing
text: Right-wing activist Sharad Kalaskar was arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of veteran Communist leader Govind Pansare. Kalaskar, who had stayed in Kolhapur for over a week before Pansare's murder, was allegedly also among the two shooters who gunned down rationalist Narendra Dabholkar in 2013. He is also an accused in the 2017 murder of journalist-activist Gauri Lankesh.

headlines: Priyanka to receive UNICEF's Danny Kaye Humanitarian Award
text: Priyanka Chopra will be honoured with the Danny Kaye Humanitarian Award at UNICEF's annual Snowflake Ball in December. Announcing the news on Instagram, Priyanka wrote, "My work with UNICEF on behalf of all the world's children means everything to me." The actress has been associated with initiatives aimed at improving conditions for children worldwide and women-related issues, among others.

headlines: Samoa bans Elton John biopic 'Rocketman' over gay scenes
text: The Pacific nation of Samoa banned the film 'Rocketman', a biopic based on the life of British singer Elton John, because of its depiction of homosexuality. The film was banned last week as it clashed with Samoa's "culture" and "Christian beliefs", Samoa's principal censor Leiataua Niuapu Faaui said. A Russian distributor earlier censored scenes depicting gay sex in the film.

headlines: I want to play Sridevi's role in her biopic: Tamannaah Bhatia
text: When asked whose biopic she would want to feature in, actress Tamannaah Bhatia said, "I've always looked up to Sridevi ji." "I always thought if there's a biopic that I'd love to be part of, I want to play Sridevi ji," she added. Tamannaah further said that apart from a biopic, she wants to star in a Bollywood dance-based film.

headlines: La Liga fined 250k for app's access to location, microphone
text: La Liga was fined 250,000 by the Spanish data protection agency AEPD for not adequately informing users of its official app that the programme can activate smartphone microphones and monitor user location. La Liga was reportedly tapping into users' location data and microphones to find bars that were illegally broadcasting games. The Spanish football league plans to appeal the decision.

headlines: PM Modi's radio programme Mann Ki Baat to resume on June 30
text: PM Narendra Modi's radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat' will resume on June 30 after it was discontinued during the Lok Sabha elections in which he was a candidate. "Your stories, ideas and suggestions can be a part of this month's episode," MyGovIndia said in a tweet. PM Modi had signed off the last episode of 'Mann Ki Baat' in February.

headlines: BJP worker murdered, burnt in West Bengal, party blames TMC
text: After the death of 8 workers in recent clashes between BJP and TMC, another BJP worker was allegedly found murdered and his body burnt in West Bengal's Malda. Blaming the TMC for his murder, the state BJP claimed that the worker was missing for the last few days. "Why are...chest thumping liberals of 'award wapasi' fame silent now?" it asked.

headlines: Will plant 1.4 lakh saplings in ridge: AAP to Delhi HC
text: The AAP government has assured the Delhi High Court that the latter's direction of planting 1.4 lakh saplings in New Delhi's Central Ridge area will be implemented without further delay. This came after the court warned of contempt action against the forest department for non-compliance of its order. It told the court that it'll plant 30,000 trees before June 15.

headlines: UP CM holds review meeting on law and order situation in state
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath held a review meeting with officials on law and order situation in the state. The meeting was attended by District Magistrates, SPs, SSPs from all districts across the state, Chief Secretary, DGP and others. Adityanath also held a meeting with Chief Secretary and senior police officials on Monday on women security issue in the state.

headlines: 31 children die of encephalitis in Bihars Muzaffarpur in June
text: As many as 31 children have died so far in the month of June reportedly due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. "From June 2 to this day 86 people were admitted, of them 31 died," Superintendent SKMCH, Muzaffarpur said. Total 109 have been admitted in this year so far in which 34 children have died, he added.

headlines: Thousands protest in Hong Kong over China extradition bill
text: Thousands of people in Hong Kong on Wednesday protested against a bill which would allow extradition to mainland China. Police used tear gas, pepper spray and high-pressure water hoses against the protesters who attempted to storm into the parliament. The debate about the legislation, that was due to happen today, has been cancelled following the protests.

headlines: Russian journalist arrested on drug charges freed after protests
text: Russian investigative journalist Ivan Golunov has been released from house arrest after all charges of drug dealing against him were dropped by the authorities on Tuesday due to lack of evidence. Golunov's arrest had sparked protests in Russia amid accusations that authorities were attempting to silence the journalist and the freedom of the press.

headlines: Jet Airways pilots to move NCLT over salary dues: Reports
text: The pilots union of Jet Airways will reportedly file a plea against the airline at the NCLT for non-payment of salaries and not providing a provision for gratuity payment to its staff. The plea will be filed early next week, reports said. Jet, which stopped operations in April, hasn't paid salaries to senior employees, including pilots and engineers, since January.

headlines: Great Learning offers PGP in Data Science with placement support
text: Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science & Engineering helps early career professionals launch their careers by imparting industry-relevant skills. The 5-month full-time classroom program has a curriculum designed by industry experts and offers real-world industry projects. Program participants get dedicated placement assistance with 100+ hiring partners, a certificate from Great Lakes and an average salary hike of 65%.

headlines: Police beat me up, urinated in mouth: Journo covering train accident
text: A local reporter covering the derailment of a train in Uttar Pradesh was thrashed by Government Railway Police on Tuesday, a video showed. The reporter claimed police locked him up, stripped him and urinated in his mouth, adding that he was assaulted for covering story that "exposed corruption in the GRP forces". Two policemen have been suspended following the incident.

headlines: I don't think I was invited to Kareena and Saif's wedding: Shahid
text: Shahid Kapoor, when asked if he was invited to the wedding of his ex-girlfriend Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan on 'BFFs with Vogue', said, "I don't remember...I don't think I was invited." Kareena and Saif got married in 2012. Shahid also revealed that he was invited to the Mumbai reception of ex-girlfriend Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas.

headlines: People thought I was crazy doing road trip at 6 months pregnant: Amy
text: Actress Amy Jackson, who recently went on a road trip across Europe, wrote on Instagram, "People thought I was crazy doing a road trip...at six months pregnant." "I've met incredible women on this trip and made friendships that will last a lifetime," she added. Amy went on the trip as part of an initiative to raise money for charities.

headlines: We put men on moon, why no reserve day in World Cup: B'desh coach
text: After Bangladesh's match against Sri Lanka was abandoned due to rain, Bangladesh coach Steve Rhodes called for having reserve days in the World Cup. "We put men on the moon so why can't we have a reserve day...when actually this tournament is a long tournament?" he said. "We really targeted [Sri Lanka match] to get two points," he further said.

headlines: Bihar Cabinet approves jail for children abandoning elderly parents
text: In a Cabinet meeting chaired by CM Nitish Kumar, the Bihar government has approved the proposal to punish sons and daughters, who abandon their elderly parents, with jail term on Tuesday. Such cases will be registered under the non-bailable section after receiving complaints from elderly parents, the proposal by the state's social welfare department mentioned.

headlines: Video shows 'YouTubers' with gun on UP highway; police to take action
text: A video showing men brandishing guns at each other from two cars running parallel on a highway in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida has surfaced online. Police said the video was allegedly shot for a YouTube channel run by the men and it wasn't related to any robbery attempt. Action will be taken against them for creating a "nuisance", they added.

headlines: Can't take trolls seriously as it gets to your head: Ananya
text: Speaking about dealing with social media trolls, Ananya Panday said, "[Y]ou need to take it positively and...not too seriously because it can get to your head." She added that social media can also act as a blessing as it helps her connect with fans. "However, one should know...at the end of the day, you're here to act," Ananya further said.

headlines: Riteish to feature in Tiger starrer 'Baaghi 3': Reports
text: Actor Riteish Deshmukh will reportedly feature in the upcoming third instalment of the action-revenge film series 'Baaghi', which features Tiger Shroff in a lead role. Reports suggest that the actor will play Tiger's character's brother in the forthcoming film, which will be directed by Ahmed Khan. Shraddha Kapoor has been signed to star opposite Tiger in the film.

headlines: National Film Archive of India screens Karnad's films post his demise
text: National Film Archive of India (NFAI) will honour late actor-playwright Girish Karnad by screening some of his critically acclaimed films through the week. Karnad's Kannada film 'Ondanondu Kaladalli' was screened on Tuesday, one day after his demise. His films 'Kanooru Heggadithi', 'Kaadu' as well as his Marathi film 'Umbartha', will be screened on Wednesday, Thursday and Saturday, respectively.

headlines: Mamata provoking violence in WB, employing police for it: Babul
text: Union Minister Babul Supriyo accused West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of "provoking violence" in the state and employing her party workers and police for the same. He added the "head of Bengali community is down with shame" across the world because of Bengal's present scenario. Supriyo said that the Mamata-led TMC government has no "moral right to be in power".

headlines: My belief in Constitution reaffirmed: Prashant Kanojia's wife
text: Jagisha Arora, the wife of journalist Prashant Kanojia who was arrested for allegedly making objectionable comments against UP CM Yogi Adityanath, said her belief in the Constitution was reaffirmed after Supreme Court's decision. "People accusing him...are trolls, who don't have a face or voice," she added. SC granted Kanojia bail saying "right of liberty of a citizen has been infringed".

headlines: Conviction in Kathua case will act as deterrent: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati said the conviction in Kathua rape and murder case will serve as a deterrent and prevent people from committing such heinous crimes. On Monday, three men, including a temple caretaker, were sentenced to life imprisonment till last breath in the case. Mayawati added, such punishments should be given across the country to establish the rule of law.

headlines: RBI constitutes six-member panel to review ATM charges
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday constituted a six-member committee to review the ATM interchange fee structure. An interchange fee is paid by one bank when its customer transacts at the ATM of another bank. The committee will review overall patterns of usage of ATMs and assess the impact, if any, on charges and interchange fees.

headlines: I want to challenge Tom Cruise to fight, tweets Justin Bieber
text: Singer Justin Bieber on Monday tweeted that he wants to challenge actor Tom Cruise to a fight in the Octagon. His tweet further read, "If you don't take this fight you're scared." On Tuesday, Bieber shared a clip of the fight scene from Tom Cruise's 1992 film 'Far And Away' with himself photoshopped in as the opponent of Tom's character.

headlines: Some pictures indeed are special: Kohli on pic with Sachin, Sehwag
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to social media to share a picture of himself with former India cricketers Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag. "Some pictures indeed are special," he captioned the picture. "3 legends of Indian cricket, its indeed special," a user tweeted. Notably, Sachin and Sehwag are commentating in the World Cup.

headlines: Ashleigh Barty becomes world no. 2 after French Open victory
text: Ashleigh Barty has risen to the number two position from number eight in the latest Women's Tennis Association (WTA) rankings after winning the French Open title. She is now 136 points away from the number one ranked women's tennis player Naomi Osaka (6486). Barty is the first Australian woman to win the French Open since Margaret Court in 1973.

headlines: It was terrifying to face you: Yuvraj on Akhtar's video for him
text: Reacting to former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar's tribute video for him, former India cricketer Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Trust me Everytime u ran into bowl at me it was terrifying! Had to gather a lot of courage to face u." Akhtar, in the video, called Yuvraj one of the most elegant left-handed batsmen India has produced.

headlines: I know you have made peace with it: Irfan to Yuvraj on retirement
text: All-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to congratulate Yuvraj Singh on his retirement from international cricket. "Kaan pakad kar retirement wapas khichwane ka dil kar raha hay. But I know bro u have made peace with it. Congratulations on the great career with so many great victories to Indian cricket," he wrote. Yuvraj announced his retirement on Monday.

headlines: First image of wreckage of IAF's An-32 aircraft out
text: News agency ANI has shared the first image of the wreckage of IAF's An-32 aircraft, which was located 16 km north of Lipo in Arunachal Pradesh after eight days of search. The image shows debris scattered around the area and trees charred seemingly due to the fire following the crash. The aircraft was located by IAF's Mi-17 helicopter.

headlines: Thaawarchand Gehlot replaces Arun Jaitley as Leader of Rajya Sabha
text: Union Minister Thaawarchand Gehlot has been appointed as the Leader of House in Rajya Sabha, replacing BJP leader Arun Jaitley, who had opted out of the government citing health reasons. He will now occupy the first seat in the House, next to PM Narendra Modi. Gehlot is the minister of Social Justice and Empowerment, holding the portfolio since 2014.

headlines: Ex-Thai Army chief who overthrew govt becomes PM for 2nd term
text: Former Thai Army chief Prayuth Chan-ocha was proclaimed as the country's civilian Prime Minister on Tuesday after King Maha Vajiralongkorn endorsed his appointment. Prayuth had been serving as the Prime Minister since he led a military coup that toppled an elected government in 2014. He was chosen as the country's leader by Thailand's Parliament last week.

headlines: Thank you for those 6 sixes: Preity Zinta thanks Yuvraj
text: Following Yuvraj Singh's retirement, Kings XI Punjab owner Preity Zinta wrote, "Dearest @YUVSTRONG12 Wish you all the best in your life as you move forward. Thank you for those 6 sixes." Yuvraj, who was part of Mumbai Indians in IPL 2019, played for Kings XI Punjab for the first three IPL editions before returning in the 2018 edition.

headlines: Mladenovic shares photo of French Open trophies with Thiem
text: French tennis player Kristina Mladenovic shared a photo with partner Dominic Thiem, posing alongside their trophies from the French Open 2019. Mladenovic won the French Open women's doubles title while Thiem was the men's singles runner-up at Roland-Garros. "So proud of you my champion @ThiemDomi, many more to come," Mladenovic wrote in her tweet.

headlines: WhatsApp says may sue users against abuse that violates its rules
text: WhatsApp, in an updated FAQ "Unauthorized usage of WhatsApp", said it will use the resources at its disposal, including legal action, to prevent abuse that violates its Terms of Service. The Facebook-owned platform added that starting December 7, it will take the said action even if the evidence against a user or company is found outside of its own platform.

headlines: Smart glasses with autonomous face recognition system made
text: American firm Vuzix has developed a fully autonomous AI-powered face recognition system in collaboration with Dubai-based software developer NNTC. When synched to 'Vuzix Blade Smart Glasses', it lets security personnel discretely screen crowd to match faces against database of violators, missing people or suspects, a press release stated. It detects up to 15 faces per videoframe in under a second.

headlines: Passenger vehicle sales falls most in nearly 18 years in May
text: The domestic passenger vehicle sales declined 20.55% year-on-year to 2.39 lakh units in May, according to data released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM). This is the steepest fall since September 2001 when passenger vehicle sales fell 21.91%, it said. Domestic car sales in May declined 26.03% over last year to 1.47 lakh units.

headlines: IAF to airdrop search teams where AN-32 wreckage found
text: After locating missing AN-32 aircraft's wreckage at an altitude of 12,000 feet, Indian Air Force (IAF) on Tuesday said it'll airdrop search teams on Wednesday morning for searching more wreckage and possible survivors. The search team will include Garud commandos, IAF mountaineers and other ground forces. "Ground forces will continue to reach the crash site during the night," IAF tweeted.

headlines: Govt scraps 10% export incentive on onions as prices go up
text: The government on Tuesday scrapped 10% incentive on the export of fresh and chilled onions to discourage overseas sales of the commodity. The move comes after onion prices jumped around 48% in a month due to falling supplies. The government had in December 2018 doubled the rate of incentives from 5% to ensure better returns for farmers.

headlines: Bhery bhel done: Big B on video of foreigner selling bhel in London
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan on Tuesday shared a video on Twitter which shows a foreigner selling bhel outside The Oval in London on the day of India's match against Australia. The foreigner can be heard saying that he learnt to make bhel in Kolkata while adding, "I learnt it from the masters". "Bhery bhel done," Bachchan wrote while sharing the video.

headlines: After Amitabh, Adnan's Twitter account hacked; Pak PM's pic posted
text: Hours after actor Amitabh Bachchan's Twitter account was hacked and his picture was replaced with Pakistan PM Imran Khan's photo, singer Adnan Sami's Twitter account was hacked in a similar way on Tuesday. The hacker changed the profile picture, cover photo and Twitter bio of the singer's account. Similar to Bachchan's case, pro-Pakistan tweets were posted through the singer's account.

headlines: Dhawan under observation after injury, to remain in England: BCCI
text: The BCCI has said that opener Shikhar Dhawan will continue to be in England with Team India after suffering a thumb injury and that his progress will be monitored. The 33-year-old had sustained the injury during India's match against Australia, wherein he did not take field during Australia's innings. No call has been made for any replacement as of yet.

headlines: Sometimes critics get the best out of you: Yuvraj trolls Manjrekar
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh trolled commentator Sanjay Manjrekar after the latter wished him on his retirement. "Thanks Sanjay I'm sure sometimes critics get the best out of you ! Cheers," Yuvraj responded to Manjrekar's tweet. Notably, Manjrekar had termed Yuvraj's selection in Team India after cancer as an "emotional decision" rather than a professional one.

headlines: Salesforce buys US firm, Oscar-winning Co-founder turns billionaire
text: US analytics platform Tableau's recent $15.7-billion acquisition by cloud computing firm Salesforce has led to its three-time Oscar-winning Co-founder Patrick Hanrahan regaining his billionaire status. Hanrahan, a former Pixar employee who worked on 'Toy Story', had won Oscars for engineering and technical work from 1993-2014. He'd first joined the "Three Comma Club" in June 2015, Forbes revealed.

headlines: Inspired by Bhojpuri film, 8-yr-old threatens to blow Patna airport
text: Inspired by a Bhojpuri film, an 8-year-old boy threatened to blow up Jay Prakash Narayan International Airport in Patna, police said on Tuesday. "The boy informed the police that when his grandfather was asleep, he had used his mobile phone. First, he found the number of the Patna airport on Google and then proceeded to make the call," police added.

headlines: Female foetus covered in watermelon skin found in Noida drain
text: A nearly five-month-old female foetus was found inside a watermelon skin dumped in a drain at a village in Noida, police said on Tuesday. A sanitation worker had spotted the foetus on Monday, police added. An FIR has been registered in the matter against unidentified persons under Indian Penal Code Section 318 (concealment of birth by secret disposal of body).

headlines: India backs Israel at UN against Palestinian organisation
text: India has voted in support of Israel at the UN's Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) to deny observer status to a Palestinian organisation named 'Shahed'. The organisation claims to deal with human rights and humanitarian issues. However, Israel claims that 'Shahed' is a terrorist organisation and operates as an arm of the Lebanon-based Hamas terror group.

headlines: Sweat on Sanji's face on cold morning raised doubt: Kathua investigator
text: RK Jalla, chief investigator of the rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in Kathua, said the sweat on accused temple priest Sanji Ram's face on a chilly January morning made him doubt Sanji. Jalla added Sanji asked him to check his son Vishal's call records in a "boastful voice". Sanji and two others have been sentenced to life imprisonment.

headlines: 2-yr-old Fatehveer died a few days back in 150 ft borewell: Autopsy
text: Two-year-old Fatehveer Singh, who was pulled out from the over 150-foot-deep borewell in Punjab on Tuesday after around 110 hours, had died a few days back, his autopsy report revealed. He was brought to the PGI Hospital in Chandigarh, some 130 km from the accident spot, soon after he was pulled out. He was declared brought dead by the hospital.

headlines: Nirav Modi, Vijay Mallya to share same cell if extradited to India
text: If extradited to India, Nirav Modi will be lodged in 'Barrack No. 12' of Mumbai's Arthur Road jail, the same barrack where Vijay Mallya will be kept in case he is also extradited. The barrack has two rooms and as of now, three prisoners are lodged in one room while the other room is vacant, an official said.

headlines: It shouldnt be too much drama: Bhaichung on his biopic
text: Speaking about a biopic based on his life, former Indian football captain Bhaichung Bhutia said, "It shouldn't be too much drama. Like Chak De! India (2007)... Though I guess it sells." "Happy and inspiring is the kind of movie I am looking at," said Bhutia, who also formed a political party named Hamro Sikkim Party in April last year.

headlines: Stoinis to miss Australia's WC match against Pakistan
text: Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis is set to miss the team's World Cup 2019 match against Pakistan owing to a side strain. Stoinis, who has played in all three games for Australia in the tournament, picked up the injury in the match against India at The Oval on Sunday. All-rounder Mitchell Marsh has been flown over to England as a back-up.

headlines: 18-yr-old Jemimah Rodrigues signs for Yorkshire Diamonds
text: India's 18-year-old top-order batsman Jemimah Rodrigues has been signed by the Kia Super League franchise Yorkshire Diamonds for the 2019 season. The 18-year old is the third Indian player to feature in the league after Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur. Rodrigues has played 25 T20Is for India and scored a total of 608 runs.

headlines: Shazam for Android now recognises music played via earphones
text: Apple-owned music recognition app Shazam for Android can now recognise music played via users' headphones. As part of its Android-only 'Pop-Up Shazam' feature, users can use Shazam to identify songs in third-party apps, playing externally or internally, without leaving them, by activating a floating button that is overlaid on the screen. It can be activated via Settings in Shazam app.

headlines: Adobe India Head Kulmeet Bawa quits after 7 years at company
text: Adobe India & South Asia MD Kulmeet Bawa has decided to leave Adobe and explore opportunities outside the company, the company stated. Bawa, who had joined Adobe in 2012, is an alumnus of Indian School of Business and the National Defence Academy. He has earlier worked at Microsoft India as Director of Government and Healthcare business.

headlines: Bengal not a toy, cant play with it: Mamata Banerjee to BJP
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday targetted BJP and said, "Bengal isn't a toy. You can't play with it. You can't do anything you want with Bengal." She said this at an event to unveil a new statue of social reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar. Banerjee accuses BJP of vandalizing Vidyasagar's statue during BJP President Amit Shah's roadshow in May.

headlines: AAP clueless about Delhi's power arrangements: Manoj Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari on Tuesday said power outages and acute water crisis were gripping the national capital. "[AAP] government is clueless on power arrangements to meet city's ever-growing electricity demand which is constantly over 7,000 MW," he wrote to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. He also wrote that despite such heat, the government's summer plan is not in place.

headlines: Congress leaders argue after election result review meeting
text: An argument broke out among Congress leaders after a review meeting in Delhi to discuss party's poor performance in UP in the Lok Sabha polls. Following the argument, a Congress leader said that it's party's "internal matter". Talking about the meeting, Congress' KK Sharma said, "Higher leadership that takes decision without meeting the right members are responsible for election results."

headlines: Maharashtra autorickshaw drivers demand Ola, Uber shutdown
text: Over 10 lakh autorickshaw drivers across Maharashtra will go on an indefinite strike from July 9 if their demands aren't met by June-end, a union leader stated. They've demanded shutdown of ride-hailing services like Ola and Uber and revised auto fares. They've also reportedly demanded a welfare body for autorickshaw drivers, making them eligible for pension, provident fund, other benefits.

headlines: Bring down corporate tax to 18% without exemptions: CII
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to reduce corporate tax rate to 18% along with the elimination of all exemptions. The move won't result in any loss to the exchequer, the industry body added. It further said the government should take steps to spur investment and growth, which slowed to five-year low of 6.8% in 2018-19.

headlines: EU regulators block Thyssenkrupp, Tata Steel joint venture
text: The European Union antitrust regulators on Tuesday rejected a bid by Germany's Thyssenkrupp and India's Tata Steel to form a joint venture. They expressed concerns that the deal would push up prices and reduce competition. The companies had last month said the deal would be rejected by competition enforcers after they declined to offer further concessions to address regulators' concerns.

headlines: Yes Bank sees second director resignation in two days
text: Yes Bank on Tuesday said its independent director Mukesh Sabharwal has stepped down from the lender's board of directors to devote his time to academic pursuits. Sabharwal has worked with the private lender for over seven years. The resignation comes a day after non-executive director Ajai Kumar quit the lender's board due to personal reasons.

headlines: TRAI asks Tata Tele to refund unspent balance of users
text: Telecom regulator TRAI has directed Tata Teleservices to refund the unspent balance of its pre-paid mobile subscribers as well as the security deposit of its postpaid users in 16 circles. This comes after the company had surrendered administratively-allocated spectrum in these circles. The company has been asked to submit a compliance report by August 20.

headlines: We don't pay heed to nonsensical remarks: Devgn on Nysa's trolling
text: Ajay Devgn, while speaking about his daughter Nysa being trolled online, said, "We don't pay...heed to such nonsensical comments made through fake identities." "The mindset of people who do these things is rubbish," he added. Earlier, when Nysa was trolled for one of her airport looks, Devgn had said, "She is just a 14-year-old...I feel...people forget that and talk rubbish."

headlines: 3rd 2019 WC game abandoned due to rain, B'desh-SL get 1 point each
text: The 16th match of 2019 World Cup between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh was abandoned due to rain without a ball bowled, with both teams taking a point each. This is the third 2019 World Cup match to be abandoned and second involving Sri Lanka. Notably, only one match each was abandoned in the previous two World Cup editions.

headlines: Regretted when mom told me on deathbed I was harsh on Yuvi: Father
text: Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh has said the only time he regretted being harsh on his son was when his mother told him on her deathbed he was spoiling Yuvraj's life with harsh training. He added he used to tell Yuvraj to practice without a helmet and make him run for over one-and-a-half hours when he was just six.

headlines: NASA's Snoopy lunar module likely found after 50 years
text: A group of amateur UK astronomers claimed they're 98% convinced that they have discovered NASA's "Snoopy" lunar module. The module was part of Apollo 10, NASA's fourth crewed mission under the Apollo program 50 years ago, and was shot off into space into an orbit around the Sun. The astronomer group had begun searching for the Snoopy module in 2011.

headlines: All 14 students of teacher who once sold tea crack NEET 2019 in Odisha
text: Odisha's tea seller-turned-teacher Ajay Bahadur Singh's all 14 underprivileged students cracked the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test this year. "I always wanted to be a doctor and I was preparing for it. But my studies suffered due to kidney failure of my father," said 47-year-old Singh. He started 'Zindagi' foundation in 2017 to help underprivileged students become doctors.

headlines: Bihar businessman shoots dead wife, daughter before killing himself
text: A businessman in Patna, Bihar allegedly killed his wife and eight-year-old daughter before shooting himself with his licensed pistol, police said on Tuesday. The businessman's four-year-old son, who was also shot at, is stated to be critical in a hospital. "Prima facie, it seems to be a case of suicide. A suicide note has also been found," police said.

headlines: 4 Kerala Express passengers die in UP's Jhansi likely due to heat
text: Four elderly Kerala Express passengers including a woman and three men died in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi likely due to the extreme heat. The deceased, travelling in the train's Sleeper Class, were from Coimbatore and were returning home from Agra. They complained of uneasiness and went unconscious when the train was near Gwalior.

headlines: World's most expensive painting on Saudi Prince's yacht: Report
text: The world's most expensive painting, Leonardo da Vinci's 'Salvator Mundi', is kept on Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's superyacht Serene, a report said. It will be on the superyacht until the Saudis create a planned cultural hub in the Kingdom's Al-Ula region, the report added. The over 500-year-old artwork was sold for $450.3 million at an auction in 2017.

headlines: Botswana decriminalises homosexuality citing India as an example
text: Botswana's High Court on Tuesday ruled in favour of decriminalising same-sex relations, saying the colonial-era laws were discriminatory and unconstitutional. The court cited the decriminalisation of same-sex relations in India while delivering the verdict. The case was reportedly brought to court by a student who argued that the society had changed and homosexuality was more widely accepted.

headlines: Airtel to pay Tanzania $26.2 million to settle ownership row
text: Bharti Airtel will pay the Tanzanian government $26.2 million over five years to settle an ownership dispute, Chairman Sunil Mittal said. It will also pay the government a special dividend at year-end. This is part of a deal where Bharti agreed to reduce stake in Airtel Tanzania to 51% from 60%, boosting the state's ownership of the company to 49%.

headlines: You let them win if they take a toll on you: Hina on trolls
text: Speaking about dealing with trolls on social media, actress Hina Khan said, "[Y]ou let them win if they take a toll on you." "I've been taught to keep my calm and maintain my graciousness no matter what and I truly believe in karma," she added. Hina further said rather than focussing on trolls, she lets her work speak for itself.

headlines: Our batting was just a little bit off: Ponting on loss vs India
text: After Australia's loss to India, former Australia captain Ricky Ponting, who is also Australia's assistant coach, said, "Our batting was just a little bit off again. We seemed to find the field a lot in the first 10 overs." "We just needed someone at the top to go on and make a big hundred like Dhawan did," Ponting added.

headlines: India's new football coach calls player out of retirement
text: Indian football head coach Igor Stimac has called defender Anas Edathodika out of his retirement to be included among the 35 probables for next months Intercontinental Cup. The 35 probables will assemble at the Mumbai Football Arena from June 25 for the Intercontinental Cup preparatory camp. "Coach has shown faith in me, and its my turn to repay," Anas said.

headlines: YouTube CEO apologises over anti-gay abuse videos row
text: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki in an interview apologised for the platform's decision that YouTuber Steven Crowder's videos containing alleged homophobic and racist slurs against a Vox journalist "didn't violate its policies". "I know that the decision we made was hurtful to the LGBTQ community...that was not our intention," Wojcicki said. However, she said she agreed it was the right decision.

headlines: Rome bans men from walking bare-chested in public
text: The Italian capital of Rome has banned men from walking bare-chested in public and the practice of attaching 'love padlocks' to bridges as part of a crackdown on 'bad tourist behaviour'. Eating food and dressing up as Roman centurions around tourist attractions, and touching one's lips against the spout when drinking from public water fountains have also been banned.

headlines: UP govt is terrorising journalists, farmers: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday said instead of working on public issues, Uttar Pradesh government is terrorising journalists. "UP government is dealing journalists, farmers, and their representatives with the baton of terror," she tweeted. This comes after journalist Prashant Kanojia was arrested for posting "objectionable comments" against UP CM Yogi Adityanath on social media.

headlines: Ola hires NITI Aayog VC's son as director of public policy
text: Bengaluru-based ride-hailing giant Ola hired NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar's son Prashant Kumar as its director of public policy. He will drive policy for corporate relations and will closely work with the head of Ola Electric Mobility Anand Shah. He was earlier heading the Mumbai office of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum.

headlines: NRS doctors on strike after patient's relatives attack doctor
text: Junior doctors at Kolkata's NRS Medical College and Hospital went on strike on Tuesday after one of their colleagues was allegedly attacked by family of a patient who died on Monday. Doctors locked up the gates and stopped work at the OPD. "Four have been arrested in connection with the attack," said West Bengal's MoS for Health and Family Welfare.

headlines: Indian agencies trying to pin fictitious charges: Zakir Naik
text: Islamic preacher Zakir Naik claimed that Indian agencies are "desperately trying to pin fictitious charges" on him and trying everything possible to put him in jail. "When terror charges didn't work, the Interpol moved on to money laundering," he said. "As much as I want to clear my name, they continue an exercise steeped in injustice and unfairness," Naik added.

headlines: Former NIA chief Sharad Kumar named interim CVC
text: Former National Investigation Agency (NIA) chief and Vigilance Commissioner Sharad Kumar has been named interim Central Vigilance Commissioner (CVC) until a new incumbent is chosen by PM Narendra Modi-headed selection panel. Kumar took over as Vigilance Commissioner in June 2018 and his tenure at the Commission will end in October 2020. CVC KV Chowdary completed his tenure on Sunday.

headlines: Baba Ramdev's Yoga Day program in Haridwar cancelled
text: A proposed program by Yoga guru Baba Ramdev for International Yoga Day's celebrations on June 21 has been cancelled. The event that was supposed to take place at Haridwar's Har ki Pauri has been cancelled due to unavoidable reasons, said Patanjali Ayurved's MD Acharya Balkrishna. Ramdev was to perform yogic kriyas with Bollywood celebrities and yoga enthusiasts at the event.

headlines: Govt seeks to ban Deloitte, KPMG arm over auditing lapses at IL&FS
text: The Corporate Affairs Ministry on Monday moved NCLT seeking to ban Deloitte Haskins & Sells, and KPMG affiliate BSR & Associates for five years, alleging lapses in their audits of a unit of IL&FS. The ministry said the companies "miserably failed" to fulfil their duties as auditors for IL&FS Financial Services (IFIN). Both auditing firms denied any wrongdoing on Tuesday.

headlines: Going through issues with family, it's living hell: Hrithik's sister
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina, while clarifying a tweet in which she wrote that she had the opportunity to "visit hell in this lifetime", said, "It's what I am going through with my family. It's a living hell." Referring to "certain issues", Sunaina added she doesn't want to discuss it as she doesn't want her family to be affected further.

headlines: I was in London rehab in December over alcoholism: Hrithik's sister
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina, who on Monday denied that she is suffering from health issues, has revealed that she was in rehab in London in December last year battling alcoholism but came out clean. She further questioned, "Why would I need any medication now and where is the question of being in a hospital arise from?

headlines: I want to end my career having won something with Argentina: Messi
text: Ahead of 2019 Copa América, Argentina forward Lionel Messi said that he wants to end his career having won something with the national team or "at least try to do so as many times as possible". Messi has played four major finals with Argentina and has lost each of them including the last two Copa finals on penalties against Chile.

headlines: Mamata unveils new bust of Vidyasagar month after vandalism
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday unveiled a bust of Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar, a 19th-century social reformer, at Hare School ground. The bust will be moved to Vidyasagar College where it will be re-installed at the same place where a similar statue was vandalised in clashes between BJP and TMC workers during BJP President Amit Shah's roadshow in May.

headlines: NASA spacecraft to use 'green' fuel for the first time
text: NASA has said it will test a "rosé-coloured" non-toxic 'green' fuel and a compatible propulsion system in space for the first time with its Green Propellant Infusion Mission (GPIM) spacecraft. The spacecraft is set to launch aboard a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket later this month. NASA added that apart from being safer, the fuel offers about 50% better performance too.

headlines: 4-yr-old girl shown obscene video, raped by 25-yr-old man in Nagpur
text: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 25-year-old man in Nagpur, Maharashtra, the police said on Tuesday. Police Inspector RL Pathak said that the accused also showed an obscene video to the child. Pathak added that the girl's mother was close with the accused's sister for the past two years and used to leave her daughter at their home.

headlines: You can't afford to snooze even a bit as an actor: Dhanush
text: While speaking about his career in the film industry, actor Dhanush said, "You cannot afford to snooze, not even a bit." "You have to be updated, on your toes, always thinking what to do, what people want," the actor added. Dhanush further said that once an actor is able to figure out what the audience wants things become easier.

headlines: Kim Kardashian shares 1st close-up pic of newborn son Psalm
text: Kim Kardashian took to Instagram on Monday to share the first close-up picture of her 1-month-old son Psalm West, whom she welcomed via surrogacy last month. Kim, who is married to rapper Kanye West, captioned the picture, 'Psalm Ye.' Kim and Kanye also have a 5-year-old daughter named North, a 3-year-old son named Saint and 1-year-old daughter Chicago.

headlines: Lilly Singh attends her 1st Pride Parade after coming out as bisexual
text: YouTuber Lilly Singh, who recently revealed that she is bisexual, attended her first Pride Parade in Los Angeles on Sunday. The YouTuber took to Instagram on Monday to share a picture from the parade and wrote, "Celebrate yourself. Be proud #MyFirstPride." Lilly is seen carrying a rainbow flag in the picture.

headlines: Washout better than rain-shortened game: Faf du Plessis
text: South Africa captain Faf du Plessis has said that washout game against the Windies was better than a rain-shortened match. "The further the game goes, the closer to a T20 game, being two down already, the odds are heavily in their favour," Du Plessis added. South Africa got their first point of the World Cup 2019 after the abandoned match.

headlines: Google Maps to alert users if vehicle goes off route: Report
text: Google reportedly appears to be testing a safety feature in Maps for some users that gives them alerts each time their "taxi or ride" goes off route by over 500 metres. Spotted by XDA Developers, the 'Get off-route alerts', reportedly exclusive to India, is found under the 'Stay safer' menu, which is accessible after selecting destination but before navigation mode.

headlines: Goal to be world's top phone maker will take longer: Huawei
text: Huawei, the world's second-largest smartphone maker in 2019's first quarter, has said that its goal to become the world's largest one will be delayed. "We would've become the largest in fourth quarter but now we feel this process may take longer," Huawei said. This comes after the US put Huawei on its 'Entity List', effectively banning it in the country.

headlines: Malegaon accused Sadhvi Pragya will hear President speak: Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday criticised BJP for fielding Malegaon blast accused Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur in the Lok Sabha polls. Pawar said that people facing "serious cases" will be attending the President's address in Parliament. Naming Sadhvi Pragya, he added, "It does not behove a political party and the democracy to give a ticket to such a person."

headlines: No talks with investors: OYO denies reports of raising $1 bn
text: OYO Rooms has denied media reports that stated the Gurugram-based startup is in talks to raise $1 billion in fresh funding at likely over double its September 2018 valuation of about $5 billion. "This is speculation...we are not in talks with any investors," an OYO spokesperson said. Reportedly, OYO was looking for a new lead investor for the funding round.

headlines: Yogi behaving foolishly: Rahul after 3 journalists arrested
text: Congress chief Rahul Gandhi has accused UP CM Yogi Adityanath "of behaving foolishly" after three journalists were arrested for sharing alleged derogatory comments against the latter. Rahul said, "If every journalist who files a false report or peddles fake, vicious RSS/ BJP sponsored propaganda about me is put in jail, most newspapers/ news channels would face a severe staff shortage."

headlines: Jaishankar flags-off first batch of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday flagged-off the first batch of pilgrims for this year's Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Jaishankar also thanked the government of China for promoting people to people exchange through their support of this yatra. The Ministry of External Affairs organises the annual Yatra via two different routes, Lipulekh Pass (Uttarakhand) and Nathula Pass (Sikkim).

headlines: Russian fighter jet chases US, Swedish planes over Baltic Sea
text: A Russian Su-27 fighter jet on Monday chased two reconnaissance aircraft of the US and the Swedish Armed Forces as they headed towards Russian airspace above the Baltic Sea. "The flight of the Su-27 was carried out strictly in accordance with international rules for the use of airspace," Russia's Defence Ministry said.

headlines: Edelweiss unit to buy two road assets for $150 million: Reports
text: The Edelweiss Infrastructure Yield Plus fund (EIYPF) is acquiring two annuity road assets from Hyderabad-based Navayuga Group for approximately $150 million, as per reports. The assets are based in Assam and have been operational for the last two years, reports added. This comes days after the fund reportedly bought two transmission assets owned by Essel Infraprojects for an undisclosed amount.

headlines: Jet falls to life low on reports Hinduja, Etihad halt rescue plan
text: Shares of Jet Airways slipped up to 14% on Tuesday to an all-time low after reports said Hinduja Group and Etihad Airways may not proceed with plans to revive the grounded airline. This comes as Jet faces government investigations, and insolvency notices by operational creditors. Jet Airways has shed nearly 69% in one year as of Monday's close.

headlines: Dhawan ruled out of World Cup for 3 weeks due to fractured thumb
text: India opener Shikhar Dhawan, who had scored a match-winning hundred against Australia on Sunday, has been ruled out of 2019 World Cup for three weeks due to fractured thumb. The 33-year-old had sustained the injury after being hit twice on his hand while batting against Australia and did not take the field during Australia's innings.

headlines: We're the bank everybody wants to rob: Trump on India's tariff
text: US President Donald Trump has said India has reduced its import tariff on Harley-Davidson motorcycles from 100% to 50%, adding that it is still too high and not acceptable to him. "We are the bank that everybody wants to rob, and that is what they have been doing for a long period of time," Trump further said.

headlines: Do I look critically ill: Hrithik's sister shares pic after reports
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina, who had denied reports of her ill health on Monday, took to Twitter to share a picture of herself. "Do I look critically ill," she captioned the picture in which she can be seen with her pet dog. "Being angry and short-tempered does not make you bipolar," Sunaina said while talking about media reports.

headlines: Afghanistan's Shahzad threatens to quit cricket after WC axing
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Mohammad Shahzad has threatened to quit cricket after being declared unfit for 2019 World Cup by Afghanistan Cricket Board which claimed he injured his knee. Shahzad, who was sent home mid-tournament, said, "I was removed from 2015 World Cup and now this one as well. I'm going to consult with friends and family, my heart isn't in cricket anymore."

headlines: BJP MP Virendra Kumar to be Pro-tem Speaker of 17th Lok Sabha
text: BJP MP Virendra Kumar will be Pro-tem Speaker of the newly elected 17th Lok Sabha. Kumar, who began his political career as an ABVP activist, previously served as a Minister of State in Women and Child Development and Minority Affairs Ministries. The main duty of the Pro-tem Speaker is to administer the oath of office to new LS members.

headlines: Pak ad on WC mocks IAF's Abhinandan ahead of Ind vs Pak match
text: Ahead of the World Cup match between India and Pakistan, an advertisement mocking IAF Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman has been released in Pakistan. Abhinandan had been captured by the Pakistani military after the Balakot air strikes. The advertisement shows a model made to look like the IAF officer with his trademark moustache in a blue jersey answering questions on camera.

headlines: Pic of man riding bike in Lahore wearing 'Virat' Pak jersey viral
text: A picture of a man riding a bike while wearing Pakistan cricket team jersey with 'Virat' and jersey number 18 printed on the back in Lahore has gone viral. "I believe there are more Virat Kohli fans in Pakistan than any other Pakistani batsman from current lot," a fan tweeted. "Cricket has no boundaries unlike politics," wrote another.

headlines: Order to release journalist not an approval of his tweets: SC
text: The Supreme Court has ordered immediate release of journalist Prashant Kanojia on bail, while stating that his release won't amount to approval of his tweets. It asked, "We don't appreciate these tweets, but can you put him behind bars for this?" Kanojia had allegedly shared a video of a woman claiming she'd sent UP CM Yogi Adityanath a marriage proposal.

headlines: Rival car rental startups Zoomcar, Drivezy in merger talks: Report
text: Bengaluru-based self-drive car rental startup Zoomcar is in early talks with rival startup Drivezy for equal merger, Livemint reported. Top investors in both startups are likely to hold stakes in the merged entity, Livemint cited its sources as saying. "Zoomcar might look at a share-swap deal, which will allow the company to pay existing shareholders using equity shares," sources said.

headlines: Judge quotes Mirza Ghalib in Kathua gangrape and murder case verdict
text: Judge Tejwinder Singh quoted Mirza Ghalib in Kathua gangrape and murder case judgement, saying it applies to the case. The judgement reads, "Pinha tha daam-e-sakht qareeb ashiyaan ke, Udhne hi na paye the ki giraftaar hum hue (Hunters placed the net near a nest and the young one got caught in it even before it could take its first flight)."

headlines: Indian Army neutralises IED in J&K's Poonch district
text: The bomb disposal squad of the Indian Army neutralised an IED in a controlled explosion near Krishna Ghati brigade in Poonch district, Jammu and Kashmir. The IED was planted by anti-national elements on Monday evening and was detected by BSF personnel on Road Opening Party duty. Meanwhile, two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in Shopian district.

headlines: 2 killed in crude bomb attack in West Bengal's Kankinara
text: Two people were killed and four others were injured in an explosion in the Kankinara area of North 24 Parganas district in West Bengal on Monday night, according to media reports. Locals claimed a crude bomb was lobbed by unidentified miscreants. Notably, North 24 Parganas district had witnessed clashes during the Lok Sabha elections last month.

headlines: Kabir Singh maker said, 'I only see you': Kiara on replacing Tara
text: Speaking about replacing Tara Sutaria in the upcoming film 'Kabir Singh', Kiara Advani revealed that she was first approached for the film but it later underwent several casting changes. "I did ask the director why cast me again? He said because 'I only see you'," Kiara added. "He was convinced that only I could do this film," she further said.

headlines: Jaaved Jaaferi's son Meezaan denies dating Big B's granddaughter
text: Denying reports which suggest that he is dating Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, Jaaved Jaaferi's son Meezaan Jaaferi said, "I'm not in a relationship with anyone." "We're from the same friends' circle, she is my sister's bestie and a really good friend," he added. Meezaan will soon be making his acting debut in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's upcoming film 'Malaal'.

headlines: Anil, Jackie to play policemen in crime-comedy film: Reports
text: Anil Kapoor and Jackie Shroff will be seen portraying a pair of 50-year-old policemen in an upcoming crime-comedy film titled 'Ramchand Kishanchand', as per reports. Directed by Subhash Ghai, shooting for the film is slated to commence later this year. Anil and Jackie earlier featured together in Subhash's 1989 film 'Ram Lakhan'.

headlines: Can't do away with dance in our cinema: Choreographer Bosco Martis
text: Choreographer Bosco Martis has said that he believes songs and dance are an integral part of Indian culture and can't be done away with in Bollywood. "We have to change our choreography...to stay relevant when it comes to Bollywood, because films are changing," he added. "[W]e have to utilise the power of dance in storytelling," the choreographer further said.

headlines: Congratulations on your 72nd incarnation day: Rabri to Lalu
text: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi on Tuesday wished her husband and RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is in jail in the fodder-scam case, on his 72nd birthday, saying that his birth is an "incarnation". Lalu is at present undergoing treatment at RIMS hospital. On Saturday, leaders of Congress and RJD met Lalu in the hospital.

headlines: 10 injured in YSRCP, TDP workers clash in Andhra Pradesh
text: At least ten workers of the ruling YSR Congress and Telugu Desam Party (TDP) were injured in a post-poll clash at a village in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district on Sunday. "Situation in B Kothuru village is tense after the Assembly election results," a police official said. Two separate complaints have been filed by the groups against each other.

headlines: Punjab CM seeks report on open borewells after 2-yr-old boy's death
text: Following the death of the 2-year-old boy after falling in an abandoned borewell in Punjab's Sangrur, state CM Captain Amarinder Singh sought a report from all Deputy Commissioners on open borewells in order to evade similar accidents. The boy was stuck in an over 150-foot-deep borewell for around 110 hours. "Very sad" to hear about the death, the CM tweeted.

headlines: Bodies of man, woman found hanging from tree in UP's Etah
text: Bodies of a man and a woman were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Etah, police said on Tuesday. Etah Superintendent of Police Sanjay Kumar said that the age of the man was around 23 years while the woman would be around 20 years of age. He added, "We've not received any missing complaint about the two deceased."

headlines: Iran raises uranium production after partially suspending nuke deal
text: Iran has increased the production of enriched uranium, Yukiya Amano, head of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), said. This comes after Iran last month suspended some of the commitments under the 2015 nuclear deal in retaliation for sanctions imposed by the US. The sanctions were reimposed after the US withdrew from the deal last year.

headlines: SC orders release of journo arrested over Twitter post on UP CM
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered immediate release of journalist Prashant Kanojia, saying that "right of liberty of a citizen has been infringed". Kanojia was accused of posting a video wherein a woman claimed a "relationship" with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Twitter. This comes after Kanojia's wife filed a plea challenging his arrest.

headlines: 25 South offers 3 & 4 bed residences by Arabian Sea in Prabhadevi
text: 25 South is located on one of the largest land parcels closest to the Arabian Sea right opposite the Siddhivinayak temple at Prabhadevi. 25 South offers over 50 amenities for an uber luxurious lifestyle, bespoke living spaces and the legacy of two of the largest real estate developers in Mumbai.

headlines: Esha Deol, husband Bharat Takhtani blessed with baby girl
text: Actress Esha Deol and her husband Bharat Takhtani were blessed with a baby girl on Tuesday. Sharing the news on Instagram with a poster, Esha revealed that the baby has been named Miraya and wrote in the caption, "Thank you very much for the love & blessings." Esha and Bharat are already parents to a girl named Radhya.

headlines: Karnad cremated without state honours to honour his last wishes
text: Veteran actor and playwright Girish Karnad, who passed away on Monday, was cremated in Bengaluru without state honours by his family members to honour his last wishes. "After a discussion with his son, it was made clear to us that his last wish was to not have any floral procession, VVIPs or visits of any dignitaries," said DCP, Bengaluru Central.

headlines: Yuvraj cried when he received kit before 2016 comeback: Wife Hazel
text: Yuvraj Singh's wife Hazel Keech has revealed her husband cried when he received his Team India kit before being recalled to the national team for the three-match T20I series against Australia in early 2016. "I obviously don't understand what that feels like...I just remember him saying, 'Never again did I imagine that I will play for India again'," Hazel added.

headlines: BJP MP Rekha Verma booked for allegedly slapping constable
text: An FIR was filed against BJP MP Rekha Verma for allegedly slapping an on-duty police constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on June 9. The constable said, "She passed insulting remarks at me, slapped me without a reason, and immediately left the spot." Verma reportedly assaulted the constable as she lost her cool when he failed to follow her instructions.

headlines: 12-yr-old girl kidnapped, raped by Madrasa teacher in Meerut
text: An Urdu teacher has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and raping his 12-year-old student in Meerut. The minor said, "When I woke up in the night, he came, gagged my mouth and took me away. His name is Shahid and he teaches in the Madrasa." Meanwhile, police said, "We will try to file the charge sheet as soon as possible."

headlines: Woman home guard set ablaze over property dispute in UP
text: A woman home guard named Kanti Devi was allegedly set ablaze by her relative in Bareilly on Monday night while she was returning home from duty. Kanti, whose condition is now said to be stable, has named the accused. Authorities said, "The owner of the house had registered the house in her name which was the cause of dispute."

headlines: 2-yr-old pulled out of borewell after 110 hours, declared dead
text: A two-year-old stuck in an over 150-foot-deep borewell for around 110 hours was declared dead after being pulled out on Tuesday in Punjab's Sangrur.
