Fatehveer Singh was flown to a Chandigarh hospital in an air ambulance after the NDRF, which dug a parallel pit, pulled him out. The borewell was covered with a jute bag when he fell inside.

headlines: Half-brother of Kim Jong-un was an informant for CIA: Report
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's half-brother Kim Jong-nam, who was killed in Malaysia in 2017, had been an informant for the US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), a report said. Kim Jong-nam was poisoned with a banned chemical weapon at an airport in Kuala Lumpur. He had reportedly travelled to Malaysia in 2017 to meet his CIA contact.

headlines: Helicopter crashes atop 54-storey US skyscraper; pilot killed
text: The pilot of a helicopter died after it crash-landed on top of a 54-storey skyscraper in Manhattan, US, fire officials said. The pilot was the only person aboard the chopper when it crash-landed and burst into flames. The incident sparked a rooftop fire, which was quickly extinguished. Some workers were evacuated from the tower, but no one were hurt.

headlines: Salman had a huge connect with Girish Karnad: Director Ali
text: Condoling the demise of actor-playwright Girish Karnad, director Ali Abbas Zafar said, "Salman (Khan) also had a huge connect with him." Karnad last featured in the Salman starrer 'Tiger Zinda Hai', which was directed by Ali. "[H]e was a very important part of the 'Tiger' franchise and we were looking forward to working with him again," the director added.

headlines: John Abraham, Emraan Hashmi to star in gangster-drama film
text: Actors John Abraham and Emraan Hashmi will star together in an upcoming gangster-drama film which will be directed by filmmaker Sanjay Gupta. "It's my third outing with John and I'm super excited to work with Emraan...I'm back to my base of film making, gangster-dramas," the director said. The film will be set in Mumbai between the 1980s and 1990s.

headlines: Want to lighten up my filmography, not be so intense: Taapsee
text: When asked whether she would want to feature in a 'masala-entertainer' film, Taapsee Pannu said, "I want to lighten up my filmography...and not always be so intense." "There are preconceived notions that I will not do a smaller part. But it's nothing like that," she added. Taapsee further said that her roles have a huge impact on her life.

headlines: SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted to Gurugram hospital
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav was flown to Delhi on Monday night and admitted to Medanta Hospital in Gurugram, the party said. Earlier on Monday, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath met Yadav at his Lucknow residence and enquired about his health. Yadav, on Sunday, was admitted to a hospital in Lucknow and was discharged after a few hours.

headlines: Plan of 100% EV sales by 2025 unrealistic, impractical: TVS, Bajaj
text: TVS Motor Company and Bajaj Auto responded to reports of government suggesting 100% EVs for sale of two-wheelers under 150 cc by 2025. "To force an unrealistic deadline...risks derailing auto-manufacturing in India," TVS Motor Company Chairman said. Bajaj Auto MD said it may be impractical to target such scale when stakeholders don't currently possess any meaningful EV experience.

headlines: 2 terrorists killed by security forces in J&K's Shopian
text: Two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, police said on Tuesday. After receiving information about the presence of terrorists in Awneera area of Shopian, security forces launched a cordon and search operation, which later turned into an encounter, the police said. Security forces also recovered arms and ammunition from the area.

headlines: 9-year-old girl raped in UP's Sitapur, accused held
text: A nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a man in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district, police said. After receiving the information, an FIR was registered following which teams were formed and the accused was taken into custody, Sitapur Superintendent of Police LR Kumar said. He added, "The girl has been sent for medical examination. The chargesheet will be filed soon."

headlines: Govt planning to integrate MSMEs with big enterprises
text: The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Ministry is planning to set up facilitation centres to make MSMEs more competitive and help them integrate with big enterprises, a senior official said. These centres will help disseminate information to micro and small enterprises and detect issues faced by them. The centres are being planned to be set up at block levels.

headlines: Video: Yuvraj's 6 sixes in an over against Stuart Broad in 2007 WT20
text: Yuvraj Singh, who announced his retirement from international cricket and IPL today, became the first cricketer to smash six sixes in an over in T20I cricket on September 19, 2007. Yuvraj achieved the feat off England fast bowler Stuart Broad in the inaugural World T20. He went on to score international cricket's fastest 50 off 12 balls in the match.

headlines: I've thought 'I am not pretty enough, my teeth are too big': Kalki
text: Actress Kalki Koechlin, in an interview with Elle magazine, said she has thought she is "not pretty enough" or her teeth are "too big". "I remember going to Hollywood once and this female casting director asked me to come closer to see the wrinkles around my eyes," she added. However, Kalki said she has grown more confident over the years.

headlines: Shahzad breaks down after being sent home from WC, criticises board
text: Afghanistan wicketkeeper-batsman Mohammad Shahzad, who was sent home mid-World Cup due to a knee injury, said that he is fit and that the Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) has conspired against him. The 32-year-old broke down and said that he was sent home without consultation. He further said that even his teammates were in shock at the news.

headlines: Aus captain Finch clarifies after Zampa is accused of ball-tampering
text: Australia captain Aaron Finch has said leg-spinner Adam Zampa was using hand warmers when cameras captured him putting his hand in his pockets and rubbing his fingers along the ball during their match against India. "I haven't seen the photos...but I know...he has hand warmers in...pocket," he added. Several fans had claimed that Zampa was tampering with the ball.

headlines: Rohit tweets Yuvraj deserved a better send off, Yuvraj responds
text: After Yuvraj Singh announced his retirement from international cricket two years after playing his last international match, India opener Rohit Sharma said he deserved a better send off. "You dont know what you got till its gone...Love you brotherman," Rohit further tweeted. Responding to Rohit, Yuvraj wrote, "You know how I feel inside! Love u brothaman...you go be a legend."

headlines: Aggressive player, benevolent man: Anushka on Kohli's gesture
text: Reacting to her husband and India captain Virat Kohli asking fans to stop booing Australia's Steve Smith during their World Cup match, actress Anushka Sharma shared an Instagram Story, writing, "Aggressive player, benevolent man...so easy to love." A section of fans booed Smith, who recently returned after serving a one-year ban over ball-tampering scandal, while he was fielding at deep.

headlines: BCCI should retire no. 12 jersey as a tribute to Yuvraj: Gambhir
text: Congratulating all-rounder Yuvraj Singh on his retirement from international cricket, former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "You were the best ever white ball cricketer India had." "BCCI should retire number 12 jersey in the tribute to your career. Wish I could bat like you champion," he further wrote. Yuvraj scored 11,778 runs and took 148 wickets in his international career.

headlines: Centre equally responsible for violence in West Bengal: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said the Centre also has equal responsibility as the state governments in case any violence takes place in the state. She also accused BJP of trying to incite violence in West Bengal. This comes a day after the Centre sent an advisory to West Bengal over post-poll violence, saying it failed to maintain law.

headlines: Govt fires 12 senior Income Tax officers over corruption, misconduct
text: Twelve senior officers of Income Tax Department have been told to resign by the Finance Ministry on Monday. "Senior officers of ranks of Chief Commissioner, Principal Commissioners and Commissioner of Income Tax Department compulsorily retired under Rule 56 by the Ministry," ANI said. Some of these officers were allegedly involved in corruption, sexual harassment and had disproportionate assets.

headlines: Tripura MLA marries woman who lodged rape case against him
text: Indigenous Peoples Front of Tripura MLA Dhananjoy Tripura has married a woman who had lodged a police case accusing him of raping and deceiving her. The woman had claimed that Dhananjoy had maintained an intimate relationship with her but later refused to marry her. The couple has now made a joint submission in a court asking for closing the case.

headlines: Video shows UP policemen thrashing transgenders for 'misbehaving'
text: A video has surfaced online which shows policemen in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut thrashing transgender people in a police station. The police said, "The transgenders misbehaved and force was used to control them." The incident reportedly took place when two groups of the transgender community, who were fighting over distribution of gifts they collected, created a ruckus in the police station.

headlines: News about my appointment as Governor of Andhra not true: Swaraj
text: Ex-External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj has said that reports about her appointment as Governor of Andhra Pradesh aren't true. Her comments come after Health Minister Harsh Vardhan congratulated her on her "appointment" as new Andhra Governor and deleted the tweet later. Swaraj clarified that she had met Vice President Venkaiah Naidu in connection with her demitting the external affairs office.

headlines: Designer makes glasses to let short people see 1 foot over eye level
text: London-based designer Dominic Wilcox has designed 'periscope glasses' that let its wearer see one foot taller than their normal eye level. I was standing at a gig and turned to see a small woman dancing away but unable to see the band. This gave me the inspiration to design a way for people to see over obstacles, Wilcox said.

headlines: India thrash Uzbekistan 10-0 to reach semis of FIH Series Finals
text: India thrashed Uzbekistan by a 10-0 margin in the FIH Series Finals on Monday at the Kalinga Stadium, Bhubaneswar. With the win, India progressed to the semi-final stage after topping Pool A while USA is the semifinalist from Pool B after holding 2018 Asian Games champion Japan to a 2-2 draw.

headlines: Muralitharan and McGrath the toughest bowlers I faced: Yuvraj
text: Speaking about his career after announcing his retirement from international cricket, Yuvraj Singh revealed that Sri Lankan spinner Muttiah Muralitharan and Australian pacer Glenn McGrath were the toughest bowlers he faced in his career. Additionally, Yuvraj revealed that Windies' Chris Gayle and former Australia captain Ricky Ponting are his favourite foreign players.

headlines: Players will come & go, but players like Yuvraj rare to find: Sehwag
text: Wishing Yuvraj Singh on his retirement, former India cricketer Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Players will come and go but players like Yuvraj Singh are very rare to find." "Gone through many difficult times but thrashed disease, thrashed bowlers & won hearts. Inspired so many people with his fight & will-power. Wish you the best in life," he added.

headlines: Qualcomm, Intel, LG Uplus cut staff access to Huawei: Report
text: Intel, Qualcomm, mobile technology research firm InterDigital and South Korean carrier LG Uplus have restricted employees from informal conversations with Huawei, Reuters reported. Such discussions are reportedly a routine part of meetings where engineers gather to set technical standards for communications technologies. Several experts reportedly said the new restrictions could slow 5G rollout.

headlines: Agri-food investor launches $70 mn 'Rural India Impact' fund
text: Switzerland and India-based agriculture and food sector-focussed investor Pioneering Ventures has launched a 'Rural India Impact' fund with a targetted corpus of $70 million. The purpose of the private equity fund is to provide growth capital exclusively to its portfolio companies. Its portfolio companies include Desai Fruits & Vegetables, Citrus Processing India, FarmLink, MilkLane and Samaaru.

headlines: Chinese payments startup PingPong to put 100M in Luxembourg
text: Chinese payments startup PingPong, which has offices in countries including the US, announced it'll invest over 100 million in Luxembourg in coming years, TechCrunch stated. PingPong reportedly unveiled proposed infusion at an event centred around Chinese governments Belt and Road Initiative. Earlier, in 2017, PingPong had secured a payment institution licence from the government of Luxembourg.

headlines: Will hike China tariffs again if Xi won't meet at G20: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs on China again if President Xi Jinping does not meet with him at the upcoming Group of 20 summit in Japan. "I think he will go and I think we're scheduled to have a meeting," he said. The US recently raised tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods, following which China retaliated.

headlines: No-frills account holders to get cheque books, other perks
text: The RBI has relaxed the norms for no-frills accounts, directing banks to provide cheque books and other facilities to basic account holders. The banks cannot ask account holders to maintain any minimum balance for such facilities. Earlier, additional facilities made these accounts similar to regular savings accounts, making it mandatory to maintain a minimum balance and be levied other charges.

headlines: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev gets married to TV actress Charu
text: Sushmita Sen's brother, model Rajeev Sen took to Instagram to announce that he got married to TV actress Charu Asopa. The couple, who had a court marriage, shared pictures of themselves with the captions "I Rajeev Sen take Charu Asopa as my lawful wife" and "I Charu Asopa take Rajeev Sen as my lawful husband". They got engaged in May.

headlines: When you find out please let us know: Samantha on pregnancy reports
text: Telugu actress Samantha Akkineni on Monday responded to an article that speculated that she is pregnant. Sharing the article which read 'Is Samantha pregnant?', the actress replied, "Damnnn....... is she? When you find out please let us know." Samantha got married to her boyfriend, actor Naga Chaitanya in the year 2017.

headlines: Fan shares video after Ranbir gets criticised for being 'rude'
text: Ranbir Kapoor's fan has shared a video after social media users criticised the actor for not stopping the fan from touching his feet and asking him to sit beside him. The fan, Vikrant Singh, clarified Ranbir is "not a bad celebrity". "I crouched on the floor as I was...showing Ranbir an album I made for him," the fan said.

headlines: SA get their 1st point of 2019 WC as match vs WI gets abandoned
text: South Africa got their first point of 2019 World Cup after their match against West Indies was abandoned due to rain. Only 7.3 overs of play was possible, in which South Africa scored 29/2 after West Indies won the toss and opted to bowl. South Africa, who had lost their first three matches, moved to ninth position with one point.

headlines: Stuart Broad wishes Yuvraj on retirement, praised for his gesture
text: England pacer Stuart Broad, who was hit for six sixes in an over by Yuvraj Singh in a 2007 World T20 match, took to social media to congratulate the Indian all-rounder on his retirement. "Enjoy retirement Legend," he wrote. The 32-year-old was praised for his gesture by fans, with one writing, "That's true sportsmanship," while CSK wrote, "Broadminded gentleman, you!"

headlines: Was promised farewell game if I failed Yo-Yo Test, I passed: Yuvraj
text: Yuvraj Singh, who retired from international cricket on Monday, has revealed that he was promised a farewell match by the BCCI provided he failed the Yo-Yo fitness Test. "I said I do not want a retirement match and if I don't pass Yo-Yo test, I'd go home. I passed Yo-Yo test and the rest is not my call," he added.

headlines: Fight you put up through all ups, downs is amazing: Sachin to Yuvraj
text: Ex-India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate Yuvraj Singh on his retirement from international cricket. "What a fantastic career you have had Yuvi. You've come out as a true champ every time the team needed you," he added. "The fight you put up through all ups & downs on & off the field's just amazing," he further wrote.

headlines: Delhi records its all-time highest June temperature at 48°C: Skymet
text: Delhi on Monday recorded its all-time highest June temperature at 48°C, as per weather forecasting company Skymet. The previous highest June temperature in Delhi was 47.8°C on June 9, 2014, followed by 47.4°C on June 16, 1995. As per an official, the factors leading to this included dry westerly winds and no effect of a western disturbance in the plains.

headlines: Mumbai student scores passing marks 35 in all subjects in Class 10
text: A Mumbai student named Akshit Jadhav has scored exactly 35 marks, the minimum marks required for passing, in all the subjects in Class 10 examination of the Maharashtra Board. "He was surprised as he was expecting 55%," his father said. "Many students can score in 90s, but not all can score perfect 35 in each subject," his father added.

headlines: 4th person arrested by UP Police for 'objectionable' post on CM Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday arrested a man from Gorakhpur for allegedly "defaming" CM Yogi Adityanath on social media. He had allegedly posted a morphed picture of CM Yogi with a woman who had claimed a "relationship" with him. This is the fourth such case, after the arrests of a freelance journalist, and a television channel's head and its editor.

headlines: Bodies of woman, 2-yr-old daughter found in water tank in Rajasthan
text: A 27-year-old woman and her two-year-old daughter were killed and their bodies were found in a water tank in Bikaner in Rajasthan on Sunday. "The woman's parents have alleged that they have been killed over dowry demands," said Subhash Sharma, City Circle Officer. An FIR has been registered and further investigation is underway, added Sharma.

headlines: Was expecting capital punishment: NCW Chairperson on Kathua judgement
text: National Commission for Women Chairperson Rekha Sharma on Monday said she was expecting capital punishment for Kathua gangrape and murder convicts. A Pathankot court sentenced the three main accused to life imprisonment for murder and 25-year imprisonment for gangrape, while three others were sentenced to five-year imprisonment. J&K government must appeal in a higher court, added Sharma.

headlines: 33 kg of silver bars seized in Hyderabad, 3 arrested
text: Hyderabad police on Monday arrested three persons and seized 33 kg of silver in the form of bars from their possession. When the officers apprehended the three and asked them to show documents of the vehicle, they failed to do so and when the vehicle was checked, the police recovered silver bars, said Ram Reddy, ACP Begumpet.

headlines: Ex-Pak Prez Asif Ali Zardari arrested in fake bank accounts case
text: Former Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari was arrested by officials from the National Accountability Bureau (NAB) in Islamabad after the Islamabad High Court declined extending his bail application in a multimillion-dollar money laundering case. Zardari, currently a lawmaker in Parliament, and his sister Faryal Talpur are accused of having dozens of bogus bank accounts. Zardari has denied any wrongdoing.

headlines: Singapore most competitive economy, India not in top 40: IMD Ranking
text: Singapore has dethroned the United States as the most competitive economy in the world while India did not even make it to the top 40 economies in IMD World Competitiveness Ranking 2019. India ranked at 43rd position, one position higher compared to 2018. Singapore is followed by Hong Kong and the United States in the rankings.

headlines: Don't wear slippers, t-shirts to work: BoB to staff in Gujarat's Bhuj
text: Bank of Baroda has sent a letter to all branch staff in Gujarat's Bhuj region mentioning 11 guidelines for them to "wear and look smart". It asked employees to wear well-ironed clothes, keep hair combed, moustache trimmed and avoid slippers and t-shirts. It further advised male employees to wear pant and shirt and female employees to wear salwar-kameez or saree.

headlines: Delhi HC restrains over 60 sites from broadcasting WC matches
text: The Delhi High Court has restrained over 60 websites and some radio channels from broadcasting the 2019 cricket World Cup matches. The Channel 2 Group Corporation had moved the court concerned over the "likely abuse" of its exclusive audio and intellectual property rights as has happened in the past causing financial loss to it.

headlines: US voting machine maker to back away from paperless models
text: ES&S CEO Tom Burt in an opinion-editorial wrote the US-based election equipment provider has decided to no longer sell paperless voting machines as the primary voting device in a jurisdiction. He added it's difficult to perform meaningful audit without paper record of each voters selections. Burt called on the US Congress to pass legislation establishing a more robust testing program.

headlines: Maruti Suzuki cuts production for fourth month in a row
text: The country's largest car maker Maruti Suzuki India said it cut vehicle production by over 18% in May, the automaker's fourth consecutive month of taking a production cut. The company produced a total of 1.51 lakh units in May compared to 1.84 lakh units in the year-ago period. Barring the Super Carry LCV, Maruti Suzuki reduced production across all segments.

headlines: JSW Steel gets NCLT approval for amalgamation plan
text: JSW Steel said it has received the NCLT's approval for amalgamation of its four units. The company has merged Dolvi Minerals and Metals, Dolvi Coke, JSW Steel Processing Centres, and JSW Salav with JSW Steel. It further said it acquired Piombino Steel from JSW Techno Projects Management, adding that JSW's Makler is now a fully-owned subsidiary of Piombino.

headlines: CVC awaits sanction to prosecute 123 corrupt govt employees
text: The Central Vigilance Commission (CVC) is awaiting sanction from various organisations for over four months to prosecute 123 government employees for their alleged involvement in corruption. Of the total accused, which include IAS officers and ED officials, the highest count of 47 is from state-run banks. According to norms, the sanction for prosecution has to be decided within four months.

headlines: 3 imprisoned for life, 3 others get 5-yr jail in Kathua rape case
text: A Pathankot court has sentenced three out of the six convicted for rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua last year to life imprisonment. Three others have been handed a 5-year sentence each. Earlier in the day, the special court acquitted one of the seven accused, Vishal Ram, in the case.

headlines: Hrithik's sister denies report of ill health, says 'I am partying'
text: Hrithik Roshan's sister Sunaina Roshan took to Twitter on Monday to deny reports which said her health condition is critical and she has been kept under observation. "Surprised to read about me being critical in hospital...I am out with friends and partying! Please get your facts right," she wrote. The report said Sunaina has been suffering from bipolar disorder.

headlines: Deepika confirms she will play Ranveer's wife in World Cup film '83
text: Actress Deepika Padukone has confirmed that she will be playing Ranveer Singh's wife in the upcoming film '83. While Ranveer will play ace cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Deepika will play his wife Romi. Based on India's cricket World Cup win in England in 1983, the film will be Deepika and Ranveer's first collaboration after their wedding.

headlines: Wouldn't hire Elon Musk for help: Russian space agency's Head
text: Dmitry Rogozin, the Head of Russian space agency Roscosmos, said that he would not hire space startup SpaceX's CEO Elon Musk to get help with reusable rocketry. On being asked about inviting Musk to Russia, Rogozin said, "He's a busy man, I'm a busy man, why should I invite him?" In the past, Rogozin accused SpaceX of "killing competitors."

headlines: We'll begin making deliveries in 2 hours: BigBasket CEO Hari Menon
text: Grocery delivery startup BigBasket's Co-founder and CEO Hari Menon said, "Very soon, you'll see us starting to make deliveries in two hours." On opening physical stores, Menon said, "We don't need to go omnichannel just because other players in the space are doing this." He added, "It's now proven that a significantly large consumer base wants to buy groceries online."

headlines: 28-yr-old posts pics of him kissing sculptures at TN temple; held
text: The Tamil Nadu Police on Sunday arrested a 28-year-old man for posting obscene photos he had clicked at the Brihadeeshwara Temple in Thanjavur. Muji Rahman posted photos of him touching, hugging and kissing sculptures at the temple. He has been booked under Indian Penal Code sections 295 and Section 295 (A).

headlines: No cancer-causing formaldehyde found in baby shampoo retest: J&J
text: Johnson & Johnson on Monday said the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation laboratories retested the company's baby shampoo and reaffirmed the absence of cancer-causing compound formaldehyde in the product. In March, the Rajasthan Drugs Control Organisation had reported the presence of formaldehyde in samples of two batches of the shampoo. The company had rejected and challenged the finding.

headlines: Portugal beat the Netherlands to win maiden Nations League title
text: Portugal defeated the Netherlands 1-0 on Sunday to claim the maiden UEFA Nations League title. Gonçalo Guedes, the 22-year-old Valencia winger, scored the match-winning goal for Portugal. Notably, this is the second trophy won by Portugal in three years after having earlier lifted the European Championship trophy in 2016.

headlines: Pandya's clarity of mind, striking ability brilliant: Kohli
text: Indian captain Virat Kohli praised Hardik Pandya, saying, "Hardik has got clarity of mind, brilliant striking ability... He knows he's batting really well." "I think what this IPL has done for his batting is that he believes that he can clear the boundary whenever he wants," Kohli added about Pandya, who scored 48 runs against Australia.

headlines: I think India bowled really well: Finch on Warner's innings
text: On being asked about David Warner's innings against India, Australian captain Aaron Finch said, "No, it hasn't been a plan, a team plan or an individual plan for David (to play slowly). I think they bowled really well early." "Their bowling plans were pretty simple but really effective on a wicket like that," Finch added about India's bowling attack.

headlines: Ronaldo wants me to come to Juventus: Ajax's De Ligt
text: Ajax's Dutch defender Matthijs de Ligt, who is reportedly being sought by clubs like Barcelona and Manchester United, said, "Ronaldo asked me to come to Juventus." "I was surprised by his request, which is why I laughed. I didn't understand him at first," De Ligt said about Ronaldo's request.

headlines: End of an era, tweets Raina on Yuvraj Singh's retirement
text: Reacting to Yuvraj Singh's retirement, Suresh Raina tweeted, "End of an era! Yuvi pa, ur ability with the bat, the glorious 6s, the impeccable catches & the good times we've had." "Players will come and go,but players like @YUVSTRONG12 are very rare to find. Gone through many difficult times but thrashed disease,thrashed bowlers & won hearts," Virender Sehwag tweeted.

headlines: Google made $4.7 billion from news in 2018: Study
text: Google made $4.7 billion last year via Search and Google News, nearly equalling the estimated $5.1 billion made by the entire US news industry from digital advertisements in the same period, NYT stated citing a News Media Alliance study. The journalists who create that content deserve a cut of that $4.7 billion, Alliance's CEO David Chavern said.

headlines: Anyone trying to break my govt will not be spared: Mamata
text: After West Bengal Governor Keshari Nath Tripathi met PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to discuss the state's 'condition', CM Mamata Banerjee said that anyone trying to break Bengal government will not be "spared". She added that she'll not "tolerate" anyone trying to topple her government. Mamata said, "An injured tiger is more dangerous than a dead tiger."

headlines: Important to be customer obsessed to be an entrepreneur: Jeff Bezos
text: While speaking at Amazon 're:MARS' conference, the world's richest man Jeff Bezos said, "If you want to be an entrepreneur, the most important thing is to be customer obsessed." "So dont satisfy your customers, figure out how to absolutely delight them," Bezos added. Bezos also said an entrepreneur should be a missionary, not a mercenary, as missionaries build better products.

headlines: Mehbooba Mufti, Omar Abdullah welcome Kathua rape verdict
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CMs Mehbooba Mufti and Omar Abdullah welcomed the verdict by the Pathankot court which convicted six out of seven accused in the Kathua rape and murder case. Mufti said, "Hope loopholes in our judicial system aren't exploited and culprits get exemplary punishment." While Abdullah said, "The guilty deserve the most severe punishment possible under the law."

headlines: J&K Bank shares plunge 20% after Chairman's removal
text: Shares of J&K Bank plunged up to 20% on Monday after its Chairman, Parvez Ahmed, was removed. The state government, which holds a 59% stake in the lender, said the action was taken to improve the bank's functioning. The Anti-Corruption Bureau carried out a raid at the lender's corporate office after Ahmed's removal, in connection with alleged fraudulent appointments.

headlines: Yuvraj Singh retires from international cricket
text: Yuvraj Singh, who was named player of the tournament in India's 2011 World Cup triumph, has retired from international cricket. The 37-year-old all-rounder, who last played an international match in 2017, scored 11,778 runs and took 148 wickets across three formats in international cricket. He had made his international debut as an 18-year-old in an ODI in 2000.

headlines: 500 men try to force women dancers to strip during cultural event
text: A mob of over 500 men allegedly tried to force women dancers of a troupe to strip during a cultural programme in Assam's Kamrup district. The dancers managed to escape from the programme at Asolpara, however, their vehicles were pelted with stones. The organisers allegedly sold tickets to people claiming that the troupe would perform strip dance.

headlines: Karnataka govt announces 1-day public holiday after Karnad's demise
text: Following the demise of veteran actor and playwright Girish Karnad on Monday, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has announced three-day state mourning and one-day public holiday in the state today. Schools will individually decide on whether they'll be declaring a holiday for the rest of the day. "He will be cremated with state honours," a statement from the CM's office said.

headlines: Actor Chris Pratt shares 1st official pic of his wedding
text: 'Guardians of The Galaxy' actor Chris Pratt and his newly-wed wife Katherine Schwarzenegger shared the first picture from their wedding ceremony which took place on Saturday. "Yesterday was the best day of our lives! We became husband and wife in front of God, [family] and those we love," they wrote. The couple wore outfits by Giorgio Armani for the ceremony.

headlines: Tamil comedian Crazy Mohan passes away after cardiac arrest at 66
text: Tamil screenwriter, comedian, and playwright, Crazy Mohan passed away in Chennai on Monday aged 66. He suffered a heart attack on Monday afternoon and was taken to Kauvery Hospital in Chennai, where efforts to revive him failed. The first feature film he worked on was K Balachander's 'Poikkal Kudhirai' for which he wrote the dialogues.

headlines: Booing Smith unacceptable, apologised to him on crowd's behalf: Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has revealed that he apologised to Australia batsman Steve Smith on behalf of Indian fans who booed him at The Oval on Sunday. Adding that crowd booing Smith was not acceptable, the 30-year-old said, "I just didn't want them to set a bad example because he didn't do anything to be booed in my opinion."

headlines: I love cricket but I also hate it: Yuvraj Singh after retiring
text: Yuvraj Singh, who retired from international cricket today, said in his retirement video, "I love the sport but I also hate it." "I love it because it has given everything to me. I hate it because it has been very tough on me mentally," he added. "It was a beautiful story...but it has come to an end," he further said.

headlines: Man who withdrew his LS polls candidature shot 18 times; survives
text: A man in Sitamarhi district of Bihar survived 18 bullet injuries after a seven-hour-long operation. The 26-year-old, identified as Pankaj Kumar Singh, was shot in his chest, legs, hands, abdomen, kidney, spleen and liver by unidentified assailants on Saturday. Kumar was offered a ticket to contest the recently concluded Lok Sabha polls, however, he withdrew his candidature citing ill-preparation.

headlines: Crane falls on US apartment building; 1 killed, 5 injured
text: One person has been killed and five others taken to hospital after a crane fell onto an apartment complex in the southern US city of Dallas. The construction crane was brought down during a thunderstorm which hit Texas on Sunday. Authorities say it broke apart and cut through five floors of the complex, which was opposite a building site.

headlines: Politicians, actors condole playwright Girish Karnad's death
text: President Ram Nath Kovind, PM Narendra Modi and several other politicians and actors condoled the death of veteran actor and playwright Girish Karnad on Monday. The President said, "Our cultural world is poorer today", while PM Modi tweeted, "His works will continue being popular in the years to come." Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar wrote that he'll be remembered for his work.

headlines: Some people couldn't recover from poll results: PM on Rahul
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday took a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying some people still couldn't come out of the impact of general election results. His comment came after Rahul in Kerala's Wayanad alleged that PM Modi's election campaign was full of "lies and hatred". PM Modi said such thinking of the Opposition is "their problem and weakness".

headlines: Dhawan's ton is the 3rd highest score vs Aus at a World Cup
text: Indian batsman Shikhar Dhawan's 117 against Australia in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday is the third highest individual score against Australia in a World Cup match. The previous highest score was an Unbeaten 132 by Zimbabwe's Neil Johnson at the 1999 World Cup. Dhawan is also the first Indian with four ODI hundreds in England.

headlines: Mamata doing politics of violence out of frustration: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Sunday said that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is indulging in politics of violence out of "frustration" as "her countdown in Bengal politics has begun". His remark came a day after four people were allegedly killed in clashes between the BJP and TMC workers. Singh claimed that Mamata is facing people's "wrath" election after election.

headlines: Mamata great tigress, postcard war must stop: Shatrughan Sinha
text: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday extended his support to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by calling her a "great tigress and most popular leader of the masses" of Bengal. He added that the "drama" of provoking Mamata unnecessarily and the "postcard war" must stop. Sinha further said that politicising in the name of religion is "not advisable nor acceptable".

headlines: Ex-Puducherry CM and DMK leader RV Janakiraman passes away
text: Former Puducherry Chief Minister and DMK leader RV Janakiraman on Monday passed away at the age of 79. He died at a private hospital where he was undergoing treatment for age-related illness. Janakiraman became the Chief Minister in 1996 and represented the Nellithope Assembly constituency for five consecutive times.

headlines: BJP will help its allies on Assembly seats in Maharashtra: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said that the BJP will help its allies on their seats in the upcoming state Assembly elections. Following a meeting with BJP President Amit Shah, Fadnavis added that the strategy for the forthcoming elections has been worked out. The Assembly election is due to be held in Maharashtra in October to elect 288 members.

headlines: BJP using Home Ministry for political conspiracy: TMC leader
text: West Bengal Minister and TMC leader Partha Chatterjee has accused the BJP of using Union Home Ministry for "political conspiracy". He added that BJP leaders sitting in Delhi aren't understanding the situation of Bengal. Commenting on Home Affairs' advisory issued to Bengal government over law and order situation, Chatterjee said, "We don't have to learn from BJP, we'll tackle this."

headlines: Rahul won in Wayanad due to 40% Muslim population: Owaisi
text: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) President Asaduddin Owaisi claimed that Congress President Rahul Gandhi won Kerala's Wayanad parliamentary constituency due to 40% Muslim population in the region. Addressing a gathering, Owaisi added that he's still hopeful that Muslims will get their place in the country. He further said, "We don't want alms, we don't want to survive on your alms."

headlines: 11 died, 25 injured in bus-truck collision in Jharkhand
text: At least 11 people died and 25 others were injured after a speeding double-decker bus rammed into a truck following a brake failure in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh. DSP Manish Kumar said, the place where the accident occurred has been declared as a ''Black Spot''. In the last six months, at least 150 people have died at the same spot, he added.

headlines: Indian airlines facing tough competition, high operational costs: IATA
text: International Air Transport Association (IATA) chief Alexandre de Juniac has said Indian airlines are facing very tough competition. The cost environment is also not in their favour, he observed. To tackle this issue, taxes in the aviation sector must be lowered, competition on fuel supply improved and more efforts must be taken on regulating airports, he said.

headlines: Great Learnings PGP-AIML helps learners become Al-experts
text: Great Learnings PG Program in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning helps working professionals meet market demand for AI experts. The program, offered in convenient online and weekend classroom formats, has a comprehensive curriculum with real-world industry projects. Delivered in collaboration with the University of Texas at Austin & Great Lakes, it has earned a 4.4 average rating by its learners.

headlines: India record 50th ODI win vs Australia, win 2nd straight match in WC
text: India defeated Australia by 36 runs at The Oval in London to register their second straight victory in the 2019 World Cup and end Australia's 10-ODI winning streak. India became the third team after England and West Indies to register at least 50 victories against Australia in ODI cricket. The match witnessed Shikhar Dhawan smash his 17th ODI hundred.

headlines: Veteran actor and playwright Girish Karnad passes away at 81
text: Veteran actor and playwright Girish Karnad passed away in Bengaluru on Monday at the age of 81, after suffering from prolonged illness. A Jnanpith Award winner, Karnad was also a recipient of the Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan. He made his acting and screenplay debut in 1970 with the Kannada film 'Samskara'.

headlines: Sameera Reddy responds after being criticised over baby bump pics
text: Sameera Reddy has responded to trolls shaming her for sharing pictures of her baby bump. "Her soul was too deep to explore by those who...swam in the shallow end. This is my answer to anyone who feels uncomfortable with me enjoying my pregnant belly," she wrote while sharing another photo. Sameera is expecting her second child with husband Akshai Varde.

headlines: Wife spent a lot of time there: Chris on naming daughter India
text: Speaking about naming his daughter India, 'Thor' actor Chris Hemsworth said, "My wife spent a lot of time in India and that was where the name originally came from." Chris, who was in India last year to shoot for a project, said, "I love the place...the people." He further called the experience of shooting in India "intimidating and exciting".

headlines: I think it's a coincidence: Dhawan on performing well in ICC events
text: After smashing 117 runs off 109 balls including 16 fours against Australia in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday, opener Shikhar Dhawan said, "I played it very smartly and calmly." "I'm happy with the century...I think it's a coincidence that I play well in ICC events," he added. Dhawan has now slammed three hundreds in World Cup history.

headlines: ICC shares video of Virat Kohli asking crowd not to boo Steve Smith
text: The ICC has shared a video of India captain Virat Kohli asking spectators not to boo Australia batsman Steve Smith during their 2019 World Cup match at The Oval on Sunday. In the video, Kohli can be seen making a clapping gesture towards Indian supporters at the stadium's Vauxhall End, urging them to clap rather than boo the ex-Australia captain.

headlines: Crowd shouts 'Chor Hai' as Mallya leaves stadium after India match
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya, former owner of Royal Challengers Bangalore, was on Sunday greeted with 'Chor Hai' chants by the crowd as he left The Oval stadium following India's World Cup match against Australia. When asked about how he would respond to the chants, the 63-year-old said, "I am just making sure my mother does not get hurt."

headlines: If ABD wanted to be here, he would be here: SA coach Gibson
text: South Africa coach Ottis Gibson has said that ex-captain AB de Villiers "left it too late" to make himself available for selection for the squad in 2019 World Cup. "Personally I suspect there are a lot of people wanting AB to be here (more) than AB himself," he added. "If he wanted to be here...he'd be here," he further said.

headlines: Grave miscarriage of justice: Cong on journalist's arrest by UP Police
text: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi has said the detention of freelance journalist Prashant Kanojia by Uttar Pradesh Police was illegal, arbitrary and a grave miscarriage of justice. He also urged Allahabad High Court to take suo motu cognisance of the matter. Kanojia was arrested for posting a video on Twitter wherein a woman claimed a "relationship" with UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

headlines: IIT professor arrested for raping 35-year-old former student
text: Noida Police has arrested Assistant Professor Vivek Vijayvargiya, who works at IIT Jodhpur, for allegedly raping his former student on the pretext of getting her a job. The professor had allegedly called his 35-year-old ex-student to meet him in a room. The former student, in her complaint, said that the professor hit her on legs and hands before raping her.

headlines: In a first, identical twins graduate from Indian Military Academy together
text: In a first, identical twins Abhinav Pathak and Parinav Pathak graduated together from the Indian Military Academy (IMA) in Dehradun, along with 457 other cadets, on Saturday. Abhinav will join Army Air Defence Corps while Parinav will join Army Aviation Corps. "Twins and even identical twins have graduated from IMA earlier. But, in...different years," a senior IMA official said.

headlines: 7-year-old girls body found without clothes in Uttar Pradesh
text: A 7-year-old girl's body was found without clothes in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun district on Sunday, with her 'salwar' tied around her neck. A case of murder has been registered and the body has been sent for postmortem, said Swami Prasad, Superintendent of Police Jalaun. "Whether the child was raped or not will be clear only after the postmortem," added Prasad.

headlines: Frogs married in drought-hit Karnataka to appease rain god
text: The residents married two frogs at a hotel in Udupi, Karnataka to 'appease god Varuna' (rain god) on Saturday. This comes after water-rationing in the district since April, with supply being done once in three days. There is an acute shortage of drinking water in Karnataka, and the state's 156 of the 176 taluks were declared drought-hit in December 2018.

headlines: 12-year-old Dalit girl gangraped by 6 men in front of her family in UP
text: A 12-year-old Dalit girl was allegedly gangraped by six men in Kushinagar district in Uttar Pradesh, the police said on Sunday. According to reports, the accused had a dispute with the girl's family over the construction of a drainage channel. Following the dispute, they dragged the girl in front of the family and raped her.

headlines: Nightclub in Greece plays 'Lamberghini', Anand Mahindra shares video
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has shared a video of a Greece nightclub playing 'Lamberghini', adding that he was "delighted" when the DJ spun the track. "Jai Ho India's soft power!" said Mahindra, who was at the nightclub thronged by people from around the world. Uploaded on YouTube in February 2018, the song's video has over 25 crore views.

headlines: Competition in Indian football team makes me helpless: Coach
text: After Indian football team defeated Thailand in King's Cup to seal a third-place finish, team's newly appointed coach Igor Stimac said the competition for every spot in the team makes him helpless. "This result against Thailand was a result of excellent defending. That was fantastic," the ex-Croatian defender stated. India will now gear up for Intercontinental Cup in July.

headlines: Neymar doesn't need surgery, may return in 4 weeks: PSG
text: The two doctors of Paris Saint-Germain have suggested that Neymar, who injured his ankle in a friendly match against Qatar, will not need to undergo any surgery. Diagnosing the Brazilian international's injury as a "sprain of the lateral ligament", doctors added that the "PSG striker is expected to return to the field in four weeks' time."

headlines: India's 352/5 their highest ever total vs Australia in World Cup
text: India registered their highest-ever total against Australia in a World Cup after putting up 352/5 in their second 2019 World Cup match on Sunday. India's previous highest total (289/6) against Australia in a World Cup had come in the 1987 edition. Overall, 352/5 is India's fourth-highest total in World Cup history, with the highest-ever total being 413/5 (vs Bermuda, 2007).

headlines: Bhuvneshwar's 2 wkts in an over vs Aus was game changer: Kohli
text: After Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar registered bowling figures of 10-0-50-3 in India's 36-run win against Australia in World Cup on Sunday, captain Virat Kohli said, "Bhuvneshwar getting wickets of Steve Smith and Marcus Stoinis in an over was game changer." "You can't take Bhuvi's performances in ODI cricket for granted, he's a champion bowler," Kohli further stated.

headlines: Huawei gets 46 5G contracts from 30 countries despite US ban
text: Chinese telecom giant Huawei said it has obtained 46 commercial 5G contracts so far in 30 countries and shipped more than one lakh 5G stations globally. This comes despite the US issuing a ban on Huawei's 5G services, warning that its systems could be manipulated by China for spying. The US further urged nations to shun Huawei in 5G networks.

headlines: Apple may acquihire self-driving tech startup Drive.ai: Report
text: Apple is reportedly preparing to acquihire "struggling" startup Drive.ai, which uses AI to make self-driving transportation solutions, to boost Apples own self-driving vehicle system's development. Previous reports stated that Drive.ai has been looking for potential buyers since earlier this year. Drive.ai has reportedly raised $77 million in disclosed funding to date.

headlines: Countries must have sovereign right to use data for welfare: Goyal
text: Countries must have the sovereign right to use their data for welfare of people, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said at the G20 Trade Minister's meeting. He said free trade advocacy shouldn't necessarily lead to justification for free flow of data. Issues of privacy and security should be given due consideration in the debate on free flow of data, Goyal added.

headlines: Two new shrew-rat species found on island in Philippines
text: A team led by the Natural History Museum of Utah's Eric Rickart has identified two new species of the 'tweezer-beaked hopping rats' or shrew-rats on mountains in the Philippines' island of Luzon. "They hop around on their sturdy hind legs and large hind feet, almost like little kangaroos," Rickart said. The new species are named Rhynchomys labo and Rhynchomys mingan.

headlines: World number 2 Nadal wins his 12th French Open title in 15 years
text: World number two Rafael Nadal on Sunday defeated world number four Dominic Thiem in the men's singles final to clinch his record-extending 12th French Open title in 15 years. The 33-year-old has now won 18 Grand Slam titles, two fewer than world number three Roger Federer. The Spaniard won the match with a scoreline of 6-3, 5-7, 6-1, 6-1.

headlines: Kohli's 'stunned' reaction to Dhoni's six in 49th over goes viral
text: India captain Virat Kohli's reaction to MS Dhoni's six off a 143-kmph delivery by Australia's Mitchell Starc in the 49th over in their World Cup match went viral. After Dhoni slammed the six over deep square leg, Kohli stood mid-pitch appeared to be shocked and started laughing after looking at Dhoni. Dhoni scored 27(14) including three fours and a six.

headlines: Billion-dollar gaming tech firm Unity's CEO accused of sexual harassment
text: US-based multi-billion dollar video game software development company Unity Technologies' CEO John Riccitiello has been accused of sexual harassment by former VP of global talent acquisition, Anne Evans. In a lawsuit against John, Anne quoted him as saying, "I want to throw you down on the bed and f**k you." She also accused the company of wrongful termination.

headlines: Kohli asks Indian fans to stop shouting 'cheater' at Steve Smith
text: During the ongoing India-Australia World Cup match, India captain Virat Kohli asked a section of Indian fans to stop chanting 'cheater cheater' at Steve Smith while the latter was fielding at deep. Kohli gestured the fans to clap instead of booing the ex-Australian captain, revealed Australian journalist Sam Landsberger. "Pure aggressive with his game and...a true gentleman," a user reacted.

headlines: Union Minister shares 'Sala Congressi' Italian sign to troll Cong
text: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri took to Twitter to troll Congress by sharing a picture of a signboard in Italian which read, "Sala Congressi". "This is what they call a 'Conference Room' in Italian. Interestingly, it also has its back against the wall!" he captioned the picture. "Wicked sense of humour," a user tweeted reacting to Puri's post.

headlines: Sri Lanka President Sirisena gifts Buddha statue to PM Modi
text: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena on Sunday presented Prime Minister Narendra Modi a Buddha statue in meditation posture. PM Modi was in Colombo to discuss bilateral issues with Sri Lankan leadership. "This is considered to be one of the best sculptures in the Anuradhapura era...This masterpiece has taken almost two years to complete," tweeted PMO India about the Buddha statue.

headlines: Mallya responds to extradition questions outside The Oval stadium
text: Fugitive liquor baron Vijay Mallya, who was at The Oval cricket ground in the UK to watch the India-Australia World Cup ODI on Sunday, answered the reporters' questions on his India extradition. "Preparations are underway for the next hearing scheduled in July," Mallya said. He is appealing against a UK court's order clearing his extradition to India.

headlines: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) now a state party in Arunachal Pradesh: EC
text: Janata Dal (United), headed by Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, has become a recognised state party in Arunachal Pradesh, Election Commission has said. The party will also be able to use its 'arrow' symbol in the state, EC added. JD(U) had won seven seats in the 60-member Assembly, next only to the ruling BJP which won 41 seats, securing the majority.

headlines: Journalist E Gopinath who covered Independent India's 1st polls dies
text: Veteran journalist and chief of news agency ANI Tamil Nadu, E Gopinath, passed away at 88 in Chennai on Saturday. Gopinath covered Independent India's first general elections for Press Trust of India (PTI) and was active till the recently concluded 17th general elections. He was the first Indian journalist to interview Argentine revolutionary Che Guevara and Cuban leader Fidel Castro.

headlines: 12-yr-old girl's body who died at MLA's house dug out for postmortem
text: The body of a 12-year-old Adivasi girl from Assam, who died last month at JD(U) MLA Techi Kaso's house in Arunachal Pradesh, was exhumed on Saturday for conducting postmortem. Police had claimed that she committed suicide and her body was buried without filing of an FIR and without postmortem. Her parents have been working at Kaso's house for 30 years.

headlines: Rape of minor is rape, rape of married woman is different: UP Minister
text: Uttar Pradesh's Minister of Water Resources, Forest and Environment, Upendra Tiwari on Sunday remarked, "If a minor is raped then we consider it a case of rape." He added, "But if you come across an incident where a married woman aged 30-35 is raped, it's different." He remarked this on being asked to comment on rape incidents in the state.

headlines: Misuse of law: Editors Guild on journalists' arrest by Yogi govt
text: Editors Guild of India has condemned the arrest of journalist Prashant Kanojia, a Noida-based television channel's head Ishita Singh and its editor Anuj Shukla, by Yogi Adityanath-led UP government. "Police action is high-handed, arbitrary and amounts to authoritarian misuse of laws," it said. The three were arrested for airing a video wherein a woman claimed a "relationship" with Adityanath.

headlines: Krawietz, Mies 1st all-German pair to win men's doubles Grand Slam
text: Kevin Krawietz and Andreas Mies became the first all-German team in history to win a Grand Slam men's doubles title on Saturday, beating Jeremy Chardy and Fabrice Martin 6-2, 7-6(3). The unseeded duo lifted the trophy in their second Grand Slam appearance. Meanwhile, Latisha Chan and Ivan Dodig defeated Gabriela Dabrowski and Mate Pavic to retain the mixed doubles' crown.

headlines: Childhood friends Kristina, Babos win French Open women's doubles
text: World number one women's doubles player Kristina Mladenovic, along with her Hungarian childhood friend Timea Babos, won the women's doubles title at French Open on Sunday. The duo defeated the Chinese pair of Duan Ying-Ying and Zheng Saisai in straight sets to clinch the title at Roland Garros. Babos and Mladenovic were runners-up at the Australian Open earlier this year.

headlines: France ready to cut Renault stake to support Nissan ties
text: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire has said the country is prepared to consider cutting its 15% stake in Renault if it leads to a "more solid" alliance between the French carmaker and Japan's Nissan. Renault should concentrate on forging closer links with Nissan before seeking other alliances, he added. The comments come days after the proposed Renault-Fiat merger collapsed.

headlines: Japan fund to invest $500K in 5 Indian vernacular segment startups
text: Japanese VC fund Akatsuki Entertainment Technology Fund is looking to make five early-stage investments in India's vernacular segment with an average ticket size of $500,000. Earlier, it invested in Indian startups like Doubtnut and LBB. Yuki Kawamura, the fund's executive, said that consumer segments including vernacular video and esports, among others, will be Akatsuki's focus areas in India.

headlines: Tesla rival Rivian CEO confirms vehicle-to-vehicle charging
text: US electric vehicle startup Rivian's CEO RJ Scaringe in an interview confirmed vehicle-to-vehicle charging feature and availability of auxiliary battery packs. "You can also charge Rivian-to-Rivian, which is a neat thing. You connect the two vehicles and then I could hand you some electrons," Scaringe said. The Tesla rival has raised $1.4 billion in disclosed funding till date, Crunchbase stated.

headlines: Mature and gorgeous: NASA shares barred spiral galaxy's pic
text: NASA tweeted an image of a barred spiral galaxy taken by Hubble Space Telescopes Wide Field Camera 3, an instrument installed on it in 2009. "Mature and gorgeous...Our own Milky Way galaxy is thought to look similar," NASA tweeted. Named NGC 7773, the galaxy's image shows a luminous core that's likely acting like a stellar nursery, the space agency tweeted.

headlines: No more light-touch regulation for NBFCs, says RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said there is a need to have a fresh look at the regulation and supervision of Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs). The conventional approach to the regulation of NBFCs had been 'light-touch', in order to complement banks, he said. The final guidelines on the liquidity risk management framework will be issued shortly, Das added.

headlines: Govt must divest brownfield assets, help private sector: CII
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to divest some of its viable operating brownfield assets such as ports and airports, and provide a low-risk investment option to the private sector. "Government capital, in turn, gets freed up for fresh investments," the industry body added. "The proceeds, however, should be earmarked for capital investments," CII further said.

headlines: Dhawan 3rd Indian after Ganguly, Sachin to hit at least 3 tons in WC
text: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan has become the third Indian batsman after Sachin Tendulkar and Sourav Ganguly to smash at least three hundreds in World Cup. The 33-year-old, who hit two hundreds in 2015 World Cup, reached the three-figure mark in 95 balls against Australia in the 2019 World Cup on Sunday. Overall, it was the 33-year-old's 17th ODI hundred.

headlines: Audience is now ready for something unconventional: Taapsee
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said audience is now ready for "unconventional" content. "The concept of not taking your brain to the theatre is slowly going out of the window. People want to take the brain to the theatre," she added. Taapsee further said a lot of waking up has happened after her film 'Badla'.

headlines: Time will tell if Imran, Avantika will reconcile: Actor's mom-in-law
text: Actor Imran Khan's mother-in-law Vandana Malik, on being asked if there is possibility of a reconciliation between Imran and Avantika, said, "Only time will determine that." "There is no change. There is no update," she added. Imran and Avantika are reportedly going through a rough phase in their marriage and reports have also said that they will get divorced.

headlines: Actor Chris Pratt gets married to Arnold Schwarzenegger's daughter
text: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt, known for his role in 'Guardians of the Galaxy', got married to Arnold Schwarzenegger's daughter, author Katherine Schwarzenegger on Saturday. Pictures from the wedding ceremony, which took place in California, also surfaced online. This is Katherine's first marriage while it is the second marriage for Chris, who was earlier married to actress Anna Faris.

headlines: Rohit fastest to 2,000 ODI runs vs a team, breaks Sachin's record
text: India opener Rohit Sharma has become the fastest batsman to score 2,000 runs against a particular team in ODIs, achieving the feat against Australia during his 57-run knock in their World Cup match today. The 32-year-old reached the milestone in 37 innings, breaking the record held by Sachin Tendulkar, who reached 2,000 ODI runs also against Australia in 40 innings.

headlines: Rohit, Dhawan become most successful opening pair vs Aus in ODIs
text: Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan have become the most successful opening pair against Australia in ODI cricket, overtaking the tally of 1,152 runs achieved by West Indies pair of Gordon Greenidge and Desmond Haynes. Rohit and Dhawan achieved the feat during the 2019 World Cup match against Australia on Sunday, breaking the previous record in seven fewer innings (22 innings).

headlines: Fan flaunts 'balidaan' badge at stadium during India's match vs Aus
text: An Indian fan was seen flaunting Indian Army's 'Balidaan' (sacrifice) badge in the stands at the stadium during India's match against Australia in 2019 World Cup today. This comes after ICC denied MS Dhoni permission to continue wearing the wicketkeeping gloves sporting the badge. Dhoni was seen sporting the badge against South Africa in India's first 2019 World Cup match.

headlines: Vaughan trolls Australia over lack of support in WC match vs India
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan took to Twitter to troll Australia over lack of support for them in the stands in the 2019 World Cup match against India at The Oval on Sunday. "So far I have seen 33 Aussie supporters in the Ground at the Oval and that includes the Team and support staff...!!!! #CWC19," he wrote.

headlines: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) to be BJP ally only in Bihar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led Janata Dal (United) will not be a part of BJP-led National Democratic Alliance outside the state of Bihar, the party decided during their National Executive meet on Sunday. JD(U) will fight the upcoming elections in J&K, Jharkhand, Haryana & Delhi alone. This comes after JD(U) opted out of Union Cabinet in protest against getting one ministry.

headlines: Bike-borne assailants fire at news channel's team at 1.30 AM
text: Two bike-borne assailants fired at a vehicle in which two ABP News journalists were travelling at around 1.30 AM on Sunday at Delhi's Barapullah flyover. The bullets hit the car and the journalists, who were reportedly travelling to cover news on a murder, escaped unhurt, police said. Three policemen on picket duty have been suspended for lack of prompt response.

headlines: 10-yr-old Dalit girl abducted, raped & killed in UP cremation ground
text: A 10-year-old Dalit girl was allegedly kidnapped, raped and murdered in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district on Saturday. Her body was found without any clothes at a cremation ground by some villagers, with injury marks on her private parts and around neck. The girl was sleeping next to her mother outside her house before she disappeared, her father told the police.

headlines: 8-yr-old girl raped & killed in Madhya Pradesh, body found in drain
text: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh and her body was found in a drain on Sunday morning. Six policemen were suspended after the locals protested against them for not acting. MP Home Minister Bala Bachchan said the accused has been identified, his location has also been traced and he will be arrested soon.

headlines: Russian sailors sunbathe during near collision with US warship
text: Russian sailors were spotted sunbathing on the deck of their warship during a close encounter with a US warship in the East China Sea. The near collision between the two destroyers, USS Chancellorsville and Admiral Vinogradov, occurred on Friday. Following the close encounter the US said, "We consider Russia's actions during this interaction as unsafe and unprofessional."

headlines: Had to convince everyone to let me bat at 3: Shakib after ton
text: After hitting a ton in Bangladesh's World Cup 2019 match against hosts England, Bangladeshi all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan said that he had to convince everyone in the dressing room to let him bat at the number three position. "Because if I don't score runs in a single match, they would think he should be batting at number five," Shakib added.

headlines: Suresh Raina backs MS Dhoni on Balidan-badge row
text: Suresh Raina on Friday backed his Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni on his decision to sport the 'Balidan' badge on his gloves in the team's match against South Africa at the World Cup 2019 on June 5. "We all love our country & that's exactly @msdhoni has done, saluting the sacrifices of our heroes & honouring them," Raina wrote.

headlines: Google Search top results to show only two listings from a website
text: Google Search has announced that it won't show users over two listings from the same website in the top results to provide more site diversity in search results. Google may show over two in cases where its systems determine it is relevant for a search. "It's not going to be perfect...we'll keep working to improve," Google said.

headlines: iOS 13 to show locations where apps tracked users: Report
text: Apple's iOS 13 will present popup notifications which will show users a map of the location data a specific app has tracked, 9to5Mac reported. The notification also reportedly presents the apps reason for needing location data. Apple had announced that iOS 13 would feature one-time location-sharing option and give more information on when apps are using location in the background.

headlines: Goa govt's GoaMiles not opposing Ola, Uber: GoaMiles Executive
text: Goa government launched app-based taxi service GoaMiles' executive Hemant Prabhu Chodnekar has said, "GoaMiles is not opposing Ola or Uber. That is the decision of the government at the end of the day." "We support technology, we believe in technology," Chodnekar added. Goa's private taxi associations have been at loggerheads with GoaMiles, accusing it of encroaching on their livelihood.

headlines: 4 killed as wall of abandoned rice mill collapses in Odisha
text: At least four people were killed and several others were injured after a wall of an abandoned rice mill collapsed in Odisha's Dhenkanal. The wall became shaky following bouts of rains over the last few days, a police official said. He added, "The laterite bricks came down crashing on the traders and others who were near it."

headlines: Goa taking all precautions against Nipah virus: Health Minister
text: Amid Nipah virus scare in Kerala, Goa Health Minister Vishwajit P Rane said that the state government is taking all the precautions to counter it. He added, "Goa's health director will take all necessary steps in public interest and the health secretary will monitor it." Rane urged people to consult a doctor if they notice any symptoms of the virus.

headlines: Govt planning ICAI-like national institute for valuers
text: Corporate Affairs Secretary Injeti Srinivas has said the government is considering setting up a national institute for valuers on the lines of chartered accountants' apex body ICAI. Srinivas further urged the Registered Valuer Organisations (RVO), currently eleven in number, to develop a code of conduct for the valuers. Valuation professionals are qualified to determine the value of an asset.

headlines: Sitharaman to meet economists for pre-Budget consultations
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to meet economists, banks, financial institutions and industry chambers between June 11-June 23 as part of pre-Budget consultations. The government has also sought inputs on the Union Budget 2019-20 from citizens on the 'mygov.in' portal. The Budget will have to address issues such as slowing economy, rising non-performing assets (NPAs) and job creation.

headlines: Whistleblower sought to uncover IL&FS fraud in 2017: SFIO
text: Fraudulent activities at IL&FS could've been uncovered through a 2017 whistleblower complaint but were covered up by top management in connivance with independent directors, a Serious Fraud Investigation Office investigation revealed. The audit committee failed to act properly regarding the complaint, it added. The IL&FS scam was uncovered last year after group entities defaulted on repayments.

headlines: We must fix imbalances in aviation taxation: SpiceJet chief
text: Low-cost carrier SpiceJet's Chairman Ajay Singh has said imbalances in regulatory and taxation structure for the aviation sector need to be corrected. "We need to get...aviation turbine fuel (ATF) under the GST [and] build India into a global aviation hub," he added. "We have the opportunity to be the service centre of the world for aviation," Singh further said.

headlines: My parents found out I married Sophie from the internet: Joe Jonas
text: Singer Joe Jonas has revealed that his parents found out he got married to actress Sophie Turner in Las Vegas after video clips of his wedding surfaced on the internet. "[My parents] have an amazing restaurant in North Carolina, and...a couple of their staff walked up and were, like, 'Congratulations! I saw'...So I was doing a lot of...apologising," Joe added.

headlines: Fan touches Ranbir's feet after meeting him, video goes viral
text: A video of a fan touching Ranbir Kapoor's feet while giving him gifts at a hotel has gone viral. The actor, who's in Varanasi for shooting, can be seen sitting on the sofa, while the fan follows him and crouches near him on the floor. Many social media users called Ranbir "rude" for not offering the fan a seat.

headlines: No one wanted to rent me an apartment as I was single actor: Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu, while opening up on her struggling days in Mumbai, revealed, "My struggle was more in terms of finding a house because nobody was ready to give a single actor an apartment to rent." "Apparently, they don't really trust the kind of job we do," she added. Taapsee further said she didn't face this when she was in Hyderabad.

headlines: Afghan captain Naib responds after Rashid Khan fails concussion test
text: After Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan failed the concussion test after getting hit on the helmet in 2019 World Cup match against New Zealand on Saturday, Afghanistan captain Gulbadin Naib said he is confident that Rashid will play the next match. "He is well. Afghani people are strong," Naib added. Rashid didn't bowl against New Zealand after failing the concussion test.

headlines: Think before you talk: Gavaskar to Indians demanding WC boycott
text: After a reporter told Sunil Gavaskar that several Indians want India to boycott World Cup if MS Dhoni isn't allowed to wear the 'balidaan' badge, the former captain said, "Do whatever you want." "Who'll win World Cup for you if they return? Have you thought of this? You just talk for the sake of talking...Think before you talk," he added.

headlines: Ukrainian footballer kisses female reporter on live TV after victory
text: Ukraine footballer Oleksandr Zinchenko celebrated his team's 5-0 victory against Serbia on Friday by planting a kiss directly on the cheek of female journalist Vlada Sedan live on television. The reporter was seen blushing following the kiss. Several social media users reacted in disgust at the kiss, before others pointed out that the two were close friends.

headlines: Kejriwal asked AAP workers to choose between me and him: Alka Lamba
text: AAP MLA Alka Lamba on Saturday tweeted that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal asked party workers to choose between the party and her. She accused the AAP convener of "dividing" the party at a time when keeping it together is important. Alka further said that Kejriwal had told party workers "whoever wants to leave, can leave...this party is mine".

headlines: Rahul meets nurse who was present during his birth; pic shared online
text: During his visit to Wayanad, Congress President Rahul Gandhi met Rajamma, a nurse who was present during his birth at a Delhi hospital. "I gave him sweets and chips made by myself," the retired nurse said. "The hands that received little Rahul five decades back embraced him again today," Leader of Opposition Ramesh Chennithala wrote while sharing their picture.

headlines: PM Modi 1st foreign leader to visit SL after blasts
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday arrived in Sri Lanka, becoming first foreign leader to visit the country after the blasts that killed over 250 people. "Cowardly acts of terror cannot defeat the spirit of Sri Lanka," PM Modi said while paying tribute to victims. "PM Modi's visit shows India's humane approach," Sri Lankan High Commissioner to India Austin Fernando said.

headlines: Headless body of woman found in box near Delhi's metro station
text: The headless body of an unidentified woman, wrapped in a blanket, was found in a box loaded on a bicycle near northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri metro station on Saturday evening, police said. The extent of decomposition suggested that she was killed two-three days earlier, added police. "There were no identification proofs in the box," an official said.

headlines: Iran closes 547 restaurants for breaking 'Islamic principles
text: Iranian police have shut down 547 restaurants and cafes in Tehran for not observing "Islamic principles", the capital's police chief Hossein Rahimi said on Saturday. "Observing Islamic principles is one of the police's main missions and responsibilities," the police chief said. The police reportedly carried out the operation over the past 10 days.

headlines: I wish I hadn't done that: UK PM candidate admits taking cocaine
text: Michael Gove, a leading contender to replace British Prime Minister Theresa May, said he had used cocaine and has "deep regrets" about taking the drug on several occasions. "I look back and I think I wish I hadn't done that," he added. Gove further said he hoped that the disclosure would not prevent him being appointed the next Prime Minister.

headlines: Dhoni should wear Army 'sacrifice' badge on bat: Virender Sehwag
text: Ex-India cricketer Virender Sehwag has said MS Dhoni should wear the Indian Army 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge on his bat instead of wicketkeeping gloves with permission from ICC. He further urged fans to watch Team India's matches at World Cup while keeping 'balidaan' badge with them and share photos on social media to show their protest.

headlines: If Rahul wants to leave, he must find replacement: Moily
text: Congress leader Veerappa Moily said that if Rahul Gandhi wants to leave the party President's post then he must find a "right person" as a replacement. He added there was dissent when Sonia Gandhi took over as party President, but later it turned out to be fruitful. Moily said, "The unity and integrity of democracy are closely linked to Congress."

headlines: We are fighting poison at national level: Rahul in Wayanad
text: During his three-day visit to Kerala's Wayanad, Congress President Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi saying, "We are fighting poison at the national level." Addressing people of his constituency, Rahul alleged that PM Modi represents the "worst sentiments" of this country. Rahul further thanked the people of Wayanad for their support and asserted that he will "fight for their issues".

headlines: New 'rain-loving' snake species, genus discovered in Mizoram
text: A new black and white zigzag-patterned "rain-loving" snake species was discovered in Mizoram's capital Aizawl. The snake, named 'Smithophis atemporalis', marks the discovery of not just a new species but a new genus in itself from northeast India, researchers revealed. It belongs to the family Colubridae, the largest family of snakes with over 1,700 species.

headlines: Happy to be back: PM Modi on arrival in Sri Lanka
text: While en route to India from the Maldives, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday arrived in Sri Lanka (his third visit since 2015), following which he said that he was "happy to be back" in the country. Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe received PM Modi at the Colombo Airport. PM Modi also paid tribute to Easter attack victims in the country.

headlines: Patients being treated on floor due to lack of beds in UP hospital
text: Patients were being treated on the floor at Uttar Pradesh's Rampur District Hospital due to lack of proper bed facilities. Patients were seen lying on the floor, while the drip bottles were seen hung on the windows. "Some patients insist on being admitted, so the number of patients at the hospital has increased," Chief Medical Officer (CMO) BS Nagar said.

headlines: 34 arrested, 3,305 kg ganja seized in Odisha
text: As many as 34 people were arrested and 3,305 kilograms of ganja was seized by the police in Odisha's Malkangiri. "We suspect the contraband was being taken to neighbouring Chhattisgarh," Malkangiri Superintendent of Police Jagmohan Meena said. Of those arrested, 17 were from Malkangiri, 11 from Nabarangpur, five from Koraput and one from Chhattisgarh.

headlines: Uttar Pradesh government transfers 17 IAS officers
text: Days after the conclusion of Lok Sabha elections, the Uttar Pradesh government has transferred 17 Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officers. The government changed the District Magistrates of many districts including Azamgarh, Barabanki, Sultanpur and Firozabad. Also, District Magistrate of Chitrakoot, Vishak G was named the Special Secretary of state CM Yogi Adityanath.

headlines: I'm Indian, will remain one: Ex-Army man declared 'foreigner'
text: After his release from a detention centre in Assam, former Army officer and Kargil War veteran Mohammed Sanaullah, who was declared as a foreigner, on Saturday said, "I'm an Indian and will remain an Indian." He also thanked the Gauhati High Court for granting him bail. Sanaullah was declared a foreigner by Boko Foreigners' Tribunal in Assam on May 23.

headlines: 14 children die of Encephalitis in Bihar, many hospitalised
text: As many as 14 children have died due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in Bihar's Muzaffarpur and many were hospitalised with the symptoms of the infection. "We've received 38 patients so far, most of them have...deficiency of glucose in their blood," a hospital official said. Encephalitis is a viral infection, which causes mild flu-like symptoms such as fever or headache.

headlines: Trump deal with Mexico a win for 'hostage-taking': Ex-WTO chief
text: Former World Trade Organisation chief Pascal Lamy has said that the migration deal imposed on Mexico by US President Donald Trump was a victory for "hostage-taking" over international rules. Trump has indefinitely suspended planned tariffs against Mexico after it agreed to curb immigration through its border to the US. Meanwhile, Trump said Mexico would strongly enforce the new deal.

headlines: Pringles India enters Guinness World Records
text: Pringles India entered Guinness World Records on June 7 for creating the 'largest sentence made with packaged food'. The message read #GetItBackIndia and the structure was created with a life size installation made out of 10,005 cans of Pringles, measuring 60 feet x 40 feet.
