Interestingly, the brand achieved this feat alongside the ongoing Cricket World Cup.

headlines: Joe Jonas almost kissed my body double on GoT sets: Wife Sophie
text: Actress Sophie Turner has revealed her husband Joe Jonas once mistook her body double for her on the sets of Game of Thrones. "He went up to her...and tried to give her a kiss and he was like, 'Oh, sorry, sorry it's not Sophie, wrong one!'," she added. "She looked so much like me, it was insane," she further said.

headlines: Smriti Irani shares Army's 'Balidan' badge amid MS Dhoni's glove row
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday shared a picture of Army's 'Balidan' (Sacrifice) badge amid the ongoing controversy over cricketer MS Dhoni sporting the symbol on his gloves in the World Cup. "We don't exist so that you can," the text on the image shared by Irani read. Dhoni wore the gloves during a match against South Africa in England.

headlines: Jofra Archer clean bowls Bangladesh batsman, ball goes for a 'six'
text: The ball went beyond the boundary rope without even bouncing once after England fast bowler Jofra Archer clean bowled opener Soumya Sarkar in Bangladesh's fourth over during their 2019 World Cup match on Saturday. Archer's 143-kmph delivery clipped the top of off-stump and flew beyond the boundary rope. Sarkar was bowled out for 2 runs off 8 balls.

headlines: NZ beat bottom-placed Afghanistan to record 3rd straight win in WC
text: New Zealand defeated bottom-placed Afghanistan by 7 wickets on Saturday to register their third straight victory in the 2019 World Cup. The match witnessed Kiwi all-rounder Jimmy Neesham take his international career's first ever five-wicket haul. Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan did not bowl in the match after failing concussion test after being hit on helmet while batting.

headlines: England beat B'desh in a World Cup match for first time since 2007
text: England defeated Bangladesh by 106 runs to register their first victory against the Asian team in World Cup since their victory in the 2007 edition. Bangladesh had defeated England by two wickets and 15 runs in the 2011 and 2015 editions respectively. Further, it was the biggest victory (by runs) in the tournament so far.

headlines: ICC's job is to run cricket, not to see who's wearing what: Gambhir
text: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir has defended MS Dhoni for wearing wicketkeeping gloves with Indian Army 'balidaan' (sacrifice) symbol on it. "The ICC's job is to run cricket in the right way, not to see who is wearing gloves and the logo on it," he said. "The entire logo issue is being unnecessarily given importance,' he further said.

headlines: Steve Smith world's best batsman in all 3 formats: Aaron Finch
text: Australia ODI captain Aaron Finch has said that his predecessor Steve Smith is the world's best batsman across all three formats. Finch added that Smith's performance against West Indies on Thursday was an example of how the batsman dealt with pressure situations. Smith has scored 10,152 runs in his international career so far.

headlines: I am not the captain, I have no idea: Rohit on Dhoni's gloves row
text: On being asked about ICC's decision to not allow MS Dhoni wear gloves with Indian Army 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge, Team India vice-captain Rohit Sharma said that he has no idea about it. "I am not the captain. I don't know what is happening with that and have nothing to say about it. Let's see what happens tomorrow," he added.

headlines: Indian-American activist who shouted at Amazon CEO Bezos arrested
text: A 30-year-old Indian-American animal rights activist Priya Sawhney was arrested on Thursday after interrupting and shouting at Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos during 're:MARS' conference, on trespassing and burglary charges. Sawhney asked Bezos to stop animal abuses in "Amazon's chicken farms", which she claimed she'd visited. "Please, you're the richest man on the planet. You can help the animals," she said.

headlines: NASA Administrator responds after Trump says Moon is part of Mars
text: Hours after US President Donald Trump tweeted that Moon is a part of Mars, NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine responded to him on Twitter. "As @POTUS (Trump) said, NASA is using Moon to send humans to Mars!" tweeted Jim. "Curiosity and NASA's InSight are on Mars and will soon be joined by the Mars 2020 rover and Mars helicopter," Jim added.

headlines: Rave party busted in Delhi farmhouse; drugs and liquor seized
text: The Delhi Police along with the Excise Department busted a rave party at a farmhouse in Chhatarpur on Saturday. Police said liquor, hookahs and drugs were being served illegally at the farmhouse. The police has detained 16 people. Last month, around 161 men and 31 women were arrested from a rave party being held illegally at a farmhouse in Noida.

headlines: Won't leave OPEC despite being treated like enemy by members: Iran
text: Iran has no plans to leave the OPEC despite being treated like an enemy by two members, Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh said. Zanganeh did not name the two countries. Tensions between Iran and Saudi Arabia and the UAE escalated this year after the two said they would increase oil production to offset the gap created by US sanctions on Iran.

headlines: Real Madrid sign Chelsea's Eden Hazard on five-year deal
text: Spanish club Real Madrid have signed Belgian international Eden Hazard from English side Chelsea on a five-year-long contract. Hazard, who arrived at Chelsea from French club LOSC Lille in 2012, leaves Chelsea after winning six major trophies in seven years. Hazard is Real Madrid's second signing this summer after signing Frankfurt striker Luka Jovic.

headlines: Shah principal of college where Prashant is student: Vijayvargiya
text: Taking a dig at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for engaging election strategist Prashant Kishor for 2021 state Assembly polls, BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said, "BJP President Amit Shah is the principal of the college in which Prashant is still a student." He added, "there's no bigger poll strategist than Shah". Vijayvargiya said, "Bengal people have lost...faith in Mamata."

headlines: Mamata should work in cohesion with Centre: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that instead of boycotting the NITI Aayog meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee should work in cohesion with the Centre for the welfare of the people. He claimed that if Mamata continued to work like that, she'd face its consequences in the Assembly elections. Thakur said Mamata should learn from TMC's performance in general polls.

headlines: Will accept court's ruling: Ex-Army man declared 'foreigner'
text: Retired Army veteran Mohammed Sanaullah who was declared a foreigner was released from the detention camp in Assam on Saturday. "I'm very thankful to the honourable high court. I have full faith in the judicial system and will accept whatever judgment the court gives in my case," he said. The Foreigners Tribunal declared Sanaullah a non-citizen on May 23.

headlines: Mekathoti Sucharitha appointed as Andhra Pradesh Home Minister
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Saturday appointed Mekathoti Sucharitha as the new Home Minister of the state. She is the first woman home minister in the remaining state of Andhra Pradesh formed after Telangana was carved out in 2014. Sucharitha represents Prathipadu (SC) reserved constituency in Guntur district.

headlines: 1 in every 10 men in Nepal gets married underage: UNICEF
text: In Nepal, one in every 10 men aged between 20 and 24 was married as a child, UNICEF said in its report. Nepal has been ranked 10th in the world's top 10 countries where child marriage is rampant among boys. It's the only country in South Asia with a significant prevalence of child marriage among both boys and girls.

headlines: Trump scraps tariffs on Mexico after it agrees to curb immigration
text: US President Donald Trump has indefinitely suspended planned tariffs against Mexico after it agreed to curb immigration through its border to the US. "Mexico will try very hard, and if they do that, this will be a very successful agreement," Trump said. Trump had announced to impose 5% tariffs on all Mexican goods, threatening to increase them up to 25%.

headlines: Bangladesh man held for plotting attack on New York's Times Square
text: Ashiqul Alam, a 22-year-old Bangladeshi citizen who is a green card holder, has been arrested for allegedly plotting an attack on New York's Times Square. Alam discussed his attack plans for nearly a year with an undercover federal investigator. He was arrested after trying to buy two semi-automatic pistols with defaced serial numbers from an undercover officer.

headlines: Once a cricketer, Ashleigh wins French Open women's singles title
text: World number eight Ashleigh Barty defeated 19-year-old Czech Markéta Vondrouová in straight sets to win French Open and her first Grand Slam title on Saturday. The 23-year-old Australian, who played as a cricketer in women's Big Bash League in 2015 and 2016, won with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3. Both the players were playing their maiden Grand Slam final.

headlines: Ananya denies faking USC admission, shares acceptance letter
text: Actress Ananya Panday, daughter of actor Chunky Panday, took to Instagram to rubbish rumours that she faked her admission at University of Southern California. This comes after a girl claiming to be her schoolmate claimed that Ananya had never applied for any foreign university. "It's never okay to bully anyone," wrote Ananya, sharing acceptance letter from the university.

headlines: Net bowler hospitalised after getting hit on head by Warner's shot
text: Jai Kishan, a British fast bowler of Indian origin, was hospitalised after getting hit on the head trying to stop a David Warner shot during Australia's net practice ahead of their 2019 World Cup match against India. David Warner called off his training session and was seen sitting near the collapsed bowler as assistant coach Ricky Ponting comforted him.

headlines: England 1st team in ODI history to score seven 300+ totals in a row
text: England have become the first team in ODIs to score seven 300-plus totals in a row, achieving the feat against Bangladesh in 2019 World Cup on Saturday. England scored 386/6 in 50 overs, with Jason Roy top-scoring with 153 runs off 121 balls including 14 fours and 5 sixes. It is also England's highest ever total in World Cup history.

headlines: Thiem beats Djokovic to set up French Open final with Nadal
text: World number four Dominic Thiem beat world number one Novak Djokovic in five sets to reach his second straight French Open final. The 25-year-old Austrian won with a scoreline of 6-2, 3-6, 7-5, 5-7, 7-5 in four hours and 13 minutes across two days due to inclement weather. He will now face defending champion Rafael Nadal in the final tomorrow.

headlines: 3 Indian-origin techies among richest self-made women in US: Forbes
text: Three Indian-origin techies have featured in Forbes list of America's 80 richest self-made women. Ranked 18th with $1.4 billion net worth, Jayshree Ullal is CEO of computer networking firm Arista Networks, and Neerja Sethi, ranked 23rd with $1 billion net worth, cofounded IT consulting firm Syntel. Neha Narkhede has been ranked 60th with a net worth of $360 million.

headlines: World's first infinity pool with 360-degree view to open in London
text: London is set to get the world's first infinity pool with a 360-degree view atop a 55-storey building and its construction may begin as early as 2020. Compass Pools, a UK-based pool manufacturer, has unveiled its design for a 6,00,000-litre pool 'Infinity London'. Swimmers will enter or exit through a rotating spiral staircase that rises from the pool floor.

headlines: Magnetism discovered in Earth's mantle, reveal researchers
text: An international team of researchers demonstrated that a form of iron oxide, hematite, can retain its magnetic properties deep down in Earth's mantle, up to a temperature of around 925°C. The temperature is comparable to relatively cold tectonic plates, mainly beneath the western Pacific Ocean. Earth's mantle isn't nearly as "magnetically dead" as has so far been assumed, researchers said.

headlines: 4 including main accused in 2.5-yr-old Aligarh girl's murder arrested
text: Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh SSP on Saturday said that the four accused, including main accused Zahid and his wife, have been arrested for the murder of the 2.5-year-old girl. "Body was wrapped in a cloth belonging to Zahid's wife," said police. "We've met victim family and they've demanded that the accused should be hanged till death," the SSP added.

headlines: 5-year-old girl raped and murdered, body found in river in MP's Ujjain
text: A five-year-old girl, whose body was found floating in a river in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Friday afternoon, was raped and murdered, the police confirmed on Saturday. The girl, who went to sleep with her family, went missing, following which her parents contacted the police. A flower vendor living adjacent to the family's shanty confessed to the crime.

headlines: US campaign against Huawei may lead to real wars: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that US tactics such as a campaign against China's Huawei will lead to trade wars and possibly real wars. The US is attempting to "impose its jurisdiction across the entire world," Putin added. Huawei, which US considers a security threat, has signed a deal with MTS to develop a 5G network in Russia.

headlines: SL intel chief fired after he says Prez was warned about attack
text: Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena has fired the country's chief of national intelligence Sisira Mendis after he testified that Sirisena was warned about a possible attack before the Easter Sunday blasts. Mendis had also said that the security council meetings were held irregularly. Sri Lanka had previously admitted they had intelligence reports on the attack threats but failed to respond.

headlines: Delhi court allows Kochhar's brother-in-law to leave India
text: A Delhi court has directed the authorities concerned to withdraw the lookout circular against Rajiv Kochhar, brother-in-law of former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar, in an alleged bank loan fraud and money laundering case. He was allowed to return to Singapore, where he is currently based. Rajiv should furnish fresh itinerary and give his address in Singapore and contact numbers.

headlines: PM Modi gives bat signed by Team India to Maldives President
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented the President of Maldives Ibrahim Mohamed Solih a cricket bat signed by Team India playing at the ICC World Cup 2019. Among other requests presented by the Maldives, India has agreed to help construct a cricket stadium in the island nation. BCCI officials had visited Maldives in May in order to help the game grow.

headlines: Hazard pens farewell letter after signing for Real Madrid
text: Belgian forward Eden Hazard penned a farewell letter and posted on Instagram after leaving Chelsea for Real Madrid on Saturday. "It's no secret that it was my dream to play for them since I was a young boy just scoring my first goal," Hazard wrote. "Leaving Chelsea is the biggest and toughest decision in my career to date," Hazard added.

headlines: Apple re-releases original Mac's font from 35 years ago for free
text: Apple has re-released a font that was first launched when its original Macintosh computer debuted 35 years ago in 1984, to download for free. The Macintosh contained a series of fonts named after famous cities, of which the New York font has now been relaunched. The font is, however, limited to use in mockups and Apple-related apps only.

headlines: With 7 MLAs in Telangana, AIMIM to demand LoP post
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday said that his party would soon request for Leader of Opposition (LoP) post. "Would request the Speaker of Telangana for the post because we have seven MLAs in the state, making us the second biggest party," he added. This comes after 12 of the 18 Congress MLAs on Thursday joined Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS).

headlines: J&K BJP President claims he is on Hizbul Mujahideen hit list
text: Jammu and Kashmir BJP President Ravinder Raina has claimed he is on the hit list of the terror outfit Hizbul Mujahideen, as per local police. Raina said he receives death threats from various locations in Pakistan warning him that he'll meet the same fate as Rising Kashmir's Shujaat Bukhari. The intelligence agencies have also been put on high alert.

headlines: Kerala didnt vote BJP but it's as much mine as Varanasi: PM
text: While addressing his first public meeting in Kerala after assuming office for the second term, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said Kerala didn't vote for BJP but "it's as much mine as is Varanasi". "Those who made us win and those who didn't are all ours," he added. PM also promised support to Kerala in dealing with Nipah virus crisis.

headlines: NASA Mars helicopter enters final test stage for 2020 launch
text: NASA has revealed its Mars Helicopter has entered the final phase of testing before its scheduled launch aboard the space agency's Mars rover in July 2020. The small, autonomous helicopter will be the first vehicle in history to attempt to establish viability of heavier-than-air vehicles flying on another planet, NASA said. It is expected to reach Mars in February 2021.

headlines: UP Police arrests Delhi journo for FB post against Adityanath
text: Delhi journalist Prashant Kanojia was arrested by UP Police from his Delhi residence, on Saturday, over a social media post against UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Kanojia recently posted a video on Twitter and Facebook of a woman speaking about wanting to marry Adityanath. Reportedly, an FIR was registered against him by a sub-inspector at Lucknow's Hazratganj police station on Friday.

headlines: He's good actor but being Prez is different: Putin on Ukraine Prez
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin called his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelensky "a good actor" but added his current role as the head of a state is very different from his previous profession. "I don't know (Zelensky), but hope we'll get to know each other at some point," Putin added. Notably, Zelensky had played the role of a president on his show.

headlines: PM Modi arrives in Maldives on first foreign visit of second term
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday arrived in the Maldives on his first overseas visit after assuming the office for a second term. He will hold talks with President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih. On Friday, PM thanked Solih for inviting him and tweeted, "India views the Maldives as a valued partner with whom we share deep bonds of history and culture."

headlines: If I had to do steamy scene, I'd do it with Varun: Ananya
text: Actress Ananya Panday, in a recent interview, revealed that she would choose Varun Dhawan if she had to do an intimate scene in a film with an actor of her choice. "I do have a crush on him, I have always said it but I have many crushes," the actress added. Ananya further said that she finds Varun "very hot".

headlines: Soil from Virat Kohli's school sent to London as blessing for him
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli's school Vishal Bharti Public School in Delhi's Paschim Vihar, where he learnt to play cricket, is sending soil from its premises to London to bless him. The host broadcaster of the World Cup revealed the news and shared a picture on Twitter. "India mein bas emotions bikte hai," a user tweeted reacting to the post.

headlines: Google seeking exemption from US ban on Huawei: Report
text: Google is reportedly in talks with the US government to exempt it from the ban on Chinese smartphone maker Huawei over alleged espionage concerns. Google reportedly claimed Huawei's dependence on Android is good for the US. It also reportedly argued the ban could lead to increased national security risks as Huawei's yet-to-come operating system could be more susceptible to hacking.

headlines: Space exploration necessary to save the Earth: Jeff Bezos
text: World's richest person, aerospace startup Blue Origin's Founder Jeff Bezos has said, "The reason we go to space, in my view, is to save the Earth." This comes weeks after the Amazon CEO unveiled a two-storey-tall prototype of Blue Origin's lunar lander, Blue Moon, to carry humans to space. "We need to move heavy industry off Earth," Bezos further added.

headlines: Hope Mamata attends NITI meet: VC after she calls body 'powerless'
text: NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has expressed hope that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will attend its Governing Council meet to be chaired by PM Narendra Modi on June 15. Mamata had called NITI a "powerless institution" having no "financial powers to support state plans". "I am still hoping that she will accept my personal invitation," Kumar said.

headlines: PM Modi awarded Maldives' highest honour for foreign dignitaries
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Saturday conferred the Maldives' highest honour accorded to foreign dignitaries, 'The Most Honourable Order of the Distinguished Rule of Nishan Izzuddeen', during his visit to the island nation. PM Modi is visiting the Maldives as part of his first diplomatic foreign visit after he assumed office for a second term.

headlines: Jet's fuel tank catches fire after getting detached at Goa airport
text: Flying operations at Goa airport were suspended temporarily on Saturday afternoon after one of the MiG 29K fighter jet's fuel tanks got detached on its own and caught fire. The Indian Navy took to Twitter to share pictures of the incident, showing thick black smoke rising over the runway. The jet and the pilot are safe, the Navy said.

headlines: Who is Saket Kumar, IAS appointed as Amit Shah's Private Secretary?
text: Saket Kumar, a 2009-batch IAS officer of the Bihar cadre, has been appointed as private secretary to Union Home Minister Amit Shah until July 2023. In 2018, Kumar was appointed as private secretary to Manoj Sinha, who was MoS (Independent Charge) for Communications and MoS Railways at the time. A native of Madhubani, Kumar secured AIR 13 in UPSC exam.

headlines: Soldiers at Siachen break open eggs with hammer, show juice 'brick'
text: A video has emerged online that shows soldiers posted at the Siachen Glacier breaking open eggs with a hammer, demonstrating their living conditions at sub-zero temperatures. A soldier can be seen tearing open a fruit juice packet and revealing it to have become like a rock-solid brick. Temperatures at the Siachen Glacier can drop up to -70°C.

headlines: Caribbean nation with 1L population smallest ever to win UNSC seat
text: The Caribbean nation of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, having a population of around 1.1 lakh, has become the smallest ever nation to be elected to the United Nations Security Council. Four other nations, namely, Estonia, Niger, Tunisia, Viet Nam, were also elected for a two-year term. These countries will take up their seats as non-permanent members in January 2020.

headlines: Game of Thrones author Martin working on video game: Report
text: George RR Martin, the author of 'A Song of Ice and Fire' book series which contains the novel 'Game of Thrones', is reportedly co-working on a video game "Elden Ring". The game will reportedly let players explore kingdoms, where killing rulers unlocks their special abilities and supernatural powers. It'll reportedly be released for Xbox One, PS4 and PC.

headlines: Thanks for the outfit: Shahid on wearing similar outfit as Katrina
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture of himself, in which he is seen wearing a striped pant suit which is very similar to one worn earlier by Katrina Kaif. "Thanks for the outfit Katrina," he wrote in the picture's caption. Commenting on Shahid's picture, Katrina wrote, "Yeh twinning."

headlines: India to play 5 T20Is, 3 ODIs, 2 Tests in New Zealand in 2020
text: India is set to play five T20Is against New Zealand in New Zealand between January 24 and February 2. The T20Is will be followed by three ODIs between February 5 and 11. After the limited-over series, India and New Zealand will play two Tests in Wellington and Christchurch between February 21 and March 4.

headlines: Messi scores brace in Argentina's friendly win over Nicaragua
text: Lionel Messi scored his fastest ever brace for his country in Argentina's win over Nicaragua in a friendly between the sides ahead of the Copa America. Argentina went on to win the match by a 5-1 margin. Meanwhile, Messi's Barcelona teammate Luis Suarez scored with a free kick in the 69th minute of Uruguay's 3-0 win over Panama.

headlines: Pathan brothers' cricket academy opens branch in Hisar
text: The Cricket Academy of Pathans, a cricket academy run by Indian cricketers Irfan and Yusuf Pathan, opened a branch in Hisar, Haryana. Cricket Academy of Pathans is present in around 20 Indian cities. Yusuf, who serves as the Director at the Cricket Academy of Pathans, said, "We are providing every possible assistance to the aspiring cricketers."

headlines: BJP workers, police clash at BJP MP's rally in West Bengal
text: A clash broke out between BJP workers and police officials in West Bengal's Gangarampur on Saturday during the victory rally for party MP Dilip Ghosh. The violence triggered after the police allegedly stopped the BJP from carrying out the rally, citing "lack of permission". As per reports, several police officials and BJP workers were injured in the clash.

headlines: Govt to award media houses for their yoga campaigns: Javadekar
text: Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar on Saturday said the government has decided to honour media houses for their contribution towards promoting healthy living through yoga. He added that 33 awards will be given, 11 each for newspaper organisations, TV and radio channels. Media campaigns on yoga from June 10 to June 25 will be considered for International Yoga Day Awards.

headlines: PM to lead main event of International Yoga Day in Ranchi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lead the main event of the fifth International Yoga Day to be held on June 21 in Ranchi, Jharkhand. Around 30,000 people are expected to participate in the main event. On June 13, a curtain-raiser will be held in Ranchi, which will be attended by several dignitaries from the state, besides yoga gurus and organisations.

headlines: Over dozen cows starve to death in UP's cow shelter: Reports
text: Over a dozen cows allegedly starved to death in a cow shelter in UP's Kannauj. While the investigation is underway, Kannauj SDM PC Srivastava on Saturday said, "I received information from Additional SP about cow deaths. The place was inspected and it was found that no cow died today." The incident has triggered protests by locals outside the cow shelter.

headlines: Teacher, her 2 kids killed in fire at a school in Faridabad
text: Three of a family, including two children, died in a fire that broke out at a private school in Haryana's Faridabad on Saturday. The teacher and her two children were reportedly living on the school premises. They were injured and got suffocated owing to dense smoke. As summer vacations are on, there were no students in the school.

headlines: IBM fires 2,000 for non-performance at 'competitive level': Report
text: US-based IT company IBM is laying off about 2,000 employees this week, The Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. The company confirmed that a "small percentage of employees" who are not performing "at a competitive level" would be leaving the company. This amounts to less than 1% of its workforce, which totalled 3,50,600 at the end of last year.

headlines: Jacqueline to play Smita Patil's role in Arth remake: Report
text: Jacqueline Fernandez has reportedly been approached to star in the upcoming remake of the 1982 film 'Arth', which saw Shabana Azmi, Smita Patil and Kulbhushan Kharbanda in lead roles. Jacqueline will play Smita Patil's role in the film, which will be directed by actress-filmmaker Revathy. The original film was directed by Mahesh Bhatt.

headlines: Akhtar shares 4-min video rant against ABD, asks him to be a man
text: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar criticised former South Africa captain AB de Villiers in a four-minute YouTube video for making himself available for World Cup despite retiring in 2018. "He should have remembered that his country needs him when he retired in 2018," Akhtar added. "Be a man and stick to your decision," he further said referring to De Villiers.

headlines: He chose money over country: Akhtar on ABD's offer to play World Cup
text: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a four-minute video, criticising ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers for making himself available for World Cup despite retiring in 2018. Akhtar alleged De Villiers chose PSL and IPL for money, while he should have kept his country as priority. "Be a man and stick to your decision," he further said referring to De Villiers.

headlines: Uber COO and CMO step down a month after IPO fails
text: Uber confirmed on Friday that its Chief Operating Officer Barney Harford and Chief Marketing Officer Rebecca Messina will depart the company. This comes a month after Uber's IPO failed. CEO Dara Khosrowshahi, who explained the departures in an email to employees, said that he wants to be even more involved in the day-to-day operations of the business.

headlines: Trump claims Moon is 'a part' of Mars; criticises NASA
text: Stating that NASA should not be talking about going to the Moon, US President Donald Trump said, "They should be focused on the much bigger things...including Mars (of which the Moon is a part), defense and science!" His criticism of NASA for "talking about going to the moon" came just three weeks after he championed the idea of lunar visit.

headlines: 20-day-old girl sleeping in mother's lap killed by goons in Gujarat
text: A 20-day-old girl, who was sleeping in her mother's lap, was killed after goons hit her head with sticks while attacking her family over an old grudge in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Police said five men attacked the 20-day-old girl's mother and two other women on Thursday. Two of the assailants have been arrested, while three are on the run, police added.

headlines: Ex-minister Aslam Khan offers to replace Rahul as Cong chief
text: Former union minister and hockey Olympian Aslam Sher Khan has offered to replace Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief for two years. Khan, who wrote a letter to Rahul, stated, "Congress needs a makeover and it needs to be realigned with the nationalist identity." He said he's suited for the job based on his experience as a politician and a player.

headlines: Amid warning of heavy rains, red alert in 4 Kerala districts
text: Amid warning of heavy rains, the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert in Thrissur district of Kerala on June 10 and in Malappuram, Ernakulam and Kozhikode districts on June 11. Further, the IMD has issued an orange alert in state capital Thiruvananthapuram, as well as Ernakulam, Kollam, Alappuzha, Malappuram, Kozhikode and Thrissur on June 9 and 10.

headlines: After delay of one week, monsoon hits Kerala coast
text: Following a week-long delay, monsoon hit the Kerala coast on Saturday, marking the commencement of the four-month rainfall season in the country. Several parts of Kerala started receiving a good amount of rainfall, India Meteorological Department announced. IMD has issued a red alert in Thrissur district on June 10 and in Malappuram, Ernakulam and Kozhikode districts on June 11.

headlines: 4 held for beating Lesbian couple over refusal to kiss each other
text: Four teenagers have been arrested for assaulting a lesbian couple on a London bus. The couple was beaten up after they refused to kiss each other. "I'm tired of being taken as sexual object, of finding out that these situations are usual," one of the women wrote on Facebook, adding, "When you stand up for yourself shit like this happens."

headlines: It's crazy time, but I love every moment: Shraddha on her career
text: While speaking about her career in Bollywood, actress Shraddha Kapoor said, "It's a crazy time." "[A]s longs as I have my sleep...and moments to meditate I feel like I can manage well. I love every moment of what I do so this is [more] exhilarating than draining," she added. Shraddha further said that sometimes she has her moments of exhaustion.

headlines: John Cena joins cast of Vin Diesel starrer Fast & Furious 9
text: WWE wrestler-turned-actor John Cena has joined the cast of the upcoming ninth instalment of the 'Fast And Furious' film franchise. Cena took to Twitter to share the news and wrote, "It's an incredible honour to join this franchise and this family." Slated to release in May 2020, the script for the film is currently being worked on.

headlines: Rishi to return to India in Sept post cancer treatment: Report
text: Rishi Kapoor, who has been undergoing treatment for cancer in New York since last year, will be returning to India in September, as per reports. While revealing that he is cancer-free, the actor recently said that he's scheduled to undergo a bone-marrow transplant which delayed his return to India. Rishi's wife Neetu accompanied him in the US during his treatment.

headlines: India releases 6 Pakistani prisoners, including 5 of a family
text: India has released six Pakistani prisoners, including a minor, who were lodged in Indian jails for overstaying their visa. Five of them belonged to the same family and are residents of Karachi. All six prisoners crossed over to Pakistan via the Attari-Wagah border after being released by the BSF on Friday.

headlines: Rohit's good form will ease pressure on Kohli, says K Srikkanth
text: Ex-India cricketer Kris Srikkanth has said opener Rohit Sharma's good form in 2019 World Cup will relieve the pressure on Virat Kohli a little. "The trio of Shikhar Dhawan, Sharma and Kohli will be crucial to India's chances so it is a great sign that Sharma got a hundred against South Africa and saw them over the line," he added.

headlines: Aussie who returned to tennis from cricket enters French Open final
text: Australian tennis player Ashleigh Barty, who played as a cricketer in the women's Big Bash League in 2015 and 2016, has reached the final of the French Open. Barty defeated US' 17-year-old player Amanda Anisimova 6-7(4-7), 6-3, 6-3 in one hour and 53 minutes. The 23-year-old will face 19-year-old Markéta Vondrouová in the final.

headlines: She called him 529 times before FIR: Delhi HC acquits man of rape
text: The Delhi High Court has upheld the acquittal of a man by a trial court in a rape case, saying the woman had called him 529 times between the date of alleged rape and the filing of the complaint. The HC said it was in agreement with trial court's view that her testimony was "unreliable", "untrustworthy" and "inspires no confidence".

headlines: Pak PM offers to resolve Kashmir issue in letter to PM Modi: Report
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan in a letter to PM Narendra Modi on Friday said his country wants talks to resolve all reconcilable problems, including the Kashmir issue, according to a media report. Khan wrote the letter a day after India said there will be no bilateral meeting between the two leaders on the sidelines of the SCO summit in Bishkek.

headlines: How did 15 lakes disappear in 4.5 years, Karnataka HC asks
text: The Karnataka High Court has sought a response from the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike as well as the state government on how 15 lakes had vanished in the past four and a half years. The court also told the authorities to submit preventive measures to be taken once a lake is cleared of encroachments.

headlines: IPS officer, accused in Bilkis Bano case, fired day before retiring
text: Gujarat cadre IPS officer RS Bhagora, who was convicted in the 2002 Bilkis Bano case, was sacked from service by Union Home Ministry on May 30, a day before his retirement. The 60-year-old officer, who was to retire on May 31, was serving as Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) with the Ahmedabad police. He was convicted for dereliction of duty.

headlines: Born without hands, Kerala girl writes with feet, gets A+ in 10th
text: Devika, a girl from Kerala who was born without hands, has scored A+ in all subjects in the 10th grade exams. The student, who was felicitated by Kerala Police Chief Lokanath Behera, was taught to write with her feet by her mother. The daughter of a senior civil police officer, Devika has chosen to pursue Humanities in Class XI.

headlines: Aged woman thrashed by son's wife; Haryana CM shares video
text: A video of an elderly woman being thrashed by her daughter-in-law in Haryana's Mahendragarh district has surfaced online. Retweeting the video, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar wrote, "This is deplorable and condemnable, such behaviour should not be tolerated in civilised society." He further said that a case has been registered and the accused has been arrested.

headlines: Yahan jhadoo nahi lagti kya: Pragya during hearing in blast case
text: During a hearing at a special NIA court in Mumbai on Friday, Bharatiya Janata Party MP and 2008 Malegaon bomb blast case accused Sadhvi Pragya complained about dust in the courtroom. "There is no space to breathe...Yahan jhadoo nahi lagti kya?" she said. Her lawyers said she raised the issue because of her medical condition.

headlines: I'll do it if story is right for me: Katrina on PT Usha biopic
text: Reacting to reports that she will be starring in an upcoming biopic on Indian sprinter PT Usha, Katrina Kaif said, "I'll do it if the story is right for me." "[A]part from sports biopics, I'm open to doing any story that I've not done before," Katrina added. She further said that she would love to star in a sports biopic.

headlines: India's practice session cancelled ahead of WC match vs Aus
text: The Indian cricket team's practice session was cancelled due to rain ahead of the side's World Cup 2019 match against Australia. The rain also caused the Sri Lanka-Pakistan match to be washed out on Friday. Notably, India's practice session was also called off due to rain ahead of their tournament-opener versus South Africa.

headlines: Balls are actually different for World Cup 2019: Trent Boult
text: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult said, "The balls are actually different for this tournament. They've got a different gloss on them, they're painted differently, so there's definitely been a little bit more swing." "It's nice to hold in the hand and it's moving a little bit, so I'm very happy," Boult said about the cricket balls at World Cup 2019.

headlines: All we talked about is sticking to what we do well: Morgan
text: Following England's loss to Pakistan at the World Cup 2019, England captain Eoin Morgan said, "All we talked about is sticking to what we do well, looking at our strengths." "[P]revious to the tournament starting we talked about losing games -- how would we react? What would we counter that with? Everything comes back to focusing on ourselves," Morgan said.

headlines: Google Maps adding feature to show driving speed: Report
text: Google Maps is rolling out a new "Speedometer" feature to display users' driving speed while using driving navigation, which will also alert users if they overspeed, a report claimed. The feature has reportedly been spotted by users across several countries around the world including India. Notably, Google Maps earlier also added speed limit indication and speed camera alert features.

headlines: Paid a huge personal cost: Google walkout protest organiser quits
text: Claire Stapleton, one of the seven employees who organised mass walkouts in November 2018 against Google's handling of sexual misconduct complaints, has quit the technology giant after about 12 years. Her resignation comes weeks after she accused Google of punishing, sidelining and even firing employees who stand up against it. "I've paid a huge personal cost," she said.

headlines: Google warns banning Huawei could increase security risks: Report
text: Google executives have warned banning Huawei could lead to increased security risks, Financial Times reported. Huawei's own, yet-to-come smartphone operating system to replace Android would be more susceptible to being hacked, sources said. "Our focus is protecting the security of Google users on millions of existing Huawei handsets," Google said over the US' ban on the Chinese smartphone maker.

headlines: Mamata's days as CM numbered, her countdown's begun: Giriraj
text: After comparing West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Friday said, "It seems that she does not believe in the Constitution. Her days as CM are numbered." Giriraj added, "The people have decided. Her countdown has begun now. People want development."

headlines: Devendra Fadnavis asking Cong MLAs to join BJP: Ashok Chavan
text: Maharashtra Congress President Ashok Chavan on Friday accused state's CM Devendra Fadnavis of calling up Congress MLAs and asking them to join BJP. "I don't think anybody from Congress will leave the party. Fadnavis is toiling to break Congress," he said. "People are unhappy with the state government and Assembly results could vary from that of Lok Sabha," Chavan added.

headlines: Committed to defend people under attack by PM Modi: Rahul
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday targeted PM Narendra Modi and said the PM and his government are "spreading hatred in the country". "We're committed to defending space of opposition...defending people who are under attack by PM's policies and by PM himself," he added. "Congress knows that only way to combat hatred is through love and affection," Gandhi further said.

headlines: Article 370 will be removed if Amit Shah has said: BJP leader
text: BJP's Anurag Thakur on Friday said, "If our (BJP) party president (and now Home Minister) Amit Shah has said that Article 370 would be scrapped from Jammu and Kashmir, it will become a reality." This comes after Home Ministry recently said it's considering a draft proposal regarding the same. Notably, removal of Article 370 was part of BJP's 2019 manifesto.

headlines: KPMG India acquihires Mumbai AI decision services startup
text: One of the Big Four accounting firms, KPMG's India arm has acquihired Mumbai-based AI-based decision services company Recommender Labs for an undisclosed amount. KPMG will acquire Recommender's trademark brand, software products and other IP rights. Founded in 2016, Recommender utilises its AI capabilities to support users during decision-making processes by generating meaningful recommendations.

headlines: MS Dhoni can't wear Army 'sacrifice' badge as ICC denies permission
text: Former India captain MS Dhoni can't wear wicketkeeping gloves with Army 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge after ICC rejected BCCI's request. The regulations for ICC events don't permit any individual message or logo to be displayed on any items of clothing or equipment, ICC said. The logo also breaches the regulations in relation to what is permitted on wicketkeeper gloves, it stated.

headlines: I feel raped: Madonna criticises article for focusing on her age
text: US singer Madonna has said she feels "raped" after reading an interview she did with New York Times Magazine, criticising the interviewer Vanessa Grigoriadis for focusing on her age. The 60-year-old added her age "would have never been mentioned" in the article had she been a man. She further said that she regrets spending even five minutes with the interviewer.

headlines: Pak, SL share one point each as match gets abandoned due to rain
text: The 11th match of 2019 World Cup between Sri Lanka and Pakistan was abandoned due to rain without a ball bowled, with both teams taking a point each. Pakistan had won each of their previous seven matches against Sri Lanka in World Cup. Sri Lanka will next face Bangladesh on June 11, while Pakistan will face Australia on June 12.

headlines: Pak players wanted retaliatory celebration vs India, PCB says no
text: Pakistan Cricket Board has turned down captain Sarfaraz Ahmed and his team's request to celebrate India's wickets 'differently' in retaliation to India wearing Army caps during an ODI in March. "We won't resort to what the other party has done. There could be sporadic celebrations in case of a hundred...but nothing different at...fall of wickets," PCB chairman Ehsan Mani said.

headlines: Dhoni's identity is country's identity, BCCI must back him: Rijiju
text: Reacting to Indian Army 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge controversy, Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju said that MS Dhoni's identity is country's identity, Army's identity and not politics. "I am hopeful that BCCI will take up this matter with ICC and will solve this matter," he added. He further said that the government does not intervene in the affairs of the sports bodies.

headlines: After naked nipple censorship protest, FB agrees to review policy
text: Facebook has agreed to review its artistic nudity policy after heavy protests against the ban on some female nipple photos on its platform and Instagram. A protest saw over 100 people lying nude in front of Facebook's New York office last Sunday. Demonstrators had covered their bodies with stickers of only male nipples, which do not face censorship.

headlines: Ex-Paytm exec Sonia, accused in CEO extortion case, joins Sheroes
text: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's former secretary Sonia Dhawan has joined women's job and career community Sheroes as Director of Communications. This comes a few months after Dhawan got bail after being jailed in October for allegedly stealing data and making extortion calls to CEO Sharma. Dhawan served at the Noida-based fintech giant for around nine years.

headlines: Woman molested, attacked on way to petrol pump in Goa; shares video
text: A Mumbai-based sculptor, Durga Gawde, took to social media to share a video of herself being attacked by a man while going to a petrol pump in Goa. She revealed she asked him to not use phone while riding his bike after he almost crashed into her bike. She added that the man, who was arrested, is currently on bail.

headlines: Man held for killing girl was accused of raping daughter: Police
text: One of the two men arrested for murder of a 2.5-year-old girl had been accused of raping his then four-year-old daughter five years ago, a police officer in UP's Aligarh said. The accused's wife took the girl and left for her parents' home after the rape, the mother of the murdered girl said. Police have imposed NSA on the arrested.

headlines: CRPF personnel carry ailing teen on cot for 8 km for treatment
text: Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel carried an ailing 13-year-old boy on a cot for eight kilometres from his village to a camp for treatment in Chhattisgarh's Sukma. The teenager, who was suffering from jaundice, was found by the troops of 231 battalion while patrolling on Thursday. He was treated by a doctor from the same battalion.

headlines: US & Russian warships nearly collide, both nations blame each other
text: A Russian and American warship nearly collided in the East China Sea, with each side blaming the other for the incident. Russia said its destroyer Admiral Vinogradov was forced to perform "emergency manoeuvre" as the USS Chancellorsville came within 50 metres of it. Rejecting Russia's claims, the US said, "We consider Russia's actions during this interaction as unsafe and unprofessional".

headlines: HDFC Bank appoints new auditor after RBI's action against EY firm
text: HDFC Bank has cancelled the re-appointment of SR Batliboi & Co, a member firm of EY, after the RBI restricted it from auditing commercial banks for a year. India's largest bank by market value has appointed MSKA & Associates as its new statutory auditor. RBI said lapses have been identified in a statutory audit assignment carried out by SR Batliboi.

headlines: Eros International loses 32% in value over two days on debt worries
text: Eros International Media shares plunged 32% in two days after Care Ratings downgraded the company to "default" levels. Its US-listed parent Eros International Plc plunged nearly 50% on Thursday. Eros International, which acquires, co-produces and distributes Indian films, said it was late on two loan interest payments for April and May but added they will be cleared in a week.

headlines: RBI relaxes rules on bad loans, replaces 'one-day default' rule
text: The RBI has diluted its earlier guidelines on bad loans and has now mandated banks to undertake a review of a borrower account within 30 days of default. The resolution plan should be implemented by the lenders within 180 days after the initial review period. The previous circular mandated lenders to start resolution even if there was a one-day default.

headlines: Anand loses to Mamedyarov, falls to last spot in Norway Chess
text: Indian chess grandmaster Viswanathan Anand slipped to the bottom of the points table after losing to Shakhriyar Mamedyarov of Azerbaijan in the second round of the Altibox Norway Chess tournament in Stavanger. Anand had earlier lost to world champion Magnus Carlsen of Norway in the Armageddon game in the first round.

headlines: Vondrousova first teen to reach Roland Garros final since 2007
text: Marketa Vondrousova on Friday became the first teenager to enter the French Open women's singles final since Ana Ivanovic at the 2007 French Open. Vondrousova defeated 26th seed Johanna Konta, 7-5, 7-6, in the semifinals of the French Open. The 19-year-old is also the first teen to appear in a Grand Slam women's final since US Open 2009.

headlines: Microsoft deletes largest public face recognition database
text: Microsoft has deleted its MS Celeb database, the largest known public facial recognition database which contained over 1 crore images of about 1 lakh people around the world. "The site was intended for academic purposes," Microsoft said, adding, "It was run by an employee that is no longer with Microsoft." "The research challenge is over," the software giant further said.

headlines: Kumaraswamy doing political drama amid water crisis: Yeddyurappa
text: Karnataka BJP chief BS Yeddyurappa targeted CM HD Kumaraswamy and accused him of doing "political drama" amid water crisis in the state. "All Kumaraswamy is doing is political drama by going to village schools and staying there and pretending. This won't work," said Yeddyurappa. Meanwhile, "as a precautionary measure", Karnataka ministers on Thursday offered prayers at temples for sufficient rains.

headlines: My door open to every citizen of Wayanad: Rahul on 1st visit as MP
text: On his first visit as an MP to Kerala's Wayanad today, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said his door is open for Wayanad's citizens. "Will know you better and understand your issues and work...to improve your lives," he added. Gandhi further said that as an MP from the state, he'll raise the issues of both Wayanad and Kerala in Lok Sabha.

headlines: Any talk of mid-term polls is now irrelevant: Karnataka CM
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said the coalition government would complete its five-year term and any talk of mid-term polls now is "irrelevant". This comes after a video of his son Nikhil Kumaraswamy asking JD(S) workers to get ready for assembly polls went viral. "His statement was taken out of context...to represent there may be election anytime," Kumaraswamy added.

headlines: UK asks Russia to change behaviour for better ties; Russia says no
text: Russia rejected an appeal by the UK to "change its behaviour" to improve their relations. "(T)he only thing Russia wants is beneficial relations that are based on each others' interests...There's nothing blameworthy in such a line of conduct," Russia said. Relations between the two nations have become strained since the alleged poisoning of ex-Russian spy Sergei Skripal in the UK.

headlines: 2.5-yr-old girl killed over money, rape not yet confirmed: Police
text: The Aligarh Police has said the 2.5-year-old girl, whose body was found in a garbage dump on June 2, was murdered due to an altercation over money between her father and the accused. According to the post mortem report, rape has not been confirmed till now. The police further said National Security Act has been imposed on the two arrested.

headlines: Dhoni not in England for Mahabharat: Pak minister on Army badge row
text: Pakistan's Federal Minister for Science and Technology Fawad Chaudhry has criticised MS Dhoni for wearing Indian Army 'Balidaan' (sacrifice) badge on wicketkeeping gloves. "Dhoni's in England to play cricket not for..Mahabharat, what an idiotic debate in Indian Media...a section of Indian media is so obsessed with war, they should be sent to Syria, Afghanistan or Rwanda as mercenaries," he wrote.

headlines: Rafael Nadal beats Roger Federer to reach his 12th French Open final
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated world number three Roger Federer on Friday to reach his 12th French Open final. The 33-year-old 11-time Roland Garros champion won the match with a scoreline of 6-3, 6-4, 6-2 in 2 hours and 25 minutes to end his five-match losing streak against the 37-year-old Swiss. Nadal now leads the head-to-head against Federer 24-15.

headlines: Umaria DC removes own office ACs for children at health centre
text: Umaria District Collector Swarochish Somavanshi removed the ACs in his chamber and office halls, and instead had them installed in all four Nutrition Rehabilitation Centres of the district. Somavanshi said, "It was really hot inside the NRC building. We were arranging ACs but we felt they needed to be installed immediately as there were children."

headlines: India no more underdeveloped: Goyal on US withdrawing trade benefits
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said India accepts US' decision to withdraw duty-free benefits to Indian exporters gracefully. "India is no more an underdeveloped or least developed country that we will look at that kind of support," he added. Goyal said withdrawal of Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) is not a matter of life and death for all exporters.

headlines: SIT formed, 5 UP policemen suspended after toddler's murder
text: The UP police have formed a Special Investigation Team and suspended 5 policemen after a 2.5-year-old girl was brutally murdered in Aligarh. Two men, Zahid and Aslam, were arrested for killing the child, whose body was found in a garbage dump near her house three days after she went missing.

headlines: Lesbian couple beaten up by men for refusing to kiss each other
text: A lesbian couple was beaten up by four men on a bus in London after they refused to kiss each other. "They started behaving like hooligans, demanding that we kissed so they could enjoy watching, calling us 'lesbians' and describing sexual positions," Melania Geymonat said in a Facebook post. The men stole a phone and bag from them before fleeing.

headlines: May quits as party leader, triggers race to elect next UK PM
text: UK PM Theresa May officially stepped down as the leader of the Conservative party on Friday, formally triggering the race to elect her successor. May announced her resignation last month, saying it was a matter of deep regret that she had been unable to deliver Brexit. She'll remain the acting party leader and Prime Minister until her successor is chosen.

headlines: ISIS plotted to infiltrate US through Mexico border: Report
text: ISIS had plotted to infiltrate into the US through the country's border with Mexico, a Canadian-Trinidadian ISIS prisoner said. The prisoner, quoted by the International Center for the Study of Violent Extremism, said he was directed to carry out financial attacks to cripple the US economy. He was to move from Puerto Rico to Mexico and then to the US.

headlines: Who is Rishad Premji, Wipro's next Chairman?
text: Wipro's next Executive Chairman Rishad Premji joined the IT services company in 2007 and has been its Chief Strategy Officer since 2010. The 42-year-old, who holds an MBA from Harvard, previously worked at consultancy Bain & Company in London and with GE Capital in the US. Rishad conceptualised Wipro Ventures, a $100-million startup fund, and was NASSCOM's Chairman for 2018-19.

headlines: Age gap doesn't matter: Arjun on relationship with Malaika
text: When asked about facing criticism for the age gap between him and his girlfriend Malaika Arora, Arjun Kapoor said, "I wouldn't even want to speak about this and give it importance." "It doesn't matter to me, so I don't want to justify anything," the actor added. Arjun, who is 33, is 12 years younger than Malaika.

headlines: Holder says Windies batsmen should learn from Steve Smith
text: Following his side's loss against Australia after a close match at the World Cup 2019, Windies captain Jason Holder said that the Windies batsmen should learn from Steve Smith. "Steve batted quite deep and needed to, Shai Hope has been outstanding in doing that for us but it didn't go his way this time," Holder said.

headlines: Exciting to find new ways to win: Starc after win vs Windies
text: After helping Australia beat Windies in their World Cup 2019 match, Australian pacer Mitchell Starc said, "We haven't played awesome cricket in that game... It's exciting to find new ways to win." "We always had the belief, there is lots of good bowling in our line-up and we were only a couple of wickets away," Starc added.

headlines: Twitter may put $50 mn in ShareChat's $100-mn round: Report
text: Twitter is in talks with Bengaluru-based vernacular social networking app ShareChat to invest in the startup's new $100 million funding round, as per a report. The micro-blogging platform is reportedly slated to lead the round with an investment of over $50 million, which would turn out to be its first such investment globally. ShareChat was founded in the year 2015.

headlines: Huawei barred from pre-installing FB, WhatsApp, Instagram apps
text: Facebook has suspended Huawei from pre-installing its own app along with WhatsApp and Instagram in all its new phones, reportedly including phones that have not yet left the factory. Customers who already have Huawei phones will still be able to use its apps and receive updates, Facebook said. This comes over US' ban on Huawei over alleged espionage concerns.

headlines: Legal-tech startup Leegality gets funding from Mumbai Angels, others
text: Gurugram-based digital legal documentation platform Leegality has raised undisclosed amount in a funding round led by Mumbai Angels Network. Chandigarh Angels and a few HNIs also participated in the round. Founded in 2016 by Shivam Singla, Prakhar Agrawal and Sapan Parekh, Leegality aims to provide secure, legally acceptable, quick Aadhaar card, as well as eSign and eStamping facilities.

headlines: Hrithik to play Big B's role in Satte Pe Satta remake: Report
text: Hrithik Roshan has reportedly been roped in to star in the upcoming remake of the 1982 film 'Satte Pe Satta', which saw Amitabh Bachchan in the lead role. Earlier reports suggested that Shah Rukh Khan and Akshay Kumar were being considered for Amitabh's role. The forthcoming remake will be directed by Farah Khan and produced by Rohit Shetty.

headlines: Nothing vulgar: Designer on Priyanka's pic in saree without blouse
text: After social media users criticised Priyanka Chopra for posing in a saree without a blouse for American magazine 'InStyle', the saree's designer Tarun Tahiliani said, "There's nothing vulgar about it." "Not using a choli makes it a global statement. The transition from...Indian beauty to this modern goddess for a mainstream fashion cover only speaks of her [Priyanka] versatility," he added.

headlines: Umpire fails to spot 'big' no-ball, Gayle gets out on 'free hit' ball
text: Umpire Chris Gaffaney failed to notice a 'big' no-ball which Australia pacer Mitchell Starc bowled a delivery before dismissing West Indies opener Chris Gayle in their 2019 World Cup match on Thursday. Had the no-ball been called, the ball on which Gayle was dismissed would've been a free hit. "The umpiring was a bit frustrating," all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite later said.

headlines: #DhoniKeepTheGlove trends as ICC wants Army Sacrifice badge removed
text: #DhoniKeepTheGlove became the top trend on Twitter in India today after several users criticised ICC's request to BCCI, asking MS Dhoni to remove the Army 'Sacrifice' (Balidaan) badge from his wicketkeeping gloves. "Dhoni's gloves are neither ethnic nor political," wrote one user. "ICC, instead of focusing on what Mahi is wearing, focus on your irresponsible umpires," tweeted another.

headlines: BCCI asks ICC to let Dhoni continue wearing Army 'Sacrifice' badge
text: Committee of Administrators (CoA) chief Vinod Rai has said the BCCI has sought the ICC's permission for allowing MS Dhoni to continue wearing the Army 'Balidaan' (sacrifice) badge on his wicketkeeping gloves. "As per ICC regulations, players can't sport any commercial, religious or military logo. There was nothing commercial or religious in this regard as we all know," he added.

headlines: Andhra to have 5 Deputy CMs from SC, ST, other minority castes
text: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday decided to appoint five Deputy Chief Ministers under him, one each from SC, ST, BC, minority and Kapu communities. Reddy announced his plans at a legislature party meeting. He said the Cabinet would be reconstituted two and a half years later after a mid-term review of the government's performance.

headlines: 4 terrorists killed in J&K, 2 among them SPOs who went missing
text: Four terrorists who reportedly belonged to Jaish-e-Mohammed were gunned down in an encounter with security forces in the Panjran village of Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Friday. Two among them are believed to be two Special Police Officers who decamped with their rifles yesterday, said officials. Three AK series rifles have been seized from the terrorists' possession.

headlines: Sadhvi Pragya sits on red satin cloth during Malegaon blast hearing
text: Bharatiya Janata Party MP and 2008 Malegaon bomb blast case accused Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur appeared before a special NIA court in Mumbai on Friday after skipping two hearings. Her aide spread a red satin cloth before she sat on the bench meant for the accused inside the courtroom. This was Pragya Thakur's first appearance before the court.

headlines: Odisha man builds bridge across river with his pension money
text: A retired employee of the Veterinary Department has invested his pension money in completing a half-finished bridge over Salandi river in Odisha's Keonjhar. The authorities left its construction midway due to shortage of funds. "I thought if I don't build it, no one else will," he said. The 270-foot-long bridge connects Gangadhar Rout's village Kanpur to Daneipur across the river.

headlines: Pictures of inmates drinking, partying inside UP jail go viral
text: The administration at Uttar Pradesh's Naini Central Jail has suspended two guards after pictures showing inmates partying and consuming liquor went viral on social media. A show cause notice has been issued to the jail superintendent. Authorities said inmates seen in the pictures would be shifted to other jails, adding that role of other jail officials was also under scanner.

headlines: 12-yr-old MP boy dies as phone battery explodes while charging
text: A 12-year-old boy was killed when a mobile phone battery exploded at his home in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Wednesday. The minor, whose parents are daily wage labourers, was using what is known as a 'kekra' charger wherein the battery is removed from the device and charged directly. He collapsed on the spot following the explosion.

headlines: In a first, US Air Force allows Sikh airman to wear turban on duty
text: The US Air Force has for the first time allowed a Sikh airman to serve with a beard, turban and unshorn hair, the Sikh American Legal Defense and Education Fund (SALDEF) said. Bajwa had joined the Air Force in 2017. The US Army had for the first time allowed a Sikh soldier to wear his articles of faith in 2016.

headlines: Number of Indians killed in Dubai bus crash rises to 12
text: The number of Indians killed in a bus crash in Dubai has risen to 12. "Deeply grieved by the unfortunate bus accident in Dubai...My sincere condolences to the families. Our Consulate in Dubai is extending all help," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted. The Oman-registered vehicle was reportedly carrying 31 passengers when it crashed into an overhead sign.

headlines: Pilot flies without passport to bring back Bangladesh PM Hasina
text: A Biman Bangladesh Airlines pilot, who was en route to bring PM Sheikh Hasina from Finland, was caught without a passport in Qatar. Biman sent the passport of the pilot on another flight to Qatar later. "It will be investigated with due importance how the pilot got on the plane at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport without a passport," authorities said.

headlines: Bradley Cooper, Irina Shayk split after 4-yr relationship: Report
text: Actor Bradley Cooper and supermodel Irina Shayk have split up after a four-year relationship, as per a report in People Magazine. The couple will share custody of their 2-year-old daughter Lea De Seine, the report further stated. They started dating in 2015, after Cooper broke up with model Suki Waterhouse and Shayk ended her relationship with footballer Cristiano Ronaldo.

headlines: Heartbreaking & horrific: Sonam on murder of toddler in Aligarh
text: Condemning the brutal murder of a 2.5-year-old girl in UP's Aligarh, Sonam Kapoor tweeted, "What has happened...is heartbreaking and horrific." "This is definitely not the kind of world we want for our children," Akshay Kumar wrote. "An innocent child becomes the victim of such a heinous act. The perpetrators must be punished! Justice has to be served," Bhumi Pednekar tweeted.

headlines: Ronaldo's hat-trick takes Portugal into Nations League final
text: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo scored a hat-trick to help his national side reach the final of the Nations League after beating Switzerland 3-1 in Porto. Ronaldo scored two goals in the final two minutes to set up a clash with the Netherlands, who reached the tournament's final, scheduled for Sunday, after beating England.

headlines: Not realistic: Tharoor on making Sanskrit official language
text: After NCST chairman Nand Kumar Sai said he will request HRD Ministry to make Sanskrit India's official language, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said it's not realistic. "I'm glad people are trying to keep the language alive, but you can't overnight turn it into a language of administration or judiciary," he added. Tharoor also said Sanskrit isn't currently spoken by most people.

headlines: Foreign Minister Jaishankar in Bhutan on his 1st bilateral visit
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reached Bhutan on Friday for his first bilateral visit after assuming office. "Great to be back in Bhutan! Touched by the warm and sunny welcome!" Jaishankar tweeted. The two countries will discuss the entire gamut of bilateral relations, including the upcoming high-level exchanges, economic development and hydro-power cooperation, an MEA statement said.

headlines: Fruitless to attend: Mamata to PM Modi on NITI Aayog meet
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has refused to attend a meeting of the governing council of NITI Aayog in Delhi on June 15. In a 3-page letter to PM Narendra Modi, Mamata wrote, "Given that the NITI Aayog has no financial powers and the power to support state plans it is fruitless for me to attend the meeting."

headlines: Man allegedly dies in custody, 3 Delhi Police officers suspended
text: One head constable and two constables were suspended after a man accused of smuggling allegedly died in custody at Nand Nagri police station in Delhi. The deceased, Govinda, had fallen ill and was later declared dead by doctors. His relatives said, "If he was ill, why didn't the police tell us? Why are they telling us now when he's dead?"

headlines: Completely false: Director Ali on reports of row with Salman
text: Reacting to reports that suggested he had a fallout with actor Salman Khan, filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar said, "These are completely false and baseless rumours." "Salman Bhai is like an elder brother to me and everyone knows we consider each other family," the filmmaker added. He further said that he will soon be working on another film with Salman.

headlines: Even though I'm from broken home, I believe in marriage: Arjun
text: When asked about his take on marriage, actor Arjun Kapoor said that even though he comes from a broken home, he believes in the institution of marriage. "I believe it's a good option to have. But that doesn't mean you...jump the gun and go straight to it," the actor added. "Life has to lead you to it," Arjun further said.

headlines: I watched 'Hindi Medium' after I signed the sequel: Kareena
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan revealed that she watched the Irrfan Khan starrer 'Hindi Medium' only after she joined the cast of the film's upcoming sequel. Speaking about working with Irrfan, Kareena said, "I've seen 'Paan Singh Tomar' and other films of Irrfan earlier...I'm his huge fan." Kareena will play a policewoman in the forthcoming sequel, titled 'Angrezi Medium'.

headlines: AB de Villiers responds to controversy over offer to play World Cup
text: After Cricket South Africa (CSA) confirmed it rejected AB de Villiers' offer to come out of retirement for World Cup, the ex-captain took to Twitter to react to the controversy. "All thats important is that we should all focus on supporting the team at the World Cup," he wrote. CSA had said it has no regrets over the decision.

headlines: Akbar misbehaved with Bikaner Queen: Rajasthan BJP chief
text: Rajasthan BJP president Madan Lal Saini on Thursday claimed Mughal Emperor Akbar had misbehaved with Bikaner Queen Kiran Devi. Claiming Akbar organised 'Meena Bazaar' to exploit women, Saini said, "When confronted by Akbar, Kiran pushed him to the ground and threatened him." Saini, who was speaking on Maharana Pratap Jayanti, said Rajput King Maharana Pratap shouldn't be compared to Akbar.

headlines: Not satisfied with treatment, Indore man kills doctor's wife
text: Irritated that a doctor who was unable to cure his itch for six months was travelling, an Indore man named Rafiq stabbed to death the doctor's wife and injured his son. Locals who heard their screams managed to nab Rafiq, who was involved in a 2015 murder case and was out on bail. The doctor ran his practice from home.

headlines: BJP VP's brother thrashes man for not standing up to greet him
text: BJP national Vice President Renu Devi's brother Pinu thrashed a man at a pharmacy in Bihar's Bettiah for allegedly not standing up to greet him. After beating the man, Pinu grabbed and dragged him outside the shop. Following the incident, Devi said, "I never encourage wrong behaviour. I've no relation with Pinu...If anyone commits a mistake, he/she should be punished."

headlines: Official demands alcohol, non-veg from juniors in MP; transferred
text: A senior official, posted as Additional District Magistrate (ADM) in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, was on Thursday transferred for allegedly demanding booze and non-vegetarian food from his juniors. Dilip Mandavi has been transferred from the post of ADM to Deputy Secretary in the state secretariat. The juniors were allegedly made to pay for the food and drinks.

headlines: 8 people die while collecting 'Himalayan viagra' in Nepal
text: At least eight people have died in one week in Nepal's Dolpa district while collecting rare medicinal fungus Yarsagumba, popularly called 'Himalayan viagra'. Six people, including a toddler accompanying his mother, died of altitude sickness while two others fell off a cliff. Yarsagumba is supposed to have aphrodisiac and medicinal properties and is found in Himalayan mountains above 10,000 feet.

headlines: Indian-American activist interrupts Bezos, shouts at him on stage
text: A 30-year-old Indian-American animal rights activist rushed on stage and interrupted Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos during an event, asking him to stop the abuses of animals at "Amazon's chicken farms". Claiming she had been inside "Amazon's chicken farms", Priya Sawhney shouted, "Jeff, please, you're the richest man on the planet. You can help the animals."

headlines: Vicky to star in Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Veeram': Reports
text: Vicky Kaushal will star in the upcoming film 'Land Of Lungi', which will be a Hindi remake of the 2014 Tamil film 'Veeram', as per reports. Earlier reports stated that Akshay Kumar, who was originally approached for the film, backed out due to scheduling issues. The film will be directed by Farhad Samji and produced by filmmaker Sajid Nadiadwala.

headlines: 'The Accidental....' really pushed the envelope for me: Aahana
text: Speaking about the Anupam Kher starrer 'The Accidental Prime Minister', Aahana Kumra said that portraying Congress' Priyanka Gandhi in the film really pushed the envelope for her. "Now is a great time for strong competent female actors to play these parts," Aahana added. She further said that her physical transformation for the role made her feel like a different person.

headlines: Six-time Grammy-winning musician Dr John passes away at 77
text: Six-time Grammy-winning musician Malcolm John Rebennack, better known as Dr John, passed away on Thursday aged 77. According to a statement released on behalf of his family, the singer-songwriter suffered from a heart attack early in the morning. He started his career as a pianist in the 1950s and gained popularity following the release of his first album in 1968.

headlines: Wanted to imitate real life cops: Ayushmann on 'Article 15'
text: Speaking about preparing for his role as a police officer in the upcoming film 'Article 15', Ayushmann Khurrana said, "My intention was to imitate real life cops." "I met a few IPS officers and also observed the way they behaved...I didn't imitate any cop from films," he added. The forthcoming film is slated to release on June 28.

headlines: Facebook's cryptocurrency may launch this month: Report
text: Facebook is expected to unveil its cryptocurrency later this month, The Information reported quoting sources. The company will reportedly cede control of its forthcoming cryptocurrency, designed to function as a borderless currency without transaction fees, to outside backers. Facebook reportedly plans to offer ATM-like physical terminals where people can exchange other currencies for the token.

headlines: Amazon's new robots can automatically sort delivery packages
text: Amazon unveiled two robots, called Pegasus and Xanthus, which are designed to speed up the automatic sorting and movement of delivery packages in its warehouses. Xanthus is a redesign of Amazon's primary robots, which have been core to its strategy since it acquired Kiva Systems in 2012. Pegasus has been specifically designed for individual packages, Amazon revealed.

headlines: Amazon shouldn't be broken up: Amazon Worldwide Consumer CEO
text: Amazon Worldwide Consumer CEO Jeff Wilke has said the e-commerce giant shouldn't be broken up while adding, "substantial entities in the economy deserve scrutiny". He said, "[O]ur job is to build the kind of company that passes that scrutiny." Earlier this year, US Senator Elizabeth Warren had called for the breakup of big technology companies like Amazon.

headlines: Telangana BJP worker murdered, 6 TRS workers held: Reports
text: Telangana BJP worker Prem Kumar Reddy was allegedly killed by a group of men, suspected to be Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) workers. Prima facie, Srikanth Reddy, son of a local TRS leader, was behind this, said the police adding Srikanth along with five others was taken into custody for further investigation. Meanwhile, BJP leaders staged a protest demanding immediate action.

headlines: Deendayal's name will be dropped from exam: Rajasthan govt
text: Rajasthan Education Minister GS Dotasra on Thursday said RSS ideologue Deendayal Upadhyaya's name will be dropped from a school scholarship exam. "When we asked the concerned officers why it was named after Upadhyaya, they had no specific reason," he added. "We decided to go back to the original name as it would help in its easy recognition," Dotasra further said.

headlines: IAU invites every country to name an exoplanet and its star
text: International Astronomical Union (IAU), the governing body that manages names of astronomical objects, has invited every country in the world to name a planet outside the Solar System and its star. About 100 countries have signed up to run public voting competitions to select popular name for their stars and planets. IAU will celebrate its 100th anniversary in July 2019.

headlines: After names for Mars, NASA asks people for music for Moon journey
text: NASA has asked people to suggest songs to add to the playlist of astronauts of its planned 2024 Moon mission. "Just like any road trip needs a soundtrack, so does a spaceflight," NASA said on the non-stop journey of approximately 3 days each way. NASA had earlier also asked people to give names that will fly to Mars in 2020.

headlines: India to enhance commitment to Sri Lanka: Foreign Secretary
text: India's Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale on Thursday said the country will enhance its commitment to Sri Lanka in the wake of suicide attacks on churches and hotels. The comments come ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Sri Lanka and Maldives this weekend. This would be his first foreign trip since winning a second term in power last month.

headlines: Trade between India and China to cross $100 bn, says envoy
text: India's Ambassador to China Vikram Misri on Thursday said the trade between India and China is set to cross the $100-billion mark in 2019 for the first time. "Last year, our bilateral trade crossed $95 billion," he added. "The economic and commercial engagement between India and China constitutes a major component of our bilateral relations," Misri further said.

headlines: Australia beat WI as Starc takes 2019 World Cup's 1st 5-wicket haul
text: Australia defeated West Indies by 15 runs in last over on Thursday to register their second successive victory in 2019 World Cup. Fast bowler Mitchell Starc took 2019 World Cup's first five-wicket haul, registering figures of 10-1-46-5. The match also witnessed Australia's Nathan Coulter-Nile register the highest score (92) by a number eight batsman in World Cup history.

headlines: Karan Wahi reacts after his pic is wrongly used in molestation news
text: After media houses reportedly used Karan Wahi's picture mistakenly in a news about a model being molested, the actor took to his Instagram Story to clarify. "I'd request media portals to...verify which Karan Wahi they're talking about before putting my pictures in an article which isn't about me," he wrote. A music composer named Karan Wahi had been arrested for allegedly molesting a model.

headlines: If I reach even half the place where Akshay is, I'll retire: Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu, while talking about actor Akshay Kumar, said, "If I reach even half the place where he has, I think I will retire after that." "He has done so many things that it's commendable," she added.
