Taapsee and Akshay have worked together in 'Baby' and 'Naam Shabana' and their upcoming film 'Mission Mangal' will release in August this year.

headlines: CSA releases statement on ABD row, says urged him to not retire
text: Cricket South Africa's national selection panel convenor, Linda Zondi, has said the decision to not accept AB de Villiers' offer to overturn retirement to play 2019 World Cup was based on "principle" and he doesn't regret it. He revealed he had pleaded with De Villiers to not retire in 2018. "We had to be fair to the team," he further said.

headlines: Mitchell Starc fastest bowler to reach 150 wickets in ODI cricket
text: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc has become the fastest bowler to reach 150 wickets in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against West Indies in 2019 World Cup on Thursday. The 29-year-old reached the landmark in his 77th ODI, breaking former Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq's record (78 matches). Starc registered figures of 10-1-46-5 against West Indies.

headlines: World no. 1 Djokovic reaches French Open semi-finals for 9th time
text: World number one Novak Djokovic defeated world number five Alexander Zverev on Thursday to reach the French Open semi-finals for the ninth time. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 7-5, 6-2, 6-2 in two hours and nine minutes. The 32-year-old will face world number four Dominic Thiem in the semi-final on Friday.

headlines: 17-yr-old Amanda beats 2018 champ Halep to reach French Open semis
text: US' 17-year-old Amanda Anisimova reached the first Grand Slam semi-final of her career after defeating defending champion Simon Halep in the French Open 2019 quarter-final on Thursday. Anisimova won the match with a scoreline of 6-2, 6-4 in 69 minutes. With the win, Anisimova became the youngest semi-finalist at French Open since Nicole Vaidisova in 2006.

headlines: Political strategist Prashant Kishor to work for Mamata Banerjee
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor will work for West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's Trinamool Congress ahead of Assembly elections in the state in 2021. Kishor, who is credited with Jagan Reddy's victory in Andhra Pradesh, had earlier worked actively in then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi's campaign for 2014 Lok Sabha elections. BJP won 18 seats in West Bengal in general elections.

headlines: Food fest organisers replace Beef with Beep* in name after threats
text: After receiving threat messages for using 'Beef' in the name of an upcoming beef food festival in Kolkata, the organisers replaced it with 'Beep*'. "Many right-wing...social media accounts have been sharing my name and number, after which we decided to change the name," one of the organisers said. He added the "event has nothing to do with politics or religion".

headlines: Shops in Tamil Nadu can now stay open 24x7
text: Shops in Tamil Nadu will be allowed to stay open 24x7 on all days initially for a period of three years, as per the notification in Tamil Nadu Government Gazette. The precondition of the order involves employers ensuring safety of women employees, including constitution of Internal Complaints Committee. It also mandates transport arrangements for women who work in night shifts.

headlines: Amit Shah to live in late PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's residence
text: Home Minister Amit Shah has been allotted late Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Krishna Menon Marg residence in central Delhi. Vajpayee had moved into the Krishna Menon Marg bungalow in 2004, after his government was voted out, and stayed there with his family for nearly 14 years. His family vacated the house last November after his death in August.

headlines: Gautam Buddh Nagar to launch e-portal to report workplace harassment
text: UP's Gautam Buddh Nagar district has tied up with an IT firm to build a software and website that will allow women to report workplace sexual harassment online. The software, expected to be launched on August 15, will be available for private and government organisations. Authorities said they will provide a list of private organisations operating in the district.

headlines: It has been a long and satisfying journey: Azim Premji
text: Wipro Founder Azim Premji, who announced his retirement as Executive Chairman and Managing Director on Thursday, said his time at the company was "long and satisfying". "As I look into the future, I plan to devote more time to focus on our philanthropic activities," he added. Premji, who has led Wipro for 53 years, will step down on July 30.

headlines: World no. 5 Sindhu loses to 29th ranked Jindapol in Aus Open
text: Shuttler PV Sindhu, who is ranked 5th worldwide in women's singles lost 19-21, 18-21 to Thailand's World number 29 Nitchaon Jindapol in Australian Open second round on Thursday. This was Sindhu's second loss in a total of seven games played against the 28-year-old. Meanwhile, in men's singles, Sameer Verma and Sai Praneeth also lost their respective second round matches.

headlines: Bihar govt to waive off 50% taxes levied on e-rickshaws
text: In a move to beat air pollution, Bihar government has decided to waive 50% taxes levied on purchase and running of e-rickshaws. While announcing the move on Wednesday, Bihar's deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi said all possible steps are being taken to check the growing pollution in cities. He made the announcement while speaking at a World Environment Day function.

headlines: Culprits of Mandsaur firing will be punished: MP CM Kamal Nath
text: On the second anniversary of the Mandsaur police firing that killed six farmers, Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath said those behind the incident will be punished. "Our government is determined...to give justice to victims and withdraw false cases against innocent farmers," he tweeted. The farmers were shot at while protesting for their demands, which included a better price for produce.

headlines: BJP gained power at Centre through lies, deceit: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav targeted BJP and said it gained power at Centre through lies and deceit and divided society over caste and religion. "BJP didn't do any work in UP's public interest due to which there is huge resentment among the people," he added. Yadav further said women feel unsafe under the state's deteriorating law and order situation.

headlines: Meet every voter: Pawar to party workers ahead of Maharashtra polls
text: With the Maharashtra Assembly elections nearing, NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday urged his party workers to visit every voter in their area. "Keep track of whom you met and whom you couldn't. Collect information about each family," he said. "Only 98 days are left for the Assembly polls...so, start working from today itself," Pawar added.

headlines: Govt recognised over 1 startup every hour in May 2019
text: DPIIT Secretary Ramesh Abhishek tweeted that since the beginning of the Startup India initiative, 18,861 startups have been recognised by DPIIT. "In May 2019 only, 814 startups have received recognition. This is more than 1 startup every hour!" he added. He further tweeted that these entities were spread across 513 districts of 29 states and 6 union territories.

headlines: Hindi is an option under draft 3-language policy: TN BJP chief
text: Tamil Nadu BJP President Tamilisai Soundararajan on Thursday asserted that Hindi will be an option and not an imposition under the central government's draft three-language policy. "Opposition leaders in the state are twisting the three-language policy," she said. "Learning a third language will give students better opportunities and improve their social skills," Soundararajan added.

headlines: Trump threatens China with tariffs on further $300 bn of goods
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to hit China with tariffs on "at least" another $300 billion worth of Chinese goods "at the right time". "But I think China wants to make a deal badly," he added. The US had last month increased tariffs on a $200 billion list of Chinese goods to 25%, following which China retaliated.

headlines: Remove Army 'sacrifice' badge from MS Dhoni's gloves, ICC tells BCCI
text: The ICC has asked the BCCI to get the regimental dagger insignia of the Indian Para Special Forces, also known as the 'balidaan' (sacrifice) badge, removed from ex-India captain MS Dhoni's gloves. Dhoni's pictures with the badge had gone viral on social media.The ICC equipment regulations don't permit display of messages relating to political, religious or racial activities.

headlines: Coulter-Nile smashes highest ever World Cup score by a no. 8 batsman
text: Australia's Nathan Coulter-Nile today smashed the highest-ever score by a number 8 batsman in World Cup history. The 31-year-old, who had never hit a fifty before today in international cricket, slammed 92(60) including eight fours and four sixes against West Indies. The previous record was held by former Zimbabwe captain Heath Streak, who hit 72*(84) against New Zealand in 2003.

headlines: Google to buy analytics startup Looker for $2.6 billion in cash
text: Google has announced it will acquire US-based data analytics startup Looker in a $2.6-billion all-cash transaction which will join Google Cloud post-acquisition. This marks the first major acquisition under former Oracle executive Thomas Kurian, who was named as the new Google Cloud CEO in November 2018. Wipro Chairman Azim Premji's family office PremjiInvest-backed Looker was founded in 2012.

headlines: MIT 'roboats' can now self-assemble to make bridges, markets
text: MIT researchers have added new features to its autonomous robotic boats 'roboats', which it had co-created alongside Amsterdam's AMS Institute, that lets them target and attach to each other. The aim of the project is not limited to just on-demand transportation, but to also form "pop-up" structures, such as footbridges, performance stages or even food markets, researchers revealed.

headlines: Google Maps adds tools to help navigate crises, natural disasters
text: Google Maps has added new navigation features to suggest safer routes during crises and natural disasters to help avoid them. Google will also show hurricane path cones, earthquake shakemaps and flood forecasts when users enter the affected region or search for them. Google said it'll launch flood visualisations feature in Patna and gradually expand to the Brahmaputra and Ganges regions.

headlines: 2 BJP leaders abuse Gadkari in audio, say he'll lose polls; expelled
text: BJP has expelled two of its Nagpur leaders for six years after an audio tape of their phone conversation was leaked, wherein they abuse Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and say he will lose the Lok Sabha elections. Jaihari Singh Thakur was Nagpur BJP vice-president, while Abhay Tidke was an executive committee member. Thakur claimed that the audio clip was tampered.

headlines: Govt may order Ola, Uber to have 40% cabs electric by 2026
text: The government is planning to order cab aggregators including Ola and Uber to gradually convert 40% of their fleet of cars to electric by April 2026, as per records of government meetings seen by Reuters. Notably, only 3,600 electric passenger vehicles were sold in India in the financial year 2019, compared to 3.3 million diesel and petrol cars.

headlines: PM Modi reconstitutes NITI Aayog, Rajiv Kumar retained as VC
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday approved the reconstitution of government think-tank NITI Aayog. Rajiv Kumar has been retained as the Vice Chairman while full-time members include VK Saraswat, Ramesh Chand and VK Paul. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Home Minister Amit Shah, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, and Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar will be the ex-officio members.

headlines: CM Jagan Reddy cancels Chandrababu's order, CBI can now enter Andhra
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has cancelled the order issued by the previous Chandrababu Naidu-led government that barred the CBI's entry into the state. The CBI was denied entry into the state without the CM's permission in November last year. The then government had cited corruption allegations against CBI's top officials as the reason for issuing the order.

headlines: Girl kills self on failing NEET; 3rd suicide in TN in 2 days
text: An 18-year-old girl committed suicide in Tamil Nadu after failing to clear the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) for medical admission. "NEET mark is less. I shouldnt be there anymore. Sorry, father," read a reported suicide note written by her. Three girls have committed suicide within two days in the state after the NEET results were declared.

headlines: 97-yr-old WWII veteran recreates parachute drop 75yrs after D-Day
text: Tom Rice, a 97-year-old US World War II paratrooper veteran, parachuted into Normandy on Wednesday, recreating the jump he made 75 years ago on the D-Day invasion during WWII. "I feel great. I'd go up and do it all again," Rice said. More than 13,000 US paratroopers had descended upon the beaches of Normandy on D-Day to liberate Nazi-occupied France.

headlines: Man jailed for 120 yrs for raping minor 100 times, livestreaming it
text: A 29-year-old US man has been sentenced to 120 years in prison for sexually abusing a girl from her infancy to age six and at times live streaming it on social media. Steven Douglas Crook Jr used social media app Live.Me and encouraged his followers to watch the abuse. The child was rescued in March 2018 from Crook's house.

headlines: Sensex crashes 554 points despite RBI's repo rate cut
text: India's benchmark index Sensex tanked nearly 554 points on Thursday to settle at 39,530, registering its biggest one-day fall of this year. This came despite the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cutting its repo rate for the third time in four months to 5.75% in order to boost growth. The Nifty 50 index also slipped 178 points to 11,844.

headlines: Manpasand Beverages Chairman says ready to quit over GST fraud
text: Manpasand Beverages' Chairman and MD Dhirendra Singh on Thursday said he is willing to step down from the day-to-day operations over an alleged GST fraud and arrests of top executives. Shares of the fruit juice maker have fallen over 60% in the last eight sessions. GST authorities had arrested director Abhishek Singh, his brother Harshvardhan Singh and CFO Paresh Thakkar.

headlines: Google offers scientists access to its air quality data
text: Google is releasing updated version of its air quality data set that includes information collected with San Francisco-based partner Aclimas environmental sensors between 2017-2018, which scientists can request to access via form. Google equipped its Street View cars with air pollution sensors under 'Project Air View', after its Environmental Defense Fund partners first proposed the idea in 2012.

headlines: Indian language self-publishing platform Pratilipi gets $15 mn
text: Bengaluru-based Indian language self-publishing platform Pratilipi has raised around $15 million in a funding round led by China's Qiming Venture Partners. Pratilipi CEO Ranjeet Pratap Singh described the platform as "YouTube for writers" and said that over 1 lakh writers are active on the platform. Pratilipi is currently operational in 10 languages including Marathi, Tamil and Bengali.

headlines: Water crisis worsens in MP; girls miss school to fetch water
text: The water crisis situation in Madhya Pradesh's Betul has worsened as the region has received scanty rainfall so far. The crisis has resulted in girls residing in the region to miss out on school to fetch water for their families. "We walk over three kilometres daily to fetch water from the nearby well," a teenage girl from the area said.

headlines: High heels for women at work are necessary: Japan Labour Minister
text: Japan's Labour Minister Takumi Nemoto has said that dress codes requiring women to wear high heels at work are "necessary". "It is socially accepted as something that falls within the realm of being occupationally necessary and appropriate," he added. His statement comes amid the #KuToo campaign in Japan that calls upon the government to ban such dress codes.

headlines: Industry, exporters shouldn't depend on subsidies: Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said industry and exporters should not depend on government subsidies. "We have to move out of this continuous effort and demand, and make our industry truly competitive and self-reliant," he said. This will help achieve the target of reaching $1 trillion exports in merchandise and $1 trillion in services in next five years, Goyal added.

headlines: Indian exporters face higher interest, tax rates: Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said Indian exporters and manufacturers are facing a cost disadvantage due to higher borrowing costs and tax rates. "We need to address the root cause of problems hurting the exporters and industry," he said. This comes after economic growth slipped to a more than four-year low of 5.8% in the January-March quarter.

headlines: Wipro Founder Premji to retire after 53 years, son to be Chairman
text: Wipro Founder Azim Premji will retire as Executive Chairman and Managing Director effective July 30 after having led the IT services company for 53 years. His son and Chief Strategy Officer Rishad Premji will take over as Executive Chairman while CEO Abidali Neemuchwala has been appointed as MD. Premji, however, will continue to serve as non-executive director and Founder Chairman.

headlines: Everyone stood up when National Anthem played in Bharat: Salman
text: Salman Khan, while thanking his fans for the first-day collections of 'Bharat', tweeted on Thursday, "Big thank you sabko for giving sabse bada opening mere career ka." "Par what made me the happiest & proudest is ki during a scene in my film jab national anthem is recited everyone stood up as a mark of respect," he added.

headlines: Odisha MLA makes official do sit-ups for poor roads; video viral
text: Odisha BJD MLA Saroj Meher forced a government official to do sit-ups as punishment over alleged poor quality of roads. Meher could be seen in a video telling the official to do 100 sit-ups. After doing some sit-ups, when he requested Meher to forgive him, Meher threatened him that locals would beat him up if he refused to do it.

headlines: Smriti Irani posts throwback pic, writes 'kya se kya ho gaye'
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Thursday posted two photos of her with Surat BJP MP Darshana Jardosh on Instagram, with the caption, "Kya se kya ho gaye dekhte dekhte". The first photo is some years old, while the second one is a more recent photo of the two BJP MPs. Irani further wrote, "When #thoughtfulthursday 'weighs' on you".

headlines: No meeting between PM Modi and Imran Khan at SCO Summit: MEA
text: No meeting is scheduled between PM Narendra Modi and his Pakistani counterpart Imran Khan on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit, the External Affairs Ministry said. PM Modi is attending the SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan's capital Bishkek. Over the last few years, India has refused to hold official talks with Pakistan unless it acts against cross-border terrorism.

headlines: Indian man installs 60 handpumps in poverty-stricken Pak district
text: Joginder Singh Salaria, a Dubai-based Indian businessman, has installed over 60 handpumps in Tharparkar, a poverty-stricken district in Pakistan. "While India-Pakistan tensions were high following Pulwama incident, we were installing hand pumps in these villages," said Salaria who owns a transport business. Last month, Salaria's charity had set a Guinness World Record with Iftar distribution.

headlines: 1 detained after ISIS messages appear on Navi Mumbai bridge
text: A man has been detained after messages allegedly praising ISIS appeared on the pillars of a bridge in Navi Mumbai and caused a security scare. Reportedly, he is mentally challenged and is currently undergoing treatment in a hospital. Navi Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Kumar had said the messages included names of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and ex-India Captain MS Dhoni.

headlines: German nurse convicted of killing 85 patients jailed for life
text: Niels Hoegel, a 42-year-old former German nurse was jailed for life on Thursday for the murder of 85 patients in his care. Hoegel had been charged with 100 counts of murder over allegations he killed patients between 1999 and 2005. He had injected people with lethal drugs and then tried to impress others by appearing to struggle to revive them.

headlines: I've had intense, self-destructive, heartbreak moments: Shahid
text: While speaking about overcoming negative emotions, actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I've had my very intense, self-destructive, heartbreak, angsty moments, where I've not been in control." Shahid added that as an actor, he tries to channelise these negative emotions into his performances. "The worst thing to do is to delve in self pity," the actor further said.

headlines: Priyanka wears Tarun Tahiliani saree on cover of US magazine
text: Priyanka Chopra featured on the cover of the July issue of American fashion magazine InStyle wearing a saree by fashion designer Tarun Tahiliani. Sharing the cover on Instagram, Priyanka wrote, "To me, [the saree's] beauty lies in its versatility, not just in drape and fabric." In another picture from the shoot, Priyanka is seen in a ruffled saree by Sabyasachi.

headlines: Amazon unveils drone to carry out 30-minute deliveries 'soon'
text: Amazon unveiled a new autonomous, electric 'Prime Air' drone aimed to start delivering packages to customers in 30 minutes or less, "within months". The drone can fly for up to about 24 kms and carry up to about 2.3 kgs, representing a majority of its packages. Notably, Amazon had made its first customer drone delivery in the UK in 2016.

headlines: World's 1st AI humanoid robot artist can draw from 'sight'
text: British inventor and art gallery owner Aidan Meller has co-created a robot Ai-Da, describing it as the "world's first ultra-realistic AI humanoid robot artist". Ai-Da is capable of drawing from 'sight' using cameras in the eyeballs and AI algorithms created by Oxford University scientists. Four sculptures, 20 paintings and two video works by Ai-Da will be exhibited from June 12.

headlines: Varanasi Mahant sends 'Ramcharitmanas' to WB CM Mamata
text: Mahant Balak Das from Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi has sent a copy of 'Ramcharitmanas' to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee in the hope that reading it will "purify" her thinking. He said, "She is opposing the slogan 'Jai Shri Ram' which reflects her hatred for Lord Ram." Das said that he was willing to help Mamata in understanding the scripture.

headlines: Please keep them coming: Sitharaman on ideas for FY20 budget
text: After receiving suggestions and ideas from scholars, economists and enthusiasts ahead of the full Union Budget FY20 presentation on July 5, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Please keep them coming." She added she is "grateful for every thought/idea" coming through "print, electronic, and on social media". Sitharaman said her team "carefully collates" the suggestions for her.

headlines: Ram Mandir construction must begin now: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena spokesperson Sanjay Raut on Thursday said people will "beat them with shoes" if they don't fulfil the promise of Ram Temple construction this time. "We have committed ourselves to the construction of the temple and I feel this time around the construction will start," he added. "If we don't, the country will stop trusting us," Raut further said.

headlines: Ola may pause global expansion for 2nd time in 2 yrs: Report
text: Ola may be preparing to pause its international market expansion for the second time in two years, Business Standard reported citing sources. Ola was supposed to expand to the Netherlands, Kenya, Dubai, Israel, and Brazil, it added. The ride-hailing company is also reportedly slowing down investment in its current overseas markets of the UK and Australia.

headlines: Fiat Chrysler withdraws offers for $35bn merger with Renault
text: Italian-American carmaker Fiat Chrysler on Thursday said it has withdrawn its proposal for a $35-billion merger with Renault. The company said it was unable to reach an agreement with the French government, Renault's biggest shareholder. The French carmaker had announced its board was unable to press ahead with the deal because French government representatives had requested to postpone the vote.

headlines: Bus catches fire in Andhra, narrow escape for 29 passengers
text: Around 29 passengers travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru had a narrow escape on Thursday when a bus operated by a private agency caught fire in Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh. Passengers onboard had complained of smoke, following which its driver stopped the vehicle and they deboarded. The bus was engulfed in flames by the time the fire department reached the spot.

headlines: RBI lowers GDP growth projection to 7% from 7.2% for FY20
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Thursday revised its GDP growth forecast for the current fiscal to 7% from the earlier projection of 7.2%. The central bank said it expects growth in the range of 6.4-6.7% in the first half of FY20 and 7.2-7.5% in the second half. The RBI reduced its repo rate by 25 bps to 5.75%.

headlines: Anupam takes scooter taxi to meet Akshay in Thailand, shares video
text: Actor Anupam Kher has shared a video in which he can be seen riding pillion on a scooter taxi in Pattaya, Thailand. "Took a scooter taxi to meet my friend @akshaykumar. It was great fun and adventurous. Enjoy the ride with me," he tweeted. Responding to this, Akshay tweeted, "Trust you to do something so spontaneous."

headlines: Harvey was sexually flirtatious even when he was married: Madonna
text: Singer Madonna, while recalling the time she worked with sexual harassment accused producer Harvey Weinstein in the 90s, revealed, "Harvey crossed lines...and was incredibly sexually flirtatious...with me." "He was married at the time, and I certainly wasn't interested. I was aware that he did the same with a lot of other women that I knew in the business," she added.

headlines: When guy is older, no one cares: Priyanka on 10-yr age gap with Nick
text: Speaking about people criticising the age difference between her and her husband Nick Jonas, Priyanka Chopra said, "People gave us a lot of sh*t...and still do." "I find it really amazing when you flip it and the guy is older, no one cares and actually people like it," she added. Priyanka, who is 36, is ten years older than Nick.

headlines: ABD offered to play World Cup 24 hours before SA squad announcement
text: Former South Africa captain AB de Villiers, who retired from international cricket in May 2018, offered to play 2019 World Cup just 24 hours before South Africa's squad was announced. The 35-year-old's offer was rejected by the management as he didn't fulfil the selection criteria and it would have been unfair on other players in the squad, as per ESPNcricinfo.

headlines: LS Dy Speaker post our natural claim and right: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Wednesday said the party has conveyed to the BJP leadership that it is the natural claimant to the Lok Sabha Deputy Speaker post. Raut added, "This is not our demand, it is our natural claim and right." The statement comes amid speculation over the possibility of Naveen Patnaik-led BJD getting the post.

headlines: YouTube stops paid ads on account accused of anti-gay abuse
text: YouTube has stopped paid ads on YouTuber Steven Crowder's account after he was accused of homophobic abuse against Vox journalist Carlos Maza. Crowder was asked to remove links to his merchandise shop offering offensive t-shirts to restore monetisation. Crowder used terms like "gay Latino" and "lisping queer" while referring to Maza in several videos, which YouTube refused to take down.

headlines: Haryana CM pushes aside youth who wanted to take a selfie
text: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday pushed aside a youth who was trying to take a selfie with him at an event in Karnal. Video footage shows that before attempting to take the selfie, the youth had also touched his feet to seek his blessings. In February, a video showing Khattar shouting at an elderly couple had emerged.

headlines: 19-year-old Navy sailor found hanging at INS Shivaji
text: A 19-year-old Navy sailor named Kannala Akash was found hanging from a ceiling fan in his room at INS Shivaji in Lonavala in the early hours of Wednesday. Akash, who was pursuing the Direct Entry Engineering Mechanics course, hailed from Pardi in Telangana. No suicide note has been found, and the Navy has ordered an inquiry into the case.

headlines: UK wrongly mentions Germany as an ally in World War II
text: The UK Royal Family's Twitter account on Wednesday posted a video of the Queen meeting the leaders of WWII allied nations that took part in D-Day. However, the picture shows the Queen shaking hands with German Chancellor Angela Merkel. Germany was part of the Axis Forces that fought against the Allied Forces in WWII.

headlines: Not mercy killing, rape survivor died after refusing food: Clinic
text: The Levenseinde clinic, which 17-year-old Dutch rape survivor Noa Pothoven approached in 2017 for euthanasia but was turned down, has refuted reports that she died with mercy killing. "To stop her suffering, she stopped eating and drinking," it said while quoting her friends. Dutch Health Minister Hugo de Jonge also confirmed that her family said "there's no question of euthanasia".

headlines: RBI scraps NEFT, RTGS transaction charges, banks to pass on benefits
text: The RBI on Thursday decided to remove charges levied by it for transactions processed in the RTGS and NEFT systems to boost digital transactions. Banks will be required to pass these benefits to their customers and instructions to banks in this regard will be issued within a week. The central bank levies minimum charges on banks for such transactions.

headlines: Hindu group accuses Ayushmann's 'Article 15' of maligning Brahmins
text: Parshuram Sena, a Hindu outfit in UP, has alleged that the upcoming Ayushmann Khurrana starrer 'Article 15' maligns Brahmins. The film is inspired by an incident wherein two Dalit women were raped and murdered in UP's Badaun. "If the film is based on the Badaun incident, where was the need to turn the accused into Brahmins?" a youth leader said.

headlines: Mental Hai Kya maker denies that Kangana tried to reshoot scenes
text: 'Mental Hai Kya' director Prakash Kovelamudi denied reports that Kangana Ranaut urged the film's makers to reshoot several scenes as she was unhappy with how her role had shaped up. "We've shot [the film] without any negativity. Both Kangana...and Rajkummar Rao have been fantastic to shoot with," Kovelamudi said. He added the film's release date was shifted for business-related reasons.

headlines: Raghava is best director for Akshay's film: Laxmmi Bomb producer
text: Reacting to Raghava Lawrence coming back on board as director of Akshay Kumar's 'Laxmmi Bomb' after earlier stepping down, the film's co-producer Shabinaa Khan said, "Raghava's the best director for this film." "There were minor creative differences which are all sorted out now," she added. Raghava earlier quit the film claiming that the film's poster was released without informing him.

headlines: Rape case against French actor Gérard dropped over lack of proof
text: A case against 70-year-old French actor Gérard Depardieu for allegedly raping a 22-year-old actress in Paris was dropped due to a lack of evidence. An investigation was initiated after the actress filed a complaint accusing Depardieu of raping and assaulting her at his Paris mansion between August 7 and 13 last year. Depardieu denied all the allegations against him.

headlines: We're working on script for Rowdy Rathore sequel: Co-producer
text: Shabinaa Khan, who co-produced the Akshay Kumar starrer 'Rowdy Rathore', has confirmed that the film will soon be getting a sequel. "We are in the process of writing 'Rowdy Rathore 2' right now and inshallah, it will feature Akshay in the lead, the producer said. Sonakshi Sinha starred opposite Akshay in the series' first film, which released in 2012.

headlines: 31,000-yr-old milk teeth's DNA reveals new ancient Siberians
text: DNA from two 31,000-year-old milk teeth found near Yana River revealed a previously unknown group of people lived there during last Ice Age. The finding was part of a wider study which also discovered 10,000-year-old human remains in another site in Siberia are genetically related to Native Americans, first time such close genetic links were discovered outside of the US.

headlines: Indias stature increased in world in last 5 yrs: Jaishankar
text: Union Minister S Jaishankar said that a large majority of people in India have recognised that the country's stature in the world has risen in the last five years. He added the government has kept alive and perhaps even strengthened expectation of change in India. Addressing a seminar, Jaishankar said the government looks different from the outside than from inside.

headlines: Cong leader offers prayers for rain in drought-hit Karnataka
text: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Thursday offered 'Parjanya Japa' (pooja) at Sri Rishya Shringeshwara temple in Chikkamagaluru for rain in drought-hit Karnataka. The government, in its circular, has ordered all the temples under the Religious and Charitable Endowments Department to conduct special poojas to appease the rain Gods. Several Karnataka districts have officially been declared as drought-ridden.

headlines: Meghalaya people planted 1.5 million trees across state: CM
text: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma informed that the people of the state planted 1.5 million trees across all the 11 districts to mark the World Environment Day. He added, "I extend my appreciation and congratulations to the people of the state for the record success of Meghalaya One Citizen One Tree campaign." Sangma said, "Let us pledge to sustain the campaign."

headlines: Kashmir will not be given to Muslims as a gift: Shiv Sena
text: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' said that the Muslim population in Jammu and Kashmir is 68.35% while the Hindu population is 28.45%, but that doesn't mean "Kashmir will be given to Muslims as a gift". It added they're Indians too and the country's laws must be "extended to them". It said, "For this, Article 370 must be abrogated".

headlines: They like to blame Kim Jong-un: Trump on N Korea execution reports
text: On being asked about reports of North Korea executing its officials over the Vietnam Summit, US President Donald Trump said, "I don't know if the reports are correct...They like to blame Kim Jong-un immediately." The Vietnam summit had ended without a deal as North Korea and the US failed to agree to certain aspects for denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula.

headlines: Springboard guarantees transition into Data Science for learners
text: Springboard launched Data Science Career Track in India after meeting 100% job guarantee for 3 years in the US for working professionals. Data scientists from companies like PayTm, Flipkart, Ola, Swiggy, Myntra, Walmart, Target, Hackerrank, InMobi have joined Springboard as mentors to provide industry perspectives. Learners benefit from their expertise through weekly online calls where they discuss their project progress.

headlines: Salman slaps bodyguard for allegedly misbehaving with young fan
text: A video of actor Salman Khan slapping a bodyguard for allegedly misbehaving with a young fan has surfaced online. The guard had reportedly roughed up the child, who was waiting amid the crowd of fans. The incident took place while Salman was exiting the screening of his film 'Bharat' on Tuesday night, reports added.

headlines: RBI cuts repo rate for 3rd time this year as GDP growth slows
text: RBI on Thursday reduced its repo rate by 25 bps to 5.75% to boost growth after GDP growth slowed to a five-year low of 5.8% last quarter. The benchmark interest rate was reduced by 25 bps each in last two policy reviews. Retail inflation was at 2.92% in April, staying below the medium-term target of 4% for nine straight months.

headlines: I intend to live with my mother for the rest of my life: Sara
text: Actress Sara Ali Khan, in an interview with Harper's Bazaar India, said that she intends to live with her mother Amrita Singh for the rest of her life. Sara added, "She gets upset when I say that because she has this whole marriage plan for me, but she can also come with me no, what's the problem?"

headlines: Kohli wins 50 ODIs as captain in 69 matches, fastest Asian to do so
text: Virat Kohli registered his 50th ODI victory as captain after leading India to a six-wicket victory against South Africa in the 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. The 30-year-old reached the landmark in his 69th match as captain, becoming the fastest Asian skipper to achieve the feat. The world record (63 matches) is jointly held by Ricky Ponting and Clive Llyod.

headlines: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to get 2019 Global Leadership Award
text: Madurai-born Google CEO Sundar Pichai has been chosen alongside American stock exchange Nasdaq's President Adena Friedman to get the 2019 Global Leadership Award by US-India Business Council (USIBC). "I'm proud Google has been able to contribute to India's exciting growth story," Pichai said. The award is offered to top executives whose firms help catalyse growth in US-India commercial corridor.

headlines: Entire MP village adopts IIT students' model for solar power to cook
text: IIT Bombay students helped design a Central Government's trial model in Madhya Pradesh's Bancha village, which provided all of the village's 74 houses with induction plates that use solar energy to cook food. The work for the same was completed by December 2018. "We don't have to go to forests and spend time collecting wood for fire anymore," residents said.

headlines: Centre reconstitutes 8 Cabinet Committees, Shah part of all
text: The Centre on Thursday reconstituted eight Cabinet Committees including the Appointment Committee of the Cabinet, among others and Union Home Minister Amit Shah is part of all these committees. Of the eight Cabinet Committees, PM Narendra Modi is part of six committees. The members of Security Committee are PM Modi, Union Ministers Shah, Nirmala Sitharaman, S Jaishankar and Rajnath Singh.

headlines: Arunachal minister Tumke's son gets life sentence for murder
text: Kajum Bagra, the son of Arunachal Pradesh Industries Minister Tumke Bagra, has been convicted for murder and sentenced to life imprisonment by a district court. Kajum had fatally shot the victim, Kenjum Kamsi, outside a hotel in March 2017 following a brief altercation over the payment of a contract. The incident had been captured on CCTV camera.

headlines: Air hostess accuses colleague, his friend of rape; 1 arrested
text: A 25-year-old air hostess has accused her 23-year-old colleague and his friend of raping her in their Mumbai apartment on Monday night. The alleged incident occurred when she was in an inebriated state, and her boyfriend and father were unable to reach her phone. The police have arrested her colleague, stating that their probe shows only his involvement.

headlines: Exam question papers go missing from Telangana police station
text: Two trunk boxes containing question papers of the 'Intermediate Advance Supplementary Examinations' went missing from a police station in Warangal on Wednesday. The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education announced, "The exams will be conducted as per schedule from 7/6/19 with new sets of question papers." Over 4.6 lakh first and second-year students have registered for the exams.

headlines: Aayush Sharma to play Army officer in his next film 'Kwatha'
text: Aayush Sharma, who is married to Salman Khan's sister Arpita, will play an Army officer in an upcoming film titled 'Kwatha', the actor confirmed. "It's a huge honour to play an Army Officer. I'm really looking forward to start shooting for the film," Aayush said. The actor made his Bollywood debut last year in the film 'Loveyatri'.

headlines: In process of getting rights for AndhaDhun Tamil remake: Dhanush
text: While speaking about a potential Tamil remake of the 2018 thriller film 'AndhaDhun', actor Dhanush said, "It's a brilliant film and we have already started the process of acquiring the rights." "It's one of those thrillers which I wouldnt mind remaking in Tamil," the actor added. 'AndhaDhun' featured actors Ayushmann Khurrana, Tabu and Radhika Apte in lead roles.

headlines: Robert Downey Jr's new foundation to clean Earth using nanotech
text: Hollywood actor Robert Downey Jr announced a new foundation that will help clean the Earth by harnessing robotics and nanotechnology, adding, "We could clean up the planet significantly, if not totally, in 10 years." The Footprint Coalition is scheduled to begin operations by April 2020. Downey made the announcement in Amazon's MARS (Machine learning, Automation, Robotics and Space) conference.

headlines: A life well lived: Kajol on pic with late father-in-law Veeru Devgan
text: Actress Kajol shared a picture with her late father-in-law action director Veeru Devgan, who passed away last month, and wrote, "In happier times." "So many people mourn the life of the man but that was a life well lived," her caption further read. The picture was clicked at an award function, where Veeru was honoured with a Lifetime Achievement award.

headlines: US TV host David Letterman seen with SRK as he greets fans on Eid
text: Shah Rukh Khan was joined by American television host David Letterman as he greeted fans gathered outside his Mumbai home on the occasion of Eid. The actor's 6-year-old son AbRam was also seen waving at fans as his father held him in his arms. Earlier this year, David interviewed Shah Rukh for an upcoming episode of his talk show.

headlines: Skype can be classified as telecom operator, says EU court
text: The European Court of Justice said Microsoft's voice and video call service Skype can be considered a telecom operator as it offers paid-for service and has deals with network operators to carry calls. Skype had argued it didn't transmit signals itself or provide electronic communications services such as those defined by EU rules. Microsoft agreed to comply with the ruling.

headlines: Time and again BJP leaders are insulting Nitish: Manjhi
text: Amid row over Union Minister Giriraj Singh's comment on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar attending an Iftar party, ex-state CM Jitan Ram Manjhi criticised the BJP saying that time and again the party leaders are "insulting" Nitish. "Giriraj tweeted at the behest of the BJP leadership. [Union Minister] Amit Shah has reprimanded, but why didn't he delete the tweet?" Manjhi asked.

headlines: Mamata behaving in anti-constitutional way: RSS leader
text: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Wednesday accused West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee of behaving in a way that was "anti-democracy, anti-secular, anti-constitutional and anti-human". He added, "She even went to the extent of saying that the Prime Minister was not her PM. This shows she is a dark patch on democracy." Kumar further said that Mamata should "improve her behaviour".

headlines: National Olympiad Foundation buys woman-led edtech startup
text: Jaipur-based Edurer, an edtech startup led by Anjali Bansiwal, was acquired by the National Olympiad Foundation (NOF) in a part-cash and part-equity deal for an undisclosed amount. Bansiwal, who is an IIT Jodhpur graduate, will join NOF as its CMO, YourStory stated. Edurer offers cloud-based SaaS products, designed to meet the learning and administrative needs of institutions and corporates.

headlines: Italy open to taking stake in Fiat in possible Renault deal
text: Italy would be open to taking a stake in Italian-American carmaker Fiat's proposed merger with France's Renault, provided the deal triggers economic benefits for the country, a government undersecretary said. The combined entity is expected to produce roughly 15 million units a year, he added. Notably, the merger would create the third-largest carmaker in the world.

headlines: Don't waste water: Ramdev over Maharashtra drought
text: Yoga guru Ramdev on Thursday urged people not to waste water and utilise every drop in the wake of dried water sources in Maharashtra. He also urged the authorities to make "requisite arrangements" for the state's drought-hit areas. Several isolated pockets of the state are reeling under water scarcity, with Marathwada and Beed being the worst-hit regions.

headlines: Make Tamil compulsory in central govt offices: MK Stalin
text: Amid row over the proposed three-language norm, DMK chief MK Stalin on Wednesday demanded that Tamil should be made compulsory in central government offices. Paying homage at the memorial of IUML leader Quaid-E-Millath, he added the DMK will continue to extend support to make Tamil compulsory. Stalin claimed that Centre withdrew its decision over the norm following opposition from Tamils.

headlines: India open WC campaign with win, hand SA their 3rd straight defeat
text: India opened their 2019 World Cup campaign with a 6-wicket victory over South Africa on Wednesday. This is the first time South Africa have lost each of their first three matches in a World Cup. The match witnessed Rohit Sharma smash his 23rd ODI hundred and Yuzvendra Chahal become the second Indian leg-spinner to take four-wicket haul in World Cup.

headlines: OPPO Reno Series to go on sale starting June 7
text: OPPO's Reno series is all set to go on sale starting June 7. The different variants of this smartphone series will be available across all offline stores as well as on popular e-commerce platforms. Powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 processor, the smartphone features the world's first periscope telephoto lens and the first-of-its-kind Shark-Fin rising camera.

headlines: Rihanna named world's richest female musician with $600 mn wealth
text: Rihanna has been named the world's richest female musician by Forbes magazine with an estimated wealth of $600 million. Majority of her wealth comes from her partnership with LVMH, the French luxury goods giant run by the world's third-richest person Bernard Arnault. Forbes estimates that Rihanna owns 15% of the $3-billion Fenty Beauty line while LVMH has about 50%.

headlines: Fans criticise ICC for sharing Virat Kohli's illustration as king
text: Several fans criticised ICC for sharing India captain Virat Kohli's illustration as king ahead of India's 2019 World Cup opener against South Africa, with some suggesting the governing body should be more neutral. "India is not the only country who participated in CWC," a user wrote. "Other teams to ICC right now: Are we a joke to you?," wrote another.

headlines: Well begun is half done: Defence Minister Rajnath as India beat SA
text: Following India's six-wicket victory against South Africa in their 2019 World Cup opener, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took to Twitter to congratulate the team. "Well begun is half done! In this match we witnessed some memorable performances by Yuzvendra Chahal, Jasprit Bumrah and Rohit Sharma. Overall it was a solid teamwork. Best wishes for the games ahead," he wrote.

headlines: New Zealand maintain 100% win record vs Bangladesh in World Cups
text: New Zealand defeated Bangladesh by two wickets to win their second consecutive match in 2019 World Cup. New Zealand also maintained their 100% win record against the Asian side by registering their fifth victory in five matches across World Cups. Bangladesh, who had defeated South Africa in their first 2019 World Cup match, will next face hosts England on Saturday.

headlines: Batsmen shouldn't be judged solely by runs they score: Sanju Samson
text: Kerala wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has said batsmen shouldn't be judged solely by runs they score. "You've to understand nature of the pitch first," he stated. "It's difficult if you play for a state like Kerala where...wickets aren't conducive for batting. Five-day matches get over in one-and-a-half days and a batsman scoring 50 is adjudged Man of the Match," he added.

headlines: India doesn't have good air, can't breathe in some cities: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said in an interview that countries like India, China and Russia, among others, do not have "very good air and water" and have high levels of pollution. "If you go to certain citiesyou can't even breatheThey don't do the responsibility," he added. "The US right now has among the cleanest climates there are," he further stated.

headlines: She's getting depressed: Mom of 11-yr-old Polish girl India blacklisted
text: Poland's Marta Kotlarska, who's been blacklisted by India along with her 11-year-old daughter, today tweeted that her daughter is "swinging into depression." They were blacklisted by India this year on the grounds of overstaying. "My employer refused to provide documents necessary to prolong visa...I tried to get NOC from MHA after the situation, no one replied," Marta added.

headlines: Video shows Delhi minor firing at house, threatening to kill; held
text: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested a minor boy after a video surfaced online wherein he is allegedly firing at a house and threatening to kill the owner. The police laid a trap to nab him after they got information that he would be coming to Uttam Nagar Bus Terminal. A country-made pistol and a live cartridge were seized from him.

headlines: Lennart Johansson, father of Champions League, passes away at 89
text: Lennart Johansson, who oversaw the introduction of the Champions League in 1992 during his 17-year reign as president of European football's governing body, has passed away aged 89. "Johansson was our biggest international football leader of all time, no Swedish has had a similar influence on football in the world," Swedish FA president said.

headlines: Tamil Cong MP praises PM Modi; faces criticism from party
text: After Tamil Nadu Congress MP H Vasanthakumar on Tuesday praised Central government for rescuing 20 fishermen stranded in mid-sea, party MLA S Vijayadharani criticised him for doing so. "It's the government's responsibility to save every citizen. Since BJP's state chief is his relative, it might be misinterpreted," the MLA said. "I just thanked the government for timely action," Vasanthakumar said.

headlines: No need to rush Renault-Fiat talks: French Finance Minister
text: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire has said there was no need to rush through the $35-billion merger talks between France's Renault and Italian-American carmaker Fiat Chrysler. "We want to make the Renault-Fiat merger but it must be done in good conditions," he said. He further reiterated that the eventual deal should protect French interests and preserve jobs at home.

headlines: Scientist regrowing lost ganja once smoked by Bob Marley
text: Scientist Machel Emanuel is regrowing a lost form of marijuana that he claims was smoked by Bob Marley in the 1970s. Reportedly, landrace cannabis earlier grew naturally in Jamaica but later disappeared due to human intervention. Emanuel visited Guadeloupe, Trinidad and Dominica in pursuit of Rastas living in the countryside and still cultivating remnants of these plants.

headlines: Train passengers trapped for 6hrs in France tunnel after power cut
text: Passengers on a high-speed train were stuck for six hours in a tunnel outside Paris, France, on Tuesday, having been left without electricity or working toilets. The high-speed train was bound for Barcelona, Spain, and got stuck after it suffered a power cut. The passengers were relocated through the tunnel to another train.

headlines: Govt probe into Jet Airways may derail revival plan: Reports
text: The government's probe into Jet Airways and its Founder Naresh Goyal could derail plans of Hinduja Group, Etihad Airways and Abu Dhabi's Mubadala Investment Company to invest in the grounded airline, reports said. Currently, the I-T department is probing possible tax violation case against Jet. Further, Corporate Affairs Ministry has ordered a probe over allegations of Companies Act violations.

headlines: Rohit smashes hundred in India's first match at 2019 World Cup
text: Opener Rohit Sharma smashed a hundred off 128 balls against South Africa at Rose Bowl stadium in Southampton in India's first match at the 2019 World Cup on Wednesday. The 32-year-old became the seventh Indian batsman to slam multiple hundreds in World Cup history. Rohit has now slammed 23 hundreds in ODI cricket.

headlines: HC rules in favour of Ilaiyaraaja, says he holds rights over songs
text: The Madras High Court has ruled that Ilaiyaraaja has the rights over the songs composed by him. The composer sought to restrain a few music labels from monetising the songs composed by him without his permission. Meanwhile, the court dismissed a separate suit filed by Agi Music in 2013 accusing him of having breached the terms of a 2007 agreement.

headlines: Suhana Khan's selfie with ATM card inside phone cover goes viral
text: A mirror selfie of Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, wherein her ATM card can be seen inside her phone cover, has gone viral. The photo is the profile picture of Suhana's private Instagram account. Shared by different fan clubs, it received comments like, "There's definitely few crores in it for daily expenses" and "Even rich kids use back cover".

headlines: Commentary box at venue of India's 1st WC game is in hotel bedroom
text: Former South Africa captain Shaun Pollock took to Twitter to reveal that the commentary box at the venue of India's first 2019 World Cup match, Rose Bowl, is actually in a hotel. The 45-year-old shared a video tour of the makeshift commentary box, showing beds of the bedroom stacked up. "Pretty unique really," he later said about the arrangement.

headlines: I don't see China targeting us amid US trade dispute: Apple CEO
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook, when asked about US-China trade dispute and a potential targeting by China, said, "The Chinese have not targeted Apple at all and I don't anticipate that happening." Cook said iPhone is made everywhere and not just China and a tariff on it would hurt all manufacturing countries. However, he added China would be hurt the most.

headlines: Kamal Nath takes out ads in papers, blames BJP for power cuts in MP
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath on Wednesday posted advertisements in local newspapers holding the previous BJP government and manmade obstructions responsible for unscheduled power cuts. CM's media coordinator said the manmade obstructions meant obstructions created by "BJP minded people" in the power distribution companies. Kamal Nath said there was more power generation than demand in MP.

headlines: Pawar invited to PM oath in VVIP section, not 5th row: President Office
text: Days after reports claimed NCP chief Sharad Pawar skipped PM Narendra Modi's oath-taking ceremony over seat allotment, the President's Office issued a clarification on Wednesday. "Pawar was invited to the 'V section', where the most senior guests sat...He had a labelled first-row seat," it said. "Somebody in his office may have confused V (for VVIP) for Roman V," it added.

headlines: U'khand Finance Minister dies in US, had almost fainted during Budget
text: Uttarakhand Finance Minister Prakash Pant passed away at 58 on Wednesday in US, where he was undergoing treatment for a lung ailment. In February, Pant had almost fainted twice while he was presenting the state budget, and CM Trivendra Singh Rawat finished the rest of his speech. Notably, CM Rawat had recently taken over the portfolios headed by Pant.

headlines: Pulwama martyr's children hosted by district judge in Rajasthan
text: The two children of Narayan Lal Gurjar, a CRPF jawan martyred in Pulwama terror attack, were hosted for three days by a district judge in his house in Rajasthan. "They should feel that the country is with them," said Pratapgarh district judge Rajendra Kumar Sharma. Gurjar was among the 40 CRPF jawans who were martyred in the attack in February.

headlines: Women body seeks reservation for pregnant women on Mumbai trains
text: Maharashtra State Commission for Women wrote to Railways Minister Piyush Goyal, urging him to reserve or prioritise minimum two seats for pregnant and lactating mothers in every general compartment of Mumbai local trains. The commission praised Railways Ministry for allowing pregnant women to travel in handicapped compartment but added it isn't always possible to board it during rush hours.

headlines: Nepal picks up 4 bodies, 11 tons of garbage in Everest clean-up
text: Nepali climbers have retrieved four bodies and collected around 11 tons of decades-old garbage from Mount Everest and its approach below the base camp. The bodies haven't been identified and it wasn't known when the people died. The mountain's slopes are littered with human excrement, used oxygen bottles, torn tents, ropes, broken ladders and plastic wrappers left behind by climbers.

headlines: Metal thieves steal 23-metre-long central part of bridge in Russia
text: Suspected metal thieves have stolen 23-metre-long central part of a railway bridge in Russia's Arctic region of Murmansk. The central part of the bridge had fallen into the water but days later, there was no trace of the section or any debris. The railway over the bridge was reportedly used to transport rare earth elements but was closed in 2007.

headlines: CEO Tim Cook rejects allegations of Apple being 'a monopoly'
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook has rejected allegations that the US tech giant is "a monopoly". "I don't think anybody reasonable is going to come to [that] conclusion...Our share is much more modest. We don't have a dominant position in any market," he said. Cook's comments come as Apple reportedly faces a possible US Justice Department investigation into anti-competitive behaviour.

headlines: Videos don't violate policies: YouTube on YouTuber's anti-gay slurs
text: A Vox journalist Carlos Maza claimed that he spent two years getting targetted by racist and homophobic abuse from a YouTuber and the platform recently decided the "videos as posted didn't violate its policies". YouTuber, Steven Crowder, had used terms like "gay Latino" and "lisping queer" while referring to the journalist. Crowder in a video called his remarks "friendly ribbing".

headlines: Congress questions Centre over missing IAF AN-32 aircraft
text: While praying for the safety and well-being of the IAF personnel and crew of the missing AN-32 aircraft, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala posed a series of questions to the Centre. "Why has the Centre not allocated sufficient defence budget to replace the AN-32 fleet?" he tweeted. "Why the missing AN-32 had SOS Signal Unit which was obsolete?" Surjewala added.

headlines: AAP announced free ride scheme for own benefit: Sheila Dikshit
text: Congress leader Sheila Dikshit on Wednesday termed Delhi government's proposal to make Metro and DTC bus rides free for women a "political move". "It would be good if they can do it. But it's being done for their own benefit...This should be seen politically," she said. The AAP government said they will try implementing the plan in next two-three months.

headlines: Paytm founder, others invest in plant seller Nurturing Green
text: Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma has invested an undisclosed amount in Nurturing Green, a retail chain of offline and online stores promoting green gifting, landscaping and other services. Mohit Goel of Omaxe, among others, also participated in the funding round. "In 2019-2020...[we] want to reach a target of 1,00,000 units sold per month," CEO Annu Grover said.

headlines: Air pollution kills 1 lakh kids under 5 yrs in India a year: Study
text: Air pollution is killing over one lakh children under the age of five in India every year, Centre for Science and Environments 'State of Indias Environment' report stated. The risk is higher for girls as 9.6 out of 10,000 girls die before five years of age. Air pollution was found to be responsible for 12.5% of all deaths in India.

headlines: Chennai's Loyola College gives admission to transgenders
text: Chennai's Loyola College has given admission to two transgenders, Mirthulla and Diya, in undergraduate courses. They will pursue a Bachelor in Multimedia and a Bachelor in French Literature, respectively. "I always aspired to be a journalist as I can highlight my community members' problems through my work. I want to improve mine and their lives with my articles," said Mirthulla.

headlines: There's a limit to our patience: N Korea to US on denuclearisation
text: North Korea has warned the US that the agreement to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula, which was signed between the two countries last year, could be at risk. It called on the US to drop its policy of "only insisting on our unilateral surrender of nuclear weapons". "There is a limit to our patience," a North Korean official said.

headlines: World Bank retains growth forecast for India at 7.5% for FY20
text: The World Bank has retained its forecast of India's growth rate at 7.5% for the next three fiscal years. The growth will be supported by robust investment, private consumption and a more accommodative monetary policy, the bank said. The GST regime is still in the process of being fully established, creating some uncertainty about projections of government revenues, it added.

headlines: H-1B visa approvals dropped 10% in 2018: US authorities
text: The approval of H-1B visa registered a sharp decline of 10% in the fiscal year 2018, according to the US authorities. The US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) approved 3,35,000 H-1B visas, which included both new and renewable, during the year. The H-1B visa programme is the main vehicle through which US employers can sponsor skilled foreign workers for admission.

headlines: Sophie Turner starrer 'X-Men: Dark Phoenix' hits the theatres
text: Sophie Turner starrer 'X-Men: Dark Phoenix', which released today, "fizzles out forgettably", wrote The Guardian. "Action-wise, there are a few fun moments, but nothing memorable," said The Times of India (TOI). Firstpost said the film "collapses under its own weight [and] ends X-Men series on underwhelming note." It has been rated 2/5 (The Guardian), 3/5 (TOI) and 1.5/5 (Firstpost).

headlines: Saw clips of Priyanka's B'wood films, would love to do one: Sophie
text: Actress Sophie Turner, known for starring in 'Game of Thrones', has said that she has seen clips of her sister-in-law Priyanka Chopra's Bollywood films and would love to star in one. "I love...seeing the big spectacles Bollywood movies are, the way they create these beautiful decades on sets, I'd love to...do a bit of singing and dancing," she added.

headlines: MS Dhoni is faster than computer, says Shoaib Akhtar
text: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that MS Dhoni is faster than computer, suggesting that he knows pitches even better than what technology can predict. He added that Dhoni is a big player and Virat Kohli is lucky to have Dhoni's "brain" in the team. He further said that India are his favourites to win against South Africa.

headlines: Khel bhi jeeto aur dil bhi: PM Modi wishes Team India for World Cup
text: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to wish Team India luck for 2019 World Cup. "As Team India begins its World Cup journey today...best wishes to the entire Team. May this tournament witness good cricket and celebrate the spirit of sportsmanship. Khel bhi jeeto aur dil bhi," he wrote. India are playing against South Africa in their WC opener today.

headlines: What will happen to iTunes music after app is removed from Macs?
text: Apple officially announced it'll kill its iTunes app for macOS users, replacing it with three separate apps for music, podcasts and shows or movies with the Catalina update. Apple Music in macOS Catalina will import users' existing music libraries from iTunes in their entirety. The iTunes Store will continue to stay and will be available in the sidebar in Finder.

headlines: ISIS messages with Dhoni, Kejriwal's names cause panic in Navi Mumbai
text: Messages allegedly praising Islamic State appeared on pillars of a bridge at Navi Mumbai's Uran neighbourhood caused a security scare. Navi Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Kumar said that the messages included names of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and ex-India captain MS Dhoni. "We are investigating every possible angle to find out who could have drawn the inscription," he added.

headlines: BJP MP seeks action against people offering Namaz on roads
text: BJP MP from Bulandshahr Bhola Singh on Wednesday said that action should be taken against those who offer Namaz on roads. He added, "If there is an inconvenience due to someone's festival of any religion, it should not be done". He further said that Hindus celebrate Holi, Diwali, Raksha Bandhan, "but no one experiences inconvenience due to our festivals".

headlines: Andhra techie drowns in US lake during birthday celebrations
text: Avinash Kuna, a 32-year-old software engineer from Visakhapatnam, drowned in a lake in the US' New Jersey on Saturday while celebrating his birthday. Avinash had rented a boat and invited eight friends, mostly from his workplace, for a boat ride. He dove into the water but got caught up in the weeds in the lake and was pulled under.

headlines: Anyone lost 590-kg ganja? Don't panic, we found it: Assam Police
text: After Dhubri Police seized a huge consignment of ganja, Assam Police took to Twitter and jokingly asked its owner to get in touch. "Anyone lost a huge (590 kgs) amount of Cannabis/Ganja and a truck in and around Chagolia Checkpoint last night? Don't panic...we found it. Please get in touch with @Dhubri_Police. They'll help you out, for sure," it tweeted.

headlines: Protestors in J&K pelt stones, wave Pakistan & ISIS flags on Eid
text: Protestors in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar pelted stones on security forces and waved flags of Pakistan and ISIS on Wednesday on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. Similar clashes were reported in Sopore in north Kashmir and Anantnag in south Kashmir. In Nowhatta, masked protestors reportedly held banners in support of banned Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar and slain militant commander Zakir Musa.

headlines: Minor boy in Rajasthan beaten up by locals for molesting girl: Police
text: Rajasthan Police has said a minor boy in Pali was beaten up by locals for allegedly molesting a minor girl. A case under POCSO Act was registered against him and he was sent to juvenile protection home. A video of the incident showed a group of men thrashing the boy, who was lying on the ground with his limbs tied.

headlines: Pakistan military cuts defence budget amid financial crisis
text: The Pakistani military has cut the defence budget for the next fiscal year as the financial crisis-hit country launches an austerity programme. The military said that the three services will manage the impact of the cut through internal measures. Pakistan PM Imran Khan said the money saved would be used for the development of the merged tribal areas and Balochistan.

headlines: App developers sue Apple over App Store fees, practices
text: App developers filed a lawsuit against Apple alleging it knowingly used its App Store monopoly to implement profit-killing commissions and fees on developers. The lawsuit claims Apple charges 30% commission on paid app and in-app products' sale and requires developers selling products via App Store to pay an annual fee of $99. The case was filed in California.

headlines: M&M arm looks to sell electric vehicle parts to global firms
text: Mahindra Electric Mobility (MEM), a unit of Mahindra & Mahindra, is in talks with global manufacturers to sell its locally made components like electric powertrains. This is part of the automaker's move to develop its Bengaluru facility into a hub for manufacturing electric vehicles. MEM will begin supplying electric powertrains to South Korea's SsangYong by 2020, CEO Mahesh Babu said.

headlines: JLR and BMW to jointly develop electric vehicle technologies
text: Tata Motors' Jaguar Land Rover and Germany-based BMW Group on Wednesday said they are collaborating to develop next-generation electric drive units (EDUs). The automakers will jointly develop electric motors, transmissions and power electronics to lower costs of developing electric cars. The production of the co-developed EDUs will be carried out by each partner at their respective plants.

headlines: CM Singh pledges to make Punjab healthiest in country
text: On World Environment Day, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh pledged to make the state "healthiest" in the country. While launching "Tandarust Punjab 2.0" mission, he added that the aim of the mission is to provide clean air and water, safe food, and ensuring a healthy environment of the state. "Looking forward to your support on this mission!" the CM tweeted.

headlines: Environmental issues as important as political ones: Rahul
text: On World Environment Day, Congress' Rahul Gandhi stressed on the need for treating environmental issues on par with political ones. In a Facebook post, Gandhi wrote, "Till we make environmental issues, political issues, they won't get the importance they deserve." "We're at a tipping point...if we don't reverse environmental degradation we're causing, there may be no turning back," Gandhi added.

headlines: Delhi man guilty of drunk driving ordered to serve at old age home
text: A Delhi court on Wednesday directed a man, prosecuted for drunken driving, to do social service at an old age home for two weeks between 10 am and 5 pm as punishment. The man had filed a plea against a trial court order that had sentenced him to two days of imprisonment and cancelled his driving license permanently.

headlines: BSF personnel, Pakistan Rangers exchange sweets on Eid
text: On the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr, Border Security Force soldiers and Pakistan Rangers exchanged sweets at the Attari-Wagah border in Punjab. They shook hands and greeted each other as soon as the border gates opened. Personnel of the border guarding forces have been traditionally exchanging sweets on religious and national festivals of the two countries.

headlines: No planet, no future: 250 kids hold protest at Jantar Mantar
text: At least 250 children on Tuesday gathered at Jantar Mantar in Delhi to raise awareness about environmental problems. They held placards that said, 'Planet nahi toh future nahi', 'Don't waste fossil fuels, don't be fossil fools', among others. The kids were inspired by the 16-year-old climate activist from Sweden, Greta Thunberg, who initiated the global movement of student climate strikes.

headlines: IL&FS unit confirms investigations by government authorities
text: Cash-strapped IL&FS Group's flagship lending unit IFIN on Tuesday confirmed for the first time that it's under investigation by various government agencies. The outcome of these investigations is still pending, IFIN said, adding that it had engaged Grant Thornton to conduct a forensic audit. This came after media reports said probes had found discrepancies in loan accounts associated with IL&FS.

headlines: Sehwag engages in Twitter banter before India-South Africa match
text: Ahead of the India-South Africa World Cup match, former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to post 'SockThem With Sehwag' video. In the video he was seen taking a light-hearted jibe at former South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes and South Africa. 'SockThem' is a campaign by PUMA around the cricket season.

headlines: Don't f*ck with my freedom: Miley after being grabbed by male fan
text: Singer Miley Cyrus responded after a video of a fan groping and trying to kiss her emerged online. "She can be wearing what she wants...She can be with her husband. She can be with her girlfriend...She CAN'T be grabbed without her consent. #DontF*ckWithMyFreedom," Miley tweeted. The incident happened while she was leaving a hotel in Spain with her husband.

headlines: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif starrer 'Bharat' hits the theatres
text: Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif starrer 'Bharat', which released today, "is an Eid winner," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). 'Bharat' is "well-intentioned, entertaining and doesn't succumb to the trappings of commercial potboilers," said The Times of India (TOI). The Indian Express called the film "more miss than hit". It has been rated 3/5 (HT), 3.5/5 (TOI) and 2.5/5 (The Indian Express).

headlines: Apple to ask app makers to put its login button above Google, FB
text: Apple will ask developers to put its new "Sign in with Apple" button on iPhone and iPad apps above its rivals Google and Facebook's login buttons, its latest design guidelines revealed. Apple unveiled its login button at the Worldwide Developers Conference on Monday. App makers will have to compulsorily add Apple's button if they wish to include Google or Facebook's.

headlines: How are you, Tim Apple? Indian student asks Apple CEO Tim Cook
text: Palash Taneja, an 18-year-old Delhi-based student attending Apple Worldwide Developers Conference in California, jokingly asked the company's CEO Tim Cook, "How are you, Tim Apple?" As people burst into laughter, Tim responded, "I am good and aware of what you mean to convey." Taneja's question was a reference to US President wrongly addressing Tim Cook as Tim Apple in March.

headlines: Swiggy may raise $1B with up to $500M from SoftBank: Report
text: Bengaluru-based Swiggy is in advanced talks to raise up to $1 billion including a $300-500 million investment from Japanese conglomerate SoftBank itself, Livemint reported. Reports in January had suggested SoftBank has dropped plans to invest in Swiggy's rival, Gurugram-based Zomato. SoftBank's decision to prefer Swiggy had reportedly come after it raised $1 billion from Naspers in December 2018.

headlines: Delhi Traffic Police constable alleges harassment by seniors
text: A video of a Delhi Traffic Police constable crying and alleging harassment by his superiors has surfaced online. In the video, he asked for help and said, "I was marked absent by my seniors despite being on duty. They said they are very powerful." However, an official said he was marked absent because he left his duty on road.

headlines: Agra to get panic buttons to alert police, turn traffic lights red
text: The Agra Municipal Corporation has announced that panic buttons will be installed at 63 major streets and junctions. Mayor Naveen Jain said that, once a panic button is pressed, all traffic lights in Agra will turn red to obstruct the perpetrator's movement and alert the nearby police station. Alerts can also be sent to ambulance services and the fire brigade.

headlines: India-born Pramila 1st S Asian American woman to preside over House
text: Democratic lawmaker Pramila Jayapal has become the first South Asian American woman to preside over the House of Representatives. "Beyond proud to serve in the most diverse Congress in our nations history and to hold the gavel today," she tweeted. Born in Chennai, 53-year-old Pramila went to pursue her studies in the US when she was 16 years old.

headlines: Stretcher with 74-yr-old woman spins mid-air during chopper rescue
text: A stretcher carrying a 74-year-old woman who was rescued after suffering an injury while hiking spun uncontrollably mid-air while she was being lifted into a helicopter in US' Arizona. Officials said that a line intended to prevent the stretcher from spinning malfunctioned. The lady suffered nausea and dizziness and was transported to a trauma centre, without any serious injury.

headlines: Nirmala to attend G20 Finance Ministers' meeting in Japan
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will attend the two-day meeting of G20 Finance Ministers and central bank governors in Japan beginning June 8, an official said. She will be presenting India's views on taxation of the digital economy at the meeting, urging greater cooperation among nations. Last week, Sitharaman took charge as India's first full-time woman Finance Minister.

headlines: Tesla blocking access to social network for work complaints
text: Blind, an anonymous workplace social network used by employees to discuss matters like workplace problems, told Gizmodo that Tesla is preventing staff from accessing its platform. Reportedly, Blind was alerted of it on May 4 after Tesla employees began experiencing difficulty receiving verification emails. Employees claim they're blocked from accessing Blind app via Teslas WiFi network.

headlines: TRP of Ram dipping, Maa Kali's going up: TMC MP Abhishek
text: After the BJP said its slogans in West Bengal would be "Jai Shri Ram" and "Jai Maha Kali", TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee took a dig at the BJP saying, "Ram's TRP has gone down and Maa Kaali's TRP is going up." He added, "Ours (slogan) is Jai Hind, Jai Bangla." He further accused the BJP of "mixing religion with politics".

headlines: Union Ministers celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr at Naqvi's residence
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh, Nirmala Sitharaman, among others celebrated Eid-ul-Fitr at Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi's residence. Naqvi also announced a scholarship to 5 crore students from the minority community, of which 50% will be girl students, over the next five years. "Today I have given a very big Eidy to girl students from the minority community," he said.

headlines: Experiments don't always succeed: Akhilesh on SP-BSP alliance
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said the alliance with Mayawati's BSP was a trial and "sometimes trials don't succeed." Akhilesh said, "As a science student, I know that all experiments do not always succeed. But still, we give it a trial and learn what is lacking." However, he said that his respect for Mayawati remains intact.

headlines: Jo humse takraega wo choor choor ho jaega: Mamata on Eid
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday attended Eid prayers at Red Road, Kolkata and apparently took a dig at the BJP saying, "Jo humse takraega wo choor choor ho jaega." Addressing the Muslim community, she added, "Don't be scared, the faster they captured EVMs, the quicker they'll go away." Mamata said, "This is our lovely India, we'll protect it."

headlines: We cherish our planet greatly: PM Modi on Environment Day
text: On the occasion of World Environment Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, "Our Planet and Environment is something we all cherish greatly. Today on #WorldEnvironmentDay, we reiterate our commitment to ensure a cleaner planet." Sharing a video, PM Modi added, "Living in harmony with nature will lead to a better future."

headlines: Include Tamil for study in other states: Palaniswami to PM
text: Amid row over the proposed three-language norm in the draft National Education Policy 2019, Tamil Nadu CM EK Palaniswami requested PM Narendra Modi to include Tamil as an optional language for study in other states. He added this will be a "great service to one of the most ancient languages of the world". However, the CM deleted the tweet later.

headlines: 5 men arrested for raping woman on her way to temple in Rajasthan
text: Five men have been arrested for allegedly raping a 30-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Pali district and filming the act. The woman's family approached the police after one of the accused called them to demand money and threatened to circulate the video.
