The accused were inebriated when they assaulted the woman, who was on her way to a temple.

headlines: Union Minister plants sapling at BSF HQ on Environment Day
text: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Wednesday planted a sapling at the BSF headquarters in New Delhi on the occasion of World Environment Day. He said, "Our security forces working in extreme situations on the borders know how hard climate change has hit us... We will all have to work for preserving the environment."

headlines: Environmental protection must for healthy life: Himachal CM
text: Greeting people on World Environment Day, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Wednesday said environmental protection is necessary to lead a healthy life. He added, "Let us pledge for environmental protection on this special day." On the other hand, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "India is committed to addressing climate change and bequeathing a greener, eco-friendly habitat to our children."

headlines: There is always a chance: Trump on war with Iran
text: US President Donald Trump has said that "there is always a chance" of a war with Iran but insisted that he'd much rather hold talks with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani. "Iran is a place that was extremely hostile when I first came into office...They were a terrorist nation number one in the world and probably maybe are today," he added.

headlines: India's services sector growth falls to 1-year-low in May
text: India's dominant services sector expanded at its slowest pace in a year in May, hurt by weak domestic demand. The Nikkei India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 50.2 in May, its weakest level in 12 months. The reading is only slightly above the 50-mark, which is the dividing line between expansion and contraction.

headlines: How have India fared in their World Cup opening matches?
text: India have won five and lost six of their opening matches in World Cup history. In the inaugural edition, India lost their opener to England by 202 runs in a match where Sunil Gavaskar batted for entire 60 overs and scored 36* off 174 balls. India defeated Bangladesh and Pakistan in their 2011 and 2015 World Cup opening matches respectively.

headlines: Gavaskar batted entire 60 overs in India's first WC match, hit 36*
text: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar played 29 overs (174 balls) out of India's 60 overs to score just 36 runs against England on June 7, 1975, in World Cup history's first-ever match. Gavaskar, who opened the innings for India, hit just one four and remained unbeaten. Batting second, India managed to score 132/3, losing the match by 202 runs.

headlines: As clarified, we're not related yet: Md Kaif on pic with Katrina
text: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif on Tuesday shared a picture with actress Katrina Kaif from a promotional event for her upcoming film 'Bharat'. "Finally the Kaif's meet. PS- As clarified earlier, abhi tak koi rishta nahi, except insaaniyat ka," he wrote. In 2018, the former cricketer had responded to a Twitter user who asked if he is related to Katrina.

headlines: Blast after stunt goes wrong damages James Bond set; one injured
text: A blast during the filming of a controlled explosion at Britain's Pinewood Studios on Tuesday damaged the set of the next James Bond film and caused "minor injury" to a crew member. The person was reportedly left crushed by part of the set which fell on him. The set was placed on total lockdown after the incident, reports added.

headlines: You're a wizard: ICC shares Virat Kohli's pic with Harry Potter scar
text: The official Twitter handle of Cricket World Cup shared a picture of Team India captain Virat Kohli from Tuesday's press conference and photoshopped the Harry Potter scar on his forehead. "You're a wizard, Virat," it captioned the picture. "Today you'll see him with his magic wand in hand," a user tweeted about Kohli, who was wearing Harry Potter-style glasses.

headlines: Misleading: Surjewala on reports of rift between Pilot, Gehlot
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday denied media reports claiming there was an internal feud in the Rajasthan Congress, stating, "I would like to reject the misleading news of any differences between Sachin Pilot and Ashok Gehlot." Earlier, Gehlot had blamed Pilot for his son Vaibhav Gehlot's defeat from the Jodhpur constituency in the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Speeding car rams into people offering namaz in Delhi, 17 injured
text: At least 17 men were injured when a speeding car rammed into them while they were offering namaz on the occasion of Eid in Delhi on Wednesday. The incident took place at a mosque in East Delhi's Khureji area. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Shahdara) Meghna Yadav said they have located the address of the accused driver and will arrest him.

headlines: Computer Baba joins MP Secretariat, demands helicopter
text: Self-styled godman Namdeo Das Tyagi aka Computer Baba on Tuesday joined office at the Madhya Pradesh Secretariat and demanded a helicopter for the inspection of the Narmada. He was appointed the Chairman of Narmada, Kshipra and Mandakini Rivers Trust in March by the state government. He said he'll need a modern "astra-shastra" (weaponry) if the river is to be saved.

headlines: Delhi man kidnaps girl to force her mother to marry him, arrested
text: A 28-year-old mason was arrested on charges of kidnapping a nine-year-old girl from outer Delhi, allegedly to force her mother to accept his marriage proposal. The girl was rescued from a UP railway station within 12 hours, the police said. The woman, whose husband had abandoned the family three years ago, works as domestic help and has four children.

headlines: Woman killed, 1 injured as terrorists open fire in J&K
text: A woman was killed and a youth was injured after terrorists opened fire in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district, police said. After the incident, both were rushed to a hospital where the woman was declared brought dead while the youth is in critical condition. According to a report, the husband of the woman was also killed in 2017 by militants.

headlines: President Kovind, PM Modi extend greetings on Eid-ul-Fitr
text: President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended their greetings to the nation and the Muslim community around the world on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. The President said, "The festival of Idu'l Fitr strengthens our belief in charity, fraternity and compassion." Eid-ul-Fitr is celebrated by Muslims to mark the end of the Islamic holy month of Ramzan.

headlines: Vistara's first Boeing plane grounded a day after induction
text: Vistara on Tuesday said it has grounded its first Boeing aircraft, a day after it was inducted into the airline's fleet. The Boeing 737 aircraft was earlier used by Jet Airways. "A regular maintenance check is being conducted on our Boeing aircraft as per regulatory requirements. We expect the aircraft to be back in service by June 5," Vistara said.

headlines: Zomato offers up to 100% cash back with Zomato Cricket Cup contest
text: Zomato presents its new Predict & Win game - Zomato Cricket Cup to coincide with the World Cup. The prediction game ZCC features 3 questions around daily matches that enables users to get a chance to win up to 100% cashback. For every correct answer, users will be rewarded with additional cashback on their order.

headlines: Actor Yash becomes the new face of Beardo as #BeardoBoss
text: Beardo, the luxury grooming brand for men, recently announced Actor Yash as the face of Beardo, awarding him the title #BeardoBoss. Inspired by the look and feel of the vintage mafia era, Yash portrays a sophisticated and classic sinister look. With this association, Beardo aims to encourage customers to seize the moment and be a #BeardoBoss.

headlines: Upskill with Great Learnings PG Program in AI and ML
text: The curriculum for Great Learning's PGP-AIML is designed in collaboration with The University of Texas at Austin, Great Lakes, and faculty from IIT-Bombay. Learners can choose between convenient online/classroom formats, and work on real-world industry projects to become job-ready AI professionals. They get access to career guidance, exclusive job boards and resume building to launch their career.

headlines: YouTuber gives homeless man toothpaste-filled cookies, jailed
text: A Spanish YouTuber has been handed a 15-month prison sentence over a video that showed him giving a homeless man repackaged cookies filled with toothpaste. "Maybe I've gone a bit far, but look at the positive side: This will help him clean his teeth...I think he hasn't cleaned them since he became poor," Kanghua Ren said in the video.

headlines: Can't join Bigg Boss as I don't want to fight over food: Sunil Grover
text: Actor-comedian Sunil Grover, on being asked whether he'd like to join Bigg Boss, said, "I like to be a part of stories rather than fighting over food or petty things and winning the game.." "Never say never but...I don't know. I can't be caged...I watch the show. But I can't be a part of it," he added.

headlines: I speak 5 languages, wasn't forced to learn any: Siddharth
text: Actor Siddharth has said he speaks five languages and understands 10 but wasn't forced to learn them and "that's how it should be". "Nobody from Tamil Nadu needs to learn Hindi forcefully. They'll learn it if and when the need arises," he tweeted. He added that any Indian who wants to communicate abroad would choose to learn English over Hindi.

headlines: Australian journalist trolls Ravi Shastri over pic with two women
text: Australian journalist Dennis Freedman trolled Team India head coach Ravi Shastri over his picture with two women. Freedman shared the picture on social media with the caption, "India's World Cup preparations appear to be going well." Reacting to it, a user wrote, "Probably that is why they are not attending official press conferences."

headlines: Archer, Roy, Sarfaraz fined after Pakistan's win vs England
text: Three cricketers including Jofra Archer, Jason Roy and Sarfaraz Ahmed were handed fines after Pakistan's win over England in the ICC World Cup 2019 on Monday. England pacer Archer and batsman Roy were fined 15% of their match fee for showing dissent towards the umpire. Pakistan captain Sarfaraz was fined 20% for a minor over-rate offence.

headlines: SL defeat Afghanistan despite losing last 9 wickets for 57 runs
text: Sri Lanka defeated Afghanistan by 34 runs (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed match at Cardiff's Sophia Gardens to register their first victory in 2019 World Cup. Sri Lanka, who were cruising at 144/1 at one stage, were dismissed for 201 in 36.5 overs. Afghanistan, who were given a revised target of 187, got all out in 32.4 overs.

headlines: Since Salah joined Liverpool, hate crimes in area dropped 19%: Study
text: Hate crimes in Merseyside county, which is home to Liverpool Football Club have decreased by 19% since Mohamed Salah joined the club, as per a study by Stanford University. Further, the study found that Liverpool fans halved their rate of posting anti-Muslim tweets since the Egyptian's joining. These results may be driven by increased familiarity with Islam, the study noted.

headlines: Bill Gates, Uber CEO back AI chip startup Luminous Computing
text: US-based AI chip startup Luminous Computing has raised $9 million in a seed round of funding led by Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates. The round saw participation from Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi and Uber Co-founder Travis Kalanick's fund 10100, among others. Luminous is aiming to create AI chips which use light to move a dense amount of data quickly and efficiently.

headlines: TMC leader shot dead by 3 bike-borne assailants in Kolkata
text: TMC leader Nirmal Kundu was shot dead by three unidentified bike-borne assailants in Kolkata's Dum Dum area on Tuesday night. Kundu, who was the president of TMC Ward 6, was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared brought dead. Meanwhile, the TMC has alleged that the BJP was behind the incident.

headlines: Mamata changes Facebook, Twitter DPs to 'Jai Hind, Jai Bangla'
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and senior TMC leaders changed their Twitter and Facebook display pictures to 'Jai Hind, Jai Bangla' on Sunday. The display picture of TMC's social media accounts was also changed to 'Jai Hind, Jai Bangla' along with pictures of Mahatma Gandhi, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, Bhagat Singh, Rabindranath Tagore, Swami Vivekananda and BR Ambedkar, among others.

headlines: Earth recycles ocean floor into diamonds, finds study
text: Australia's Macquarie University researchers-led study revealed salt traces trapped in many diamonds show they are formed from ancient seabeds that got recycled after being buried deep beneath Earth's crust. Researchers carried out experiments at extreme pressures and temperatures found 200 km underground. At 120-180 km depth, results showed salt balance similar to that found in natural diamonds.

headlines: Indian in UK gets 7-yr jail for rape after DNA match from earphones
text: An Indian man, who fled to India in 2017 after raping a woman in the UK, has been sentenced to seven years imprisonment for the sexual assault. The police located Ajay Rana's earphones and matched DNA from them with swabs taken from the victim. They issued a European Arrest Warrant, following which he was detained by Spanish Police in Bilbao.

headlines: Looks great: Obama praises Sikh man who wore rainbow turban
text: Former US President Barack Obama has praised Jiwandeep Kohli, a San Diego-based Sikh man whose picture wearing a rainbow turban for Pride Month (June) went viral. Obama tweeted, "Thanks for everything you do to make this country a little more equal. Turban looks great, by the way." Jiwandeep responded, "Im a fairly verbose person, but today I'm lost for words."

headlines: It's finished: Dutch teen rape survivor ends life with mercy killing
text: Noa Pothoven, a 17-year-old girl from Netherlands, who was raped as a child, died after being assisted by the state to end her life after a years-long struggle with depression. In an Instagram post shared days before her death, she wrote, "After years of fighting and fighting it is finished." Euthanasia, or mercy killing, is reportedly legal in the country.

headlines: Algorithm predicts actors' career peaks with 85% accuracy
text: Queen Mary University of London researchers claim they developed an algorithm that predicts with around 85% accuracy whether an actor's career has reached its most productive year yet or not. Using IMDb data, careers of over 15 lakh men and nearly 9 lakh women globally were analysed. Data showed around 70% actors had careers that lasted only one year.

headlines: Mamata-led TMC govt in WB will fall on its own: Vijayvargiya
text: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said that he doesn't think Mamata Banerjee-led TMC government in West Bengal "will go on till 2021" and that this government "will fall on its own". Terming Mamata "an arrogant administrator", Vijayvargiya added that her arrogance has led to TMC's "doomsday" in Bengal. Referring to general polls result, he said BJP won "hearts of masses".

headlines: 2 Army jawans killed, 3 injured in road accident in Assam
text: Two Army jawans were killed and three others were injured when their vehicle overturned in Assam's Sonitpur, police said. The incident took place when the jawans were going home on leave and the driver lost the vehicle's control which skidded off the road and turned over, the police added. The injured have been taken to the Tezpur Army Base Hospital.

headlines: Planned base price of 5G spectrum too high: Telecom lobby
text: The government's proposed base price for auction of spectrum for next-generation 5G networks is 30-40% higher than global rates, India's top telecom lobby COAI said. This will be a "serious impediment" to the uptake of 5G in India, it added. This comes a day after Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said India will hold spectrum auction for 5G this year.

headlines: Hollywood actor gets divorced after ending marriage within 4 days
text: Hollywood actor Nicolas Cage got divorced from his fourth wife Erika Koike on Friday. This comes two months after he tried to annul his marriage within four days of the wedding, claiming he was 'too drunk' to marry. Cage claimed the union was based on fraud, alleging that Koike didn't disclose her criminal history and her relationship with another person.

headlines: I've changed my body mechanics to emulate Kapil Dev in '83: Ranveer
text: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is portraying India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev in '83, has said that it is very tough to emulate Kapil Dev's signature move. "Only his body, the way it is genetically structured, can execute that action," he added. "I have changed my own body mechanics around to be able to do it," he further said.

headlines: Carried Salman's pics in pocket, asked producers to cast him: Jackie
text: Actor Jackie Shroff has revealed he used to carry Salman Khan's pictures in his pocket and ask producers to cast him. "I felt this kid would become a star one day...He was a kid to me and remains the same," he added. "He was my big fan and liked my jeans, my boots. He thinks I'm god," Jackie further said.

headlines: 2009 champ Federer to face 11-time champ Nadal in French Open semi
text: World number two Rafael Nadal will face world number three Roger Federer in the French Open semi-final on Friday. The 33-year-old 11-time French Open champion Nadal defeated Kei Nishikori 6-1, 6-1, 6-3 to reach his 12th Roland Garros semi-final, while the 2009 champion Federer beat 2015 champion Stanislas Wawrinka 7-6(7-4), 4-6, 7-6(7-5), 6-4 in the quarter-final.

headlines: Tsitsipas reflects on 5-hr Wawrinka match, says learnt living life
text: World number six Stefanos Tsitsipas reflected on his French Open fourth-round defeat against world number 28 Stanislas Wawrinka in an Instagram post, saying he learnt living life from the 5-hour 9-minute match. "First time in my entire life, in my twenty years of existence that I felt that "aura", the real definition of the word, competition," he wrote.

headlines: 100 lay naked outside Facebook NY office to protest nipple censorship
text: Over 100 people lay nude in front of social media giant Facebook's New York office on Sunday to protest against Facebook and Instagram's ban on some photos of female nipples on the platforms. The demonstrators covered their bodies with stickers of only male nipples in protest. The activists said the ban harms artists and users exploring gender and identity.

headlines: State elections in J&K to be announced after Amarnath Yatra: EC
text: Election Commission on Tuesday said it will announce the schedule of state polls in Jammu and Kashmir after the conclusion of Amarnath Yatra. The pilgrimage will take place from July 1 to August 15. J&K has been under President's rule since December 2018, which will end on July 2 and will have to be reimposed until the elections are held.

headlines: Cigarette lighter helps police identify Indian man murdered in France
text: French police said on Monday that they had identified the body of an Indian national found in a sack with the help of a cigarette lighter found in the man's pocket. The lighter had the name of a cafe stamped on it and the cafe was located near the victim's home. Investigators later confirmed the victim's DNA from a toothbrush.

headlines: Policymakers should take part blame for Jet failure: SpiceJet MD
text: SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh has said policymakers should take part of the blame for the failure of Jet Airways. He added that Jet's grounding should be a "wake up call" for the aviation sector and the policymakers. Singh said high taxes on jet fuel and high import duty on aircraft parts are among the factors making domestic aviation sector "uncompetitive".

headlines: ABC journos ask news chief to explain why Adani story was dropped
text: Australian public broadcaster ABC's journalists called on their news director Gaven Morris to explain why a story on Adani was never broadcast. They condemned alleged editorial interference by Adani after reports said an Adani spokeswoman called Morris to complain about the story. ABC, however, said the radio story was pulled to give Adani more time to respond to their questions.

headlines: TMC workers send 10,000 'Jai Hind, Jai Bangla' postcards to PM
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers have sent 10,000 postcards with 'Vande Mataram', 'Jai Hind', and 'Jai Bangla' to PM Narendra Modi. "We wanted to show what's in people's minds. We don't want to go and shout before PM's vehicle," a TMC worker said. This comes after a group of men last week started shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' at Mamata's convoy.

headlines: Ashok Gehlot, Sachin Pilot attend Iftar party in Jaipur
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday attended an Iftar party in Jaipur organised by Rajasthan Pradesh Congress Committee. Deputy CM Sachin Pilot was also present with Gehlot at the party. Earlier today, Gehlot blamed Pilot for his son Vaibhav Gehlot's defeat from the Jodhpur seat in the Lok Sabha election and said that he should take responsibility for it.

headlines: BharatPe to raise $75 mn at up to six-fold valuation: Report
text: Fintech startup BharatPe finalised a $75 million Series B funding round led by Insight Partners, Entrackr reported. It's reportedly in talks to raise additional $25 million but nothing has materialised beyond $75 million yet. Reportedly, its valuation may soar five to six times its estimated $60-65 million valuation in Series A round to about $330-350 million in Series B round.

headlines: US smart mirror startup raising $36M at $300M valuation: Report
text: New York-based fitness technology startup MIRROR, which sells full-length mirrors that double as interactive home gyms, is closing a funding round expected to reach $36 million, TechCrunch reported. With this funding, the startup's valuation will reportedly near just under $300 million. Founded by Brynn Putnam, the startup has raised $40.8 million in disclosed funding to date, as per Crunchbase.

headlines: Gunman out on parole kills 4 people in Australia shooting
text: A gunman shot dead four people and injured several others at five different locations in the Australian city of Darwin, officials said. The 45-year-old suspect had been released on parole in January and was wearing an electronic monitoring bracelet. Police said they were trying to establish a motive for the shooting, adding that it was not terrorism-related.

headlines: Manipal Group to raise stake in Cigna TTK to 51%, TTK exits biz
text: Manipal Group will raise its shareholding in joint venture Cigna TTK Health Insurance to 51%, the companies said on Tuesday. TTK will exit the business by selling its 31.48% stake while US insurance giant Cigna Corporation will continue to hold 49% stake. The name of the Mumbai-based joint venture has been changed to ManipalCigna Health Insurance.

headlines: Received several proposals for stake in SpiceJet: Chairman
text: SpiceJet Chairman Ajay Singh said the low-cost airline has received several proposals to buy into the company, but it is only willing to evaluate an offer if it's strategic. "SpiceJet has enough cash," Singh said. "We have to see if [the proposals] serve SpiceJet's long-term interests, and when we come to that determination, we'll do something," he added.

headlines: Economy showing signs of rebound: Economic Affairs Secy
text: Economic Affairs Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg has said India's economic growth, which hit a five-year low of 5.8% in the March quarter, is showing signs of gaining momentum. "Crude is moving towards $60. Government bond yield has gone below 7%. Rupee is firmly below 70," Garg tweeted. "Turn around in demand and financing conditions beginning very well," he further said.

headlines: AAI ties up with Boeing to modernise air traffic management
text: The Airports Authority of India (AAI) and US planemaker Boeing have signed a technical assistance agreement to modernise air traffic management in India. The comprehensive 10-year roadmap, to be developed within 18 months, is being undertaken with a grant from the US Trade and Development Agency (USTDA). The plan aims to improve airspace utilisation and help maintain efficient aircraft operations.

headlines: India's tallest garbage mountain to be higher than Taj Mahal in 2020
text: India's tallest rubbish mountain in New Delhi is on course to rise higher than the Taj Mahal in 2020, according to a report. The Ghazipur landfill rises nearly 10 metres a year and is already more than 65 metres high. At its current rate of growth, it is expected to be taller than Agra's 73-metre-high Taj Mahal monument next year.

headlines: Girls shouldn't stop speaking up: Taapsee after clean chit to Bahl
text: Taapsee Pannu has said even though the spirit of the #MeToo movement gets affected when an accused isn't punished, girls shouldn't stop raising their voice. "Nothing will change overnight, but we shouldn't give up on the situation and tolerate abuse," she added. Her comments come after sexual harassment accused filmmaker Vikas Bahl was given a clean chit.

headlines: Priyanka quit Bharat knowing I may get upset: Salman
text: Speaking about Priyanka Chopra quitting his film 'Bharat', Salman Khan said, "She did it knowing perhaps that I might get upset...or might not work with her." "Despite all the thoughts that may have crossed her mind, she chose to get married to a man instead of this movie, which is a...noble and gutsy thing to do," he added.

headlines: Boxer Amir Khan mistakenly says Pak's WC chances depend on fixing
text: Pakistani origin British boxer Amir Khan mistakenly said that Pakistan's 2019 World Cup chances depend on how matches are "fixed". "It just depends on the draw, depends on the match-fixing," he said. After realising his mistake, Amir quickly said, "[It depends] on the matches, how they fix [schedule] the matches."

headlines: Delhi HC restrains Asus from selling phones under ZENFONE trademark
text: Delhi High Court has restrained Asus from selling mobile phones and other products under the trademark ZEN, ZENFONE or any other deceptively similar trademark. The interim order was passed by in a case filed by Telecare Network India against Asus. Telecare contended that it had been continuously using the marks ZEN and ZEN MOBILE for smartphones and accessories since 2008.

headlines: Thermally stable glowing protein made with gene-edited bacteria
text: Russia, France and Germany-based scientists made a new protein that glows when irradiated with UV, blue light and is small and stable under high temperatures. The protein was identified in a thermophilic bacterium's cell. Scientists introduced a genetically engineered DNA sequence to reproduce only the protein's fluorescent segment into the cells of another bacterium to mass produce the protein.

headlines: Praying for his safety: Family of IAF officer on board missing AN-32
text: IAF Flight Lieutenant Mohit Garg's brother Ashwani said that his family is praying for his safety after there was no trace of the missing AN-32 aircraft even after more than 24 hours. The 27-year-old Flight Lieutenant from Punjab's Patiala district is among the 13 people on board the military transport plane that took off from Assam's Jorhat on Monday.

headlines: Centre refuses to share details of notice to Rahul over citizenship
text: The Home Ministry refused to share details of its notice to Congress President Rahul Gandhi that had asked him to clarify his "factual position" on a complaint questioning his Indian citizenship. It cited RTI Act provision which bars disclosure of information that will impede the investigation, among other provisions. It had served the notice on BJP leader Subramanian Swamy's complaint.

headlines: Reservation in MP set to be 73% after govt okays 27% OBC quota
text: The Madhya Pradesh cabinet on Monday passed a resolution to increase the reservation quota for Other Backward Classes from 14% to 27%. This is set to take the total reservation in the state to 63%, including the reservations for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes. However, 10% quota for the economically weaker sections takes the total to 73%.

headlines: Pakistan PM Imran Khan accused of insulting Saudi King
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has been accused of insulting Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz when they met during the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation summit last week. In a video that went viral online, Khan appeared to speak directly to King Salman's translator and walked off as he was still translating, apparently without giving King Salman the opportunity to respond.

headlines: Apple's iOS 13 features option to 'silence unknown callers'
text: Apple recently unveiled iOS 13 at Worldwide Developers Conference which features a new setting which protects users from unknown and spam callers. When the 'Silence Unknown Callers' setting is turned on, iOS uses Siri intelligence to let calls from numbers in Contacts, Mail and Messages ring a user's phone. However, all other calls are automatically sent to voicemail.

headlines: No objection if Nitish joins grand alliance again: Rabri Devi
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Rabri Devi on Monday said, "If Bihar CM Nitish Kumar joins the Grand Alliance again, we have no objection to it." However, she made it clear that any decision on this will be taken by top RJD leaders. Earlier, RJD's Raghuvansh Prasad Singh said Kumar should join hands with non-BJP parties to fight against BJP.

headlines: Permit to chargesheet ex-Min: Police sends reminder to AAP
text: Delhi Police on Tuesday sent a reminder to the state government for sanction to chargesheet former Delhi minister Sandeep Kumar, who is accused of sexually assaulting a woman. The sanction is pending with Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi Government for around one year. In 2016, Kumar was accused of sexually assaulting a woman who wanted a ration card.

headlines: Trump says Russia removed its people from Venezuela; Russia denies
text: Russia has denied US President Donald Trump's claims that it withdrew its people from Venezuela. Media reports had said that Russia is pulling out its military and technical personnel, with the number decreasing from 1,000 to several dozen. Denying the reports, Russian military corporation Rostec said it sends specialists to Venezuela for maintenance and repair of equipment supplied by Russia.

headlines: Did he fist bump? Twitter users as Trump greets Queen
text: US President Donald Trump was photographed sharing a handshake with Queen Elizabeth II as the pair met at the beginning of his state visit to the UK on Monday. Several users on Twitter likened it to a fist bump, however, the US President seemed to clench the Queen's hand instead of shaking it with a flat hand.

headlines: My passport was misplaced before Miss Universe pageant: Sushmita
text: Sushmita Sen has revealed she misplaced her passport right before the Miss Universe pageant. Sushmita explained that she had given her passport to a coordinator, who needed it for ID proof but ended up misplacing it. She further revealed the pageant's organisers suggested they should let Aishwarya Rai compete in for Miss Universe instead.

headlines: Dale Steyn ruled out of 2019 World Cup due to shoulder injury
text: South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn has been ruled out of the 2019 World Cup due to shoulder injury, a day before his team's match against India. Fast bowler Beuran Hendricks will replace the 35-year-old Steyn who did not feature in South Africa's first two matches due to the injury. Steyn featured in 13 ODIs since 2016, taking 21 wickets.

headlines: PUBG hurts Muslim religious sentiments, ban it: TN Muslim League
text: The Tamil Nadu Muslim League (TNML) has filed a complaint against PUBG with the Chennai Commissioner demanding a ban on the game. The party argued that PUBG has a crate resembling 'Kaaba', the holiest site in Islam, which the Muslim community finds offensive. Adding that the game is distracting the youngsters, it demanded PUBG to be banned.

headlines: Google Maps to let India users see live train, bus travel status
text: Google Maps has added new features to let India users check live bus travel times in 10 cities and also see live status of trains. It will also offer mixed-mode commute suggestions that now combine auto-rickshaw and public transport. Google revealed it worked with Sigmoid Labs, a Bengaluru-based startup it had acquired in 2018, for the live train tracking feature.

headlines: World's 1st gene-edited babies likely to die earlier: Study
text: University of California, Berkeley researchers found genetic mutation on embryos by Chinese scientist He Jiankui to immunise twin babies born from them against HIV might've shortened their life expectancy. They discovered people with two non-working CCR5 genes, like one of the babies, passed away 21% faster. The study was based on DNA and death records of over four lakh volunteers.

headlines: Court asks for report on Nirbhaya gangrape convicts' execution plea
text: A Delhi court on Tuesday sought response from Tihar jail authorities on the application of Nirbhaya's parents seeking to expedite the execution of gangrape convicts. It asked the jail authorities to apprise it with the legal remedies that the four convicts availed and the ones that are available. It directed the jail superintendent to appear in person on July 19.

headlines: Porn clip played at govt meeting on food, civil supply in Rajasthan
text: A porn clip was inadvertently played in a meeting of Food and Civil Supply Department officials in NIC room of secretariat in Jaipur. The meeting was chaired by Mugdha Sinha, the department's secretary, who has asked NIC director to probe the matter. She added that 10 people were inside the room, while various officials were participating through video conference.

headlines: Avoid alcohol, tea, coffee: Health Ministry's advisory on heatwave
text: The Health Ministry has issued an advisory in view of the soaring temperatures in several parts of the country, advising people to avoid alcohol, tea, coffee, carbonated soft drinks and the Sun between 12 noon to 3 pm. It advised people to use umbrellas, caps or towels when outside. It also advised people to frequently drink water and salted drinks.

headlines: #KuToo campaign in Japan seeks to ban dress codes with high heels
text: Nearly 20,000 Japanese women have signed a petition to ban office dress codes which force women to wear high heels. The term 'KuToo' is an amalgam of #MeToo and the Japanese words for shoes (kutsu) and pain (kutsuu). It was started by artist Yumi Ishikawa who says she was made to wear high heels while working at a funeral parlour.

headlines: Don't know about it: Salman on Vivek's meme on him, Aishwarya
text: When asked about an election meme shared by Vivek Oberoi which featured him and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Salman Khan said, "I don't know about it. I haven't seen it." The meme, which took a dig at Aishwarya, was shared after the Lok Sabha elections' exit poll results. Vivek earlier deleted the meme and apologised after facing criticism for his post.

headlines: Actor Vijay Varma to feature in Hrithik starrer 'Super 30'
text: Vijay Varma will feature in the upcoming Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', which is based on mathematician Anand Kumar. "[W]hen I heard the story of 'Super 30' and about Anand sir who literally changed so many lives I knew I wanted to be part of this story," Vijay said. Directed by Vikas Bahl, the film will release on July 12.

headlines: Don't compare myself with star kids, was launched with one: Kriti
text: Kriti Sanon, who made her acting debut opposite Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti', said, "I don't think I compared myself with star kids. I was launched with one." "Both Tiger and I were equally new...The way we were treated...was so equal," she added. She further said the film's makers treated the film as the launch of two newcomers, and not one.

headlines: Google hiding, flagging our app as harmful: Play Store rival
text: Portugal-based Android app store alternative Aptoide accused Google of anti-competitive behaviour like flagging app as harmful, hiding it in users' Android devices and requesting users to uninstall it since Summer 2018. "Even if [users] go to settings...say they trust Aptoide, Aptoide installations are blocked, CEO Paulo Trezentos said. Aptoide launched website to call for Google to Play Fair.

headlines: BJP's Rajesh Patnekar elected Speaker of Goa Assembly
text: BJP MLA Rajesh Patnekar was elected as the Speaker of Goa Assembly, defeating ex-state CM Pratapsingh Rane of Congress by 22-16 votes. Speaking to the MLAs, Patnekar said, "Don't leave the House while the Assembly is in session. Try to watch, try to study." His rival Pratapsingh Rane said that Patnekar "will be judged by the decisions of the House."

headlines: Pak angry as likes of Masood Azhar not invited: Sena on Iftar row
text: After Pakistani officials turned away guests invited for an Iftar party organised by the Indian High Commission in Islamabad, the Shiv Sena said that India should not forget the "ruckus" that the "Pakistani drunken monkeys" created. The Sena added, "Possibly, the reason behind Pakistan's anger is that people like Masood Azhar were not invited for the party."

headlines: Giriraj Singh shouldn't be taken seriously: JD(U) leader
text: After BJP leader Giriraj Singh's remark on Iftar party attended by JD(U) Chief Nitish Kumar and others, JD(U) leader Ashok Choudhary said he shouldn't be taken seriously. "He tries to portray himself as a hard Hindutva leader...his tongue's only for hard Hindutva," Choudhary added. Earlier today, Singh tweeted it would be better if such gatherings were organised during Navaratri.

headlines: Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil quits Cong, might join BJP: Reports
text: Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Tuesday resigned from Congress party and said that staying with the party would have been "inappropriate" for him. As per reports, Patil is likely to join BJP soon. Earlier in April, Patil resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Assembly and also declined to campaign for the party in the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: CII urges govt to cut corporate tax rate to 25% as growth slows
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to cut the corporate tax rate to 25% when its budget for 2019-20 is presented next month. It added that the current rates, which run from 32-35%, damage the competitiveness of firms. This comes as the country's economic growth between January-March slipped to 5.8%, the lowest in over four years.

headlines: Dad feels awkward when I put glamorous pics on family group: Disha
text: Actress Disha Patani, while speaking about her parents' reaction to her glamorous pictures, said, "They know it's work, and I am not doing anything wrong...Of course, my father feels awkward whenever I send my pictures on the family group." "I've always shared the pictures I shoot with my family because I want to keep them in the know," she added.

headlines: Bumrah undergoes doping test ahead of India's WC opener vs SA
text: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah underwent a doping test on Monday, two days ahead of India's 2019 World Cup opener against South Africa. A dope control official took Bumrah for conducting a test during India's practice session at Rose Bowl stadium in Southampton. Under every ICC event, every BCCI player has to undergo doping test conducted by World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).

headlines: Instagram faces global outage; users unable to log-in and upload
text: Instagram faced a global outage, including in India, that affected app log-ins, page refreshes, commenting on posts and uploading content on the platform. According to online outage monitoring website Downdetector, Instagram was facing the issues since around 9 AM (IST). Instagram has reportedly recovered from the outage, however, there is no official update from the Facebook-owned platform.

headlines: SP will fight by-polls alone: Akhilesh after BSP ends alliance
text: After BSP supremo Mayawati announced that her party will fight the Assembly by-polls alone in UP, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said his party is ready to fight the 11 seats on its own. Akhilesh added, "If the coalition is broken, I'll reflect deeply on it and if the coalition isn't there in the by-elections, SP will prepare for the elections."

headlines: SoftBank to gain $11 bn from its 1st Alibaba stake sale in 16 yrs
text: Masayoshi Son-led Japanese conglomerate SoftBank announced it expects to gain over $11 billion in pre-tax profit after selling part of its shares in Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba. SoftBank, Alibaba's largest shareholder, still holds about 26% Alibaba shares worth $101 billion after the deal. In 2016, SoftBank had announced it was selling Alibaba shares for the first time in 16 years.

headlines: Woman delivers baby herself after doctors leave and don't come back
text: A 23-year-old woman delivered her baby without medical assistance in a Nagpur government hospital on Monday. According to her relatives, she was taken to delivery ward on Sunday, but the doctors left after her labour pains eased. She was alone in the ward past midnight and cried in pain, and later pushed the baby out when the pain became unbearable.

headlines: Focused and calm as I make my way to ED for 13th time: Vadra
text: Before heading to the Enforcement Directorate office today for questioning in a money laundering case, businessman Robert Vadra wrote on Facebook, "As I make my way for the 13th time...I stay focused and calm." Vadra claimed he has been questioned for nearly 80 hours amid "unnecessary drama" and requested that "interrogations go on without the extra attention of Media Drama."

headlines: 86 people under observation after Kerala man contracts Nipah
text: As many as 86 people are being kept under observation after a 23-year-old man tested positive for the Nipah virus in Ernakulam, Kerala. They include two nurses who developed a high fever after treating the 23-year-old man. Meanwhile, one person has been shifted into an isolation ward.

headlines: Trump fails to recognise gift he gave Queen less than a year ago
text: During his visit to the Buckingham Palace, US President Donald Trump failed to recognise the gift he gave Queen Elizabeth. Trump was shown a pewter horse that he had presented to the Queen at Windsor Castle in July 2018. On being asked if he recognised it, Trump said, "No!", after which Melania pointed out they had given it to Queen.

headlines: What led to the Tiananmen Square massacre in China 30 yrs ago?
text: More than one million pro-democracy protesters occupied Beijing's Tiananmen Square in 1989 and began the largest political demonstration in communist China's history. The demonstrations lasted for six weeks before the Chinese Army was sent in. On June 3, Chinese tanks moved in and troops opened fire, killing and injuring hundreds of unarmed people in and around Tiananmen Square.

headlines: RBI bars EY member firm SR Batliboi from auditing banks for a year
text: RBI has barred SR Batliboi & Co, a member firm of EY, from auditing commercial banks for a year starting April 1, 2019. The regulator found certain lapses in an audit assignment carried out by the firm. SR Batliboi is the statutory auditor to private lenders HDFC Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Bandhan Bank and the South Indian Bank.

headlines: Actress Arzoo's husband gets restraining order for alleged abuse
text: After actress Arzoo Govitrikar accused her husband Siddharth Sabharwal of domestic abuse, a Mumbai court has granted her a restraining order against Sabharwal. The court also ordered Sabharwal not to enter the couple's home in Mumbai's Worli until further notice. Denying the assault allegations, Sabharwal claimed that Govitrikar asked him to slap her as she was preparing for a role.

headlines: We bond like a house on fire: Bhumi on equation with Ayushmann
text: While speaking about her equation with actor Ayushmann Khurrana, Bhumi Pednekar said, "We bond like a house on fire and it just shows on screen." "[W]e share a great equation as co-stars and as friends which is why people have appreciated our chemistry on screen," she added. Bhumi made her acting debut opposite Ayushmann in 'Dum Laga Ke Haisha' (2015).

headlines: Ayushmann, 'Bala' makers summoned by police in plagiarism row
text: Ayushmann Khurrana and the makers of his film 'Bala' have been summoned by the police in connection with a plagiarism complaint filed against them by assistant director Kamal Kant Chandra. Chandra claimed that he shared the film's script with Ayushmann, who then announced a film with the same concept. Chandra earlier filed a case against them in Bombay High Court.

headlines: H Vishwanath resigns as Karnataka JD(S) President
text: Following the Lok Sabha debacle of the Janata Dal (Secular) in Karnataka, state party President H Vishwanath on Tuesday resigned from the post. He resigned saying, "I take moral responsibility for the (party's) defeat." The Karnataka JD(S) chief was reportedly unhappy over being sidelined and not being taken into confidence by the party on key issues.

headlines: SoftBank facing challenges raising $100 bn for new fund: Report
text: Japan's SoftBank has faced a lukewarm response while raising $100 billion for its second Vision Fund, the Wall Street Journal reported. Saudi Arabias Public Investment Fund and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board are reportedly among those that plan to make limited or no contributions. The Vision Fund refuted the Journal's claims, calling them misleading and...inaccurate.

headlines: Naxal hideout busted in Chhattisgarh forest, pistol, gunpowder seized
text: Indo-Tibetan Border Police on Monday busted a Naxal hideout in the forests of Kondagaon district in Chhattisgarh and seized one pistol, one magazine, 2 kg gunpowder and other incriminating materials. The Naxals had hidden weapon and other items in a plastic water tank and covered it with tarpaulins to prevent damage. Naxal literature, ammunition pouch, and batteries were also seized.

headlines: New govt to retain autonomy of Prasar Bharati: Javadekar
text: Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday said that the new government at the Centre will retain the autonomy of Prasar Bharati. He added that Prasar Bharati was established through an act which safeguards its autonomy. Javadekar further said that the government wants Prasar Bharati to work "smoothly and bring new programmes and find new dimensions".

headlines: Jet Airways staff meet Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri
text: A delegation of Jet Airways staff on Monday met the newly appointed Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and sought help to revive the grounded airline and save their jobs. "They handed over a memorandum regarding revival of Jet Airways," Puri tweeted following the meeting. The airline's staff also reportedly met Nirmala Sitharaman, who was recently appointed the Finance Minister.

headlines: upGrad learner transitions to Analyst role with 200% salary hike
text: upGrad's PG Diploma in Data Science, with IIIT-Bangalore, empowers learners to transition in the field of Data Science. One such learner, Moulik, transitioned to an Analyst role with 200% salary hike. "Mentorship through Industry veterans, BaseCamps and Student Mentors make the program extremely engaging, would endorse the program for its rich content and comprehensive approach to Data Science," says Moulik.

headlines: BSP breaks up alliance with SP for now, to fight by-polls alone
text: BSP chief Mayawati has announced her party will fight the by-polls alone in Uttar Pradesh, breaking alliance with SP. She added the "break is temporary" and that the parties might get back together if she's satisfied with the steps SP chief Akhilesh Yadav takes. She added that SP had failed to get their supporters' vote during the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Alcohol in test due to hair serum: Suspended Air India pilot moves HC
text: An Air India pilot moved Delhi High Court against three-year flying licence suspension in 2018 claiming alcohol in his hair fall treatment serum showed up in the breath analyser test. He said the alcohol levels in the test were 0.16 and 0.20, below the international permissible standards of 0.40. However, DGCA said its standard for permissible alcohol levels was 0.0.

headlines: No bum, cleavage shot in 'Kabir Singh': Maker on portrayal of women
text: Filmmaker Sandeep Vanga has said he disagrees with the criticism that his film 'Kabir Singh', starring Shahid Kapoor, glorifies 'toxic masculinity' and added that his film doesn't portray women in a derogatory way. "There's no bum or cleavage shot. I never asked...audience to look at the girl's body," he added. Sandeep further said he "genuinely does not bother about pseudo-feminists".

headlines: Fan tries to kiss Miley while she is with husband, video surfaces
text: A video of a fan groping singer Miley Cyrus and trying to kiss her while she is walking through a crowd behind her husband, actor Liam Hemsworth, has surfaced online. Miley can be seen turning away from the man, after which security guards separated him from her. The incident reportedly happened while they were leaving a hotel in Barcelona, Spain.

headlines: Family said 'How dare these bastards?': Priyanka on scam artist story
text: Reacting to the article which called her a "global scam artist" for marrying Nick Jonas, Priyanka Chopra said, "I didn't comment on it at the time." "But I went up to the hotel room to find Nick, Joe, Sophie and my mum furiously responding to the article on their phones. They were like, 'These bastards! How dare they?'," she added.

headlines: Pilot should take responsibility: Gehlot on son's LS poll defeat
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that state Deputy CM Sachin Pilot should take the responsibility for his son Vaibhav Gehlot's defeat from the Jodhpur seat in the recently held-Lok Sabha elections. He added, "There should be...complete post-mortem of the results in Jodhpur seat to find out why we didn't win it." Congress couldn't win even a single Rajasthan parliamentary seat.

headlines: Pet dog keeps barking at tiger to save owner's life in MP
text: Twenty-two-year-old Pancham Gajviya was saved by his pet dog after a tiger attacked him in Seoni district, Madhya Pradesh. Gajviya said, "The tiger stood over me, on my hands, but before it could get at my throat, the dog started barking." Alerted by the dog's barks, villagers came to his rescue and the tiger melted back into the forest.

headlines: 23-yr-old Kerala student tested positive for Nipah virus: Govt
text: A 23-year-old student from Kochi's Ernakulam was tested positive for Nipah virus in the results that came from National Institute of Virology in Pune, confirmed Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja. "The confirmation came in today morning. But there is no need to panic. From the time we suspected this was Nipah, we have put all measures into place," said Shailaja.

headlines: Will try to serve Andhra better than my father: Jagan Reddy
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, whose late father was a two-time CM of the state, on Monday said, "I will try to serve the state better than my father YS Rajasekhara Reddy." Jagan Reddy took oath as the Chief Minister on May 30 in Vijayawada. His party won 151 of 175 seats in the recent state Assembly elections.

headlines: Delhi man arrested for killing wife by setting her on fire
text: The Delhi Police have arrested a businessman who allegedly set his wife on fire and tried to make her death look like an accident. The accused, a gambling addict, allegedly murdered his wife following an argument and later fled the crime scene. Their 17-year-old daughter, who suffered burns on her body while trying to save her mother, informed the police.

headlines: Man shot dead by terrorists in the outskirts of Srinagar
text: A 32-year-old civilian was shot dead by terrorists in the outskirts of Srinagar on Monday evening, said the Jammu and Kashmir Police. The deceased, Sameer Ahmad Wani, suffered a bullet injury on his chest and was rushed to the hospital where he was declared brought dead. Meanwhile, security forces launched a search operation to trace the terrorists.

headlines: It's largely my responsibility: Karan on Kalank's box office failure
text: While speaking about his film 'Kalank' and its performance at the box office, filmmaker Karan Johar said, "It's largely my responsibility and my blame." "I'm the wiser one. I'm the more knowledgeable person about what works and what doesn't," Karan explained. He further said that he sees it as a success as he has learnt from the film's failure.

headlines: No one questioned when I played college girl at 30: Taapsee
text: Speaking about the criticism that she and her co-star Bhumi Pednekar faced for playing older characters in their upcoming film 'Saand Ki Aankh', Taapsee Pannu said, "I was pretty surprised." "[N]o one questioned me when I played a college girl at 30," she added. The actresses will be seen portraying the world's oldest female sharpshooters in the forthcoming film.

headlines: Keanu Reeves to star with Angelina in Marvel's The Eternals: Report
text: Hollywood actor Keanu Reeves is in talks to star with Angelina Jolie in Marvel Studios' upcoming adaptation of the comic book series 'The Eternals', as per reports. Directed by Chloé Zhao, the forthcoming film will also feature actors Richard Madden, Kumail Nanjiani and Dong-seok Ma. The script has been written by screenwriters Matthew and Ryan Firpo.

headlines: Gadkari takes charge of Road Transport and Highways Ministry
text: BJP leader Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday took charge of Road Transport and Highways, and Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Ministries. Gadkari said that with the creation of infrastructure under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, "it's our priority to increase the country's growth rate and employment through small scale industries". Gadkari is credited with reviving the languishing road projects.

headlines: Betrayed western Odisha: BJP after Patnaik resigns from Bijepur
text: After Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik vacated the Bijepur Assembly seat and retained Hinjili, the BJP accused him of betraying the people of western Odisha. BJP leader Suresh Pujari said that Bijepur people had high expectations from Patnaik but now they "feel cheated". Notably, Patnaik had contested and won both the seats in the recent Assembly elections in the state.

headlines: Nitish Kumar, Sushil Modi attend Paswan's Iftar party
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Sushil Modi on Monday attended the Iftar party hosted by Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) President Ram Vilas Paswan at his residence. This comes a day after it was reported that BJP and JD(U) leaders had skipped the Iftar parties hosted by each other. Bihar Governor Lalji Tandon was also present at the event.

headlines: Vidyasagar's statue to be re-installed on June 11: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee announced that a bust of social reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar, which was vandalised during Union Home Minister Amit Shah's roadshow in Kolkata, will be re-installed at the Vidyasagar College on June 11. She added that a Bronze bust will be installed once it is completed. Mamata said the college's beautification work will also be conducted.

headlines: Mass puffin die-off possibly linked to climate change: Study
text: The deaths of estimated thousands of tufted puffin birds in the Bering Sea in late 2016 to early 2017 may be partially attributed to climate change, a study stated. Scientists believe the birds starved to death. They suggest climate-driven shifts in prey abundance and/or distribution, combined with onset of moult (when birds shed their old feathers), may have caused this.

headlines: 200 kg marijuana seized in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
text: Hyderabad Task Force Police arrested two persons, Shaik Arif and Shaik Sameer, and seized 200 kilograms of marijuana (ganja) from them in the city. During interrogation, Arif confessed that owing to the lack of a sustainable source of income they both decided to earn easy money by selling ganja. Police have recovered a car and a cell phone from them.

headlines: 18 specially-abled couples tie the knot in mass wedding
text: Eighteen specially-abled couples tied the knot at a mass wedding in Vadodara on Monday. Rajesh Ayre, who was one of the organisers, said, "It is God who has given us everything and we can only make good of it by helping others... Everyone supported this cause by giving whatever they could." The wedding ceremony was followed by a reception.

headlines: What are the features of iOS 13 unveiled by Apple?
text: Apple unveiled iOS 13 at Worldwide Developers Conference on Monday which features dark mode, 'typing by swiping' letters on keyboard and redesigned Reminders. The iOS 13 automatically hides duplicate photos, lets users add profile photos to iMessage, and has 'Sign in with Apple' option to create accounts. It promises up to two times faster app launches and 60% smaller updates.

headlines: I would love to run for Prime Minister of India: Priyanka Chopra
text: On being asked about her political aspirations in a recent interview, Priyanka Chopra said she would love to run for Prime Minister of India. "I would love Nick to run for president," she added. "I don't like the things associated with politics...but I know that both of us really want to make a change. Never say never," she further said.

headlines: Pakistan beat England in World Cup, end their 11-ODI losing streak
text: Pakistan defeated hosts England by 14 runs at Nottingham's Trent Bridge to register their first victory in 2019 World Cup and end their 11-ODI losing streak. Pakistan registered their second-highest World Cup total of 348/8, driven by fifties by Babar Azam, Mohammad Hafeez and captain Sarfaraz Ahmed. England were restricted to 334/9 following hundreds by Joe Root and Jos Buttler.

headlines: SA's eternal chokers tag is like Shakespearean tragedy: Rabada
text: South Africa pacer Kagiso Rabada has said South Africa's tag of eternal chokers is like a "Shakespearean tragedy". "It's something that has been haunting us for years...Hopefully, we can change that," he added. "We believe we have every chance to win World Cup. What happened in the past, you got to let go of that," he further said.

headlines: Wordplay wont solve unemployment problem: Shiv Sena to Modi govt
text: BJP's ally Shiv Sena on Monday said that "mere wordplay" will not solve the problem of unemployment and economic slowdown. Sena added that failure to create jobs cannot be blamed on Jawaharlal Nehru or Indira Gandhi. This comes after Statistics Ministry said that the country's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-18 fiscal year.

headlines: Doctor beats up patient in Jaipur's govt hospital, video goes viral
text: A video allegedly showing a doctor thrashing a patient admitted at Sawai Man Singh Hospital in Jaipur, Rajasthan has gone viral online. In the video, the doctor is seen slapping the patient, however, the hospital administration said the patient had first manhandled some doctors. "The video circulated on social media seems to be edited," said Dr DS Meena, hospital superintendent.

headlines: 6-yr-old Indian girl falls from 3rd floor in UAE, fighting for life
text: A six-year-old Indian girl is fighting for her life after she fell from the third floor of her building in UAE's Sharjah on Saturday. The girl's parents were inside the house when she went to the balcony and fell from there while playing. The doctors said that she suffered fractures in all parts of the body.

headlines: Air India flight from Delhi lands in US with 'hole' in door
text: An Air India Boeing 777 flight from Delhi was grounded in US' San Francisco post landing after a "hole" was discovered in the area below a door. The flight, which was carrying 225 passengers, had landed safely and the "small cut/crack" was discovered during inspection. An investigation into the matter to find what caused the damage is on, officials said.

headlines: 50.3°C maximum temperature recorded in Rajasthan's Churu today
text: Rajasthan's Churu recorded a maximum temperature of 50.3°C today, as per India Meteorological Department. On Saturday, the temperature reached 50.6°C in the city, close to India's record of 51°C recorded in Rajasthan's Phalodi in May 2016. Eight of the world's 15 hottest places in the past 24 hours were in India, according to weather monitoring website El Dorado.

headlines: Delhi man objects to urinating in public, thrashed to death
text: A 27-year-old man was allegedly thrashed to death by his neighbours for objecting to public urination in South Delhi in the early hours of Monday. The victim, who was facing 17 criminal cases, had slapped a 65-year-old man for urinating as there were women living nearby. Following this, the man's family thrashed him and hit him with a cement slab.

headlines: Kerala-born billionaire becomes UAE's first permanent expat resident
text: Yusuff Ali MA, Kerala-born billionaire businessman and Founder of LuLu Hypermarket, has become the first expat to get the United Arab Emirates' first gold card permanent residency. Unlike the long-term visa of 5-10 years, the gold card gives permanent residency of the UAE to the holder. The gold card was provided under a new scheme aimed to attract investors.

headlines: Police trace auto with Rajinikanth sticker to solve murder in 7 days
text: Police in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore solved a 45-year-old woman's murder case in a week after zeroing in on an autorickshaw with actor Rajinikanth's sticker. The CCTV camera footage from near the house of the victim showed the autorickshaw with Rajinikanth's sticker arriving before the murder and leaving after it. Police checked 10,000 autorickshaws in the city and in rural area.

headlines: Another IAF AN-32 aircraft with 13 on board went missing 10 yrs ago
text: In June 2009, an IAF AN-32 aircraft went missing with 13 people on board after taking off from Arunachal Pradesh's Mechuka landing ground. The wreckage of the aircraft was later found over 25 km from Mechuka and all 13 on board died in the crash. Today, another IAF AN-32 aircraft, headed to Mechuka, went missing with 13 people on board.

headlines: 66,000-tonne cruise ship crashes into tourist boat, dock; 5 injured
text: A 66,000-tonne cruise ship crashed into a tourist boat and a dock after losing control in Italy's Venice, injuring five. In videos of the crash, people can be seen rushing to disembark from the boat as the ship blared its horn after a reported engine failure. Two tugboats tried to guide the ship but couldn't prevent it from crashing.

headlines: I don't believe in marriage, it's a dying institution: Salman
text: When asked about his take on marriage, Salman Khan said, "I don't believe in marriage. I think it's a dying institution." The actor added that while he doesn't support the concept of marriage, he believes in companionship. Salman was also asked whether he was looking forward to having children, to which he said, "When it has to happen, it'll happen."

headlines: Delhi HC rejects plea seeking stay on release of 'Bharat'
text: The Delhi High Court rejected a petition which sought a stay on the release of upcoming Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat'. The petitioner, Vikas Tyagi, claimed that the title violates a legal act which prohibits the use of the word 'Bharat' for commercial purposes. The court stated that the petition was premature as the petitioner is yet to watch the film.

headlines: I cross my fingers for Virat Kohli: German footballer Müller
text: Germany's World Cup-winning footballer Thomas Müller shared a picture of himself posing in Team India jersey, to wish India captain Virat Kohli luck ahead of their World Cup opener on Wednesday. "I cross my fingers for @imVkohli, the captain of the Indian team. He's a fan of @DFB_Team and supported it multiple times," the Bayern Munich forward captioned the picture.

headlines: Nishikori in French Open last 8 after 5-set win in 4 hours
text: World number seven Kei Nishikori took five sets to defeat France's Benoit Paire 6-2, 6-7(8), 6-2, 6-7(8), 7-5 in a 3-hour 55-minute match to enter French Open quarter-finals on Monday. Nishikori, the only Japanese left in the men's event, won his eighth consecutive five-setter. The 29-year-old will next face 11-time French Open champion Rafael Nadal on Tuesday.

headlines: US ban won't affect Huawei aviation tech business: Official
text: The US' ban on Huawei has had "no effect" on the Chinese company's aviation tech business despite several countries taking steps to block its mobile services, a top company executive said. Huawei provides communication technology services to over 15 airlines and 50 airports including those in Dubai and Singapore. Customers pledged to "keep cooperating" with the firm, the executive added.

headlines: Alphabet falls to lowest in 5 months over antitrust probe
text: Google parent Alphabet's shares on Monday fell up to 6.7% to their lowest since January, after a report said the US Department of Justice is preparing an antitrust probe against the search giant. The investigation would examine competitive practices of Google's search business. This comes after the Federal Trade Commission declined to take action against Google in 2013, following investigation.

headlines: Zomato announces 26 weeks paid parental leave for men, women
text: Zomato will be offering women and men 26 weeks of paid parental leave or will follow the government mandated policy, whichever's more. This policy also applies to non-birthing parents and in cases of surrogacy, adoption and same-sex partners, the startup's CEO Deepinder Goyal wrote in a blog post. New parents will also be given an endowment of $1,000 per child.

headlines: Pre-monsoon rainfall second-lowest in 65 years: Skymet
text: The pre-monsoon rainfall in India in 2019 was the second-lowest in 65 years, with the lowest being recorded in 2012, private weather forecaster Skymet Weather said. The three-month pre-monsoon season (March, April and May) ended with a rainfall deficiency of 25% this year. In 2019, the country received 99 mm of pre-monsoon rainfall as against the average of 131.5 mm.

headlines: England's Root smashes 2019 World Cup's first hundred in 6th match
text: England's number three batsman Joe Root smashed 2019 World Cup's first hundred, after reaching the three-figure mark off 97 deliveries against Pakistan in the tournament's sixth match on Monday. The 28-year-old became the second player from England after Kevin Pietersen to score multiple hundreds in World Cup history. Overall, it was Root's 15th hundred in ODI cricket.

headlines: No wreckage of missing AN-32 aircraft has been sighted so far: IAF
text: The IAF has clarified that no wreckage of AN-32 aircraft that went missing after taking off from Assam's Jorhat today has been sighted so far. "IAF is coordinating with Indian Army, various government and civil agencies to locate the missing aircraft. Search operations will continue from air and by ground parties of Army through the night," it added.

headlines: 8 of world's 15 hottest places in last 24 hours were in India: Report
text: Eight of the world's 15 hottest places in the past 24 hours were in India, while the others were in Pakistan, according to weather monitoring website El Dorado. Churu, a city in Rajasthan, recorded India's highest temperature of 48.9°C on Sunday. Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar, Phalodi, Bikaner, Barmer and Jaisalmer, Madhya Pradesh's Nowgong and Haryana's Narnaul were among the hottest places.

headlines: How did Roberto Carlos score 'goal that defied Physics' 22 years ago?
text: Former Brazilian footballer Roberto Carlos scored a 35-metre banana free kick, called the 'goal which defied Physics', with no direct line to the goal against France on June 3, 1997. The rotations of the ball about its axis created a pressure difference on its sides, making it curve towards the goal. This phenomenon is known as the Magnus Effect.

headlines: Wasim Akram once smashed 257* while batting at number 8 in a Test
text: Former Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram holds the record for smashing the highest score while batting at number eight in a Test match. Akram, who is celebrating his 53rd birthday today, smashed an unbeaten 257 off 363 balls including 12 sixes and 22 fours against Zimbabwe in 1996 to achieve the feat. Akram scored three tons in his Test career.

headlines: Rafael Nadal once portrayed Shakira's love interest in music video
text: World number two tennis player Rafael Nadal portrayed Colombian singer Shakira's love interest in the official video of her 2009 song 'Gypsy'. "Shakira, as always, was spectacular. Working with a woman as charming as her, well, it makes it a lot easier," Nadal had said. The 17-time Grand Slam champion is celebrating his 33rd birthday today.

headlines: Met boyfriend online, he sent me a message on Instagram: Sushmita
text: Talking about how she met boyfriend Rohman Shawl, Sushmita Sen revealed he sent her a direct message on Instagram. Adding that she accidentally opened his message, Sushmita said, "The message...was from a compassionate person...I wrote back saying 'Thank you'...Rohman replied with 'I can't believe you responded'." She revealed she decided to meet him in person as she found him honest.

headlines: Djokovic first man to reach 10 straight French Open quarter-finals
text: World number one Novak Djokovic has become the first ever male tennis player to reach 10 consecutive French Open quarter-finals. The 32-year-old Serbian defeated world number 45 Germany's Jan-Lennard Struff 6-3, 6-2, 6-2 in one hour and 33 minutes in the Round of 16 on Monday. Overall, it will be Djokovic's 44th Grand Slam quarter-final.

headlines: Free ride for women in Delhi attempt to mislead people: Manoj Tiwari
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal announced free rides for women in DTC buses, cluster buses and metro trains, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari called it another attempt to mislead people. "We are not opposing the idea but something that couldn't even be started in 52 months, how can it be done in 5-6 months?" said Tiwari.

headlines: Congress expels Kerala leader for praising PM Modi on social media
text: The Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee has expelled party leader AP Abdullakutty for praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi on social media. Abdullakutty had credited Modi's success to "adoption of Gandhian values", and hailed Modi's pet projects such as Smart Cities, Swachh Bharat Abhiyan (SBA) and Ujjwala Yojana. Abdullakutty has been a two-term Congress MLA.

headlines: Paytm in talks to acquire Coverfox for $120M in all cash deal: Report
text: Paytm is reportedly in talks to acquire digital insurance marketplace Coverfox for $100-$120 million in an all-cash deal. If the deal goes through, it would be the largest acquisition deal for the SoftBank-backed Paytm. Besides Paytm Money that deals into wealth management space, Paytm also incorporated Paytm Life Insurance and Paytm General Insurance Corporation in February last year.

headlines: Delhi metro, bus made free for women keeping safety in mind: CM
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said the government has decided to make metro and bus travel free for women "keeping in mind the safety of women". "The move aims that the maximum number of women can use public transport. Public transport is said to be the safest for women," Kejriwal said. The Delhi government will bear the cost, he added.

headlines: NCP leader ties rakhi to Gujarat BJP MLA who slapped her in public
text: NCP leader Nitu Tejwani tied a rakhi to BJP MLA from Gujarat's Naroda, Balram Thawani, who assaulted her in public. "He (Thawani) said that I am like a sister to him and that he didn't have any bad intentions when he slapped me. I too now consider him my brother and we've resolved the matter among us," she said.

headlines: IAS officer who posted controversial tweet on Gandhi transferred
text: Maharashtra IAS officer Nidhi Choudhari, who posted a tweet on Mahatma Gandhi, has been transferred from the Mumbai municipal corporation to the water supply department. Maharashtra government also issued a show cause notice to her for her tweet in which she "sarcastically" thanks Godse for killing Mahatma Gandhi and asks to remove his statues and his face from currency notes.

headlines: Just won a match, have to be calm: Mortaza as B'desh beat SA
text: After Bangladesh registered their highest-ever ODI total and defeated South Africa in their first 2019 World Cup match on Sunday, Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said, "We've just won one match...It's important for our players to stay calm". "There are eight more matches...This win doesn't take us anywhere in this tournament," he added. Bangladesh will next face New Zealand on Wednesday.

headlines: Flexible generators that turn movement into energy made
text: Researchers at US' Rice University adapted laser-induced graphene (LIG) into small, metal-free devices that generate electricity that could help power wearables. In experiments, a larger piece of LIG embedded in a flip-flop let a wearer generate energy with every step. It was able to store 0.22 millijoules of electrical energy on a capacitor after a 1-km walk, a researcher said.

headlines: Huawei to exit undersea cable business amid US blacklisting
text: China's Huawei is planning to sell its 51% stake in Huawei Marine Networks to Hengtong Optic-Electric. The move comes weeks after the US blocked Huawei from buying American technology over espionage concerns. Huawei Marine, a joint venture between Huawei and British undersea cable firm Global Marine Systems, has drawn scrutiny because of its role in building internet-connection infrastructure.

headlines: New breast cancer treatment boosts survival, show trials
text: Combination treatment with a drug, ribociclib, helped improve overall survival in advanced breast cancer patients, as per results of a clinical trial. The trial involved 672 pre-menopausal women aged 18-59 years, who were given a combination of endocrine therapy with either new drug or placebo. Overall survival at 42 months was 70% with the drug compared to 46% without.

headlines: Sephora to shut US stores for a day after racial incident
text: Beauty chain Sephora said it will close all its US stores on Wednesday to conduct diversity training for employees after Grammy-nominated singer SZA accused the store of racial profiling in April. A Sephora employee had allegedly called security to make sure SZA wasn't stealing from the store. "We take such complaints very seriously, [racial profiling] isn't tolerated [here]," Sephora said.

headlines: Telecom spectrum auction to be held this year, says Prasad
text: Newly-appointed Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Monday said India will hold spectrum auction for 5G and other bands this year. He added that the revival of state-owned MTNL and BSNL will be amongst his priorities. Other issues in his agenda include 5G trials in 100 days, fast-tracking of five lakh Wi-Fi hotspots, and promoting telecom manufacturing.

headlines: IL&FS management ran business as 'personal fiefdom': SFIO
text: The Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) has charged the erstwhile top management of IL&FS group's subsidiary IFIN of running the business as their "personal fiefdom". It also accused them of forming a "coterie" with auditors and independent directors to defraud the firm. The SFIO is seeking prosecution of former executive and independent directors of IFIN and attachment of their properties.

headlines: Mamata Banerjee breaks open BJP office, paints TMC symbol on wall
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee broke open a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) office in North 24 Parganas district and painted her party TMC's name and symbol on the office's saffron wall. This reportedly happened on May 30. Trinamool Congress has claimed that it was their office which was captured by supporters of a newly elected BJP MP.

headlines: Wreckage of missing IAF aircraft found near Payum, Arunachal: Report
text: Wreckage of the missing Indian Air Force AN-32 aircraft has been reportedly found near Arunachal Pradesh's Payum village. The aircraft had gone missing with eight crew members and five passengers after taking off from Assam's Jorhat airbase on Monday. The aircraft, headed to Arunachal Pradesh's Mechuka, lost all contact with ground staff at around 1 PM.

headlines: IAF aircraft with 13 on board missing after taking off from Assam
text: An IAF AN-32 aircraft with 13 people on board has been missing for three hours after taking off from Assam's Jorhat airbase at 12:27 pm. The aircraft, which was on its way to Arunachal Pradesh's Mechuka, last contacted ground sources at 1 pm. IAF has launched Sukhoi-30 combat aircraft and C-130 Special Operations aircraft on a search mission.

headlines: Sensex, Nifty close at record highs ahead of RBI monetary policy
text: The BSE Sensex and Nifty closed at record highs on Monday with Sensex touching 40,268 and Nifty hitting 12,089. This comes ahead of the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) slated to announce its bimonthly policy on Thursday. The RBI is expected to cut repo rate by at least 25 bps, the third in a row, experts said.

headlines: Fell sick in 2014, took steroids every 8 hrs to stay alive: Sushmita
text: Sushmita Sen, during an interview with Rajeev Masand, revealed that she fell "violently sick" in 2014. "There's a hormone...called Cortisol. My adrenal glands had stopped making it...I was declared steroid dependent for life...I had to take a medicine called hydrocortisone...every 8 hours to stay alive," she added. Sushmita said she learnt in 2016 that her body started producing Cortisol again.

headlines: You've actors like Meryl Streep on TV, what's the big deal: Kareena
text: Kareena Kapoor, while speaking about movie actors appearing on television shows, said, "What is the big deal? I mean, you have actors from Meryl Streep to Saif Ali Khan, to...Benedict Cumberbatch....so many great actors on TV." "I think it is very sad that people continuously say that 'Oh why you are doing TV?'," she added.

headlines: Actress Ruma Guha Thakurta, Kishore Kumar's 1st wife, passes away
text: Singer-dancer Ruma Guha Thakurta who was also Kishore Kumar's first wife passed away aged 84 in her Kolkata home on Monday morning. The actress was suffering from aging-associated ailments. Ruma, who was the niece of filmmaker Satyajit Ray, was a prominent figure in both Hindi and Bengali films. Apart from this, she also starred in the Hollywood film 'The Namesake'.

headlines: We plan to start 5G trials in India in 100 days: Ravi Shankar Prasad
text: Newly appointed Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Monday said the department of telecommunications plans to initiate trials for 5G in 100 days. "It shall be our endeavour that 5G is used for deprived sectors and social causes as well," Prasad added. He also aims to establish five lakh Wi-Fi hotspots on priority and create Broadband Readiness Index for India.

headlines: Youth admitted in hospital may have Nipah: Kerala Health Minister
