text: A 23-year-old man in Kerala's Ernakulam district has tested positive for the deadly brain-damaging Nipah virus in an initial test, said state's Health Minister KK Shailaja. The disease is not yet confirmed as the government is awaiting confirmation from one more virology institute, Shailaja added. He was hospitalised after he complained of persistent fever and headache for 10 days.

headlines: I'll send thank you note to parents who sent children to Army: Rajnath
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met soldiers posted at Siachen Glacier on Monday and tweeted he is proud of the parents who have sent their children to Army, and added that he will personally send a thank you note to them. Singh also paid tribute to more than 1,100 martyred soldiers who sacrificed their lives serving in Siachen.

headlines: TN asks Secretariat to avoid casuals, wear saree, formal shirt-pants
text: Tamil Nadu has issued an order for the dress code to be followed in Secretariat. It states that casual attire should be avoided and women must wear saree or salwar kameez or a churidar with dupatta of "sober colour", while men must wear formal shirts and pants. It added that employees should wear clothes that reflect Indian and Tamil culture.

headlines: 2 Army jawans attacked by hotel staff in Uttar Pradesh, 7-8 arrested
text: Two Army personnel were thrashed by a group of waiters with sticks in a restaurant in Uttar Pradesh's Bagpat district on Saturday. Police said the incident took place when the jawans allegedly entered into an altercation with a customer, following which a waiter intervened and it led to a fight. Police has registered a case and arrested 7-8 restaurant staff.

headlines: Harsh Vardhan cycles to office to take charge as Health Minister
text: Doctor-turned-politician Harsh Vardhan today took charge as the Union Health Minister, almost five years after he was divested of the charge. The 64-year-old arrived at Nirman Bhawan on a cycle on the occasion of World Bicycle Day. He said he would try to continue cycling from his home to office and vice-versa and appealed to people to adopt healthy practices.

headlines: Deal or no deal, we leave EU on Oct 31: UK PM candidate Johnson
text: Launching his leadership bid, UK PM candidate Boris Johnson has promised to lead the country out of the European Union on October 31 with or without an exit deal. UK PM Theresa May is due to resign on Friday having failed to deliver Brexit on schedule. Johnson had resigned as foreign minister in protest at May's handling of Brexit.

headlines: Alligator enters 77-yr-old woman's kitchen in US; video goes viral
text: A 77-year-old woman in Florida, US found out that an 11-foot alligator had broken into her kitchen on Friday. A video showing the alligator inside the kitchen went viral on social media. "During apprehension, the alligator knocked over several bottles of wine. The red liquid in the video is wine, not blood," police said while sharing the video on Twitter.

headlines: VP Sivakolundhu elected as Puducherry Assembly Speaker
text: Puducherry Deputy Speaker and Lawspet legislator VP Sivakolundhu was on Monday elected as the new Speaker of the Union Territory Assembly. The Speaker's chair fell vacant after Congress' V Vaithilingam stepped down on March 21 to contest the Lok Sabha elections from the lone Puducherry parliamentary seat. The Congress leader, Sivakolundhu, was the sole contender for the Speaker's post.

headlines: Google faces outage affecting YouTube, Cloud services in US
text: Google on its Cloud Status Dashboard said it has resolved a "network congestion issue" in eastern US, affecting Google Cloud, G Suite and YouTube. "We will conduct an internal investigation of this issue and make appropriate improvements to our systems to help prevent or minimise future recurrence," the company said. The outage also reportedly affected Snapchat, which uses Google Cloud.

headlines: Vistara plans international flights from second half of this year
text: Vistara CEO Leslie Thng has said the full-service carrier plans to launch international flights from the second half of this year. "Vistara can start short-haul flights but would need more time for long-haul ones," he added. The carrier has bought six Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner planes, scheduled to be delivered between 2020 and 2021, for long-haul operations.

headlines: Smriti Irani, Ravi Shankar take charge of their ministries
text: BJP leaders Smriti Irani and Ravi Shankar Prasad on Monday took charge as the Union Women and Child Development Minister and Law and Justice Minister respectively. Soon after assuming charge, Irani held a meeting with all senior officials of the Ministry. Prasad, however, said that he will play a role as a stakeholder, giving due regard to the collegium system.

headlines: PM Modi wave won't work in Assembly polls: Bhupinder Singh Hooda
text: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda has said that PM Narendra Modi's wave was for Delhi and not Chandigarh and so it won't work in Assembly elections. He added that people are aware of the state BJP government's "poor work" in the last five years. Addressing Congress workers, Hooda said, "We lost only one fight, the battle shall go on."

headlines: BBNL plans to take over optical fibre infra under BharatNet
text: Bharat Broadband Network (BBNL) Chairman Sarvesh Singh has said the state-run telecom infrastructure provider is planning to take over operations and maintenance work of optical fibre-based infrastructure being laid under BharatNet project. The entire maintenance of fibre under BharatNet is done by BSNL, he added. BBNL had allocated around 70% of rural broadband network roll-out work to BSNL.

headlines: Dad told me to marry Jaya if I wanted to go on trip with her: Big B
text: Amitabh Bachchan has revealed he got married to Jaya after his father told him they could go on a trip together only if they are married. This was after Amitabh told his father that they wanted to go for a vacation to London. Amitabh further said they got married the very next day and flew to London at night.

headlines: Delhi govt makes metro and bus travel free for women
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has announced women can travel free of cost on all DTC buses, cluster buses and metro trains. "Women who can afford these modes of transport can purchase tickets, they need not take subsidy," he added. "Around 3,000 new public buses will be on the streets by the end of the year," he further said.

headlines: Gauahar defends Sarfaraz after he is criticised for wearing shalwar
text: Actress Gauahar Khan has defended Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed after he was criticised by writer Tarek Fatah for wearing shalwar-kameez to meet the Queen in England. She tweeted, "He is representing his culture, [and] looking [very] handsome in that!" Her tweet further read, "Every human being has the right to wear what he does, with dignity [and] pride!"

headlines: My father thought GoT would be nothing when I got the part: Sophie
text: Actress Sophie Turner has revealed when she got the role of 'Sansa Stark' in 'Game of Thrones', her father thought the show would be "nothing". "My mum had a little panic...But my dad was like, 'Look, it's what she's always wanted to do, and it's probably going to be nothing. We've never heard of this show before'," she added.

headlines: 45-min call with Viv Richards stopped me from retiring in 2007: Sachin
text: Sachin Tendulkar has revealed a phone call with ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards stopped him from retiring in 2007. Sachin added that he was 90% sure of quitting cricket after India crashed out of World Cup. "We had a conversation for about 45 minutes and that was so heartwarming...That was the moment things changed for me," Sachin added.

headlines: Rashid reveals his teammate stole bat gifted to him by Virat Kohli
text: Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan has revealed his teammate Asghar Afghan stole the bat gifted to him by Virat Kohli. "I loved the bat...It was like every ball I hit went for six," he added. He further said Asghar took it from his bag and put it in his bag. "I hope he doesn't do well...and gives it back," Rashid joked.

headlines: Give data privacy records to shareholders: US judge to Facebook
text: A US judge ordered Facebook to give shareholders emails and other records concerning how it handles data privacy, after 87 million users' data was accessed by political consultancy firm Cambridge Analytica. Judge said shareholders showed credible basis to believe board members may have committed wrongdoing. Last year, shareholders sued Facebook to get Cambridge Analytica breach-related records.

headlines: Doval given Cabinet rank, to continue as National Security Advisor
text: Ajit Doval has been given Cabinet rank in the Government of India in recognition of his contribution in the national security domain. His appointment will be for five years. However, Doval, under whose supervision the 2016 surgical strikes after Uri attack and the 2019 Balakot strikes took place, will continue to be the country's National Security Advisor.

headlines: Ex-Myntra, Alibaba, Paytm executives launch $50 million startup fund
text: Former e-commerce startup executives Raveen Sastry, Sanjay Ramakrishnan and Bhushan Patil, who worked with firms like Alibaba, Paytm, Flipkart, and Myntra, have launched a $50 million startup fund 'Multiply Ventures'. The early-to-growth stage fund has received $10 million in commitments so far. Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma and Myntra Co-founder Mukesh Bansal are among its few early backers.

headlines: My tweet was sarcasm: IAS officer who thanked Godse
text: A Mumbai IAS officer who in a tweet thanked Nathuram Godse for killing Mahatma Gandhi has said, "My tweet was sarcasm." She shared her tweets from the past, saying, "Kindly read and understand how I feel for Gandhiji. I am a devout follower of Gandhiji." "High time we remove his face from our currency," Nidhi Choudhari's May tweet read.

headlines: Kerala woman wrongly diagnosed with breast cancer, gets chemotherapy
text: A 38-year-old Kerala woman underwent chemotherapy at Kottayam Government Medical College and Hospital, even though she had no cancer, after being wrongly diagnosed with cancerous cells in her breast. After the first session of chemotherapy was done, doctors received another report which said there was no malignancy in the lump. Kerala's Health Minister has ordered an inquiry into the incident.

headlines: BJP MLA caught on camera kicking woman; says it wasn't intentional
text: Gujarat BJP MLA Balram Thawani was caught on camera thrashing a woman NCP leader in public near his office on Sunday after she demanded restoration of water connection in the area. Thawani alleged some men hit him first and added he had "no intention" to thrash her. "I got swayed by emotions, I accept the mistake...I'll say sorry," he said.

headlines: Trump announces departure of White House economic advisor
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said that White House Council of Economic Advisors Chairman Kevin Hassett will "shortly" leave his post. However, Trump did not provide a reason for the latest high-level departure from the administration. "Kevin Hassett...has done such a great job for me and the administration...His very talented replacement will be named...soon," Trump added.

headlines: SpiceJet plans to hire up to 2,000 staff of grounded Jet Airways
text: SpiceJet plans to hire up to 2,000 staff, including pilots and cabin crew, of the grounded airline Jet Airways and has already hired 1,100 people so far, SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh said. SpiceJet has taken at least 22 planes that were earlier used by Jet Airways. Currently, SpiceJet has around 14,000 staff and a fleet of 100 planes.

headlines: US-based IEEE reverses peer review, editing curbs on Huawei
text: US-headquartered Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers lifted curbs on Huawei and its affiliates' employees, letting them participate as peer reviewers and editors in its publication process. The reversal is based on clarification received from the US Department of Commerce. "Our initial...approach was motivated...by our desire to protect our...members from legal risk," IEEE said.

headlines: Sena urges govt to act against unemployment citing CSO data
text: Citing Central Statistics Office (CSO) data that showed the country's unemployment rate has touched its 45-year high, the Shiv Sena urged the Centre to act against growing unemployment. In its mouthpiece, 'Saamana', the Sena added that the previous central government promised two crore jobs every year, but that has not happened and the "Nehru-Gandhi family cannot be blamed for this".

headlines: Imposition of Hindi brutal assault on our states: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the draft National Education Policy saying that the imposition of Hindi is nothing but a "brutal assault on our states". He added, "Instead of imposing Hindi, the government should focus on recognising regional identities." He said, "For us, Kannada is an identity and learning any other language should be by choice and not by imposition."

headlines: Stalin pays tribute to Karunanidhi on his 95th birth anniversary
text: DMK President MK Stalin on Monday paid tribute to his father and former Tamil Nadu CM M Karunanidhi on his 95th birth anniversary. Karunanidhi was Tamil Nadu's longest-serving CM and breathed his last in August last year. Congress President Rahul Gandhi also remembered Karunanidhi and said, "A true leader of the glorious Tamil people, whose memory will never fade away."

headlines: Giriraj asks people to make population control law a movement
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh asked people to take the population control law campaign to every house and make it a "movement" from the road to Parliament. Sharing a screenshot of the population count on Twitter, Singh added that increasing population is a "hurdle" in India's development and society's harmony. Earlier, Singh also supported Baba Ramdev's suggestion to control India's population.

headlines: Rajnath Singh leaves for J&K, to meet troops in Siachen
text: Two days after taking the charge of the Ministry of Defence, Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday left New Delhi for a day-long visit to Jammu and Kashmir. Accompanied by Army Chief General Bipin Rawat, Singh will meet troops at Siachen Glacier to review the security situation. The new Defence Minister would also be meeting the Army personnel in Srinagar.

headlines: 150 jhuggis, including 41 of Rohingyas, gutted in fire in J&K
text: As many as 150 jhuggis, including 41 of those belonging to Rohingyas, were gutted in fire on Sunday in Jammu and Kashmir. The fire broke out in Maratha Mohalla near Jammu railway station. According to a report, residents of the area said it was a "massive fire", fuelled by wind and that fire brigade reached the spot after an hour.

headlines: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Shopian
text: At least two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Molu-Chitragam area of Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Monday. As per reports, the encounter broke out after terrorists opened fire on the Quick Reaction Team (QRT) of Army that was passing through the area. The identity of the slain terrorists is being ascertained.

headlines: OPPO's Billion Beats campaign cheers team India for ICC World Cup
text: In its endeavour to provide cricket fans an opportunity to cheer up Team India for ICC World Cup, OPPO launched first-of-its-kind campaign titled 'Billion Beats'. OPPO urged its fans to send heartbeats through OPPO Billion Beats App which was further created into a song composed by dynamic Bollywood music director duo Meet Bros.

headlines: Bangladesh hand South Africa their 2nd straight loss in World Cup
text: Bangladesh opened their 2019 World Cup campaign with a 21-run victory against South Africa at London's Kennington Oval on Sunday. South Africa, who will next face India on Wednesday, have lost their first two matches at the 2019 World Cup. The match witnessed Bangladesh score their highest ever total in ODI cricket (330/6).

headlines: India can beat this Pakistan team 9.5 times out of 10: Harbhajan
text: Off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that India against Pakistan match is not as big as India against England. "India can beat this Pakistan team 9 and a half times out of 10 times. Pakistan do not have the kind of players. Favourites tags are with India and England," he added. "India have 11 match-winners," he further said.

headlines: What the hell: Thiem on being asked to leave presser for Serena
text: World number four men's player Dominic Thiem got angry after being asked by organisers to leave the main interview room at French Open as they had to accommodate Serena Williams' press conference. "It's a joke. I have to leave the room because she's coming. What the hell, I don't care. I can also do whatever I want," he said.

headlines: Akhtar posts inspirational tweet for Pakistan, Pietersen trolls him
text: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a picture of himself celebrating ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen's wicket and posted a motivational tweet for Pakistan. "Can't argue with that tweet buddy as you're celebrating after I smacked you all over for a 100...! Great passion!" wrote Pietersen. "Mate you were a true force to reckon with but loved my chicken dance...," Akhtar responded.

headlines: No one in the team believes in my bowling but I do: Virat Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli has said no one in the team believes in his bowling but he does. He revealed during an ODI series in Sri Lanka in 2017, he was about to bowl when Jasprit Bumrah shouted from the boundary, "No joking around, it is an international game." He added that he doesn't bowl anymore because of "back issues".

headlines: Wawrinka beats Tsitsipas in 5 hrs 9 min to reach French Open last 8
text: Stanislas Wawrinka defeated Stefanos Tsitsipas 7-6(8-6), 5-7, 6-4, 3-6, 8-6 in five hours and nine minutes on Sunday to reach the quarter-final of the French Open. It was the fourth-longest match in French Open history. Wawrinka will face world number three Roger Federer in the quarter-final on Tuesday. Wawrinka had won the French Open in 2015.

headlines: Rafael Nadal reaches French Open quarter-final for the 13th time
text: World number two Rafael Nadal defeated Argentine Juan Ignacio Londero 6-2, 6-3, 6-3 in two hours and 13 minutes to reach the French Open quarter-final for the 13th time. Nadal has now won 59 of 61 sets during his 20-match unbeaten run at French Open since losing to Novak Djokovic in the 2015 quarter-finals.

headlines: Give our players time, they are Pakistan's future: Azhar Mahmood
text: Pakistan bowling coach Azhar Mahmood urged ex-players to back the current Pakistan team. "If team isn't playing good then criticise their cricket...but personal attacks aren't good," he said. "These were same players who won Champions Trophy. These players are future of Pakistan cricket. Give them 100 more games and you'll see how much of a difference it makes," he added.

headlines: Man breaks Ramzan fast to donate blood to 7-yr-old thalassemic girl
text: A Muslim man in West Bengal's Nadia district broke his fast so he could donate blood to a seven-year-old girl, who is suffering from thalassemia. Osman Gani Sheikh said he did not think twice when he received a call from the girl's father, saying that he was in dire need of A+ blood but could not find any donor.

headlines: No one in North is learning Malayalam or Tamil: Shashi Tharoor
text: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said, "Most of us in South India learn Hindi as a second language but nobody in the North is learning Malayalam and Tamil." Tharoor's remark was in reference to the recommendations of the Draft National Education Policy 2019 promoting Hindi as the mandatory third language in schools all over the country.

headlines: Ex-SC staffer published wrong info on Anil Ambani to get daughter job
text: A former Supreme Court staffer allegedly posted wrong information in a case involving Reliance Communications Chairman Anil Ambani on the court's website. He posted on the SC website that Ambani's presence in a case was dispensed with, despite him being asked to be present in next hearing. Someone assured the former staffer's daughter a BSES job for posting wrong information.

headlines: 8 climbers including an Indian missing at Nanda Devi, 4 rescued
text: Eight mountaineers including an Indian, who began climbing the Nanda Devi mountain in Uttarakhand last month and were reported missing on Friday, have still not been traced, officials said. However, four other British climbers stuck near the base camp of Nanda Devi East peak were rescued on Sunday. Two IAF helicopters are pressed into service to locate the missing climbers.
